3.description: Finally closer to my house. Friendly and helpful like their other locations.  Not too much new, but that's not necessarily a bad thing as I always spend way too much here. I need to stay focused and get the garbage can I need. This is a big store for the Roosevelt Collection and it will give some competition for Bed Bath & Beyond and Target.I ended up buying the trash can with the green stick, it was a reasonable priced 79$ compared to a Simple Human one of similar size, plus it's the exact one I have now. Since our neighborhood finally got recycling we need to separate the trash, so either two cans or a ridiculously priced Simple Human dual trash can 179$ with a tiny blue insert. If I go with that one I'd have to switch how I use the trash inserts. We recycle more than we have have of regular trash, I can also see guests throwing stuff in the wrong side. Modern day problems!They were well staffed, and for as busy as it was there weren't any lines. You can pull up to the front doors to load up, but you're warned to have someone stay with your car. I parked in one of the pay spots above ground and took the cart to the spot and back. I got lucky as the meter boxes were broken and security told me they'd be out for two hours. Parking is 6.75 for 45 minutes. I don't know if the garage below is any cheaper or free? One could hope.

1.description: Bought a couple of spice racks to organize my pantry. The screws they came with were FAR too short to be useful for wall mounting. So I used one rack as my test subject and since I had ripped the label and packaging off, I knew I'd be out at least one when attempting to return it. Fair enough. That's not the point.I have my receipt misplaced but came in with my ID and the card I used to pay with to return the other racks I purchased. I knew that without a receipt I'd likely only be able to get store credit. Not even. They won't even bother to look up by card, SKU, name or anything, unless you're a member of their spammy rewards program. Look, I worked in retail. I know how the POS works. I know you can look up my purchase. This is 2015, not the dark ages.What a waste. Jill, the associate... you're not nice. So I just left the racks there. You can make some more money off of another unsuspecting customer. Overpriced merchandise, restrictive return policy, unfriendly associate? Useless. I won't be coming back.

2.description: I love the elfa displays...not much else about the Container Store thrills me. I get really overwhelmed here. The staff, however, are fabulous. Especially the lady that helped me with designing my closet with the Elfa!

5.description: We stopped by after catching a movie at the Showplace Icon.  This store is so spacious, clean and organized! Of course there were lots of containers, storage bins, and bags made of every material. But they also had a section of bath room products and products made for other rooms in a home like a closet or an office.  They even had travel gear as well! The staff here was very friendly.  Prices are competitive and they have sales too.  Make sure to check out the cool items by the cashier area.

6.description: As a professional organizer I am so excited to have a Container Store located in the South Loop. Excellent service, great products and stimulating environment!

7.description: Literally THE container store. If you need a container, it's here.All the staff members seem really friendly. But I think it's a bit too much. Because I had to wait for maybe 5-10 minutes just to checkout. There were a lot of chitchat with each customer, and there were two lines for checkout, but no signs on where to stand to checkout.

8.description: Went to The Container Store in search of some roll-out cabinet shelves.  After calling and being told that the size they had would fit our necessary dimensions we went to pick them up at the store.  We waited in line for one cashier who decided to chit chat with the man in front of me for about 5 minutes.  Then another cashier came up and went to open her station and skipped over us because the lady she had been helping only had 1 item (versus our 4).  After the poor service, we went home to find out that the shelves were too long.  Had much higher expectations for this new store.

0.description: Very happy to have one closer to my home. Such great products here.Every staff member has been super friendly and kind... one of the check out ladies double checked that every elfa piece I purchased was correct, fit together, and took time and care to ensure I had everything I needed. I was lucky as there was no car in front when I 'picked up' but could see how it could be a real challenge.

4.description: Visited this new Container Store about ten days after Christmas, on a Monday at 3:00.  There were more sales people than customers, so apparently few have discovered it yet.  The inconvenient parking doesn't help... underground in a confusing dark maze, and I still had to walk outside in freezing weather to enter the store.  It's a typically gigantic CS, staffed with happy sales people eager to help.  Container Stores have some of the best-trained people in any chain.   But I didn't see anything that would differentiate it from any of their other locations.My goal was to buy a storage container for my new artificial Christmas tree, since I couldn't fit it back into the original cardboard box without smashing it.  If you've ever had an artificial tree, you know what I'm referring to.  (I think Fox Mulder would agree with me that this box thing is a conspiracy.  They make the boxes so small, everyone is forced to buy a container to store their trees.)      This day, everything related to the holidays was 50-75% off... except the tree and wreath storage.  Just my luck.  CS refused to tell me when the $50 fabric container I wanted was going on sale.  (Does anyone really pay $50 for a fabric artificial tree container?  Apparently not many, as there were still dozens on the shelves long after Christmas, waiting patiently for sale shoppers.)  I pointed out that I was registered with them, and that I'd spent over $1,500 on one of their excellent Elfa shelving systems last summer.  I really love my Elfa adjustable system!  (They have a 30% off Elfa sale twice a year.)  No one cared, and they still wouldn't give up the sale date.  Or perhaps corporate doesn't empower them to reward loyal customers.So I drove home and ordered something similar online (not at CS online), for half the price, with free two-day shipping and no sales tax.   It came today, and it's perfect. Considering the parking, the number of alternative CS locations... and especially their attitude... I'd only shop here again if I was already parked for an Icon movie.  But if you live nearby and don't have a car, this is probably your most convenient CS location.

1.description: It's a 7-11. Pretty much your standard stuff. Cashiers are about average. Prices are high, but that's expected - you're paying for the convenance and the location. You obviously should do your regular grocery shopping here, but is an acceptable option to fulfill a craving.

0.description: Average stuff but pricey but I mean what else do you expect from State st. Cashiers were nice and it wasn't busy so checkout was fast and easy. Also they sell those overboard things so that's cool. I would recommend coming here to get your slushy fix and maybe the occasional 2 for $1 gummy candies, but don't pay for an overpriced pint of ice-cream or pantry goodies.

28.description: I went to Basia again after setting up a correction appointment with the owner, Basia. She kept the salon open late for me, personally explained the circumstances behind my stylist's rescheduling and did not rush on my hair. She listened to what I wanted and not only did the color come out beautifully, but she took the time to style my hair perfectly since I was headed for a night out after my hair appointment (which was so appreciated and extremely considerate of her!). She did not charge me for these services and she was extremely polite and professional. I fully intend to return to Basia Salon for future highlights and cuts. My hair turned out so well, she took pictures for her portfolio! I am EXTREMELY HAPPY with my hair now and I have Basia to thank for that!Based on my combined experiences at Basia, I advise future clients to not only bring pictures, but also to write down in extremely specific detail what you want so your personal vision for your hair is as well articulated as possible.

1.description: I'm giving this one star because I can't give it 0. My daughter is, as I type, having her hair "fixed" after Jasmine gave her the worst ombre coloring I have ever seen. I would have been better off buying the ombre kit at Target. My daughter also has an eyebrow threading scheduled- there is NO WAY I would let Jasmine touch her eyebrows after this. Now I will have to pay probably close to $200 to have our old stylist (we moved to Chicago from the suburbs recently) fix her hair, which is absolutely fried from bleaching, coloring & re-coloring. There is no way I will be relinquishing the Groupon to this business, and I can only hope Groupon will refund my money.When I called a little while ago I had the absolute pleasure (sarcasm) of speaking to Olga, who indicated that she was a manager. She explained to me that Jasmine was "fixing" my daughter's hair. The fact that she admitted it was being "fixed" is admittance enough to the horrible job that was done. WHen I informed her I wasn't paying, she became belligerent. TERRIFIC customer service. WOW. Never again. Avoid this place like the plague. I only hope I can upload pictures of the nightmare that is my daughter's hair.

39.description: Love, love, love this salon. It is a hidden gem in the lower level of the Hilton Hotel. The owner, Basia, has been my stylist for many years (always a fabulous cut & color). I will be a client 4-life!

9.description: What a great experience!  I came here on a whim after buying a Groupon Now! Deal ($95 for a haircut and highlights). Basia was nice enough to make an appointment for me at 7:30PM (even though that meant I would be closing the place out with a 2-hour process). In addition to the highlights, Sam (the stylist) suggested for my roots to be dyed too since my hair was lighter on the bottom due to previous dyeing.Sam worked efficiently and precisely.  He was very friendly and made me feel at ease.  I have naturally stick straight dark brown hair, which he turned into a wavy rich medium brown w/ caramel highlights.  Sam gave me layers to add body to my hair as well as side bangs that swept across my forehead.  He kept the length of my hair long, and the cut was exactly what I asked for. In short, my hair looks amazing!  I haven't had highlights for years, but after this experience I definitely plan on coming back again and doing it all over again. My hair just looks so shiny, full and SEXY!  I definitely recommend this place to anyone!

29.description: The best Brazilian Wax in town! Go to Marta! Ive been seeing Marta for a couple years now and she does waxes along with amazing facials!

23.description: I got a haircut and higlight deal from groupon for $95, so i thought, why not?  They had availability that afternoon so timing was extremely convenient.  Finding the place was a bit of a challenge as they are in the basement of a hotel.  The salon needs a facelift, but if you go in with the attitude that you are getting a good deal, the glitz and glam aren't needed...I got my hair cut and highlighted with Sam, who was really nice.  However, I felt not attentive.  I have gotten higlights many times before... and he seemed to have left the highlights in for a rather long time.  As i was waiting someone else came in to get a blow dry last minute. While i patiently waited, 5 minutes turned into 20+ minutes.  At one point I had to interupt their conversation and remind Sam that I still needed tending to.  The highlights didn't turn out as even as i had hoped (i don't like the chunky look and even after mentioning it, his resassurance proved inadequate).  The haircut was great, but I don't think i will return.  But then again... i only paid $95 - so what could i expect?  I would only go if you needed a last minute fix and you got a deal.

5.description: I still go to Marta regularly for my waxes and she has been the best aesthetician I've come across. I recommend her to all of my north-side living friends and she is worth the trek to the South Loop.

31.description: I went here last month after getting a Groupon for a cut and highlights and it was terrible! I had to spend over $200 dollars and 3 hours getting my hair fixed the next day at my regular salon (Red Door Spa). First of all, the place was hard to find, no signs or anything, and then it was in the basement and looked like a cheap place from the 80's. I had made an appointment and there were no other customers but I still had to wait forever to get started. I should have left by now, hind sight is 20/20. When they can finally be bothered to get to me the guy talks me into getting low lights for an additional cost. There's no music playing or any separation between stylists stations so when another customer came in I had to spend an hour listening to his entire conversation about back waxing and breaking up with his girlfriend. When everything was finished, at first I thought it looked good. I blame this on the terrible fluorescent lighting because it wasn't until I got home and my boyfriend looked at me horrified and asked why my hair was gray that I could see my "highlights" were bleach blonde and the "low lights"  were big BLACK streaks! I have red hair, WHITE and BLACK are NOT highlights and low lights! I had to go to my regular salon the very next morning and spend over $200 dollars and 3 hours having them fix my hair. I was also informed that they never should have offered me low lights, those are only used when someone has had a lot of past highlights and they need to even your hair  tones back out some. He just wanted to get more money from me. I do not recommend this salon, I can't believe there are so many good reviews on here for them. The atmosphere and their work is awful.

25.description: Marta is the best waxer ever! So fast and virtually pain-free. They run good deals, too. Don't waste your time at the other south loop salons. This place is no frills - not fancy and sort of hard to find in the basement of the Hilton. But, well worth it.

12.description: I went to Basia again after setting up a correction appointment with the owner, Basia. She kept the salon open late for me, personally explained the circumstances behind my stylist's rescheduling and did not rush on my hair. She listened to what I wanted and not only did the color come out beautifully, but she took the time to style my hair perfectly since I was headed for a night out after my hair appointment (which was so appreciated and extremely considerate of her!). She did not charge me for these services and she was extremely polite and professional. I fully intend to return to Basia Salon for future highlights and cuts. My hair turned out so well, she took pictures for her portfolio! I am EXTREMELY HAPPY with my hair now and I have Basia to thank for that!Based on my combined experiences at Basia, I advise future clients to not only bring pictures, but also to write down in extremely specific detail what you want so your personal vision for your hair is as well articulated as possible.

37.description: Great place, awesome stylists and welcoming atmosphere. I have been going there for over 10 years to do my highlights as well as cuts. Basia, the owner helped me so much with chosing the color and style every time I was there. She always finds time for you even though she is booked every day.Beside good service, people who work there are very nice and proffesional.I will be back ;-)

21.description: In San Diego I have been going to the same woman for over 10 years and when I moved to Chicago, I was convinced that I would never find anyone just as fabulous as her, I think I've found my match, his name is Sam and he works at Basia's! I went in for partial highlights, low lights and a cut and couldn't be happier with all three services. I told Sam I wanted my highlights chunky but classy and tasteful, he also suggested my lowlight color be a little warmer than my natural color. Do you ever see a woman with the most beautiful and healthy hair that has not a strand out of place and think she must have spent a fortune on her hair? Thanks to Sam, I'm that woman now! And I didn't have to spend a fortune on it. I was checking out hair of the other women in the salon and they all had beautiful, classy, tasteful, and expensive looking hair. It is quite clear that everyone at Basia's knows what they are doing. If you want a timeless look, go to Basia's and you will leave looking like a million bucks! I can't wait for my next appointment with Sam!

16.description: I have been going to Basia to get my hair cut and colored for a couple of years now and wouldn't dream of going anywhere else.  I stumbled upon Basia when I was in a last minute, dire need of having my roots done and she made time to squeeze me in.  It was love at first dye.  I went back a month later for a hair cut and it was exactly what I asked for.  Not only is she very skilled with hair services, but she is also very warm and welcoming.  She is also very accommodating with her schedule.  Her salon is hidden in the lower level of the Hilton Towers and isn't going to wow you aesthetically (it is very simple and humble), but when I think of how many times I walked into a high end salon with all the bells and whistles to set a perfect ambiance, only to end up leaving with a so-so haircut/color and next month's rent check halfway spent....I am a faithful customer here for a reason and if you're looking for somewhere great to go downtown for hair services that will leave you smiling and at a cost that won't break the bank, this should be your one and only choice.

17.description: What a hidden gem!  I work in the South Loop, and really wanted to get a haircut on my lunch break.  I have not had good luck with a few other South Loop salons, so I went searching around on Yelp before heading out.  Basia Hair Design didn't have many reviews, but they were all 5 stars, so I thought I would check it out.It's a bit tricky to find.  You have to go down into the basement of the Hilton.  But it's well worth it.  The space is pretty bare bones.  No fancy lighting or elaborate stations.  But the staff there clearly knows what they're doing.  I was able to walk right in and get a great haircut from Olga.  She did exactly what I wanted and helped me think about how I might cut my hair after it grows a bit more.  She was super meticulous.  I will definitely be back.

10.description: i have been Basia's customer for about 3 years. i first dealt with Sam for my highlights and base color, then when he left, she took over and did what i would call an overall good job (ok, had to go back a few times to remove some orangey parts). That means spending $210 every about 45 days (calculate the total spent there), in addition to keratin treatments & occasional trims. i think she is among the most expensive salons in chicago, but no money is spent on improving the salon's appearance. It looks very basic. it was nice to feel treated like a guest and be able to schedule easily. We always had a very friendly relationship, not really a stylist/customer one. Unfortunately it ended in a very unpleasant way for me. My last visit was extremely stressful, as i could feel negative vibes from her, and it was similar during the previous visit....45 days earlier. So both times were unpleasant. When i asked her what was wrong, why she was stressed, she kept saying she was fine. She was coughing and her voice wasn't clear. i wanted to check if she was sick to protect myself, she flat out said "NO, i am NOT sick. i am in PERFECT health". She kept coughing over my face all the time, including during the shampooing. i thought "okay, looks like she IS sick after all, and that i will be contaminated". The visit was long, and When i briefly expressed my frustration with the fact that my stylist was taking out her bad mood on me, i got yelled at in a sort of a blow up / nervous breakdown where she said she was "worried about" (something that i won't disclose here). So i was right from the start that something was wrong. To be honest, i was shocked to find myself in this truly awkward, uncomfortable and unpleasant situation and have to endure 1 more hour of negative vibes there. i didn't say anything, and even though i empathize with her issue, it does NOT justify yelling at your customer and acting stressed out all the way TWICE in a row. After all, she is not doing me a favor, i am paying BIG bucks for those visits. i was stupid enough to leave a tip but was in a rush to get out once and for all...with a 1.5 INCH chunk of platinum/yellow hair on the top of my head and copper orange on each side when i had insisted i wanted to get away from the chunky look. When i pay $210, i expect a better job. Here is the "scoop": the very next morning i woke up with throat ache, mucus, all over body aches and a runny nose and am still struggling with it, and struggling to work. If i had not been contaminated by Basia who was careless and unprofessional enough to cough around customers and make them sick while denying she is sick, i would not have updated this review. i remember i had a 70+ year old Esthetician long time ago whose husband was literally dying from cancer and who was always incredibly professional and nice everytime, even after he passed away....We all have worries in our lives, and when i go there i have my own worries too, and you do too. it does NOT justify taking them out on your customers, ESPECIALLY a long time one. This is just entitled, spoiled behavior. When you are unable to deal with stress and work at the same time, you stay at home. When you are SICK, you wear something to cover your mouth or you inform your customer, or you stay at home. This is all just so unprofessional and ridiculous. But there are many hair salons in chicago to choose from.

11.description: Went here based on the stunning reviews. Had an O.K. experience. The ambiance was lacking, the tone and feel of the place very unprofessional, but the lady who cut my hair (Olga?) was kind and took her time, albeit cutting my hair a little too short. Oh well, hair grows back. Glad I gave it a shot, but I won't be coming back.

26.description: I have to say that I love this place!! My main reason for visiting was because my "Rock Star" aesthetician, Marta, joined the staff. Once I walked in, I feel in love. The staff is friendly and knowledgeble. You're greeted the moment you walk in; you don't have to wait forever before you're seen.And if you're in need of a good waxing, have no fear, Marta is here! Hands down (no pun intended!!), Marta is the best when it comes to your waxing needs. She makes you feel comfortable, and is totally fantastic at what she does. I've been going to her for years, and I wouldn't even consider going to anyone else. This place is great! Convenient location, excellent prices, 5 star service!

27.description: I usually stick to one stylist but she burned my hair and then cut it like an ugly birds nest with too many sticks on one side, so I had no choice but to sever the relationship. Heartbroken and ticked off, I went on hair strike and waited too long to get a highlight and cut.  My hair was droopy and ugly and I was as stubborn as my fuddy father is in going to the doctor. I am always leery of going to a new salon but I knew the day would come when I needed to look like a human being again. I took a chance, bought a groupon and I am soooo glad I did. I had really good luck. Among the other reviews here, I am going to add another great review for Sam. I explained what I wanted, got what I wanted and walked out feeling like a million bucks in under 2 hrs. The best thing about this place is their flexibility. I felt like if I asked them if I could come in for an updo for a surprise ball gown function, they would stick around just to help me, without question. They just want to be there for their customers, hopefully gaining repeats. I will be one of them. AND Basia is a quirky host and Prince Jordan her little old-guy rescue Yorkie is ADORBS. He scuttles around following her like a little guard slash supervisor. I LOVE HIM. Thanks.

35.description: What a hidden gem!  I work in the South Loop, and really wanted to get a haircut on my lunch break.  I have not had good luck with a few other South Loop salons, so I went searching around on Yelp before heading out.  Basia Hair Design didn't have many reviews, but they were all 5 stars, so I thought I would check it out.It's a bit tricky to find.  You have to go down into the basement of the Hilton.  But it's well worth it.  The space is pretty bare bones.  No fancy lighting or elaborate stations.  But the staff there clearly knows what they're doing.  I was able to walk right in and get a great haircut from Olga.  She did exactly what I wanted and helped me think about how I might cut my hair after it grows a bit more.  She was super meticulous.  I will definitely be back.

8.description: Used a Groupon and booked an appointment with Jasmine.  She listened and did exactly what I was looking for.  The highlights look very good and the cut was very professional.  It was a very good experience and I'd recommend them.

0.description: I have to say that I love this place!! My main reason for visiting was because my "Rock Star" aesthetician, Marta, joined the staff. Once I walked in, I feel in love. The staff is friendly and knowledgeble. You're greeted the moment you walk in; you don't have to wait forever before you're seen.And if you're in need of a good waxing, have no fear, Marta is here! Hands down (no pun intended!!), Marta is the best when it comes to your waxing needs. She makes you feel comfortable, and is totally fantastic at what she does. I've been going to her for years, and I wouldn't even consider going to anyone else. This place is great! Convenient location, excellent prices, 5 star service!

38.description: I recently went in for a hair cut and style after buying a Groupon Now deal.  I have really thick, curly hair, so usually when I get it cut, it looks awesome when I leave the salon, but I can never get it to look that good myself.  I'll spend over an hour blow drying and going over it with a flat iron, and I still look like a triangle head.But alas!  Bashia gave me a haircut that actually works with my hair!  She layered and thinned just right, so that I can spend a half hour blow drying and it looks good!  The haircut was about a month ago and I'm still able to re-create the look.  I've honestly not sure what she did different, but she did tell me when I walked in that she loved thick hair...so maybe it's her specialty...who knows.I've very happy with my hair cut and will return in a few months!  Only thing I didn't like was that it was downstairs in the Hilton, kind of hidden away, so it took me several minutes to find the place.  But if you have a better sense of direction than I do (which is basically everyone in the world), you'll find it no problem.

20.description: Went here based on the stunning reviews. Had an O.K. experience. The ambiance was lacking, the tone and feel of the place very unprofessional, but the lady who cut my hair (Olga?) was kind and took her time, albeit cutting my hair a little too short. Oh well, hair grows back. Glad I gave it a shot, but I won't be coming back.

19.description: I recently went in for a hair cut and style after buying a Groupon Now deal.  I have really thick, curly hair, so usually when I get it cut, it looks awesome when I leave the salon, but I can never get it to look that good myself.  I'll spend over an hour blow drying and going over it with a flat iron, and I still look like a triangle head.But alas!  Bashia gave me a haircut that actually works with my hair!  She layered and thinned just right, so that I can spend a half hour blow drying and it looks good!  The haircut was about a month ago and I'm still able to re-create the look.  I've honestly not sure what she did different, but she did tell me when I walked in that she loved thick hair...so maybe it's her specialty...who knows.I've very happy with my hair cut and will return in a few months!  Only thing I didn't like was that it was downstairs in the Hilton, kind of hidden away, so it took me several minutes to find the place.  But if you have a better sense of direction than I do (which is basically everyone in the world), you'll find it no problem.

33.description: I went to Basia for the first time today and couldn't have been more pleased with the cut and style Sam gave me.  Definitely my new go-to stylist.

2.description: My stylist Jasmine was VERY sweet and skilled. My coarse Ainu hair cannot be tamed but she did an amazing job. I was staying at Essex Inn across the street for my friend's wedding weekend and needed help with bridesmaid hair. Very convenient place to get done up for a wedding in the loop. I would give her handiwork 4.5 stars -- I did the other bridesmaids' hair myself but my own hair is very difficult.What detracts from the very positive results was the very unpleasant experience with owner Basia. When I had booked the appointment I explained I was looking to spend no more than $60 and they said they would take care of me and give me a good deal. But of course when the services were finished she wanted me to pay $80, not including tip. When I wanted to use a Yelp deal to offset that she added a restriction and said that the deal was only valid for Chicago residents and that I could not use it. I was in a rush to stick to the wedding day-of schedule so I just sucked it up. But it was pretty lame to feel misled and ripped off.

34.description: If I could hire anybody to be my daily stylist, it would be Sam. He listened to my ideas about what I thought I needed, he gave me suggestions, and then followed through in execution and made my hair so much more beautiful than I imagined. I love my cut, highlights, and the entire experience. Next to walking out feeling beautiful, I love getting my scalp massaged and hair washed. And let me tell you... I think I might come back JUST to get my hair washed. It was the best shampoo of my life! No joke! And then he proceeded by blowing out my hair to perfection. The salon is modest, but I will trade that for the wonderful service that I received. No rushing, pretentious attitudes, or lack of cleanliness here. Sam's great personality is backed by his 20 years of experience, and I will definitely be going back.

32.description: I got the groupon now for highlights and cut and Sam did a great job! It's not hard to find there's even a sign when you walk into the Hilton. I appreciated the fact that they got me in right away and I didn't spend 4 hours in there. Sam works fast and great. Also there are no hidden fee's, he told me right away it was going to be extra $40 for low lights and asked if I still wanted them. Great place all around, and Jordan is a cute little dog that comes with Basia!

18.description: A hidden little gem!  In addition to Yelp deals, they run Groupon Now deals fairly regularly - it's so easy to get a last minute appointment and they do a good job.

41.description: Nestled in the lower level of the Hilton is a sweet spot where I just went to get a great haircut. A South Loop gem-walking distance from so many places. My hair cut is as good or better than the ones I've gotten at the  super expensive salons on the Gold Coast. Basia, the owner and my stylist, gave time and ideas as we consulted about the look I was hoping to achieve. She is meticulous, professional and talented. The shop isn't fancy-schmancy like the chrome and glass glossy salons who are filled with young stylists just learning their craft-ON YOU! Basia is seasoned but very contemporary-my hair is just perfect!

13.description: I went to Basia a couple months ago with a groupon for partial highlights and haircut. She was AMAZING! I showed her a couple pictures on my phone of how I wanted my highlights to look and she totally followed what I showed her. These highlights have lasted longer and looked fresher months later than anywhere else I have gone. I'm finally going to call to make another appointment but I know I'll be in good hands with Basia.

4.description: I had a groupon and made an appointment with Jasmine. My partial highlights and cut turned out wonderful and the best part, I was in and out in just an hour and a half! I highly recommend Jasmine as a stylist. She is sweet and really tries hard to do exactly what the client wants. I took a risk and got my eyebrows threaded by her too. Oh my. It was painful but so worth it. My unmanaged eyebrows are asymmetrical with more hair on one side than the other. This usually trips waxers up but not her. The shape of my eyebrows turned out to be natural with just a little arch and both sides looking exactly the same. Just like I want them to be. :)

24.description: It is amazing and the price is reasonable! Highly recommended!

6.description: Terrible cut, layers look like my hair got chopped with a machete.They don't blend together. I will have to go somewhere else to fix this mess.Don't go there.

22.description: I got my nails done here for my wedding.  The owner did my manicure and pedicure herself, and they turned out great. She was even able to salvage the nail I broke about a week before.  I tend to destroy manicures in no time flat, and I didn't get a single chip for nearly a week, and they still looked OK two weeks later.  The pedicure has held up for over a month now. Negative points though because I told her I needed to be back in my hotel room by a certain time to meet my makeup artist and I had to leave her waiting in the lobby for 15 minutes because my appointment ran long.  Also, at $85, it was a little more than I'm used to paying for a mani-pedi.

15.description: Ok I didn't actually go to this salon but I did enquire about their waxing services (which are listed on their website and there are other reviews about these services on Yelp....) So looking at the positive reviews I phoned them up. The woman who picked up the phone promptly told me they are just a hair salon! So FYI fellow yelpers - just in case you are looking for a Spa - maybe this just isn't the place!

40.description: I have been going to Basia to get my hair cut and colored for a couple of years now and wouldn't dream of going anywhere else.  I stumbled upon Basia when I was in a last minute, dire need of having my roots done and she made time to squeeze me in.  It was love at first dye.  I went back a month later for a hair cut and it was exactly what I asked for.  Not only is she very skilled with hair services, but she is also very warm and welcoming.  She is also very accommodating with her schedule.  Her salon is hidden in the lower level of the Hilton Towers and isn't going to wow you aesthetically (it is very simple and humble), but when I think of how many times I walked into a high end salon with all the bells and whistles to set a perfect ambiance, only to end up leaving with a so-so haircut/color and next month's rent check halfway spent....I am a faithful customer here for a reason and if you're looking for somewhere great to go downtown for hair services that will leave you smiling and at a cost that won't break the bank, this should be your one and only choice.

7.description: Had a GREAT experience here when in Chicago for business trip. Desperately needed some hair repair as color applies few days earlier did not match and left me wanting to hide from my colleagues. The stylist took time and effort to rematch my color and then did a gorgeous blowout. I was very nervous about final cost but was very reasonable - given all the work she did. Would definitely recommend.

36.description: What a great experience!  I came here on a whim after buying a Groupon Now! Deal ($95 for a haircut and highlights). Basia was nice enough to make an appointment for me at 7:30PM (even though that meant I would be closing the place out with a 2-hour process). In addition to the highlights, Sam (the stylist) suggested for my roots to be dyed too since my hair was lighter on the bottom due to previous dyeing.Sam worked efficiently and precisely.  He was very friendly and made me feel at ease.  I have naturally stick straight dark brown hair, which he turned into a wavy rich medium brown w/ caramel highlights.  Sam gave me layers to add body to my hair as well as side bangs that swept across my forehead.  He kept the length of my hair long, and the cut was exactly what I asked for. In short, my hair looks amazing!  I haven't had highlights for years, but after this experience I definitely plan on coming back again and doing it all over again. My hair just looks so shiny, full and SEXY!  I definitely recommend this place to anyone!

30.description: I needed a haircut BAD and found a special Basia was having a special so I decided to go for it- though risking going to a salon I knew nothing about. It was tricky to find at first, being in the basement of the Hilton, but I was very pleased once I found it and was finished. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, and Sam did amazing with my highlights and cut. Sometimes I spend up to 3 hours in a salon for a partial, hair cut and dry but Sam worked quickly and efficiently and I was out in about 2. They also take good care of their customers and always willing to do what is in the best interest for them - including offering competitive prices!

3.description: Pros:  Staff was very nice and accommodating.  Location was super convenient (we were staying at the Hilton - the salon is on the lower level).  I had a manicure, pedicure, and eyebrow threading.  All were fine.Cons:  My 7 year old daughter had polish applied to her fingernails and toes (not a full manicure/pedicure. Just polish).  It was $40 total for her.  $25 for polish on her teeny tiny toenails, and $15 for her itsy bitsy fingernails.

14.description: I got the groupon now for highlights and cut and Sam did a great job! It's not hard to find there's even a sign when you walk into the Hilton. I appreciated the fact that they got me in right away and I didn't spend 4 hours in there. Sam works fast and great. Also there are no hidden fee's, he told me right away it was going to be extra $40 for low lights and asked if I still wanted them. Great place all around, and Jordan is a cute little dog that comes with Basia!

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

1.description: My wax lady is getting way too popular, and pricey.  Sadly, that left me in need of a new wax specialist.  I remembered a friend of mine recommending this place, and it's close to home, so I decided to try it out.  Overall, I thought it was a good wax, but not great.  First, the room was cold and sterile.  I prefer to be somewhere relaxing and more inviting.  Second, they don't leave you along for a minute to change before or after the appointment.  For me, that's no big deal, since I'm going to be pretty much naked on the table anyway, but I've never had a situation like that, so it was a bit awkward.  Third, while my tech did a good job, I did find a few small areas that she missed, which was disappointing and just showed that she wasn't as thorough as I'm used to.On the good side, the tech was fast, efficient and had a great process that allowed me to observe good, clean waxing technique and habits.  Since cleanliness, ease and efficiency are the 3 most important aspects of a wax for me, this place did well in all the most important areas.  I might be back, but I'm not sold that this is my new go-to place, so I may experiment with a few other locations before committing to buy a recurring wax pass.  Oh yes, they sell those here.

9.description: First time their and I absolutely loved my wax specialist!  her name is Maneisha  she was super friendly and she did a great job at distracting you ! It was my first time having a Brazilian wax done and she gave me the best experience! Def going back to her!

23.description: Not a terrible place for a wax but not for me.  I maybe get my eyebrows done two or three times a year.  So I was a bit put off by them making me make an appointment for three weeks afterwards.  This is something I can maintain on my own at that point!But the wax artist was super sweet and liked that I wasn't picky.  But again, put off when she told me I needed about $50 in products and proceeded to put them on the counter, not even asking if I was interested in actually buying them.  All-in-all, I'm a person who wants to just run in and out to get my eyebrows done.  This took me being in there a little over 30 minutes.  The only bonus was the fact that they used something that made my skin calm down a little quicker.  They have a membership program if you buy your waxes up front which again, I'm not the person for that, but if you get waxed regularly you save some cash!  There's even an unlimited plan.  It's around the corner from me, but it was just too exhausting declining the up-sells for me to return.

12.description: I had the worst wax of my LIFE here!  Very painful, had to go over the same areas SEVERAL times. It was horrible. I ended up just saying, "Forget it!" and not letting the girl finish. I think my waxers name was Shavonne. I thought I was getting a deal because of their new customer special, but I wouldn't go back there if they PAID me. Maybe other waxers are better, but I wanted to cry.

21.description: I found out about European Wax Center via Sloopin. Because EWC recently opened, it's been offering free wax services and half off for a Brazilian for new clients, so I decided to give it a try and booked an appointment for a Brazilian.When I got there, I was greeted by two receptionists. The waiting area was clean and spacious. While I waited, one receptionist walked over and gave me information about EWC's waxing services and discount membership options.My wax artist came out to greet me and take me to the room. The room was clean, spacious, and well-lit. (I've been to a couple places that were literally rented rooms/closets in salons and thus not as aesthetically pleasing.) She was very nice, but I thought it was a bit odd that she stayed in the room while I undressed my bottom half. (Every other time I've gotten a wax, the wax specialist left the room, giving me time to "freshen up" and get comfortable.)She kept conversation going the entire time. She explained that EWC is known for its special wax (special color, hard wax, no cloth strips, etc.). She did a good job of applying pressure and making sure the process wasn't too painful. Towards the end, she extolled some of EWC's products and really encouraged me to purchase them. She took me back to the lobby/waiting area and showed the products to me. Considering the price of each product, I politely declined. She and the receptionist were very firm in scheduling another appointment within the next 4-6 weeks. The wax specialist left me alone with the receptionist so that I could schedule something; I tried to explain that I would call and schedule over the phone, but I couldn't get out of it. It's not that I mind scheduling in advance, as I often do with my regular waxer, but I wanted to be sure that the waxing was well done by checking "growth" over the next couple weeks. The receptionist also tried to encourage the discount membership option again, and I said I'd think about it--again, for the same reason of wanting to make sure over the next couple weeks that the waxing was done well.It's been a couple weeks since my waxing appointment, and "growth" has been good--no in-growns, irritation, etc. Also, hair growth seems to be a bit faster than when I get waxed with my usual wax specialist, but it's not that big of a difference. (Personal note: I don't really have a lot of growth down there, and I can go eight weeks between waxes. I also am not prone to in-growns, irritation, etc.--only got redness once when I first got waxed). I think my usual wax specialist is a lot more efficient and quick, though, so I'm not sure if I'll be switching right away. (However, they just opened a couple months ago, so I'm sure the specialists will get better with time.) EWC is convenient for people living in the South Loop, though, and since it is closer than my usual place, I wouldn't mind going here when I can't make it up to the suburbs. Also, the discount membership packages are actually pretty decent, and if you're a student, you can get a good discount as well. The prices are fair--$40-something for a Brazilian is the lowest I've seen in the city! Overall, I liked my experience at European Wax Center and will probably visit them again!

16.description: Worst customer service.  Everyone good leaves this place.  Choose another location as this one couldn't be worse.  Do you normally bleed when someone waxes you?

17.description: Staying within budget, I don't get my "lady parts" waxed as often as I did when I lived in Miami and utilized a European wax spa then, but I love the look and feel of it. So when I saw that they were opening a European Wax Center a block away from my house I was ecstatic. People don't understand how comfortable and pain free  European wax is in comparison to normal cold or honey wax. While walking past the spa on my way home I was given a service menu and a card for a free service (eyebrows, underarm or bikini). I jumped on the opportunity and went for the bikini! The receptionist greeted me as a I walked in and told me about the frequent wax membership they provide. She was informative, but not aggressive or pushy. My waxer, Sharther, was fantastic! She was very bubbly to the point we were laughing and chatting during "the deed". I appreciate that she told me everything she was doing as was doing it. I definitely walked out a satisfied customer and even made an appointment to return in 3 weeks. I highly recommend the spa. Great, friendly employees and efficient service.

10.description: I have never been waxed at a different chain, but I have been waxed at two other EWC locations by three different wax artists before finding Chavon at this location.Usually my wax artists are awkward and quiet and it makes an already uncomfortable bikini wax seem terrible, but Chavon actually has a personality which makes the time go by faster.At this location, I have also been waxed by Cherry who made me cry so I prefer Chavon. She gets the job done fast and does not pull the wax slowly or multiple times. I feel like its half as painful as it used to be.I give four stars because while I recommend Chavon, the receptionists are so annoying! They are constantly asking me to buy more and they are also not very smart!Judging by other reviews on here, they annoy everyone.I have purchased the exfoliating gel here and I think it is a waste of money. An exfoliating scrub would work better and cost a lot less.

5.description: I had been to a different waxing place before this and decided to make a change. My previous waxer used strips, went super fast, and broke hairs causing breakouts and messed up the cycle growth. When I came here I still had the after-effects of that. I was skeptical at first because the last time I was at a European Wax Center location I had basically been told I was disgusting, which left me in tears. This time however, I had a great waxer. She made me feel super comfortable, she used hard wax everywhere which is perfect (less pain, more hairs pulled, no broken hairs). She used baby powder (a first for me, but it was awesome). She looked at my area and knew what had been done wrong by my previous waxer. She took her time and waxed at normal speed rather than lightning speed, which is what my previous waxer had done. Also, no tweezing, which was new to me. My previous waxer always tweezed the crap out of me, which I think left more irritation and ingrowns. At home it looked great. I was dry and felt clean for once and there was minimal redness whereas before I had usually been beet red and covered in leftover wax. The next day - no redness. There were a few hairs left over, but that was fine. It was probably the easiest and most comfortable I've ever felt with a wax. So I made another appointment and will definitely be going back. Here's hoping this amazingness lasts!

11.description: I have been going to EWC in the South Loop now for a few months.  I've had services done for eye brows and lips.  I am really impressed with this place.  The price is budget friendly, very clean, and the staff is friendly.  I really like having a private room for my waxing services (verses the Benefit Brow Bar where you're in the middle of a store and anyone/everyone can watch you as your service is completed).  The waxing technicians are also all really great, but I have to say Stephany is my favorite so far!  I will definitely continue to use their waxing services in the future.

22.description: Great find, were able to accommodate me last minute. Did a great bikini and brow wax. Will definately be going back. :)

0.description: Googled this place as I was lol for a place to get my eyebrows and upper lip waxed. It was convenient to my next destination so I stopped in without an appointment hoping I could be seen. At first I was told I couldn't be seen until a certain time but when I said I'd have to come back as I couldn't wait that long I was seen right away! Taylor took very care of me. She took her time working on both my eyebrows and upper lip. It's the longest anyone as ever taken! Both look great. The facility has a great special for residents of Chicago, the first eyebrow treatment is FREE!! How wonderful is that! And I was given a $5 off coupon for my next visit! I'll definitely recommend this place as well as return!!

20.description: First time here and enjoyed my free brow wax with Brigette. She was friendly, professional and did a great job. I didn't like the part where she tried selling me on a bunch of products, but I imagine that she was told to do so by the company. However, she was not pushy at all, which I appreciated. I will definitely be back.

19.description: This is the third time that I have waxing done at EWC, but first two was from a different location. I don't have bad to say about this location, their staffs are pretty nice and friendly. Although, the receptionist, Courtney I believe her name is forgot to put the tip I want to give my waxer on my bill. It kinda made it seem that I am a cheap client. Other than that, I had pretty decent experience in this location.

2.description: So I came here with my sister in law. We both received a Brazilian. When I got home I noticed all the patches of hair that was still left behind. Let's start from the beginning. 1. The room felt like I was going for a pap smear. The bed, counter, the walls all gave me gyno office feel. 2. The tech never left the room so I can get undressed. I understand she's gonna see it all anyway but I've never had anyone just stand there. 3. She didn't give me a mirror to check her handy work. 4. I had patches of hair left on my lower labia, the top and the sides. 5. There was nothing spa like or pleasant about this whole experience. Now I'm left with a spotty waxing that now all has to grow back so I can get a proper brazilian.6. She didn't have an additional light to see close up like other places. All the light she had was the florescent above. 7. She didn't tweeze. Most places make sure things are even and gone.

18.description: Not a terrible place for a wax but not for me.  I maybe get my eyebrows done two or three times a year.  So I was a bit put off by them making me make an appointment for three weeks afterwards.  This is something I can maintain on my own at that point!But the wax artist was super sweet and liked that I wasn't picky.  But again, put off when she told me I needed about $50 in products and proceeded to put them on the counter, not even asking if I was interested in actually buying them.  All-in-all, I'm a person who wants to just run in and out to get my eyebrows done.  This took me being in there a little over 30 minutes.  The only bonus was the fact that they used something that made my skin calm down a little quicker.  They have a membership program if you buy your waxes up front which again, I'm not the person for that, but if you get waxed regularly you save some cash!  There's even an unlimited plan.  It's around the corner from me, but it was just too exhausting declining the up-sells for me to return.

13.description: Today, I experienced humiliation and frustration when I attempted to get service at the S. Loop location in Chicago.  I had an appointment for 3:30 p.m. for brow & lip wax.  I arrived at 3:20 p.m.  (only 10 minutes early).  The door was locked.  A young lady came to the door, unlocked it, and said they were having a staff meeting. I advised the young lady that I had an appointment at 3:30.  She said, "You'll have to come back at 3:30." It was 19 degrees outside and snowing.  I was cold, shivering and bundled up.   I told her I was only 10 minutes early for my appointment.  She breathed a heavy sigh (as if I was annoying her) and told me to come back at 3:30.  She then shut the door, locked it and left me standing in the cold.    Unbelievable.I walked around in the cold looking and feeling lost.  I was stunned and amazed.  I couldn't help but wonder if I were a white woman if I would have been treated this way.  This young lady was either a racist or just plain rude.  The employee should have appreciated me arriving early, offered to let me sit in a treatment room or waiting area until my appointment time at 3:30.  I will NEVER set foot in that place again.  If I could give it ZERO STARS I would.

4.description: I love the European wax center, I came in to see Manisha the other day and she was so amazing.

24.description: Staying within budget, I don't get my "lady parts" waxed as often as I did when I lived in Miami and utilized a European wax spa then, but I love the look and feel of it. So when I saw that they were opening a European Wax Center a block away from my house I was ecstatic. People don't understand how comfortable and pain free  European wax is in comparison to normal cold or honey wax. While walking past the spa on my way home I was given a service menu and a card for a free service (eyebrows, underarm or bikini). I jumped on the opportunity and went for the bikini! The receptionist greeted me as a I walked in and told me about the frequent wax membership they provide. She was informative, but not aggressive or pushy. My waxer, Sharther, was fantastic! She was very bubbly to the point we were laughing and chatting during "the deed". I appreciate that she told me everything she was doing as was doing it. I definitely walked out a satisfied customer and even made an appointment to return in 3 weeks. I highly recommend the spa. Great, friendly employees and efficient service.

6.description: I will never recommend anyone to get a wax at this place. The employees are unprofessional and not trained well. Just because  you attend some run of the mill salon school does not make you a knowledgeable esthetician. The unexperienced & unprofessional women that helped me put wax all over my nether regions and couldn't remove it! What a grade A idiot!! The supervisor who is not a certified esthetician ( i was told that several times)  came in the room and just starred at me as if she was on drugs all zombie like, never once did she apologize or offer to have someone help remove the wax. At this point i started to freak out and called the ambulance to see if they could help, they offered to take me to ER but i declined because i could drive myself.  While all this was going on the supervisor just looked out of the window in daze. I will never return to this place, finally after 30 minutes the supervisor offered to have another lady help me. When i showed the new tech what happen she had a look of horror on her face. she was able to remove the hard wax however it hurt and i started to bleed. She was very helpful and apologized that this happened to me. This is the worst experience i have ever had in my life!  I will be reporting this place to the BBB and contacting an attorney. None of the people working here ( besides the tech that helped me) are qualified for the their jobs! If you never listen to a review please take mine into consideration and never step foot in this place. If you decide to go run away from the Young African American tech with braids ( sides shaved) she needs to go back to school and the supervisor should be fired. Total waste of space!

15.description: I finally reached a breaking point and couldn't wait for my usual lady at another establishment to come back from her holiday vacation and booked an appointment online. Glynis was excellent and I had a relatively painless hard wax brazilian, which is saying something since I thought, after a 3 month stint in between, it would be a world of pain. If my usual waxer is out of town again, I wouldn't hesitate to go back!

7.description: I've been to a couple other EWC locations before and they did a pretty decent job. This time I chose this location for a Brazilian and eyebrow wax because it was the closest to me.My eyebrows... the shaping of my eyebrows were pretty good. My eyebrows felt burnt but i didn't see anything. Next day though, I found a couple burnt spots. Aren't they also suppose to put some sort of cooling lotion/oil/something after the wax? The Brazilian was ok.  Some ingrown she couldn't get but that's fine. And no burnt spots!  Thank God!If I do choose to go back to EWC it would not be this location.

8.description: I had my first brazilian here with Danielle and it was one of the best experiences I've had. She was gentle, funny, and quick. I'll definitely be returning!

3.description: My visit to the EWC was my very first wax ever so I didn't really know what to expect nor do I have anything to compare it to but I thought it would be more inviting and spa like. I had full arms and lower legs done. I was hoping to leave smooth and soft but my hairs didn't seam ripped from the roots. it was more as if the hairs where ripped in half or just broken off and lots of places were missed altogether.  My waxer went over the same areas 3 or 4 times. I think her name was Janel or something like that. I'm going to give the EWC one more try with a different waxer though. I really hope this time I leave with the SMOOTH!!!!!! skin I desire. After all isn't that the point of a wax!!

14.description: My wax tech Stephany (go figure) rocks. I am not the easiest client but she makes sure I'm comfortable. The best service I've received.

58.description: We were on vacation. My wife wanted a Chicago hotdog. Devil Dawgs had great reviews. Well it is not fancy and does not purport to be fancy, but the food was good.  We had walked from the Vice District, (another review).  I had the Chicago Dog and a Blue Demon Dog, my wife had the Chicago Dog, we split an onion ring order.  Excellent!  If you want a simple inexpensive, very well made dog, this is the place.

56.description: The service here is very slow. You wait in line to order at the counter, and that line moves very slowly. Then after your order it seems to take about 5 minutes to get your food. The fries are disappointing - they tend to be like warm, soaked in grease, and limp. It's OK for a late night craving, but not my first choice for places to eat.

29.description: Stopped back in, purely for research's sake. Yup, Elvis burger still crazy delicious. My wife got the Bull Dawg (deep fried with slaw and onions) which she really liked. I thought it was solid, but not as good as the Elvis. We split a bucket of cheese fries. They are a good value and exactly what they sound like (a giant bucket of fried cheesy goodness). Finally, we actually got to try some shakes. She got a peanut butter and chocolate and I got the Latin Beat. The chocolate and peanut butter was very good, that's a flavor combination that is pretty hard to mess up. The Latin Beat was chocolate and ancho chiles. The ancho was a little unexpected, as most Mexican chocolate I've had features cinnamon and cayenne, while the ancho brought a smoky richness that really complimented the chocolate. It was perfectly spicy and tasty. Once again, a solid offering from Devil Dawgs.

42.description: Didn't love it, but that could be because i like my dogs grilled.  Liked the toppings and the onion rings were good but overall, it was just ok.  small, lots of younger crowd.  cheap!

23.description: My mouth waters every time I think of the delicious Malts and Hotdogs we had at Devil Dawgs! If you're in Chicago you need to stop by and have the best food in town. We tried about 4 different hot dog places while in Chicago and this was hands down the best hot dog spot in Chicago! And their Malts, probably the best in the US.

47.description: The food here is always good! Highly recommend the "Clucker" very good! The morning burger is also a favorite of mine

8.description: Right outside the Harrison "L" train stop... the Devil Dawgs neon sign is a sight for sore eyes (literally) at 2:30 AM. Stopped here for some dawgs after a long night with some coworkers on a company trip. Definitely a great place to stop by for a hot dog on your way back to your hotel room. Myself and two of my coworkers stopped in and never having tried them before, I asked the cashier "this might be a stupid question..." and proceeded to ask about their menu. At 2:00 in the morning, with a smile "there are no stupid questions here at Devil Dawgs" was his reply before explaining what exactly goes into some of their more "creative" named dawgs.For the price of a frappuccino, you could have a delicious, heart stopping, hot dawg to end your glorious night.

31.description: When I first moved here, we would pass this place all the time not even taking a second look. When it came up on Yelp as being a good place, we tried it and have never looked back again. To us, it's truly the best burgers we've ever had. We bring our friends from the burbs all the time and they love it. I love that the burgers are small and you can double or triple it. The milkshakes are also just to die for. We're here almost every week.

34.description: Ordered late thursday night . Amazing shakes . The banana split one is amazing.  So is the oreo. When my delivery arrived the shakes were nice and cold. I also ordered a side of fries which were good. Little old tasting had they been fresher im sure they would of been amazing

16.description: Came here for a wedding last april and read plenty of yelpers reviews!!! Thankfully most reviews steer you towards the Clucker. It was no joke.  I think I ate 5 during the course of an entire weekend.

13.description: When I first moved here, we would pass this place all the time not even taking a second look. When it came up on Yelp as being a good place, we tried it and have never looked back again. To us, it's truly the best burgers we've ever had. We bring our friends from the burbs all the time and they love it. I love that the burgers are small and you can double or triple it. The milkshakes are also just to die for. We're here almost every week.

11.description: Whenever I see an entire crew of tumbling, stumbling sorority girls wearing mama-would-be-hella-ashamed tight dresses and damn-those-thangs-look-like-they-hurt-alot high heels and screaming at the top of their lungs, "OMG, I need a Devil Dawg like right now, or I'm gonna starve to death!" post-club/ bar (I'm assuming), I take it as a good sign. So how did I end up at Devil Dawgs? ***Despite visiting Chicago several times on her own, my girlfriend had never eaten a Chicago hot dog until that night. (Tisk tisk.) So when we found our planned dinner destination to be closed, we looked for hot dog joints on my Yelp app. Luckily, we found this establishment only a couple blocks down from the Hilton. My breakdown:I. FOOD*Chicago Dawg: Solid classic with mustard, onions, relish, pickle, tomato, sport peppers and celery salt. The mustard didn't overpower and the pickle gave a great crunch. I also appreciate the pillow-y soft bun. Pretty good. ($2.95)*Boykin Dawg: Consists of their homemade Coney sauce, hush hush slaw, and pickle. While I don't know what the first two ingredients I listed are, I can tell you that I had no problem scarfing this beauty down, and I liked it more than my Chicago dog. ($2.95)II. SERVICEDogs came out in under five minutes and the staff there were nice. No problems.III. ATMOSPHERE/ DÉCORIt's "hot dog" shaped (ha ha), and clean, despite the foot traffic they get. There are some hi-top tables and sit-down seating. I imagine it would be impossible to sit anywhere, though, during peak hours.IV. PRICESThey are very reasonable for the South Loop. V. OVERALLI would absolutely return to Devil Dawgs if I had the chance. Although, I'm not sure if I would go out of my way to visit there if I was in another part of Chi-City. (Mainly because of traffic.)

39.description: If you are looking for a great local place to get a dog, I would definitely recommend this. The location is small so getting a table might be tough depending on the time of day, but the food is great and the people are friendly. The food is always freshly made, and the portion sizes are great. They also have a large variety of hotdog styles, from the classic Chicago to the Coney dog with chili. Milkshakes are very tasty as well to finish things off.

37.description: This place is just awesome! I took my family and boyfriend here. They all liked it especially my boyfriend! He came here 5 times in 1.5 weeks and ordered 5 times "call of the rooster" sandwich for himself. It's just so funny! He couldn't stop coming here, so I also came here with him and ended up ordering the same thing with him. We loved that sandwich! I had "Seoul dawg" hot dog and "the shroom portobello" sandwich before. They all were good although the Seoul dawg was a bit salty for me. Anyway, try the call of the rooster sandwich! Hope you'd like it too!

0.description: Great hot dogs here.  Was in town for a business conference and I grabbed a couple of dogs on the way back to the hotel.  I had a dog with kraut and mustard as well as a chili dog. Both were served up quickly with a  smile. The dogs were great.  Kraut was heated and topped with a touch of celery salt. Chili had a good ratio of beans to meat and I enjoyed it thoroughly. Very clean operation. I'll be back in Chicago in January and I'm making it a point to go back.

38.description: This is a great place to get a dog or burger!  Hell, even fries!!  Went here tonight with my nieces on a whim to get some Chicago dogs before we leave town.  I got the bacon cheddar dog & José Calienté dog.  Both were great.  With the José Calienté, it was my first time having a dog with spicy pico de gallo, cucumber, & devil sauce.  And it was fabulous!   I tasted my one of my niece's milk chocolate shake (stated that on receipt) but I'm sure it was the peanut butter & chocolate shake.  DELICIOUS!  She also ordered the BBQ bacon burger and she loved it.  My other niece ordered the chili cheese fries.  We were both surprised that it arrived in a huge styrofoam container.  Not your average sized order.  I didn't sample it but she was loving every bite of it.  If you're in Chicago and you need a hot dog or burger fix come on down to Devil Dawgs.

51.description: Loved this restaurant!!!! I highly recommend the Chicago and taco hotdog. Prices are more than reasonable and there is a wide selection of flavors for hot dog styles.

27.description: This was the first place we went to the night we flew in. We walked to the place and were a in awe of all the choices. I tried something new each time I went! Sean was really patient and took his time explaining a few of the menu items. If your looking for burgers they got a great selection as well. The Chicago dog and Morning burger are my favorite! Fries are great too! Not too salty and delivered piping hot! But everything is good. Didn't get to try the shakes but I'm sure they're good as well. Great place!

32.description: Classic 'fast food' but done properly with solid customer service and open late.Sliders (5/5)The buns are soft and fluffy, the meat is crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  These sliders are done right and I would recommend the Elivis and the BBQ BaconHot Dogs (4.5/5)These aren't fancy hot dogs by any means, but are fundamentally done right.  My recommendations include the bacon cheddar dog and the Coney chilli cheese dog. The Chicago dog is somewhat disappointing compared to other places so that's the only one I'd avoid.Milkshake (5/5)Thick, creamy, and absolutely delicious.  The one thing I really appreciate about these milkshakes is that they aren't too sweet.  I went with the strawberry oreo milkshake but there's so many combination here and it's really really hard for me to not order a milkshake every time I come in. Overall a fantastic place to eat and the only real reason for me not awarding that fifth star is because the prices are a little bit on the higher end.  I know you get what you pay for but if they increased the portion sizes or decreased the prices I'd happily give Devil Dawgs a five star rating.  Nevertheless, this is still a great place to eat at and the food usually comes out quick!

54.description: Had the chicken sandwich and fries. Both were really good. I know. I know. Why didn't I have a hot dog at a dogs place.

48.description: The burgers are out of this world. The Elvis with peanut butter and Sriracha, the Morning Burger with fried egg and Clucker chicken sandwich are great choices. Hotdogs: Chicago, Devil Dawg, New Yorker, Cheese dog and the Polish were super great as well.

44.description: While visiting Chicago on business I was so pleased to find this place near my hotel.  Friendly, fun environment, many options and great food.  I liked it enough to bring my coworkers back.  Highly recommended.  Thanks Devil Dawgs!

24.description: Great dawgs and fabulous fries. Good prices and convenient location near Millennium Park and museums.

7.description: Went here as I wanted a burger and live in the neighborhood.  Got the BBQ Bacon Burger (double), fries, and a drink.  Really good prices and quality.  Fun atmosphere and all around good experience.  Fries could have been a little hotter and more cooked, but were very good nonetheless.  Great portions and quality as stated earlier.

49.description: Yo, dawg, I heard you like hot dogs. If that's the case, you might appreciate the variety at Devil Dawgs. But, as an out-of-towner looking for a killer Chicago "dawg," I left feeling rather ambivalent.Big plus: the prices are good. And the fries were chock full of fresh, greasy goodness as seems to be the norm in Chicago. The Chicago dog itself didn't really impress me very much however. I'm not certain the wiener itself was of the best quality although it was probably the same Vienna brand dogs as seemingly every other place in the city.Summary: This devil could use a little more soul.

40.description: Excellent. I visited this location on a business trip to Chicago, as it was my first time in Chicago, and of course I couldn't leave without eating a deep dish pizza and a chicago dog. After picking up a personal size deep dish pizza from Lou Malnati's across the street, I came here to make sure I got both iconic foods in my stomach before I left.I ordered a Chicago dog, and the woman working the cash register asked me if I wanted it to be a Devil Dawg, which she described as being a bigger hot dog. Sold. The pickle and sliced tomatoes were really fresh. The pickle was crunchy and tasty, and the tomatoes were crisp and juicy. The peppers gave the dog a great kick, and the bun was soft. This place is a great stop to grab a quick Chicago dog (as well as burgers, fries, and all kinds of other hot dogs), and all of the components in the Chicago-style Devil Dawg I got were terrific.

53.description: Right outside the Harrison "L" train stop... the Devil Dawgs neon sign is a sight for sore eyes (literally) at 2:30 AM. Stopped here for some dawgs after a long night with some coworkers on a company trip. Definitely a great place to stop by for a hot dog on your way back to your hotel room. Myself and two of my coworkers stopped in and never having tried them before, I asked the cashier "this might be a stupid question..." and proceeded to ask about their menu. At 2:00 in the morning, with a smile "there are no stupid questions here at Devil Dawgs" was his reply before explaining what exactly goes into some of their more "creative" named dawgs.For the price of a frappuccino, you could have a delicious, heart stopping, hot dawg to end your glorious night.

30.description: They are my local supplier of Chicago style hot dogs.  They are open late late, so I can wander here after hours and grab a bite after a night on the town.  WYSIWYG, they're a hot dog joint that gets it right most of the time.

46.description: This is the perfect place to go to for a hotdog fix.  They have all the local favorites. You can't go wrong with their traditional Chicago Dog.  Since I already had my fill of Chicago dogs and I was severely intoxicated I decided to try something different slash buckwild. I asked for the "most ridiculous thing they've got" and they made me The Bull Dog. I was too drunk to remember what was on it but it was fantastic.  I think it may have been sweet.  Anyway the picture is below so you be the judge.  It was 6 bucks and we'll worth it cause of its size. I tipped the guy 4 bucks so he would make it more reDONKulous and oh boy did he. I recommend doing what we did.  Go next door and get a small personalized pizza from Lou's so you can save room for a sickTASTIC hot dog.  Here's a link to their menudevildawgs.com/eatsENJOY!

1.description: I ordered the triple sloppy job burger and I was surprised how small it was!  That being said it was super delicious, just expect more of an In-N-Out size.

55.description: Gotta have a Chicago dog!This place reminded me of a college fast food joint, complete with coordinated red ketchup and yellow mustard bottles on every table, and bright neon signs in front.

9.description: You would think that a chili dog would be the perfect late-night food after making the rounds at various jazz clubs around town. My husband sure did, and I went along for the ride. But oooof, I was not impressed. The employees were friendly, but the interior was pretty grimy and the clientele made me nervous -- evenly divided between loud drunk people and falling-asleep-in-their-milkshakes drunk people. We got our food to go. Our hotel was just a couple of blocks away, but a few minutes later when we unwrapped everything there, it was pretty unappetizing. I had a bite of the Coney Island dog and while the hot dog itself was fine, the bun was smushed and soggy from the chili that was also . . . sweet?! Why would you do that to ground beef? The fries had congealed together into one big mass in their styrofoam bucket, and they had the same chili topping. No thanks.It could be that this kind of food is only good when eaten seconds from the fryer; I also hated Five Guys the first time I tried it, but eating in the restaurant I liked it better. Still, I can only rate my experience, which fairly awful, and with so many options in Chicago, I can't see a reason to return here.

26.description: You would think that a chili dog would be the perfect late-night food after making the rounds at various jazz clubs around town. My husband sure did, and I went along for the ride. But oooof, I was not impressed. The employees were friendly, but the interior was pretty grimy and the clientele made me nervous -- evenly divided between loud drunk people and falling-asleep-in-their-milkshakes drunk people. We got our food to go. Our hotel was just a couple of blocks away, but a few minutes later when we unwrapped everything there, it was pretty unappetizing. I had a bite of the Coney Island dog and while the hot dog itself was fine, the bun was smushed and soggy from the chili that was also . . . sweet?! Why would you do that to ground beef? The fries had congealed together into one big mass in their styrofoam bucket, and they had the same chili topping. No thanks.It could be that this kind of food is only good when eaten seconds from the fryer; I also hated Five Guys the first time I tried it, but eating in the restaurant I liked it better. Still, I can only rate my experience, which fairly awful, and with so many options in Chicago, I can't see a reason to return here.

25.description: Fun place! My husband and I both had hamburgers and fries as well as a chocolate shake. All was good, especially the thick and creamy shake. The fries needed salt but otherwise were good and the price is definitely right!

12.description: Had chicago style hot dog fries an a burger all there burgers are( sliders )with bacon it was  good no its was delicious i wanted to turn around  an get two more. Man that little slider was theeeee bomb

59.description: By no means am I a hot dog expert...but I can't imagine them tasting any better than the ones I had here.  And the fries are hand cut...and the shakes are frigging awesome...thick thick thick.  Fast and cheap also.  Really can't say anything bad about this place...except it's a cheat meals cheat meal.

21.description: Went here on a whim for a snack. Wanted something local. Was very pleasantly surprised by the service and food. While I csnt remember the names of the dogs we chose, one was beer battered and deep fried. The other was covered in grilled onions and pickles and bacon.Only dissapointing part of the meal was the bucket of cheese fries with bacon and grilled onions. Didn't expect cheese sauce. But also the way it was served the fries were not crispy and we ate in the restaurant. So it wasn't a matter of taking it back to the hotel. Think they need to double fry the fries or cook them a little longer.

17.description: Had the chili cheese hot dog. It was pretty good! Came with cheese, mustard and chili, of course

10.description: This place is the epitome of a cheat meal. While visiting Chicago, we couldn't resist the appeal of a Chicago dog. We got that, but wanted more. That's where Devil Dawgs comes in. My husband and I ordered a disgusting amount of food. Among those foods were a chili cheese dog, bacon dog, burger, onion rings, and fries. OH. MY. GOD. Grease was seeping through our pores after, but it was worth every bite. The onion rings were freshly battered and fried to perfection...same goes for the fries. The dogs were equally amazing. Of course, after that big meal, why not get a hand-crafted milkshake? We split a chocolate peanut butter shake and it was probably the best milk shake I have ever had in my life. They have big thick straws to match the big thick milkshakes. Everyone who works there was super helpful and happy. I can't wait go back and gain another 20 lbs from this meal. At least Chicago is a walking city!
