5.description: New Found spot for lunch. Second time getting the "Clucker Sandwhich". Really good & not your regular chicken sandwhich. Lets start with the chicken. Its very tender on the outside/ juicy on the inside! It also offers hush hush coleslaw and topped with a pretzel bun. Amazing! Overall the experience is good just operation needs to move in a more timely fashion. Devil Dawgs will see my face more often!

3.description: I'm here in business, but knew I wanted a Chicago dog. I asked the locals where I could get a good tasty dog, they recommended Devil Dawgs. Got the Chicago dog and also the Chicago Polish. I split it with the boss. Both dogs were delicious and made quickly. They have a yin of dogs to choose from including a "Seoul Dawg", but I have to try that before I leave town. Great spot for a Chicago dog and definitely recommend.

35.description: We came upon this place because I was getting "hangry" and I needed to eat. This was so good!!!!!!! I had the Seoul Dawg, Chicago Dog, and Morning Burger. As I am writing this review my mouth is watering. This place is so good and i am so happy that I stopped here. I am excited to go back to Chicago just so that I can eat here again!!!

19.description: Yo, dawg, I heard you like hot dogs. If that's the case, you might appreciate the variety at Devil Dawgs. But, as an out-of-towner looking for a killer Chicago "dawg," I left feeling rather ambivalent.Big plus: the prices are good. And the fries were chock full of fresh, greasy goodness as seems to be the norm in Chicago. The Chicago dog itself didn't really impress me very much however. I'm not certain the wiener itself was of the best quality although it was probably the same Vienna brand dogs as seemingly every other place in the city.Summary: This devil could use a little more soul.

28.description: Pretty good hot dog! I would ask devil style, when the actual sausage link is thicker. Fries (bag o' fries) are homemade, and the portion is more than enough.

45.description: Had two great dogs - The Chicago and the Coney.  Take it from someone who loves a good dog, these were delicious!

33.description: I can't rave about this place enough. I probably go there at least once a week. The clucker sandwich is one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had. Huge piece of chicken fried to perfection. Pretzel bun. Slaw and pickles taste great as well. Some type of special sauce for the slaw and the pickles aren't your regular dill. This sandwich alone can fill you up. Onion rings are so light and delicious. The awesome sauce that goes with it is my favorite. Milkshakes are good as well. I initially went there for the hot dogs which taste equally as great, but the clucker sold me. I'm a loyal customer.

43.description: Good food and fast service.  Lots of originals on the menu.   Really great shakes, we had cookies and cream.  Tight in places to sit, but overall a great lunch.

2.description: Came here for lunch today and had a Chicago Dawg, which was a hotdog with mustard, pickles, tomatoes, relish, and peppers.  It was very tasty and only $2.95, so it was quite a deal.  Also had a bag of fries that were pretty good too.  Overall, it was a good deal for a meal.The venue is decorated with fun hotdog paintings, and the location was convenient on South State Street.  The staff was friendly, and the service was quick.  One real downside though was that there was no restroom for customers to use when we asked, and therefore, nowhere for customers to wash their hands...  That should certainly be improved.

18.description: Gotta have a Chicago dog!This place reminded me of a college fast food joint, complete with coordinated red ketchup and yellow mustard bottles on every table, and bright neon signs in front.

41.description: This place serves a need in the community.  When you have gone out partying, had a few too many beverages, need something to soak up the Etoh....Devil dawgs will serve your need.  (unfortunately in my case I was being stuck in conference way to late to get food anywhere else)  I tried a "kick ass" burger and green chile dawg.  Both were ok.  Nothing to write home about, but good enough to satiate a late night craving.  The burgers are pretty small, so two is better than one, and at least 2-3 dawgs to  The service is quick and the variety of food will satisfy anyone.

52.description: Staying in downtown and a couple people said to try this place. I looked it up on yelp and thought wow could be good. Little did I know their hamburgers are a size of pepperoni and they are smacked with oil that will lead you to the hospital. The fried are freshly cut but you'd rather have the freezer ones. I thought wow 19$ to feed two people isn't bad. Yeah it was terrivle. Hot dogs weren't anything special either.

50.description: When you absolutely,  positively have to have a Chicago dog and you need it fast, cheap and good, come here.  Being from the suburbs,  I am ashamed to admit that I haven't had much in the way of Chicago dogs.  I now consider myself sufficiently enlightened. I came here with some friends from out of town.  They had a combination of the Chicago dog, the New York dog and the Seoul dog.  The Chicago dog had the required complement of peppers, onions,  relish, mustard and a pickle that won't make you flinch from the acidity.  Ensconced within a soft poppy seed bun, the dog itself is firm with the expected snap from a Vienna hot dog.  You can easily snap this up in 2-3 bites, but I recommend that you savor it.According to my friends,  the Seoul dog was punchy, but not overwhelming in its spiciness.   The New York dog's only flaw was an inherent structural one, with the sauerkraut spilling over.I also had a bacon BBQ double burger.  Though small and smashed (a point of pride at this establishment), it packed a good deal of bad-for-you flavor.Devil Dawgs isn't fancy,  but it's very good at what it does.  You CAN have it fast, cheap and good.  Highly recommended.

4.description: Well this review has been long over due lol But recently me and my gal traveled and had a layover in Chicago!! Long story short we missed the layover and got to trek the city. Kate kept noting that she wanted an Authentic Chicago Dog and we searched the biting streets of Chicago. Devil Dawgs is great if your in the mood for a chow down. The prices are little pricey for Hotdogs but they really do load everything up. The blends for some of these dogs were gut punching we had the Wisconsin, The Chicago, The Coney Chili Cheese dog and a Sig Ep dog. I loved the Chili cheese dog and the Wisconsin was wow! The Chicago had a secret relish on it that's an original Devil Dawgs speciality. I could go without it but Kate LOVED it so it all matters of preference. All in all I think it's a great spot we met the owner and got to see some of the NFL playoffs while eating drop in and try it out if your shopping in the area.

6.description: This is the perfect place to go to for a hotdog fix.  They have all the local favorites. You can't go wrong with their traditional Chicago Dog.  Since I already had my fill of Chicago dogs and I was severely intoxicated I decided to try something different slash buckwild. I asked for the "most ridiculous thing they've got" and they made me The Bull Dog. I was too drunk to remember what was on it but it was fantastic.  I think it may have been sweet.  Anyway the picture is below so you be the judge.  It was 6 bucks and we'll worth it cause of its size. I tipped the guy 4 bucks so he would make it more reDONKulous and oh boy did he. I recommend doing what we did.  Go next door and get a small personalized pizza from Lou's so you can save room for a sickTASTIC hot dog.  Here's a link to their menudevildawgs.com/eatsENJOY!

22.description: Best Burgers and Dawgs in the South Loop. No lie.

15.description: This place serves a need in the community.  When you have gone out partying, had a few too many beverages, need something to soak up the Etoh....Devil dawgs will serve your need.  (unfortunately in my case I was being stuck in conference way to late to get food anywhere else)  I tried a "kick ass" burger and green chile dawg.  Both were ok.  Nothing to write home about, but good enough to satiate a late night craving.  The burgers are pretty small, so two is better than one, and at least 2-3 dawgs to  The service is quick and the variety of food will satisfy anyone.

57.description: This place has a very suburb feel inside a city. The hamburgers are about the size of a White Castle burger but definitely much tastier. I know everyone raves about the Elvis burger but I wasn't too crazy about it. Partially because I was having a delicious mint chocolate milkshake and the flavors between the spicy peanut butter and the minty chocolate definitely don't pair well. The original cheeseburger was good and the fries were delicious. So a key thing to remember is mint shakes can ruin a meal despite being super tasty.

20.description: Great hot dogs here.  Was in town for a business conference and I grabbed a couple of dogs on the way back to the hotel.  I had a dog with kraut and mustard as well as a chili dog. Both were served up quickly with a  smile. The dogs were great.  Kraut was heated and topped with a touch of celery salt. Chili had a good ratio of beans to meat and I enjoyed it thoroughly. Very clean operation. I'll be back in Chicago in January and I'm making it a point to go back.

36.description: Really relaxed atmosphere where you can head after class or to get hot dogs for a great price. Service is fast and the milkshakes are my favorite. Also definitely order a side of devil sauce because it's spicy and can transform your dog or fries into a true Devil Dog dish.

14.description: Was looking for a snack on the way back to the hotel from the Field Museum, and came here since I had not grabbed a hot dog in my time here. I just went with a Chicago dog, which was reasonably priced and served quickly. The dog was flavorful and delicious, and not just because I'd spent the whole afternoon walking around Millennium Park and such. Definitely going to check this place out again the next time I'm in Chicago.

3.description: I'm here all the time because they're open late and I never have food at home.  Luckily for them they're the only fast place open in the area that late.  Props for convenience, but don't expect anything special.Also, I think I'm putting the owner's kids through college.

1.description: I would give it ZERO stars if I could. I will never ever go back to this location. We showed up at 10:55am and ordered a breakfast sandwich. The girl behind the counter was rude and very short. She stayed they didn't sell breakfast after 11. But it wasn't even 11 yet. AWFUL service, dirty restaurant, and disrespectful worker.

2.description: The woman behind the counter put her finger in my tuna to spread it across the bread instead of using utensils and then was moving so fast trying to anticipate what I wanted that she put wrong things on and wouldn't redo it.

5.description: This Subway sandwich recently opened and the service and sandwiches are great! Everything here is new and clean. The ingredients are fresh and the staff is friendly and helpful.  $5 foot long sandwiches for any sandwich listed on the menu!! Their double chocolate chip cookies are chewy and delicious too! My new favorite place! A better deal than Potbelly's for sure!

6.description: This location did not honor the any regular sub in October promotion. I ordered a subway club, and they told me that they were only honoring the promotion for three subs.

0.description: "Sub" way... I emphasize "Sub" since this is supposed to be what they're known for.  However, you can tell by the end of the day that the bread is not as fresh as other locations.Other than that, it's your standard Subway, specializing in Subs, salads, wraps, soups, cookies, etc.

4.description: I love Subway but unfortunately, my last two trips have been disappointing. The first trip resulted in hard, OLD bread and nasty roasted chicken (that was my husband's sandwich). On trip two, my bread was hard as a rock. I couldn't even bite into it, transferring the inner parts of the sammie to my own bread when I got home. :( Think I'll take my business up a bloock to Potbelly.

58.description: Great tacos for good prices! Love going here.

56.description: blech.  been here a few times and i've never been impressed.  i leave grossed out.  the best thing i've had was the french fries, and their specialty definitely shouldn't be french fries.

29.description: Cheap? Check!  Good quality? Unfortunately not. I got the cowboy taco and was disappointed with the meat quality. I guess it makes sense given the price point.         Cute little place though.

42.description: They had their last chance. We have lived in the South Loop for 6 years now and visit several of the restaurants regularly, but not Flaco's Tacos. Here's why... several years ago, the 1st visit in which food was horrible, service was bad, and was one of the worst experiences we had ever had. A couple years later, we thought OK we'll try again. Hmm... pretty much same results. So once again last night we tried again. And this will be the last time. As we walked in 1 1/2 hours prior to closing, we were immediately told "Take out only" before we even got to the counter. Well, we had wanted to sit down to have a beer or Margarita with dinner, but OK. We are less than 5 mins away so we would just eat at home. Our food was ready, we checked to make sure it was correct (it was), and on the way we went. When we started to eat... everything was cold. not a hint of warmth. The Chicken in the tacos was over done, almost burnt, the only thing acceptable thing was the rice and beans, which also were barely luke warm. It's pretty hard to mess up the type of food Flaco's Tacos serves, but they have seemed to do it on every visit we ever made. Never again.

23.description: Was looking forward to trying this place for awhile, this place packed during the Lit Fest. Sadly it was an unimpressive experience.  I tried the combo tres, 3 items with rice and beans for $11.  I ordered 2 mini-burritos - 1 Al Pastor and 1 lime-grilled steak, and a fish taco. The regular price of a mini-burrito is $2.95 and I thought it would be at least a third of a full burrito, I wish I was that lucky!  Those suckers are TINY!  Maybe 2 bites, I honestly laughed when I saw them.  The Al Pastor had good flavor but I couldn't really taste much besides the tortilla on the steak one.  The fish taco was just ok, not much flavor there either. The rice and beans were just standard, I didn't eat much of those and walked out still hungry. I have no problem paying for food but I'm kinda used to getting more than a bite when I order a plate.  I shoulda listened to the reviews on this one, I won't go back.

47.description: Living in the South Loop, your restaurant options are pretty limited. I was sick of my old standbys so ventured here for dinner on a summer night, envisioning myself enjoying a balmy summer evening with a cold margarita. We ordered margaritas, and I was really bummed to see that it was basically a slushie-- not on the rocks. Is it just me, but doesn't that require an explanation? When I see "traditional margarita" on the menu, I definitely was picturing on the rocks. Oh well. We asked to exchange it for a beer and they allowed it. The tacos are fine-- they're good but nothing revolutionary. Good prices. Would come here again if I had a hankering for Mexican, but otherwise I'm not dying to.

8.description: Best tacos I have ever tasted. Great hangover food, that is actually delicious. Great prices, although super tiny sitting area. While we were there, just about everyone had the frozen sangria, and we wished we had gotten one too.

31.description: Best tacos in the South Loop! Waaaay better than Spanglish(especially on the service side of things).

34.description: Felt like some nachos.  Ordered the steak.  Pretty safe bet usually, worst idea ever tonight.  The meat was cut with the grain with a flavor that reminded me of Old El Paso.  Every piece had a flavor and texture that offended.  Takeaway outside their delivery zone, so I pushed the steak to the side.  On to the guacamole, which consisted of larger than normal chunks of tomato and unchopped cilantro leaves.  Very little avocado to be found.  Strike two.  The beans are passable but my quest for cheese ended rather abruptly.   Supposed to be nachos, right?  Salsa also mysteriously absent from the bag.   This is Friday night at 8:30 service.

16.description: I am obsessed with this place.  The south loop was in dire need of a Mexican eatery and they scored big time with Flaco's Tacos!  (I'm sorry Taco Burrito King but the truth hurts, OK, I'll still visit you when I am hungover)  If you are feeling all fancy, you can hit up their other location at Water Tower Place.You know what they call Thursdays?  THIRSTY THURSDAYS!  Yep, on Thursday you can get yourself a yummy horchata with rum for under 4 bucks.  They have a clever name for every day of the week and the names all revolve around alcohol.  Be still my beating heart!I rotate between three items when I come here, their bowl with either chicken or just veggies, their fish tacos (so fresh, grilled), and when I'm being naughty I have their carne asada smothered fries.  Great drinks, great food, and cute place to boot.

13.description: Came here recently after a long hiatus, and this place is even better than I remembered! It's a friendly, bustling spot with great food. Nice variety without being a completely overwhelming menu. I've always enjoyed their tacos, and they have a special for different days of the week that switches things up and makes it affordable. Their margaritas are amazing (and a steal at ~$5/glass) and they have wonderful salsa as well as tables indoor and out. Ambiance is fun, bright and cheery, and the food comes out very quickly. Anytime I'm in the South Loop, I'll make my way to Flaco's!

11.description: Dang, Flaco's reminds me of the Mexican food I miss in Chicago. The Al Pastor Burrito ($7.45) is HUGE and so delicious. I split it with a friend, and we were thoroughly satisfied. I couldn't stop saying, "Wow, this is great."On Monday, there were also $3 margaritas. The mango went down easy.There's some nice though packed outdoor seating on Dearborn, but the inside is also pleasant and more spacious for seating. Be sure to get some of the squeeze bottles of hot sauce.Very solid and was a food highlight in my latest trip.

39.description: Plentiful, Cheap Eats, LaidBack Interior - We were quite surprised by the quantity of food, as well as the quality. I'm not a big fan of Mexican, unlike my spouse, but I really loved my chicken burrito. I mistakenly ordered two, and it was so much that I gave the second to some street people to share. A bar-like interior, plus they serve alcohol.

37.description: Just went to this small little taco place tucked into printers row recently and had some great tacos. The service is fast but not sit down. The tacos were good but not as good as Rick Bayless. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and more then just tacos. They also have tamales which I can never seem to get enough of. Over all it was okay.

0.description: The price and portions are pretty darn good of a downtown restaurant. The food was fresh and delicious. The only reason I gave them one star less is because they messed up our order and didn't even inform us about it. We waited 20 minutes for our  3 tacos to be made. Note to the chefs: Don't make your veggie tacos with mostly rice and beans when those are already the sides. Add some fresh veggies.

38.description: The food is delicious, plenty of vegetarian options. The service could be better, I have been overcharged my last few visits. The first time they could not refund money so they gave a gift certificate. The second time, the manager inspected the gift certificate as if it was counterfeit then overcharged me. After I asked for the receipt, he opened the drawer and refunded my money minus tax.I am not a fan of establishments counting my pennies...

51.description: Overall really good experience if you're looking for quick and cheap Mexican food at a casual place. What I ordered: Combo #2 with two vegetarian tacos and rice and beans. Chips and salsa as appetizer. Pros: Very quick service, friendly staff, tasty food, outdoor seating, great specials (went on Taco Tuesday) Cons: Not too much space to move around

27.description: I'm a strong endorser of flavorful Mexican food. Authentic Mexican food has a kick and spice to it above all else. This food was a little watered down in terms of flavor but still great overall. I ordered the Combo Tres and tried the "Puerco Tamale", the "Cowboy Taco", and the Mini Chicken burrito. It came with a side of rice and beans. The Tamale was very good and very authentic tasting. Not at all Tex-Mex. The Cowboy Taco seemed good on paper but didn't have the flavor profile I was anticipating, but it was still alright. I ate the mini burrito too quickly to judge because I was pretty hungry in the beginning but ordering all three of those plus the side of rice and beans (which was delicious and everything I anticipated it tasting like) it's enough to keep you full for a while. I'm a small person, but a big eater and I couldn't finish it all in one sitting. As someone who comes from a town where the best "Mexican" food is Chipotle, this was a much appreciated and pleasant surprise for lunch while on a business trip. The seating at this location is horrific. Very crowded and not too much wiggle room. Come during off hours for some space and a little less noise. Lunch time they are packed!

32.description: The place was packed but tables were available outside. The food was very good and price decent. Not much room inside if you have a stroller.

54.description: We were in town visiting and needed a late night bite. This was perfect. A good mix between chipotle and Baja Fresh. Food tasted very good and left us feeling satisfied. Highly recommend it if you are looking for something quick and casual while in Chicago.

48.description: Came here recently after a long hiatus, and this place is even better than I remembered! It's a friendly, bustling spot with great food. Nice variety without being a completely overwhelming menu. I've always enjoyed their tacos, and they have a special for different days of the week that switches things up and makes it affordable. Their margaritas are amazing (and a steal at ~$5/glass) and they have wonderful salsa as well as tables indoor and out. Ambiance is fun, bright and cheery, and the food comes out very quickly. Anytime I'm in the South Loop, I'll make my way to Flaco's!

44.description: Dang, Flaco's reminds me of the Mexican food I miss in Chicago. The Al Pastor Burrito ($7.45) is HUGE and so delicious. I split it with a friend, and we were thoroughly satisfied. I couldn't stop saying, "Wow, this is great."On Monday, there were also $3 margaritas. The mango went down easy.There's some nice though packed outdoor seating on Dearborn, but the inside is also pleasant and more spacious for seating. Be sure to get some of the squeeze bottles of hot sauce.Very solid and was a food highlight in my latest trip.

24.description: We lovvvvvved Flaccos tacos. We were typical tourists, shopping on Michigan Ave and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. Nothing too heavy. We used Yelp to find this place and are so glad we did!Flaccos tacos is off the street in a small space. It was crowded when we arrived. I ordered a cowboy taco and he ordered a fried fish taco. Cheap and perfectly priced for all the ingredients. They were amazing!!!! I kept wanting to go back and get another one. If you want a quick light bite, go here. Soooo good.

7.description: Just went here with boyfriend and it was a mix of good, okay, and very bad.The good:The Monday special $3 margaritas.  I got the "Jamaican" (hibiscus) and boyfriend got strawberry.  They were both good frozen fun margs that had a GOOD amount of alcohol in them for three dollars and tasted yummy.The southwest salad.  Yummy, creamy, great flavors.  Everything blended nicely.  There was a little too much dressing but this can be fixed easily.  They are liberal with the meat and all of the toppings.  Boyfriend got this and I ate half of it.  Luckily he's generous with his food :).The okay:The carne asada fries.  The steak was the least fun part -- they had a ton of cheese, guac, tomatoes, and jalapeños.  Quite good.  Fries were kept crispy, which is hard when they're doused in toppings.  Really the only bad part was the overly tough steak.The BAD:The fish taco.  So boring and bland!!  Oh my goodness, fish tacos are usually my favorite things and this one was so bad.  There wasn't much in it and what was there was bad tasting.  Never getting this again -- I'll get the salad next time, because it was great.

49.description: I grew up in LA so when it comes to Mexican food I can be pretty picky, however, I know most places aren't going to live up to what I've grown up with.  That being said, Flacos is pretty good.  Don't expect mind blowing creativity nor some great tacos that your best friend's grandmother used to make.  Go on Taco Tuesdays as you can get specific weekly special taco for $1 each.  They don't make them any smaller than normal so you'll be full on just a few.  They also have weekly specials for beer/margaritas/sangria as well.  My only wish is that their burrito w/ cheese sauce didn't cost another $2 more just for the cheese sauce as it makes your burrito nearly $11 w/ tax.

40.description: Fucking great tacos          They're the best in the south loop                   Nice and fast service

53.description: Love this place! Food is awesome. Good vibe in a good location. Prices are great and specials are so good, such a value.

30.description: Pretty solid taco joint. I'd have to visit again to grant 5-star. I'm a fan of a big over stuffed taco and that's what I got. The rice and beans were a nice accompaniment but definitely sauce them up. The chicken taco was very good but the tilapia taco was super bland. The sauce didn't have much flavor. Thankfully the sauces they provide are pretty decent. For the price this place is great!

46.description: I've lived in the South Loop for 3.5 years, and by default Flacos has been my go-to Mexican food joint. Not because the food tastes great, or its a great deal, or the great sevice,  it's just my go-to place because it's close and the next closest Mexican place is about 4-5x farther away. I wish it was better, and each time it go I hope that the food is better, but it's not. Tonight was the straw that broke the camels back though. I ordered a beer twice but the cashier never got it. I ordered a chicken taco, but instead I was given a "steak" taco that had some pretty tough low grade meat. I think if there weren't so many students in the area that would patronize them regardless of their crappy food and service they would have already gone out of business. For me, this is my last visit to Flacos.  From now on when I get a hankerin' for Mexican food, I'll make the trip to other nearby places or just go over to Pilsen. Goodbye Flacos.

1.description: First off, food is ok, but it depends on what you get. I love the menu items, it tries to catch on to a modern twist of Mexican food but doesn't go too far. The steak fries is like a nacho grande just with fries instead of nachos. The tacos and tortas are also very simple. What I don't like too much is the steak, it almost tastes like roast beef and is too saucy and has a huge flavor kick that gets old after a while. The meat feels grainy, and personally I don't like the sauce.Service is ok, it takes a while to get your food; one time we waited 30 minutes for our food. I guess that could be good if the food tastes fresh, but it does taste frozen. The staff at the registers really don't act like they want to be there and are not too inviting. Well if the staff don't want to be there, why do I want to be there?There is a cool vibe and it is a fun spot. Every time I go there is different music playing. The first time I heard Salsa, the second time I heard Hip-Hop and the last time I heard top 40. Personally I didn't enjoy the music the last two times and so I chose to get the food to go. Other than music, Flacos Tacos has a Spanish decor that resembles the food they are trying to make.Overall, this is a good spot to go if your in the mood for Mexican flavors, and it is definitely good the first time, but the shotty service, inconsistent music, and long wait for food is enough to make me want to choose another spot, or get to-go.

55.description: It's fast and cheap to eat in the city and open late when out on the town. Only thing I dislike is the lack of room to sit and move around. The tacos are good but not outstanding. So 3 stars cause of lack of room and not amazing tacos

9.description: Ordered a strawberry margarita. Apparently that just meant strawberry syrup poured into the bottom of the margarita glass with frozen margarita poured on top. Not stirred or mixed or anything. OK, whatever. Not a big deal, tasted fine.Then, I tried ordering queso and chips - which was still on their online menu. They don't make queso anymore? Why wouldn't a Mexican place make queso... So, I just went with chips and salsa. The 'salsa' was impossibly hot (and I can handle a fair bit of heat) and more like the red sauce you get w/ eggrolls. The chips were crispy/fluffy but overwhelmingly oily and not all the way fried - so the middle of some of the larger chips were gross and chewy.The homemade coconut bars were on point, though.

26.description: I guess if you go to this place around lunch time on a Friday, it might take a little longer than expected. A lot of people show up for take out, and single people take up a table for 4.  I can understand if that's the only place to sit, but eat your food, don't sit there writing in a notebook or messing around with your lap top.We had a party of 4, and it 36 minutes from order to delivery of our food at the table.  I suppose that's okay for "fresh" food, but I wasn't impressed by the food quality overall.  Just pretty average. If it takes longer to order the fish tacos, you might want to tell people that or have it on the menu. I had no idea, and I would have probably gone with something else had I known.Service was friendly.  I think it was really busy when I was there, though.  Maybe avoid the 11-12:15 timeframe on weekdays.

25.description: Ridiculously overpriced taco joint inundated by knit-hat wearing hipsters that wouldn't know authentic food if it slapped them in the face with an Echo And The Bunnymen record.But seriously: $13 for three tacos the size of my wallet? What a joke.

12.description: We came here after a race for a few tacos and a few beers. Reasonable prices and okay tacos.

59.description: Just went here with boyfriend and it was a mix of good, okay, and very bad.The good:The Monday special $3 margaritas.  I got the "Jamaican" (hibiscus) and boyfriend got strawberry.  They were both good frozen fun margs that had a GOOD amount of alcohol in them for three dollars and tasted yummy.The southwest salad.  Yummy, creamy, great flavors.  Everything blended nicely.  There was a little too much dressing but this can be fixed easily.  They are liberal with the meat and all of the toppings.  Boyfriend got this and I ate half of it.  Luckily he's generous with his food :).The okay:The carne asada fries.  The steak was the least fun part -- they had a ton of cheese, guac, tomatoes, and jalapeños.  Quite good.  Fries were kept crispy, which is hard when they're doused in toppings.  Really the only bad part was the overly tough steak.The BAD:The fish taco.  So boring and bland!!  Oh my goodness, fish tacos are usually my favorite things and this one was so bad.  There wasn't much in it and what was there was bad tasting.  Never getting this again -- I'll get the salad next time, because it was great.

21.description: We came here after a race for a few tacos and a few beers. Reasonable prices and okay tacos.

17.description: I really liked the vibe of Flacos, an eclectic atmosphere with some interesting art on the walls. I was surprised at how busy it got on a Sunday night. Seems like a lot of people from the neighborhood. Even though I didn't get anything to drink, I always like to see Mexican restaurants with liquor licenses because they are hard to find in Chicago. As for the food, I felt it was just okay. The two taco dinner is a good enough deal. Unfortunately the fish taco had too much sauce and the steak taco was over seasoned as well. I also felt the rice/beans were dry. Next time I would try something else.

10.description: I'm a strong endorser of flavorful Mexican food. Authentic Mexican food has a kick and spice to it above all else. This food was a little watered down in terms of flavor but still great overall. I ordered the Combo Tres and tried the "Puerco Tamale", the "Cowboy Taco", and the Mini Chicken burrito. It came with a side of rice and beans. The Tamale was very good and very authentic tasting. Not at all Tex-Mex. The Cowboy Taco seemed good on paper but didn't have the flavor profile I was anticipating, but it was still alright. I ate the mini burrito too quickly to judge because I was pretty hungry in the beginning but ordering all three of those plus the side of rice and beans (which was delicious and everything I anticipated it tasting like) it's enough to keep you full for a while. I'm a small person, but a big eater and I couldn't finish it all in one sitting. As someone who comes from a town where the best "Mexican" food is Chipotle, this was a much appreciated and pleasant surprise for lunch while on a business trip. The seating at this location is horrific. Very crowded and not too much wiggle room. Come during off hours for some space and a little less noise. Lunch time they are packed!

5.description: Food was delicious!!! Steak burrito is what I had, meat very flavorful, and it was a reall big proportion for 7 bucks! Also, those Margaritas were delicious, I had strawberry (they were $3 in honor of National Margarita day Feb 22.

3.description: Felt like some nachos.  Ordered the steak.  Pretty safe bet usually, worst idea ever tonight.  The meat was cut with the grain with a flavor that reminded me of Old El Paso.  Every piece had a flavor and texture that offended.  Takeaway outside their delivery zone, so I pushed the steak to the side.  On to the guacamole, which consisted of larger than normal chunks of tomato and unchopped cilantro leaves.  Very little avocado to be found.  Strike two.  The beans are passable but my quest for cheese ended rather abruptly.   Supposed to be nachos, right?  Salsa also mysteriously absent from the bag.   This is Friday night at 8:30 service.

35.description: Me and a friend had chicken tamales and steak tacos. the steak tacos were seasoned throught the meat and it was juicy. The tamale was also seasoned good. the place was really nice.

19.description: I had never actually tried a sangrita before visiting Flaco's Tacos. I'd never even heard of it, actually. But it sure it tasty. It's dangerously tasty because you may not realize how much alcohol you're crushing until you start feeling tingly and invincible. Moving along, I also thoroughly enjoyed the food. I went with the al pastor - a personal favorite - and was not disappointed. The meat was nice and juicy, which doesn't always happen with al pastor tacos. And as an added pleasant surprise, the chips and guac were really good. Simple things like chips and guac sometimes get neglected, but these were very good.Staff was cool, wait time was about what you'd expect for what we ordered, and the prices were more than fair. We enjoyed the meal and will be returning soon.

28.description: I don't know what I'm missing here, but I did not have anything extraordinary here. I LOVE Mexican food and tacos but I was very disappointed in my chicken tamale, fish taco, and beans and rice. Everything was super dry and the seasoning had a weird taste. Even the refried beans and rice were dry. I ate it because I didn't want to waste my money, but it wasn't very enjoyable. I feel that everything was heated in the microwave, and nothing tasted fresh. Maybe ppl love this place because of the margaritas (I didn't order any, just a to-go order on a Wednesday night), but I didn't experience anything to write home about.

45.description: Can you say "overrated"?  Went there with a few guys.  The tacos were about 1 step below what you would get from the local taco truck.  One guy really liked his margarita though, saving the place from the dreaded 1 star review.

33.description: I am obsessed with this place.  The south loop was in dire need of a Mexican eatery and they scored big time with Flaco's Tacos!  (I'm sorry Taco Burrito King but the truth hurts, OK, I'll still visit you when I am hungover)  If you are feeling all fancy, you can hit up their other location at Water Tower Place.You know what they call Thursdays?  THIRSTY THURSDAYS!  Yep, on Thursday you can get yourself a yummy horchata with rum for under 4 bucks.  They have a clever name for every day of the week and the names all revolve around alcohol.  Be still my beating heart!I rotate between three items when I come here, their bowl with either chicken or just veggies, their fish tacos (so fresh, grilled), and when I'm being naughty I have their carne asada smothered fries.  Great drinks, great food, and cute place to boot.

43.description: I've been to this place three times and the food is always fresh and flavorful. Service is good plus they have a nice selection of desserts - all yummy! I've had their margaritas and was extremely pleased. They feature drink specials too so check the board when you arrive.

2.description: We lovvvvvved Flaccos tacos. We were typical tourists, shopping on Michigan Ave and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. Nothing too heavy. We used Yelp to find this place and are so glad we did!Flaccos tacos is off the street in a small space. It was crowded when we arrived. I ordered a cowboy taco and he ordered a fried fish taco. Cheap and perfectly priced for all the ingredients. They were amazing!!!! I kept wanting to go back and get another one. If you want a quick light bite, go here. Soooo good.

18.description: I really like this place.  The tacos, tamales, and enchiladas are great.  The frozen margaritas are good to.  The taco of the week is usually outstanding.  But, it does not compare with places like Big start and Antique Taco that seem more authentic in the way they make their food (and have more flavor).However, the staff if pretty rude. Which is why I rated them less stars.  I have been going here for years and am almost to the point I don't want to bother coming in anymore.  Especially this one girl with blue hair.  Every time we go in she just looks mad at the world and is pretty short with us.  Never mind asking her questions about the menu like you are inconveniencing her while she is at her job.  The other register employees are not much better.Be careful if you come on Margarita Monday ($3 Margs) or Taco Tuesday ($1 taco of the week) because it will be packed, there will be a long line, a wait for food, and most likely no where to sit.  But, that is expected because of the daily specials, so you have been warned!I have also tried catering once.  Bethany is great.  She is probably the best and nicest person I have every interacted with at Flacos.  I was also very happy with the catering - the mini sambraos were a cute touch!  I would just not get quesadillas for catering - all the other food was hot and yummy but those were cold.  However, that is to be expected with quesadillas as you need to eat them as soon as they are off the stove. Overall if you want fast, cheap Mexican food, and a delicious margarita and don't mind the occasional wait or care about friendly staff interactions this is the place to go to in Printers Row!

41.description: I live right down the street from this place so it's really convenient for me . That being said I have to honestly say that I prefer eating at Chipotle. I've order tacos here before and they aren't anything special. Tonight I thought I'd try something different and ordered the Flaco Bowl. I ordered steak was very uninspiring. I could immediately tell that they are using cheaper cuts of meat evident by the amount of gristle. The quality of beef at Chipotle is much better.  Another much better alternative to Flaco's is Spanglish on State & Harrison.

52.description: I get to eat here 2-3 times a year and each time I'm never disappointed.  Started out with guacamole and chips and was impressed!  The steak taco was tender and perfectly spiced. My favorite. I had seen other comments on here about them, so I went into it being a critic. I also had a "cowboy taco" which was fine, but my least favorite.  The chicken taco was great. Beans and rice were good and a great side to go with the tacos. Wash it down with a $3 margarita and life's good!

50.description: This is some of the best Mexican food I've ever eaten, and I'm not a big fan of Mexican food! Flacos Tacos is one of the best quick good tasting restaurants I've ever had a meal at. Definitely would come back again. Very affordable.

4.description: People that bash this place must be confused. Every taco I tried here was absolutely amazing.  I'm telling you, people that say otherwise have to be some kind of snobs with nothing better to do than bash a restaurant. Find a hobby people!  Anyway, it was great. Haters gonna hate I guess. Spending a little time south of the border does not an expert make. Clearly they are offering a more contemporary take on the whole taco thing. Anyway, and one last time for the people in the back row, screw the naysayers. Margaritas were great too by the way. And I'm out.

6.description: I have been here a few times now for their tacos of the week.  Sometimes they are amazing (Village Taco) and others they are almost flavorless.  They either hit it perfectly or not at all.  Service is decent and a fun atmosphere.

22.description: I just ordered the chips and salsa, but it was pretty good. I loved how it was homemade chips that was actually fresh. The salsa was a bit spicy for my taste, but still yummy nonetheless.

15.description: Ridiculously overpriced taco joint inundated by knit-hat wearing hipsters that wouldn't know authentic food if it slapped them in the face with an Echo And The Bunnymen record.But seriously: $13 for three tacos the size of my wallet? What a joke.

57.description: Usually the food here is good, but beware! I've had some really awful not fresh take out, so I think they need to have Gordon Ramsey come in and go through their freezer and pantry and chuck food that's out of date. The first time, it was a tamale with serious freezer burn, hard crusty and nasty. The second time it was a big cookie that was so stale it was ridiculous. I've had both of these items before and they were great, but it does make me think twice. Big sellers are the burritos and tacos, so they should be safe.

20.description: 5 star margaritas 4 star food. I enjoy the costumer service everyone is really friendly and helpful. The manager is very helpful mayzle she always puts a smile on my face. I'm in here now enjoying a delicious steak taco and a phenomenal margarita. Love this place

36.description: bombass tacosthe cowboy and al pastor tacos were on POINT! def coming back

14.description: I can't say much about the food considering me and my boyfriend only had guacamole and chips. We went on a Monday for $3 margaritas and I must say that for a Monday the place was packed... I mean it's not a big restaurant either it has like 5 tables you can sit at and then the bar table along the wall with stools to sit on. Margaritas were yummy they have lime, wildberry, strawberry, hamaica (hibiscus), and a special Valentine's Day one called besame mucho which is really tasty as well. We tried all of these my boyfriend got a lime margarita and a hamaica one, I got a strawberry one and a besame mucho. I sipped some of his and he sipped some of mine, pretty yummy. So the only one we didn't try is wildberry. Overall I liked it I wish it was a bit bigger because it did get packed. They also seem to have specials everyday of the week. I want to go again for more Monday margaritas but also to try some food :)

58.description: If you love breakfast and brunch, this is a place you must try. I routinely visit this location on the weekends, and the food is always top notch. Unless you go very early, or near closing time, expect a decent wait even for small parties, but it's definitely worth it. I haven't try any of their other locations, but I would recommend this place for sure. The portion sizes are great. I've personally had the classic waffle, eggs with potatoes, pancakes, and French toast. Everything has been excellent. The staff is friendly, is this is a great place to take your out of towners.

56.description: Delicious!!!! I've had this place on my list of breakfast spots to try for a long time.  Finally, I got my opportunity during my vacation week.  I was a little skeptical because their is no parking, however we had no problem finding a spot on the street.  We were seated right away.  The waitress wasn't that friendly, but I didn't let it get to me.  I had the Eggs Benedict, which was my first time and it was fabulous!  Hubz had the bacon waffle which he complained they were stingy with the bacon, but otherwise it was tasty. I will definitely return to try out more menu items.

29.description: Was in Chicago for a conference and wanted something tasty and local for breakfast. Yolk was recommended and I decided to try it even though it was a chain. A short drive (or 30 minute walk) from that Hyatt Regency. It was busy, definitely the popular breakfast joint. (I went on a Sunday). Was able to sit immediately at the bar. Quick and friendly service. Ordered the nutty monkey pancakes. Could only eat half, it's a lot for one person. Delicious!

42.description: Delicious breakfast. The orange and strawberry juice was delicious. I liked the atmosphere and the wait staff were great. The food came quickly and it was a good portion and it was delicious. There are so many options that you are sure to find the perfect meal.

23.description: This place is yummy! Everything we had was incredible.  Our favorite was the red velvet french toast.  It was most and had a topping. I believe it was a cream cheese frosting as well. One would think it would be too sweet,  but it wasn't. The flavors were well balanced. The wait can be long and the waiting area is outside (as it's too small to wait inside in the front) But it is worth the wait!

47.description: Amazing service despite being very crowded. Waitress was incredibly friendly. Enjoyed my meal before I even got my food. I had the Taffy Apple Crepes (seasonal special) and their famous strawberry-orange juice. Both were delicious and the food came much quicker than expected. Definitely got a lot of bang for my buck!

8.description: This is the cutest little breakfast/brunch place I have ever seen. The vibrant yellow and blue just makes you feel like you're in a fun place.The Yolk logo is so darn cute and the little fried egg inside the building is overly adorable. I just loved the color scheme here! It even goes all the way into the bathroom! There are a lot of people coming in and out and it's a little confusing as to what you're supposed to. You wait and then you will be seated shortly. The menu is filled with so many different things that it'll be so hard to choose which one to get. But when I saw the very berry french toast, I knew that it was calling for me.The portion sizes are big here and I barely even made a dent in mine. The french toast came with five pieces of half toast smothered in honey, yogurt, granola and berry explosion. There were blackberries, blueberries and strawberries everywhere. I think I made it through about 2.5 pieces of half slices before I caved in. The pieces of toast are buttered and so fluffy on the inside. They don't get soggy, which I love. The yogurt has a nice tartness that balances the sweetness from the honey and berries. Berries are really fresh and in season! I loved it berry much!My friend got the chicken and waffles and I was surprised by how big it was. The waffle is so fluffy and has pieces of bacon scattered throughout. The pieces of chicken are tender and perfectly crisp on the outside. I think it could have used a little bit more gravy, but it was decent enough to get through the entire dish. Who knew that chicken, gravy, waffles and syrup could make such an awesome combination?! My friend also ordered a side of potato hash which came out well seasoned and nicely cooked. Our server was friendly and did check up on us here and there. Our water was refilled promptly. We were just slightly confused as to how we pay since many people were coming up to the register (you can order takeout which a lot of people do). The server will bring you your check which you then bring up to the register to pay. Most of the dishes here range from $10-15 depending on what you get. The portion size is very generous, I could have definitely shared.Overall, it's a perfect little brunch place. The place is clean and I couldn't stop looking at that adorable fried egg on the wall!

31.description: A friend and I came to this location for brunch. The atmosphere was very calm and peaceful. Our order came out just the way we wanted. I highly recommend the pancakes! Our server Gloria was very nice and pleasent.

34.description: This is a great place for breakfast. They give you nice portion sizes and everything I had from the potatoes, the pancakes, the sausage and the eggs were fresh, hot and flavorful. I was impressed and left with a full stomach! They have a menu with a wide variety of breakfast choices. Great ambiance and pretty decor inside as well! I will definitely return soon!

16.description: Not usually a fan of breakfat/brunch places as they tend to be just eggs, pancakes, bacon, and waffles.  Don't get me wrong these are great but the markup on these items is way more than what I would like to pay for and when I can make these simple items as home.  HOWEVER.... Yolk's Quinoa Bowl is amazing and is definitely NOT something I can make at home and is delicious.I didn't have time to wait for a table so I decided to do a to-go order.  The wait from what I could hear was 10-15 minutes and this was labor day Monday.  I will say that they need to put some benches in the waiting room area as currently it's an empty room with no sitting area at all! I don't really understand why the restaurant couldn't invest in some chairs/benches to put out there to make it comfortable for people waiting - you basically see a bunch of people just standing around.  The breakfast quinoa bowl is fantastic as I love the combination of the quinoa, creaminess, fruit, and nuts.  I've never had quinoa like that before and was so glad to see such a different breakfast item available on their menu.

13.description: Family breakfast on a weekday. Much more pleasant place than the boring restaurant next door in our Best Western. Huge menu. Service was fast. They covered our whole table with plates, very pretty looking, my daughter loved it. The smoked salmon hash with eggs with fruits was fantastic. Hot tea was really hot and in a teapot. Crepes were OK: too much crepes and not enough berries. Greek yogurt was simple and very tasty. I'd come again any time.

11.description: We dined here every morning for breakfast during our three day visit to Chicago and loved it. The people working here from Kevan, Sophia to Lana were all very nice, helpful and on the ball taking great care of my wife's and my dining needs.I found all the dishes we chose to be made with fresh ingredients, wonderful flavors and great presentation. My first day I selected the Tour de France from the sweet side of the menu. It was three different varieties of their French Toast including banana with peanut butter, orange bread with strawberries and lemon poppy seed with blueberries. I enjoyed all three but the poppy seed was my favorite. Day two I flipped to the savory side of their menu and chose a hearty Santa Fe frittata. It turned out to be huge and I was unable to polish it off. I enjoyed this dish as well with a good bit of spiciness to it. The last day I went old school and just picked their scrambled eggs with bacon and wheat toast. This dish too was yummy and well prepared. The eggs weren't to dry or runny but just right. They have a nice variety of juices to pair up with your breakfast. I stuck with OJ but one time I got a strawberry OJ mix that was a nice change. Their bacon is thick and meaty and not cooked too crisp just the way I prefer. Plenty of tables and booths to seat everyone are available without a wait during the week at least. I found their prices a tad on the high side but well worth it in terms of the quality and quantity of food served. We will definitely return on a future visit to Chicago.

39.description: Great place to go for breakfast or brunch. Waited a half hour the first time we went, but that was due to the fact that there was a Bears game. The bottomless coffee is great. Both times I went, the coffee was amazing! I got the 'two eggs and meat' option. It came with two sides. I got the red potatoes and English muffin. Great place. Was definitely worth the wait!

37.description: Very good. The food was delicious- no vegan options, unfortunately, but you kinda expect that with the name "Yolk." So I broke and went veg instead. Benedict caprese was pretty dang good. The West Coast Crepes were overpowered by how sweet the crepes were, it was hard to taste the filling, but good too. So loud and busy though, nearly impossible to hear people. The service was good and quick, but they forgot a side and it was nearly impossible to interrupt how busy the flow is to get it. Pretty decent brunch place, I would return.

0.description: We love the Yolk. I am just now writing a review after eating at the yolk 4-5 times. we've had dine in and carry out. The servers are always great with great personalities, very personable and on top of things. We've had the omelets, french toast, apple blintzes, and red velvet french toast. All are excellent. They give you a lot of food. Oh and the pancakes! Its worth the upgrade to the pure maple syrup!!!!!!!Great place.

38.description: Great food and great service! Got seated right away and had great suggestions from our server. I definitely recommend the cinnamon roll french toast.

51.description: Just had a great breakfast at Yolk. We are in town for a conference and wanted to get out of the hotel and voila. Service was great and the food was awesome. Crepes were thin and moist and the eggs were perfect. Can't say enough. Great atmosphere, great food and service.

27.description: Great Nutella crepes - the best ones this side of Paris!  Super fresh fruit and ingredients virtually left off the plate and got. In. Mah. Belly!

32.description: This is the first time we went to Brunch at Yolk. Didn't know what to expect. But we were surprised to see so many people waiting. We thought it would take 30-40 mins to be seated. The hostess said 20 mins wait so we stayed. We ended waiting for only about 15 mins. Their coffee was great. We ordered Pumpkin & Roasted Apple Soup with Bacon, House Made Sweet Potato Hash, and Countryside Skillet. The food was pretty awesome. Our waiter was nice and the food came out quickly. The place was loud though. And we had to go pay for the food by the cashier. I guess it was to speed things along. Wish we interacted more with the staff. They all seem nice. We just went there during busy times. We will probably good back and try other items on the menu!

54.description: I usually don't know what makes breakfast places so wonderful. An egg is an egg. Pancakes, coffee, toast, fruit. So what? But this place has a big menu, lots of great options, healthy options that are unique and tasty, so many breakfast entrees to choose among. Usually I am underwhelmed, but Yolk does it right and the buzz was worth it!

48.description: Service was phenomenal! Our waitress Alex was very courteous towards our group and knowledgeable on the dishes. She also kept our glasses topped off and accommodated to our every needs promptly. The food was also fantastic! I had the country side skillet which was flavorful and filing. The south of the border Benedict was different with a Mexican twist from the sausage they used. Smoked salmon was also very tasted. Our waitress suggested the pumpkin swirl french toast and red velvet french toast. They both were just the right amount of sweet and we didn't use the syrup provided. The place is a tad loud because it's pretty busy. You could barely hear the music even though I'm sure it was blaring. There's a slight wait, but honestly not that bad. The hostess said 30 minutes whereas we only waited 10ish.Overall an excellent dining experience and highly recommended!

44.description: Nice place.  I was 1/2 hr early before they opened. And they let me come in from the cold and wait at a booth until service started.   Had the Irish Benedict.   Very tasty.  Good sized portion.   Lots of fruit on the plate.  Wish they had hashbrowns.   Like them better than cubed potatoes.  But that's me.  That did taste good anyway.   Excellent coffee.

24.description: I just wouldn't go here. I love diners and this place is pretty lackluster. The good:-No wait at nine on a Sunday morning-They're quick with the coffee-The sausage was very good - the nice thick sort-Service was quickThe bad:-My ham and cheese omelette contained no ham. I pointed this out to the server and he apologized for not hearing me and offered to bring a plate of ham. No dude. I don't want a plate of ham and a pile of scrambled eggs with cheese on top. I want the ham and cheese omelette I ordered - bring me one. I may be a low talker, but that doesn't mean I have to eat the mistake you left in from of me.-My cheese omelette didn't have cheese inside. It's not an actual omelette. It's just a pile of scrambled eggs that they put cheese on top of. -I was charged for this foolishness (to be fair, I never asked to have it taken back or removed from my bill - but I didn't eat it and it was flat out not what I ordered. It was kind of befuddling to me that I was charged for it. I shouldn't have to kvetch, you should figure that out on your own.)-When we left around 9:40 there was already a very healthy wait forming.-My wife's eggs where cold.-The coffee was weak. -My hashbrowns were cold. -No splenda (though they did have Stevia, which is likely even better in my book). -Cream consisted of those annoying little packets - not actual cream.-It's expensive. The average breakfast dish is $12 to $16. ---------------I live nearby and we had high hopes for this place. This is the first time either my wife or I have walked into a restaurant in recent memory where we just have no desire to return (it's not just the omelette... everything else was just lackluster). It's not awful. It's just not good.There are much better breakfast places in the area.

7.description: The food was decent. It came out quickly and was cooked to order. The waitstaff was friendly and attentive. The restaurant was clean and welcoming. Overall a nice experience. The food was only ok though.. While it was not bad, it was just nothing amazing.

49.description: Long wait but worth it. had their insane red velvet cake french toast. it fed me for two meals  - the vanilla cream cheese filling was insanely awesome.

40.description: I L.O.V.E Yolk!!! I discovered this place the day after my bachelorette party.... We needed a place that would get us in and out because we had massages scheduled and NOT ONLY WAS THE FOOD AMAZING (everyone RAVED about it) but they got us in and out I no time!! I order the 'Cheesy Egg Sandwich'--- AH MAZ ZING! With the potatoes.... Delish!! I've been here twice and one of the other locations once. They're my new favorite breakfast spot! This time, I was with my hubby.... He's hooked too! :) One word.... YUM!

53.description: Breakfast selection was amazing, wish I could go back to try different things like the red velvet French toast

30.description: I went here for breakfast before heading to the Blackhawks' 2015 Championship Rally (so you can imagine how busy it was), and the food and service was great! Definitely somewhere I'd go back to for breakfast.

46.description: Love. Food is good and there is so. Much. Of. It. Lovely place.Eggs Benedict leaves something to be desired but they serve the world's most perfect pancakes. So fluffy, so light. Pure perfection.

1.description: Came here on a Saturday around 1ish for brunch. There were a few people waiting for a table, but my friend and I decided to sit at the bar so we were seated right away. I'd say this place is pretty similar to Wildberry, although not quite the same since the menu items vary a little bit.I ordered the Caprese Benedict and added bacon. I liked this creative twist on a classic, and thought the pesto especially added a nice touch. The flavors of the mozzarella weren't as strong as I would have liked, and I think the dish could have done better if they switched the english muffin for something a little more 'Italian inspired.' However, it was pretty tasty overall, and the portions here are huge for the price (only $12.49!). If the wait at Wildberry is looking a little too long, I'd definitely suggest this place as a pretty decent alternative.

55.description: Great breakfast place, I wish they had one next to my house.  The place is really noisy but the service was great, and the food was fast.  They really try to get your food to you in under 7 minutes.  It is not a place to bring your laptop and sit quietly and work on your computer.  It is quality food at a good price

9.description: We ate here two days in a row.  The first day I had an omelet called Hey Ricky. It was so delicious and perfectly fluffy.  It came with tasty red diced potatoes and toast. I also ordered a pumpkin latte that came in a very tiny glass and cost over $4. I do not recommend the latte since the flavor was ordinary and the value was horrendous. My bf had the seasonal sweet potato hash. He loved it.  It was a little on the sweet side for me because the potatoes were tossed in a maple glaze. It was still very good though. Day two was not as impressive.  We both ordered the corned beef hash that looked and tasted like it came out of a can. My toast was so burnt it was black on both sides. I would consider going again but stick with the omelets or egg dishes.The vibe was cool and the waitresses were quite friendly.

26.description: The first thing you notice about this place is that it's always packed. However, thanks to the factory-like efficiency, you don't have to wait much to be seated or to your food to arrive. The food is fantastic. I ordered waffles with chocolate chips and sausage links and both were great. My girlfriend ordered chocolate chip pancakes and they were also splendid. The atmosphere is fantastic, the food is second to none and the service is as efficient as a luxurious restaurant.

25.description: What bad could I say about this Yolk? Great food, great ambience, great people. The California omelette (with garlic) is my fave. I've tried a few different meals, and all of them have been good. You can't really go wrong with much here. You may have to wait depending on what time it is on the weekends, but it's usually never too long, no more than 20 minutes.

12.description: This was a classically decent brunch spot, but it didn't blow me away. It was really packed when we were there, but I wasn't totally sure why. The menu wasn't anything too creative but the food was good. The eggs Benedict was good and the cinnamon roll was a little dry. For what you get, I thought it was a little overpriced.

59.description: Excellent! Ate here at 11:30 on Chicago Marathon Day, just across Michigan Ave from the finish line. Still seated within 10 minutes. Food was delivered quickly and was delicious.

21.description: The service is incredibly quick and the food is AMAZING! I had the cinnamon roll French toast and my husband had the Farmhouse biscuits and gravy. They were both excellent, and the perfect amount of food. I would order them both again, except I want to try the rest of the menu!

17.description: The waffles were hard to chew and the chicken tenders are too hard. The French toast was too tasteless even with a lot of maple syrup. With the popularity of Yolk, I expected better food. Probably won't visit again.

10.description: Delicious!!!! I've had this place on my list of breakfast spots to try for a long time.  Finally, I got my opportunity during my vacation week.  I was a little skeptical because their is no parking, however we had no problem finding a spot on the street.  We were seated right away.  The waitress wasn't that friendly, but I didn't let it get to me.  I had the Eggs Benedict, which was my first time and it was fabulous!  Hubz had the bacon waffle which he complained they were stingy with the bacon, but otherwise it was tasty. I will definitely return to try out more menu items.

5.description: Was in Chicago for a conference and wanted something tasty and local for breakfast. Yolk was recommended and I decided to try it even though it was a chain. A short drive (or 30 minute walk) from that Hyatt Regency. It was busy, definitely the popular breakfast joint. (I went on a Sunday). Was able to sit immediately at the bar. Quick and friendly service. Ordered the nutty monkey pancakes. Could only eat half, it's a lot for one person. Delicious!

3.description: 3.5I mean this in the nicest way possible but Yolk to me is like a high-end IHOP. While the food at this chain is slightly above average, the vastness of the menu was more impressive than the quality of my meal.It seems that I am in the minority as Yolk was voted best breakfast in Chicago. Also, it was ridiculously packed during my visit. Wait time was an hour! As I said earlier, that menu is rather extensive and there is something for everyone. For those with a sweet tooth, Yolk offers a variety of pancakes, waffles, crepes, and french toasts. Luckily for me, they focus more on savory items such as omelets, benedicts, scramblers, skillets, and a myriad of specialty options. I opted for a scrambler with a side of fresh fruit and an english muffin. (yelp.com/biz_photos/yolk…). Mine had turkey sausage, spinach, and mushrooms. I really appreciate that they will use egg substitute upon request without any additional charge. It was just ok but the turkey sausage seemed like some generic jimmy dean breakfast item. I also had a bite of Christina C's Irish Bennedict (yelp.com/biz_photos/yolk…). It had corned beef hash and roasted tomatoes. Not bad at all. I enjoyed it more than my own order. My other friend ordered a skillet. Normally, this guy can pack away food but he barely got through half of the order. That skillet was so heavy that he couldn't even look at the side of pancakes...that poor soul haha. Be prepared to share if you decide to go this route. Fresh strawberry orange juice was a hit with us! Definitely check that out. I think my favorite part of this restaurant was the location. It was around the corner from my hotel,down the street from the train station and a short walk from the museums and other attractions. Overall, Yolk is a decent choice but there is one other breakfast spot in the area I'd rather go.

35.description: Food is good and quick but could get most of the same at Denny's. Waiters are friendly and has good pricing. Can't speak on the other locations but this one was clean and had alot of space. The coffee is delish. The bacon waffle is something you might be skeptical about, but it's a must try!!

19.description: I feel like this is an average brunch restaurant. Nothing here really stood out to me. I waited maybe 30 minutes to be seated for a table of 2 on Memorial Day weekend so I expected it to be longer. We ordered the Pot Roast Benedict and the Nutty Monkey pancakes which were both just okay. The potatoes that came with the Benedict were very plain, I added hot sauce to give it some spice and flavor. The coffee was also just meh. When I visit Chicago again, I don't think I'll be returning here. I'll be checking out other brunch joints.

28.description: Good eggs. Toast was burned. Canadian bacon was cold and hard. The stars are for the amazing pancakes.   Second visit much different experience! Wonderful wonderful service, sat in the back so do not feel so crowded and rushed. The eggs Benedict with roast beef were awesome pancakes are delicious I'm so glad I went back.

45.description: We ate here two days in a row.  The first day I had an omelet called Hey Ricky. It was so delicious and perfectly fluffy.  It came with tasty red diced potatoes and toast. I also ordered a pumpkin latte that came in a very tiny glass and cost over $4. I do not recommend the latte since the flavor was ordinary and the value was horrendous. My bf had the seasonal sweet potato hash. He loved it.  It was a little on the sweet side for me because the potatoes were tossed in a maple glaze. It was still very good though. Day two was not as impressive.  We both ordered the corned beef hash that looked and tasted like it came out of a can. My toast was so burnt it was black on both sides. I would consider going again but stick with the omelets or egg dishes.The vibe was cool and the waitresses were quite friendly.

33.description: My second visit to Yolk was sadly to say..underwhelming. This time I stopped in with another good friend who actually made the suggestion for Yolk. Considering my first experience i gladly agreed. When i arrived, seemingly as always, Yolk was having a busy morning but i considering my arrival was early i wanted to save a table. Unfortunately I was seated in the back near the bathrooms which I am positive that anyone would be dismayed at thos placement, there just weren't anymore options except for the bar and i couldn't risk that because of the noise. After all the objective is good food and convo. So i agreed to the back table. Our server was friendly and as soon as my friend arrived we were tended to efficiently. It took a minute to decide on a plate but i eventually went with the breakfast sandwich of egg cheese and bacon and home fries. In this case I experienced one of those food follies where you realize it's probably better to go with what you know is good for i was not really pleased with my selection. The bread was a bit wilted, the egg a bit dry, the bacon a bit rubbery and the fries a bit tasteless. I failed to finish my plate. On the other hand my friend's plate looked satisfying. She went with a favorite, french toast and fries. I should've taken her lead on this one. So overall my experience food wise was fair this time but not so bad that I'll never return. That would be a stretch. Yolk is generally a decent choice if your hungry and in the south loop. My suggestion: opt for a battered breakfast

43.description: This restaurant used to be a favorite. Unfortunately, they have made the menu smaller and many of my favorite brunch items are gone. If you prefer savory dishes to sweet, then I'm sure it's still fine. But for me, the loss of those crepes that other restaurants don't offer, puts it in the category of "all the rest."

2.description: When you're in the mood for sweet breakfast try Yolk's red velvet French toast. Yessss! Though definitely decadent this toast was substantial and didn't leave hungry again in an hour. Loud setting in fast paced atmosphere. Tons of options no matter your tastes.

18.description: I L.O.V.E Yolk!!! I discovered this place the day after my bachelorette party.... We needed a place that would get us in and out because we had massages scheduled and NOT ONLY WAS THE FOOD AMAZING (everyone RAVED about it) but they got us in and out I no time!! I order the 'Cheesy Egg Sandwich'--- AH MAZ ZING! With the potatoes.... Delish!! I've been here twice and one of the other locations once. They're my new favorite breakfast spot! This time, I was with my hubby.... He's hooked too! :) One word.... YUM!

41.description: This place was one of the highlights of my trip to Chicago. There are hundreds of options to choose from, and the eggs were delicious- came with fruit and an English muffin, but there were other choices too, like potatoes, toast, bagel, or even pancakes as a side. I sat at the counter. The only issue was that the coffee creamer was the artificial kind, they didn't have real half-and-half.

52.description: Staying at the best western grant park it was just around the corner - reaaaaaally good breakfast. Only had it once - but i d totally go there again!

50.description: Stopped here for brunch with my wife based on the excellent reviews and the brunch did not disappoint. I had a delicious omelette "the works" with the strawberry orange juice and enjoyed every bite and sip. Huge portions and great service. Yolk is definitely on my will be back list.

4.description: Came here after 3 years and boy the quality has deteriorated! I don't mind waiting but at least serve edible food. We asked for a patty melt and got char burnt meat with super burnt toast. NEVER AGAIN!

6.description: What bad could I say about this Yolk? Great food, great ambience, great people. The California omelette (with garlic) is my fave. I've tried a few different meals, and all of them have been good. You can't really go wrong with much here. You may have to wait depending on what time it is on the weekends, but it's usually never too long, no more than 20 minutes.

22.description: 3.5I mean this in the nicest way possible but Yolk to me is like a high-end IHOP. While the food at this chain is slightly above average, the vastness of the menu was more impressive than the quality of my meal.It seems that I am in the minority as Yolk was voted best breakfast in Chicago. Also, it was ridiculously packed during my visit. Wait time was an hour! As I said earlier, that menu is rather extensive and there is something for everyone. For those with a sweet tooth, Yolk offers a variety of pancakes, waffles, crepes, and french toasts. Luckily for me, they focus more on savory items such as omelets, benedicts, scramblers, skillets, and a myriad of specialty options. I opted for a scrambler with a side of fresh fruit and an english muffin. (yelp.com/biz_photos/yolk…). Mine had turkey sausage, spinach, and mushrooms. I really appreciate that they will use egg substitute upon request without any additional charge. It was just ok but the turkey sausage seemed like some generic jimmy dean breakfast item. I also had a bite of Christina C's Irish Bennedict (yelp.com/biz_photos/yolk…). It had corned beef hash and roasted tomatoes. Not bad at all. I enjoyed it more than my own order. My other friend ordered a skillet. Normally, this guy can pack away food but he barely got through half of the order. That skillet was so heavy that he couldn't even look at the side of pancakes...that poor soul haha. Be prepared to share if you decide to go this route. Fresh strawberry orange juice was a hit with us! Definitely check that out. I think my favorite part of this restaurant was the location. It was around the corner from my hotel,down the street from the train station and a short walk from the museums and other attractions. Overall, Yolk is a decent choice but there is one other breakfast spot in the area I'd rather go.

15.description: This is my first review for Yolk, but probably my 5th or 6th time here. There is a reason why Yolk is my breakfast joint of choice, time and time again, whenever I'm in Chicago. There is a consistent quality across all of its locations and this one in the south loop is particularly convenient - just off Roosevelt station. I can't do this review justice like the many native Chicagoans that frequent place. I will say that there is not a better breakfast meal than their corned beef hash with eggs done over easy. The fruit, which seems to be seasonal is a nice touch to balance the amount of greasy deliciousness.The service is fantastic as with all Yolk locations. If you're coming with a large party, expect to wait quite a while on the weekends. Otherwise, smaller parties should get through within 30 minutes. Food service is blazing fast but there never seems to be a rush to kick you out despite the droves of people waiting at the door.I can't wait to be back!

57.description: Came here for breakfast October 11 and OOOOOOOOOOOHHHHHH MY GOSH!  It was simply the best! Had the Salmon Scrabbler with a side of potatoes and pancakes.  It was a pretty huge serving and beyond delicious!  Randu was my server, very attentive, kept a big smile on his face.  I'm definitely coming back my next trip!

20.description: Extremely nice staff members, everyone was very welcoming, making my experience a great one from the start. The wait wasnt as long as expected. My only issue was that most of the menu does include egg, which explains the name of the restaurant but I still loved it. Had the chicken and waffles which tasted wonderful. If you aren't an egg kind of person, I highly recommend it with a glass of orange juice to top things off!

36.description: I had the thanksgiving special turkey burger.  It was awesome. Very hard workers.  All jump to serve you

14.description: Delicious breakfast spot in Chicago! Only downside is the long lines and wait on the weekends, but it was worth waking up early to make the line and get a table within 30-40 minutes. Yolk was one of the top restaurants on my to-go list during my first visit to Chicago; mainly for their Red Velvet French Toast. We were a large group of friends so we each got something different and were able to try a little bit of everything. I have to say that my favorite dishes were the Banana nut breadwith bananas & peanut butter and the Red Velvet French Toast. On the savory side, I really enjoyed their Pot Roast Benedict.

3.description: I am ADDICTED to these cookies!  Butter cookies are my favorite, and these have surpassed the Girl Scouts' Trefoils on my list.  Not too sweet, not too hard, not too soft.  Delish! I kind of wish they were sold in larger quantities, but it's probably better (for my body) that they're not.

1.description: The only reason I continue to buy these cookies is because they are like a surprise every time! One time they fell completely apart immediately upon opening the package and proved to be mainly flour. They are ALWAYS different! I bought a lot around Christmas time because I figured this small business probably needed as much help as possible. I also thought maybe they could keep together a decent cookie with more business, extra funds, etc... Not the case!!! I've tried many locations thinking I might find a decent cookie and alas I did, for an extra dollar and a longer journey you can find such a cookie from THIS same company at whole foods. Although the 100% butter version is somewhat a better one it is not worth either the journey nor the dollar.
