I will continue to support this small business because I believe in the American dream and I hope one day they can get it together.

2.description: Earlier this year I happened upon Crockett Cookies at my local Walgreens.  One bite, that's all it took.  I was instantly transformed back to my youthful school days where they served these cookies in the lunch room.  I knew then that any future diets were in serious jeopardy.  4 ingredients, that's all that's in this "Lunchroom Butter Cookie".      Well, today I grabbed another batch of these cookies from the Walgreens downtown.  One bite, Pathooey!!!!   Nasty!  Crockett took a perfectly good TRADITIONAL recipe and F****D it up.   Their sin?  They added margarine.  I'm a Purest, so they've lost me as a customer.This is easily a 5-Star cookie without the dreaded margarine.   Sometimes you just have to leave well enough alone.

0.description: I don't know about other cities but in Chicago we have this kind of butter cookie that is famous as the "lunchroom style". It's made with only flour, sugar, vanilla & butter and tastes freaking awesome.This cookie comes as closer to that recipe than any of the many imitators on the market. Sure the latest incarnation has an 80/20 mix of butter to margarine mix but it's still quite good. My only concern is that they go down the slippery slope and before you know it it's 50/50 or worse. I'm sure they're worried about cost but personally, I would rather pay more for a better cookie and I'm sure most cookie connoisseurs would agree.Also, these cookies need to be all over town not just on the south side. They're missing a huge market by not being in more stores. The only place I can find them is the walgreens on 35th & King Drive.

3.description: This is a great find in the south loop. The space is small and intimate, with bright green walls that give it a warm, cheerful feeling. It features the work of local artists and designers, and is a mix of fine art (painting, photography) and crafts, like jewelry, t-shirts and cards. The quality of the work is high, prices are extremely reasonable, and the people who work here are friendly and helpful.

1.description: Elephant Room is a laid-back and unpretentious art gallery that showcases local artists.  There is no entry fee and the gallery is rather cozy.  I have attended several opening receptions and have had the opportunity to speak with the actual artists and mingle with a diverse crowd.As the other reviewers have stated, the pieces of work can be purchased.If you are ever in the area it is a nice place to stop in and check out.

2.description: This is a great shop in the heart of the south loop. It features local young artists and displays their medium. Painting, sculptures, photos. The prices are very resonable for this cute little upstart. The gallery curator is Kimberly Atwood if you would like a private showing during the week. As they are usually only open on the weekends.

0.description: I agree this is a great shop and location. This is a new business and had a great opening featuring a local artist. She had a variety of her work on display for viewing and for purchase. Kimberly Atwood is the curator and is planning on a variety of events featuring local artists. This is worth stopping by. Parking is available next door for $6.

58.description: We've been going to the Brasserie for a few years--whenever we visit Chicago. On a recent visit, it was the first place we stopped to eat. There's outdoor seating, which is surprisingly private--even though the place is right on Michigan Avenue. Indoors is quieter, and the large widows allow for people watching. Service has progressively slipped over the years, but is never rude or intolerable. The food is refreshingly different and well prepared. There appears to be a concern for good quality ingredients, preparation and presentation. (They use Julius Meinl coffee) We have had many breakfasts and lunches at the Brasssrrie...all enjoyable. The Mister dreams of their breakfast potatoes...and their frenchfies are done in a similar fashion.

56.description: The food was good but the service is terrible. Seems that they are short staffed or something. My friend ordered a soup and I ordered an spinach salad with salmon. The salmon was just a half piece of filet. Not sure if I was shorted or if that's what I was supposed to get??? Overall we sat at the table for 20- 30 mins before getting our food and 20-30 mins to get our check.  We should've checked yelp before we decided to eat here.

29.description: I met some friends here and have to say, the outside patio view is great, but the service is not so great.  While people were nice, I was told I couldn't have a mocha because it 'wasn't on the menu' (but a cappucchino was) and they had chocolate. ANd the waitress also had to ask what a mocha was.  Hmmmm....I didn't eat, but my friends said the food was good. Overall, it's alright.  Don't know if I'll be back.  Location isn't as convenient.

42.description: Came here for brunch late morning on a Thursday.  It looked clean and fresh, and we were ready for a good breakfast nosh.  We sat at a tall table near the window, which was a little on the warm side with the sun coming right in, but not really a problem. The problem was when the service started, which was mystifyingly poor.  First, the hostess - who never smiled in our presence - walked up without comment or explanation and took our placemats away.  Every other table and every other patron in the place had placemats, but suddenly we didn't.  Why? I don't know. Even the little kids eating outside had placemats, but suddenly and without warning we were not worthy of placemats.  I got the benedict, which was clearly made with pride and accompanied by fried potatoes which could not have been any better.  I did not love their take on the hollandaise, but that's a small point of personal preference, because my food was obviously very high quality.My companion ordered eggs over medium and bacon.  What arrived was scrambled eggs and sausage... and after the food arrived we didn't see another employee - AT ALL - until the check came 30 minutes later (definitely did not see the unsmiling hostess who took our placemats), giving us no opportunity to ask them to correct their mistake. All told, the ambiance and the quality of the food in no way compensated for the inattentive service.  Really disappointing to see such care put into the building and the cooking, and no care put into the patrons.

23.description: Came in unexpectedly with my boyfriend only because there was no wait. We were pleasantly surprised by our little detour. On Sunday's there is a brunch deal that comes with bottomless mimosas until 2pm. I had French toast with Caramelized bananas and Creme topping.  I ate every last bite! My boyfriend had egg and hash browns which he also enjoyed.

47.description: I've been to this place twice, and both times I've left before ordering anything because the staff has completely ignored us at the bar. Both times the place was pretty much empty as well. Not a surprise, I'm sure I'm not the first person that has been neglected at this sub par establishment in a prime location. What a waste.

8.description: So much potential, wasted on overcooked everything.Was lured into the Brasserie on a Tuesday, drawn by the promise of bottomless mussels.  Not finding "bottomless mussels" on the menu, decided to order the standard serving of moules frites with white wine/herb broth, for $13.The broth was truly excellent.  Rich, flavorful, and not excessively sour as other mussel purveyors tend to offer, the white wine/herb broth was worth the price of admission.Unfortunately, that's where the good luck ended.  While the broth was good, there was precious little of it - while Chicago competitors such as the Publican, or my NYC go-to Le Parisien (Kips Bay, Manhattan) offer at least second-knuckle quantities to be slurped up, no such luck here.  Further, the smallish mussels were greatly overcooked, so much so that the outer ring of flesh was often fused to the shell.  For shame.The coup de grâce was the cooked-stiff fries.  While they looked rather appetizing covered in cheese and herbs, each bite required concentrated chewing to soften the potato staff, then to swallow.  How does a French place botch frites?  Outrageous.So against my better nature, I declined the second bowl (two bowls = bottomless???) of mussels and decided that my time would be better spent gawking at Sue the T-Rex.  Because her fossilized bones were probably softer than the fries.  (Heya!)

31.description: Hostess was beyond rude. Slammed glasses on table, refused to talk to us, didn't respond when we said thank you.Server was slow, served other tables first.Unannounced stopped serving brunch even though we were there at 11 and the menu said it was served until 2.Will never go back. Not worth paying their high prices to get treated like dirt.

34.description: Great location, choice of seating, great food and attentive servers. I would absolutely recommend.

16.description: I would come here just for the cheese and meat plates. I literally had that for dinner with a glass of wine and I was in heaven. Service could be quicker.. Entrées could be fancier but over all a nice place!

13.description: I had a good dinner here last night. Service was good and the food tasted great. I ordered mussels a fries which were fresh and perfectly cooked, and my husband ordered a classic burger which he enjoyed. The beer selection is great and cocktails are tasty, I had a negroni. The only thing is the server switched our credit card with another customers and we didn't notice until the following evening, so had to cancel our credit card which was a pain.

11.description: I really wanted to love this place. We came here for a pre-Nutcracker dinner and I was hopeful when I saw it was $5 infused martini night. A table of three tried all four options:Grilled Pineapple Vacation: tequilla based with a nice hint of jalapeno; hands down the winner for me, despite not being the biggest tequila fan out thereKentucky Florida Line: weird screwdriver like drink with bourbon that the OJ way overpoweredLeaves on Lake: rum based lovely autumn smelling drink that my friend really enjoyedRosemary's Sister: I'm not a gin fan so I didn't try, but my other friend really liked itFor the food, we shared the cheese plate, which was divine, and the garlic/white wine mussels with french fries, which was eh. The sauce was good, but the mussels themselves were pretty cold by the time they arrived at our table as were the fries, which also were way over cooked and over seasoned with cheese. Less would have been more in the case of the fries.Overall it was okay, but not great. On a busy-ish Saturday night there were only two servers and drinks were left unfilled for too long and the check took forever when we were anxious to get to the Nutcracker a few blocks away. I'll probably try the brunch, but skip coming back for dinner again.

39.description: I am no expert in French cooking, but I really enjoyed my breakfast. The eggs in my Benedict were perfectly poached and the dish overall was substantial and delicious. My son had the chocolate French toast, which was rich and chocolatey and thoroughly enjoyed. The house coffee was nice and rich--perfect. The service was very friendly and attentive. Overall a great breakfast!

37.description: Been here for an hour, no food yet. Service is horrible. The manager is not very helpful either. Would not recommend.

0.description: I'm surprised by some of the negative reviews of this place, as I've never had anything but a positive experience here. My friends and I come very often for the bottomless mimosas on Sundays (they have it on Saturdays too), and it's amazing!I would recommend trying their breakfast potatoes, and of course the mimosas! I will be back this weekend as usual. :)

38.description: BRUNCH served on sat/sun!! walked in on saturday morning on a whim when walking by. SO glad we did! Lady who first assisted us (manager maybe?) seemed like she didnt want to be here, looked tired, but, our host was ever so kind and sat us down by the window. server was on and off, he came around a little late all the time (coffee unfilled, water needed, check up, etc) but he was friendly so meh. food took a LITTLE bit of time but the food was SO WORTH IT. my bf got the LM eggs benedict, which was perfect consistency of runnt-gooeyness and flavorful. the hollandaise sauce was a bit on the richer side (and orange, im not sure what spice they put in there since I didn't eat much) but it was so good. I opted for the croque madame!!!! DO get this! i am uploading a photo of this too, but it was the perfect warm, juicy and burst of flavor in every bite. the cheese and ham was so good, and crispy perfection on the crust. the runny egg on top was the cherry on top!both came with a side of potato chips (thick) and it was so good too, sad I couldnt finish mine since I was so full! if you are seeking brunch, DO GO if you are here on weekends.

51.description: Started off on the wrong foot when the bartender took almost 10min to ask us anything... (we sat at the bar thinking it would be quicker than the tables bc there was a short wait & we were in a rush) finally he came asked what we wanted. I order a house infused martini that happened to be $5 on a Saturday lunch. Very nice! 2 of us ordered the Le Francaise  burger and it was deliscious. Food was great service not so much. If you are patient then it is a good place to check out for the food!

27.description: Service is not their best starting by the host who is not very good at customer service. Not enough umbrellas for sun coverage in the outdoor.   Food was just ok so very likely not coming back.  Not recommending it to my friends.

32.description: This place is solid. Few frills. Pretty straightforward fare. Simple menu. Bottomless mimosas if that's your thing. Lots of pastries/breads. There are definitely better brunches to be had in Chicago, but if you value being able to walk in and not wait, this is a good option. If you are in the South Loop, you should give this place a shot one weekend. Nothing bad to say, really. Always had good service. The food always met expectations. I wouldn't put it on a Chicago bucket list, but unless your expectations are just too high, you probably won't be disappointed.

54.description: I went here with my boyfriend for the mimosa brunch special, and it was an amazing experience. We sat outside--the outdoor seating is limited but absolutely lovely. It feels quaint and has a nice view of the park across the street--it was very romantic! The mimosas were good and our waiter was very quick to replace our glasses after we finished a round. Also, the food was excellent! We both had the American breakfast and enjoyed tasty eggs & absolutely delicious breakfast potatoes. You must try the potatoes, so good!! The best thing is that we got great food, amazing ambiance, & bottomless mimosas for only $25/ea. I think this is reasonable. Can't wait to go back to LM for brunch!!

48.description: Went here for brunch and bottomless mimosas with my boyfriend. Very fun!! Waitress seemed overwhelmed, but had a right to be so, as the restaurant and city in general were very busy that day. Oatmeal was good, smoked salmon bagel was great! Got drunk and lost count of my mimosas!

44.description: Way to understaffed for simple Fri breakfast service.  Food OK if you have the (French) time. I'd pass.

24.description: This restaurant gets a 4-star review as opposed to 5 because of the brash & rude behavior of the host during my visit last Saturday. I didn't get his name, but he was a complete arse that made me & my friend (who was visiting from out of town, by the way) feel very unwelcome. We only stayed because we were famished & I'd heard wonderful things about the food. So glad we didn't allow that twerp to ruin our fantastic meal! It was simply divine & our server, David, more than made up for the 1st impression we received from the host.

7.description: I wasn't sure what to expect from a "swanky" downtown restaurant on Halloween (of all nights). A group of 6 of us came in full costume to eat dinner before going on a "booze cruise" on Lake Michigan. I ordered salmon and my husband ordered fettucine. I don't remember what everyone else ended up ordering but I know we were all really happy with our food. The food and specialty cocktails were really good! Maybe due to the holiday and everyone being at parties, the place wasn't crowded at all which was great (this was a Saturday night around 6pm). I felt that the food was really good and the service was prompt. Overall, a great experience and a really convenient location if you are headed to another event downtown.

49.description: Made a reservation and showed up early, got seated right away and was served the bottomless mimosa special while waiting for our last friend to show. Bottom mimosa is beyond accurate as server Ogi made sure we didnt see the bottom of our glasses for over two hours! Food was equally as impressive. Eggs benedict was spot on, croques are out of this world and the apple pancake option was phenomenal. Not sure about the negative reviews for this establishment as our entire experience was superb. The owner stopped by our table and chatted us up as well, she could not have been nicer or more engaged.  Beyond the service and food this place is super cute. The music was perfect for brunch, happy/upbeat not too loud or random. Table, bar, high top and outdoor seating. What more could you ask for?! Get in here right away.

40.description: My dear friend insisted on meeting up @ this place, I was hesitant because I was in the mood for something familiar (deep dish pizza). Only my second visit to the area. I was very pleased with atmosphere, and service. Absolutely adored the host David, he was charming and was able to recommend places around the city to visit. My friend and I order to share. The arugula salad was very tasty with the fromage. Marc was able to recommend a few drink choices the coffee with grand Marnier was exactly what I needed Overall I would definitely revisit merci Basserie

53.description: Let's start off this review with the positives.First, this place got our group of nine in ASAP and was really accommodating. When you're practically herding cattle, that's so helpful. Secondly, the atmosphere is really nice. It feels European and relaxing, which is what you want out of a brasserie.And finally, the presentation is very pretty. The sides come in little baskets and the whole meal is served on wooden slabs. It's a nice touch.However, once we got our server, I actually don't think we saw her again until we had to flag her down furiously to get the checks. Girl, come check on us a little.Truly, the food is meh. I got the croque vegetable, and had to douse it in mayo, Dijon mustard (which it already had on it), and hot sauce to actually taste anything. My counterparts agreed with theirs as well. The prices are average, but I left feeling disappointed with my dollar to satisfaction ratio.I'd likely not return unless it was for the mimosas, which I didn't try this past trip.

30.description: I recommend this place to all of my friends and the feedback is always positive   The manager is so sweet and hands on with the staff. Love the outdoor patio and the bar area I recommend the quiche and the French onion soup......amazing !!!!!!

46.description: This place is an embarrassment. We came for the $25 brunch and it couldn't have been a worse experience. Even though the patio had open tables, we were told it'd be a 15 minute wait. Okay, maybe they needed time to catch up. We waited roughly 25 minutes, still with tables open, before we asked how much longer it would be. We were then immediately sat in the patio. Then why the 15 minute wait? After nearly 40 minutes, our brunch came out. One of our plates was cold, and the toast wasn't even "toasted." After sending the plate back, we were told that they were making a completely new plate. The same plate came out with the same untoasted bread, cold eggs, but minus the potatoes (which were supposed to be included). After sending the plate back a second time, the manager came out and comped the entire meal, and provided a voucher to come back. After today's train wreck, we're not even sure we'd want to come back. However, we do give credit for the manager doing what was right.

1.description: Definite solid 3 star A-OK place!I had brunch here today (Saturday) with a group of people. $25 will get you an entree and unlimited mimosas. Entrees were fine, nothing too special. My burger was ok, the fries were crispy, but service for the mimosa was a little on the slow side. My husband and friend both got the beef hash and wished there were more beef. Other entrees were the brie croissant, American breakfast plate, and the french toast which were fine.Overall, not a bad place to grab breakfast!

55.description: This makes me SO SAD to write, but I feel like people need to know how awful this staff is.My sister was a total regular and decided to take me there. Food was delicious. And when I say delicious, mouth is watering just thinking about my sunny side up eggs and sausages. Anywho, I was seated next to the big wall near the bar. My purse was hanging on the back of my chair NEXT to the wall. I NEVER got up, once. Our waiter seemed pretty cool, at some point he ended up leaving during our meal because it was the end of his shift. I had taken my ID out of my wallet (in my purse) for our mimosa brunch and was putting it back in after maybe 45min/an hour? In this time period, I never got up from my chair. I went to put my ID back in my wallet and my wallet was gone. I initially was in disbelief because something like that has not ever happened to me, so it was a bit shocking.I decided to be mature and understanding and calmly asked the waiters if they had found a wallet, they said no. Then I decided ok I guess it was stolen. I told them that my wallet had been stolen but didn't understand how because I had never gotten up from my chair and I was sitting a considerably far distance from other people. The only people who came by my table and me were the bus boys who put down our plates and picked them back up and our two waiters. They immediately asked me if I was sure that I didn't get up from my chair. Then proceeded to ask me if I even brought my wallet..at this point my sister was furious that they tried to make me look like a fool. Once we realized it could have been someone apart of the restaurant staff, we told them. The managers both vouched for the waiter, stating he'd been here for three years and he didn't need to steal. I don't know what that means, but ok. They kept lying for the waiter and said he was in the back doing some things, but when my sister kept insisting on speaking to him, he had miraculously left (a while ago). At the end of it all, I had cancelled all my credit cards and had no money whatsoever with me. This was a Saturday and the banks had just closed an hour prior. You would think they would comp my meal, but they sent me my check with no apologies or anything. It disappoints me to have to write this, because the food was amazing. But the way everything was handled was very irresponsible and I'm sure the restaurant owners wouldn't want any customer to feel the way we did: dissatisfied and disappointed. At the end of the day, the customer is the most important person. The least they could have done is comp-ed my meal. BTW: we are two girls in our early twenties who don't have big girls jobs yet (LOL)Go there for the food if you'd like, but beware of the thieves and unsympathetic staff who just stare at you for being upset.

9.description: First, the staff are extremely efficient and friendly here. The hostess was attentive from the moment we arrived and our waitress checked on us frequently, without intruding on our conversation. I took advantage of the prix fixe menu as it appeared to be a good bargain. The onion soup was amazing with a creamy combination of cheeses. The beef bourguignon was equally amazing with some of the most tender meat I've ever experienced. My only complaint was in the chocolate tart. Even though it tasted good, it was evident that it was a bulk product, which is okay, but there are certainly ways to enhance a foodservice product to make it unique. We plan to go back soon for brunch. For a Michigan Avenue restaurant, the value and quality are superb!

26.description: The host is way too rude not only to the customers but the staff as well. They need to get their act together as the food is just ok too. Not worth the money. I would not go there again! Bad experience.

25.description: I would come here just for the cheese and meat plates. I literally had that for dinner with a glass of wine and I was in heaven. Service could be quicker.. Entrées could be fancier but over all a nice place!

12.description: BRUNCH served on sat/sun!! walked in on saturday morning on a whim when walking by. SO glad we did! Lady who first assisted us (manager maybe?) seemed like she didnt want to be here, looked tired, but, our host was ever so kind and sat us down by the window. server was on and off, he came around a little late all the time (coffee unfilled, water needed, check up, etc) but he was friendly so meh. food took a LITTLE bit of time but the food was SO WORTH IT. my bf got the LM eggs benedict, which was perfect consistency of runnt-gooeyness and flavorful. the hollandaise sauce was a bit on the richer side (and orange, im not sure what spice they put in there since I didn't eat much) but it was so good. I opted for the croque madame!!!! DO get this! i am uploading a photo of this too, but it was the perfect warm, juicy and burst of flavor in every bite. the cheese and ham was so good, and crispy perfection on the crust. the runny egg on top was the cherry on top!both came with a side of potato chips (thick) and it was so good too, sad I couldnt finish mine since I was so full! if you are seeking brunch, DO GO if you are here on weekends.

59.description: The service here was good. The waiters were attentive, but I would not say extraordinary. The food on the other hand was delicious and will be the reason I return. The arugula steak salad was amazing. The steak was cooked perfectly medium, the blue cheese added a creamy touch, the grapefruit added the perfect zing, and the arugula was fresh. But don't leave without trying their crème brûlée. It was the perfect size for one, and you won't want to share. The atmosphere was perfect for a late afternoon lunch. I would highly recommend for great lunch spot.

21.description: I have to admit, we were not sure about going to this place, due to all the other negative reviews we read on yelp, but because it was a per-arranged dinner with friends, who selected this restaurant, we decided to go. We were totally expecting a somewhat disaster from the start. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a party of 6, and we were all seated promptly by a gentleman at the host/hostess stand (due to other reviews) this is where we thought we would run into problems, but did not, he was very pleasant. We all chose to have the prie fixe selections on the menu, and opted for the 3 course meals. My partner had the mixed green salad, while I had the onion soup gratin for the starters, which were great, very flavorful. For the main course, all of the party selected the Beef Bourguignon, while I had the Grilled Chicken Breast. The beef was just delicious, and very tender, as I tasted a bit of my partners meal, the chicken breast was just awesome. It was very juicy, and just a great selection. For dessert, my partner had the chocolate tart, which, in tasting I did not care for, but the rice pudding (Teurgoule) was very good, great flavors. The service was great, the waitperson was right there to take care of all our needs, and made excellent recommendations.It is unfortunate that many of the other reviews pertaining to staff really can deter someone from patronizing an establishment, so I am glad we took the chance, and decided to join the dinner party. I hope that this is a sign that things have turned around for this place.

17.description: We had the blue cheese burgers and they were great :)) also great service again and a good wine selection!!!

10.description: A VERY GOOD EXAMPLE OF A VERY BAD AND RACIST RESTAURANT!!!!" Initially, I heard good things about this place which is why I decided to take my friend there. As we walked in the staff stared at us without a pleasant greeting. We were seated and asked about the bottomless mimosas. It was not explained well. Out of no where the manager comes over. I wasn't offended the manager asking me "is there a problem"  I asked her about the drink specials, she told me about them in a very condescending tone. Further, she walked away and never returned and NO one ever came to take our order. We sat there for 45 minutes! I found that to be very disrespectful. I would NOT recommend this restaurant to anyone, in addition to its poor customer service, the experience itself was uncomfortable, the atmosphere seemed very judgemental from beginning to end. Honestly, I have never written a bad review about a restaurant before, but this experience was so awful that I had to warn others. On the restaurant scale I would give them NO STARS.

5.description: I had heard this was a good place to go for breakfast, so I decided to go try it out.  Disappointing.  The food was lukewarm and not very good.  The service was slow and inattentive.  The ambiance was fun and open and the view of the park was gorgeous.  Honestly, if it's summer and you're going to sit outside and take in the scenery, this could be a great place to go for a drink, but otherwise, skip this place for food.  Such a disappointment.

3.description: Made reservations for Valentine's day with my family visiting from out of town and had to move it by 1hour on the day of and was easily accommodated. 3kids and 5 adults we had a fantastic time with the bottom less mimosas.The food was pretty good and enjoyed the ambience and polite service.  We will definitely walk over for a few brunches in the summer.

35.description: Experience was a bit confusing...first the host seemed pissed at us for asking to sit outside, there was 4 open tables! The menue has good descriptions but things felt like they were in the wrong place. Then we had 3 different servers cone to our table to take drink orders. The 2nd drink on the cocktail menue -I think it was called dark and stormy, we'll it was awful,  like the worst combo. My lunch, the French dip, was really good a d the fries were amazing. My friend got a burger and it was clearly a frozen patty and tasted like that also. My other friend got the chicken sandwich and said it was good but the bun was too hard- they used a baguette.  All and all it was good but could be way better

19.description: We've been going to the Brasserie for a few years--whenever we visit Chicago. On a recent visit, it was the first place we stopped to eat. There's outdoor seating, which is surprisingly private--even though the place is right on Michigan Avenue. Indoors is quieter, and the large widows allow for people watching. Service has progressively slipped over the years, but is never rude or intolerable. The food is refreshingly different and well prepared. There appears to be a concern for good quality ingredients, preparation and presentation. (They use Julius Meinl coffee) We have had many breakfasts and lunches at the Brasssrrie...all enjoyable. The Mister dreams of their breakfast potatoes...and their frenchfies are done in a similar fashion.

28.description: We came here for Sunday brunch and were not disappointed! Bottomless mimosas and a meal for $25 each!  Our server, I think her name was Iona, was amazing. Even when she took her break, she made sure another server checked in on us and topped up our glasses. The food was wonderful, I had the Brie Croissant, and others at our table had the Croque Madame and the Salmon Bagel. All of the food was good, but the french food (croissant & croque madame) were particularly wonderful. While the bagel was good, he said he would pick something different next time. Definitely recommend coming here!

45.description: Food was good. Service was terrible. We had to ask for drinks multiple times, and we were served spoiled cream with our coffee. When we brought that to our server's attention, she was rude and dismissive. I would not return. You can certainly get the same quality food with kinder service elsewhere on Michigan.

33.description: Arrived for Brunch on a Sunday. Restaurant was  very busy, but we were seated after a short wait. The Brie Croissant and Egg Benedict by LM were ordered and were excellent. Place had a relaxed feel, server arrived a few times to check/provide water/coffee  refill. Overall, we had an excellent experience. Foods were excellent, server was very courteous  and friendly, price was very good and the atmosphere  was  very relaxing. The manager/owner came to see how we were doing and we feel like we were very much at home. We would definitely  return and recommend  to our friends Brassiere  by LM. Thumbs up! 5 Stars rating from us!

43.description: Nice place. I had breakfast there. It's a comfortable and friendly place. I can't say, that their Benedict eggs are the best, however, cappuccino is super nice- enough strong, enough creamy.

2.description: I was here with my family for a pre Nut Cracker dinner. We gave ourselves about 2 hours' time.We had the 3 course set dinners, wine garlic herb mussels and pasta Arrabiatta.For the 3 Course Prix Fixe Dinner Special $25We tried both APPERTIZERs:Onion Soup Gratinee crouton, melted cheeseandMixed Greens Salad sunflower seed, seasonal vegetables, red wine vinaigretteEntree:Boeuf Bourguignon potato puree, mushroom, onion, baconBoth DESSERTs:Teurgoule Brasserie By LM's Signature Cinnamon Rice Pudding and Chocolate TartThe French onion soup topped with melted cheese was good but it seemed to be missing the wine taste.The salad mix is unique and excellent.The Boeuf Bourguignon was absolutely out of this world!! Very soft and tender and juicy like beef stew.Both rice pudding and chocolate tart were good.For the wine garlic herb mussels, they seemed to have a mix of small and big mussels with the big ones on top and the smaller ones hidden under the big ones inside the bowl. It did not have any cooked wine taste that I was expecting. Not sure the kind of wine used here. The French fries were slightly crunchy and tasted unique.The pasta Arrabiatta was good and flavorful.For dinner, the place did not have many people and there were like 3 servers around. Not sure if this is the norm for dinner.Overall for dinner, I absolutely loved the Boeuf Bourguignon. All the rest that we had that night were just alright.

18.description: One of the owners of Brasserie By LM contacted me on Yelp and invited us to come back for a second go around. Good deal because we were planning to return anyway. We liked the proximity of Brasserie By LM to the ITU Triathlon and planned to hit it up again after the Chicago Triathlon this past Sunday. What's better than bottomless mimosas after an exhausting day of racing and spectating in the scorching summer sun?We got the $25 bottomless mimosa deal again. That is a sweet deal that comes with a brunch entree. The only reason NOT to get this deal is if you don't imbibe. We've decided that our minimum is three mimosas at Brasserie By LM.Once again, we were seated right away in the bar area and we had a fabulous server. No problems in that department either time.My friends and I all ordered different foods than last time. I got the French Toast which was right up my alley on that day. M got the burger (which came medium and not rare like my burger last time) and was satisfying to her pallet. She especially enjoyed the potatoes that came on the side. Our friends ordered the croque madame and something else. They seemed to enjoy both of their selections.The quality of food at Brasserie By LM is good. It's not: "Oh-my-gosh-this-is-freakin-amazing!!!" or even, "Hold up. I'm having a mouth orgasm..." But it's good. There's nothing special done in the plating department. There aren't any complicated layers of flavors or textures. I think it's good and I like it. Well, I liked my French Toast. For the price, I think it was bangin'.We've decided that Brasserie By LM will be our after-race-tradition. I'll chalk up our issues to mis-ordering. For example, if I know I like fancy burgers then I shouldn't order a plain one. M now knows she dislikes tomatoes on her Benedict.

41.description: Horrible service today August 23, 2015. Came at 1:30pm. African American male host was busy flirting with some male patron and ignored my party as well as another. Finally he walked over and said you sit there and the other party sit there with attitude, pointing us to a table.We had one server take part of our order than a shift change and got some girl. It took 20 minutes after asking her twice for another server to have to be asked to bring it. By the time I ordered my partner had finished their food. I had to wait 35 minutes for my food. A Caesar salad with chicken! Our server never came over and forgot items and was so aloof. They weren't even that busy except for patio. It appeared everybody was running all over the place. No manager ever came by, when I finally found one after waiting for the bill for 20 minutes she appeared just as confused and frazzled as the rest. She did comp 50% and gave us $20 to return in gift certificates. Too bad, the food was decent as well as unlimited mimosas. Not sure if I'll go back, but boy nobody in that place had a handle on what was going on. It was chaos!

52.description: Talked to hostess on entering and went outside.  Waited 5 minutes.  While waiting 2 servers worked tables around me.  Neither spoke to me. I cant tell you how the food is as i was unwilling to wait any longer.

50.description: Don't believe the negative reviews!!  We're from Philadelphia, came to the restaurant half hour before our reservation for a drink and they sat us immediately, offered us the bottomless mimosas and never let our drinks get passed half full.  The service was amazing, the owner is very friendly and came over to our table to chat with us.  Our server Ogi was the best - very attentive.  The food was delicious and very reasonably priced.  This is a great spot for brunch!!

4.description: And the challenger receives 3 stars from the judges (Star Search reference). Brasserie by LM food is so damn good it deserves 4 stars, but the crappy service made me remove a star.My BFF and I came to Brasserie by LM for a catch up brunch and upon arrival we were greeted by...wait for it....NO ONE. We stood there for about a minute waiting for someone to acknowledge our presence. When we realize that wasn't going to happen I flagged down a lady who appeared to work there and ask if it was open seating or something because we had a reservation, but no one was manning the host/hostess desk. She just shrugged and kept walking. Annoyed at this point (3 minutes has passed now) I start staring down every waiter and waitress that I see trying to get someone to come and seat us. FINALLY a waitress comes over, asked if we have been helped (NO we respond), asked if we have a reservation (YES we respond) and then she says, "OK" I'll prepare a table. I thanked her and told her my stomach thanked her as well.Once we were seated we quickly ordered our food and prayed the service wouldn't continue to be crappy. Thankfully, it wasn't and our food arrived in a timely manner. The food was delicious so I highly recommend checking this place out, even though the beginning of our dining experience was less than desirable. I recommend trying*Apple Tatin Pancakes (caramelized apple, crème chantilly, homemade pancakes, caramel sauce) - 4 stars so good, so rich, so sweet, so shareable*Croque Madame (hot ham and cheese sandwich, béchamel, Dijon mustard, fried egg) - 4 stars almost as good as the ones I ate when I lived in Paris.*Croque Vegetable (spinach, brie, caramelized onion, béchamel, Dijon mustard) - 4 starsOh and I recommend you NOT try the apple juice as it cost $5.50!!! I mean who the hell charges that for apple juice?! If it had booze in it I would have been A OK paying that price. However, since it didn't I'm still mad I had to pay that when they probably paid less than that at Jewel for the bottle the juice came out of.

6.description: This place is solid. Few frills. Pretty straightforward fare. Simple menu. Bottomless mimosas if that's your thing. Lots of pastries/breads. There are definitely better brunches to be had in Chicago, but if you value being able to walk in and not wait, this is a good option. If you are in the South Loop, you should give this place a shot one weekend. Nothing bad to say, really. Always had good service. The food always met expectations. I wouldn't put it on a Chicago bucket list, but unless your expectations are just too high, you probably won't be disappointed.

22.description: Hands down THE WORST BRUNCH I have ever had. Ever. Service was so terribly slow. Got my cappuccino AFTER my meal arrived (which was 30 minutes later). Also had to remind the waiter to bring us water, and about my cappuccino... One of the servers was extremely rude to us when we walked in trying to figure out where the hostess table was (it's towards the back, not near the door). DO NOT GO HERE. You will most definitely regret it. The food is good, but will not make it worth your time nor money.

15.description: They charge an 18% tip on groups of 5 or larger. Like who does that? Also, adding on gratuity is now illegal in the state of Illinois, so...also what? Our waitress was terrible. She didn't know the menu or the specials; she was slow and inattentive. On top of that, after speaking with a manager, she was supposed to notify us that because we were a group of 5, we would be charged the (illegal!!!) added gratuity, but she didn't.The food overall was alright. I ordered the prefixe menu which included soup or salad, beef bourguignon or a chicken dish and dessert. I went with the salad and the beef bourguignon. It tasty, but the portions were smaller than I expected. For dessert I ordered some chocolate tarte-ish thing. The whole meal was actually very unmemorable.We ate on the patio, which was nice, but kind of cramped. People walking behind me kept bumping my chair and it got a little cooler than we would have liked, but that was on us (darn Chicago weather!). Oh and this kind of relates to the restaurant, but the bathroom (which actually is outside in the hotel lobby) was being cleaned while we ate here and I wanted to use the bathroom, so I knocked and tried to ask the man when he would be done. He then got really annoyed and left and told me to use the bathroom. It felt really uncomfortable and rude.I don't think I'll be back.

57.description: Food was amazing. The croquet is delicious and the potatoes that come with it. The pancakes and coffee are 5 stars. I gave 4 stars because of the service. Despite of waiting for about 30 minutes for our order to come I would definitively come again because the food was worth the wait.

20.description: the service is poor. the food is good. the servers have no idea how to execute their duties and need training. it is a shame.

36.description: Love this place! Wonderful patio, impeccable croque madame, and full bodied coffee in a cup that is always warmed and full courtesy of the attentive, super friendly staff. Great spot for people watching and close to the museum/aquarium/planetarium. Highly recommend!

14.description: Attached to my hotel and I was tired so it was easy.   I was impressed.  I got the hamburger "off the grill", which meant it came with no bun, a fried egg, salad and fries.  It was delicious!  And I was stuffed.  And it was $10!  Shoot.  That's a bargain.   Cinnamon rice pudding dessert was tasty, but unimaginative.  (The waitress convinced me to order it.)All told, with soda (and I never drink soda, so this was a splurge), tax and tip: $25.  What a deal!

29.description: This place really is a ZERO STAR!!! There are not words to describe how terrible it is. I have been there about 5 times---always hoping they can get it right. I have even brought pictures in of what I wanted and still the girls couldn't get it right! I question if they have even attended beauty school. They also cut my boyfriends hair and did a HORRIBLE HORRIBLE job! above his ear the women cut the hair about an inch and a half up-just terrible. I would not recommend anyone get their hair done there. Additionally, one of the girls told me she has a 7 month year old....she told me she had a 7 month year old when I went there year ago! Amazingly the child has yet to grow! Besides having a terrible attitude all the women that work there are sloppy and rude. Avoid this place like the plague! Yes it is inexpensive...but it is crap.

42.description: The Staff here is very rude.  They never speak directly to you, they chat among each other, and totally disregard you. I've gotten one good haircut here, which is why I went back, and then after the second trip I started to find other places to get my hair cut.

23.description: I give five stars to Valerie who took my long phone call answering my questions, gave me a great color and perfect cut. She is super friendly, outgoing and very easy to work with and talk to.  She did a complicated color process too and was very experienced and pulled a back to back color session with ease. I would ask for her if you are planning on visiting this location.  if you can find the RIGHT stylist who understands what you want and delivers, you've hit the jackpot right? For such a cheap price, I got exactly what I wanted.  Definitely ask for Valerie and give this place a go. My experience was ideal.

47.description: In general I'm a big fan of Hair Cuttery but this particular location really blows.  Even when the hairdryers are turned off.  I've been here two or three times and each time walked out with a mediocre haircut.  The worst time was when I went once around 2pm on a weekday...  There was only one person working, and she was grouchy.  I went in, she told me "it's gonna be awhile" (she was already cutting someone's hair), then three more people came in and she told them she was going to lunch after she cut mine so it was going to be a long time.  So then she rushed through his, and rushed through mine...and just closed up shop in the middle of the day???  What's with that.  I feel bad it was nearly 3pm and she hadn't had lunch but that's by no means my fault.

8.description: I had been diligent customer of this location for past 4 years not anymore.Kimberly - the hair stylist. I knew she was not as good as others. But she was the only one available. I specifically asked her to use tea tree shampoo and not redken . She frowns at me and asks " why are you teaching me?!". She did not tell me what shampoo she used.5 min she spent on my haircut - my hair is long and wanted layers. Did not even offer a blow dry ( it's winter!) just because I came in at 4:30 pm and they close at 5 on Sunday.There were awesome hairstylist here before like Valarie, Dion ,all who have left. Now that I am having painful breakouts in my forehead which I used to get  from redken, I am forced to write a review. And I am going to call corporate and reiterate this .

31.description: I've only visited once and I regret not yelping this location before that first and last visit.  By luck of the draw, I ended up with Antoine, who seemed far more interested in joking around with his colleagues than cutting my hair.  I would have been ok with that if my cut was halfway decent.  My sideburns were uneven and there was absolutely no symmetry to his trim.  The employees also get irritated when there are more than 4 people in the store.  It clearly shows in the haircut and in their conversations with each other.

34.description: I read the reviews of this Hair Cuttery location before I went and still wanted to "risk" going because I can't see the point of getting a $50 trim.  I'll pay that much when I want to get a whole new style, but not for a trim.  Nikki was my stylist and I really like my haircut!I went in last night at around 7 (fully anticipating a wait, as one should in a "walk-in" location - you never know what might happen).  After I waited for about 30 minutes, Nikki took me to her chair and gave me a great trim.  She took her time and made sure everything was even.  She was quiet, but so was I when sitting and getting styled.  I didn't mind it at all.While I was waiting, the women there were super polite to anyone who came in and made sure to be honest about the wait time.  My fiance got a haircut at the same time I did and his hair looks great as well.It's unfortunate the some people had bad experiences, but I think it's a great location and I'll definitely be returning in a couple months!

16.description: My go to place for a quick and affordable haircut. I'm a man with simple needs, and most of the time they take care of me quickly and effectively.

13.description: Let's be frank. These people are very rough with your head. I had a light amount of product in my hair and instead of spraying you down like any normal place does, they just take the clippers and start in. She actually told me "this might hurt". Haircuts are not supposed to hurt.If you have straight hair, I do not think these employees know how to cut it. This place is staffed by southsiders who are not only uncaring, but I truly believe do not know how to cut straight hair. They would brutalize a curly head of hair too, definitely do not send your kids in here. Just stay away, pay more or cut your own hair. This place is that bad. If you go in, be prepared to be as aggressive and mouthy as the staff if you want your hair cut right.

11.description: No sense of urgency. At all. When I walked in I was told 15 minutes. It has been 45 minutes later a woman who knew a hairstylist went ahead of me. Stylists are dancing and talking to each other way more than actually paying attention to the clients!

39.description: I went to Jennifer for a year and then suddenly she was gone.  I have tried it several times since but never again. Staff spend their time talking to each other and banging your head with clippers. Can't even get a clean up around the ears without then cutting too much or too little.

37.description: I mentioned to the stylist on duty what kind of cut I wanted and they pulled out a book of pictures of heads and told me to pick out something from that.  I sort of get what they were going for but can people not make a picture in their mind?  Utterly ridiculous.My stylist had the conversational style of trying to sell me products.  Again, not what a barber should be.  Talk to me, make me feel good.  I understand it's a chain but the people who work here could enjoy their jobs too y'know.  Though, what they lack in personality they make up for with a constant flow of coupons in those weekly coupon mailers for $3 off so they've got that going for them.

0.description: The staff is wonderful here. Great location by my condo. Friendly staff and very talented...Jackie and Elliot are the best!! Highly recommend

38.description: The only reason that I am giving this hair cuttery 4 stars is because you cannot make an appointment.  Which I know is a chain wide policy and not their fault but it still drives me crazy.  I got an amazing cut and color from Danny at this location. I highly recommend going to him for all of your hair needs.  He used to work at Mario Tricoci  so he is actually a trained hair stylist.  All of the other stylists were nice and greeted me when I came in.  I went in the evening and there was not a huge wait.  For the people that complain about the wait, what do you expect?  Walk-ins only.  do you want to pay more and wait less or vice-versa?

27.description: Wow! I see all these bad reviews. I got lucky.Valerie is the one who cut my hair. (She's blonde and Caucasian.)She was very attentive and friendly to me, and quite patient. I've gotten a few too many haircuts that wound up being so obviously uneven and I told her this. She took her time to check and recheck the length. (No, it didn't take "forever"; I was just being paranoid about any possible screw-up.) She made a believer out of me. I will definitely go back to have Valerie cut my hair. I sure liked what she did, and boy, did I get lots of compliments from my  friends - even from a few strangers!

32.description: the saying....you get what you pay for....is definitely true. i read all the reviews and was very nervous but pushed on anyways. all i needed was a quick trim, only wanted a 1/2 in cut off, who can F that up?! Certainly not Antwaun. I couldn't give this place 4 stars because i certainly don't "love it". Went in Friday evening, around 4:45pm and there was no wait, however, a mad rush of men came in shortly after me and were piling up by the door waiting to be trimmed by the chatty stylists. Antwaun was very meticulous about my cut. Took his time and even serenaded me a bit to the tunes on the mandatory Hair Cuttery radio station. Would i go back? maybe...i am in the process of growing out my hair and when you only want a 1/2 in taken off why pay $50 when you can pay $15 and dry it yourself at home! Overall not as bad of an experience as i expected...

48.description: A very nice Hair Cuttery, fancy looking counters and overall design. I've been here a few times during the midday and the results vary per stylist.  While your supposed be offered a shampoo with hair cut,  it seems only some stylists actually offer this. If shampooing is so important to Hair Cuttery that its widely advertised, it upsets me to see it not offered. Overall, a good value and nice location, just watch who you get to cut your hair.

44.description: I only stick with two barbers.  A bunch of the people are different since I last reviewed it and I never go in during the day.  It's either 8:58AM on a weekday and I'm out by 9:20AM.  Weekend morning or any other time is a waste of time.  I tried 9:58AM on Sunday (they open at 10AM) and a dad, mom, and kid were already in the store.  I looked past the magazine rack and saw another lady.  Damn, four people and one stylist... I'll come back another day.

24.description: I've been here twice. I have to say I'm never satisfied with my haircut right after I get it done. But with $15 I was happy with the results. I would never recommend going here for a complete change but to have a couple of inches off or just a trim- I think the Hair Cuttery is fine! The staff is really not the best. I think there was some drama between one hairdresser and mine. I found the banter entertaining, it didn't get in the way of cutting my hair. Not chatty and when it comes down to it a decent hair cut!

7.description: This place has gotten better, almost all their staff is new. I recommend Claudia, Kimberly, or Elliot. All has given me good haircuts in the past. I recommend Claudia for men, she really knows what she's doing! Go to her every time

49.description: I have a couple of hits and a lot of misses with this particular hair cuttery.  A lot of the "stylists" seem to think that all heads and needs are alike and they seem to love the ease and convenience of a clipper.  You have to be very specific when you go in with that mop head of yours or else you'll walk out looking and feeling like a kid.  Nothing angers me more than a bad cut and having to wait a few weeks to get it cut again...just be warned, it does get busy in there in the evenings so bring something to do if you just walk in.

40.description: Quite possibly the worst haircut experience I have ever had. The staff is incredible rude. They act annoyed when you come in for your haircut. The staff would rather talk about their personal lives between themselves than speak with you about your haircut.When I entered the there were 3 people ahead of me and I was told that there was a short wait. I left when there were 6 people sitting, waiting and the last person in was told there would be a 10 minute wait. Come on ten minutes with 6 people waiting and 3 employees not cutting hair. Lets be serious. Either way if you are headed to this Hair Cuttery. I wouldn't expect good service or a good haircut.

30.description: STEP away from this place. My experience was a woman who kept cutting and cutting, "Don't make it short" I say. She kept cutting and cutting, until I had a mess on top of my head standing straight up in parts due to shortness. Different lengths, my grandson is better with scissors and took about 6 months to get back to just being short. NEVER again. In this case, you do get what you pay for.

46.description: I really don't know why people come to Hair Cuttery to pay $15 to get their hair cut by inexperienced barbers who just f**k it up. They have no interest in your hair or your well being and you might as well get your own clippers to do your own hair. I was so tired of trying to find a good cheap barber I purchased my first electric clipper for $30 from Bed Bath and I won't ever look back again. My first haircut resulted in a clogged drain, but I won't give in ever!

1.description: Jackie was nice and super friendly with my little son when we came to get a haircut for him - 2 stars only for that. The haircut itself - sorry, implemented not accurate enough +  doesn't match my request.

9.description: I really did get the worst haircut of my life at this hair cuttery. it wasn't just the awful cut that made it so bad, but the experience which teetered on mortifying. I made an appointment for 5:30pm a little over a year ago (yeah, it's been that long - I'm looking for some closure here). I was coming straight from work and arrived at 5:32pm. My stylist, I can't remember his name - something like Keith, looked at the clock as I gave my name and he said he'd been waiting for me. Okay. Sorry dude, I rushed here from work so you can chill out and I'll give you two of my minutes some time to make up for the couple you lost. So this man, I will call him Keith, takes me to the back and we get started. I'm a pretty simple girl on the outside and I am that way intentionally. Like a lot of people, I've got anxiety about talking to strangers and being the center of attention and change and blah, blah. It's written all over me. When I answered "Suave or something. I don't really know" after Keith asked me what kind of shampoo I used, he should have changed his whole game plan. I'm at the [bleeping] hair cuttery, I'm not here to buy a new product. Keith was offended with my answer, "Girl, You're in CHICAGO! You should know what shampoo you're using." I don't think my location has anything to do with how necessary it is that I am aware of the brand of shampoo I use. But then again, I'm not a professional stylist so what do I know? At this point, I knew Keith and I were not going to have a lasting relationship, but when we started small-taking I found out he has familial ties to the city where I went to college. I grew up and went to college in Pennsylvania and am a real sucker for "it's a small world after all" coincidences so I thought maybe the rocky start Keith and I have had could be salvaged. I tried to listen with an open mind when he was telling me about the superior product he was using to wash my hair. When the cut started, I told him I just wanted a trim. I didn't even tell him to give me layers. Just a trim. I knew not to give him any leeway. He, again, seemed offended. And I again, thought, "I'm at the [bleeping] hair cuttery. Just cut my hair and let me leave satisfied." He held up my long-ish hair and tried to sell me highlights. Highlights! What in the world made him think that I'd be interested in highlights is beyond me. I tell him no, I'm not really one for highlights. Again, offended. He then said, in a tone that I didn't take as playful, "What made you so... blah?" I joked and offered, "That'd take more time than we have right now to explain" and we both laughed, but this time I was the one who was offended. Someone who I am paying to give me some vanity should not be diminishing my confidence and I thought Keith was very unprofessional and judgmental in this manner.  From there the cut continued, and it continued, and it continued. To be honest, I wasn't paying much attention to the actual cutting as it was happening, I was more focused on how this man could be so demeaning and wondered if he was like this in all areas of his life. When he took off the apron and held the mirror up for the symbolic revealing, I nearly cried. Not only was the cut really, really bad, it validated the sheer misery I was feeling. I still paid Keith, something I regret to this day, and I even took his business card. I was pleasant and nodded when I looked through the mirrors, but man, I should not have been so polite. I was going out that night and I thought about bailing. I promise you, I'm really not one to overreact, contrary to this review. I've never had a haircut bad enough to affect me other than how I brush or style it or the amount of shampoo I have to use. All in all, Keith cut about four inches off. Not quite a trim, but it's normal for a stylist to cut more than you ask for. I could have dealt with the length if the cut had any style to it at all, but it didn't. I looked like a four year old who cut their own hair.No one made mention of my disastrous haircut, probably because they didn't want to talk about the mess that must have been made to make such a mess. After writing this review, it seems like I'm reviewing Keith  more than the hair cuttery. The establishment was pretty bland and forgettable itself, everyone knows what a hair cuttery looks like. I did find myself wishing I had a different stylist because at least their customers were smiling sitting below them. I was not. I'll never go back to a hair cuttery because of this experience. I had a fine hair cut at a different location about a year before this one, but I won't give the company another chance. I will also never go somewhere to get my hair cut because it's cheap. I've learned my lesson and for that, I suppose, I should thank Keith. ::eyeroll::

26.description: I moved to south loop 3 years ago, it's always a great thing when you can find a great place close by that can give you a great hair cut -couple years back this place was a zoo, bad service with very rude personnel - I had 2 bad experiences here.  Recently re-visited this place for my last 3rd try - Very impressive change from the zoo I visited couple years back - management is different with very nice & attentive personnel working there. It's like they want you to come back :) Will return - keep up the great service

25.description: Kirsten is the best in the shop and She' the only one I let touch my hair. She takes her time and does a great job. No complaints ever!!!!

12.description: Overpriced. No coupons or promotions or rewards for being loyal. Nice, clean store conveniently located - so they get some starts. They did a poor hair cutting job on 1-2 occasions.

21.description: Visited this place on a weekday afternoon and requested the first available stylist. I had two people waiting in the cue ahead of me, so there was about a 15 minute wait, which seemed fine. Everyone working there was courteous and friendly.  My stylist gave me the basic haircut that I requested, along with a shampoo and conditioning treatment.I would return again, especially when looking for a basic, low cost, quick hair cut.  The only reason I am not giving five stars is because the place could be a bit more tidy. I don't like to see any hair on the floor when I sit down in the stylist chair, and although the staff did sweep the floor a bit, they were kind of lax about it, so there was still quite a bit of hair noticeable on the floor from the previous customers.

17.description: SLOW! SLOW ! SLOW! I never wanted to write a review on Yelp until today. If you have 2 hours to wait for a hair cut then this is the place for you. On April 16, 2013 I stopped by after work to see if i could get in for a hair cut, they told me it would be an hour wait. That was fine with me because I needed to do some shopping and walk my dog. I came back exactly one hour later and they told me two people were still in front of me and that it would be another twenty minutes. The last time I got a hair cut here "20 minutes" turned into one hour. This "Salon" and time management have never met. After poor service my last two visits I have had enough and will NEVER go back. The manager and owner need to consider going on Tabatha's Salon Takeover

10.description: This is by far the worst Hair Cuttery location.  No sense of urgency.  Walked in without an appointment and instead of being welcomed the stylist looked at her watch.  On a previous visit I came to buy some shampoo and it took 15-20 min for the stylist to find the price and ring me up.

5.description: In the winter of 2014, I fell victim to a very bad hair color job. My friend had actually visited hair cuttery to see David and she told me how great her experience was. I decided to give them a try, David saved my hair and I'm happy to say I'll definitely continue to go back to him!

3.description: Ask for nina for mens hair cut. Got a decent cut but for 17.48$. A bit pricey for the cut.

35.description: The wait is ridiculous. The service is horrible. The stylists complain while they cut your hair. The stylists will turn you down. Im actually going to complain to their corporate about my experience. The only person there that I LOVE is I believe his name is Vinnie. He was not there on my last visit. If I ever decide to go back, which after the other day is really friggin slim, I would HAVE to go when he is there.

19.description: I've been here twice. I have to say I'm never satisfied with my haircut right after I get it done. But with $15 I was happy with the results. I would never recommend going here for a complete change but to have a couple of inches off or just a trim- I think the Hair Cuttery is fine! The staff is really not the best. I think there was some drama between one hairdresser and mine. I found the banter entertaining, it didn't get in the way of cutting my hair. Not chatty and when it comes down to it a decent hair cut!

28.description: Contrary to other reviews I thought this place was great. I have typically always visited salon's and paid two-to-three times the price of what I did here. The wait wasn't long eventhough it appeared it to be (great for people like me who can't or are always late for appointments. $15 bucks!!!! Staff were genuine and nice.

45.description: First off.  I feel awful cheating on good hair places, and going to a chain like Hair Cuttery.  However, my hair was pretty disgusting and in desperate need of a cut and dye.  I'm pretty freaking happy that I did.  I didn't even know places like this dyed hair.  Marty was pretty awesome.  He did both mine and my roommate's hair.  He cut my hair pretty much exactly the way I asked, which was nice.  The dye job was also surprisingly good, which was really exciting.  I was afraid that the ends were going to be over saturated, but the color turned out beautifully.   The wait was the only reason the place doesn't get 5 stars, that and the fact that I didn't reallly want to trust the woman that was working.  Overall 65$ for a cut and color and style was a pretty sweeeet deal.

33.description: I have been going here semi - regularly since I moved to south loop 5 months ago.  Recently I went and asked for a very basic standard men's haircut, I have short hair.  She screwed up above my ears, she trimmed a HUGE arch above my ears for a hairline.  Looks really silly.I have never really had a good cut here, always missed spots some place - but this was the worse.I'll not be going back again.  It's a gamble.

43.description: Ok seriously.Monday night, 3 guys in front of me, I waited 90 minutes before my hair cut! That's definitely the longest I've ever wait for a hair cut.If you decide to go here, bring a book!

2.description: I have had ok service here usually. But this time was horrible. I went on a Sunday to get my hair straightened. I know, it sounds dumb, don't go to Hair Cuttery to straighten your hair. I had my hair curled on impulse before, and it came out beautiful, so I decided to have my hair straightened here. When I requested my hair to get straightened, I said permanently. They said Keratin? And I said the one that straightened my hair permanently. I repeated it several times. They finally got to straightening my hair, but afterwards, when I got home, my hair was straight, but it smelled burnt. I thought the smell would go away, but it has not. On top of that, when the stylist told me to wash my hair 24 hours after, and I did, my hair is back to the wavy messy form after the wash.     On top of that, the manager, Nina, refused to give me a refund when I walked in the store to talk to a staff member. She told the staff member over the phone that if my hair was not burnt or damaged, I do not get a refund. The service they provided me was not what I requested. I spent $139 on the straightening, only for them to claim that they said they gave me a product that will smooth my frizz. Why would I pay $139 to smooth frizz? My head is now itchy all over and smells weird, one week after the treatment. Never again!!!!!  DON'T COME TO THIS LOCATION!!!

18.description: Took our 21 month old daughter here for her first haircut. Michelle was great!!!! She cut our daughter's hair perfectly and in just 20 minutes. We got our daughter's cut locks and a certificate to keep. We are all very pleased and will be going back.

41.description: Let me preface this by saying I have never gotten my hair cut here, but my husband goes a lot and I cannot stand this place. Every time he comes home it's with lopsided side burns, a too short top, hair pieces all over his neck, and complaining about how rough they were. The employees are completely oblivious and SOOOO slow. The last time we were there we walked out after two of the three employees were taking personal phone calls while five people were waiting for haircuts.  Seriously, spend the extra $ and go somewhere where people care, like Milios.

4.description: We have been going here for a decade, lots of turnover every time there are new stylists. Anyways walked in with kids on a weekday and was told its a 1 hour wait. So went to grab a bite and promptly returned and were asked to continue waiting. Another 40 minutes later fortunately Tiffany called for my daughter and i was anxiously waiting for my sons turn because 2 other stylists were done with their customers and when asked one of them said she is done for the day and the second lady said she is stepping out to get a drink, really?? i was fuming at that point, fortunately Tiffany got done with my daughters haircut and then took care of my sons hair equally fast. Highly disappointed with the customer service!!

6.description: Definitely a loyal customer as long as Kimberly is here. Excellent customer service and great at what she does. It's great to just walk in, already knows how I'd like my hair cut and  know my name. Very personable and amicable ambiance!

22.description: Kisha is five stars out of this world! She took her sweet time on me which I am not used to in such a burn and turn establishment. It was a pleasant surprise. My haircut is amazing and honestly much better than other much more expensive experiences. She helped me pick out the perfect product for my dry scalp and offered me some practical advice. I would definitely recommend requesting her for your cut.

15.description: I give five stars to Valerie who took my long phone call answering my questions, gave me a great color and perfect cut. She is super friendly, outgoing and very easy to work with and talk to.  She did a complicated color process too and was very experienced and pulled a back to back color session with ease. I would ask for her if you are planning on visiting this location.  if you can find the RIGHT stylist who understands what you want and delivers, you've hit the jackpot right? For such a cheap price, I got exactly what I wanted.  Definitely ask for Valerie and give this place a go. My experience was ideal.

20.description: I got a haircut today by Danielle, and she was amazing. She did such a great job-not only is she very personable and easy to talk to, she verbalized what she was doing and painted a great visual picture of how the haircut would go! I haven't been to this hair cuttery ever, it was my first time here, and the service was good. I went in the morning so there wasn't a huge rush and I didn't have to wait long. Good first time here, and i think i'll be back. I am extremely satisfied with the shampoo, cut, blow-dry and "styling" done by danielle!

36.description: I'm not that picky when it comes to hair... but the lady did a horrible job of layering the back of my hair.  the top tier of layers looked god, but then there was a bottom layer that did not blend in well with the top.  I made her redo it and it looked exactly the same, but shorter. so then i just gave up. not going again

14.description: i hate saying this because I really liked the lady that cut my hair, but damn how do you screw up a buzz cut? She was super friendly funny, but i didnt realize how bad my hair looked until after i got out. It was super lumpy..... and im pretty sure my head isnt lumpy. Someone definitely would have told me by now. But i actually had to go home and even things out with my beard trimmer. C'set Le vie.

3.description: On top of workers being rude or careless the woman behind the counter used her fingers(inside of gloves) to spread my tuna across the sandwich instead of using utensils! !! Gross!!!

1.description: The employee here was so rude to me. He chose my cheese and toasted my sandwich without asking. I had to repeat myself several times to get my order correct. If this isn't the only place open, go somewhere else. Not worth the money.

2.description: No Honey Wheat. No 9-grain. No spinach. No Swiss cheese. No place to put trash. Not very well put together, for a Subway franchise. I expect more. That's the point of a chain, even if individually owned. I would walk to another one.

9.description: I got food poisoning there on Friday.  I used to go at least 3 times a week.  I am never. Ever. Going back.

10.description: Don't expect much from Subway besides a good sandwich. But the employees could be friendly. If they don't like working there then they need to find another job.

4.description: This place is the epitome of average. These one star ratings are complete nonsense. Most of the poor reviews commented on the employees. At 9 pm on a Sunday night, I found there to be an average number of words spoken, adequate eye contact, and nothing but reasonably on topic questions. The food tasted a lot like subway.

6.description: Wow - talk about a rushed order. Ended up with a sub in the oven with no cheese. Didn't want it cooked and did want cheese. Felt like a cow in a meat processing plant.

12.description: Have been there three times over the course of a years time. Each time I have been there the bread was stale and the meats funky. That place survives only because of its great location across from Columbia college.Walk a few blocks in either direction and head to either Jimmy Johns or Quizno's

5.description: Within walking distance of the Chicago Hilton. Starbucks didn't have breakfast sandwiches, so headed here for a quick bite. Have done lunch here too. It's what you expect from Subway.

11.description: Ok. It is Subway and it is not fine cuisine but this Subway is the worst Subway I have ever been to in my whole life.  The people who work their can't seem to hear, the meat was slimey, the lettuce was brown and the tomato was green.Yes. It is just Subway but that doesn't mean it has to be disgusting.  I even went here when I thought it wouldn't be that busy and while there was no line there was nothing worth saying about this Subway.  I have bene to Subway stores where the food actually tastes good and the employees half care about your satisfaction.That commercial where the guy says "If my car broken down in front of a Subway, I'd walk 10 blocks to go to Quiznos" is so true about this Subway.

8.description: Dear sweet Jesus.Delicious, soft, buttery chocolate chip cookies that rivals my other favorite, Mrs. Field's. Baking my own or going out of my way buying it at a real bakery? AS IF!Bless You Subway. Haters: PFFT!!!!!!!!!!! ...Whack ass.

0.description: Came here with a large order for my high school students. The workers made my sandwiches without an issue and labeled all of them so my students knew which sandwich belong to who. The manager also threw in some cookies for my students to enjoy. Great place!

7.description: Where did the owner(s) find such angry employees? Is it really too taxing to greet the customer and say anything more than, "Chips and a drink?" at the register?Not a "Hello," "Thank you" or "Goodbye" to be heard.

3.description: This is my first time reviewing the company. The people who run it are nice but this is about their business.I have only been to Glo On Braids twice and unfortunately I won't be returning because they are getting too expensive. Don't get me wrong, they do a good job on the hair but I am not made of money and at some point you have to question what you are really getting for your money. The first time I went the cost for mid back Senegalese twists was $200 in September or October of 2013. The cost for the same hair-do in February 2014 is $250 which is now really out of my price range. I understand that prices have to increase for inflation but a $50 increase is ridiculous. Now I don't have a lot of experience with getting my hair braided/twisted  and so I went with Glo On because they had really good reviews. Everyone seems to have an opinion of what makes a hair braider good and all I knew was that this place had good reviews and they weren't too difficult to get to. Something else that bugged me besides the price was willing to write off is the experience. When you have someone sitting in a chair for up to 6 hours and the client is paying you a lot of money I think it is courteous to offer them refreshments such as water and it also can't hurt to apologize if you are delayed by something.The last time I went I think that my spot was overbooked because at one point there were 3 people at once waiting to have there hair done including myself (though she did have an assistant). At some times I was left sitting waiting for long periods of time because she was working on other people. Shavon started doing my hair at 9:30 but I didn't get out of her office until 6pm. It is in the south loop off of Wabash and Roosevelt Road.I don't have a lot of experience with hair braiders so I thought I had found a winner that I would return to for years to come. That all changed when she increased her prices. I recently found an alternative that I can use next time who can do it for much cheaper for the same result.
