1.description: I had a great experience at Glo On and will be returning to her for braids in the future. Shavon was pleasant and we had friendly conversation. I didn't get my hair washed and tried to blow dry it but I do wish it was blown out more because my hair (which is kinky curly) cam be seen through the braids. I know for next time to get it washed/blown out there.Other than that, I love my braids and the location is SUPER convenient, in the south loop. I'll be back!

2.description: I was happy to be in Shavon's chair again. I love my yarn twists. The atmosphere is peaceful and easy to relax in. Shavon truly works her magic and takes care of your hair.

5.description: My cousin has been natural for almost 10 years but never went to a professional stylist. She was getting married and I insisted that she have her hair done professionally. We went to 3 consultations. Glo On won hands down! They we're very patient during the free consult and used her hair to show samples of different styles they could achieve. Upon leaving they set up a tentative appointment with us in their computer system and said they would follow up to see what we decided. We had a horrible experience at another natural hair salon named Chatoo, which charged us a consultation fee knowing they wouldn't be available for the date we needed the hair done and the simple style we requested was going to cost a ridiculous amount. We hurriedly left and finally confirmed our appointment with Glo On. From that time on they were constantly in communication with us. They confirmed different hairstyles and hair accessories. The appointment they gave us started exactly on time and they finished 2 hours earlier than the initial estimate. But with the speed they did not sacrifice the quality. The hair turned out beautiful!! It was exactly like our vision and the price was so reasonable. Thank you Glo On for a wonderful experience. We will be back!

6.description: I had a great experience today. I moved from CA looking for someone to do loc maintenance with a latch hook for micro-locs and Glo On came to the rescue. The products smelled great, the conversation was friendly, and my hair looks great!

7.description: Customer service SUCKS!!!!! I had a consultation with Shavon and was very excited about getting my hair done...After the consultation, I got no response from her. I called and left a message on her VM then I reached out to her on Facebook - NO RESPONSE. What I found funny is, FB will let you know when a person reads your messages and needless to say she read my message 20 minutes after I reached out to her. I'm very glad that I didn't purchase the hair from her ($200), because I would be stuck in a rut being that she won't return calls. Good luck to anyone needing to get their hair done by her, I guess she's too busy for new clients.

8.description: I have been going to Glo on Braids for about 6 months now and will look no further for anyone else to care for my hair. Shavon is every efficient and works at a speedy rate. She braids very neat and does not pull tight. I have been consistently getting my hair braided for 6 months and still have strong healthy edges. Shavon does a beautiful job and I recommend her for natural hair care and styling services.

0.description: Shavon is my go to natural hair stylist because she is creative and gentle. She's the best around in my opinion.

4.description: "I really enjoyed my visit to Glo On Braids. The environment was relaxing and my finished style looked great. My braids were neatly done but not too tight such as my past experiences with braided styles. I will be a returning customer. Thanks Shavon for a job well done!

58.description: We are big fans of the old Villains and decided to try out the new one the second night they were open. Beer selection was excellent and well-priced. The service was also great.We were surprised at the menu. We knew it would not be the same, but were a bit disappointed. The menu was not yet posted online and we went intending to get burgers. There was only one option on the menu, but it was a good burger--perfectly medium rare. We'll be back, although nowhere near as often as we went to the old Villains. We're hoping that there might eventually be happy hour specials (hint, hint). They were one of the things we loved about the old place.

56.description: Right out the gate I have to say, FANTASTIC! I tried the Pan-Roasted Walleye and it was great! I didn't want the meal to end! It's a comfortable and welcoming environment, thanks to the staff and the atmosphere. Great craft beer selection... I'll be back for sure!

29.description: If you want to have a dining experience and not just another meal to fill your gullet, then you should try Villains. From the outside, the restaurant is appealing already and has quite the appeal. The inside is industrial, sophisticated, evoking simple modern elegance. There is a steampunk light at each table one can control which just adds to the wood table and general ambience. We bought a Groupon for the wine/beer pairing with chef tasting menu. It was one of the best culinary decisions we have ever made to try out a new place! The tasting was more than enough for two average sized people. The waiters were so courteous, informative and just truly added to the wonder of the epicurean adventure. Beers were really awesome and staff was knowledgeable about all aspects of dining. Our first course was a charcuterie board with the most amazing chicken pate ever! Really delicious hams and pickled goodies too. Second course was a corn cake and veggies which wasn't my fave. Too bland. Third course was a seafood hotpot with langoustines and fish and like a fish stew of sorts. Delicious! Third course we picked was the beef tenderloin cooked to perfection. Then a raspberry topped cheesecake for dessert. All courses paired with beers to compliment the dish. Presentation and cleanliness were top notch. Service professionalism absolutely wonderful. Decor minimal: the space was inviting and cozy. Prices reasonable and good portions. Bar scene was very laid back. A great family place or date or just out with friends kinda night.... Villains can and will accommodate. Drink selection very well crafted serving all palates! I even saw a 17% ABV beer! Go and try this place out. You will most definitely come back.

42.description: "there's only one burger on the menu"i'm going to give it to you straight. the villains burger is the best burger i've ever had, and it's not even close.i've had burgers from many places in LA, NYC, Vegas, and the list goes on. This burger has something that can't be described, or matched, by any other burger in the country. it's not just the beef fat mayo (for real? beef fat mayo?!), it's the charred inside of the bun, the smoked red onions, the 4-year cheddar, the B&B pickles...the new villains burger is an experience that you need in your life.

23.description: We had brunch at Villain's and it was delicious. We tried the biscuits and gravy, the trout, the scrapple and the hash and all were extremely tasty dishes. Obviously beer is they're specialty, but the bloody mary's are good as well. Overall, the experience was great....really cool restaurant. We will definitely be back.

47.description: As a SLooper, I've been waiting for years (literally) for Villains to re-open.  Since they opened about a month ago, I've been there 3 times and my experience has gotten better each time.  The beer menu that is second to none - my only critique would be that the menu is very meat-heavy and can be difficult to satisfy a diner who doesn't want a heavy dinner (or a salad).

8.description: Best burger ever!!! Love their beer selection... Need 2 stomachs... Definitely be back!!!

31.description: I walk by here every day between 7 and 8 at night, and oh how sad and desolate it looks from the outside, now that people have gone here and spread the word about this place.I went here twice just to be sure.  The service was lacking both times, a combination of inexperienced wait staff and being ignored too much.  The first time I went they were out of hamburger meat (yeesh), so I settled for their off-menu pork chops that the server suggested to me last after everyone else I was with had already ordered.  So it's not like they were pushing the special or anything. It was ok. Not good, but ok.Second time I went here I got my burger, but only after one of the chefs/cooks came out and advised me that this place is "not just a burger joint" and that I should consider something else on the menu as well.  Hmm... sounds like the people have spoken and you don't like what you're hearing, buddy.  Burger was actually good.  Burger + 1 beer + tip = $30 is absolutely ridiculous.Menu selection is too eccentric for it's own vibe, and the neighborhood.  I'm not a beer drinker so I don't care they only serve beer from one brewer, but my friends who do drink beer seem to take exception to this.  Seriously consider changing/expanding your menu, or you know, keep your nose held high while everyone eats somewhere else. What you're going for now is ok.  Not good, just ok. +1 for interior design.

34.description: This is our go-to spot for any occasion or lack thereof - we can be found at Villain's whenever friends come to town, or simply on a Friday night to go sit up at the bar and split a burger and opine over the extensive beer list.  We were regulars of the old Villain's as well and are so happy that we have the same long beer menu to pore over as with the old.  I love seeing what their rotating seasonal menu brings and trying the new offerings when they become available.

16.description: Every once in a while you stroll by a restaurant that catches your eye and peaks your interest...  This restaurant has perfected one of the most amazing, flavorful, and juicy burgers that Chicago has to offer.  They only have it Monday evenings.   The head chef put his heart and soul into this creation.  I've eaten at hundreds of burger joints and I have to say they've raised the bar quite high with their quality and presentation.  The beer selection is impressive to pair with your dinner.  Overall this place is great to bring a date or have a bunch of friends.  I highly recommend it!

13.description: Pro: great selection of beer. As a stout fan, this place is definitely a must visit place for me. The servers were very attentive and seemed to be knowledgeable about their selection. Con: Food is disappointing for the price. We ordered the burger as entrees. The meat patty is a little bland, which might be better if there's more thought put into the marinating process. Overall,  the burger didn't meet the price tag of $16.

11.description: I haven't had a better burger in Chicago than the one I had here. Amazing! However, it might be the only dinner item that doesn't seem a tad overpriced. I love the ability to do flights of beer since they have so many beer options. The winter list has been pretty stout and saison heavy, so it has been tough for some of my friends to find a pale ale/lighter option although they do offer wine and cocktails as well. I love the wood decor. Since they've opened we haven't had trouble getting a  table here ever. The bar is pretty small so that can be hit or miss if you just want drinks.

39.description: To the people complaining about high prices or a menu they cannot read, go back to Hooters or some other run down bar. While their menu is not extensive, their food is delicious. Prices are higher than average, but was not dissapointes. Service was great, the beer was delicious of course, and the burger and sirloin we had for dinner did nor dissapoint. Will be coming back to try out the apps (and more beer).

37.description: The food is incredible! The burger is one of my favorites in Chicago.The table service, and drink service was very, very slow, during a not-busy Saturday night. Will be a personal 5-star place if the service gets better.

0.description: The new Villains is a 180° from their old space, under new management and reinventing a new chapter. At the bar, it was very comfortable and laid back, with some understated modern decor. It had a similar modern/rustic vibe to the Publican, somewhat upscale, but relaxed. Friendly people at the bar, had some nice conversations.Service at the bar was great, very prompt and friendly, the bartender made a mean cocktail too. Beer selection was very impressive, there were a number of the Mikkeller Spontan series on draft, a number of Prairie drafts, Logsdon, and more. Lots of depth and variety. There was a reserve bottle list with some spendier stuff that I haven't seen elsewhere. The menu was well organized, with prices and sizes listed, and they offered half pours if you just want to test drive a few beers. Just an amazing selection.Overall a great experience, I'd return again soon to try some food, the photos here look good. Best downtown beer bar in my opinion.

38.description: Definitely potential to improve, but off to a good start.Food is decent, not spectacular. Good, fresh, organic ingredients, a distinct southern tinge, and well cooked. Just a tad bland, perhaps, and missing a little bit of the wow factor to make it supremely tasty. With a bit of time, I really do think this will improve.Beer selection is amazing, but it's a bit of a crapshoot. I kinda like that as you're never quite sure what you'll end up with despite the descriptions.Service: this was where I feel Villains needs work. Despite the restaurant being half-full on a midweek evening there seemed like there was just one server. The pace was a little languid and the server didn't really engage us about our food/drink choices which I think needs to happen at a place like this.Still think Villains has room to improve and grow and hoping that it will. It's so different from the old space across the street with its skull lights and dive-bar vibe (which I miss) but good luck to them with their new concept.

51.description: We went to Villains on a whim.  We went to another local restaurant and, after sitting on their patio for over 10 minutes without the waitress acknowledging us, we decided to try another place.  Villains is on each of our ways to/from work and we'd been wanting to try it, so we popped in around 8:15 on Wednesday.Aesthetically, the place is great.  A very cool mix of industrial and rustic.  A good mix of trendy, upscale, and a bit divey.  Between the exposed-filament bulbs, the giant wall of beers, and the knives that look like switchblades, it's clear that the owners put some effort into every detail.  We were greeted quickly with some waters and started looking at the menu.  Neither my girlfriend nor I think of ourselves as foodies or craft beer people.  Looking at the menu, we were both a little unsure if we still wanted to eat there.  Our waiter, Pascal, greeted us very shortly after that and we decided to give us a shot.  We weren't feeling too adventurous, so we both ordered a burger.  In my mind, burgers are deceptively simple and it's surprisingly difficult to make a truly good burger.  I also got a dry cider to go with it.We were both glad to see that the attention to detail extended to the food.  The burger was a true medium rare, and clearly made of high quality beef.  The bun was perfectly toasted.  I won't keep going on with each ingredient, but it was a damn good burger.  We were both impressed and will be back.  The prices aren't cheap by any measure, but it became clear that Villains is serving high quality food.My one major complaint: the angles of the chairs are absurdly upright...like something you'd expect from an etiquette school where they want you to sit at 90* and balance a book on your head.  Looking around, not a single person was sitting back in their chair - everyone was leaning forward to keep their back off the chair.Overall, the chairs suck but the food, drinks, and service are awesome.I'd love to see a broader menu though, for us non-foodies.

27.description: We lived in the building and we were excited for the place to open! They had brown paper up in the windows for a long time and we thought it would never open.The space is aesthetically pleasing to the eye. We stopped in on opening night and my wife had a couple of beers and we both had the burger. Great beer selection. We chose the burger as the food menu is VERY limited and the price to portion ratio seemed a little off from the other plates we saw leave the kitchen. The burger was nothing special and the ambiance matched the fare.We never went back for a second chance as there are so many solid places for a good bite in the south loop. It's a shame as the place and location have great potential...

32.description: The burger here is amazing, let's just get that out of the way first. To be perfectly honest, I throw it in the DMK-Au Cheval-Kuma's-Bad Apple mix of top burgers in Chicago. Also appealing is the extensive list of relatively hard to find beers on draft (Ballast Point tap takeover currently, Mikkeler, etc.). What lacks, as other reviewers have pointed out, right now are service and price point. The service was really poor, taking 10-20+ minutes between check-ins (I'll conservatively say the joint was 2/3s full when we ate), which resulted in empty glasses and quite some time to actually place our food orders. That will improve with time. The price point, is kind of a head-scratcher though, which are all probably $3-4 too high (burger, maybe more like $2) from what I was looking at on the menu and comparing against plates at other tables - but I can't speak to the quality of those dishes. Decor was cool, ambiance was good, and will say it was a bit noisy, but otherwise really liked this joint. Pretty close to the EL as well, so that's pleasantly convenient. Will be back for that burger, most definitely!

54.description: This place is a gem a true Gastro Pub. No joke beer selection obviously chosen by people in the know and not some slick beverage manager jocking the local Trend. the menu is a simple list of quality product in season not a glutton of comodity beef and low quality cheddar cheese. this place is awesome and will only mature and get better with time 5 stars all the way!!

48.description: Wonderful.  Try it!  You won't regret it!

44.description: The food and the wine were so-so and definitely overpriced. We requested mayo on the side, and they brought a (not requested) beef fat mayo, which we didn't like and had to pay extra for. I would not recommend this place.

24.description: Damn...where do I start?The selection of beers is outstanding!!! They have a HUGE assortment of craft beers with good description of each.  Even better the bartender Nic was excellent, had an understanding for the flavors of beer and selected some based on my liking.  Very attentive and just seemed like a nice guy.Now the menu....Extensive list of apps and main entrees, even lots of vegetarian options.  I tried the burger for $18, and it was worth every penny.  The components are divine, and the combination of the bread, mayo, and the meat itself......oh my good.  This burger had a unique crisp along the outside and was perfectly cooked medium on the inside.  It was like nothing I had ever had before....truly remarkable...the crispy outside of the meat, drenched in 4yr aged cheddar cheese, topped with a melt in your mouth bun...(potato maybe) Damn my mouth is watering talking about it.....The fries that came with it were good too, large steak fries with mild seasoning.  Sorry the burger was so good, the fries were just a side, literally.  Overall, this place is on one of my top burger joints ever.  The excellently prepared burger in combination with craft beers and knowledge friendly service....this is a must eat if you are in the downtown Chicago area.

7.description: Damn...where do I start?The selection of beers is outstanding!!! They have a HUGE assortment of craft beers with good description of each.  Even better the bartender Nic was excellent, had an understanding for the flavors of beer and selected some based on my liking.  Very attentive and just seemed like a nice guy.Now the menu....Extensive list of apps and main entrees, even lots of vegetarian options.  I tried the burger for $18, and it was worth every penny.  The components are divine, and the combination of the bread, mayo, and the meat itself......oh my good.  This burger had a unique crisp along the outside and was perfectly cooked medium on the inside.  It was like nothing I had ever had before....truly remarkable...the crispy outside of the meat, drenched in 4yr aged cheddar cheese, topped with a melt in your mouth bun...(potato maybe) Damn my mouth is watering talking about it.....The fries that came with it were good too, large steak fries with mild seasoning.  Sorry the burger was so good, the fries were just a side, literally.  Overall, this place is on one of my top burger joints ever.  The excellently prepared burger in combination with craft beers and knowledge friendly service....this is a must eat if you are in the downtown Chicago area.

49.description: I'm not sure where to really go with this review and it's taken me a few weeks to think about how I wanted to write it. I purposely waited a bit after my experience cause I was so disappointed. As a long time Printers Row/South Loop resident, I admittedly had high expectations for Villains. Not in the sense that I wanted a new place to go, but in the sense that this section of Clark is going through a rebirth. Places like First Draft, the new condos, and now Villains will hopefully bring this section of Printers Row up to the standard that exists two streets over on Dearborn. I'd comment on Blackies as a contributor, but that's just hopeless. I was a bit disappointed in my first visit. First, the menu is highly complicated for the customers in this neighborhood. I get that they are trying to be "organic," "local," "authentic midwestern," etc, but come on, when the cheese plate and the burger are the only things recognizable on the menu, there is a problem.  My wife order the cheese plate since she wasn't feeling the burger but nobody seemed to really know what the cheeses were. Their response was "this is an international one." The Fromage Gods are shuttering! While my burger was good, it wasn't great considering the price point. Yeah yeah, I get that it that the burgers are hand made, but I'm not paying that much for bacon cheese burger. I will say the beer menu was extensive, although somewhat unrecognizable. Across the street at First Draft you find 60+ taps of names you know and love. The same thing is true for Bar Louie, Kaseys, Hackneys, and even Flacos. At Villains, it's a crap shoot. You order one and hopefully it meets your expectations. However, again, like the burger, the prices were high. Well, according to the management, not high enough since they crossed out the old prices and hand wrote in higher ones in pen (note my photo of the beer menu with the magically changed prices).   The service was spotty at best, which is shocking since they don't really seem busy. I get that they just opened, but when the staff gloats that they "worked at the old Villains" and have a "fantastic chef" there is a certain expectation of competency that they failed to exhibit. Don't hype yourself up until you're ready! This is a tough f&b town and many of us despise arrogance in our dining and drinking experience. Take the humble road and you'll be successful. Finally, I wish Villains good luck. With some minor changes, they could be a wonderful addition to Clark St and Printers Row as a whole.

40.description: If you like beer come here and ask Cecil the bartender what you should have.  He is the pro at matching Villain's vast selection of beers to your particular tastes. He can also recommend some great appetizers -- the pork belly was AMAZING!  Good thing I live on LA or I'd be here too often.  Cecil and the team were great; the chef even brought our our food and explained all those foodies things.

53.description: Villains! What took you so long to rejoin Printer's Row. I loved it before and it's possibly even better now. Bartenders super friendly, amazing beer list, and great atmosphere! Burger was good. Dry aged beef and wonderful smokey flavor to the onions. Not to mention you can't go wrong with aged cheddar..Will definitely be back, especially to see what's new on draft.

30.description: I was looking forward to this place opening up for well over a year.  I have now gone to it a few times, and it's a complete and utter disappointment. The service is bad and the atmosphere is Blah at best.  I walk by it every single day and it is almost always completely dead (with the exception of the same 5-10 dudes that are always in there sitting at the front bar).  The actual booths for where the diners are supposed to sit is always vacant.  Did I mention this spot is also completely uninviting and dark?  Villains only has 1 TV in the bar which is rarely ever on - which seems odd for a bar. With the new Sociale Bar opening up (which seems to already be a hit as it was packed on a Thursday and it's not even officially open until the following Monday, Sept. 28th).  That place has the doors/windows open and seems to have a lively atmosphere from what I can tell.  First Draft down the street is also a complete hit and has an excellent wait staff, great selection of beers and amazing chicken wings.My guess is that this place will be around for the next 6-12 months at best.  I had very high expectations for the re-open of this one...but it's a complete failure.  I am now looking forward to the next bar that will be there...

46.description: Best meal of 2015, with Selden Standard in Detroit a close 2nd.I am officially a member of the Villains Clean Plate Club.  I do not want to go into too much detail about how good our meal was because if someone else eats all of the cheesecake I.will.lose.my.shit.Our meal was so good, I finally admit to being ignorant to what Medium-Rare means.  My sirloin was cooked medium on the outer 4 cm of the sirloin, and rare on the inside 4cm.  Medium rare is not "pink on the inside".  Our tab was $107.  We ordered 3 glasses red wine, 2 appetizers, 2 main courses, 1 dessert.  I feel that is an extremely fair price for the food we were served.  I cannot wait to come back and drink beer and try more of the menu.One request of the owners, please stock some bottles of Einstock beer from Iceland. xoxoxoxZach

1.description: Beer and food menu have changed since I was here last and I got food this time:Under "Bites:"Roasted almonds - could have been store bought. Nothing special.Pig ears - very thinly sliced, nicely seasoned, went well with the lemon aioliCharcuterie: serrano ham and salumi were good but chicken liver parfait and country pate had an unpleasant funk to them that I have not encountered in other force-meat preparations.Kennebec fries were less fluffy on the inside than last time. Coworkers still seemed very happy with the burger.Had high hopes for the buttermilk pie, but it was served cold with warm but undercooked apple slices. Although the pie itself was pretty good, the filling was overly sweet instead of tangy and gooey and the slice should have been served heated for maximum luxurious effect. The apple slices felt like an after-thought; a tart apple compote or chutney would have been prettier and a better counterbalance to the sweetness of the pie.But I think the make-your-own beer flight option is new and awesome. Right now Villains has a whole bunch of fruity and sour options to be on trend. I got the Baird Shuzenji Heritage Helles (excellent, complex, but easy drinking), Rosee d'Hibiscus (watery body but tangy bright flavor and beautiful color), EOS Hefeweizen (like a paler Hoegaarden), and the Mills & Hills Russian Imperial Stout (roasty, malty, medium-bodied, great) to go with dessert. Some colleagues got mixed drinks and were not impressed with the Villains Punch, the Old Fashioned, or the Fortunate Son - common complaint was too sweet or one-note.It was also hard to get service after food was served despite the place only being half full. Still a decent choice for after-work beers, but spend your money on the great beer list and save the rest for food elsewhere.

55.description: They just opened so hopefully they will pull it together.  My reference point for the visit was the old Villains and Three Aces a wonderful craft food and beer mecca that strikes the right balance nearby in Little Italy.The space is beautiful and worth a visit for the aesthetics alone.  The handwritten beer list is an awesome sight even if illegible. Unfortunately most of the rest of the experience feels like a novelty act - a peculiar beer menu dominated by selections from a couple of Danish Brewery's that make American style craft beers that you can get from dozens of great local breweries - Revolution, Ale Syndicate, Metropolitan, Bell's, etc. Another former Villains regular theorizes that they are in a hassle with the local distributor.  Pretty standard stuff for Chicago. I didn't dip into the food on this visit but it is limited and expensive - a solo burger sits in the accessible slot for those wanting to give Villains a try.  All in all it feels like after the long wait that the new Villains is trying way to hard to stand out in Chicago's increasingly crowded craft beer and food scene.  I will be back for the burger and another crack at the beer list but my regular stops in the area will continue to be at Three Aces, First Draft and the recently opened Burger Bar.

9.description: What a disappointment!  I had been looking forward to coming here since it opened, but when I came for drinks on a Friday night, the service was abysmal.  We sat in the dining room, and perhaps our waiter was disappointed that we weren't ordering food?  (There were plenty of open tables though).  In any event, it took 15-20 minutes to get our beers after we ordered them.  The waiter apologized, but this seemed to be insincere, as we later waited another 15 minutes for him to come and take our card.  When he did not do so, we decided to leave cash and head out.  This place has great ambiance, a solid beer list, and some serious potential, but I hope they can remedy these service challenges!

26.description: Meh. Limited menu options. Inattentive service. Overpriced. Many interesting beers on draft, if that's your thing.

25.description: We went to Villains for the brunch on Sunday,the atmoshphere is really nice,but the brunch menu was not that tasty,I ordered a french toast,it was very dry and felt like eating an old piece of bread,my husband had a skillet and it was just ok,the taste was very plain.Bloody Marys on another side were good.We will try to come back to check out the food for dinner,because I do believe in second chances,will see

12.description: The burger here is amazing, let's just get that out of the way first. To be perfectly honest, I throw it in the DMK-Au Cheval-Kuma's-Bad Apple mix of top burgers in Chicago. Also appealing is the extensive list of relatively hard to find beers on draft (Ballast Point tap takeover currently, Mikkeler, etc.). What lacks, as other reviewers have pointed out, right now are service and price point. The service was really poor, taking 10-20+ minutes between check-ins (I'll conservatively say the joint was 2/3s full when we ate), which resulted in empty glasses and quite some time to actually place our food orders. That will improve with time. The price point, is kind of a head-scratcher though, which are all probably $3-4 too high (burger, maybe more like $2) from what I was looking at on the menu and comparing against plates at other tables - but I can't speak to the quality of those dishes. Decor was cool, ambiance was good, and will say it was a bit noisy, but otherwise really liked this joint. Pretty close to the EL as well, so that's pleasantly convenient. Will be back for that burger, most definitely!

59.description: Love the new place - the feel of the place is great - warm but industrial.  Good selection of beer and wine.  I would definitely come back to drink.  However, the menu is bad.  I'm a semi-adventurous eater and there was nothing other than a burger (which I don't generally order) that I could order.  The selections are too obscure - they really need to add some options that people have actually heard of before.  Change the menu and I'll try again for dinner.

21.description: I love this place because sometimes you don't want regular bar food, so if that's you.....you should check this place out. The selection of beer is amazing and the food is absolutely delicious. I admit if you just want wings, sliders or skins this is probably not your spot. If you want to up your taste buds then this is a great place with great service!!

17.description: Walking in I had high expectations for this reborn south loop restaurant.  I was a little more than worried that my fantastic Monday night memories of delicious burgers and beer would be ruined.  I was definitely wrong.Here's the pro... the burger was freaking awesome.  One of the best tasting burgers in the city.  The bacon & onion gave the burger an incredible unique smokey flavor that I haven't had before.  To top that, the aged cheddar was a great compliment to the rest of the burger.  I would definitely order it again.That being said... the burger and fries was $16. I walked away spending $42 on burger and fries for my wife and I.  Seems like a little much for 2 burgers.  The fries were nothing special and my wife's burger was a little under-cooked for her medium-well order.

10.description: Pros: Really enjoyed our evening at Villains! Sat at the bar with my husband on a Saturday around 9pm. We each ordered several beers and a sampler. Great selection of diverse brews we've never had before. We also had the scallop appetizer and 30-day dry aged sirloin; both were delicious. Cons: Food was a little pricey but we attributed that to the fact that it's Chicago. Chairs at the bar are incredibly uncomfortable.Overall - We'd visit again!

5.description: The selection of beers here is exceptional.  Last night, I tried several options with a flight.  All were delicious.  I started with the Bomb and moved on to try other drinks including the Pumpkin Lager and Shipwreck Porter.  Of note, the Big Worster is a fun choice, as it has 17.3% alcohol content.  It's one of my husband's favorites.  The food here is delicious but the serving sizes are generally small in my past experiences here, especially for the appetizers.  The ambience and service are great.  We will likely be coming back, and we recommend it.

3.description: Went to Villains for the first time 1/23/16.  We stopped in before a show at Chicago Theater for dinner and beer or two.  I read the reviews and saw some mixed opinions, decided the beer list was worth it so we went.  So here's my take on Villains using lists of things I liked versus disliked. What I liked:1.  Great selection of Imperial Stouts2.  Service was awesome3.  Atmosphere and decor4.  Food was good overallWhat I didn't like:1.  While the Imperial Stout selection in numbers was impressive, I felt like there was a big drop off in quality from the good ones to the rest.  I did a flight of just Imperial Stout.  They do have a couple outstanding Stouts just the same.2.  Music was what you'd find in a trendy restaurant, not exactly my taste.3.  Food was just good not great.  Overall, I'd say my experience here was average.  The burger is good and not great, and the fries on the side are the same.  Beer list is good overall but I felt the quality was lacking in the middle tier of quality.  Would I go back?  Yes I'd probably return, but I would not seek it out again for dinner.

35.description: Walking in I had high expectations for this reborn south loop restaurant.  I was a little more than worried that my fantastic Monday night memories of delicious burgers and beer would be ruined.  I was definitely wrong.Here's the pro... the burger was freaking awesome.  One of the best tasting burgers in the city.  The bacon & onion gave the burger an incredible unique smokey flavor that I haven't had before.  To top that, the aged cheddar was a great compliment to the rest of the burger.  I would definitely order it again.That being said... the burger and fries was $16. I walked away spending $42 on burger and fries for my wife and I.  Seems like a little much for 2 burgers.  The fries were nothing special and my wife's burger was a little under-cooked for her medium-well order.

19.description: The atmosphere is nice but the food was horrible and service was slow at best. We had a large group but it took nearly an hour and half to get food. I ordered trout which was extremely salty. I sent it back and ordered a medium burger which turned out to be extremely over cooked and flavorless.

28.description: I just left Villians and all I can say is WOW. The service was attentive but not overbearing.  The space and music were top notch. The food was quality, well prepared and delicious.  Don't miss the chicken, burger, cheese plate and cheesecake.  Amazing.  What a great addition to the South Loop. We had the great fortune to meet  the owner Marco.  He is committed to the neighborhood and providing a quality social and dining experience to its residents and visitors. Can't wait to go to enjoy Fried Chicken Monday's.  While their beer menu is amazing you won't be disappointed if you want a glass of wine or a cocktail.   There is something for everyone.  Take my word, you must go to Villians.

45.description: I like many others, have been waiting for Villains to open for a couple years now!  I think this is why our expectations were high.   Pros:Really great beer list.  I enjoy that Villains has new beers to offer from Denmark, etc.  There are plenty of restaurants in the area with local beers, so this is a nice change in my opinion. Service was fantastic.  The server had extensive knowledge of every beer and every dish.  Cons: The food did not meet our expectations, especially for the price.  The pork belly was our favorite with a lot of flavor.  The walleye was okay but too salty and the sirloin was nothing special.  I think Villains could be a great place and I will absolutely try it again as I think it has the potential to be a solid addition to the neighborhood! Good place just not my favorite YET!

33.description: I have been to Villains five or six times, and have always enjoyed the food and drink.  I stopped in Sunday to try the brunch, and they still had a lot of beers from the Ballast Point event.  The oyster sandwich was excellent - the oysters were fried but still tasted like seafood and were topped soft eggs, spicy salsa and radish garnish.  I have had the vegetarian dish, fish dish, burger, charcuterie... the menu changes regularly. Everything tastes really good and the portions are the right size.  The beer selection is atypical, and they have had a lot of Scandinavian breweries.

43.description: If you're looking for shitty bar food, or poorly executed gastropub eats, you won't find it here.Many of the complaints below are that the food is too obscure. Spring peas, turnips, argula, roasted chickens, steaks, and pork belly isn't 'obscure' last I heard. Actually, the cats here are making local, organic, seasonal food as approachable as possible. With a cool environment with a hint of edge and a beer in hand, why not go for the walleye? If that's not up your alley, maybe some fries and the cheese plate. I'm sure you've heard of those.

2.description: This is a solid place.  Not the best in the area, but for sure not the worst.  Went here and was almost overwhelmed by the beer selection.  It isn't huge by any stretch, it is just for such a small place in the Loop, it was unexpected.  This place has a huge stout collection, so if you are a fan or darker, richer, and more flavorful beers, you'll be in heaven here.  Atmosphere isn't bad.  Very, VERY dimly lit, more light comes from outside than there is light inside.  Staff are friendly but not overall attentive and overbearing.  If you ask for advice or questions they will answer, but they aren't overly friendly and helpful.  That kind of if you know great, if you don't know what you want, we will give it a shot, but not go out of our way.

18.description: So... Huge fan of "old Villains" and now I am huge fan of "new Villains."  Initially, I was under the impression that they would only serve Mikkeller Beer.  Yes it is great but it comes from afar and there are so many great local options.  My concerns where eliminated upon my second visit when I found all my favorites on tap. My wife and I tried the scallops which was a great choice.  Perfectly cooked and the perfect temp (scallops can be tricky).  Looking forward to going back for the burger that everyone is raving about.  One suggestion... They should have a "old villains" week.  Bring back the tots and the Motherload Burger if only for a limited time only.

41.description: So... Huge fan of "old Villains" and now I am huge fan of "new Villains."  Initially, I was under the impression that they would only serve Mikkeller Beer.  Yes it is great but it comes from afar and there are so many great local options.  My concerns where eliminated upon my second visit when I found all my favorites on tap. My wife and I tried the scallops which was a great choice.  Perfectly cooked and the perfect temp (scallops can be tricky).  Looking forward to going back for the burger that everyone is raving about.  One suggestion... They should have a "old villains" week.  Bring back the tots and the Motherload Burger if only for a limited time only.

52.description: I had a sub par burger with overcooked bacon that I didn't ask for and a lukewarm beer and the check came to over $25.  This restaurant has serious delusions of grandeur, it's not Everest, it is a bar on the first floor of a parking garage between a convenience store and a gym.  I was turned away on opening night even though there were several tables available.  Do yourself a favor and go to First Draft right across the street.  They have a huge menu, the servers are actually friendly and I just had a delicious goat cheese burger and beer there for $12.

50.description: Would not recommend and will not be going back anytime soon. Way overpriced for what you get. I ordered a glass of wine and there was hardly any wine in the glass...while the wine tasted good I would have enjoyed a full glass of it. Had to send my steak back after undercooking...just overall a bad experience.

4.description: I'm not sure where to really go with this review and it's taken me a few weeks to think about how I wanted to write it. I purposely waited a bit after my experience cause I was so disappointed. As a long time Printers Row/South Loop resident, I admittedly had high expectations for Villains. Not in the sense that I wanted a new place to go, but in the sense that this section of Clark is going through a rebirth. Places like First Draft, the new condos, and now Villains will hopefully bring this section of Printers Row up to the standard that exists two streets over on Dearborn. I'd comment on Blackies as a contributor, but that's just hopeless. I was a bit disappointed in my first visit. First, the menu is highly complicated for the customers in this neighborhood. I get that they are trying to be "organic," "local," "authentic midwestern," etc, but come on, when the cheese plate and the burger are the only things recognizable on the menu, there is a problem.  My wife order the cheese plate since she wasn't feeling the burger but nobody seemed to really know what the cheeses were. Their response was "this is an international one." The Fromage Gods are shuttering! While my burger was good, it wasn't great considering the price point. Yeah yeah, I get that it that the burgers are hand made, but I'm not paying that much for bacon cheese burger. I will say the beer menu was extensive, although somewhat unrecognizable. Across the street at First Draft you find 60+ taps of names you know and love. The same thing is true for Bar Louie, Kaseys, Hackneys, and even Flacos. At Villains, it's a crap shoot. You order one and hopefully it meets your expectations. However, again, like the burger, the prices were high. Well, according to the management, not high enough since they crossed out the old prices and hand wrote in higher ones in pen (note my photo of the beer menu with the magically changed prices).   The service was spotty at best, which is shocking since they don't really seem busy. I get that they just opened, but when the staff gloats that they "worked at the old Villains" and have a "fantastic chef" there is a certain expectation of competency that they failed to exhibit. Don't hype yourself up until you're ready! This is a tough f&b town and many of us despise arrogance in our dining and drinking experience. Take the humble road and you'll be successful. Finally, I wish Villains good luck. With some minor changes, they could be a wonderful addition to Clark St and Printers Row as a whole.

6.description: I'm always excited to see a new bar/restaurant open in the south loop, and Villains was no exception. It's conveniently located near the Harrison redline station, so getting there is easy. Once you're there, the ambiance is warm and sultry, and the service is friendly and prompt. They've got a great a drink  menu including  my fall favorite Pumking. The food menu is full of locally grown/raised food, and features a list of their partner farms, which I love. The main problem were the prices and the variety. I think they could use a few more reasonably priced items: throw some Pom frites on there - everybody eats them and all the farms have potatoes. I get it, there's a fancy demographic moving to the area, but until the area develops more, I think the menu could be a bit more accessible. It's not outrageous, just slightly overpriced I. My personal opinion. And I couldn't bring myself to order a $16 burger with Blackies across the street. I'll be back again for a cocktail with friends for sure.

22.description: Our expectations were high.  Villians didn't come close to meeting them.  In the new location they've ventured away from standard pub fare, which was a mistake.  They're having trouble measuring up on everything else.The new space is dark, cold, barely decorated, noise, no ambiance.

15.description: Our expectations were high.  Villians didn't come close to meeting them.  In the new location they've ventured away from standard pub fare, which was a mistake.  They're having trouble measuring up on everything else.The new space is dark, cold, barely decorated, noise, no ambiance.

57.description: Living close by, my husband and I have been awaiting the opening of Villains for quite some time. That being said, they exceeded our expectations! You won't find these beers anywhere else, and the burger was out of this world! Definitely a must try, and a great Printer's Row addition!

20.description: The selection of beers here is exceptional.  Last night, I tried several options with a flight.  All were delicious.  I started with the Bomb and moved on to try other drinks including the Pumpkin Lager and Shipwreck Porter.  Of note, the Big Worster is a fun choice, as it has 17.3% alcohol content.  It's one of my husband's favorites.  The food here is delicious but the serving sizes are generally small in my past experiences here, especially for the appetizers.  The ambience and service are great.  We will likely be coming back, and we recommend it.

36.description: My friend had trouble finding the restaurant and called for directions, the person answering the phone couldn't give him directions and told him to walk in the wrong direction. It was comical to me at least. We ordered a fried cheese ball thing for starters which was good but fried everything is good. We ordered the socca cake which was just ok. My friend ordered the porkchop which was mostly grizzle. Everything we ordered had peas on it. I assumed a Green Giant truck must have overturned near the restaurant and they really cashed it. The waiter also mentioned that the greens were suffocated and it made my eyes roll. I hope those greens didn't suffer much. I remember leaving hungry and thinking we spent too much money. For the small menu, they should do those dishes really well but it's not worth it at that price. So many places in Chicago have a great beer menu and great food. Go to one of those places.

14.description: Came here with the gf for a date night and we had a great dining experience. We got:- Farmers cheese gnudi - pronounced "nudie" - light, flavorful and not too filling.  - The 2013 & 2014 "draft beer". They had a massive list of beers from two beer companies from Denmark- "mikkeler" and "mad beer".- Pan-roasted bone-in skate wing - 1/2 of us would try this again - Grilled slagel farms beef burger - 8.5/10We will be back again for the rest of the menu

58.description: Great brunch! The chilaquiles was delicious and loads of drink options. Highly recommend!

56.description: Best brunch in the city. Food is always great and the portions are huge. Extensive menu. Great atmosphere and friendly wait staff.

29.description: I've been to the Lincoln Park location for brunch, and wanted to give this one a shot too. Here's what you can expect: can't be seated without your whole party there (pretty standard around Chicago); breakfast served all day!; large portions at a fair price; a good but not spectacular tasting omelet (I got the 3x frittata); and decent service. It may have been unique to the day, but the upstairs seating at this location was extraordinarily warm. Loved the decor up there though. Way different vibe than the Lincoln Park location.

42.description: Any place that has Maker's Mark, apple pie, and a great deli gets 5 stars. We ate breakfast. Waffle with bananas/pecans My husband ordered corned beef hash/eggs served with American fries and delicious hot ketchup. There were many choices for breakfast which is served all day. It is a quaint place with upbeat music. Service was great. Prices were reasonable.it will be our go-to place when we return to Chicago.

23.description: I have lived in the south loop for a year and a half and this is by far one of my favorite places to eat for lunch, dinner or breakfast.  We were chatting with our waiter and it came up that me and my husband got married a month ago.  We were surprised with an order of French toast with fruit and coconut on the house!!!  I highly recommend Eleven City!

47.description: Eleven City is one of my favorite restaurants!Every time I go to Chicago (a handful of times a year), I go to Eleven City Diner. Usually multiple times in a weekend. Decor is great and I love a good diner. The food is excellent, but then I always order things I expect them to make well (being a Jewish diner): challah French toast, corned beef, knish, salami sandwiches, kreplach, and their to-die-for Bubbie's matzoh ball soup. No one makes food like Eleven City Diner. Did I mention the soup?We always expect to wait for a table when we go on weekends, and to eat way too much food because we know we'll have to wait until the next trip to eat like that again. But it's totally worth it. And yes, they have a weekend policy of not letting you put in your name for a table until your whole party is there. And they won't seat you if you're not all there. Knowing that's the deal beforehand is half the battle. Just order a drink while you wait and for heaven's sake, don't block the door.

8.description: came here for dinner around 7pm on a Thurs.  Somewhat surprised to see a healthy crowd still for a diner.  Server was super friendly and good with kids.  Great suggestions and has passion for the food.  A real highlight of the night as well, as she knew the food, how its prepared.   Great to chitter chatter with.   All meats are done in house, and after trying the corned beef/pastrami #24 sandwich, I would say its worthy of a repeat trip.   I used to love in the neighborhood and always shunned this place from the earlier yelps, but I was ready to dance and since with my first bite.  The highlight is the chopped liver spread.  Matzo ball soup was very homey, comforting, almost nostalgic (ideal for a cold winter night).  -though my first ever (a bit salty for my own taste) but it was good!  Also had some fries with made freshly made Wisconsin sauce.  In all of Chicago, I have found my default deli!  Now I just need to figure out how to move back to the SoLo.

31.description: Sat at the counter and service was fair. Hash was dry & overcooked. $3.50 for coffee!

34.description: Really good food, lively atmosphere, 50's style diner, friendly wait staff, prompt service, conveniently located...eat here!

16.description: Came back because I loved the food and was hoping for better service and boy, did I get it! To start, my friend and I arrived around 11:30 on a Sunday morning. Originally it was just going to be the 2 of us but as soon as we arrived another friend let us know he was on the way. So we put down our names for 3 and waited outside. After about 30 minutes my name was called. Unfortunately my friend was about 15 minutes away. So I let the host know this and he said he'll seat us once he arrives (this is a policy they have for weekends). So we sit back down and wait. 14 minutes later he calls my name, looks at me through the doorway and makes a face of inquiry. I shake my head no and he made a sighing face. Then, my friend arrives. I rush in and he was like, "Geez, Ana. Couldn't he have arrived a moment sooner." I laughed and he quickly found us a seat.We sit and order really quickly. Vodka lemonades, a Caesar salad, pancakes, and chilaquiles make it to our table. The chilaquiles are amazing and I definitely recommend them. So much flavor and so many vegetables. It's a great way to start the morning. I tried just a few bites of the pancakes and I know I'll have to go back for more. Dense and flavorful and buttery. Delicious.When we finally went to leave, the host actually said goodbye to me by name. I just loved that he remembered me. Granted, my situation was a bit memorable for the morning but still. Definitely will be back and both of my friends are planning their next trips as well!

13.description: I dig the vibe. The owners certainly went whole hog with the "accessible Jewish diner" vibe and I'm into it. The servers and hosts have always been friendly and admirably tolerant of the post-game Bears crowds who are pretty amusing to watch at 3 or 4 in the afternoon following another devastating loss with what is probably just more drinking. They're pick up counter is super fast and easy for takeout and have the all-day breakfast, which, personally I love. The matzah ball soup, I'm told is great, but I'm not much a connoisseur of soups. A couple things I've ordered in the past were a little bland and flavorless (open faced turkey sandwich for example), but for the most part the servings are more than generous, slightly over priced (my opinion) but not overly disappointing. I'd hoped they'd remind me of my hometown hero "Zingerman's" if you're a 'Gander and familiar with their selection, but I don't think I've found a place to compare that to in Chicago yet. If you're looking for a place in the South Loop that, at best will have decent food options and it's not a game day at Soldier (be prepared to wait, if so) it's a good option that's consistent and middle of the road. The service is pretty on point, and being seated in front of their line is real fun people-watching.  I had coffee at brunchtime once and was a little appalled at how bad it was, but the omelet I ate was not bad. Not sure what happened that time, but the milkshakes and malts are swell. I haven't sat at the bar or ordered drinks from here so I don't know much about quality there. I'm told there's upstairs seating too.

11.description: Matsoball soup is authentic and fantastic taste. The biggest matsoball I ever ate . Cabbage soup is a good appetizer but... It's anything but real cabbage soup. Those who know and love Russian food will be disappointed by this cabbage soup, those who don't know will be misled. Brisket was great, very tender and juicy, a little but plain in taste. Telapia plate was great as well. Overall, very good place, I'd come back....And next night I did come back! Barley beef soup was simple yet perfectly done. Potato latke with lox was also simple and good tasting. Service was friendly and prompt. I do have one complaint though. The place positions itself as Jewish-themed, with Jewish stylized writings on the walls and menu items. Guys, for G-d sake decide your place and remove pork from the menu.

39.description: This is the first and last time I will ever come to this establishment. As I had a craving for a Reuben sandwich my first thought was to go to Manny's deli which I should have followed my first mind but eleven City Diner was a little closer. Why did.I not go to mannys like I said I would,? I ordered a sandwich with extra cheese and it cost me over $17, okay I didn't have any problem with that I don't mind paying for good food. Like I said I don't mind paying for good food. Wasjust a little more than average. The staff was very rude and told me that I had to stand at a certain spot as I was watching the guy make my sandwich. I started to ask for my money back because I didn't appreciate the tone or demeanor of the butt hole that asked me to stand in another place but I did as I should. The food was just okay definitely not worth $17 I took one bite of my sandwich and gave it to the homeless guy on the corner. I hope it made his day? As I said I will never eat at this place again nor will I recommend it to anyone but I will express my sentiments that of being displeased with many people as I can as I started to like I'm doing right now. I have a hard time giving this diner with even one star because I was so just displease and I had a corned beef Reuben sandwich on my mind since last night I know how I was so disappointed. I hope the owners in the management of this establishment reads your Yelp reports because they can learn a lot from it all I can say is hell no I won't go I won't ever go back to 11 City Diner.

37.description: I came here for my birthday with a group of girls.  I called ahead to make sure we could all be seated together.  They told me on the phone they don't take reservations but it shouldn't be a problem.  It was 3pm on a Wednesday so it wasn't really a rush hour.  When I arrived the hostess gave me a lot of attitude about seating a group of 7 together.  She said she would see what she could do but ultimately came back and said we had to be separated. When we walked in there were two tables right next to each other that she didn't put us at! I ended up having to ask for the manager who moved us to a table together.  It really should t have been a problem, but she was just really rude.  After that fiasco was over we had a pleasant time with a lover waiter and the food was really good.  I am willing to try it again but bad staff really puts a damper on a special occasion.

0.description: Eleven City Diner is an awesome, old school Jewish deli down in South Loop serving up some mean breakfast food all day long. They have a Lincoln Park location too but it just doesn't have the atmosphere and authenticity the South Loop original does.My friend and I started by sharing a Root beer float with the Blonde ale, which is their lighter root beer. It was so delicious (and massive) that we were half way through it before I remembered I had given up sweets for lent... Shit. It doesn't count if the ice cream is in root beer does it??For food I ordered the Black and White french toast. 3 huge slices of bread covered in a dark & white chocolate mix. Really sweet but SO delicious. I've made the rounds in the Chicago brunch scene and this dish was one of my favorites! Afterwards, our waitress said, "I'd offer you some dessert, but I'm guessing you've had enough of it already." We burst out laughing...too true!All of the food looked amazing here. The deli sandwiches are huge; I'd love to try a classic corned beef or pastrami next time. Great place! Can't believe it's only 3.5 stars on Yelp. Stop hating people!

38.description: came here for dinner around 7pm on a Thurs.  Somewhat surprised to see a healthy crowd still for a diner.  Server was super friendly and good with kids.  Great suggestions and has passion for the food.  A real highlight of the night as well, as she knew the food, how its prepared.   Great to chitter chatter with.   All meats are done in house, and after trying the corned beef/pastrami #24 sandwich, I would say its worthy of a repeat trip.   I used to love in the neighborhood and always shunned this place from the earlier yelps, but I was ready to dance and since with my first bite.  The highlight is the chopped liver spread.  Matzo ball soup was very homey, comforting, almost nostalgic (ideal for a cold winter night).  -though my first ever (a bit salty for my own taste) but it was good!  Also had some fries with made freshly made Wisconsin sauce.  In all of Chicago, I have found my default deli!  Now I just need to figure out how to move back to the SoLo.

51.description: Really really good food love the music the atmosphere is great service is friendly but my lord its a little too pricey. 35 dollars for two sandwiches and 2 coffees. Kind if too much. Their Bloody marys are amazing though

27.description: Four stars for the food, 2 for the attitude and service, making the average 3.Food was fine. Nothing special but nothing to complain about either. Sandwiches were maybe a little dry and could have been a bit more flavorful, but were huge and on good solid bread. Ketchup bottle on our table was empty but we scrounged one from another table. Like others, I don't get the sea of 'reserved' signs when they don't take reservations! Just don't get it. Also, I get the whole party must be present thing, but we were left standing in the front at a time when the place was pretty much empty. Maybe be a little flexible? The only napkins present were the little ones wrapped around the flatware. If you serve giant sandwiches filled with gloppy stuff you need more napkins! Yes, they brought some when asked, but most similar places just put some on the table when your food comes.The float, which was OK but far from the best I've had, could only be served in a single glass and the request to bring a 2nd glass, please, was greeted with an attitude of "now you want an extra glass?" Bar service was horrific, but the people we were with said it was usually better. Couldn't make a drink properly and couldn't bring what we'd ordered, and the stock wasn't great. No Bombay Sapphire? The server said something about "bar service isn't our thing."The previous reviews are spot on. OK food, but served with an attitude and aloofness, and many inexplicable things like the reserved signs on the tables. Not sure if I'll go again, I need to decide of the OK food is worth the disdain for the customer.

32.description: The food here was amazing and the atmosphere is really great. The wait staff is fun and welcoming and there were tons of tourists who all heard pretty much the same great things about this place. It's a NY kosher style dinner with all the warm welcome feeling of the Midwest. The portions are huge and everything that came out of that kitchen looked amazing!!!

54.description: I love this joint!  Looks like an old-time diner.  Everyone is friendly here.  Their portions are huge and delicious.  I got to try their light rootbeer and it was AMAZING!  There might be free refills on all drinks but I can't be too sure because I only had the rootbeer (which had free refills) so you will need to double check on that.  Their tomato soup is outstanding - nice & fresh, homemade, warms up your entire body, tastes great.  I also tried a little of the matzah ball soup.  They give you delicious homemade chicken broth and a huge matzah ball.  This was my first time trying this soup and I'm glad I did at Eleven City.  To top it off, their frozen vodka lemonades are ADDICTING!  Can't wait to go back.

48.description: First time here.  Had a very good, huge omelette.Staff was friendly with quick service. Prices are reasonable.

44.description: Like this place a lot, would've been 5 stars, however, service just needs a little more patience. I get that the weekend breakfast crowd keeps you busy, but our server was literally asking for the menu and walking away before we even finished the order. Anyways, besides that... great bloody mary's, amazing breakfast sandwiches, I got the Bad@$$ breakfast sandwich, which was very tasty. The place is definitely packed on weekends, but moves pretty quick. I'd go back for sure.

24.description: Yo, this place is the REAL DEAL!  I haven't had good deli food like this since I was a young girl in Philly.  Their sandwiches are awesome.  Also, the Lox Bagel is the business.  This place is raved about by people as being one of the best spots to visit in Chicago with good reason.  Eleven City Diner is worth the hype and a must visit spot in the Chi.

7.description: Very cool place with fast good service and delicious food! Really enjoyed it! I think I had the smallest portion of all as I just ordered lax with latke. It saved me space for a cake though. Red Velvet Cake is delicious and perfect to share.Would definitely recommend this place for lunch or dinner.

49.description: Always accommodating of the stroller and the French toast is amazing. Best when paired with a mimosa.The staff is very helpful and professional.We love coming here

40.description: Very good!  Ate here for lunch on Sunday.  Had the Matzah Ball soup, brisket sandwich, and chocolate malt.  Everything was delicious.  I had a nice time speaking with Roz, the owners mom.  The soup was the recipe of her great grandmother.  She is a very sweet lady.  Highly recommend this place!

53.description: DONT GO HERE--FIRST TIME EVER GETTING KICKED OUT OF A RESTAURANT!!!! I have been coming here every Sunday for the last five years. They have the best bloody marys, quick service, and very nice wait staff. About a year ago I was dining here with three other family members when the cute older lady owner asked us to move because there was a larger party coming in and wanted to sit together...without being offered a free round of drinks or complimentary slice of cake...we happily agreed and moved.Fast forward to this afternoon, my fiancé and I were brunching here and before we could even finish our frozen lemonades we were approached by a bald guy (no idea if he is the manager or owner, the white guy. The black host/manager is very pleasant) who didnt ask us---he TOLD US---to move to the bar stools to free up the table we were sitting at. I agreed to move and honestly was familiar with this happening before but his approach didnt sit well with fiancé. He went up to the NICE manager and said "we dont mind moving but we feel as though it could be done a little bit more gracefully"...the nice manager apologized and even said that he has seen us here all the time. The bald guy then overheard my fiancés conversation and asked if there was a problem. We told him he could have asked us in a different way and he flipped out. He then got completely condescending saying "What would you of liked me to do since you're the professionals?" At this point my fiancé told him there is no need to be an asshole about it and at that point he kicked us out and said if we didnt leave right away that he would call the cops on us. I was completely in shock and almost thought it was something I did wrong...until I read Kevin's review and saw that it was almost the exact same review.This manager or owner, whoever he is, is a very rude and unprofessional person. Why become sarcastic and irate when a customer is giving constructive criticism? I dont care how good the food is, customers need to be treated with respect. After experiencing all of this, we are honestly fine with never going back. I feel bad for his staff and also the reputation that the original owners worked so hard to create.

30.description: Some (many) months back, I saw a few ("tagged") photos trending on Instagram with a caption of "Chicago's best malt." (Photo credit to the foxy "EATTRAVELROCK" foodie.) Ice cream related drinks, folks.  Figured since it was an off day and the last bit of spring break for a hot date, I'd surprise her with a train trek into the city and a nice malted treat.  She was impressed.  I don't however "get" malts.. milkshakes are more my speed but she said it was the "good stuff".Two offerings I found stellar.  Their malts/milkshakes and their turkey burger.  Definitely good stuff.  I wish  I could say I've been back to try other favorites, but alas, I haven't.  I have however sent other deli lovers here and they have reported their newfound love.  I gotta go back..

46.description: Don't expect to be blown away by the hospitality here. But the food is great, all sandwiches are absolutely amazing, the portions are huge and Bloody Mary's are some of the best I've ever had.One star off for the less than amazing attitude of the employees but great food experience.

1.description: Stumbled across this diner/deli during a conference and didn't know much going in. Inside was quite lively and bright. Menu was fairy extensive making it hard to choose. So a soup and sandwich combo it was.Matzah ball soup was about the size of a softball and very good. The smoked beef brisket was good, although not very smokey. A little pricey overall being a diner but still food was pretty good.

55.description: Food was decent service was good. I liked the root beer.like the decorations and atmosphere am planning to stop back.

9.description: Gone here a few times. They have an upstairs and downstairs. I like sitting upstairs. But then you have to walk down stairs to go to the bathroom. There's a novelty soda fountain which is kind of neat - ice cream floats blah blah blah. And a candy shop in the front.the prices felt sort of on the high side for what you got, but what I've ordered was pretty good, even the veggie burger. Roast beef, pastrami sandwiches are good. Matzo ball soup also good. ten to twenty bucks a person i'd guessin some ways the place is kind of a novelty, the decor is a throwback to (sometime in chicago's past where things like soda fountain bars were a thing)i've always been curious about the root beer and floats, but i get sick when i have that much sugar. I wish they had a smaller option than 'unlimited root beer for $5 or whatever'You know, this reminds me, there is a place in the loop that sells mini milkshakes. I like that idea.

26.description: I went this morning with my boyfriend, and it was pretty good! He had the latkes, which we both really liked (and they came with a healthy heaping of sour cream and apple sauce). I had a pesto omelette which I enjoyed. The coffee was good for the first sips but for whatever reason, the more I drank it the less I liked it (and it wasn't because it was getting old, our server was attentive with refilling). I was torn between 4 and 5 stars, and didn't give it 5 stars because I wasn't completely blown away. I'd go again if I were in the neighborhood, but won't go out of my way.

25.description: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER I am not a resident of Chicago IL and as a visitor heard that Eleven was a great place to go with wonderful food. Unfortunately, I never had the opportunity to experience the food due to extremely poor customer service. I arrived to the restaurant with a large group, however not all members of the group accompanied the eight of us that were in the restaurant. The OWNER greeted us with the immediate response that all members of our party needed to be present and told our entire party to stand to the side, as not to startle the incoming customers. We obliged. We understood that all members needed to be with us, but asked if there were any accommodations that could be made. The OWNER, came back and told us that he could accommodate ten people, but reiterated that the other two people, upon arrival would not be able to sit with us. Which we understood. However, this point he presumed was not clear because he re-stated it another two times, with the unnecessary presumption that we would proceed to "get in his face" if they were to arrive and not be seated with us, this which he based on his "30 years of restaurant experience." Each member of our party assured him that that would be fine. As we waited, the hostess assured us that the OWNER does not usually behave in this way and that he may have been overwhelmed. However it was 2pm on Christmas Eve and there were only a handful of customers. The OWNER, came back and angrily asked us where the "other two members of our party were." At that point, having been harassed by the OWNER of the establishment, it was pretty clear to our large party that the OWNER did not want to accommodate a group of young professionals. We promptly took our business elsewhere. This was the worst customer service my party and I have ever experienced, especially by the OWNER of an establishment. His customer service training clearly only extends to a certain type of customer, that category my party failed to fit. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER.

12.description: While in town for our anniversary we knew we couldn't leave without eating at the place we had our rehearsal dinner. It's still just as eclectic as ever and the food remains consistently delicious. I was excited to see them on the show Unique Eats about a year ago making their famous matzoh balls which they put into the best soup I've ever had. I wish they had a location in Texas because I can't think of a better thing to order for comfort when you're feeling under the weather. Or when you just want something you know will be delicious, like their killer macaroni and cheese. Of course being a Jewish deli they also have perfected the art of making amazing sandwiches such as a heaping pile of pastrami and turkey on fresh challah bread. Their French toast made with the same bread is also a show stopper. Look up pictures of their black and white French toast too. Drool inducing right?! And the best part is you can get it whenever you want since breakfast is served all day! Remember, a side of guilt is free as mentioned on their menu since 'there's always plenty to go around'. They have something for everyone like a candy bar, a soda jerk where you can order classics like Brooklyn egg creams, shakes and malts, frozen vodka lemonade, Bloody Mary's, cake, and even Intelligentsia coffee to satisfy the hipsters.

59.description: This place is ALWAYS busy during weekend brunch times but I've never had to wait more than 20mins- I think that says a lot about the efficiency of the staff. The food is delicious (large portions to cure any terrible hangover). Salmon and Latke is my personal favorite. Also, do not leave before ordering a Bloody Mary they may be the best in the city!

21.description: Such a cute place! I had the corned beef and it was a nice size portion and delicious! We were able to be seated right away for lunch.

17.description: I had a omelette with pastrami in it.  OMG!  It was amazing.  I chased it down with Challah Bread French Toast.  The best.  Great atmosphere.  Great service.  Lots of family pictures on the walls near the bathroom.

10.description: Some (many) months back, I saw a few ("tagged") photos trending on Instagram with a caption of "Chicago's best malt." (Photo credit to the foxy "EATTRAVELROCK" foodie.) Ice cream related drinks, folks.  Figured since it was an off day and the last bit of spring break for a hot date, I'd surprise her with a train trek into the city and a nice malted treat.  She was impressed.  I don't however "get" malts.. milkshakes are more my speed but she said it was the "good stuff".Two offerings I found stellar.  Their malts/milkshakes and their turkey burger.  Definitely good stuff.  I wish  I could say I've been back to try other favorites, but alas, I haven't.  I have however sent other deli lovers here and they have reported their newfound love.  I gotta go back..

5.description: I've been to the Lincoln Park location for brunch, and wanted to give this one a shot too. Here's what you can expect: can't be seated without your whole party there (pretty standard around Chicago); breakfast served all day!; large portions at a fair price; a good but not spectacular tasting omelet (I got the 3x frittata); and decent service. It may have been unique to the day, but the upstairs seating at this location was extraordinarily warm. Loved the decor up there though. Way different vibe than the Lincoln Park location.

3.description: At best an mediocre interpretation of a diner. As a person who's lived in NYC and NJ, I know diners. This is a classic Midwest attempt at being a diner. Let's start with the outliers, a trained eye would know:1. Bar seating is reserved. In what world is bar seating reserved? Anywhere. Anyplace. Let alone, a diner. A general rule of diners is booths and tables are hostess seated, but the bar is first come first serve. Even at Lou Mitchell's this isn't the case. 2. The "deli" is the same come cuts you can find at Jewel. They aren't making their own pastrami, corned beef, etc. Why pay the price that makes it seem like they are?3. The cheesecake is clearly (as prominently displayed) from Juniors, a Brooklyn, NY institution. Yes, you're paying for them to import cheesecake from NYC. Beyond that, let's discuss the other problems:1. A horrible entry area. If you have to wait for a table you'll be constantly bounced around, being told to move from one location to the other. But, in reality, you'll just keep getting yelled at for blocking the door (impossible to avoid) or blocking a "hallway" (also impossible to avoid). Frankly, given their crappy attitude, I almost called them in for a probable fire code violation. 2. There's no reservations. None. This is a ridiculous issue, when you consider the waiting situation and reserved bar seating. 3. The food is meh. Good, but not great. Certainly not worth the wait, the surly service or price. It's meh, mostly because of all the above. The system for seating, stresses the kitchen, forcing them to rush. Which means you get a non-toasted, but toasted English muffin or raw, yes raw onions and peppers in the Rito's. You can do better. Simple as that. Bongo Room and Yolk are nearby. Both offer a better overall experience.

35.description: Good food and casual ambiance. The French toast is simply amazing. Would recommend! Tried the hand made root beer and though it's different than expected, it's pretty tasty! I enjoyed the blonde root beer in particular. The portion sizes are very good for the prices.

19.description: I've only done take out. But I dream about Bubbe's chicken soup and the potato knisch. That sometimes is the perfect meal for what ails ya'.
