28.description: This place needs more competition in the South Loop for sure.  Its prices are on the high side and the food quality is inconsistent but it still seems to be popular.  Having been here four times, I think I will take a pass next time.  Although some sandwiches and the coleslaw are pretty good, how does a deli pass off the chicken noodle soup as authentic?  While lunching there recently, I was brought a bowl of tepid (probably canned) broth - not a lick of chicken in it - with under-cooked noodles like Mueller's macaroni at the grocery store.  That did it for me.    Try The Bagel on the north side if you're in the vicinity - it's far better.

45.description: The atmosphere, classic Chicago style, and amazing "Blank Blank" sandwich was all I needed.

33.description: I'm torn!  I've been here twice with my boyfriend, as we live nearby.  I had the exact same meal both times: the Cheddar, Parmesan, and Swiss Mac and Cheese with a root beer.  Although I've had better mac and cheese, it was pretty delicious, and the portion size was large.  The root beer, however, was AMAZING (at $5.95, I guess it should be, but they did give free refills!)  I had to take two stars away, though, because my boyfriend essentially refuses to come back after getting sick immediately after eating here both times.  (I've been fine, myself).  The first time, he had the BBQ Smoqued Brisket Cheddar Melt, and the second time, he had the Moshe Cristo melt.  So maybe stay away from the melts?Other than the food, the service was decent, and I really like the deli atmosphere and the candy counter in front!  Overall, a fun neighborhood place to eat--as long as you don't get sick!

43.description: Good food--lotkas in particular were excellent. Service was also excellent. Homemade root beer was good. Food came out pretty quickly too.

2.description: I've dined at this restaurant so many times while visiting Chicago. It's my favorite breakfast/brunch spot there. After my first visit I knew I'd become a regular. The staff are all extremely nice, friendly and attentive. The restaurant is clean and homely. The portions are huge. They make a mean pastrami corned beef hash. Be sure to give it a try! The prices are also excellent. I always leave with a full stomach and completely satisfied. Please come to Miami!

18.description: I have never encountered someone in the service industry that is so consistently condescending, rude, self righteous and overall impossible to be around than the man in charge.   He speaks to the customers like it's his privilege to allow them to dine in his establishment.   The service staff are friendly and almost apologetic, with their head on a swivel to make sure he's occupied elsewhere.  The food is good.  Really good.  More pricey than some would expect, but you get what you pay for.  I don't think I've ever ordered that I didn't really enjoy.   For that reason, I find myself waiting for a table once every 12 months or so.   Sometimes I'm lucky and Mr Wonderful is out when I visit.  That's rare.  One can always hope.

41.description: Today will be my last time to visit this establishment. Over the last 2 years I have probably dined here about 20 times. Further, I usually suggest 11 City to visitors to Chicago. No more. As many others have mentioned, there seems to be a general aloofness of the staff and several inconvenient "policies" that are counter to what would generally be deemed as good customer service. Splitting a $150 check 3-ways doesn't seem to be too complicated for other restaurants. Also, don't lie to me by saying that your computer system won't allow it. There are many places to eat in this city with comparable food, better prices, and a value proposition that stresses quality customer service.

52.description: it was ok. my liver sandwich wasn't all that great and bloody mary's was ok, i wish it was more spicy and had a better kick to it. over all ok

50.description: Started off w some matzo ball soup. So delish and heart warming in this crisp day! Then I had the "43" sandwich. Piled miles high w beef and latke and crispy onions. I could not fit it all in my mouth! The meat was tender and juicy. The slaw on the side was good! Not too much mayo which I enjoyed. Cute diner w sky high ceilings! Would definitely come back to try the booze!

4.description: Food was to die for. Best matzo ball soup I have ever had in my life. Waitress was extremely helpful and friendly. It was noisy but it had a very retro diner atmosphere, I would expect nothing less. Great great eats!

6.description: I'm torn!  I've been here twice with my boyfriend, as we live nearby.  I had the exact same meal both times: the Cheddar, Parmesan, and Swiss Mac and Cheese with a root beer.  Although I've had better mac and cheese, it was pretty delicious, and the portion size was large.  The root beer, however, was AMAZING (at $5.95, I guess it should be, but they did give free refills!)  I had to take two stars away, though, because my boyfriend essentially refuses to come back after getting sick immediately after eating here both times.  (I've been fine, myself).  The first time, he had the BBQ Smoqued Brisket Cheddar Melt, and the second time, he had the Moshe Cristo melt.  So maybe stay away from the melts?Other than the food, the service was decent, and I really like the deli atmosphere and the candy counter in front!  Overall, a fun neighborhood place to eat--as long as you don't get sick!

22.description: At best an mediocre interpretation of a diner. As a person who's lived in NYC and NJ, I know diners. This is a classic Midwest attempt at being a diner. Let's start with the outliers, a trained eye would know:1. Bar seating is reserved. In what world is bar seating reserved? Anywhere. Anyplace. Let alone, a diner. A general rule of diners is booths and tables are hostess seated, but the bar is first come first serve. Even at Lou Mitchell's this isn't the case. 2. The "deli" is the same come cuts you can find at Jewel. They aren't making their own pastrami, corned beef, etc. Why pay the price that makes it seem like they are?3. The cheesecake is clearly (as prominently displayed) from Juniors, a Brooklyn, NY institution. Yes, you're paying for them to import cheesecake from NYC. Beyond that, let's discuss the other problems:1. A horrible entry area. If you have to wait for a table you'll be constantly bounced around, being told to move from one location to the other. But, in reality, you'll just keep getting yelled at for blocking the door (impossible to avoid) or blocking a "hallway" (also impossible to avoid). Frankly, given their crappy attitude, I almost called them in for a probable fire code violation. 2. There's no reservations. None. This is a ridiculous issue, when you consider the waiting situation and reserved bar seating. 3. The food is meh. Good, but not great. Certainly not worth the wait, the surly service or price. It's meh, mostly because of all the above. The system for seating, stresses the kitchen, forcing them to rush. Which means you get a non-toasted, but toasted English muffin or raw, yes raw onions and peppers in the Rito's. You can do better. Simple as that. Bongo Room and Yolk are nearby. Both offer a better overall experience.

15.description: AMAZING! this place is amazing! I was in Chicago for only four days and I ate here every morning. Couldn't resist returning! They serve breakfast all day every day and it is AMAZING! Had the granola tower, the french toast and the waffles and I can't say anything bad about any of it! The only negative note I have is about the Cappuccino, which was bad compared to their Latte. Will definitely come back to Eleven City Diner next time I visit Chicago!

57.description: Breakfast is my favorite meal and they serve it all day! It can be hard to choose off the menu because it's so extensive, but I've never been let down. I live close by, and I enjoy bringing out of towners here. Be warned - it gets crowded on the weekends. Unfortunately, they don't take reservations, but the staff is always helpful and they do what they can to keep customers from waiting too long. The food is worth the wait.

20.description: Love this place solo and they are great with my Kids. It would be great if they opened earlier than 1130. It would be a great meeting place for parents and kids with all the schools close by . Other than that great staff and management.

36.description: Great food and part of Chicago's cultural mosaic. Great lively environment. The kindest staff one could hope to be served by. Deli food at its finest!I love it!!!~Jonathan Stein

14.description: Another fun visit to eleven city diner.  I use to live in the neighborhood and visited eleven on almost a weekly basis for a weekend breakfast.  Food was good and as a single I almost got a seat right away at the bar.   After moving out of Chicago I came back for a long weekend and brought the GF to see where I use to go.  Something's never change.   Food was great, service was great and the owner was still running around waving his arms and yelling at everyone.  I was back in my comfort zone.

58.description: OMG.. I love this place. It is very small and quaint. If you are looking for glitter ,glitz, and fashion then you have got the wrong place.. Now if you are looking for a nice bar to unwind in after a long day or week of work then this is the place for you. They have pretty decent bartenders and very reasonable prices. I love going for their martini night special. They are just spectacular! a remember they def don't pour lightly so be ready...

56.description: Tantrum is an enigma. It has an interesting crowd depending on what day of the week you're visiting. I do recommend it as a good place to grab a drink though as you can usually carry on a conversation (ok, that is unless they have a poetry jam? or are playing soft core porn on tv).Comfortable seating and friendly bartenders. Love their very dirty martini. They have an extensive martini list so check that out before placing your order with the bartender.

29.description: This place is tap or miss (it's rarely a hit...anymore). Tantrum has taken a dive off of the shallow end, which says, it hasn't drowned yet. I think they lack identity or something. Not exactly sure. Drinks: I typically always get the long island, and it's always pretty yummy. It's 12 bucks. I guess not too bad, whatever. Service: the waitresses (although I'm sure they have a bias for fair skinned chicas with long curly/straight hair) are always super nice. They're never like they have a PMS chromosome. Spot: Tantrum is cute, but small. I think the biggest issue I have here is on the weekends, they want to be a club, but they aren't. They are far from it. The communicate this FAR-FETCHED dream by holding the reserved signs on the table for folks who get bottle service. Sorry, but NO ONE is coming in here for bottle service if you don't find what you lost. No one ever comes and uses the tables. As a result, us 5inchers have to stand for hours because tantrum thinks it's a club and not a afterwork spot with a couple of tubes. I go here because it's convenient and I tend to go off on my own, and it's a cool vibe (sometimes) when I just want to get out the house. They have a ton of potential, I just don't think they know it.

42.description: Oh Tantrum... Again what a disappointment. So here it is..  I've given Tantrum more than enough chances but I'm NOT sorry to say, that I will not be returning.  This place definitely falls short and lacks VIBES!  Tantrum is very narrow lounge/bar, not nearly enough space to get your groove on w/out getting bumped or having to play musical chairs. The tight quarters make it almost impossible to maneuver from front to back. NO visible signs on the bathroom doors. (Opps!)  The music is okay and the staff were pleasant.  So, last night  we were invited to a supposedly (vip) b-day celebration, a waitress carrying a veggie tray (store bought) and a guy pouring sips of Remy, (instead of real samples) and stated "ONLY one per person".  Are you serious?!   Tantrum wasn't  worth the time or money!

23.description: Only reason I liked this place was because it was free to get in.It's pretty small and crowded. Lots of people just sitting around looking at each other and showing off their clothes. Music was just OK. Decor is nice and bathroom was clean and it's easy to find street parking, so I guess those are SOME plus'es.

47.description: Well...I was at Tantrum last  Saturday night. It wasn't bad but it wasn't good.  I think Tantrum has potential to be a great place for urban professionals to just chill but it hasn't quite arrived yet. There were some chicks in the corner doing the "Stanky Leg."  Oh well... I did have a delicious raspberry cosmo..it was tasty.  The music was good.  I plan on going back, but during the week after work when they have $5 martinis.  I like to chill...

8.description: A glorified cafeteria with a douchy owner that's only saving grace is a hit bartender here or there...can make the difference in what usually ends up being a sausage fest.

31.description: Went with a group of friends. Love the energy here. Beautiful people, great video-djing and music all around. But, the drinks were on the weak side. Our waitress was new and unprofessional.  My husband had on some throwback Nikes, which were in violation of their "no gym shoe" rule. But, the door attendant let us in, so as to not "embarrass him in front of his lady." nice, but he'd be my hero anyway. :)In short, go with friends if they ensure that you'll have a good time. Go dressed to impress, men; at least as far as your footwork is concerned. . Ladies, you might be outnumbered, which would be nice if most of the  men didn't look old enough to be your dad. Nice time, anyway!

34.description: My first impression of the place when i walked by was "ok this looks like a nice quiet spot". After a few times driving by i finally stopped in. The place has a beatiful set up.Pros: good drinksYoung pretty waitresses Nice set upCon: kinda smallLots of middle aged mentwo small flat screensNice quiet spot to take a date. Not for meeting people.

16.description: So after two visits on a Tuesday for their Sports Themed evenings I can finally say - I LIKE THE PLACEFrom the decor to the size and crowd there when I attend. Last Tuesday I went for the Jamaican Cuisine however was too late to sample but definitely enjoyed the 5.00 Bacardi Dragonfly cocktails made sour or sweet (I had sour) they were delicious.My only beef with the place is there are no visible signs for the mens/women's bathroom so on my first visit I walked into the men's room, lol - bittersweet I got no view of anything upon my stumble.I will continue to go to the afterwork "get-togethers" on Tuesdays and enjoy the ambience and comfy couches :)Oh and you should too!

13.description: I have been here a few times and I usually forget that it exists after I leave as it is just a little out of reach for my Lincoln Park ass...lolThey usually have Monday Night Football game parties every week for those of you looking for a spot in South Loop to watch a game.They pour big ass vodka shots here...FYI...good spot

11.description: I gave one star for the lounge setup and the prompt service.   The drinks are watered down and expensive.   I expected the price of the drinks but I would like to get what I pay for.

39.description: Drinks were weak and service slow but if you want a chill spot where you can hang out with friends, not bad. I imagine this will become more like Cheers for thirty-something middle class African Americans. I've heard it gets crowded some nights but it was fine when we went with a group of friends from high school. Don't expect fancy drinks, appetizers or even chips, or good service. But also you don't have to worry about the attitude that often comes with places that have those things.

37.description: My first impression of Tatrum this past Friday night was that it is very narrow.   If you are not one for crowds like me than it can be a struggle when this places gets crowded.  That being said the music was good.  I loved the old skool movies on the monitor.  People seemed to have a good time.So, what else can you ask for??  Well I could have gotten a stronger drink since it wasn't cheap but oh well.Tatrum was cool.  Next time I will go a little earlier..a girl needs a place to sit!

0.description: Tantrum is a cool over 25 bar in the Loop. It's a classy bar with clean restrooms, plenty of available seating and good DJ's. The drink specials aren't anything to write home about, but who's writing home about drink specials at a neighborhood bar anyway, right? :) he eh eh *Yes, very corny joke I know* Anyway, the hardwood floors and comfortable sofas and long bar with extra stools make this  a place where most patrons can sit down and have a drink and talk without worries. :) Late hours you will see people ordering food from nearby restaurants and yes that's completely fine in this place. You can order a pizza and the bouncer will allow the guy to bring it to you. This is a reasonably safe bar it's not a place that attracts rif raf or your run of the mill losers who have a short temper. It's a place where professional people go to unwind after work so enjoy! Side note: Yes, most of the patrons and staff are African American. You will occasionally see people from other backgrounds, but not too often. The crowd pretty much sticks with whomever they came with so this isn't a mingle bar unless you sit at the bar alone and decide to talk to put in effort to talk to other people. This isn't the place where you will be constantly approached and bothered. Clothing: Patrons wear jeans, dresses, club outfits, summer dresses, and pretty much anything except for workout clothing. So, you can wear your club dress or a pair of jeans with heels and no one will stare at you like you are at the wrong event.

38.description: Came to this place to meet up with a few friends on a Wednesday night.  The place was really cool when I walked in, and I should have just left after that. Clearly, looks don't mean everything because this place was terrible.  The crowd was mixed, which I love, however there were a ton of middle aged (being polite here) men who were totally trying to pick up a PYT (Pretty young thang).  The bartender was TERRIBLE! Hey I get it, you gotta make money.  Problem is  you think that you can make your money by serving only middle aged (again polite) men.  WRONG! I tip and I tip well, and I dont appreciate being ignored, you arent that cute! Sorry yelpers, I had to go off a second.  To put it plainly, I will never EVER go back.  That is all.

51.description: Randomly stopped in here on a Friday night with my two girl friends.  The music was all hip-hop, and the crowd was primarily African-American 30somethings.  A waitress actually walks around to take your drink orders for even people who are standing since it gets so crowded.  One extra star for that!  However, because it's SO narrow, it lacks seating (that are mostly reserved tables), and it essentially feels like a lounge in a bar atmosphere.  Nothing else really within a few blocks of Tantrum (in terms of nightlife), so you'll either end up here because you intended to, or you just drove by and spontaneously decided to.

27.description: New owner. New update. Same result.Tantrum sucks.I'm in the unique position of having been in the neighborhood since this place first opened, and I've seen it change hands many times.It went from being a cool little neighborhood hipster joint (A), to a would-be rockabilly/sports bar fusion spot (C-, D+), to its current incarnation as a Black-owned spot primarily frequented by Black professionals (F).And it's terrible. (Hence the "F").Once the hood mentality of checking ID's at the door and arbitrarily enforcing a "dress code" became standard, I knew Tantrum was done. And when the owner himself had no answer for the stingy pours of liquor and exhorbitant prices for bad, grocery store wine, I knew that Tantrum was done. $11 for a glass of wine that costs about $5.59 a bottle at Jewel? As my dear departed Granny would say: Negro, please.Further evidence of this hood mentality: Not too long ago I was there with a group for a friend's birthday. We'd been there about 2 hours when some bouncer came up and asked a guy in our group to remove his baseball cap. Mind you, other men in the joint had on hats and caps. But because this was a baseball cap, somehow it wasn't allowed? After two hours? They put out a man with three college degrees and an open tab who had been spending money with a group all evening -- no disturbance at all. That was just the most recent of many accumulated slights and bad, hoodrat business policies... My friends are already on notice to never invite me there, despite the fact that I live nearby. I wouldn't spend another penny there.So, yeah. For me, Tantrum is done.For 20-something Black "professionals" still clamoring for a "scene"? They can have it.

32.description: The drink prices have increased and the waitresses are hit or miss.  My least favorite thing happened on my last visit: Me and some friends come in to watch the playoffs and grab a table.  the lady takes our orders and when she brings back the drinks, she wants us to open a tab or pay-per-drink.  And she's not moving til we hand over Visa or cash! Now I understand the need to gaurantee the tab will be paid, but they need to find a better way to communicate this to customers. I'm not trying to encourage profiling, but ummm.... me and my crew are bourgie black folks and we look like it.  We're not walking out on the tab ma'am.  So i was NOT feeling that. I've been there and had a really cool server, but that ONLY (and I mean only) happens when I'm introduced to her by a guy she already knows.  Like they gotta clear me as one of the cool kids or some'm. Wtf?  0_o  That's all.  I only go to Tantrum for events now or when I know DJ World or DJ INC is spinning.  otherwise i can be overcharged for drinks and treated like crap in the Gold Coast.

54.description: This place is hard to find, but the drinks can be well priced and strongIts a hit or miss

48.description: This place was cool.  I went on a Monday night, and they had $5 Cosmos and Appletini's.  The only downside was that we were there for a while and discovered that they were playing some sort of CD on repeat....  That was weird, but the place is pretty cozy.  It did get crowded, but we had a big seating area to ourselves.  All of the above could have been because it was a Monday, but I would recommend trying this place out.

44.description: So after two visits on a Tuesday for their Sports Themed evenings I can finally say - I LIKE THE PLACEFrom the decor to the size and crowd there when I attend. Last Tuesday I went for the Jamaican Cuisine however was too late to sample but definitely enjoyed the 5.00 Bacardi Dragonfly cocktails made sour or sweet (I had sour) they were delicious.My only beef with the place is there are no visible signs for the mens/women's bathroom so on my first visit I walked into the men's room, lol - bittersweet I got no view of anything upon my stumble.I will continue to go to the afterwork "get-togethers" on Tuesdays and enjoy the ambience and comfy couches :)Oh and you should too!

24.description: I had a pretty good time in this place last Friday night (27th April), It was the last evening of my 3 weeks vacation trip through the US with a friend of me (I am from Switzerland). I spent only 2 whole days in Chicago, what a lovely city !I met there so beautiful and nice girls that it's such a pity to not have more time there... Moreover my english was a bit too poor in order to engage a real discussion... There was a girl next to me (unfortunately I can't remember her name) who was so nice and beautifull, but I hadn't enough time to spend with her coz my flight was early the morning... I think me and my friend were the only white guys in the place lol, so if you recognize please send my a message...

7.description: Took my girlfriend there for her birthday this past weekend. We were asked 5 times if we were with another party and we repeatedly replied no. After getting irritated with a hostess telling us we couldn't sit in a particular area me and a friend decided to by a bottle and get a table. After purchasing the bottle, which we requested was split on 2 separate cards, the waitress stated that both cards didn't go through and needed our cards again. Well, they triple charged my card and double charged my friends card. Then later had the nerve to say we didn't pay and would have to take the bottle service away. After talking the security, the unhelpful manager(whom had an attitude as if HER money taken), the owner finally was called in. My friend blew up at him out of frustration, understandably!! I was insured that the funds taken off of my card would be returned by mid week, considering it was a holiday weekend........... Still no refund..If it wasn't my girlfriends birthday, I probably would've had the police called on me because I felt taken advantage of because of my cool temper at the time.. I've never had this problem at Tantrum before. I will be taking my business elsewhere in the future and will be putting the word out to the various promoters, fraternal brethren, etc. to do the same.

49.description: This makes me sad.  No drink specials, no random board game nights and no community feel.  In my opinion.  I loved the diversity of the old Tantrum.  I work in the area so it was the perfect place to "escape".  We would go after work - talk and laugh.  Now it's more of a  club - I'll pass!!!!   I'm not sure who owns this place now but in my opinion I liked the old place better.

40.description: I finally got around to taking a look at Tantrum, which is a really sad thing since I've lived in the area for so long. I'm glad I did...because I'm not coming back.I'm not sure when I should have headed back towards the door...the moment when my girlfriend complained about the overwhelming scent of perfume, incense, and other crap in there. Maybe it was when the bartender, upon me asking for a Long Island, took all the ingredients and shook them. She seemed positively stunned when the drink exploded in her hands. (Here's a hint, dear: don't shake carbonated beverages). Or just maybe it was that none of our drinks tasted quite right.There's no atmosphere at Tantrum, and I wouldn't come here unless I was already extraordinarily blasted. Save yourself the money and go somewhere else for the inebriation.

53.description: I went here to wind down on a bad day with a friend, and I left much happier than I went in.  It was a random rainy week day so it was pretty empty, but the drink specials were great, and the bartender was really friendly.  Oh, and I think we had 2 lemon drop shots and 4 full glasses of wine for about $20.  So it was easy on the wallet.

30.description: Oh Tantrum!  What the Hell happened to you?!?  It's definitely been some years since I've been here and I assume they are under new (and greedy) management because they NEVER had this 'reserved' seating that has been plaguing Chicago nightlife for the longest!  Crowd: pretentious, 'boogie' wannabes.  The 'men' (for lack of a better word)? Lame.  I mean, you wait until the bar is about to close to try to pick up women because you're too cheap to buy her a $7 drink and *gasp* indulge in a civilized conversation????  What is this?  A community college mixer???  Begone!!!  I could say more, but Imma keep it 'PC' and just say don't bother, at least not on the weekend.

46.description: Waitstaff is wonderful...but the management is terrible!!!Will NEVER patronize this business EVER again! Reserved seating (2 bottle minimum) to celebrate a special occasion and upon my arrival it was not ready. Waited 30 minutes to be seated and the manager was not on site to correct the problem. Upon his arrival, the manager accused me of getting the date wrong, instead of apologizing and asking how he could make things better. Tell me, how do you confuse your own birth date? When spending any amount of time and money, you expect friendly service from the top down...The management could learn a thing or two about customer service from his waitstaff!

1.description: Oh the shenanigans that Tantrum has gotten me into! *hiding face in shame* Minus the foolishness I get into after having 2 (or 4) of their Blue MotherF****, Tantrum is a very nice urban establishment! Located on the corner of 10th and State Street in the south loop, it is a semi-hidden spot that you would almost miss if you werent carefully looking for it.The drinks are always good and strong! It can get packed due to the lounge not being that big of an establishment, but it never seems to bother anyone there. There are different "events" nightly, such as a focus around house music or hip-hop and if Im not mistaken, you can watch Monday Night Football there. Tantrum is totally a place for catching up with an old friend over a drink or meeting a group to chill and sip a cocktail with.

55.description: I've lived in the South Loop now for almost two years, but I usually do not stay local when it comes to nightlife.  This all changed a few weeks ago (see Kasey's Tavern Review) , so I decided to try yet another place in the neighborhood.  There must have been seven or eight other people in the bar when we walked in at half twelve and about the same when we left at closing.  I suspect this place would have had more people but the miserable weather kept everyone inside.  Although I considered leaving after seeing an almost vacant bar, I decided to just crash there with my friend.  The first thing I noticed was the comfortable seating.  It's not something I particularly think about but we had just came from walking around in the pouring rain, albeit with an umbrella, and the only thing we cared for was a dry space, a place to sit, and a nice stiff drink.We stuck to drinking gin and tonics so I really can't speak for the extensiveness of their bar menu, but I can say the bartender made the drinks just right and was very professional.Unlike most watering holes, Tantrum is part neighborhood corner bar part hip lounge.  It's dimly lit, there's comfortable sofa-chairs, Radiohead is playing in the background and yet it's still just a regular bar.  I suppose it's hard to describe but one will have to see for him or herself.

9.description: Place is Horribly Small. Waitresses are Beautiful ! lol thats for the guys.Drinks are ok ... Wasnt a spectacular experience.Ill recommend it if u dont hav anything else to do. If ure tryin to just get away, But not if ure tryin to have fun.

26.description: I had the worst experience ever at a Tantrum. I had a party of 12 visiting from out of town this past Saturday. DO NOT under any circumstances order bottle service or any other service from this establishment. The service was awful we were waiting over 45 minutes for drinks while watching our server socialize with non-paying customers. They pre-billed us thus making it impossible to refuse our order. The so-called VIP accommodations were a joke there was no barrier separating my section and the rest of the crowd. In the past I have had better experiences but this place has definitely gone downhill I would not recommend my worst enemy to support this location and this is sad because it is a black owned establishment an I try and support my people!!!

25.description: So after two visits on a Tuesday for their Sports Themed evenings I can finally say - I LIKE THE PLACEFrom the decor to the size and crowd there when I attend. Last Tuesday I went for the Jamaican Cuisine however was too late to sample but definitely enjoyed the 5.00 Bacardi Dragonfly cocktails made sour or sweet (I had sour) they were delicious.My only beef with the place is there are no visible signs for the mens/women's bathroom so on my first visit I walked into the men's room, lol - bittersweet I got no view of anything upon my stumble.I will continue to go to the afterwork "get-togethers" on Tuesdays and enjoy the ambience and comfy couches :)Oh and you should too!

12.description: I love this place, small quaint and I have had 3 events here. I wish they served food. You can't have everything. Drinks affordable.

59.description: Tantrum is a great place to have a drink and relax.  If Audra is working there then you can be sure to have good music and good service!  The regulars that hang out there are awesome characters and will have no problem filling you in on their stories and jokes.  Just watch out for Kenny:)

21.description: I was at this spot a couple of weeks ago on a Thurs. with one of my boys and was shared that the crowd would be 27 & up. Given that I missed my flight home, I was looking for the mature crowd. The spot was in a decent neighborhood and there was parking on the street when we arrived about 1030pm. The place is not that big, more of a shotgun or row house layout, so dont expect it to be a large place. I would describe it as a neighborhood bar more or less, the people there were having a good time and seemed friendly, but its a spot you need to come to with your own friends as a start, before you hit up another place. The music played was a mix of some old school hop-hop and new stuff and not too loud (you could have a coversation with the person next to you without leaning into their ear). I will say the the bar staff were some very nice looking women and friendly, I will compliment the management for picking the right team to work that night!! In addtion, they serve some great portions on the drinks (I had Woodford Reserve, straight up). From my point of view this seems like a decent spot to go to for a Happy Hour and that is how I might call it the next time I am back in Chicago during the week. I am curious to see what its like on the weekend, but again I would use this a starter place.

17.description: Been here twice and had fun both times.Music is good (at least the second time I went), but the place is small and there is limited seating.  Gets crowded as the night goes on. The drinks are only okay, nothing special. I would say the crowd in late 20s early 30s, which at this point in my life I prefer.The wait staff is very friendly.  Never had to wait in much of a line. Just a note, the bathrooms are not marked (or not very well)....the ladies is to the left. It isn't my go to place, but it isn't a bad option either.

10.description: I've been to Tantrum atleast a dozen times, so I feel I've gotten a good overlook at how this place operates.  There was a dress code enforced a couple of years ago, but just lastnight I seen a guy with New Balance (red) sneakers on, so go figure.The decor is dark, and nice enough to mistake a physically attractive person for a heart throb. A lot of people complain about how small this place is, but in my opinion it's cozy.The bartenders are always nice. The owner seems to always know how to pick good eye candy. The drinks, like most downtown bars - are overpriced. One word, two syllables - pregame.The music is usually old school R&B and Hiphop. If you're looking for Chief Keef's greatest hits, this ain't the spot for you. Perhaps Reggie's down the street is more your speed.

5.description: Im trying to find a reason to give this place 3 stars given how many times I've frequented it.  But my frequency is largely due to where its located and its the closest bar in the area where I know I can find black people.  Place is super small and has a tendency to get crowded.  Drinks are little bit pricey and I agree with the consensus, the bartenders do as little as possible to make conversation.   I try to also go on nights when one of my friends are DJiing therefore I can just stand in that area and listen to good music.  Besides that I rather just go to the 40 other places in the South Loop where I can feel relaxed while having my drink.

3.description: Beautiful ! lol thats for the guys.Drinks are ok ... Wasnt a spectacular experience.Ill recommend it if u dont hav anything else to do.If ure tryin to just get away, But not if ure tryin to have fun.

35.description: This place is pathetic.  If you are professional, accustomed to bartenders that pay attention and like sumptuous interiors head to Rebar at Trump.  If you are looking for someplace to see the latest fashions from Rainbow and Pay/Half make a stop here. I went here on a Friday with co-workers and was shocked at the service we received.  I ordered my usual drink--Kettle and Tonic with a twist.  I asked my normal question of the bartender, "Is your tonic from a bottle or a gun?" The bartender replies, "a gun." I roll my eyes but go ahead with the order.  Now I would assume that if a patron asks that question you would at least check to see if you tonic carbonation levels were appropriate--no such luck.  Nothing like flat tonic and Kettle. When I informed her of this, her response was complete disinterest.  Our group started to get larger and we considered moving to the other side of the lounge area.  Until, of course, we were informed that this was VIP and you had to have bottle service with a $500 minimum.  EXCUSE ME?  This place doesn't even have windows! Or proper tonic.  Why the hell would I pay $500 for anything?So, if I were able to give this place a slither of a star as a rating I would.  Stay away, far away from this hole in the wall.

19.description: Where to start. This place is freaking hole in the wall. The bathrooms are unmarked so it's a guessing game. The bottle service was weak. It was humid outside and hell inside. There was no AC on. Sweaty bodies everywhere. I won't be back.

28.description: The only reason this place has a 4 rating from is because of the Wednesday special for margaritas that are always good and have yet to fail me.Nice crowd, but a hit or miss if you're in the mood to mingle.Service:  Not the happiest group of ladies, but they're alert and prompt.  Owner seems like a cool guy but I guess you would be to if it's your establishment.I have yet to really visit on other nights, but I don't have the desire to do so (what else really goes on here?).

45.description: Don't mind my comment below, This bar used to an awesome place to chill and grab a drink after a long day. Now......It SUCKS!!!! I don't know what the new owners of this place think they are doing but I hope they fail!! The last time i was in Tantrum I felt unwelcome, uncomfortable, and unfortunately lost the best bar tenders!!! I highly suggest going to Villains right across the way to 649 S.clark.

33.description: This is our neighborhood haunt. Strong drinks, pretty awesome DJs. It's small - like ... really small - but the perfect size for a mid-week swig. Bartenders are friendly, though a bit slow when crowded - I get it. If I didn't live within walking distance ... eh ... Go elsewhere for well-made drinks. But some nights ... it's just not about that. Want to hear good "old skool" R&B, hip-hop, have a strong drink and you live in the neighborhood? Go for it.

43.description: Me and sister went to this "Vip BDay Celebration" and I have to say it wasn't worth the trip nor parking charge.  First, the vibe wasn't there. Second, a "sample per person" is ludicrous. (Not to mention the measurement in the shot glass,of the Remy, was at least 1/2 teaspoon) Third, the "delicious hors d' Oeuvers"  was a joke. The hors d' Oeuvers looked as though someone ran to Jewels, took the lid off, just before serving the broccoli and cauliflower.  If this was indeed a "VIP BDay Celeb." it should of been as such.  There should of been "delicious food" served. Such as mini sandwiches/ burgers, kabobs, chicken, fish, olives, etc..Men in suits obviously don't mean to much. We was horribly disappointed and won't ever go back. I read reviews before I visited, and 90% of them was true. Please do something to help your patrons identify the men's room from the women's.This place has potential however if you refuse to elevate with the right attitude, Tantrum  will continue to receive bad reviews and ultimately close/new owner(s). Peace

2.description: Came on a Friday at 10p. It was basically empty when I got there, but it definitely picked up around 10:30-11ish. It's a chill spot for the 25+ AA crowd. Drinks are ok and the DJ was good. It gets a little loud with all the people talking, but it's a bar, what can you expect.

18.description: I'm only writing a review because I checked in here. LOL. I don't like to review EVERY place I go to geez. I've been here plenty so let's see where to begin:It's free - a great thing because I would never pay to get in here.It's small - the layout is the worst for a lounge. It's all bar and no space/walk way. The only "free" seats are around the bar and then there are couches that line the walls available for bottle service. Who buys bottle service at a small lounge like this? I prefer to come here for a quick drink before moving on to somewhere else. Or a drink at an off time when it won't be crowded... this way, I can enjoy the bar or couches freely.When it's packed it's actually an awkward environment to be in. They play music videos to correspond with the tracks so at the end of the day people just end up standing around looking at the screen. To add to the awkwardness, there's nowhere to move around to dance or even walk around to mingle with one another.Service is poor - If I can't dance or move around, at least have the drinks flowing! Well, because it gets crowded it's hard to order at the bar. Outside of the bar, the servers are just plain slow and inattentive. The last time I was here, it was a Sunday evening and not crowded. Perfect. We sat on one of the couches and had a server bringing our drinks... or so we thought. Again, it wasn't crowded so paying attention to the few patrons you have should be an easy job. Nope. We had to track this lady down whenever we wanted another drink. And when we did see her she would be chit chatting with other people or texting on her phone.I'm all about supporting a black-owned, small business but for real, hiring the right people to get the job done is priority number one. Our server wasn't the worst ever but she for sure needed some talking to. And I'm not sure if it was the owner or just a manager on duty but he was standing right there watching her not do her job. Come on now... y'all are making it difficult for me to continue to support. Like I said, I've been here plenty and probably will be back some other time too. But it WILL NOT be my "night out" spot... Tantrum is just a "pop in for a quick drink" type of place... that's all I can handle here.

41.description: Nice little So-Loop spot to check out. I love it because its near my gym.  Not that I venture over there to drink after working out hard!  Better yet, go before you workout. It'll make the workout go even better.  I agree with "It's the F", its hard to figure out the signs for the potty.  If you've been under the influence of alcohol, it may take a while to figure out which one is for you.  Ask someone if you don't like the play the guessing game.

52.description: This place just got an new owner who have pretty much ruined it.  This place used to be incredibly laid back and had great drink specials.  They didn't care when we brought outside food in and it was never crowded.I guess last night was the "opening night" for the new owners and it was really loud, really crowded, and the staff has suddenly gotten incredibly uptight.  Oh, and no more drink specials.

50.description: Oh how this pains me.  What happened to my favorite neighborhood bar???  Velvet rope, bouncers, bottle service??  Where did my relaxed bar with fun bartenders and great drink specials go???This bar was so much better before they tried to "improve" it.  I bet it doesn't last long now...

4.description: This is a nice spot in the south loop of Chicago. It's pretty small and can get extra crowded, but it's great for the grown and sexy. The week nights aren't as crowded and you are able to hear the person your talking to with out yelling. The drinks are strong and average priced for the area. Parking consists of city meters. The earlier you arrive better chance at getting a spot up close (especially if your wearing stilettos ladies). Overall, I would return again. Tried it twice and they were consistent in good service!

6.description: I celebrated my birthday here. The lounge is nice and cozy. The bartenders were very rude and so was our initial server kianna. She never came back to serve us and fortunately we ended up with another who was way more polite. Unfortunately, I would probably not return to this establishment due to how I was treated on my first visit.

22.description: tantrum are you a sports bar, club or lounge? there are tv's all around the bar playing sports, there is a dj setup with very little dance space and there are cute lil couches and comfy chairs. tantrum is free which is huge for me and there is no dress code which is equally huge for me + parking is easy in the lot next door. i arrived at 11 and the place was pretty dead, was told next time to come around midnight so we will see next time.

15.description: I like this place...it's very small inside, but the drinks and the music are good. It was smoking hot inside though...I was sweating without dancing a bit...No A/C or it just wasn't on, I'm not sure..

57.description: I think this place is nice to get a drink and hang with friends. The decor is cool, music is good, drinks are fine. If you are looking for some kind of scene or something, you are in the wrong place. Just a more trendy neighborhood pub.

20.description: I'm only writing a review because I checked in here. LOL. I don't like to review EVERY place I go to geez. I've been here plenty so let's see where to begin:It's free - a great thing because I would never pay to get in here.It's small - the layout is the worst for a lounge. Well, because it gets crowded it's hard to order at the bar. Outside of the bar, the servers are just plain slow and inattentive. The last time I was here, it was a Sunday evening and not crowded. Perfect. We sat on one of the couches and had a server bringing our drinks... or so we thought. Again, it wasn't crowded so paying attention to the few patrons you have should be an easy job. Nope. We had to track this lady down whenever we wanted another drink. And when we did see her she would be chit chatting with other people or texting on her phone.I'm all about supporting a black-owned, small business but for real, hiring the right people to get the job done is priority number one. Our server wasn't the worst ever but she for sure needed some talking to. And I'm not sure if it was the owner or just a manager on duty but he was standing right there watching her not do her job. Come on now... y'all are making it difficult for me to continue to support. Like I said, I've been here plenty and probably will be back some other time too. But it WILL NOT be my "night out" spot... Tantrum is just a "pop in for a quick drink" type of place... that's all I can handle here.

36.description: I stumbled across this place like two years ago, me and some coworkers would go twice a week after work and I absolutely loved it! It  had a great community feel, nice bartenders, great drink special, you were allowed to bring your own food in. As someone mention it was like a urban cheers, everyone knew your name.  I came in one day in asked for a menu to order food and found out it was under new management and they no longer allowed that, also their drink specials were no longer available. (bad Tantrum) I came back in a different night and it was like a mini club w/ a dj . This place is way too small to give off the club vibe, it just wasnt the same.. Im not sure who owns it now but they need to go take some pointers from the previous owners. It was a nice laid back neighborhood bar, that attracted a lot locals, and the bartenders were all very friendly. The drinks and drink specials were great and allowing food in was a plus.

14.description: Me & my girls from Detroit MI  came out to hang. Very small inside. This is more of a lounge. You're dancing where you're sitting. We were referred by a local waitress to come here. Best part about this place was NO COVER charge. Music was ok... Not really my style. I'm a old school rap/r&b girl. I made the best of it though. I would recommend if you're looking to chill, drink & kick it to sometimes really good music.

1.description: Got some breakfast and had upside down pineapple pancakes. Greatest pancakes I have ever had!

9.description: Hotel restaurant, right? Only the NY strip and mashed potatoes were outstanding! Our visit was last Friday night and a terrific waiter suggested the comfort foot we craved after s long day of travel. Worth a look!

23.description: Went here for breakfast with a buddy before a Bears game.  It was a typical breakfast buffet, best feature was the Omelette station.  Otherwise it was standard scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast and some fruit.It got the job down and got us on to the game and a Chicago win but I wouldn't hurry back.

5.description: We went for the Thanksgiving buffet - it was great. Good selection of food, including beef, seafood, and a ham carving station. The desserts were especially good. Staff were very friendly and didn't make any attempt to rush us, which we very much appreciated.

25.description: This is a tough place to review. Some of the food was mediocre, some was great, some was terrible. The service was initially AMAZING, but then after we got our food, we were practically ignored. After being asked if I wanted to take any of my food home, the brought the boxes out and just laid them on the table. For these prices, and the environment, I should not have had to pack my own food up. THE WORST PART!!  We had to fight with the front desk to validate our ticket.The valet told us to self park and validate our tickets for a lower cost. The front desk refused to validate the ticket. Back and forth back and forth for 15 minutes. I wouldn't pay almost 50 dollars to eat at this place or anything.

12.description: I was staying at the Hilton for a four-day conference and ate lunch twice at the lobby restaurant. The first visit I had the small caesar salad which was ok. It would have been nice if the description mentioned the anchovies as I am not a fan.My co-worker ordered the lobster roll and he said it was great.On my next visit, I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and it was pretty good - flavorful and the bleu cheese gave it a nice twist.The downside is the service was horrible both times - the servers all looked miserable and seemed to be bothered when it came to waiting on you. We had to ask for drink refills and they made it clear that it was an inconvenience.It is a hotel lobby restaurant so the food is a little overpriced - if they could just work on the service, it would be a huge improvement!

21.description: You all know how I feel about a poached egg. In fact, I base whole reviews solely on the poached egg experience (sometimes). Well, let me tell you something about 720 South Bar and Grill. Wow. Just. Wow. We used to hit up Kitty O'Shea's before heading to Bears games, but they stopped serving legit breakfast and only serve burgers and deep fried stuffs. We wanted eggs. And bloody Mary's. So we made our way through the Hilton to this fine establishment. No crazy crowds. No waiting. Excellent service from Lisa, who served us delicious double bloody's. :)I ordered the Eggs Benny. Oh. Mah. Gawd. These were the best bennies I've ever had. Instead of Canadian bacon, sliced ham. Instead of boring English muffin, savory bread pudding. Instead of a side of greasy potatoes, asparagus and oven dried tomato. Perfectly poached eggs( And I do mean PERFECTLY). A creamy Hollandaise sauce that completed the meal. My second mom, Kathy, ordered eggs with bacon, which looked beautiful and was LOADED with slices of delicious bacon joy and asparagus/dried tomato. Did I mention that the Bloody Mary's rocked? Served with celery and a lime, they were spicy and delish. Yes, please.

16.description: The usual standard disclaimers apply to this review - if you happen to be staying in Chicago, and you are staying at the Chicago Hilton, the Blackstone, or the Essex Inn, and you like burgers, beer, and bourbon, you should consider the 720 for a dining and / or drinking option.Why?  Because the burger here is freaking unbelievable.  Order it medium rare, as it is a high quality, juicy steak cut, simply adorned with aged cheddar, and, as you see fit, lettuce, tomato, ketchup and mustard.  You can get a fried egg too, but resist the urge to gild.  I rarely finish a burger but I inhaled this one.  Rarely is a $15 hotel burger worth it, but this is the exception.  The fries are good, too, and the restaurant has some local beers on tap which I highly recommend, particularly the Metropolitan option.For cocktails, their rye manhattan is superb, made with "Rhode Island Rye", a brand with which I was not previously acquainted.  She was silky smooth and spicy, but sadly is cooped up all day long, for the bar does not open until 5 PM.  And it is because of that late opening time that I give this place three stars only; after all, what is the point of staying in a downtown hotel if you cannot start your lunch with a hearty Manhattan?Don Draper would have a thing or two to say to Conrad about that!

17.description: This restaurant is located in the Lobby of the Hilton Hotel on Michigan Avenue. Ate here three times while in Chicago, its a safe place for a business meal or to drop by with the kids. I had the $40 rib eye and it was worth it, so was the lesser priced fillet Mignon. Both were perfect made even better by the fact that the company paid for it. All of the sides were very good, and, since its Chicago, the portions are enormous. They offer a super burger thing with egg and some sort of bacon and mounds of cheese and....well there's a lot going on with that burger. It's like it has attention deficit or something. Here's the good part. After you eat you can waddle down the hall a few feet and they have a snug little corner where you can watch four TVs at once (The above mentioned burger would love this place) ...is this a great country or what? Steak and TV...take that fancy french cuisine. ha!

10.description: Having spent the last five days at the Hilton Chicago, I have to say that 720 South Bar and Grill could win an award for the least engaged staff.  They apparently know how to avoid eye contact with customers at all costs. Orders, extras, checks.  Whether it was for breakfast in the morning or drinks at night, it was like I wasn't there.  I swear I could have set myself on fire and still not gotten their attention.  Epically poor service.

11.description: An ideal business lunch meeting place.Conveniently located right in the lobby, this restaurant is comfortable, has nice decor and a few tables. My dining partner has meetings here regularly and insisted we sit at a particular table with the armless style chair. Funny, but I could see his point. There are three seating types here. A bench, an arm chair and an armless chair. I learned the armless is the way to go because the others are too low or too high. Ha! My partner ordered the shrimp salad and I ordered the Garden chop salad with crisp greens, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, radish, sharp cheddar, honey-dijon vinaigrette large salad ($12). On a hot day my salad made for the perfect lunch, and the large size was ideal for a meal. I was told the small is appetizer size. I left perfectly full.A bread basket was brought to the table ahead of time, and our coffee was actually very good.I'd definitely come back here for another meeting! Good to know.

26.description: Mediocre steak but an excellent caprese!

22.description: Awful. Worst service ever. How is it that the people next to me and the people at the other table in front of me had a waiter fawning over them but he failed to acknowledge or provide any service the entire time. Can you imagine what was different about them vs me???  Save your money.

0.description: Food was ok. Buy I only went for breakfast. Short rib hash was the best thing I ate from them. Beef was tender and potatoes flavorful. Otherwise it's a pretty basic breakfast, with a very pricey price tag. $32 for breakfast buffet. Expensive! Good thing the company paid, just wasn't expecting a large price tag. Servers were fairly attentive. Not a bad spot at all, just expensive for what you get.

Mah. Gawd. These were the best bennies I've ever had. Instead of Canadian bacon, sliced ham. Instead of boring English muffin, savory bread pudding. Served with celery and a lime, they were spicy and delish. Yes, please.

2.description: My friend and I stopped by for cocktails. She was very happy with hers. My Sidecar was a bit sweet for me but definitely was not watered down. I think we both agreed that we got a good value.

18.description: Stayed at the Hilton so it was convenient to go here, get food and drink. Ordered a skinny mojito and it was too sweet. Ordered Atlantic Salmon and it was OK, not too great. Being from the Pacific North West, I am spoiled with fresh and tasty seafood. While the salmon I ordered was cooked just right, there was not much flavor to it. The plate did come with different color carrots, that was good. I sat at the bar area and they gave free peanuts snacks mixed with wasabi peas, sesame sticks, rice cracker in a small vase and a very small little bowl. Each person had their own individual peanuts so no germs! That was a good snack while waiting for the entrée.

13.description: I recently dined at 720 South Bar and Grill during a conference at the Hilton. The modern/chic ambiance and slightly lofty price tags tricked me into expecting a worthwhile, if not safe, meal. The reality is that 720's decor perfectly mirrors its fare: nicely-presented but wholly shallow. The steak I ordered, aside from being woefully over-cooked (nearly brown for a "medium" steak), was drenched in buttery, caramelized onions and a wedge of a buttery-cheese concoction. I realize that, on paper, this now sounds somewhat appetizing, but the actual dish tasted like the worst "Americanization" of steak frites possible. This is a dish that should rely largely on the subtle flavors of the beef, not saucy onions. Any buttery additions should be light and enhancing, not overblown and heavy. And then there were the "frites." Calling them that is an utter disservice to Belgian cuisine. These were simply generic, fried potato wedges with no seasoning at all, save some requisite salt. Nothing more to say here.I also had the opportunity to try the "720 Burger," which featured all sorts of meats combined together (beef, pork belly, short ribs, and so on). Again, the bun was too buttery, the meat heavy and well done (also ordered as "medium"), and the general effect was an "enticing on paper" dish rendered completely uninteresting to the taste buds.I cannot recommend 720 for anyone interested in anything more than a handy location and a lot of extra bills burning a hole in their pocket.

4.description: Ordinary food and ingredients with high price.  Edible for convenience and desperation.BURGER -- the only decent food to price selection.  So so.  Thick fries.  Thick tomatoes.SERVICE -- typical hotel restaurant...VERY SLOW.

24.description: The usual standard disclaimers apply to this review - if you happen to be staying in Chicago, and you are staying at the Chicago Hilton, the Blackstone, or the Essex Inn, and you like burgers, beer, and bourbon, you should consider the 720 for a dining and / or drinking option.Why?  Because the burger here is freaking unbelievable.  Order it medium rare, as it is a high quality, juicy steak cut, simply adorned with aged cheddar, and, as you see fit, lettuce, tomato, ketchup and mustard.  You can get a fried egg too, but resist the urge to gild.  I rarely finish a burger but I inhaled this one.  Rarely is a $15 hotel burger worth it, but this is the exception.  The fries are good, too, and the restaurant has some local beers on tap which I highly recommend, particularly the Metropolitan option.For cocktails, their rye manhattan is superb, made with "Rhode Island Rye", a brand with which I was not previously acquainted.  She was silky smooth and spicy, but sadly is cooped up all day long, for the bar does not open until 5 PM.  And it is because of that late opening time that I give this place three stars only; after all, what is the point of staying in a downtown hotel if you cannot start your lunch with a hearty Manhattan?Don Draper would have a thing or two to say to Conrad about that!

6.description: I was staying at the Hilton Chicago where this place is located. It was late, rainy outside, & I need something to eat. Thus I ended up here. The sliders & truffle fries on the menu caught my eye. Thank you for having your menu online. It was pretty empty & I found a server to inquire about placing a to go order. Since I knew what I wanted he took my order & gave me a class of water. Quick & easy. The bill was also brought out quickly before I even had food. A bit pricey for two sliders & truffle fries but that's what happens when one doesn't want to leave the hotel. My order came out pretty quickly & I took it to my room. The sliders were way smaller than any others I have had. For $6/each I expected them to be bigger than kids menu size. The truffle fries were tasty but way too much parmesan. It looked like the lid fall off the cheese shaker & no one cared to dust it off or make a new batch of fries. I shook off the excess myself. Hopefully I don't have to be subjected to this place again during my stay. Not worth the cost in my opinion.

15.description: Went here for breakfast with a buddy before a Bears game.  It was a typical breakfast buffet, best feature was the Omelette station.  Otherwise it was standard scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, french toast and some fruit.It got the job down and got us on to the game and a Chicago win but I wouldn't hurry back.

7.description: We ate here three times during our stay, twice for breakfast since it was included in our room and once for room service dinner.Pros:Good service for breakfast.Large buffet for breakfast including fresh fruit, french toast, meats, etc. and had an egg station to make any eggs you wanted.We went around eight and got seated right away, looks like there is a wait if you go later in the morning.Cons:Very expensive for room service. Dinner food is okay, I had the burger and it had a smell to it so I ate the fries but husband and kid liked their grilled cheese and chicken sandwich. When told not to put pickle, tomato, etc on the burger still came with it. We also order the chocolate cake which tasted pretty good but upon inspection of the backside, it looked like they were white chocolate and regular chocolate shavings, except the white chocolate was no longer white, it was brittle and kind of tan. We would go again for the breakfast but would not order for dinner.

8.description: We went here on Thanksgiving day and I would never go back.  The food was sub-par and the place was not busy at all yet it took forever to get a servers attention.  The only decent thing that we ate was the pie, but we saw them take the pies out of boxes, so they didn't even make it themselves.  If you're in the area and just want to order a cocktail you may be able to find use for this place, but do NOT go here to eat.  You will be utterly disappointed.

3.description: I'm surprised this place is rated so low but that may be because many reviewers talked about the food and I've only been here for drinks. I was staying at the Hilton for a few days and trying to meet up with as many friends as possible while I was in town. This lobby bar was a perfect meetup place as it was obviously super convenient for me and I loved the sleek modern ambiance. Out of 4 nights at the hotel, I went here twice. Both times, the staff was friendly and timely and the drinks were on point. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!

14.description: Service was so-so then it got pretty bad - had to ask for the check and then ask for the credit card to be taken away.  Food, overpriced, not bad, but not great.  Had the spinach salad with Shrimp.  Shrimp (3 or 4) were large and tasty.  Dressing on salad a bit goopy and not very inspired.  Did not even get bread with salad.

12.description: I just had my first waxing experience with Missy today and it was superb!  Thanks to all the other yelp reviews for helping me find her (and steer away from other choices).  In the past I'd always gone to Sisters, which is a fantastic place.  However, the location is really not that convenient for me, so I figured I'd give Ms Verve a try.  No disrespect to Sisters (like I said they're great), but now that I've tried Missy, I'll never go back.  This was easily the most painless wax I've ever had (don't get me wrong - no wax is painless, but this was a breeze compared to most).  She used a blend of different natural waxes and oils to sooth, and so far I'm having no irritation, which is just shy of a miracle for me!  She's also extremely warm and friendly, and makes you feel totally comfortable with the process.  I was expecting to pay a pretty penny for her service (and it would have been worth it), but then found out she has some amazing deals that brought the price down quite a bit.  Not only was it the best wax I've had, it was also the least expensive!!

7.description: She is really professional.  She knows what she is doing. And she puts her heart into what she is doing. Therefore I had a good experience.  I just had brazillian waxing today and It was painless. I am glad I found her on groupon.

19.description: The worst brazilian I have ever had. I was about 10 minutes late (whoops). Apparently she charges $10 when you're late by 10 minutes or more--doesn't post this anywhere. Because I was late, her next appointment arrived before I was done (again, my fault). While my vag was still covered in hot wax, she opened the door, and left the room to talk to her next client--not once, but twice (also, the client could not have been more than 5 feet from the door of the room I was in, AWKWARD). She was gone so long that the wax cooled. She then could NOT wax that area. She went over it and over it about 20 times. It was insanely painful. She went over most other areas more than once. It took forever and was the most painful brazilian ever. It hurt and itched for days afterward. She got ALL up in my business--much more so than any other waxer I've been to--which was a bit uncomfortable, and seemed unnecessary, but I would have been fine with it if she had been wearing gloves (seriously? disgusting). Absolutely do not go. I got a deal online, and it was sososo not worth it.

1.description: Okay let me start by saying, as a person, I find Missy absolutely wonderful. She's always been friendly and dynamic. Initially I went in for a Brazilian wax because of a groupon. I was so impressed with the service that I bought a package (her package prices really cannot be beat!)Now that I've purchased 3 packages and have been a client of hers for over a year, I must say the service seems to progressively gotten worse. The last three times I went there, it felt very rushed even though I have been on time and no other clients were waiting. I've had to pluck full patches of stray hair (OUCH!). It seems like she's trying to take off way too big patches of hair at once which is not only extremely painful, but it also leaves behind hair and wax. I was willing to keep with her and continue using her services seeing if things would improve, just because Missy really is so sweet and really seems to care about her clients. But this last visit sort of put the nail in the coffin for me. I've had a landing strip for the past four months and it seems like she forgot and just slathered the wax right on it. I tried telling her but it was already too late. She tried fixing it but it ended up too thin, off center, and crooked, so i just shaved the whole thing off after over a year of healthy skin down there from no shaving :-(.I tip every time (20% of her full price) so I really have no idea why things have gotten worse over time. I feel as though repeat clients should be getting the best service, not the old bait and switch. I think I still have 1 or 2 sessions left on my package, but after this last visit I don't think i'll be returning to Ms Verve to redeem those.

2.description: Great wax and deal. Getting a brazilian is never a comfortable situation, but Ms Verve takes your mind off it by asking questions and being funny. Really love this place!

9.description: At 3.30 today, I had my appointment with Ms. Missy. I was a little scared because it was my first wax of any sort. I arrived about 20 minutes early, which wasn't a problem at all. Ms. Missy sat me down, we chatted a bit and I filled out the form that she needed. So far, I was beginning the experience was not what I expected! I expected to be waiting in a room with other customers and for her to be rushed. After about 15 minutes of talking, we proceeded into the room, which was right off of the main area. It was a smaller, more intimate room that was nicely decorated with supportive words on the lights! Ms. Missy talked to me the entire time, easing all my worries. She was so sweet and sincere. She genuinely wants to have a relationship with her clients and get to know you! I will be coming back again and again.

6.description: All around fantastic. Convenient location just one block off of Michigan, clean boutique location, outstanding customer service, and, best of all, fast and relatively painless. Loved my first time so much, I purchased a package - one of the best deals I've ever seen in Chicago!

18.description: My friend suggested this place to me. She knew i was looking to find a good waxer and raved about Ms. Missy and the business, so I went for it. I have never had a Brazilian and was pretty unsure of what to expect. The office itself is small ( in the words of my friend "you dont need a lot of space for whats about to go down") , but has a very relaxing feel to it. Ms. Missy was very kind, explanatory, and dealt with my lack of pain tolerance! I couldn't have asked for a better first experience. It definitely hurt my first time around (not because of her, but because of the obvious waxing part), but I went back for my second yesterday and it was WORLDS better. I was in and out in literally less than 10 minutes. Scheduling is crazy easy online, and the location is conveniently located near several CTA lines. Very affordable, very professional and clean, and Ms. Missy is very, very sweet and (most importantly when it comes to waxing your lady parts) works quickly! I will definitely be going back for the foreseeable future :)

10.description: Today was my second out of a five pack I purchased directly through Missy. My first braz was in December with her, a little skeptical of having one done, but it turned out better than expected. First and foremost, she has a spot on balance of personal and professional. She can hold a conversation while she's taken care of business- which keeps your mind off whats really going on. Second of all, her space is easy to get to, cute, and convenient. Lastly, her work is great and it lasted just about as long as I hoped it would. Oh! And very affordable compared to other downtown businesses. Highly recommend Missy.

13.description: I had my first Brazilian wax today, it was needless to say nerve wrecking. However, despite from the last minute booking, Missy was inviting, soothing and professional. It was shorter and less painful than I expected. I couldn't ask more for my awesome first experience, I will definetely be coming back after my travels! Thanks, Missy!

16.description: I went here for a Brazilian wax. This is my second wax. I really love Ms. Missy. She was so nice and professional. 5 stars for her! She  made sure I was comfortable and gave me a mirror to make sure she got everything.My 2 star review is for how my skin reacted the next day. My skin was very tender and there were little red bumps around the area that looked like my skin was breaking out. I did not have this reaction when I went to Mario Tricoci's for my first wax. I'm pretty sure it's the wax. I don't know if I can take the chance and come back again because of how my skin reacted  :-(

17.description: Ok I really do not know why Ms. Missy has such terrible reviews! I love her and her quality of work! I honestly would never go anywhere else! I bought 2 deals on YOUSWOOP and good thing I did! I went to here the first time and I was so nervous but she made me feel so welcome. I thought it was gonna be the most awkward thing in the world, but because how friendly and hospitable Ms. Missy is, conversations flowed and she was done before I even knew it. I have the most sensitive skin in the world! I will break out if I go to a swimming pool, bug bites would get huge and red and blister, some lotions and skin care products will either make me break out or make my skin rip apart. If my super hyper sensitive skin didn't have ANY issues with the waxing, I don't know how other people did. She's never had to go over the same place more than twice and that's only happened once, so I mean I don't think you can blame her for your stubborn hairs. Let's face everyone's bodies are and react in different ways so I don't think it's really Ms. Missy's fault. She even accepted my second voucher that was expired by 5 months! She truly is the best and I would definitely recommend her to everyone!

15.description: Had a brazillian here this morning, and it was hands down the fastest, least painful wax I have ever gotten! Missy is very sweet, chatty, and knows what she is doing! Super affordable, clean, and professional! This is where you should take your bikini region for some TLC!

0.description: I had an extremely positive experience with Missy. She does her very best to make you comfortable while also talking to you the whole time to keep you distracted from the pain. I echo so many of the positive sentiments, as I also had a great experience. I came in because of a groupon and needed a wax before going on vacation. Sometimes companies/vendors make a fuss about accepting groupons but she made it so simple (as it should be!). I will return for all future waxes. Highly highly recommended!

5.description: A friend of mine recommended this place and I'm so glad she did.  Not only did it come highly recommended but I also had a Groupon. WINNING!!!  I've become a fan of Brazilian wax and Missy did an awesome job.  Although I got there 15 min late she was still very accommodating and was able to get me done in 10 min.  And she did a great and painless job. I was a little nervous at first but she made me feel really relaxed.  So...u may ask why 4 stars.  Well my only concern is that the Brazilian does not include waxing my stomach. Not sure why I would wax all that area and not get my stomach done...which will show hair when wearing a bikini.  Shouldn't that be part of the wax.  IJS!   But I will be back cause she super nice.  I just hate paying extra to get my stomach waxed.  Oh well.

11.description: Missy was very professional and made sure I was as comfortable as possible with my lady parts in a strangers face. She was quick and knowledgeable about the steps I should take to keep ingrown hair away.

8.description: Ms. Missy is awesome! I just started getting Brazilian waxes this year and Ms. Missy has been a great and professional guide. She is very attentive, knows how to put you at ease, and never fails to address any issues you may have (such as cleaning up/getting missed spots/hairs) without offense or attitude. At my first visit I thought it was weird that she kept talking to me throughout the entire thing, but she knows what she is doing and knows exactly how to keep your mind occupied while your "area down below" is going through pain. But, I have to say the experience with her is much less painful than I anticipated and I am getting used to this regimen more and more after each visit. I actually enjoy our conversations. Ms. Missy is sweet, patient, and super funny and I always leave satisfied and feel taken care of. A great person and a great place! I wholeheartedly recommend her!

3.description: My first time getting and Brazilian Wax and meeting Ms. Verve.....AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!! She was so sweet, she talked to me through-out the whole process to comfort me. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, private and relaxing experience. I felt so comfortable with her!!! I told her I'm her new client and will be going back every 4 weeks. I have my next 3 months booked for Brazilian and Underarm Wax. I'm her client for-life now!!!!

14.description: Missy is fantastic! She is very skilled at both her art and customer service. Her internal special is also a steal!

4.description: I normally only get Brazilians for special occasions, but my groupon is about to expire and Memorial Day is around the corner so I figured why not. I had an appointment scheduled for 6:00 with Ms Missy. I was on time and so was she.The spot itself is very small and appears to have 2 rooms and a very small waiting area. That doesn't bother me since I just want to get in and get out.I'm not going to lie Brazilians are painful, but Ms Missy is so sweet and does everything possible to make you comfortable and alleviate the pain. She did go over a couple spots more than once, but it's just because she seems like a perfectionist and wants to do good work. I was very satisfied with the results and will go back....eventually. Ha can't take this pain all the time. Also as a side note I like the signs on the ceiling RELAX and BREATHE

3.description: This place is wonderful! If your looking for a deep tissue massage that will hit all your trigger points this is the place for you!!!I called at 8:30 am and they were able to accommodate me by making an appointment at 10:30 am! I absolutely loved that! I walked in and everyone was so friendly! My therapist was Jennifer! She is AMAZING! I felt so much better after my massage! I am Definitely coming back to her! She knew exactly all my tense spots without telling her! This place is clean, friendly, professional and top notch! No one will be disappointed!

1.description: I really had a great massage here! I only went here once over this past weekend and I literally walked out of there feeling like a noodle. LOL! My massage therapist was Sheila - I think she may have been new. I had a 90-minute massage and enjoyed every minute of it. I really didn't have anything specific that I wanted her to work on so she massaged me from neck to feet. She did detect that I had more tension on my right shoulder and she gave that area a lot of attention. Some spots she applied firm pressure, but was very accommodating and made sure that I wasn't uncomfortable. The bed warmers are a bonus too! I specified that she not work on glutes or pecs but I still had a very good full body massage. I think next time I will get a 60-minute massage because the 90-minute will make you not want to leave and become so relaxed that you will struggle to drive home :-(The front desk receptionist Evelyn was super friendly and made it not feel like an uppity spa.
