2.description: Ok so - I have very sensitive skin. Not fake sensitive skin - after I go try on clothes at a department store i have welts like I have been in a war with a raptor. Hence, my wax experiences have not been so good - I always leave with a bit of skin missing - until now. Skye is amazing - Quick, thorough and she uses a combination of waxes and gels that dull the pain and sanitize the area. I am very pleased. I did my research on yelp before buying a groupon for my first service, the space is small but welcoming - she did not disappoint.

18.description: I went to Skye on the recommendation of a coworker for a Brazilian wax. It was my first time, so I was---rightfully--a little scared. Listen to me-- DO NOT BE. Whether or not you've had this done before plays no part in my opinion. Skye is INCREDIBLE. She is funny, warm, gentle, hygienic, and GREAT at what she does. I absolutely can't wait to schedule another appointment. She immediately made me feel comfortable and like we were old friends, and even gave me a sweet little hug on my way out. Seriously-- make her part of your routine, and tip her nicely.

41.description: Skye is fabulous! It was my first time getting a Brazilian and she made it super easy. I purchased the 2 for $45 Groupon but her regular prices are still great at $25. Also since I got in a little early, she had me done before my initial appointment time. I highly recommend her!

50.description: I went to Skye Rose with a Groupon for a Brazilian and was happy when I got there because she was very nice and easy to talk to but after the wax I had to go to the bathroom to wipe myself down because I still had wax on and it was sticking to my clothes. She mentioned that she doesn't use tweezers and so there were patches which was okay I guess. The part that I was upset about was that when she started the wax she told me the wax was going to be a little hot but that it should be fine but 2 days after the wax I looked down and my skin was flaky and was peeling. Also I was sore for a couple of days because she took a little bit of skin off... I was looking forward to going back because she gave me a good deal for next time but there is no way I'm going back no matter how nice or how cheap it was. Looks like I got what I paid for.

4.description: Super professional, almost painless... I would definitely be using her services all the time. Prices are amazing and she offer great deals! Her website is very easy to use. 2 thumbs up to Skye Rose Skin care and waxing!!

6.description: Skye is amazing! I love her. Probably the most pain-free* wax I've ever had. And she's quick and lovely too. Definitely recommend Skye. Her prices are very reasonable too.(*waxing is never truly pain-free, but this is pretty close).

22.description: I purchased a Groupon for a Brazillian wax with Skye Rose before a vacation and was extremely pleased with my experience. She was very professional and I did a very thorough job. I was really happy with the end results and enjoyed chatting with her through the appointment. I'll absolutely be going back.

15.description: Great service for a first timer getting a Brazilian (oh, already TMI).  Missy took great care of me in the clean facility.  Very professional and did not make an awkward experience, awkward, if that makes any sense.  I called a few places, none would take men.  Anyway, I did it (for running), quite pleased!  I highly recommend!

20.description: Love her! Extremely down to earth and very professional. Professional meaning, respectful of my time, clean office space, personable, and explanation of products. Highly recommended!

36.description: Skye is amazing! She's very personable and knowledgable - instantly felt comfortable with her, not to mention it was the least painful waxing session I've ever had! Quick too! Highly recommend her, prices are very affordable as well. Definitely returning, thanks Skye!

14.description: Very friendly and professional. Skye is great

58.description: Great beer, whiskey and scotch selection! Service was great and the staff were really friendly. Just visiting Chicago but I love this place. The poutine fries was delicious!

56.description: Great BLT and fries and great staff who helped me sort through their awesome brew selection!

29.description: Another visit, early Thursday afternoon, when the bar was very lightly patronized.  This time my lunch choice was a new item on the menu, cactus chili.  Ground beef, corn, and navy beans; the "cactus" part appeared to be not nopalito pads but rolled-up greenery which might have been taken for green onions, really more a garnish than a flavor element.  Mildly seasoned, with the spicery dominated by cumin rather than hot peppers.  Pretty tasty; I'd order it again.Onward to the beer.  I sampled six new items, including a flight of four samplers:- Saugatuck Neapolitan Milk Stout.  5.9%.  Opaque dark brown, light head.  Minimal nose, mostly bitter chocolate.  The taste is bitter chocolate, vanilla, and a definite strawberry note--certainly something I've never before encountered in a stout.  Creamy nitro mouth feel.- Three Floyds Lord Rear Admiral ESB.  6.4%.  Dark amber, light head.  Hoppy aroma.  Bittering hop taste, with a sour apricot note; long bitter fade.- Cahoots Brewing Amen Barleywine.  10%.  Cloudy red-brown, medium head.  Light nose with a hint of something fruity.  Malt-forward, bitter-chocolate and peach notes.  - Thr Bruery Autumn Maple.  10%.  Cloudy amber-bronze, light head.  Sweet, spicy nose, with just a touch of...chlorine???  In the style of a pumpkin seasonal, but actually brewed with yams rather than pumpkin among the fermentables.  I don't think that in a blind tasting my first reaction would have been "Ah, yes, yams," but, knowing they're there, I did detect (or imagine) a subtle difference from the familiar pumpkin.  Sweet pie-spice taste; I couldn't detect maple.- Crazy Mountain Lawyers, Guns and Money Barleywine.  10%.  Clear amber, light head.  "Cat pee" hop nose.  Good balance of sweet malt and bittering hops, with a slight salty note.  Less ethanol presence than the ABV figure would suggest.- Founders Devil Dancer.  12%.  A rather pretty red-amber, with a heavy head fading to "Belgian lace."  Ester and ethanol nose, with a bit of "fruit cocktail."  A solid malt base is nevertheless almost overwhelmed by intense bittering hops.  Here too ethanol is not as much of a flavor element as might be expected based on the wine-level ABV..

42.description: I dare someone to try the Black Stout which contains 17% alcohol and you have to send me a pic(or it is not true) that you actually drank it and I WILL personally buy you 3 rounds of drinks and I'm by being sarcastic . Anyhow, the beer selection is quite enormous with many Local beers on tap, and they have Mikkeller beer which is a good highlight to have in tap. I have NOT tried the burgers but I hear good things about it but I figured one burger taste like any other burger but I will try it next time.I enjoy the theme of this tavern, big bar stools nice and clean bar and restaurant area. They have tvs to watch football/basketball/baseball and if any restaurant doesn't have a tv to watch sports they don't belong in Chicago... Plus Cubbies adding to World Series!

23.description: I wish I didn't have to leave a low star rating, but I always rate by the food I receive, not the service and experience. Feeling a little adventurous, I thought I'd try First Draft pizza seeing as it got some other positive reviews here. I ordered pickup and my pizza was ready in 30 minutes, awesome! Brought it home and opened it up, not really what I was expecting, but what matters is how it tastes. The best way to describe this pizza is an identity crisis. I ordered it with boar sausage and sopressata (dry cured salami). These toppings are something that I'd expect from a Neapolitan brick oven style. They have some pretty bold flavors that are enjoyable, perhaps better off the pizza. I have no other way to describe the crust, but reminiscent of Little Caesars, although made in-house. The sauce is pretty bland; it's mostly dry tomato paste with some seasoning. The cheese was undercooked. When all of the above is combined, it just simply did not work. Pizza aside, First Draft is a really enjoyable down-to-earth spot with a great beer selection and friendly staff. It is definitely the type of neighborhood bar that you'd take your friends when you're not sure where to watch a game or grab some brews. Perhaps their other offerings would be a go-to at a future visit. Next time I feel adventurous and want to try a new pizza joint, I will do just that.

47.description: Good god, the beer selection here is amazing.I've had very little in the way of food from First Draft (though, both times I have gotten food, it was fantastic. Especially the squeakers, oh my god.) What primarily brings me out is the beer selection, which is one of the best that I've seen in the city. Was it worth waiting for them to open for a year? Yeah, definitely. (Though I just wish they had opened before I moved out of the dorm across the street, but alas. I'm sure my wallet's thankful that they didn't.)They have a truly mind boggling amount of draft beer on their menu in a wide variety of styles and will even mix beers for you (which I definitely recommend in some cases. They don't have Lagunitas's cappucino stout right now, but when they did, mixing it with a vanilla porter was my go-to if I didn't want to try something new). And really, it's nice to look at a beer menu and feel compelled to get something new every time, especially when there's such a variety.

8.description: Visited here recently and we left very disappointed. My husband and I stopped in for a quick bite and a drink. It took about 20 minutes to get our first drink and an appetizer of hummus. Then, we waited almost an hour for our entrees, a sandwich and a salad. No one was really ordering food, and there wasn't much of a crowd, but all of a sudden four tables worth of food just come pouring out of the kitchen. Including one table that ordered their food maybe ten minutes before their food was delivered. To top it off, his sandwich was not cooked properly. Our waitress could tell we were disappointed and took it back. She came out abut five minutes later with a totally fresh sandwich. Not sure why it took an hour the first time. The manager was drinking at the bar. The servers and staff were sipping from Starbucks cups, standing around. And we never got a decent apology. It was our second time there after a very pleasant first trip. We won't be back and unfortunately this seems to be the case with several bars in the area: poor service and very overpriced bar food.

31.description: Good spot. Easy walk from my hotel. Tons of beers on tap. Burger was really good. TV's everywhere. Good spot.

34.description: Probably more like 3.5 stars. The beer selection was excellent.  The service was alright, there was only one person doing double duty handling tables and bartending.  We ordered burgers and pizza, the food was good but not amazing, the atmosphere is great, clean and a lot of televisions, definitely won't miss a game no matter where you sit.

16.description: This nice little cozy bar we found off Yelp!! It was our first time to downtown CHI and wanted something walkable (in the snow) from our hotel. Thanks to Yelp we found this perfect place. Everyone was friendly! OMG their poutine fries r to die for!!!! Totally would come back here if I'm ever in town. Btw they have 64+ beers on tap!!!

13.description: Another visit, early Thursday afternoon, when the bar was very lightly patronized.  This time my lunch choice was a new item on the menu, cactus chili.  Ground beef, corn, and navy beans; the "cactus" part appeared to be not nopalito pads but rolled-up greenery which might have been taken for green onions, really more a garnish than a flavor element.  Mildly seasoned, with the spicery dominated by cumin rather than hot peppers.  Pretty tasty; I'd order it again.Onward to the beer.  I sampled six new items, including a flight of four samplers:- Saugatuck Neapolitan Milk Stout.  5.9%.  Opaque dark brown, light head.  Minimal nose, mostly bitter chocolate.  The taste is bitter chocolate, vanilla, and a definite strawberry note--certainly something I've never before encountered in a stout.  Creamy nitro mouth feel.- Three Floyds Lord Rear Admiral ESB.  6.4%.  Dark amber, light head.  Hoppy aroma.  Bittering hop taste, with a sour apricot note; long bitter fade.- Cahoots Brewing Amen Barleywine.  10%.  Cloudy red-brown, medium head.  Light nose with a hint of something fruity.  Malt-forward, bitter-chocolate and peach notes.  - Thr Bruery Autumn Maple.  10%.  Cloudy amber-bronze, light head.  Sweet, spicy nose, with just a touch of...chlorine???  In the style of a pumpkin seasonal, but actually brewed with yams rather than pumpkin among the fermentables.  I don't think that in a blind tasting my first reaction would have been "Ah, yes, yams," but, knowing they're there, I did detect (or imagine) a subtle difference from the familiar pumpkin.  Sweet pie-spice taste; I couldn't detect maple.- Crazy Mountain Lawyers, Guns and Money Barleywine.  10%.  Clear amber, light head.  "Cat pee" hop nose.  Good balance of sweet malt and bittering hops, with a slight salty note.  Less ethanol presence than the ABV figure would suggest.- Founders Devil Dancer.  12%.  A rather pretty red-amber, with a heavy head fading to "Belgian lace."  Ester and ethanol nose, with a bit of "fruit cocktail."  A solid malt base is nevertheless almost overwhelmed by intense bittering hops.  Here too ethanol is not as much of a flavor element as might be expected based on the wine-level ABV..

11.description: 64 beers on tap, good food and fair prices! I stumbled across this place on the beer menus app when I was looking out for a particular beer. I'm a beer geek and always looking for new places to go, especially on Blackhawks game nights since I go to most of the games and like to have a few beers and eat dinner before getting to the UC. I was able to park right in front (metered parking) at around 4pm on a Thursday. They had good specials for Blackhawks or Bulls game days and a lot of great craft beer at good prices. My wife and I shared the buffalo chicken sandwich which was very good. We substituted the mac & cheese for fries which was tasty. I'm not sure how long this place has been around but it's a great-looking bar and restaurant. Service at the bar was friendly and helpful. First Draft is a great alternative to Madison Street bars before games at the UC. We will definitely be back.

39.description: The food is delicious and the beer selection is top notch. The Chicago style wings are delicious. Very flavorful and well cooked. If you're like me and like to read at the bar on occasion, this is a good spot. The music isn't obnoxiously loud.

37.description: So my boyfriend and I sort of found this place by accident. We were looking for lunch at a bar near a conference we were at, and we sort of went mostly based off of location. But wow did we get lucky! The bar looks really clean, it has a great vibe and they played good music. The waitress/bartender was super friendly and attentive! They had an amazing beer list and the bartender was knowledgeable about them to boot. Now on to the food... Which was delicious. I had the first draft burger, and let me tell you, that beer cheese is amazing! My boyfriend had the 34 Hanger steak sandwich, which he practically inhaled it was so good. I think the best part about the food was how well the burger and steak were cooked. We like our meat on the medium-rare to rare side and it's hard to find places that actually cook it like that, and First Draft certainly did! I would definitely recommend this place! It was the first place we went to eat at in Chicago and it definitely started the trip off right!

0.description: Fantastic neighborhood sports bar with food and drinks that will surprise you, (in a good way!)First Draft has a great vibe and definitely fits the south loop feel. I was amazed by the extensive beer list, especially the amount of beers on tap. There are also great selections of spirits to choose from.But don't miss out on the food, which is above average. And if you're there during a Hawks or Bulls game, it's half price pizzas and $4 beer specials.Mix all of this with a friendly, helpful staff and you've got yourself a winner.

38.description: I made this place the Last Draft of the night after touring some other beer locations and having earlier dinner with friends.  This place in the South Loop has it going on.  The draft beer list is quite good.  They had some great Bell's limited edition and some seasonal Oktoberfest beers that were unique.  The location is pretty large with lots of seating and tables.  The staff are super friendly and efficient.  I will be back.

51.description: Love this place. Its our after work hang out spot.  My friends love to come here because of the large variety of drinks that they have here.  I'm more of a foodie and I thought their food here was pretty delicious. So far I've tried the first draft burger, the chicken wings, fried pickles and the cheese curds. All delicious!  Service was good and they even allowed us to do separate checks for our group of 8.  They have specials on Tuesdays for half off chicken wings. Lots of TVs and good comfortable seating. I'm sure we will be back soon.

27.description: Great beer selection here covering just about all pallettes. Chicken wings were good, grilled after they were sauced so they were not soggy. Caesar dressing could use a little more lemon to cut the mayo base.I sat at the bar, which was the perfect place to watch a Blackhawk game. The bartenders, Amanda and Ashley rocked it, making great beer suggestions. I'll be back for the Stone Brewing event next week.

32.description: This place has a great beer selection, really good food and for the sports fan an amazing array of screens that will allow you to never miss a moment of the excitement. I did have one mishap with my bill but the owners handle it and were more than awesome. This will be a spot ! frequent!!

54.description: Really bad customer service.. Barely said 2 words to me and my guest while I was there.

48.description: This is a great place to go if you like craft beer and burgers. It is a popular bar in the area and can get crowded at times but still has a great atmosphere. Lots of TVs to watch games.

44.description: Four stars for huge beer list, knowledgeable staff, and beer cheese soup unlike any other.

24.description: The manager contacted me and apologized about the inconvenience. I will try again soon.

7.description: Fun times at First Draft! 20 TVs will keep any sports fan happy. They have a whole lot of items on their beer list, and the food is of the high-casual low-fancy fare. The food is priced reasonably and tastes pretty good. Meatballs in marinara sauces is hardly ever a disappointment. And the happy hour deals are great! Their menu items and deals make it easy to try a variety of different drinks and appetizers. I like the beer samplers. Fun times!

49.description: We ventured to this local establishment right around the corner from our hotel.  The place is small but loved the open doors along the south side of the building to allow the evening breeze to flow through.  Ordered the poutine and mac n cheese with bacon.  Both were flavorful and rich, but not over the top.  The beer selection is top notch.  Our waitress was super friendly and very knowledgeable about the beers being featured.  If you are a beer nerd or a foodie, definitely worth checking out!

40.description: This is my go to bar/restaurant at least once a week.  The staff is the best around.  Everyone who works at First Draft must have memorized the beer and food menu  because they are just THAT GOOD at giving  the best suggestions for the kind of drink or food one is in the mood for.  I'm always impressed with how fast the wait staff is considering the huge crowds that come in on big game days.  The bartending staff is beyond great!  They are the best.  The food is excellent which is hard to find at an establishment that has so many drink selections. I also find that even if it's crowded, the staff is very on top of the tables of people who are wrapping up soon and keeping the people waiting updated.  I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes on an extremely busy weekend to be seated.  Also a GREAT place to catch a game to watch.  They have an abundance of televisions.

53.description: First of all, the service is abysmal. We waited 20 minutes after we ordered our drinks to order our food---meanwhile, our waitress went to another table at least 5 times while we sat and waited  The food is also very sub par. The fried pickles are pickle spears which is the worst. The pretzel bun I received was completely ripped in half so I had to eat my burger with a fork and knife! Everyone raves about the draft selection---two beers that I ordered were no longer served!It was just one thing after another here. Do not recommend. (Bus boy was lovely)

30.description: I love this place as my neighborhood bar around the corner. They have TONS of beer on tap and always give good suggestions (sometimes they let me try a sip before I commit to a whole glass). They have pretty good food too - some of my favorites are the South Loop Pizza, the Spinach salad with salmon, and a seasonal watermelon caprese salad they had this summer. It's small inside, so it gets crowded sometimes if you don't get there early.

46.description: This is a great place all around.  We do not usually come to this part of Chicago when we visit, and I am glad we did.  First Draft has a great atmosphere and character if you want a good bar to just sit and socialize or watch sports.  We came to also try some of the food, which looked very interesting (thank you reviewers!).  We had the Poutine among other things.  The food was fantastic but the Poutine was to die for, so that is what I remember most (and I eat mostly veggies).  The manager and bartenders are very friendly, great draft beer with a good selection.  I highly recommend if you are in the area.

1.description: My dad and I had a mixed experience here last evening. We arrived around 5:00 and found a half-full, welcoming space with plenty of room. We were offered a window seat and quickly got full menus, which boasted day-of specials for Bulls and Hawks games. Several TVs showed a variety of sporting events, and our high-top table was surprisingly roomy and comfortable. The bar filled up later, so I recommend grabbing a table before 6 on Friday nights.Our server was friendly but confused not only about when the specials happened (she wasn't aware there was a Bulls game that night) but which beers were offered at $4. We asked her to list them and she mentioned a few then vaguely pointed to our menus. Most of her sentences ended with sound effects. She seemed to infer that any 16oz beer would be offered at $4, so some of the ones I ended up ordering were full price. Not only that, they were served in 12oz glasses, which was confusing and disappointing.The food was worth our time, though. The honey-sriracha porksicles were tender and lovely with just the right amount of heat. Our salads were packed with spinach instead of what most restaurants do - iceberg - so they were a really great pick. And the pizza came out fresh and hot - they even modified it slightly so we could get the spicy condiment on only half!Overall, this is worth a try. Just do some hard-core investigating on the specials so you're not surprised when the bill comes.

55.description: This became our go-to spot while staying in the south loop.  Great beer selection, free snacks late night, and the food we ordered one night was also delicious.  You won't find a better bar in this area.

9.description: Between hitting the Art Institute and heading to Northerly Island for a concert, my boyfriend and I had several hours to kill. Normally we'd wander and see where we ended up, but it was pouring outside with no sign of stopping. We ducked under a construction awning and pulled up Yelp, and First Draft sounded like an excellent place to kill time.When we arrived, there were only a couple people at the bar and a large table full at the back, so we didn't feel like we needed to rush at any time to clear the table. We started with a couple of drinks and poutine - fries, beer gravy, queso, and brisket. The fries were a bit undercooked but the rest of the dish was tasty. We had another drink and chit-chatted and watched the ten TVs in our vicinity - this would be a great place to watch a game. After another hour or so we decided to put in our dinner order. My boyfriend built his own burger, and I went with the Southern Fried Chicken sandwich, subbing cheddar for American. Delicious. The chicken was moist, the cheddar melty, and the pickles crisp. The fries were much better this time, though I only ate a few due to my previous poutine gorge and being full from the large sandwich and drinks beforehand. Customer service at First Draft was great - our server was attentive but wasn't pushing us to order or move along. On our way, I flagged down a bus boy and asked if he could get us two large trash bags for the rain. He did, and they were a life-saver until we found ponchos (and, frankly, a boon even after - the poncho/garbage bag combo ended up being crucial). If you have time to kill, First Draft is first choice.

26.description: Great beer selection, three floyds on tap. Tvs everywhere. Nice ambiance. Some of the best chicken wings I've had. Highly recommended.

25.description: One of the most impressive tap-lists in the area.  Come in for a beer, and then plan to spend 30 minutes picking which one you want to actually have.

12.description: Numerous reviewers seem to indicate that this place has the best draft list in Chicago. If that's truly the case then it doesn't speak well for Chicago, as where I'm from in SE Michigan there are a number of bars with more extensive lists. With that being said, the list here WAS quite solid and the prices were reasonable considering the location. I would not hesitate to drink here again. In fact, I drank here no less than three times during my recent weekend long trip to the Windy City.The service was always cordial and one late night bartender was extremely friendly. The kind of guy you could easily shoot the shit with all night if things were slow. I dug the decor as well. Kind of like an unpretentious sports bar with lots of hard woods a la a converted prefab Irish pub.I ordered some lunch one day of the food menu. The "first DRAFT". By the menu description I thought it was going to be some sort of BLT-like creation with a fried egg and beer cheese and some other over-indulgent crap on it. As soon as I ordered it the bartender asked how I wanted it cooked. Then it dawned on me I had just ordered a freaking 1/2 lb burger loaded with everything but the kitchen sink. It was pretty darned tasty but truthfully would have been better suited to the end of the night, too soak up the tail end of a bender, than it would have been as a lunchtime gut bomb. Duly noted for next time.

59.description: If you are looking to try some good beers then this is the place. The burguers were amazing,  the maple glazed bacon was outrageous and we decided to have some fries and some roasted sparragus as well,  they were both super good options.

21.description: Beer selection is great! Bartenders are friendly and quick. If you like social settings for sporting events, their tv layout is phenomenal. The only reason I am deducting a star is because the food is sub-par. I have eaten their twice and both times my food tastes like week old fry oil, that dirty taste is the worst.

17.description: We came here for drinks pre-dinner reservations to kill time, not expecting much. We definitely were surprised! Such a great little bar! Super great service and the bar food was amazing! We had fries and onion rings. The batter on the onion rings is top notch and the garlic aioli for dipping really sets them off. Try the vanilla bean Amber ale by pig minds brewing. Great little spot for snacks and drinks!

10.description: Great spot and great food. Been wanting to go here for a while and just got around to it tonight. Atmosphere was good and the beer list was more than anyone could ask for. There was a slight accident with our pizza (not the restaurants fault) and they made us a brand new one even though most of the other one was fine. They also have a really good special for when the Blackhawks and bills are playing!

5.description: We decided to hit up the First Draft on the way to the Bears game. Since we were staying in River North we decided it would be best to get a few drinks closer to the stadium. It is about 1.5 miles to the stadium but I wanted a good selection of craft beers and this place came up on yelp.It has an expansive list of craft beers that I have not had a chance to sample before so that made me happy and all at a good price.The food was good, but nothing spectacular as I had a fried chicken sandwich.If you are in the neighborhood and want good craft beer might as well check this place out.For more information and pictures check out our site : thegreatcubeescape.com

3.description: What a great bar! I came here back in Nov 2015 for a quick lunch and a flight of good beer and I found both of them here. The beer selection is really great and they have a lot of dark, heavy, flavorful brews and I was quite impressed with the selection. My turkey sandwich was also very good and was a great compliment to the beer. The service was great and I would definitely recommend coming here if you like good beer!

35.description: Food was not tasty. The chicken in my sandwich was too hard, not sure if old or over fried. I asked them for a price adjustment because I couldn't eat a few parts of the chicken, and they gave me 10% discount off the sandwich, which came down to $1 decrease only! Otherwise it's a nice place with many screens and good service.

19.description: Good beer, great food, and great atmosphere. Was in town for work, from San Diego. Staff was very friendly and offered advice on what to do in the area for fun. Food was delicious, was looking for something Midwest and this really hit the spot!

28.description: One of my favorite places to eat in South Loop.  Don't be scared by the sports theme, the kitchen is better than anywhere in a 1 mile radius!  I cannot remember life before porksicles, you have changed me forever. Also, the fried chicken sandwich is nothing less than a work of art.  Not a beer drinker, but their selection is A+ and will satisfy the most selective of connoisseurs.Probably the best sports bar in the South Loop, and one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood, too.

45.description: I love First Draft!  Food options are great, they always have my favorite beer available, and the atmosphere is perfect for watching your favorite sporting contest!The staff and service are very welcoming and will treat you like family.  Bartenders Chevrolet and Daniel are now my best friends.Amanda makes a mean watermelon vodka, definitely ask her for one the next time you're there!

33.description: Thanks Yelp. Some friends and I headed to Soldier Field to get tickets to the Bears Raiders game.  After getting there and seeing the ticket selection 2 of my friends decided to go to the game and me and another friend decided not to spend the extra cash so we grabbed a cab, opened yelp and found this sports bar right around the corner.  When we walked in it was not crazy busy and we were able to get a table in the center of the bar where we could comfortably see 5 different games.  This place has not only an extensive beer list but a very good whiskey menu as well.  I would recommend it if those are your drinks of choice.  We stuck to the beer as we were drinking for the long haul. I really like that their menu is broken up by styles and what is popular in the bar at the time. Also the beers are served in specific glasses for the style of beer which will enhance the flavor and experience.The only food item we tried were the fried cheese curds and they were pretty good.  Large curds with a heavy batter but it was suitable for the size of the curds.  Decent ranch but not spectacular.  If I end up in Chicago again this would probably be my Sunday sports bar of choice.

43.description: First Draft has become a go-to of mine in the South Loop (after the gym, after anything at Soldier Field). I've been here a bunch of the past couple of months and I can now confirm that the food is pretty good (specifically the Turkey Burger).  Also, the service is always good here. I dig it here.

2.description: Stopped in here recently mainly because I was curious what happened to the "old Villains" space. The new owners stuck a sports bar in it and kept all the draft lines, adding some windows and removing the cheesy rock n' roll decor. Minor improvements, and they also put in a nice custom back bar. Service at the bar was a bit of a hassle. It took almost 20 minutes to get a drink when the bar was half empty. They were out of the first 2 beers I ordered, then weren't sure if I could order a beer smaller than a pint just to try it. After seeing a flight of beers on the bar, they remembered they do flights, so i'd have to order 4 beers at a time. I asked for 3 and a dealer's choice, which turned out to be Founders Project Pam, which was not good. Maybe they were new, i'll give the frazzled bartender the benefit of the doubt. Didn't try the food, but it looks like your average fried pub grub. The beer selection was good, and i'd return another time but my experience didn't make the greatest first impression. 3.5 stars.

18.description: Great beer selection here covering just about all pallettes. Chicken wings were good, grilled after they were sauced so they were not soggy. Caesar dressing could use a little more lemon to cut the mayo base.I sat at the bar, which was the perfect place to watch a Blackhawk game. The bartenders, Amanda and Ashley rocked it, making great beer suggestions. I'll be back for the Stone Brewing event next week.

41.description: Lively bar in the loop, decent selection of draught beers, and one of the few open bars on a Monday night past midnight.  Did not eat here but will give it a try next time I am in Chicago.

52.description: Great place.  They had a special for a burger and beer for $12. The waitress was a little off and did not explain the special until I asked.  She was new, did not know Stone was a U.S. Brewery, (I live about 40 min from Stone Brewery).  But the burger was done just right and the selection of local beers was great!Nice atmosphere. Well cared for local pub type good food.

50.description: Love this place! Always friendly, good food and an OUTSTANDING Bourbon list. I'm not a big beer drinker but they have a great selection of beers on tap as well. I always discover some kind of beer I never knew I would like.  First Draft is everything a neighborhood bar should be, and the prices are also fair. I enjoy supporting neighborhood establishments & this has become one of my favorites.

4.description: Came in here for a Sunday Morning BLoody mary and was treated to a good one. The place itself was clean and the large windows allowed for some great street watching. Why did i give this place 5 stars? Because the bartenders. 2 females behind the bar offered great conversation while we were there. i wish i could write more but like i said only stopped in for a Bloody Mary. Would recommend Sundays there if these ladies are behind the bar

6.description: I popped in here after a game at soldier field just based on the yelp ratings it got. So, thanks yelpers! This is a really fun bar! There are TVs everywhere, and on a Saturday night I didn't know where to look there were so many games happening at once. A host took our name down for a table which is better than most bars where you have to stake out and fight for a table. While we waited we grabbed a few beers. Bar was a good amount of people, but not people on top of you so it was fun but comfortable. There was a huge beer list to choose from, like several pages, but was surprisingly affordable with lots of beers in the $5-$6 range.Once we were seated, the waitress was super nice. We ended up ordering a few more beers and got the wings and brussel sprouts. The wings were very good, they fry them and grill them I guess so they have a good semi crunchy feel. I'd recommend the Chicago flavor, kind of a sweet bbq. The brussel sprouts were pretty good, but I dunno I thought they were pretty average contrary to popular yelp opinion. The waitress suggested Wisconsin spiggetes (spelling?) which are a fried cheese type thing, so you might wanna try that.I'd definitely recommend this place, especially if you are a sports fan. Friendly staff, cheap, good beer, good food, TVs everywhere : )

22.description: The best bar in the South Loop, and one of my favorite bars in all of Chicago. So many beer choices, constantly changing out every week or two. It's a new menu every time I come here (which is pretty often especially during winter). Food is good as well, but my five stars goes to the beer and the relaxing pub atmosphere this place has.

15.description: Great fried chicken sandwhich. The owner is great, as well as the staff. Adjacent parking lot. Great place to watch the game.  Fabulous beer selection.  Need I say more?

57.description: We came here for a coworker's birthday lunch, and it was quite empty. It looks like mostly all high top table seating here. The tables have a storage area underneath that holds the menu which is really neat. We were probably the first table here, and there were a few other people that came after. I felt like service was a little slow still given that there was 1 server/bartender. She did refill our water once, but I could have used another glass. It also took a little bit to get our bill. We were only a group of 6 so I'm not sure how they would have handle this as sometimes our group gets to be around 12 people or so. The food here though is really good. I really liked the fried chicken sandwich and fried brussel sprouts that I had. The other food items looked pretty delicious too. I might not really dine in again, but definitely would come for a pick up order.

20.description: Went here on a Monday night with my girlfriend. Half of their beers were not available and our waitress was nowhere to be found. After a while our mussels arrived and at least 20 percent of them were spoiled. The place has a charm and if their beers were available I'd recommend but my experience here was quite poor.

36.description: I was staying on Mich Ave and I always like to see what the area has to offer. I was walking around printer's row and found First Draft. They have a great selection of tap beers across all types. The food was very good, a simple burger & fries with a side of fried pickles. Definitely worth a try if you are in the area.

14.description: Thanks Yelp. Some friends and I headed to Soldier Field to get tickets to the Bears Raiders game.  After getting there and seeing the ticket selection 2 of my friends decided to go to the game and me and another friend decided not to spend the extra cash so we grabbed a cab, opened yelp and found this sports bar right around the corner.  When we walked in it was not crazy busy and we were able to get a table in the center of the bar where we could comfortably see 5 different games.  This place has not only an extensive beer list but a very good whiskey menu as well.  I would recommend it if those are your drinks of choice.  We stuck to the beer as we were drinking for the long haul. I really like that their menu is broken up by styles and what is popular in the bar at the time. Also the beers are served in specific glasses for the style of beer which will enhance the flavor and experience.The only food item we tried were the fried cheese curds and they were pretty good.  Large curds with a heavy batter but it was suitable for the size of the curds.  Decent ranch but not spectacular.  If I end up in Chicago again this would probably be my Sunday sports bar of choice.

28.description: Most horrible Starbucks customer service ever!Customer service stinks at this location! I asked for a drink (iced grande decaf non-fat latte), and this black medium height woman got it ALL wrong. I corrected her politely (and had to do it 3 times as she couldn't get it) so she responded: "I don't know what you want anymore" and threw her hands in the air. I don't mind walking another block or two, but this location will not get my business.Who hires crazy people like that to deal with customers face-to-face?! I have notified their corporate office about my horrible experience and hopefully something will be done.

1.description: Ah, the beans are burnt       Save the beans and burn a witch                 Go somewhere better

39.description: This isn't about the company, this review is about this specific store and one of the guys that works there. I've worked for Starbucks for what seems to be a lifetime (almost 6 years). I have even worked at THIS store a few years back. I'm down in this area all the time because of school but I usually go to the one closer on Jackson and Wabash. I had some extra time before class started so I decided to check out the old store and reminisce. Bad idea. I ordered a Grande Soy Chai Tea Misto. My drink isn't that hard but I understand that it can be confused with a Chai tea latte. I said something when the Barista started putting in the Chai syrup instead of the tea bags. He apologized and told the other guy to ring me up while he made my correct drink. The guy that was ringing me up had the worst attitude. I'm almost positive he was high because the guy had to tell him several times what the drink was and he would just stare. I could tell he was having trouble figuring out what buttons to push so I said "it's a chai tea add soy". He gave me the look of death. Like "god forbid I tell him what to do." I handed him my card and when he gave it back to me, he threw it on the counter and walked away. ARE YOU SERIOUS!? You work at Starbucks buddy, you're not that cool. I will never come here again.

9.description: Barista pulls shot.... shortly later... "here's your double shot!"... "wait, but I ordered a triple shot"... "Oh, then, its a triple shot!".  HMMMMMM.....I should have known better... I'm not sure if I am more bitter about starbucks itself - or if the doubleshot that magically became a triple was just that bitter.I shall NEVER return... I'll sooner dive into the cal sag and take a gulp than ever come back to this place.

29.description: This Starbucks is pretty busy. Every time I go there's a line, but it moves pretty fast. Many employees taking care of customers, so that's a plus!

23.description: As a former Starbucks barista, I get what it feels like to have a line out the door and have the expectation of being a smiling, helpful employee behind the counter. This Starbucks gets it. They're insanely friendly (not in the fake way) and understand what it feels like to have a day that makes you feel like you've been run over by a bus. Regardless of when I go in, they are very prompt and my drinks always have the same delicious taste. Other Starbucks I've been to in the city don't have the same professionalism when it comes to the drink itself. The store manager at this location, or whomever the trainer is, has done a fabulous job at ensuring amazing store quality. Their Clover Brew preparation is also very accurate and ...of course, delicious. Compared to the other Clover store that's right down the street, this store is amazing. Outside of there never being enough chairs because of the traffic in the store itself, this is an amazing store.

5.description: Love this location! Great employees, and good drinks.

31.description: I am not a coffee drinker, but I do love coffee houses, because you can get something other than coffee and they are great places to just hang out or take a rest from your day. I went to this one during the Lit-Fest, and despite it being jam-packed, the service was great -- the staff was cheerful and pleasant. It was pretty hot the first day of the Lit-Fest, so Starbucks was a welcome site that day, indeed. I love that you can get a Frap with no sugar! Score! And then, they were handing out free samples of Via coffee with coupons on the street. Quite nice, indeed.

25.description: It's a Starbucks. For that I take away a star. I'm not a huge fan of their coffee: a bit bitter for my taste. And everything is over-priced. That being said, this particular shop is super-well run. The staff are friendly and helpful and things move quickly. It is small and seating is limitted. But if all you can find is a stool along a bar looking out the window, it's a busy corner and fine for people watching. You could do worse.

12.description: Ivan is the reason people started going to Starbucks. He makes this corporate store a local coffee shop!

37.description: Duuuuuuuuuuuude.Thissssss Sttttaaaaarrrrbbbuuuuucccckkkksssss isssss sooooooo slooowwww.Seriously. My more regularly-visited 'bucks on Lake and Jefferson knocks out my Americanos in like, under four minutes. This joint? More like seven if they don't forget to make it in the first place.

21.description: Its a very small store. If I go there on weekend, I cant get table for most time. but people here are very nice :)

16.description: after grabbing coffee here for a year i can finally say i've had enough. its an absolute shame because its incredibly convenient and i'm admittedly addicted to star bucks, but aquillia has made it impossible to be a patron. each and every time i've encountered her i have received the absolute most miserable customer service that i have ever experienced. the only way i can describe my experience with her is rotten. it's a shame because literally every other employee at this establishment is pleasant.i understand that people have bad days but she is consistently miserable. it's absolutely atrocious.

17.description: Its a very small store. If I go there on weekend, I cant get table for most time. but people here are very nice :)

10.description: I miss my neighborhood Starbucks!!I absolutely love the weekday morning staff, they're always so friendly, engaging, and they never mess up :PThey get super  busy but they get your order out quick. Miss you guys! Awesome staff and great location!

11.description: A solution:If you stop here during a random time of day, there will be tourists. Your process will be slowed down.If you stop here during morning rush, there will still be tourists, but the person who grabs the muffins and drip coffee will entertain their questions while you can expertly and quickly order your drink and go.#winning

26.description: When it comes to Starbucks, you know what you're getting.  The menus at each franchise are just about identical, but there are distinct differences that make some branches more favorable than others.  This review is meant to reflect what makes this Starbucks unique more so than the company as a whole.This is my favorite Starbucks in the Loop.  For the true coffee fanatic, they offer Clover Brewed Starbucks Reserve coffees.  These are exceptional rare blends that cannot be purchased at most Starbucks franchises.  The Baristas competently handle this high-traffic location and make it all look easy.For frequent coffee drinkers, I also strongly recommend pursuing a Starbucks Gold Card if you do not already have one.  By simply reloading and reusing a gift card, you can easily reach Gold status.  By doing so you get free flavors, free soy milk, and a free drink after every 15.

27.description: 1. Nice BIG wood table seats at least 12 Starbucks fan.2. Great staff3. At least another 15 bar stools to work on high table against windowsgreat usage of space.

35.description: As of Monday, this Starbucks is closed for remodeling.  Watch for a new review once its back up and running!

8.description: This Starbucks is super tiny.  When there is a rush, the line is literally out the door!  It's not bad when it is warm out, but when it's cold the entire place fills with a sharp, icey gust whenever the door is opened.  There are not many places to sit, so I do not recommend coming here if you want to sit and enjoy a cup o' joe. There is a table in front of the door that seats six (coldest place to be here), a few barstools, and three small tables that will sit 1-2 people.The baristas here are hit or miss.  Some are extremely friendly and helpful, and some just don't know what's going on.  They don't really seem to work as a team here to fill orders when there is a long line.There's a very aggressive Streetwise vender who is usually standing by the front door, often opening it for people while asking for them to buy him stuff when they go in.  He starts cursing when turned down or ignored.  I know this isn't directly related to the Starbucks company, but it can make for an unpleasant trip to get coffee.

0.description: This Starbucks is honestly never too busy when I go in and the service is always friendly but very slow. Sometimes there's only one person behind the counter to take orders and make drinks so there might be a slight hold up, but usually when they get on drinks, they go flying out. They always have Coconut Milk in stock now since me going previously (twice) and them being out and having to give me a refund (which is very courteous). Overall very small Starbucks but very convenient especially with the order ahead option so you can swoop by while you're walking home or on your way out.

38.description: The people that work here are fantastic - so much so that I have to update this to a 5-star review.  I am one to respect great service and friendly attitudes, and this Starbucks has stepped up to the plate.

20.description: A solution:If you stop here during a random time of day, there will be tourists. Your process will be slowed down.If you stop here during morning rush, there will still be tourists, but the person who grabs the muffins and drip coffee will entertain their questions while you can expertly and quickly order your drink and go.#winning

19.description: As a former Starbucks barista, I get what it feels like to have a line out the door and have the expectation of being a smiling, helpful employee behind the counter. This Starbucks gets it. They're insanely friendly (not in the fake way) and understand what it feels like to have a day that makes you feel like you've been run over by a bus. Regardless of when I go in, they are very prompt and my drinks always have the same delicious taste. Other Starbucks I've been to in the city don't have the same professionalism when it comes to the drink itself. The store manager at this location, or whomever the trainer is, has done a fabulous job at ensuring amazing store quality. Their Clover Brew preparation is also very accurate and ...of course, delicious. Compared to the other Clover store that's right down the street, this store is amazing. Outside of there never being enough chairs because of the traffic in the store itself, this is an amazing store.

33.description: In this particular Starbuck you get a bunch of attitude with your coffee. They don't know how to grind coffee and when you ask for them to correct it, they roll their eyes and sigh audibly.  When you want to buy more than 2 cupcakes they frown and tell you that messes up their inventory. Go elsewhere if you have the choice.

2.description: This is a Starbucks, so I'm not going to bore you with details you can presume on your own. They get 4 stars for the simple fact that today, as I work on something that I find hard to concentrate on, they are playing BPM and I'm dancing in my seat. My thinking is clear and I'm fully productive. The volume is perfect, not too loud but also not so soft that I can hear what others are doing next to me. They would get 5 stars if the space was bigger, only one table where you don't have to share with others, otherwise you are at a stool. Thanks for the great music today guys!

34.description: This Starbucks is OK and my tea is always decent when I go here. But honestly, this needs to be called Kiddie Starbucks. Once the kids get out of school it takes forever to even get in the store, let alone order your drink. Between the baby strollers that's the size of a mini cooper and the book bags and cackling of already ultra hyped teens, this place is a zoo. I drink tea to relax and calm me but going here, I need a cup of coffee just to get in the store.

32.description: I live near this place, so it's MY Starbucks. I like it. The only way I would suggest for them to be improved is to have more space. It's a bit hard to enter there with my BOB stroller, especially when it's crowdy.But the baristas there are very sweet and friendly, I like them all.

18.description: It's a Starbucks so it's never bad. Its quite small but functional. The staff is fast and serviceable.

13.description: Always a pleasant experience at this location. The people who work here are extremely nice and welcoming. I haven't had a bad time here yet! 4/5 because it's very small. Better for passing through than sitting down!

4.description: Overpriced, undervalued.Barristas make no eye contact at any point when processing transactions. WiFi is 500kbps. Go to HERO if you're in the neighborhood and want good food and coffee.

24.description: In a nutshell - orders incorrectly filled on multiple (at least 10) occasions, inattentive, lackadaisical and rude staff.  Go somewhere else.In more detail - This is my first foray into Yelp writing.  If that makes you not trust me, that's fine; what I'd like it to reflect is that in general, I'm not a complaining person.  Most of the time I got to restaurants or coffee places and things go fine.  I do not nitpick, just place my order, usually enjoy it and move on with my life.Not so at the Starbucks at Dearborn and Harrison.I have been here about 15 times, having moved into the neighborhood a few months ago.  I would estimate that of those 15 times, on 10 of those occasions, they got my order wrong.  The biggest culprit is a middle-aged-ish white woman who seems every time to confront the register as though she has never used this device before in her life.  I have ordered the same drink nearly every time, and the price is different on nearly every occasion.Beyond the ordering process, at the barista end of things, seemingly random orders come up.  The Starbucks corporate procedure seems to call for the cashier and the barista orally repeating orders to one another.  I used to think this was annoying; after getting to see how this location works, I now understand the thinking behind the procedure.  When the order is wrong (and it usually is) I have no way of knowing that.  I therefore have to initiate a conversation with the barista each time, asking what the order is.  When it's wrong, he/she looks annoyed with me.  The drink costs more than $6, so I think I have the right to know I've gotten when I've ordered.  On a couple of occasions, it has taken the barista more than one try to get my order right.Furthermore - each time I am in there, there seems to be an attitude of "why hurry?"  In general, I don't mind this.  In fact, at many coffee shops, it seems fine, especially if the workers are friendly.  What these workers are generally doing, though, is not making friendly conversation but doing side-work they should clearly have time to do when no one is there (and this branch, except for weekend mornings, is never that crowded).  I've walked in on several occasions and it seemed as though my presence hadn't changed anything; they finish whatever they're doing before acknowledging me.  Again, I don't demand servitude, but I expect to be acknowledged.I'm sure this sounds grumpy, but I'm just trying to save you time and aggravation.  Walk over to one of the places that sell coffee on either Congress, State or Michigan.  There is a Caribou, a Panera, and probably another Starbucks inside the Barnes and Noble just up State.  Cafecito, on Congress, also makes espresso drinks.  Any of them will be better.

6.description: I recently moved into the area and this Starbucks is conveniently located next to my building. Very rarely do I have a bad experience at Starbucks. However, this location is operated with pure incompetence. The Baristas are very unfriendly and move at an extremely inefficient pace. But since this location is so close I've just learned to deal with the inefficiencies. However, today was the final straw. There was an indecisive family of three in front of me that was holding the line up. You know, the patrons that order the most difficult drinks and then stare at the pastries bar in pure confusion for another minute or two before placing an order for an overpriced donut. After standing in line for 5 minutes or so, I finally walked up and asked if anyone else could take my order as their were 5 baristas and only one cashier. One lady told me to stand back in line, which infuriated me. The manager comes out and yells, "get back in line sir!" We then exchanged some words and I walked out. I would expect this kind of service at the DMV, not a coffee establishment.

22.description: This starbucks is very close to where I live so I frequent the place.  I give it two stars instead of 1 because for being at such a busy location, I rarely see a line going out the door, coffee comes out quick, and they always have my favorite brew.  But this is not enough to keep me at a coffee shop.  As far as customer service goes, they are not even close to mediocre. I am rarely greeted with a smile which just makes me sad because I work in customer service and truly enjoy going places where I feel welcome.  Unfortunately, I don't feel a warm welcome at this starbucks.  I wish I did. The employees are rude and have an attitude problem.   And just a side note, my mother bought me the starbucks coffee mug for Christmas where I get free coffee all of January and I am just a little tired of this starbucks accusing me of coming in multiple times a day.  Um nope once again, it wasn't me. Apparently I have a twin.  I would love to find a coffee shop around here where I feel welcomed and can get to know the baristas a little more.

15.description: Barista went absolutely out of her way to be amazing! The Starbucks new app was not working so I couldn't use my gift card to pay for a bag of coffee. Barista gave us the whole bag of coffee for FREE plus the other drinks we were getting. Love this place!

7.description: When it comes to Starbucks, you know what you're getting.  The menus at each franchise are just about identical, but there are distinct differences that make some branches more favorable than others.  This review is meant to reflect what makes this Starbucks unique more so than the company as a whole.This is my favorite Starbucks in the Loop.  For the true coffee fanatic, they offer Clover Brewed Starbucks Reserve coffees.  These are exceptional rare blends that cannot be purchased at most Starbucks franchises.  The Baristas competently handle this high-traffic location and make it all look easy.For frequent coffee drinkers, I also strongly recommend pursuing a Starbucks Gold Card if you do not already have one.  By simply reloading and reusing a gift card, you can easily reach Gold status.  By doing so you get free flavors, free soy milk, and a free drink after every 15.

36.description: I cant believe I haven't reviewed this Starbucks yet. This is my GO TO Starbucks because#1 its close to my work place#2 they ALWAYS get my drink order rightWhat sucks is that they are usually busy so the wait can be a while, even though they are working as fast as they can. At least its good to know this Starbucks will never shut down. =)

30.description: So I have to preface this by saying I've recently relocated to Chicago from San Francisco and SF has great coffee places. That being said, this Starbucks is disappointing from even from a Starbucks point of view. - Location is small, even by San Francisco standards, and this is Chicago where everything in general seems to be bigger when it comes to sq. footage. - The service is a tad slow. It is a busy spot for its size but no where near as busy as other Starbucks I've been too and so I'm not sure why the service is a bit slow. - In the three times that I've gone in, they got a food item wrong and also a size of drink order wrong. - The workers are not very friendly or personable especially for a Starbucks.1 star - in a pinch, like when the heat index is 110 degrees, I will stop in to get something cold, no complaints there1 star - for the convenience to my apartment

3.description: This is a small, but very busy Starbucks in the South Loop. Like any Starbucks, they have blond, medium and bold  coffees. They offer all of the espresso drinks people are so fond of. (I stick to black, bold with nothing in it). And, they have the typical food selections that Starbucks has gotten into.They do have good service. The Baristas have always been pleasant when I've been there. The only downsides are it is small and there is little seating. Since it is fairly busy, it is not always easy to get a seat. And, there is one restroom only. Typically, there is a wait.I have never noticed a Clover machine, but see it referenced in other reviews. I will make sure to look for it next time I'm there.

14.description: I do love the Pikes coffee Starbucks offers, one of the best black cup of coffee I have ever had, I really really can't stand the high maintenance customers that Starbucks attracts. I have waited in line for as long as 10-15 minutes just to get a Venti black coffee. This is not the fault of the staff, I lay the blame on the customers who think it's OK to tie up the baristas and cashier with some highly complicated coffee concoction for a pretentious palate they seem to own. I have walked out of this place on several occasions and settled for a 7/11 coffee across the street just because of the wait time I refuse to put up with on some days. This place would need about 20 people working behind the counter to keep the line moving with some of the idiotic orders I have witnessed.

58.description: There's a chain in Houston called Frenchy's, where the only acceptable answer is to visit the O.G. in the third ward. Other franchises need not apply. However, if you do happen to stumble upon the originator, you're treated to some of the greatest fried chicken that walked the G's green earth.Chicago's finest, or at least most-well known, Harold's Chicken Shack, has been far more prolific than Frenchy's, but perhaps it falls under the same purview. I'm not even sure where the original Harold's sits, but it's most assuredly not this South Loop location (one of two in the Sloop, in fact).As such, the fried chicken at Harold's on Wabash is decidedly average. The chicken, particularly the thigh, runs on the small side, and the crisp decidedly lacks flavor. A chicken dinner comes standard with fries, seasoned decently, and a very delicious hot sauce. If taking to go, hot sauce is most definitely recommended on the side, as it quickly permeates the chicken skin and will render it soggy. A small side of cole slaw and some white bread recalls a fun visit to Raising Cane's.All in all, I just really miss Frenchy's. Or, y'know, maybe the Memphis mafia can bring me a Gus' Fried Chicken location in Chi-town. I mean, they opened one in Austin and all...

56.description: Pretty sure if I lived in the South Loop I would be like 450 pounds by now and spots like Harold's would be the reason. I ordered the 3 piece fish (perch) with the 3 piece chicken (dark meat) and I loved every bite. Tons of food, all perfectly cooked. Great bang for your buck and a solid choice if you're in the mood for some deep fried goodness!The hot sauce, by the way, is super fine. Classic old school joint with framed pictures of Scottie Pippen and Kanye West on the walls.I will be back!

29.description: The wings were decent and the fries were mediocre. I would recommend stopping by for a low key, quick-ish dinner if you're in the area. But I would not recommend driving across the city because you heard this was a good fried chicken restaurant. And definitely don't come here needing to use the restroom. The worst thing about visiting Harold's is that I have a vision of the bathrooms stuck in my head forever.

42.description: We ordered lunch delivery for my coworkers birthday/to celebrate his baby being born last week Friday at 11:36am. We were starving by 12:30pm but gave them another 30 mins. At 1pm we called Harold's wondering where the order was and after waiting on hold for 10 minutes, were told they had no record of our order. So, the three of us decided to eat elsewhere separately, since it was already well past our lunch breaks. Which was a bummer since we wanted to eat together (it was a celebration after all). Fast forward to about 3pm and security at the front desk calls us to say that Harold's is there with our order?!? My coworker went downstairs to tell the delivery driver we didn't want the food. The driver was annoyed and told us that he couldn't issue a refund and we'd have to call. He motioned to the food and said "well do you want it or not?" My coworker took the food up to us and upon inspection we found that it was cold and we were missing 2 of the 8 pieces of chicken we ordered. The sides were correct, but that's all. After we finally stopped laughing and caught our collective breaths, we threw it in the microwave and brought it to a couple of the street musicians outside who were very happy to receive it. So at least some good came out of all this. Still, that is the last time we order from Harold's.

23.description: This place is like the Harold's Chicken used to be back in the day.  I prefer my sauce on the side.  To me that is the only way you can truly know how good the food is.  I only give 3 stars because of the service I get when the lady that is normally there is off or on her lunch break or something.  Whoever takes her place is very rude over the phone when I try to call ahead of time.  I use to go every Friday for lunch.  But since the last incident I go when I get the taste for it.

47.description: meh, skip it. Chicken was crispy but had no flavor. Fries were just ok. Grocery store fried chicken is better. You're in Chicago - you can do better!

8.description: This is old school goodness.  This place is not fancy, just great food.  I got ours to go, it was fast, the people friendly, if you are in the neighborhood, stop by, simply amazing

31.description: Staff was rude, hair in the food, place is filthy, no bread or slaw with my order, took forever. Do not eat here.

34.description: I love going here for lunch, I work in the area and my staff and I love the chicken. I'm glad they finally realized the difference between mild sauce and barbeque sauce.

16.description: Soggy fries next to a piece of soggy bread. Basically hell going down your esophagus. The chicken however was good.

13.description: Just finished my meal that was delivered to my hotel. It's the best chicken I've ever had!  It had wonderful flavor. The French fries we ordered had good flavor too!  They were seasoned. The price was reasonable ($12.95 for bucket of 8pc dark chicken). Delivery was fast considering the weather today. It was sleeting all day and the roads are bad. The delivery man was super friendly and apologized for the long wait but it really wasn't!  The only complaint I would have is that they were out of lemonade however they let me substitute with Snapple and they didn't offer mashed potatoes and gravy on the menu. Otherwise this is a great place that delivers if you're craving fried chicken!

11.description: I have to say that the food by my house from Sharks is slightly better but I'm not knocking this place. The hot sauce from Harold's is amazing and I believe they sell it to go. Definitely recommended.

39.description: Returning home after a 700 mile trip all I could think about was ordering from Harold's Chicken Shack! I had raved to my family Christmas Eve day that our office had ordered food from Harold's and how delicious my chicken wing dinner was. Never before had I had a wing with so much meat!!! Needless to say I ordered the Bucket/3 sides and my husband & son now know what I was talking about!

37.description: Stopped by for a 2 piece and a soda.  First off the place is very dirty!  At 3:00 in the afternoon there were only a couple there with 5 employees and it took 15 min to get my food.  Chicken was cooked propper but nothing fancy at all!  It is regular friend chicken, nothing more. Had to edit my review.... the "plumber crack" from the guy cleaning tables was NOT a nice touch LOL

0.description: From 2007 to now, my very first Harold's Chicken Shack has acquired new brown vinyl seating and taken down their barn house red wooden booth dividers and yet the chicken is even better than my rose-colored recollection. Having learned from years of eating Harold's down in Hyde Park that dark meat is best, my friend and I ordered an 8-piece dark bucket and discovered that this Harold's uses smaller, but higher quality chickens than its Hyde Park cousin. The chicken came out very hot and very tasty and the wait time seemed shorter than expected. It's good to return to where my fried-chicken love began. PS - If you're looking for the magical, layered combination of white bread on top of sauced chicken on top of fries, then you should get one of the dinners instead of the bucket.

38.description: OK Chicken....but NEVER, NEVER, NEVER give them your credit card! Two times in 3 years...my chase account has been stolen from ordering from this store. The people that work here are crooks.

51.description: Good staple. Always consistent but made to order so you will wait. We always get the 6 piece. It comes with 6 wings coleslaw white bread and fries. The mild sauce is delicious. We will always return when we visit Chicago.

27.description: being from LA, i just didnt get the hype ... i wasnt a fan AT all . my chicken was drythe skin was thin & flaky [not in a good way]i think the fries were cooked in the same batter and i ate the chicken with the sauce STILL regular.

32.description: Love Harold's fried chicken but the side choices aren't the best (you need greens with fried chicken) also wish they served up their chicken with white gravy or at least carried it. Wait time is ridiculous in store or delivery, been waiting an hour and 53 min for an order now. Called to confirm there was no issue and service was horrible....

54.description: Regular chicken spot... not really sure what all the hype about it was. I guess Chicagoans have never gotten a chance to experience a local NYC hood chicken spot like Crown Fried Chicken. If you're interested in tasting the chicken from here, but you're from NYC don't bother going out of your way. It's nothing special to rave about.I did find it funny on the other hand that there was this one guy who was sweating a storm while eating his fried chicken. Yup he was seriously dripping sweat all over the place but just kept eating the chicken. I asked for some of the hot sauce after to try it out, and again I wasn't impressed with the spicyness but it was a funny sight to see. There was also a lot of annoying kids in here making a bunch of noise, so I made it my best to eat a wing or two then do the walk and eat to get out of there quickly.pass.

48.description: I ordered the three drum special, and husband ordered the catfish.  He enjoyed the catfish, though it was too hot to eat at first.  My chicken, on the other hand, was just OK:  a little on the dry-side with no distinct flavor or seasoning.

44.description: You order at the counter, you get a number, and you wait for your order. I am country, so I ordered the chicken gizzards!!! They're hard to find in Phoenix! The gizzards were fantastic! I sat inside to eat. An asker of coins came in and made a beeline to my table. He inquired about my ability to spare coins so that he could get a bite to eat. I invited him to take half my order as I couldn't eat it all. He declined. Imagine that....Reasonably priced, pleasant staff, fast service.

24.description: Get mild sauce on the side,  everything is drenched in sauce otherwise.We got a 30 piece bucket of chicken and 20 piece chicken nuggets with a side of fries, had the sauce been on the side, we would have enjoyed the food a lot more

7.description: It's Harold's Chicken....need I say anymore! Chicken wings are their specialty.  It's easy to mess up fried chicken but they get it right every time.

49.description: Save yourself five bucks and go to Popeyes instead. But for drunk 2 am food, I guess they enjoyed it.I had the shrimp 6 piece. I ate only the shrimp because the fries were flavorless and soggy.The atmosphere is kinda urban grungy cool at like 2 am.

40.description: The food is good.  I will eat here again (if craving fried chicken and not willing to venture outside the south loop)With that being said, I'll also mention that the food was not "I need to tell everyone how good it is" or "Best southern style fried chicken".   I ordered the 2-piece chicken and 2-piece Perch fish meal with fries and sample of the coleslaw (a small ramekin hardly qualifies as a full side).  Chicken and fish were fried perfectly. Fries are meh and the coleslaw is good.Finally, the man working behind the counter was a nice guy so extra points for customer service.

53.description: I just love Harolds - the wings are fried and boxed, and then you pick your sauce and add it, and the frying is just so good and I'm in love with their mild sauce.Cooked well, guy behind the counter was nice, and we were in and out quickly (especially for fresh-made food).

30.description: The chicken is dryer than the Sahara desert. The hot sauce was okay. There wasn't enough hot sauce on the fries and chicken. The coleslaw was probably the best part of the meal. The onion rings were crunchy and the batter to onion ratio was good but it was also dry. We came during lunch and the place was packed. It was good to try once but not worth a second visit.

46.description: Very good friend chicken! Very crispy! I love the mild sauce... I wish they sold those and put it containers for people who travel so they can bring them back home! A part of me is hoping that my work sends me to Chicago soon just so i can have some food from here.....

1.description: Came in for something to eat fast when working around the corner. It's nice and clean inside. So much so that a local said this Harold's is like a 4 star hotel compared to the rest.Inside is clean and has a variety of tables avaliable.  In my opinion could have had a little more seating with the layout. Ordering food was pretty simple, chicken,  chicken and more chicken.  They do have shrimp and a variety of fish.  That's a good thing since most chickens places have well just chicken. There is also a good selection of side and sauces. Ordered my food and it felt like it took forever.  I'm a patient person but it was well over 10 mins for my order. The food wasn't bad. Had chicken strips.  Without sauce has a good flavor but lacks a little bite or spice. Definitely needs some type of sauce. Also the strips were huge. I got a 6 piece and couldn't finish it  each strip was almost have a chicken breast. Fries were good but nothing to rave about. In short I was hungry and needed some quick and easy. Harold's fit the bill but I probably won't be coming back. I'm from Florida and miss Guthrie's so maybe I'm spoiled a little

55.description: In NYC, you know this as Kennedy Fried Chicken. Harold's serves every food item that you can imagine, but battered, drenched in grease and fried. Yum.Everything is fried to order, so I guess that's comforting, but somehow the place doesn't smell like fried foods, in fact, it doesn't smell like anything.We stuck with a basic order of 4 chicken wings. They were STEAMING HOT when we got them, so be careful, or you'll burn your face off. They were pretty good, reminded me of wings that we get at our local Chinese food joint, just way more oily. Nothing special. Rus seemed to really enjoy them. I was kind of amazed that people were actually ordering and eating fried livers. Didn't realize that was still a thing.Oh well, to each his fried own!

9.description: You order at the counter, you get a number, and you wait for your order. I am country, so I ordered the chicken gizzards!!! They're hard to find in Phoenix! The gizzards were fantastic! I sat inside to eat. An asker of coins came in and made a beeline to my table. He inquired about my ability to spare coins so that he could get a bite to eat. I invited him to take half my order as I couldn't eat it all. He declined. Imagine that....Reasonably priced, pleasant staff, fast service.

26.description: Conveniently located close to the Hilton Chicago, I walked to this Harold's location. The staff was very friendly.  I ordered their fried Perch dinner and calamari. Both dishes were cooked wonderfully. While eating there, I encountered every walk of life: students, working people, convention goers, city dwellers and tourists. Just minor complaints here. I did not care for one of their hot sauces as it was mainly ketchup based and there was a random slice of plain white bread in with either dish. Not sure what I was to use it for exactly as the two orders came with fries. Overall a good local experience.

25.description: Let me tell you this story so you can understand my rating.  I went to this location because it was in walking distance to the hotel where I stayed. I made my order and waited. The guy who ordered in front of me received his order. He opened the to go container and said "I don't want this bread!", picked it up and handed to the guy behind the counter. That guy behind the counter, in one fell swoop, put that same bread on top of my order of chicken. And that's why I'll NEVER set foot in this place again.

12.description: Get mild sauce on the side,  everything is drenched in sauce otherwise.We got a 30 piece bucket of chicken and 20 piece chicken nuggets with a side of fries, had the sauce been on the side, we would have enjoyed the food a lot more

59.description: The chicken was fried to a crispy perfection. Not the best friend chicken I've ever had, but very tasty. Small wings considering it's a shack. The sauce was mild in taste and went perfect with the fries. The fried okra was good. I will visit again when I visit chicago again, if my taste buds are seeking fried chicken.

21.description: I know three things. Pizza, cheeseburgers, and fried chicken. I've eaten at two Harold's now, and I don't get the positive reviews. Greasy chicken, slow service. Jewel has better chicken than this chain.

17.description: There's a chain in Houston called Frenchy's, where the only acceptable answer is to visit the O.G. in the third ward. Other franchises need not apply.
