However, if you do happen to stumble upon the originator, you're treated to some of the greatest fried chicken that walked the G's green earth.Chicago's finest, or at least most-well known, Harold's Chicken Shack, has been far more prolific than Frenchy's, but perhaps it falls under the same purview. I'm not even sure where the original Harold's sits, but it's most assuredly not this South Loop location (one of two in the Sloop, in fact).As such, the fried chicken at Harold's on Wabash is decidedly average. The chicken, particularly the thigh, runs on the small side, and the crisp decidedly lacks flavor. A chicken dinner comes standard with fries, seasoned decently, and a very delicious hot sauce. If taking to go, hot sauce is most definitely recommended on the side, as it quickly permeates the chicken skin and will render it soggy. A small side of cole slaw and some white bread recalls a fun visit to Raising Cane's.All in all, I just really miss Frenchy's. Or, y'know, maybe the Memphis mafia can bring me a Gus' Fried Chicken location in Chi-town. I mean, they opened one in Austin and all...

10.description: I heard about Harold's Chicken Shack from watching an interview between Nardwuar and Common and if Common is plugging this place then it is a must try. I ordered the 5 piece wing dinner with hot sauce on the side. There was a slice of bread in my order which I am assuming they threw it in there to absorb the moisture so the chicken stays crispy. Overall the chicken was light and crispy and the hot sauce was above average. I recommend getting the sauce on the side so your chicken remains crispy.

5.description: The fried chicken is really good(on the bone), but it a little hit-or-miss, varying from alright to great

3.description: I am completely baffled by the negative reviews of Harold's. Being a true southerner now living in Chicago, I know chicken. I KNOW the chicken. Fried chicken is very easy to screw up. And being cognizant of that, I am super picky when it comes to trying new chicken joints. Harold's was recommended to me by all of my associates and so I finally tried. Usually I just resort to Popeye's and call it a night. This Saturday night I decided to finally test the grease at Harold's and boy I'm glad I did. The only reason why this review isn't 5 stars is because of the subpar team of workers. I ordered 5 wings and a piece of white fish. I had the hot sauce ordered on the side. I was so pleased with the made to order nature of the place! The chicken was piping hot when I sat down. The seasoning brought back so many memories growing up in the country of North Carolina. My wings were juicy and tangy/spicy from the hot sauce. The fries were on point too! What I could do without is the toast. Hello, we need biscuits! Not toast Harold!!!Other than that, I will definitely return.

35.description: Not all Harold's are created equal. This particular location took an exceedingly long time to prepare the half-dark dinner. I ordered it with salt and pepper + mild sauce, but the chicken is outrageously bland and dangerously hot. What a cruel situation to make you hungry with a long wait and burning your tongue with grease. The mild sauce was sparsely tossed on and the fries were flavorless and bland (surprise surprise). Go to the Harold's in Hyde Park.

19.description: Had a craving for fried chicken so I decided to give this place a try. Tried the fried chicken and shrimp. Did not like the shrimp. It had too much batter and not enough flavour. The chicken was good but did not blow me away. It was piping hot and crispy but lacked flavour in my opinion. I would definitely go back if in the area and craving fried chicken. But would do so with the right expectation.  I would recommend the mild sauce over the hot sauce. The hot sauce taste like Frank's Red Hot Sauce.

28.description: I heard about Harold's Chicken Shack from watching an interview between Nardwuar and Common and if Common is plugging this place then it is a must try. I ordered the 5 piece wing dinner with hot sauce on the side. There was a slice of bread in my order which I am assuming they threw it in there to absorb the moisture so the chicken stays crispy. Overall the chicken was light and crispy and the hot sauce was above average. I recommend getting the sauce on the side so your chicken remains crispy.

45.description: This Harold's is the bomb! I love their perch and I'm addicted to the batter dipped fries. I recently cheated on this Harold's with the one on Clark and Lake and that was a big mistake (to say the least). Now I can appreciate this location even more. My Favorite Harold's is 87 Dan Ryan, but this one holds the downtown title. Great job and keep up the good work!

33.description: found this place on groupon a while back, awesome spot!!have been back a few times since, always delicious

43.description: Mediocre fried fish and small, bland wings. You can smell the grease from the corner. Ugh. It was a quick late night snack I could have done without. Nothing spectacular about this 'fast food' joint and worth the stop-in. Maybe some of the other locations are better.

2.description: Terrible. It was like punch to the gut. I had shrimp there and it was okay. I think the hot sauce did me in my insides felt bloated after I left.Strange ambiance and I couldnt help but notice the couple making out In the booth.... wow was that.ridiculous.The serving of cole slaw.was hilarious. It was served in a tartar sauce container but that turned out to be okay with me because it tasted horrible.

18.description: Not all Harold's are created equal. This particular location took an exceedingly long time to prepare the half-dark dinner. I ordered it with salt and pepper + mild sauce, but the chicken is outrageously bland and dangerously hot. What a cruel situation to make you hungry with a long wait and burning your tongue with grease. The mild sauce was sparsely tossed on and the fries were flavorless and bland (surprise surprise). Go to the Harold's in Hyde Park.

41.description: What's the fuss? Really, Best Fried Chicken in America? Don't think so - maybe I was in the wrong branch - but there was nothing to-die-for with this fried chicken. It was just so-so.

52.description: Not impressed at all. How could this place be so famous? Seriously? I agree with someone else's comment. You can get better chicken at Popeyes or Church's. Not to mention the service wasn't the greatest. I'm from the south and maybe folks from up north just don't know any better. Save your money, go to someplace else. Limp, soggy fries, the actual chicken not seasoned. Not sure if the batter had any in it either. Def not worth the money. #letdown.

50.description: I first tasted their chicken at this years taste of Chicago . Chicken was very crispy with a light breaded crust. The sauce was not spicy but was tangy. While downtown yesterday I brought my family who was visiting Chicago . We ordered chicken for 9 adults n 2 kids. Expecting the same the first of my experience was a young lady who took our order was very rude. She was agitated with all our questions. She didn't know any answers. She wouldn't look at me when I talking to her . Rolling her eyes ! I was shocked! Why is she the one to help customers ! I'm so glad we didn't eat there ! Although the chicken was good it was not the same we had at the taste of Chicago . The mild sauce is just ketchup. We ordered 20 pieces and only was given. 4 little cups with the order. Had to pay extra for more sauce. Not going back ! Won't recommend !

4.description: Ordered through yelp.  When the delivery did not come in the hour quoted, I called.  I was told that they quoted 2 hours to GrubHub(??? I ordered through yelp/eat24).   All around unhelpful service.

6.description: WTH? That is what I left here asking myself. This place is SO overrated. In fact, I've never experienced a more overrated place in all of my life. First things first : the atmosphere was mad cafeteria at a school in the ghetto like. There were goons and homeless persons in every corner of the dining area. I stood at the counter debating about whether my curiosity about this so-called delicious chicken was worth my life. More goons entered as I stood there contemplating. I was surrounded. The tension in the air was mad thick as each goon visually inspected the other for any familiarity or past transgressions. I got the chills. I was steady debating and simultaneously shaking. I gave up and placed an order; life's too short and I'm the quintessential foodie. I ordered a 5 wings dinner and a bottled water. It came out  to about $8.65 +\-. I ordered the mild sauce everyone keeps posting about. People have raved about the sauce being this or that. Many have went on and on talking about "wonder what's in that secret sauce..."  Hey wise guy!! From what I can tell, that "secret sauce" was nothing more than ketchup with hot sauce in it. Wtf?! Worse: The wings were not fresh at all and were fried over and over and over again. The fries were average and nothing to get excited about. Overall, I left feeling tricked; hoodwinked; and just played. Never again! This place is BEYOND overrated and I will not be returning.

22.description: I ordered a popcorn chicken dinner. At every other Harold's, a small fry is mandatory for every chicken dinner. Except this fake ass white washed Harold's downtown. I got literally 18 French Fries with meal. Very dissatisfied & restaurant looks raunchy & has graffiti on the window. They even made the logo white & changed the name from Harold's Chicken King to Harold's Chicken Shack. This restaurant is very distasteful.

15.description: Great deal and tasty food. We got the Two pieces fried chicken with onion rings for $6.99 & three pieces Cod Fish with fries for $5.99. The fried chicken with hot sauce...very tasty. The cod fish was not all the way cook but still really good.  Good choice for Fast, quick, and tasty!

57.description: Good fried chicken - and I love their fries. Though... if you're gonna charge for ranch, at least fill up the containers. Mine were barely half-filled.

20.description: The place itself looks a little run down and old but the food is very redeeming.  There are some mispricings in the menu you can take advantage of, such as two orders of three wings being cheaper than one order of six wings (plus you get extra sides for ordering twice in addition to a cheaper unit price).  The fried chicken itself has crispy skin with surprisingly little oil and well-cooked, tender meat.  It also comes with a side of fries and a small cole slaw sample, both of which were pretty good.  The amount you get for your money and the quality of the chicken makes Harold's Chicken a better option than KFC or Popeye's.

36.description: When i am hurry. Go eat chicken here. But the restaurant is little far from central downtown.

14.description: I'm from NC. We know fried chicken. I've honestly had better fried chicken from a truck stop. Really bland and greasy. Also, it's a complete dump. Think black mold stains on the ceiling complimented by no restrooms. HOW DO I EAT CHICKEN IF I CANT WASH MY HANDS?

58.description: Trendy place with lots of tv screens, pretty good burgers, and several beer and bloody mary options.  I ordered the chicken burger which was very large and very juicy...didn't keep me from finishing every bite!

56.description: Food is great! Very big menu. Just not very into the way they made the paste smaller than the bread, feels weird.

29.description: Place looks cool! The staff is friendly. But the food, although presentation wise great, was way below my expectations! I had a burger, I ordered rare. Came out well done. Manager offered to redo it but considering the ticket time on the order (party of four) of approximately 25 minutes, I passed. Then, as the bar was getting busier, we got the check without asking for it (universal waiter language for "get out of here - I need this table")... My friend had wings they seemed pretty good, but I will not eat here again.

42.description: Didn't eat here but the burgers on the menu sounded amazing and looked even better coming out of the kitchen.The beer selection is on point...PLENTY of local and regional craft brews to choose from.AND there's USB ports/AC outlets under the bar...score!

23.description: The burger is amazing! I love the one with bleu cheese. The beer collection is good, but not as good as First Draft. However, the food is in reasonable price range, Great for people to have a rest after work.

47.description: Man, I love this place.  The space is well laid out - big windows, plenty of TVs, great bar set up.  I usually sit at the bar, and find the bartenders to be very knowledgable, friendly and exactly the right amount of attentive.  Solid beer list, with the beer of the month usually a strong option at a fantastic price.  The burgers are of course great, but don't neglect the rest of the menu.  Wings are well prepared (listen to your server - when they say spicy, they mean spicy) and salads are huge and delicious (Cobb is my favorite).  Chicken burger competes with the beef for flavor (what?  yes, it does).  Just hoping they bring the hot pretzel back in time for Monday night football....

8.description: So I had a get together with the girls and there is no better way to bond than by eating delicious greasy food and drinking some beer. I found this place on yelp and when I asked my friend if it was good (I have been looking for a great burger). She said her husband really enjoyed it and that was good enough for me so we decided to eat here. I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. It oozes the dive bar vibe which makes you know what you eat is going to be great. The day we went was great out so the windows were open and there was a cool breeze coming in. We asked to sit by the window and they had no problem accepting our request. Overall great atmosphere and service. The first thing we ordered was beer. While I don't know the extent of their draft menu, I saw some things on their beer list I haven't seen other places. Now keep in mind I like sweet beers so I always enjoy a beer that has fruit accents. They had a full list of summer beers with different flavors. They had pear, watermelon, blueberry, peach sour... the list goes on. I have Summer Shandy often so I decided to try one of the more unique flavors. Watermelon made the cut and it was yummy, but my friend ordered a raspberry beer and that was by far my favorite. The burgers were amazing. I got the hey shortay which had short rib on top of a very delicious burger. The flavor was great. In fact, I finished my entire burger (dont' judge) and those portions are huge. One friend got the Wild Bill. She was a little nervous about trying bison for the first time, but it came recommended by our waiter. She was very happy with her decision saying it was really great. My other friend got the high hog which is pulled pork on top of a burger. While she only ate half, she kept saying how yummy it was. She took the rest home to share with her dad. Next time I plan on trying the truffle fries and one of their boozy milkshakes. I wanted to try a milkshake this time, but I was so full I decided against it. I had a great time here and plan on brining my boyfriend here.

31.description: This place was a waste of calories.  Looks great and very conveniently located but the food did not live up to the hype.  They did have a nice beer special which I took advantage of.  I really liked all the different beer glasses, def got a kick out of the Traveler Shandy mug with the mustache as you drink, but that's about it. Our table ordered the poutine which was completely underwhelming.  It consisted of gravy and a blob of cheese over cold fries.  They have a nice list of burgers however we opted for the BYO Burger and got overcooked bacon, a slightly burnt bun and an unseasoned beef patty.  Thanks but no thanks.

34.description: I like this place, the burgers and sweet potato fries are definitely good. My only issue is that one person can definitely walk out of here spending $25 or so, which is expensive for a burger, fries, and a drink.

16.description: Yum!  We came here after a run at Soldier Field.  We were starving and oh so thirsty, and Burger Bar totally came through!  We immediately ordered a round of the $3 Goose Island Thursday special and perused the menu.  The burgers here are fantastic!  Lots of options, or a build your own, if you are high maintenance ;)We started with the poutine, like you do.  Pulled pork on top of fries, gravy and melted curds?  Yes please!  Also ordered the fried pickles which were good, but not great.  They cut the pickle into spears and then fry; I prefer the round slices, you get more batter-to-pickle ratio.  Oh well.  Burger-wise, I had the Big Shoulder Blues, sans blue cheese.  The peppercorn added a nice kick and the onion bacon jam and port wine glaze mixed in a surprising sweet flavor.  I sprung for the truffle fries (high roller) and didn't regret it.  Others raved about the sweet potato tots.  Food was enjoyed by all.Service was a little spotty, but not enough to keep us away.  Nice work, Burger Bar!

13.description: Ate here on Saturday after visiting the Field Museum.  I ordered their burger of the month which was an elk burger with Andouille charred pepper-onion relish, smoked gouda, guajillo aioli + spicy crispy onions.  It was excellent.  My girlfriend ordered the cheese curds which very tasty with the sauce as well. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars though was because of the temperature of the beer we ordered.  I ordered a Cold Snap and my girlfriend ordered a cider and both should have been colder than they were.

11.description: I passed by here on the way to my hotel in Chicago and the place seemed to be pretty busy, and had a heavily "burger smell" coming from it (that was my first indicator that it would be a epic burger experience). I came here with a few friends for a early lunch, and was pleasantly surprised by the uniqueness of their burger & topping choices. The server was attentive and explained all of the different burgers to us (i.e. lamb, elk, beef, etc.) I ended up going with the Elk Burger, topped by andouille sausage and chipotle aioli. At first I was unsure of the size of their burgers (that's never stopped me before) and whether it was smart to go for a Elk Burger (it was my first time trying elk!)It ends up that the Elk was cooked to perfection, as recommended by the server due to the dryness of elk if overcooked. It was also the perfect size and all the condiments were in perfect harmony! Also, the sweet potato fries were not overwhelming-ly heavy and the perfect portion of them were served. My friends and I also ended up splitting a oreo milkshake, which thankfully they split 3-ways and was the perfect end to the meal. All in all, I'd say that the ambiance, service, and food were all great! I'll definitely be back if I am in the area! You should too :)

39.description: INCREDIBLE wings. just amazing. and they have this bacon lollipop thing that should be illegal. great bartender named Mike makes the whole thing even better.

37.description: I went here for a late lunch. I split the burger w the blue cheese with my husband  we also had the sweet potato fries. Both were good and is order them again. This restaurant has excellent air conditioning and appears to be really clean. Love that all the tables look set with beer glasses turned upside down. The vibe is great and I'd love to go back to try some beers at the bar.

0.description: Love the ambience here! It was so windy, so my boyfriend & I stopped in. We sat at the bar to chill before we head to our next destination. He got two beers & he loved it, while I got a delicious milk shake. I got to try the sassy chicken wings & they were good too. I'd recommend you to stop by after visiting the Agora Sculptures in South Loop!

38.description: Lance was our server for some late-lunch burgers on Sunday afternoon. He was very attentive, and even swapped out some fries for a side salad after our sodium-sensitive friend made a special request. Within the group we had a chicken burger (yum), veggie burger (yum), and a custom burger (also yum). The bacon bloody mary was a nice addition to our afternoon meal. We'll be back!

51.description: Just ate here today this place was delicious! I loved it! I got a burger called "Hey Shortay" it has shredded rib tips on it and was so juicy, and I had chocolate three way shake which I loved! I recommend this place to anyone who loves burgers.

27.description: Ironically the burgers are nothing special here.  Sometimes overcooked and mostly dry from the 4-5 I've gotten.  All other food is on point though! (try the fried pickles, wings, truffle fries).   They have wings for cheap ($5 for 10) on Tuesdays.  It's never too packed since the Sloop is still 'up an coming'.. so its a great place to grab a quick bite and enjoy some local brews on draft.

32.description: So delicious! Visiting the city, this became our go-to spot. Delicious food and drinks. Super hospitable staff. Will absolutely return when we're back.

54.description: Yum!  We came here after a run at Soldier Field.  We were starving and oh so thirsty, and Burger Bar totally came through!  We immediately ordered a round of the $3 Goose Island Thursday special and perused the menu.  The burgers here are fantastic!  Lots of options, or a build your own, if you are high maintenance ;)We started with the poutine, like you do.  Pulled pork on top of fries, gravy and melted curds?  Yes please!  Also ordered the fried pickles which were good, but not great.  They cut the pickle into spears and then fry; I prefer the round slices, you get more batter-to-pickle ratio.  Oh well.  Burger-wise, I had the Big Shoulder Blues, sans blue cheese.  The peppercorn added a nice kick and the onion bacon jam and port wine glaze mixed in a surprising sweet flavor.  I sprung for the truffle fries (high roller) and didn't regret it.  Others raved about the sweet potato tots.  Food was enjoyed by all.Service was a little spotty, but not enough to keep us away.  Nice work, Burger Bar!

48.description: Walking distance from soldier field, we stopped in with 2 kids before show, not too expensive for Chicago, friendly service, yummy burger.  We're from out of town, but would definitely recommend. Multiple sports playing on tvs.

44.description: Bacon lollipops.... Need I say more?  Good choice of craft brews.  Burgers are huge and tasty.  Overall service was good.  Would not hesitate going back if in the area.

24.description: Food was pretty good... But then again, I just ran the marathon, so pretty much anything would've been pretty good. The shakes were not as tasty as proclaimed by others. The service was barely adequate. They have a nice idea, but could be carried through a bit better.

7.description: Stopped in here on a Saturday around 3 p.m. to grab a late lunch. We sat at the bar, which was less than 1/2 full, and yet the 'tender was slower than molasses in January. He also had the personality of molasses in January. NOT that I need to be chatted up 24/7, but SOME lightness and/or observance would be appreciated.Thought the food might do the work that the bartender didn't - but, sadly, no. Fried pickles had so much breading you couldn't even taste the pickles. And everything else was so greasy I could have oiled my car and then done the duty on another 'mobile. Truffle fries were bathing in oil, burger buns dripping with butter, meat patties over-seasoned and fried in a pan? It'd be one thing if the food made up for the service or vise-versa, but this Michigan Ave. spot is simply relying on its address and nothing more substantial.

49.description: Pretty awesome selection in food and drink, we fed have to put it on the list of places to go in the future.

40.description: Four stars because the food was great, especially the sassy wings, but it was a little expensive for a burger place. Everyone raved about the wings, so we had to try them, the sassy wings were the perfect amount of spicy and sweet, best wings I've had! I'd got back just for the wings! I ordered the wild bill, it was good if you're into goat cheese, arugula, and tomato chutney; it was a VERY messy burger to eat! My husband did "build your own burger" very delicious but it gets pricy, each extra toppings are  $1.50 each. Sweet potatoes fries were okay, salty and fried. Lots of beer choices too. Atmosphere, was definitely a bar atmosphere, loud and crowded (if you go during w popular time).

53.description: Boyfriend and I were craving a burger and decided it try it out. I had the regular cheese burger and it was pretty good! The cheese horseradish sauce is amazing but they do give you two giant scoops which was a bit overwhelming. They also had a great selection of beers! Would definitely come back!

30.description: And again, another location known for terrible customer service. I was near the location but decided to call in to try to place an order so it would be ready when i arrived. The employee answered the phone and immediately put me on hold. While on my 7 minute hold i had already arrived at the resturant to see, no customers, no lines, nothing! Therefore there was no reason why my order couldn't have been immediately taken over the phone. Once i arrived to the resturant, the call was disconnected on the resturants side. The quality of the food doesnt even matter at this point because the customer is terrible for it to be on Michigan Ave. Again, I'm sure the Caucasians will receive awesome service, so enjoy!*put a star because i had to*

46.description: Stopped in here on a whim and had a delicious lunch. Buffalo burger with goat cheese and a tomato chutney cooked medium, exactly like I ordered it. I was concerned goat cheese wouldn't hold up to red meat and that the chutney would be strange but it turned out to be a perfect flavor combination. Top it off with a large and varied selection of tap and bottled beers.I don't live in Chicago anymore but next time I'm back I will surely visit!

1.description: I really like Burger Bar! Conveniently located just about a block from the Roosevelt Red, Green, and Orange line station, it's a great central happy hour location. If you're driving, you'll have to park at least a block away, but it's kinda worth it. The space is a lot bigger than it appears from the outside and is not too small for a group. The staff is super friendly, the place is clean, with typical bar decor.The menu is reasonably priced and accessible. They have a pretty good beer list, they have beer flights, and a full bar. I was very excited to try the burgers. They have beef, veggie, and turkey burgers which made me happy. They have some pre-designed burgers that are listed as beef but you can substitute with turkey or veggie burger patties. You can also build your own burger and they have some pretty good options. I chose a turkey burger with bacon, and was really happy to find that the burger was well seasoned and delicious and my bacon was crispy. I didn't have the French fries, so next time I go that will definitely be my side of choice.

55.description: Delicious burgers,,,attentive help and, a huge selection of beers on tap! Very convenient walk to the Chicago Hilton. Great sweet potatoes.

9.description: I laugh that the norm now is to pay around $15+ for a burger and fries without batting an eye. Well I still bat an eye....but hope the taste/quality is at least worth it. I wish it was a few dollars cheaper, but overall I got close to my moneys worth. I went with the lamb burger (house made lamb sausage, manchego cheese, mint chimmichuri (yum!), spinach, tomato-onion salsa. I thought the chimmichuri and tomato-onion salsa definitely provided a unique taste and the lamb sausage was tender and juicy. For a $1.00 I upgraded my side of fries to truffle fries and they were pretty good, although I wouldn't have mind if they were a little less crunchy. My friend and her boyfriend ate a big meal the previous night (so don't judge), but they just went with the cobb salad and sweet potato tater tots which they enjoyed. The sauce that goes with the tater tots was pretty good. We went on a Sunday around 12:30 and were surprised it wasn't packed and there was no wait to be seated. The staff was super friendly and I enjoyed my experience and plan to go back to try more burgers and sides.

26.description: I've been to both Burger Bar locations & I'm partial to this one because of its proximity to my home. I also enjoy the friendliness of the staff. The menu is to die for & I love the numerous flat screens for viewing sports. I highly recommend building your own burger if you're particular about toppings. As a tip, order the sweet potato tots crispy if you prefer a crunch, otherwise they're on the soft side.

25.description: Loved this place, food is amazing! The grass fed burger is my favorite. The location seems to dislike when you come with a stroller and they sit you in the loudest part of the room, by the kitchen and the restrooms. You get all the smells... Not going back with my child!

12.description: The burger was good, but the wings were amazing. Cannot beat $5 Tuesday wings.  I am putting it in my calendar to come back next Tuesday!

59.description: Excellent place. Sand which was delicious and service was as good as you can ask for.

21.description: Went for diner with my friend , the bartender took a good 20 minute to notice us and gave us a menu ,after 40 minute wait for 2 burgers they over cooked my burger , my burger wasn't anything special for the price I payed and was to salty . South loop deserve better then that .

17.description: I wasn't blown away and maybe that is because it was freezing while I drank and ate.  Place was crowded for an event so we sat at the bar and sort of near the door (our choice and bad decision). So that contributed to the problem, plus it was below 0 outside.  Anyway let's get to why were are here.Beer list was great.  I will enjoy it more when the garage doors are open.So we had wings and fried pickles to begin and the wings far out shined the pickles.  I think the fried pickles are pre fried or maybe that was just last night with the event coming on because we forgot to order or the bartender didn't hear me either way the wings come out, I ask about the pickles and they show up 2 or 3 mins later luke warm.  Now wings are smoking hot, I mean smoking, I am sure the place being a little on the cold side helped with seeing the smoke, and the pickles you could eat as soon as they came out.Burger, burgers, and more burgers.  Lots of options here and I like options.  But went with make my own of Grass Fed burger, friend onion strings, bacon and cheese, ended up being just under $20.  Burger was good,, not that best but good. Cooked perfect and everything came out as ordered.  Came with fresh cut fries.My buddy got a basic cheeseburger and ordered truffle fries, that he said they were outstanding.I think between the combination of the cold inside and outside, put a damper on the experience, but i will be back as their mug club option ($40) is an awesome idea.  So I can see a 4 or maybe 5 star in the future.keep it up Burger Bar and open one of these in the 60640 zip code, we could use a burger craft beer place.

10.description: Gimme those Sassy Wings ... and Fried Pickles! These two really are a match made in heaven and then some. I think I'll return just for those items.. I'm up to my second visit with one of the two.So it's not a 4 as I've had some other menu items that were less than delicious. The Baha shrimp burger was actually kind of gross in the grand scheme of things. If you want to check it out, have them put the cole slaw topping on the side. The amount of mayo was ridic. My friend said her burger was tasty, but on her second visit.. the burger wasn't stellar. Says to me that maybe certain items sit higher than others.The setting is a great sports bars with enough TVs, that you should be able to catch your sport of choice. The volume can be really loud, so avoid sitting under speakers and hoping to have a conversation.The service is slower than I'd like for it to be. Like minutes before someone takes your order and more minutes before they come back. My advice is to order everything up front, so you don't get h-angry in the process of ordering/waiting.

5.description: If your coming to a burger bar, you better be getting a burger because they are AMAZING.I've been to this establishment twice and I was impressed both times. I got a build your own the first time with the grass fed beef and it was a very solid. Cooked perfectly, although I did find the meat a tad salty. You can choose between salad, fries, sweet potato fries, or chips for a side. I actually highly recommend the salad if you're trying to eat clean - *hint* choose the red wine vinaigrette.Although the BYO burger was good, I recommend you going for their specialty burgers instead. The buffalo bill burger was WOW. The tomato chutney, goat cheese, and arugula packed a nice and original punch to the gamey bison patty.The atmosphere is great, it's very trendy with HDTVs all over. They open the windows during the summer, so if try to nab a window seat if possible.

3.description: I went here for a late lunch. I split the burger w the blue cheese with my husband  we also had the sweet potato fries. Both were good and is order them again. This restaurant has excellent air conditioning and appears to be really clean. Love that all the tables look set with beer glasses turned upside down. The vibe is great and I'd love to go back to try some beers at the bar.

35.description: Was in town for meetings and walked down from the Hilton. I ordered the Bar Cheese Burger which came with a horseradish cheese spread and the wife got a blue cheese burger with sweet potato fries. I had the regular fries and they were good. My burger was good but not great, seemed to be a little dry and the cheese spread with caramelized onions seemed to be messy. The blue cheese was also good but dry. The best thing for sure was the three way chocolate shake we spilt, Amazing. Overall I would give a 4 instead of 5 because it was good but not outstanding.

19.description: Really delicious.  I love that I can order a burger that has exactly what I want on it, but I still have the option to have some of the house creations.  The sweet potato tater tots were delicious.  And, they had house made ranch not that hidden valley junk.

28.description: It was okay. Asked for medium rare, but it was overdone.  There's a lot of things you can forgive with a takeout order, but there was no juice on or soaked into the bun.  Seems like the takeout is hit or miss.   I will give it a try eat in.   The topping combinations alone would take weeks.

45.description: If your coming to a burger bar, you better be getting a burger because they are AMAZING.I've been to this establishment twice and I was impressed both times. I got a build your own the first time with the grass fed beef and it was a very solid. Cooked perfectly, although I did find the meat a tad salty. You can choose between salad, fries, sweet potato fries, or chips for a side. I actually highly recommend the salad if you're trying to eat clean - *hint* choose the red wine vinaigrette.Although the BYO burger was good, I recommend you going for their specialty burgers instead. The buffalo bill burger was WOW. The tomato chutney, goat cheese, and arugula packed a nice and original punch to the gamey bison patty.The atmosphere is great, it's very trendy with HDTVs all over. They open the windows during the summer, so if try to nab a window seat if possible.

33.description: Ahhhhhmazing burgers!! Friendly bartenders, awesome burgers (our favorite in the city..or anywhere by far) and good wings. Yum yum yum you  should go here!! You won't be disappointed. My favorite burgers: the one with chorizo and then one with horseradish cheese.

43.description: I really enjoyed this restaurant. I was in town for a conference and was looking for a good but quick bite to eat. My friends and I chose burger bar for its convenience but I'm glad we did.The shrimp burger was amazing, and so was the peanut butter nutella milkshake. However the best was the service. Our water was always full, our food came out correctly and quickly, and our server was awesome. He gave us a list of other things to do in Chicago, and seemed genuinely interested in talking to us, rather than being annoyed by tourists. We really appreciated that.

2.description: First time ever on a Saturday (January) around 2ish in the afternoon for lunch, my boyfriend and i stopped in. It wasn't very crowded (im sure due to the weather that day). Service was fairly quick, however not the best. By this i mean our server was polite and somewhat attentive, my thing was i like to be asked if we had ever been there and get some suggestions. Maybe this wasn't the case because it's a burger "bar". All in all my experience was good and the food tasted great! FOOD: We started off with appetizers (bratwurst corn dogs) tasted great along with dipping sauce. My boyfriend ordered their burger of the month. I took a bite and it was very yummy and spicy. I ordered a grass fed burger with provolone cheese and lettuce, tomatoes & red onion. I like to keep things simple. Along with their sweet potatoes fries. Very good and filling. I stuck with water because i don't drink. However my boyfriend ordered one of their beer's (don't remember which one) but he had no complaints. DECOR/ATMOSPHERE - Nice decor and atmosphere. Feels like a bar low key & chill. Seemed clean from what i saw. $$$ - It's about average pricing for a good steak burger. STAFF/SERVICE - i pretty much explained this above. I dislike judging from a first experience from one person because everyone is different. People have off day's, people have different attitudes and personality's etc. I don't judge harshly so i overlook this type of things most of the time unless it is a really bad experience. That is why i still rated this 5 stars. I like to look at the overall picture of my experience and if positive outweighs the negatives then I'm sold.

18.description: One word. YES! I had lunch here yesterday and it was delicious. The service was great. Our server was very friendly and attentive. He answered all our questions and made some good recommendations. I ordered the Get In My Belly Burger. Loved it! A burger topped with Potok belly, caramelized onions, pork belly and Brie. Yes Brie. Mmmm The pork belly was tender and juicy...with sweet, smokey flavors. It comes with your choice of selected sides. I chose the sweet potatoes, which were yum-my. I also recommend the Sassy Wings and Baja Shrimp. The Sassy Wings are kind of spicy...with hints of ginger, sweet & smokey notes from the delicious charred tips. I suppose I'm saying I'll be returning to Burger Bar in the future. I'd like to try other things on the menu and definitely check out the beer list. It also seems like the perfect place to watch the game. It has a sport's bar atmosphere with lots of flat screens. I see really great food, beer, and sports for my next visit. A must try!

41.description: Sassy wings were amazing! Burger was amazing! A lot of different beer selections, great place to hang.

52.description: Oh good ol Burger Bar where do I begin? I have been in love with the this place since I found the original location I Lincoln Park. Their food is always a hit if you are near be sure to stop in!

50.description: I've been here 3 times. First time - Hated It. Second Time - Loved It. Third Time - It's was OK. They are still relatively new but since they're across the street, they will get a few more  chances to win me over. The burger blend itself is mouth watering when it's cooked to the correct temperature. This is where I think they lose me. The beer selection is vast. Their fried pickles are amazing and their wings are the best in the neighborhood.  The first time, I ordered my burger medium but it must have been cooked in hellfire.   Another person at my table ordered medium well but when he took his 1st bite, the mooing from his burger made us all a little uncomfortable.  It looked like the burger was put on for 30 seconds per side to get a sear and then plopped on a bun. The second time I came here, I was in heaven. Everything was just perfect and if I had written my review that day, you would be reading a 5 Star review. The third time had temperature issues with the burgers again. All in all, Burger Bar has the recipe to be great, now they just need to execute.

4.description: Super gourmet burgers. We had the elk. It was enough for my husband and I to share. We finished licking our lips. It was phenomenal. Fresh ingredients, hand pattied, lots of gourmet things you would never think of putting on a burger that may make you nervous at first but are delicious!! Truffle fries..... is your mouth watering yet? Because mine is just thinking about these beauties. fantastic. Pricey but worth it. Cant wait to eat here again.

6.description: Stopped in for a bite before the game at Soldier Field. The bar had solid ambiance - tons of TVs  broadcasting college football, lots of fans, big bar area, and a great burger list. It is a longer walk to Soldier than you might think - about 20 minutes depending on your pace / luck with lights. Beer list was pretty solid - lots local (Chicago & Midwest) beers on draft and in bottles. My server let me try a few beers to help me decide, which is always a plus. Prices were a bit high, but the place is on Michigan Ave and walking distance to Soldier, so they can get away with it. We ordered the Hot & Smokey with truffle fries and the Santa Fe Salad. The Hot & Smokey was served exactly as I ordered it and was a massive undertaking. The main flavors ended up being the BBQ glaze and the cucumber-onion slaw. The slaw was piled on thick, burying the Tillamook cheddar (and its flavor, sadly). The burger overall wasn't hot as the name suggests, which was a little disappointing. The flavors were more underwhelming than I expected, especially with the lack of heat and lack of cheddar goodness. The truffle fries were seasoned perfectly - salty goodness that was definitely worth the extra $1. Unfortunately, a lot of my fries were overdone. And  I didn't order it, but $2 extra for sweet potato tots? Come on. It's cheaper to add chicken to a salad ($1). The salad was large, served with 2 small bowls of the chili-lime vinaigrette on the side. The dressing was flavorful, albeit a bit spicy (even for my dad who loves spice), beware! It was your basic "Mexican style" restaurant salad - a good option if you're not wanting to tackle one of their gigantic burgers. The manager popped by our table to check in on our dining experience and seemed genuinely concerned about making sure that everyone's table was being taken care of properly. Very customer-oriented and friendly! If I was in this area, I wouldn't hesitate to try this spot again, but it didn't  take over my top burger spots in Chicago list.

22.description: Recently visited for the first time. The drink menu is pretty good and the bar staff was friendly. I had high hopes for this place, and maybe it was just an off night, but I left less than impressed. The burgers weren't bad, but for a place with this name, I honestly expected an amazing burger that is cooked to perfection. Unfortunately that wasn't the case as all our burgers came out over cooked, and honestly just lacked that wow factor. Might try it again one day, but there's cheaper burger places in the area that make a better burger.

15.description: The atmosphere is nice. Kind of trendy and hipster. Waiter was great. The food was good except the burger was really salty. We got the fried pickles as an appetizer and the urban sauce was delicious. It's right next to the museums if you want a quick lunch.

57.description: Recently came to this place before the Blackhawks parade took off. The bar opened extremely early and had people in there drinking around 8:30 am. They had some breakfast specials going on, which was great since we were starving. We had an amazing dish - French fries, topped with gravy, cheese curds, and over easy eggs. The food was so delicious! It looks like they have actual chefs there. The establishment is so clean and they serve a lot of beers and you can tell they take pride in their beer selections. The employees were very nice, but pretty busy. We were there until about 11 am, only spoke with our server and bartender combined 4 times. (1st round of beer, order food, drop off food and get our drink order, 2 more drink orders.) It was pretty packed in there but at the same time, they should have been prepared for what was to come since we've had 2 other Stanley Cup celebrations that should give them an idea of how busy they would be. Either way, that's my only complaint. Very cute place. Good food. Fun atmosphere.

20.description: You have to get served before you can get fed...30 minutes of waiting without a single server coming by. Asked the hostess who our server was and she replied "I'll get them right now." 30 secs later tables on either side were being helped by servers...did I mention we sat down a good five minutes before BOTH tables?!! Not sure if that's the servers trying to make a point. Too bad...We were visiting from CA and excited to try the place out. Instead we left starving and disappointed. Oh well, off to another place willing to serve food.

36.description: The sassy wings are my favorite.  The burger I had was good too, and I'm not even a burger fan.  The diablo wings will burn off the tongue of the average human, but being partially related to a ghost pepper, I found them to be delicious.  Service was great and the bartenders and managers and the entire staff are friendly and take the time to stop and make sure everything is going alright.  My waitress recommended the perfect beer for me, based on what I like and they even have a beer of the month club.  With football season upon us, I will definitely be back here to watch some games, eat and drink.  Fun alone or with friends, it's overall just a great bar.  Oh, and on Tuesday the wings are $5 for 10, so bring a friend and your appetite.

14.description: Had bbq wings and a cheesebuger with fries.  Hit the spot!  And a great bloody mary.  If you like beer they have over 30 on tap.  Seems like it would be a fun place to come in the summer when they open the garage doors facing the park.  Perfect place to eat if you are in the south loop.

12.description: I hereby dub this location "Ghetto Walgreens".  Half of their merchandise is under lock and key, and for some reason, only one person in the store has the key.    The first time I hit this, I was trying to buy razor blades.   I found the ones I want then notice there is a lock.   You know how stored hang merchandise where they use a little hole in the case to hang it on a metal rod in the wall?   Well Ghetto Walgreens puts locks on the tip of the metal rod.  Brilliant system-   obviously the thieves could never resort to just tearing the 1/8th of an inch of cardboard that holds the blades on the rod...  But wait there's more.  They apparently only have one person in the store that has the key.  BRILLIANT! As long as that one person is available, and not more than one person in the store wants something at a time, they are covered.   Obviously they have realized that this is a problem, because they have come up with a system where you can push a button in the deptarment when you need the keyholder....   This nice system repeats a fun message over the PA about how a customer needs assistance in the deptartment until their keymaster comes and shuts it off.BRILLIANT you can keep track of where the keymaster is as the different messages go away one by one...   It is almost comical watching the employees sitting around the front register chatting away as you wait for the keymaster while sitting at the electronics counter.... Maybe you could ask if you could just tear the 1/8th inch of cardboard and help yourself....

7.description: Apparently the Olay Regenerist products are what's hot in the streets, because they're kept under lock & key here.I needed an Olay Regenerist cream cleanser. The clerk unlocked the cabinet and obliged me, then asked "Are you done shopping?" I said no. She said, "Ok, well it will be behind the counter waiting when you're done shopping..."So, really Walgreens...you trust a clerk in a bad lacefront weave, bad fake eyelashes and bad, pop-off nails, but you don't even trust your customers enough to let them physically put Olay Regenerist into a shopping basket? Because they might steal it? Olay Regenerist? And you think I'm gonna steal that in a half-full basket of items I'm clearly *already* planning to purchase? GTFOH.Walgreens? Get that hood mentality out of the South Loop, please. Residents who spend money at Walgreens and other establishments in the neighborhood regularly *clearly* deserve better than to be treated like criminals trying to buy some damn face wash...

3.description: OoooOOOhhh ... Where do I begin ... I am tellin' you, Walgreens employees are something elses. For one their dummer than a box a rocks, they move like they just shitted on themselves and they act like your bothering them when you ask for help and when they do; they don't have the answer...

1.description: They have messed up my prescriptions time and time again. It's quite amazing, actually. They're unfortunately my closest pharmacy but I'm willing to travel a bit further to avoid this place.

2.description: This review is for the Walgreens pharmacy staff.  I find them to all be extremely fast and nice.  There isn't any other pharmacy I would go to at this point.   I've had to sit and wait before and saw  what that staff has to deal with on a daily basis and some moments it's like a circus (usually during rush hour).  That location brings a diverse and busy crowd of people because it's right next to the "L" .  I'm always impressed by how I (usually) get my scripts filled faster than predicted!  Both pharmacists,  Jamie and Howard are always helpful and kind.  The pharmacy tech professionals are also really patient and nice, they have to deal with a wide range of personalities and I'm always impressed how they handle the "busy rush" times.

9.description: One of my favorite stores in town .its never crowded do that's good . Everything is in order too .

10.description: Always poorly stocked with the surliest, most incompetent cashiers and managers I've ever seen at any Walgreens. Heaven help you if you try to use a coupon that doesn't scan - they would prefer you not buy the merchandise rather than try to fix the coupon problem. Avoid this disaster area like the plague.

13.description: I generally love Walgreens (hence the second star) but it never ceases to frustrate me how bad this one is.  They run out of things all the time.  I understand that they only get deliveries every so often, but they should know, based on the location, that a lot of people are going to come in for sodas/water/cold beverages.  Yet they run out of a number of these things every single week.  Additionally, service here is just unbelievably slow.  They are both understaffed and poorly staffed.  I want to like this location and I'll go anyway sometimes because it's convenient, but the Jewel across the street is so much better.

16.description: Terrible customer service. One of the worst pharmacy in the area.They are willingly to give you a reward for transferring a prescription but they will not go the extra effort to fill the prescription while you wait.

17.description: I feel like this is the worst location I have ever visited. The employee's are unwilling to help, slow and often rude. I have walked in before and asked an employee for help with an item that was locked. I was immediately given an attitude for even asking and it took some dialogue with her to even get her to tell me who to ask. (hows that for customer service? Sorry to bother you. ) Unfortunately, this is the closest location for me to run to while I'm at work to grab a soda or whatever I need. There is ALWAYS a line and it usually takes at least 10 mins or more for me to "run in and run out".  It is usually because they are too busy carrying on conversations with each other or someone they know in their line. I will walk the extra few block to the BP if I am in need of anything "convenient" from now on.

15.description: The cashier was rude! The service was subpar. I wouldn't waste my time. Go to CVS instead

0.description: I find this Walgreens and its staff to be very customer friendly and well organized for a store of its size and location.I'm amazed at how efficient the operation runs given it'sd location and demographics.My hats off to the management and staff and I invite the naysayers to walk just one day in your moccasins.

5.description: This is by far the worst Walgreen's I've even been to in my ENTIRE life. All of the employees are incompetent and unfriendly. Take your business elsewhere.

11.description: I don't know how could other reviewers actually review this Walgreens location that badly. It's not bad at all! And once I was pregnant and went there, they allowed me to use the restroom which was for the staff only. Also this Walgreens is big and have a good selection of souvenirs, clothes, food and cosmetics.

8.description: Wish I could give negative stars here! The pharmacy tech who works here is so miserable and rude it makes going here a punishment. I actually started mail order prescriptions when possible to avoid going here. The regular staff is hit or miss regarding helpfulness and the store is always packed with a long wait at the register. Avoid if possible!

4.description: Have been coming to this walgreens for months now bc my job is almost next door. Anyways, the people working there are really nice they say hello to the customers and are interested in helping you..

14.description: I don't come by often nor do I plan on coming by often, but this was the closest Walgreens to where I was staying in Chicago.  I was able to by one of the 7 day CTA bus passes for $23 here.  This thing has been of great value!

6.description: this is most of the time my spot to stop in the morn when on the way to work . i pick up one of the best muffins for the money here at this walgreens.

58.description: We were a party of 3. They brought us the check. My wife checked that everything was right and gave them her credit card. They took the credit card with the check and brought it back so that my wife signed the credit card check. My wife signed it and left a generous tip.When we got back to our hotel room after the concert, we realized that they changed the credit card check with respect to the first check, including a 18% gratuity for being a party of  9 (when we were only 3!). So they charged both the tip my wife initially left plus a 18% of gratuity (plus of course the dinner cost). That was not right at all. Double check your bill at this place

56.description: Ridiculous seating policy. You have to get there 3 - 4 hours before showtime in January to get a very limited number of seats or else you will have to stand for the performance. Not very senior or disabled friendly. Have tried on many occasions to contact the management but just get the brush off.

29.description: Operation blue falcon at the door! What an a$$ dont let the guy at the door fool ya tho Buddy Guy rocks! #semperwho

42.description: I like this place I really do and I should come here more often. I've eaten here maybe a handful of times and each experience was a good one. The salmon was so good that I was pretty angry when I found out someone at my house are the leftovers. The gumbo is delicious and I love the cornbread too. The drinks are good and decently priced and they music never fails to serenade me. I love it and wish they were open for lunch everyday too.

23.description: I came here on a Sunday for some food with friends..Atmosphere - music, dim lighting, spacious seating, anyone is welcome (they check ID though, i think)Buddy's bucket ($19) - delicious fried goodness, fried crawfish tails, chicken wings, catfish, okra, fries with different dipping sauces-Can't go wrong with all fried food items!  Unfortunately, I didn't think any of the items were just soo amazing that I would have a dire need to come back..I will come back maybe to try some food items besides the Buddy's bucket.  They definitely have quite a selection.

47.description: This was a great place to catch a show. We went and saw Sugar Blue play and it was a really good show. It definitely is a good place to watch a show and have a few drinks. We did not eat here so this review is not based on that.

8.description: I stopped in one night for a bite and drink(s) after a really nice walk around the Loop area and it was quite the experience. I went right to the bar and sat where I had a good view of the stage and settled in. It January so it took a bit. A few folks collected at the bar next to me and we sparked up some easy conversations. I learned one of them was there for open mic night and so the rest of us became instant supporter turned fans as he prepared to get on stage. He turned out to be so great he mixed in with the next performers. It was a really cool experience. And there were some really great vocalists, pianists, bands, and more. They just kept rotating through. Try it if you like music (because they redefine blues here) and try it if you want to just want to change the frequency you're night is in. The new friends and cool conversations make sure of it.

31.description: This is my first time in Chicago and a live Blues bar. Just so happen Corey Dennison was perform tonight and he was fantastic! I'm not much a blues listener but it has been a really  great experience. The food was decent. I ordered half a rack of baby back ribs and a side of gumbo. Over all the food was ok....

34.description: I hate, hate,hate that everything about this place is terrible except the music. Food is about as good as Applebee's.Drink list, short. Whiskey cocktails are basically sugar water.Staff is rude, impatient, and just all around terrible.Great music. If you get the privilege of seeing the Buddy Guy perform, it is a real treat. Every other artist/band I see is always good.  If you are going for the music, it's a can't miss. If you expect food, drinks and a relaxed time, you'll most likely be disappointed.

16.description: Always love Buddy Guy's. I've been here a few times and each is just as fun as the last. If you want a seat you have to show up early; like really early. My boyfriend arrived at noon to ensure a table for the 9pm show. There is live music; however, all day while you're waiting. This last visit on Thursday was a ton of fun. Our server was very attentive. Always made sure we had drinks. Also just wanna give a shout out to Angie, the bathroom attendant. WHAT UP ANGIE!

13.description: If you are looking for GOOD drinks, live music, and yummy Southern eats, this is your place! Stop in, grab a bite and enjoy free live blues music during lunch time hours! Besides, the gumbo and red beans and rice are REAL!!!!

11.description: Blekh. Ok I get it the music is great but everything else is just about horrible. The food, the service, the crows and the venue.... Im not gonna rant on just wouldn't. one back again

39.description: It was all around a good bar. Great musicians and good drinks. Staff wasn't too friendly though.

37.description: How cool for my first food experience in Chicago to be here!  To find myself eating homemade mac n' cheese & gumbo while listening to Blues on a quiet Sunday afternoon....wow!  I am so glad to have found his place in Yelp because it was the best kick-off to a few days in the Windy City.

0.description: "We're gonna play some blues so funky you can smell it," exclaimed a twenty-nine-year-old blues guitarist in a seventy-nine-year-old body. That's exactly what he and his band did. Every January, Buddy Guy himself holds court in this room, and every year he shows the young'uns how to put on a show, whether they be in their tens, twenties, thirties, forties... Well, you get the idea. The sign out front my say, Buddy Guy's Legends; but in January, it should read Buddy Guy, The Legend.My friends and I hadn't made the annual pilgrimage to see Mr. Guy for several years, and we thought we'd better, given that the ranks of the blues greats have been thinning (RIP, Koko Taylor, and now B.B. King...). But if anything is ailing him, you wouldn't know it from the speed at which his fingers fly over the fretboard, whether he's playing the guitar in front of his body or behind it, whether he's performing on the stage or walking the perimeter of the club, whether he's strumming the guitar with his fingers or his mouth... Ah, so that's how he gets to that level of "so funky!" Sure, we had to get there ten or twelve hours in advance to get a good table, which means that we ate two meals and a few snacks of food that was just "okay." It was worth it. He and his band were, indeed, that funky, and each of the three other bands that played that day was superb. I may even join the tourists to return again soon, especially since what I'm calling a "pilgrimage" to the home of this uber-legend is only a 5 minute Uber ride from my home.

38.description: Came for some drinks and sat at the bar.  Very cool vibes, love the photos and memorabilia.  Very friendly staff and the food looked yummy (we only had drinks).  Didn't stay later for the main performer but that did have a cover charge of $10 each.

51.description: Business trip to Chicago, First time. I went here 3 nights in a row.  incredible!  Mr. Guy got on stage and did a few numbers.  Made my Chicago experience over the top.

27.description: Live music definitely makes for a fun atmosphere! The salad was great, the jambalaya was delicious and the mac-and-cheese was just eh. If it weren't for some of the food being served cold and the service taking much longer than seemed necessary, this place would have gotten at least a 4-star.

32.description: The music is great of course, but the layout and staff treatment is awful.  First the staff treatment:  I went to the bathroom before the show and the guy in the bathroom that hands you towels etc was busy handing towels to others, so i just grabbed my own.  He got up, and screamed at me to come back and talk to him or he said he would not let me in the bathroom again.  He told me I don't have to tip him, but I am required to take his towels. I live in NYC where there are guys in bathroom in many bars and restaurants and none of them have ever had a problem if they were tied up, if I took my own towel.  This guy also walked around with a fancy jacket acting like he owned the place so maybe he did, I don' t know.  But I can tell you, i did not order a drink for the entire time I was there, lest I risk encountering him in the bathroom again. Second the layout:  I was told when i called the bar weeks in advance that there was no need to make a reservation, just show up about 30 min before. I did so and found out its first come, first served so unless you get there very early you will not get a seat. There were people standing in a roped off area fenced in like they were animals.  It would make a lot more sense and be a more pleasurable experience if people there were just more chairs for people.

54.description: Amazing atmosphere with good food and great music.  The chicken fingers were a little dry, but the burgers were well cooked and flavorful.The music and the environment on the first floor was great.  The bands they get here are fun and lively, making the place feel like a small jazz dive right in the middle of Chicago.

48.description: What a miserable disaster this has become.  I used to come here in the late 90s --and was so happy to hear great original blues masters sing with their guitar directly into my soul.  NO MORE.  Completely a commercial, pop music, horrific version of live music torture.  What a disappoinment.  If you "think" you like the blues then maybe go as a tourist to hear something different.  However if you are a true seeker and lover of chicago blues to the soul level --avoid this place.  Sorry Buddy! I love you but this place sucks.

44.description: The atmosphere was amazing, I love the live blues band even if your not a fan of blues music listening to this will make you one. The drinks were delicious.

24.description: Music is fun. Don't come for the food though. My fish was greasy, and I haven't a clue what they did to the greens. I'm from the South and have had lots of every type of greens. None were ever this weird. It wasn't crowded, yet the service was poor.

7.description: How cool for my first food experience in Chicago to be here!  To find myself eating homemade mac n' cheese & gumbo while listening to Blues on a quiet Sunday afternoon....wow!  I am so glad to have found his place in Yelp because it was the best kick-off to a few days in the Windy City.

49.description: Good atmosphere and amazing okra!

40.description: I'm all about costumer service and this place was horrible. The staff was awful and rude. The front door did not tell us there would a $20 cover after 8:00 PM even if you're in before 8! Absolutely ridiculous. We got there around 7:30, ordered food and drinks and while eating they came to our table and demanded $20 or leave.... While we we're eating! We had no other choice but to pay $80 (table of 4) on top of the money we had already spent on several drinks and dinner. Horrible customer service & lack of human decency.

53.description: Buddy guy's legends is one of the coolest bar/restaurant's I have ever been to. With a rich history of Blues and great atmosphere and staff it's is a pure delight. I was lucky enough to go with my family from Australia. My dad being a huge blues fan was able to chat with Buddy Guy and get up and play the drums. Honestly a well planned time to come as Buddy was there from The Chicago Blues festival. The food is fantastic. Traditional down home southern Cajun food. I had a full rack. The others had the soul combo (half a rack of ribs half a chicken) the jumbo gumbo which was fantastic. The crab cakes which rivaled the best I have had. And the Jambalaya everything was so so good. Being the location I expected it to be pricy however the price was very decent and the serving well well worth it. This truly is a great experience anyone from outside of Chicago or a local should do. And believe me they welcome everyone.

30.description: Ordered a lot of food and it was very plain.  We were so disappointed, we left with boxes of food and gave it away to homeless folks outside.  Was expecting some great food and music, sigh, this place is a MUSIC place. Stayed through and heard some great music, but next time will eat first.

46.description: Super disappointed. Was there before for the NRA Sargento parties many times. Saw it on best bars in America as well. Told friends to go there for their wedding anniversary as one of them is in a band. My friend tried to call and pay for their anniversary dinner and drinks. The man on the phone was very rude and wouldn't allow her to do it. Needless to say will never suggest this as a spot to friends visiting Chicago again.

1.description: Pretty disappointed with this place because the guy who was screening me to get inside was such a jerk. First he lets me in for free and then he follows me to the bathroom to check my ID again. Bro. That's fucking weird. Don't do that.

55.description: Music speaks for itself. But if u are ordering food, know that the burger is very good and the corn bread is beyond excellent.

9.description: Wife and I were in Chicago for a few nights and wanted to see some live music, something close to our hotel. After dinner nearby we walked to the club and paid the $15 entry fee (per person). Got to see two live sets from two great performers and even had the privilege of seeing Buddy Guy himself on set for a couple of songs. He didn't play guitar but just to here him for a short for minutes was an experience. The place also serves food and has a real motown feel to it - you'll know it when you get there.Overall I highly enjoyed my experience

26.description: Well the positive is great music and inexpensive entry fee, I have been here before so I was looking forward to visiting again. The drink prices are responsible and the food is good, what ma see this as three experience this time was you cannot record the show on your cell phone because they put it on Buddyguy.tv which you can stream later for 3 dollars, which they never said was a cost. I have never been told not to record with my camera at Kingston Mines,  I thought that was a little much.

25.description: Some of the best blues that I've listened too! The venue is historic but nothing real exciting. It felt like a supper club at first then they turned down the lights and it was all about the music...oh, and the huge chocolate cake! Mmmm!

12.description: I loved this place! the food wasn't all that great, but the ambiance and the live music was incredible. I really enjoyed it.

59.description: I was recently in Chicago for the HIMSS '15 conference, and needed to find a couple of good places to grab some food. A coworker and I got-in on the Saturday before the conference, and because it was such a nice day out, we decided to walk from our hotel and eat at wherever the 'wind took us'.  We arrived at Buddy Guy's. Food: After a horrific plane ride on our corporate plane, I needed a beer. I am not particularly a man who cares for the 'refined' beers, so I stuck with a classic Bud Light. It was ice cold; but I am partial to frosty mugs and disappointed that these were not available. No big deal though, as I typically view frosty mugs as a bonus, and not a necessity. Admittedly, I wasn't as hungry as much as I was craving some alcohol to take the edge off, so I stuck with a cup of their 'down-home' mac and cheese. My coworker grabbed some of their BBQ wings.I did not get to sample the wings, but my coworker lauded at how good they were. There was definitely a generous portion of wings, smothered in a thick BBQ sauce. They did look good. THe wings might have even been dusted with some sort of flour mixture to help the BBQ adhere better to the wings. I can't be sure on that though.My cup of mac and cheese was good. A little bit one-note, and a little bit under-seasoned; but I liked the overall flavor of it. The consistency was nice and creamy, so it definitely delivered. What did not deliver was the overwhelming smell of dirty dish water emanating from the ceramic cup my mac and cheese was in.  This was a major disappointment, but I decided to just finish my meal and be done with it. There wasn't dirty dish water in the bowl, it just had that after smell -- you know what I am talking about. Like it was was washed and sanitized, but the water might have been a little old -- then it dried and the lingering smell remained.Either way, it was unpleasant and disappointing.Food: 3 / 5 (4 / 5 minus 1 star or the odorous cup)Service: We received service from the bar tender who had a million other duties to attend to (cleaning glassware, tidying up the bar, attending to bar guests, etc.). Though her service was hurried and indifferent, it was prompt and efficient. For me, I like an experience with a lot more character, and somewhere where I can go an feel at home. The server/bar tender failed to deliver this.Service: 2 / 5Atmosphere: The atmosphere was alright. It definitely isn't my usual scene. Had there been music, it may have heightened the experience, but no one was playing mid day on that Saturday.  It seemed clean, but the smell of my cup seemed to indicate otherwise. I did not use the restrooms. Either way, I don't think this is my type of place.Atmosphere: 2 / 5Price: $4 for a cup of mac and cheese isn't bad, and had there been no issue with the dishware, I think it would have justified the price. I believe that the prices here reflected the quality of the product appropriately.Price: 3 / 5Final Thoughts: Through-and-through, for me, I think that Buddy Guy's is a pretty mediocre establishment. If you are specifically coming for the music, I can see how this place would be a lot more enticing. However, for just a bite to eat without any of the music, I wouldn't recommend it.

21.description: This was my first time at a live Blue's bar and I had the best time! At first I thought the cover ($20) was a bit steep, but I honestly had so much fun listening to REAL musicians doing their thing. I did not eat here, but the drink prices were great, and I definitely plan on going back.

17.description: Showed up at Buddy's place on Friday night, sold out! Hung out by the front door and pick-up two tickets for that night for $40. Standing room only, so my girl friend got drunk took her back to the hotel, jump back in a cab and headed back to Legends. Got back on Buddy's first song! and he rocked the night. He is the best at his smoking hot Chicago blues. Buddy is getting up in years so get to his club and go see the man, you won't be disappointed. Drinks are reasonably priced and the food is good. Great night overall and I have a slight hangover!!

10.description: Music is fun. Don't come for the food though. My fish was greasy, and I haven't a clue what they did to the greens. I'm from the South and have had lots of every type of greens. None were ever this weird. It wasn't crowded, yet the service was poor.

5.description: I came here on a Sunday for some food with friends..Atmosphere - music, dim lighting, spacious seating, anyone is welcome (they check ID though, i think)Buddy's bucket ($19) - delicious fried goodness, fried crawfish tails, chicken wings, catfish, okra, fries with different dipping sauces-Can't go wrong with all fried food items!  Unfortunately, I didn't think any of the items were just soo amazing that I would have a dire need to come back..I will come back maybe to try some food items besides the Buddy's bucket.  They definitely have quite a selection.

3.description: After seeing this bar on TV, my boyfriend was beyond stoked to check it out, so I put a smile on my face and went. They were charging a $20 cover, so I was ready to turn around and walk out, but he paid and I followed. For the price, it was standing room only, it was packed and I wasn't feeling doing all of that. We went to the bar and got a Buddy Brew, splurge for the 6.50 beer because you get to keep the neat glass, and found a spot to watch the show. Side note: Buddy Brew wasn't my cup of beer, I didn't like the taste. Now back to my review. All of a sudden the boyfriend is freaking out, it's Buddy himself sitting at the bar, and now walking towards the stage, wait, what?, is he performing? Sweet! He performed and it was a great experience! After he was done he grabs his stuff, does a couple hand shakes and then bounces. Shortly after that a drunk guy got dragged out and started fighting in the street. My trip to Chicago is starting off great!

35.description: (Update on a very old review: Obviously, Legends has been  at their "new", permanent location, for quite a while now. It's  much improved; better sound & better sight-lines by far.) Just curious: Legends  opened July 1989, exaclty 20 yrs ago. They received   notice that their lease would not renewed in 1999, (& probably were privately notified of their future landlord's intention in 1998), over 10 years ago Since then they've publicized at east 3 different 'new locations', & at least that many "last time" s for Buddy's winter concert series.  Now, July 2009,  Legends has been at the same location -without- a lease -longer- than they were there -with- a lease! I see no mention on their site of moving, any where, any time. What's up?

19.description: just got back from our trip to see Buddy Guy at Legends. The whole experience was so great. we went Wed. night 1/27/16 just to check it out, had a drink and listened to the band that was playing. They were very good, and our server was nice and attentive to us. We spoke to the gentleman at the front desk, asking what we should do the following day to ensure a great table for seeing Mr. Buddy Guy himself. we had a ticket, but its first come first serve on getting a table for the evening sow. We decided to go as early as 8 am. and we were let into the bar at 10:30 am. we got our coveted front row table. For the rest of the day we enjoyed live music, we had some good food, remember folks this place is known for the music, but its very good bar fare food. Our servers were great, friendly and attentive. we made sure to tip well because we sat at the table all day and night. Once Buddy Guy arrived i was so glad we had gotten our table, it was worth being up front, the energy this man releases is palatable!!!! what a show, and he signed merchandise after the show too.If your a blues lover, go to this place, its awesome. and if your fortunate enough to see Buddy, well that's just icing on the cake.

28.description: Had so much fun with my girl friends at Buddy Guy's!!  The food and entertainment was point on!  Mike Wheeler and his band was the entertainment and they were awesome.  Kept us on our feet.  The crowd loved them.  Can't wait to go again.

45.description: Decent music if you like standing up for $20. No idea how the food is as you can't get served standing.  Arrived at 9 for 9:30 show it is 10:30  and the advertised band is nowhere in sight. Opening guy is pretty vanilla. Hope the real band is worth the standind around.

33.description: Stopped by and Buddy Guy happened to be here! Great authentic blues band!!! The Harmonica player was amazing!! Ok beer/drinks ....typical bar food but no smoking inside the place which I really liked.

43.description: We were here on vacation from Calif. The Blues here were awesome!! We were there the night Cashbox Kings played, we really liked them. I don't know of many places that you can pay a $10 cover and hear great Blues for over 3 hours.

2.description: It's Buddy Guy! I wanted to love it! The music and atmosphere was exactly what I would want. Dimly lit, blues playing, cold Buddy beer in hand. I love the place and absolutely would go back again. But why 3 stars?  Food was not as good as expected. It was mediocre at best. I got the shrimp appetizer, which was pretty decent. Corn bread was dry and crumbled easily. The rest of my colleagues said their food was horrible. Didn't look horrible, but I didn't eat it. I'd go again for the music and beer.

18.description: Amazing atmosphere with good food and great music.  The chicken fingers were a little dry, but the burgers were well cooked and flavorful.The music and the environment on the first floor was great.  The bands they get here are fun and lively, making the place feel like a small jazz dive right in the middle of Chicago.

41.description: Very cool place! Buddy Guy was holding court at the corner bar stool. The food was surprisingly good! Had the Big Bayou platter with a sampling of all your standard New Orleans foods, everything was delicious! The collard greens were so good. Also had jumbo grilled shrimp...they were huge! Cool blues band playing...great night in Chi-town!
