52.description: You don't come to Buddy's for the food... Don't get me wrong, it's good, better than your standard bar food... But you come here for the music. When you come, be sure to come early... Like 3-4 hours early if you want to get a table for a 9pm show... There is no hostess to seat you, so watch for folks leaving and grab the table. There was a $10 cover for the 9pm show but that is a drop in the bucket considering. If you sit at the bar for a while you may catch yourself sitting next to him. Tip: Ladies wear polka dots... He likes them. I had the catfish tenders with fried... It was good and filling for $10-  Best part of my night here was watching Jimmy Johnson and his band AND then Buddy himself took the stage for a couple songs- and locked the house down with his soulful singing and amazing riffs. Another tip: if you stand by the counter and bar before/after he performs you will likely be able to get an autograph. It has been a long time since I've enjoyed a show this much... In fact, it was in New Orleans watching BB King and Al Green. Customer service- well I'd say it isn't most of the servers strong point, but the bartenders were good. And I'll give them a break considering how busy it was in here tonight.

50.description: I had the crab cakes and the big bayou blue plate. Both were delicious, great atmosphere and even better music.

4.description: What a night. This is my first time to watch some Chicago blues, and I have sure set the standard high. Tickets can run upward of $100, but it is definitely worth the money. Buddy goes on at about 10:30pm and plays for at least 90 min. He is an amazing musician, entertainer, and person, at the age 79. He knows the people are there to see him, so he makes sure to please. Every January he plays 4 days a week, and it's well worth the time. I will definitely come back here again. Phenomenal man and wonderful venue/bar. Check it out if I'm Chicago!

6.description: Some of the best blues that I've listened too! The venue is historic but nothing real exciting. It felt like a supper club at first then they turned down the lights and it was all about the music...oh, and the huge chocolate cake! Mmmm!

22.description: Poor service, this place needs better management. The employees here treat people like trash. The front door guy is ghetto and is the most unprofessional person at that place. The staff tarnish the prestige of this place. Food and music is good but this place has to work on manners and management. You get 1 star in my book ....

15.description: Went here this past weekend with my mom and sister. We went around noon and were treated to a live blues set. The music itself would be a 5 star rating. My mom was jamming when he played Smokey Robinson. The staff was friendly, however a little slow when it came to taking orders.The atmosphere was a little weird to me. I was expecting a little bit more diversity and it felt a little too touristy for my taste.Now onto the most important part....the food. It was okay, but nothing blew me over. My mom ordered the catfish sandwich. I found it a little bland and had to add some hot sauce for flavor. I ordered the gumbo and also found it bland but found it made a nice dipping sauce for my fries. My sister chose the best dish. She got the jambalaya which had a nice spicy kick to it. Another notable mention goes to the corn bread. I'm not a huge fan of cornbread but I did love the sweetness of the bread. Food is okay, but the performances would bring me back.

57.description: Found this place on yelp and walked a few blocks to get here from the loop. It was our first night in Chicago and we thought paying $20 for cover was a bit extensive, but little did we know that was the ticket price to see Corey Dennison. Overall great show and even better company. The locals there were very nice and helpful, they even gave us a few suggestions on where to go and see in Chicago. The food was good, we had their Ribs dinner and they had a few craft beers on tap in addition to a full service bar.

20.description: Wife and I were in Chicago for a few nights and wanted to see some live music, something close to our hotel. After dinner nearby we walked to the club and paid the $15 entry fee (per person). Got to see two live sets from two great performers and even had the privilege of seeing Buddy Guy himself on set for a couple of songs. He didn't play guitar but just to here him for a short for minutes was an experience. The place also serves food and has a real motown feel to it - you'll know it when you get there.Overall I highly enjoyed my experience

36.description: Me and my husband had a great time and the saff was very heplful they had to school me on some blues artist . I enjoyed the whole night me and my husband had a geat time he is a blues fan and he draged me here I was not disapointed at all. The waitress was on point she checked on her tables and made sure everyone was happy. Love the food could not eat everything I order I just know better next time. This place is great!Svenska folket är stora blues fans jag rekommendera denna plats stora mat bra musik.( njuta alla)

14.description: Came all the way from Austin Tx in January just to see Buddy play at Legends. Arrived at 4 and stayed all night. Buddy was phenomenal as always. He stayed late to take pictures with all his fans and sign my Tshirt.  Went back for Sunday brunch. Live acoustic blues was great. Buddy recommends the Jambalaya and it did not disappoint.  Don't miss it!

28.description: This place has simple and delicious sammiches. I was getting dinner with my husband earlier this week and he picked us up some Potbelly sammiches. I ALMOST went for a strawberry milkshake (omg, they are SO good) but that's not going to help my waistline, so I held off.Anyway, I ordered a veggie sammich with hot peppers, mayo, mustard, lettuce and onions on wheat bread. Nothing too fancy. It was cheesy and mushroomy and DELICIOUS. Food doesn't have to be complicated to be satisfying and Potbelly's is a testament to that. I don't eat at Potbelly very often since in order for them to deliver to my work, I have to order more than just a sammich, and that's more than I need on a daily basis. So, Potbelly remains an occasional treat.

1.description: Always a wonderful experience. I had the skinny the last two times. For 400 calories I cannot find something that beats it. Very flavorful!

39.description: first place i ate in chicago.  the concept is simple.  sandwiches are made to order and they are toastedi got the broccoli cheddar soup and it was really good.  the mushroom melt skinny is really good too.  i wish it came as a full size.

9.description: I like to come here since i live nearby because i really like the soup, salads, sandwiches.But omg the lines move so slow and I will never understand why when I order a skinny pair for example I have to tell basically each person in line what soup i ordered to get my soup...It's not perfect but the workers are nice and the food is good so i dont mind returning.

29.description: Potbellys are normally all the same. But this place was open on the day after the huge storm 2 weeks ago. A roast beef sandwich and warm oatmeal chocolate chip cookie never tasted so good.

23.description: The worst. It took OVER TWO HOURS for them to deliver our food. They called and told us that our estimated delivery time of 12:30 would be more like 1 PM. Fine. I can relate to being crazy busy. When we called them to ask what was going on (after waiting patiently for over 1 1/2 hrs), all we got as a big attitude and no sympathy. Food arrived cold. SHOCKER- probably because they had to drive around for 2 hours to find our office that is LESS THAN 4 BLOCKS AWAY. Why not just go get my own sandwich? Good point since I could have walked there and back and ordered about 15 sandwiches in the time it took to get to us.

5.description: The kids like it, conviniently located.....we eat here atleast once in 10 days.

31.description: A Potbelly is a Potbelly is a Potbelly to me.  But can we please turn down the music a smidge?  Or get people that can hear me?  I was already yelling and they still couldn't hear my complete order.  *sigh*Otherwise, they're nice people that work in here.  And I love the lunchtime live music.  Helps artists out!  Just turn it down a notch, kaithxbi.

25.description: Here is a place that makes good sandwiches for a decent price.  They toast their bread (which I love) and give you the option to make it pretty much any way you want.  The quality and taste are really good I feel but they do have a minimum for delivery which sucks sometimes.  I also have to wait 45 minutes just to get my order...and I'M NOT THAT FAR!  They need to change that.  This place works better if you go in person.

12.description: Just want to recognize great customer service, and today the award goes to Sam!!! My soup ordered was incorrect during my lunch break from work and there was no possible way for me to go back and correct it. So upon calling I spoke with Sam who offered to bring me another soup herself and she did just that within a matter of minutes, I was still eating my sandwich when she arrived smiling. Thank you Sam for great customer service because you rarely get that nowadays keep up the great work...

37.description: I generally don't like to review huge chains such as this, but I went to this location so often before I moved that I wanted to give them a good review. I literally lived on this block, so I would order from there quite often. I'd been going since they opened and I always enjoyed my sandwich. The food is consistently good, and the staff is really friendly. They're super helpful and quick, and when my friend came to visit and told them it was her first time at a Potbelly's, they took care of her and even threw in a free strawberry shake. Now that's service. I often ordered my meal online because it was a time saver, and they always had it ready in advance of when I got there, even if I was a little bit earlier than my pickup time. I'm a simple girl who only gets lettuce on her TKY's, and I always got thanked for having such a simple order. Guess they get a lot of people who put a ton of toppings/spices on. Unfortunately since I moved I probably won't be back to this location very often, but since Potbelly's has become my friend's favorite lunch place in the city, I'll go for sure whenever she comes to town.

21.description: I've had Potbelly's sandwiches before but I'd heard that the milkshakes were good. So, I popped in on a sunny afternoon to grab a cookies and cream shake. It was thick, creamy and delicious. Although I was intending just to get the shake, the fresh cookies at the counter caught my eye so I had to try the chocolate brownie cookie. Amazingly great! The cookie was incredibly rich but ohhhhh, so good! I may have had a little cookies and cream overload but who cares? Everyone needs one every now and then!

16.description: Potbelly's is one of my favorite sandwich chains! My husband introduced me to this chain when we lived in Michigan, and it always hit the mark. At this Chicago location, we didn't come across any service issues. It was kind of slow that day so we were attended to pretty quickly and got our food. My favorite item here is the Italian sandwich because: 1) who doesn't love an Italian sandwich? and 2) you can add hot peppers to it, which creates another dimension of deliciousness! The hot peppers add a nice kick to ANY sandwich. I have to admit it's one of the main reasons I'm a fan of this chain. Did I mention that I love the peppers? Lol. Sadly, I haven't come across any Potbelly's in Florida (the sandwich chain... not the anatomical potbelly). But whenever I'm in the Midwest, I know where to go for a good sammich!

17.description: For starters, I have never heard of this chain in California, so a couple of friends took me here for the first time in Chicago. Honestly, I wasn't so thrilled thinking it was just going to be an ordinary sandwich shop. But I am glad I trusted their good judgment as I was in for a surprise. I must say that I was impressed by the live music entertainment for a casual restaurant, and the old-fashioned, quaint feel made the experience enjoyable. I'm not sure if the atmosphere is the same for every restaurant around the area, but this was exceptional.  Its store location was a plus, as well. If you bring an appetite after visiting The Bean or The Art Institute, the food served is pretty filling for a decent price. The mushroom melt skinny sandwich on a flatbread and their broccoli soup had my vote on the first try.

10.description: Food is potbelly good but the one star is for the WiFi. It sucks. It's painfully slow and to make matters worse since there are only windows on one side, the front you get a poor signal.

11.description: Good location close to the museums in Chicago.  They had a musician playing inside that was just awesome.  He made our lunch even better - the food was just okay.

26.description: It will come as no surprise that communications is how I scratch out a living.I pride myself on effective communications. Being clear & concise.And as a foodie? When I go to someplace like Potbelly, I pride myself on knowing what I want, not holding up the line hemming & hawing over the order.On the rare occasion I eat at Potbelly, I get the same thing: A "big" Wreck on wheat. With everything. EXCEPT hot peppers. Harvest cheddar Sun Chips. Orangina.So it's Saturday evening. It's not busy. Two people ahead of me who don't know what they want. They wave me through since I know what I want.I order my Wreck. With everything. EXCEPT hot peppers. Dude says ok. Does prelim work, theoretically passes said sandwich down the assembly line. I tell assembly line girl exactly what I want. Everything. EXCEPT hot peppers. While waiting, I head to the fridge to pick out my Orangina.I walk back to the cash register and I wait. And I wait. Even though it's empty, I wait.I peek over the counter at assembly line girl and I repeat to her, smiling: You know there's no hot peppers on that Wreck, right? She smiles back at me, "Right!"So you know how this ends, right? You know I got home, opened the bag, and that bish put hot peppers on my sandwich.I felt like I was being punished, because I have no business eating a Wreck with everything EXCEPT hot peppers anyway, but dammit if I'm paying for it and I'm clear about what I want, I want it the way I ordered it.With apologies to The Good Book: My people perish for lack of active listening skills...

27.description: Good alternative to Quiznos and the other deli guys. but roast beef that I tried was not as good as I thought

35.description: I played a game the whole time I was visiting Chicago called "Find the Potbelly's on this street!". There are tons of them all around! The bf has stopped at this place back in the day and seemed to remember that the sandwiches were pretty good.We got the veggie sandwich and the meatball sandwich. I'm not sure if we were just super hungry from a day out and about or if the sandwiches were just that good, but we shoved those suckers down in about 2 minutes flat. The potato salad was pretty decent too!My only complaint...the employees at this joint! We walked in and were standing there waiting to order when the woman behind the counter just said "are you going to order or something?" Uh yes...we were just waiting for you to acknowledge us and turn around from whatever you were doing! There was just a lot of staring at us by the employees rather than asking questions or acknowledging us.Totally a five star place if they could just get a little more friendly/helpful employees!

8.description: Love Potbelly.   I am a sucker for the "Wreck sandwich"...on a flatbread.  Toasty and crispy.    Sometimes the fillings are still cold, so it is best to ask for the sandwich to be run again thru the oven. Delicious...I am not a sandwich type of guy....but Potbelly is just great...

0.description: This was my first experience at Potbelly, and the Mediterranean sandwich made for an excellent post-aquarium day snack.Service was interesting - the servers were very intense and trying to move people through the line super quickly. It was off-putting, and seemed unorganized. However, I do see how a quick line could be a good thing; this may be the slow southerner in me complaining. :)The food made up for it, though. Maybe it was because we were so hungry after a long day, but my husband and I agreed that our sandwiches were some of the best we've had in a while. We are definitely returning!

38.description: I'm a regular at this Potbelly location (usually go once a week) since they opened and all of the staff is always warm and inviting and most importantly the food is consistant.  I particulalry enjoy the tuna on wheat for lunch (with hot peppers) or sausage egg and cheese for breakfast also with hot peppers and Starbucks coffee which is a nice touch.  This location recently added a soda machine to compliment the soda can offerings.

20.description: My favorite chain sando place. Don't get it back home but love when I can go!

19.description: I thought most Potbelly's were about the same in terms of quality of food and level of service. Not this location. I found a hair in my salad I took home. Disgusting.The wait times are ridiculous cause the staff is some of the slooooowest people on earth. I wouldn't even know where to find these slow moving people to hire if I owned a business... They spend more time trying to put their gloves on and talking to each other, it really pisses me off. And when I say no mayo, I really mean no mayo. It wasn't something I just say randomly. Listening is half the battle.  And whats with the 2 hour wait times for delivery when you try to order online? I know its not subs so fast, I'll freak but do they have a delivery guy who is just as slow as the people making it? 2 hour wait time for delivery?! I'm getting fired up, so that's it. I'm done.

33.description: Friendly staff, good sandwiches, pretty cheap.If I have to rank the "sandwhich chains," here is how I usually go:1. Jimmy John's (love that bread!)2. Subway (super convenient, healthier options)3. Costello's - Lincoln Square (expensive, but good sides and very tasty)4. Potbelly (tasty, usually good amount of seating inside)5. Quizno's (Meh)This Potbelly lived up to my expectations for my turkey sandwich, but I was disappointed that they only had one flavor of ice cream and frozen yogurt: vanilla. Is that normal? I know it's supposed to start getting colder this month, but some people still want ice cream, right?

2.description: I really enjoyed this location. We ended up eating a quick lunch, I got the Mediterranean sandwich and my friend got a salad and a sandwich. Both of us were extremely satisfied by the end. The bathrooms were clean, we sat near the booths and it was busy but comfortable. Definitely a great experience eating potbelly for the first time.

34.description: Friendly staff and sandwiches are good. Love the toasty bread.Vanilla shake was pretty good. Not too sweet which I like.

32.description: The staff here is very friendly and the service was excellent.I usually order the wreck and add bacon and mushroom. Very tasty sandwich. Their milkshakes are very good too, nice and thick with great flavors to choose from.The thing i love most about potbellys is their cookies.  They have the best cookies in all of the sub form sandwich joints.  Very chewy, very tasty and very sweet.

18.description: I've had Potbelly's sandwiches before but I'd heard that the milkshakes were good. So, I popped in on a sunny afternoon to grab a cookies and cream shake. It was thick, creamy and delicious. Although I was intending just to get the shake, the fresh cookies at the counter caught my eye so I had to try the chocolate brownie cookie. Amazingly great! The cookie was incredibly rich but ohhhhh, so good! I may have had a little cookies and cream overload but who cares? Everyone needs one every now and then!

41.description: The staff is very friendly and I always get my order very quickly. I had a problem with my potbelly gift card and the cashier told me not to worry about it and took care of the entire situation for me. Great customer service!

13.description: The employees looked like they didn't want to be there. It wasn't a friendly environment at all. I've been to other Potbelly's and they're friendly, but other thsn that the food was good. I always get the Wreck with cheddar, ir tastes amazing.

4.description: I came here because of the positive reviews from other Potbelly locations. I didn't know it was a chain since I'm not from here... first restaurant I ever tried in Chicago. Pretty decent. Let's see...Service - I saw on other reviews that the service is not the great here.... I agree.  The server who took my order did not seem that happy and didn't even smile. When I wanted to change my soup order, the worker looked mad and then yelled out the new order to her other co-workers. Other than that, I can't complain much otherwise. Customer service is so important in food service.Food - Of course, what is wrong with Potbelly food? Nothing really. It sort of tastes like a higher-class of Subway (which I didn't mind because the price was still pretty decent). I believe you can't go wrong with an of the sandwiches here. I have to rave about their soups though..... you have to try their Chili soup even if it's a little pricey! It's chunky and filled with ingredients. The flavor is on point. So hearty. Yum. I also had the enchilada soup... which was good as well.Overall, I would come here only for soups because the sandwiches are not that spectacular. Customer service broke my review though.A-okay.

24.description: Kind of cross between Subway and Quiznos. Yes I am very aware that sounds like a giant insult   The major difference is all the ingredients are fresh all the sandwiches are well made the place doesn't smell like ass ( Subway that's aimed at you.) and I would recommend Potbelly to anyone looking for a good sandwich and a friendly staff.

6.description: Potbelly's has become one of my favorite places to grab an afternoon meal. As a matter of fact, I just went to the one across from the HIP yesterday.My mom and I decided to make most of our afternoon together by using the CTA and spending our time at the Field Museum. By the way, the World Fair of 1893 exhibit was a disappointing waste of money.I became hungry. As we walked back to the Red Line on Roosevelt, I asked my mom if it was okay to eat in the S Loop area before we headed back...Of course I knew this was here. Unfortunately, I did not know how uncomfortably hot and loud it was going to be inside. I didn't mind it as much as my mother did.I've heard about musicians performing at Potbelly's but their space has always been quietly unoccupied at all the other places I've been to. There was a gentleman performing today. I found out later he's been at this location singing and playing his guitar since 2007.When I compare this location to other Potbelly's, I give this one 3 STARS: it is unbelievably HOT in this place. The square footage is SMALL. There is only ONE bathroom per gender. Because of this, there are bodies standing every where. The people behind the counter are incredibly and genuinely friendly. I have to give them a lot of credit for having a sense of humor and dealing with what is given to them to work with.I asked for a Chicken and Cheddar Sandwich on a Flatbread with tomatoes. The man asked me if I wanted the tomatoes heated or fresh and then he recommended that I try it with bacon. Bacon? Of course! I also ordered a cup of chili and since my dog wasn't with me, I added onions and cheese. As for soda, I can choose between Pepsi and Coke products from their fountain.

22.description: Buffalo chicken skinny new sandwich which is pretty darn good.  Think this place is just levels above Subway, Quiznos, Jersey Mike's, or any other chain place.  It has an small sandwich feel and taste from a local chain.  Given the choice between most of the sandwich places out there this is my goto location.

15.description: I love Potbellys but , NOT THIS LOCATION!!!!. After asking what type of bread for my sandwich twice, it was still wrong! It was not busy either!!! (Blondish brown hair, large physique lady). It was not busy either!!! Why so many employees standing around doing nothing??!!!When waiting for them to remake my sandwich, an UNPROFESSIONAL cashier mocked me to another coworker, while  I WAS STANDING THERE, that I was waiting for my sandwich!! No one seemed warm, welcoming or friendly and went out of their way to make me feel uncomfortable. I only go to this location b/cause they have a parking lot next to great Trader Joes. I have been a loyal customer since I was a kid eating at he original Lincoln Ave location.  I get your style.....old decor, but he floor at this location is gross and unappetizing, chairs felt sticky/dirty and they stuck to the floors! You are expanding everywhere, put some $$ into this one, and demand better attitude from your staff. They are cold, unwelcoming and rude. Hope they train staff better for future locations.Like Mediterranean sandwich with chicken, great flavor and I have been a loyal fan of the Wreck and roast beef.

40.description: The sandwiches at potbelly are the best sandwiches I have ever had! Ok, I have only had the meatball sandwich, but why change when you know you've got a good thing? Maybe the next time I make it back to Chicago I'll order something different...or maybe I'll order as many meatball sandwiches as I can to fill up my carry-on.

7.description: Potbelly is yummy in general. I like a wreck and the grilled chicken cheddar sandwiches. The broccoli cheddar soup is good. The vanilla shake is delicious!This particular location is great. The sandwiches are made quickly and ingredients are fresh. I like how they put in just the right amount of hot peppers in the sandwich when they're requested. The location is great as it's right off the Roosevelt Red/Green/Orange lines and some bus stops. They don't deliver after 7pm, however. The service is fine and there's plenty of space for seating. They had candy out on Halloween, which was sweet.

36.description: My friend was raving about Potbelly's ice cream sandwich, so of course I was tempted to try one. I ordered one with oatmeal and mocha ice cream. The ice cream, I suspect, wasn't firm- so it melted before I even took my order to sit down. I didn't want a dripping mess on my shirt so I asked if I could get another ice cream sandwich with a firmer and more frozen flavor of ice cream. The server did it without ANY hesitation! I was really surprised that I was able to exchange it without any problems.

30.description: I love potbelly sandwiches. I think they have the perfect amount of spiciness and different sizes to choose from. I write about the potbelly in the south loop location because the staff is cool because I would imagine that we know what to expect when it comes to the sandwiches.They remember you and they are very friendly. I always ask for extra hot peppers on the side and they never charge you extra for it. Im sure thats the case at every Potbelly's. Its cool to know that some places don't charge extra for extra ingredients. For the most part, its always clean. I go here at least 2x a week for lunch for the past year and I have yet to be disappointed.

3.description: This is right between my work and the train. I'm so surprised that people were unhappy...I was so happy with my service from Taurus a few weeks ago that I called corporate to compliment her. I was in the middle of a long day (I teach full-day kindergarten and then had grad school until 9:30) and she was legitimately kind and sincere. I love the Mediterranean on flat bread :) plus avocado, no artichokes

14.description: Bad customer service from this potbellys I came expecting a great service since I work in a potbelly but manager seemed upset and was in a bad mood no smiles no thank you. Just wanted to get us moving.

58.description: It's just your typical overpriced bar food, but the location is great. We especially love it because you can sit outside and tie your dog to the fence. The service is always great and the staff is friendly and attentive. Glad this place is only a few blocks from my house.

56.description: I've been to this Bar Louie before and had the same experience last night that I did before.Service....slow as all heck. I understand it's a busy place, but...plenty of other "busy" places are extremely attentive to each table. It's their job! First of all, we were seated at an unclean table. It took about 10 minutes for our waitress to clean the table after we sat down. Then it took another 10-15 minutes for her to come back and take our order for drinks. Since we didn't put a card down, we almost left after 25 minutes waiting for our beers. I don't NEVER would do this but it was a Monday night (already past 830), we were tired, and we were waiting 25 minutes after we ordered our beers for them to arrive. Just as we all decided to just leave, another waitress brought 3 out of 6 beers and said, "oh! These must be for you guys!" indicating that our beers were most likely sitting out for some time. We did not order food (which, by the way, is sub par anyways). Last time we came here for dinner and drinks, the service was just as slow with less people in the restaurant.There is no denying that Bar Louie is a casual place to grab drinks and whatnot, but it's just not worth coming here based on the service and when there are so many other places in this area.

29.description: Hosted a small event in the private back room and I cannot say enough about the staff and management of Bar Louie in Printer's Row.  They were so helpful and accomodating!  The space was great for our event, and the service was outstanding.  If you need to host a party with good food and drinks, and you need to keep the overall price point down, look no further.  Special shout outs to Mandy, Kevin and Kiera.  Outstanding!!!

42.description: It was ok.  good for fast wings during the chicago marathon

23.description: The one star is in honor of the fact that it is located rt off of the loop, but the service is always shabby. I'm constantly receiving a text to come and ck out their specials, but it's not even worth my time. The $1 burger night is a sham because unless you only want bread, mystery meat and lettuce, then it's not really $1. The burgers are horrible, IMO. Otherwise, if you go for the martini specials, then that my be your best bet.

47.description: I would really like to give it a 2.5 for the $1 turkey burgers on Tuesday.  Why a the 2.5?! Two of us arrived Tuesday evening after 8 and waited a considerable amount of time for someone to acknowledge us and take our order.  I eventually went to the bar and asked if I could place the order.  The bartender stated that he would send her over.  Well..... We continued to wait until a guy came over to take our order.  I believe the issue is that this location allows patrons to walk in and sit anywhere, which can result in people sitting in an unstaffed area.  My advice to management is to have adequate staff to man all of the areas (upstairs, outside, booths, etc.) or have a hostess to direct people to areas where they are staffed.The food is acceptable and I will go back as it is in my neighborhood, the waitstaff is nice, and they tend to have some good deals on food and drinks throughout the week.  I would just encourage some minor tweaks with their staff and coverage.

8.description: I have had a beer at Bar Louie before and never found the need to review the place.  I remember that I thought the beer selection was a little light and that when I did pick one out they did not have it.  This time I decided to use Bar Louie as my time killer before Jazz Showcase instead of using Hackney's every night.  I must say, I would not normally choose a big chainy place, I just wanted some new scenery.I nursed a Revolution Fistmas Draft for a while and finally decided on a Bacon and Fried Egg sandwich and I must say this was pretty good.  It came on nicely toasted multi-grain bread with cheese, lettuce, tomato and mayo.  I would never have thought to dress an egg sandwich with lettuce and tomato, but this was really good.  It was just what I wanted.  I finished up with a Temperence Gatecrasher and managed to stretch it out until time to walk to Jazz Showcase.  I was not hassled to move on or order more.  While I usually am going to go to Kasey's Tavern or Hackney's, this was just fine.  It just is never going to have the local bar feel of those places.

31.description: Have tried it and the quality of food for the price is Gawd awful.  When I was nice and mentioned the quality the waitress responds, "Alright.l. Lol, it is laughable it is so bad.  Save your money and pick any one of all the other choices in the area.  I am patient but they blew it here.  Win some, lose some, this was a loser.

34.description: I've been here a few times after work with a a group of coworkers. Parking is easy around here and the location is near a train stop, so everyone had a way back home. Outside seating is pretty nice and I've never had trouble grabbing a table for outdoor seating. Indoors is nice too; However, it tends to get pretty crowded. The food is alright. Nothing out of the ordinary. The drinks are average too. What this place is good for is the convenience.

16.description: This is a so-so place. The server was okay, though it was a little busy. Ordered 2 Black and Blues, calamari, luigi sandwich and turkey burger for $56, expensive for pub food. Black and Blues was watered down (go to Kitty O'Sheas for the best version); should've just drank water. The calamari was tough and not worth it as half of the cone container it comes in is filled with lettuce. The burger was good. It didn't come with fries, so ordered a side. The fries were delicious. My friend enjoyed the sandwich but only ate half; it was on the heavy side. The building itself is nice. I don't think I'll go back, plenty of other places nearby to try.

13.description: It's a super neat, vintage building. It feels as if it should be a lot more formal than it is; the vaulted ceilings, frescoes, dark wood, and loft make it feel straight out of Boardwalk Empire. But it's casual, youthful, and ebullient. Most of the tables are tall, but there are a few regular height tables along the wall. There's a leather-covered bench on one side with several small tables pushed up next to it. A huge bar is in the middle, orchestrating the vibe.The food and drinks are fun, affordable, and fosters a sense of casual community. Everyone can afford something. We went on a Tuesday evening when they had $1 burgers. We could choose between veggie, chicken, turkey, and beef burgers. The burgers were plain, but we could add toppings such as cheese, bacon, and guacamole for an extra charge. We also bought French fries and tater tots each for $4.The burgers were kind of dry and not well seasoned. I had avocado and bacon on my burger and still did not really like it. The avocado was in a single, large chunk that failed to make it into every bite. However, the fries and tater tots tasted delicious. They tasted exactly the same but had different textures.The service was a bit too casual for my taste. It took a while to be noticed and directed to sit anywhere. Our server was nice enough but I was impatient between our interactions.

11.description: Went with my brother for dinner and beers and wasn't impressed , mostly because of the mediocre service. It seems like this restaurant used to be nice ten years ago but when the bathroom looks like it's falling apart you may want to invest back in the business . Definitely not in line with other Bar Louies I've been.

39.description: We stopped by for dinner and to kill some time, and it was just an average experience. I ordered a club sandwich (or something of that variety) and it was average, the atmosphere is what you'd expect from a bar in the south loop, and the service was satisfactory. It wasn't a spectacular experience, and it wasn't a terrible experience. If you find yourself needing a place where a potentially stressful situation could occur, go to Bar Louie. At least the place you're at won't be stressful/over or under whelming.

37.description: Celebrated NYE here... Great staff and bartenders. Prices are always fair for chicago. Try the inferno wings! Definately coming back to this location.

0.description: I've been wanting to try Bar Louie for a while now.  This location is in Dearborn Station, which is a beautiful building with lovely architecture.  Inside, you can see some of the original structures, and they designed the bar to fit within that setting.We came here for brunch, and our meals were pretty good.  I chose the PB&J Cakes, which were a fun spin on two food staples - it's essentially a hybrid between a classic peanut butter and jelly sandwich and a stack of buttermilk pancakes.  My husband went for the Eggs Bennies, and these were Eggs Benedict on fancy buns.They have many cocktail options that looked fun, although we opted for only coffee this morning.  Looks like they have great drink specials throughout the week, according to their signs, with half-off martinis on Thursdays.  They have many big screen TVs - great for watching big games with friends.  The staff was friendly and attentive, and the price was very affordable.  Brunch for two with coffee was around $25 with tip.  We will likely stop back by here for drinks in the future!

38.description: Love the place, great food great time. Yelp wants me to type more so in typing this to just retort that bar Louie Is a good place

51.description: I came in with a large group (less than 10 people) to sit outside. We were accommodated, but I felt like we made everyone's brain hurt when we asked to put a couple of tables together (even when we, the patrons, were willing to do it ourselves - as we should have). Service was soooo S  L  O  W, which was weird since there was hardly anyone there (it was a Sunday). I came back later in the evening (maybe 30 minutes after I had left) to grab a drink with neighbors of mine, and our tables were just as we had left them when I was there with my earlier party. Kind of weird... and gross, especially when people passing outside can see your outside mess. I'll be back, though, because I live in the area and you can't beat those dollar burgers on Tuesdays (I'm sure you *can* probably beat their dollar burgers, but Tuesdays are my lazy day, let's be honest, so it works).

27.description: good for a national chain.  the sammies are good

32.description: No standout reason to go here with the muffuletta no longer on the menu. Seems like any old boring bar/pub menu, nothing standout anymore. Bar Louie used to be a cut above, unique. It just doesn't have that same aura anymore and more "chainy" than it used to be.

54.description: Came for a drink with the family before a movie on Father's Day.  The place was empty, even the outside seating and it was a gorgeous day out, so I'm not sure what the problem was.  I ordered a peach bellini and a walnut, mandarin and brie salad.  The bellini had no bubbles and was pretty bland tasting.  The salad had no dressing on it, so i ordered extra on the side, which they brought out.  The salad was pretty good once they brought the extra dressing with one exception.  The menu said it had mandarin oranges, which I love.  Instead, the chef cut regular oranges into small bits, and apparently didn't think I'd notice.  I don't like regular oranges, and I don't like the chef and/or waitress not thinking it's necessary to inform patrons of changes to the menu.  The service was lukewarm, especially given how empty the restaurant was.  It's close by, so I can't say I won't be back, but it definitely won't be my first pick for a drink in the neighborhood.

48.description: I thought I would add a review concerning large groups, as our experience was very good.  We were 20 people, seated inside upstairs at a long table.  There were various influxes of people arriving, and others leaving in the couple of hours we were there.   Just for that aspect alone, the service part, handling ordering and final checks .. great!   I ordered the salmon sliders and a Guinness, and very much enjoyed it!  It appeared others found their menu choices also satisfactory.  It is a bar sort of atmosphere, and it was Friday happy hour time, so the place was somewhat noisy, but our being upstairs was helpful for our gathering.

44.description: The girls and I stumbled upon this cute bar on our way back to our hotel.  It so happened to be a Wednesday night where they offer $1 domestic beers.  I've never seen such a bar so packed on a Wednesday night.

24.description: Great place to go to on Tuesday for the $1 burger.  Outside seating in the summer makes it even better.  Drinks are pretty good.

7.description: Consistently bad food and service. Just wasted $40+ on lunch for two. Again. My office is 50 feet away, so it's tempting to keeping giving this place another chance. I won't go into details about the poor quality etc. Just trust me. Today's tipping point was the bartender (we sat at the bar for lunch, hoping for quicker service) kept rubbing his nose and then filling drinks. Waitress rubbed her eye consistently. Neither one washed hands. I am not a germophobe by any means, but give me a flipping freaking break. Just nauseating.The two stars are for location, and the iced tea is decent.

49.description: Love it.. They make an orange Moscow Mule that is awesome and the bartenders will make you feel at home.. Love stopping in after work and I highly recommend if you're in the South Loop looking for drinks or a quick bite.. $1 Burgers on Tuesday and 1/2 priced apps on weekdays.. Can't beat that!

40.description: The food here is decent but the service is ridiculously slow, only person on point there is the bartender Mike. The food is decent though. Hit up $1 burger night on Tuesdays and $5 martini Thursdays. The staff is definitely stepping it up a little.

53.description: Dollar burger on Tuesdays. Dollar beer night on Wednesdays. Casual place to have a few drinks. Dollar burgers are a little misleading. It's $1 for the burger and bun. You pay extra (like 50 cents) for toppings such as cheese, lettuce, sauces, and a little more (~75 cents) for grilled mushrooms, grilled onions, or onion straws. Also, to get the burger, you must get a drink. So it's cheaper in the end, but it's still like $10 (with a Pepsi, beers will bring the cost back to normal - I made this mistake)Dollar beers are for Bud Light, Budweiser, and Coors Light bottles.

30.description: Significant upgrade post remodel. They did a nice job and it seems as though the food has gotten better too. I like the servers but would it kill a neighborhood bar to buy a brother a drink every once in awhile? Oh, and stop serving draft beer in a talk thin glass...I'm not a chick. They are called pints for a reason.

46.description: BAD SERVICE. A couple of friends and I went there on a Sunday afternoon to grab some appetizers and a few drinks. The place was not crowded at all....a few patrons at the bar and 1 group that had already finished their meals. We were aware that we need to seat ourselves and sat in plain sight at a table near the bar and the group. After 15 mins, not one server, or even the bartender who could see us, acknowledged us. Granted, we could try and go to the bar but there was bascially NO ONE in the place.At this point, a gentleman walked in and sat down at a table near the entrance. After about atleast 10 more minutes, we noticed a server approach the man and say " Are you doing ok?" (as if he had been served already and she was just checking in). The man replied calmly" I haven't been helped yet.  Is it supposed to be you?" to which the server replied "No, it's not".  That may be the case as it may not be her area, but Customer Service 101 would be to quickly apologize and just take the man's order i.e "I'm sorry, what can I get for you?...." Easy Breezy response to remedy th situation.After hearing the server's nonchalant response, we were done with this Bar Louie and walked out. (I'm sure it was as if we weren't even there)  Suggestion: Go to Hackney's across the street. WAY better service and food is good too.

1.description: Went and ordered sesame ginger chicken lettuce wrap.  Food wasn't bad, prices were reasonable for the neighborhood, and fun atmosphere on a Sunday night for football.  Service however was terrible.  The waiters spent more time talking to each other and talking about after work, than they cared about the customer.  Otherwise an okay experience.  Not great, but not bad.

55.description: Yes, it's a chain. Get over it, food/local snobs.Printer's Row offers a few staples in the "sports bar/pub food" arena, and Bar Louie is a decent option among those. Adequate TVs, an outdoor area, and standard slighter-better-than-pub food. I've had a few pretty good salads, and $1 burger night on Tuesdays is actually quite amazing (yes, you have to pay for extras and buy a drink, but I'm a simple gal and you always order a beer with a burger anyway). Like any other restaurant, service is hit or miss, but I've generally had more good experiences than bad. So for times when you need casual food and some booze stat and you find yourself in Printer's Row, you can't go wrong with Bar Louie. Not life-changing, but does the job.

9.description: Really terrible service. Our group of 4 put in a food order and waited for over an hour to say anything. When we did, we were told that it was coming right out, but of course we waited another 20-30 minutes before we gave up. Apparently it takes them over 75 minutes to put chips in a basket and to ration out dip. It was pretty clear the waiter never submitted the order in the first place and lied to us to cover up his mistake instead of owning up to it.

26.description: Who serves Eggs Benedict on a hamburger bun? Bar Louie does. Bar Louie is here to satisfy your craving for a prison version of a traditionally great tasting brunch meal.

25.description: I'm not a big fan of chain restaurants (even the hyper-local kind), but this place is an exception. Located in a gorgeous century-old train station, staffed by thoughtful, engaged waitstaff, and catering to a more diverse crowd than any place else I can name in Chicago, this is a great place to spend an evening. The drinks are well crafted (especially the dirty martini), the food is pretty good (especially the panko fish skewers), and the physical space is lovely and worth a visit.If you're looking for a quite place to chat with friends, stay away when there's a local sports team playing or a trivia night (unless you can score a seat in the mercifully quite outdoor patio). At all other times it's the best place in town for a reasonably quite meal or a drink. If you're a night owl, it's worth noting that the kitchen is open later than any other within several blocks.

12.description: I enjoyed the space but not the $1 burgers. I'd rather spend time at the bar or just drinking rather than grabbing a few cheap burgers. Our server was great and so were the fries. I assume the beef burgers are par-cooked before service. They were over done with no seasoning at all. It was hard to get through eating one actually. A decent beer list with 20 ounces around 8 bucks. Not a bad deal.I'd come back for the atmosphere and stay away from the food specials. Maybe the rest of the menu has something going for it. Not sure I'd venture back but if I do I know what to expect.

59.description: Julie took really great care of me when I was there on Monday.  I know Bar Louie isn't exactly the fanciest digs in town, but I was very pleased with the level of service and the promptness.  I was a difficult customer, asking for the check over and over because I kept adding to the order, but every time I needed service, she was there.

21.description: So you can't expect much from this chain place. The food was fine. The drinks sickeningly sweet (should have stuck with a beer). No drink specials on a Monday night. Location is good with nice patio for summer months. I put it in the same category as TGIF and you get what you would expect from a standard place--nothing great but nothing terrible.

17.description: Pleasant! The large layout of the restaurant makes great for enjoying yourself or your party. The server we had was very friendly, and she helped my best friend and I select tasty appetizers, entrees, and drinks. I had their twist on the Moscow mule that included hints of orange?..and I was very satisfied I ended up having 2, or 3?Hint: Awesome place for a visitor of the town

10.description: I debated on one or two stars, but the overwhelmingly bad service and non-caring attitude of the bartenders and waitstaff pushed this to one star.  You'll feel like you're in France as the waitresses ignore you. When you ask about why none of the cocktails have a price on the menu, the waitress gives a scoffing answer of "a lot of places don't have prices. "  I'm not going to pay money to be treated like this. One other annoying thing, for whatever strange reason, when I stream Pandora I swear that at least 50% of the ads are from Bar Louie. How much are they paying for advertising and radio time? Perhaps they should spend less on marketing and spend more to hire some friendly waitstaff. And the food, it is edible, but never really impresses.

5.description: I guess 2 stars is appropriate since I was going to write "meh" a lot in this review.Food is meh. Brunch is meh. Service is meh (this place lends to my building theory about the deterioration of wait staff in Chicago over the last 3-4 years).  Price for aforementioned is ... wait for it ... meh.Location is great. Interior is great. But I don't go to an establishment to get meh food and service inside a moderately better-decorated establishment.Definitely better choices in Printer's Row.  I won't name names, but do some research and only come here if you're desperate.

3.description: We just order a burger with fries , The food was ok , The service not bad .For 2 burgers and 2 cokes we paid $29.00Honestly I thing it's little bit expensive ,but that's ok .I'm not sure if we back !

35.description: First off it's a great location beautiful building from the outside and there is parking in the back for a fee. There's a small lounge type seating area to one side that does not blend in with the room at all and it kept distracting me! I know so silly but still it was a distraction it was too lit up and I just could not stop thinking that it did not blend with the room!I had a couple appletinis with olives both of them were great, nice,crisp & cold. Waitress was fantastic, friendly fast service but the food itself was forgettable -no!Nice crowd watching the bulls game....

19.description: So you can't expect much from this chain place. The food was fine. The drinks sickeningly sweet (should have stuck with a beer). No drink specials on a Monday night. Location is good with nice patio for summer months. I put it in the same category as TGIF and you get what you would expect from a standard place--nothing great but nothing terrible.

28.description: Literally walked out when I came with friends, waited for 15 minutes, and received no service whatsoever. Wasn't like it was busy- just a bunch of waitresses chilling in a corner completely oblivious to what was happening. Had to leave in order to keep my cool. If I'm willing to go to a chain restaurant and pay for over-priced food in the South Loop, you better at the very least have good service. PS- this was like, 3 months ago but I just happened to get a yelp account now and still feel the need to leave a comment.

45.description: This is not a review of the food. This is a review of pub trivia night, of which I'm a huge fan. There were about 5-6 teams for the 8pm and 9pm rounds of pub trivia. Martini's were half off ($5.25), and I'd definitely recommend the Effin Good cucumber martini if you're in the mood for something refreshing. Apparently, that's one of the most popular drinks. The trivia night itself was a lot of fun. The questions weren't TOO hard nor too easy and it's great if you have 3-4 other people to play with. The prizes were free appetizers for first and second place, which will definitely motivate me to come!The space is also quite nice. It's very casual and the music is pretty low-key and calm for a bar, which I appreciated. Sadly, they didn't take my friend's request for "Bass Down Low."

33.description: I have had a beer at Bar Louie before and never found the need to review the place.  I remember that I thought the beer selection was a little light and that when I did pick one out they did not have it.  This time I decided to use Bar Louie as my time killer before Jazz Showcase instead of using Hackney's every night.  I must say, I would not normally choose a big chainy place, I just wanted some new scenery.I nursed a Revolution Fistmas Draft for a while and finally decided on a Bacon and Fried Egg sandwich and I must say this was pretty good.  It came on nicely toasted multi-grain bread with cheese, lettuce, tomato and mayo.  I would never have thought to dress an egg sandwich with lettuce and tomato, but this was really good.  It was just what I wanted.  I finished up with a Temperence Gatecrasher and managed to stretch it out until time to walk to Jazz Showcase.  I was not hassled to move on or order more.  While I usually am going to go to Kasey's Tavern or Hackney's, this was just fine.  It just is never going to have the local bar feel of those places.

43.description: I actually think the food has gotten a lot better. The bbq ranch salad is fantastic. The only gripe I have with the menu is the fact that it's an additional 50 cents to make a burger vegetarian. They don't have a vegetarian burger, it's just a portobello mushroom cap. Kind of ridiculous to make non meat eaters pay more, especially since mushrooms are cheaper than beef...The service is spotty. Expect to wait forever for everything. To be honest I think they are understaffed and undertrained. Also had a waitress get lippy with me when my loaded fries came out with bacon, after I requested without. Thankfully I haven't had that waitress again. Also, Thursday night is trivia and the mic/mc is ridiculously loud. My friend and I went there just for dinner and drinks and had to scream at each other to be heard. We would have stayed longer but it was way to uncomfortable

2.description: Food/Drinks - Great deals and the food always comes out great. I usually am here for the $1 burger specials (which btw you need to order any kind of drink...soft or hard) and I finish that burger in 5 seconds its so good. The problem I find at a lot of restaurant bars is that the drinks are either too strong or too fruity. Bar Louie makes their drinks with the perfect mix, and I'm proud to sip my martini.Service - I have honestly never had bad service. I always sit by the bar and the bar tenders are always informative, fast, and friendly. I would also like to note that I usually come here after 8 or 9 and the place is usually only about mid-packed.Atmosphere - The atmosphere isn't anything to gawk about. It has the typical Bar Louie feel, but this one is a bit darker which puts me to sleep. I think the couches are unique but not enough to sell me over on this place. There are tv's with sports and the restaurant is a bit cramped by the bar and the tables around the outside. In terms of music, the music is very soft and the restaurant tends to play the typical top 40/hip-hop/rock selection you hear in restaurants.Food/Drinks - 2/2Service - 2/2Atmosphere - 0/1

18.description: Service at this location has utterly declined. As a long-time South Loop resident, we used to frequent Bar Louie for the location, food, and service. I would expect an acknowledgement and drinks within 5 minutes, we didn't receive either within 10 minutes. When addressed, the reply, "I guess I'm your waiter." We left and will not be back. Too many better food and service options in the area. Take some pride in your job.

41.description: It's a super neat, vintage building. It feels as if it should be a lot more formal than it is; the vaulted ceilings, frescoes, dark wood, and loft make it feel straight out of Boardwalk Empire. But it's casual, youthful, and ebullient. Most of the tables are tall, but there are a few regular height tables along the wall. There's a leather-covered bench on one side with several small tables pushed up next to it. A huge bar is in the middle, orchestrating the vibe.The food and drinks are fun, affordable, and fosters a sense of casual community. Everyone can afford something. We went on a Tuesday evening when they had $1 burgers. We could choose between veggie, chicken, turkey, and beef burgers. The burgers were plain, but we could add toppings such as cheese, bacon, and guacamole for an extra charge. We also bought French fries and tater tots each for $4.The burgers were kind of dry and not well seasoned. I had avocado and bacon on my burger and still did not really like it. The avocado was in a single, large chunk that failed to make it into every bite. However, the fries and tater tots tasted delicious. They tasted exactly the same but had different textures.The service was a bit too casual for my taste. It took a while to be noticed and directed to sit anywhere. Our server was nice enough but I was impatient between our interactions.

52.description: Recently here on a Thursday evening.  We walked in and did not know there was open seating.  Customers stared at us but no staff member said anything, just looked.  I had to go up to a bar tender and ask if we could just sit somewhere since there was no sign indicating that.  Service was okay, average wait times.  Food tasted alright. This is basically to be expected at a corporate chain like Bar Louie.

50.description: Cool, casual atmosphere, good food, fast service, not very crowded even during weekend night

4.description: Thursday night trivia at bar Louie south loop,  it's the best night off the week. Have great snack foods and also good,  hoppy beers on tap.

6.description: Decided to pop in for a quick lunch. The waitress that apparently wants to remain anonymous since she didn't give her name was attentive but not overbearing.The pasta was plentiful but salt would've made the dish much better. Not the best food I've had in Chicago but it wasn't the worst either.

22.description: Decided to pop in for a quick lunch. The waitress that apparently wants to remain anonymous since she didn't give her name was attentive but not overbearing.The pasta was plentiful but salt would've made the dish much better. Not the best food I've had in Chicago but it wasn't the worst either.

15.description: I live next door to this place. I have been here 3 times. The first time we spent 30 minutes waiting for our drinks to come and nobody wanted to take our dinner order. Walked out. Second time was dollar burger night. Food was inedible. Gave them one last try for dollar burger night and it was the worst burger I have ever had in my 30 years of weekly burgers. I paid a dollar, but in hindsight I would have paid 50 dollars to not have to suffer through the agony of such a horrible meal. I hope this place stops wasting valuable restaurant space in my neighborhood and retreats back to whatever hole Louie crapped it out of.

57.description: DO NOT EAT HERE!The food is absolutely terrible.  You are better off buying microwavable food from the grocery store than eating here.  The chicken nachos are made with fake chicken.  The fish and chips are battered so much the ratio of batter to fish is 4:1.  How is this place still in business?  Guessing the bar is what keeps it open.

20.description: We are in the city with two of our boys (ages 9 & 12) for Lollapalooza & this place just happened to be within walking distance from Grant Park & a good spot to wait for an Uber driver. We came here all three nights of the festival and weren't disappointed at all. Cecil was our waiter (on the patio) every time and the manager (didn't catch her name) came out to visit with us several times. Cecil was great! (Tell him the mini Joe Dirt says hello) We tried a few apps- the triple dip & chips, quesadillas, & spinach & artichoke dip; off the sandwich menu, we got the "Luigi", and tonight we got the Chop Chop salad & the wedge salad. All of them were great, especially the sandwiches, & we had no complaints AT ALL. The drinks are kind of high (white wine & 7&7 came to about $20) but we live in northern Texas and maybe we just aren't used to the higher prices here. All in all, go try it if you're nearby and make sure to ask for Cecil!Oh!! My favorite part was that there are several dog bowls filled with water on the patio-makes me wish I had brought my pup!

36.description: I enjoyed the space but not the $1 burgers. I'd rather spend time at the bar or just drinking rather than grabbing a few cheap burgers. Our server was great and so were the fries. I assume the beef burgers are par-cooked before service. They were over done with no seasoning at all. It was hard to get through eating one actually. A decent beer list with 20 ounces around 8 bucks. Not a bad deal.I'd come back for the atmosphere and stay away from the food specials. Maybe the rest of the menu has something going for it. Not sure I'd venture back but if I do I know what to expect.

14.description: The one star is in honor of the fact that it is located rt off of the loop, but the service is always shabby. I'm constantly receiving a text to come and ck out their specials, but it's not even worth my time. The $1 burger night is a sham because unless you only want bread, mystery meat and lettuce, then it's not really $1. The burgers are horrible, IMO. Otherwise, if you go for the martini specials, then that my be your best bet.

3.description: The food here is consistent with any other Panda Express. No complaints there. I like the food at Panda Express': it's inexpensive and pretty tasty. I eat at this location the most so I thought I was appropriate to leave my comment here.There's gentleman working here that I see almost every time I come in. His name is Noah and if he's not a manager, he should be. He is extremely kind and super professional. My friend and I were finished eating, but were continuing our conversation. Noah came up and asked us if we enjoyed our food and offered to take our trays and trash away for us. I don't think that's required, but it was definitely a nice gesture. The food is good, but the customer service here is what makes this location top-notch.

1.description: Favorite Panda Express in town. The only problem is customer service. Rude and impolite. Not what you would expect. Not sure if I will be making anymore trips here.

2.description: Food is always a 5 at any panda in the city. What made me angry is the supervisor or manager that was degrading his staff! A staff member made a mistake by giving a Key to another employer and out of his mouth Quote "SORRY WE HAVE to hire as an equal opportunity employer" ......wow... I own a business and would never do that to anyone! Get over yourself you will go no where in a corporate company managing in that manner.

5.description: Once in a while, I get intense cravings for Panda Express' chow mein. Lucky for me, this location is on my route home, so when those cravings hit hard, I spot in here for a large chow mein to go - easy and delicious. I will say, I was a little sad when they got rid of the mandarin chicken, but as long as they keep their chow mein the same, they will be in my good graces. Not my favorite location to eat in (pretty high student and tourist food traffic), but for a quick take out order, it serves its purpose.

6.description: Ouch. 13 degrees outside and you're out of soup?! 15 other Panda's in a 2 mile radius. Maybe borrow some? Epic fail. Now we're having Epic Burger (next door) for lunch!

0.description: Some of the other reviews here make me want to scream. Not all of them.This place... it's American Chinese food and kind of what you might expect. There's a nice variety and there are some fried kinds and sizes there are some stir fried foods.It's not "authentic" Chinese, but then again, "authenticity" is a myth. This is Chinese food that caters towards American taste buds - sweeter, etc.It's always been a clean restaurant for me, and it's in a very convenient location (right off the Harrison Red Line stop)

4.description: Absolutely horrible. Was craving some Panda Express so I decided to stop by before hitting the train which I then missed because they took so dang long. They were out of orange chicken and the woman kept working out of order of guests of when they came in. When she finally gets to me I order chow mein and she goes to grab the measly dried out noodles left in the pan when fresh stuff just came up, when I asked for the fresh stuff she threw my box down in a huff to go grab the new pan. I got my entrees after the whole ordeal and commented to the girl on the register how slow everything was and how poor the service was and her response, rather than an apology, stated "yeah we are short a person today and the manager didn't send anyone." What a joke.

3.description: JUST HORRIBLE!!! If u r looking for a quick I-don't-care-how-it-turns out haircut then this is the place. Very unprofessional and crude. The reason why I am giving them 1 star is because the "stylist" did not charge me for the haircut because she realized she completely screwed up mine. I guess they do that a lot. STAY AWAY if u are looking for a decent hair cut.

1.description: If you want a decent haircut, this is not the place. The cut was done very fast is not clean at all. I will not go there again.

0.description: Molly was very friendly and the complimentary MVP package as a first timer was luxurious.They don't do line ups which was disappointing but overall, I would come back.

2.description: If you are looking to be in and out on your lunch break this is the place to go. If you are looking for someone to spend the time to make sure every strand of hair on your head is perfect, this is not the place.You get what you pay for here,  medium price medium look. But the workers are friendly which is awesome. Id go again if just looking for a quick cut.

5.description: So glad Nicole is back!

6.description: First time customers get a free upgrade to the "full service cut" that includes shampoo, hot towel, etc.Mid-day during the week the place was empty and service fast. Happy with the haircut.

7.description: Pretty good haircut for 18 bucks. Nadia did a good job on my old-guy hair. The locker room theme is a little hokey, but give them credit for trying something different.

8.description: woowHad an awesome girlfriend and everything was going fine until I got my haircut here at sports clips. One side of my hair wasn't even the same length. Sure enough, she breaks up with me today. Thanks a lot.

9.description: don't know why Yelp deleted my previous review. Do NOT go to this place for a haircut.  And DO NOT have "Nicole", cut your hair.  I went in last night for a haircut after work.  I showed her a photo (front, side, and back views) of myself from a haircut I had few months ago.  I told her I wanted the same haircut (about 1.5" on the top, with sides and back faded at very short 1 clippers).  She said okay, took off my glasses, and proceeded to buzz my sides and back (which was fine).  Then without saying anything she started grabbing my hair (from the top of my head) and clipping it off....all the way to only 1/2" left on the top.  When she was finally done, it looked COMPLETELY HORRIBLE.  It looked nothing like the self photos I had shown her.  I had planned on leaving a $10 tip since I came in with a coupon.  When I saw how horrible my cut looked, I just walked out....since complaining wouldn't do anything since there was no hair left to fix.  :(

10.description: Had Nadia and I must say that her customer service was excellent! I look forward to have her to do my haircut again.

4.description: Sport Clips is like the Buffalo Wild Wings of barbershops. Super chain-y from the décor to the "Welcome to Sport Clips, we'll be with you in a moment" greeting, but I definitely dig it. Although it's not an actual barbershop that does straight razor shaves, this salon totally appeals to the male demo. From the TV's touting sports games to the flirty stylists, it's just got an overall dude vibe...obviously. Ultimately, they do a decent doo for a fair price, (about $18) and they'll line you up in the back for free anytime you need it so that's a big plus. If you want something super stylish it might not be your bag, but if your head is like mine and doesn't require much maintenance I'd definitely rec it.

28.description: I have spent about a year now as a patient of Dr. Knox, working through my chronic lower back pain. The evaluation she provided after my first visit really gave me the insight and understanding other doctors did not. She spent a good deal of time ensuring I knew what my degenerative disc disease meant. She was motivated and convinced she could help strengthen me in place of recommending back surgery like so many others jump to do. I knew the minute she said, "80% of your disc is gone and there is no fixing that but what we will do here is focus on getting that 20% strong enough to make this condition a great deal less painful and tolerable", that she was exactly the Chiropractor for me. Her program, advice and adjustments have really improved my condition which previously, with other Chiropractors had not subsided at all. And it's through her treatment I got a real education on balance and all that it means to back conditioning and strengthening. The kind of service and personal attention she provides is hard to come by and I'm big on great customer service. To give an example, there was once a Friday I was still at her office after which she had closed and a patient of hers arrived when the doors were locked. It seems he needed some sort of letter for his job and she took the time to let him in, write and sign this letter, instead of turning him down. This spoke volumes to me! She's hard-working, personable and sincere. She knows her craft extremely well and talks you through everything she's doing. Her massage therapy team is fantastic as well!

1.description: I bought a groupon for a prenatal massage for my sister and she had to leave 8 messages over a two week period before they would call her back, then they were talking to someone else while on the phone with her and still told her she couldn't get in for awhile because they like to spread out their groupon bookings. Awful customer service. I'm returning the groupon.

39.description: I'd been suffering from earaches for almost 10 years.  In the months leading up to my visit to Dr. Creevy, I was experiencing horrendous ear pain almost every day.  Even when the pain wasn't excruciating, it was still there, vaguely and annoyingly.  My doctor offered little help and never made mention of chiropractic care. Olive oil in the ear was my only salvation.  The oil helped, but only temporarily and who wants an oily ear all the time??Finally a co-worker suggested I try chiropractic.  The first practice I visited impressed with their teachings of how the spine affects every part of the body, but the cost for treatment had me in tears.  My x-rays showed that I had a problem and here I was unable to afford treatment.  That is a feeling I wouldn't wish on anyone.  Another co-worker referred me to Proper Balance for a second opinion.  Cost aside (because chiropractic is expensive any way you slice it) Dr. Creevy's more advanced equipment was able to better pinpoint the source of my problems and the treatment has been outstanding!  After 3 months of treatment my ear aches are almost completely gone.  When I started I would have given ANYTHING to not experience that pain every day and here I am feeling great.  It's really amazing.  Dr. Creevy's method of treatment is unlike many others.  Her staff is great and I hope that I can continue to make chiropractic treatment at Proper Balance a part of regular medical treatmnet.  If you are in any kind of pain I urge you to seek chiropractic care and recommend Dr. Creevy!

9.description: Wonderful service, very helpful and love how they get to know you and not just as a patient.  They take the time to figure out what other items could help in your recovery.  Also the massages are the best!

29.description: I actually followed Dr Creevy from another chiropractor.  She has helped me to overcome some back pains from a car accident earlier in my life and even helped improve the curve in my neck.  I go once a month to maintain and am thinking about making that twice a month.  I feel so much better after an adjustment.Thanks Doc!  I'll refer you any day.

23.description: I went to Proper Balance because a girlfriend of mine had a Living Social deal that was about to expire and she could not use it.  As I walked in the receptionist was on the phone so I could not fault that but I did not even get a smile or get acknowledged when he was finished.  Someone in a white coat came out and gave me a form to fill out and stated that my insurance may be able to take care of future visits.  That interested me as my doctor suggested that I get a massage because of tightness in my back.  I was led to a massage room and asked what needed work.  My shoulders are the focal point but I mentioned some other things on my form.  I felt the difference in my shoulders and really felt the therapist did a good job on a difficult back but would have liked some attention paid to my legs and arms also.  After the massage was over I left the room, was given a warm cup of water and sent on my way.  I stopped by the reception desk and his main concern was that the massage therapist receive the proper tip.  (Yes, I tipped on the total cost and not the coupon price.)  I was a little disoriented after leaving and felt light headed.  I remember at other massages you are usually led to another room to relax a little before leaving.  Anyway, 3 stars because the massage was pretty good but the customer service could be tightened up a little.

5.description: This review is for the experience I had with my groupon massage only.I was excited when I saw a groupon for here because I live in Printers Row so this was a close option for me! But wow, I am shocked with how TERRIBLE they were with customer service. I purchased a groupon and emailed/called several times to try to schedule it. NO one called me back or emailed me back. Uhhhh.... okay. So a week went by and I continued trying to schedule by filling out a general form on their website to have them call me to schedule it, or to schedule it via email. Finally someone emailed me and with a curt response.... "call us". Not helpful WHEN YOU DON'T ANSWER* your phone! *note, all caps indicates dramatic tones in voice, not yelling.So yeah, first impressions: annoying that I couldn't get through to schedule it, which I found odd but whatever. Finally I did connect with someone and they told me there was a two month wait for massages! WTF? Well, that was unfortunate because my groupon expired in three weeks (note: the group on does say to call at least a week in advance.... not two months in advance!). I mentioned this to the receptionist, hoping they could schedule it for after the groupon expiration and her "zero f**ks given " attitude inspired me ask Groupon for a refund. I don't want a massage or my money going to a company that is so unaccommodating. Yeah, no. BYE.

31.description: I was very thoughtfully given a gift certificate for a 60 minute massage at Proper Balance Healthcare; to try and accomplish the goal of de-stressing me. Most people would opt for the relaxing Swedish, but not me. I have knots in my back that taunt me on a daily basis...and I want them out of there. I scheduled an appointment and since I didn't have anyone specific to request, they paired me with Stephanie. I should send the receptionist a thank you note, because it was great. You can tell that Stephanie is a pro and knows exactly what she is doing, she even nicknamed one of my knots "The Headache Monster". Now, I still had knots in my back...but it would take a miracle worker (not a professional massage therapist) to get those out in an hour. Although I was expecting the massage to be mostly painful it ended up being mostly relaxing and I walked out of there feeling like a subdued version of myself (equivalent to me after a glass of red wine). The best part? The 5 minute head massage...it was incredible. I am tempted to make another appointment just for a full 60 minute repeat of that. Keep in mind that this place is NOT a spa. It does not look or feel like a spa...and that is not their goal; it feels like a nice West Loop chiropractor. Don't get me wrong, I love plush robes, lemon water, and soothing tunes as much as the next person, but if what you're looking for is some serious help with your body...this is the place to go.

25.description: Thanks to YouSwoop my back is nice and sore. I mean that in the best possible way. I apparently was storing industrial rope with knots that any Cub Scout would be proud of, in my back. Mid-way through my massage I began thinking, "These knots aren't so bad... I can live with them... please let me keep my knots!" The pain eventually melted away a few hours later and I am coping with life after my Cub Scout knots. Fully recommend to those who also suffer the ailment of ratpacking ropes and knots in their backs as well.Pros & Cons+Health insurance is taken (PPO I hear is the way to go)+Lots of those bouncy balls+Large Staff for easy to make appointments-Not the easiest place to get to

12.description: Thanks to YouSwoop my back is nice and sore. I mean that in the best possible way. I apparently was storing industrial rope with knots that any Cub Scout would be proud of, in my back. Mid-way through my massage I began thinking, "These knots aren't so bad... I can live with them... please let me keep my knots!" The pain eventually melted away a few hours later and I am coping with life after my Cub Scout knots. Fully recommend to those who also suffer the ailment of ratpacking ropes and knots in their backs as well.Pros & Cons+Health insurance is taken (PPO I hear is the way to go)+Lots of those bouncy balls+Large Staff for easy to make appointments-Not the easiest place to get to

37.description: A lot of reviewers talk about injuries that precipitated going to Dr. Knox. For me, I found that just working at a computer about 5 hours a day is enough to push your body to the limits. I'm a 30-year old healthy woman but my posture was so-so and it was straining my lower back, feet, and knees. After a fair amount of easy-to-learn and non-strenuous exercises, my core became stronger, my neck was straighter (instead of nerd-like forward head posture) and my knees didn't click anymore. They are incredible in their knowledge and in their manner. Dr. Christina Knox has a soothing, approachable quality and Dr. Steve Knox helps to push you further with a great sense of humor.
