Beyond the classic training of this chiropractic office, they also improve your overall health with cutting-edge awareness of 'alternative medicine'. I wish it wasn't called alternative; especially since it works!  Long story short: I have been 100% impressed with the quality of treatment from Proper Balance Healthcare and have thoroughly enjoyed the personalities and professionalim of the entire staff.

21.description: Got in on LivingSocial deal for a massage.I saw Morgan.  She no longer works there, but she was one of the best masseuses I have ever had.  Listened exactly to what I need and worked those areas longer.  Too bad she doesn't work there anymore.  I haven't yet gone back there, but it's close to where I use to live.

16.description: I had never been to a chiropractor previously and picked this one based on yelp reviews  (which is why I'm reviewing this now) and because it seemed like they had a good 'whole' approach that included physical therapy and massage along with adjustments.  I knew that I would need more than the average "crack and go' since I had been experiencing lower back issues for quite some time, without too much success with other treatments.The staff was always very nice and accommodating throughout the months that i went to PBH, with the physical therapist truly being the best part of the three headed approach.  Massage was good, but it was a revolving door of staff, which wasn't the best thing when you're trying to build on the last session.  Starting over with someone new, especially some of the less experienced people right out of school was totally a waste of time.  There were a few therapists there however that made that 30 minutes of the visit worth it.One thing that was pretty annoying was having to actually tell the massage therapists what to do each and every time you had a massage.  There should have been more communication between the doctors and the massage therapists.  I understand how important feedback is, but I shouldn't be directing you at all in a place that prides itself on a complete 'treatment' - if i knew what to do, my pain would have been gone long ago.This part of my experience, just smelled like is was built for people to milk their insurance into paying for a massage that made them feel good, but not something that was actually part of a recovery program.  A couple therapists were really fantastic and knew what they were doing when it came to muscular structure and how it played a role in your ailment, the others were barely different than getting a massage school session at Cortiva for $40.Anyway, from the beginning, the doctor laid out a plan and assured me that there was no reason that she thought I wouldn't see relief if i committed to the schedule she laid out (which miraculously, lined right up with the exact amount my insurance would cover for 'one instance' of treatment).That's fine, all I'm looking for at this point is a solution.  So i committed, and three months later, I was not all that much different than when i walked in the door for the first time.That said, I get the fact that these people aren't going to be able to solve every problem, everyone has.  It's just the nature of what they do.  If you're arm is broken, no matter how much massage, PT and chiropractic 'adjustment' you get, you're arm is still going to be broken.  What bothered me most about this place, was that by the time we were coming to the end of my treatment plan, the input from the doctor was less and less frequent.  It was as if they could smell the well drying up.  To the point, where we actually scheduled and followed through with an MRI to get a closer look at my problem, that was met with indifference on the part of PBH.  When i came in for my last session, i had my adjustment, my massage, and that was it.  No exit consultation, no real suggestions on what next steps for me could be, seemingly, and truly, absolutely no concern for me and my recovery.  A very nice smile and see you later, but nothing that I expected.  After working with a small group of folks for that many months, seeing them 3 times a week, there was one massage therapist and one physical therapist that were great and seemed to have true concern about what i could do there, and outside of there, to help my situation.  Other than that, including the two main doctors, you're just a number...and that number coincides with what your insurance is willing to cough up for you.If you're looking for some sort of surface level massage/chiropractic type session, that is more relaxing than anything and your issue is slight or basic maintenance, this place is probably fine.  If your issue is a little deeper than something a basic massage can't clear up and you're looking for someone to really delve into your issue and spend time and effort trying to find a solution with you, you should probably look to someone that will actually spend the time to find a solution with you instead of just putting you into the same routine they put everyone else into, hoping it'll fix your issue.To PBH, if you can't fix someone's issue, it would be nice for you to put together some sort of exit consultation where you could outline some potential next pathways.

17.description: I have seen Dr. Knox on a monthly basis for maintenance since going through my correction program back in 2011.  It is time for me to provide an update because the treatments really do have a profound impact on the way I feel.  I am getting married in the near future and because of all the craziness I kept pushing back my monthly maintenance appointment this month.  With each week I could feel the old pain slowly coming back in my lower back/hips/neck and I found myself having pain in my hand.  Yesterday I finally went in for a massage followed by an adjustment (I think my adjustments are more effective after the muscles are loosened by the massage).  I told Dr. Knox what was going on and she performed my adjustment and went over where the issues were showing up on the fancy machine (she always does this).  Sure enough, my upper neck and hip area were out of whack, but then I could see how it was corrected after the adjustment.  She gave me traction, manually adjusted my neck and hips and then I told her about my hand and she said it was likely a result of the misalignment of my neck and did a small hand adjustment.  She told me it would likely feel better the next day now that I had my adjustment.  Here's the thing...she was exactly right!  I was definitely feeling the adjustment after effects last night, but this morning I felt great!  My neck wasn't stiff, my hand didn't hurt and my hips felt so much better when I walked the dog this morning.  I really believe if you go through the proper balance program as suggested in your initial visit and follow up with monthly maintenance you will see a huge LASTING improvement.  I speak from experience!  I cannot thank Dr. Knox enough for the improvements she has made to my quality of life and I will continue to keep up with my maintenance (on time) because it is worth it, plain and simple.

10.description: I went to Dr. Knox from March to July of 2013 to treat a shooting neck pain which affected my upper back and mobility. I subscribed to her full plan of treatment which was weekly, then bi weekly then monthly adjustments in addition to physical therapy. I spent over $1000 and still have the issue. She did no final check when the regimen was complete. Only suggested  I continue to get adjustments and add massages. During the course of treatment I expressed concern I wasn't improving and she only told me it takes time.When I requested my records to take them to a doctor at the rehabilitation institute of Chicago, they said they would have to charge me $60. I offered a thumb drive to transfer them digitally and he said that was cost even more due to some record policy.Insult to injury- literally.I rating massages only, 5 stars for Ellen who was amazing.

11.description: I was a first time client recently with a Groupon, for a one-hour massage. It was a good experience overall. The therapist (Cassidy, I think) was just excellent. The only downside is that it was very noisy. Even with a wind machine going, I could hear phones ringing, conversations in the hallway, and a baby wailing.

26.description: As another review stated, "WOW" is right!  The only regret I have now that I've been to PBH is not having given chiropractic care a chance sooner.  I never knew what "normal" was in terms of back and neck pain and now I do - it's no pain!  I've spent 10 years of my life with back and neck issues and for the first time since then I can sit comfortably, sleep through the night and walk around feeling 100% awesome.On top of the top notch care, the staff is incredibly kind.  I actually look forward to my appointments (even ones that don't include massage :)).  I feel stronger and happier.  Thank you so much!

27.description: wow Wow WOW!  Had a Youswoop deal for a 1 hour massage.  PROs- My back feels brand new.  Best massage I've ever had.CON- I may have started a new addiction to this place!I was assigned to Diandra.  She asked some questions.  I told her I preferred more pressure versus less.  I opted for the full body massage (instead of lower or upper body).  I'm a dancer and also have a stationary 40+ hr job at a computer, so I told her I have a lot of tension in between my shoulder blades and mid to lower back.  Diandra started on my back and...D@MN!  Diandra is a knot master!  My back even felt pretty good that day, and she dug out knots I didn't even know I had.  Every single knot in my back was tackled, not necessary untangled (b/c that's impossible), but thoroughly tackled.  She worked some sort of magic where just when it hurt maybe a bit more than preferred, she eased up and smoothed out the surrounding tissue.  It was a short bittersweet pain followed by extreme relief and relaxation.  I found myself on the brink of drooling every couple minutes.  Gross, but I'm serious.  My back has never felt better.The leg, arm, hand, and feet massage were also very good.  But next time, I will simply have Diandra focus on the back/upper body (my trouble areas).This massage was just what I needed after a long day of work.  I left Proper Balance Healthcare happy, relaxed, and feeling like a million bucks.  I'm already saving money for my next appointment.

35.description: I was routinely getting massage treatment while living overseas for neck tension as well as residual issues following a car accident and after moving to Printers Row I decided to give these guys a try.  I am very skeptical of chiropractors from time working at a major insurance company many years ago so I came in with less than an open mind.What I like about this place is that they utilize massage therapy, traditional PT exercise / training / ultrasound, and chiropractic care.  As a result of this combination approach I have been able to greatly increase my neck's range of motion and core body strength.  Its a work in progress but definitely making it.Everyone there is a pleasure to deal with as well which is important in a long term relationship such as this.

8.description: I came to Proper Balance Health and Wellness Center because of neck and upper back pain due to sitting at a desk all day. I had a consultation with Dr. Elliot Jordan. Dr. Jordan was very thorough asking a lot of questions about my day to day activities so that he could get an idea of what may be the cause of my back pain. After that he did an x-ray scan of my back that used low radiation. And explained the results of the scan in detail and what could be done help alleviate the pain. The equipment they use is state of the art and Dr. Jordan explains what's going to happen so that you're not surprised by anything. As great as the electro-massager is, having Dr. Jordan crack my back manually was awesome. I could feel the tension release immediately.I'll definitely go back and see Dr. Jordan again.

0.description: Very close to Marina City on Wells, I was not expecting a massage place here. I needed a fix on my back and saw that they offered massages. I called them for an appointment and the only thing I did not like was the 24 hour prior to appointment cancellation fee of $25 other than that I enjoyed my time with them. I arrived 15 minutes to sign a few documents with the receptionist (which was rude) she was strict on having me sign all parts of the insurance agreement even though I did not use insurance on my massage. Chastity, my masseuse was very polite and did a great job on my back. I would definitely come back to Chastity again and not the receptionist.

38.description: When I first came into Proper Balance, my back was really tight, I leaned towards my right side and was putting almost 12lbs more weight on my right leg and had a tough time sleeping.  Years of distance running, sitting on airplanes and in front of computers really took a toll on my body.  Dr. Knox (formerly Dr. Creevy), performed some tests to show me where I was out of alignment and developed a plan to help fix my problems and prevent future issues.  Now my weight is more evenly balanced, my back has more flexibility, and I sleep throughout the night without waking as much from back pain!  My health improvement is directly related to the amazing team at Proper Balance.  Dr. Knox, Steve and her staff do an amazing job at listening to what is hurting you and focuses on reducing the pain (without the use of medicine) as quickly as possible while showing you how to prevent it long-term.The combination of Physical Therapy/exercises, the manual alignment (AKA massage!) and the normal alignment (when your bones crack and you feel this amazing sense of relief) and the periodic tests to measure your improvement have a high impact on the rate of your health improvement.I will cut out cable TV and a few nights out to dinner before I stop going to Proper Balance, that is how beneficial they have been to my health.PS: Try the water in the funky Nikken gravity water filter in front lobby, it is the best water I have ever had!

20.description: The nice people at Proper Balance gave me another chance to experience a massage with a different therapist, and I will say that it was much, MUCH better. I believe that my therapist's name was Chastity (pretty sure), and she definitely provided the deep tissue, stress relieving massage that I was looking for. She also did a few techniques that I had never experienced before. My tip is to be really clear about what you are looking for when you book, b/c it seems like they have a lot of different techniques that they do, and they should be able to match you w/the therapist that is best at what you are looking for.  Its also a good deal vs. going to a spa, as they charge $70/$75 vs. $100+ at a spa. Just know that it is not a spa environment (i.e. with the robe, quiet room etc.) but it is still very nice, as it is in a relatively new building.

19.description: In response to the owner's comment and update what happened to all future users. Basically, Dr. Knox called and offered to waive the adjustment cost for me to remove the review. I REFUSED and paid the entire charge in full and took the receipt because I don't trust her or the business and does she believe my integrity is worth so little?. I have high doubt about her ethical standard. Seriously, she is one of the most hypocritical person I have ever met. Earlier when I said I wanted to switch to another Chiro practice, she did this entire routine of how she is hurt, she opened early for me (seriously, the opening time is 7:30 on Friday, and there s other people there already) and how it is only 40 bucks with my insurance, aka why would i make her upset when i only have to pay so little. Hello, this is my money and my time. Seriously, I dont want to work with her and you can go find out for yourself and I wrote to the board of Chiro practice informing them of the business s unethical behaviors.Also she called me, I didnt call her, wasted another 20 mins of my time. Also, who is Christina? the reviewer? Steve said, "it is not worth my time to argue with you, I will just call our biller and bill u and u can decide to pay or not" That is what he said, please stop misrepresenting yourself.And also I know you dont offer free service, just don't give ppl "free" adjustments then charge them for it, made under the pretense of not knowing their insurance, which u called the insurance company 3 months ago and somehow the bill from the other chiropractitioners got delayed for that long. I don't think so. And seriously it is what happened afterward that made me angry or else who has the time to write such long comments. Anybody who posts on yelp knows how long this takes and i have better things to do with my time than arguing with ppl like these if not for the fact that I don't want them to get the last word on this and pretend like they are who they say they are.

33.description: I've hurt my back a few times in the past and my doctors always just gave me pain relievers or muscle relaxers, but the problem just kept coming back. I was very skeptical of chiropractors but after a friend convinced me to go to for a consult I looked on Yelp for a suggestion. I found Proper Balance and made an appointment. They got me in right away and gave me a full assessment within 24 hours. Because I was in so much pain they were able to get me in multiple times over the next two weeks until the pain had subsided and started me working on a regular PT exercise schedule immediately. I have been going for about two months now and have no pain at all. My core is much stronger than it ever has been and they keep giving me tougher exercises to do so I am constantly being challenged. I just go in for a minor adjustment every week or so and some PT. Soon it will be a monthly visit or calling them if I need to come in. As everyone else on Yelp writes, the best part about Proper Balance is the people. They obviously go out of their way to hire nice people who really care. The atmosphere is relaxed and fun and their brand new office across the street from the old one is spotless and beautiful. It is also easy to get appointments that fit your schedule. The other thing I love is that they do not overbook! When you get there for your appointment you either go straight in for massage therapy or start on your PT. I am always there an hour at the most compared to most doctors' offices where you sit for 45 minutes past your appointment in order to see someone for five minutes. They appreciate the business and understand that your time is important to you. I would recommend them to anyone!

2.description: I was gifted a Groupon to Proper Balance for a Prenatal Massage and am thoroughly impressed with the massage I received. I like a deeper pressure, which is hard to find in a prenatal massage session, but Chastity was phenomenal and used the perfect amount of pressure. She found all of my many knots and was able to work out a lot of the aches and pains that I have been experiencing due to pregnancy. She was professional and attentive, and kept the environment very comfortable for me. This was one of the best massages I've had, hands down. My only complaint is that I don't think I could afford her on a regular basis since I'm a pregnant student! :-( However, I know that in the future if my budget allows for it, I will be visiting her again and I would definitely recommend her to any pregnant women needing a therapeutic massage.I have an appointment set up soon with Dr. Knox for chiropractics--she seems very professional and like she will be able to help prepare me well for childbirth. I hope that I have as wonderful of an experience with her as I did with Chastity!

34.description: One of the few good youswoop purchases I made!  They moved to a new location across the street 733, so I've never been to the 800 building.  So, it's pretty stark and bare, and I wasn't sure what to expect.  The receptionist was warm and friendly, and got started on my massage appointment with Stephanie.  She was amazing!  I don't think I'm a massage snob or anything, but I have gotten enough to know what I like and she does deep tissue like no one's business!  I don't like massages where I'm just getting rubbed massage lotion on me.  I want the knots worked out, and she found them and has very good techniques as to get them out.  I was amazed at how much she got done in the one hour.  When I got up I felt so much stress lifted off my shoulders and just in a state of bliss and euphoria - like you just got great news about something.  It's been a while since I've come across a massage where I felt anyone has done some real work.  I would like to come back here for more of these massages, but worry of what that cost would be.  It's unfortunate that the youswoops are only good for one visit per person, otherwise I would have gotten more.  You can purchase them as gifts for other people, but I'm sure it's a way to get more new patients.

32.description: I came here with a groupon for a massage.  While the atmosphere was not very spa like as it is a chiro's office, Stephanie did a great job of working my knots out.The downside- the location.  It's a rather barren spot in the south loop with no meter parking and not easily accessible from public transit.

18.description: Let's be honest, I know nothing about chiropractic care and had always been a little nervous about trying it out.  Dr. Jordan was great with me and made me feel so comfortable.  He answered all my questions and really explained everything thoroughly.  It's so important to me to be treated like and person, not just another nameless patient or customer wherever I go, and Dr. Jordan surpassed my expectations.  I would absolutely recommend him to all my friends.  I feel awesome and can't wait for another visit!

13.description: I've had back pain for about the last two years. I'd slipped a disc and completed several months of physical therapy. That helped with the actual injury, but not with the additional strain on my back that my pregnancy brought me.I'd avoided chiropractors out of fear of having my neck and back "cracked". Then, I was referred to Dr Martinez by a friend of the family...She was FANTASTIC! She took the time to better understand my history, and actually listened to the various activities that help, or hurt me. She did a complete and comprehensive exam, which also included ON SITE X-rays. Dr Martinez put my nerves and worries to ease with her kind nature. I'll definitely be returning. That's saying a lot, since I live an hour away.

4.description: I haven't had an adjustment here or any services for that matter. However, I've been there many times as an accompaniment. I think the facility is spacious, appears clean, with a variety of equipment. The doctors and therapists appear to know what they are talking about (again, I haven't had any services). The massage therapists are friendly and professional.HOWEVER, I am only writing this review (and giving my 3 stars) in hopes that the facility sees it and does something about their receptionist, Nancy.Not sure if the place is making good money, but for a couple more bucks an hour, I'm pretty sure they could afford a friendly front line person that actually greets people when they come in and is not always looking down to avoid eye contact. While people are in the waiting area, a good receptionist can/knows how to make small talk or at least ask people how they are doing. Nothing!Not sure if maintaining appointments (on a computer system) is difficult but seriously, she seems to struggle with it, can't communicate exactly when the upcoming appointments are, or what the appointments will be for (and assumes everyone has all the time in the world to hang out here). I'm saying this because after several appointments of JUST adjustments, all of a sudden we walk in one day and she said "you have adjustments, massage appointments, and a re-exam today". Um, excuse me?!?!? We thought this was another 15 minute appointment like the last three have been. Had we known, we wouldn't have made plans for after the 15 minutes. We can't reschedule without paying a $25 fee, you say?!?!? Oh, sure, you'll mention THAT, but won't mention that the appointment was going to take at least an hour when we booked it. I see. That's world class customer service if I ever saw one.She evens goes to state that they overbooked the number of adjustments because "she didn't keep track". Ok, I'll give her points for knowing she's incompetent.Dr. Knox....if you're reading this...please do something about Nancy. Either send her to customer service training or replace her!!!! I may someday want to get services done there myself but there's no way I can deal with Nancy and scheduling appointments at this point!!! Front line and customer service is a foundation to any business. This place definitely has potential for being five stars.

24.description: I just had a 60-min swedish massage here a couple of days ago, using my youswoop. The space is pretty big, they have a area for physical therapy right by the front door, and then individual rooms I assume for massages and adjustments. At first I thought this place might not have the massage ambiance I'm used to at a spa, I was wrong, the small room that I had my massage was cozy and quiet. Now onto the service, I really liked the massage, the amount of pressure was just right and it definitely ease my shoulder/neck muscle pain. My massage therapist asked me which areas bothers me and unknot some of the knots by my shoulder blades. I was instantly relieved from the tension on my shoulders. Good stuff! Now since I have insurance and it's walkabl, I think I will be going back for a chiropratic exam and more massages!

6.description: Had a massage here on a Groupon, not bad not great. Its a clinic that offers massage so do not get that confused. You can tell the associates are encouraged to promote the bodywork & wellness portion of the business, which is fine but id help them find the passion in that aspect of their employment. Clean, spacious, easy location.

surface level massage/chiropractic type session, that is more relaxing than anything and your issue is slight or basic maintenance, this place is probably fine.  If your issue is a little deeper than something a basic massage can't clear up and you're looking for someone to really delve into your issue and spend time and effort trying to find a solution with you, you should probably look to someone that will actually spend the time to find a solution with you instead of just putting you into the same routine they put everyone else into, hoping it'll fix your issue.To PBH, if you can't fix someone's issue, it would be nice for you to put together some sort of exit consultation where you could outline some potential next pathways.

15.description: I got a few treatments after discovering the place via a Groupon massage.  The chiropractors and massage therapists were nice (which is why this is a 2 vs. 1 star review) but I'd give a 1 star primarily in response to the billing process.  When paying my balance due, I noticed that I was being charged for services I had already paid for (via Groupon and my HRA/FSA).  It was a $200 discrepancy which is why I noticed and I must have gone into the facility/called to inquire about the matter at least 5x but each time was told someone will look into it and get back to me.  They were nice about it but alas I never got a call back.  After a good 2 months of this back and forth I finally decided to go through my insurance to look into it/call proper balance on my behalf which seemed to resolve everything.  I've never experienced this sort of billing discrepancy with a medical practitioner before and I completely understand things happen but the lack of communication/responsiveness re the issue is what got to me.  Not sure if I'm a one-off case but just writing this review as a heads up for patients to maybe double check your statement here.

7.description: Beautiful facility but HORRIBLE at keeping appointments!  I went in for a groupon massage and was excited thinking it would be great!  However after waiting 55 minutes I went from relaxed, to annoyed to angered!  One person said it would be 15 minutes, not 55 minutes!  That's insane!  I'm sure it's a great chiropractor but scheduling and appointments they are lackluster.  My appointment was at 10:30 am Saturday morning, and it didn't start till 11:30 am.  Just what I wanted to do is wait for 60 minutes before I start.  I'd much rather run errands, sleep, anything besides sit around for 60 minutes.  To add to there horrible service, there bathroom is broken, I had to go in the alley like a bum because there's nothing open around there.  In regards to the massage, this is the only reason why they got 2 stars.  The massage was very good!  The therapist was clearly trained and very professional.  If it was not for the horrible service, then I would absolutely return.  Next time just be honest and tell people the actual wait time.  I would have gone and came back or just rescheduled.

36.description: I've been to several chiropractors in my life, and I've always been nervous when they lay me on the table and crack my neck... I've never felt that way with Dr Creevy-Knox. She does a holistic approach (not as hippie as it sounds) that involves massage therapy, physical therapy, and chiropractic work. On top of that she encourages an overall wellness lifestyle.I love her office too! Its open and spacious with lots of light, it makes going there a pleasure (as opposed to an office with lots of walls and low ceilings). It sounds like an insignificant thing, the office space, but it really does effect how you feel when you walk out of there. I've never been so happy with a chiropractor. I'm always walking out of her office with a smile on my face

30.description: I used to be dubious about chiropractic care, adjustments and the like.  But not anymore -- after an efficient combination of massage, physical therapy, exercises and adjustments -- i feel better than ever and have zero knee and hip pain - absolutely amazing - the doctors, therapists and LMTs are top notch here!  love this place -- caters to your schedule, teaches you life-long habits for a more balanced lifestyle and future--

3.description: I had a spectacular massage here and would return again if they could get their reception straightened out. The woman who answers the phone (Nancy) and checks you in is exceptionally unfriendly and unprofessional. She instills no confidence when you make your appt and again when you ask questions at the check in.My appt was on time and I believe Jenny was the therapist who did such a great job. It's really close to my house and I was introduced to them via Groupon, but don't think I'll be going back.

14.description: wow Wow WOW!  Had a Youswoop deal for a 1 hour massage.  PROs- My back feels brand new.  Best massage I've ever had.CON- I may have started a new addiction to this place!I was assigned to Diandra.  She asked some questions.  I told her I preferred more pressure versus less.  I opted for the full body massage (instead of lower or upper body).  I'm a dancer and also have a stationary 40+ hr job at a computer, so I told her I have a lot of tension in between my shoulder blades and mid to lower back.  Diandra started on my back and...D@MN!  Diandra is a knot master!  My back even felt pretty good that day, and she dug out knots I didn't even know I had.  Every single knot in my back was tackled, not necessary untangled (b/c that's impossible), but thoroughly tackled.  She worked some sort of magic where just when it hurt maybe a bit more than preferred, she eased up and smoothed out the surrounding tissue.  It was a short bittersweet pain followed by extreme relief and relaxation.  I found myself on the brink of drooling every couple minutes.  Gross, but I'm serious.  My back has never felt better.The leg, arm, hand, and feet massage were also very good.  But next time, I will simply have Diandra focus on the back/upper body (my trouble areas).This massage was just what I needed after a long day of work.  I left Proper Balance Healthcare happy, relaxed, and feeling like a million bucks.  I'm already saving money for my next appointment.

58.description: I would actually give this Gino's East 3 1/2 stars. Ordered a 9" deep dish sausage pizza and an order of mozzarella sticks. The mozzarella sticks are homemade from scratch on site.  Was one of the better cheese sticks I have ever had.  The pizza was made with a delicious Roma tomato sauce. The pizza was a four slice pizza enough to feed two people as long as you order an appetizer with it.  I would definitely rank Gino's East as one of the better franchised Chicago style pizza even ahead of the so called great Giordano's.

56.description: After running around in the cold we were extremely pleased to have come around Gino's. We were seated promptly, given our drinks and enlightened on the specials.  Pizza did take a while to arrive, but it was worth the wait.  Wonderfully fresh and saucy, nicely topped with a ton of cheese and sausage patties it was irresistible and full of flavor.  The deep dish dough was soft and crunchy in all the right places.  Unfortunately we didn't have a chance to visit any other locations, but this one was very good. Give them a shot if you're in that neck of the woods.

29.description: I'm a newbie to Chicago pizza, but I have to say it was excellent. But it must be eaten fresh. My husband and I went to Chicago for the day and of course we have to try pizza. A friend suggested this place and it definitely did not disapoint. Really great atmosphere, got to try local beers and the pizza was AWESOME! We only had time to eat one slice each because we had a megabus to catch so we took it to go.I ate a piece on the bus and it definitely was not as good. We arrived at our destination and I heated it up and... same... not great. I will never forget the slice that I had when it was fresh out of the oven.Thanks, Ginos for making our trip to Chicago awesome!

42.description: I came in today 5/9/15 with my family. I graduated college today and I was really looking forward to having a good dining experience at Gino's east. Crystal was our server and she went above and beyond to make sure our time was special. She was an exceptional server. I am a server myself so I really appreciate great service. I would just like to say thank you to crystal and Gino's east for making my graduation so memorable.

23.description: Took a solid 50 minutes for a small deep dish pizza to arrive. Unsure if that's the usually for deep dish but seemed like a while that's for sure. Pizza was great though.

47.description: Everyone has their thing to do when they hit Chicago... Mine is Geno's!  With over 200 reviews... there's not much to say... so I'll say the other stuff.1.  Get an appetizer; it will take some time to cook!  2. Skip right over the deep dish, and really enjoy the menu!I think the thin crust here is stellar, especially on the veggie pizza.  2 employees mentioned it is their favorite!Also, the cheese and charcuterie board... delicious!The mozzarella sticks are homemade, on the premises.  Some of the best I've had.  While I would never hold it against the Texas boys (Uno, Due'), I can get that in Fort Worth.  Although it's a chain, it's a local chain.  Geno's gets my vote as the best!5 STARS (because I know how to order right!)

8.description: Came to visit Chi town from SF, CA. Wasn't sure which restaurant is famous for deep dish pizza in Chicago so I just yelped something near my hotel.I got a groupon $16 for $30. We got spinach mozarella sticks and chicago fire 9". Im deducting 2 stars because the wait was really long for the pizza to come out like almost 1 hour. And the pizza itself was aight not alot of meat... and I'm not a big fan of the crust. 9" was a good size for 2 people. Service was 5/5. The waitress suggested the 9" for us and explained the menu. Thank you! :)

31.description: So we're driving thru the area and I was determined to eat legit Chicago style deep dish pizza... After the disappointment of the ridiculous wait time of the first place we were going to, and then walking blocks to find a different pizza spot, I was happy to stumble a pond this place. After awkwardly being told to stand and wait 10 mins, even tho there where plenty of visible empty tables, we were seated to a very sweet waitress who took our whole order and informed us of the exp. 40 min wait for deep dish. That was ok tho cause that what we came for. In the meantime tho we made sure we had apps: calamari, way over cooked which was a shame cause the seasoning was very good, and buffalo wings that were really good. They have a great beer selection and their Little Sumpin' Sumpin' hit the spot! In less than 40 mins, the pizza came. And here's where I'm torn... Cause Im a jersey girl living less than 15 mins from the city all my life... I just can't... It was "different". We got the BBQ brisket one, the brisket was absolutely delicious, except there could have been more. The funny thing is... The more I ate the deep dish, the more I liked it... Messy, but good... It went from 2 stars to 3 and the 4th for the service. I'm happy to have my Chicago experience!!

34.description: my first deep dish experience...  it was intense, very filling and tasty, although the crust was not entirely satisfying.  the service was pretty slow.  it took a while to get seated and the pizza took about an hour, so get appetizers if you're hungry.

16.description: We got there promptly at 11:00AM on a Saturday, knowing we had a little over an hour and the deep dish reportedly takes 45 min (normal for a well prepped deep dish).  I got the small Meaty Legend.  It was very good, and I could only eat two slices.  Crust was crunchy with a touch of corn meal.  Sauce, cheese and meat were all very good.  My son opted for the spaghetti with meatballs (I know..I know...spaghetti at Ginos).  Spaghetti was solid, nothing spectacular - but again, don't come here for spaghetti.  Will definitely repeat when we are in Chicago again.

13.description: Nope.  In the past year I've given Gino's East two shots, and boy how I pine for the Gino's of the 80's and early 90's.  This is a pale, wan imitation of what was once a great Chicago pie.  An extra star for the bartender who was very nice and didn't frown upon my iced tea ordering.  Both the deep dish and the thin crust are just lame.  Last visit I decided on the thin supreme, and ordered it well done, asking for char and a crispy crust.  Apparently this is not possible here, as the pie clearly had no contact with the oven surface, but came out on an aerated metal pan of sorts.  Crust was white, it was so devoid of evidence of a hot oven, or even baking.  Please deliver a charred crust if that's what the customer wants.  Will not return, but word to the wise if you go, take your pie to go and scorch it in a cast iron pan at home, then give it a few minutes under the broiler.  It will be better than at your table, I promise.

11.description: We had a great experience at Gino's East. We already knew that the deep dish pizza would take an hour to cook, so we showed up at 4:45pm to put in our order. This seems early, but we settled in, ordered some beers from their wonderful draft beer list and were nice an hungry by the time the food was out at 5:45pm. We actually ordered at 5:00ish, so it was more of a 40 minute wait than an hour. The flavors of Gino's pizza are unrivaled. It is definitely one of my favorite deep dish pizzas in Chicago. We go the spicy sausage special and it was very good. It wasn't really that spicy but had excellent flavors. The wait staff were very friendly and the location was clean. Will go back next time we have the chance!

39.description: I don't feel I can give a good review of this place since their kitchen closes at nine. Yes, NINE! WTF? Major metro area? Seriously? I was staying across the street and wanted eats and drinks. Oh well. Their loss. They didn't need the business, not did the wait or bar staff need the decent tip, I guess. Too bad. First time in Chicago and won't be returning to Gino's. We went to Blackie's instead. Blackie's is a short walk and pretty good service with decent food.

37.description: Terrible service, can't speak for the pizza as we could not get any servers or managements attention. This is a Sunday night, I wonder what happens on a busy Friday or Saturday night. Sorry to say we left after 20 minutes at our table...no water, no server, no pizza!

0.description: Seeking the quintessential deep dish Chicago experience, Gino's East does not disappoint.  Really enjoyed the Supreme deep dish, Caesar salad, and Mozzarella sticks.  Some things to note for deep dish newbies- even for a guy, generally 2 pieces is all you can muster.  Also - plan for about 45 minutes for the pizza to cook after ordering.  Pretty good selection of local beers.  This location was not very busy on a Saturday at 5pm, albeit it was snowing and not many people were out.

38.description: Delicious spicy deep dish! They messed up our second pizza - they gave us pepperoni when we asked for the BBQ brisket pizza and then proceeded to tell us that it was somehow cheaper than the barbecue brisket and didn't really apologize. The service was less then great. I was unimpressed by the hostess and the front of house manager's handling of the messed up order. Our server was excellent! Overall I give it 3 stars for the whole Chicago-deep-dish-experience.

51.description: This was my first time ever having Gino's East, and I had a nice experience at this location.Interesting side note: It was a bit odd that the doors were locked at 11am on a Saturday when it was supposed to be open. I called, and they weren't aware that the doors were locked. Thankfully they quickly let me in.LPT: Order an appetizer, salad, and some drinks while you wait for your order of deep dish. It takes 45 minutes!I had the asian sesame wings buffalo wings, and they were certainly bigger than normal sized wings, but not sure about the "giant" label. :) This order was large in quantity... I think somewhere between 8-10 wings?The service was nice and attentive at this location. When the pizza came, it's a nice experience to be served table-side by our waiter! Gino's East deep dish pizza has become one of my favorites in Chicago right behind Lou's. Get the patty sausage!

27.description: I came here on a Thursday night. It was pretty crowded because there was a game later that night, but we were seated right away. We ordered a build your own deep dish pizza with fresh garlic, artichoke hearts, black olives, pineapple, and spinach. Our waitress informed us that the pizzas take a while to bake, so we decided to get the spinach and artichoke dip too.The spinach and artichoke dip comes with toasted crostini which came with some parmesan on top. Seriously, this stuff was SO good. I definitely recommend it. Our deep dish pizza came out a while later, and we were excited to try it for the first time! We weren't disappointed. The crust was light and there was a generous amount of ingredients. Yum!

32.description: I was originally going to give this place 3 stars but upon more reflection I feel like it was a 2.   For an appetizer we had calamari which extremely rubbery stay away from the calamari here!  The entire reason we came here was for the deep dish pizza. We ordered the bbq brisket which I was really looking forward to, but the meat wasn't evenly distributed. Some pieces had so little I first questioned whether it was even there. Other slices had big gobs of it.  The service was ok.  Nothing to either complain about or give a positive recommendation for.  All in all I wish the food was better, especially for the price.

54.description: As one who frequents Giordano's and Lou Malnati's, I have very high expectations for Chicago pizza. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of pizza provided by Gino's East. We ordered the Chicago Fire, a sausage pizza with red peppers and onions (deep dish, of course). While it did take forever to cook (quoted that it would take 45 minutes, but took a full hour) it was worth the wait. The pizza is very similar to a Giordano's style with a different crust. For dessert we ordered the beignets. I was not overly enthused. It took an additional 20 minutes to cook. It came out piping hot but rock hard. My impression of beignets is soft dough which this was not. It was essentially just a bunch of cinnamon sugar. I'll also mention that I used a Groupon which helped and made it dirt cheap. While maybe not my favorite Chicago pizza, I would come back.

48.description: I see that most of the low star reviews are because the deep dish pizza took an hour to come out.... But when you come into the place the waitress told us that. Gino's is know for the deep dish pizza and it is know for taking 45 minutes to an hour. So don't let those reviews turn you away. In my opinion the pizza is so good waiting an hour (which they tell you when you show up... Is worth it) I would recommend the cheese sticks and the nachos. They are both great. Great place to hangout and watch sports with friends.

44.description: I had to be a tourist for food while I was in Chicago. Ginos was right across the street from the hotel so I went for it. For those of you from not Chicago, like me, be prepared. It actually takes about 45 minutes to cook up a deep dish pizza. All told though it was very worth the wait. I took the sausage and cheese deep dish back to my hotel and proceeded to savage it with reckless abandon. As it was take out, I don't know much about the bar/restaurant, but it looked pretty typical. They also had a really wild beer selection. I really wanted to try one of the couple of local brews in the fridge, but I really didn't want to drink alone in a hotel.

24.description: Nice new-ish location in the South Loop. The space is relatively classy, and I love the high ceilings, and the booths are comfy.On a Sunday PM, my friend and I waited about 15 minutes to be seated. Our waitress was a-ok with our taking our time to order. I suggest making our own deep dish, as their signature options all seemed pretty heavy. (I think spinach makes the crust too soggy, too.) We got patty sausage and mushroom - a winning combination. A small deep dish was definitely enough for us two. Definitely did the trick and satisfied my deep dish pizza urge. Our waitress reminded us when we ordered it, but it takes ~45 minutes for a deep dish pizza, so be sure to budget for your hunger levels.

7.description: I was originally going to give this place 3 stars but upon more reflection I feel like it was a 2.   For an appetizer we had calamari which extremely rubbery stay away from the calamari here!  The entire reason we came here was for the deep dish pizza. We ordered the bbq brisket which I was really looking forward to, but the meat wasn't evenly distributed. Some pieces had so little I first questioned whether it was even there. Other slices had big gobs of it.  The service was ok.  Nothing to either complain about or give a positive recommendation for.  All in all I wish the food was better, especially for the price.

49.description: I really did not enjoy the place, I waited an hour for my  Spinach Mozarella sticks and the 9' Thin pizza with mushrooms, hot sausage and pepperoni. I was disappointed that I waited too long to get my food the mozzarella sticks were dry and the pizza had little meat and cheese but a lot of uncooked dry mushrooms  and the sauce tasted like it came from an old can of tomatoe sauce. The waitress never came to check on me ,and the place wasn't packed.

40.description: The 4 topping large deep dish pizza arrived soupy. It was the worst experience ever. I took a friend who was in town for the first time, imagine the horror! Had to leave halfway through it.

53.description: Coming for the renown deep dish pizza. Many people I saw were also ordering this. It tastes nice to be. And one 9'' is actually too much for me....

30.description: This is a review of average food but TERRIBLE service. We came in after the Cubs game so we were hot, tired, and hungry. We were told that the wait was going to be 45 minutes to an hour. That's what we expected. That was not a big deal to us because, as out of towners, we were told we just had to come here. About 5 minutes in we decided that since we were very close to our hotel, we would just order our dinner to-go. Before we ordered, we double checked that the wait was in fact still long and they confirmed that the wait was about 40 minutes still for us even though there were 5 empty tables. We placed our to-go order, payed for it, and waited outside. Seriously 5 minutes (we checked our watches) after that, they called our name to be seated. We were shocked that this all happened so quickly! Excited, we were ready to go to the table but then they told us they were going to refuse to seat us because we "preordered" our meal. What?! Preordered?! We explained the situation and they still would not seat us. When my husband spoke to someone in charge, we were seated. When our dinner came, the pizza was just average. We ordered a regular crust cheese and pepperoni.

46.description: Went here for the deep dish and not impressed, wife said it tasted like vegetable soup on a crust which I tend to agree.  Service was excellent just not the pizza.

1.description: It was decent, but no rave reviews. We got the Chicago Fire and the Gino's Supreme. Chicago Fire was fairly flavorful (not as spicy as menu implied but still pretty decent)... there was a token jalapeño atop the pizza, so can't complain too much. This pizza was a little heavy on the slabs of meat, which did a disservice to the crust (the meat slabs shielded the unfortunate crust from the other toppings so crust seemed quite brittle). The Supreme was remarkably better because of the less cumbersome distribution of meat. Overall, the crust seemed less brittle on this pizza so it was much less burdensome on the cutlery (and one's dentition).Big picture: other than the touch of flavor in the "hot and spicy" sausage of the Chicago Fire, honestly couldn't find much to distinguish these two pizzas in the pool of sauce and cheese.

55.description: Tourist trap but Great people watching! Love the jalapeño sausage pizza. Go on the weekends to avoid the long lunch/afternoon waits but we'll worth it. Try the mozzarella sticks, they are great.

9.description: Everytime we are in Chicago, my husband has to get deepdish pizza. So he had it delivered to our hotel room, this time it was Gino's.  His choice is a cheese only deepdish. I have tried to like chicago deepdish, and I fail each time. This time was no better.For one, the sauce was akin to tomato paste. IT didn't even taste like it had seasonings on it....just tomatos paste spread about. Below this, was a huge slab of molten greasy mozzarella. The crust was too thick and dry, but greasy where the cheese soaked it. It looks like a mess too. It doesn't cut well, and just ends up looking like afterbirth on a plate.

26.description: I could write forever but I will keep this simple: Best pizza I have ever had! Service was great and atmosphere was awesome - AMAZING beer selection!

25.description: My boyfriend & I came here after a Cubs game. We sat at the bar & ordered a few local beers. Ordered our pizza and waited patiently for 45 + minutes for our deep dish to arrive!!!! Flavors were good but there was a slight cheese overload. Maybe next time I visit Chicago I will have a better pizza experience. 2.5 stars!

12.description: I ordered a supreme thin crust to my hotel room on North Michigan. But for one problem, I think the pizza would have been quite good. I was particularly impressed by the delightfully crispy crust. The problem: the pizza was cold. It was a cold night, but that's not unusual for Chicago. Paying $30 and waiting two hours (which I knew before ordering), only receive a cold pizza, was extremely disappointing.

59.description: AMAZING!! First time trying Chicago pizza. Everyone told us to go here. We did and it was awesome. It takes 45 min for it to cook so we got cheese sticks and pizza bread as apps. The cheese sticks were by far the best we have ever had. The pizza bread was ok. Pizza was amazing! We got a large because we didnt know any better. For 2 people it was WAYY to big. We could only eat 1 piece each. Hands down AMAZING!

21.description: Best pizza in Chicago! This was our first Chicago pizza on the trip. We loved it. However, after visiting some of the competition we realized how much we REALLY loved it. The crust is made with cornmeal, which makes it yellowish and slightly sweet. Since my hubby and I have different tastes in pizza, we had Chicago Fire and Spinach Margharitta. Both were delicious. Down side is they don't have a personal portion. If you are staying in a hotel where you don't have an in-room fridge and microwave, like us, it will kill you to see all the pizza you can't eat go to waste.

17.description: This place is very yummy and I really like the atmosphere. I came here with a friend from out of town and was introducing her to the iconic Chicago deep dish pizza. We got the spinach marghertia deep dish and I highly recommend it. Deep dish pizza is very heavy on its own without the sausage or pepperoni, so the spinach marghertia pizza (fresh mozzarella, spinach, basil, tomatoes, and garlic) is perfect if you want something a little lighter (at least as light as deep dish pizza can be). It also lets you taste the sauce a little more since it isn't so heavy on the cheese which is a real treat. Our waitress was really nice, but not very helpful when it came to beers. They had a nice list of local beers they serve on tap and I told her my preference. I prefer lighter beers that aren't very hoppy and she said she had the perfect beer for me. However, the beer she served me was dark and very hoppy. It wasn't that bad, though, so I drank my glass, but I feel the staff should be more knowledgeable about the beer since it is a sports bar. I enjoyed my experience and will come again!

10.description: I came here on a Thursday night. It was pretty crowded because there was a game later that night, but we were seated right away. We ordered a build your own deep dish pizza with fresh garlic, artichoke hearts, black olives, pineapple, and spinach. Our waitress informed us that the pizzas take a while to bake, so we decided to get the spinach and artichoke dip too.The spinach and artichoke dip comes with toasted crostini which came with some parmesan on top. Seriously, this stuff was SO good. I definitely recommend it. Our deep dish pizza came out a while later, and we were excited to try it for the first time! We weren't disappointed. The crust was light and there was a generous amount of ingredients. Yum!

5.description: Nice new-ish location in the South Loop. The space is relatively classy, and I love the high ceilings, and the booths are comfy.On a Sunday PM, my friend and I waited about 15 minutes to be seated. Our waitress was a-ok with our taking our time to order. I suggest making our own deep dish, as their signature options all seemed pretty heavy. (I think spinach makes the crust too soggy, too.) We got patty sausage and mushroom - a winning combination. A small deep dish was definitely enough for us two. Definitely did the trick and satisfied my deep dish pizza urge. Our waitress reminded us when we ordered it, but it takes ~45 minutes for a deep dish pizza, so be sure to budget for your hunger levels.

3.description: Everyone has their thing to do when they hit Chicago... Mine is Geno's!  With over 200 reviews... there's not much to say... so I'll say the other stuff.1.  Get an appetizer; it will take some time to cook!  2. Skip right over the deep dish, and really enjoy the menu!I think the thin crust here is stellar, especially on the veggie pizza.  2 employees mentioned it is their favorite!Also, the cheese and charcuterie board... delicious!The mozzarella sticks are homemade, on the premises.  Some of the best I've had.  While I would never hold it against the Texas boys (Uno, Due'), I can get that in Fort Worth.  Although it's a chain, it's a local chain.  Geno's gets my vote as the best!5 STARS (because I know how to order right!)

35.description: Nope.  In the past year I've given Gino's East two shots, and boy how I pine for the Gino's of the 80's and early 90's.  This is a pale, wan imitation of what was once a great Chicago pie.  An extra star for the bartender who was very nice and didn't frown upon my iced tea ordering.  Both the deep dish and the thin crust are just lame.  Last visit I decided on the thin supreme, and ordered it well done, asking for char and a crispy crust.  Apparently this is not possible here, as the pie clearly had no contact with the oven surface, but came out on an aerated metal pan of sorts.  Crust was white, it was so devoid of evidence of a hot oven, or even baking.  Please deliver a charred crust if that's what the customer wants.  Will not return, but word to the wise if you go, take your pie to go and scorch it in a cast iron pan at home, then give it a few minutes under the broiler.  It will be better than at your table, I promise.

19.description: it not good. The crispy squid is not crispy , not fully cooked. The deep dish pizza... Just so so.

28.description: Nice atmosphere,  good food.  But horrible service

45.description: "One yummy version of famous Chicago pizzas"The east side downtown location of Gino's East has both table dining, outdoor dining and sit-at-the-bar dining. I dined solo this visit so I chose sit-at-the-bar. Ordered the thin crust pizza small pizza (12-inches) with mushrooms. Took about 30 minutes to arrive at 6PM on a Saturday. Very tasty, very good, sauce and cheese. The bar doesn't serve conventional beers like Miller, Busch, etc; they only serve craft style or local beers. I tried the Metropolitan light beer, a local brew -- it was a-okay. My pizza was not cheap, but it was a cheap meal for downtown Chicago, running $17.50 for the small with one topping.

33.description: Shitty reception. Told us to wait forty five minutes but we waited ONE and half hour instead!!!  We asked several times during the wait. They only told us to wait a second. At last we knew that there was a party of 24  before us. However the receptionist wouldn't spend her precious time to tell us. Even the best pizza wouldn't make up for the reception.

43.description: Gino's East deep dish sausage patty pizza has always been one of our faves but our last couple visits to this location and the Streeterville location have been disappointing. You can read details on our still unresolved, negative Streeterville experience under that location on Yelp. Our last pizza at the south loop location was only half the normal thickness (so bizarre) and we had to track down our server to order and to get our check. We'll probably just go to Lou Malnatis exclusively from now on.

2.description: Let me start right off the bat by saying that I much prefer New York style thin crust pizza over Chicago style open-faced calzones (oops, I mean pizzas), but for what it was, Gino's East has the best deep dish I've ever had.I think the Chicago Man Vs Food episode said it best - New York style is for people on the go, while Chicago style is more of a sit-down experience. And while visiting Chicago, we had quite the sit-down experience as we got to eat their signature food while watching a Black Hawks playoff game on TV (which they lost, by the way).It was a nice taste of Chicago and a really good deep dish pizza, but it wasn't quite enough to convert me over from my beloved New York thin crust.

18.description: Tried their 6inches pizza for one- but it was not that attractive as others described. I was a little disappointed but I guess maybe that's because I didn't try the specialties.

41.description: This place is very yummy and I really like the atmosphere. I came here with a friend from out of town and was introducing her to the iconic Chicago deep dish pizza. We got the spinach marghertia deep dish and I highly recommend it. Deep dish pizza is very heavy on its own without the sausage or pepperoni, so the spinach marghertia pizza (fresh mozzarella, spinach, basil, tomatoes, and garlic) is perfect if you want something a little lighter (at least as light as deep dish pizza can be). It also lets you taste the sauce a little more since it isn't so heavy on the cheese which is a real treat. Our waitress was really nice, but not very helpful when it came to beers. They had a nice list of local beers they serve on tap and I told her my preference. I prefer lighter beers that aren't very hoppy and she said she had the perfect beer for me. However, the beer she served me was dark and very hoppy. It wasn't that bad, though, so I drank my glass, but I feel the staff should be more knowledgeable about the beer since it is a sports bar. I enjoyed my experience and will come again!

52.description: I have been craving pizza for a while and I mean months, have been fighting the urge. Today I had to drop my husband off downtown and fail to my cravings. I run in to Gino's East and bought a lunch size pizza, I was sadly DISAPPOINTED. This pizza crust was tasteless, the sausage was big chunks of meat, sauce horribleDONE WITH GINO's

50.description: Staff was great.  We came in with a big crowd to watch MNF and they did everything they could to fit us in.   Super nice and excellent service.

4.description: This was my first time ever having Gino's East, and I had a nice experience at this location.Interesting side note: It was a bit odd that the doors were locked at 11am on a Saturday when it was supposed to be open. I called, and they weren't aware that the doors were locked. Thankfully they quickly let me in.LPT: Order an appetizer, salad, and some drinks while you wait for your order of deep dish. It takes 45 minutes!I had the asian sesame wings buffalo wings, and they were certainly bigger than normal sized wings, but not sure about the "giant" label. :) This order was large in quantity... I think somewhere between 8-10 wings?The service was nice and attentive at this location. When the pizza came, it's a nice experience to be served table-side by our waiter! Gino's East deep dish pizza has become one of my favorites in Chicago right behind Lou's. Get the patty sausage!

6.description: The location is so cozy and warm with the retro Edison lights and dark wood furnishings. We got a supreme deep dish which takes 45 min to cook, but in the meantime started off with the mozzarella sticks and Caesar salad. The beer selection was quite nice and it was an excellent stop to warm our frozen toes and fingers. I liked the fact that this place has less of that big chain feel such as Lou malnettis and Giordano's and enjoyed my meal there. The pizza was excellent and the star of the meal with a rich deep hearty sauce that was excellent. I ordered a thin crust to go for a friend which took significantly less time and he loved it. Great spot to go if you're in the area and looking for a smaller city spot.

22.description: Second time here.  Always get the thick pizza with pepperoni ads sausage, always forget how filling it is. Gino's is the corn meal based crust, always delicious.

15.description: I heard great things about this place.........Not everything that people tell you is true.  It is an OK place.  We were ignored a bit from our wait staff, all the beers they have are the hoppy craft beers, of which I am not a fan of.  Give your self some time if you order the deep dish pizza, a small took 45 min, my fault, because I should have called ahead to order.  The staff was nice, and it was a bit noisy.

57.description: So appreciate this place!  I went with a few coworkers to Gino's and as a vegan, I didn't really expect to be able to order much.  However, they will make vegan deep dish for you.  Also, they have butternut squash soup that is vegan.  The waiter was really sweet and helpful.

20.description: Delicious. Pretty sure it just ruined all other pizzas for me. The service was ok. There were a few times when we had empty glasses and when we were waiting for the check. Other than that the food was amazing.

36.description: Wasn't a big fan of Chicago style pizza until I ate here. The meaty legend was on point. So so good. The spinach dip app was savory and delish. 2 thumbs up!

14.description: I remember loving Gino's but alas it was the other location and long ago.  Look - compared to WI pizza it's awesome but compared to Giordono's or Lou's - it's just ordinary.I want to Gino's I remember from my childhood.....

3.description: Solid overall. The slices remind me of the opening scene is the 1990's TMNT movie. They are  huge, greasy, and have lots of cheese. The sauce is lackluster lacking much taste, but the crust is thin and crispy and the cheese being topped of with oregano and basil is a nice touch. Overall great place, nothing excellent, but a good spot for a quick lunch or a drunk bite.

1.description: Pizza-ria has solid pizza.  Great for delivery and I believe you can even stop in and grab a slice to go.  Very convenient if you are walking by.  The pizza is a standard thin crust and has a nice flavor.  It's not one of my favorite thin crust pizzas but for the South loop it is probably one of the better late night options available.I've also gotten their cheesy bread sticks and they remind me of a place called "gumby's" back in college.  I do like ordering those but they come in a small order.  Give Pizza-ria a try if nothing else is open.  It's pizza, you will like it but it won't be your favorite.  But stick with Lou Malnati's, Aurelio's, Connie's, or Trattoria for better pizza alternatives in the area

2.description: A good pizza at a ridiculous price. Around $3-5 for a slice is absurd.

5.description: So I was walking back from downtown with my gf one Tuesday evening and was hungry. It was about 11pm...most places seemed to have been closed. That is until I saw Pizza-RiaFirst Impression: Nice decor - steel chairs and tables, brick interior walls, huge open kitchen, a couple of plasmas, and pizza shaped mirrors. Does it all match? No idea, but it worked well enough for me! 1 / 1 starFood: They had pizza by the slice! I got myself a BBQ chicken, and my gf had the Malibu (I think that's what it was called). Before I go any further, let me say this: THE SLICES ARE HUGE! In fact, it's soo HUGE that it was actually TWO SLICES. For about $4 a slice, I thought it was pretty decently priced. I'm no pizza expert, but I do know what I don't like, and this was something I liked...just wish they had more chicken on my pizza though :-/  2 / 2 starsDrinks: Didn't have any here since I had some Gatorade that I bought from Walgreens. Maybe next time... 0 / 1 starService: The cashier was very friendly and helpful. We chit chatted a little about the place and how long they've been around. Overall, no complaints. 1 / 1 starSo, on a 4 star scale, this place gets a 4 / 4. Food is good, service is good, decor is nice. What else do you really need in a late night pizza place? *This is only based on my one experience so far and once I go back, I will be updating if needed. *Until next time...peace

6.description: Average pizza slices. Nice atmosphere. and they open late when every other place has been closed for hours.

7.description: I love this pizza!!  I'm a huge fan of their thin crust (low carb) and multiple options for toppings.  I'm a big lover of the plain cheese and often stop in for a slice = 2 slices.  I think their pizza is THE BEST in Chicago!  Their salads are really yummy and I'm never disappointed whether it be wings, pizza, brownie....or a quick slice!!

8.description: perfect for those days when you think without pizza you might die. the meat- lovers was the only thing we ordered and to be honest, probably the only thing they need to have on the menu. i don't think i'd ever order anything else. this thing was for real with gia-normous meatballs, pepperoni, ham, and bacon. yes, bacon. and not like the bits that you identify as bacon because someone tells you thats what it is, real, legitimate, strips of bacon. need i say more, beyond the fact that delivery was pretty quick?

0.description: Sometimes a girl needs a slice. Sometimes, she needs two slices. Sometimes, these slices need to be thin rather than thick. And occasionally, there's Pizza-Ria coming to her aid. Wide open space, big old ovens ready and willing to prep your chosen pie and a decent price to do it. Open late, crispy crust, fountain sodas, seats if you want to eat in and a door if you want to get out. Whole pies and delivery can be a little steep so really, if you're nearby anyway, just walk it on over there and get yourself a slice (which is actually two). You'll be just fine, darlin.

4.description: Not bad for everyday pizza. And the slices are cut in triangles not squares. Pricing point isn't bad. I only ordered one slice as a trail should have ordered 2. Not bad, check it out.

58.description: boned wings taste better than boneless which tend to be oversalted. i dont know about all the 1*s due to service bc when i go somewhere, food is my primary concern. they are swamped with ppl every time im there so the service is curt. their flavors are hit and miss but i guess it depends on your taste.

56.description: Maybe I caught them on a bad day, but my food was pretty terrible.  One of my wings had a funky flavor like it had been sitting out too long before it was cooked.  My fries were undercooked and extremely greasy. The rolls were amazing and delicious, but covered in butter flavored oil.  Because the rest of the food was so bad, the rolls turned into my dinner.  I'd take a pass on this Wingstop.

29.description: Me and mine eat here at least once a week.  We love the young sweaty nervous dude but I'm afraid of the guy who has bleeding from the face acne.

42.description: I can't really think of a place in the area that does wings other than this place, which is sort of a positive to me about this place. Are they the best wings I've ever had? No. Are they a bit pricey? Yeah. But the food is pretty good, though the fries I had were awful (soggy and tasteless). The service was pretty lackluster as well. They take your name before ordering and the woman not only got my name wrong (thought it was Sam), but she wasn't very friendly and very to the point with the order as if she were a robot.The soda machines are novel and they are one of the few places I've seen carry them, but I'm sure that'll change as time goes on. Overall, if you're downtown and got some extra cash and want wings, give it a shot.

23.description: Every time went back to Chicago I went wingstop, it's always yummy like first time ate it in TX:) hope you don't skip the chance to eat this:) cheers

47.description: Their phone is always off the hook. If you're the owner of this franchise, you might want to start doing checks if your employees are taking the phone off the hook. We're always forced to go in and not order ahead of time. Also, the tall white kid is a total jerk, he's a punk smartass who should be fired. I've witnessed him being rude to us and other customers. The food is good but it's not this particular location's merit, it's the Wingstop franchise organization that makes this true. The actual location, 12 E. Harrison, is a terrible Wingstop. I will note the other employees other than the tall white kid (the one without glasses) are friendly and a pleasure. But they need to start allowing orders over the phone and get rid of that kid.

8.description: Haiku:I love wings and foodDo you love wings and good food,Yes? Hehe, me too.Wings bring me delightEspecially with ranch sauce.Do you? Ye, me too.I am almost done.Spreading my love for good wings.Come with me. Lets eat!

31.description: My wife and I ordered dinner for pickup from this location tonight.  Before we ordered online, I remembered I received an email this week for a free order of regular fries with the purchase of wings.  There was not a promo code to enter online for the fries, so I figured I would just present the email from my phone when I picked it up.I stopped in to pick up the order and as the female employee put the bag on the counter, I mentioned to her that I had an email for a free order of regular fries, as I pulled out my phone to show her the email.Wingstop Employee:  "You have to print it out.  Your total is $20.67."Me:  "Can I just show you the email here on my phone?"Wingstop Employee:  "You have to print it out."Me:  "Can I just give you my email address and show you the email?"Wingstop Employee:  "You have to print it out."Me:   (looking at my phone) "It doesn't say anywhere on the email that it has to be printed out."Wingstop Employee:  "You have to print it out." She proceeded to hand me the receipt with the charge for the fries still included.  I wasn't going to waste any more time with this woman over $2, especially when the conversation was going nowhere and she clearly did not care that nowhere on the email did it say the coupon needed to be printed.  If they didn't already have my credit card on file, I would have walked out.  I'm not going to lose sleep over the extra $2 for the fries (which were cold and soggy), but I will certainly not give another dollar to that WingStop location.

34.description: Went here with a buddy for dinner.   Ordered the 6 pc boneless wings; my friend ordered the 4 pc tenders.  Both meals came with fries and a drink.  Overall very salty; seriously have some wings & fries with your salt!  The boneless wings were not as good in flavor as the tenders, even though we both chose the same BBQ sauce.  Flavor was overly bold and salty.  If you love really salty food come eat here.

16.description: I would die for an order of the Hawaiian boneless wings.Food is always great, and the cook aways give me a couple extra wings, noticed that when I used to order the strips too. (boneless wings are way better than strips)The personalities of the people working here are hilariously different. Some are the no-sass type, and others are hilarious. It takes longer than desired to cook, but the wings are worth the wait.

13.description: It is truly amazing at all be different, imaginative, and almost unbelievable ways in which this place can screw up a pick up order. Whether I just get the wrong order, they give me boneless instead of bone in, or they just leave that an order of a full dozen yeast rolls. I can confidently say that four out of five pick up orders will be wrong in one way or another. When I do get the right food, however, it is good. The lemon pepper never disappoints. I recommend either dine-in or check your pick up order before you walk out the door...

11.description: I was here during closing time and the manager received a call about a wrong order. Lalo offered to go out of his way after work to drop off the order. You don't see this kind of service nowadays.

39.description: HORRIBLE Service! Placed order online and picked up.  The 2 women at  the counter were too focused on talking on the phone and bitching to each other about something that they couldn't be bothered to acknowledge me for several minutes.  Once one of them finally looked at me I  was handed my soggy bag of cold food.  Before I could leave 3 ladies came back in to get the ranch dip they ordered and did not receive.  I should've known to check my bag then, but I didn't.  Once I walked to my car I inspected the contents of the bag and realized that the large ranch dip that I paid $4 for wasn't in the bag.  Walked back in to get it from the surly and excruciatingly slow counter clerk.  She didn't bother to apologize, or say anything for that matter.  The cook was too busy flirting with a group of thugs and stoned college girls who walked in and were being loud. To add insult to injury once I got home I realized that  Miss Personality also neglected to give me the veggie sticks that I paid for.  I'll never order from this location again and will think long and hard before patronizing another Wing Stop again.  The franchisee of this location should fire the whole staff and start fresh with people who can at least get the basics right- like giving customers the food they've ordered and paid for.  Troy Aikman should be ashamed to be the spokesperson for this joint.

37.description: This is a review of the wings at WingStop, not this particular location.  While this is the closest to me, my first experience with WingStop came from having it delivered from a delivery service.So, the wings at WingStop are really good!  Maybe not the best I've ever had but certainly better than I was expecting.  I also thought the ranch dressing was really good as well.  My only complaint really is the size of these wings.  They're tiny!  I ordered 20 but it felt like I was eating half that since the wings are really small.  Next time I will stop in to one of their locations and see what's that like.

0.description: I just left here for lunch. It is probably my 2nd or 3rd time eating here since they opened this location. I usually stick with the Original Hot. Last time I remember getting their Cajun which is listed 3rd below the "hottest"; Atomic. It was actually not very hot but because of the seasoned sauce it was kind of difficult to eat. Today I got the combo Original Hot and Mango Habanero. I Original is always good with very nice flavor and non-palette destroying spice. The mango really tempers down the habanero and balances nicely without being too sweet, especially on the meat itself. If you try the sauce along as I did it will kind of throw you off. The nice young lady at the counter suggested the honey mustard dressing. The meal only comes with (1) sauce so I added that to the mix. Overall the wings were pretty good. They were cooked perfectly. Just right crust and nice warm and moist interior!. The mango habanero did mix well with the honey mustard... DISCLAIMER: I do LOVEEE Jamaican/Caribbean food and sauces, which is traditionally "have-your-nose-running hot and spicy...Now on to the "Seasoned Fries".... Oh Boy......!..... Now again, this is NOT the first time I have tried them. It HAS been a while, but nothing has changed. "Seasoned" is being confused with SALTY!!!.. In fact aggressively salty, especially for people whom have either eliminated salt from their diets or practice a low salt diet or if you have decided to cutback your general intake. I had to physically try and remove the salt from the surface of each fry before eating. I could only have it through approximately half of the bag. They should probably offer customers the option of "seasoning" on or off. If you are not sure just stick with veggies (which I will probably do next time I visit). But again..... besides that, they are a good choice for your hot-wing fix!.Gone................ -JV
