38.description: The wings here are just okay...definitely had better, but the service is so AWFUL, I seriously considered emailing the manager to let them know that the seemingly emotionless workers and their miserable attitude are single-handedly hurting their business--just look at the other 50 or so reviews here...almost all complain about the staff, service and attitude.The very moment we walked into the place I knew I wouldn't like the service. The woman at the register was taking a phone order, ROLLING her eyes and pursing her lips the whole time and talking to the caller as if he or she were a nuisance. She got at least 2 more calls during my wait and had the SAME attitude. Another woman began taking my friend's order and was just rude. NO smile, no emotion just "name? Go ahead with your order..." as if she totally did not want to be here...on earth!The  counter area, where the ketchup, straws, etc. were was also very dirty. I opened the top of the straw box to get a straw rather than push the lever because it was so filthy. The fries here were the only things I really liked.  That said, I won't come back again...the staff is depressing and the wings are NOT worth the price or lackluster experience.

51.description: I have never had a good experience here. The wings are terrible and the service is very slow. One time the ketchup machine was clogged and ended up exploding all over me, and they didn't seem to mind much. Not a party. I suggest going around the corner to Harold's Chicken Shack instead - much better!

27.description: They charge for any sauce.They charge you for water and don't offer a tap water option.The waitstaff could literally give two ****s about you or your business.The wings were okay, but nothing to write home about.Too much breading on the boneless wings.Not sure what sauce I had, but it tasted like ginger ale.  I like ginger ale, but not on my wings.

32.description: Ok, so this is an updated version of my review. I've been coming here for the past two years now and I know the workers can have a slight attitude at times, but I seriously love this location. Recently I had a financial issue with one of my orders and I was incredibly embarrassed about it and the workers were sympathetic and accommodating to help me. I don't know any other restaurant that would have done the same in the area. Moral of the story, no matter what anyone says I frequent this Wingstop at least once every week or two. it's probably my favorite comfort food in the city. Love love loooove, and when it comes to food I recommend the Lousiana dry rub, it is seriously sooooo good :) Also, go for boneless wings. Bone in are tiny, you come to learn this the hard way.

54.description: My lady loves chicken wings.. We checked this place out.Wings were really good. Took awhile but that's ok. The drink machine here will change your life. TV's in the joint. I'll go here again.. When  you have a wing craving... it's hard to beat

48.description: Yea I would say 3 stars is accurate.  Food - there's a lot to choose from, so you really get a feast of wings at almost any flavor, sauce, and size. They even have boneless wings too which is nice. Can be pretty salty. Portions are pretty sizeable so come hungry. The staff we had were pretty friendly. Smaller size seating, but we also came in a big group. I'm not a HUGE wings person, but I wouldn't mind coming back.

44.description: So we call to see if they deliver (we are from MN, everyone delivers) and the young lady (thats a HUGE overstatement) was just about as rude as they come. We had read the reviews so we expected the service to suck and the food to be good.. We went in to get some wings, only because I was craving them and this place happen to be with in walking distance. OH EM GEE, I can not believe how incredibly rude the girl was at who took our order. I waited for our food and watched her continuously be short and impatient with all the customers that came in. While waiting for our food, we both used the restroom - I should have held it. Dirty, messy, and no paper towels to dry our un-soaped hands. YUK! Once we got our food, it was just Okay, not great but not horrible. The next day I called to talk to the owner, and whomever answered the phone refused to give me the name or # of owner, and told me the manager was too busy to talk to me. Unreal.

24.description: It's the little things in life that make a difference sometimes...we went to Wingstop yesterday. We ordered a 15 piece mix bone and boneless pack. Half were parmesan and half were the feature flavor. The parm half was as  tasteless as can be, the mango habanero half was just spicy but no a hint of mango flavor as the habanero overwhelm any possible flavor. We ordered our food at one minute to five and though there were a few people the restaurant was not as busy as other times we've visited this location. Our food was not ready until 25 minutes later at around 5:24. The clencher...While we were waiting my partner asked the girl behind the counter for a cup for water and was told "we do not have any courtesy cups for water" I could not believe my ears, seriously, you mean to tell me that Wingstop has a policy not to provide customers with a cup for water because they have no "courtesy" cups......Needless to say you've seen the last of us. We will never set foot on this or any other location and believe you me I will tell everyone I know about this asinine policy of yours.

7.description: Got our order wrong. Ended up with boneless when we clearly ordered traditional. Overly salted chicken. Completely unimpressed with this location. Definitely won't return.

49.description: Foods really good, service is great, and the wait time isnt that bad. The boneless wings are something similar to Buffalo Wild Wings. You can order the 10 piece and mix it up and choose two flavors. I recommend the Louisiana Rub, so good.

40.description: Worst staff & customer service of any WingStop in Chicagoland.  Cashiers are rude and the eating area isn't well kept.  The wings are good, but the consistent poor service make this location a "no-go".

53.description: I'm sad to see all the poor reviews for this location. I am 100% obsessed with Wingstop, I've never had a problem at this particular location, and I usually stop in at least once a week.My personal favorites are actually the strips or the gliders (in general, I'm not much of a wing fan). SO FREAKIN' GOOD. I'm pretty boring so I used to just get the plain strips with ranch but I've more recently started ordering the garlic parmesan. The fries are really good too! Although, I guess I would agree with some reviewers than it can be hit or miss sometimes. There's been a few times where I have gone and they've been a little soggy/sub-par. But they're usually pretty crispy with lots of delicious seasoning on them. If you go, definitely, definitely, definitely, try the gliders at least once! They are absolutely AMAZING. The chicken patty is so crispy and the chicken always tastes fantastic. As far as cons, the only thing I don't like is that it's kind of expensive. A 3-strip combo (with fries and a drink) comes out to $8.07 and the glider combo (2 gliders, fries, and a drink) comes to a little more than that... $8.50+But for me, it's worth it every time!

30.description: I came here for a quick work lunch. That was my first mistake. I put my order in and the service was just awful.  They took 20 minutes to finish my order and were very rude. There was at least 8 tables with trash on them and they didn't make any attempt to clean them up. My favorite was the manager chatting on her phone near the bathroom at 12:47 PM!!!! That's lunch time...... Not the best service and food wasn't the best either.

46.description: Food usually tastes ok, but the service has always been HORRIBLE. The phone is always off the hook when you try to call, making call-in orders impossible. I've never had a friendly cashier or a helpful employee.The website says that they are open until midnight, but they usually lock the door 15-20 minutes before they close.The owner of this location needs to train the staff to provide friendlier and more welcoming customer service.

1.description: This place would have gotten 5 stars if it wasn't for the poor customer service and horrible attitude. First and foremost, we had a large group of people and there weren't any open seats. So in order for us to accommodate everyone we brought some chairs down that were already up on the table. (This location was no where near to closing) as we brought the chairs down and brought the two tables of 4 together a lady from the kitchen punched the glass at us and was yelling. This was soooo embarrassing and uncalled for. The entire restaurant looked at us and back at her as she slammed her fist into the glass and continued to mouth us off. My party and I were all confused and the lady came out with anger from behind the kitchen and yelled at us to sit in the table of 4 that was opened. She says, "these tables are closed because we cleaned them already". After informing her that we had a party of 8 and that we couldn't all sit in a table for 4 she understood. My question is, why punch the glass, make a scene and then yell in front of customers because a party wants to sit together?My wife and I were looking forward to capping off to a great night. Instead visiting wing stop at this location did nothing but put a bad taste to the great food. As the individual behind the counter called for our order I informed him that the order was incorrect. My wife ordered hot and garlic parmesan. He insisted that we didn't order it this way and refused to make the corrections. After informing the individual once again that the order was incorrect he simply replied, "well that's not what I put down and that's not what you're getting". I will not recommend this location to anyone as the staff here is very rude and have poor customer service. So sad to write a review like this when the wings are actually good.

55.description: Lets start off by saying this the place isnt great but is it awful no..After skimming through the reviews it seems like if management read this they could really increase their ratings with a few adjustments with the staff at the front counter. The service could be a little better seems like alot of orders where getting mixed up. mine was fine and took about 5 min(they are made to order so thats ok).  But i think it might be a problem of under staffing so when a rush comes in they get overwhelmed.  The ketchup was out at the same time the ice ran out and it seemed like everyone was asking everyone else to get the ketchup and ice.  Instead of just going to get a refill themselves. As far as the wings they are ok... nothing special but i def dont have any complaints.  Mine were hot and the sauces where good. I had the original hot and the garlic parm.  I would go back for a quick bite to eat but its wont be a regular stop for me .

9.description: I used to not have a problem with going to this location at all, then I tried to phone in an order...I called in around 7:50pm and was ready to pay with my card through the phone so my friend could pick it up from his way home. So I call, place my order, an order of a 15 piece wings, half lemon pepper and half spicy korean BBQ for my friend and my order, a 5 piece of garlic parmesan, and he tells me my total price. But before I could tell him that my friend couldn't pick it up until 8:30, he hangs up on me.So I call back, I'm put on hold. I finally reconnect with the man on the phone, and I tell him, "wait, my friend cannot pick the food up until 8:30". Then I hear him yelling in the background, and then I'm in the middle of asking him if I can pay with my card through the phone when I find out he hung up on me. AGAIN.Like can any indication be given before hanging up please? Thanks.So my friend arrives at 8:30, and what do you know. The food isn't ready yet. So he waits 15 minutes, watching them make the food I ordered over half an hour ago... He gets back, I'm grabbing paper towels from the kitchen and I hear swearing from the living room. Turns out the employees just kind of threw the saucy chicken into the box without any regard to the mess that it can create. There was sauce everywhere. And then my order of 5 garlic parmesan wings were buried somewhere under his saucy wings, so that was nice too. The food is great, but the customer service needs a lot of help.

26.description: This place sucks. Everytime I put in an order, it's never ready when I get there. Show up 15 minutes after when they said it would be ready and they still havent started on it. Only reason I still come here is there isn't another wing place. This place sucks.

25.description: I would die for an order of the Hawaiian boneless wings.Food is always great, and the cook aways give me a couple extra wings, noticed that when I used to order the strips too. (boneless wings are way better than strips)The personalities of the people working here are hilariously different. Some are the no-sass type, and others are hilarious. It takes longer than desired to cook, but the wings are worth the wait.

12.description: There are a lot of bad reviews on here that I don't understand, i went here with my family and they took care of us completely! The food was excellent and came out not once but twice to check our orders and make sure everything tasted fine, the cook had offered us additional food even for free! Wings and chicken were excellent with a lot of sauce and plenty to eat. The person that took our order made it the cheapest possible and made sure we had everything we needed! I asked her what her name was and she said it was tee! So next time someone goes there see if she's there because she made sure our food was good! Overall very good food definitely going back sometime

59.description: As a member of the Blah people (thanks, Rick Santorum) I've had a chicken wing or several thousand in my life.I know how they should taste. And how they should not taste. And they shouldn't taste like this.No matter how many different kinds of fancy sauce you try to put on it, the quality of the wing begins with the quality of the bird. I don't know where Wing Stop is getting those chickens but they don't taste good.They don't taste good and they're not cooked right. The skin is weird and not crisp and the sauce adheres to it strangely. They don't taste good, they're not cooked right and the sauce(s) are hit or miss.This location is near University Center so maybe Wing Stop is geared toward college students with limited funds and who they think have limited palettes. Well, if every store's wings taste as bad as this location, I don't know how this franchise has survived. Save your money and go around the block to Harold's if you must. Better yet, take a trip up north to Crisp and get your money's worth!

21.description: seems like the wings have gone down hill some and the prices have gone up.  plus they wouldnt give me a glass of water, I had to pay for it.  combine that with the charges for dipping dressing and celery sticks and I left feeling cheated.

17.description: It's the little things in life that make a difference sometimes...we went to Wingstop yesterday. We ordered a 15 piece mix bone and boneless pack. Half were parmesan and half were the feature flavor. The parm half was as  tasteless as can be, the mango habanero half was just spicy but no a hint of mango flavor as the habanero overwhelm any possible flavor. We ordered our food at one minute to five and though there were a few people the restaurant was not as busy as other times we've visited this location. Our food was not ready until 25 minutes later at around 5:24. The clencher...While we were waiting my partner asked the girl behind the counter for a cup for water and was told "we do not have any courtesy cups for water" I could not believe my ears, seriously, you mean to tell me that Wingstop has a policy not to provide customers with a cup for water because they have no "courtesy" cups......Needless to say you've seen the last of us. We will never set foot on this or any other location and believe you me I will tell everyone I know about this asinine policy of yours.

10.description: Do yourself a favor and skip this place. Not only is the food subpar but when you pick up your order and get home and realize they messed it up, the manager (name starts with an L-I am forgetting his name) can't be bothered to fix it. There is a Buffalo Wild Wings opening in the south loop soon, if I were you I would wait for them.

5.description: Their wings are okay. I have had better wings than that.If you really like wings people try WING ZONE they have the best wings one can have.

3.description: On the way to the Chicago Bears preseason game, we decided to grab dinner here.I LOVE buffalo wings with a side of ranch....and that's exactly what I ordered. I chose the boneless wings, which made me wonder if the regular wings would have been a better choice. We picked the 15 wings combo that came with a side of fries. Unfortunately, the wings were dry, lacked true buffalo sauce flavor and weren't crunchy at all. The fries were decent though.We also ordered a fountain drink. This restaurant had one of those fancy fountain soda machines where you have many button options to press and dispense the flavor of your choice with each kind of soda. I wanted a regular Coke and was shocked to find out that they were out because they apparently had 6+ variations of Coke. I chose Cherry Coke as an alternative.I'll give the regular wings a try before I write off Wingstop.

35.description: 1. Ordered wings 2. They called back to confirm something they did not understand from the order, told me they would be ready in 19minutes, re-confirmed the entire order3. Arrived in 20 minutes, bag was on the counter waiting for me4. My apt is 5 minutes away by the time I got home everything was COLD.5. The order in the bag was incomplete (thats a little on me, should have checked the bag before leaving)6. Called back and got a short and rude person on the phone.This unfortunately has not been my first negative experience with this WingStop location. But we will not be returning. Their customer service is some of the worst I have ever experienced, their wings are never really that good, and there has been some thing wrong or left out in 2 of my 3 orders with them.

19.description: dont eat from here unless you want food poisoning....!!!!!! my whole family got sick from this place.! save yourself eat elsewhere

28.description: I have been to this Wing Stop multiple times and it's always the same: rude employees, mediocre food, and a broken down Coke machine. I love other Wing Stops, but at this location the employees always have a poor attitude and lack of patience. I hope they can turn things around to make this spot a regular stop for me!

45.description: Not gonna lie, pretty shotty service, and the wait time is horrendous. Regardless, this place has some great wings to dine-in for a quick meal w/ plenty of sides and appetizers. I believe they do delivery too, but kinda pricey.Plenty of inside seating area, and Free Refills!!

33.description: Last time I'm ever going here!1. Despicable customer service! From the moment I walked in I not only had to wait without explanation, but I was literally treated like some unwelcome nuisance (they realize I'm paying them right?) even as I continued to be polite, thinking maybe they were just having a bad day. 2. In spite of being one of the only two customers there, it took them ten minutes to serve my six measly wings.3.  And measly they were! Tiny, and only PARTIALLY dipped in sauce--what the hell was I waiting for? Nowhere near worth the nearly 9 bucks I paid for them. Absolute BS!!!You'd be better going to Pauly's for wings, even though I've never gotten wings there they at least have something resembling customer service there.

43.description: I'll take Wingstop over Buffs ANYDAY. The food is much better, but the prices.... meh.For sub-par, greasy wings, I want some kind of deal. The service at this place... don't get me started. There used to be an extremely friendly fella at this location, Phil (was his name, I think?) But I haven't seen him around. Okay, I get it, the food is cooked to order. But my goodness is the staff slow. One can expect to wait about 10-15 minutes for chicken to be fried.... but often times the place is completely empty and the wait is still very long. Other times I have stood in line, was not acknowledged when I tried to order, and then asked, "What do you want?" The staff just seems miserable and bothered by customers, which takes away from the good food.Avoid this place if you have somewhere to be within an hour.On the brightside....I'm a big fan of the Louisiana rub wings. Less messy than hot sauce, but just as good. The fries are my favorite, actually one of my favorite french fries around. There's some kind of garlic salt, or godly flavoring they add to them.

2.description: I don't know why people are giving this Wingstop location anything less than 4 stars. I personally love the food (maybe too much) but on a customer service level, I have never been disappointed. Order is always right, always efficient and friendly. Most recently I forgot my phone and the team went out of their way to contact someone who just texted my phone to let me know they had my phone. In a city of almost 3 million people, I honestly thought my phone would end up in the trash based on my own negligence and it didn't. I appreciate their attention to detail and their overall attitude! Thanks Wingstop team on Harrison!

18.description: It's okay.  Boneless wing chicken is chewy, Louisiana rub is just a seasoning salt, and they forgot my cheese sauce, which I paid extra for.

41.description: 1. Called to order wings.2. Person answers and places me on hold for seven minutes (I'm quite patient if you didn't know).3. Person takes order, confirms with total price and gives me an hour wait before pick up. 4. Wait an hour, call to check status of order. Person answered and said "what time did they SAY your order would be ready? Well that's when your order will be ready!!" Yes, there was much attitude. 5. Go to pick up order within allotted timeframe. 6. Order was never placed into the system, no record of a call, nothing. No, never again.

52.description: This shop is kinda the Chiptole of Chicken Wings.. it's a "fast service" specialization in one thing.. that it does DAMN well in my opinion.  The staff is always willing to take your order.. I don't know if I'd say they are very happy to be there.. but they are willing to take your order.. And with the few of them that are working they are the same people that cook/package your order.. so it pays to be nice! The food is always great tasting.  They have about 10 different sauces.. I stick to the mild ones but have heard good things about the Atomic Heat (aka death for me) sauce from the roommate. The french fries come HEAVILY seasoned so you should anticipate that or ask for none.. but then you'd be missing out.. Yeast rolls are pretty good as well! They also have one of the newer 100+ flavor combination machines that allows you to take suicide soda mix to a whole new level.  Yes it takes awhile.. but that's because your food is FRESH.  I'd rather wait a few extra minutes and know that I'm having something that hasn't been sitting for hours.

50.description: Depending on the shift, you might just have to overlook a staff member. Most of them live up to the "cheerful" standard I've seen at other stores. So overlook them already. These wings are the best anywhere. ANYWHERE. I LOVE WINGSTOP WINGS. I used to have to go to Milwaukee/Damen store. Now it's handy. OMG. I'm going to go get some now. . .and I take the CTA! YES. They're THAT good. So many flavors. I need to try the new Cajun/New Orleans flavor, but my favorite is Lemon Pepper - evn tho' it's a bit on the salty side (it could be cut by HALF maybe?). My Ma loves the barbeque. Actually, I just don't eat teriaki anything, or I'd love them, too! I'm leaving now...Later...YES! "The Louisiana Rub" is scrumptious. I got 5 - plain, 5 - lemon pepper, 5 - barbeque, and 5 - Louisiana Rub (that's the new flavor). I'm stuffed! NO. I didn't eat all 20. I have some for tomorrow!! Yay!BTW. WingStop flavors include 3 kinds of Buffalo wings - which I'm not a fan of - but thought it'd be good for you to know: Hottest, Hotter, and Hot/Mild.

4.description: I visited because it the rest of the group wanted to visit but I have to say it is not my favorite choice the only thing in the menu is either wings or chicken tenders it looks quite dodgy since you come in and there is not even a trash can around to clean the table. I will never come again if it  is in my choice. I will only recommend it if you are starving and there is nothing else around. They don't sell any alcohol so not even beers to go with the chicken wings. They use tons of wrapping even if you say it is to stay and eat there they pack it as if it was to go so not very environment friendly. A very limited place I don't recommend it at all.

6.description: Loved the wings I got from this restaurant. The Garlic Parmesan and Cajun wings were seasoned just the way I like them. I have also tried the Mango, the Hawaiian, and the Habanero. They are all pretty good. I seriously recommend this restaurant if you like boneless wings. The only downside is that sometimes they may be spicier than you might like. Just ask for them to go easy or keep a glass of water handy.

22.description: i like this wing stop.. decent service and they make the wings just right.. the other wing stop i go to either put too much or too less seasoning and usually drenched in oil.. they are pretty consistent here..

15.description: Vanessa is a rock star!!  I had to take the time to write a glowing review of her and the staff at this Wingstop location on Harrison.  She's a shining example of the type of personal touch it takes to retain customers. Vanessa took the time to get to know my name and my preferred order within the first couple of times I visited.  That's especially great, given that no other such restaurant employee has deigned to do so in the five-or-so years I've worked just south of the Loop, and given that she likely sees hundreds of college students a day.  The food here is pretty typical of Wingstop (I'll admit it sometimes seems greasy, but I kinda like that).  I am addicted to their teriyaki glaze and crave it's savory taste even as I type this.  And you can't really beat the 60¢ specials they have on Mondays and Tuesday.

57.description: Their wings are just the best.. Try out their atomic sauce..

20.description: Possibly the worst wingstop ever! They always manage to eff up my order. My suggestion hire better staff & a good manager.

36.description: Food is good, but service is horrible! I placed my order online and I even got there 10min after it was supposed to be ready but I still had to wait 20min to get my order which was missing items.

14.description: Awful awful awful!!!! I have been to other Wingstops, and they have been great. This ons is the pits! I ordered online thinking I can walk in and pick up my order. I walked in, was treated so rudely by the cashier, who kept giving me attitude. She finally looked down and saw my order in the printer bin. They then started my order when I walked in. They ask everyone for ID like they are criminals. The have no system when the orders are ready, a random person whispers a name. I sat there like an idiot for 45 minutes waiting for my order, when I asked them if it was ready. It seems it was sitting there for some time. Of course my order is cold when I finally get to eat it- about 1.5 hours after I ordered it online. Crappy service. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere better!!! Avoid this place at all costs!

58.description: Great selection of wine, with some very reasonably priced specials.  Limited but very interesting selection of beer.  Individual chilled bottles of beer start at $5.  Funky neighborhood.

56.description: Such a cute little place with a fantastic selection of wine, beer and spirits.  The staff is knowledgeable and laid back and will steer you in the right direction if asked.Though I popped in here for libations for my gentleman caller and I, the extra star is for being whistled at on the way out.  I knew I was rocking that red dress!

29.description: Love this place.  The staff is so friendly, and they have a great selection.  Be on the look out if you can get a groupon, it's a solid deal.

42.description: We had us a good ole time at Printer's Row Wine Shop during Lit Fest this weekend. All I have to say is, I have never been to a wine shop that is more fun than a bar! They will let you drink whatever you buy, right there. Anyway, we stopped in just to look around and wound up staying and drinking for two hours. Lots of cool locals to chat with and the selection of wine, beer and alcohol is smart and eclectic. I was familiar with most of the offerings already but it was fun to see it all collected in one place. The shop itself is attractive, with high ceilings and hardwood floors. The owners are personable and laid back and cultivate a laid-back atmosphere. Unfortunately, they are Sox fans (j/k!- no, seriously)...The only negative to point out is that the prices skew $2-$5 more here than at other places where I buy wine and beer. Anyway, it's a great neighborhood stop and I will definitely be back. (Shout out to our friends, Gilles and Hal!)

23.description: Let me put it like this:  I like Printer's Row Wine Shop so much that, even though I live in the northern part of Streeterville, this is my preferred shop for all things Bacchus.  Period.  If I'm in the neighborhood, I have to stop in just to poke around.  Is it the awesome people who work there?  The great selection?  The down-to-earth atmosphere?  I have no clue.  There always seems to be something interesting to try, regardless of your mood: Fun craft beers, fantastic wines, wonderful spirits (including awesome bourbon)!  If cost is your concern, Printer's Row Wine Shop is competitive with most, and even if you have to spend an extra dollar, you get more value from your visit than you do from a Big Box Booze store.  No glazed over zombies in matching polos here.  It's a educated person's Drinking shop, and class is always in session... leave your pretentiousness at the door.

47.description: This is a great little wine shop in Printer's Row.  My boyfriend and I come here regularly since we live close by.  Actually, we stumbled upon this place by accident after a horrendous experience at the nearby Warehouse Liquors (read my review on it for more on that).The owner is quite friendly and helpful.  They have a great selection of different wines in a wide array of prices.  The prices reflect the neighborhood, so you could definitely find cheaper altneratives, but not in the area.  The atmosphere of the shop is very clean and rustic.  Their craft beer selection is wonderful!  We've tried all kinds of different seasonal beers from this shop over the last year.  They have a small selection of spirits, which is fine.  They have all the basics covered and a few unique options here and there, but the real reason to come here is for the beer and/or wine.I love it!

8.description: It's kind of dumb, actually, to review places like liquor stores. No matter what, people WILL patronize a liquor store if they want/need their fix. But then there are people like me who actually prefer to spend my hard-earned dollars & support businesses that actually appreciate and respect their customers. I realized after a certain amount of time that I didn't get this here. Have spent way too much money over the years & put up with way too much attitude and/or indifference in this hypermasculine establishment. Part of the whole point of supporting a neighborhood business is that there's supposed to be a familiarity, a congeniality, a level of respect that you're not necessarily going to get at a big box where you know they don't know you. Well, if you're not getting that then it's best to go elsewhere. And the beauty of liquor stores & even speciality wine shops is that there is always another one. Especially in Chicago, thank goodness, there is always another one...

31.description: LOVE This place.Rob and Flavio take FANTASTIC care of their regulars.  The prices are a little high on some items, but totally worth it because they treat you like a human being and appreciate your business.Always a killer beer selection.They also recently got turn tables installed.  FUN!

34.description: Perfect local wine and beer shop - knowledgeable owners/staff, unique high-end beer, and a pretty decent wine selection.  They beefed up their beer list not too long ago - and it's quite extensive now.  I'm not much into beer (but will not say no to a yummy glass of red wine), but it's fun to try some of their offerings as they really are unique and tasty.  Oh, and they have a wine tasting every Friday evening - so taste before you buy!

16.description: I'm a sucker for craft beer. I love trying new brews but hate when I can never find them again. Enter Printers Row Wine Shop.I went in for Pumking today (after googling where i could get it nearby) but was thrilled to have found New Holland brews, Founders, other Southern Tier, etc. I left with a much higher total but I had planned but my new bag helped with that!What bag you ask? $2 for a bag that holds 4 beers in place and gave me 10% off my purchase today and will continue to do so forever and ever. Aside from the products- the dude working was also really pleasant. He asked only once if I needed anything (more would have annoyed me) and didn't stare while I meandered around. We had a nice chat before I left as well. Cool guy. Long story short, I became a loyal customer in the matter of minutes. Great selection, nice people, good deals, awesome vibe.

13.description: Environment: 5/5Employees: 3/5Cost: 3/5Parking: 4/5Total: 15/20Synopsis: When I first arrived in Chicago, I knew I needed to find something like Hasr, to meet people, drink wine, have special treatment. However, by comparison this place fell lower than expected. Customer service is not robust, but the fact that it has to be a "suitable" replacement would have to suffice.Environment: Quite an elegant place and very organized! Wooden floors that look sharp, sturdy, and releases and Earthy essence. Homely like. 5/5Employees: Have mostly an average experience or poor service. Makes my eyes roll after being engaged. However, the knowledge of the people are exquisite and they know their stuff! They even are good at offering recommendations.Cost: It depends on what you get and what deals are available. I would not say, "Come here for the price."Parking: For where it is, parking is plentiful. They even have a huge section for parking just require moolah to pay.

11.description: Are you one of those people who will buy a beer/cider/wine/booze based on the label or packaging? Do you like to browse and read patter on the labels? Do you think finding a good bottle of alcohol is like a treasure hunt?I do, and I LOVE this place. I'm fairly sure that the employees think I'm lost or going to steal something because I spend so long just browsing the ever-so-slightly-changing selection, reading the labels, and then buying based on cool name or awesome patter. I've had some hits, a LOT of misses, but that's not the point. The fun is in the hunt. On the less exotic side, I have found tall boys of Magners and Strongbow here, and for that, they are forever in my heart. Sure, there are cheaper places, but the service and the selection here makes up for any cost differential. But I think I need more tats to fit in. Oh well. We can't all be winners.

39.description: I shopped here for the first time with a 50% off Groupon, and I couldn't have been more impressed with the service, selection and ambiance of the place.  The man working was knowledgeable and helpful, even though he knew that I had a Groupon and probably couldn't afford to spend a lot of money.  He asked me what type of beers I liked, and then helped me find new bottles that I would enjoy based on my tastes.  Boy was he right.  Definitely going back -- maybe next time to try the wine.  Or the liquor...

37.description: I challenge you to imagine what a wine/beer shop in the heart of Printer's Row looking like, then step in here and tell me it is not exactly what you pictured. There are bottles of wine stacked against every spot of wall, there are old barrels filled with goodies, tables featuring some deals, coolers and racks filled with fancy beer, liquor bottles stacked behind the long counter, homemade greeting cards to go along with the gift you are picking up, and even some gourmet-ish snacks to go along with whatever beverage you purchase. I should share that I am not what you would call a "boozer", in fact I know almost nothing about wine and beer. However, I am engaged to a man that could write a book on beer and I can safely say that the guy that is always working here (possibly the owner?) always has a chat with him about what's new, how to concoct your own mix of beer, and their favorites from around the world. The prices here vary, I don't think this is where you go to buy cheap stuff but there are certainly plenty of options on the more cost-effective side, as well as some options to splurge on. I definitely encourage you to come here for their expertise and selection, and please give them your money instead of the grocery and convenient stores around the area.

0.description: This place is an example of the style of Printers Row. This quaint little shop has original hardwood floors and a careful organization of every bottle of wine, or beer.They also sell cheeses, meats, crackers and treats! They will assist you if you get confused all you need to do is stand there long enough to be offered help! Customer service here is A-1.If you go to this place I'm sure you will find something that you never tried to enjoy.... So go ahead and enjoy!

38.description: These guys are very friendly and helpful!  Would come here again anytime!

51.description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood haunts. The staff is super helpful and they have a wide variety of wines (yes they've got some fabulous $10 specials) and treats. I was pleasantly surprised when I went to buy two bottles as hostess gifts and they actually "wrapped" them. Nothing fancy but they'll put a stamp with the name of the store and tie them up with some twine. Definitely a nice touch and from a classy Printer's Row wine joint what more can you ask for?

27.description: My absolute favorite place to buy wine.  Note, they have a great selection of quality liquor as well.The atmosphere just oozes cool.  With old hardwood floors and wood shelving, the place feels as if it was plucked straight out of the early 20th century.  The recent addition of turn tables and the guys playing real vinyl and you just want to hang out for extended periods of time.Service is awesome.  You don't get the typical 'I know so much about wine, let me tell you about it and why you don't ' attitude.  The guys are always ready to make some suggestion, but honestly, I typically go with whatever they have on special in the front of the shop.  I like trying new wines and really trust them to put out some good choices.You can put your flashers on and pop in, which makes parking easy.

32.description: Stopped in this shop to find a relatively small shop with somewhat bare shelves. I knew the answer to this though, its the groupon effect (a rush of consumers in the final deal days buying up what is available) and I was contributing with my expiring voucher. I didn't have trouble finding a few bottles that sounded good though. I found the clerk nice, not too much interaction though. I'm not sure I'd go out of my way to this shop. I find security in thinking I'm getting a fairer price at a larger store rather than a small local shop surviving in the big city, especially when it comes to wine (not a forte of mine).

54.description: This Wine and Beer shop is amazing! my boyfriend and i just happened to stumble in one night after going to Villians and we've been back every week for something every since.Since i dont know too much about beer, i really appreciate the staff taking the time to suggest bottles and types for me that i would have never picked up otherwise. They suggested the best $3 hefeweizen that i will ever drink in my life and i've always picked up a bottle when i'm there now. They also have a great arrangement of off the wall beers, such as Banana Bread (which is yummy!)If you are in the South Loop and have a moment just to browse they always have a great wine selection and dont mind answering any questions. Another thing i really appreciate was that the clerks didn't pretend to know things. I wanted to know about a certain beer and they jumped on the computer and told me everything they could find out it. It was great!

48.description: Helpful staff, great (free) wine tastings on Fridays, unique selection of wine (and beer)!  Nothing I hate more than going to a boutique wine shop and seeing grocery store brands line the walls.My only complaint is that the markup seems a little high...but it's a small business.  I understand.

44.description: I lived in Printer's Row for a year, and this little wine shop is still one of my favorite places to buy wine.  The have a decent selection and prices for being in the loop area.  On multiple occasions, they would be sampling wine when I would go in- which is always a plus ;) And the employees were always super friendly and helpful!

24.description: Very knowledgeable staff who know wine from different regions very well!

7.description: Is this a...dare I say it...hidden gem?  Ugh, I can't believe I just typed that.  My college professors would probably weep at the fact that I couldn't come up with something more original.  Seriously though, I want to know how a store has [beer name withheld] sitting right there on the counter a week after it pops up in all the beer stores.  This place HAS to be a hidden gem.Oh wait, it's a wine shop.  They just happen to have a small yet splendid selection of craft beers.  I can dig it.  Called to see if they had a few beers.  They even set aside said beers, even though it would be a few hours before I'd be in.  I hate when the place down the street from where I work won't even hold a damn beer that's not all that popular (but down to their last one that hasn't moved in days), yet this place had no qualms about holding their last 2 bottles of something that some beer nerd easily could have come in looking for.  After a little chatting and a little buying, I asked myself "self, what can you get the woman who birthed you and currently has everything thanks to you and your step-dad for her birthday?"  I answered myself with "wine", because what mom who drinks one margarita and asks for "another margaritee please" WOULNDN'T want booze?  (In case you missed that, my mom isn't a drinker.  Who gets drunk off one margarita?  Pfft.)  I'm so thoughtful.  I really liked that despite spending more than I should have on booze (including an impulse buy, thanks to it being on the counter and all), when I asked for help picking a wine and said "no more than $50 please" I wasn't met with nothing but $50 wines.  In fact, I picked two wines that were roughly $20-$22.  I don't know my wine like I know my beer, but I was able to help him narrow it down to a few bottles for me to choose from.  I spoke with one gentleman on the phone and was helped by a different one upon arrival, but both were very pleasant to deal with.  I like that in a wine shop.  I also like that I was signed up for their rewards program.  Looks like I'll have to find a way to work this CBHG into my rotation.

49.description: Without a doubt the best liquor store in the city.The staff is super friendly, and they are the only retailer (as well as sister-store Gentile's on the campus of UIC) to carry Vinejoy products.Vinejoy has an amazing selection of wine and other liquors and I truly believe that they are on the rise in the competitive Chicago market for high-quality wine.I love the decor, the overall feel, and selection that Printers Row has and you can always hear great music being played while in-store.The Loop is a convenient location no matter what way you are getting there on the CTA, so there really is no reason other than perhaps laze to make a trip down to Printers Row.YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED! Definitely inquire about Vinejoy for some top-notch wine.

40.description: After Sam's closed down in 2009, this is where I went for all my craft beers.  Good selection and cool guys running the place.  Their prices are a bit high compared to Binny's, but it's a small business, so it's understandable.  I didn't buy much wine there, but they seem to have good choices at various prices, as well as hard liqour and cigars.All in all, it's a good place if you live in the area, but to be honest, had Sam's not closed, I probably wouldn't ever go here.

53.description: love this place. i always stop when i'm in the neighborhood. they have great prices and can suggest a great wine or two for any dish!

30.description: Nice little neighborhood wine and beer shop. I'm not so familiar with their wine selection, but the beer selection is really nice, they always have an array of craft brews. The prices are pretty good, sometimes significantly less than the more well-known liquor stores. The staff is always friendly, too.

46.description: Visit on a Friday night and request a TV sitcom theme song and they'll play it! Great vibe, sick selection. Col times.

1.description: If this were my neighborhood wine, beer, and liquor store, I'd definitely be a happy camper.Their selection is top notch, and there's always someone knowledgable there willing to help. I was particularly impressed by their sake and local beer selection.Don't forget the loyalty points! If you come here enough, leave your name and score major discounts. Or, don't hesitate to leave my name.

55.description: Printer's Row Wine Shop is awesome if you are into inebriation, which, fortunately for them, I am. I don't know much about wine, but it looks like they do in fact have all two colors of it, so that is a plus.Looking beyond the obvious best feature of being only a couple blocks from home, their beer selection is also awesome and the staff is always nice and helpful. A few blocks away from the heart of downtown Chicago, it is good to know a place that feels like a small local neighborhood shop. They constantly rotate in their craft beer section and the staff is pretty knowledgable about recommendations and what is good seasonally. They also always stock a variety of sample packs from random breweries around the country, so it is fun to try something new and learn by trying new things. When my girlfriend and I got obsessed with pumpkin ale during last October (or ROCKtober, if that's your preference), their employee Nate put some behind the counter for us for a while without us asking, assuming we were coming in eventually. $35 extra YelpBucks for that.They carry the crappy stuff too, but don't walk too far down the beer aisle and be that dickhead that goes into a nice unique shop and buys a case of miller lite. I wish they would price 30 packs of college-beer at like $100 a case just to get across "you're a douchebag."

9.description: What a great shop. This is definitely my go to in the neighborhood any time I need wine, beer, or spirits. I moved into Printer's Row just over a year ago and am so glad I found this place. The weekly wine tastings are always good, but I really enjoy the periodic spirit tastings they have. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.On a side note, I love that the shop offers rewards points on purchases. I've never heard of another wine shop that does this.

26.description: This place reminds me of all stop shop of wine, beer, spirits, with few cigars in Williamsburg (Brooklyn) without the hipsters. Of course in NYC, this doesn't exist.As you enter, the music playing is not coming from an iPod, but vinyl records on turntables. The store is small, but clean and neatly organized.One of the workers came by and asked if we needed help. I politely declined, as I drooled over the selection of craft beer bottles in the fridge. Some wines have nice descriptions of flavor profiles on placards, so I wish all of them did.Overall, Printers Row Wine Shop is an impressive wine and spirits shop and open late (11pm).Watch your step on the way out! I forgot I had to step up to get in and almost tucked and rolled on the way out.IFHTP 1

25.description: I feel so lucky to have this unique wine shop in my hood!While not as big as the super-store-wine-shops, Printers Row Wine Shop has a rustic elegance that allows you to peruse wines from every region imaginable.  If you are a fan of European reds (and c'mon, who's not?) then you'll find a fantastic selection.Best yet--Printers Row Wine shop has tastings of 5 or so wines, which is fun to indulge in.  They also have sales on a variety of wines, and a wine of the month club.Mostly though, it's just a relaxing atmosphere--not pretentious at all.  Wine snobs need not enter!  Thanks Printers Row Wine Shop for being such a great part of the neighborhood.

12.description: Love this little shop! The owners are so knowledgeable and every bottle is chosen for a reason to be there. You can find anything good in any price range (even beer), and I dearly miss their Friday night tastings. J'adore!

59.description: Quaint wine shop that sells everything else you might need for a night alone in front of the TV with just you and the bottle...Okay, all kidding aside; it's a nice place.  The sales associates know what they're talking about and don't try to force the most expensive wine on you.  There are cheeses, chilled wines, hard liquor, some mixers, cigars, and alcohol flavored chocolate to accompany the wines on the shelf.  All in all, go go go to the Printer's Row Wine Shop!

21.description: These guys were awesome!  As a wine novice, I wanted to buy a boss's gift and they nailed it.  Were incredibly helpful and steered me to an outstanding selection as it turned out.

17.description: Mon dieu. I've since sampled all of the three wines I bought that day. Aforementioned Fiction was fantastic, as was the anti Red.But the one that made me moist was the Agua de Piedra (Foot water?!) Malbec. Whoa. This is a wine that will make your panties dissolve. Dry, dry, DRY, and bold, baby.I will so make the trek back to Printers Row for more of that goodness. Mmmmmm.

10.description: I went in this morning to find a few local beers to bring back home for my husband and the guy who assisted me was super friendly and helpful. Great selection! Wine selection was great too!

5.description: I needed to buy a bottle of champagne for my brother in law and didn't have time to go to a big store on the way home. A quick search on Yelp led to me this great little shop. If you're thinking this is a great alternative to Binny's, it's not. It doesn't have the same selection nor size. But what it lacks in space, it makes up for in weekly wine tastings, beer tastings, customer service and honest to goodness passion in the product.

3.description: Worst wine store I ever encountered in Chicago-land or anywhere else for that matter. Poor selection, semi-bare shelves, disinterested staff, no gratis gift wrapping available from what I was told. The semi-comatose clerk acted like he was doing me a favor when he snipped the price off a bottle I intended as a gift. Then he slid it into a plain brown paper bag. Class act. I'm sure glad this isn't my neighborhood liquor store. This was my first time here, essentially my welcome to the neighborhood, and I won't be back (if I can help it). I'm off to Binny's right now and hopefully their awesome selection, good service and loyalty program will erase some of the bad taste I got from this establishment.

35.description: Hidden gem of a nicely done smaller and selective wine shop in the south streets of Printer's row.   Mr. and Mrs. Groupon led me here but I had jogged by a few times before and wanted to come back. Very nice helpful suggestions and great deals of wines that turned out to be quite good.  Need to come back for my local wine needs.  Nice diversity of prices and types.

19.description: This place is seriously one of the best wine shops I've ever been to. I have never had a bottle of wine from there that I did not like. The staff are some of the better-educated I've ever encountered, and since they're not dealing with such a massive selection, they tend to know a lot about each bottle they carry.  Bottom line, get your wine here.

28.description: Great selection of wine and beers.  They have a lot of great micro-brews from around the country and local breweries.  The store also has a nice selection of cigars and other tobacco products for those who are inclined.  Staff is very friendly and prices are fair.

45.description: I always enjoyed coming in here when my sister lived in Printer's Row.  It was so convenient, and has a great selection of wine!  Everyone working is always friendly and helpful.

33.description: This is such a cute little wine shop with a pretty extensive selection.  I stopped in for the first time today because I had purchased a Groupon that was about to expire.  As far as prices go, they seemed pretty competitive.  I like that they had a lot of wines from places I recently visited in Napa.  I just wish I discovered this spot when I actually lived in the neighborhood!

43.description: Absolutely amazing selection of micro brews and wines.  I also really dig the feel of the store.  Very printers row.  lolz.  They also ahve beer and wine tastings quite regularly (join the email mailing list).  Very Nice

2.description: This shop is super cool. Their selection is stellar. They carry really rare stuff and their staff is knowledgeable. Whats the problem? The price. I bought a batch of four roses - small batch bourbon. I saw the price tag, $43, and asked the gentleman at the counter if this was a fair price as I thought this was overpriced but was unsure if I was getting it confused with single barrel. The hipster behind the counter told me "no, I've never seen it cheaper". What a D. Binny's sells this for $29.99. I do not care what these guys sell, I will not go back there. I will gladly drive an extra two miles to find this somewhere else. Fairly unhipster move IMO btw. That beard, skinny jeans, and beanie suggested some sort of hipster code that I thought guaranteed my liquor purchase to be a reasonable deal. False. If I was Wilford Brimley, I would name this store Diabetes, it's the worst.

18.description: Great selection of wine and beer. The owners are super friendly and extremely helpful. The shop has a fun neighborhood feel to it. Everyone who visits is treated like a long time friend and often treated to a wine tasting! This spot is a true neighborhood gem and assets to printer row.

41.description: Mon dieu. I've since sampled all of the three wines I bought that day. Aforementioned Fiction was fantastic, as was the anti Red.But the one that made me moist was the Agua de Piedra (Foot water?!) Malbec. Whoa. This is a wine that will make your panties dissolve. Dry, dry, DRY, and bold, baby.I will so make the trek back to Printers Row for more of that goodness. Mmmmmm.

52.description: I was here for the great beer selection - not as many beers as wines, but still a good selection of regional and beyond.

50.description: I am very surprised by the glowing reviews this establishment has received. Laid back is an excellent description...so much so don't count on getting any assistance. You would think being a small neighborhood liquor store would survive being so discourteous however, young naive  college kids insure they survive. The worst is the owner, can't be bothered to say hello or thank you--- ever. This might be acceptable if their prices were reasonable but they are easily 20% higher than most liquor stores -- high prices, terrible service = 1 star

4.description: Haven't been impressed with this shop for years now. Staff always seem too cool to be bothered. A friend of mine had a very negative experience there recently but I needed to pick up a quick bottle on the way home from dinner knowing that nothing would be open the next day (Thanksgiving). Bought a bottle of FEW bourbon. $70. Wha?!?!? Are you kidding me? Are you charging so much because it's imported? No, wait, it's from Evanston! Same bottle is currently $40 at Binny's and $45 at Whole Foods. Yes, this place is more expensive than Whole Foods! I do like to support the local businessman but will never go there again. Sure, charge a couple more bucks, that's fine. But $30?!?! Warehouse Liquors is only a short walk away and, while they usually charge (a little) more than Binny's, the staff is awesome and actually appreciative of the business.

6.description: I stopped into this little shop last week when I was in town for a conference. Great selection of wines! Several of my favorites that are hard to fine were displayed on the shelves. They were having a free tasting which was also nice. Actual wine glasses for the tasting is a perk!The only odd thing was the staff interaction I had. There was only one guy working, and it was a little busy - maybe six people?  When checking out I mentioned I found the place on Yelp and the guy told me all about how much he hates this site! A little weird. Especially since I mentioned the site and they have great reviews.

22.description: A hipster-ed out alcohol sales joint. Parking is reasonable given Chicago standards. They carry a deep selection of wine for the space. Good micros. The staff seems to enjoy their job. A plus. They also have a wine tasting every Friday. Very interactive. A great place for a casual first date. There's a cool hamburger spot two doors down if things are clicking. But, if there's no connection at least you learn more about the art of wine. Overall, it's a win-win I tell ya!

15.description: My absolute favorite place to buy wine.  Note, they have a great selection of quality liquor as well.The atmosphere just oozes cool.  With old hardwood floors and wood shelving, the place feels as if it was plucked straight out of the early 20th century.  The recent addition of turn tables and the guys playing real vinyl and you just want to hang out for extended periods of time.Service is awesome.  You don't get the typical 'I know so much about wine, let me tell you about it and why you don't ' attitude.  The guys are always ready to make some suggestion, but honestly, I typically go with whatever they have on special in the front of the shop.  I like trying new wines and really trust them to put out some good choices.You can put your flashers on and pop in, which makes parking easy.

57.description: I fell in love with this shop. Fun wine selection and a great beer selection. They carry the sampler 12 pack of Great Lakes which I haven't seen anywhere recently. Good selection of Half Acre, they had the Ginger Twin, yay! Also the staff was great and told me about some beers that had just come in that weren't on display yet. This place is a godsend to get out of the craziness for a bit when at the book fair. Loaded up with books and all the beer I could ever want I left here for home totally satisfied.

20.description: This shop is a gem. I don't live in the south loop, but I will take the trek here to visit this wine shop. I'm not super cultered. I just like wine. This place understands that and works with that.First off, the service is impeccable. I came here on a whim on a Saturday night half an hour before closing, and I didn't feel like it was the end of the day type service. The guy who was working was really helpful and interesting and not in the least bit pretentious. He was also very conscious of our budget, which I appreciated. They have free wine tastings every Friday. I'm so glad I found this place.You're not going to buy a $3 bottle of Trader Joe's wine here, but why on earth would you want to? If you want $3 wine, go to Trader Joe's.

36.description: People often compare small neighborhood shops to mega marts and oversized beverage providers. And I have no idea why. To me, it's an unfair comparison for countless reasons. No small place can offer the limitless selection of a larger store while larger stores don't have the intimacy and service of a smaller place. That said, every neighborhood needs a shop like this. It's warm, inviting, and they have a great selection of beer and wine available.Is the store so great that I'd bypass my regular places to further my trip and head here? No. But I wish this place was in my building. I'll leave it at that.

14.description: This place reminds me of all stop shop of wine, beer, spirits, with few cigars in Williamsburg (Brooklyn) without the hipsters. Of course in NYC, this doesn't exist.As you enter, the music playing is not coming from an iPod, but vinyl records on turntables. The store is small, but clean and neatly organized.One of the workers came by and asked if we needed help. I politely declined, as I drooled over the selection of craft beer bottles in the fridge. Some wines have nice descriptions of flavor profiles on placards, so I wish all of them did.Overall, Printers Row Wine Shop is an impressive wine and spirits shop and open late (11pm).Watch your step on the way out! I forgot I had to step up to get in and almost tucked and rolled on the way out.IFHTP 1

3.description: Been here twice now. Selection is pretty good but pricey, but the staff is just too rude for it to be worth it. Rather just walk to 7-11 or CVS.

1.description: It's clean... It's convenient.... It's slightly over priced, but it is a convenience store, so it's expected. Honestly, their prices are cheaper than all of the other convenience stores in the area. *Shrugs* It's either Urban Pantry or a grocery store.

2.description: It's great for this area full of condos to have a quick stop pantry shop. It's not so great how friggin expensive everything is. A pack of Starburst for $1 and the cheapest gum I could find was $1.69, ugh.If you need something quick, it's great. You can run in & run out if you live right there. Or if you're passing by, you can easily park on the street with blinkers & run in. If you go to Target a block away, you have to deal with parking in their massive parking lot.No issues with service the few times I've been in. Guys aren't overly friendly but they definitely aren't rude in any way. The whole shop was well organized and clean every time I've gone in.

5.description: Wow! Another great addition to the South Loop.  This is right on Clark in Printer's Row Burnham Pointe Building. Super modern place that allows you to order groceries by text - if you wish.They have super friendly owners and you can find bread and pastries, vegetables and fruits.  They have coffee and wine. Option of online ordering with home delivery and curbside pick-up.

6.description: Forget quick convenience, this place always just leaves me annoyed and frustrated wishing I had walked the extra block to Target, 711 or any of the other convenient stores in the area.  The staff is extremely rude and always trying to get you to spend more money, I have been told there is a $3, $5 and $7 minimum to use credit, as well as no minimum at all... varies depending on the amount of my purchase.  One would think with the lack of business that they would take whatever customers they can get.

7.description: Simply put:  the previous two 1-star reviews are absurd.Reasons I LOVE this store:  1)  It's open until midnight every night except Sunday, when it closes at 10pm.  2)  It's immediately downstairs from my apt., and I don't even have to walk outside to get there (amazing in the winter).  3)  While they could overcharge ridiculously for the amazing convenience (see #2), they don't -- their prices are in line with Target (which is nearby).  4)  They have a pretty exotic beer selection.  It's not just your typical Coors, Miller, etc., but truly good beers.  Today, for example, I got a limited release "Lagunitas 'Little Sumpin' Wild'," which is epic.5) Their selection adapts over time.  When they first opened, they didn't have many home/bath products -- but they learned their business and their clientele and adapted.  Now, can often find that random something at the store without making the trip to Target.I feel genuinely sorry that a private business owner has to fear getting 1-star reviews because of one or two childishly unhappy customers, but that's just the modern age in which we live.Bottom Line:  This place is GREAT, and one of the perks of living in my building that makes me want to stay here for years to come!

8.description: I went to this store expecting to be blown away. The idea and concept is great but it's just poorly executed. It seems underfunded, disorganized and not real clean. Maybe they'll get their act together soon and I'll go back and give it a try.

0.description: If you are staying in the Financial District and looking for groceries this store is listed on Yelp as a grocery store which is incorrect.  It is a convenience store.  Grocery stores will have foods such as produce, milk, eggs etc.  stopped by earlier to learn of this mistake on the Yelp category.That being said it does have a nice selection of snack items at reasonable prices.  Craft and local brew selection is good, wine section was surprisingly nice and the service was friendly.  Useful convenience store indeed.

4.description: Fortunately, I've not experienced what the first two reviewers have noted.  I have some of my own notes:Location: 5 out of 5 (South Loop)If you happen to live in the south loop, it's actually quite convenient since it's in the ground floor of the Burnham Pointe apartments.  Parking is usually available on the street, though most of my "errands" here have all been on foot due to the super close proximity from my place.  As others have noted, it competes with Target and 7-Eleven from a geographical perspective.Service: 2.5 out of 5I wouldn't say the guys that work here are "rude" or "mean."  The guys that I presume are the proprietors are "nice enough" and they probably work stupid long hours so that their second generation Indian-subcontinent kids can have their own kids born into middle class like it ain't no thang.  The part time help guys are a little nicer, but still not what I would consider to be "happy."  I mean, they ask me if I want a bag for my beer, and they say, "thanks" as I walk out.  Good enough.Selection of Beer: 3 out of 5I've not perused the aisles (in the real meaning of the word, not the mistaken definition of 'browse') for foodstuffs or convenience items, but their beer selection will do in a pinch.  I'm actually pretty impressed by the amount of craft brewers they carry:  3 Floyds, 2 Bros, Bells, Flying Dog, Chimay, etc.  They've also got your typical run of the mill American style light lagers and well-established imports like Corona, Guiness, and Heineken.  I mean - could I walk another block to Printers Row Wine and find tons more beer?  Yes.  But if what I drink on a regular basis can be found here if I'm rushed for time, is there a need to do that?  No.Price of Beer: 2.5 out of 5Eh...noticeably more than other places where you might find craft beers.  Craft six packs are 1 - 2 dollars more expensive than anywhere else, and craft 12 packs are 2 - 3 dollars more.  I think once there was some mixup with the bar code, and I got a 6 pack of beer for 4.99 plus tax, which was awesome.  The next time I went, it was properly tagged at 8.99 or 9.99.  Boo.  Like I said - I come here if I'm pinched for time, and with that in mind, maybe the prices are worth it.  Cleanliness/Organization: 3 out of 5I don't recall seeing anything that was "dirty" or unorganized.  Things seemed to be running ok after they initially opened up in Q3 of 2011.  Overall: 3 out of 5 (beer centric)Close enough that I don't dismiss them if I'm in need of craft beer and I've forgotten to grab it on my weekly errands.  Expensive enough that it prevents me from coming here regularly.  I think for awhile they were trying to reach out to the college students by doing wine tastings and nominal discounts -maybe that will pick back up as more students get back after the summer is over.

58.description: Without a doubt, I will be back. Great for a mid-week massage, especially when the prices are so reasonable. This is a great place to go with friends/family members, as it is sort of a "communal-massage" experience; sounds weird, but it isn't.I certainly recommend this place if you have a significant other in your life who is kind of "iffy" about the idea of getting fully undressed and doing a traditional massage. You can go together, sit next to each other, and you will feel faaantastic afterwards.I've read a few complaints on here about the masseuses being too "rough". They have ears, people.... Tell them. I've asked them to be more gentle on certain places on my back, and they were absolutely wonderful at respecting my requests.Be sure to bring cash for tips; hand your tip to your masseuse directly. Afterwards, you will feel about 4 inches taller, and get to sip tea before walking onto busy Michigan, fully relaxed and happy with the world.

56.description: If you are looking for an affordable massage in the area and you don't necessarily want to make an appointment far in advance and you are fine with community style rooms (note this is not a massage where you get naked), then this place is for you. They have a great 3 massage special where you get 3 60 minute massages for $100 which is a steal! You are in a dimly lit community room possibly with a few other people, and you get a foot soak, and the first half of the massage is your head, shoulders, arms, and hands. Then you get the foot massage and then the finale is the focus on your back, shoulders and legs including a few pressure points and such too. You might be sore a little the next day, but they really do work your muscles!! Everyone here is nice and they definitely run a strict schedule here, where you don't get a ton of down time after the massage to come back to reality, which would be one downside for this community style room of massage. But 3 60 minute massages for $100 really can't be beat at all. So if you are on the market for a massage, you should consider this place.

29.description: I came to DQ after seeing their deal on Groupon. Really good pedi and mani for only $35. They used an OPI nail polish on my toes and a gel polish on my fingers--- worth it for the money.

42.description: I have mixed feelings. This was definitely a different type of massage than I'm used to, so read some of the other reviews for the full experience before proceeding. It wasn't terrible, but I can't say I truly enjoyed it either. The facility was nice. The massage is given in a room with other clients, but everyone is fully clothed, the room is relaxing and dark, and it's not (that) weird. The price was also nice - $45 for 60 minutes (although I only got about 50 minutes of actual massage time). The warm foot soak and the face/scalp massage at the beginning of these were very relaxing. I also liked the soles of my feet getting all the TLC (hence, a reflexology massage). But, the rest of the massage was hit or miss, literally -- there was a LOT of pounding/hitting going on. This style of massage made it hard to relax as your body is being jolted with the force of a blunt fist. While it was strangely soothing at times, the massage was more painful than enjoyable. My therapist was very nice and skilled, but his technique was a bit rough for my liking. I prefer deep tissue massages, but this felt a little like Fifty Shades of Grey and I needed a safe word.

23.description: I went with my boyfriend. Because I asked before, they gave us our own room. This was one of the best, if not the best, massage I've ever had, and I've had a lot. We just got the introductory massage. At first, our feet were soaking while they rubbed our necks. They gave such an amazing reflexology foot massage. I tend to need work on my back and neck. They really did a great job. They were leveraging their whole body weight to get rid of knots. I highly recommend, and it's affordable!

47.description: Awesome massage for a bargain price! I will go again! Love the foot reflexology.  Wear loose clothing as you don't need to undress

8.description: Perhaps it's unfair for me to be this picky about massages at this price range, but I've definitely experienced better.The facility:Very clean and quiet (unless there's someone snoring who you'd definitely be able to hear). The lighting is good, but when I went, there were long breaks of silence between tracks which was really distracting for me. Other than that, the environment was very comfortable.The massage:The foot massage portion was great, except that was only maybe 15% of the massage. The head massage portion was also pretty good, but once she got to my neck, it just felt like she was very aggressively lotioning me, rather than actually massaging the area (same goes for my calves). The lotion was unscented, but I think she could have been a bit more generous with it because the back of my neck felt pretty raw after she was done rubbing it. Also, I just feel like this massage wasn't a personalized experience. For example, I know I carry most of my tension in my lower back, but that area felt pretty neglected in comparison to my neck and upper back. If this location is convenient and you have a yelp deal or groupon, I wouldn't deter you from DQ Luxury, but there are definitely better options out there.

31.description: I will never come here again. One of the worst nail experiences I have ever had. I made an appointment for a friend and I. The nail salon is small (only 3 chairs for pedicure) and when we got there they had someone in the middle chair meaning my friend and I could not sit together. They only had 2 people working so they took us one at a time even though we had an appointment. They started my pedicure while my friend just sat in the salon waiting. Then when the other nail tech was finished with the first girl instead of starting my friend's pedicure she took another girl that walked in after us. I think the workers started noticing how mad my friend was so they started her pedicure- they sat her in a chair and made her soak her feet for over 20 minutes! The nail tech did my entire pedicure and manicure while my friend sat and waited for me to be finished. The nail tech started to rush through the end of my manicure and by doing so messed up one of my nails 2 times. They did not offer us anything to drink or to take our bags (my friend had a suitcase), the staff was unfriendly the entire time. Clearly appointments did not matter since they were not prepared to have my friend and I get our nails done at the same time AND they took another girl that was just a walk-in before taking my friend. The only good thing was that we used a Groupon so we did not have to pay a lot for a terrible experience.

34.description: The service was ok. I had better, but I'm not here to complaint about that. It's more about the service I got from the owner of the place. I had a Groupon so I presented here the Groupon on my phone and gave the young lady who did my nails a tip. The owner pretty much asked me for more money for the tip and said she could even buy a burger with that that the service is worth $72 and she already giving the service at half price and I should be tipping on that the full price of the service not on the discount price. Anyway she pretty much told me if I was not going to give more money I should take my money and leave.

16.description: This maybe my 5 th time coming here.  Don't expect too much as what they've said you're in a large room with others thus you can here them talk which may be irritating.  But hey the massage is great and cheap.  I will still be coming back here.

13.description: I purchased a Groupon here, and came for the mani & pedi combo deal. I was able to schedule my appointment and reschedule without any issues. The nail job was a bit lackluster for me. First my nails were not even cut straight when I asked for them to be cut down. Secondly, my cuticles were not pushed back. Thirdly the nail cutting and clipping was done so close to the skin that I bled in two areas. I bought the deal because the existing reviews were all pretty positive, but I'm starting to re-think that the purchasing of the deals makes for a less quality job and the saying that you pay for what you get applies.

11.description: Came in to get a no-chip Mani and a regular pedi. The overall outcome was great. Love the way my nails turned out. However, I feel as though that it was rushed. I was in and out under an hour. My leg rub/massage was done within one  3 minute song (I listen to my iPod while getting my pedis) which I think is more than too short. I also think they should turn on the heater. Its 20 degrees outside. My toes were freezing while getting my manicure. I am cold right now sitting in the waiting area for my bf who is getting massage and I am wearing my jacket!

39.description: Went for the no chip manicure and pedicure with my mother, not a fan. To start, the front desk had no idea why we were there... We made an appointment several days ago. After waiting for 5 minutes while she answered phone calls we finally got back. The color choices were minimal, the woman hardly spoke to you. I asked for round shaped nails and she filed them so low and square I have no idea what she was thinking. We sat in silence for an hour an a half. Was never asked if we wanted a glass of water. This place might be top notch for massages, but not for nails!

37.description: My first time going into DQ luxury i decided to buy a groupon for 1 no-chip manicure and a regular pedicure for only $35.00. I called ahead to schedule my appointment which was very easy. I find it very accommodating they were able to schedule me up until 7pm. I was out in just under an hour. Im pleased with the staff they are professional and very fast. The shellac came out very beautifully. I hope it will last 2 weeks .

0.description: Located on Michigan Ave, this is a great option for recovering as a tourist, or a convenient stop on your way home from work.  Clearly you do get what you pay for.  This is not some elegant spa.  You share the room with the other patrons, keep your clothes on, and do have to listen to others checkout as you get your massage. During our massage one man snored for about twenty minutes--we still enjoyed it, but just realize that you share your experience with others.  They seemed to go the full time, did not disappear when the emptied the foot soak (many places use this as a "five minute break"),  and used firm pressure.  They seem to understand the body well enough to notice a problem area and tailor the massage to target it.  Some tips I've learned over the years going to similar Asian massage places:  The receptionist speaks the best English, so if you have concerns or problem areas, tell him or her so they
