can relay it your therapist.  Also it is easier to tell them to use harder pressure than to say lighter pressure.  I usually ask for medium firm and then tell them to increase pressure if they are doing it too lightly.Wear something like yoga pants or capris, and a tank top.  They use lotion some at this location so if you want them to use lotion on your shoulders wear something that permits doing so.  I say wear pants or capris because they do sometimes stretch your legs in ways that you might wish you did not have shorts on.  Guys longer shorts or sweatpants are good.  I imagine it would not be weird to take your shirt off for the massage.  Years ago one of the therapists at one of the Asian massage places I went to told me that they do not get the credit card tips dollar for dollar like they might get the cash tip.  (Not implying they have to pay taxes on CC tips and not cash, but that the owner would take a share of the tip)  Another told me that if you handed the cash tip to the receptionist they did not always get it either.  Places like this are great for my budget but I like to remind myself that a person just worked very hard for an hour and only got $40, when let's face it, most massages are 100+ for an hour.  I can't imagine how tiring it must be doing this all day--and how little they actually get from the $40.  With that said, I try to always tip at least $10 in cash, and directly hand it to my massage therapist. I never know if a place is good about getting the whole tip to the therapist so I just try to eliminate the guess work and give it directly to them.  They seem to appreciate it, and my conscience feels a little better too.Cash or credit card  but they provide a discount for cash. I suggest asking if they will honor the groupon price if it has ended.  Also they allow you to "upgrade" the 1/2 groupon to an hour for $15 more, making it $33 for the hour.  I did not notice any parking.

38.description: Have you ever had a reflexology experience that was more about the body and less about the feet while aromas of cheap Chinese food fill the air? I have. I followed my yelping heart and looked up a place for my cousin and I to experience on yelp. The reviews were positive and so we thought we would give it a try especially with the yelp special going on. This business is on MICHIGAN avenue so I expected no less than at least a 4/5 star experience. We walked in, and did notice the "please be quiet" signs and asked to check in. The two front desk women were busy and asked us to sit down please. They said it rudely and abruptly. I don't care how busy you are or how stressed you feel, don't project onto me. We sat. A minute later we were told our voice were too loud and the spa needs quiet. okay. No problem. Another woman walked in and also stood there waiting for them to acknowledge her but after four min they said please wait. She sat down and said "well just tell me to please wait instead of keeping with waiting". Amen sister. They made us pay up front before the services were even done. I didn't like that at all. What is this, a drug deal? Fine. I payed the yelp rate of $45 for one hour REFLEXOLOGY massage. We were taken back. It's a room full of multiple massage low beds so you're not alone in a room at all. It's dark and the ambiance is a solid attempt with the music in the background. Here is the problem: the whole place smelled like a cheap and dirty version of Panda Express. It's subtle but I was hoping for scents of lavender and other relaxing things. Nope. It smells like Chinese food. The air conditioning vents are also super loud and when they turn on they actually drown out the sound of the music. Oh and you know how they said please be quiet? Their own staff are talking to each other intermittently and snickering at God knows what while trying to give you a massage. Can you tell so far that during my reflexology experience I was not able to relax and enjoy it and focused on a lot more things than I should have? I don't know the name of the man who was my masseuse. He didn't speak English. He was way way way too rough. Plus he spent less than 15 min on my feet and that's all I came for. Instead it was like a painful full body massage and best down. I swear at one point I literally took my hand and indicated to take it down a notch. I kept stopping him. It was a violent and almost traumatic experience. Maybe i pissed him off in another life? I don't know. But it felt that way. The water that they offer at the end was tap water and poorly mixed with lemon. It's gross. Avoid it. The only good part? They soak your feet in hot water in the beginning. The front desk woman: the both of you are rude. The younger one kept getting annoyed when I asked her a question and would scoff at some of my questions. They charge you $2 to use credit card for tip. Then they don't even give you the tip to give the guy. She said something I a foreign language to him so I have no idea if he knows he was getting a certain amount. I took the receipt and wrote his name and that it was his tip. But you never know with these places. Documentaries have shown that they don't always get their tip so I like to make sure it gets in their hands. I don't recommend this place. I have had reflexology in the past and it's usually focused on the feet and not that painful. The front staff are extremely rude and will scoff at you. The whole place in the back smells. The bathrooms are average and I'm fairly certain the toilet paper was stained with blood. How are they on Michigan avenue? I have no idea.

51.description: Just had my second massage here... Terrific!At first I was skeptical because of other people in the room. But, you soon forget anyone or anything...Reflexology hits every sore spot and some you didn't know you had!Lovely people. No pressure to upgrade, clean environment Reasonably pricedWill def make this my go to massage place

27.description: Thanks to frontier airlines new seats, we needed a massage ASAP. Pros PricesServices Cleanliness ConsCrazy lady before me asking a million questions No parking Notes: non private clothed massage for all you newbsHonestly, southern California has reflexology on every corner and this place was the best I've ever had!!!

32.description: I had bought 8 massage coupons and today I made reservation for 6 pm. I walked in few minutes early and gave them the coupon. I was told they running 10 min late so i waited & I checked again after 10 minutes. The person at desk did not remember I had been waiting and again asked me to wait for 10 more. Eventually I went in for the massage which was pretty decent and as mentioned by others it is a bit different but not bad at all. On my way the masseur was waiting with a glass of water and mentioned something in Chinese  to the front desk / owner lady. She told me to come over and give tips!! I was taken aback as I had never been asked that I have to pay tips!! Due to the wait time and insisting on tip in spite of that is just bad taste and hence I can not give more than 3 stars

54.description: I am not being overzealous  when I say this was the BEST massage, I have ever experienced. And, I did not take an ounce of clothing off. When I tell you that the masseuse, Fiona, was God sent. Before I knew it, they lady was walking on my back. Swaying me back and forth with her super powers. LBVS. First, I should start with the beginning. I used a groupon that I purchased a while ago and took one of my friends with me. If you can find a group on, grab it! It's worth all the tea in China. If you can't, they only charge around $45 for an hour massage. Tip 1: Wear workout clothes. A tank top would be preferred. Tip 2: Be vocal about the strength that the masseuse uses!Tip 3: They will do wonders to your feet. Just Let them do it. It tickles for a second but is worth it. Tip 4: If you don't want them to massage your head, let them know. However, if you're concerned about messing your hair up, id suggest that you go on a bad hair day bc it is more than worth it!Tip 5: Being cash and park down the street at the public garage for $14 for 2 hours and make an evening out of it. I hope this helps!

48.description: Paid 37$ for runners massage worth half hour.  Got a foot soak by a beautiful healer followed by face - neck. She spent well over an hour of blissful pressure release.  Rejuvenated my tense travel experience in the city.  Thank you!

44.description: They still got it! Did a two hour this time, which was a bit on the long side probably will stick with 90 minutes for next time.

24.description: One of the best massages I have ever had. I was trying to figure out how to afford it every day.... Dreaming.  lolI will be a regular. That is for sure.

7.description: I had a groupon for a no-chip mani and pedi and decided to use it last weekend.  The pedi is fine; the no-chip mani, on the other hand is terrible.  I had a three-week old no-chip mani on when I arrived and the lady who did my nails left parts of my previous manicure on multiple nails before doing the new color.  Also, the color I requested was not the one she applied (it was close, but not the exact one).  And finally, it's a light pink color, that required an extra coat, yet the differentiation of my nails (from the pink part to the white -- I have rather long nails -- is still visible through the manicure.  It's so terrible, in my opinion, that I'm going to get my nails re-done today (four days after) because speckles of gray on a see-through pink manicure just looks terrible.  I definitely will not be visiting this business again.

49.description: First word: Wowzers!They have or should I say had a discount a full massage for an hour for $33. *with happy tears in my eyes* Y-E-S!No it was not the best massage I've ever had, but it we excellent for downtown Chicago and even better for $33 plus tip. The regular price is $45 and even that is cheaper than the average in Chicago.So, I enjoyed my very deep tissue massage. They lost a star, because well it's not one of those places where you take your clothes off and wear a towel and underwear. You get a massage in a quiet open room on a table while others are in the same room getting a massage as well. Wait before you assume it's gross or lame it's not. The lights are out, everyone is fully clothed and your massage bed has a curtain dividing you from others. You are also given a towel that covers your eyes gently so that you can enjoy he experience without having to look into the eyes of the masseuse. My advice:Arrive early and look for street parking Pay in cash the pay in cash price is $41 the regular price is $45. Do not wear make up on your face during the appointment they rub your face with lotion.Drink plenty water before the appointment these are deep tissue pressure point massages and if you aren't hydrated the toxins won't move out of your body properly. Speak up if the massage is too harsh or deep because it won't get lighter over time.

40.description: Wow.  This place is pretty unbeatable. As a massage junkie, I spend much effort finding the best places to go to.  Most of the time, the age old saying is true: you get what you pay for.  Not here.  I had a groupon, (23.00) for a one hour reflexology which is first of all un heard of nowadays!  I wasn't expecting much of the actual massage as most places worth anything you're looking at $100 at the bare min for an hour long massage.  This place made my socks melt off!  Living in Chicago, you walk everywhere; and your feet get so sore; but they not only do your feet, but your whole BODY!  I cannot wait to go back!  Thank you, thank you thank you!

53.description: Bought a groupon for a "couple's massage" for my fiancé and myself. When we got there, we had to wait for 25 minutes before the front desk lady escorted us back to the massage room. When we got back to the massage room, I ran into an elderly man with no shirt, pulling his pants on. When we reached our room, the woman motioned for us to lay down on two of the four massage tables in the room. Yes, four! There was another couple already getting their couple's massage right next to us. That's not a couple's massage, it's a quadruple massage - false advertising!This would have all been fine if there had been some kind of warning of the set-up or if they had suggested to wear workout clothes over the phone when I made the appointment - but they didn't. So now we are standing there, half-naked elderly man in the hallway, already disrobed couple on the tables next to us, impatient front desk lady urgently motioning for us to disrobe and lay down. It was weird. We panicked. My fiance' ran out the door, while I stayed behind to explain that this was not at all what we had expected - could we please reschedule (for a time that we could come wearing workout clothes) or get a refund? The lady shot me down, stating that she had already redeemed my groupon voucher and there's nothing she can do. So, I have to chalk it up as a loss. Do not go here!

30.description: I discovered DQ via Groupon. I'd been searching for a reflexology place and this seemed like a good place to check out. I wasn't disappointed!You'll get an idea of the process around this establishment via other reviews. You're in a communal room, yes, BUT you keep your clothes on and the rooms are kept dimly lit and quiet. It's a very tranquil and relaxing atmosphere. The massage begins with a foot soak, along with a head and shoulder rub. I've seen various masseuses and have never been disappointed. Every one worked out all the kinks and knots so that I walked out fully relaxed! For those looking for a "traditional" massage with all the pampering and perks, be forewarned. I admit it took some getting used to, but I love it. I even took my boyfriend in once and he was pleasantly surprised at how great the experience was. Go in with an open mind and you won't be disappointed!!

46.description: My therapist was amazing! She worked on areas that I didn't even realize were sore. However, the front staff is not pleasant. When I checked in for my appointment, the receptionist informed me of the special that they had. I told her that I was only interested in the groupon offer for the 30-minute reflexology session. Long story short, the receptionist tried to charge me for the special because the therapist did the special anyway. I did not pay extra and nor will I return!

1.description: Purchased a groupon for a mani/pedi and chose this one because it waste best seller. Location is excellent, has a beautiful view and awesome if you wanna do some people watching while getting a pedi. The place is clean and tidy, the techs are hygienic as well.I think maybe because of a language barrier (tech probably can't converse in English very well or understand) I felt she was not very conversant or friendly. I noticed her rolling her eyes every time I would do something like move a little. Not cool! I'm a customer, you have to be nice and courteous!The pedicure was average, foot massage was rather a few dabs of lotion. Nail color they use are Essie or OPI and have a good selection. There's really nothing special about the nail work they do.Bottom line come here if you want a regular inexpensive service, don't expect too much! And yes ask for a complimentary water or coffee, they won't bother!

55.description: Overall the establishment was appealing. Even the pictures were accurate to the photos on the website. The receptionist was straight to the point, and non interactive with any of the customers. In addition guest were told to remove their shoes, and put on slippers. Issue number one is that EVERYONE uses the slippers. The workers were not fluent in english what so ever, any questions I had could not be answered. In addition they didn't take note in any allergies or injuries I could possibly have. The "massage" was nice, the reflexology part of it was a little off. My mother is a naturopathic doctor and does specializes in reflexology I've sessions with her for years now. But I never felt like this before. In addition it was very painful, after the massage I found it hard to walk to my condo, less than a block away. After the massage no one instructed me what to do in order to conclude my visit. Posted on the front counter was a tip chart. $5 means the service was fair, $10 meaning the service was good, and $15 meaning great. I'm currently a student, a $15 tip in certainly not in my budget especially if the Groupon price was on $17. EVERYONE stares at the customers while leaving a tip, which is NOT okay. Lastly there were cameras in the actual massage room. During my visit I didn't have a need of removing any clothes, but the guest do deserve their privacy. The establishment wasn't all bad. The overall design was nice, cozy, and warming.

9.description: My husband purchased the Groupon for me for a no-chip mani and pedi. I have never had a pedi before since I'm not a fan of having my feet touched by anyone, so I was a bit nervous. I really enjoyed my pedi! I cannot remember the girl's name, but I hope that I can get her when I make another trip to the city. I was expecting a thorough scrubbing of the heels like I had seen at other nail spas, but my feet were still very soft. She did a great job with massaging and oiling my legs and feet and my nail color was perfect and it hasn't even chipped yet - it's been over a week. The massage chairs are a nice plus! The mani was very nice too! She shaped my nails very nicely and the polish job was perfect. The only problem was that I hit my thumb nail on something at work and it chipped...which eventually led me to have to peel off the entire nail polish. Other than that, my nails still look very cute.The only drawback I have to this salon is that the nail spa area is small and have 3 pedi chairs but only 2 mani desks so they had to juggle using the area. I had it done Feb 13th which was a cold day and the room was a little cold for my liking - but I didn't notice it until after my feet were out of the warm water.But overall, I enjoyed my visit and will visit them again.

26.description: I haven't written a Yelp review in years but I just had the best massage at this place that I had to post. Left here feeling like a million bucks, highly recommend it.

25.description: This review is for their nail service.  The price is reasonable for its location. I found out about this place on groupon and as many of you know...most places will honor the groupon price without purchasing a groupon. I got a no chip mani and regular pedi for $35. And they did a fantabulous job. Fan. Tab. Bu. Lous! There is street metered parking right around the corner. And with the location being far enough south and east from anything "touristy" which eats up parking, there are ample spaces.

12.description: I have been coming here randomly for about 4 months.  Each time I've always received great service, but it was the service that I received tonight that made me write this review. I purchased the Groupon for the 3 30 minute massages. I always pay the additional $15 to upgrade to the 1hour massage. It's worth every last cent. Tonight Jack was the kind man that took care of me. He was absolutely AMAZING!!!!! I felt like a brand new person at the end of the hour. If you are in need of  a "calgon take me away" moment give this place a try.

59.description: We arrived and the reception blew her blew her nose and while not looking up, rudely asked my name. When we got back there. Everything was great. They put our feet in hot water. Massage out head neck and shoulders. Next was our arms. She moved to the feet and legs, which was awesome! Next she flipped me over did the same thing. The weirdest thing was she gave a lot of attention to my butt. No complaints, it was just weird. Definitely going back.

21.description: I requested a woman but then I got a man for myHour massage and I felt so violated. Then they forced me to give a tip and when I gave a two dollar tip for the terrible massage the guy cursed under his breath. He kept hurting me throughout the massage and I even told him hey that hurts but it didn't matter.

17.description: My first time at DQ luxury was a bit of surprise. I checked Google for massage studios near me and was taken aback when I came in and saw the communal rooms. However, my furrowed brow was quickly wiped away with the best massage of my life. I am a regular at DQ Luxury and here are just a couple things to know if you are going to enjoy yourself to the fullest.1. Be quiet as you walk in the front door. The sound carries back as the walls don't go all the way to the ceiling. You will appreciate it when others are quiet during your massage.2. Pay with cash - you get a discount!3. Wear loose fitting clothing and make sure that you have pants that's can be rolled up when you soak your feet.4. Be prepared for an unconventional massage. This is reflexology and is not the canned massage you'd receive at your neighborhood massage envy. There are communal rooms and your clothes stay on. Therapist will work your glutes and hips so don't be surprised when they touch areas that other masseurs tend to avoid. 5. The therapists dig deep! They will get to stress spots you didn't even know you had. Sometimes the women will even use their knees/elbows and crawl on your back to work out the tension. If it's too much, you can certainly ask them to ease up.This being said.. The results are incredible. I always feel so relaxed and loose. The music playing is relaxing and the experience is something I look forward to each week! Highly recommend.

10.description: Thanks to frontier airlines new seats, we needed a massage ASAP. Pros PricesServices Cleanliness ConsCrazy lady before me asking a million questions No parking Notes: non private clothed massage for all you newbsHonestly, southern California has reflexology on every corner and this place was the best I've ever had!!!

5.description: I am reviewing the substandard mani/pedi I received at DQ. There were more people visiting for massages. If that is you, no need to read on.I am giving it 3 stars because the scheduling and rescheduling process was easy and accommodating, which is a rarity. The mani/pedi experience was disappointing and frustrating, barely worth the $19 Groupon I purchased. I will admit my feet needed some work, so I dealt with the rough treatment I received during the pedicure. However, getting an attitude because I jump after you knick me several times is not ok. The nail tech did not appreciate me sharing that piece of information with her. In the end, I walked away with an acceptable pedicure.The manicure, on the other hand, was not. The nail tech carried her attitude from the spa chair to the nail table. When I asked her why there were streaks through the polish, she said the top coat would fix it. It did not. She also tried to fix her shoddy work at the back of my nails leaving a considerable amount of my nail exposed. After the top coated of the first had, she asked me if each nail was ok. They were not, but I had no desire to sit across from her any longer. If I have to tell a nail tech if a nail looks good, you have more problems than I can help you with.End result. I will not be back, and I am still looking for a forever home for my mani/pedis. Good luck. I share my experiences, so people can manage their expectation or learn from my experiences.

3.description: It all started when a couple of friends and I bought a Groupon deal for $35 which included a no-chip manicure and a regular pedicure. Upon arriving we were greeted and helped immediately. We chose our colors and went with the process. The service was nice while we were there. My nail technician got the shape that I wanted for my nails correct (ballerina/coffin style) and the pedicure was nice; there were massage machines so that was a major plus.However, as nice as all that was, it did not last. My no-chip manicure began to chip within a week. The edges were lifting and I noticed air bubbles in the polish. Within two weeks my nails look significantly chipped, and the entire polish fell off of one finger. Although my pedicure has some chips, it has held better than my no-chip manicure.I'm giving this place a 2 starts out of 5 because the experience while we were there was nice, however the actual longevity of the job is horrible.

35.description: Had various appointments for hour long, always good no matter who is the masseuse. Don't miss it and once you've tried, look for their pre bought offers that are a better deal. And do tip generously!

19.description: If you are looking for an affordable massage in the area and you don't necessarily want to make an appointment far in advance and you are fine with community style rooms (note this is not a massage where you get naked), then this place is for you. They have a great 3 massage special where you get 3 60 minute massages for $100 which is a steal! You are in a dimly lit community room possibly with a few other people, and you get a foot soak, and the first half of the massage is your head, shoulders, arms, and hands. Then you get the foot massage and then the finale is the focus on your back, shoulders and legs including a few pressure points and such too. You might be sore a little the next day, but they really do work your muscles!! Everyone here is nice and they definitely run a strict schedule here, where you don't get a ton of down time after the massage to come back to reality, which would be one downside for this community style room of massage. But 3 60 minute massages for $100 really can't be beat at all. So if you are on the market for a massage, you should consider this place.

28.description: Spacious rooms (communal, but you're not on top of others), great hours, 90% of the massage therapists I've had are great, but the only thing keeping it from being 5-stars is you will occasionally get a therapist who is a smoker. You can really smell it. I've just made it a point to request someone who does not smoke.I usually buy the 3-pack for any day/time and it's a great deal. They spend the full hour working your whole body - not just your feet. It's a deeper pressure massage. Not designed to be spa-like or zen. Sometimes you'll get an unlucky room with other people who talk too much or grunt a lot. Not to be helped in this set-up, but a bummer when it happens.Please tip generously. The place is very inexpensive, but I believe the therapists work for tips so you need to tip much more than 20% of the cost of your hour. I typically tip $15 for the hour. Even with that tip, an hour massage for $45-$50 tip included is pretty amazing!

45.description: This place is incredible! They have a deal now where you can get 5 massages for $100- so $20 per massage!  I've been here 3 times for the hour long reflexology massage and I'm definitely becoming a regular :)  I've had a different person everytime, and have all been top quality- I am a runner and have a demanding job so I appreciate all the knots getting worked out. Just the right amount of pain to work on the problem areas but enjoyable as well.

33.description: I discovered DQ via Groupon in early June after a coworker recommended it. I didn't connect with my first masseuse, but on my second visit I had a different masseuse and it was awesome. I now go every Saturday at 11a and see the same guy.At times it gets very busy and the front desk staff are juggling a line of people and the phone ringing off the hook. I'm going for a massage to relax and I know what goodness lies ahead, so I just roll with it.The prices are very reasonable and I look forward to my appointment all week. I've had nothing but positive experiences and have referred many of my friends and coworkers to DQ.I think some people are expecting a traditional Swedish massage; this is CHINESE REFLEXOLOGY people. It's a very different style of massage, which some will like and others won't (everything in life is about personal preference!). If you want a 'Michigan Avenue massage', perhaps try the Hilton a block away that starts at $95 and goes to $165.I tried another Chinese Reflexology (Fit Foot) with some coworkers after work one night (who all raved about it) and DQ is heads above them in every way; modern, clean, professional lobby, dark and quiet massage rooms, staff that are all dressed in scrubs, a better massage, and a very quiet environment.

43.description: I go to this spot whenever I'm in town to relax/detox from business. The face massage is the best. Great place!

2.description: I booked with a person on the phone for reflexology massage followed with a Groupon Mani-Pedi.  Our Appt. was scheduled @ 10AM on a Friday Morning for two people. I've been to this place about 6 x, and never noticed the time on the door to open @ 10:30 am.  We arrived @ 10am, but noticed barefoot lady standing in the doorway, her appt. also @ 10, now 10:40 am and a crowd if 6 as formed, still not open.....10:45am....all at once group of 12 or more Asian women and men arrive to open.  The receptionist as she checks us in, takes a call from someone to make an appt., thus furthering the wait.......After the massage, that was fair, I checked in again for the mani/pedi, and the receptionist had the NERVE to ASK for a T.I.P for the massage therapist.  First never ask for a tip, then I told her if she understood what TIP means, To Insure Promptness, They were 45 mins late.....I told her, I would let her know after my Mani/Pedi service. Then after checking in the mani/pedi ,still had to wait for service because our appt. had domino'ed.  Good Mani/Pedi, okay so when I'm checking out, this women, the receptionist asked for a TIP again.  Now, I'm offended and educated her about the policy of TIP and gratuity was voluntary based on service experience. The will be my last visit!

18.description: First word: Wowzers!They have or should I say had a discount a full massage for an hour for $33. *with happy tears in my eyes* Y-E-S!No it was not the best massage I've ever had, but it we excellent for downtown Chicago and even better for $33 plus tip. The regular price is $45 and even that is cheaper than the average in Chicago.So, I enjoyed my very deep tissue massage. They lost a star, because well it's not one of those places where you take your clothes off and wear a towel and underwear. You get a massage in a quiet open room on a table while others are in the same room getting a massage as well. Wait before you assume it's gross or lame it's not. The lights are out, everyone is fully clothed and your massage bed has a curtain dividing you from others. You are also given a towel that covers your eyes gently so that you can enjoy he experience without having to look into the eyes of the masseuse. My advice:Arrive early and look for street parking Pay in cash the pay in cash price is $41 the regular price is $45. Do not wear make up on your face during the appointment they rub your face with lotion.Drink plenty water before the appointment these are deep tissue pressure point massages and if you aren't hydrated the toxins won't move out of your body properly. Speak up if the massage is too harsh or deep because it won't get lighter over time.

41.description: Here I am again ! Make sure you wear shorts and tank top. You don't want your collar stretched. And make sure gentleman that you wash your hair from the night before and get rid of the jersey shore look. They run their fingers through your whole head. Great great place to go. Been here a few times and get my body beat up. Take the pain! Love it.I come at least once a month. It worth it. The price is a little over 40 for an hour. If you catch the group on price BONUS! But please do trust,  it's worth the 40. Take cash for a tip. They do an awesome job, and they start to remember you!

52.description: This was one of the best massages I have ever had. I was not sure what to expect, (I naively thought it was just a fancy foot massage), wore jeans, and regular shirt, and walked into paradise!  How my masseuse was able to work through my clothes and achieve the magic he did is a mystery to me. If I could live there I would.

50.description: amazing hour. very relaxing, clean, professional & comfortable. wear loose clothing. busy place. worth the $. you will want to tip well they earn their $. (tip cash, there is a surcharge of $2 to tip on card).cant wait to go back. Groupon deal is 3-30 minutes visits for $18. you can upgrade to a 60 minute service for $15. the best $21 + $15 tip i have spent on an hour massage/reflexology.

4.description: It's quite difficult to decide how many stars I want to rate this business, because you really have to try your luck with different masseuses. I purchased their $100 for three hour-long massages, and I've tried three different masseuses. The first guy did not seem to know any pressure points at all, but he was very nice and tried to accommodate me the best he could. He asked me if the foot bath was at the right temperature and if he was going too rough from time to time.My second guys knew a little bit more about pressure points, and the third time I had a female masseuse, Fiona. She's your go-to girl! She's very precise in finding your pressure points, but she could be a little rough sometimes. Simply ask her to go lighter if you start to hurt.I know this is not a place where you get five-star treatments. Don't expect that kind of service with the amount you pay. I'm so grateful that they keep the price reasonable while delivering good-valued services.I'll recommend friends and family to this place.

6.description: Have you ever had a reflexology experience that was more about the body and less about the feet while aromas of cheap Chinese food fill the air? I have. I followed my yelping heart and looked up a place for my cousin and I to experience on yelp. The reviews were positive and so we thought we would give it a try especially with the yelp special going on. This business is on MICHIGAN avenue so I expected no less than at least a 4/5 star experience. We walked in, and did notice the "please be quiet" signs and asked to check in. The two front desk women were busy and asked us to sit down please. They said it rudely and abruptly. I don't care how busy you are or how stressed you feel, don't project onto me. We sat. A minute later we were told our voice were too loud and the spa needs quiet. okay. No problem. Another woman walked in and also stood there waiting for them to acknowledge her but after four min they said please wait. She sat down and said "well just tell me to please wait instead of keeping with waiting". Amen sister. They made us pay up front before the services were even done. I didn't like that at all. What is this, a drug deal? Fine. I payed the yelp rate of $45 for one hour REFLEXOLOGY massage. We were taken back. It's a room full of multiple massage low beds so you're not alone in a room at all. It's dark and the ambiance is a solid attempt with the music in the background. Here is the problem: the whole place smelled like a cheap and dirty version of Panda Express. It's subtle but I was hoping for scents of lavender and other relaxing things. Nope. It smells like Chinese food. The air conditioning vents are also super loud and when they turn on they actually drown out the sound of the music. Oh and you know how they said please be quiet? Their own staff are talking to each other intermittently and snickering at God knows what while trying to give you a massage. Can you tell so far that during my reflexology experience I was not able to relax and enjoy it and focused on a lot more things than I should have? I don't know the name of the man who was my masseuse. He didn't speak English. He was way way way too rough. Plus he spent less than 15 min on my feet and that's all I came for. Instead it was like a painful full body massage and best down. I swear at one point I literally took my hand and indicated to take it down a notch. I kept stopping him. It was a violent and almost traumatic experience. Maybe i pissed him off in another life? I don't know. But it felt that way. The water that they offer at the end was tap water and poorly mixed with lemon. It's gross. Avoid it. The only good part? They soak your feet in hot water in the beginning. The front desk woman: the both of you are rude. The younger one kept getting annoyed when I asked her a question and would scoff at some of my questions. They charge you $2 to use credit card for tip. Then they don't even give you the tip to give the guy. She said something I a foreign language to him so I have no idea if he knows he was getting a certain amount. I took the receipt and wrote his name and that it was his tip. But you never know with these places. Documentaries have shown that they don't always get their tip so I like to make sure it gets in their hands. I don't recommend this place. I have had reflexology in the past and it's usually focused on the feet and not that painful. The front staff are extremely rude and will scoff at you. The whole place in the back smells. The bathrooms are average and I'm fairly certain the toilet paper was stained with blood. How are they on Michigan avenue? I have no idea.

22.description: I have had four massages at DQ. I got hooked after buying a groupon. At first it bothered me to be in a communal room, but I got over it quickly. Each massage has been really good, which is why I continue to return. It's very clean and they keep the room dimly lit, so you forget others are even in the room. Tip: If you pay with cash they give you a discount. Also, if you're a woman, wear a bra with straps that can be pulled down, otherwise instead of relaxing, you'll be thinking about how your bra is on the way.

15.description: I requested a woman but then I got a man for myHour massage and I felt so violated. Then they forced me to give a tip and when I gave a two dollar tip for the terrible massage the guy cursed under his breath. He kept hurting me throughout the massage and I even told him hey that hurts but it didn't matter.

57.description: Great massage! More deep tissue than reflexology, but they really work you over from head to toe. They will lighten up if you ask them to. It's starts with a nice, hot foot soak while they massage your head, shoulders & arms. It is a "communal" room, but it's dark & you forget about that almost immediately. The Groupon deals are a great value. I've gone twice & will be back. Wear socks, as you remove your shoes & put on slippers. They run "on time," which is really nice. There is a $2 surcharge for debit card tips so bring cash or pay the fee.

20.description: Perhaps it's unfair for me to be this picky about massages at this price range, but I've definitely experienced better.The facility:Very clean and quiet (unless there's someone snoring who you'd definitely be able to hear). The lighting is good, but when I went, there were long breaks of silence between tracks which was really distracting for me. Other than that, the environment was very comfortable.The massage:The foot massage portion was great, except that was only maybe 15% of the massage. The head massage portion was also pretty good, but once she got to my neck, it just felt like she was very aggressively lotioning me, rather than actually massaging the area (same goes for my calves). The lotion was unscented, but I think she could have been a bit more generous with it because the back of my neck felt pretty raw after she was done rubbing it. Also, I just feel like this massage wasn't a personalized experience. For example, I know I carry most of my tension in my lower back, but that area felt pretty neglected in comparison to my neck and upper back. If this location is convenient and you have a yelp deal or groupon, I wouldn't deter you from DQ Luxury, but there are definitely better options out there.

36.description: Horrible experience! I purchased a deal on Groupon for a no chip manicure and pedicure. The pedicure was basic and  subpar to say the least. I had acrylic on my nails that needed to be removed and I told the tech before she began. She finished my pedicure in ten minutes and proceeded to polish my nails with the acrylic stil on there. I told her that I need it removed and I told her that before she started. She could not remove it. She still charged me for the pedicure and i was too disgusted to continue so I left. I have unpolished nails and I am out of $35 for the Groupon and $28 for the horrible pedicure. The salon owner told me to pay us and we will polish them then you can go somewhere else and have them fixed. No thanks!

14.description: Well, today I went for manicure and pedicure.As soon as I walked in, there was nobody at the front desk. I looked around, still nobody. I waited and after a couple of minutes the front desk person showed up. Ok, maybe they had a slow time. Then she told me to go to the room for manicure. As soon as I walked in, the lady yelled to me from another side of the room, "pick a color", not "hello, my name is __ and I will assist you today", but "pick a color". I was thrown off by that. When I finally picked a color, that lady started speaking Chinese with another lady who works there. I am a foreigner myself, and I perfectly know how it makes others feel when you speak in different language in front of somebody, who has no idea how to speak in it. They made me feel so uncomfortable. I am not even talking how unprofessional that was.Then the second lady left and I stayed alone with the "specialist", who was trying to do her job as fast as she could. I got my manicure and pedicure done in 40 minutes!!! Usually, it takes nearly two hours to make it careful and neat, but that lady was rushing somewhere (no idea where, as there was no clients for all 40 minutes that I was there). All the base and some nail polish were put occasionally and unevenly (luckily, I chose clear nail polish).  When I went to pay for my service, I was not going to leave any tips as, I believe, this service did not deserve any. Being a hospitality student, I know that people live off from those tips, but I also were taught that people, who messed up completely and who did not respect you, do not deserve them. The front desk lady made a huuuuuuuuuge deal out of that referring that I am a Groupon client and that they made already a huge discount for clients like me. Again, I understand this policy, but when you were completely ignored during the service and treated poorly, would you want to leave a tip?

12.description: what gift do you get for fit , athletic, friends? Gift card for a message! Perfect! I called Hand & Stone  and was taken care of by a knowledgeable friendly staff member. My gift certificate was sent out via US mail and I received it in two days in a lovely gift bag. Thank You Hand & Stone for solving a gift delema as well as making me look good.

7.description: I visited the spa 4 times.  It's a welcoming, clean & serene environment.  The facials were great, I loved the net full of vitamins the technician put on my face.  It was refreshing!  My needs for my massage weren't met and I received a complimentary 30 min massage to address my issues.  Those issues were only addressed for about 5 out of the 30 minutes.  I did like the technician and figured I would try her for a full hour next month and pre book  before I left the spa.  Pump the brakes!  That was prior to my experience with the receptionist.  For the third time I was reassured that the desk staff is clueless.  I wanted to prebook my next massage and facial as well as spend roughly $350 on their  BOGO pre sale, however the receptionist was clueless and uninterested in what I was asking about.  I'm not trying to attack anyone's character.  This place is not cheap, it's pricey I just expect a little more professionalism for what I am paying.  I really hope this place hires a desk staff that doesn't frustrate patrons.  I will not be back!!!!  I will check out the new place around then corner on Roosevelt.

19.description: Stay away!  This place is the worst.  The first clue should have been that they don't list ANY prices on their website other than their $49.95 1-hr special. They also don't tell you the price when you book online, email, or call.  That's because AFTER the massage they hit you with a super inflated ($95/person/hour) cost if you don't join their massage club.  If you decline the membership, you pay the "walk-in" rate that is 1) not advertised and 2) nearly double the market rate for massage services.  They also tell you that the membership is "not a contract" and that you can "cancel at any time" but that's not true either.  Further inquiry reveals that they won't let you cancel until after the membership auto-bills for a month of membership that you never wanted in the first place.  The pricing schedule at this place is shady, deceptive, and way over-priced.  Pricing aside, the massage wasn't great either.  The technique was painful, the music crapped out 5 minutes in, and the reception staff was rude and inflexible.  Overall, ZERO out of five stars.  This has all the hallmarks of a shady chain operation.

1.description: I don't know how you can do better for a $59 hour massage. Usually the hour massages at Hand & Stone Massage and Facial Spa are $99; however, you can become a member and pay $59/month which gives you discounted services. Additionally, that $59 can be used toward those services.You're greeted warmly by wonderful reception staff. They offer flavored water and a seat in their tranquil waiting area. The rooms are mostly customizable: temperature, heated massage tables, and lighting. They even have a heater for the floor!So far I've had two massages. The first one was okay except that it's not exactly what I discussed with the massage therapist. The owner called me and wanted me to try a different massage therapist. The second time I didn't have specific goals for the massage.The second one was much more in-line with what I like for massages. I am a big fan of effleurage. This therapist told me about lomi lomi which is very similar. Both involve flowing and soothing motions instead of finding tense muscles and digging into them until they relax.I also added on some aroma therapy for $10. I love the scent of lavender - especially when I'm relaxing or sleeping - so I think that is how I'll begin every massage from now on. I'm eager to return for even more massages with my membership.

2.description: I'm a big fan of this place.  Nic was an excellent therapist and really targeted the areas we discussed beforehand - perfect pressure, perfect technique.  The front desk staff was courteous and warm and I really hope to get back to explore the other services they offer very, very soon.

9.description: I just had my first facial EVER with Brittany. It was a perfect way to end a work and travel day!  Emily greeted me at the desk and made me feel welcomed from the time of my booking until I left.

6.description: Been here twice so far and blown away each time. Lara is now my masseuse and she is wonderful! She really cares about MY comfort and makes the massage all about me. Mary did my facial and she was so gentle and knowledgable. The spa itself is welcoming, clean, and most importantly relaxing. The girls at reception have been so kind and accommodating as well. I became a member because their program is month to month and on my 2nd visit I guess I already almost built up enough credits for a free gift card! I'd recommend this place to anyone.

18.description: Had my first treatment at Hand and Stone and it did not disappoint.  I used to live in this building so it is amazing to see a beautiful spa created out of what used to be a small grocery store.  Chris was great and she was incredibly knowledgeable.  The stones were a great addition to the treatment.  I am not officially a member and look forward to my monthly treat of visiting this new neighborhood gem.

10.description: Like going to heaven....wonderful experience from beginning to end. One of the best facials I have experienced. Signed up for the membership (which by the way its FREE!!!) i will be returning every month or even more frequently if time allows.Prices are very reasonable specially when you sign up for the membership... and did I mention that the membership is FREEE!!!! I highly recommend it!!!

13.description: I live in the building, and I took advantage of this place right when they opened.  I have since had 3 facials and 2 massages...all by different people (which I did on purpose, because I want to find someone that I like).  My first and third facials were great!  The first girl is no longer there, but the 3rd one, Mary, was great!  I will definitely be seeing her again.  She got my skin right!  You're probably wondering what happened at the 2nd appointment...well, it wasn't great.  The steamer wasn't working properly, and the girl was little annoying.  Don't remember her name, but I don't want to call her out anyway because she was still sweet.  However, my skin was a mess afterwards.  Very dry, etc.  Now on to the massages...they were great!  I wish I could remember the first guy's name (I know I can ask, since it's in the computer), because he was such a nice guy!  Great deep tissue massage, and was able to zero in on my problem areas.  I decided to try someone else this time anyway, and booked with Kevin.  He was also wonderful!  I had some terrible knots in my upper back, and he spent some extra time in that area.  I was actually able to stand up straight when I left there.  My back was a little sore, but that is to be expected with deep tissue in problem areas.

16.description: Kevin is the bomb!!! As someone with a job that requires quite a bit of time at a desk, in front of the computer, I get some major knots in my back and shoulders. Kevin made sure to work to work them all out and was super professional in the process, checking in on pressure and my comfort constantly. He was also very helpful with hints on how to keep my exercise intensive legs loose, including doing Epsom salt soaks. Overall, it was a great experience. Give Kevin a try!

17.description: I stopped by Hand and Stone after work one day to get a massage. It was a great experience.  I was impressed by the front of the space which is clean and professional looking. The massage was great and for a reasonable price.  The location is great also...not hard to get away from work for an hour if you work in the area as well.

15.description: I would never go here again. I actually never write bad reviews, but I want to warn people to save their money and go to a really luxurious spa place. This was not worth it. My husband and I had a couples massage which we were told was an hour. We found out that meant 50 minutes and 10 minutes to change, although our massage lasted about 40-42 minutes. My massage therapist Jordan did not say a word to me at all. I requested medium to light pressure and said I had no major soreness. She never checked with me about pressure, but she proceeded to use what I would call extra heavy pressure. She did not massage my feet at all. She spent 10 minutes massaging my shins which I have never had done (because it is miserable). I have bruises now today on my legs and back, and I wish I did not have a massage because now I am in pain. I am not new to massages, and I have experienced soreness after due to releasing a knot or tension but this is awful and uncomfortable. Do not go here!

0.description: Loved my massage from Keshia! I even bought a gift certificate for a friend for Xmas while I was there! Gotta share the love. The lobby was peaceful and calm, well-lit with affable front desk staff. I met the owner, Jim, who was really pleasant. The rooms were relaxing, with a stone motif (based on the title of the place I'm guessing). Keshia was an excellent masseuse. I got this add on of a peppermint scalp massage. It. Was. Awesome. I can't wait to go back!

5.description: I booked with Kevin in the evening and he was amazing, I asked for deep pressure and he found every knot in my back, AWESOME!!!

11.description: Hot Stone Massage = awesomeness. Seriously, it's perfect for a cold Chicago day. Have the table heat cranked up, lay back, and thaw out during a great massage. Friendly staff, organized front area, nice and calming massage rooms. The price per massage with membership is pretty amazing for the quality and location.

8.description: I wasn't really expecting much of Hand and Stone.  Because they are a membership club I assumed the quality of services would be less than par. I had been to Massage Envy once and did not really enjoy the experience at all - the massage was mediocre, there was a lot of pressure to join, so I was expecting the same here.  I WAS SO WRONG!  I would highly recommend this Hand and Stone location, and specifically Dariel.  The location was clean, staff was very friendly, and I felt no pressure to join. my massage started right on time and it was amazing.  To be honest I didn't join, and am really reconsidering. It was such a great experience.Dariel really took care of me - I had not had a massage in a long time, but needed a good deep tissue massage.  I had a regular massage, and wished i had booked the extra 30 minutes they offered when I got there.  He zeroed in on my 'trouble' areas immediately as he was massaging and worked out so much going on in my shoulders.  He also explained that he modified the massage because he didn't want me to be in too much pain.  He was quiet, professional and made me feel very comfortable.  I do not live in Chicago, but if I have time the next time I come back, I will be making a second appointment.  And, if all H&S locations are like this, I'll definitely consider a membership...

3.description: Yesterday, i received the best massage I have ever received in my life. Joey was so attuned with my body. He focused on my tightest areas such as: my shoulders, hamstrings, and calves. I had to give him little to no direction as to what areas of my body needed special attention. I will surely be going back for monthly massages with Joey.

14.description: Was visiting Chicago and walked too much for my aching body. Happened upon Hand and Stone and was pleasantly surprised. The front staff was wonderful and accommodating. The massage therapists were beyond my expectations. I belong to Massage Envy at home and this is basically the same. They are a membership club but they still charged the lower $49 per hour for my massage even though I wasn't a member. The second day (yes I went twice I liked it so much!) they even threw in a free foot treatment. I highly recommend this place to anyone for one time or for a membership.

4.description: I recently moved to Chicago and during my brief time here, I've had massages at a few different places. Unfortunately, until I visited Hand and Stone Massage, none of them met my expectations. My husband arranged an appointment for me as a surprise and all I can say about the experience is - AMAZING!! I consider myself a massage connoisseur, I've had massages all over the world. Yet this spa, that I had never heard of before, provided one of the best massages I've ever had. My therapist's name was Joey. He was professional and his massage style was excellent. He provided just the right amount of pressure to relieve my pain points and his stokes were super relaxing. I honestly did not want to get off the table once my session ended. I immediately signed up for another session and applied for a membership.If you want a great massage, ask for Joey.

58.description: Good notes: Love the food. Chipotle Chicken sandwich is my favorite, and their chips/dip is delicious!  They Deliver and have good coupons sent out occasionally.Bad notes: Place is overpriced, and they have gotten my order wrong a couple of times. While it says the place is open until 9pm that's only for desserts and coffee. For food, it closes at 8pm, which is a bit too early.

56.description: Nope. No thank you. Slow service and bad food in a city that is blooming with culinary greatness. This place is not worthy of my dollars -- or calories!

29.description: Went here for lunch during a day at the Art Institute, with a friend who used to hang out here in his college days. He says the place has changed, there used to be actual art on the walls, etc, but now it's just a small little cafe diner with a nice view of the park. We got seated quickly, but as mentioned, the place is small, so expect to be seated thisclose to someone else. The food is good, not great, and the descriptions aren't all that precise, but the service is very good. My sandwich was good, but my friend ordered meat and they only had a butter knife to cut with. Why? Prices are Chicago loop prices, don't expect any bargains. But it was a nice lunch outside the museum and a quick walk out and back.

42.description: Been there twice, first time I found out they don't take credit cards with no warning and the second time I went there the food was awful, I had a  grilled cheese sandwich,  it had onions and pickled cucumbers, it was so bad I ate half. and I was starving. My friend had a gyros, the waitress told us it had pork and beef in it ? it was lamb, but she had no idea, it was the worst we ever had..avoid this place, it's for real desperate tourists only! STAY AWAY

23.description: Good food, Atmosphere, right off the redline an green line. Nice size portions of food.

47.description: I come here for Sunday brunch. There is no wait or line and the food is delicious. My favorite is the Breakfast Bowel and the Mega Breakfast. The omelet is full of  tasty ingredients.

8.description: The food was OK. It's a bit expensive. I just liked that it was close to everything. There are other restaurants nearby that can get you better food for a better price. Warning: THEY ONLY TAKE CASH. The patio seating was a nice touch so three stars

31.description: This place is great. I eat here often and have never had a bad experience. The food is always fresh and delicious. The staff is courteous and the service is fast. If you are in the area stop in for lunch.

34.description: I had breakfast here on a whim after being disappointed with the food so far and was very happy with Artist's Cafe! The price was reasonable and the selection was great! I am glad I listened to that little whim and stepped in for breakfast!

16.description: Went here for lunch during a day at the Art Institute, with a friend who used to hang out here in his college days. He says the place has changed, there used to be actual art on the walls, etc, but now it's just a small little cafe diner with a nice view of the park. We got seated quickly, but as mentioned, the place is small, so expect to be seated thisclose to someone else. The food is good, not great, and the descriptions aren't all that precise, but the service is very good. My sandwich was good, but my friend ordered meat and they only had a butter knife to cut with. Why? Prices are Chicago loop prices, don't expect any bargains. But it was a nice lunch outside the museum and a quick walk out and back.

13.description: Good food, Atmosphere, right off the redline an green line. Nice size portions of food.

11.description: My fiancé and I love this place! We order from them all the time and just recently dined in. Lovely clean place with great service. The food is delicious, fresh, and has great healthy options. Our favorites:Chicken kabob plateChicken Caesar wrapGrilled chicken Cobb salad Greek fries Not your kid's grilled cheese Gyros plate

39.description: The menu selection is small, but the food is decent. I prefer the food in their sister location on Michigan Ave. The atmosphere is more casual than the other location.

37.description: My husband and I had made plans to go to the bongo room but with a long wait we ran across this. They have something called a mega breakfast and let me say the potatoes are to die for. Mmmmm. Cheap, clean, and delicious!!

0.description: Chipotle Chicken, BBQ Chicken, Greek Chicken, and Not Your Kids Grilled Cheese! Yeah!!!!! Also, must try their homemade potato chips!

38.description: Went here one afternoon after getting out of work waay early before meeting a friend. I was about to step in the Five Guys next door but changed my mind upon seeing the $3 GYRO SANDWICH SPECIAL plastered on their windows and door. The decor is nice and modern, and the entire area feels clean and polished. There were only about 3 other customers there; I guess 4 pm on a Monday is a rather lonely time. I ordered my gyro sandwich, got offered fries for an additional $1-2, pretty good deal. I declined, and my sandwich was ready in a few minutes. First thing I noticed was that it was just a gyro - nothing sandwich-y about it, just one curved pita around meat and stuff. Second, it was HOT. I literally waited about 20 minutes before I could eat it. While waiting, I attempted to connect to their free wifi, which also took about 15 minutes, but that might be on me. When I finally ate my gyro, I noticed it was really greasy :( every bite resulted in oil seeping out from the pita. I also thought the meat was kinda gross. It was exactly the same kind of meat my school uses for "gyros", only greasier. However, I've only had gyros at one other (highly acclaimed) place and am very spoiled when it comes to Greek food. Artist's Cafe tried...I probably wont be returning, but their prices seem fair, and very cheap in my case. Service was polite and fast, and the atmosphere good for getting work done. Especially if you go to school at Roosevelt or nearby.

51.description: Nice family owned restaurant and great part of the neighborhood for a really good quick meal.  I've been here 3 times and I left satisfied each time.   Food is fresh and high quality, I consider myself an expert due to my 30 plus years in the food business, I know when a restaurant skimps on quality and this place uses the good stuff.  I was surprised that a few people gave some low ratings because it did not meet their expectations for a high end restaurant, this place is more of a diner style only several levels better.  One of the owners introduced herself, Maria, and I really liked the warm reception I received.  Good food, good people and clean, also very important for me.

27.description: Had a solid meal here. The "not for kids" grilled cheese was elevated above a pedestrian caprese (glad to live in a age where the caprese is pedestrian, but still) with goat cheese and actually really good quality fresh mozzarella. The fries were solid, crispy golden with peel on.Also, if you're looking for a place to charge your devices (as I was when I wandered in), there are amply available outlets.

32.description: It is hard to fine a place that serves non antibiotic chicken and they do. They have a great menu and serve breakfast all day. The chicken is amazing, the bar b que sauce for the pork is awesome. They are fast and friendly. They have hot dogs, gelato, burgers as well as amazing salads and gyro's. The breakfast is fast and great portions. If you have not stopped in you are missing out.

54.description: Nothing to write home about . You go up to the counter to order, and your food is brought to you.  Our order came pretty quickly.  Bright interior.  Noise level moderate. We came here because the Bongo Room was a 30 minute wait.  We got right in. I ordered a southwestern breakfast wrap.  It wasn't very southwesterny.  It was a big fat burrito stuffed with scrambled egg and not much else. It was supposed to have pico de gallo in it.  I didn't see anything but a few flecks of red which must have been tomato.  Coming from the south, I expected some zing in there, but there was no zing.  Other than that, it was okay and it was filling. My daughter ordered some sausage patties and they were the tannest, weirdest looking sausage I've ever seen.  They looked swollen, not crisped or fried looking.  She didn't say how they were but I would have hesitated to eat something that looked so alien. Not too impressed, so unless I had an absolute favorite here, I wouldn't be back.

48.description: Everything about this place is awesome! Prices: reasonably great for the area. Look: artsy and modern. Entertainment: 2 TV's!They deliver AND they use iPads!

44.description: I got a coupon for a free gyro in the mail when you buy chips or fries and a drink for $1.50.  So a complete meal for $1.50.  Based on this I would give it 5 stars, however, this was a one time thing.  Otherwise this meal would have cost $8.45 or close to $10 with tax.  I don't think the value preposition is there.  The meal was less than okay for $8.45 but absolutely fantastic for $1.50.The gyro was a gyro, similar to any gyro you can get anywhere.  I got the homemade chips which I have never had before and was curious.  They were okay, but I wished I had ordered the fries instead.  The drink selection is limited and I ended up with Mr. Pibb, because I can't remember having that in the past.  The service was prompt and everything else was great.

24.description: I got the breakfast bowl. 3 eggs over hard, with potatoes, and choice of 3 veggies, one meat and one cheese. Overall it was pretty good. My only gripes were the potatoes and eggs were not seasoned. No salt. Which maybe a plus for some salt conscious people. For me, it's a con making the dish bland. but easily remedied by adding salt Which I did. I got bacon as the 1.meat item. the bacon was undercooked which can be dangerous due to tape worms. I insist on crispy bacon so I had to pick a lot of it out. however, next time here I will just ask them to cook it longer. other than that it was quite good and they have a simple menu which good breakfast lunch and dinner options.

7.description: I've only ordered for pick up so I can't speak for the service, but the "Not your kids grilled cheese" is delicious!

49.description: Very, very average. The coffee, whether or not Intelligensia, was flavourless, and wasn't refilled. The service was cold. The food was alright, but overpriced for what you got. And to top it off, they don't take card payments. A classic tourist trap. Breakfast options in the Loop aren't the greatest, but there are better alternatives.

40.description: Things started out bad when I got a $4 orange juice in a small, plastic, disposable airplane glass.I wanted a side of eggs until I was informed that it was $2.50 per-egg.  So $7.50 for a side of eggs?  Basically as much as the 2 slices of french toast.The food was okay but I've certainly had better at most breakfast places.Finaly, I go to pay and am informed "We only take AMEX."  Conveniently, I was pointed to an ATM just inside the door, which I'm sure is a nice little profit center for them.Clearly this place isn't counting on getting any repeat business and they're just trying to get as much as they possibly can from the tourists.Skip it unless you like to overpay (cash) for mediocre food & service.

53.description: Honestly, I don't really see the draw of Artist's Cafe.  Maybe the name makes people think that a bunch of artists hang out there?The quality of the food is very poor.  All the food that I have ordered, or have seen other people order, reminds me of when my mom would buy big bags of frozen food that she could heat up real fast and feed all us kids on the cheap.  The prices are very expensive.  I paid $3.50 for a small tea... Hot water and a tea bag in a cup:  $3.50.Too pricey.  Poor quality.  Not recommended.

30.description: Not nearly on the same level as the Bongo Room/Yolk/Eleven City Diner/Waffles circuit that are all within a few blocks.  But, Artist's Cafe (usually) offers something those places don't: zero wait.  The food was in the "OK" to "better than we were expecting" range.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but if your hunger wins out in your wait to eat breakfast at one of the nearby places, you could do a lot worse than settling for Artist's Cafe.

46.description: The first time I went here I was so excited because they have fried zucchini and this is my favorite so I had to try it. I got it to go and I think that was a mistake because by the time I got home to eat them they were not crispy any more. I was so sad and I hate when places put the cold dressing in with the HOT food and they did so when I went to use the ranch it was as hot at the container it was in. Im not a fan of warm sauces like that. blahh but I will try them again and see if its better when I can eat there.

1.description: OMG. The veggieburger here didn't look much for the world but was really really good! Fresh and tasty. Burger was made of beans and corn. Served with avocado, tomato, onion, lettuce,bread and mayo made of herbs. We liked that the volume was low so you could talk to each other. Nice lamps! :)

55.description: I have never been to the original but I have to agree with most of these reviews on this.  I stopped in for a gyro.  They had take out.  Great...so I ordered just a gyro.  I looked at the time stamp.  It took 15 minutes to bring it out.  I mean, really?  I a gyro?  The place was empty.  Okay so I'm hoping this gyro is awesome but nope.  I opened it and it was not wrapped tightly so a ton of Tzatziki poured out.  I prefer it on the side but in all fairness I didn't ask for it.  There were like two tomato wedges and a few very thinly sliced red onions.  Part of the fun is the Tzatziki (on the side) and a tower of tomatoes and onions but that didn't exist here.  Some of the pieces of meat were juicy, others were burned so it was inconsistent.  Needless to say I won't be going back.

9.description: Horrible service, from the second we walked in, servers looked like they didn't want to be there. We were given an attitude for asking for milk, during breakfast for the horrible "latte" they made us. Sad because the place actually has potential and what seemed to be great history to it. I'd blame this on the manager as well as bad management. Also, tip to the manager... If a customer is complaining that one of your servers is mistreating them, you should do something about it.

26.description: Great local diner across the street from Trader Joe's in the South Loop. Had their chicken kabob dinner plate. Tons of food and delicious for just $10! Can't beat that. Good Greek diner and also had a nice looking breakfast menu that is available all day.

25.description: No!, I ordered their Santa Fe Breakfast Burrito ............... 7.95eggs, gouda cheese, pico de gallo & bacon,wrapped in a warm our tortilla and for the kids we them share a Chicken Breast Plate ..................................... 9.95two marinated chicken breasts charbroiled andseasoned with lemon and oregano, served with pita.Let me start with their Santa Fe Breakfast Burrito for around $8. Like wow can a breakfast burrito that cost $8.00 make you wish you had Mcdonald's breakfast burrito instead for half the price?  Yes, it can be Artist's cafe did that to me yesterday while dining in at their empty establishment.The description for this breakfast burrito sounds great, " gouda cheese," and pico de galio and bacon and whatever else oh the eggs. All I tasted was burrito wrapped in egg and I no clue what sauce they gave to me on the side. I tried it taste like perhaps frank's hot sauce? The girls aren't big foodies yet, they ate their chicken pita with no real complaints. I didn't try it. My husband and I were like this is our first time probably our last time eating here. Big mistake spending money here but we at least learned our lesson.

12.description: I had the gyro dinner and I've got say......beat gyro I've had. Their tzaziki sauce is flavorful and the small salad on the side was good too. I wish I had more pita bread but the size of the platter was enough to feed 2 people. Great service as well. I'll definitely go back.

59.description: Just went to this place yesterday with my Parents for Sunday breakfast. Food was amazing! I tried the croissant sandwhich, which was extremely yummy: eggs cooked perfectly and potatoes on the side are just incredible. We also shared a stack of pancakes for the table and they were fluffy and syrup had a cinnamin twist to it that topped them off perfectly. I am really surprised to see some of the negative reviews as everything I have tried there has been so delicious.I have been here quite a few times and each time I swear I will leave room for their indulgent looking desserts or gelato. Haven't been able to try yet as I am always so full with the yummy entree. We just moved into the neighborhood so planning a coffee and dessert trip soon!

21.description: Way too expensive. I've been here multiple times because it's convenient during school, but my wallet regrets it every time. Their food is good but not THAT good. Unfortunate.

17.description: After a quick trip into Chicago, Kerrie and I met our daughter at this South Loop spot for a quick lunch. Artist's Cafe is a place where you order at the counter, they give you a number to post at your table, and they deliver the food to you when ready.It's small, quaint, but the food is really extraordinary. It's not what you expect going to a restaurant where you order at the counter. The menu varies from burgers and chicken, to skewers to salads. Their specials were really interesting.The service was relatively quick. I would give five stars for the variety, but there was a small problem with my food. While it was quite tasty, I ordered a burger which came with a number of toppings. The bacon was a little burned. And, they didn't ask how I wanted my burger cooked and it came well done. I would have prefered medium, but they didn't ask and I didn't offer.The service was quite good and they were very nice to their patrons. I will be going back next time I'm in the south loop.

10.description: Hope the food is better than the service. The cashier must really love her job....said extremely sarcastically. We came here because of all the good reviews on yelp. So far not so good.....

5.description: I used to love this place, now it's meh & I probably won't be coming back. Went in today to order the lunch special. Was overcharged for it and brought it to the cashier's attention, she gave me some wonky explanation about sales tax as to why I was paid $3 dollars more than the listed price, huh? Called the manager she looked at the receipt apologized and refunded me the overcharged amount.  Cashier had charged me for the cheese twice and the special was rung up at regular price. Fine problem solved. 15 mins later, I get the food, fries are cold and there is NO CHEESE! Not to mention there was no ice in the machine. The lids for the cups were in a complete disarray  & had ketchup all over them.  Horrible lunch experience, for the price and hassle skip it. Two stars are for how nice the lady (owner I presume) who passed out samples a few week ago was. The tomato soup is also very good.

3.description: No!, I ordered their Santa Fe Breakfast Burrito ............... 7.95eggs, gouda cheese, pico de gallo & bacon,wrapped in a warm our tortilla and for the kids we them share a Chicken Breast Plate ..................................... 9.95two marinated chicken breasts charbroiled andseasoned with lemon and oregano, served with pita.Let me start with their Santa Fe Breakfast Burrito for around $8. Like wow can a breakfast burrito that cost $8.00 make you wish you had Mcdonald's breakfast burrito instead for half the price?  Yes, it can be Artist's cafe did that to me yesterday while dining in at their empty establishment.The description for this breakfast burrito sounds great, " gouda cheese," and pico de galio and bacon and whatever else oh the eggs. All I tasted was burrito wrapped in egg and I no clue what sauce they gave to me on the side. I tried it taste like perhaps frank's hot sauce? The girls aren't big foodies yet, they ate their chicken pita with no real complaints. I didn't try it. My husband and I were like this is our first time probably our last time eating here. Big mistake spending money here but we at least learned our lesson.

35.description: I ordered an Italian beef and was disappointed. The food was delivered fast and it tasted that way. I've spent much less for the same item at other restaurants and had better results. Maybe I'll go back and give their breakfast a try seeing as that gets great reviews, but my first impression wasn't a great one.

19.description: Artist's Cafe has become one of my favorite spots for take out.  The grilled cheese... almost as good as the way I make it and 100 times easier and less messy!  I appreciate take out where fries (or another side) is optional, because more often than not I just want the sandwich.

28.description: I tried the Cesar chicken wrap. It was very flavorful and delish. I thought this would be more of a sit down, by its a lil fast food cafe. Not bad! The food came out quickly. It's a good spot if your are trying to grab a quick bite.

45.description: Had gyro plate. It was greasy.the salad was good potatoes have a lot of flavor. Rice tasted like Uncle Bens..cucumber sauce didn't taste like cucumber sauce. Was a little confused there. They also play music with no words. U know the kind that be at Target where you push the button at the kiosk...but it's super clean and nice little jointBurgers are to expensive to be right next to a well known burger chain.

33.description: The staff is pretty friendly and the food is fine.  It was never my first choice but my classmates loved their food.

43.description: I got a coupon in the mail for Artists Cafe. I had never been here before receiving the coupon so I'm glad they sent me something! The deal was also too good to pass up. I ordered the gyro with a side of fries.  The gyro came with onions, tzatziki sauce, tomatoes and a pita bread. I asked to have my onions grilled and they were able to accommodate my request. The meal was great! It was large in portion and the pita bread and gyro meat tasted fresh. The fries were skinny and lacked flavor which is why my review loses a star. I usually go to Pita Heaven for my gyro but I think Artist's is a good competitor.

2.description: The food here is usually good. My order is usually missing something, but when I come back they fix it. My only real issue is the cashier. There is one gentleman who is kind, but the other cashiers are rude. They never greet you and they seem to be irritated.

18.description: I will NEVER come back to this place,  $14 for a burrito and a soda, that's ridiculous; I know, they're in South Loop but still... SERVICE IS TERRIBLE... The girl didn't know what the hell she was doing, they mixed up my order as well, then she gave me an attitude and rolled her eyes at me when I told her it was wrong. On top of that, they took FOREVER to make it. The Manager has no people skills, he got upset when I asked them for my money back due to them taking their sweet time, screwing up my order, while the manager and the girl gave  me a HORRIBLE attitude about it. I will NEVER come back to this place, and will put them on blast. I'd just stick to Five Guys which is next door.

41.description: This place deserves a solid 3 stars. I got a delivery meal from here and it's about as average as you can get. It was only $13 for a ribeye steak and some sides. I wasn't expecting Gibson's, but the steak that I received was probably 20% meat and the rest was fat. It was kinda gross actually, all fatty and exuding grease puddles.
