Surprisingly, the sides saved the meal. Rice was pretty solid, as were the potatoes. The French bread was also decent. That's about all I have to say about that.

52.description: This is the most neutral review I've ever written.We went in on a Saturday around noon. Yolk and the Bongo Room had hour or more waits.The food is good, but not great. I got scrambled eggs with bacon and potatoes. Eggs were well made, bacon was thick, potatoes were eh. My boyfriend enjoyed his burger. But the prices are really quite high for the amount of food you get.The servers were nice and the inside was clean.I wouldn't refuse to come back here, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

50.description: After a quick trip into Chicago, Kerrie and I met our daughter at this South Loop spot for a quick lunch. Artist's Cafe is a place where you order at the counter, they give you a number to post at your table, and they deliver the food to you when ready.It's small, quaint, but the food is really extraordinary. It's not what you expect going to a restaurant where you order at the counter. The menu varies from burgers and chicken, to skewers to salads. Their specials were really interesting.The service was relatively quick. I would give five stars for the variety, but there was a small problem with my food. While it was quite tasty, I ordered a burger which came with a number of toppings. The bacon was a little burned. And, they didn't ask how I wanted my burger cooked and it came well done. I would have prefered medium, but they didn't ask and I didn't offer.The service was quite good and they were very nice to their patrons. I will be going back next time I'm in the south loop.

4.description: I will give 1 star for the food and three for the service. My steak sandwich was burned and the vegetables were not fresh. I had no idea how they got a four-start review.

6.description: Worst service ever. Waited over 15mins to pay for my food when I was the only customer at the time.

22.description: I came here for lunch, looking for something easy and simple.  I got the not for kids grilled cheese, which I thought was ok.  All the ingredients individually sounded great, but I thought there was too much mozzarella  relative to the other ingredients.  The bread was excellent, and the size of the sandwich was good for the price.  The fries were decent but nothing to write home about.  I did think the decor was stylish and attractive. The service was quick and efficient, and the location is very convenient.  I think I'll go back and give this place a second try.

15.description: Had a solid meal here. The "not for kids" grilled cheese was elevated above a pedestrian caprese (glad to live in a age where the caprese is pedestrian, but still) with goat cheese and actually really good quality fresh mozzarella. The fries were solid, crispy golden with peel on.Also, if you're looking for a place to charge your devices (as I was when I wandered in), there are amply available outlets.

57.description: Cute name and concept but the food doesn't live up!Came in recently for breakfast and got omelets and coffee. The omelet was rubbery in some areas and not well mixed while the potatoes were seasoned well but undercooked.  The one highlight was the Intelligentsia coffee. Would stop in for coffee but probably not eat here again.

20.description: Bleak decorative style. Cashier charged me for a grilled chicken sandwich when I ordered a grilled cheese. Luckily my friend asked for the same thing and she repeated back "grilled chicken?" and when she said no a grilled cheese-I was able to correct my order but was not given a refund for the difference $10 vs $6. So that was annoying. Gelato was tasty-the only good aspect.

36.description: If I could give place this 0 stars, I would. Went here with my mother today after passing it many times as I live nearby. I have been to the Artist's Cafe on Michigan Ave many times and enjoy it so I was interested and looking forward in trying the second location. Most breakfast places in the vicinity were packed, such as Eleven City Diner and the Bongo Room so the new Artist's Cafe seemed like the best choice with no wait and outdoor seating. We both ordered breakfast at the counter, a veggie omelette and myself scrambled eggs and bacon. Unfortunately we were waiting almost 45 minutes. The fruit plate side for my mother was moldy, eggs were overlooked orange and dry, our toast was simply just room temp sliced bread stacked on top of our potatoes, and the bacon was floppy, unreasonably greasy, and undercooked. The girl (not sure what to call her as there was someone who was clearly the busser and there were no servers) working there was quite unhelpful, not rude by any means, just very inexperienced and seemed lost on the floor and wanted to charge an extra 2.50 for a coffee refill. For the price I wasn't expecting what I would get at Eleven City or the Bongo Room, nevertheless the food was awful and the 45 minutes we waited for a sub-par meal would have been much better spent waiting in the rain for a table at either of their bustling neighboring restaurants.

14.description: The man who ordered my food was polite. The Chicago dog was awful. No Vienna beef, no tomato slices. The mustard wasn't in the dog, it was all over the bun, and there wasn't any celery salt. Don't even bother with this place

3.description: Thai food and sushi???  It doesn't get any better than that!!  We're big Thai food fans and the food here is out of this world.  We felt pampered with the service and found the prices were not your typical downtown "let's fleece the tourists for all we can get" prices.  I could eat there every day as there's nothing on the menu that doesn't sound great.  Parking is on the street or in the convenient lot diagonally across from the restaurant.  Can't wait to go back.

1.description: Really nothing bad to report. It's attached to a hotel but don't let that deter you. The service is great. Soundtrack is kicking late 90's love songs. The Panang is smooth and flavorful. The green is bright and rich. I guess the tofu could have been fried a bit longer but it was great otherwise. Good portion. Didn't try any sushi but it doesn't smell like stagnant ocean water in here so that's good. Worth a visit and the price is right.

2.description: Amazing experience. Great food. Loved the sushi! Really recommend this restaraunt if your in the area! Fast service and friendly smiles!

0.description: I stopped in whilst walking around and got hungry.It's a very clean establishment and spacious. The food is pretty good. The sushi was very tasty. I had some sashimi and a few rolls. It was very fresh.We also got thai and everything was good.The staff were very friendly and quick.

4.description: One of the best thai and sushi in chicago. Good food, friendly service, nice ambiance and reasonable price. Very recommend this place for anyone who visit chicago.

29.description: LOVE this little place. I've tried the pulled pork sandwich and the BBQ chicken salad. Both are fantastic. Ironically, I gave up eating meat last August, then got cancer in February. During chemo, I was encouraged to eat whatever I had an appetite for. So I began eating meat again. In July, I finished chemo and am having a hard time giving up meat again. And Porkchop isnt helping!

42.description: really good ribs and spinach salad.  fast service and good location.  the rub in the ribs was very tasty and I enjoyed the sauce.  it!

23.description: Mehhhh. Unfortunately, not impressed. The cornbread was not very fresh...the mac and cheese was nothing to write home about....and the pulled pork sandwich was doused in BBQ sauce...probably because the pork itself had no flavor. Disappointing, as we can always use good new restaurants in the neighborhood.

47.description: I wish I could give zero stars.  First of all this place is in the old Pockets space and that came into play during my experience.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and mac.  The worst pulled pork I ever had!  It was so hot, you could barely pick it up and when I did the hot dog bun (seriously!) it comes on fell apart from the steam.  The sauce?  What sauce!  There was no seasoning on the pork, not even salt.   When I asked the girl how they cook the pork she points to the old calzone oven from Pockets and said, "We smoke it."  Come on!! The only smoking going on is what ever she does on her break!  There is no way this pork was smoked, no bark, no smoke ring.  There was also no evidence that cooking of any kind is occurring at this location.The mac was ridiculous!  It made Kraft look like a Michelin winner!  I was so excited for this place as a south looper.  Do us a favor Porkchop, don't ship your leftover, dried out scraps from your Randolph location so they can be reheated in warming pans and pass that off as bbq,  With all of the amazing bbq in this city, this place is a shame!  Run, run away!!

8.description: Wasn't feeling too well today so wasn't really interested in cooking or trying new foods.  My son came by and ordered delivery for me.  But Hey!  Rib-Tips!  This was a very pleasant surprise, although I wasn't able to eat much. The servings are gi-normous and food arrived piping hot!  Great sauce! Great flavors to meat which was succulent and tender.  Will have to eat all week for leftovers.  Baked beans were okay with nice chunks of meat in them.

31.description: I don't get how many reviewers gave this place such low ratings.  I've always been a fan of Pork Chop Randolph location and this sandwich spot does a decent job.  The Beef Brisket sandwich I ordered was huge, tender and it had a great tangy BBQ sauce.  The Mac and Cheese was a bit bland, needs more flavor but the portion was almost too big. The counter lady was polite and she worked fast which is an important part of Fast Food for me.  I deducted one star because of the price. Sandwich, side and a bottle of Coke is $15, this may cause me to go somewhere else if money is tight for me, but the good service I received and the filling meal I ate will make me a repeat customer. The reviewers who gave this place 1 star are a bit harsh in my opinion.

34.description: The brisket was literally the FIRST brisket I chose not to finish.  When I say this, I feel the need to qualify: if it is dry, I will finish; if it's been sitting in my fridge for a week, I will finish it; if someone approaches me after I've eating a large pizza and offers the leftovers they found on a seat on the 29 after closing time, I will STILL finish it.This brisket had no smoke ring and was basically steamed without seasoning. Quite simply terrible. Imagine really bad barbecoa.My bud pushed away his chicken because it was stringy and excessively dry.Buns were steamy and mushy.Sides utterly forgettable. When  we ordered, the service was only slightly friendly and looked sort of bewildered, like kind of surprised they were even working at a BBQ place at all, that look that responds to my order of a brisket sandwich that says "wait let me check if we can... yeah... wow... yeah .... we can totally throw one of those together for you. how 'bout that!" In short, under-trained, under-versed and not BBQ people.I am tempted to be more brutal because it takes a certain level of audacity to open a BBQ when the BBQ is not good enough to serve at a home party let alone a professional establishment.  I felt cheated, swindled even.

16.description: Came here for a quick lunch on a Sat.  The one person who was working was incredibly nice and helpful.  I tried the brisket sandwich (which is served on texas-style toast) and it was solid.  Not the best BBQ I've had in the city, but was just fine in a pinch. The restaurant itself was fine... a little dirty, but about par for upscale fast-food establishments.  I'm happy I tried Porkchop out, but I'll continue to explore other places before I come back.

13.description: Not very good experience. -Food doesn't taste that good. People here are very nice. They started to provide discount to students.

11.description: Seriously the worst BBQ I've ever had. Go to one of their other locations if you can.Food seems to get trucked in from another location - the brisket I had was simply reheated in the old Pockets calzone oven, rather than smoked on-site. Brisket was tough, and flavorless. Coke machine was also busted.I've gone to their location on Randolph, and had a great experience. The food tasted great, and actually appeared to be smoked on site.Of course, it'd be rather difficult to get a smoker into a small space, especially in the Printers Row neighborhood... but with that being the case, why even open a barbecue joint in the area?Great idea, just poorly executed.

39.description: After posting my review a few weeks ago, it came to my attention that I had reviewed the incorrect location. In the spirit of accuracy, I am attempting to recreate my previous review from memory. I visited the Printer's Row Porkchop location during the June 2014 Printer's Row Lit Fest. Not wanting to brave the usual suspects - Potbelly or Subway- I saw the sign for this outpost of Porkchop as I was crossing Dearborn.  I must have timed it right, as there was just one person ahead of me in line when I walked in. By the time I had finished my lunch, the crowd had picked up considerably. After studying the menu, I decided to keep it simple with a brisket sandwich. I noticed that chips were on offer, but none of the sides appealed, so I stuck with the sandwich. The brisket itself was delicious- tender and not fatty/gristly in the least. The sauce was solid, though I would have liked to be able to customize my sandwich with other types of sauce, possibly via squeeze bottles of the stuff set out on counters. I don't know if this is how things are run at the other locations, but I did not seem to see any free-range sauces here - even hot sauce. I had never had brisket served on a pretzel bun before - methinks it might be BBQ with a hipster twist - but I found the quality of the bread fairly tasty, if unexpected. The service was efficient, and pleasant, getting me in and out in good time for the afternoon's slate of Lit Fest events. I hope to branch out and try other BBQ places around the city, but am glad to know that this place exists next time I am in the area and in the mood for BBQ.

37.description: Our order was take away, we had a good feeling about the service over the phone. The food was tasty. We had the brisket sandwich and the ribs. The one disappointing note is that for a BBQ place you cannot order in large quantities. We wanted to have a couple of meat items to accompany some side dishes previously cook at home and did not necessarily wanted to buy a sandwich but an order of brisket.

0.description: Excellent beef brisket! Very nice mac and cheese. The bread like "Texas toast" used for the sandwich was lightly toasted and good. The bbq sauce was a little smoky and a little spicy which is a very good combo.Rahsaan did a great job preparing and serving my meal too. I will be back.Don't tell too many people but there is parking available on Plymouth CT.

38.description: Stopped in for lunch today and ordered the pulled chicken sandwich.  I wish I had eaten there so that i could have taken it back.  It was really dry and had way too much pepper.  The sauce was okay but couldn't compensate for the dry chicken.  Also a little disappointed that it didn't come with any sides, just a pickle.  They do offer sides but they are $3 extra and looked pretty large, more than what I wanted as a side.  Overall, it was pretty disappointing and I don't think that I will be back.

27.description: This place is all over the board - some days the 'cue is dandy, other days, just so-so. And there's no consistency with the "bbq delivery systems" - I've had my pulled pork sandwich arrive on pretzel rolls, sub sandwich rolls and even a sesame seed hamburger roll. Folks, plain white bread would be just fine.Recently, I managed to score one of the best pulled-pork sandwich I've had since moving from North Cakalacky! Juicy, tender, with a subtle smoke ring. And while I usually prefer eastern North Carolina 'cue - historically a vinegar-based pepper sauce- this was topped with a somewhat sweet tomato-based barbecue sauce that packs a smattering of heat. On my last visit, the meat came piled atop a huge pretzel roll - total overkill.The pulled-chicken sandwich is also pretty good, and the full rack of ribs ($20) was the size of an infant. I've never had an issue with the speed of the service and the crew behind the counter appears friendly enough.

32.description: After losing Pockets I was happy to see they didn't wait long before finding something to fill the void, and Porkchhop did the trick! I had the Beef brisket on a Pretzel bun, and it was better than I expected . The brisket was tender the sauce had a delicious spicy yet  tangy taste. This place has a real scaled down menu compared to it's other stores, I was kind of disappointed at first  they didn't offer fries as a side dish, and the price of the sandwich was little expensive to not include anything with it but a pickle but after tasting the sandwich I decided it was worth it. I will definitely be back to try those ribs.

48.description: This was some of the worst food that I have ever eaten, although I say eaten very lightly, since I after the first bite or two, I basically just choked it down because I was hungry.I can't decide where to start with how bad this food was.  I ordered the pulled pork and Mac and Cheese.  The pork was awful.  There was no evidence of the pork being smoked.  No rings or no color.  There was no evidence of seasoning at all.  No bark, no flavor.  The sauce was awful and basically, non existent.  There were no options of sauces either.  Just some flavorless, poor attempt at a vinegar based sauce.  It was the driest pork sandwich that I had ever attempted to eat.  I don't know how long ago the meat was cooked, but it was obvious it was reheated and served.The Mac and cheese was equally bad.  It was a combination of noodles and some awful cheese, that's it.  No seasoning at all.  It had the appearance of a plate of nachos that you whip together late at night when you have nothing else in your fridge but cheese and chips.PLEASE DO NOT GO THERE!!  The south loop deserves much better.  I don't see how people can call this BBQ.

44.description: I'm glad I went before checking reviews because I might have stayed away and missed out. Porkchop needs to improve the restaurant flow and operations to be smoother, I will chalk this up to just opening... However the lunch I had was very good. The ribs were flavorful with a good balance of being very tender towards the center with a little chew at the rib tips. They came with the right amount of BBQ sauce on top, not soaked, so you could enjoy the meat and not taste only sauce. I also tried the chicken wings. They were smoked wings (not fried) that were in a tamer buffalo sauce. The tame sauce let you taste the smokiness of the chicken without overwhelming the meat and next time I may just get sauce on the side to enjoy it more.

24.description: Not very good experience. -Food doesn't taste that good. People here are very nice. They started to provide discount to students.

7.description: Where to begin.... I live down the street from this location and have wanted to try it for a while now. My vegetarian wife was out for the night so I decided to give it a try. Boy was I disappointed... The rib tips were mainly burnt and dry and my chicken wings were room temperature and dryyyy, which is strange because I saw her take them out of the oven and I live about 400 feet away so I can't blame travel nor being late to pick them up. It's disappointing because they had good flavor they were just cooked poorly. Despite the potential, I just spent $30 for bbq for dry meat so I don't think I'll be taking a chance on Porkchop again. Save yourself the trouble and walk 200 feet to First Draft on Clark. They at least know how to make wings.

49.description: Oh my, what awful barbecue. Gave this place two tries. Had the brisket and pulled chicken sandwiches. Both had been in the smoker too long and were dry. The brisket was sliced too thick and served on Texas toast. The chicken was on a sub roll but could not be picked up because the bottom was a soggy mess, like an Italian beef. Extra sauce did not help, because that was lousy too. Way too hot. So save your money and suck on a burnt match dipped in hot sauce and you'll have the same experience.

40.description: Mac and cheese lacks flavor! It's almost like eating plain noodles, though you can smell nutmeg or some other similar spice. It's clear they attempted to layer the flavor, but fell short. The pulled chicken sandwich was actually quite tasty. The chicken was a bit dry, but overall it had a nice smoky flavor and the sauce was very rich and flavorful and nice accompaniment to go on a pretzel bun. Having lived in the south, it's not reminiscent of any of those little hole in the wall bbq joints, but a nice try for a big city. If in a pinch and super hungry, I might try the sandwich again. However, never again will I do that terrible Mac and cheese.

30.description: Sucks.Bbq chicken was horribly drySalad had a lot of pretty mashed up greensAt least they used a pretzel roll.Tortilla chips, stale.

46.description: So far we have a trifecta of "one star". We did take out from this Porkchop on Saturday evening, and I'm hurrying to write this review since this place won't be around long. We actually wanted to try the ribs, but at 7:00pm they had been erased from the board. They were sitting there, but apparently the salamander had been turned off for the evening, or was broken or the generally clueless help just didn't care, so no ribs for us. Instead we picked up the pulled chicken, which was overcooked and dry as dust. This was served on a sub roll and had some so-so BBQ sauce sort of thrown on it with the chicken then plopped for in the middle. It was only saved by a liberal dose of our own BBQ sauce at home. We also got the mac and cheese as sides. To call this gooey mess "library paste" would be doing a disservice to the library world. Just horrible, no discernible cheese taste, the mac was overcooked to a total mush and the entire thing just blended into one mass. All this cost $24!!! Avoid this place at all costs. Any upside? Well, the dog loved the mac and cheese.

1.description: Really quick and easy service and a very nice staff. Definitely somewhere to go to split a meal or get some good BBQ in the city. Shared Riblets and sweet potato fries with someone and it was delicious. That BBQ sauce is delicious and the portion sizes are definitely generous.The table was a little sticky and the space is small but the food makes up for it.Also, a pretty sweet selection of soda/pop with a few novelty bottles that add to the experience.Definitely get the BBQ!

9.description: I've tried both the Adams/State and Dearborn/Harrison location twice. All 4 times I was disappointed for a variety of reasons. Both neighborhood locations are in desperate need of a quick and affordable bbq place that has good food. The bbq is average at best. All the sauce in the world won't make dried out meat moist. When a staff member walks out of the bathroom and see's you standing in line to place an order, it's probably best to hang up your phone call. Literally, the person stayed on their phone while I placed my order, why she made the order, and then the entire time it took me to eat my food. I just can't conceive a scenario that this would constitute good service and a welcoming envrionment. I've tried the brisket, rib tips, pulled chicken, mac & cheese, and the fries. All were very bland at best. Until they can address the food issues, as well as the service issues, I'll not be returning.

26.description: Very tasty. Best BBQ in the vicinity. Love their pulled chicken and brisket. Try their Mac & cheese.

25.description: Pulled chicken sandwich was a bit spicy. I fell in love with the Mac and cheese tho! I would go back specifically for just did that. Saw this place from my hotel room and checked out the site, I was disappointed when I looked at the menu and went over there with the know of what I wanted and they didn't have it. But girl behind the counter was super nice! So for the Mac and cheese and staff I give 3 stars!

12.description: The place was dead quiet at 12:45 on a Friday afternoon... Should have taken that as ominous sign number 1. When I walked in, there was a gentleman cleaning up the trash can and getting the garbage out of the bin. Honestly thought he was the janitor. He went about his way and I sat there for a minute or two as he did so expecting someone to come from the back and help me. Nope. The mistaken janitor was the lone man working the joint. He did wash his hands before handling food or anything else. So props for that as I have seen people not be as diligent...I got the Brisket Sandwich, a side of baked beans and a bottle of soda all for takeaway. As has been said in a previous review, it appears that this is all brought in from somewhere and heated up on site. That's not a worry for me; as long as it's hot and tasty. The sandwich was; albeit loaded with fatty pieces. Normally in a sandwich or platter, the fat isn't as prevalent. I would call it 70% meat, 30% fat on my sandwich. But tasty, allow me to reiterate that. The beans on the other hand, a bit cold, albeit tasty.I think it's a bit pricy for what you get and it seems to be a poor interpretation of what they hoped it could be. It's almost like a skeleton of what the potential of this place is. All places deserve a second chance and this one will get that as well.

21.description: Meh.  $16 and change for a meal that was less tasty than a fast food value meal. 1) The pulled pork sandwich was dry.  There was bbq sauce on the bread but the pulled pieces of pork were very dry and bland without the sauce2) The gumbo had the consistency of chicken noodle soup.  In this case, looks were NOT deceiving; The gumbo tasted like chicken noodle soup with sausage substituted for noodles.3) Lastly, the mac and cheese was also a bust.  The cheese sauce was tasty but it didn't stick to the flavorless macaroni pasta very well.

17.description: Mehhhh. Unfortunately, not impressed. The cornbread was not very fresh...the mac and cheese was nothing to write home about....and the pulled pork sandwich was doused in BBQ sauce...probably because the pork itself had no flavor. Disappointing, as we can always use good new restaurants in the neighborhood.

10.description: Wow! This was spectacular BBQ! I stopped in on my way home Saturday night and will definitely be going back.The rib tips fell off the bone, the sauce was vinegar based with pleasant sweetness and the spinach and bacon salad was a great compliment. The salad had oranges, pecans, cherry tomatoes and tangy red onion. Fresh and crispy like I'd make at home.Thanks Porkchop for the perfect food to eat while watching the Bears lose!

5.description: Oh boy, where do I even begin. I tried this place a few years ago at a Yelp Elite Event and it was soo good! I travel downtown for work sometimes and have been meaning to stop in to give them a try at their actual restaurant. When I first walked in at lunch time (Downtown) - the place was deserted with one other guy who looks like he had been waiting a while. That wasn't a good sign, but I was already in and didn't want to leave. When you first walk in - all I smelled was a strong smell of cleaning solution which I can't stand in restaurants. You should smell food, not cleaning solution! Also, the place looks like they made an effort in making it trendy, but it still gives off a very dingy vibe. It's dark and the lighting is awful. It would not be a place where I would want to eat for lunch. You want to get away from the fluorescent lighting in the office - not to go to another fluorescent room! Oh and there was only one lady at the counter who was moving super slow. While I was waiting for my food - another worker came in (looks like she was late). The late girl asked the other girl if she needed any help, she said no and the girl went to go sit down at one of the dining tables playing on her phone!!! WTH! The menu was not that big at all. All the pulled pork sandwiches came on a pretzel bun which I do not like, so I ended up getting the pulled chicken because it was the only one that came with a regular bun. I'm not the type to change the Chef's recipe unless I absolutely hate an ingredient. After waiting a while (I actually got my food before the guy who had looked like he'd been waiting a while!) - I took my food elsewhere. First, my sandwich came on a pretzel bun! The chicken was dry and it didn't even look marinated. The girl had just squirted some BBQ sauce on top of the chicken! Not the way I had it at the Yelp Elite Event. BBQ tasted good, but it was not mixed in well with the chicken. It gets worse -  the sandwich had a hint of the cleaning solution taste to it. I ended up throwing half the sandwich away it was that bad. Needless to say, I will not be back. Very disappointed!

3.description: Rib tips are on point! I've ordered from the Yelp app several times, but I always have to wait for my food, even when I arrive for pickup in the allotted time frame.

35.description: I am still trying to figure out how this place is called pork chop with NO pork shops on the menu.

19.description: The brisket was literally the FIRST brisket I chose not to finish.  When I say this, I feel the need to qualify: if it is dry, I will finish; if it's been sitting in my fridge for a week, I will finish it; if someone approaches me after I've eating a large pizza and offers the leftovers they found on a seat on the 29 after closing time, I will STILL finish it.This brisket had no smoke ring and was basically steamed without seasoning. Quite simply terrible. Imagine really bad barbecoa.My bud pushed away his chicken because it was stringy and excessively dry.Buns were steamy and mushy.Sides utterly forgettable. When  we ordered, the service was only slightly friendly and looked sort of bewildered, like kind of surprised they were even working at a BBQ place at all, that look that responds to my order of a brisket sandwich that says "wait let me check if we can... yeah... wow... yeah .... we can totally throw one of those together for you. how 'bout that!" In short, under-trained, under-versed and not BBQ people.I am tempted to be more brutal because it takes a certain level of audacity to open a BBQ when the BBQ is not good enough to serve at a home party let alone a professional establishment.  I felt cheated, swindled even.

28.description: Decent food, but I swear this location is cursed with bad service. I ordered a salad with no onions and chicken and it came with no chicken and onions. They just picked the onions out of the salad.

45.description: Was wondering what was going to replace Pockets after it closed at the end of the year.  What a surprise - Tasty BBQ!  I work in the area and had lunch there the other day.  The menu is small but covers the 4 major BBQ food groups (ribs, brisket, pulled chicken and pulled pork) and offers a few salads and sides.  I think the brisket is the best barometer for the quality of a BBQ joint and Porkchop really delivers with theirs.  Brisket was moist with a solid flavor ring and smokiness.  The ribs were meaty, fell off the bone and had a solid rub.  Lightly sauced with house BBQ, which I found to have a good balance of sugar and spice.  I tried my brother's smoked chicken wings, which were decent (note I am not a wing fan).  I'm glad to have a BBQ option in the south loop and will definitely go back to try the pulled chicken, salads and sides.  Pricing is reasonable and consistent with the area.

33.description: Finally Yelp has added an entry for this location.  I was super excited to see this place open in my neighborhood and was looking forward to trying it out.  Unfortunately I was shocked at how bad it was.  I went in and ordered a half slab for take out.  I got home and the ribs were cold (I live right down the street); un-f'inbelievable!  I was starving and didn't want to have to walk back to return it, so I ended up just eating it. It's obvious that this place just serves up pre-cooked food from their other location and simply reheats the meat when you place your order.  That would explain the other bad reviews about dry meat.  What is the owner thinking?!  They might as well pack up and close shop now, because it's not going to last long if they think they can survive by serving re-heated food and charge the prices that they do!

43.description: PorkChop provides a decent pulled pork sandwich, but not for $9.  This location had a single person yesterday, so she was acting as cashier/manager/cook/etc.  The sandwich was fine, but without any beer/bar or atmosphere, I doubt I'll be back.  I will say the gal was very pleasant and it's probably worth trying if you live in the neighborhood, but it's nothing special and I'd predict they close this location within a year.

2.description: Don't go here unless you 1. like spicy hot BBQ and 2. have all the time in the world. I've never been to a BBQ place that did not give you a choice of sauce. I like a mild, sweet sauce. What I got is still burning my mouth after one bite so I'll be throwing out the pulled pork sandwich I bought. Also, the place is staffed by ONE person and the wait was so long as she filled orders one by one that I had to just give up. The sandwich was ready but I couldn't keep waiting for the side of mac n' cheese which I would expect not to require preparation time. Too bad, maybe I would have gotten something decent to eat if I'd left with the mac n' cheese instead of the pulled pork.I felt so bad for the girl stuck in such a horrible job all by herself that I put the refund she gave me for the mac n' cheese into a fishbowl on the counter. So, a total of $11 completely wasted and I have no dinner, here at a client's late.Also, there's no porkchop on the menu. Go figure.

18.description: Meat was good sauce was clearly ketchup based. WAY to expensive for what you get $11 for a sandwich & soda (fountain was broke) no sides! This is clearly a chain trying to cash in on bbq fad and doing a poor job. No ambiance ok food and decent service I expect Smoque level quality! My choice was this or the sub chain across the st. I wish I went there!

41.description: Had the FAT ELVIS sandwich on a limb, and I am SO glad I did!  Awesomely delicious sums it up for the sandwich and my experience here was great as well.  Very friendly customer service and helpful too, the girl gave me an industry card.  FOLLOW UP: I had them cater my son's birthday this past weekend, and it was equally delicious.  BEST BBQ IN THE CITY!

4.description: Wow the food was to die for delicious. I was impressed. I was referred to this place by a coworker  and the food knocked my boots off. My biggest complaint had to be the line and the wait for foods. By the time I ordered and got my food my lunch break was almost over so I definitely recommend ordering ahead of time. The girl who takes your order is very nice and personable, but more importantly the food is amazing. I had the Po boy sandwich and it was amazing. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and the fries and coleslaw made great sides. I kinda wish they would have taken the tails off of the shrimp. Other than that I do recommend giving them a try it is really worth the wait!

6.description: Meh.  $16 and change for a meal that was less tasty than a fast food value meal. 1) The pulled pork sandwich was dry.  There was bbq sauce on the bread but the pulled pieces of pork were very dry and bland without the sauce2) The gumbo had the consistency of chicken noodle soup.  In this case, looks were NOT deceiving; The gumbo tasted like chicken noodle soup with sausage substituted for noodles.3) Lastly, the mac and cheese was also a bust.  The cheese sauce was tasty but it didn't stick to the flavorless macaroni pasta very well.

22.description: Came here for a quick lunch on a Sat.  The one person who was working was incredibly nice and helpful.  I tried the brisket sandwich (which is served on texas-style toast) and it was solid.  Not the best BBQ I've had in the city, but was just fine in a pinch. The restaurant itself was fine... a little dirty, but about par for upscale fast-food establishments.  I'm happy I tried Porkchop out, but I'll continue to explore other places before I come back.

15.description: I'm giving this place 1 star strictly for service, I didn't even get a chance to eat the food. My wife and I walked in at 7:30 to a completely empty restaurant, which was the first red flag, to an employee on his phone, which couldn't even be bothered to look up and greet us. After deciding on  what we wanted I ordered two sandwiches and a couple of sides. The employee stared at his phone the entire time I ordered and when I asked for a couple sides he finally looked up off his phone and rolled his eyes at me. At this point I had already had enough of this guy and told him to forget it, I didn't want to bother him with the order and I was heading across the street to Potbelly's . He didn't seem to have a problem with that by saying "alright sounds good" on our way out. To sum it up, there are way to many good restaurants around the area to ever give this place a second chance. I look forward to seeing what moves in Porkchop Express' place after the doors shut! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!

20.description: I've generally had good experiences with Porkchop's sandwiches.  They are tasty, and the one time I had an issue with an order, they were very quick to rectify it.  The resolution to that issue is why this is a 3 star review, and not a 2 star.My main beef with this restaurant is price, at least relative to the business model.  At $9+ (after tax) for a medium-sized sandwich, Porkchop Express would generally not be in the average Chicagoan's wheelhouse for a lunch spot.   And clearly that is what they are going for at this "express" location.   And $20 for a slab of ribs at a non-sit-down restaurant?  Nuh-uh.  They are good, but not that good....So my piece of advice to the owners is this:  throw something in with the sandwich!  Take your cheapest-to-produce side dish and include it.  There are very few, if any, successful fast food lunch spots in the Loop where $9 wouldn't at least get you a drink and/or a bag of chips (usually both!) with your order. Again, love the food, but when I do the math, my wallet usually guides me to another spot for my mid-day grub.

36.description: Although not typically yelp reviewers, this place has frustrated us both times we've been. Poor service, strange environment, less than quality, cold food, and expensive. Completely unimpressed.

14.description: This place is all over the board - some days the 'cue is dandy, other days, just so-so. And there's no consistency with the "bbq delivery systems" - I've had my pulled pork sandwich arrive on pretzel rolls, sub sandwich rolls and even a sesame seed hamburger roll. Folks, plain white bread would be just fine.Recently, I managed to score one of the best pulled-pork sandwich I've had since moving from North Cakalacky! Juicy, tender, with a subtle smoke ring. And while I usually prefer eastern North Carolina 'cue - historically a vinegar-based pepper sauce- this was topped with a somewhat sweet tomato-based barbecue sauce that packs a smattering of heat. On my last visit, the meat came piled atop a huge pretzel roll - total overkill.The pulled-chicken sandwich is also pretty good, and the full rack of ribs ($20) was the size of an infant. I've never had an issue with the speed of the service and the crew behind the counter appears friendly enough.

58.description: Beware that they started out very nice and told you your vision plan only covers eye exam however does not cover contact lens fitting fees.  They'll OVERCHARGE you and unless you find out beforehand, they will never say anything when asking for your payment.Remember to bring a copy of your vision plan description.  Highlight the section which describes contact lens fitting is covered.  Otherwise it takes them forever at the end of the eye exam appointment and they'll pretend that they researched your insurance vision provision and said you get some sort of discount but still have to pay 95% of the contact lens fitting fee.  I didn't want to argue with them since I didn't bring a copy of my insurance vision plan description.  Then 2 weeks later when I asked my vision plan network to contact them first, I called them immediately after they just said "we'll refund the amount back to your credit card".  Didn't even bother to offer an apology.  Imagine how many other customers have they fooled with.They are listed on my vision plan (Davis Vision Plan) as a network provider but the plan has tagged them now as being a dishonest provider.

56.description: Still love it! I had my first exam there and the doctor is very friendly. The people remember my name as well as my husbands. They even remembered where I worked and some other personal info about me.  They truly care about your eyes and getting the best glasses for you.  They are very knowledgeable about the fit of glasses and eye care and exam techniques.  It's worth the extra cash.

29.description: Both doctors are wonderful!

42.description: Dr. Sarai was great, I was seen very promptly. All the stars because they were able to sell me a "floor model" of frame and were able to expedite my lenses so that I could have them before I went out of town. Employees were helpful and nice and they had a really good selection of frames. Don't go in expecting anything cheap though. Frames start at $250 for really basic designs. But if you have good insurance, you'll get out spending about $300 for everything. Which isn't bad.

23.description: Great service and section. Really liked my doctor, he took the time to review the results of my test and explained everything in a straight forward and clear manner. I wound return without hesitation,

47.description: I have been to both locations, on Taylor St. and Wabash Ave. Dr. Sarai nd Dr. Sood are very good. There was an issue with one of my eye tests and they immediately sent out for further testing, as a precaution.They are very professional and will answer any questions you have. The offices are very nice and comfortable, and the employees are also very helpful.The glasses and lenses are high quality, and some can be very pricy. However, I've always found moderately priced glasses, and was even told about a special rebate/promotion by my contact lens brand that saved me a lot of money.Overall, I recommend this place. If you are looking for a discount eyeglass exam/lens location, however, look elsewhere.

8.description: Village Eyecare has been my go-to optical place ever since I moved to South Loop. The store is well kept, always clean and open. Staffs are really friendly and helpful. They also have a nice text messaging notification system when you have an appointment or your ordered lens are ready to pick up. Great location too!

31.description: Making an appointment at Village Eyecare was easy and I didn't have to wait weeks for the appointment.  All of the staff is extremely courteous and professional.  I say Dr. Elizabeth Urbaniak who was great! She is very thorough in explaining tests and their results. I would highly recommend Village Eyecare.

34.description: I moved to Chicago from  Canada last fall and needed to find an eye doctor.  I was able to get an appointment pretty quickly. When I arrived, it was busy, but the two individuals that work with the doctor , acknowledged I had arrived and  were polite as they were multi tasking with other  patients.  I was able to see the doctor without a long wait.  She had recommended I move to daily contacts, which I enjoy.  The part that I was most impressed with was after I had seen the  doctor, Elaine had put  aside several  pairs of glasses that she thought suited my colouring and face shape. I ended up buying one of the pairs.Overall, I would highly recommend going to  Village Eyecare.

16.description: I am a satisfied customer. All the staff was friendly and concerned with my comfort. The exam was thorough. My new glasses fit better than the old ones. And the prescription must be accurate, since I can see better than before.

13.description: I've been going to Village Eye Care in the South Loop for many years and I've always had a wonderful experience. Doctors Sood, Sarai and Urbaniak and the staff are all amazing!  Village Eye Care also has a great selection of unique frames, which I'm always looking for. Thank you for providing me with many years of great service!

11.description: Both the staff and doctors are very communicative, personable and good at their job. We've been going here for three years and I have only positive feelings about Village Eyecare. They accept our insurance so I'm not really sure if they're competitive in terms of pricing. But the service is always top notch.

39.description: This place is so good to me. Dr. Sarai is awesome and really cares about the health of my eyes, as he should. They are extremely accommodating. The receptionist, Christopher, has been nothing but helpful with what I need when it comes to getting me contacts or solution samples. You will never have to buy contact solution again, they love giving out samples. They are all very thorough and reliable. I trust them. It is easy to make an appointment online and are great at following up with you when your contacts or glasses are in! As long as my insurance keeps them in their network I will keep going to them.

37.description: Excellent experience always. I drive from suburbs to see Dr. Sood. Always a warm welcome. The staff is so knowledgeable.  I am so confident I am getting the best care. Their frame selection is great. I'm always excited to see what's the latest!

0.description: Having a few years lapse in my eye doctor visits, I was a bit skeptical going, however the staff (Elaine and Josephine) and Dr. Urbaniak were amazing. My wife came home a few days earlier with nothing but good things to say so I made an appointment and was floored by how painless the entire process was. Dr. provided me an eye education that made me know I came to the right place! From the hostess (sorry cannot remember her name) to both ladies in the front office- Elaine and Josephine, this place is unmatched and has earned me and my entire family's business. Keep up the good work! If only all businesses could be like this.

38.description: If you look through the reviews for Village Eyecare and are worried about previous negative reviews, don't be.  This company has completely transformed itself.  I will be the first to admit it used to be bad, but it's clear those days are gone.  I have high expectations when it comes to customer service and this place exceeds them.  This place has done a great job on hiring professional, approachable, intelligent employees.  Not an easy task.(Since there are two locations, I'll be posting this review twice)

51.description: My review is for the South Loop location. This review is a bit overdue since I have been going to Dr. Sarai for a couple of years now. After having terrible experiences at several optometrists, including America's "Best" I have finally found an eye doctor I trust and would highly recommend!I will admit that the last time I was there, I left a little frustrated with the staff because they messed up my insurance information and it took forever to get my contacts in (4+ weeks). But, Dr. Sarai is so awesome that I was able to overlook this and give them another try. I'm so glad I did - this time around, I was welcomed by different staff than last time and they were really friendly and knowledgeable. This time, they even had my insurance information set up before I got there as to not waste my time with that. Yes, it is a little pricey, but they have a great selection of stylish and trendy eyewear. I came in for contacts, but I have my eyes set on a lovely pair of Gucci eyeglasses that are to die for. Despite being an "upscale" eye place, the staff was really friendly and they even worked with me and my stingy HMO insurance so that I could get the most out of my insurance and pay the least possible out of pocket. I can certainly appreciate that!So onto the optometrist - the best part! Dr. Sarai is so completely thorough with the exam and always takes the time to answer any questions that you may have. He took the time to explain to me the different tests he was doing. After suffering with dry eyes for a long time and struggling with my contacts, Dr. Sarai was able to come up with a treatment for me and suggested contacts for me that I can actually wear now without the dry redness I was so used to. As others have mentioned, he remembers his patients and you never feel rushed during your appointment.A few other great things about Village Eye Care in the South Loop: (1) you can book your appointments online, as well as fill out your health and insurance information online so it cuts down on the time of filling out the paperwork at the office. Love a place that keeps up with the times and makes it easier on the patient; and (2) it is really easily accessible on the CTA - just a couple of blocks off the Roosevelt stop where the red/green/orange lines converge.

27.description: Appointment setup was great and easy. And the front desk staff did fantastic work to get previous medical records from my former doctor. Dr. Urbaniak was pretty thorough and answered a ton of questions during a painless checkup. I'll be sure to visit them again in the future.

32.description: I had a wonderful experience at Village Eyecare. The place is very conveniently located in the South Loop, clean and my first immediate impression was that it smelled awesomely like fresh balsam (my fave--the front desk guy informed me he had just changed the plug-in). The staff was exceptional and incredibly helpful and knowledgeable when it came to handling insurance matters. I was actually able to use both of my separate insurance providers to get the best deal possible. I really appreciated that they were wiling to bill separately to make it most reasonable for me. The doctor was very knowledgeable and patient with me as I had a lot of questions about which type of contacts (daily vs bi-weekly) would be best for the health of my eyes. She answered all of my questions thoroughly and attentively. I highly recommend this facility.

54.description: This post will be regarding the University Village Location.I've been a customer to them for over 2 years, but only visited a few times. Overall I did like it. I knew it was overpriced, but I just told myself that my eyes were important and it was worth it. I even brought them more business when I referred my girlfriend, and she got an exam and a year of contacts.Well I recently scratched my cornea taking my contact out. It annoyed me for a week, and even though I could tell it was almost healed, I decided to set up an appointment. I called and explained and was told the cost would be anywhere from $50 - $250. I fought with myself over whether to go but finally decided that it would have to be near the bottom of the estimate considering it would be such a simple visit, and that it was worth $50 for peace of mind, knowing it would heal correctly. I got there, and explained to the doctor before I went into the examination room that I am currently unemployed, and that I know it isn't that big of a deal and that I couldn't afford to pay more than $60, and if it would be more than that, I would just go. She seemed to be very understanding, and said it wouldn't be a problem. 5 minutes later and we were done. She looked at my eye, confirmed a very small abrasion almost healed, and gave me a sample of antibiotic eye drops. I'm sure you can tell where this is going. Got to the front desk, and they gave me a bill for $140 for the 3-5 minute exam. I argued and they claimed that includes the follow up exam. I told them I don't want a follow up exam and to take half off the bill. They said that was impossible. So that's about it. They won't even check out a return customer's very small problem for a reasonable rate. Even if you explain to them you don't have the money to pay if it's over a certain amount. This shows me nothing more than greed and impersonal service, even though I recognized most of the people working there.In my opinion their frame selection is absolutely hideous as well. All new age, modern, sleek, super expensive label names. Hopefully I'll have better luck elsewhere.

48.description: A man walks into Village Eyecare at 1243 S Wabash Ave. Inside are four employees, two women and two men (one a college-aged guy), standing around chewing gum.Man off the street: How much does it cost for an eye exam?Saleswoman 1: We charge $120 for an eye exam.Man off the street: How much are lenses?Saleswoman 1: They start at $60.Man off the street: How much for your thinnest lenses?Saleswoman 1 (using computer and a separate calculator): $295 for the lenses.College-Aged Sales Guy: That doesn't include the UV protection.Man off the street: How much is it with UV protection?Saleswoman 1: $400.Man off the street: That's alright I don't need the UV protection.Saleswoman 1: Those lenses don't come without UV protection.Saleswoman 2 and Sales Guy 2 standing at the back of the store: ___.Village Eyecare gets what you pay for.If the owners of this shop ever check yelp, how about cutting the useless staff and getting real with your prices?

44.description: I went in because I needed a contacts fitting. The office is really nice and there is a good selection of glasses, but I had already gotten a new pair, and they were nice about leaving me alone after I said I didn't need a new pair of glasses. My appointment was at like 1130 i think, but I had to wait for about 15 minutes before I was seen, which is my only complaint. The doctor was very nice and quick, and I got a sample pair even though they didn't have quite the correct prescription, but they were nice enough to order me a sample pair with the correct prescription, which I ended up picking up about a week later when it got in.Overall, it went smoothly and I have a new contacts prescription, so I'm happy about it. If I had been seen when I got in quickly, I would give them a 5 star rating.

24.description: I still like this place, nothing about my opinion has changed, two eyeballs up!

7.description: I've been coming here for 3 years now and highly recommend Dr. Sood and her staff.  Everyone is friendly and helpful. They have a great selection of eyeglasses especially my favorites Prada and Tom Ford. A special thank you to Elaine for helping select my glasses again!

49.description: Bought a $300 pair of frames here about 18 months ago, and went to get them fixed after one of the hinges broke (no dropping on the floor or anything, just normal usage). The associate who seemed more interested in selling me a new pair of frames than trying to fix the ones i brought in, made some snarky remark about how people should get new glasses every two years anyways. At $300 I sure expect my frames to hold up for more than 18 months, and honestly expected an offer to get them fixed free of charge, with the place trying to come of as high-end and all. Needless to say I was disappointed. The bottom-line, you are better of going to a discount-store. There you can expect the service to be crappy, but at least those places have full  disclosure.

40.description: Been a customer here for 2 years. Clean place, pretty good selections, really good and nice eye doctor, but the other who work there have bad attitute, and treat u basing on if they think u can afford it or not.

53.description: I should have written this review two years ago.  I love my eye doctor!  Isn't that weird?  I like him, the staff in his offices and my overall experience when I go see him (minus the blowing air in your eye test).The staff is always super friendly and they have helped me to pick out two pairs of fabulous frames, which I constantly get complemented on.  I love their help and suggestions, because I end up with styles I may not have chosen but that are stylish, fit my face and flatter me.Dr Sarai is, young, friendly and provides a very personalized visit.  For a doctor I see so rarely it is nice to be remembered during my visits. He also listens very well, provides solutions to my issues and answers my questions.

30.description: Fantastic all around. The staff are beyond friendly as is Dr. Sood - who is also extremely knowledgeable and helpful in resolving your sight issues. They also carry a great collection of designer frames. I highly recommend Village Eyecare to anyone in need of an eye doctor within driving distance of the south loop - also convenient to red line Roosevelt stop and accessible to expressway.

46.description: Dr. Sood is very nice, answered all my questions well, and made my annual eye exam an altogether pleasant experience.Her ancillary staff, however, were kind of useless.My insurance allows for 50 bucks towards the eye exam, 50 bucks towards contact fitting, and copays for contacts based on what kind they are.After they incorrectly charged me for the eye exam and the fitting, and told me that I couldn't get contacts because my co pay wouldn't allow it, they also said they'd contact my insurance company to see why this was happening, and that they would get back to me.  Fast forward to two days later.  I called my insurance company, was told about my benefits (which are quite generous), and for the next week, received no word at all from Village Eye Care.  They never even told me if alternate brands of contacts would be covered.  They can keep the 50 bucks they made off of me.  I just don't feel like dealing with them.I ended up getting my contacts from walgreens.com (covered by insurance AND the brands I wanted) and saved myself more headaches.

1.description: Great experience ... Great atmosphere .... Very pleasant and informative ...

55.description: Maybe it depends on who you get to help you and place your order, but in a small place like this, even one inexperienced or incapable person is a problem, and that's what happened to me.  I got progressive lenses for the first time (combination of distance and close-up vision), and although I did like the frame I chose, I was having trouble with the "reading" portion of the lenses - there was a very small portion of the lens that worked for this purpose.  Since then, I have had two optometrists tell me that Village Eye Care never should have let me get the frame I did - it was not large enough for this kind of lens, which is why the lens doesn't work well for its intended purpose.  Also, they said that the lenses could have been produced much better.  Both of the subsequent experts I consulted with each told me much more detail than I received from this store.  Oh, and the cost of all of this (before insurance, luckily)?  Close to $1,000.  So, Buyer Beware - there are better places in our city, luckily.  I am now in the midst (after waiting for my insurance to kick in again, 2 years later) of paying for another set of frames and lenses, to make up for their mistake.

9.description: I haven't been to the eye doctor in years, because it's usually tedious and a waste of time. I made an appointment at Village because I live nearby and wanted to update my frames. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The doctor was very nice and actually informed me that glasses can help someone like me a lot because they filter out that harsh light. She gave me a second prescription for general use, which I never realized how much I needed. Overall, this was an awesome experience. I plan on referring my boyfriend so we both get $25 off our visits!

26.description: A Marine Veterans  5 Star designation. I highly encourage all military veterans or acdu to try here first. 1st class support, Dynamic Doctor, and overall a pleasant experience. Master Gunnery Sergeant,USMC ret.

25.description: I've been coming here since moving to Chicago. Initially chose Village Eyecare because of proximity to work and turned out to be wise choice. Best eye doctor I've ever experienced. Unparalleled customer service.

12.description: I have been going to Village Eyewear on Wabash for a few years now.  Excellent staff and customer service.  I recently saw Dr. Sood who was very thorough and engaging.  Always a good experience.  I highly recommend!

59.description: Modern and chic eye ware. They have a great selection of handmade frames from France as well as the designer standbys like Prada.This is  THE place to go in the South Loop if you want cool Eurostyle and aren't as concerned about the price. The sales lady helping me was great and recommended frames to fit my face. She also did a good job of recommending frames that happened to be $500 (before lenses!) I could have been sold too as I'm easily persuaded and she was doing a fabulous sales job on me. Luckily the bf was there and helped to be my voice of reason. I settled on super cool frames that were still a few hundred dollars.Staff was friendly, but I had to call them to find out where my glasses were. They said they'd be ready within the week. After 10 days I called them to track down my specs.

21.description: Love this place. Great staff from the ophthalmologist to the couple of front workers. Friendly, professional and personable. My new eye center, for SURE.

17.description: This place is great. Very nice selection and very professional staff as well. After some issues with my current glasses, the staff here adjusted them free of charge. Now they fit great! Thank you again!

10.description: I have been coming here for a year and have received nothing but excellent care. Everyone is genuinely nice and cares for my well being. I would definitely recommend Village Eyecare to anyone.

5.description: Absolutely love this place. I recently moved downtown to south loop and was hunting for a great eye doc. Their pricing is affordable and their staff (as well as doctors) are well educated and extremely friendly. They go out of their way to make it as painless as possible. I recommend them to all my friends!

3.description: Great experience. Dr. Urbaniak was very patient, explained my options thoroughly, and gave sound recommendations. The staff was friendly and very enthusiastic about finding me frames that I would enjoy wearing. Josephine truly has an eye for frame fitting (pun intended)-- the first pair she selected ended up being my absolute favorite! I really appreciate that the practice managers took the time to explain my payment options.

35.description: I wandered upon this place because we live in the neighborhood and they happened to accept my eye insurance. I hadn't been to the eye doctor in years (like probably 10 years) so I was looking for a lot of guidance and help. Dr. Sood and the staff were truly great. Dr Sood talked me through the whole process and it turned out I need reading glassed. They let me browse for a long time because I wasn't really sure what kind of frames I would look good in and they even helped pick out a few that would go with my face shape.I must have tried on 10 pairs and then I wanted my fiance's input so they held up my phone while we FaceTimed. I ended up picking one of the frames they had pulled out and the glasses were ready in 5 days. I went back a couple times to get the fit adjusted and they were always pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this place to any of my closest friends.

19.description: Love this place. Great staff from the ophthalmologist to the couple of front workers. Friendly, professional and personable. My new eye center, for SURE.

28.description: AVOID AT ALL COSTS.  This office is not well run, and did not provided me with good quality eye care.  It took months of visits to get me fitted into contacts, from July through October of last year.  An approximate fit was finally achieved my calling my optometrist from a few years prior to get old records on the shape of my eye.  My new optometrist has already taken me out of those contacts from Village Eyecare. Not only was the number of visits incredibly inconvenient, but their policy of "squeezing you in" between appointments meant that each appointment took an hour.  They also switched doctors on me halfway through without any reason, which meant starting over. At the end of it all, they billed me for a test they used to fit my eyes.  When I pushed back on this charge, the bill magically disappeared in their system.  They have cute glasses and prescription sunglasses, but as a serious contact and glasses wearer, this place is not worth a visit.

45.description: This review is for the Wabash location. I ordered a pair of glasses from this location over a month ago & they still haven't come in yet! First I was excited because of the convenient location and because I actually found frames that I liked and fit. But now I feel like I've been getting the run around from them. I first received a phone call from them saying my frame was on back order and that it wouldn't come for 3 weeks. They apologized and said I would get a phone call on the 12th when they come in.  I was OK with this. No biggie. It was out of everyone's hands, and they seemed to be proactive about it. But then it got worse. Then the 12th comes and I don't here from them. I call and they seem confused as to why I've been told they were coming in on the 12th. They look into it, and tell me that my frames aren't at the store yet, but they are in the lab. They apologize, say they'll leave a message for the lab and that they should be in soon.....they will call me. Monday I talked to a woman. She tells me she looked into it. They're in the lab, they should be in tomorrow. I call again on Tuesday. Nope no glasses. This time I'm told, they're in the lab and all they need to do is cut them. Should be fast no big deal. I'm also told that the lab they use is close by, and the glasses will be sent by messenger. Hopefully I can pick them up Weds. after work. So which day is it? Everyday they tell me the frames are in the lab and my lenses just need to be cut. Everyday they tell me the next day my frames will be in....and they never are. Weds: They call me and leave a message apologizing. Apparently there was a power outage at the lab today. My glasses haven't been finished and aren't in yet. Really? A power outage. Maybe there really was a power outage, but come on. Now I'm just getting annoyed. They promise they will be in by next Tuesday.......I appreciate apologizes and all, but after awhile, you don't want to hear it anymore. Just solve the issue. I just want my glasses please.

33.description: The experience from booking to the actual visit was super professional, engaging and just overall informative.  The staff is a fun bunch and I was super impressed with Dr. Elizabeth Urbaniak, who's very personable, thorough in providing me insight of substance literally into my vision.  I really appreciated this and would highly recommend this practice. They also have an excellent selection of frames for characters with edge wanting a unique and complimentary look.

43.description: I moved to South Loop a couple of years ago and was looking for an eye doc close by. Found the folks at Village Eyecare and I couldn't be happier. EVERYONE there is helpful, friendly and knowledgeable. The docs are great.  I highly recommend them.

2.description: My eye exam was very thorough. The girls up front were also helpful in picking out my frames.

18.description: I have been going to Village Eyecare since I moved to the South Loop in 2012 and I have been very pleased!  I have seen 2 doctors there (Dr. Sood and 1 other who's name I unfortunately can't remember now) and have been very impressed with both.  They were very personable and were able to explain the issues that I have with my eyes very well.  I have not bought glasses from Village Eyecare but have been very happy with my contact selection and options.  Additionally, the staff that work in the main area are so friendly and also very willing to accommodate any request.  I did have to go to a different location to get a glaucoma test in 2013 but I believe that now the south loop location also does that test and I will be able to go there when I get it done this year so no real complaints there!  Would definitely recommend!

41.description: Dropped in  to see if Village Eyecare could mend my 9-year-old daughter's glasses while on our way to a music lesson.  The glasses were held together by a staple. (clever, but temporary). Jennifer greated us warmly, treated my daughter like a true customer and teamed with Christopher to fix us up, clean the lenses and send us on our way in no time.  Great service. Friendly people (and stylish eyeglasses in stock too).    The kind of experience made for sharing on Yelp with a big thank you to Village Eyecare.

52.description: So, in the middle of Restaurant Week (God bless it!) this review is going to stick out like a sore thumb (or dry eyes in this particular case) but you know what?!?!?As shocking as it may sound, there is not only food in life.Nope.I know!! Weird, huh?More seriously though - I have to admit that I found my health providers exclusively through Yelp these last couple of years. It's an awesome way to 'shop' and learn more about the people you are entrusting your body with.Not a small feast.One of my Yelp cuties recommended this place and particularly Dr Sarai, and I immediately made an appointment. I have been suffering from dry eyes for a long time now, and nothing has helped. Eye drops only bring a temporary relief and I am beginning to have pronounced dark circles on top of acute discomfort. Time for an intervention.Dr. Sarai was very thorough in his examination, and even more so in his explanations of my condition. He came up with different solutions and gave me a follow-up appointment in two months to see how they work for me.I just loved it.Staff - really nice and helpful.Parking - easy, metered on Wabash.Two (sore) thumbs up.

50.description: love it!  chris is fantastic...he is honest - as people should be. took the time to go through all the eyeglass options, wouldn't let me find fondness with any unappealing for my face options. 110% helpful, attentive, and welcoming. quick turn around time too, had my prescription eye-ware in a weeks time.over all, completely confident and happy with the prodesign: denmark glasses i chose, and ok with the cost....even with travelocity sending me price updates at the same cost for a trip to spain. my last glasses purchase was 10yrs ago, possibly 1/3rd the price, but definitely no where near the good experience. this time around - i know if i have a problem they will gladly help me out, he actually put the center of vision where it should be, i'm going to wear these things all the time....and thats coming from a girl that wears her 2week contacts atleast for a month.good people, good glasses.....need/want some glasses or shades for the long or short haul, south loop village eye care will provide.

4.description: Very friendly and helpful staff. Easy to schedule appointments.

6.description: I have been going to Village Eyecare in South Loop a year now. Excellent staff and customer service. I always satisfied every time. I highly recommend.

22.description: I've gotten great glasses at the South Loop location. The staff is very friendly and accomodating, and the doctor is thorough and friendly.  I'll definitely go back for my next pair.

15.description: Great to have in the neighborhood. Service and products/selection always above and beyond.

57.description: It really all depends on what you're looking for.  This place is really more of an eyeglasses boutique rather than a full eye care facility.  They have a nice selection of ultra high-end frames and lenses.  If you're looking for quality eyeglasses or contacts at a competitive price, there's nothing wrong with Pear Vision, etc.  Think Nordstrom vs. Wal-Mart for eye wear.  Both are just fine and certainly have their places.I second the notion of UIC's Eye and Ear Infirmary as a more cost-conscience and eye health-oriented alternative.  Village Eyecare dropped the ball a few times on the health side when they failed to follow up with me for a minor eye issue.  Again, more boutique than practice.My only other gripe with the South Loop location is the impossible parking situation.  I made several visits for glasses and then prescription shades and can't remember ever trolling for less than 20 minutes every time.  For this reason, should I have a need to return, I'd likely try the Taylor Street location.As far as eyeglasses, I've worn many a pair since grade school and now wear surgical loupes to perform tedious surgeries for several hours each day.  I am extremely picky and exacting in what I want in eyeglasses.  Simply put, the everyday glasses I got here are the best ones I've ever had.  They were expensive as hell, even with insurance, but I don't regret any part of it.  They didn't up-sell me on anything.  I requested the thinnest, most bullet-proof, space shuttle technology-enhanced lenses possible, and that's precisely what I feel I'm wearing right now.   My otherwise relatively thick prescription enjoys correction with the thinnest lenses I've ever seen.  They're pretty tough, too.As for insurance, it is an unfortunate hassle for most people.  At the same time, be glad if you have it at all, especially "add ons" like vision and dental.  I don't think it's fair to completely vilify Village Eyecare for insurance issues.  As a private practice doctor myself, I deal with insurance companies on a daily basis.  **Most of the time, it is nearly impossible for a health care provider to determine the exact amount of coverage in the absolute permutation of individual insurance benefits under a given company and even policy.**  Even at that, some insurance companies simply won't talk to anyone other than the insured, so a lot of times offices can't even call anymore to check benefits!  Companies that make policy reference available for verification online often include clauses giving them the right to adjust coverage as they see fit.  Kinda freaky.  I think there's a certain amount of responsibility people need to take for their own healthcare.  Patients should know their benefits.  If a policy doesn't cover something it seems like it should, the patient should contact his or her HR department!  It's not fair to automatically assume it's the evil doctor trying to weasel someone out of extra money.  If private practice doctors did this, we would not have any patients.  This I assure youOn the other hand, in an effort to avoid confusion and ticked off clients, I think Village Eyecare could make a better effort to encourage patients to check benefits directly themselves and remind them that coverage estimates provided by the store are just that--estimates.  Actual co-pays and/or patient responsibilities could be more or less than the estimate.On another note, keep in mind that under HIPAA (Google it), doctors cannot even verify or deny that a person posting a review is actually a patient.  So much for the checks and balances of free speech.

20.description: I am a satisfied customer. All the staff was friendly and concerned with my comfort. The exam was thorough. My new glasses fit better than the old ones. And the prescription must be accurate, since I can see better than before.

36.description: I came here after purchasing a yelp voucher and the care I received was excellent. The staff and doctor were super friendly and thorough. The doctor made some solid recommendations for my eye health and the optician even checked some web sites to make sure I was getting the best price for the contacts after I mentioned that I might buy them online instead. He completely respected that was trying to save money. The prices were very close so I just ended up buying them there. The office emailed me a day or two later to tell me my contacts were ready to be picked up and they are a perfect fit.I want to add that some businesses treat you with less respect or try to upcharge you when you come in with a Groupon or a yelp deal. That was not the case here. I was even given a 15% selfpay discount for the eye exam which helped to offset the cost of the contact lenses even further.

14.description: Wonderful experience! The staff is amazing. they were super helpful. They have a great selection of glasses different from what you find at other places. This will definitely be my new yearly eye glass place.

58.description: Good food, fast delivery and outstanding service. I recommen this restaurant to my family and friends and they love it. I order from this restaurant at least twice a week. And now we're regular customer.

56.description: Ordered 4 entries and they all came with one rice container. Rice smelled like a cleaner product and we couldn't eat it. Restaurant wouldn't do anything about it. Can't believe they would lose a customer over this. All 4 dishes tasted the same too!

29.description: I've experienced better , every gravy tastes the same.

42.description: My favorite curry in Chicago.

23.description: The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place. They also do deliveries!

47.description: You know how sometimes Lamb Vindaloo is medium spice? Sort of a "white person vindaloo" recipe? Well, not here. You want heat? You got it.Good service, polite service, good wine, good beer. One more nice addition to the south loop repertoire of good places to eat.

8.description: Fantastic food! For vegetarians, the palek paneer is my favorite, rich and flavorful, so filling. Non-veg, I suggest trying the lamb seekh kabab and chicken vindaloo. Everything is fresh and pretty authentic, served in gracious servings. I have never been to the restaurant which I plan on doing soon, but I can say that their delivery is amazing! I have nothing but great things to say about the food - about once a month I treat myself and splurge. Completely comforting and delicious!!! If I lived any closer I would be there every week I'm sure.

31.description: Went for a second time, ordered Banghan Bartha (spell?) and it was the best I ever had. The okra dish was also super. So good, I had to revise my rating from before.

34.description: I walk by this place everyday .Sometimes twice a day when I'm walking my dogs, and there is nothing that gets your stomach growling like the smell of Indian spices.  I don't claim to know much about Indian food.  Ask me the difference between a Vindaloo sauce and a Tikka Masala and you'll be greeted with the same look my dogs give me when I talk to them.  I am, however, a doctor.  So I got that going for me.  Take my review for what you will.  Where do I start?
