 The restaurant is bigger on the inside than it looks.  It's a bit tucked away being off Plymouth in a neighborhood, and there isn't much for parking in the area.  The inside of the restaurant is pretty stereotypical for an ethnic restaurant.  They got a large buffet section if you come for lunch, and it sounds like it's a pretty good deal.  I haven't tried the buffet yet, so I'll save that for my next review.  We started with a Flying Horse beer to share.  They have your typical Indian tourist beers too: Kingfisher,Taj Mahal, and Flying Horse.  They all pretty much taste the same.  They are the equivalent of Bud light in the states.  But you know, its from India so it tastes better with Indian food.  The food is as follows:Chicken Momo: Nepalese chicken dumplings.  The meat was dry, and not overly tasty.  I wouldn't order it again.Vegetable Samosas: A nice fry on the outside, not oily at all, but a bit too much dough.  The filling was good, and for $4.95, not a bad dealButter Chicken: fantastic.  I love butter chicken, and Chicago curry house does not disappoint.   Sweet and creamy and spicy.  Everything a good butter chicken should be.  Your taste buds will be pleased.Naan: Nothing beats good naan, and they do it right.  I could almost make a meal out of naan, I probably would if my girlfriend wouldn't get mad at me.The service was great too.  Everyone was very polite, and the wait time was very reasonable.   The prices are a bit high to me (I've just moved to this city), but I don't think they're unusual for Chicago.

16.description: The restaurant is in an unassuming corner of a brick office building. A sign on the street corner will guide you there. Stopped in for lunch after the Chicago Marathon. The place offers a nice, but standard Indian buffet. There was a black lentil dalh that was delicious and unique. A nice place for Indian food. Good value.

13.description: The person who took our order gave us a demeaning look just because we ordered a "small" amount of food (2 apps, 1 entree, 2 naan for 3 people). We even had some leftovers from that. They raised the prices on the main entrees to the point where you can get much better food for cheaper elsewhere. The service is bad. The waiters always try to hurry you up if they sense that you won't order a lot of food, even if the restaurant is empty. We've been here multiple times and every time they disappoint. The only thing they are good at is the Kasmiri Naan. That thing is freakin' awesome!

11.description: You know how sometimes Lamb Vindaloo is medium spice? Sort of a "white person vindaloo" recipe? Well, not here. You want heat? You got it.Good service, polite service, good wine, good beer. One more nice addition to the south loop repertoire of good places to eat.

39.description: Ordered delivery from here hoping to find a go-to Indian delivery place and didn't even finish a first serving.  Three veggie entrees - not much flavor.  The veggie korma, besides not having a flavorful sauce, had lame vegetables.  Corn, lima beans, peas, small carrot squares, and small green beans; it was IDENTICAL to your generic frozen vegetable medley.  In fact, it tasted like it *was* just that.  The pakoras were cold and completely soggy and the samosas were oddly bland.  My husband and I will look elsewhere for Indian.

37.description: Still the bomb.Still delicious.Still the best Indian buffet in the city.Still winning that South Loop Indian Restaurant Steez.Still sending people there and to their other spot, Nepal House, on 13th and Michigan.Still loving it. Still want you to get there.STILL that good.

0.description: I walk by this place everyday .Sometimes twice a day when I'm walking my dogs, and there is nothing that gets your stomach growling like the smell of Indian spices.  I don't claim to know much about Indian food.  Ask me the difference between a Vindaloo sauce and a Tikka Masala and you'll be greeted with the same look my dogs give me when I talk to them.  I am, however, a doctor.  So I got that going for me.  Take my review for what you will.  Where do I start?  The restaurant is bigger on the inside than it looks.  It's a bit tucked away being off Plymouth in a neighborhood, and there isn't much for parking in the area.  The inside of the restaurant is pretty stereotypical for an ethnic restaurant.  They got a large buffet section if you come for lunch, and it sounds like it's a pretty good deal.  I haven't tried the buffet yet, so I'll save that for my next review.  We started with a Flying Horse beer to share.  They have your typical Indian tourist beers too: Kingfisher,Taj Mahal, and Flying Horse.  They all pretty much taste the same.  They are the equivalent of Bud light in the states.  But you know, its from India so it tastes better with Indian food.  The food is as follows:Chicken Momo: Nepalese chicken dumplings.  The meat was dry, and not overly tasty.  I wouldn't order it again.Vegetable Samosas: A nice fry on the outside, not oily at all, but a bit too much dough.  The filling was good, and for $4.95, not a bad dealButter Chicken: fantastic.  I love butter chicken, and Chicago curry house does not disappoint.   Sweet and creamy and spicy.  Everything a good butter chicken should be.  Your taste buds will be pleased.Naan: Nothing beats good naan, and they do it right.  I could almost make a meal out of naan, I probably would if my girlfriend wouldn't get mad at me.The service was great too.  Everyone was very polite, and the wait time was very reasonable.   The prices are a bit high to me (I've just moved to this city), but I don't think they're unusual for Chicago.

38.description: As others have said, and this is a very strange fact, this restaurant smells good from the OUTSIDE. As friends were walking me here for the first time, I knew we were almost there by the terrific aroma of Indian food. This dissipates inside, because obviously vents direct the great aromas out of doors. Inside there is a comfortable arrangement of tables and booths, and I found the service to be friendly indeed. I won't say the menu breaks any new ground for frequent diners on Indian cuisine, but all the favorites are here, and in my experience well prepared. The samosas were delicious, and so was the nan. Lamb saag (with spinach) was tasty and prepared to the exact degree of spiciness I requested. My friend Phil's buttery chicken was just great. Others had shrimp and chicken vindaloo and they were pleased. I prefer aloo paratha with much more potato stuffing, and they were out of mango chutney, but these are small things. If you're searching for Indian or Nepalese food in the south Loop, you might want to give this place a try.

51.description: Top Indian cuisine we have enjoyed in Chicago in 25 years..and we have tried them all.We are both career chefs and are often asked by personal chef clients to serveour South Indian fare. The recipes in this kitchen are more nuanced than any Chicago Indian establishment we have dined at. SPICY ,not for the novice but fans of Indian cuisine will love this kitchen and menu.Many vegan options and low oil/ghee on 6 items we had delivered.Delivery was  speedy, items was carefully packaged, items in containers wrapped with plastic so no spillage.  Food was still hot upon delivery Outstanding!

27.description: We've been ordering from Chicago Curry House for years now, and we are never disappointed. Everything always arrives hot and the orders are always accurate, fresh, and delicious. I love the chana masala and the chicken tikka, and have also enjoyed a number of other vegetable as well as chicken dishes in the past, and all have been top notch. Their naan and their samosas are also very nice. The portions are very large as well. The one down side is it seems rather expensive every time we order from here.

32.description: Totally dissappointed. Not at all preferred for south indians!! No biryani no starters!! No chicken curries

54.description: Had the Lamb curry while wife had the Shrimp curry . Very good indeed and will be going back .

48.description: This place was very good, food was tasty and service was on point. There is really nothing negative to say. The environment is a bit library like, a little too quiet for me with soothing Nepalese music in background. I live in Rogers Park so I'm used to the lively Indian/Pakistani restaurants. I had the Non Veg Bhojay which gave me a good sample of the Nepalese entrees. Super tasty. The Lamb was ok, I've had extremely good lamb at a Serbian place so I know what it should be like if really cooked well. I did not have dessert but the coffee was great.  I wouldn't mind going again if I was in the area but wouldn't make the trip from the Northside just to dine there.

44.description: The food was delicious. However I came here with friends & I told him they had never tried Indian food before instead of making recommendations he stood around awkwardly waiting for us to pick something. I had chicken mikhani $14.95 and it came with a side of basmati rice. It was rich and spicy, I really enjoyed it. The food arrived in a reasonable amount of time. The mango Lassi which was chilled mango and yogurt was to die for. The garlic naan was okay, nothing to write home about. I would definetly swing by again for a taste of Indian food but not with a group because the restaurant does not seem to friendly.

24.description: My son and I loved the food!! Great Choice!!

7.description: 5 Star for their home delivery menu1 Star for their buffet menuI have ordered home delivery from Chicago Curry House many a times now, and it has always been a nice experience. I loved their food. So with the same impression, I went to their Sunday lunch buffet once, hoping to be amazed again. And yes I was, but not pleasantly!! Their buffet spread was so meager, there was hardly any selection. All the vegetables looked poor cooked and half of the trays were empty. Whatever was there, tasted only OK. Extremely disappointing! One of the worst, or probably the worst buffet experience ever.

49.description: Ordered delivery for the 1st time and will definitely be my lastFood:3 cold and expensiveDelivery service: 2

40.description: I seriously love this place. It smells so good when you walk by that you absolutely must eat there. It never seems to be too busy. And I've been a fan of pretty much all of the dishes, except I wasn't as impressed by the Lamb Vindaloo as I have been at other establishments (although those places are no where near Chicago), and I tried a cauliflower dish I probably wouldn't order again but just because there were better options. The meal is very shareable, so come with a group a order a bunch. I particularly like the Jhane Ko Dal, any of the Paneer, any of the spinach dishes, the Baigan Bharta, and the Butter Chicken. The Chicken Biryani is also spectacular. And don't forget the garlic naan.

53.description: I will never order from this place again. I ordered through Grub Hub (which I've always had pleasant experiences with) and I only ordered from here because it is one of the few places that offers Regular Lassi, not just mango. I am extremely allergic to mango. I ordered 2 regular lassi along with $45 of other food. They delivered MANGO lassi. I called the driver first, he did not answer. Then I called the restaurant manager and he told me that he would refund me the money (even though I paid cash). I asked, will you bring 2 regular lassi? He said, "No, because I would have to pay a delivery fee to bring you back out another order." I said, well I paid a delivery fee ($8) for food that was not delivered. So if you won't bring me the food I ordered, then I want a refund of the delivery fee as well." He said no and hung up. I then called GrubHub. They called the restaurant. They told me that the manager would send someone to bring me back $10 cash only for the lassi. When I asked Grub Hub about the delivery fee, they said the manager would not refund the $8. Grub Hub gave me a $5 credit which was nice. But what kind of sense does that make?!! They will bring me back my cash (which 30 minutes later they still have not) but they won't refund the delivery fee or bring what I ordered?!! At this point, their incompetence, rudeness, and lack of customer service has me distrustful of eating their food at all. What a waste!

30.description: So, so, so, so good. Omg, so good. I am still on a high from the delicious food served here. Had some lamb with incredible spice. Had some bread. Had some rice. My cousin, who dined with me, had some sort of vegetarian dish. I don't really know what to tell you, except that this place is incredible. I will be back.

46.description: Overall it's bad for Chicago that there's better Indian food by far in Florida and Texas than there is here. Chicago Curry House s one of the 'better' Chicago Indian places but the quality is not matching the price, and the sheer randomness of the spice levels in their food despite specific requests for "mild", and the management's nonchalance that this is a reasonable customer issue despite constructive feedback tells me that they have no interest in being a truly excellent top tier Indian restaurant. Management feedback response - "This is Indian food, it's supposed to be spicy" might be considered old school charming by some, but to this reviewer shows they just don't care about the customer and having some standardization of spice levels. Specifically some dishes are pretty tasty - butter chicken, tandoori prawns - but others like the palak paneer are just meh. Some nice vegetable options but as this review suggests already - don't be surprised if you order something traditionally not spicy come back hot tamale spicy (like tandoori vegetables). My advice - order "As mild as possible" with every order even if it is not a traditionally spicy and you will at least have a 75/25 chance of it being mild enough for someone who hasn't burned all of his/her taste buds with cayenne to not be sweating profusely to survive the experience.

1.description: Worst Indian food ever!! I wouldnt recommend Curry house to anyone. We have given it a couple of tries and has been disappointing every single time. There are much better places to get Indian food in Chicago downtown and this one doesnt come close. Last week I ordered my two favourite dishes Paneer Kadhai and Aloo gobhi....it was the worst aloo gobhi I have ever tasted in my whole life. We didnt even eat it. Paneer Kadhai was nothing like what paneer kadhai is..although they claim that's how they make it there. The samosas were good to be fair. Aloo gobhi and paneer was so bad that I made the effort to call them the next day and give them the feedback. The person who answered the phone said that he will convey my message to the supervisor who will call me back which never happened either. My friends have had similar experience with the food. Not recommended especially if you know what authentic Indian food is like.

55.description: Couldn't love this place more. Their food always tastes great, their restaurant is quaint and peaceful to dine in and street parking was easy to find.  Also, they delivery service comes almost as soon as you order it, and their customer service is top notch. My go-to Indian restaurant in the downtown area.

9.description: OMGosh it's ok that you think you hate curry--thick and yellow and yuck--but you're a fool to not come here.Get your "geosocial" head out of its dark place and prepare for a soul-awakening level of spice of one of the 1000's and 1000's of combinations in addition to those choices that overtly include curry. Vegetarian dishes are a specialty here, and the meat flies off the bone too. The menu is rich in choice and clarity, with sweet Indian Customer Service rarely experienced this side of the Pacific Ocean. Eat here. Take a chance. Be brave. Don't stay stuck. You can be stuck at home, any time.

26.description: This restaurant has deteriorated over time. The other evening I had the chicken tikka masala. A frozen dinner from trader joes would have been better. The chicken was rubbery and tasted processed and precooked. The sauce had no flavor and the rice was dry and cold. Very disappointing.

25.description: I visited here and ordered chicken samosa, lamb curry, naan, and coke.First, I ate chicken samosa, unfortunately, I failed to find chicken inside it.Only potato and spices were in the samosa.Lamb curry and naan was good.Especially, the cook removed the bad smell of lamb perfectly.Also, the texture of naan was nice, too.So they were totally good except tough onion (or green onion) in the curry.I thought here is 4 stars of 5.But a waiter was really weird.Before yesterday, I hadn't have an experience that waiter/waitress threw the receipt on my table.Of course, I finally got that experience, and twice, when I checked the receipt and signed.In addition, when he gave me the packed food, it was same, almost threw the food on my table.That's why I'm giving just 2 stars to this restaurant.So I don't recommend this restaurant who consider of service.But if you really like curry or are too tired of friendly waiter/waitress, you can go there.

12.description: If you have a NUT allergy- beware!!!! My company ordered catered lunch from here and we told the restaurant that I had a nut allergy, but they swore that nothing had nuts except for the rice pudding. So I went ahead and believed them and ate rice, chicken, lamb, paneer... After a few bites I developed a severe allergic reaction! A couple days ago our coordinator talked to the restaurant owner about this, and this time he admitted that the lamb curry had cashews in it! What if I had had an anaphylactic reaction that killed me?? Nut allergies are NOT a joke and should not be taken lightly. The fact that people from this restaurant lied to us and put my life in danger sickens me. I will never eat from this restaurant again. I hope they read this review and learn to be honest before they get sued.

59.description: Great service and seated quickly. We enjoyed the veggie samosa's and onion baji. The baji were light. (More rice flour than chickpea) made them light and crispy. Eat them fast because they seem to get soggy quickly as they cool.The chicken briyani was not flavorful and was our least favorite. The lamb vindaloo was spicy good and loaded with lamb. The chicken korma was very mild, but deliciously stewed and tender. We liked the nan - especially the onion one.

21.description: I went to the Curry House before a night out and really enjoyed it. I had the chicken mo mo but it was more than filling. My friend had the lamb vindaloo and she said it was the best she had tried in a long time. I can't wait to try their buffet which they have daily. Plan to go back soon.

17.description: i had food from here thrice. First time was buffet. This was ok neither great nor bad food but they did have a lot of varietes which was good. Last 2 times were delivery first time they took 2.5 hrs and second time superfast dominos delivery.Food was great when delivery was late and food was below average while delivery was quick. So i am not ordering delivery again for sure. 3* rating is they are neither great nor bad. Worth a visit kinda place.I would rather visit than order for delivery. I like the Poori here. Vegetarian dishes in buffet is good. Chicken I haven't tasted. I would like goat to be cooked more. Overall okie dokie.

10.description: This is our neighborhood curry house and we love their goat curry! We order from them about twice a month and would probably order there more if there were more available dishes suitable for our four year old twins ( they are adventurous with food but there seems to be few entrees on the menu of suitable mildness). Delivery is always very timely and they are very polite. Can't go wrong with this place!

5.description: We ordered delivery for a large group, so we got 50% of the menu. Overall, the food was good and not too spicy. I will definitely order from them again.Only improvement that they need to make is to write on each container what's inside, we were busy guessing what's in the box. Packing wasnt the best especially for the samosas, and they didn't send us forks even though we asked from them.

3.description: I went here twice while attending a conference at the nearby Hilton, which as far as I can tell, ought to be the only reason anyone might go here voluntarily.I got the impression that their food was pre-made somehow. Either that or they are obsessive about making sure that their food always tastes exactly the same. They were unable to omit the dairy from anything containing dairy, something that plenty of other Indian places are happy to do. They also won't let you choose the level of heat. Everything is "medium."Avoid this place if you are vegan. I got the Aloo Gobi both times since I was told that my only dairy-free options were chickpeas or cauliflower. Yes, there was heat (too much for my tastes), but mainly it was bland and the cauliflower undercooked. It was exactly the same both times. At least they are consistent.

35.description: I am a fussy eater when it comes to desi (read: South Asian) food. Ate the brunch here. And  very happy.Slightly relieved too. Finally I found a place where they cook with minimal oil, and they understand light flavours...probably has to do with the Nepalese/ NE Indian palate.Now for the specifics. The Farsi green beans in a light light light coconut curry  were lovely. The gobi (cauliflower) and bhindi (lady finger) pakoras are great too...as is the green chutney that goes with it. The yoghurt was slightly sour. The Jhane Ko dal was lovely too. Palak paneer is more Palak than paneer which is how I like it, but paneer needs to melt in your mouth darlings, which it barely does. It needs to be cooked into the Palak so that they don't taste as separate items. The chicken makhani is exactly the way everyone I know loves it. Papad could be fresher. The kheer needs some sprucing - dry fruits and  caramelising. Mutton needs to be tender but the curry was lovely and had the least amount of oil used to cook all mutton dishes I have eaten outside. Other desi restaurants,  are you watching?!

19.description: Still the bomb.Still delicious.Still the best Indian buffet in the city.Still winning that South Loop Indian Restaurant Steez.Still sending people there and to their other spot, Nepal House, on 13th and Michigan.Still loving it. Still want you to get there.STILL that good.

28.description: Excellent food, lousy service. On Friday night, was told the $33 multi-course dinner special, on the second page of the menu, wasn't available because "we're too busy tonight"! Also, upon arriving for our reservation, sat at the bar to wait for my party. Was told by the bartender I could be seated. Within 5 minutes, was approached by the host, asked if I could get up and give the table to another party! Luckily my group was walking in just then.In short, do not go here on a busy night!

45.description: Very pedestrian Nepalese food. We went here because we were staying nearby we wouldn't go back.

33.description: Starters r ok. Main course is not good. Not many items in lunch buffet. Definitely not a good place for SOUTH INDIAN'S. I would rather suggest HEMA'S Kitchen in Devon.

43.description: All dishes were good Paneer as expected as we get in india didn't felt like it was frozen

2.description: Came here tonight as I was in the mood for some good Indian food and live in the neighborhood.  Came in and the place was about 3/4 full.  A nice, quiet, dimly lit atmosphere with light chatter.  After being seated with a menu, waited about ten minutes for the waiter to take my order, and get my glass of water filled.  Brought out a Flatbread cracker (sorry not sure of its name), with three sauces to put on it.  About five minutes later, my order of butter chicken and na'an arrived. The na'an was nice, thin, light, and perfectly finished.  The butter chicken wasn't bad, a few pieces of gristle type meat, but otherwise not bad.  The seasoning was nice and the sauce not bad.  Overall the service was the only downer as I had to wait about 10 minutes after I finished for a refill on my water (twice) and it took about 15 minutes to get the bill.  The slow speed might have been because they were understaffed, but otherwise it was ok.

18.description: I don't understand where  all these good or ok reviews are coming from. I live close to chicago Curry house and I have personally bought food from them only 3 times and this is in the last 1.5 years. every time I get food from here, there is always something bad. This time it is both the delivery and the food. They delivered the food almost 1.5 hrs after I placed the order on a Tuesday evening and absolutely no reason for that. Second the food delivered late was so raw and bad. I ordered the Navrathan kurma and it was navrathan kurma only by name and nowhere any close by taste. bottom line there are better places in the city and I would not waste my money ever again here.

41.description: We decided to try out the place on a Saturday night. A corner lot the place looks out onto a quiet street just off of State Street. It has a relaxed dark decor with a few booths and tables. Entering there is a bar with the tables located on either side. The menu consists of a selection of Indian and Nepalese dishes with a good selection of vegetarian options. We opted for a selection of appetizers, including onion bhajis (yum), veggie momo's (meh), bhel poori (delicious), a garlic man and a lamb dish for my friend (He loved it). The service was fast and attentive and a great value for the price. Really a good choice for anyone interested in Indian or Nepalese food in Chicago.

52.description: Usually ordered takeout for work and it was always good. First time dining in with a few family members. Great food! Good price. Got lots of food and easily shareable.

50.description: Ugh. Tasteless tikka masala. It just isn't good. Read my reviews of other Indian restaurants. This isn't good. It isn't terrible. I guess "fair" would be fair.  Go elsewhere.

4.description: It was a good experience. Enjoyed the dishes. A bit disappointed at the dessert (Rasmalai); should be soft and chewy but was a bit hard and didn't taste like the usual ones. Also, they could do better on the chicken chili and bhel puri. Loved the chicken tikka masala though and the garlic naan. Since I am a native to these food, it wasn't as good as I have had before. The price was a bit high comparing to the quantity and quality of the food. But would recommend anyone who hasn't tried Nepali food before.

6.description: The staff was so friendly and nice! Definitely enjoyed their service. But the entrees were a bit disappointing; not as packed with flavor as I would have liked.It is a great place for groups in terms of layout though.

22.description: If you have a NUT allergy- beware!!!! My company ordered catered lunch from here and we told the restaurant that I had a nut allergy, but they swore that nothing had nuts except for the rice pudding. So I went ahead and believed them and ate rice, chicken, lamb, paneer... After a few bites I developed a severe allergic reaction! A couple days ago our coordinator talked to the restaurant owner about this, and this time he admitted that the lamb curry had cashews in it! What if I had had an anaphylactic reaction that killed me?? Nut allergies are NOT a joke and should not be taken lightly. The fact that people from this restaurant lied to us and put my life in danger sickens me. I will never eat from this restaurant again. I hope they read this review and learn to be honest before they get sued.

15.description: No matter how good food is, bad service gets 0 star. I called for delivery from work, after end of my order, i was getting my credit card and i heard from the other side "please hurry up", i asked him to repeat And he replied back with "we don't have all day to take order, hurry up". I have never experienced something like this before. The name of the person who was taking my order, was Miraj.

57.description: Went with a small group for my friend's birthday. Overall good experience. The chicken tikka masala and lamb curry were my favorites. Dishes are a bit small, so keep that in mind when ordering. Also, the garlic naan is great, so get that instead of/ in addition to plain.

20.description: I like Indian food, though my Indian friends told me that no Indian food in Chicago restaurants is good. I think everything in curry house looks good. If you are not good at eating spicy food, maybe you should order something mild. I would recommend Lamb curry or Chicken curry. Garlic Nan is a must.

36.description: OMGosh it's ok that you think you hate curry--thick and yellow and yuck--but you're a fool to not come here.Get your "geosocial" head out of its dark place and prepare for a soul-awakening level of spice of one of the 1000's and 1000's of combinations in addition to those choices that overtly include curry. Vegetarian dishes are a specialty here, and the meat flies off the bone too. The menu is rich in choice and clarity, with sweet Indian Customer Service rarely experienced this side of the Pacific Ocean. Eat here. Take a chance. Be brave. Don't stay stuck. You can be stuck at home, any time.

14.description: I like Indian food, though my Indian friends told me that no Indian food in Chicago restaurants is good. I think everything in curry house looks good. If you are not good at eating spicy food, maybe you should order something mild. I would recommend Lamb curry or Chicken curry. Garlic Nan is a must.

1.description: This is my local bookstore around the corner from me. I can't say I have always been fair to them and tried to buy local, so yesterday I was in need of some new reading materials and I decided to go to Sandmeyer. I walk in and an older man was at the desk. He did not greet me. I asked for help with a book. He got it for me but did not engage in any conversation with me. I paid for my books and I got a paltry "thanks".If you want locals to get up and come to your store when Amazon will deliver a book to my door in an hour maybe you should try a little harder to be nice and engaging.

9.description: Great local, old school bookstore with classic wood floors and good variety for such a small space.

12.description: I work in the neighborhood and have been to Sandmeyer's more than a few times. Usually to pick up a gift or a unique card. I bought a book for a gift recently. They didn't have the exact book I wanted in stock but the salesperson was friendly and showed me some other items from the same author. We did find the exact book from another bookstore which was more appropriate for the receiver so I never gave them the book. I was not able to return the book within their 2 week return policy so the "not so friendly" gentleman put the book back in the bag and said I couldn't return it. No store credit, nothing. I left very disappointed. It gave me that "I'm not going to shop there ever again" feeling.

21.description: I can't believe no one else has reviewed this yet, and I don't even live in Chicago!This bookstore gets four stars only because my friend and I waltzed in 10 minutes before closing and barely had any time to browse before we left so they could shut up shop.But I liked what I saw. Located in Printer's Row, this independent bookstore has been in operation since 1982, and you can tell that the proprietors love books. The business section is fair to middling, but the poetry shelves were impressive. Most appreciated of all, however, were the books that greet you upon entering: A quality selection of design and pop culture-related books.I wish I'd had more time here. I know I'll return, and you should go in my stead! They even have a frequent buyer's program. For $10 a year, you can get 10% discounts on all purchases.

16.description: This bookstore is so great. It's beautiful inside and out, and I love the old smell, look and feel of it. The staff is extremely friendly and they have a great selection of books. It's very cozy and welcoming, unlike some OTHER bookstores in the neighborhood.

17.description: I can't believe no one else has reviewed this yet, and I don't even live in Chicago!This bookstore gets four stars only because my friend and I waltzed in 10 minutes before closing and barely had any time to browse before we left so they could shut up shop.But I liked what I saw. Located in Printer's Row, this independent bookstore has been in operation since 1982, and you can tell that the proprietors love books. The business section is fair to middling, but the poetry shelves were impressive. Most appreciated of all, however, were the books that greet you upon entering: A quality selection of design and pop culture-related books.I wish I'd had more time here. I know I'll return, and you should go in my stead! They even have a frequent buyer's program. For $10 a year, you can get 10% discounts on all purchases.

10.description: This is such a great bookstore. Lovely, quaint, and tucked away in a little section of the South Loop. They have excellent taste in books, all of which fall under a huge range and are very well organized on the shelves. Never have I been in here and not had my questions adequately answered, ranging from "where is... [insert name of a book]?" to "do you have anything on... [insert subject]?" to "Please help. I need something and I don't know what to get." The one and only issue I have with this place is slight, which is that the books are a little more expensive than you would find elsewhere. The reasons for this are obvious: rent in the Loop must be rather high, and it is an independent bookstore after all. Still, if you can, try not to let that deter you. This place is really wonderful, and it's good to support a brick and mortar store where you can reach out and smell the books in front of you.

5.description: Really lovely bookstore, friendly owner and great array of books! Books are priced by the regular price on the back. Love that's it's on Printer's Row which is down the street from where I live! Love the vintage feel of it with the creeky hardwood floors. A great local business to support. Will come back!

11.description: There is so much to love about Sandmeyer's.This quiet, well-organized independent book store has all the things you like from the chain stores, and none of the things you don't.Excellent selection? Check. You can find novels, literary journals, nonfiction, children's titles, and the usual categories you'd look for at Border's or B&N. Unlike those places, however, Sandmeyer's has an excellent selection of local history books. Whether you want a pictorial guide to the suburbs or historical fiction set in Chicago, you'll find it here. A discount program? Check. Sandmeyer's has one, just like the big chain stores, but they won't send you a million emails every day if you sign up for it.Helpful staff? Check. The guy at the register was happy to chat with me about their selection of literary journals, what they normally stock, when they get new ones in, etc. They're also happy to order things for you in many cases.Here are some things Sandmeyer's has that your typical chain store does not: location in a beautiful building in Chicago's historic Printer's Row, proximity to numerous places to grab lunch and read your new book, and excellent displays of the new Penguin books with the beautiful covers, including the great ideas series. The publishing industry as well as bricks and mortar book stores are allegedly in crisis, but Sandmeyer's reminds me of all the reasons I walk into a real store and buy a book instead of downloading something onto an e-reader. The tactile experience of holding one of those new Penguin editions, a "curated" selection of books rather than a few suggestions generated by an algorithm, a staff member to recommend something if you can only buy one thing today but have your eye on three different titles, and yes, that wonderful paper and ink aroma. Plus, if you're like me and you sometimes drop your reading material while perusing it in the bathtub, you're only out $10, not $150+.Did I mention that Sandmeyer's is also convenient to public transit? It is! You can walk to this lovely building from the red, blue, brown, orange, and green lines, and if you don't mind a little walk, it's totally doable from the metra as well.In short, go to Sandmeyer's. Buy a book. Read the book. Repeat as necessary.

3.description: The staff is kind. The store is adorable. Their selection of children's books is incredible. The creaky wood floors make it feel like the coziest little place on the map. The only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars is that their philosophy section is a bit smaller than I'd like. However, they have tons of books elsewhere.

0.description: Beautiful building with helpful staff. The wood floors creek when you walk, which is lovely. There is normally only one copy of a book out so there is a ton to look at!

20.description: Very nice store with a friendly staff.  The selection here was excellent and it's easy to find something in particular and great to browse through the racks.  Not a bad selection of crafty books either.  We bought some books on Chicago hikes, and I'm sure we'll be back again!

19.description: One of my favorite bookstores in the world and one of the best things about Printers Row.  This is the way a bookstore should be.  Creeky wood floors, intimate bookshelves, comfy and cozy atmosphere.  The owners are mavelous and very knowledgeable.  A true gem indeed.

2.description: As previous reviews have stated, the guy working there (who may have been the owner) is not the friendliest, but he is certainly not rude and I found a great book in the sale section at half price which I will be taking home to New York with me as a lovely souvenir! (My Berlin Kitchen by Luisa Weiss).

18.description: I love Sandmeyer's! Not a massive selection being that they have limited space but I dig the aesthetic and can usually find a worthy book at Sandmeyer's. They have the Penguin 'Great Ideas' series which rocks my world. I recently became a VIP meaning I get 10% off all books here. Yayer!

13.description: Nice small independent bookstore. They have a good selection of local flavor books and authors, the remainder of the selection is interesting and diverse, if a little limited. Great Printer's Row loft/storefront atmosphere. The owner is not terribly talkative, so don't expect a lengthy conversation with him, he's pleasant enough, though.

4.description: Lucky to live close to here, the 10% off member card for $10 is a nice touch. Friendly staff. the discount card works for families/couples/etc, which is also nice.

6.description: I absolutely love this store. The service is great but most of all it's in my neighborhood. Having a bookstore in your neighborhood today is rare, and to have one as great as Sandmeyers feels like a luxury. They have a great selection of cards for any occasion and fantastic books. The key to this place is that the volume is low, quality is high.

15.description: This is how a bookstore should be.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff.  It's not a huge store, but big enough.  A great store to "have a look."  Very comfortable atmosphere, good vibe, quiet.

7.description: It's so sad that bookstores are becoming a thing of the past with the advent of the Internet and technology.  This is a really cool bookstore; it's on the first floor in a historic loft building and still has the original creaky hardwood floors and radiators.  I live in the neighborhood and whenever I pass by the store is usually empty.  It's too bad they don't allow dogs, otherwise I would visit more often.

8.description: I live right down the street and come here often, especially to buy birthday and holiday cards at the last minute. The store is pretty with lots of light and the book selection is fairly good, though they are limitted by small size. The shop could do with a couple of spots to sit and read and I wish that they sponsored more cultural events like public readings and signings. But overall, it's a good independent bookstore.

14.description: It's everything I want a book store to be.  So quiet and peaceful.  The historical building is probably why I fell in love initially - the friendly owners make it perfect.  They won't have every single book you're looking for but they'll happily order it for you.  Join their club and you can get 10% off everything for a year.  I love it here.

29.description: Organic, fresh, delicious. Great customer service. It's nice to have this new go-to in the South Loop. Prices are the same (or less) than any other high end juice bar in the city but the servings are bigger. Will definitely be coming here regularly. Highly recommended!

42.description: With sweet, but filling and nutrient-rich smoothies listed alongside more types of grass shots than you can imagine, FruVe's menu can satisfy a range of health food comfort levels. With the exception of the green, the cold-pressed juices tend to be more fruit-forward. The Vino combines grapes, lemon and ginger for a juice that is sweet, tangy and spicy all at once. Though it's not listed on the menu, FruVe' has also been serving a watermelon, mint and basil juice that is incredibly hydrating, sweet and herbal.The menu is seasonal, and it appears the shop is still refining its offering. But for still being in its first weeks of operation, FruVe' has already begun building its community; the owner makes customers feel welcome and makes every attempt to get to know them and their health needs. Juices are a bit expensive, but the shop is worth a visit for the inviting atmosphere and fresh juices.

23.description: The bowls/smoothies are quite good but the prices are outrageous. I realize organic fruits and ingredients are expensive but I don't know how $10 smoothies/bowls are a viable pricing model.

47.description: The staff was very nice but the prices were pretty extreme. They pre make their juices so they are already in the bottle. A drink with three ingredients is 10 dollars. The smoothies are 10 dollars as well. They seem high for other places I have been. Cant come to terms with paying 20  dollars for two quick on the go drinks. At that price point I wish them luck.

8.description: The smoothie was tasty, but the wait and the prices are ridiculous. To top it off, the smoothie barely filled my cup.

31.description: I LOVE this place.  I have been waiting for an organic juice bar to pop up in South Loop and was so excited when this one did.  I had no idea that I'd be getting the amazing experience that I get, because a personalized experience like the one at Fruve is so rare in Chicago.  The owners are so friendly and truly take the time to get to know you!  The "cheers to great health" they say as they hand you your shot of wheat grass or barley grass is such a fun touch.  It is completely worth the price to purchase a juice, smoothie, or acai bowl here - as they are all so filling and give you lots of energy that will last throughout your day.  The acai bowls are the most delicious and beautiful thing!  Try this place & cheers to great health!

34.description: Love this establishment. Tried the Green Bee Acai Bowl. Very filling and delish! The owner was very personable and knowledgeable. Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

16.description: I've only had the chance to visit here twice, but I definitely plan on making it a little more of a regular place to hit up. Fantastic juices, super friendly staff, and even though it's incredibly tasty, you don't feel guilty about the indulgence! The first time I went in, I had a lot of questions about juice cleansing. I can't remember who I spoke to, but she answered all of my questions (and then some), never forced or pressured me to buy anything, and made sure I knew about the student discount (10%) and the current sales they had going on before I made a purchase. Like I said, definitely would love to make it a more regular spot to hit, and highly recommend for anyone looking for a bite to eat or drop to drink in the Loop!

13.description: Delicious, good for you, and the best in the area - thank you for giving the south loop this wonderful health option! I've started to go here after my workouts as it's close by. Their ingredients are fresh and they have a great menu (smoothies, juices, salads, wraps, and acai bowls). The acai bowls are actually filling and come with a generous amount of toppings. Get the rewards card - every 10 smoothies/bowls you buy you get one for free!

11.description: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! Everything is so fresh. It's so hard to choose from the menu because every description sounds so great. If I could afford it, I would definitely be in here daily. It's definitely a special treat and you feel rejuvenated when you leave. I tried the Berry Breezy açai bowl and the cashew milk. Can't wait to go back. If you've never been, GET THERE ASAP!

39.description: Such a fantastic addition to the south loop! The juice is tasty. The staff is knowledgable and friendly. The price is reasonable. It's independently owned and run professionally. I can't wait to do the cleanse!

37.description: Nice addition to the South Loop. Very friendly staff and professional which is VERY important.  Great smoothies and juices. My only issue is the pricing. Now we all know there are many other juice spots in the area that charge between $4 and $5 for a smoothie so in keeping it real a $10 smoothie / $8 cup of juice is a bit extreme for the size that you are getting.  Will I go back, of course.  The friendly staff and professionalism was definitely a high point for me and I would like to experience their other offerings.

0.description: Best Juice cleanse! I have had two cleanses from here and they are the freshest. I stay at the Chicago Hilton, and Dominique delivers two days at a time. I give her a few days notice when I order the week long cleanse. Her team is creative with their combinations. I prefer more green juices and she build a perfect cleanse.I recommend her to all local and traveling friends. I just finished a 7 day cleanse and feel fantastic. The first day is the most challenging but the nut milk fill you up and make the second day easier. Give Dominique a call if you want to reboot your system!

38.description: Terrific place!!! Excellent staff and the organic cold press juices are always fresh, great tasting and they have a good selection to choose from. The location is perfect and the smoothies and acai bowls are great. I'll definitely be a regular. Keep up the great work!!!!!

51.description: Just tried the Vino juice...amaze! Great service, good location and the juices are a good size for the price. I'll def be back when I start my juice fast!

27.description: Try the vino juice!!! One of the best juices I have ever had anywhere. Very nice family owns this great place. Extremely friendly & they take great care preparing everything.

32.description: Very clean and inviting space with a wonderful family running the establishment. The type of place you can tell the owners take a lot of pride in. The ladies at the front greet you with a smile and truly care about getting the right juice/bowl for you!Today I had the acai bowl with strawberries, granola and banana! I asked the lady at the front if all of the ingredients are organic and she said yes! That's really exciting. A lot of places (like pealed on Sheffield) give organic vibes but have admitted to not being 100% true. My bowl was delicious and filled with flavor, worth every penny.I see people here complaining about the price, but you are not taking into account that the cost to run an establishment in DOWNTOWN CHICAGO is expensive and so is FRESH ORGANIC PRODUCE. No where in the city has cheap organic smoothies...that doesn't even make sense. Also as Chicagoans we should be supporting LOCAL FAMILIES and SMALL BUSINESSES as opposed to big corporations.   this place!

48.description: I Love this place! FruVé has helped me increase my intake on veggies and fruit! Instead of coffee in the morning before school everyday I come here and get a Smoothie or Acai bowl! Great prices and tasty product!! So many benefits to drinking these organic juices and I must say my body is feeling better already! I must recommend my favorite the Berry Breezy Acai Bowl or the Mango Acai Bowl. Great customer service..if you have never juiced before they help you and explain what everything is and I love the atmosphere! Glad to finally have a Organic Juice Bar in the South Loop area! MUST TRY!!!

44.description: Love, love, love fresh juices. This place nails it. Everything organic, super clean, friendly, and knowledgeable on the healthy benefits of the fruit and veggies blended. This place is a winner! Worth the price! Service is excellent!! Everything I've tried so far is beyond expectation.

24.description: Stopped here with a coworker last week while in town on a business trip. I had a "warrior" smoothie while my coworker had a "gym rat" (I believe that was the name of it). Both of us were pleasantly surprised at the drinks being so tasty and also refreshing! We were also greeted by the owner (sorry....bad with names) who was extremely friendly and informative! Def will be back on my next trip!

7.description: Omg this place is da bomb. Like da bomb dot com. The Balance bowl and the Green Mylk is where its at. So healthy!!! They do everything in house obviously and all the ingredients are fresh! The girls working here are super knowledgeable about the products they use and the superfoods! They have a menu of all the superfoods they use with full explanation and benefits for each one!!! The place is bright, spacious but inviting! I am so lucky this place is right by our house. :) I highly recommend it and will definitely be coming here again and again!!!

49.description: This place gives me wings!  it is really a feel good experience. Although I'm originally from Chicago,  I live in NYC and I'm constantly searching for a juice bar when I come home.  This is it. it's a cozy place where you can exchange information with the staff and other customers about their healthy lifestyle journey.  you feel like you're in the company of friends.  friends that care about your health.  Me and another customer took Wheatgrass shots at the bar.  So fun!  and I feel great.  love this place!

40.description: Great selection, really fresh organic ingredients and friendly knowledgeable staff. Good place to get a protein shake, juiced veggies or fruits, and exotic lunch and smoothie options. Lots of cold pressed juices.

30.description: I'd been hearing about this place and decided to give it a try. The juices and smoothies are completely organic and combine flavors you'd never imagine would taste so refreshing!When you walk in, the staff always greets you warmly and, even with so much going on in making the smoothies, they always engage in friendly conversation. On my first visit, I was overwhelmed by what to get with the long list of offerings and their ingredients listed on the chalkboard to the right. I asked Dominique, so friendly and great at what she does, what she'd recommend with examples of things I normally like. Her recommendation was spot on, but not before she let me sample some leftovers of my friends' smoothies to get a feel for my taste buds. How thoughtful, right?!But it wasn't just me! The guy in front of me had more smoothie leftover in the blender than could fit in his cup, so she asked if he had a minute to drink the rest and poured it in a [wheatgrass] shot glass (to be returned). I was totally blown away by this honesty system...you literally get all that you pay for! On my second visit, I was the only patron in the store. Dominique was still very friendly and personable and she offered me a sample of a beet juice (beets, pear, lemon & ginger--the "Heartbeat"). She never once pressured me to buy it. She simply wanted to expose me to the juices they offer and I was thoroughly impressed! Great new hip place with organic ingredients that reenergize you and gives a top notch customer experience. Certainly worth every penny.

46.description: First of all this place is incredible. I'm a college student whose often around unhealthy restaurant options so this place is a great alternative when the burgers and wings seem to take all my energy. Their atmosphere is great and their selections are very fulfilling, I never feel like I need anything else with it. PLUS they have student discounts!!! which is absolutely necessary for students. In reading some of the other reviews I would like to say THIS PLACE IS ALL ORGANIC, THE ONLY REASON YOU WOULD FIND WHOLE FOODS, MARIANOS, OR JAMBA JUICE WITH CHEAPER PRICES ON THEIR JUICES IS BECAUSE THEY DON'T USE ALL ORGANIC FRUITS&VEGETABLES LIKE FRUVE DOES AND WHOLE FOODS & MARIANOS AREN'T JUICE BARS, OF COURSE THEY WOULD HAVE CHEAPER JUICE. For those of you who want something that's just as great for your body as it tastes, this is the place for you. After I have one of their items, my body feels better almost instantly

1.description: After my workout at Xsports, I was looking for a healthy option for my post workout meal.  I stumbled across Fruve' Xpress Juicery.  It's a small shop that is located on the busy streets of Southloop.  There are lots of meter parking, but I can never seem to find a spot. The acai bowls caught my eye and I knew I had to give one a try.  I opted for the "balance acai bowl" which is made up of acai, mixed berries, banana, maca cacao, and almond milk topped with granola, banana, strawberries, cacao nibs, hemp seeds, coconut, and coconut flakes.  Everything about this bowl was delicious: perfect balance of sweetness and fresh ingredients.  I ate the whole thing up without feeling one bit guilty.The service here was extremely slow, but what can you ask for when they are preparing everything from fresh and raw ingredients?  Definitely call ahead to avoid the long wait time (which I will be doing in the future).  There were also many complaints about how expensive this place was, but the prices are very comparable to other juiceries.  Living a healthy life doesn't come with a cheap price tag.  You pay for what you get.  I am looking forward to try out some other items they offer.  They all look and sound delicious.

9.description: Great place in the South Loop to get something healthy, filling and delicious! Smoothies are really good, and the Acai Bowls are amazing. So happy this is in my neighborhood:)

26.description: Two things happen whenever I come here: I'm made to feel really good walking in the door, and I feel even better walking out. If you're wanting to make healthier choices with respect to your dietary intake, patronizing this business is an easy way to do it. It's also pretty convenient that it happens to be located right outside my back-door!I am pretty clueless about organic, and the real health benefits of all of the ingredients this menu incorporates, but the entire staff is friendly, patient, informed and more than willing to educate you so you can make a wise and flavorful choice. The owners obviously take a great deal of pride in what they're doing at Fruve' xPress Juicery. The place is always spotless, the video wall overhead boasts relaxing digital images and the dining-area music is calming.The entire customer experience here is one of serenity and professionalism. It's like just taking a few minutes out of your day to center yourself, and spoil your mind and body, which we all could probably stand to do more of. I've found myself bypassing the Five Guys next door increasingly of late, and I have absolutely no regrets.

25.description: WOW. WOW. WOW. A bit of a hike from Lincoln Park, but it was worth it. The owner makes the acai bowls for you, and every ingredient she uses is completely fresh. The acai is unlike any that I have had in the city before. The menu is fun to pick from.I had an acai bowl with bananas, strawberries, cacao nibs, and coconut, and I felt so good after I ate it.

12.description: First of all I do love this place and the products they offer are great! I will also continue to come to this place as long as it's open. My only complaint is how long it takes for your order to be completed. I've learned to call in my order but sometimes you get stuck waiting just to pay because the only person working there is helping a customer. They have to come up with a better system because I saw saw potential customers walk out today. Make some changes.  Good luck!!

21.description: So I've been going to this lovely juice bar since the day it opened. I will admit that at first I was overwhelmed since I am so used to seeing a generic set up for a juice bar. However, Dominique, with her warm and cheerful demeanor immediately put me at ease. I've tried their juices, salads and açai bowls. To date, their juices have completely won me over. I love them.  The prices are well worth the investment of treating yourself well.  I can't recommend this place enough.

17.description: The acai bowls here are delicious! I come here as often as my wallet can afford. My favorite is the Green Bee but the other bowls are tasty as well. They are pretty darn expensive though ($11+tax for a small bowl).

10.description: With sweet, but filling and nutrient-rich smoothies listed alongside more types of grass shots than you can imagine, FruVe's menu can satisfy a range of health food comfort levels. With the exception of the green, the cold-pressed juices tend to be more fruit-forward. The Vino combines grapes, lemon and ginger for a juice that is sweet, tangy and spicy all at once. Though it's not listed on the menu, FruVe' has also been serving a watermelon, mint and basil juice that is incredibly hydrating, sweet and herbal.The menu is seasonal, and it appears the shop is still refining its offering. But for still being in its first weeks of operation, FruVe' has already begun building its community; the owner makes customers feel welcome and makes every attempt to get to know them and their health needs. Juices are a bit expensive, but the shop is worth a visit for the inviting atmosphere and fresh juices.

5.description: My favorite new addition in the South Loop! Great spot for the health conscious and trying-to-be health conscious among us. I do not at all get the people saying it's "too expensive." You spend a minimum of  $10 or more on drinks downtown & points north -- why is it too much to spend $10 on something that's actually good for you? I really love the bowls (my favorite is mango) and the smoothies are always excellent post-gym boosts. I've done the juice cleanse and while I don't "love" all the juices, I do know that they are all fresh and organic and healthy. Dominique the owner has done a wonderful job turning her small business into a destination location in the South Loop. It's a small shop and everything is made from scratch, so there are times when there's going to be a bit of a wait--I think it's worth it & I'm happy to give her my business. You can also call ahead & have your order waiting when you get there. What can I say? I'm a fan. This location used to be a tanning spa that went out of business. I can't think of a better repurposing of this spot than a place that is affirming, healthy and delicious. Good job, Fruve!

3.description: I like this place. It's on Wabash in the south loop. We came here after our massages to get the system truly cleansed! I ordered a shot of E3 live ( I think) and the Popeye. My friend got the peachy kale and liked it too. It's s large, clean store with very friendly staff. There are limited choices for freshly squeezed juices but keep in mind they are already bottled. Regarding the shot of goodness, I made sure i chugged it quickly without tasting it and followed it with my smoothie. My smoothie had mango, spinach, coconut, and pineapple. It was awesome. We didn't try any food or anything else. We sat inside on their tables and enjoyed our smoothie. I enjoyed my first experience here and would definitely return next time I'm in the neighborhood and need some nutrition for my body. Oh and the staff are very honest!! I asked her if the shots are tasty and she told me nope you definitely may want to follow the shot with your smoothie. I like that!! Thanks for not trying to convince me that grass tastes like sugar. I appreciated that.

35.description: The Warrior Smoothie is delicious and energizing. I also like the cold pressed juices.

19.description: I will just cut to the chase. You are missing out if you don't try this place! This was my first ever trying an acai bowl, and I'm already planning my next trip downtown to have another. I tried the Green Bee acai bowl which had acai, mixed berries, banana, mango, spirulina, and apple juice, topped with banana, bee pollen, strawberries, honey, and goji berries. Absolutely delicious. I enjoyed every bite. So flavorful, fresh and fruity, with a nice crunch on top. And best of all I felt GREAT after eating it. Healthy and filling. I'm just wowed by how phenomenal it was. I highly recommend you give it a try!

28.description: I've only had the chance to visit here twice, but I definitely plan on making it a little more of a regular place to hit up. Fantastic juices, super friendly staff, and even though it's incredibly tasty, you don't feel guilty about the indulgence! The first time I went in, I had a lot of questions about juice cleansing. I can't remember who I spoke to, but she answered all of my questions (and then some), never forced or pressured me to buy anything, and made sure I knew about the student discount (10%) and the current sales they had going on before I made a purchase. Like I said, definitely would love to make it a more regular spot to hit, and highly recommend for anyone looking for a bite to eat or drop to drink in the Loop!

45.description: They are doing it right at Fruve. Organic foods including salads, soups and acai bowls. The cleans is great deal and all organic!

33.description: I am so excited that healthy eating has become so much more accessible downtown! It's going to take me some time to learn the Fruve menu. There is just so much to choose from. They have drinks/granola bowls for all kinds of detox goodness. The menu is flexible - the bowls can be ordered as a smoothie too. I like this option a lot because then I could just take it out and eat as I go. But I saw others eating the bowl, they looked delicious....! Though like most other raw smoothie shops, the price is a bit high for me, I'm a fan of Fruve just because each menu is actually rich with different ingredients and flavors. For 10$ I got to try a range of powerful fruit like acai, spirulina, goji berries, all at once! I think this smoothie is sufficient as a whole meal. The whole space is very clean and refreshing. I could see that they take sanitation very seriously, and I love how the prepping area/kitchen is set up. It is very well organized, and I get to visually understand what each ingredients look like in the jars.The owner is super friendly and informative. I can't wait to go back!

43.description: Wow! LOVE! Way to go, FruVe!While I have not tried the pre-bottled juices, I think the smoothies and acai bowls are delicious! Each time I've had a smoothie or bowl, I find I have so much more energy than usual and feel strong to power through my day. I'm much more productive.As for pricing, I don't mind paying $9 to $11 for a meal/smoothie/bowl because by the time I purchase all of the ingredients myself I'm spending the same amount. The staff is incredible. They are always offering me samples of their super food ingredients and the juices of the day. They always remember who I am and are beginning to remember what I typically order. I enjoy going in to say hello and look forward to getting to know them better.

2.description: I visited this location a couple of times and each time the staff where friendly and the food was great. Fresh juices, smoothies, salads and acai bowls. Prices where about average for these types of dishes. Eat in or take out options. Great for breakfast, brunch,lunch or an afternoon pick-me-up.My only gripe would be that they need to get their menu act together. There is a large chalk board which you see to the right of the counter but hidden away at the back corner of the restaurant is another menu board with scrumptious wraps and sandwiches on it which I nearly missed. The staff didn't point it out which was another downer. I wonder how many people miss out on seeing this menu board and how much biz the restaurant misses out on.Day one I ordered a curry wrap on a tortilla which was so good I went back for it again the next day. Well the next day I was served the dish on bread, not in a wrap as the menu described. The staff just said they change it up sometimes. Well, please if you are going to give me something not as described, let me know when I order it. On day three they didn't have any of the sandwich or wrap options so that was disappointing.All up a great little gem but in need of some improvements.

18.description: Tried the Balance Bowl. Tastey! It had bananas and cacao nibs and granola. I'm a big fan of smoothie bowls and this hit the spot. Slightly pricey but better than other smoothie bars I've been to! Will be back!

41.description: Nice addition to the South Loop. Super friendly and an obviously quality product.  VERY extensive menu choices. You pay for both those things of course. Pricing will be an issue for some, but hopefully enough folks will see fit to support this ambitious place.

50.description: Underwhelming and overpriced for the quality. I was very excited that a juice place was opening in our neighborhood but was disappointed after my visit today. The staff was very nice but the prices were way too high and unreasonable for the amount of product you receive. And the flavors of the cold pressed juices while good mixes were not tasty or enjoyable. I got the green lemon which I expected to be much better then it was. My homemade juice turns out better and I don't have to pay ten dollars for barely two servings. Much better off going to Whole foods or Mariano's, or better yet just juice at home. If they brought the prices down by half could be more worth it.

4.description: I'd been hearing about this place and decided to give it a try. The juices and smoothies are completely organic and combine flavors you'd never imagine would taste so refreshing!When you walk in, the staff always greets you warmly and, even with so much going on in making the smoothies, they always engage in friendly conversation. On my first visit, I was overwhelmed by what to get with the long list of offerings and their ingredients listed on the chalkboard to the right. I asked Dominique, so friendly and great at what she does, what she'd recommend with examples of things I normally like. Her recommendation was spot on, but not before she let me sample some leftovers of my friends' smoothies to get a feel for my taste buds. How thoughtful, right?!But it wasn't just me! The guy in front of me had more smoothie leftover in the blender than could fit in his cup, so she asked if he had a minute to drink the rest and poured it in a [wheatgrass] shot glass (to be returned). I was totally blown away by this honesty system...you literally get all that you pay for! On my second visit, I was the only patron in the store. Dominique was still very friendly and personable and she offered me a sample of a beet juice (beets, pear, lemon & ginger--the "Heartbeat"). She never once pressured me to buy it. She simply wanted to expose me to the juices they offer and I was thoroughly impressed! Great new hip place with organic ingredients that reenergize you and gives a top notch customer experience. Certainly worth every penny.

6.description: Very clean and inviting space with a wonderful family running the establishment. The type of place you can tell the owners take a lot of pride in. The ladies at the front greet you with a smile and truly care about getting the right juice/bowl for you!Today I had the acai bowl with strawberries, granola and banana! I asked the lady at the front if all of the ingredients are organic and she said yes! That's really exciting. A lot of places (like pealed on Sheffield) give organic vibes but have admitted to not being 100% true. My bowl was delicious and filled with flavor, worth every penny.I see people here complaining about the price, but you are not taking into account that the cost to run an establishment in DOWNTOWN CHICAGO is expensive and so is FRESH ORGANIC PRODUCE. No where in the city has cheap organic smoothies...that doesn't even make sense. Also as Chicagoans we should be supporting LOCAL FAMILIES and SMALL BUSINESSES as opposed to big corporations.   this place!

22.description: An exceptional juice bar in the city of Chicago.  I walked in with a horrible cold and walked out instantly feeling better from experiencing organic juices and elixir shots.  The knowledgeable, welcoming and inviting staff sets this juice bar apart from all others in the city. If you can chat with Dominique she is amazing, patient, extremely knowledgeable,  and takes time out to explain the benefits of organic products and juicing. The ambiance, variety and combination of juices, health shots and healthy food choices makes this all worth the trip.  This is my new go to spot.

15.description: Two things happen whenever I come here: I'm made to feel really good walking in the door, and I feel even better walking out. If you're wanting to make healthier choices with respect to your dietary intake, patronizing this business is an easy way to do it. It's also pretty convenient that it happens to be located right outside my back-door!I am pretty clueless about organic, and the real health benefits of all of the ingredients this menu incorporates, but the entire staff is friendly, patient, informed and more than willing to educate you so you can make a wise and flavorful choice. The owners obviously take a great deal of pride in what they're doing at Fruve' xPress Juicery. The place is always spotless, the video wall overhead boasts relaxing digital images and the dining-area music is calming.The entire customer experience here is one of serenity and professionalism. It's like just taking a few minutes out of your day to center yourself, and spoil your mind and body, which we all could probably stand to do more of. I've found myself bypassing the Five Guys next door increasingly of late, and I have absolutely no regrets.

20.description: Great organic/natural smoothies that don't sacrifice taste. The ladies that own the place are friendly and helpful.

36.description: This place is great! Tried their acai bowl today and it was top notch. Delicious, filling, and satisfying. The steel bowl they serve it in is perfect too! The young woman working was so pleasant and knowledgable. Can't say enough great things about this place. Looking forward to coming back and trying more!

14.description: The acai bowls are SO good and SO fresh!  I want that for breakfast every single day bc it's so delish and healthy!  The juice is just as good, although a little expensive.  $10 for a juice....it's so good and freshly made that's it's kind of worth it though.  My husband and I were able to share a juice and a bowl and walked away perfectly satisfied.

0.description: This review is 2 years late YES! It's embarrassing that my daughter and my weave are the same age but when u see these pictures you will never know. the quality is there. I can't trust these other hair companies  when I go into herimports from the location that was on Madison to the location that was on 10 s. riverside Rd. To the new one...it's the best they let you pick your bundles! smell! your bundles! They let your poor self know how much it is with tax "me" lol it is worth it I have turned my purchase into a custom wig. They constantly offer deals on the hair. I'm no guru or spokesgirl I'm a paying customer who can't wait to get her tax refund check because 18" 20" 22" & a new silk closure is calling my name!

58.description: Unfortunately I was disappointed. We went for a Sunday morning brunch for coffee and sandwiches. Being a regular patron of Cuban sandwiches, we had an idea of what to expect. On the menu, there was no mention of any of the drinks containing sugar. My husband got his cordito and it was shockingly sweet. They remade it. I had the Jardin sandwich, which came out smelling delicious. I took the first bite and the eggplant was ice cold. Tastes like it was straight from the fridge. Yuck. I brought it back and they remade it. I was just disappointed at these two oversights.

56.description: Phenomenal sandwiches.  First time in Chicago and this was the first stop for food--we ordered the Chivito and Palomilla sandwiches and both were unbelievable.

29.description: Every single time that I visit Chicago, this is usually my first and last stop. I cannot get enough of their cafe con leche and sandwiches. It does not matter what type of sandwich you choose, I GUARANTEE, you will love it. If you don't, your tastebuds are out of whack. I usually opt for the Cubano or ropa vieja. To each their own. Don't be discouraged that it's located next to a hostel, it's worth you being uncomfortable, if that's a concern.

42.description: Incredible sandwiches!! Good coffee! Impressive. I got the jerk sandwich, slightly spicy which is what I like. My wife got the chipotle chicken sandwich, also a great choice but I'm partial to the Jerk sandwich! I will be going back for sure!

23.description: Okay, no. F**k no...just no! Don't waste your time on this "Cuban" sandwich place, people! I literally just left cafecito after giving them a second chance and am even more disappointed this time around than I was the first time. I ordered a palomilla Steak sandwich. There were about eight tiny pieces of flavorless Steak on each half of the sandwich I was given. The bread was soggy, the shoe string potatoes were stale, and the tiny bit of lettuce they did give me, was so sad looking I almost shed a tear. Even after adding salt, I just couldn't enjoy it whatsoever. I'm not one to say, "I just can't do this" when it comes to food but I could not believe the lack of presentation and the lack of effort they put into making this sandwich. I went up to the counter and explained the aforementioned issues and Caroline said that all she could do was give me a gift card and no refund. I opted for the gift card but will give it to a friend that works nearby the other cafecito because Jesus Christ, I will never visit their establishments myself again! As a Cuban myself, I am appalled by them pretending to be! There is NOTHING Cuban about this place. We cook with lots of flavorful spices and sadly, what I received was so bland I wouldn't even feed it to my dog. Next!

47.description: Cafecito is situated next door to a hostel and it's about as appropriate of a location as possible.  Not really sure why this place gets such high ratings but it was a huge let down in the sandwich category.  The Palomilla is what I went with and the sandwich was just down right bland and boring.  For a pressed sandwich it was lacking any crunch whatsoever.  The bread they use is pretty much any crappy bread you would probably find at a wallmart or something.  If you're looking for a place to sit down and eat, good luck because there is very, very, limited seating.

8.description: YUM! This place is just delicious! Not a fan of the really really really long wait, but the food is very tasty. We came here at 2 pm on a weekday, expecting it to be pretty calm. It was not. The place was packed, all the seats were taken and there was a line out the door. We decided to wait anyway because of all the positive reviews. I ordered the Ropa Veija sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the Cubano sandwich. We waited another 10-15 minutes to get our food. It was worth it though! My boyfriend's Cubano sandwich was good, but my Ropa Veija sandwich was incredible!! It had skirt steak, black beans, plantains and tomato creole sauce. The sauce was very tasty and paired well with the skirt steak. The plantains were a nice surprise, a suble sweetness to a savory sandwich.Overall, I recommend visiting this place at least to try it out. The food is delicious if you can withstand the wait.

31.description: Would not recommend if you are trying to find a coffee place that is unique or memorable. Not a fan of the coffee and I had hoped to find a cozy place to hide away from the cold, but the place was noisy, had minimal and bad seating and weird lighting. The food and pastries did not look appetizing but some of the sandwiches seemed good but they were small for their prices.

34.description: This place was good.  Stopped in here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon.  I had the Jardin and my husband had the Roja Vieja.  Jardin was like any other vegetarian panini, but the Roja Vieja was unique in that it had a fried plaintain in it.  The place is connected to a hostel.  The hostel was fine, but it created a college cafeteria feel.  The vibe was okay, but not as cool as I was hoping out of a cubano sandwich kind of place.  Also, the restaurant doesn't have a bathroom. You have to get a key card, go into the hostel, go up the stairs, swipe the card at a door to get into their recreational area and use the restroom.  Kind of complicated and pretty far from the restaurant area.  Overall, sandwiches were good.  We'll probably be back, but only if we're in the neighborhood.  I don't think that I would go out of my way to get to South Loop just to get a sandwich from here.

16.description: I LOVEEEEEEE this place. Words can't explain. You just have to go there and try it yourself. Make sure to order the jerk sandwich. Yea, you're welcome!

13.description: What a hidden gem, tough spot to hit if you're driving due to lack of parking but can't fault them for that.  This place was amazing, so authentic and full of flavor along with quick turnaround time and friendly service.  I had the lechon (marinated pork plate) - which I highly recommend.  The pork was tender, juicy, crispy and mixed so well with the rice and beans.  You will not be disappointed!

11.description: Really good and inexpensive Cuban sandwiches and cafe con leches. You have a pick from a variety of chicken, pick, beef and vegetarian options. All sandwiches are panini pressed on French bread. Although the line goes out the door, it moves quick and food also arrives relatively quickly. They also have salads, sides and deserts including tres leches cake, flan etc.

39.description: Cheap and yummy sandwiches. Not very quick, but worth the wait I'd say.

37.description: I heard about this place and went for lunch on our recent holiday break visit.  I ordered the Cubano (of course!), mexican wedding cookie, cafe con leche, and the plaintain chips.  Skip the plaintain chips.  I didn't like the garlic taste and I'm usually a huge fan of plaintain chips.  The rest was delicious.  I also had a bite of my mother's sandwich and thought it was even better than the Cubano (it had pork and some guava jam).

0.description: I'm not a sandwich guy. Messy to eat and and even if you finish one, you need to brush your teeth immediately after. The sandwiches here are all that and it is worth it. Its small almost hipsterish interior is nothing but cute. Staffs are extremely friendly and they actually do smile.
