Now to the money shot: the sandwiches.  I ordered Pollo Chipotle, not the most authentic Cuban sandwich, but I like chicken. It was the bomb. Ciabatta was toasted on point. The combination of chuncky chicken breast tenders, chipotle mayo and the Basil was out of control. The presence of mozzarella, tomato and  the basil may bring memories of the best bruschetta you ever had, but that was definitely not the intent. If you're in the loop and you feel like you want sandwich fix, hit this place. No questions asked.

38.description: Awesome little spot! Located about a 10-15 minute walk from the art institute, so it's definitely worth checking out for those post-art munchies. It was fairly crowded, so I would recommend calling in your order ahead and then walking there. Also, limited seating, so plan on eating in Millennium Park or taking the food back to the hotel room/apartment. The black beans and rice were awesome; I would go for the combo, which is more than enough food to go around. Will be back.

51.description: went with groupon enjoyed it and have bought more groupons to go back soon. I have had 4 different sandwiches, cant remember which ones they are not in english so I do struggle placing my orders but taste good so its good to me. Parking is hard but I have a monthly pass for downtown parking in the loop.

27.description: The food is authentic and very tasty and the prices very reasonable. Cafecito is across the street from the Auditorium Theatre between the Dairy Queen and the Hostel- in fact the wash room is in the Hostel. The food is prepared as you order so there can be a little bit of a wait but everything we ordered was so good it was worth it. We shared a pork sandwich and a mango shake and eggplant salad and I went back a few days later and had the Ropa Veija platter with black beans and fried plantains. Everything was spot on. A plus is window tables are great for people watching especially as the Auditorium Theatre gets out. I spotted a couple of Joffrey dancers on my last visit.Go at an off time as it can get crowded with students from Roosevelt and hostel visitors. Great place to go with friends or alone.

32.description: Simply fantastic. The choripan is absurd.1. Read this review. 2. Leave your home.3. Go to Cafecito.

54.description: My hotel was around the corner from this place and I picked up a sandwich togo so that I could eat it at the airport.  I got the Palomilla and it was EXCELLENT!  The Palomilla has steak, grilled onions, tomato, lettuce, and shoestring potatoes.  The steak was tender and well seasoned  and the bread was the perfect consistency.  Not soggy or too hard.  There is also a coupon online to get a free soda or coffee when you order a sandwich!  I totally recommend this place!

48.description: Best Cuban Sandwiches in all of the land...if you haven't tried GO! GO! GO!....actually call ahead there can be a wait....but try this place!

44.description: Before Latinicity opened in the Loop, I would go to Cafecito to satisfy my craving for Cuban food. After Latinicity opened, I go to Cafecito for Cuban food. Nothing has changed. Cafecito always has a line, and for good reason, the food is good and it comes at a great value. I always order the ropa vieja sandwich and the cafe con leche. They rarely, if ever, have the batidos in stock. In fact, its why I docked a star on my review. Only on one of my five visits have they had the batidos in stock. Its difficult to find a spot to sit during peak lunch hours, but you'll fare better on evenings and weekends. The place is filled with students and Loop workers, but they don't stay for long and you can find a table if you're patient. I have yet to try their desserts, but there is a case of pastries made of guava and chocolate, and flan. The bathroom is located in the adjacent hostel, and you must ask the barista for a key. There is free wifi, but a limited number of outlets.

24.description: The sandwich ingredients were fresh including the bread used for my panini. I was expecting a little more flavor but overall a decent sandwich for a good price.  I think the value warrants four stars but flavor maybe three.  Going to try breakfast and coffee next time.

7.description: Every single time that I visit Chicago, this is usually my first and last stop. I cannot get enough of their cafe con leche and sandwiches. It does not matter what type of sandwich you choose, I GUARANTEE, you will love it. If you don't, your tastebuds are out of whack. I usually opt for the Cubano or ropa vieja. To each their own. Don't be discouraged that it's located next to a hostel, it's worth you being uncomfortable, if that's a concern.

49.description: Came for lunch. Good food, rude service. Really yummy ropa vieja sandwich. Didn't taste any plantains in it, but the meat was good. From having to get their attn to get a pen to sign the receipt, to overcharging, to people eating behind the counter, and rudely telling me where the chips are (my bad, damn) I wasnt feeling it. Also, the churro is meh.

40.description: Nothing spectacular, just okay.

53.description: Excellent, fast, and fairly priced sandwiches, soups, platters, and desserts. Cuban coffee, nice atmosphere, good service. Highly recommended!

30.description: Weirdly enough my friend and I weren't feeling sandwiches for lunch but decided to stop by Cafecito and suddenly sandwiches sounded like an awesome idea for lunch. I don't have much experience with Cuban food but it was delicious. They have tons of options for sandwiches and other menu items like plates and salads as well as a pastry case. It was packed on a weekday afternoon at around 1 PM but the line moved along and there wasn't too much of a wait. At least the sandwiches justified the x amount of time (don't even remember) that we had to wait. The choripan is great for anyone who has a weakness for chorizo and the chivito oddly reminded me (in a good way) of breakfast?Anyway, great place for sandwiches whether or not you're feeling them!

46.description: Love their tasty sandwichesGreat spot

1.description: I honestly love Cafecito on Wells & Madison but given the fact my school shut down. I found Cafecito on Congress always a fan of the food and today it wasn't disappointing what was: was the customer service from one employed. I didn't catch her name but I did catch her attitude. She's a heavy set high arch eye brows and with an accent. I approached the register and she didn't greet me nor made eye contact. I asked about the sandwich "la Costa" and she said is a sandwich. I order it and she asked for my name, she rolled her eyes and asked again. Ok! So then I order something else after I paid for my meal I saw the shakes and I requested for one. The other friendly girl took my shake other and told the girl w the accent the name of the shake. This chick goes and rolls her eyes again hardcore. I almost cancelled my order but nah I let her do her job. After my shake was made she didn't call my name nor the shake she left it on the countertop, petty much? Look we all have bad days but jeez she should've just called off or be one phone orders. Left very disappointed with the customer service because of this one individual.

55.description: This place is a true gem. The quality of the food is excellent, plus they also have a lot of options. I would have expected each sandwich to cost around $11 (compared to $6-8 which they actually cost). I find it the best grab-n-go sandwich place in the loop and around. Really can't get enough.

9.description: Was looking for the best Cubano sandwich in Chicago and all signs pointed here and those signs weren't wrong...Hard to find any meal, regardless of genre, that will beat this place on value...four completely stuffed adults with drinks for $50 with quality food is hard to top...The price allows you to try a couple different items without breaking the bank...Between the four of us, we had the Cubano, Chimi, and Chivito with a couple sides of beans & rice...everything was terrific...only thing that could make them better would've been a bit more butter/oil on the bread...

26.description: Best place for great and simple sandwiches ! Be ready to wait in line for a while until you get served...

25.description: This place is popular not only due to the hostel traffic from next door, but the well-known fact that their food is fresh and delicious. I got cubano lunch special. Sandwich was fresh, made with real food (no processed pork in my sandwich) and yummy. Black bean soup was good, but I got way too much of it. I suppose that would be good for some- would have preferred a cup size. Got the garlic plantain chips which were tasty. They ran out of the cuban soda drink (that bummed me out). I should have come back here for breakfast as it sounded good. Will think about doing so if I ever get back to Chi-town.

12.description: Cafecito. With such high ratings and reviews, I rushed in and browsed the menu... I found an abundance of great sounding items. I went for the Cuban as it was written up in a hotel magazine but, I left with not only the Cuban in my belly; The Jerk Chicken and Chivito were also split with a buddy of mine.The anticipated Cuban was good but, not amazing;The Jerk fell short without much flare and lacked something.The real shining star, The Chivito, was out of this world good. Order the Chivito, garnish with a little hot sauce, taste heaven.Great choices, good and friendly service... made fresh, & gets busy, so expect a short short wait.

59.description: Food was ok but the service was horrible. We had to wait 20 minutes for a coffee. With so many choices in Chicago this is not the one to visit twice.

21.description: Went there while on a quick trip to Chicago - great food at a low price!

17.description: SO good. Tucked away in downtown Chicago and sharing an entrance with a hostel, you'd never guess!  However, the food is delicious and made quickly, and my cuban coffee was the best I'd had in awhile.  The staff is also super friendly and helpful if you've never been.  The only downside and the reason I knocked a star was the seating.  It's fairly limited for how much business they do, and it gets crowded with people stalking your table (I was one of those people). The next time I stop by, I will probably take it to-go.

10.description: The line to order was about a half hour during the lunch rush. However the wait was well worth it. Cuban sandwich check. Could have had more pork in it but overall solid sandwich.

5.description: Okay, no. F**k no...just no! Don't waste your time on this "Cuban" sandwich place, people! I literally just left cafecito after giving them a second chance and am even more disappointed this time around than I was the first time. I ordered a palomilla Steak sandwich. There were about eight tiny pieces of flavorless Steak on each half of the sandwich I was given. The bread was soggy, the shoe string potatoes were stale, and the tiny bit of lettuce they did give me, was so sad looking I almost shed a tear. Even after adding salt, I just couldn't enjoy it whatsoever. I'm not one to say, "I just can't do this" when it comes to food but I could not believe the lack of presentation and the lack of effort they put into making this sandwich. I went up to the counter and explained the aforementioned issues and Caroline said that all she could do was give me a gift card and no refund. I opted for the gift card but will give it to a friend that works nearby the other cafecito because Jesus Christ, I will never visit their establishments myself again! As a Cuban myself, I am appalled by them pretending to be! There is NOTHING Cuban about this place. We cook with lots of flavorful spices and sadly, what I received was so bland I wouldn't even feed it to my dog. Next!

3.description: Before Latinicity opened in the Loop, I would go to Cafecito to satisfy my craving for Cuban food. After Latinicity opened, I go to Cafecito for Cuban food. Nothing has changed. Cafecito always has a line, and for good reason, the food is good and it comes at a great value. I always order the ropa vieja sandwich and the cafe con leche. They rarely, if ever, have the batidos in stock. In fact, its why I docked a star on my review. Only on one of my five visits have they had the batidos in stock. Its difficult to find a spot to sit during peak lunch hours, but you'll fare better on evenings and weekends. The place is filled with students and Loop workers, but they don't stay for long and you can find a table if you're patient. I have yet to try their desserts, but there is a case of pastries made of guava and chocolate, and flan. The bathroom is located in the adjacent hostel, and you must ask the barista for a key. There is free wifi, but a limited number of outlets.

35.description: I like the sandwiches, much better than the platter. But the portion is quite small. Unfortunately i dont know what i ordered because they were all recommended by the staff and after walking a mile in icy windy rainy chicago i was too starved to care.

19.description: Came here for a quick lunch with friends and was very happy with how fast and quality my sandwich came out!  I got the Ropa Vieja sandwich, which is straight up bursting with delicious flavor.  I wish they'd put more plantains on it - it could have used a little more sweet in that delicious sweet/ savory sandwich combo.  The guava batido (or really any batido) is a must-have, if they've got it. It's fresh and light tasting (and I really enjoy the beautiful light pink color of the shake).The atmosphere is spacious and laid-back...sometimes it can be hard to find seating but you've just got to wait until people leave and swoop in quickly enough! Also, the prices are pretty reasonable, especially for downtown Chicago :).

28.description: First time at Cafecito was a success, great customer service and the Cubano was amazing. Love the Cafe con Leche as well, for 2:59 for a large, I will never look at a Starbucks the same. Absolutely wonderful. Highly recommend !

45.description: Being Brazilian I love the atmosphere of this place! I got the Pollo Arugula and it was amazing, I would definitely recommend it! I also got the Cafe con Leche and it tastes like my childhood, when my Brazilian grandma would let me drink "cafe con leite" while over at her house for breakfast... Everything came together for my lunch here and I will definitely be back! Great food, great atmosphere and on top of all that, great prices!

33.description: Came here for some good old steak, rice and black beans and left very disappointed. My food came out cold and the steak had no flavor my rice was cold and beans were cold as well! Don't recommend that dish at all.

43.description: Waited almost 20 minutes for my order.  Worst customer service.  Not friendly at all.  They told me they messed my order and gave it to someone else.  The girls at cashier Tiana didn't even talked to me when i told her.  No apology.  Just dirty looks from the two girls up at the front.  Never coming back.

2.description: oh my sandwiches...i love me a good sandwich. unfortunately, the world seems to think that vegetarians can live off of cheese or pb alone. thank you cafecito for saving me from the perils of boring sandwich hell!timba - ok, yes it has cheese but the guava jelly and throw anything into a press and it makes it 30 times better. yum. our team was on our way to a huge meeting so i needed something fast. i will need to go back and try their numerous other veggie options - jardin, elveez...whoa!

18.description: This was a treat! I don't get into the city much, but my wife and I were attending Chicago Jazz Philharmonic's "Scenes from Life: Cuba!" at the Auditorium Theater next door, so in a bit of unexpected serendipity we enjoyed cuban sandwiches for dinner beforehand. Looking through the menu and the photos here on Yelp I could see it was going to be hard to choose just one sandwich to try. My wife settled on the Cubano (roasted pork, ham, swiss, pickles, and mustard) and I had to go for the Chivito (steak, ham, bacon, fried egg, mozerella, onion, and citrus mayo). We each shared halves of the other's and while we liked the Cubano the Chivito was the clear winner of the two. You might think it would taste like a breakfast sandwich but the flavors of the meat were different enough from what you normally expect from those meats that it was a very unique taste.  Definitely high on my list next time I'm in the Loop.

41.description: I used to come here to study years ago. I don't go down to this area too often but when I do I get my cuban food fix. I miss it being from Fl and being cuban myself. I used to hate that they would play Latin music blaring, it was always packed, next to hostel, and that it would get smokey and you would smell of food after you left...not much has changed. So now I go in, get my food, and get out quick for my fix. The food is really good so worth the trip!!!

52.description: The food was great, it's all cooked to order, and they graciously customize their dishes to customer's desires!! The prices could not be better!! I highly recommend it!!!

50.description: This place is great.  Great sandwiches, great platters, and a good atmosphere.  Will have to come back next time I'm in Chicago.

4.description: We stopped by on a weekday before visiting the Art Institute and it was BUSY.  Seating is minimal and you get a lot of college students not really eating on their laptops.  I felt bad for the people who could not find a seat.  Luckily we came before the rush.  The food is decent.  The cubano sandwich was tasty and the lechon plate is just ok.

6.description: Loved this place! You can't beat a place with great food, friendly service, reasonable prices and a nice casual atmosphere.Tried the chimichurri chicken pressed sandwich and it was so good! Very filling, so you should be hungry before u come here! Husband tried the jerk chicken and loved it as well.. We had coffee and a wedding cookie which was so yummy. Wasn't the best cappuccino ever but it was alright. The place itself is really chill and the Cuban music playing in the background is so upbeat. There are interesting light fixtures and unique drawings on the walls.

22.description: Loved this place! You can't beat a place with great food, friendly service, reasonable prices and a nice casual atmosphere.Tried the chimichurri chicken pressed sandwich and it was so good! Very filling, so you should be hungry before u come here! Husband tried the jerk chicken and loved it as well.. We had coffee and a wedding cookie which was so yummy. Wasn't the best cappuccino ever but it was alright. The place itself is really chill and the Cuban music playing in the background is so upbeat. There are interesting light fixtures and unique drawings on the walls.

15.description: Never had a cuban sandwich before. Order the jardin and a cuban espresso and they were both amazing.The eggplant must have been marinating in something because it was wonderfully sweet without it being overpowering, and the jalapeno hummus gave it a nice even spice level. Wish there was one of these in my home state but at least itll give me a reason to visit chicago again.

57.description: CHEAP AND DELICIOUS. Cuban sandwiches at this place was super worth it. I wanted to come here again just to get a sandwich on the go before leaving Chicago, but I had no time! I took a bite from some of my other friends' sandwiches and they were also amazing. You can't beat the cheapness and deliciousness of it. YUM!

20.description: I had the Chivito sandwich and it was beyond my expectations. The price is really reasonable too.I'll be back at this place for sure.

36.description: This place has delicious food! I ordered the Ropa Vieja platter which was awesome! I would definitely eat here again and recommend it to others.

14.description: Cafecito is situated next door to a hostel and it's about as appropriate of a location as possible.  Not really sure why this place gets such high ratings but it was a huge let down in the sandwich category.  The Palomilla is what I went with and the sandwich was just down right bland and boring.  For a pressed sandwich it was lacking any crunch whatsoever.  The bread they use is pretty much any crappy bread you would probably find at a wallmart or something.  If you're looking for a place to sit down and eat, good luck because there is very, very, limited seating.

44.description: I should have written this review two years ago.  I love my eye doctor!  Isn't that weird?  I like him, the staff in his offices and my overall experience when I go see him (minus the blowing air in your eye test).The staff is always super friendly and they have helped me to pick out two pairs of fabulous frames, which I constantly get complemented on.  I love their help and suggestions, because I end up with styles I may not have chosen but that are stylish, fit my face and flatter me.Dr Sarai is, young friendly and provides a very personalized visit.  For a doctor I see so rarely it is nice to be remembered during my visits. He also listens very well, provides solutions to my issues and answers my questions.This office also works with UIC's business school, helping students learn about working with local businesses.

29.description: I have been going here for my eye check-up, once a year every year for 5 years or so. No pushy sales people, never a long wait. I usually see Dr.Seth Sarai, who is very professional and makes me feel very comfortable.  I have encouraged other students who do not live in the neighbourhood, to go here too. All of them have had positive experiences. . If I could afford it, I would buy my frames here. Always critical, yet I can not think of any  reason to take a star off.

42.description: I would recommend anyone to Village Eye Care.  The service is great and the staff is even better.  Nazneen helped me with picking out the right frames and I have received so many compliments.  I am horrible at picking them out and she said that she would get me in the right frames and she held up to that promise.  Prices are great and they accepted my VSP plan which really helped out a lot.  However, the glasses that I received were still a good price with out the insurance. The eye doctor was wonderful in during my exam.  She explained everything to me from start to finish and never rushed me.  My glasses and contacts were ordered and arrived right when they said they would.  I have already suggested them to friends and co-workers.  A+++ Much better than going to the dentist.

23.description: Very enjoyable and I feel like I am always getting the top of the line service.

47.description: If I could give it MINUS 5 stars, I would.ros: Well-equipped with necessary diagnostic tools/machines; seemingly "nice" docCons: Long wait, pushy sales associates (as other reviewers have commented), dishonest sales tactics (not disclosing fees until after they've already charged you for services you never gave a consent for), and poor patient/customer service.  Once I stepped out of the exam room, I felt like I was in a high-end retail shop (which it is, essentially) where the sales hyenas won't leave you alone until you buy something [read: something expensive].  I walked out of there without purchasing anything because I wished to consider other options, and the staff made it pretty damn clear in their words and demeanor that they weren't happy with my decision to decline any purchase at that time.  Now they refuse to disclose to me any health information related to the eye exam of my OWN eyes which I paid for and rightfully own.  They will go ahead and bill the insurance company $$$ for all the tests they've run; and yet the actual patient does not get to see their own diagnostic information.  What kind of a Mickey Mouse health practice is this???Filing a major complaint about this unethical healthcare practice with the HMO immediately.  No question about it.

31.description: Friendly staff and awesome Dr.! Great selection of frames too!  I will definately be back!

34.description: I'm certainly a fan of Village Eyecare.  I've always had good experiences with both the doctors and staff who have helped me over the last few years.  I'm ultra picky with eyeglasses, and they always get me what I want. Reading other Yelp reviews, it really all depends on what you're looking for.  This place is really more of an eyeglasses boutique than a full eye care facility.  They have a nice selection of ultra high-end frames and lenses.  If you're looking for quality eyeglasses or contacts at a competitive price, there's nothing wrong with Pearl Vision, etc.  Think Nordstrom vs. Wal-Mart for eyewear.  Both are just fine and certainly have their places.Though a very nice facility, I couldn't stick with the South Loop location due to the impossible parking situation.  Taylor Street isn't as bad, but it can still take some trolling to find a spot.

16.description: Honesty, Dr. Sarai is the best eye doctor i have ever visited in my entire life. I have some other health problems that effect my optic nerves and i had terrible headaches so i have decided to make an appointment. When he heard about my condition he decided to do couple of extra test and explained to me in details what is going on. It was a relief to see what the tests meant and why i might have those headaches. He also told me he would sent the detailed results along with a letter to my own doctor so my doctor would know how my condition is going! I am really impressed how he cares about his patients. He is a great doctor and i would strongly reccommend him!

8.description: Great professional service! Would definitely recommend to everyone.

11.description: I have been going to Village Eye Care for many years. Dr. Sarai and staff are very professional with a big touch of warmth. The office has the latest equipment to assess the medical condition of your eyes and Dr. Sarai provides a complete explanation of all concerning your site. If you are looking for a complete eye care facility Villiage Eye Care is the place to go!!!!

26.description: I've been coming to this practice for about 10 years.  And though I live in Lakeview now I will still take public trans down to come to VIllage Eyecare  (because parking is stupid on Taylor Street now). I have always been treated with care. The staff is always professional and they will go the distance to help you get what you need.  Dr. Seth is fabulous and I'm glad to see that this practice has flourished under his care.I have a multitude of choices for my eye care, some as close as 2 blocks away but I will continue to be part of this practice because I know it would be hard to find one that even comes close.

39.description: I went there to get an eye exam and new contacts. First i saw the doctor's assistant, She asked me if i wanted specialized eye tests. I told her I wanted the standard eye exam. She again asked me if i wanted specialized test and I felt as if i were talking to a wall. The doctor was not very friendly, he too asked me if i wanted the specialized test after I told his assistant no. The office is very clean. I got a free pair of contacts.My total bill was $534.....okay what?? Usually my bill is about $250. They give you a whole page print out of the receipt. Apparently they didn't charged me for the specialized test...imagine if they had?My point is, If you live in the area and can afford it sure go ahead. If you're a normal working gal/guy like myself, AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE!!

37.description: I went to Village eyecare on Feb. 28th 2011; my eyes were really sore and I needed to see a physician immediately. THE GOOD NEWS - I was able to make an appointment and see a doctor the same day. The doctor was courteous, professional, and reassuring.The BAD NEWS - The office staff did a horrible job with placing my order for reading glasses. They gave me the run around and never followed-up; I had to call them and my insurance carrier a couple of times. One of the office members flat out lied about the mix up and casually mentioned that the first office guy was incorrect in the 7 - 10 day timeframe that he gave for receiving glasses, the timeframe (according to him) was actually 12 - 14 days for my insurance carrier's lab - Ughhhh!!! Of course they missed that timeframe as well. Avoid this place like the plague, unless you have the patience of Job, and are prepared to deal with a sophomoric, unprofessional staff.Galen M.

0.description: I started going to Village Eyecare on Taylor a couple of years ago since it is so close to my house. Since then I've referred a handful of people there. The doctors are great, the office is modern, clean, and I have absolutely nothing but good things to say about this place. One thing I like is that there's never any pressure to purchase frames like other places that I've been to in the past. This place is highly recommended!

38.description: Ugh, I just realized today that they wrote me the wrong prescription for colored lenses. Enhancers don't work on dark eyes...duh. And my insurance already covered my visit so theres no going back.Great.

51.description: Dr. Sarai IS awesome. And handsome. If you're going to the doc, it doesn't hurt if the he's easy on the eyes. (really, no pun intended)Besides that, the exam was extremely thorough. They recommended two optional tests--not covered by insurance, of course, but reasonably priced, so why not? The climax of the visit was when Dr. Sarai showed me pics of my eyes' insides. Have I got a pair of optic nerves!Selection of frames is excellent. This place only loses one star because of the long wait I had that day and because one of his assistants was a bit pushy--though pleasant enough.I recommend!

22.description: So after leaving my initial review here, the office manager reached out to me. I told her that it was too late for my eye exam but my fiancé needed an eye exam and if they could comp his eye exam (in place of mine) we could forget this thing ever happened. The manager, Lori, said, "Yes, we can comp your boyfriend's lens fitting." WTH? Reading comprehension fail. Anyway, so my fiancé called and they told him that only the measly "contact lens fitting fee" would be comped but he'd still have to pay for the exam. BEWARE-This office is extremely disorganized and dishonest!!!

32.description: I went to Dr. Sarai for the first time and was extremely impressed.  He was the first doctor for me to see after being with my previous optometrist for 18 years.  Dr. Sarai was quick but efficient and thorough.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  They accidentally ordered the wrong contacts from what we had decided was the right prescpription for me but it was no trouble at all.  They still had them ordered and delivered in time to not cause me any problems. Overall, I was very pleased with my visit there and will continue to go back. Also, it was fairly easy to find and they have their own parking spaces behind the building, which is phenomenal!

48.description: I agree with the other reviewers that Dr. Sarai (on Taylor St.) is awesome. He's very professional, very good at what he does and they seem to have top-shelf equipment.HOWEVER, his sales staff can be very, very pushy trying to sell you stuff. I usually buy my contacts online because they're cheap -- well, the staff pretty much convinced me that they could get it for me cheaper with their discounts and special offers. Now if I had an iPhone, I could have gone online and validated their claims, but I don't have one. So I ended up paying $120 more than 1800contacts.com for a 6-month supply of contacts. They did the same thing with expensive designer frames to a friend.So if you want a great doc, this is the place. If you want the lowest prices and are not ready to deal with high-pressure sales tactics, try another place.

13.description: I really was impressed by the doctors and technicians here.  very friendly and inviting space. Lori, a technician, helped me with understand my insurance and was very easy to talk to. I will be coming back!

24.description: Had my annual eye exam here and they were great. Exam was done thoroughly and everything was explained throughout the appointment.Staff is very welcoming and friendly. Was able to get an appointment on very short notice!Haven't bought any glasses from here yet, but they seem to have a wide price range. I was told their other location carries additional brands, so I'd say they have a pretty decent selection of glasses.I'll be back for my future exams!

7.description: Warm environment. Great selection of glasses but on the pricey side.

27.description: GREAT pair of glasses! A doctor that looks like a movie star. He is terrific! Save time and energy just go here for ur glasses.

49.description: I went to both locations, the one in the South Loop as well as the one on Taylor. The doctor is nice, however I felt the service was a bit slow. Wait time was a little inconsistent, considering I waited over half an hour both times. However, the Dr. was very helpful with helping me correct my vision. The staff was friendly. The prices were a bit high, however the glasses were really nice.

30.description: Location is convenient for me (Taylor St). Felt welcomed on arrival. Wait was very short (less than a minute) to be examined first by technician (?).  Dr. Sarai was amiable; he also answered all my questions.  Subsequently, cared for well by another staff member when selecting frames for new glasses; frames were more expensive than I'd like, but to me, the service made up for it.  Costs of various lens options were clearly described to me.I plan to continue going to Village Eyecare on Taylor street for my vision needs.

46.description: I have only had great experiences at Village Eyecare!I have been a patient here for about 2 years, and feel like my eyes have never felt better since I've been seeing Dr. Sarai.  I  am a medical professional myself, and appreciate the fact that they are so thorough with my eye exams!  This may explain the longer wait sometimes, but I think it's worth it to have a doctor that really cares about your health.  I also think that they have a nice selection of frames to choose from depending on your price point, from high-end designer to your standard frames.  The staff is also very helpful and knowledgeable with the eyewear.  In fact, I believe it was Kathleen who picked out the very frame I wear now and I get compliments all the time. Thanks!

1.description: Dr. Sarai is Awesome!His optical assistants (AnnMarie ++ Jay) are extremely friendly, the nurses/technicians could use a bit of a "congenial" tune up...But overall your experience will be pleasant.

9.description: My son & I have been going to Village Eye Care for several years. We have always had the best customer service from Dr. Sarai, who takes the time to explain everything to you. The staff are professional & helpful as well. I highly recommend!

40.description: Bought a $300 pair of frames here about 18 months ago, and went to get them fixed after one of the hinges broke (no dropping on the floor or anything, just normal usage). The associate who seemed more interested in selling me a new pair of frames than trying to fix the ones i brought in, made some snarky remark about how people should get new glasses every two years anyways. At $300 I sure expect my frames to hold up for more than 18 months, and honestly expected an offer to get them fixed free of charge, with the place trying to come of as high-end and all. Needless to say I was disappointed. The bottom-line, you are better of going to a discount-store. At least there you will know the service will be crappy, but at least those places have full  disclosure.

25.description: I've been going to LensCrafters and Americas Best for eye glasses for years until a friend recommended Village Eyecare. I've been wearing glasses for 25 years and was impressed as how comprehensive the eye exam was. The Dr. Sarai was very friendly, knowledgeable, took his time and explained everything he was doing - I was impressed. They have a great selection of eyeglasses, however they are expensive - but no more then any other retailers selling designer glasses. My only issue with them, unlike the other retailers, they don't offer a selection of cheaper frames. BTW, the staff was super helpful and friendly and helpful. While I didn't purchase my glasses from Village, I found the same frames on eBay for a fraction of the cost, I do plan on getting my Rx filled here. I've heard they have an onsite lab and can fit the lenses within a couple days. Overall, I had a great experience here and highly recommend this doctor. If you've been going to the chain places, you'll notice a big difference in the care you receive here.

12.description: How often does the owner of a business actually work with his/her customers? I was astonished by the level of customer service and attention I received from not only Dr. Sarai (the owner) but also from his two other staff who were very kind women. I had a comprehensive eye exam for both glasses and contact lenses. Plus I bought the $50 for $100 Yelp coupon! Nowadays it's easy to buy glasses from Warby Parker etc. for fairly inexpensive glasses but after my visit to Village Eyecare I absolutely see the value in coming in, in person, to one's local eyecare shop. I got GREAT service, spent about an hour just scoping out new frames and the ladies were super helpful as I tried them on, plus I got a great estimate on future contact lens purchases! Overall staff were extremely kind, patient, and gave me 110% customer service---they went above and beyond! I highly recommend giving Dr. Sarai and his staff a visit, you won't be disappointed!

21.description: Dr. Sarai was very helpful and thorough.  The staff here is amazing!  I've been to other boutique vision centers before and have YET to receive the level of quality service that I received here.  I was so pleased with my visit that I made them my go-to for any eye care related stuff I will need in the future :)Their selection of frames is also pretty expansive.

17.description: The best!  Great staff and Dr. Serai is awesome.  Very helpful in selecting nice frames that suit the individual.  The best service!

10.description: My first experience here. Top-top-notch. I had a full eye exam and bought glasses and contact lenses. The exam was the most comprehensive and thorough I have ever had, with both cutting-edge diagnostic technology and plenty of old-fashioned doctor-administered tests. Professional, thoughtful and super-friendly help from Dr. Sarai and two technicians - one who performed a few of the initial tests (sorry - don't remember her name) and Lori, who was fun, energetic in finding me the right frames, candid about what was a good and a bad idea, and extremely knowledgable about optics, frame design, and how to best use my insurance coverage. An absolutely fantastic experience; I felt that everyone was committed to making sure my eyes were healthy and that I got the right glasses and lenses. Good prices for contact lenses, too.

5.description: Great customer service from scheduling appointments, the great reminders, no waiting and great support from all of the team. Eye exams and appointments I don't mind making and keeping.

35.description: Lover Dr. Sarai!!!  I have never had much success getting prescription glasses spot on (I have the worst vision).  After going to Optometrist after Optometrist, Dr. Sarai was able to fit me with the correct prescription glasses ---- I can see perfectly!!!!  And the staff has always been only pleasant!

19.description: Easy to schedule, and quick and efficient appointment without feeling rushed over by the doctor. Exactly what I look for in any appointment!

28.description: If you look through the reviews for Village Eyecare and are worried about previous negative reviews, don't be.  This company has completely transformed itself.  I will be the first to admit it used to be bad, but it's clear those days are gone.  I have high expectations when it comes to customer service and this place exceeds them.  This place has done a great job on hiring professional, approachable, intelligent employees.  Not an easy task.(Since there are two locations, I'll be posting this review twice)

3.description: Very enjoyable visit to the optometrist! Nice, clean office, helpful staff, and caring doctor. I would recommend them highly!

33.description: I chose Village Eyecare because it was close to my work and home and was listed as a participant in my vision plan.  I had no problem making an appointment on a Saturday.  The staff was friendly as was the doctor.  After a visit with the doctor, I was sent out to chose frames while my eyes adjusted to the solution that was put in them.  The salesgirl brought me quite a few frames to try on.  She wasn't pushy about any of them, but I ended up choosing a designer brand.Afterward I went back into the examination room and waited for what seemed like 25 minutes.  The doctor had been with another patient.  When I returned to pick up the glasses they said if there was any problem to come back in a week.  I did return a week later because the world seemed a bit blurrier than clearer.  The salesgirl took them to the back and adjusted the angle and everything now seems fine.  I found the people there competent and professional and would recommend it to others.

43.description: My vision is fine.  So, I can only speak of the service that I have received for several unforeseen eye issues.   My first visit was for an emergency.  I was able stop in, be examined, and have the issue addressed within half an hour max.  Dr. Sarai is very personable and humble.  He does not rush appointments and makes sure that you understand what is going on with your eye (or eyes). Also from my experience, the staff has been friendly and accommodating.  I have also been to the other Village Eyecare and I can say the same for his wife, Dr. Sood, and her staff as well.Should I ever need eye care (again) in the future.  Village Eyecare will always come to mind first.

2.description: Dr. Sarai and the staff at Village EyeCare are Amazing. I appreciate Dr. Sarai and his thoroughness with his patients, he goes through everything with you and doesn't rush you in and out of there, he cares and has his patients best interest. I have Type 2 Diabetes and he is concerned and always checks my eyes for diabetes and ask me about my Sugars and if they are under control to make sure that I understand clearly what he is looking for with my eyes and my diabetes. Which is very important to me. I have been going to Village Eye care for 5+Years and love it. I always recommend them to friends and co-workers who are looking for an eye doctor and they have multiple locations to meet most areas and needs.My experience there is always top notch!

45.description: I have always had good experiences at Village Eyecare.  I've been a patient for a few years now, and have never had a problem.  The staff is extremely friendly: they always remember my name.  Walking into a business where nobody greets you is horrible- Village Eyecare is not one of these places, which is so refreshing!  Dr. Sarai is such a nice doctor and very thorough with eye exams.  His professionalism and charisma are top reasons why I continue to visit this place.   Although the eyeglass selection is more pricey than your local Dr. Tavel, I have to say that I have definitely gotten what I've paid for.  I always have contact lenses and the latest fashionable frames that I'm willing to pay for.  I recently went in for a pair of sunglasses at the other location and was surprised at the selection that was offered to me. Overall, this establishment is very welcoming and I give it an "A" for customer service.

18.description: Dr. Sarai was very helpful and thorough.  The staff here is amazing!  I've been to other boutique vision centers before and have YET to receive the level of quality service that I received here.  I was so pleased with my visit that I made them my go-to for any eye care related stuff I will need in the future :)Their selection of frames is also pretty expansive.

41.description: I went to Village Eyecare for the first time because my insurance had changed. The staff were all great. They were very friendly and helpful. The eye exam was as thorough as anywhere else I had been. When it came to pick frames I wasn't finding exactly what I wanted so they suggested I try the South Loop location. Again, the staff there was great. They helped me pick out a frame I love and had them delivered to the Talor street location because it is more convienient for me. Like otheres, I would have given it five stars except I had to wait two weeks to get my glasses, but believe me, they were worth the wait.

50.description: I got a chance to meet bot the doctors. Both are good. The persons over the counter talk very nicely and helpful except in certain situations.I am not sure about the spectacles. but definitely avoid buying contacts. though they say that they will supply 1 yr of solution free of cost, you have to go and pick up a bottle(60 ml) or two every month.  the person over the reception asked to go ahead and buy contacts even after me complaining that I see blurry vision some times. after having a second checkup, I decided that I will not wear contacts. The worst part is that they wont take back the products, Return policy is not mentioned on the receipt. They said that they can only give store credit  and can only be used by me. So, Just beware. you can buy same contacts in other stores and are anyway lot cheaper.

4.description: Dr. Sarai is great!  Staff is very friendly and efficient. Scheduled times are kept.  I have been going here for years and have nothing but great things to say.  I always recommend the office to those looking.

6.description: The staff here is so great! Dr.Sarai was very thorough and was an extremely awesome guy to talk to aside from the actual exam. Went home with a new prescription which included contacts to treat astigmatism that was not noticed by another OD. Let's just say that I have not seen objects this far away for some time.Lastly, the staff was so helpful in sorting out what my insurance and FSA account would cover and not cover, which can always be confusing and a headache. They made everything smooth from beginning to end. Highly recommend Village Eye Care!!!

15.description: great service, nice atmosphere, clean and helpful

20.description: This is a fantastic eye care practice with extremely helpful, thoughtful, and knowledgeable staff. The doctors are top notch and are very easy going and easy to talk to. I have rarely had such a consistently positive experience at any other businesses overall, so it is an extremely well-run establishment. The office is neat and their frames selection is modern and plentiful between this and their 2 other locations. I would recommend anybody to go here. I would make the drive from my residence in Edgewater to visit their location(s).

36.description: PROS:  I have been too many opticals in my lifetime.  I have gone through MANY pairs of eyeglasses...maybe as many as 10 pair of eyeglasses...  I have extremely poor eyesight.  Dr. Sarai does a very thorough eye exam.  The lens turned out great.  Lens were very thin with its new and latest advanced technology and  vision was sharper than before.  They have excellent and stylish selection of eyeglasses that are from Europe and Denmark such as Lafont, Salt,etc.  I bought a pair of  ProDesign.  This is the optical that has the widest selection of ProDesign glasses that I've seen so far....CONS:  Absolute nasty staff (ie Lauren).   I am so tempted to tell Dr. Sarai (the owner) that the people at front are rude and should think second about his staff.   I dealt with Kathleen at my first encounter...she was extremely helpful in picking out my glasses.  My glasses had to be specially order to come with nosepads (prodesign eyeglasses gives you the option of adding nosepads).  My glasses turned to be on backorder.  It took a very LONG time to get my glasses (probably 4-5 weeks after the eye exam).  I dealt with Lauren (I believe that is her name) and she was absolutely unprofessional.  If my glasses are on back order, why wasn't I notified?!  The staff absolutely dropped the ball on their part. Okay, that is understandable and I am a forgiving person. However, Lauren was really rude about this situation to me...First, she talked to me very condescendingly as if I did not know what the meaning of "back order."    Then she gave this LAME excuse that this glasses were coming VERY far from Denmark so it takes a VERY long time.  Okay, lady friend...I KNOW what back order means and I know that glasses are from Europe (I gone through more than 10 pairs in my lifetime already!)... I dont care if glasses are coming from planet Mars...I have always get my glasses in 1-2 weeks max!    I don't need you to come up with whole bunch of excuses..though they were reasons for the long wait, I was very upset having to dealt with such a rude associate..at least I should have been notified earlier and would not have an unecessary trip expecting my glasses.  As any customer,  I should have been spoken with   RESPECT.  Remember, customer is always right...esp if you want my business next year!!!  I am personally conflicted whether I should come back to this optical.   They have great selection of eyeglasses, good optometrist. and advanced eye technology.   However, if I see this Lauren girl in the optical, I don't want to ever  go back.

14.description: Great place to get a through eye exam our whole family comes here !!! Great and friendly staff !!

58.description: Terrifically intimate place to enjoy live jazz. The owner is generous and has a great ear for talent!

56.description: What a find this was. Was strolling down Chicago lanes, getting ready to say good bye to my abode of 1 year..and what do I find ? A tucked away Jazz lounge..which turns out is almost 66 years old. Walked in right in time for a Jazz Matinee show by David Sanchez Quartet, from Mayaguez Peurto Rico. They were teriffic.We were instantly treated like one of their inner circle guests...Wayne Segal, the perfect host, made sure we were entertained as well as well attended to...with perfect wines to accompany the music.It is such a cozy atmosphere, getting to socialize with the artists and guests and have a very merry time. I am going to miss Chicago and I would definitely add this to my list of Chicago faves.Highly recommend :)

29.description: My first visit and definitely not my last. This small listening room resonates history -- walls covered with photos and posters of jazz greats who have performed here, a mishmash of antique upholstered settees and less-comfy chairs, and small round tables with candles. I wanted to send the large photo on the stage out for conservation and apply furniture polish to the abused legs of the Steinway but the feeling of being in the living room of someone who is not a great housekeeper has its charm.  The intimacy makes for wonderful sound and interaction with the performers. We were privileged to hear Benny Golson with three excellent sidemen. Mr. Golson's stories and delight with his colleagues and the music was pure joy to experience.

42.description: The only place I know where I can take my kids to hear live music on a Sunday afternoon.  We have heard top acts in a comfortable family friendly venue.  I love the Sunday matinees!

23.description: I love music. Our concierge recommended this place. The music is good. The service is okay. The cocktails were average but not worth the price. To end the evening I chose to have coffee, $3 per cup... Ridiculous! The music is worth the experience, but would I come back....probably not.

47.description: This is the best place in Chicago to to see the BIG Names in jazz up close and personal. There is not a bad seat in the house and the staff is always welcoming. If you love or even like jazz support this place as nothing in Chicago comes close to the Jazz Showcase.

8.description: Wonderful venue for jazz.Saw Jodi Roberts who took requests from the audience (just no Miley Cyrus :-(). She was absolutely amazing. The people are chill AND the couches are nice. What more can you ask for?

31.description: The highlight of our trip to Chicago was our visit to Jazz Showcase.  KT had asked if we would like to see some jazz while in town so we did a little investigation and ended up at Jazz Showcase based on its reputation and the artists playing that weekend.  We happened to be there for the Ari Brown Quintet and found enough examples of his playing on YouTube to know what we would be hearing.This review is for Jazz Showcase and not for Ari Brown, but I must say I would go back to hear him and his group any time.  At least on the night we were there they played great straight-ahead hard bop, it was perfect for our group.  We all liked it.  I would like to see him come down to St Louis to Jazz at the Bistro.  I was surprised the place was not packed full for this local talent.  I hope he is appreciated in Chicago.We are regulars at Jazz at the Bistro and found Jazz Showcase to be similar.  It is a little larger, seating and viewing is still excellent and it remains an intimate venue.  It is a listening room with drinks service, rather than a nightclub.  I have bookmarked Jazz Showcase to watch the artists that they have coming.  I would not rule out an occasional drive to Chicago for more.  Places like this keep Jazz accessible to those of us who prefer the intimate places to the concert halls and who are not night club people.   I also liked that they have Sunday afternoon family friendly matinees.  This is a great place for jazz.

34.description: A gem for the south loop. I usually come here when Rajiv Halim plays.The jazz acts the play here are all good.There usually is a cover like $10 but it is worth it. I look at covers this way. It's like you are paying for the music and it helps the place book the talent plus its like you are paying a service fee to help the establishment keep rif raff out. Like people who get into fights, are not ready to be outside their house and other crap like that. This way you are just with people who are classy or want to be out.I first saw Rajiv Halim play at The Drake last year. I like his sax act and how he mixes it up.youtube.com/watch?v=aVG-…He and I are not related. The reason I bring it up is because he plays at this place a few times a year.This is not a dingy jazz place. A good place to see some of Chicago's home grown jazz talent.check the schedule. if you are a live jazz person, you will be tempted to stop on by

16.description: Fabulous!!!  Cheap cover and a great performance last night.  I especially appreciate that you don't have to meet a drink/food minimum here.  I am so happy I happened upon this place.

13.description: The highlight of our trip to Chicago was our visit to Jazz Showcase.  KT had asked if we would like to see some jazz while in town so we did a little investigation and ended up at Jazz Showcase based on its reputation and the artists playing that weekend.  We happened to be there for the Ari Brown Quintet and found enough examples of his playing on YouTube to know what we would be hearing.This review is for Jazz Showcase and not for Ari Brown, but I must say I would go back to hear him and his group any time.  At least on the night we were there they played great straight-ahead hard bop, it was perfect for our group.  We all liked it.  I would like to see him come down to St Louis to Jazz at the Bistro.  I was surprised the place was not packed full for this local talent.  I hope he is appreciated in Chicago.We are regulars at Jazz at the Bistro and found Jazz Showcase to be similar.  It is a little larger, seating and viewing is still excellent and it remains an intimate venue.  It is a listening room with drinks service, rather than a nightclub.  I have bookmarked Jazz Showcase to watch the artists that they have coming.  I would not rule out an occasional drive to Chicago for more.  Places like this keep Jazz accessible to those of us who prefer the intimate places to the concert halls and who are not night club people.   I also liked that they have Sunday afternoon family friendly matinees.  This is a great place for jazz.

11.description: I want to give it 5 stars but they don't take care of the bathroom between shows and charge $1 extra (separate line item in the bill and everything) for ice in your drink...just petty stuff for a $30 cover charge. The mystic and space saves it but maybe this is just a preview of the post Joe Segal regime.

39.description: This is the best place for jazz in Chicago (all respect given to The Green Mill and Andy's). The atmosphere harkens back to a bygone day of live music. I've been here on several occasions, and have yet to be disappointed with the groups they bring in.My most recent trip to the Showcase was on NYE to hear the Roy Hargrove quintet. It was absolutely my ideal rendition of what NYE should be like: good music, a drink or two, and good people.

37.description: A great Chicago classic place for jazz.

0.description: Wow!! Coworker and I wanted to celebrate our Christmas break. We wanted to go out to listen to some live jazz. Ive heard so much about the jazz showcase and I didn't want to miss the opportunity to see Rodger Glasper Trio.  People came everywhere from out of town, south side, Wheaton and Highland Park. Show was sold out!! We were lucky enough to get standing tickets by the bar. Great music, Great view, Great environment and Wonderful staff. No matter where you seated it was a great seat. Drinks, the bartender allowed you sample couple of choices. Wow!! Never had a bartender do that before. I recommend this for a date night, meet up with friends and for the ones who just loves great music. The crowd was diverse in ages, race and sizes of people. Before or afterward you can dined at Bar Louie's. That located on the corner.

38.description: Strolled in late (11pm) on a Friday to catch some jazz only to find out that there was maybe fifteen minutes of the final set left. Really? In Chicago? I was surprised to learn this. Either way the door guy was cool and let us catch the last little bit. The layout is pretty straight forward, bar in the back, tables and chairs, stage, bathrooms to either side of the stage. Tip - if your evening is still in progress after the Showcase is done, Buddy's is right around the corner and still going.

51.description: Saw the Heath Brothers Quartet here on a recent Sunday night -- fantastic, these guys were great. As to the JS - great room, got there early, had good seats. $25 cover charge, cash only. Drinks not cheap but well made - $8 for a Jack Daniels & ginger ale, but tasty. Staff friendly. Waitress attentive but not hovering. Sound system good. Ambiance good - lots of photos and posters; sound system first rate. No food here, so if you're hungry eat before you go. Their web site says "The only food here is the olive in your martini."Will absolutely go back next time in Chicago.

27.description: As a huge jazz fan, I was very excited when I stumbled across this gem near my hotel. This is an exceptional place! The vibe is fantastic, it's the 2nd oldest jazz club in the country and the music on the night I went was stellar. Bartender was a bit of a tool, but the waitresses were awesome and friendly. A must see place if you are a jazz fan visiting Chicago!

32.description: One of the best venues for jazz in the country, hands down! They also boast a reasonable cover charge, especially for big names that play there.

54.description: I love good  jazz.  I love intimate venues for live music.  I love jazz photos/art.  I love history.  And this place has it all.  During the week, the cover is only 10 bucks.  If you are hungry, you can stop by Bar Louie next door and either eat there before the start of a show, or you can bring your food.  The drinks are reasonably priced.  The last time we went, we saw a great band that had not performed together in over 22 years.  They were actually quite good and I personally appreciated them returning to their passion after taking a break to "take care of life" as they put it.  One of the singers was particularly good and gave a great performance.  I took off one star because the few times I have been, the place has been quite cold and the seating isn't especially comfortable to me.  But everything else is 5 stars.  Hope to go back next weekend to hear Willie Pickens...check out his band if you haven't - awesome!!

48.description: Great little jazz spot in printers row.  You can see great music here almost any night of the week.  The drink list is on the basic side, but it's good enough if you are here for the music.  This venue has great feel, and more than a little bit of history.

44.description: I"m not exactly a jazz connoisseur, but I knew over the holidays I wanted to go to a nice relaxed jazz spot and I found Jazz Showcase.  So glad I did, I went over the holidays to see Roy Hargrove quintent, and it was awesome!!  A nice intimate venue, very relaxed (even with a packed house) and great location in Printer's Row.  We had "VIP" seating ($45) but given the size of the venue, I cant say that there are any bad seats.  I cant comment on the mixed drinks, but the waitstaff was moving briskly.  I arrived a few minutes into the set, after dinner (which I had with me)...and the guy at the door just asked if I was going to be eating that I open things before I went in (?)...if I was still hungry, I would have really appreciated that lol.  Great venue, and awesome talent....oh, and I appreciated how diverse the crowd was (both age and ethnicity) which was another plus for me.The only other venue for jazz I've been to in Chicago was Green Mill, and I'd definitely visit Jazz Showcase before making the long trek up north.

24.description: I went to Robert Glasper showcase last night and it was absolutely wonderful! His performance was flawless and the band left nothing to be desired. I ordered French martinis which were the best I've had in a very long time. The ambiance matched the energy of the crowd..... Pure Dopeness!!

7.description: Seriously, why consider going anywhere else?I went here on a my first weekend living in Chicago and I was blown away at how good it was.  The music was sooooooo gooood!!!  They mixed up the show between high energy jazz, smooth and sultry, and finally, classic jazz.  Each instrument was given a solo so you really got a taste of the various personal styles.   I was actually sad that I couldn't record the music, but it means I'll definitely have to return.  This is easily my new date spot, and a place I hope to go once a week.  The venue is also the best I've seen of dedicated jazz clubs in town.  I love the couches, the vintage pictures and advertisements, and the fact that every seat has a good view of the stage without standing spectators obstructing your enjoyment.

49.description: This is a great place to unwind after another crazy day at work.  The staff is friendly and the servers are attentive.  It's a very laid-back atmosphere (get there when you get there-- you're always welcome).  I often go by myself or with friends.  It's pretty large, but it feels intimate thanks to the candlelight at every table.  It has comfy seating spread throughout.  It is too bad more young people (or more people generally) don't frequent it.  The photographs suggest this was the spot to be some years back.  It has a great variety of shows and features some really talented musicians.  Enjoy!

40.description: I went here recently and had a fabulous time, and am looking forward to going back. I will be getting in more of the Jazz Showcase this Spring/Summer.

53.description: I've been going to here since they were at the Blackstone Hotel.  This location in Printers Row is only 2nd to the Blackstone location.  The ambience and setting is perfect for a jazz environment.  Wayne and Joe Segal know how to present the perfect jazz venue.

30.description: Went for the Jazz and got a nice dose, great music, nice atmosphere, and Joe the owner was there greeting everybody at the door.  There was a show at 8PM and another at 10PM, wish it was one long show with more than one band.

46.description: Pleasantly surprised. I'm not much of a jazz fan but wanted to let out-of-town friend experience true Chicago. The space is nice and not as crowded as Green Mill. The atmosphere was also more laid back (nobody shushing and frowning if you can't resist the urge to whisper). Cover was $20 when I went, didn't know if the artist was famous but I enjoyed the music and had a great time. Recommended!

1.description: I came here for New Years Eve and was supper excited to ring in the new year with some jazz.The music was wonderful, but we left with a sour taste in our mouth when one of the managers/bartenders shushed us! We were sitting at the bar, quite far from the band itself, so we really didn't see any harm in some chit chat while the music was playing. I'd love to come back and try it out on a regular night, as this night was just A-OK.

55.description: We came for a late night 10pm after dinner show, and had a no problem finding a seat. That was pretty much the only good thing encountered. We had to pay $25 dollars per person to get in. Expecting to get a good show we decided to pay and walked in. The service was terrible, but that is to be expected in a jazz bar. And the show? Well ... for 45 minutes of music and the musicians deciding what they are going to play next I can say there was barely a show. And definitely not worth $25 dollars. So when you decide to spontaneously go here make sure you check who is playing and if anything arrive to the early 8pm show.

9.description: Went here on a Sunday afternoon and enjoyed the space and live jazz music. Beer is cheap. Only $5-7 but I don't recommend getting a cocktail. The bartender didn't know how to make the most basic of drinks. Parking is only $5 so I recommend driving and parking - don't drink and drive though

26.description: This is a classic Chicago jazz nightclub.  Nothing fancy...just tables, drinks, and great music.  We saw Paul Molinaro and loved him and the place.

25.description: A Grown Folks Jazz Club - lol. Finally got my butt to this Fantastic and Legendary Club and it's ashame I didn't stop in much sooner, like years ago. Jazz Showcase is A Gold Standard in what a Jazz Club should be. All about the music and you the fan enjoying it. It's a Small and Cozy club. Excellent, Professional and Courteous Service from the host to the servers. I saw Robert Glasper Trio's 1st show in 7yrs together and it was OUTSTANDING. Seating is great and I don't think there's a bad view in he place. Heck, if you're lucky, you might be able to get a spot on the couch located on stage. Yes, while the band's performing you're sitting on the stage. I can't say enough GREAT things about the service. I felt like I was being welcomed home. Very friendly people and looking forward to returning. It's located just south of downtown Chicago, so if you're an out of towner, it's a short cab ride or long walk depending on where you're staying. Make it your business to see shows at the club.

12.description: I agree with everyone that the jazz performances are wonderful, however, I do wish the owner would consider A better cocktail menu to ensure his cocktails are the same caliber as the performances.I have been to the Jazz Showcase several times, however I am always disappointed by the quality of the mixed drinks served. The bartenders are very nice and courteous but the mixers are always flat and the drinks are watered down. I live in the neighborhood and would go more often if the complete experience was better.

59.description: Jazz Showcase was one of the stops on the Jazz Tour  - definitely a must-visit for the future. I loved the spacious and old-school glamorous feel of the hall.

21.description: We had a great experience because we had a private pre-party but I was disappointed the band started an hour later than scheduled time which means I had to miss most of the show!

17.description: This venue is an awesome place to enjoy jazz in Chicago.  Parking is very convenient with a lot right next door and a security person to watch over your ride.  Inside the staff were extremely nice to us and showed us to a table.  We had to share because it is crowded, but this was not a problem.  Drinks are served at the table, but you can also bring in someone under 18 as long as you are a parent or guardian.  I did not see any food options.

10.description: Went on a Thursday on a date This was a great spot I never head of Great atmosphere . Lots of history and great music 20 to get ... A little high price for only 90 min set , but I think worth it

5.description: I'm not a huge Jazz music guy so this is coming from the perspective of a newb just having a good time. Went here with a jazz enthusiast and she loved it. The band was really talented and easy to listen to. Drink menu had a lot to offer from cocktails to beers. Venue had plenty of seating available. One could sit right in front of the band or in the back by the bar. Good place to bring a date. Dim lit atmosphere with a spotlight on the mainstage. It was a fresh experience.

3.description: A fantastic venue for live jazz. Just don't order the High Society cocktail, it tastes like Robitussin cough medicine.

35.description: I stopped in to listen to a set during the Annual Jazz Pub Crawl.... It was love at first sight. I found it to be the perfect setting.  Nice, clean, dimly lit, lots of windows, an actual stage and great acoustics. It's a nice spot for date night or have a cocktail or three after dinner. The place has both traditional tables and high tops. There is also seating at the bar. If I had to guess, the place comfortably holds 150 people.

19.description: I brought a friend here for his birthday and the experience was AMAZING. The venue is intimate and the space is medium sized but can fill up pretty quickly so get there early. The Jazz was great and I was ready to come back again before I even left lol I will be back here for sure!

28.description: A music venue closest to matching our image of Chicago's jazz history.  We'll just try going over and paying cover next time, but on this occasion the artist (Pat Martino) was such a talent, and it was our first time, and we wanted to be sure to try seats right up front, so we opted to purchase seats ahead on line.  Unfortunately messed up and booked the early show when we meant to book the late and didn't realize until we were at the door.  Must have been the kind owner, at the desk, who admitted us graciously despite our error.  Cozy but roomy space with multiple seating style options and more an intimate concert space with drinks than a club with the music as background - great. Husband loved being up close on comfy little couch; I enjoy bar stool height seats and would try the back another time.  Either way, will return.

45.description: The venue was wonderful!!  Small yet intimate with great sound.  Saw the Maurice Brown Quintet and they were outstanding!!!!  Very nice hostess and we had a great time!!  Will definitely return!!!

33.description: Enjoyed my night here. It is as advertised.Showed up slightly late and was sat at a couch near the stage on the side of the room - it was actually great.The music was fine and the band was quite humorous hosts.  If you are looking for jazz in Chicago, I would look to come here.

43.description: Great entertainment,convenient parking,we saw Ravi Coltrane , great seating, altogether great night!!

2.description: We went to see Joey De Francesco, arguably one of the greatest B3 organ players ever (per my date).  If you are a jazz enthusiastic you will love the place.   They frequent live musicians each week.  The owner went over the schedule, and I wished I lived in the area.  There was not a bad seat in the house.  Good vibes, good music.  Apparently on Sunday, you can bring your children to a matinee so they can experience real music. :) Our Uber driver was unfamiliar with the area.  Thankfully we saw the BIG Jazz Showcase sign before he put us out at any one of several abandoned buildings. SMH.The drinks are expensive, but it doesn't matter if you come from the music.  After looking at the other reviews, I didn't even try to go to the bathroom.

18.description: We had a great experience because we had a private pre-party but I was disappointed the band started an hour later than scheduled time which means I had to miss most of the show!

41.description: I love this place for world renowned artists, but have to point out a few negatives , which they should really work on if they want to survive.  The cocktails are horrible.  They serve the cheapest alcohol in your cocktail (and it's not inexpensive).  Even after asking for a specific rum, they still gave me the cheap stuff.  One of the enjoyments when listening to live music is to relax with a good drink.  Also, their seating is back breaking.  They have small tables with hard wooden chairs that are so uncomfortable, that you can't sit very long.  They have a few cushy love seats, but they are always taken.  I really hope that Joe makes the changes with the bar and can get more comfortable seating.  These two negatives can make the entire experience unpleasant.  People like to "relax" while enjoying live music.

52.description: Loved it. Looked up things to do around Chicago before traveling for a conference. Walked over on a Monday evening from the Palmer House, was charged 1/2 the entrance because I showed up at least 20 minutes into the hr. The 7 & 7 I was served was tasty, stronger than not, which is to say perfect for some 20-something in search of a dark, beat room to hear music and wander mentally. The band I saw perform were 5 different folks ranging a good 23 years in age, 8 inches in hair (facial or head), and several shades of pigment. Their music was awesome, and so were their solos. The transitions from many to one instrument were graceful, gracious. I'd like to go back already.

50.description: Nice and quaint place that has good blues/jazz music. We went on a Saturday night and it wasn't busy. Cover charge was $20. Good entertaining music with a good crowd. Bar makes good  drinks and the bartender was very friendly. We lucked out with good seats next to the bar with a great view on a high table (recommended so you don't have somebody's head in your way). A good alternative to the usual clubs.

4.description: My Bestie invite me out to see Robert Glasper in concert. Amazing very low key and mature atmosphere. The whole experience was grown sexy and relaxing.I felt so relaxed after a long week at work. Nice music wine and awesome ambience.Well be back for another concert.

6.description: After living in the south loop for 6 years my wife and I finally made it to the Jazz Showcase to see the Roy Hargrove Quintet.  A fantastic venue for live jazz, the band was groovin' and put on a great show!  The show seemed to be sold out, as the venue was full, but there was not a bad seat in the house. And they have some couches, in different areas of the seating area.The wait staff was busy before and during the show serving cocktails, service was a little slow but the two servers had a full house so I can't expect them to work faster than they did. They were hustling to accommodate all the customers.Previous reviews mentioned the bathroom cleanliness.  I did use the restroom, and did not see the same issues as previous posters.Drink prices are actually very reasonable comparative to other places in the loop. Beer $5-7, and cocktails $7-12.Not sure why we waited so long to actually come here, but will definitely be back regularly now!

22.description: I recently went to Jazz Showcase with a group of friends. I had never heard of the place, but was blown away by how much fun it was! Good music, good alcohol selection, and great atmosphere. The location is in a strange area. Safe, but strange.I have lived in the South Loop for a while and am only a 12 minute walk away from this place (it is ~10 minutes from the corner of Michigan and Roosevelt). Now that I know Jazz Showcase exists, I will definitely be going back!

15.description: I recently went to Jazz Showcase with a group of friends. I had never heard of the place, but was blown away by how much fun it was! Good music, good alcohol selection, and great atmosphere. The location is in a strange area. Safe, but strange.I have lived in the South Loop for a while and am only a 12 minute walk away from this place (it is ~10 minutes from the corner of Michigan and Roosevelt). Now that I know Jazz Showcase exists, I will definitely be going back!

57.description: One of the jazz club gems in Chicago. The talent is top notch and the nostalgic decor takes you back to the golden days of jazz. The chairs aren't the most comfortable for an extended stay.

20.description: This venue is an awesome place to enjoy jazz in Chicago.  Parking is very convenient with a lot right next door and a security person to watch over your ride.  Inside the staff were extremely nice to us and showed us to a table.  We had to share because it is crowded, but this was not a problem.  Drinks are served at the table, but you can also bring in someone under 18 as long as you are a parent or guardian.  I did not see any food options.

36.description: Like it a lot, think it's defly one of the top 3 in Chicago (on par with Greenmill, Andy's).

14.description: Had a wonderful holiday treat to visit Joe Segal's (new) dogs and to see the fantastic Roy Hargrove Quartet on January 2. Had not been to venue since before it moves from the historic Blackstone and was pleasantly surprised. While it lacked the retro-cool ambience of the original, it was comfy enough (get VIP seating if possible), some former staff were on hand, jazz enthusiasts were aglow in the intimate setting and the smell of stale cigar and cigarette smoke was gone (yay!).For Chicago to have the unique vintage it possesses with jazz, why are there so few intimate venues today in which to enjoy world-class artists such as Hargrove? Fortunately, not only does the Showcase still make this possible but affordable. Additionally, my party ordered three premium cocktails for under $20 and convenient parking was only $5 - in the South Loop!Thank you Jazz Showcase for keeping it real and keeping it ALIVE.By the way, Hargrove and Co. were ON FIRE during the last show of the evening and he even treated us to a vocal rendition of "Never Let Me Go". It was stirringly emotional and captive.

58.description: I don't get my ass out of bed at 4am to be able to get in anything just to have your trainers hogging many pieces of equipment at once.EDIT:  incidentally, male trainers have been hitting on my girlfriend when I'm not there with her--very unprofessional.

56.description: This place is a dump!  I got a 7 day guest pass online, I was visiting from out of town, they wouldn't accept it. WTF?! Doesn't state that anywhere on the pass itself, so I asked to see the manager, David Reyes and he said" well, since you're already here I'll let you work out today but next time you'll have to pay $20 per day for a day pass or pay $100 for the month."I got a really bad vibe from the attitudes of the employees here.
