Felt as though I was an inconvenience to get a pass.So, if you're someone who is seriously interested in joining, who was visiting, showed an out of state ID, the guest pass somehow wouldn't  be allowed? Wow. Get a clue, this is a service business people! Poor customer service, company seriously needs to train  employees on how you treat people.Additionally, the first Floor looked like it hasn't seen a vacuum since the place opened 8 years ago.I had intended on joining this location but based on the way I was treated I won't be back. Goodbye brutal man cave gym, my next visit.. will be FFC right down the street.

29.description: Not a fan.  I signed up for the two year membership and still will not be going.  Staff is overwhelmingly rude, weights laying all over the place and the men's room smells like no other.  What a waste of money.

42.description: I completely agree with the previous commenter (L.T), that this place "is not about fitness... it's about cornering people into getting memberships and not providing adequate customer service". I too signed up for the 7-day pass online to see if I would like the gym. I went into the gym informing the lady at the front desk that this was my first time and that I would like to use the guest pass. I was told to fill out and sign a form which then got directed to Mike as well. He then asks for a bunch of information from me, followed by a long tour that felt like an hour. Afterwards we were led back to his table and he insist that I needed to sign up for membership. I told him I was only going to be here for the weekend and that I was a college student from out of town. He then told me to start a membership and put it on freeze until I'm off school. At this point, I was completely dumbfounded and felt very uncomfortable with the way he forces me to get membership at the gym. I simply just wanted to use my guest pass to workout, because by this time my pre-work has long pass kicked in. We wasted what felt like an hour of my time touring the area and discussing membership plans. I haven't even used the gym yet! What makes you think I want to get membership without even using the gym yet? Furthermore, he told me to fill out a form to reference friends, in which I did because it seemed like the only way he would let me in the gym. (Don't do this guys! Your friends will message you back in disgust.)Oh, and he warned me not to report him if I felt like "anything was wrong" because it would make him look bad ... I don't think posting on yelp is considered "reporting" is it? I'm just being honest; if you have fitness goals, achieve them anywhere else but here.

23.description: Avoid this company!!!! Poorly managed and terrible customer service that do nothing to address concerns.Here follows a list of the multiple issues at this club:- My initial PT failed to show up for multiple sessions, always cancelling at last minute or simply would be now show. When I would go to the club to ask - no one was ever to contact him. On two of those occasions, his roommate, a fellow PT loudly said while talking to other PTs at the main PT desk that my PT was at home, "hungover and too busy f***ing this girl" to come in to work. This banter carried on while two of the main trainers were working with other clients and in the main upstairs workout area (with cardio and weight machines) - both referencing having been out the night previously, their heavy drinking and the girls they had brought back home. In total this PT's no show happened 5 times over the course of 3 weeks. At that point I was fed up with the unprofessional behaviors or both this PT and his colleagues and went to the GM with my concerns. - An individual heavily urinated on several exercise mats and the upstairs hallway near the cycling studio, soaking the carpet. The smell was horrible and nothing was done to clean it up. Two weeks later the same incident happened again.- While working out in the weight area the back corner often reeks of heavy marijuana smell.- In May my son and his nanny were at the club. They went to the ladies bathroom and sent me a picture of them finding an open needle in the one of the toilet stalls.- Many many times while working out you can hear PTs loudly airing their very detailed grievances against Xsport as well as many inappropriate, sexually orientated or vulgar derogatory comments about both males and females guests that were working out at the same time.

47.description: UPDATE 4/15:  After contacting corporate, XSport did right by me and made me whole again.  They re-activated my membership and everything is as it should be.  So I'm upping the number of stars from 1 to 3.  I still feel some kind of way when I approach the front desk though......  (original review follows)I've been a member of this particular XSport for a few years now....well, scratch that.  I WAS a member until my membership got cancelled.  Sit down and let me tell you this story....About two weeks ago, I attempted to log on to my XSport online account to check on some information.  I couldn't get in.  So...I called XSport Customer Service thinking that maybe I forgot my password and could get it reset easily, right?  Wrong.  They told me that because my card had been declined three times in a row, they cancelled my membership.  Only problem is, my bank had not received any requests for payment from XSport.  Customer Service dug deeper and found out that (to my surprise), not only was the wrong card number on file, but my e-mail address had been entered incorrectly, therefore the e-mails they claim to have sent out never reached me.  You would figure that due to their gross errors, they would just reinstate my membership and let me go on my merry way, right?  Wrong again!  They tell me I have to truck into an XSport, RE-SIGN AN AGREEMENT, and then I could rejoin their fabulous gym.  HA!I was crazy enough to try that.  And here is where it gets even crazier.I walked into this XSport and walked up to the front desk to let the young ladies know that I was here to re-sign.  They told me to have a seat and someone would be there shortly.  No problem.....or so I thought.  People that were coming in AFTER me for the same thing were getting serviced BEFORE me....and not only did the young ladies at the front desk not check on me, but they looked me RIGHT IN MY FACE as I was sitting there and didn't check on me, didn't ask if I was being helped, NOTHING.I left...and immediately called corporate (again).  They took a formal complaint (or so they say) and advised I called the gym and speak to the manager there.  So I called and spoke with Jessie, who sounded as if he could really care less about my problem, but asked me to come in and speak with him personally and he would help me through the process.  He then told me that I could get my membership reactivated for $78 up front and $39 a month....for a month to month membership.Question:  If I'm paying a month to month membership, why are you asking for two months up front?  That sounds like a contract to me!As much as I liked working out at XSport, I do not think I can in good conscious give these people a second chance to screw me over like they have.And XSport, if you're reading this, please remember two very important things:* The customer is usually (not always) correct.* You're not the only gym in town.

8.description: I was giving a 7 day pass and not told that I had to to use the pass immediately once it was activated the same day I received it. And it doesn't say anywhere on the pass that it has to be used immediately once activated. I paid for parking and that was free but they did not share that with me on my first visit. Ask the manager if he could make an exception for another seven day pass or just give me this day for free since I paid for parking so I can see if I like the gym. I was told no you need to pay for one full month we don't make exceptions!It's not the money it's the principle that I wasn't given all the information that I needed to make all the right choices and now I'm being penalized for it. First encounter with the arrogant manager is just a reflection of what this place is going to be like.Management it's not rocket science all your bad reviews are customer service related!!! SMH

31.description: The gym is fine. You can get your workout in and do any exercise you want. Yeah, the free weights are never where they should be, and re-racking never happens but you get over it.This review is more about the customer service I've experienced. I've been disputing a charge put on my card for over a month now and have a feeling I'm being lied right to my face. When I signed up, I was offered a few free personal trainer sessions. I wasn't interested because I work out with a buddy. As an alternative, the manager, Jesse, offered me 3 free massages. Sweet!Well, they weren't free. I was charged full price for 3 massages! When I saw it, I said I'm not interested in the massages if I'm being charged full price and would just like a refund. I visit Jesse every week to check the status of the refund. The conversation begins with me saying "Hey Jesse, do you remember when we talked (Jesse starts shaking his head no) last week about the charge I'm disputing?" It was just the other day that we finally realized the charge was coming from the spa...when Jesse was on vacation and another manager helped me. How does it take this long?Now I'm dealing with the spa and since they initially entered my info into the system, they can't find my account. Figure it out XSport, figure it out.

34.description: Better than most basic gyms. The pool and the many workout stations are a plus. I find the staff to be not as accommodate as in other basic gyms. The men's locker are left to desire. Shakes are standard as well.

16.description: Danielle Guzick is seriously the best spin instructor I've ever had...including multiple locations and gyms. She is fun, motivating, and engaged with every single person. Her music makes me wanna hit the club!! Highly recommend seeing her FREE classes on Wednesdays at 5:30pm or Friday's at 6pm!

13.description: If you are like me who just wants to use raw weights and don't care much about Modern equipment this place would work for you as long as you find the best time that is less crowded. Unfortunately there is not a ideal time this place is ever les crowded. You need to walk into the gym with a mind set to switch workouts, In short you need to be knowledgeable about your workouts just for the fact you might not get what you need to workout on for quite sometime. Their maintenance can improve a bit I guess especially with the workout towels. Pro-Huge gym All possible equipments Friendly staffNew equipments added very often at least from the time I joined. Cons -They are trying to keep the place clean and it's still a work in progress- Crowded - can get smelling Cos it is crowded and close with minimal ventilation.

11.description: There's this one girl who works in the front that's like a sign-up-blocker. She is unwelcoming, has an attitude and really, makes you just not want to deal with this facility. The rest of the people are nice, but sales ooze out of the people who work here. Whether it be their sweaters, protein bars, etc, they really eye you like a hawk and swoop in at every opportunity... But besides trying to sell you stuff, they won't offer any help with anything. Actually when you need someone to help you with something, there isn't anyone that can help-- ugh.Their women's bathroom needs maintenance/updating, as there was water mold on the ceiling in the bathroom. They don't allow members to bring in the same guests repeatedly, so you have to have a different guest every time. What? The manager explained it's due to the over-crowdedness of the place -- how is bringing the same person and bringing different people each visit help with the population issue?  Upon my sign up, I wasn't shown around, so I walked around not knowing where things were. Towels anyone? Anyone??

39.description: this place very clean

37.description: I had joined the gym few months ago and never had a great experience. The people working there and other customers are just rude. Recently, Someone broke the lock and got into my locker. Stole my wallet and cash.  I reported to the Manager but he did not care. Took my membership number and that's it. Was more interested in eating his breakfast than finding out what happened.  Seems like this happens there very frequently. I contacted the corporate office and the customer assistant took my phone number and said that the manager will call back. It has been a week now and have not heard back. I canceled my membership and joined a gym where I can feel safe. The cheap membership price attracts all kind of people and mostly people who are there to cause problems. You will get what you pay for.  I learned it the hard way. If you join them, join at your own risk and if your belongings get stolen then don't complain.

0.description: Heads up - If you are looking for superior customer service, fine attention to detail, and an associate who takes care of his customers, hit up Will at this location for any and all membership inquiries. Dude is a rockstar!!!

38.description: If you can avoid this gym altogether, It is in your best interest to do so.  Integrity is a unknown word to them. Example: I referred quite a few people including family members that I live with I never received my discount or free month. Next if you are member that pays 39.00 dollars and well you decide to go to another location add ten dollars more especially in the Schaumburg  area. Normally when you're a loyal client for 5 years you get better offers and deals not here. THE MOST IMPORTANT REASON IS THE CANCELATION PROCESS IS GOD AWFUL. EXASPERATION FITNESS took out a total 150.00 out of my bank account without my consent and after I submitted a letter demanding cancelation.  I have not pointed out all the negatives because there is no need to discuss opinions, I'm just stating facts. You have been warned.

51.description: wow.  in order to cancel a gym membership in 2015, I have to WRITE A LETTER and MAIL IT.  verified by calling the gym to ask.  as well as the website which says to cancel by CERTIFIED MAIL.  what a scam.  they could make this easier but why would they do that?  everybody knows big gyms make their money by selling memberships to people who never end up going....why not make a little bit more by making it more difficult to quit.   BE CAREFUL.  they go for a hard sell when you go in for a "free" trial period.  seriously.  CERTIFIED MAIL TO QUIT THE GYM.  nice corporation.  support the little guys.  the independent gyms.  the big ones - they don't care.  they don't have to.  I know.  take your money elsewhere.  right by a bunch of downtown colleges where they are happy to prey upon college students.  please note - other reviewers have said this same thing about XSport.  wish I had visited yelp BEFORE I signed up.what a pain.

27.description: I've been here for 1.5 years because I bought the whole year got one year free. I liked the price and liked Xsport very much at the beginning, but then it gets busier and busier and busier! They try to get as many as people they want!! Very ambitious I see it, but can you imagine working out at a super smelly and crowded gym? When you want to breathe, you can't because the smell is really bad. When you want to use some workout equipment, you can't because it's full of people. Where are weights? They rarely are back to where they are supposed to be. My stuff got stolen from the locker room. Yes, I did lock my locker! I also saw a sketchy lady walking around the locker room and did not know what she was doing. But then when she opened her locker, she collected a lot of Xsport towers and some other stuff in her bag. I'm sure she's not a staff there.Anyway, you decide whether to join or not.

32.description: This review is for the spa.. I went in for an eyebrow wax, which I normally don't get as I am an esthetician and I always do my own eyebrows but since I was moving I packed up all my stuff and decided to get my eyebrows done instead. I specifically told the girl just to do a clean up since my eyebrows already had a natural arch shape and only had a few hairs to wax. I repeated it twice that I just needed a touch up. What do I get? Fucked up eyebrows! She completely thinned them out. I no longer have my arch! .. Literally looks like sperm eyebrows since they're thick at the beginning and thin out. On top of that they aren't even even .. She left my left side thin and my right side thick. I don't understand how you fuck up a touch up?!?!?! It's the easiest waxing since the client already has the shape. I didn't ask for a re-shape I asked for a touch up. Don't go here if you care about your eyebrows! I would give it 0 stars if I could.

54.description: Xsport is swift to assist their customers when a concern is brought to their attention. State of the art facilities and offer a variety of services!

48.description: I took a shower after my workout today and the water was hot for about five minute, then it went ice could.  I stayed in the shower for about ten minutes after that to see if it would warm up.  Well it didn't, so I had to towel off my soap covered body.  This is the third time that this has happened.  Xsports makes a lot of money and should have an unlimited supply of hot water!!!

44.description: I came in and signed up for a $39.99 1 month trial membership. I was weary, and asked the sales guy if there were any other associated charges or fees. I was very clear about my concerns. He indicated there were none. I signed the contract without reading any of the fine print. This apparently was a fatal error, even after my inquiries.  After I finished my 1 month contract, I decided Xport wasn't for me and never again utilized their services. 6 months later Xport has charged my credit card a total of more than $250 without my consent. A conversation with the GM and a letter to customer service got me $40 back. I'm so sick of people being dishonest and evasive when you ask them point blank questions, just so they can sell you memberships and take advantage of you. Xport is the worst of the worst. Management is incompetent, and customer service is a joke to them. Anyone reading this can do themselves a favor and avoid this gym at all costs. If for no other reason than to protect your bank account from the greedy fingers of these dishonest assholes.

24.description: ANTI VEGANS !!!So... that just happened. I feel mortified. Completely embarrassed and offended by the staff at the X-Sport on State Street. I should begin by saying, that I have recently completely changed my diet. I am a strict vegan, and have noticed a change in the accumulation of gas in my alimentary canal.It happened. Let me be honest. It happened twice this morning, as I was on the cycling bike. Im human -I farted. Forgive me! 20 minutes into my workout I was asked if I had stepped in a pile of "shit" , later I was demanded to go into the bathroom to and I quote "check myself". This was not done in a tactful manner by any means. The guy "sterling" I believe. Blk guy/ long hair said that he was a manager and would get security loudly in an means to embarrass me if I didn't immediately take care of the situation. Again, never in my life how I ever felt so embarrassed by a gym. So... thank you "Sterling". Thank you for great customer service. Thank you for ruining my day. Thank you, Sir. Ps... I do find it ironic that security will be called if you fart in the gym. But I have been robbed twice at that facility, and nothing happens. I never go there with a wallet, or anything of value. Locks will be cut. Items will be stolen. No security or police will be called. However, change your diet, and allow the toxic gases in your body to be expelled, and then and then only will security be notified.

7.description: Update on previous review (12/3/2015):After calling the manager and literally listening to him type up an email to Corporate to cancel my membership and issue me a refund, I expected some sort of response. He told me they should respond within 5 business days. So I waited. Nothing. Charges still on my card.Called Corporate (877-417-1450) on 12/4/2015. Was on hold for 15 minutes listening to the most obnoxious ad for Xsport ever. And every two minutes an a voice came on saying all the operators are busy but my call is important. Seriously. Every two minutes. Most annoying thing ever. Not only am I stuck listening to you promote yourselves for 15 minutes but you have a voice come on telling me all operators are busy. DUH. That's why I'm on hold.Anyways.Finally get ahold of someone. Tell them I'm still being charged even though I cancelled on August 31. Immediately transferred to someone else who looks me up (first tries to by my key tag which I turned in when I cancelled so that's a smart question). She said, and I quote, "We just received notification from South Loop and our system hasn't updated." Ridiciulous. JUST? The manager at South Loop sent an email over a week ago. Finally get them to refund me my money. Then I ask for a confirmation email that my account is closed. She says "We're refunding you the money. Your account is closed." I tell her I want it confirmation emailed to me because they clearly have a problem with documentation. After putting me on hold, she comes back and tells me that she'll email me. Never receieved an email. But I did receive a voicemail saying my membership is cancelled so that's never getting deleted ever. This was absurd. The number of hoops I had to jump through when I was told a piece of paper is all that is needed to cancel membership. Don't sign up for a membership here. Don't. Unless you want to have to deal with this.

49.description: I was convinced by my boyfriend to join this club. Reluctantly i did, was smoothed talked into paying over $500 in personal training which i have yet to use. I explained the day i signed up i am a nurse and my schedual varies. I was asured that would not be a problwm for the trainer they were there for me. Welp, the very first time i needed to reschedual was a big problem. My assigned trainer would not respond to a reschedual. I was given a new trainer he did the first evaluation by leaving me on the machine and going off to help some one else and laugh and joke with co-workers. When i finished my set on the machine i went off searching for him, blno where to be found, hmmmmm. I continued my search down the stairs got my thing on my way out the door. He walks in the door looking surprised and aaked me if i was done, really dude. Ao much for personal trainer. I yet gave them a third tey with a female trainer, gender change no difference. Front desk staff looks down at you like your diseased. Hell, i should be the germaphobe, im the one working with patients all night. No help by the person that signed me up. Upgraded to a more expensive package to get in the touchy gum closest to my house, cleaner, nicer people until i was talked into joining biggest loser contest paid for more training sessions and nearly $500 worth of supplement. Needles to say i have yet to use there trainers, cant find one to work with my schedual and tried to return supplement unopened without receipt (dont recall getting one after an almost $1000.00 purchase of more training sessiona nd pills). No refund. Now stuck with pills that made me vomit and $1000.00 qorth of training i cant get to use. I want to cry but to angry to do so.

40.description: I've been going to the XSport on N. Av. for about a month, and I guess the saying "it is what it is" would apply. It's a pretty big place, with lots of equipment, so you can generally get your workout in, whatever it is. Free parking is for two hours, which is nice, but you can't dawdle or you'll end up paying $10 if you're 1 extra minute over. Reception area is crowded with merch, which isn't really segregated from the surrounding workout area. I mean, I know they have to make the club financially viable, but can't they do it in a slightly classier way? Also, the music in the club is very loud and god-awful. As almost everyone now-a-days wears personal headphone why do they play their music so loud (or at all) that it over-rides what you're listening to on your headphones? Very obnoxious, but I'm sure it gets the staff through their day (it's all about them, right?). The locker rooms are OK. Big enough, but quite squeezed in. TVs everywhere, which makes it seem like an airport waiting area. Enough already! OK showers, sink area, etc. A thread-bare towel service, which is way better than nothing. What they do need is modern water fountains. In a gym where everyone is concerned about adequate hydration this is a real failing. Tisk, tisk; any self-respecting and competent gym operator would put in modern water fountains first thing and as a matter of course. I don't ball anymore, but the basket-ball court looks pretty darn nice. I'll have to pay more attention and see the quality of the game here. Spin room: doesn't need to be locked all the time. Very exclusionary. Throwing a couple of worn down spin bikes onto the workout floor (in tragically comical areas: very top of the staircase?) doesn't cut it. Why not just eliminate spinning altogether, and use the room for more than an hour or two a day? OPEN THE SPIN ROOM!!!! OK, next month I'll write more as I've had a chance to use this club (I go 3-4 time a week). So far: 3 stars.

53.description: This place rips you off. They add random service fees everywhere and don't explain them and tell you they'll waive them and never actually do. I've spent $160 for their sub par facilities and they make it impossible to get a refund or cancel your membership. Save yourself the hassle and invest in a real gym.

30.description: Although this XSport is convenient with a cool rock climbing wall , free parking and smoothies that aren't consistent .... The level of cleanliness is deplorable!!! I've been to many gyms where things are worn out due to usage.  But to have black dirt on top of the foam (which indicates bacteria) in the Hot tub or caked mold and grime in the corners of the pool is just gross. Because of an injury I NEED to be in the water but it's so disgusting that I can't even bear to stand in it although my face isn't going under water anyway. The machines don't work or aren't available.  You would think because of the location that you're getting what you pay for but considering my memberships are 33-39.00- not 15.00...  u can definitely go somewhere else.  If u take a closer look- This place SUCKS and I'm not the only one that thinks so

46.description: total scam, I pay $ 39 for one month, one week after it freeze my account and I'm asked to pay another $ 30 twice. faster you escape this gym !

1.description: This gym is very good!I workout 3-4 times a week with my trainer Cosmo. Every day he shows up on time and ready with a full workout for the day. We also track nutrition, progress, and recovery.The gym also has a nice smoothie section where you can order a tasty post workout shake.It is a very clean and the staff will help you with anything you need.

55.description: I went here the day after Valentine's day with my girlfriend as its her gym. The place has plenty of amenities (weights/machines, swimming pool/sauna, basketball courts, multi-purpose room) but is missing a track which is important for me as I like to run indoors in the winter (not too fond of treadmills). The staff was friendly, but I had to go through a somewhat lengthy sign up for a guest pass. That along with swimming pool and basketball court not being allowed for guests made this a ho-hum visit.

9.description: Avoid this company!!!! Poorly managed and terrible customer service that do nothing to address concerns.Here follows a list of the multiple issues at this club:- My initial PT failed to show up for multiple sessions, always cancelling at last minute or simply would be now show. When I would go to the club to ask - no one was ever to contact him. On two of those occasions, his roommate, a fellow PT loudly said while talking to other PTs at the main PT desk that my PT was at home, "hungover and too busy f***ing this girl" to come in to work. This banter carried on while two of the main trainers were working with other clients and in the main upstairs workout area (with cardio and weight machines) - both referencing having been out the night previously, their heavy drinking and the girls they had brought back home. In total this PT's no show happened 5 times over the course of 3 weeks. At that point I was fed up with the unprofessional behaviors or both this PT and his colleagues and went to the GM with my concerns. - An individual heavily urinated on several exercise mats and the upstairs hallway near the cycling studio, soaking the carpet. The smell was horrible and nothing was done to clean it up. Two weeks later the same incident happened again.- While working out in the weight area the back corner often reeks of heavy marijuana smell.- In May my son and his nanny were at the club. They went to the ladies bathroom and sent me a picture of them finding an open needle in the one of the toilet stalls.- Many many times while working out you can hear PTs loudly airing their very detailed grievances against Xsport as well as many inappropriate, sexually orientated or vulgar derogatory comments about both males and females guests that were working out at the same time.

26.description: I debated on how many stars to award this gym and I honestly don't give one star okay but this gym needs to take a class on personable skills!I don't care if you have issues or are having a bad day.... If you work the front checking in people at least be somewhat pleasant and at least polite!!!-which was not the case at this location.Let me paint you a play by play!!!Me "hi how are you..I haven't been at this location in like five years so I need to validate my ticket after my workout"Girl at the front "no you don't need to its good for two hours"Me "are you sure?"Girl at the front "yes" (minimal eye contact)Fast forward to gentleman signing up my guest Who basically didn't respond to my question of "hi how are you"...Went straight into a sales pitch...Ignores half my questions....Didn't show any personable skills....I mean how would someone be interested with that kind of attitude?!Fast forward to the parking lot where oh wait the ticket that supposedly didn't need to be validated.....comes out to $8....not free...waited and wasted five minutes of my time for someone to let me out...And the individual stated "they're not validating tickets up front again?" Ugh not coming back here....Worst xsport experience EVER!!!!

25.description: I was surprised to see so many bad reviews about,  in my experience I've found the place pretty clean (but some areas like the basket ball court smells of sweat), lots of equipment but I agree with the reviews about not very personable front desk crew.One reason that makes me be loyal to the gym, is my trainer - Sterling Moss. Great guy to work with, I have bad knees, ankles, back, wrists and feet, but I still workout everyday and feel strong,  thanks to him. If I had to rate him,  he'd get a 5+

12.description: My husband and I visited this location today. He has a membership and I went as his guest. Sam the manager explained to us that they were one of 2 locations that do now allow guests because of how busy they are.  This was something that we were unaware of. He however values his members, explained the policy and allowed us to work out this one time! Customer service is everything to us. This same thing happened to us at La Fitness, but that manager turned us away in subzero temperatures. Thanks Sam and Xsport!

59.description: Thank YOU STEVE! I came to Xsport with a friend who is a current member, he convinced me to try his gym (Xsport). The first day I came, I filled out the necessary paperwork for a guest pass and was assisted by a current employee named STEVE. Steve displayed OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE! He was proactive in explaining the gym to me, answered any questions I had and made sure to follow up with me in a timely manner to offer me a membership. He went above and beyond and displayed true leadership skills. After my guest pass was up, because of STEVE'S AWESOME customer service and the gym facilities offerings, I said YES to a membership. I cannot stress enough to people how excellent customer service makes a HUGE IMPACT on a customer decision to purchase a product or services.  I have left stores/establishments forever because of horrible customer service. It only takes one time to make a good or bad impression.  Your first impression is a lasting one. STEVE/Xsport has made a great and lasting impression.  Thanks Steve and Xsport for your service.  We all need more STEVE'S in the world. I look forward to hitting the gym and accomplishing my set goals. This gym has everything I need including Spa services,  group classes and a steam room. Those are just some of my favs so far. If  anyone is looking to sign up for a guest pass or get a membership, go into Xsport (STATE STREET LOCATION, CHICAGO) and ask for Steve. He is my recommendation. You WILL NOT be disappointed. One of the BIGGEST perks is that this gym is open 24/7.

21.description: There's this one girl who works in the front that's like a sign-up-blocker. She is unwelcoming, has an attitude and really, makes you just not want to deal with this facility. The rest of the people are nice, but sales ooze out of the people who work here. Whether it be their sweaters, protein bars, etc, they really eye you like a hawk and swoop in at every opportunity... But besides trying to sell you stuff, they won't offer any help with anything. Actually when you need someone to help you with something, there isn't anyone that can help-- ugh.Their women's bathroom needs maintenance/updating, as there was water mold on the ceiling in the bathroom. They don't allow members to bring in the same guests repeatedly, so you have to have a different guest every time. What? The manager explained it's due to the over-crowdedness of the place -- how is bringing the same person and bringing different people each visit help with the population issue?  Upon my sign up, I wasn't shown around, so I walked around not knowing where things were. Towels anyone? Anyone??

17.description: I was surprised to see so many bad reviews about,  in my experience I've found the place pretty clean (but some areas like the basket ball court smells of sweat), lots of equipment but I agree with the reviews about not very personable front desk crew.One reason that makes me be loyal to the gym, is my trainer - Sterling Moss. Great guy to work with, I have bad knees, ankles, back, wrists and feet, but I still workout everyday and feel strong,  thanks to him. If I had to rate him,  he'd get a 5+

10.description: Pros: - inexpensive- the majority of the staff are friendly & helpful- they're getting better about fixing broken machines- a fan of their childcare and hours- great location, easy to park, etc.Cons:- still some broken treadmills- they need more yoga classes

5.description: Great gym for the price $39 one person and they have everything + incl Pool, Hot Tub, Sauna, Steam Room & a wide variety of Classes. Always good energy & motivation in the building. A diverse crowd too, I love to see all different cultures and ages working out together. A bit crowded in the eve and morning but that's the same for any gym. A few weight machines broke on occasion but there are usually duplicates & they are never down for long. Friendly staff

3.description: This will be short and to the point. I signed up as a new member on 1/16/16. Membership cancelled on 2/12/16. End of story.

35.description: I have been a member to several gyms including LA. I really like this gym, the location is great and you get 2 hour parking for free. If you are a regular and are actually working out the employers are pretty friendly the trainers will even give you side advice. I would imagine if you are not a regular and just go to walk on the treadmill and sit on your phone and hog up machines people will notice and they will not knowledge you. It is a good gym for motivation and not a good gym for slackers. I like the steam room and the 24 hour tanning beds. I've had a few complementary massages and they were great. I paid for an entire year and got one free I like that they have that and I don't have to worry about monthly chargesthe only negative is that at all other Xsports I can take a friend for free but this one doesn't allow it :(

19.description: Update on 12/23/15: I got a call from a customer service rep and she helped me cancel my membership via email. Still, it is a big frustration and inconvenience not being able to cancel online or reach anyone via phone. I called the customer service number within the work hours but no one answered. Original review (1 star): Cancellation with mail? Really? You cannot cancel via phone or online. You have to send them a certified mail. They don't have a customer service at all. They provide a number but no one picks up the phone.I want to cancel the membership right now to prevent further charges but who knows when the mail will arrive. They will charge me for at least one more month.

28.description: Been an on again off again member of this gym... not they're fault in any way but mine... lol. Will power doesn't come easy...but over all... been coming to this gym since they opened this location and the north ave... branch before then. But needless to say... state st. has much work that needs to be done. Despite north ave have been opened so long already they seem to be able to maintain a standard level of cleanliness that state st has yet to accomplish. The sauna is literally FALLING APART... the wooden boards has somehow lost its nails and barely stable, a serious lawsuit waiting to happen!!! The walls are all stained with...I'm AFRAID to find out... it stinks to high heaven in there. The steam room reeks of piss... WHERE IS THE CLEANING STAFF?!?! The towels are serious stained with all kinds of marks that literally yellow and spotted. The staff at the counter is a joke. They're so busy chit chatting with each other, flirting with customers and playing with their phones that there's a line to beep in and no one gives a damn. Should just eliminate them and leave the scan bar on counter and parking ticket validator on the counter and things would move faster. It's ridiculous. And they need some kind of break room or something for them to have their lunch or dinner in. They bring pizza or pasta and the whole joint reeks of it, all the way up to the second floor. Note to management.

45.description: I signed up for 7 day pass online to see if I would like the group fitness classes. The next day a representative, Mike, called to ask if I was coming in. I told him I planned to around 4PM. An hour later, he calls again asking if I will be coming in today. I gave him a snappy tone and asked "I'm sorry, but were you not the one that called me earlier? I said I would already." He apologized and made some lame excuse that someone had printed out my information twice.So 4:30PM, I come in and fill out some paperwork. He then takes me around on a tour and gives me a spew about Xsport. I told him that there was a 5:00 class that I came specifically to attend. He said he would get me to the class on time, no problem. At 5PM, I asked if we could resume after the class. He said absolutely not and he needed to finish the tour. He leads me to his desk and tells me that because I've been a guest before (2 years ago!), I'm not eligible for the guest pass this time and that I needed to sign up for a membership. It is currently 5:10 and he keeps saying "let's do this as quick as we can so I can get you into your class. Just give me you credit card." Then he waves a manager over (which is their tactic.. "the manager will give you the best deal ever")So he charges me $39, 30 day guarantee or your money back. Unfortunately his computer craps out multiple times during our transaction... 5:30PM I look pissed and say that I missed the class. Mike goes and says "No, no I'll get you in." Then I told him it's a 30 minute class. He says "oh.." Then silence. No sorry, nothing. What a socially challenged douche.I am currently on the phone cancelling my membership and getting my money back because this place is not about fitness... it's about cornering people into getting memberships and not providing adequate customer service.

33.description: The workers aren't friendly, the TVs played in the locker rooms and on the cardio equipment are terrible (seriously, who watches USA Network and what gym has no TNT for the NBA, NFL Network during 3/4 of the football season, and replaces it a screen literally showing a Major League Baseball logo???), and half of the handsfree ellipticals do not incline and the Arc Trainers remain broken!!! It looks nice on the inside, but the longer you are there, the more you realize that it is actually a dump.

43.description: This location is a nice size. It's awkward having to go downstairs to the locker room but maybe thats just me. The gym idclean and I never have to wait for equipment but I usually go in the mornings. They have a great selection of classes and good deals on personal training.

2.description: When it comes to trainers ANTHONY C. Is the one for you! His customer service is phenomenal!! His knowledge of BOXING & fitness was impressive to say the least. Anthony  sent me a text the night beforehand which I never expected and made me excited to workout. On the night of our session he was prompt, professional and genuinely seemed to care about my level of comfort and overall wellness!  Now let me just say boxing is FUN! Much more difficult than I thought! U definitely need coordination which all black people DO NOT possess!! I quickly found this out when he had to tell me "no, 1-2,1-2" several times which after a while I had to even laugh at my own lack of rhythm. I worked out muscles that had not been worked out in years I'm sure and muscles I didn't know I had! So if you're interested in making a lifestyle change for the better and need someone to help you ask for Anthony C. You will not be disappointed!!

18.description: Bad customer service all around.  I don't need people to smile or even ask how I am doing.  I am there to workout and not to socialize.  Only thing that matters is their workout equipments.  Put in a complaint regarding two of their popular equipments and response from management has been zero.  When I stopped by the front desk regarding canceling due to my frustration, they seemed like they couldn't give zero ----.  They just told me who to talk to and when.  If you work as sales or management, wouldn't you do everything you can do to retain members?  Many of them heard me, but clearly they didn't care.  There are plenty of gyms near by: Fitness Formula, UFC, LA Fitness, Snap Fitness, Foundry, and the list can go on.  I like xsport since it's close to home and very convenient due to free parking, but the facts that your concerns or complaints are not taken seriously or even acknowledged is insulting and I rather spend my money somewhere else.

41.description: Great gym. Affordable. Clean. Big. Equipment variety. Nice staff. Trainers. Protein bar. Supplements that beat every major retailers prices. I don't see where the negativity is coming from. I signed up for the 30 day money back trial period, it's all explained in the documentation. I have 30 days to cancel or I'm charged. If I cancel, I get a refund. Matt was nice, Ray reiterated everything Matt said. Everyone complaining clearly wanted to be spoon fed. As a consumer, understand what you're signing. It's a membership. You pay monthly unless you cancel. I may do the buy 1 year, get 1 year free.

52.description: I have been working out here for close to 2 years. Con: Not the best places to work out. Barely any available equipment. Super packed most times. Cancellation process is difficult. Sent in the letter. Still getting charged. While not location specific, xSport corporate office has terrible customer service. Cancellation via mail is so backward. Still waiting to speak with a representative regarding the recurring charges even after I sent in the letter to cancel my membership.Pro: its cheap and conveniently located when I was in Printer's Row.

50.description: I used to love Xsport been to most of all there locations thorough out the city and suburbs new facilities and old been with them last 5 years. Dealt with sometimes griminess of the place no big deal I loved the 24 hour convience.  The only thing is I paid $1000.00 in training sessions convinced my girlfriend to join and then she got another $600.00 in training sessions.  I got injured at xsport on one of there machines was under doctors care, out of work for a couple of weeks. I let my membership lapse like 3 months so they cancelled my membership and I could not get refunded my $1000.00 in training sessions i did not used. This is after i upgraded my membership to access all their premium clubs. So yeah Im out $1000.00 they cancelled my premium membership. They did refer me to the Coporate office which wanted me to rejoin and they will restore my training sessions WOW. I should have never been cancelled in the first place. If I am unders doctors care.They concinced my girlfriend to up grade her membership and then sold her $500.00 in supplements which she wanted to return unopened and get a rerfund but they would not I think she lost her receipt. But wow Xsport with all there new facilites and premium membership still needs work on customer service. I have not rejoined even though I have spent years with xsport looking at other clubs to join thanks xsport fitness

4.description: I debated on how many stars to award this gym and I honestly don't give one star okay but this gym needs to take a class on personable skills!I don't care if you have issues or are having a bad day.... If you work the front checking in people at least be somewhat pleasant and at least polite!!!-which was not the case at this location.Let me paint you a play by play!!!Me "hi how are you..I haven't been at this location in like five years so I need to validate my ticket after my workout"Girl at the front "no you don't need to its good for two hours"Me "are you sure?"Girl at the front "yes" (minimal eye contact)Fast forward to gentleman signing up my guest Who basically didn't respond to my question of "hi how are you"...Went straight into a sales pitch...Ignores half my questions....Didn't show any personable skills....I mean how would someone be interested with that kind of attitude?!Fast forward to the parking lot where oh wait the ticket that supposedly didn't need to be validated.....comes out to $8....not free...waited and wasted five minutes of my time for someone to let me out...And the individual stated "they're not validating tickets up front again?" Ugh not coming back here....Worst xsport experience EVER!!!!

6.description: They'll gladly take your membership and trainer money, but when it comes to utilizing the workouts you're supplied by the trainer, good fucking luck. My trainer had me training with weighted balls. I needed them for a specific work out. The xsport fitness member at the desk just looked at me and said 'Sorry. Can't help you. Don't have them.' I then pointed to the studio full of the. And said 'Can I just use one of those for ten minutes.' 'Nope. That's for X Fit only.' Cool. This place is garbage. Their bottom line is the almighty dollar and don't ever forget that. They could give a shit about you.

22.description: I go to the gym primarily for personal training.  I had a trainer for 4 yrs at the Downers Grove location, but when she moved out of state a friend recommended training with Jordan at State St.  Jordan customizes each work out depending on goals/needs and he'll explain everything in detail so it's clear how each exercise is done as well as why you're doing it.  Every session is different and challenging so it never gets boring.  It's like working out with a buff friend!  He also teaches the Wednesday 6am group class which is crazy fun (and difficult, but mostly fun).

15.description: UPDATE 4/15:  After contacting corporate, XSport did right by me and made me whole again.  They re-activated my membership and everything is as it should be.  So I'm upping the number of stars from 1 to 3.  I still feel some kind of way when I approach the front desk though......  (original review follows)I've been a member of this particular XSport for a few years now....well, scratch that.  I WAS a member until my membership got cancelled.  Sit down and let me tell you this story....About two weeks ago, I attempted to log on to my XSport online account to check on some information.  I couldn't get in.  So...I called XSport Customer Service thinking that maybe I forgot my password and could get it reset easily, right?  Wrong.  They told me that because my card had been declined three times in a row, they cancelled my membership.  Only problem is, my bank had not received any requests for payment from XSport.  Customer Service dug deeper and found out that (to my surprise), not only was the wrong card number on file, but my e-mail address had been entered incorrectly, therefore the e-mails they claim to have sent out never reached me.  You would figure that due to their gross errors, they would just reinstate my membership and let me go on my merry way, right?  Wrong again!  They tell me I have to truck into an XSport, RE-SIGN AN AGREEMENT, and then I could rejoin their fabulous gym.  HA!I was crazy enough to try that.  And here is where it gets even crazier.I walked into this XSport and walked up to the front desk to let the young ladies know that I was here to re-sign.  They told me to have a seat and someone would be there shortly.  No problem.....or so I thought.  People that were coming in AFTER me for the same thing were getting serviced BEFORE me....and not only did the young ladies at the front desk not check on me, but they looked me RIGHT IN MY FACE as I was sitting there and didn't check on me, didn't ask if I was being helped, NOTHING.I left...and immediately called corporate (again).  They took a formal complaint (or so they say) and advised I called the gym and speak to the manager there.  So I called and spoke with Jessie, who sounded as if he could really care less about my problem, but asked me to come in and speak with him personally and he would help me through the process.  He then told me that I could get my membership reactivated for $78 up front and $39 a month....for a month to month membership.Question:  If I'm paying a month to month membership, why are you asking for two months up front?  That sounds like a contract to me!As much as I liked working out at XSport, I do not think I can in good conscious give these people a second chance to screw me over like they have.And XSport, if you're reading this, please remember two very important things:* The customer is usually (not always) correct.* You're not the only gym in town.

57.description: I am reviewing this xsport mostly on its group fitness classes as that's what I use most often. There is always a critical mass at each class which is nice and instructors have great energy. If you like to dance, Werq is a great class! It doesn't feel like you are working out for the whole hour. As one of the instructors put it, it makes you feel like you are in a music video. Zumba is also a great option. Spin classes are tough but a great way to get a kick butt workout in. The only class I wasn't thrilled with is Laura's yoga/pilates class. It's not challenging and I don't feel like I'm getting a workout. Other yoga classes here have been great! I also wish there were more "before work" classes in the 7am time slot. It is very annoying that you have to write a letter to corporate to cancel your membership.For the price ($40/month - don't let them guilt you into signing up for personal training if you won't use it), this gym is great. It also has lots of locker space, a climbing wall, and a pool.

20.description: I'm here 4 times a week and I have never had any issue nor being treat rudely. I am that kind of person who doesn't make eye contact or talk to anyone and they pretty much leave me alone. The cleaning people are working hard trying to keep the gym clean and I'm quite sure there's only two of them for this big ol gym. The only down side is that people never put things away or clean up after themselves but that's not the gym's fault.

36.description: This gym is a terrible establishment. It's messy, always crowded, and some of the equipment is broken. These are all things that drove me to my main frustration which is  their cancelation policy, it is absurd! You have to attend the facility 8 times in 30 days no more no less, to get a refund. EXACTLY 8. When  I spoke to the lady at corporate last Friday she said I had to visit the gym one more time to get my refund and then I could cancel, so I obliged. Then I called her office again for 4 days with no answer or response after I MAILED in my written request, to ask if I could put a stop payment on my next month dues since the mail is slow. Also, I can't for the life of me think of anyone who cancels things via postage anymore, usually these things are done in person but xsport requires you to mail in a request. Then upon speaking with her today come to find out I have to visit the gym yet AGAIN or I can't get my refund! And all before tomorrow when my account is supposed to renew. Had she picked up the phone or returned a call I Would have been able  to take care of this days ago. But I will make it to the gym today for my last and final visit so I can get my money back, which I didn't mention, comes in a check form 30 days later. My general point being that the information about membership and canceling is very poorly conveyed to members and their customer service is less than helpful. I don't mind jumping through whatever ridiculous hoop policies businesses have in place  for canceling but even cooperating with xsport is frustrating because you never get the same answer twice. There is no retention team, no one was interested in asking why I wasn't satisfied with the facility or how they could help, and their employees have zero desire to be forthcoming with information. I'll go back to a gym who cares about the treatment of their members.

14.description: Ok. so I've been going to this gym for 2 weeks now and I must say that I LOVE THE CLASSES I have taken. I have been to spin, muscle max, yoga, super strength, and pilates. The instructors are awesome and very efficient.I honestly don't understand the bad reviews this place has been getting. The equipments are top notch, the place is clean, they have a pool, spa, sauna, and everything is very updated. Staff is super friendly; they are on top of the game. If you ever make any complaints they want to know why and they will make everything they can to solve the issue.I am really impressed with this gym.I recommend Monday: Courtney's super strength class at 9 am; Tuesday interval training at 9 am; Wednesday Yoga at 9am; Thursday muscle max at 9, Friday yoga/pilates fusion at 9:15 and Saturday muscle max at 10 am.You will not regret joining this gym; I LOVE IT!CONGRATS GUYS! Keep up the good work.

58.description: The problems I have with this store are rarely about the store itself, but rather the customers. I can't stand grocery shopping on weekends when every person and their brother stroll through the cleaning section at a leisurely pace and decide to park in front of the men's shaving end-cap for a riveting conversation or yelling match.But, in any case, all Target shoppers absent, this store is pretty great. Granted, they don't always have every brand, but it was certainly a great one stop shop for me my first year of college. The employees can be well informed, but some have very little clue as to what's going on around them. A friend and I were looking for beach towels and went up to an associate and asked her if they had any more left. She said no. I went to go find someone else to ask. Sure enough, another associate said there were more on the second level. Case in point: if you have a question, better ask a couple of employees to get a feel for what could possibly pass as an answer.Above all, the most stunning thing about this store is that I've never ever had to wait more than a few minutes in the check-out lane. (Take that Jewel-Osco.)

56.description: This is my favorite Target, "stuff wise". I like the layout, I like their selection, I like the location, and I like the parking situation. The employees though, are another story. I went on what i realized too late was back to school shopping day for every student going to college in Chicago. There were people everywhere; it was intense. What really struck me was how apathetic the staff was. It's like they knew it would be extra busy and scheduled more bodies, but the extra bodies were so excited to see each other that everywhere you look you see pockets of 3 to 4 employees just talking. I had to track people down and interrupt gab sessions when I needed help. Checking out was worse. Ringing was interrupted by excited chatter. I love hanging out with and talking to my coworkers too, and I LOVE that they are all friends - but work comes first!

29.description: I only go there because this Target is closer to me, but every time I hated even more... the baby department is poor I never can't find things what I came for (the shelves are not restock) Today to avoid that problem again, I purchase specific item online (to pick up in the store). After few hours they send me confirmation that the item is ready to pick up in store. I only have 2 days to do that, before they will cancel the whole order. Few minutes ago I went to pick it up and what a surprise they system is down and she can't pull up any info !!!! really by 8:30 pm you have a problem to log on to the computer !!! so I have to go again tomorrow. this is the last time I am dealing with this particular store, change your management or you will loose more clients. This store is dysfunctional !!!... I don't know if its me or I run out of luck... so next day I went to pick up the item and they brought me the wrong color (actually exactly the same basket that I returned 3 weeks ago !!!) Online I order green color to be specific they brought white one and the person argue with me that white and green comes under the same item ... oh I gave up ... I told them I don't want white and I did not order white item.... they canceled the order (confirmation e-mail specify it should be green ) Someone need to visit eye doctor for vision and color blindness ... Good luck people ....

42.description: This target is great except the ghetto employees. They are rude and never smile and are full of attitude!

23.description: This review is for the pharmacy specifically.  The store is fine enough.If I could give NO stars, I would.  I don't regularly get medicine, so I'm only there maybe once every year or two, long enough for me to forget how poorly I was treated the time before, at least until I'm getting crapped on in the moment, and the memories return.  Although this one is the worst.So I am super sick with a virus +, and after days of getting worse, my physician called in some medications for me (antibiotics and cough medicine).  4 hours later I dragged my sorry tail in to pick things up, surprised to be told nothing was phoned in.  When I objected, they found one item (the antibiotics) but not the rest.  What?  I'd think that's an all-or-none thing.  But even the one thing they admit to is not ready.So there I was feverish, coughing, no place to sit (some mom and her kid are on the one bench) standing in the middle of the aisle until the prescription is filled.  I voiced my displeasure to them, as well as called my MD after I left.She called back the cough medication, and when she asked if there was a problem with their automated system for leaving prescriptions, even she got lip from the pharmacist.  This place needs a heaping helping of... human decency.  Forget customer service skills.  How about basic professionalism?  I think I've finally learned my lesson for the last time and will

47.description: I'm obsessed with Target. This store had the awesome cart escalator and free parking.

8.description: The experience I had last night trying to give this Target my money was a complete joke.Over the holidays, I missed out on the insane Xbox One bundles being offered online. So it made me quite happy to see that the price reduction to $350 came back after a short hiatus - not the best deal I've seen, but better than full price of course.Headed to this Target as the website said it had the Assassin's Creed bundle in stock. Picked it up as well as an additional game. When scanned in the video game area, it rang at $400. After rudely dismissing my saying it was now $350 "as that was a holiday thing," I showed Angelo the target.com page and he said I'd need to go to Guest Services to have it price matched. Annoying, but not a huge deal I thought.I get down to Guest Services and the woman whose name I can't remember already seems in a bad mood (can't really blame her, probably as fun as the airline lost baggage counter). I tell her the story (phone in hand) and she has to look it up on an iPad to confirm. After waiting a few minutes, I am told this is a temporary price cut and therefore not eligible for price matching. My problem with this is, is it really "price matching" when it is your own website?! I understand different stores incur different costs in getting their products but c'mon, this is a major international retailer we're talking about. I ask if I can sit here and buy it online for in-store pickup at the online price. "Yes but it could take up to one hour to process." At this point I was tired of trying incredibly hard to give Target my money and left. While the woman carefully set the console in a bin, she essentially took the extra game I intended to purchase and threw it over her shoulder into another bin. If you're shopping for games here, maybe avoid NHL 15 for that reason ;)

31.description: If you live in the more southern part of Chicago and need more than what City Target has to offer, this is where you need to go. Plenty of other shopping in the area too and a convenient location to transit.

34.description: I live in the neighborhood but don't like coming to this Target.  The main reason being is that I hate walking on Clark street.  This store is not pedestrian friendly; it was made for people with cars.  The sidewalk leading to the store is narrow and you are forced to cross a wide driveway leading to the store's garage, along busy Clark street.  The lower pedestrian story entry is very unassuming and unwelcoming.  Although I'm all for business in the area, this part of the South Loop reminds me too much of the suburbs.  All of the big box stores from this Target to Whole Foods and the new Roosevelt Collection etc all cater to the car driving crowd.  Now the Target in the heart of the Loop is a different story, that is a true urban concept store!

16.description: Leandra (sp?), the store manager, was the only positive part about my entire night and experience. I'm 9 months pregnant and really would have appreciated a little more respect and kindness from the other Team Members.We had a leaking item when we got to the cashier. I asked for a new one and the cashier said, "You can go get it."  I responded w/ "No, please call someone to get it." (I'm pregnant and you want me to run upstairs and back down?!) The young female cashier decided to give me an attitude for the next five minutes. I asked her to calm down and she then proceeded to YELL back at me that I needed to calm down. She looked young but I didn't expect her to actually act like an argumentative rebellious teenager. I pretty much had a screaming match at Target tonight. After we had been rang up, I reviewed the receipt and found that she had overcharged me by incorrectly ringing up an item twice. Of course, I received the same amount of attitude this time around, too, when I mentioned it to her. As I left, I mentioned I hadn't appreciated her attitude and her disrespect and she spat out more attitude. Had she been focused on her job and not arguing with me, she would have done her job correctly and not overcharged me. I feel terrible for her parents who must be severely disappointed in her, her coworkers who have to work with her, customers like myself, and mainly for her as she obviously has a barely bright future ahead of her. I hated my experience here tonight, it makes me almost want to shop at Walmart. Maybe even Kmart. *she didn't have a name tag on and refused to give me her name when I asked, and I can't find on the receipt the register number, but I'd be happy to come back in even if only to identify her. She shouldn't be working there.

13.description: This is my local store and I enjoy it very much. I purchased art work at this store and returned it.  The thing I didn't realize was that it was purchased on a gift card.  The returned was applied to the gift card but it was disguarded once the balance on the card was reached. Tabetha was absolutely amazing as was Racheal. They have excellent customer service skills! They gave me a target gift card in the amount that was placed on the visa gift card.  I can't thank you guys enough!

11.description: NO CROWDS OR CUSTOMER SERVICETarget has really expanded in Chicago to obnoxious level. Target feels like Starbucks with a location on every corner. We stopped in here twice this past week and both times it was a ghost town. It seems like this breach of credit card information is really hurting them. I recently heard on the radio today that upper class and middle class shoppers are no longer going to Target anymore. I would have to believe the reports after visiting myself. This location is two stories with three levels of parking. Speaking of Starbucks there is a location inside along with a Pizza Hut express. I don't get the express version of Pizza Hut because that food is just sitting there. It would be better if I just bought a frozen microwave pizza from Target and cooked it at my office. I will never know if that's true  because there is no way I'm eating either one of those food items. Target has everything you could need but I think there location expansion has saturated there brand. I use to go to the location on Elston near Diversey all the time because it was the only one around but since I've got 4 locations within a mile of me I don't even really care to go to Target anymore. The prices aren't great and the prices use to be amazing. There are no deals at Target. The customer service lady was kind of militant. She was a little rough on the customers prior to our time under the grill. There was no pleasant customer service hello. It was more like why are you returning this stuff because we need the money kind of attitude. Plus the lady behind us kept trying to get in front of us. She obviously doesn't like lines or does she think they are necessary. Since were talking about lack of friendly employees, the cash register employees were not that helpful or happy either. This store is in need of a managerial pep talk. Target is really going to need to do something to get back on track. Employees should be kissing some customer a**. Target lost the trust of the consumer and they need to step up their game but they haven't even made an effort. I thing they might be in trouble with declining sales and way too any Chicago locations. Hopefully they can fix the current situation in time before it's too late.

39.description: I'm not typically a Target fan, particularly in light of their exploitation of overseas workers.This is a very large and clean Target store. The main entry is a little confusing - hard to find. But once you are inside, it looks like a traditional Target with wider aisles and better lighting.Unfortunately, they did not have what we wanted. Oh well.

37.description: I mean its a Target, not a whole lot to say about it. Friendly enough service. Probably won't visit it again because it is not located near us. Stopped there to pick up spiced gouda cheese that I can't find anywhere else (gluten free). Like I said it's a Target, you can't find what you need there.

0.description: Super convenient to get to since it's so close to the Red/Orange/Green line and there is a bus stop right out front. They lines are always long so hopefully you aren't in a hurry when you go. It's a super Target so they have groceries and when you use the cartwheel app it's easy to save money on things you were going to buy regardless. I live at the Roosevelt Collection so it is super easy to get to whenever i need anything quickly.

38.description: Free parking, things I want have always been in stock (knock on wood), and sales associates are very helpful. Love Tarjay!

51.description: It's a target, what do you expect?  My only complaint is that the "automotive" section on the second floor is very small, but that's to be expected in the city.  I shop here frequently and have never had a problem.

27.description: Good clean store. Service is always friendly. Not the cheapest prices, but convenient and great atmosphere.

32.description: NO CROWDS OR CUSTOMER SERVICETarget has really expanded in Chicago to obnoxious level. Target feels like Starbucks with a location on every corner. We stopped in here twice this past week and both times it was a ghost town. It seems like this breach of credit card information is really hurting them. I recently heard on the radio today that upper class and middle class shoppers are no longer going to Target anymore. I would have to believe the reports after visiting myself. This location is two stories with three levels of parking. Speaking of Starbucks there is a location inside along with a Pizza Hut express. I don't get the express version of Pizza Hut because that food is just sitting there. It would be better if I just bought a frozen microwave pizza from Target and cooked it at my office. I will never know if that's true  because there is no way I'm eating either one of those food items. Target has everything you could need but I think there location expansion has saturated there brand. I use to go to the location on Elston near Diversey all the time because it was the only one around but since I've got 4 locations within a mile of me I don't even really care to go to Target anymore. The prices aren't great and the prices use to be amazing. There are no deals at Target. The customer service lady was kind of militant. She was a little rough on the customers prior to our time under the grill. There was no pleasant customer service hello. It was more like why are you returning this stuff because we need the money kind of attitude. Plus the lady behind us kept trying to get in front of us. She obviously doesn't like lines or does she think they are necessary. Since were talking about lack of friendly employees, the cash register employees were not that helpful or happy either. This store is in need of a managerial pep talk. Target is really going to need to do something to get back on track. Employees should be kissing some customer a**. Target lost the trust of the consumer and they need to step up their game but they haven't even made an effort. I thing they might be in trouble with declining sales and way too any Chicago locations. Hopefully they can fix the current situation in time before it's too late.

54.description: I Like Target In General and MOST in Chicago but this place is always out of things, Has alot of RUDE people working there and is not the cleanest store around. My advice is Customer Sevice, Customer Service, Customer Service and then work on the other stuff.Not exactly sure why i gave thias two stars and not one.Maybe because i like the 2 floor setup and the Cart Mover so you do not have to wait for an evevator to get to the 2nd floor and food department i guess.

48.description: I like the fact that they're incorporating more fruit and groceries into Targets. I have been consistently going to this Target location ever since it has opened. One thing that I do miss is their own layout. Although I like that the makeup/cosmetics section has better lighting, it's just boring to walk through the paper towels/toilet paper section to get what you need. That's probably a marketing ploy to make shoppers walk through the store and get enticed by other products. Ah, I see what you did there Target. Park on the top floor so you don't have to deal with the elevators!

44.description: It's convenient. Really convenient especially if you live in the area. It was my go to place for everything when I went to school in the South Loop.This Target is well stocked and nicely spaced out. I've never had difficulty finding what I want, and the staff if really helpful and friendly. You might have to wait a while at the lines, but then that usually happens at any store that caters to such a large area.I've only always bought things for my dorm room here and have never been disappointed.

24.description: Expect More. A lot more.Target opens its first stores in the Pacific Northwest in 1988. After only a year it opened 30 stores in Kentucky Tennessee Georgia North Carolina South Carolina and Florida becoming a national retailer with stores from coast-to-coast. In 1993 target opens 11 stores in the Chicago metropolitan area in one day- the most store openings in any one city on the same day to date.How often do we go shopping at the grocery store? Some people go every day, others - every two or three days, and others - purchase once a week. I belong to those who purchase once a week. Agree, it's convenient. Naturally, I choose the big supermarket where you can buy everything you need and not anywhere else to go. The best supermarket for me is Target.As I mentioned before Target is famous for the wide range of products from toothpaste to bots and technology. Moreover, I really like how they set items. Met quite a distance between detergents and products, so choosing bread you do not smell anything like Tide or some powder. On the top shelf is mainly organically clean and fat-free product that encourages buyers to look first at the healthy food.Have you ever come to Target and there were no free carts? No, never, it shows the presence of fast attendants. The first thing I noticed when I walked into Target, apart from the crowds was the smiles of the staff. If you go to Target to buy the products do not advise you to wear a red shirt. Uniforms of every staff present the quality and reputation of the supermarket.Also, despite the fact that Target is always full of people and a lot of shelves with goods I never felt I do not have enough space. Bright lighting creates the appearance of a huge space. Furthermore, there is one of the most spread errors in supermarkets - a cash register. Suppose in a supermarket 10 banks, but only two works, one express and one for large trucks. To have to stand in line longer than you spent on food choices. In the Target not all the cash, the company's focus on the client and she knows what time they are many. Therefore, you will not encounter this problem. Target is in daily business. This company knows that the client is paramount and create all conditions to make each of our shopping trip a little easier and a little happier.The company does not run in the race among the other supermarkets. Target understands that the one with whom he competes is its customers. The aim is the client complained or tried remake something and get ahead of it - to improve service to facilitate the process of shopping and etc. Target collaborates with its clients and this quality of his highlights in this business.

7.description: It's fine. The location of certain items doesn't always seem ideal, but it's not that big of a deal. I've never had too much difficulty finding what I was looking for which is all I really care about.  The employees can seem a tad dismissive at times but are basically more than friendly enough for me. Location is great for me. Prices seem consistent with the area.Here is my one gripe: stock some batteries, Target. I found an end-cap display by the food section (for food that requires batteries, apparently...there's that non-ideal placement of items), with the following basic selection: two D cell batteries, two watch batteries, six or eight AAA batteries, and 250 AA batteries. I needed AAs, but not enough to power the city in case of a power outage. I wandered around the food section, dismissed the idea of asking an employee if the rest of the batteries were by the cereal or the frozen pizza, then stormed off. Bye, Felicia. And what was at the register but a pack of six AA batteries.

49.description: I'm a Target-aholic and usually don't stray from my neighborhood Targets in the burbs, but we were in the neighborhood and decided to do our weekly (bi-daily is more like it cuz we come to Target 2-3 times a week!) Target-run here yesterday.First time at this particular Target.  I have to say the pharmacy is awesome here.  We had to consult a pharmacist, and the staff is amazing.  Very helpful and went out of their way to help us with our questions.  So, huge props for that.The store itself seems to still be in post-holiday disarray.  No big deal for me since I don't shop here all the time and we were really here to pick up a few things and look around, but if this was how it always was here, it would probably drive me crazy.  We were in the Men's, Kids, and Women's clothing departments and it was chaos with clothes strewn around.  Walking around in the other departments (grocery, electronics, toys, etc.)...not overly awful, but still many things all over the place within the aisles.No issues on the stocking of things that we ended up getting - they had everything we needed (mostly cleaning supplies, OTC meds, and a few clothing articles) and the staff we encountered were very pleasant (again, special shout-out to the pharmacist).  The store was crazy busy this afternoon too, lots of customers, and longer check-out lines.The kids liked the attached parking garage and the cart-escalator (although at first, it frightened them because they thought we'd put them on the escalator IN the cart. haha).  We used the elevators both in the parking garage and in the store, and I liked that they ran pretty quickly...didn't have to wait too long for an elevator.Also, I have to say, they had different styles in the clothing departments here than in the burbs.  I always like finding different inventory in stores across the city...today was no exception.

40.description: First things first, yes it's Target, not like there's too much different here than any other Target. So what makes this one better than others...1. Parking, if you park on the ground level and take the elevator or stairs, there's          plenty  of parking.2. Two levels, for me it's easier a smaller footprint I can find what I want faster.3. Flat out decent produce, they carry Almond Milk, and the yogurt I like.4. They're open an hour later than other Targets.5.
