A Starbucks, I need my caffeineI can get in/out of here fast and be home in five minutes, right now this is a big plus for me as I've been juggling some extra things, so food, sundries, booze, toilet paper, and some weird comfy chairs for deck called dish chairs for 20$ works for me.

53.description: I've shopped this target a number of times, and it's always the LAST resort for me, primarily because it's never clean and shoppers are rude and out of control. Merchandise is strewn all over the place, much of it dirty and damaged, any many times they're out of what you made the trip for in the first place. Compared to the recent experience I had at the State and Madison store, it's not even on the same planet. That store was a joy to shop -- clean, nicely organized, civil, nicely dressed shoppers who weren't shoving each other out of the way. I didn't see one article on the floor or left in a random aisle. (Yesterday, I saw a bag of grapes in the feminine hygiene aisle at a suburban Target. Nice.)Unless you have to...don't.

30.description: This location is out of our way however, the prices are much cheaper than City Target (State St.) so it makes it worth the trip for us.  Grocery section was great and offered a wide variety including some frozen vegan options.

46.description: I feel like rating a store like target is weird but this place is so awful I thought I'd make an exception. Also I am a little late to write this... but better late than never. So my boyfriend and I decided to make a target run to get much needed things for the house and he also needed razors. We spent a good hour in the store and bought his $30+ razors along with $200 worth of other things. When we got home he noticed they werent in the bag but they charged us for it. We searched his car and etc with no luck and since we had a formal dinner to attend that evening we drove back to Target to get the missing razors. He spoke to customer service who kept asking us if there was a chance if we left it in the cart or dropped it. And we kept replying "no, it never made it in the bag" then the incompetent rep went and got security to find these razors for us. So this piece of shit security guard with an attitude says that he replayed the video footage and that the clerk who checked us out put the razors in the bag and he called us "LIARS" and implied that we wanted to STEAL $30+ razors even though we come here all the time and ALWAYS spend over $200. My boyfriend made it very clear we were not leaving until they resolved this, so the security guard went back to go through the tapes again and said that he checked twice now and he knows for sure that we left with the store with razors and if we werent lying then must have been careless and dropped them. My boyfriend was getting extremely heated when the security guard left for the third time and then walked backed WITH THE RAZORS in hand and forcefully handed it to him saying again with an unapologetic attitude "the clerk dropped the razors between the bags instead of in it" and walked away. No apology for calling us liars, or thieves, or for the attitude. And mind you, this whole thing took an hour and a half to clear up.I understand that this is the city and they must deal with a lot of theft issues, but check your hoodrat attitude at the door. Immediately after we were given our PAID FOR RAZORS back we asked to see a manager and the manager was almost as bad as the security guard. She gave us a half ass, almost sarcastic apology and offered us three $4 coupons after being treated like criminals and wasting 1 1/2 hours of our lives. This isnt the first time we have been charged for things not in the bag but this was the most expensive missing item, sometimes I think they do it on-purpose to later pocket your stuff. I stopped shopping at this location after this horrible experience not to mention this place is a zoo. Its ALWAYS dirty, unorganized, and ALL of the staff is either half minded or unprofessional. Almost every time the clerks are ringing you up they are loudly joking around and shouting (oops I mean talking piercingly loud) to other staff members.

1.description: I love target!!!  I can honestly spend 2 hours here - no joke!  This particular store has the escalator for the carts. So cool!!  I was a bit afraid to use at first as I had no idea how to work it.  Little did I know that all I had to do is push it all the way in.This is store is huge!  Despite the size of the store, you can find things rather easily. What I like most about this place is that it was clean and organized.

55.description: The South Loop Target seems to be eternally restocking challenged.  Empty shelves are pretty common, it doesn't really appear to be dependent on a particular time of day, day of the week, etc.  Also, the customer interactions are pretty atrocious.  Rarely am I even acknowledged by check out staff.   My son literally had to yell "I've got bags!" after telling the checker while standing directly in front of him three times.  Mainly, the staff appears to be focused either on texting or talking to one another.  Most recently, as my check guy discussed how having to wear shirt with collars was too burdensome a requirement, he rang up a $15 item twice.  I realized it upon returning home and I went back to the store.  I had to wait while security verified I wasn't trying to steal from them (yes, it was their mistake).  I was then told my card would be credited.  No "Sorry about that" or "Yes, the guy just wasn't doing his job when he checked you out"  or "Sorry to waste your time".  Honestly, it's just not worth the hassle, poorly stocked items, and lousy customer service.

9.description: Rarely come to this location but when I do it seems like employees are consistently dreading their job. This morning I had asked for different size on a particular item that was not in its right place & before agreeing to the search the employee grunted! Saying the item might be the last & that is only because I commented on being in a place with other clothing. The employee ended up scanning the item & telling me it might be the last because it only showed so many on her gadget. It was too early in the morning to get a manager so I left with a different item. Now I understand it's early in the morning but one should be prepared for any sort of questions and be more then happy to assist..

26.description: Great place to pick up toiletries, cleaning supplies, birthday cards, or snacks. Target has all the necessities for your house or bathroom at a much cheaper price than Walgreens or cvs. The store is clean and we'll stocked even late at night after the store has been hit hard by the daytime rush. I have never had to wait a long time at the checkout line because there is always multiple lines running smoothly. The staff is helpful and always present. Staff is no more then 20 ft away willing to help.

25.description: Leandra (sp?), the store manager, was the only positive part about my entire night and experience. I'm 9 months pregnant and really would have appreciated a little more respect and kindness from the other Team Members.We had a leaking item when we got to the cashier. I asked for a new one and the cashier said, "You can go get it."  I responded w/ "No, please call someone to get it." (I'm pregnant and you want me to run upstairs and back down?!) The young female cashier decided to give me an attitude for the next five minutes. I asked her to calm down and she then proceeded to YELL back at me that I needed to calm down. She looked young but I didn't expect her to actually act like an argumentative rebellious teenager. I pretty much had a screaming match at Target tonight. After we had been rang up, I reviewed the receipt and found that she had overcharged me by incorrectly ringing up an item twice. Of course, I received the same amount of attitude this time around, too, when I mentioned it to her. As I left, I mentioned I hadn't appreciated her attitude and her disrespect and she spat out more attitude. Had she been focused on her job and not arguing with me, she would have done her job correctly and not overcharged me. I feel terrible for her parents who must be severely disappointed in her, her coworkers who have to work with her, customers like myself, and mainly for her as she obviously has a barely bright future ahead of her. I hated my experience here tonight, it makes me almost want to shop at Walmart. Maybe even Kmart. *she didn't have a name tag on and refused to give me her name when I asked, and I can't find on the receipt the register number, but I'd be happy to come back in even if only to identify her. She shouldn't be working there.

12.description: I've been here a couple of times and when I shop, I see items that I've seen on sale or clearance in other Targets and here they're not, I assumed it was because of the area that the prices were higher, but for higher prices one should get better service. During my past shopping experiences here I didn't speak to any employees, except the regular exchange with the cashier, but yesterday I asked an employee here an item related question and she had this "Why are you bothering me" look on her face, and she was no help. Then during checkout, I tell the cashier that the shoes she just rang up were supposed to be an additional 20% off, and she said it was already taken off, I tell her no that I think it was a promo or cartwheel deal that I couldn't find on my phone and I ask her if she knew of it, and before she answered she sighed, and gave me the "Why are you bothering me" look, then said no. As it turned out the shoes were an additional 20% off clearance on Cartwheel but I paid the price she rang up just to move on. Then as I'm walking out,  security runs after this guy (SWAT team style) that just walked out of Target and was in the parking lot, the guy opens his jacket for them and had nothing, security quiets down and they walked away very nonchalant, as though that scene never happened. Maybe it was a bad day for them, but there are tons of Targets in Chicago (theres one on State, one on Damen Ave, and on Washington St, all literally 10-15min away from this one) that there's no need to go through Roosevelt traffic and get poor customer service and pay more money here than at other Target stores.

59.description: Located about four blocks from where I live. This Target is a pretty good one.Huge two story with free parking (in the structure). Staff is friendly. Some even ask if you need help. Elevator access w/ cart escalator. Pretty neat.Store is clean. The ICEEs are always delightful.

21.description: Plain clothes security followed me around the store today. PLAIN CLOTHES SECURITY FOLLOWED ME AROUND THE STORE! LOL! I guess my hat, coat, gloves, and boots made me suspicious? I mean, it's only 19 degrees out, who dresses like that in Winter? Too bad I didn't notice until I was leaving and saw the guy in a plaid shirt and jeans walk into the door that said 'Team Members'. Where is your red shirt and khakis young man? Had I noticed before, I would have given him a tour of his workplace. What a joke.  I used to be a regular here Summer 2014, until I realized some of the employees on the 2nd floor didn't like being asked for assistance when I couldn't find something that was on sale or ask them to use their handheld scanner to see if they had anymore in the stockroom. Thank God for City Target on State Street. This Target and some of the employees SUCK!

17.description: This location is out of our way however, the prices are much cheaper than City Target (State St.) so it makes it worth the trip for us.  Grocery section was great and offered a wide variety including some frozen vegan options.

10.description: It's an adequate Target.  It's neither fantastic nor terrible. They do have a parking deck for customers; however, it's located one (1) black west from the CTA Roosevelt red, orange, and green line station.  I like Target because it's friendly to couponers like myself.  They have the gift card deals frequently when you purchase specific products at a certain amount.  Although you won't walk out with paying nothing, you have potentials to make some money back in a gift card form.  Those gift cards good for most items in the store at the next transaction.  By no means, you can save them since they don't expire.  Target also have a decent women's ready-to-wear department.  I typically check out what they have as I'm getting groceries or household items.  If you're not a hater to credit cards or suffering for bad credits, consider getting the Target credit card.  You get to save 5% on every transaction.  You know it's not a lot of savings, but it does add up eventually.  I believe they do have the "Target debit card" if you prefer that.

5.description: Customer service is ridiculous at this location. I was trying to get in line with to pay, the cashier was Jennifer in line 15. Around 7pm. We waited a couple minutes, and then she says, "I'm closed." So we had to go to another line that was long. Then we noticed that the same cashier Jennifer was attending to other customers after we had just been kicked out of her line. Then more people came and were taken care of. We asked for the manager, and they sent us to Maryam, whom was already with Jennifer. And she spoke with us and apologized and said that she was going to speak with Jennifer, but then after we turned around, she and Jennifer high-fived each other and started laughing together. That makes me think that there's no serious people working there. Worst customer service I've had at Target.

3.description: I love this Target. Ample parking spaces, huge selections, and it is close to home. I've been coming here for years!!!

35.description: 10+ person lines and they are closing registers instead of opening them.  All this while other employees simply stand around.  They also do not always honor the prices posted in their aisles.  At least the cashier told me to have a good night....

19.description: Very good.. Have been for the first time and this will be my regular car wash and detailing center..

28.description: I shop at this location because of the convenience and the selection of the beauty department. The  staff and security are so courteous and friendly. They proved themselves today to be worthy of 5 stars with their exceptional service. There was a solicitor who was asking customers for money. She so happened to ask me and when I wouldn't give her cash she asked for a credit card and then proceeded to try and touch my nieces face with her fingernails. No sooner than she attempted, that I asked her not to and she hurried to walk away. Security then approached me and inquired what was said; they then proceeded to escort said solicitor out of the store. Thanks target for prompt service and friendly customer service, as usual.

45.description: Yay I'm a fan, because honestly, who isn't a fan of Target?  Communists maybe.This Target is literally next door to where I live (not figuratively).  Despite that, I drive here on occasion when I stock up on staples or heavy things.The 2nd floor of the parking garage always seems to have parking, but the 3rd floor with direct store access is a hot mess.  Sometimes I'll just watch the near collisions from my balcony when I'm bored.It's a 2 floor Target with an elevator and a cart escalator for those who prefer that option.  The grocery section is seriously weak unless you're looking for processed stuff or frozen stuff.  If you want decent fresh produce/choice, go down the block to Trader Joe's.  I mean, but did you really need me to tell you that?

33.description: FREE PARKING GARAGE! Huge target with 3 floors!! And it has those cart escalator things along side the human escalators! So cool! A very clean and organized store

43.description: Love the store and selection.  Not always the best service and the parking lot is a bit of a jungle.

2.description: Worst target! So unfortunate that this is the one near where I live!! Doing returns here is such a pain! For example, I just came to return a movie because after taking the seal off I saw that the case was broken. Well, they're not letting me return it because "it's been open." Note that 1- the customer service girl, Brenda cut me off and didn't even let me talk and was overall just rude and 2- the case was still sealed with the sticker on the top. How is it my fault that the case was broken?? Final note- talking to a manager is useless and they are just as incompetent and always side with the staff. I love target, just not this target.

18.description: Expect More. A lot more.Target opens its first stores in the Pacific Northwest in 1988. After only a year it opened 30 stores in Kentucky Tennessee Georgia North Carolina South Carolina and Florida becoming a national retailer with stores from coast-to-coast. In 1993 target opens 11 stores in the Chicago metropolitan area in one day- the most store openings in any one city on the same day to date.How often do we go shopping at the grocery store? Some people go every day, others - every two or three days, and others - purchase once a week. I belong to those who purchase once a week. Agree, it's convenient. Naturally, I choose the big supermarket where you can buy everything you need and not anywhere else to go. The best supermarket for me is Target.As I mentioned before Target is famous for the wide range of products from toothpaste to bots and technology. Moreover, I really like how they set items. Met quite a distance between detergents and products, so choosing bread you do not smell anything like Tide or some powder. On the top shelf is mainly organically clean and fat-free product that encourages buyers to look first at the healthy food.Have you ever come to Target and there were no free carts? No, never, it shows the presence of fast attendants. The first thing I noticed when I walked into Target, apart from the crowds was the smiles of the staff. If you go to Target to buy the products do not advise you to wear a red shirt. Uniforms of every staff present the quality and reputation of the supermarket.Also, despite the fact that Target is always full of people and a lot of shelves with goods I never felt I do not have enough space. Bright lighting creates the appearance of a huge space. Furthermore, there is one of the most spread errors in supermarkets - a cash register. Suppose in a supermarket 10 banks, but only two works, one express and one for large trucks. To have to stand in line longer than you spent on food choices. In the Target not all the cash, the company's focus on the client and she knows what time they are many. Therefore, you will not encounter this problem. Target is in daily business. This company knows that the client is paramount and create all conditions to make each of our shopping trip a little easier and a little happier.The company does not run in the race among the other supermarkets. Target understands that the one with whom he competes is its customers. The aim is the client complained or tried remake something and get ahead of it - to improve service to facilitate the process of shopping and etc. Target collaborates with its clients and this quality of his highlights in this business.

41.description: This store only gets my business because its so close to my new apartment. the staff has the worst attitudes I have ever seen. The guy at the food counter Darius whatever his name is has to be the worst ever. He always says they don't have things around 7 when his shift ends so he does not have to cook it. Every time I ask for a pretzel they don't have any when he is there but as soon as he is off they magicaly appear. So I like to snack when I am at Target and one day I asked for the little stuffed bites he looked at me frowned and said "Well it will take like 5 minutes to cook you sure you want that..." UHHHH YEA! Jerk! He is lazy and has visible tattoos and just a ratchet mess. I saw one of the managers grind her booty all up on him so i think he feels like he has swag or something.I think the best way you get good people in there is to complain to management. I plan to do so in writing about him.

52.description: Don't waste your time at the clinic. They are nice, hence the two stars. But, they are not capable of taking care of you. I went there twice. On my first visit, they couldn't perform a strep throat test. Had to go to the immediate care center. Tried them again. Why? Well, I am a sucker for giving second chances. I went again and they couldn't test me for the flu. I was told to go to an urgent care center. Are they there just for show???? Stick with what you know....and, treating patients is NOT what they know!  PLUS, the store is so ill-designed that they are constantly out of stock!

50.description: This is a terribly depressing Target Store!It has a confusing layout and it is not very appealing..Shelves were depleted of merchandise and merchandisewas thrown around in the aisles.And.. it seemed like so many aisles were disheveled and Isaw employees having a good old time on the sales floor..They really need to go and clean up the christmas clearanceaisles for they are a big mess!I have a great Target near my place at Broadway and Sunnysideand  the only reason I stopped in here tonight was becauseI was doing something in the area.The one plus.. I did get a bag of Christmas M&M's at 70% offso I paid 0.89 cents for the bag.. this I did like..:)But.. Target  I will not be returning to your store on South Clark..I shall remain true to my neighborhood store.My neighborhood Target does not depress the hell out of me..your store does..Nuff Said...

4.description: Massive target. Great selection of TVs and grocery. However, the workers here are very unenthusiastic about life which makes the shopping experience an unpleasant one. I was also not very pleased with the furniture selection. I know for a fact that Target sells much more product than what was on the floor here so I was confused.

6.description: This is the Target closest to me, unfortunately. I dread walking in the place and tonight have finally vowed never to go back. You will wait....and wait....and wait....in line patiently while you see only three registers available and six shoppers in queue and no one seems...to....respond...they are too cool to respond to customers.  Almost every cashier I have encountered when I finally get to the check out, seems to resent your presence like a venereal disease. I have set myself free of this Target tonight and it feels so good I may decide to free myself of Target period.

22.description: I ended up paying $200 out of pocket to the urgent care clinic that Target sent me to, just to hear that I had flu and I should rest and ride it out!

15.description: This review is for the pharmacy specifically.  The store is fine enough.If I could give NO stars, I would.  I don't regularly get medicine, so I'm only there maybe once every year or two, long enough for me to forget how poorly I was treated the time before, at least until I'm getting crapped on in the moment, and the memories return.  Although this one is the worst.So I am super sick with a virus +, and after days of getting worse, my physician called in some medications for me (antibiotics and cough medicine).  4 hours later I dragged my sorry tail in to pick things up, surprised to be told nothing was phoned in.  When I objected, they found one item (the antibiotics) but not the rest.  What?  I'd think that's an all-or-none thing.  But even the one thing they admit to is not ready.So there I was feverish, coughing, no place to sit (some mom and her kid are on the one bench) standing in the middle of the aisle until the prescription is filled.  I voiced my displeasure to them, as well as called my MD after I left.She called back the cough medication, and when she asked if there was a problem with their automated system for leaving prescriptions, even she got lip from the pharmacist.  This place needs a heaping helping of... human decency.  Forget customer service skills.  How about basic professionalism?  I think I've finally learned my lesson for the last time and will

57.description: It is always a very crappy experience visiting this store from the workers who don't care to help you (or ever offering even) to the horrible lack of stocking shelves when they run out. I have emailed target twice about lack of their issues lack of keeping up with store inventory but nothing improves and you'll often find shelves of various items missing for months. The caliber of staff there too at the South Loop in canal location is the pitts. Obviously the hiring manager hires many of the same lazy workers who barely if at all acknowledge you. It would be great if they could greet you on entering and just ask if you news any help finding anything. Then, if you need help, it would be even better if they would ask you if you need them to show you where the item is rather than sending you on a wild goose chase by pointing to a random section.Also you'll see and have to smell Target workers smoking right outside the entrance in the bench which is not allowed but nobody says or notices it, except the customers who have to breath in smoke when coming and leaving the store.Management to Target, please read this.

20.description: The experience I had last night trying to give this Target my money was a complete joke.Over the holidays, I missed out on the insane Xbox One bundles being offered online. So it made me quite happy to see that the price reduction to $350 came back after a short hiatus - not the best deal I've seen, but better than full price of course.Headed to this Target as the website said it had the Assassin's Creed bundle in stock. Picked it up as well as an additional game. When scanned in the video game area, it rang at $400. After rudely dismissing my saying it was now $350 "as that was a holiday thing," I showed Angelo the target.com page and he said I'd need to go to Guest Services to have it price matched. Annoying, but not a huge deal I thought.I get down to Guest Services and the woman whose name I can't remember already seems in a bad mood (can't really blame her, probably as fun as the airline lost baggage counter). I tell her the story (phone in hand) and she has to look it up on an iPad to confirm. After waiting a few minutes, I am told this is a temporary price cut and therefore not eligible for price matching. My problem with this is, is it really "price matching" when it is your own website?! I understand different stores incur different costs in getting their products but c'mon, this is a major international retailer we're talking about. I ask if I can sit here and buy it online for in-store pickup at the online price. "Yes but it could take up to one hour to process." At this point I was tired of trying incredibly hard to give Target my money and left. While the woman carefully set the console in a bin, she essentially took the extra game I intended to purchase and threw it over her shoulder into another bin. If you're shopping for games here, maybe avoid NHL 15 for that reason ;)

36.description: This place has really improved in the last couple years. It's much cleaner, well-stocked, and the employees are more professional. They have everything a girl could need - free parking, starbucks, groceries, clothes, and pizza hut ;)Oh, and let me rave about the pharmacy. I had to have a zillion prescriptions filled before surgery. They made it happen promptly even though some were out of stock. Then, I lost a couple teeny tiny pills (must have been in a daze from painkillers), I called them and the pharmacist was quick to help and coordinate replacements :)

14.description: I am absolutely impressed with the customer service! Friday evening and tired, I shopped for some bathroom mats along with a bunch of stuff including some b'day presents. Got home and realized  after 3 hrs I had only 2 of the 3 mats when I was putting them in the bathrooms. I had thrown my original receipt but fortunately had my gift receipt for the gifts I had, went back asked them about my mat and they looked up In their system and didn find anything. Sheenah the team leader asked me to go get another mat and let me go with it for free. That people, is outstanding service!!!

58.description: Get the gyro pizza, just do it, it's fantastic. Great food, great price, great service, I'll definitely be back.

56.description: I rely on Yelp because I believe that, more often than not, a group of average consumers will get it right about a business. So one thing that burns my backside is when an owner and/or friends and associates spam a Yelp listing with glowing five-star reviews in order to up the rating. Which has happened here. You guys know who you are.  How is the weather in Florida, by the way?This is typical chain-store pizza, nothing more. And not particularly good. I had the "MyZa" (personal size) Toppers Classic (Pepperoni, sausage, onions, green peppers, mushrooms and mozzarella). It was mostly bready crust. The toppings were small and scant. And I could not find any sauce. Who ever heard of dry pizza? And at $7.50 (plus tax) it's hardly a good deal.  For take-out and delivery there are way better options in the neighborhood.

29.description: Tried to get pizza when I visited Chicago and this place is horrible - the absolute worst service I have ever received. I ordered a pizza and paid for it over the phone with my credit card and it was never delivered. Called back about an hour and half later and they told me it was on the way -- still never delivered. I checked my back account to confirm that my card was indeed charged. Called the place the next morning to let them know what happened and they claimed to have no record of my order. The man gave me the cell number of the manager who wasn't in, so I called him and left 2 messages with no call back. Called again a few hours later and his mailbox was full. Called the pizza place back and they told me the manager wouldn't be until the next day. Called the next day, and they said the same thing - manager won't be in until tomorrow. Called AGAIN, and still got the run around. The manager never returned any of my messages. In the end, I never got a pizza and never got a refund. $25 down the hole. I would never recommend this place to anyone. The service is crap, the staff has no idea what they're talking about, and the management is virtually nonexistent. Not to mention the fact that they literally stole my money from me.

42.description: This is a tip for Toppers (and customers as an FYI).  Toppers sends out coupons to locals with "ORDER ONLINE" plastered on it.  But you can't actually order online and use the coupons.  Advertising/customer service fail  :(That being said the pizza is okay, on a Domino's level, maybe slightly less greasy.  Pizzas with chicken, especially, seem to be a little lacking in the amount of toppings.

23.description: *Yawn* I went into my Toppers experience with high expectations. That's almost always a mistake, right? I thought with a great menu and concept like this, how could it fail?! Well it could. By providing tasteless, cheap crust and less than plentiful toppings. You'd think with their name, the toppings would be generous and of higher quality. If you think at all like me, you'll be let down. This is Chicago and and the pizza options are limitless. Don't waste perfectly precious pizza time on Toppers.

47.description: It's late, you don't want to cook dinner, and you could really go for some greasy food. Insert Topers Pizza. It's a 5 minute walk from my apartment. The price is right, and the ToppersStix just hit the spot sometimes. I haven't had the pizzas or anything else. But the ToppersStix are just... good. In that "I really want cheesy breadsticks that are greasy and tasty and remind me of college." There are a bunch of dipping sauce options--something for everyone. I'm a fan of the garlic butter. [If you're going to do greasy food, then do it right and go all out. Cheese + bread + butter + garlic butter for dipping = unhealthy deliciousness.]So it's not a gourmet pizza by any means, but it's exactly what I want and need some nights.

8.description: More so a 3.75, but i'll be generous and round up since they are generous with their toppings.  The other reviews are accurate, it is pretty much like Pizza Hut, but a little better.  Their pizza is greasier and has more on it.  The dipping sauces are key!!! Must get the Garlic Butter, Buffalo, and others.  Also try the breadsticks.The downside is that it's pricey compared to the other competitors, dominos, papa johns, etc.,  It's worth it once in a while.

31.description: This pizza is delicious. A great place for a late night pizza. It's priced well and I enjoy every piece of it. The wings are not my favorite menu item so I would probably steer away from the wings and just go with the pizza...after all it's called Toppers Pizza not Toppers Wings---makes complete sense. They are open til 3 AM and deliver til 3AM which is a plus especially after a late night out on the town. Definitely a neighborhood favorite.

34.description: I mean this is one of the only pizza places open next to me that I can get pickup from, which let's me avoid the costs of delivery. I love pizza and especially late night pizza. Go here. It's good.

16.description: So the pizza is obviously not great by any standards.  It's also a bit overpriced.  But this place is open until 4am and the staff was super friendly and enthusiastic.  Be warned: the 30%-off coupon advertised here is not honored.

13.description: this fast-food pizza chain gives coupons occasionally. each week you can get a large (196*pi square inches of pizza) for $10.99 plus tax. That's about $12.  that's like, two dinners for two people, $3 dinners! I guess that's not that cheap after all, but it's much better than full price.Of course, with that deal you can't choose what pizza you want. Only one or two a week get that special status. There are some days ofthe week (tuesday, I think) where  you can order 2 of any size, buy one get one free. try to use a coupon, i guess. it's good fast food pizza

11.description: This place is open to the near ass-crack of dawn. There's a bunch of stoners working here, but that's pretty much every pizza place in the universe. Service and greasiness are always fluctuating. Bacon sticks are on point.Every time I eat one of these pizzas I hate myself for a while because of how much cheese there is. In the end, no regrets. Just don't get delivery, they'll screw you over and say they don't have change.

39.description: I went to Toppers for the first time last night.  I finished my last full day of classes and presentations for the semester so I decided to reward myself with some good, and by good I mean bad for you, food after longingly walking past this place all semester. The store itself is really clean, which is always a plus.  There was so many different options on the menu I couldn't decide what I wanted!! Toppers has a very unique selection of pizza to choose from.  One that particularly caught my eye was the Totzza and the Mac and Cheese pizza.  I was teetering back and forth between the two until the friendly man behind the counter that was probably really annoyed with how long I was taking to decide recommended the Totzza because it has bacon on it.  Bacon? I'm sold.  The Totzza featured tater tots (duh), green onions, bacon bits, and cheese drizzled on top of it.  The crust was really good! It reminded me of Pizza Hut's crust but a lot less heavy and greasy, which is always a plus.  Now I'll add my disclaimer, if you are a pizza 'connoisseur' I would say this is not the pizza place for you.  But, I liked it because of their wide variety of choices and uniqueness.  Now on to my Totzza pizza.  All pizzas come with your choice of dipping sauce and of course I picked the garlic one.  I walked happily to my car in the freezing weather and couldn't wait to dig in! First couple bites I thought to myself... this is genius! It was awesome.  Now, I'm not so sure if that was my hunger talking or if it was really that good because the second piece I ate wasn't as appealing. It was good, but I'm not sure I'd get it again.  I'm giving them a 4 star because I've only been there once.  I don't like giving three stars either so really I'd say they're at a 3 1/2.  I will definitely try them again and maybe opt for a regular pizza and see how that pans out.  I still can't figure out why so many people gave them bad reviews though.  I enjoyed what I got even though it was kind of strange.

37.description: Cozy. But takes forever. The place was pretty much empty. I'm guessing my food was cooked on the spot. It was pretty good. I just hated the wait. Nothing spectacular. The staff was sweet!

0.description: Who doesn't love toppers? It's the best. Great for a college student here. It's kind of pricey and may be worth it, it depends on your personal view. The food is really great to have with a group of friends so I definitely say check it out.

38.description: My friend went to the Wisconsin location and was like "omg, best pizza ever, with taters tots" say... What?!??!!! I decided to go there yesterday with friends. It was a bit of hassle to communicate on paper because there is only one person working the cashier plus he is making pizzas too. I ordered the tater tots pizza and bacon cheese stick. It was worth the wait. As I open the the box of breadsticks, it wasn't bacon cheese stick, I went to the counter and say this isn't what I order. The man say he will make another batch. As I sat down, he came back with the one I return and say we can eat it while we wait for the new one. I really like how he approach us, it make me want to come back for this good service!

51.description: Open till 3 am nightly!  That alone is an awesome detail since those that live in the South Loop know its hard to score decent pizza late late night.Okay.. so it's fast food-esque chain pizza.  That aside, the draw is about their cheesy breadsticks which you can have topped in bacon, taco meat or pepperoni.  Their pizzas are loaded with dough FYI and they offer plenty of sauces for dipping.  Each for a cost of .75 cents each.About their pizzas I think their staff tend to overload on sauces depending on the pizza ordered.  I've tried the Philly (elsewhere) before with just enough sauce and thought that it was excellent.  I had it last evening and it was sauced to the max, so myself and another trying it for the first time came away thinking it was way too salty. It's not the best pizza around, just a change from what we're all used to; Domino's, Little C's, Papa John's or its main competitor in these parts; the comparable Sarpino's.______Side note: Very odd but I'll share.  So I had some leftovers of the Philly pizza.  When I put a couple in the oven and re-heated they were hardened, that is, the cheese got hardened.  It wasn't good to eat and the strange detail is that it wasn't in the toaster oven long.  Now I tried warming a few in the microwave and while the crust was soggy the cheese and toppings were perfect like the day we ordered the pizza.  Weird. Very when you're dealing with mass produced GMO pizza pie.

27.description: My pizza was running an hour late so I canceled my order. Toppers still proceeded to charge my credit card after I called three times to get a reimbursement.   I left a message with the GM who was too lazy to return my call.  I had to call my bank to file a claim because toppers hired a bunch of idiots.  Way to go Toppers.  You really fucking blow.  TOP That.

32.description: I tried ordering online, but was confused on how to apply my coupon. I called the store and the man that answered the phone walked me through the process to use the coupon for the order. He was extremely kind and very patient.Whenever I went to pick up my order, I was greeted by a store full of friendly people. I placed my order to have it ready by 8:30, but I wasn't able to receive it 'til about 8:40. Can't complain about the wait because my order was piping hot and everything was correct (and I placed a rather large order). The food was delicious, even though I thought the wings could've been a little saucier. Very pleased.

54.description: Went to toppers to get some food during one of my study breaks. When I opened the box the topperstix looked absolutely delicious. Unfortunately, they piled so much cheese on that they didn't let them cook for long enough and the dough underneath the cheese was completely raw. Too bad I was too far away to go back and return them, because I am sure they would have been good if they were cooked properly. Can't give them any leeway for being a new restaurant because they are a chain, so they should definitely know how to cook their own food. Oh well.

48.description: *sigh* I wish I could give Toppers a higher rating...but I just can't bring myself to do it. That being said, their pizza is okay..decent even. Like someone said, it's a pizza chain. So, don't go in there with super high expectations. My friend raves about their Topperstix, while I think their pizza is better. So, I guess it just depends on what you're looking for. Or hungry for, I should say. I agree with a lot of Yelpers, that a HUGE plus is they're open late. Which is nice, when you're hungry for some pizza.

44.description: This place is good. We ordered Thin crust pizza. The order  took 15 mins .. came out to be good. It has different flavor than other restaurants. Spicy Flavor which we dint expect. Staff service was Good.

24.description: What would you expect coming from Wisconsin! This is the crap of crap. The taste of freezer burnt sausage was priceless. I've had store bought pizzas that are better then this. Wisconsin should stick to cheese curds and Poutine.

7.description: I never intended to write a review for Topper's, because most people know what to expect. It simply isn't good pizza. I'll get it pretty often when I'm drunk at 3am and need food, but I digress. The reason I'm leaving this 1 star review is because I almost feel like I was intentionally insulted by the staff for what I received the other night. I ordered the Mon-Wed Deal: Large 3 Topping Pizza for $7.99 (Online Only) for dinner (not drunk). Their pizza is usually pretty cheesey, but I ordered EXTRA CHEESE, because you know, I can. It wasn't like this was a phone order; it is printed out with the words fully legible "Mozzarella (Extra)". It wasn't a note or comment section; it was a legitimate option that I clicked online and paid extra for as it was not part of the 3 toppings. There were no customers there and I was the only pickup. One of the workers was making a pizza as I waited and I saw her carefully cover the entire crust with cheese, all the way to outer edges. I expected the same for me... What I received was a pizza with not only less cheese than a standard Toppers pizza, but it only covered HALF of each slice. This had to be a sick joke, except it wasn't very funny. Seems like if I didn't order the extra cheese I would have been better off. This is just awful service, and I will never return to this location

49.description: This place makes me sad. It's like a wannabe Sarpino's, but it isn't even as good as Sarpino's which is depressing. The pizza that I had from there was dry with almost no sauce and the toppings were scant and not really that good. If you want to eat dry bread with crap thrown on it then this is the place for you.  But when there are so many better pizza places in the vicinity, why eat here? My recommendation, dish out a little more money and head over to Pat's pizza where they have one of the best thin crust pizzas in the city. Even Pauley's pizza almost next door is better than this place and that's saying something.

40.description: The pizza is good here. I ve always had deep dish pizza downstairs, then one day i decided to try something different. This place is near to my home and they can made your pizza quickly. it is a good choice when you are really hungry and you want pizza for lunch/dinner and don't wanna wait for like 30 mins to get your pizza. usually it only takes around 10--15mins to get your food ready. i like their meat toppers, it got bacon, hams, something like that on it and  it tastes really good. The only reason i gave it 4 star is because of the size of their pizza.... the small one is still too big for me and it is a little expensive.

53.description: I was excited for a new addition to the 2 block radius that I like to frequent around my apartment. And so a week or so after the grand opening, I ordered a pizza and got some cheesy sticks as a "side." There wasn't anything great about it, there wasn't anything bad about it. The cheesy sticks would have been great if they were just cheesier - they tasted more like cheese-flavored sticks with a flavorless topping. I wanted gooeyness which is not what I got from the order.The pizza itself was okay as well. The people working there were nice and relatively efficient so you didn't have to wait too long for your order. Will go back but probably not very often - it's no Lou's!

30.description: this fast-food pizza chain gives coupons occasionally. each week you can get a large (196*pi square inches of pizza) for $10.99 plus tax. That's about $12.  that's like, two dinners for two people, $3 dinners! I guess that's not that cheap after all, but it's much better than full price.Of course, with that deal you can't choose what pizza you want. Only one or two a week get that special status. There are some days ofthe week (tuesday, I think) where  you can order 2 of any size, buy one get one free. try to use a coupon, i guess. it's good fast food pizza

46.description: Ok. So if you really want to feel bad about yourself after eating a meal, go for the bacon Topperstix.  They are really good but you will want to cry after thinking about how many calories you just ate.Again, usually stick to a non-meat My'za - they're good, greasy, and again I usually feel bad after eating it.  Yet I still go back.

1.description: My kiddo likes thin pizza, and I wanted some wings, so I decided to give this place in our neighborhood a shot. WHAT A MISTAKE.This was truly disgusting. I've had better pizza in school cafeterias. The Home Run Inn frozen pizza we eat is better than this crap. The pizza was overcooked, the crust was like cardboard, the toppings were sparse, and the taste was just gross. The boneless wings? I mean I don't even know how to describe them. Spongy, weird shapes and sizes, with gross bbq sauce. And the lats straw is that everything got here cold, as if it took an hour to deliver it the whole 5 blocks. This entire meal was a complete failure. I can't stop apologizing to my family for this huge disaster.FWIW, I still tipped the poor delivery gal $10 because it's a massive storm out there.NEVER AGAIN.

55.description: If you think this is the best pizza in Chicago you're either delusional, know the owner, or were paid for a review.  This is pretty standard chain pizza, nothing special, and not fast or cheap...

9.description: I use to like to order from here on occasion.  However, last Sunday was the last time I will ever order from there again.  The pizza was never great but it was decent.  Too pricey though for the quality.  Back to last Sunday, I ordered delivery.  It took a little over an hour, my wife had to actually call and ask what was going on, never a good sign when ordering any kind of delivery.  When the pizza finally arrived, everything was cold.  We ordered wings, topper stix and a pizza, all of it was cold.  I was simply too lazy to call and complain, I was just really hungry by this point.  Bottom line is because of this, and because there are so many pizza options, I will never order Topper's again.

26.description: The past few times that I have ordered online, my food was never ready on time.  I have had to wait 15-30 minutes after the food was scheduled to be ready, regardless of how busy they seemed to be in there.If you order ahead of time, expect the food to be ready at least 15 minutes after promised.

25.description: Less than 1 Star if I could. After getting off work on Black Friday in the South Loop. I decided to put an order in for carryout. First they acted like they didn't want to honor a deal, 2 med. 3 toppings for $8.99 ea., which was playing on the phone while I was on hold. Finally, Place order was told it would be 30 to 45min. Calls me back after 1/2 hr. says, "We don't have any reg. medium dough would you like thin.". My 1st reaction was, "You didn't even start the order?!?". Then wait 1/2 hour to call. Then I'm expected to wait another 1/2 hr. Blow Monkey Balls! I'll order from the Greektown loc. from now on. Leave this place to the Stoner college kids.

12.description: Im not throwing a 1 star for no reason or just to show amplify my anger. I know an establishment like this panders to a young and undemanding crowd, but the service is pretty -to put it nicely- not good. When ordering in advance or ordering delivery you can expect to watch most of a movie waiting for them to get back to you (or you contact them) I can only imagine the delay is because they finally remembered to start the order. Instead of firing the topper sticks (stylized stix) up when they first get the order they tell you it will take thirty minutes and they have to call to tell you there is a delay or they lost your number (something that happened tonight). In past experiences of ordering in advance I expect to order 30 minutes ahead of time so I can arrive to pick up my order but every time I arrive and have to wait another 10-20 minutes. I dunno I stray from complaining when it is one of only a handful of eateries that offer late night food but it surprises me how they continue to have such passionate fans (my drunk friends were still thrilled when the stix arrived and said the sticks boost the rating to at least a 3 or 4 even with the poor service. So my rating is a 1 but know that your demographic still love ya to death.

21.description: If it looks like a Pizza Hut, smells like a Pizza Hut, and tastes like a Pizza Hut, it probably could also be Toppers.

17.description: False advertisement! On yelp the restaurant advertises 30% the entire menu if you check in with yelp but the business didn't honored it and the only explanation was that they don't take yelp offers, what a lame excuse, yelp don't give the discount, the business do.

10.description: I tried ordering online, but was confused on how to apply my coupon. I called the store and the man that answered the phone walked me through the process to use the coupon for the order. He was extremely kind and very patient.Whenever I went to pick up my order, I was greeted by a store full of friendly people. I placed my order to have it ready by 8:30, but I wasn't able to receive it 'til about 8:40. Can't complain about the wait because my order was piping hot and everything was correct (and I placed a rather large order). The food was delicious, even though I thought the wings could've been a little saucier. Very pleased.

5.description: This is an excellent restaurant to go to if you want your order completely mishandled. Never a manager to be found, maybe one lone employee running the show, I can't remember the last time they received our order and handled things in a timely, error-free manner. On the plus side, decent pizza.

3.description: Today's my first time trying out this place.  I ordered a pizza, chicken wings, AND topperstix (i was starving). 6:49pm:  order placed!  Hungry and excited i was to try some good pizza.7:22pm:  30 minutes later i get a call from Toppers that they have no chicken wings so they have to remove that from my order and charge me again.   It took them 30 minutes to realize they have no chicken wings for me?! hmmmmm.   I just need to wait and see if they will double charge me or if i will actually get the refund back for the original order.7:58pm:  still no food.  delivery time i was given was 7:56pm....i called Toppers to see where my food is at. I was told that "it's on its way" but there are 2 other deliveries.8:38pm:  still no food.....it's been almost 2hrs since i placed the order and i have yet to receive any food.  i called them yet again, and was once again told that the food is on its way.  I live a quarter of a mile away from Toppers!  Does it really take this long to deliver food?!9:36pm:  still no food.  absolutely nothing.  Toppers managed to charge me twice and give me no food.  What a sweet deal they've come into.  I better get a full refund.  I am too tired to call and i need to go to bed......hungry.I cannot speak for the food since i have yet to try it, but that probably will never happen.  I didn't realize this place had such crappy reviews; otherwise, i would never have ordered anything.

35.description: I eat here every once in awhile.  I have usually over-imbibed-- I order the bacon Toppers-stix. I always regret it afterwards.The employees there are ALL really nice and friendly. The wait time is short. The "Stix" are exactly what they are advertised as. Hot, really doughy, greasy. Sauces are all kind of gross, so I just say "keep 'em." Again, the service is 5-star. The epic indigestion caused by eating them is my own problem.

19.description: Great fresh twist on pizza and cheese sticks! I was pleasantly surprised. But the best thing about this Toppers was Assistant Manager, Nico. He was polite, diligent, funny and very organized! Loved him!

28.description: Toppers is one of those places that is a gem in its own way, mostly because you can 1. get something to eat at 2am and 2. put bacon on everything.It's the sort of food you eat before going to sleep and wake up the next day regretting you had it the night before, but while you're eating all you can think about is how good it is right now.

45.description: I don't know why this place has fairly low reviews, I LOVE the food here. No, it's not the overrated chicago pizza that the tourists run for, but how can macaroni and cheese or potatoes with cheese and chives pizza be bad? It's amazing! The service is always super fast, the food is delicious (although still "fast food pizza"), and they try to be funny with recorded messages while you wait to order. I am giving it 5 stars bc I am comparing it to other pizza joints of similar "genre."

33.description: like papa johns...meh

43.description: My new husband and I decided to try Toppers Pizza for our weekly Pizza Monday.  We received a flyer with several coupons, so had been aware of this place for a while.  Mind you, we are true pizza snobs.  I grew up in Chicago only consuming the deep dish piece of heaven that the city is known for and my husbands favorite food is pizza.  We ordered the pepperoni pan pizza.  While it was quite tasty, the pizza was so dang greasy.  It dripped through the box and onto the table.  I'm not afraid of a little grease, but this was out of control.  Price wasn't bad, then again we had coupons.  I would order again, but maybe ask that they towel down the pizza before sending it to me.

2.description: I ordered a Mac and cheese pizza for 20$ over the phone and after I was ringed up I look and see Mon-Wed they have a large three topping special for $7.99. The lady confirmed that I could have rung it up that way but apparently decided to ring up the more expensive version of my order. Terrible customer service, first time I went there and won't ever be going again

18.description: The past few times that I have ordered online, my food was never ready on time.  I have had to wait 15-30 minutes after the food was scheduled to be ready, regardless of how busy they seemed to be in there.If you order ahead of time, expect the food to be ready at least 15 minutes after promised.

41.description: If you are really hungry, really love carbs and cheese, this is for you.I haven't ordered delivery (I live near by) so I can't comment on delivery, but the food is B+ and a nice change from Lou Malnati's, though at least one/two steps above Dominoe's/Papa Johns. Their crust is very thick (hand-tossed style) and very bready, but not flavorless - pretty good dough.The bacon cheesey bread sticks? Fantastic, a meal unto themselves. Nothing gourmet, but very filling.Buffalo Chicken Pizza - incredibly good.Tried some other pizza (meat lover's) but wasn't as impressed as the Buffalo Chicken one. Be sure to use one of their many perpetual coupons when ordering (they have them in the shop) to save each time you order. They don't ask for the physical coupon, so if you just mention the deal over the phone they'll give it to you.

52.description: Topper's with NO TOPPINGS!!  All crusty/doughy  bread and a sauce that was painted on without dipping the brush in the sauce bucket.  Got a mushroom/black olive/artichoke  medium pie:  5 thin slices of mushrooms & 6 artichoke leaves & 10 slices of black olives.  No sauce to swirl your finger in and the cheese did not cover all that bread like crust.  For $17 bucks you'd think you would get pizza sauce at least and cheese that covers the crust!!   No wonder they are giving "their food" out for free. Will NOT GO THERE AGAIN!  For the money there are many better pizza joints 3 or 4 blocks away.  Where the pies are not all bread and imaginary ingredients.

50.description: If you order Toppers with the right expectations, you'll be fine.  It's in the same class as Dominos, Papa Johns, Pizza Hut, and that whole gang.  I'd say it tasted a LOT like Dominos before they changed their crust.  I guess that's not a good thing.  On the plus side, their pizzas do come with dipping sauce and some peppers.  The Topperstix were pretty good - again basically cheesy pizza crust.Their menu does have a few unique topping options.  May be worth trying the Mexican topping pizza or something like that.  I think for what it is, they may be overpriced.

4.description: Honesty toppers is always my favorite drunk food. Can't go wrong with cheaply made pizza. It's kinda like a dominos pizza but better.... But if you're looking for a good Chicago pizza I wouldn't suggest this... It's just good drunk food. And sober up food for the next day.

6.description: Not much pizza for the price.  $20+ for a large pizza with a couple toppings for pick-up.

22.description: Went here for the first time ever because it's walking distance from the apartment and was incredibly disappointed.. My pizza was straight up burnt. The cheese on top was crunchy... I don't know about you but pretty sure cheese isn't supposed to be crunchy. The woman in there was very nice but their customer service skills lack severely. I walked in and nobody said anything to me then I waited at the register for about 5 minutes til the woman walked up. All in all I won't be coming here again unless I feel like eating pizza crackers...

15.description: Terrible. Took over two hours to receive a one topping pizza and we live less than a mile away. Plus it took over 40 mins after it was "out for delivery". Also the pizza wasn't even warm!! Sarpinos will bake and deliver in an hour, with free delivery, its hot, and cheaper! Sorry Toppers your going to lose these pizza lovers!

57.description: A nice change of pizza pace! The night I walked by they were giving free slices away so I went in to try it out. Plenty of college students were out there like vultures rambling, "dude, free dinner for me tonight."On to the pizza - think pizza hut pan pizza style. This is not a NY style slice nor a Chicago style place. It sort of has it's own style. My My'za was bigger than I thought it would be. I really liked it and would have given it 5 stars but it was very light on the cheese. 2 of the slices were more like bread sticks, albeit good bread sticks. Wings - really good, very meaty. I thought price points were a little high when ordering but was slightly pleasantly surprised by the size of the pizza and meaty wings. I'll come back..

20.description: The first time I ordered a pizza from here I got the loaded totza  myza. It was phenomenal. So every time I go back I generally order the same thing. Well recently when I ordered it they didn't even finish adding on the toppings! The last time I got it they only put ranch and tater tots on it. I'm not paying 10 dollars for a pizza with just ranch and tater tots. I could easily make that at home. When they actually do finish the pizza it's great, but for the past few times they haven't and I've lost my patience with them. From now on I'd rather splurge on Lou Malnatis which is less than a block down.

36.description: I ended up going here after a night out. It was past 2 am and this was the only pizza place open. When I got there, the place was packed with other brilliant minded people who were craving pizza after a fun night out. Unfortunately for all of us, the place was  understaffed - there was only one guy to work the register and make the pizza. The one employee was great, but it was too much for him. I ordered the 9" Myaza, which he politely told me would take 15 mins. It took twice as long as that. Aside from the slow service, the pizza itself is average - no more, no less tasty than Papa John's or Pizza Hut. This place has some pretty cool toppings like tater tots. Overall, I wouldn't go back unless it is the only thing open at the time.

14.description: I had purchased several restaurant.com certificates for Toppers, but the owner wouldn't honor them. In carrying 2 pizzas two blocks to my condo, lots of grease dripped out of the boxes onto my jacket and pants, staining them. I don't think I've ever had a greaser pizza. Tastewise, they weren't bad, but nothing special either.

0.description: Amazing pearl necklaces!

3.description: Worst! How hard is it to cook a burger? Really? I mean it's not that hard. The guy at the grill is lost. I waited 20 minutes for a burger I didn't end up getting because he mixed my burger up with a guys turkey burger that was so raw that it was still clucking. It's not that hard. Meat, cheese, bacon and a stinking bun. I ain't even asking for special sauce. Also, check your receipts people. Walked out of the door paying $3 bucks for a 2 dollar fritter. I mean it's only a buck but 1 plus 1 is two. Not three. Get it chick at the register. Two days deep and your not making any fans. Finally checking out is a nightmare. You have to wander around the place like a chicken with your head cut off in order for someone to notice that you might be ready to pay for your over priced meal. Might have to wait a while before I roll back and partake in your establishment.

1.description: Open to tenants of the 440 S. LaSalle building and their guests.Stopped by for breakfast.  Fruit and yogurt bar, bagel bar, made to order omelet station, packed and ready to go meals, Ended up having a tradition breakfast.  Scrambled eggs (cracked right in front of me, pinch of course salt, cooked firm... perfection), and bacon, sausage links, sausage patty, and hash browns.  Nice that you can get it all A La Cart for less than $2 each.Today's breakfast special was banana bread French toast with Vermont maple syrup for only $3.99.  I only passed because I wasn't in the mood for sweet this morning.Lunch was the Hanger Steak sandwich. I went with the pretzel roll and provolone.  Steak was tender, and tasty. Sometimes I need to add something like A-1 but this was solid on its own.  With pretzel rolls you can sometimes get an overly tough or dry one that requires gallons of water to wash it down.  When you go this route you sometimes end up "tearing" off your bites. This sandwich was perfect.  Held together and didn't fall apart yet easy enough to eat and wasn't tough at all.  Bonus points for not cooking it well done.Additional items tried-Pizza 4 out of 5 stars- Sausasge was pretty good as it was a little spicey. My co-workers and I were suprised this cooks in only 4 minutes yet comes out plenty crispy.  Pretty much everyone plans on getting the pizza again.    ***** Thai Chicken Pizza special 5 out of 5.  If it wasn't for the sample I may not have thought      twice about this option.  The peanut sauce offered a rich flavor and the spice clinched in. The     large portion of fresh veggies (carrot, cucumber, green onion) was impressive for something that costs less than $6.  I would have taken pictures of it but was handing out samples before I got back to my desk :)Taco Pizza - 4.5 out of 5. Refried beans, choice of fresh tomato salsa or roasted green salsa.  I had both and the green had a nice light kick and lots of extra flavor.  Green is the way to go here.  Cheddar cheese and ground beef.  Then out of the oven finished with queso fresco and cilantro.    It would have been a 5 for me if it had black olives.  Worth a repeat visit for sure.-Buffalo Chicken Wrap 3 out of 5 stars - Maybe 4. This think was delicious and loaded with chicken.  It's just I wish it was freshly fried chicken then diced, sauced, and served.  I realized that would take more time but with how good this tasted with the breaded chicken being soft, I can imagine it would be a 5 out of 5 with freshly cooked chicken.-Meatball sandwich 4 out of 5 stars - 3 nice size meatballs with proper amounts of seasoning. I hate it when a meatball is JUST a ball of meat.  These had plenty of seasoning and the sauce that it was tossed in was full of flavor as well. Visable chunks of olive, garlic, and capers.-Roast Beef and Swiss sandwich 4 out of 5 stars - This had to be at least 1/4lb of roast beef. Nice size sandwich and a nice assortment of ripe veggies to choose from as toppings.  I went basic lettuce, tomato, onion with the horseradish sauce. $1 more added a nice large side of fresh fruit.-Gryos Pizza (daily special) 4 out of 5 stars. - I was brave here.  I love gyros, one of my favorite foods, but as a pizza?  Cheese pizza made with seasoned lamb topping and onions. After it comes out of the oven it was dressed with the Cucumbers and Tomatoes and Tzatziki sauce. Nice melody of flavors but the tomato sauce overpowered the fresh veggies a little bit.  Not bad but I might as for less sauce or olive oil brushed on instead next time. That and likely ask to pay for extra meat.  -Burger, 3 out of 5 -  I think the other reviews are being a bit harsh. The taste of the burger was good but yes, it shrinks too much. They are hand formed but after cooking they shrink together making a thick patty that doesn't even cover the bun fully.**Update. 4 out of 5 but ask to have the beef patty flattened so it's thinner and fills out the bun**-Sweet BBQ Chicken Quesadilla. 2 ouf of 5 stars - Sweet is correct, no real spice hear.  Was hoping for a more falvorful chicken, like blackened or marinated.  Appeard to just be diced grilled chicken.  Very messy once the sauce was added.  A fork and knife meal.  It won't hold together eating it with your hands.

2.description: Absolutely Horrible!!!! Complete rip off. I got a burger, it started out a nice size, by the time it was done cooking it was the size of a white castle hamburger. it's about 1/4 the size of the bun, burnt, all of the seasoning was plopped into one spot in the middle of the burger so i had a massive bite of salt!! The fries are god awful, no flavor, no salt. I'm severely disappointed. I've also had the flavorless terribly dry pizza and a sandwich from the deli. Save your money go some place else. You want good cafateria food go across the street to the board of trade basement and visit cellars. At lease if you pay 10.00 for something the food is well worth the cost.

5.description: The prices have gone up 25% since they have opened a month ago while my salary has gone up 1% in a year. PUT A FOURK IN ME. I'M DONE!

6.description: I like the pizza station. Something new every day. A lot of food for not a lot of money.

0.description: I have yet to be disappointed.  The food and service is excellent. They do a seafood "catch of the day" (which actually changes only weekly) one week it was an ocean trout, which was beautifully prepared and served either over greens or as a sandwich for 8.99, I have not found a place nearby that would serve a comparable salmon/trout dish for less than 14.00. Today's chef special was a coriander crusted lamb tenderloin, with glazed baby root vegetables and a potato pave, which I think is just a fancy way of saying escalloped potatoes.  It also was 8.99 and the presentation was something out of a magazine.  Seriously, have a waiter bring that plate to me, and I am happy to pay well over 20 bucks for some of that!They have made to order pizzas, which look beautiful and run only 6.79.  Some sandwiches can be ordered with a standard amount of meats, or you can choose to beef it up for a small up-charge. If they continue to offer this quality of food, at these prices, I will continue to come back almost every day.

4.description: I love this place and eat here almost every day.  Make your own omelette with a lot of fresh vegies for breakfast.  Banana bread and pancakes were great. For lunch I have gotten the made to order grilled salmon and turkey burger and chicken sandwhich.  I thought the burger was a little on the small side but not nearly as small as Tony D.  I think they fixed that problem.  The Pizza is DELICIOUS.  The sandwiches are very fresh and high quality meat.  I thought the carvery sandwiches were a little light, then I found out you can order it city style and it comes with double the meat for $1.5 more. Fresh salad bar. Coffee and smoothies are great.

1.description: Rashaad is the man. Extremely professional and well trained in his craft. Prompt, courteous, and provides a great all around experience. I've never been happier with my hair cuts. Highly recommend

2.description: Rashad is an experienced, licensed, and professional barber. I've been getting my haircut by him for 3 and a half years and his service is impeccable. Highly recommended!

0.description: Phenomenal Barber and person.  He is skilled, efficient, and professional.  I've been coming to him for over 2 years and would highly recommend his services.  He works by appointment which is ideal for the working professional.  I'd sent numerous friends to him, all of which have become regular customers.

3.description: Easily one of the best breakfast places near Grant Park. I was here right after the opened a few months ago and couldn't wait to come back.

1.description: Got the iced coffee, which was a cup of ice with essentially all hot coffee (i.e., watered down hot coffee). I also asked if I could have a bit of soy milk in it and she said she would then have to charge it as a "latte" which didn't make sense to me.Food was okay. I asked if I could have sausage instead of ham in my omelette and then my omelette came with ham...meh.It was a very clean restaurant with a nice atmosphere.

2.description: Got the 2 eggs with fruit and bread and potatoes. Potatoes were great, good wheat bread and the fruit was fresh. The eggs were just the usual scrambled eggs, people were friendly enough

5.description: Was staying at the hotel next to it and decided to try it my last day here. I had the bacon and eggs with fresh squeezed orange juice. Best OJ ever. The breakfast was excellent also. I thought only 3 pieces of bacon wasn't enough until I realized I had only paid $8.25 for the whole breakfast. Plus it was excellent bacon. I'd definitely stop again but am heading back to Seattle today.

6.description: Great place for a casual breakfast. Service was a bit slow but the food was delicious.

7.description: Don't go here if you expect your food in a timely manner. Saturday morning and it looks like we have 1 line cook. Serving tables of 2 with 1 meal at a time, then bringing the other persons food 5-10 minutes later. Won't return.

0.description: Was in the area and wanted to get a late brunch/lunch....saw this place om Yelp and gave it a shot....Its a cafe right off the street in the Travelodge Hotel near Michigan Avenue close to some of the other fancier hotels and Columbia College...nothing fancy and the prices are average for the area.  I got an omelet (bacon, mushroom, and cheddar cheese) which came with potatoes and my choice of toast (I opted for English Muffin).   They serve Lavazza Coffee products here but no bottomless cups of coffee.I did notice they had a decent selection of other breakfast and lunch options.  All in all a decent meal near the heart of downtown Chicago....a good place to stop if you aren't looking for anything really fancy or overly expensive.

4.description: Mehh, buttery potatoes, normal eggs, and some bread. Nothing fancy by any means but it was breakfast I suppose.

1.description: Employees are very helpful, I love their jewelry! I love this place has the cutest stuff.parking on the street or in the lot on the bottom

2.description: I was in the area and stopped into this shop. One sales assistant immediately greeted me, which is always nice, and all the sales assistants were helpful the entire time.  I had no plans to buy anything but a trendy little chevron patterned dress at a great price spoke to me! Plus the service was helpful the whole time, so why not?Glad to have Francesca's in the neighborhood. Keep up the good work!

0.description: Super cute boutique with a variety of options. They have clothes, jewelry, handbags, wallets, accessories - warm weather, hair, etc. and a bunch of random items too. I came in specifically looking for jewelry because I always seem to find great pieces among their wide selection. They don't have matching sets but if you're patient and look through it all you should be able to find great coordinating items. Morgan and Carina (sp?) were very sweet and helpful. I usually deny help initially while I'm browsing, but after a while I figured I could use the help in finding a great set to give as a gift. I kid you not, in less than 60 seconds Morgan had pulled the most gorgeous Emerald-like necklace and earrings that were perfect! Then I spent time looking at the random stuff that I never really paid attention to before. They have an assortment of quick gifts, party games, drinking accessories and games, really a mix of everything. Carina pointed out a few interesting items and I ultimately found some cool stuff to take to an upcoming holiday party. To make my experience even better, I feel like everything in the store was buy one get one 50% off that day!FYI, the theater parking deck is free.

58.description: We went to Hackney's on Dearborn for appetizers and a beer at 10:15 pm on Friday night, 26 DEC 2014.  The sign on the door read "Open 'til 2 am."  We were immediately told that the kitchen is closing.Service was fine, though server had limited knowledge of their beer offering.  When we ordered, then waited five minutes, we found out the first two beers we requested were not available.  At 11:00, they were putting up chairs and mopping the floor around us (nice scent on that mop water!  Not!).  We asked about the 2:00 close and the manager told us we were free to stay as long as we like.  In the same breath, he turned off the music in the whole place.  We got the hint.The food was OK.  The beer that we didn't want was OK.  But I would not recommend this place after our unfortunate experience.

56.description: I've been coming to Hackeny's for awhile, and what keeps me coming back are their burgers. There is nothing like them. They are fresh, original and just down right delicious. The fries are just as good, and this might sound weird, but the pickle on the side is the best ever. I know when I come here I am going to leave happy.

29.description: Nice Americana food, good beer selection. My favorite is the inside out burger. Service is always nice, fast, and friendly. Im not a fan of the onion rings, but everything else on the menu has always been good. The have a nice outdoor seating area that is across the street from an impromptu dog park, so you can watch the south loop dogs run and play in the park if that's your thing.

42.description: The server forgot our appetizer, so we went without. The $15 dollar margarita pitcher came with limes on the glasses that were so dry, we couldn't get a drop of juice out of them. There were like 10 more lime slices in the pitcher, and overall the taste was too sour for my liking. BUT, there was plenty of tequila in there. My boyfriend said his pretzel bun tasted syrupy, but his burger was otherwise good. My buffalo chicken sandwich was fair. The fries were dope.Our second server (shift switch?) was pretty slow on bringing the check. There were WAY too many drunk middle aged women there...at 6 PM on a Sunday. We were forced to sit at the bar due to unavailable seating, so..that's kinda our fault I guess.

23.description: Ordered delivery from here. Food was extremely sub-par. I appreciated that they separated all the side items from the main meal but the quinoa was very bland and the 'Cajun turkey burger' was just a turkey burger covered in Cajun spices poured on top.

47.description: This is a convenient spot to meet people after work. There is an $8 lot a couple blocks away and close to the Red Line. It's a small place with tables pretty close together so expect a wait if you show up after 6 o'clock on a Friday. We ordered some chips and guac to share. The Burger was nothing spectacular but definitely above average. I liked the heaping pile of seasoned fries that came on the side. Their beer list was extensive enough to please most everyone. It's a great location and I look forward to coming back when it is warm enough to sit outside.

8.description: I am so used to the Hackney's in the 'burbs I had no idea there was one in the city!  I came here with my mom and my aunt after exploring the city of the architecture tour.  I thought the food was decently good.  I had a chicken club sandwich that I enjoyed.  I also ordered a Blue Moon margarita which I thought could be some cool margarita made with blue moon beer.  Sounds interesting, right?  Wrong.  Although it was tasty it was just a margarita that was blue.

31.description: The Bison burger here is delicious. I've ordered it on two different occasions and I would get it again, along with a few new items of course. They mashed potatoes are as smooth as silk and paired with the bison burger, pure perfection. Their salads are also great options that are large enough for a full meal. Definitely not side salad portions. Well done!

34.description: It's high time I wrote a review for this place considering I average coming here once a week for the past 3 years. I mean any place you do that for is worthy of a 5 star. I've tried a lot of the menu. My favorites are mesquite chicken salad, grown up Mac and cheese, New Mexico chicken melt, fried onion rings, egg breakfast sandwich (with avocado), hackney burger, Reuben egg rolls, chili...I think the list would be far smaller if I told you what not to get and really all that comes to mind is the Mexican breakfast skillet and quiche. Everything else is super solid and tasty that I've tried. Also good beer list!!Great place, good food, fun patio. Worth a trip...or 20.

16.description: It's high time I wrote a review for this place considering I average coming here once a week for the past 3 years. I mean any place you do that for is worthy of a 5 star. I've tried a lot of the menu.
