My favorites are mesquite chicken salad, grown up Mac and cheese, New Mexico chicken melt, fried onion rings, egg breakfast sandwich (with avocado), hackney burger, Reuben egg rolls, chili...I think the list would be far smaller if I told you what not to get and really all that comes to mind is the Mexican breakfast skillet and quiche. Everything else is super solid and tasty that I've tried. Also good beer list!!Great place, good food, fun patio. Worth a trip...or 20.

13.description: I love how every time we walk in it feels like a family! Even when it's busy the staff is still totally on their toes with everything.Bison burger is probably my favorite option and their candy cane pie is to die for. I give mad props to the the staff at this restaurant for making it a excellent experience every time.

11.description: Nice Americana food, good beer selection. My favorite is the inside out burger. Service is always nice, fast, and friendly. Im not a fan of the onion rings, but everything else on the menu has always been good. The have a nice outdoor seating area that is across the street from an impromptu dog park, so you can watch the south loop dogs run and play in the park if that's your thing.

39.description: Went here with a friend on Sunday for lunch. Food is good, but not excellent. I ordered the bison burger with black beans on the side. It could have used a little more seasoning.  My buddy ordered the blue cheese burger.  He said it was good.The beer list here is good. I was lame and had Budweiser.  Service was also good.

37.description: Awesome awesome draft beer selection, great burgers, and the best onion rings (served as a giant brick on the plate straight out of the fryer). The menu from top to bottom is solid, from the southwest salad to the fish tacos. We have been going to the two Hackney's locations on Lake and Harms in the suburbs my whole life, and it's great to have the Printer's Row location so close by. The fries are actually better here than in the burbs. It never lets us down. Are there better places? Sure. But Hackney's always hits the spot and you'll always have a good time, and their consistency with regards to both the food and service ensures we go back over and over. Thanks!

0.description: Coat Hooks: NoAlso: the bar has a nice bump-out that's good for groups.

38.description: Quirky place.  Kind of weird, the colors and decor scream a Mexican place for taco Tuesday, but it's American food and beer.  Good beer menu!  Plenty of choices for all palates.I had the Kobe beef burger, it tasted great!  Good fries too! We were here for a rehearsal dinner, a small one (only about 7-9 ppl), but after the entrees were served our server was no where to be found.  The more the dinner went on, the more I felt neglected..

51.description: The last time I came here service was great, for a tiny overcrowded dining the waiters move with great finess. I ordered the hot chocolate which came in a mug and cinnamon stick, while my friend ordered a apple cider which she loved. Then I ordered the chicken club, I'm weird and ordered it with pretzel bun and not cut and they made it perfectly. I did this other weird thing (they must love me wink wink) and ordered appetizers after dinner because I'm so original(cue eye roll) and the cheese curds were probably tied for my favorite cheese curds next to curly's at lambeau field in Green Bay. (Don't ask, and go bears). Anyway he spilt the check without a hint of anything and we left smiling. I've been here before that and am here now waiting for a table, so yea great service great food.

27.description: I am so used to the Hackney's in the 'burbs I had no idea there was one in the city!  I came here with my mom and my aunt after exploring the city of the architecture tour.  I thought the food was decently good.  I had a chicken club sandwich that I enjoyed.  I also ordered a Blue Moon margarita which I thought could be some cool margarita made with blue moon beer.  Sounds interesting, right?  Wrong.  Although it was tasty it was just a margarita that was blue.

32.description: My wife and I both had the inside out burger. They were delicious and cooked to perfection. We had four in our party and had to split up and sit at 2 tables due to the small, but cozy outdoor seating space. We will definitely come back

54.description: Having been to the two locations in glenview and the now defunct wheeling location, I had to give the printer's row location a try.   I've come here several times for lunch and have not been disappointed.  The room is small, but the staff keep a good job turning tables, and I've rarely had to wait long to be seated.    Additionally the seats at the bar are apt and they have a great selection of rotating drafts on tap.  The menu is a bit limited compared to the other locations, but they still have a wide variety of HackneyBurger's and you really don't need to look much farther than those. Highlights:-onion rings (like at all hacnkeys)-Chips (a good change from the fries)-inside out burger (if Guy Fieri likes it, then its good by me)-price (reasonable for the area and I always leave full)I'd recommend for anyone looking for a casual business lunch or a relaxing weekend lunch with family or friends.

48.description: Pretty good. The waitstaff were all so friendly. It's nice to see ppl who actually want to be at work! I got the grown-up Mac and cheese which wasn't too bad. My friend got the inside out burger and said it was really good! Their "famous" fried onions weren't all that great. A little burnt, actually. But I'd recommend this place to a friend!

44.description: Good place  to chill out with friends and have a good time. Never feel overwhelmed. Not your typical bar or hang out in the city. Very relaxing especially when sitting outdoors in the summertime. I would definitely recommend coming here.

24.description: We have been visiting Hackney's Printer Row location for the last 6 years since we moved to the South Loop.  The food is always great as well as the service. We are typically here at least once every couple weeks. Sometimes at peak times you can have 15-30 minute wait i. Service is very good, even when busy.  Have never been disappointed in any of the menu choices. (Go to is the pretzel burger!)

7.description: Good place for a beer and meal. I think it is a little bit overpriced for what it is.

49.description: Good food -may be too loud for conversation. They had a live band that was pretty good too.

40.description: First time there tonight. I was very impressed. Extremely friendly hostesses and waiter. Food was hot and correct. Great experience. I almost was impressed enough to bother the manager and tell him/her how pleasant the meal was, but it was a Fri night and figured I'd do my part with a simple review. I'll be sure to tell others about this place! I'll be back!

53.description: I love this place. The food, staff, and atmosphere is really relaxed and nice. It's perfect for a date night or going to catch up with friends. It's about a block from where I live and it's definitely my go-to restaurant. Best part is, it isn't overpriced like SO many places in the loop.

30.description: We live in the South Loop, but haven't been to Hackney's in a few years.  Not sure why.  Anyway, decided to go one late afternoon recently.  Their food has always been a little hit or miss, but it was always our go to place for a great steak sandwich.  Unfortunately, that is no longer on the menu.  We were happy to see that the onion loaf was still on the menu and ordered a half.  However, it was not what we remembered.  The loaf was crispy on the outside and mushy and undercooked on the inside.  We could taste the grittiness of raw batter.  The onions themselves weren't very sweet either.  Needless to say, we didn't finish it.  My husband had the Hackney burger and I had the pretzel burger.  They were not under seasoned .... they weren't seasoned at all!  My husband said his bread was soggy.  My "pretzel" bread was not really pretzel bread.  It tasted more like regular bread that was scored to look like pretzel.  The best part of our meal was the fries.  So sad this neighborhood staple has gone downhill.  We won't be back.

46.description: You know I really was impressed by this place. It had a cozy family restaurant feel that i dont usually get in the city. So i really liked that. They had lots of options on the menu and beer options as well. Good food, good service, good prices.

1.description: Great place in Printers' Row that has something most places in this neighborhood lack - a NEIGHBORHOOD vibe. We only came here for drinks, but loved the atmosphere, service, and they make a great dirty martini. Cheers

55.description: This place is warm and cozy. Very inviting. Good for travelers and locals alike. I had the spinach strawberry salad and it was delish!  We brought our toddler and everyone was super nice!

9.description: Wonderful draft selection.  Really should have a 4.5.  The fries were perfect and the bison burger was made exactly the way I asked.  Seating outside made for a perfect night.  Our server was excellent and a lot of fun.  I wish I could remember his name but it was the first week in September.  John?  Everyone had a great time.  Looking forward to the next visit.

26.description: I walk by here every June during the Printers' Row festival. It has always struck me as a convivial spot, though I had never stopped in for a drink or one of the famous burgers as there has always been a crowd inside and spilling onto the patio. Yesterday I came here for happy hour after turning in a book at the library. I knew I didn't want to elbow my way to a crowded bar and be jostled, so Hackeny's delivered perfectly. There is a long list of beers on draft, available in various ounce pours. Feeling overwhelmed, and not just wanting to go with a standard Blue Moon, I ordered a glass of the daily drink special- a red wine sangria. It was a taste of summer  in a glass and I appreciated the maraschino cherry which reminded me of an adult version of a kiddie cocktail. I will certainly keep an eye on the specials. In fact when I sat down at the bar I noticed posters being put up advertising half-price burgers during Bears games- home or away- starting Sept. 13.

25.description: I would talk in my review about the food, but after being sat outside (right in front of their main window) by the host we waited over 25 minutes for our waitress to come. She never did, so we left.

12.description: Waitress completely forgot to put in my order and when I asked about it she completely forgot to put it in. Came with my co-workers and she wanted to put it in AFTER I asked. My co-workers had already finished eating, so why would I still want my food all late about it? This place was not busy AT ALL and she literally had one job. Worried about this place when there's actually a good amount of customers in it. Never coming here again after today.

59.description: Haven't had a Hackney burger in years - and it is still as delicious as I remember. Excellent meal all around, great service, conversation-friendly, and easy metered parking on the street (quiet night, but lots nearby). Also, a block from the Harrison stop on the Red line. Out of town company loved it.

21.description: Wonderful draft selection.  Really should have a 4.5.  The fries were perfect and the bison burger was made exactly the way I asked.  Seating outside made for a perfect night.  Our server was excellent and a lot of fun.  I wish I could remember his name but it was the first week in September.  John?  Everyone had a great time.  Looking forward to the next visit.

17.description: This is a charming neighborhood bar. The bartender was a nice guy who gave us lots of attention. The burgers are very tasty and my dad remarked that the fish had too much batter and not enough fish. The salads are ood, nothing earth-shattering so if you go - order the burgers or the grown-up mac and cheese because my mom loved it and she knows best.The dining room is a little tight but it has a friendly atmosphere.

10.description: I usually love Hackneys but I have no idea went wrong today. I ordered delivery (right around the corner). The box came open and the fries were ice cold, the cold slaw was not covered and was just diced cabbage - ick!  I called because $19.00 for cold fries and unsanitary cabbage is a big rip-off. The person I spoke with said she was sorry and would be right over in 5 minutes to fix it.  Never showed up. What is going on with the establishment that I used to like so much???

5.description: Went here with a friend on Sunday for lunch. Food is good, but not excellent. I ordered the bison burger with black beans on the side. It could have used a little more seasoning.  My buddy ordered the blue cheese burger.  He said it was good.The beer list here is good. I was lame and had Budweiser.  Service was also good.

3.description: MMMMMmmm.. sometimes, you just gotta have a good greasy meal.  I ordered some battered french fries and wow... they were incredible. Best I think I have ever tasted~! Top that with some ranch dressing and well.. YOU'RE IN HEAVEN.  Not THIS last visit, but a previous visit, I enjoyed a margarita (or 4) and they were pretty damn awesome as well. :)

35.description: We had a birthday lunch here, and everyone seemed to have enjoyed their meal. Reservations were easily made and they pulled tables together pretty quickly to accommodate our group of 10. Our waitress was helping me narrow down my decision, and so I went with the meatloaf. It was good, but it didn't really blow me a way. It was solid, and the mashed potatoes were super buttery but good. You definitely have to order the onion loaf as they are well known for it here. The sweet potato fries were tasty as well. I would like to come back and try one of the burgers.

19.description: I was very pleasantly surprised by the beer list and the old world charm here.  They had a lot of local (midwest) brews on tap, some of which I hadn't heard of.  The service was great as well.  The only thing that was a tad disappointing was the burger that I ordered.  While it was delicious, it was supposed to be a bleu cheeseburger with bleu cheese inside.  I didn't taste the cheese at all.  So, if you order that burger, I guess ask for extra bleu cheese?  I just feel like you should be able to taste the cheese if it's in the very title of the meal.  Call me crazy.  I would for sure come back here and try another burger, though!

28.description: Talk about a disappointment! Has Hackneys been taken over by McDonald's???? The burger was dry & tasteless & certainly not cooked-t-order! The fries were cold & the onion rings, which are usually a treat, were greasy!Hackney's is NOT the Hackney's of old. Never again...at least at this location!

45.description: Love sitting at the bar but almost never go there because there only are 10 seats tops. The food is not very good (although a million times better than Flavo's Tacos but that is a hurdle my Irish grandmother who can't cook at all can clear) but the bar seems to attract a great mix of ages.

33.description: I was torn between 4 or 5 stars, but I have to give it 5 because of the VEGAN chocolate cake. Happy dance!!!

43.description: Excellent service and management. Had a slight issue with the cooking temp of a bison burger and manager quickly took care of the issue. Their signature onion dish is worth the hype, and their outdoor seating was nice. Will definitely be back because of the managers actions as well as the tasty food and chill atmosphere. Cheers to excellent customer service and food/atmosphere.

2.description: First: regular food is solid. Reliable. Fine. Second: Dollar Pie Friday. They purport to offer a slice of pie for a dollar. What they're actually selling is about 1/4 of a slice for a dollar. But their ads show a whole slice and nothing says "mini slice of pie for a dollar!" And then when we asked the manager about it, she didn't particularly care. When we asked to have it taken off the bill because the ads weren't clear, she snatched our plates off the table and said, "Ok, then I'll take these." Soooo....go somewhere else.

18.description: Further update August 2015 - Excellent burger, juicy and good quality beef.  It actually reminded my of our own farm ground beef as a kid in Iowa.  They make excellent slaw and provide a large server.  I continue to patronize Hackney's.  I get great service in the bar. Now rounding up to four (4).Update as of February 2015 - Still 3-1/2 stars.  On a recent visit I greatly enjoyed a cheese burger with a very good side of slaw.  They do a good job with their burgers and I am never at a loss with the beer selection.  The servers are friendly and don't hassle me when i don't plan to order food.  I will continue to use Hackney's as my place, on my way to Jazz showcase.I have become a semi-regular visitor to the South Loop for the Jazz Showcase.  Because I am driving in from Aurora when I do this, and never can predict traffic, I always leave early and kill time at Hackney's before getting dinner, either there or at another restaurant in the South Loop.  I like Hackney's bar for this purpose of buffering my time.  I can almost always get one of the high-top tables which will also accommodate a jazz buddy if I have one that evening.Hackney's has a decent beer selection to choose from, I can always find something I like.  The service has always been attentive, even though they are usually pretty busy with people loosening up after work.  On the occasions that I have ordered food, I have had quite acceptable pub food; fish and chips and burgers.  I rate Hackney's a solid 3-1/2 stars.  I will certainly continue to return for a beer before dinner and jazz.  I kind of like to walk down to Chicago Curry House for dinner so I have not really challenged Hackney's food menu.  Perhaps I need to.Update as of February 2015 - Still 3-1/2 stars.  On a recent visit I greatly enjoyed a cheese burger with a very good side of slaw.  They do a good job with their burgers and I am never at a loss with the beer selection.  The servers are friendly and don't hassle me when i don't plan to order food.  I will continue to use Hackney's as my place, on my way to Jazz showcase.

41.description: I ordered the strawberry salad with tilapia and the tilapia sandwich. My order was delivered within 30 minutes and everything was great! We had no complaints. The blackened tilapia in both meals were hot like we dined in. Will definitely be back.

52.description: I have never been disappointed when going to Hackney's.  They have a great dining atmosphere and their food is always delicious and wonderfully prepared.  Whether it's a burger or a salad, I have yet to have any issue with my meal.Their bar staff is also really knowledgable and willing to give any recommendations.

50.description: The whole experience was average at best. Service was nothing special, the guacamole average, and the $17 burger was bland. I won't be going back.

4.description: Good beers and drinks all around.  Food is standard American fare, and onion rings are to die for.

6.description: Great burger joint with a very nice beer selection in printers' row.  I thought they used to serve the burgers on rye bread but the last time I came here, they did not. A good neighborhood bar that gets packed And does not take reservations, but good for casual get togethers if you don't mind a bit of a wait.

22.description: Went to Hackney's on a week night with a reservation at 6:30 through Open Table. There was seating available so I found that the reservation might not have been needed. However, the outside sidewalk seating area is always full. Our server was friendly and knowledgable of the menu and offered the beer of the month, which he described as an old school IPA with a smooth finish for $4; which was exactly how he described. We started off with the chicken quesadilla appetizer. It was probably the best quesadilla with an American bar food twist I've ever had. Very large and had caramelized onions and bacon on it. Something about it just worked with all the flavors cooked together. I ordered the Bleu Cheeseburger substituted with a pretzel bun. It was just slightly over cooked to my request for medium rare, but still had the juicy flavor I was looking for. My mom got the Reuben sandwich, and the corned beef was delicious. Very tender and melt in your mouth. Prices were pretty average, but well worth it for what we got. I will definitely be returning to Hackney's.

15.description: We had a birthday lunch here, and everyone seemed to have enjoyed their meal. Reservations were easily made and they pulled tables together pretty quickly to accommodate our group of 10. Our waitress was helping me narrow down my decision, and so I went with the meatloaf. It was good, but it didn't really blow me a way. It was solid, and the mashed potatoes were super buttery but good. You definitely have to order the onion loaf as they are well known for it here. The sweet potato fries were tasty as well. I would like to come back and try one of the burgers.

57.description: First time there and loved the ambiance! The Green River soda definitely taste like green jello in a good way! The food was delicious! The candy cane pie was a delight!

20.description: I am so grateful for this neighborhood restaurant/bar! The staff are so nice, friendly, and willing to go above and beyond to assure you are satisfied with your experience. My favorite aspect of Hackney's however is that they regularly change their craft beer selections on tap! In a city filled with several standard options depending on where you go, I enjoy having Hackney's to provide the experience to sample several beers without having to change location every time. I admit....i get excited to go in just to see what my new options are! Great idea! Thanks! Oh and the food is always delicious with great specials that change regularly! Highly recommend!

36.description: I was very pleasantly surprised by the beer list and the old world charm here.  They had a lot of local (midwest) brews on tap, some of which I hadn't heard of.  The service was great as well.  The only thing that was a tad disappointing was the burger that I ordered.  While it was delicious, it was supposed to be a bleu cheeseburger with bleu cheese inside.  I didn't taste the cheese at all.  So, if you order that burger, I guess ask for extra bleu cheese?  I just feel like you should be able to taste the cheese if it's in the very title of the meal.  Call me crazy.  I would for sure come back here and try another burger, though!

14.description: JUST KEEP ON WALKING!We've dined at Hackney's Printers' Row many times over the years.Usually we order their turkey or beef burgers, which are good.Our last two visits (and literally our last) were awful and left our stomachs churning.A couple of months ago we ordered  fish and chips (for a change), which were described as lightly battered. Really? Not!The breading was thick and greasy.We needed a fishing pole and hook to find the fish under all that mess.Our last visit (12/21/15) was another awful meal.Ordered the guacamole and chips. The guacamole didn't taste fresh, although it is madein-house. It was beyond bland. Not even worth eating.Next came the chicken pot pie. It was the size of a large, shallow dinner plate.It was steaming hot, so it obviously had been microwaved (something I could do at home).The thin crust was rubbery and the inside was more like a watery chicken soup.Again, to bland to eat.What a waste of money.If all other restaurants are closed, go to Hackney's for a burger.

56.description: Julia was awesome! She is extremely friendly and professional. The barbershop had a great atmosphere with some cool people. I will be coming back!

29.description: Jeremiah is amazing. I've gone to him a couple of times and loved the results both times. He was even about to leave one night because his shift was over but decided to stay to do my cut. What is particularly great about Jeremiah is that I had started using the Wen hair products and noticed my hair was looking increasingly...oily. I had brought this up to him and he confirmed that the products were way too heavy for my hair and after showing me all the residue in the sink after my wash, I knew it wasn't a line of BS and he knew what he was doing. His birthday is this month, so happy birthday buddy! Hope you celebrate appropriately and I'll be back to see you soon!

42.description: Awesome experience - Ashley was amazing.  Relaxing warm cloth on face, plus massage at the end were icing on the cake.

23.description: Best stylist here is Mercedes. Not trying to dis anyone else, but she gave me the best eyebrow wax I've ever had, and a fantastic haircut. She also has a great smile and a really lovely personality, among other stellar qualities. Yay, Mercedes!

47.description: Date of Visit: May 31, 2013This review's context is for a men's buzz cut package only, i.e., I can't speak to how they do  regular cut, coloring service, etc. Location: 4.5 out of 5Quick and easy walk from the south loop for me.  I'm basically right at Plark (Polk and Clark, see what I did there?) and it's about a quarter mile walk for me.  Easily accessible via public transportation too (Red line or bus).  There is street parking available as well.  Customer Service: 5 out of 5Super quick in and out today.  Came in and spoke to the "receptionist" and there was a stylist, Sarah, waiting to go already.  Sarah was the quintessential conversationalist when it comes to making superficially substantive small talk.  No religion, no politics.  Played it safe and stuck to things like sports (she's from Kansas City and we talked about Livestrong Stadium, the Chiefs, the Royals, etc) and upon asking where I was from (east TN originally), we talked about Nashville sports teams.  Our topics of discussion also revolved around the parts of the city that we've lived in, and our respective tattoo artists and interests.  While I do appreciate Michael (of Michael's in the loop) and his affinity for motorcycling, it was nice to just change up the topics.Quality of Cut: 4.25 out of 5Like I said - I'm buzz cut type guy, and asked for the 1/8th in treatment.  Sarah faded the back nicely so it won't look like an overgrown hedge a month down the road, and as it goes with most barbershops, there's a little part of my noggin where it's part cow-lick, part "what in the world is that swirl pattern?"  Unless you really look at it closely and run the clippers every which way, it's hard to get it to be completely even.  Look, 99% of the barbers I've been to miss it, and it's not something I have really "fix" when I get home unless it's really atrocious.  Speed: 5 out of 5Even with making small talk, this was a speedy affair, lasting no more than 15 or 20 minutes even with the hot shave at the end.Value: 4.5 out of 5Sure, I could make my way to Hair Cuttery or Great Clips to save a dollar or two, but at 17 bucks for the cut (and an even 20 including tip), the value at Floyd's is pretty good, considering that you also get the offer for a neck and shoulder massage at the end.  I politely declined, because I'm really not a neck and shoulder massage guy, but I do enjoy a nice hot lather neck shave, even if I don't have that much hair.Decor: 4 out of 5Industrial chic meets Rock n Roll.  The storefront windows slide open as well, so when the train rolls by, you sort of get a nice and compact Chicago experience all at once.Overall: 5 out of 5Realistically, a 4.5 star experience, but my conventional rounding bumps it up to a 5.  Speedy, well done, and a pleasant conversationalist made this experience a decidedly positive one.

8.description: My stylist name was Yvonne(not sure if that's the right spelling) gave a badass haircut and super hot on top of that.Def recommend!!

31.description: I've had my best and worst haircut here, but most of them are just mediocre and the same quality I could get at great clips for $10 less. I have a short haircut and have had a hard time finding someone who can find the line between soccer mom and 12 year old boy/Justin Bieber, and Floy'ds isn't any better in that category than anywhere else I've gone in Chicago. I'm about 50/50 of getting what I ask for, with Jeremiah being the best, and Marcin isn't bad either. Jeremiah I can just give a general idea and he'll give me something great, and Marcin is good at talking through the cut to make sure it's what I'm asking for. Adam (?), on the other hand, I pretty actively avoid. All in all, probably not worth the cost for just a run of the mill haircut, and the inconsistency is pretty scary. Honestly, now that I don't live in the area, I don't feel bad looking for a new place.

34.description: I came to Floyd's on a whim one day after a back and forth, love-hate relationship with my old stylist that I could never get into when I wanted. Walked in and got seen right away by Jeremiah. I have since been back 3 times and have walked away happy every one of them. Jeremiah listens to what I want, tells me his honest opinion, and then lets me decide what we will do. I always walk away feeling like he read my mind even if I didn't explain what I wanted very well. It looks like I have found a new regular stylist with no hassles who always sends me away happy!

16.description: Mercedes was attentive and did a great job in giving me the cut of choice. Very few places understand the specific way I like my hairline at the neck, but being a barber shop they did a terrific job.

13.description: $26 for a clean / fast haircut, shampoo + head massage, and shoulder massage? Can't beat that.

11.description: Ashley was great.  I was overdue for a cut, the shop is walking distance from work, and she did a great job.  Good attention to detail, personable, and good music.

39.description: I tried out this place when I first moved to the neighborhood and it made me feel like an old man, and I'm barely 30.  Loud music and a thoroughly confusing collection of band posters on the wall.  The view out the front window in the summer is great but I don't think they're paying enough attention to the most important part of the business; getting a really quality haircut.  I thought the staff was a little b-list.  At the rates they're charging it's going to be tough for college students to afford and the quality isn't there for people who are willing to pay a few dollars extra.

37.description: Ashley scalped me! I came in for a long boob and she showed me where she would cut my hair to just above the shoulder. I said that was perfect and showed her to repeat what she said. After her first cut I knew I was doomed but I had hope! She turned the chair away from the mirror so I didn't see what she was cutting and it was too late to speak up! I gave her a nice tip and left. So my hair is shorter than my chin!!!I will be wearing a hat for months! I feel violated and as times goes on, I get sicker!I'm really very upset and I think someone should take the scissors away from her and never give them back! And it's not even a good cut! I'm! I'm devastated! Stay away from Ashley is my review!  Besides for $50. You can go just about anywhere else!

0.description: First time at this location and it was a great experience all around. I made a reservation before hand and I walked in with no wait time. I requested Katherine P. as she is highly Yelp recommended and now I see why. Great conversationalist and hair cutter/stylist. I will definitely be coming back! Thanks Floyd's!

38.description: I can show all the pictures I want and rarely get a "cool" haircut. Newish to the area, I had earlier found a gal I liked right across the street at Sport Clips. But she lasted there all of a week for no-call-no-show a few times. So I go back to Sport Clips after calling and saying there's no wait, information I need to know as I'm feeding hungry meters! I go in and somehow two people are ahead of me for the stylist I was going to get. Running short on time as I had to get to work later, I left in a miff and walked across to Floyd's.I saw Floyd's on my last trip to Sport Clips and it definitely looked funkier, cooler, more hip, less corporate (though it is a chain). I walked in and Lena T was able to take me right away. She was a hip looking gal...as were most of the staff there.I showed her a pic and she very competently and quickly gave me an awesome cut and a comp shampoo and hot towel because it was my first visit. Well it won't be my last!! $24 for the cut and normally $5 extra I think for a shampoo and towel. Worth it for stylish cuts that don't take forever. I believe it's the slow nitpicky hairstylist who really doesn't know what she's doing. Quick = pro!

51.description: My husband found Floyd's as we were walking in the neighbourhood one night and he recently decided to stop in to get his hair cut.  The receptionist greeted us really warmly and took great care of both of us.  As I was sitting in the waiting area, I noticed that there were signs up saying that they do colour now... and not just colour, but Paul Mitchell colouring products, which I LOVE!   I just got done with my appointment for highlights, and it looks AMAZING!  Siouxsie was fantastic - she made me feel completely at ease, we chatted the entire time I was in the chair, and most importantly - my hair colour, cut and blow dry is phenomenal.  I'm now going to feel like a total rock-star going out for my birthday dinner tonight.  :)

27.description: Not worth the risk.  A lot of women cutting hair and attempting to understand clippers.  Been here twice and both times I had uneven hair on top with sciccors and distinct lines of clippers not blended in....seriously new barbers being hired weekly...not professionals....

32.description: The environment and atmosphere were great, fun place to get a haircut. Marcin did a great job and gave me exactly what I wanted and communicated really well as he cut my hair. 5 stars.

54.description: Besides the funky Floyd's atmosphere they had off haircuts for their grand opening, no wait at all, and of course that famous neck shave and massage. Just a few extra reasons to love this franchise.

48.description: Great place. Have Ellen give you a shave and a haircut. FANTASTIC!

44.description: Look, I just wanted a haircut. A good haircut. Not a shampoo, not a neck massage, not a hot towel. Instead, I got this $30 hack job. Looks like I wore three different hats. Anybody know a "haircut repair" place in South Loop?

24.description: Kat absolutely killed it! She got my haircut perfect on the first shot and I was in and out (between classes) in under 20 minutes. She's also really cool and easy to talk with. I'll be back for sure.

7.description: If you're looking for a good haircut with consistency every time, ask for Katherine. She does a great job and definitely knows what she's doing. Besides awesome haircuts, she's cool to chat with while you're sitting there. Nothing's worse than having to sit there in awkward silence, but Katherine is fun to talk to! Don't be a cheap, tip at least 20%.

49.description: I'll publicly admit that there are days when I just don't feel like shaving. Sometimes entire weeks, allowing my stubble to shamelessly grow from my neck and face. The good news is that, for $18, I can walk across the street to Floyd's for a pampering and relaxing straight-razor shave. Everyone wins, and my skin doesn't complain in brash, red sensitivity afterwards. Live a little, men.

40.description: This might be a better place to get a buzz cut than a haircut. I wanted a simple trim, just dead ends cleaned up, which was exactly what I didn't walk out with. The hairdresser, I believe her name was Allison, seemed inexperienced, and although she did manage to get rid of my dead ends, did not adjust the style to what she cut off. The cut was very awkward as it didn't shape my face nicely, and it laid thick and dumpy on my shoulders (I have shoulder lengthed hair). She left it untextured and it looked very unstylish which I found ironic to the edginess of the salon they seem to boast on both their decor and advertising. I paid and left, but felt very uncomfortable about the cut, and so went back to get an adjustment. Luckily, the original hairdresser was unavailable and another lady who seemed to be more aesthetically inclined was able to help. She agreed that it needed more texture but even after she texturized it, it didn't look great. She too seemed to have a hard time understanding how to make shoulder- lengthed hair lie nicely with some layers and texture to frame a face nicely. I had a hard time communicating with both hairdressers, as they looked at me blankly when I told them exactly what I wanted. I have no experience cutting hair, but I wasn't asking for anything dramatic. In the end, a lot more was cut off than I wanted, into a style that does not compliment me or my face. After $50, including tip for both hairdressers, I am much less than unhappy and will not be going back.

53.description: Glad to have a place just a walk away from my office in the Loop.  No longer do I have to decide between chop shops in the suburbs or limited selection in downtown.  Great atmosphere, received a solid cut, and the blade neck shave and massage provide a good send-off as I head back to work.  Love that the playlist includes 80's rock.  Will definitely return.

30.description: Mercedes is aces. Walked in and gave a vague ill-defined idea for a haircut. Mercedes nailed it. Walked out well-pleased despite my inarticulate description. Good stuff and glad I dropped by.

46.description: This place is awesome. Alex A. cut my hair today and she did a dynamite job. The entire experience: location, service, products, haircut was awesome. This is now my place to go. I highly recommend it, and keep in mind that I am very critical and picky when it comes to finding a place to call great.

1.description: My fellow yelpers....before I get into the massacre that occurred yesterday at this spot, I'd like to point out one very obvious thing.  This place has a FOUR star average and most of the ratings are from guys.  And it just so happens that all of the employees that were there, at the time of my arrival were......come on Chicago.....you guessed it!  GIRLS! GIRLS! GIRLS! (YEAH!!!) With the exception of the guy cleaning up.  Does that raise a red flag???So I had reservations right from the start.  I go in and ask for the cost of a beard trim and shape up.  The person behind the counter says between $20 and $29.  I say to my self DAMN! that's expensive, but then I ask what constitutes $20 vs $29?  The employee says " you'll have to discuss that with your stylist" In a snotty way, because obviously my questions are bothering her.  1st sign of impending disaster.  (If you have a good product, know what you're doing, and provide a good service, you don't get defensive.)So I'm given a seat at the chair, then comes the stylist (a woman), 2nd sign of impending disaster.  Now wait a minute my fellow Chicagoans and Chicagoettes!!! I am the biggest feminist on earth, so I didn't immediately panic, but I was concerned.  In the same way that you lovely ladies tell us guys, "you don't know Sh*t about pregnancy and a woman's body" well Gentlemen, I'm taking a stand for all MEN and will say to all the ladies "You ladies don't know what it's like to grow a FULL Beard! (And I hope no lady ever knows what that's like!)So let me land this plane.  What resulted on my face was a disaster.  If this stylist was forced to walk the lines on my face, that she created, for a DUI test, she would have FAILED and been JAILED.  I mean EPIC FAIL.  I'll post some pictures later but figured I should save another mans face from what happened to me.And there you have it folks!

55.description: btw I'm so glad that a floyd's open up in SL!  Just went for cut and style and extremely happy.  I definitely recommend ADAM.  He was so attentive to me and definitely educated me on my hair.  My hair looks great and I love it!  Thanks Adam!!!

9.description: I can show all the pictures I want and rarely get a "cool" haircut. Newish to the area, I had earlier found a gal I liked right across the street at Sport Clips. But she lasted there all of a week for no-call-no-show a few times. So I go back to Sport Clips after calling and saying there's no wait, information I need to know as I'm feeding hungry meters! I go in and somehow two people are ahead of me for the stylist I was going to get. Running short on time as I had to get to work later, I left in a miff and walked across to Floyd's.I saw Floyd's on my last trip to Sport Clips and it definitely looked funkier, cooler, more hip, less corporate (though it is a chain). I walked in and Lena T was able to take me right away. She was a hip looking gal...as were most of the staff there.I showed her a pic and she very competently and quickly gave me an awesome cut and a comp shampoo and hot towel because it was my first visit. Well it won't be my last!! $24 for the cut and normally $5 extra I think for a shampoo and towel. Worth it for stylish cuts that don't take forever. I believe it's the slow nitpicky hairstylist who really doesn't know what she's doing. Quick = pro!

26.description: I like this place and I'm glad I found them especially Adam who has cut my hair several times.  I always call at the last minute for an appointment and Adam always finds time to squeeze me in without a long wait.  He is friendly and he knows how to cut hair and the best part is that he listens to what I am looking for when I tell him.  The place plays good music and I get a great massage after every cut.  I hate high maintenance foo foo attitude and I never get that here, it's all good.

25.description: Bounced around barbershops and salons for years, finally found someone I truly trust. Jeremiah is an absolute professional and a master of his craft. I'm a difficult client and he was incredibly comforting and careful. Highly recommended.

12.description: It seems like the haircuts can be hit or miss depending on who's working that day.  I have fine thin hair with a couple of squirrly collicks in the front and back, so granted my hair isn't the easiest, but by no means should it be that complicated to get a nice haircut either.  I usually go with a "Don Draper" style, and last time I ended up with a rooster tail in back because of a collick (sp?).  Otherwise the barbers are usually friendly, and will make conversation if you want, or cut in silence if that's more your style.

21.description: In town for work stopped by to get a cut. I was in town a couple of months ago and stopped in and I think I had the surliest hair cutter ever. But I like Floyd's and I appreciate the concept. Anyway, Mercedes took care of me tonight. She did a great job. She talked to me about what I wanted and delivered in spades! Thanks again. Next time I'm in town hopefully she will still be around.

17.description: Date of Visit: May 31, 2013This review's context is for a men's buzz cut package only, i.e., I can't speak to how they do  regular cut, coloring service, etc. Location: 4.5 out of 5Quick and easy walk from the south loop for me.  I'm basically right at Plark (Polk and Clark, see what I did there?) and it's about a quarter mile walk for me.  Easily accessible via public transportation too (Red line or bus).  There is street parking available as well.  Customer Service: 5 out of 5Super quick in and out today.  Came in and spoke to the "receptionist" and there was a stylist, Sarah, waiting to go already.  Sarah was the quintessential conversationalist when it comes to making superficially substantive small talk.  No religion, no politics.  Played it safe and stuck to things like sports (she's from Kansas City and we talked about Livestrong Stadium, the Chiefs, the Royals, etc) and upon asking where I was from (east TN originally), we talked about Nashville sports teams.  Our topics of discussion also revolved around the parts of the city that we've lived in, and our respective tattoo artists and interests.  While I do appreciate Michael (of Michael's in the loop) and his affinity for motorcycling, it was nice to just change up the topics.Quality of Cut: 4.25 out of 5Like I said - I'm buzz cut type guy, and asked for the 1/8th in treatment.  Sarah faded the back nicely so it won't look like an overgrown hedge a month down the road, and as it goes with most barbershops, there's a little part of my noggin where it's part cow-lick, part "what in the world is that swirl pattern?"  Unless you really look at it closely and run the clippers every which way, it's hard to get it to be completely even.  Look, 99% of the barbers I've been to miss it, and it's not something I have really "fix" when I get home unless it's really atrocious.  Speed: 5 out of 5Even with making small talk, this was a speedy affair, lasting no more than 15 or 20 minutes even with the hot shave at the end.Value: 4.5 out of 5Sure, I could make my way to Hair Cuttery or Great Clips to save a dollar or two, but at 17 bucks for the cut (and an even 20 including tip), the value at Floyd's is pretty good, considering that you also get the offer for a neck and shoulder massage at the end.  I politely declined, because I'm really not a neck and shoulder massage guy, but I do enjoy a nice hot lather neck shave, even if I don't have that much hair.Decor: 4 out of 5Industrial chic meets Rock n Roll.  The storefront windows slide open as well, so when the train rolls by, you sort of get a nice and compact Chicago experience all at once.Overall: 5 out of 5Realistically, a 4.5 star experience, but my conventional rounding bumps it up to a 5.  Speedy, well done, and a pleasant conversationalist made this experience a decidedly positive one.

10.description: I have always had great experiences at Floyd's,  but Kat at the South Loop location is by far the best. Been going to her for about a year now and have received countless great haircuts. I normally cringe at having to make chit chat while someone is cutting my hair,  but with Kat it's a pleasure.

5.description: If you're looking for a constantly good haircut, at an affordable price, by a knowledgeable barber, in a cool setting, with no long waits, good music, and in close proximity to the Harrison red line stop, then Floyd's 99 on Harrison in Printers Row/South Loop is the place to go. I've had my haircut by both Jack and Ellen. Both were super friendly and between the two of them they work most days of the week. Oh, and if you need hair care products, they have plenty in stock.

3.description: I asked to get my hair cut in layers because my hair grew out and wanted to keep it long just less volume. Girl took a hour and she didn't even style it all she did was cut the back 3 or 4 inches off and she also did some snips on the front. No side bangs no style if your going to cut my hair short at least layer it like I wanted. I only tipped her 5 bucks. It was 60 for this crap I could of gone to great Clips for this crap. I am sticking at going to chinatown because they do stylize and layer my hair. It was my first and last time here.

35.description: Floyd's is a solid shop and I endorse all of their OTHER locations.  This location unfortunately is staffed by very unfriendly and less talented barbers who often skimp on many of the details of their haircut.  For example, both the "hot lather, straight razor neck shave" and "famous shoulder massage for all" that are advertised as part of their basic cut on their website (see 'Services' page) are often skipped.  Despite living a couple blocks away, I will (and recommend you also) pass by this shop in the future.

19.description: I've come a few times since I had that mishap with Marcin. Those haircuts were just okay. I liked them, but they weren't exactly what I wanted. I guess it's partly my fault because I struggle with relaying exactly what I'm looking for in a haircut. I tried to give the hairstylists some creative room since they are the professional.Today I went, and Jeanna did my hair. I get really nervous when I go to new stylists, since I've had some rough experiences with hair mishaps.After my haircut with Marcin, I gave Floyd's a one out of 10. Today I'm changing my review to a five out of five and would give it a 10 out of 10, if I could.Jeanna was awesome. She communicated with me the entire time she was doing my hair. She took her time, making sure that everything was not only to my liking but also her liking. I have an undercut pixie hairstyle, and I asked for a one on the sides. She made sure to not go to the one immediately, just in case I didn't want it that short, slowly making her way down to the one to make sure it was exactly what I wanted. She also made genuinely nice, friendly small talk the whole time, which I liked.I have never felt more comfortable and a hair stylist's chair. If you want a fun, edgy cut, GO TO JEANNA. She also used to be a colorist, as well, for 8 years, I think she said- so there's that too! 10/10.

28.description: Lena did an incredible job coloring and trimming my hair. I'm a tough customer - long, somewhat damaged hair, very particular, a bit anxious anytime someone is doing my hair - but Lena was super professional and confident in her skills which made me feel at ease. She was able to achieve an amazing ombré by darkening my roots and sparing my drier ends. I've been contemplating this change for awhile and hadn't mustered the balls but I'm so glad I went for it. Lena was helpful and knowledgable and I'll definitely be going back to her. Thanks, girl!

45.description: Having just moved to Chicago, I needed to determine where I will be getting my haircut here on out. Be that as it may... A Google search and scan of reviews led me to Floyd's 99 on the South Loop. Very impressed. Ellen P cut my hair and did an outstanding job. The way I see it- fate was in her hands...she delivered. $25+ tip for a cut- can't beat that.

33.description: Sean is the shit.  End of story.  Sean's been cutting my hair for a while now and every time its exactly what I want and it grows out so well.  Thats a sign of a good hair cut, how it grows out.  Sean is extremely personable, genuinely interested in our conversations, and really down to earth.   I know that when I see Sean I'm going to get a fresh ass cut and he's going to get me in and out because he knows I'm a busy lady.  I don't let anyone else come near me with clippers.

43.description: I made a last-minute stop in in hopes of having a botched haircut from the day prior from a different salon fixed. My stylist was great, friendly, fixed the cut.

2.description: This place can be great, but when it is bad it is BAD. After about seven great cuts in a row, I got a mediocre one--hey, it happens--but shortly after I left the shop the stylist started stalking me on a location-based dating app. Creepy! Then for my latest cut, just moments ago, the stylist basically clipped the sides and announced she was done. This, despite me asking her, "Can you shorten it up on the sides and then notch it out on the top so I can wear it messy?" When she didn't do that, and after I told her I that I still needed some taken of the top, she rolled her eyes and cut some off the back. Then when I told her more all over and shorter on the front, she said she didn't understand. So I explained to her how I do my hair again, and she goes, "That makes no sense." When I explained again, telling her how other stylists handle it, she said, "I'm sorry, but I don't know that technique. And you don't want me practicing on you!" I told her I didn't know how else to explain. So I tried one last time to tell her what other stylists do. She laughed and said, "You make absolutely no sense. I have no idea what you are even talking about." So I asked her if she had a book that showed styles. Based on her response, you would think I was in a fancy restaurant asking for ketchup. After reacting like she wanted to strangle me and telling me that they didn't have any style books, I suggested, "Well, maybe I can get my phone and pull up a picture." She then said, "No, I'll just chunk some out." I said, "Yep -- that's basically what I was asking for." She then said, "It is called NOTCHING. I will notch your hair." So I politely responded, "Yeah. That's what I said. I asked if you could notch it out." She then replied, "It sounded like you said knotting. That you wanted me to knot your hair into chunks or something."Okay, lady. First time ever I have had a stylist not catch on to what I wanted, especially because my hair was kind of already the way I wear it, just a bit grown out. Maybe she was just having a bad day. Regardless, she doesn't know how to notch hair out, or, evidently, use her context clues. So here I sit, recommending that you avoid "Cassandra" if you don't want to chance a weird, tense experience that leads to a bad haircut.And I'd tell you the name of the stylist that was following me on social media, but I'm worried she'll start creeping on me again.

18.description: Just received incredibly terrible service and a haircut I could've gotten from Great Clips for $8; or done myself for free.I have been going to Floyd's for years, garnering mixed feelings. Sometimes the cut is good, sometimes its no so great. Sometimes the service is alright, sometimes it sucks. This was my last visit.I don't remember the stylist's name (probably because she rushed through my haircut and was done in record time) or else I would post. I was greeted with an almost look of disgust on her face. She sat me down, wasn't pleasant, and asked what I wanted. I told her I was literally just in Floyd's about 2 weeks ago and decided I wanted it a little shorter. There was no offer to do the cut at a discounted price or even for free. (I wasn't expecting this, but considering how pricey they are, I spent a total of $48 + tips on this terrible haircut)Now, my hair was the longest it has been in years, almost down to my upper lip; so she had a lot to work with. I ended up with hair on top that is much shorter than I would've liked, and sides that are blended terribly. My hair has no style whatsoever. She proceeded to shave my neck against the grain, which was painful. The complimentary massage was not offered, I was not asked how I liked the haircut. The seat wasn't even lowered before she decided it was time for me to leave. I would've said something but I wanted to get out of there as quickly as possible; there is no fixing this cut without making it shorter than I like my hair to be.Basically, go somewhere else. I've heard of some great barbershops in Chicago that offer cuts at prices lower than Floyd's. I will be taking my business there in the future.

41.description: My husband came home with a BAD haircut. He said a female (with tattooed arms) at this location did it. Half of his hair is slightly longer than the other half, and she gave him a totally different (and utterly unnatural) neckline. It looks weird. No bueno.

52.description: I've been shifting around Floyd's Barbershops it seems the past couple months. Floyds being the ONLY joint I go to for haircuts in the City. The atmosphere is always laid back no matter what location I'm at, no prissy women gawking at the newest celebs or gossiping my ear off. No overly smelly perfumes or judging the fact that I look like crap entering in the barbershop.I strayed away from Lincoln Park's location once I found out West Loop opened, then I cheated on West Loop once I saw South Loop open! They just keep getting closer and closer to me!I passed by the South Loops location on a whim on Tuesday March 12th. Thought i'd stop in to make a later appt. Receptionist greeted me with a warm smile, ready to help out with anything I needed. I scheduled it for an hour past the time it was. Returning for the cut an hour later, a young woman with cute glasses and a bright pink streak in her hair greeted me with " You were in earlier! glad you came back!' i'll be taking you right over here. Such a warm personality, I was instantly at home. I have a special haircut that not many people know how to 'spruce up' no matter how good they think they are. Julia knew, she suggested a few things to make it look hot and I let her go! One of the BIGGEST perks to getting a haircut that no1 thinks about is, the head massage. yes, the shampooing portion, its the perfect opportunity to make the process a little more relaxing by a quick head massage. FINALLY.. Julia knows! I was ready to pass out in the chair as she cleansed my quaffer of the city smells.Between the great conversation, relaxing atmosphere and Superb job on my hair cut, this abrupt hair cut turned out to be the greatest thing I did that day! I will FOR SURE be staying with Julia Slaughter and suggesting Everyone to go to her!

50.description: ~ Floydian Snip ~Remember back in college when you'd go out drinking on Wednesday night when the weekend started?Remember back in college when you'd go out drinking on Wednesday night when the weekend started, come back to the country club feeling pretty good and then cap off the evening by entering outer space via breathing in Dark Side of the Moon?  Remember how relaxed you were at that blissful moment?That's almost how you'll feel when you're finished with your cut, neck shave, hot towel and shoulder massage at Floyd's.  I almost felt like a woman at a full service spa with all of the unexpected pampering I received at Floyd's.  I believe Adam (the guy in the first chair) was the one who cut my hair.  I walked into the punky Floyd's (ironically, punks allegedly hated The Floyd, but I digress) looking like Elvis circa 1970 with three months of growth (this hair is so lovely I hate to ever cut it) and walked out looking like the 24-year-old Mike K., with a haircut that looked like it had "more of a style" compared to the haircuts of the hack on Wells, according to a stylish source who has a good eye.How much did I pay for all of this pampering?  Twelve bucks.  I got a half-off deal because it was their grand opening.  Money, it's a hit.  I'll likely be back in eight or ten weeks' time and will gladly pay the full 24 dollars for a cut this good.Five stars.

4.description: I've been going to this Floyds for a few years. I work in the area, so the location is perfect for a quick lunch break cut. Everyone at this Floyds is super friendly and helpful, the cashiers and the stylists. I've gotten a great cut from every stylists I've been to, but lately I've been scheduling my appointments with Kat ( Katherine P). She does such a good job that I will reschedule my appointment if she is unavailable. She remembers my style preferences and has excellent suggestions when it comes to my hair care.I highly recommend her services and the shop in general.

6.description: Good haircut, quick, low wait time.  Call ahead and you can basically walk right in. Every stylist I have had has done a great job. Repeat customer since 2013.

22.description: I've come a few times since I had that mishap with Marcin. Those haircuts were just okay. I liked them, but they weren't exactly what I wanted. I guess it's partly my fault because I struggle with relaying exactly what I'm looking for in a haircut. I tried to give the hairstylists some creative room since they are the professional.Today I went, and Jeanna did my hair. I get really nervous when I go to new stylists, since I've had some rough experiences with hair mishaps.After my haircut with Marcin, I gave Floyd's a one out of 10. Today I'm changing my review to a five out of five and would give it a 10 out of 10, if I could.Jeanna was awesome. She communicated with me the entire time she was doing my hair. She took her time, making sure that everything was not only to my liking but also her liking. I have an undercut pixie hairstyle, and I asked for a one on the sides. She made sure to not go to the one immediately, just in case I didn't want it that short, slowly making her way down to the one to make sure it was exactly what I wanted. She also made genuinely nice, friendly small talk the whole time, which I liked.I have never felt more comfortable and a hair stylist's chair. If you want a fun, edgy cut, GO TO JEANNA. She also used to be a colorist, as well, for 8 years, I think she said- so there's that too! 10/10.

15.description: I went here for the first time a couple days ago and have nothing but great things to say about them. Ashley, the GM/hair stylist extraordinaire, was absolutely wonderful. She did a great job of listening to what I wanted while also providing her professional expertise. First timers get a free shampoo (aka incredible head massage) and shoulder massage (also awesome). They could charge much more and I would still come back every time. I will definitely be recommending this place to friends.

20.description: I started coming here after I moved to the Sloop and haven't gone anywhere else since.  With any haircut chain, I was skeptical at first, but after the first time I haven't turned back. Kat is a true barber (barbette?) and goes extra to make sure I got the freShest cut.

36.description: Great place to get haircut! A little pricey, but well worth the $24 price since it includes a neck shave and massage. I've gotten swivel haircuts from Alex and Jerimiah and they are both great!

14.description: I was in Chicago for Memorial Day Weekend and my hair was out of control.  I happend upon Floyd's and Jeremiah cut my hair, by request and not assigned.  Even though Floyds is a chain and the stylists work on a clock, Jeremiah took his time with me to make sure I was comfortable with his haircut, which I really appreciated.  I don't like changing barbers or stylists but this was an emergency and turned out to perfection.  I also don't like switching dentists or trying on shoes either, but "you gotta do what you gotta do!!"....especially since I live in New Jersey and couldn't wait until I got home.

3.description: I come with my mom and I have had massages before, but never feel good of this.Both our massages were excellent.they have a good massage therapist, and I would definitely Come back. they are so wonderful and they worked on all our problem areas.

1.description: I had a sore shoulder and came here to get a massage. They were really pushy about trying to get me to do a 1 hour massage instead of 30 minutes. I also saw them throwing their trash in the city/street garbage can. Maybe that doesn't make any difference, but what kind of business can't pay for their own trash disposal? I guess they figure my tax dollars can pay for their trash.

2.description: This was the worst nail salon I ever went to, starting with them telling me they didn't do no chips, even though they had the no chip colors in plain view and my friend had gotten one there before. When I pushed her on getting one she said the lady who does them was tired. That should have been my cue to leave. In hindsight I realize they wanted me out of there because they wanted to serve their male clientele. There are absolutely some sketchy things happening in there. From 7 - 7:15 the men just kept piling in. I was so uncomfortable I left. You may not think this is strange but why did the female employee who came in for her 7:00 shift strip down from her winter gear to daisy Dukes and a camisole... Hardly the masseuse outfit. But I digress. In an effort to get me out In a hurry, the girl doing my nails said a different girl was gonna do my massage. This was the lady that came out from the back flossing her teeth. So gross. I wanted the 20 min massage they had posted in their mani/pedi packages and again in an effort to get me out fast before 7:00 the lady told me only 15 minutes. But I called her out on that and she said fine. 10 min on my legs and feet, 10 min on my back and shoulders. During my leg massage she was on the phone, calling, answering and giving me the worst massage ever with one hand. For the shoulders and neck part, she put me in a chair in front of the cold door. I will NOT be coming here again

9.description: I wouldn't let these people touch me if I was stranded on an island and had no hands!!  I'm serious.  I'm really trying to keep my business in the neighborhood so I stopped in to have them do my nails and it did not go well.  To make a long story short, it took over an hour and she was only halfway done when I finally just left.  Why did I leave with my nails (acrylics) half done?  Because she drew blood!  It was so bad I actually let out a loud YELP and the others came out from the backroom to see what was going on.   They remain in business and are open some interesting hours for a salon so I'm sure they are good at something, just not the services I'm in need of.......

10.description: This place is filthy, and they have signs inside stating that they are not responsible for infections.  Something tells me that the city health inspectors might just have a different take on that statement.  Yuck!

4.description: DONT GO HERE! They don't know what they are doing! They don't even deserve one star. They messed up my eyebrows!!! I asked if they did eyebrows and she seemed confused with what I asked her, she answered yes and told me 15$ we went in to this little room and mind you this place is humid and smells bad. She then proceed but still seemed confused with what was going on. I should have stopped her there and walked out but I was giving her chance. She goes on and does my left eyebrow and waxes half of it off!!! I begin to yell at her, which i don't like to do, but this pissed me off. Seconds later women from the back of the room heard the yelling and came to see what was going on. The lady insisted on a free one hour massage, but I stormed off with out paying and one and half eyebrows. I later yelp this location, which I should have done in the first place, and I learn that this isn't the first time that someone storms off with out paying. I also learn that this place is also not a typical "spa" I really don't understand why they are still open and why they put up a front like they know what they are doing.

6.description: OK manicure, but I could have done the same at home in about the half the time.It might be the weird hours - manicures until 5 or so, "other services" until 10 or 11 - or the employees that kept trying to push the massage services. Maybe the fact that the only clientele I've noticed (and I live around the corner) are men?Something rubs me the wrong way here.

11.description: I was gonna get a massage.  I saw plastic flower on the massage table.  I was scare to get naked after i walk in the place, i am not sure the decor is right or clean enought to get massage their.

5.description: I stopped in here because I was walking by and noticed they had a combination deal for reflexology and massage for only $39. Always looking for a bargain, I thought I would check it out. I had never had a reflexology treatment before and I must say it was amazing. They explained each part of the foot they were working on and what part of the body it connected to. I literally had this chronic pain in my hip completely disappear. The massage was just icing on the cake. I've had many massages and it was certainly in my top 5-10%!

7.description: I received a massage from a male therapist which I requested. It was odd and somewhat uncomfortable. You could hear the women talking the whole time in the next room. I carpet on the floor looks like maybe 10 years old. The therapist kept taking calls, texting and even left the room a couple of times...and there I lay on the table naked (a towel over me) with the door swinging open as he entered and exited. It was a bit pricey especially for the quality. Don't walk a away.....RUN!

8.description: DONT GO HERE!!! NOOOOOOOOOO DONT DO ITTTTresist the temptation of a convenient location- dont make the same mistake i did .. and apparently the other yelper before me. her review was made just a week ago.. does that mean this place is STILL open!?i used to live right around there a few months ago and went in to get a pedicure and a cut and color change on my hands.  honestly, why did i pay for a lady to put nail polish all over skin?!??! my nails were super sharp and not filed correctly.  the chick had NO idea how to apply nailpolish.  my 4 yr old niece can apply it better than she could.  i had her re-apply it on my nails and i remember showing her how to do it.. and she couldnt figure out what she was doing wrong. um HALLO- if theres clumps all over my nails and the nail polish doesnt cover the entire nail and instead is all over my skin.. there is SOMETHING wrong with that.  i felt so bad bc my friend was visiting from out of town and this is the gdamn nail place i took her to. the pedicure was just as bad if not worse.  i actually went home and took the nail polish off. there was no point in trying to go back and have her do it over, cuz she flippin sucked. anyways.. since this experience, i have never wanted to try another nail place in chicago. i stick to the best - Orchard nails in Naperville.  i dont care if its 30 mins away, i always leave with the most amazing nails at a much cheaper price than this horrendous place. DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE BEAUTIFUL PEDICURE CHAIRS. DONT GO HERRE!! SAVE UR MONEY! SERIOUSLY.

0.description: So, well let me start off by saying that I was warned by a couple of co-workers that there was a little more than nails being done here, so I was a little skeptical about trying this place, but I was in desperate need of a Manicure and Eyebrow Wax; as this place is right across the street from my job, I really had no other choice but to go during my Lunch.I went in about 2:00 pm on a Monday and was out in about a little over an hour, maybe not quite even that long. The Nail Tech, which I believe was also the Owner, was very pleasant and engaged me in conversation during my Manicure. The place is stocked with a pretty decent range of colors from OPI and some other brands. For awhile I was the only customer in the place, not too long after a gentleman came in looking for a Pedicure, and was almost forced into going in the back for a "massage". All-in-All the experience was a pleasant one and the Manicure was done nicely. My Eyebrows, left a little to be desired, but to be fair, I do have quite difficult eyebrows to work with, so I won't take away too much for that. Prices aren't bad, around what you would expect from a Loop Location Nail Salon/Spa.

58.description: Dined here twice. First time was beginner's luck and had a deal coupon, second time was also a deal coupon and affirmation not to return unless it's based on desperation. Disruptive noise from the bar, when sitting in the train car/dining section of the restaurant. Venue layout is a bizarre set up, to enter the dining area, you have to walk through the bar crowd which feels like a different establishment than the train car/dining section. The food is okay, it's filling due to its large portions but I've had much better Italian food. Waitstaff seems to be hardworking but not very knowledgeable about the menu.

56.description: Came here on a working lunch. FOOD: I wasn't footing the bill, but still ended up ordering only a $9.00 entree because everything else looked kind of heavy. I had the chicken asparagus salad, which was very good. A LOT of chicken, like the equivalent of two chicken breasts, which was nice. I took home an entire turkey breast. We also had the grilled calamari, which was delicious!SERVICE: The staff is fun and friendly. Food came fairly fast.AMBIANCE: Definitely feels like a real Italian place as opposed to an Olive Garden type feel. Kind of neat to be eating in an old train car. It seemed kind of dead at lunch time on a Friday, but maybe that's normal. I don't know.

29.description: Cute train car dining room. Friendly service and decent Italian food. Nice, old establishment in the South Loop.

42.description: Beautiful environment. The food was delicious and they even let us split the ravioli entree into two plates with the different sauces. The server was a bit of an old snappy Italian man with an attitude.

23.description: Cute dining car and bar here.  Food was OK lacked a bit of "finesse" for the prices for dinner I expect more. I'd imagine lunch and the bar here are really the way to go. Probably would not return for dinner just wasn't anything I'd come back for.

47.description: excellent food.  reasonably priced for Chicago.  Nice setting.  Visiting from out of town, and looked for several Italian restaurants.  Was not disappointed at all with this one.

8.description: This space was a weird one! But ended up being delicious savory Italian food. Dining in the railway car made it seem like an entirely different restaurant from the front bar. The waiters were friendly and helpful, suggesting entrees for us. The food was hearty portions and kept us full!

31.description: Picture eating delicious Italian food inside an old train car with lights strung across the ceiling, candles and old books beautifully arranged, and fresh flowers on your table. It's what dreams are made of. I'd put this location at the top of my list for romantic, intimate dinners, or a perfect place to have a dinner with a group of girlfriends. The bruschetta and ravioli are my favorite and I couldn't recommend them enough!

34.description: Food was pretty tasty. The best part by far is the ambiance. We sat in an old train car and I thought it was a great place for a romantic date. The staff had clearly built relationships with customers who come often. There's also a bar area that's filled with people as the offices empty out. A very different vibe from the train car, but there's something for everyone.

16.description: The food was bland and tasteless. I expected the bread to be warm like other Italian restaurants, but the bread was stale and cold. My wife ordered pasta with shrimp and creamy pesto sauce, it was very bland, she had to order red pepper to give it some favor.The Waiter was very inattentive, he never said what his name was. He took a long time to come by each time we needed something even though the dining room was less than 10% full.   The place was dead when we were there during dinner time, 7:30pm on a Saturday evening, prime time which was ominous sign.The only reason we went was because I had purchased a coupon, the only rules on the coupon was the bill had to be over $50, with tax and tip not included in the $50 total. I satisfied the requirements, but the waiter came back and said my alcoholic drink (glass of wine) could not be included in the $50 total and I was $10 short. I told him there was no requirement stating alcoholic drinks could not be used. He still said I was $10 dollars short, I ask to speak to the owner, but I was told he was not available.I felt they were trying to jack up my bill, I did not argue or complain but not happy with my experience here one bit. I did not order any more food, just paid my bill and left.I tried calling the restaurant several times over the next few days, the owner I was told, was never available. I left message, no one called me back, so it seems they don't care about the poor food and bad service. I will never eat there again.

13.description: Below average Italian food compared to olive garden and maggianos. I came here with a groupon and as soon as the waiter heard "groupon", he had a bad attitude. Didn't seem like he wanted to serve us or talk to us. Very dissapointed! The food was very light, the flavour wasn't enough and the place was deserted. Would not recommend!

11.description: Great little place!! Randomly walked by & was attracted by the train car that people were sitting in. Then we looked it up on Yelp & saw they had a Yelp deal AND what looked like good food so we just decided to try it. Such a good find! Cute atmosphere, good servers. It was a shame that it wasn't more busy on a Saturday night but we enjoyed it because it was quiet & we could enjoy the music & relax.

39.description: Love the setting, great wine, and wonderful food.  The food was fairly traditional, full of flavor, and not too rich.  I'll be back the next time I'm in Chicago.

37.description: We went as full price clients, forgetting there were deals on yelp and living social. First impression was a bunch of people crowding door at bar and that it smelled musty. We were seated in the train part where there was no one else. Empty. Our service was good and server was helpful. We had an affordable bottle of wine and each had an entree. Bill was over $100 and was it worth it? Maybe. Husband had risotto which had way too much garlic. Mom had some sort of cremy chicken dish, and I haf lasagna. Food was good.

0.description: Three of us arrived at about 7:00 pm on a Friday night.  The bar and restaurant were busy but we were told we'd be seated within 10 minutes.  True to promise we were seated in a quieter area from the bar, as requested.  I talked my vegan order over with the waiter and got penne pasta with marinara.  It was delicious!  So fresh!  We will definitely be back!!!

38.description: Your response is another example of your exemplary rudeness. We did in fact initially order two entrees and two deserts because there were no limitations listed in the groupon but changed it to 4 entrees after your server was whining about how the restaurant wasn't making any money off the groupons. And we showed you that we had paid for the groupon before ordering- that's what a receipt is. The real reason you did not ask us to leave was because your pathetic dining room was empty. And no answer to the charge that the bar patrons were yelling throughout our dinner? I guess twenty years of being in business is exactly why you have to offer groupons to drum up business any way that you can.

51.description: Pretty decent food and a fun location. Kind of weird because when you walk in it seems like a bar but you go in the back and there's this sort of box-car feel. I enjoyed the food - it was big portions - and it was fairly reasonably priced, but I didn't think it was outstanding. That being said its a perfectly fine place to go when you want some decent food and a nice waitstaff.

27.description: The food is TERRIBLE. Yes, it's in an old train car, which is kind of cool, but the food is downright awful. The spinach linguini was bland and had no flavor. There was supposed to be pesto in this dish, but there definitely was none. My girlfriend had to douse it in hot pepper, salt, and black pepper to give it any hint of flavor, but it was still bad. The gnocchi with classic ragu sauce tasted way way too buttery inside. I also believe they recently increased their prices quite a bit, but I'm not sure about this. Regardless, the food is way overpriced for the quality. I kind of had a feeling that the food was going to be bad in a restaurant located right off the entrance to 290. The place was also DEAD when we were there during DINNERTIME ON A SATURDAY EVENING- another ominous sign. We had leftovers, but it was so bad that we didn't even want to take them with or bother finishing the food- that's a first.

32.description: Food was good. Came with a 10$ for 20$ Groupon by myself for lunch (that way, I can get the most expensive thing on the menu for 10, lol). I had the Veal Saltimbocca (which was, the most expensive @ 18.95).
