It was very tasty; the side of pasta al olgio was yummy too.The only weird thing was them using shredded Parmesan for the bread/oil appetizer, instead of the usual grated Parmesan. The bread also wasn't the best.Good food, cool ambiance in the train car.

54.description: sat in the train part with my homeboy after work 4 dinner. there was only 2 other parties there so it wasnt crowded or busy at all. i ordered fettucine pasta with shrimp and spinach & he had the cheese & spinach ravioli. i actually liked his order better than mine but both were pretty delicious. our waiter was nice but couldve been a bit more attentive. regardless, we would both go back cuz the food was tasty.

48.description: Very good food! Came here may times for weekday lunch. Great service (not as bad as I saw in other reviews) Food came fast even during busy hours.Ordered their chicken & mushroom/ chicken pasta for few times. very tasty.

44.description: This place is always interesting.  It's a whore-fest in the bar area (think old traders with too much money and chicks short on brain cells).  Then, you walk through this mess into one of the most romantic dining areas available in the area - it's an old train car that is dimly lit.  The service is fairly professional in the train car, but if you want to have some tits rubbed in your face on the way out, just stop in the bar area.  Also, they are always running deals - Groupon, Yelp, PBS, so be sure to pick one up before you go.  Outie!

24.description: The food was bland/tasteless, the bread brought out was stale. We ordered fried calamari,  chicken fettuccine, a pizza with chicken and spinach and a pasta with shrimp/rice. Waiter was not great,  the waiters helper was amazing though, never once had to ask to have my water refilled, it was always topped and had a change of napkins before we even asked, props to him.I had purchased the groupon special. I paid with my credit card. The waiter increased the price on everything slightly and automatically put himself 18% gratuity for a party of two. Which from my understanding is only done on large parties and optional depending on the service received for small parties. I did not argue or complain due to being with my mother but not happy with my experience here one bit. Antico posto in Oakbrook is actually worth  their price, quality food and service. Check them out if you're in search for a good Italian restaurant.

7.description: This review is for the BAR area only.Totally great. This is one of those smallish "Grotto" type bars that look like they should be crawling with Playboy bunnies. Or lawyers. Or both. And it also looked like it hadn't been updated since the 70's. Yeah, now we are talking!I only went here for drinks, but it was a blast, and by the time I left, the bartender felt like a friend. Super cool for after work, cozy bar for a cold winter night. I sampled some of the pizza, and it was GREAT. I look forward to returning for the food.

49.description: I can only think of one word to describe the Rigatoni Paesano....dank (that's a good thing btw). Tutto Italiano is a hole in the wall Italian (obviously) restaurant right on the corner of Wells and Congress.  Every once and a while, we have a "premium" lunch day at work and hit this place up.  I haven't been dissapointed yet.  When walking in, there is a bar to the left and the dining room to the right is an old converted train car.  I haven't dined in before, but the staff seems very professional, and my to go orders are always ready 15 minutes from the time I call. The food is good, and always still hot by the time we get back to the office. Like I said above, the Rig Paesano is money, and a favorite amongst our group...pasta, with sausage, mushrooms and broccoli, with a thick tomato basil/mozzarella sauce. One time I will man up and have a beer during my pickup without worrying about seeing another coworker/boss....damn, I'm inSANE!!

40.description: Went back for dinner today, got the same order as last time was equally good.The groupon i had expired and our server  Mante threw in free dessert(tiramisu) to makeup, which was a very nice gesture!!

53.description: Pretty good lunch option for the area if you want to have a nicer lunch.  Eating in the train car is very interesting, though the decorations are tired.  Eat outside if it's a nice day.  Their blackened salmon salad special is quality. Perfectly spiced and a really good sized portion.  The bar also looks nice (but dark) for an after work drink, but I haven't checked it out yet.  Service is a bit slow so only go if you have time to spare.222/365

30.description: great spot, great people and great food

46.description: Bad service. Dirty place. We could not even order food because everything looked awful , from the decoration to the atmosphere

1.description: Came here with the hubby for dinner. The places is really cool. The main sitting area is in an old train  that use to be part of the CTA.  The staff were very friendly and attentive.The food was delicious, it was well seasoned. The prices were about average for what we expected to pay.  I will for sure come back,  because it took me forever to decide what I wanted to eat due to all of the delicious options. They also have a good selection of wines and beer to pick from.

55.description: We should have known better when we were immediately seated at 7 on a Friday without reservations.The food was adequate and unremarkable, although it's difficult to screw up bolognese.  The service, on the other hand, was poor. First, my wife has a food allergy. As she was explaining this to our server, he acted as though he had never heard of such a thing. Then he just responded that, "you'll be fine" without writing down a single allergen or checking with the kitchen. After our food arrived, we had to flag down the joker several times for such major requests like water, another drink, etc since he never took the time to check back in.Don't get lured in by the $20 for $10 yelp deal. You can find the same uninspired menu, and likely much better service, at your local Olive Garden.

9.description: It's a bit of a crazy looking place--half is a happy hour type bar but then they seat you in an old train dining car. It was very comfortable in there despite the summer heat of Chicago, and we liked it. The menu is pretty basic old school Italian. We had the calimari and it was cooked perfectly. Very good. The pastas we ordered were OK. The server was very pleasant and great. I feel it was a little expensive for what we ordered but maybe not for the area.

26.description: Below average Italian food compared to olive garden and maggianos. I came here with a groupon and as soon as the waiter heard "groupon", he had a bad attitude. Didn't seem like he wanted to serve us or talk to us. Very dissapointed! The food was very light, the flavour wasn't enough and the place was deserted. Would not recommend!

25.description: Nice little place that has pretty good food.  It's reasonably priced and the food is done well, good selection and no complaints about the service.  A good option for a business lunch.

12.description: Couldn't chew the Calimari. Caesar salad was placed on top of hot Calimari during delivery. Watery dressing and wilted lettuce....awful waste of money.

59.description: CHi town offers lots of great autmospheres for eating out that are amazing. this place on a tuesday night was empty in the "caboose" area and it had the feel like i rented the whole place out for me and my date :) I loved the service, and the food was very timely, and very good for the price, i HIGHLY recommend!

21.description: I am solely writing on the disgusting act of an employee (female blond) who was working on a upstairs holiday private party.  She wore the shortest skirt and was super inappropriate.  Long story short, she decided to 'twerk' instead of work and her whole vagina was completely shown to the whole holiday party attendees.  I was livid and couldn't believe my eyes.  This classless employee of yours should be completely fired immediately.  She has done a disservice to your image and admitted to drinking 20 shots prior to even starting the party at 6pm.  How is this ok I have no idea.  She was completely laughed at by everyone at the party, and didn't care about her actions.  The food was disgusting as well and bland. If I wanted to see what I saw, I'd go to the strip club.  No apologies whatsoever and very disappointed.  I will  make sure no one will ever step foot in that trashy restaurant if you continue to hire trashy classless employees.

17.description: I found this place on Groupon and I'm so glad I did. You would drive right by it if you're not looking (which happens to be my favorite places, go figure). The side of the building is an old train car converted into restaurant seating. When you first walk in, it looks like a typical bar and then BAM! You're transported back in time. It was cozy but not overcrowded.The service was excellent and the food was delicious. I'm always nervous trying out Italian places because you walk out feeling like a bloated water buffalo. This was just the right amount to feel full without the indigestion. Try the spinach and cheese ravioli - you won't be disappointed. My friend had chicken and it was well cooked and moist.The only negative aspect, which really isn't negative but more like an annoyance, is that they REALLY want you to drink your water. It seemed like every 2 minutes they were filling our glasses. Kind of overkill but thoughtful.

10.description: Just had dinner here, the ambiance is a bit confused, half of it is a very noisy bar and the other half in a quiet train car with romantic lighting. Onto the food:(1) We received fresh shredded cheese, oil and bread upon sitting down which was as expected, delicious. (2) For appetizers, I had caprese salad which was an enormous portion, easily big enough for two people. My bf got the calamari which was also an enormous portion. Between the two, we preferred the caprese.(3) For main course, I ordered the Linguine Spinachi which included mushrooms, spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, garlic oil & pesto. It wasn't what I expected at all - very strong spinach flavor, not the best. My bf ordered the Rigatoni Paesano with Italian sausage, broccoli & mushrooms in a tomato-basil sauce with mozzarella cheese. It was considerably better than my dish.This place was way over priced for the quality of food. The service was good and the portions were huge. However, I don't think I'll be going back. As a side note, parking is a nightmare. There are only about 10 street spots which are always taken and the garage is extremely overpriced.

5.description: I've had nothing but negative experiences with this restaurant. I think they need to work on their customer service. My boyfriend also raved about Tutto Italiano and having never been there I was so excited to try their food -- they have this cool dining section that's in an old train car! First time we tried to eat there, we just missed their closing time by 2 mins ( parked but had trouble getting to the actual place). Totally our fault but when they see me running in and out of breath and I look at the owner with pleading eyes.... All he said was we are closed, kitchen was actually closed by 9:30p anyway. It was just sad.... Empathy was definitely missing there. At least pretend you care so that I'll actually want to come in next time?Anyway next time we tried going I called ahead to make a reservation and he told me none needed. Then when we arrived the same person made fun of me and smirkingly said "you're the one who called". Mmmok I guess it's funny that I just really wanted to make sure you guys would serve me. The overall experience/ambience was nice. Train car was nice. The food was bland. We ordered chicken fettuccine, gnocchi con gambri, bruschetta and the cheesecake. The bruschetta was really good, it was delicious! The two pasta dishes were just blah --- I definitely expected more. At the end when we mentioned we had a restaurant.com certificate to use they tacked on an automatic 18% gratuity. I have no qualms with paying it except it was never stated anywhere as a requirement, reading the other reviews they do this for groupon users too. My boyfriend wasn't even arguing about it just asked why it wasn't disclosed anywhere including restaurant.com (we checked) and the server became argumentative stating how that is clear company policy and that the loop area it's at least 18-20% gratuity and that we should be grateful we weren't getting charged 20%. I was shocked. This is how they treat their new customers, I am surprised people keep coming back because I will not be.

3.description: This is such a cute little place! Food was super delicious and not too expensive. Everything was wonderful. Their shrimp is TO DIE for. Will definitely be back again soon!

35.description: Nice romantic Saturday night dinner with my girlfriend. The food was great, the wine was delicious, and the atmosphere was comfortable and we could easily carry a soft conversation. Our waiter was not especially kind or helpful, but he did not add or take away from the overall experience one bit. I would certainly recommend.

19.description: Nice little place that has pretty good food.  It's reasonably priced and the food is done well, good selection and no complaints about the service.  A good option for a business lunch.

28.description: I found this place on Groupon and I'm so glad I did. You would drive right by it if you're not looking (which happens to be my favorite places, go figure). The side of the building is an old train car converted into restaurant seating. When you first walk in, it looks like a typical bar and then BAM! You're transported back in time. It was cozy but not overcrowded.The service was excellent and the food was delicious. I'm always nervous trying out Italian places because you walk out feeling like a bloated water buffalo. This was just the right amount to feel full without the indigestion. Try the spinach and cheese ravioli - you won't be disappointed. My friend had chicken and it was well cooked and moist.The only negative aspect, which really isn't negative but more like an annoyance, is that they REALLY want you to drink your water. It seemed like every 2 minutes they were filling our glasses. Kind of overkill but thoughtful.

45.description: Came here with a Groupon, looking for a cute Italian eatery for our anniversary dinner in the loop, we were not disappointed one bit.Toasted ravioli to start was phenomenal. I got chicken fetticine and my beau got himself something with italian sausage and marinara sauce. Entree portions are huge! We stuffed ourselves, and I am fairly confident that there's currently enough in my fridge for one if not two more meals. We also got a side of seasoned fries, which are amazing (crispy on the outside, perfect on the inside) and we got a huge plate for $5.Service was decent, but the waiter was friendly and water glasses were filled often. We went for dinner and there were only a few other diners in the place, I'll absoluetly be telling everyone I know about this gem!

33.description: Had lunch at Tuttos with my husband and son today.  Atmosphere is charming as we dined in the railcar under twinkling lights.   Shrimp pappardelle was scrumptious with absolutely huge shrimp in a light cream sauce.  Hubby had a chicken breast layered with spinach and a cream sauce and son had a shrimp in Diablo sauce that was to die for.  This restaurant is definitely on our lets go back list.   Service was great and timely.  Definitely would recommend this to anyone.

43.description: After a long while, I had a business lunch and a business late lunch at Tutto this week. :)  The food was as tasty as ever. The ambiance is always cozy and the service is perfect.  You feel you are valuable guest there.  It is within a couple blocks away from my work, and I should take my business lunches there more often. The restaurant is cozy as it is a converted railway car, but it defines its character.  Enjoy it!

2.description: Hey, you're eating in a dining car. You're on vacation! It can be the Orient Express, the City of New Orleans, Hogwarts Express...whatever you conjure up.  You just need to travel with someone who's a lot of fun, has a vivid imagination and who won't grimace when the food comes and you say "chew chew!" instead of "bon appetit."The food is good, though nothing to telegraph home about. Definitely not what I'd imagine the Orient Express to serve, but it's no Amtrak Dinette car either. Much closer to Amtrak prices too.One reviewer mentioned that all the servers were women with long hair and low-cut tops. Somehow I missed that scenery passing by, but maybe it was because I was watching the world go by outside. It's mainly gentlemen who have served me here, and they've been very friendly (and, luckily, appropriately attired).

18.description: Surprising good, especially considering all the mediocre reviews. The highlights were the asiago stuffed gnocchi and tiramisu. A couple of my faves for Italian cuisine and these were both great! The service and the ragu sauce on the gnocchi were both good but nothing special. The atmosphere and the bread were the areas of opportunity.

41.description: Came here with a buddy and was seated in the back room which felt like an old train car. This was kinda cool actually. The bread that came was not hot...never understood why a restaurant would not have hot bread. That being said, there was FRESH parmesan cheese and olive oil to dip it in which was nice. The veal dish a had was pretty good but would probably have been better with a more traditional marsala sauce then the one it had which was a play on marsala. Eggplant appetizer was decent.

52.description: The food is awesome!...but the Service was even more wonderful!! This place exceeded our expectations. With that said, please read other reviews. This place is really two establishments in character - the local "sports" bar with a nice dining car attached. The decor is on the oldish side but we where "charmed" by all of it. We are tired of "chains" and really love to visit "owner" establishments! This one is a WINNER!!

50.description: Location of the Restaurant is a bit of a walk from downtown State Street in a busy highway (Congress/290) and Wells. It was a bit noisy when we entered the restaurant because their bar is located by the main entrance and it was a Bears Game night. We were greeted as we entered and lead to their dining area which was pretty neat because it's an old train car which they've converted. Air-condition was better there. We were given water, french bread and freshly grated parmesan. Could've been better if the bread was a warmed (photo attached) but it was okay. We ordered Margherita Pizza and Chicken Fettucine. My pasta was great (although a little bland) and the serving was of medium size. I had some leftovers that I've brought home. I had a lot of chicken in the pasta that's why I somehow liked it compared to other Italian Restaurants that puts a little of the meat. My husband had the pizza and he said he also liked it. The pizza crust looked like it wasn't a hand tossed pizza. It wasn't crowded on a Thursday dinner night by their dining area so there was only one server and an assistant which was okay. Food was served fast and server was polite and nice.  What we were surprised was the cost of pop which is $3. Think it's a little high that's why we only gave it 4 stars rating. Overall, it was a nice dining experience so we might come back since hubby works downtown.

4.description: Damn, I saw that I forgot to use my Yelp deal. We came here for a coworker's birthday lunch. I love how they have the grated parmesan cheese and oil for me to dip my bread in. The blackened salmon I had was fantastic. The portion of fish was huge and the server was right on the money about it being filling without me feeling stuffed. Shamelessly, I might come back another time just to try the tiramisu as it looked fabulous - the birthday boy didn't even offer to share or let us have a bite so it must be that good!

6.description: The food was bland/tasteless, the bread brought out was stale. We ordered fried calamari,  chicken fettuccine, a pizza with chicken and spinach and a pasta with shrimp/rice. Waiter was not great,  the waiters helper was amazing though, never once had to ask to have my water refilled, it was always topped and had a change of napkins before we even asked, props to him.I had purchased the groupon special. I paid with my credit card. The waiter increased the price on everything slightly and automatically put himself 18% gratuity for a party of two. Which from my understanding is only done on large parties and optional depending on the service received for small parties. I did not argue or complain due to being with my mother but not happy with my experience here one bit. Antico posto in Oakbrook is actually worth  their price, quality food and service. Check them out if you're in search for a good Italian restaurant.

22.description: Great, great food! So many great options to choose from, and pretty reasonable pricing for a nice Italian dinner. Very cute atmosphere in the train car dining area. Definitely will be returning!

15.description: Went back for dinner today, got the same order as last time was equally good.The groupon i had expired and our server  Mante threw in free dessert(tiramisu) to makeup, which was a very nice gesture!!

57.description: Quickie review: 3.5 stars rounds to 4Quaint rail-car dining room and broad Italian menu. Service was quick - we needed to get out in an hour and were done in 45 minutes. Pasta was fresh and well-prepared, flavorful and in large portions. At $15 a fair price for downtown. BIg basket of good bread could have been tossed in the oven to crisp it up. Wines were just OK, so that's an area they could improve on. With a Yelp deal or Groupon it's a good choice.

20.description: This review is for the BAR area only.Totally great. This is one of those smallish "Grotto" type bars that look like they should be crawling with Playboy bunnies. Or lawyers. Or both. And it also looked like it hadn't been updated since the 70's. Yeah, now we are talking!I only went here for drinks, but it was a blast, and by the time I left, the bartender felt like a friend. Super cool for after work, cozy bar for a cold winter night. I sampled some of the pizza, and it was GREAT. I look forward to returning for the food.

36.description: Good italian in the Loop - service and food were both excellent.

14.description: I went here for Dinner with the boyfriend after a long day of traveling. I was starving! We yelped the closest Italian place to his apartment and we walked into this beautiful gem. In the front area there's a bar with some tables. We were led to the back of the restaurant to this cute area, designed as if we were about to eat in a train, curtains and all! It was so romantic. We ordered two glasses of wine, and were given excellent pours. For meals, I ordered the chicken fettuccine and he ordered the cheese ravioli. The cheese ravioli was absolutely delicious. The reason I give 4 instead of 5 was becaus the chicken fettuccine was a little bland. I had to doctor it up with salt, black pepper and red chili flakes but after that it was pretty good. There's a yelp offer-- $10 for $20 but we forgot to use it! Next time.

29.description: I love their chicken salad!!! However, I was bummed when I tried to order JUST the chicken salad w/o the bread and they still charged me for the entire sandwich and it's a very small portion. They could have at least taken $2 bucks off ...

42.description: Great sandwiches.  I enjoyed the Wreck and the Italian.  Toasted like Quiznos, but they don't skimp on the meats.  Very friendly staff and superfast service.  And cheap, too!

23.description: I'm a big fan of Potbelly's. That magic sandwich of melty goodness is enough to make my day!This location is quick with a lunch crowd, even the time I was stuck behind Mr. "I have a super specific order and you messed it up slightly so remake it." Sheesh, pack your own lunch dude. There are usually quite a few college kids in here, but in general the atmosphere is pretty quiet. Love that little bit of calmness on a lunch break :)

8.description: This place reminds me of Quiznos, if Quiznos had a more focused branding, better selection, and better ingredients.  It was a very atmosphere, great service, and deliciously fresh ingredients.  I'd go here over and over again!

31.description: A Potbelly's Haiku: Dreambar and a shake!Solerno Butter Cookie!Sandwich and a treat!

34.description: Awesome sandwiches!  For under 5$ you get a good size sandwich, and DANG is it tasty.  I had the Italian, the hubby had the Wreck and they were both wonderful.  The bread is not too overwhelming, I hate having to fight a piece of bread to get to the good stuff.  The veggies, sauce and meat are all high quality and in good portions.  The loaded baked potato soup was about $4 for a large portion and it was super creamy and delicious.  The staff was nice, service was quick.  Potbelly tops any subway, Quiznos or Togo's I have ever been to.  I would say besides a real deli sandwich, this is the best you can get.

16.description: Damn good sarnies!!Eat here for a nice sandwich with plenty of choices for a decent lunch with a classic styled cafe /deli feel.  Have vegetarian friendly choices too.In spite of the affordable menu the three locations I have visited actually have all provides a pleasurable dining experience and atmosphere. The sandwich comes warm...Yum!  The bread has the perfect light crispy texture to the crust and inside the different sandwiches have had nice overall flavor.  I always add the hot giardinera it's delicious!Helpful staff every time and condiments that are fresh.Great for a quickie lunch that's delicious. :)

13.description: How can you go wrong with a sandwich that you select the base product and then the toppings? Their soups and salads are equally good and their pricing is moderate, even in downtown Chicago. I try to arrive prior to 11:45a, just to beat the lunch rush because after that time the line can become very formative. If I miss this time frame I work through lunch and plan to go around 1:30p. One more tidbit; their cookies are too die for!

11.description: I love cozy sandwich shops. I love Printer's Row. I love Nantucket Nectars. I'm a history buff who likes old print material, and I usually take the train into the city. This Potbelly location is like a vortex of stuff that makes me happy. I can get off at the LaSalle blue line, walk over here, grab a meal, and continue on foot to another destination. The staff is friendly, they have live music on occasion, and yes, this location is one that has breakfast! Not all Potbelly stores serve it or are even open that early. This probably explains why this one always has plenty of OJ in the beverage case.One thing I would like to see different here: cleaner tables. The staff are not as on top of wiping down after customers leave as they should be. On two occasions I have set my book down in a puddle of soup that I didn't see because its color matched the table. Still, it's no worse than at some of the other nearby Potbelly locations, which also tend to be busier and therefore messier. (I'm looking at you, State and Lake Potbelly, with your mayo-coated napkin dispensers and Art Institute Potbelly, with your lettuce explosion chairs.) It's also not as bad as Subway, where I sometimes suspect the tables get cleaned twice a day--once at opening, and again at closing.Bottom line: this is an improvement over many other fast food options in the area. It beats most competitors, too. Get your sandwich here and tell Wabash Subway to eat your dust.

39.description: I love sandwiches. Actually, most of my reviews on here are probably for sandwich places. Anyway, Potbelly has great subs, and they're really cheap. I like the chicken salad with lots of mustard. Yummm. And with a can of Mr. Pibb, the total's only about $5.78 (approximately. ha.). Yeah, I'm a regular here.As for the atmosphere, well, it's Potbelly. They all look pretty much the same. It's good though. And I like when there are people singing up on the little stage thingy. It makes me happy.

37.description: This place is my usual hot spot for lunch.  The staff is great because they are pretty good at remembering my usual Italian salad. ohhh delicious!  But every now and again I'll get A Wreck sandwich made skinny.  This place loses a star because the cashier always rings up a regular Wreck sandwich instead of the skinny Wreck sandwich.  So basically, I am paying more for less bread and less meat. Its already happened to me twice. No more!  But overall, a great place to stop in for lunch. Especially since its right around the corner from me.

0.description: My boyfriend and I were visiting from SF and he insisted on eating there. I was skeptical in the beginning but it's probably the best sandwich I had tried. Compared to subway their bread is heaven. Tip: you can combine their famous a wreck and meatball, it's called the wrecking ball.

38.description: I like Potbelly because it doesn't lie about what it serves and it's super cheap. Out of all the fast-food style sandwich joints I recommend this one for freshness, service, and mustard selection!

27.description: Excellent sandwiches, if you like it hot there hot pepper are awesome.  The service is fast and friendly.

32.description: My husband and I visited Chicago just last week and I must say I wish I had one back at home. I purchase the sandwich "A Wreck' with the works. Including their prized pickled peppers and olives. Much in the style of Quizno's where the heat the sandwich on a conveyor belt, but the bread and meats are way better. Very good price. Makes eating out affordable without having to subject yourself to McDonalds or Taco Bell (which I refuse to eat at for numerous reasons).

44.description: They make the best sandwiches in the world! Even if it's just a "simple" turkey breast sandwich filled with all the good stuff, there is something about it that makes me go back all the time!

24.description: I love Potbelly's! While at the Lit-Fest on Printer's Row, I opted to visit this place to get a light sandwich. While I would have preferred a wrap, those are a bit hard to find in Chicago. But the skinny tuna sandwich I got was out of this world! In fact, it was the best tuna salad sandwich that I have ever eaten! The bread was lightly toasted and the tuna and fixin's were just divine. You really can't beat their prices, the atmosphere is great, the restaurant design is really cool and the staff is great! Yeah!!

7.description: The Italian sandwich was delicious. It had a lot of flavor. I had it with tomatoes, lettuce, onions, mayo, hot peppers & Italian seasonings. I was going to get the chicken salad b/c people post that picture, but I'm glad I went for Italian instead.. I would get it again & it was so convenient b/c there's literally a location almost every corner of Chi-town lol

40.description: It was 2pm ish and I hadn't eaten all day. It was right next door so I thought I'd check it out.Way cool. for under $7 I got a can of diet coke and on a wheat roll a ham & swiss plus bacon + mushrooms (an extra fiddy cent each) then topped with mustard, hot peppers, diced onions and tomatoes. Simple but awesome. The sandwich artists were very polite, the second one was even like "oh damn dude, that smells good even" and the cashier even after I paid offered and extra bag to hold the sammie and can of coke (I had a backpack on and was gonna hop a cab).A nice solid place for quick and very delicious sammies. I'm a fan :-)

30.description: I will keep this review as simple as I can.  I know I can get kinda wordy with these things.  This is the first time I've ever been in a low-pro sandwich joint and after I was done I went up to the cashier and said, "Wow, that was a delicious sandwich!"To bad they aren't out in Southern, CA.

1.description: Came here for lunch with my husband who raves about this place. Unfortunately, I was not hungry enough for a sandwich so I opted for chili and a cookie instead. The chili was awesome. It was chunky just the way I like it and served at a perfect temperature. Also, I was given a good amount of crackers to put in the chili. The cookie was great as well. It was oatmeal chocolate chip (which is my favorite but is so hard to find!) and it was so good! It was perfectly baked so that it was soft. Only wish they had coffee to eat with the cookie! This is a great place to grab lunch or just a small snack.

9.description: I had a great experience at this Potbelly Shop. After walking around for what seemed like 45 minutes I stumbled upon Potbelly. I had heard good things from friends and it lived up to expectations. They have a conveyer line style of assembly with a toasting oven in the middle. You order your meat and bread, toast it up and then choose your toppings. I went with the roast beef with everything. It was just warm enough to give that extra feel of indulgence. The ingredients all seemed fresh and tasted great.I think the number one thing about the location was the staff. Everyone who was working there was extremely friendly. I was in town for a test and was feeling a bit stressed out, so the little things really made a difference to me. I remember the cashier made an ever so slight little extra effort that really made me feel good. I definitely think fondly of this sandwich shop.

26.description: Everyone that eats at Potbelly's from out of town says.. "I'm going to steal this idea and open a place like this." ... I hate to break it to you but it's an improved and cheaper version of Quiznos.. Those aren't working out too well.Do it right and get yourself "The Wreck" with everything on it.  It's delicious.  They also have really good soups and cookies. At this location the staff is always cool and it's not as busy as other locations (think state and lake).Cheaper than Pockets and SRO in the neighborhood and defiantly better than subway. Living in NYC I miss grabbing the occasional sandwich from here!

25.description: I'm a fan. I've been here only once to check it out because I was told this was the go to sandwich place. It reminds me of Quiznos. Good selections and good sandwiches. Reasonable prices.

12.description: Stopped in for lunch on a blazingly hot day.  I normally gravitate toward the excellent toasted grinder sandwiches whenever I visit one of the Potbelly Sandwich Shops (it's a mini chain, started in the late 1970's on Lincoln near Belden in Chicago's Lincoln Park neighborhood).  But it was so blasted hot outside (103 in the shade) all I wanted was a cool salad, a bottle of cold Nantucket Nectars lemonade and a chance to soak up as much air conditioning as I could.  I opted for the excellent "farmhouse" salad, a variation on a chef's salad, with lettuce, chicken, bacon, crumbled hard cooked egg, tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion and crumbled bleu cheese for extra tanginess.  I chose the "Potbelly vinaigrette"--couldn't tell you exactly how this differs from standard vinaigrette, but it was good.The line at the counter was long, as it is at any Potbelly's at lunchtime, but it moved quickly.  The salad was assembled in front of me, and not premade, a nice touch.  There were enough booths and tables to accomodate the crowd.  I didn't see the usual Potbelly second floor seating or an area for live musicians, so this outpost may be slightly smaller than the Lincoln Park or Evanston shops I frequent more often.

21.description: I love cozy sandwich shops. I love Printer's Row. I love Nantucket Nectars. I'm a history buff who likes old print material, and I usually take the train into the city. This Potbelly location is like a vortex of stuff that makes me happy. I can get off at the LaSalle blue line, walk over here, grab a meal, and continue on foot to another destination. The staff is friendly, they have live music on occasion, and yes, this location is one that has breakfast! Not all Potbelly stores serve it or are even open that early. This probably explains why this one always has plenty of OJ in the beverage case.One thing I would like to see different here: cleaner tables. The staff are not as on top of wiping down after customers leave as they should be. On two occasions I have set my book down in a puddle of soup that I didn't see because its color matched the table. Still, it's no worse than at some of the other nearby Potbelly locations, which also tend to be busier and therefore messier. (I'm looking at you, State and Lake Potbelly, with your mayo-coated napkin dispensers and Art Institute Potbelly, with your lettuce explosion chairs.) It's also not as bad as Subway, where I sometimes suspect the tables get cleaned twice a day--once at opening, and again at closing.Bottom line: this is an improvement over many other fast food options in the area. It beats most competitors, too. Get your sandwich here and tell Wabash Subway to eat your dust.

17.description: I'm a big fan of Potbelly's. That magic sandwich of melty goodness is enough to make my day!This location is quick with a lunch crowd, even the time I was stuck behind Mr. "I have a super specific order and you messed it up slightly so remake it." Sheesh, pack your own lunch dude. There are usually quite a few college kids in here, but in general the atmosphere is pretty quiet. Love that little bit of calmness on a lunch break :)

10.description: The sandwiches here are pretty awesome. The selection isn't amazing, but unless you are super picky you will find something you like. I hear the shakes are real good, sadly, everytime I go they are finished with shakes. Which is weird, but whatever.It is just a good and quick place to eat. Oh and definitely toast your sandwich. Thats what makes it good.

5.description: Very good flat bread breakfast sandwich. 1 block from the blue line for those traveling and who need a respite with a comfortable atmosphere and quick service.Service was friendly

3.description: I enjoyed this restaurant. I heard a lot of good things about this place. My co-workers and I had a great time here. For the price not a bad choice. They have a lot of locations in the area. I'm not from this area but I see why they have so many locations.

35.description: Sometimes you take people that you love for granted.  I realized that you can take food that you love for granted as well, when I thought about how some of my favorite fast food (as in "fast food" outside the realm of McDonald's and Co.) places were neglected in my reviews.  I thought I should begin with Potbelly, since they have my all time favorite vegetarian sandwich, and I should review the place on Printer's Row, since I worked there for a whole year and miraculously bear no ill will.Well, all I have to say is this:  I LOVE YOU, veggie sandwich on wheat (as in "wheat") with extra pickles and giardanera.  I just love you.

19.description: Great service at this Potbelly, which seems to be standard. The staff is very friendly and personable--always very happy to see us.

28.description: awesome sandwiches and shakes.

45.description: Designed in 1891 by the architecture firm Holabird and Roche, the Pontiac Building is the oldest standing building in Chicago by them. It has several protruding bays that are wider than on other buildings in the area. This Printers Row building now has a Potbelly on the main floor.

33.description: It's been a few years since I've eaten here, but Potbelly is a must whenever I'm in Chicago.Love the bread, huge fan of their brown mustard (best mustard ever!), everything is fresh and the amount of filling/toppings is just right!  Once I was fortunate enough to receive a complimentary container of their mustard to take home to Miami.  I actually asked if I could purchase their mustard and the girl on the counter just gave it to me as a gift.  I thought this was an awesome gesture!  I treasure that mustard for special sandwiches only.  Even if I don't come anywhere close to replicating a potbelly sandwich.If i happen to see a bright, shiny star, my wish is that Potbelly comes to South Florida.  In all honesty, this is the only "sub-type" sandwich I actually like (love).Sheila's Dream Bars are just what the name implies.Now I'm craving a turkey-swiss sandwich....and I won't be going near Chicago any time soon!!! Boo hoo!!!

43.description: Sometimes I dream about The Italian and a warm, fresh oatmeal cookie.  By sometimes I mean every time I'm not eating one.  Best sandwich place ever!

2.description: The wreck is a must when you come to potbellys. This shop has everything you are looking for sandwiches or salads they are all very tasty. Would recommend to anyone who is in the area.

18.description: Everyone that eats at Potbelly's from out of town says.. "I'm going to steal this idea and open a place like this." ... I hate to break it to you but it's an improved and cheaper version of Quiznos.. Those aren't working out too well.Do it right and get yourself "The Wreck" with everything on it.  It's delicious.  They also have really good soups and cookies. At this location the staff is always cool and it's not as busy as other locations (think state and lake).Cheaper than Pockets and SRO in the neighborhood and defiantly better than subway. Living in NYC I miss grabbing the occasional sandwich from here!

41.description: Oh, Potbelly's, how I miss thee! The most delicious fast food sandwich shop- without the feel of fast food. I usually watch my calories, but here it's all about the mayo, melted cheese (that's right, their veggie sub has 8 slices), and drizzled olive oil.  And it doesn't stop there- their fresh chocolate chip oatmeal cookies are perfect.I guess it's a good thing they're not here in NY- I'd probably have a HUGE ol' potbelly if I didn't have to resort to eating moldy Subway sandwiches for lunch!

4.description: The food is great and the line moves pretty fast. Now here goes the problem...last week me and a friend go in and he's telling me what I should get on my sandwhich, Ciara(I was told is her name) tells him to be quiet and just chimes in on our conversation. We get to the register & she says, "you not even gonna pay for her food!" I just thought that was totally unprofessional and she overstepped her boundaries. But it doesn't stop there! Smh...The other day I go in and Catrell whom is a sweetheart is fixing my sandwich and I ask Ciara(employee) hi, how are you" she says fine now that I'm not making your sandwhich". My response is "Excuse me?" She says " no, you just always ask if I have everything". I couldn't believe she said that! Well excuse me Ms.Ciara, I didn't know it was against the law to make sure my sandwhich was correct. She was totally rude, again. Even if it were a joke it wasn't funny and a very asinine comment.

6.description: I came in here for a late lunch on Saturday to fortify me for the rest of my errands. I had never been to this location of Potbelly on Printer's Row. The menu was standard- I went with the roast beef original on flatbread- but I felt that that service really put this location over the top. From the order taker, to the person crafting the sandwiches, to the cashier, everyone was across-the-board competent and pleasant. The restaurant itself is laid out nicely, with ample seating. I am sure this location will be a veritable mosh pit next weekend, when Printer's Row comes to town, so I am glad that I had the chance to scope it out and enjoy a bite of lunch before then. Potbelly is always a reliable option and I will make it a point to return here.

22.description: Fantastic sandwiches, great live music, and excellent service. This potbelly, like most others I frequent, has it all and always provides a great meal and experience.

15.description: ordered tuna salad sandwich last night. same good as all other sandwiches. there was only one staff yesterday, but she is quite efficient.

20.description: Pretty good. The staff and personnel were interactive and friendly and helpful. One guy gave me a free dessert since it was late at night! They were fast and tasty. As this was not exactly my kind of place (I prefer more unusual or organic food), I give it 3.5 stars.

36.description: I love potbellys as far as generic sandwich places goes.  It's better than Subway, Goodcents, and even Quiznos, but they're ok too.  Sometimes the sandwiches are definitely better on somedays than on others, but that's normal.  It gets five stars because one time I came here with a bag from H&M and since I have to bring new meaning to the word scatterbrained everyday, I left my bag there.  Three weeks later the girl making my sandwich asks if I was here with an H&M bag and I leave with everything I bought three weeks ago.  The service here is ridiculously nice.

14.description: best hangover food I found in Chicago that was close to my hotel. Seriously yummy and those pickles...yum!

58.description: Vibe: Swanky and classy. I can sense that they are going for a "sexy" vibe.Service: Our server was very attentive and gave us recommendations. What we ordered:Robata items: -Ribeye steak was tasty with a little bit of fat attached. Simple and good.-Cow Tongue was super tender. Heavy cumin taste and with a bit of spice. Loved it.-Chicken Satay: It looked like a mini chicken kefta. Moist, but nothing special.-Asparagus wrapped with bacon: The bacon was super fatty and delicious. Great char taste.Starters:- Cherry blossom: Presentation was gorgeous and very tasty although a bit small.- Sea bass: The fish is so moist and delicious. Set on a bed of shitake mushrooms which was amazing. Again, very small.Sushi:-Rainbow roll: Although well done, it's not any different from any other restaurants.-Mellow Yellow: I really liked the mango and safron. Very bright and refreshing roll.-Forgot the name of this one maki with escolar,jalepeno and cilantro but it was my favorite one. -Sweet potato maki: the sweet potato wasn't quite cooked all the way through. I would skip this one.Drinks:-Far East Old Fashioned: strong. no complains, but didn't see what was so far east about it.-Lychee Mimosas: The ladies that ordered it in our party loved it.-Rose bud tea: Very cute. Came in a tiny glass pot with a tiny glass cup. Not bad for $4.We also ordered the Spider roll, but they gave us soft shell crab appetizer instead......after we started eating it without thinking, the server recognized the mistake and asked if we wanted to just have the appetizer instead. At this point, we were already eating it so we said it's fine. Overall, the food was actually pretty good and service was great as well. The only complaint is the price. A lot of the rolls were about $15.

56.description: I have been here twice since opening, and the second visit showed they had shaken some of their opening week jitters.The first visit was met by some pleasant but sporadic service. And the militant was a little strange because some girl was being hovered over by the chefs and some well-dressed gentleman who appeared to be either management or ownership. This wouldn't have been so bad that we not been sitting next to her. However, the maki was very good and priced competitively compared to nearby sushi restaurants.The second trip was much, much better. The rolls were of the same, above- average quality. The service was smoother, but two of the three chefs seemed preoccupied with socializing with staff, and the third chef seemed to be covering the lion's share of the work. The salmon roe was way too fishy, so that was a bit disappointing.The Mexican role is not very spicy; the rock 'n roll was delicious; the Rogue beer is a must.

29.description: We were there off hours and had the place to ourselves. We had the sexy Mexican and the salmon delight- both were awesome!

42.description: Let me start by saying that the quality of the fish used at Niu B is excellent. Since that is by far the most important quality when it comes to sushi, my experience started out on the right foot. When I was seated, I was immediately served water with cucumber which was a wonderful surprise. If you've never had the pleasure of eating sushi and cleansing your palate with cucumber infused water, you're missing out! I started with the Miso Soup and it was very good. I ordered the Lychee Martini in hopes of trying something a little different. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was a very light and refreshing cocktail. Something I'd happily order again. For my meal I ordered the Maki Roll, Mellow Yellow Roll, and two pieces of Salmon Sashimi. Everything was wonderful! The Mellow Yellow Roll is so unique and beautiful. The presentation of both rolls was very impressive. I've noticed several complaints regarding the prices of the sushi. Sushi is quite similar to steak in that pricing dictates quality. So if you can't tell the difference between a $10 Applebees Steak and a $40 Ruth's Chris steak, by all means, go to Applebees. Yes, Niu B is a bit higher on the sushi price scale, but it was worth the price. My next trip to Chicago will lead me right back here to try out the other rolls that Niu B has to offer. If I could give this restaurant a 4.5, I would!

23.description: My wife and I went here Wednesday night after the gym right down the street!. We both have been here numerous times. I myself used to visit Oysie (sp) before they left!.Last night left a wonderful taste in my mouth and stomach.  From the drink the PLT 6 which was FANTASTIC!!!.... to the Gyoza to the Lyechee Tea Smoked Duck Breast to the rolls we each had. I was compelled to write a review. The server was also very patient and attentive. PLEASE-PLEASE-PLEASE continue to keep up the great work. Hopefully they will stick around a lot longer than its predecessor.....The ONLY reason I did not give a 5 is because I have not tried a majority of the menu yet!. :-)

47.description: They could provide more variety and choices in the menu but the food they do have tastes lovely. Service and atmosphere is definitely nice and relaxing whether you're going there to eat alone or with a group of people. I also like it because the prices are very decent and reasonable for the food and service they provide. I love the food and definitely one of my favourite places for lunch or dinner!

8.description: Niu B has creative rolls and very fast service. I visited during lunch time and was in and out in half an hour. My server was pleasant but what they lacked in warmth they certainly made up for in efficiency. The lunch menu reasonably priced and the rolls are good value for money.

31.description: Now I know why it's called newbie. This was probably the worst sushi I've had EVER. Trust me, don't waste your money and stomach space for it.

34.description: ive eaten here before but I don't remember it being this good! the lychee martini is fabulous! the calamari is not ur usual calamari & has a distinct taste that's deeelish! the other maki rolls we ordered were phenomenal as well. there wasn't anything we ordered that we didn't love. it was just a bit pricey but since iits downtown I guess I expected it. great service witht he wonderful food that u cant go wrong here! plus they gave me a discount card I can use next time I come so I can get 10% off! yaaaaaaay!! will be back!!

16.description: Holy Smokes! Their wasabi is the real deal! The miso soup was delicious and I loved their salmon roll. The cold water is served in a thin clean glass with a thin fresh cucumber slice. I was far too ambitious with the wasabi and almost broke down into tears! The ambiance is wonderful - wood, fire candles, dim lighting, and calm music. I would love to come back!

13.description: Really good service, v. nice atmosphere, cute presentation, extremely uneven food.  East asian fusion place in the old Oysy location.  Went Monday night around 7 and were seated immediately.My partner commented that the owner must be a front-of-the-house kind of manager; that part was extremely attended to, even curated.  Some presentations are so elaborate as to verge on precious, for example, the Wild Mushroom Hot & Sour Soup was served in a blue-and-white porcelain tureen that included a candle warmer (I blew it out - the soup was too hot to eat as it was).  Also, really cute ceramic soy sauce cruet rather than plastic-topped bottles on the table, and lovely glass tea set.  Service was lovely:  gracious and attentive without being overbearing or cloying.  The food needs more attention:  miso soup was bland, as were the maki/rolls.  The seaweed salad came served atop lettuce salad, which was quirky, though not unpleasant.  I might go back; the cost wasn't too high and the setting very nice, though we left somewhat unsatisfied with our meal.  Would like to try the Wild Mushroom Ramen, since the mushroom soup was the best thing we got.

11.description: I love sashimi but my tuna and salmon were frozen.  The eel was good, but was severely disappointed with the frozen sashimi.  Also tried the spicy miso ramen and that was better than expected.  Service was good, but go somewhere else for good Japanese food.

39.description: My boyfriend and I found ourselves hungry on Christmas Eve. We came into niu b at 9:45 pm. Service was excellent. Tak was very knowledgable about the menu. He made great suggestions which were all really good. Loved the cherry blossom app he suggested. We chose the flamer, rock n roll, ultimate spider, and the summer roll. We definitely had plenty to take home. My boyfriend was beyond pleased. We will definitely be back. Thank you Min and Tak!

37.description: Freshest sushi I have ever had. Great service, very friendly and welcoming waiters. Food is hot and fresh and does not take long to bring out. Their mojito drinks are so refreshing as well. Great sushi place overall.

0.description: We stopped here for lunch while visiting a friend in the city. We were a little apprehensive as it was pretty close to empty at lunch time on a Friday. We were pleasantly surprised by our entire experience.We were a party of 5, three adults and two kids... we ordered off the lunch menu. The adults each ordered 2 rolls and the kids each ordered one roll. Everything was amazingly delicious. The kids each ordered the California Maki Roll and they pretty much housed their rolls in record time. Thinking about it now, I probably should have ordered three rolls for them to share. The adults ordered a variety of rolls off the lunch menu. I know I had the Rock n Roll and the Mellow Yellow Roll. They were so yummy, I am wondering if I convince my family to go back there today. I cannot remember all the rolls the other two adults ordered but I know one of them ordered the Sexy Mexican and the other adult ordered the Crunchy Maki. Everything was delicious.Not only was our food incredibly tasty, it was fairly inexpensive. 5 people, sushi and drinks (nonalcoholic) for around 40 bucks.I am sure we will eat here again the next time we visit the city... actually, I am thinking we may have to take a special trip to the city just to dine here again.

38.description: I should have written a review 2 weeks ago, because I really liked them!  We went there for dinner on the 18th, and then ordered it to go two more times before Christmas.  When we got back in town this past week, we ordered it again and they had apparently changed their entire menu- so they said.  It's possible they just made the wrong thing, but whatever happened, it was not good.While we enjoyed our dinning in experience, the restaurant was ridiculously cold, and my mom had to ask a few times for her silverware (she can't use chopsticks lol).

51.description: I have to say..compared to some other places nearby they are pretty decent.The must try roll is the Flamer roll! its yummy..lots of unique sauces and baked.Plus unlike horrible places like Tamarind- they dont charge you just for extra sauce!  I recommend this place for decent sushi in the Loop area.Avoid most the hot plates except the ribeye robata was good too...stick to Sushi and you will be happy.

27.description: The service was good, fast and attentive. The food was good but what made the visit better - having the cherry blossom cold appetizer.  That was the most delicious thing. You'll have to eat it quick so the plum sauce doesn't get soaked up into it. We have 3 young kids under 5 and they were all able to eat everything - edamame, sesame chicken (with veggies and brown rice), Tokyo ramen and the cherry blossom. Definitely worth the visit.

32.description: One of the best sushi I ever tried.  Fresh fish and a great presentation. Something simple like a hot tea they serve you in a clear teapot with a cute cup.  Something like a hot and sour soup would be in a nice ceramic bowl you may see in Asian History Museum.   Oh and did I mention an amazing service!

54.description: So I was a very regular customer at Niu (the parent restaurant on East Illinois by AMC) and I loved their food and drinks. So it was disappointing to see that they never brought along their signature dishes like Japanese Fried Rice, Red curry or their signature drinks - Sake Mojito, Green Tea Zen Mojito. Ah well, I quelled my disappointment and sat down to dinner with a friend who was a regular customer at the original Niu. The waiter came in literally 30 sec after we sat to see if we wanted appetizers. Clearly he was new to this - he did that a few times (coming too soon to take the order) and even gave us our check without asking if we wanted dessert. Ah well - such things happen in a new place with someone who didn't seem like he had been a waiter before. I am sure he will get better and friendlier with time. However to give him credit - when we had initially asked for some chili sauce on the side, he said he didn't have any (only the sweet chili version) but later on he did find chili sauce and bring it to us. Definitely nice of him to do that. The food was quite good - I ordered the soft shell crab appetizer that came with oranges, edamame and avocado. The sushis I ordered - the Flamer was great but the other one with the Alaskan crab was ok. I had about 4 pieces each left on my orders which I asked them to pack for me to take with me. (I came home to discover that two of the Flamer pieces were missing which seems really odd - not sure what happened there but I don't want to speculate). I looked at the fairly large check (~$120 for 2 people - this included 4 drinks) and they had charged us $1.00 for some chili/ spicy sauce we ordered on the side - are you kidding me? For 1-2 tablespoons? The woman who seemed to be the manager had the nerve to tell me that they did the same at the other Niu when I said I was a regular there. I have eaten at Niu for 4 years and I have never had to pay for a side of sauce. I miss "Chai" from the original Niu - he was so nice. She did then take it off the check but that definitely added to the less than superb experience we were having there. Overall it seemed more expensive compared to Niu especially for the rolls ($!5). I doubt I would go back anytime soon despite it being so close to home for me. I still miss the signature dishes from Niu and maybe its just the hiccups that come with a new place but unless they added those dishes on the menu, I might just go to the original Niu even if it is farther away. There are a lot of nice and less expensive sushi places in and around that I might frequent instead.

48.description: to my previous p.s. they actually seem to be shaking things up!  We're pleasantly surprised, keep up the good fight!  They have added Ramen and a noodle section to the menu, smart.  Service is improved and the scene, whether manufactured or not, is a little better.  As mentioned earlier, we live VERY close by so the convenience factor is huge, if they can get it together -- it's looking good for a cold winter and some HOT ramen.  bravop.s. next suggestion, how about a better name?  maybe too late for that?  Niu Asian Fusion (south loop) -- just call it what it is and don't sound like a "newbie" LOL

44.description: Great food, ambience is adequate. Nice staff. Three stars because it took forever for my friends to get their meals. The waiter tried to explain this stating that there were only two chefs in the back making rolls. We got to the restaurant at 530 and some friends had not received their meals by 730. Unacceptable.

24.description: Food was ok but service was excellent. Sobrino was really attentive, friendly and took very good care of us. We will come back

7.description: The cherry blossom to start was delish! So much avocado and being from California, I love that!The rolls were a good size and tasty. We had the mellow yellow and salmon delight. Good sushi. The spider man roll was not our favorite. Not much taste going on there.Server was very nice and the ambiance and decor was pretty cool.

49.description: Fantastic food!  Highly recommended (menu has something for everyone...sushi lovers and those who don't eat raw fish.)

40.description: Such a meh place. after the symphony, and gladly found this place is still open after 10. Decided to grab a bowl of ramen and then got really disappointed. The ramen was meh. The broth was meh. I'm sure it's not tonkatsu. And the meat was overlooked. The vegis were not fresh. Also got the orange juice.  It tasted so weird, like with alcohol in it. (Though they insisted no) The service was pretty bad as well. A lot of people were friends of the waiters. But it's pretty late, so I can understand. But overall, THE FOOD, IS, JUST, SO, BAD.

53.description: Basic sushi is great. The best hamachi I've had. Experimental dishes are also quite good. Spicy hand roll doesn't have big chunks of tuna, but the taste is excellent. Soft shell crab app is large and tastes great. Purple haze hot sake=plum goodness.

30.description: I loved the service here. This is my first time here since I'm visiting from New York.The sushi was really good. We got the Ume and California roll and the rice was really soft. The sushi itself was fresh as well. We also got the seaweed salad and it was really good. I didn't expect that there was going to be green salad on the salad lol.. because every time I eat seaweed salad, it doesn't come with cucumbers or tomato.Overall the salad was really good.My cousins shared the tonkatsu Ramen and they said the Ramen was good.I myself, got the spicy miso Ramen and it was really delicious.It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. The Ramen was really good and everything else tasted delicious.They also give u a candle on the table so It made the restaurant feel really fancy. I would come here again. When I revisit Chicago.

46.description: While walking back from the museums, we stumbled upon this place since we were in the mood for sushi. Overall decor and mood is nice but we were sat at a 2 top table squeezed between two other 2 top tables so it felt a bit claustrophobic. I wish we would've had some more room and privacy from the other tables but it was not terrible. The prices were more than average but it tasted pretty good. We ordered 4 rolls and an app, all delicious. Jade, our server, was super nice and made our experience very enjoyable.

1.description: My boyfriend and I dropped in here only to get out of the snow storm.It looked like a mediocre spot, so we weren't expecting authenticity or quality, just a warm place to warm up and grab something quick to eat.We were having a great time with each other and the food was as expected, generic, but at least warm and filling.  The young waitress was very sweet and did an excellent job bringing out the food quickly.It wasn't until towards the end that weird shit went down.  We paid our bill, but the waitress came back to our table and demanded 20% tip. Mind you, we weren't a large group, there was only 2 of us.  If there were 6 or more people in our group, then 20% gratuity is reasonable, but there definitely were not 6 of us.The waitress was distressed and her English wasn't very good, so she had the host, a young man come over to demand 20% tip.  I was really shocked by their rude outrageous demand. I'm American, but I look super Asian, so I'm always mistaken as a foreigner. Meanwhile, my boyfriend is foreign and has a heavy accent, so the staff at this place thought they could bully us "foreign tourists" into tipping more than necessary.In the host's own words,  "This is America, it's a tradition to tip 20%.  Our waitress doesn't get a wage, she PAYS us for her job, and she only makes money from tips."  I couldn't believe what I was hearing, it's really amazing that this guy told me all of this!  First of all, it's illegal not to be paying at least minimum wage to hired staff in America. This sounds a lot like a slave trade going on at this restaurant. I do not support slave trade in America or anywhere in the world and I suggest everyone else stop going here because you're supporting the slave trade.

55.description: It's my second time since they have been open. They did indeed fixed and changed few things. Which made a difference for me. They added Beef tataki!!!! Which is amazing,  super tender and jucy! Great option for a starter can also be tuna tataki as well as himachi tartar! I litterally fell in love with the Flower roll, just super fresh amazing fish!!! And Hawaiian sunset is a great choice as well! Service is ok, but over all it a great place in the neighborhood!

9.description: Fantastic.  All around great sushi bar.  Great food, great atmosphere.  I sat at the bar and had a nice quiet dinner, great staff and just incredible food.  I had the bagel roll, lemon pepper sashimi, kani, spring rolls and was made a special dish by the chef: fried white fish with hot mayo.  And it was all incredible and the staff as very attentive.  I will absolutely be going back whenever I am in Chicago and will be recommending this to anyone I can!  If you love sushi and want a relaxing calm atmosphere this is your place.

26.description: This place is on Michigan Ave, so it is to be expected that it will be priced slightly above what similar sushi would cost other places in the city. The service is usually fine, occasionally a bit on the slow side. One evening we ordered a cocktail when we first sat down, and it didn't come to our table until after our main course was brought. Otherwise, I have no complaints, it's good sushi that is in a convenient location for me in the south loop. I would take Southcoast Sushi over this place anyday, but they are a bit farther away from me.

25.description: I ordered the dragon roll; the rolls had non-uniform size but most were decently large and all were filled properly.  If you're looking for dessert, I recommend the lychee sorbet, which had good texture and tasted very good.  The sorbet also contained jello bits and mango puree, which added a nice touch.

12.description: I loved the service here. This is my first time here since I'm visiting from New York.The sushi was really good. We got the Ume and California roll and the rice was really soft. The sushi itself was fresh as well. We also got the seaweed salad and it was really good. I didn't expect that there was going to be green salad on the salad lol.. because every time I eat seaweed salad, it doesn't come with cucumbers or tomato.Overall the salad was really good.My cousins shared the tonkatsu Ramen and they said the Ramen was good.I myself, got the spicy miso Ramen and it was really delicious.It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. The Ramen was really good and everything else tasted delicious.They also give u a candle on the table so It made the restaurant feel really fancy. I would come here again. When I revisit Chicago.

59.description: How I know about this new place is because my friend recommended me to try this place and I did... Very good experience. I love the decor and it's very comfortable. The server was friendly. I had the cherry blossom and Dan dan noodles.... Yum Yum !!!!!! The lamp chop is to die for.. I will bring my boyfriend to try it one day.

21.description: We keep coming back and will keep coming back because the food is great and the service is amazing!

17.description: Really great meal, unexpectedly good. My daughter and I ate here as a carb loading meal before the Chicago marathon. We started out with the mellow yellow roll which was very fresh and a large portion for $14. It had mango on top but was not too sweet which I appreciated. Chicken gyozas were pretty standard but still good.My daughter had the chicken fried rice for $12.  It was a huge portion and freshly prepared without too much sauce which was nice.I had the spicy soy ramen for $13.  It was very good. Not the best ramen I've eaten but very solid. The pork was flavorful, the broth was good but I would have preferred more of it and the noodles were just fine.Prices were very acceptable for the generous portions. Would definitely recommend.

10.description: Oh thank you for the lovely pot of green tea.And a pretty good chirashi as well.  Very fresh fish over good rice. Would have just liked a little more rice and could have been a bit more moist. Dining partners had a nice selection of rolls they all looked really good.  And started with a hearty miso soup, again very good but would have liked a bit more.And then the tea - a lovely little pot with fresh leaves; not a teabag in site.  Well done!A quiet and rainy Tuesday night so no crowd at all. Very friendly service, quick and courteous.  All in all pretty good sushi on Michigan and away from the the usual places

5.description: Good sushi! I ordered the Shrimp Tempura which came with 10 large pieces for $9. Not bad at all. The service was VERY speedy and polite. Love the atmosphere in there-very modern! Definitely recommend for a fun night out.

3.description: Excellent service and food. Parking readily available. Excellent prices. Fresh food.. You must visit it is awesome. This is my favorite sushi place

35.description: I ordered a variety of foods. Starting with appetizers: I ordered the miso soup which was way too salty for my liking. The Ocean salad is my favorite at NIU on Illinois but the B location really cut back on the size portion. The stuffed clams came with only 4 shells but very tasteful. The raw scallops were sliced thin and had roe on top, delicious. Moving on to entrees: I loved their sashimi because they were generously cut just like NIU on Illinois. I just wished they had other varieties instead of the common ones like salmon, tuna, and yellowtail. My kids' favorite at NIU is the sea bass appetizer but NIU B has a sea bass dinner so I tried it. The dish was made with a different flavor. The sea bass was moist and delicious, breaks apart in your mouth. A variety of maki rolls were ordered and we're all pretty good. However, I didn't like how one dish had aluminum foil under the maki when plated?? Was that a mistake? If it wasn't, the presentation for that 1 dish was sloppy looking. The next time I go I will have to try the cherry blossom which I totally forgot about.

19.description: I went to Niu B when I visited my brothers in Chicago. Two weeks ago, I called four separate times to try and get gift cards sent to each brother. The receptionist told me that he'd call me back each time because he was too busy at the moment. Each time I called, he said he had forgotten and was still too busy. I have never heard back.. Seems like terrible customer service. I'm trying to give them my money!

28.description: The food was ok, but the service was abysmal. We ordered water, and we were brought vodka tonics. Not safe if you're in recovery. Got charged for items ordered and not delivered. Avoid this one.

45.description: I ordered the ramen and couple nigiri. Everything is so - so. The highlight is cherry blossom

33.description: Holy Smokes! Their wasabi is the real deal! The miso soup was delicious and I loved their salmon roll. The cold water is served in a thin clean glass with a thin fresh cucumber slice. I was far too ambitious with the wasabi and almost broke down into tears! The ambiance is wonderful - wood, fire candles, dim lighting, and calm music. I would love to come back!

43.description: Quite new and a good addition to the area. The interior is beautiful, the location perfect for area residents and hotel dwellers, and the staff is friendly. The sushi is very fresh - the cherry blossom is exceptional - even my non-sushi-loving husband enjoyed it. The noodle options have improved and the robata menu is quite good (meats and seafood on a stick are always a good choice). The location does make it a bit more attractive, but I'll keep coming back. I hope they stick around for a while.

2.description: I had a 20% off coupon and it's across the street from the crib.....so I went in.I don't know what it is about the City of Chicago and WARM sushi. But it makes me wanna gag. The staff are REALLY nice. But.... "Ewww" on the rolls. Except the Salmon Delight is yummy. Mostly because of the slice of lemon on the salmon. I've never had that before. Maybe (But that's the keyword: MAYBE) I'll give them another try, after they allowed me to keep the coupon for another dining experience.

18.description: Decided to stop by for dinner and the food was amazing the ambient was great and our waiter Sobrino I believe his name was, was so friendly and very tentative to us. Great place!!

41.description: The prettiest food presentation in the Chicagoland mid-priced Asian Fusion world.  Competitively priced and portion.  A notch up to the common menu.  Decent taste.For 2:  share a Ramen + 1 maki will suffice.WINE LIST -- decent selection that is below $10 per glass.CHERRY BLOSSOM ($12) -- one big half a scoop of spicy tuna.  Impressive avocado wrapping.SPICY MISO RAMEN ($12) -- 2 big rounds of perfectly grilled pork, 1 half egg, bamboo shoots, 2 slices of rice cakes, and my favorite wood ear.  Medium spice.  The artistically pleasing bowl is inconveniently functional.THE FLAMER ($15) -- skip it.  The baked shrimp tempura batter is hard.  Nice and colorful.SALTED CARAMEL CAKE ($8) -- the perfect ending to a meal.  Light, fluff and crunch.  Unique.  Presentation looks like a painting with red flying birds.  Impressive.SERVICE -- Tak is informative, smart with good recommendations.  If you are curious and bored, seek out Tak's knowledge of Chinese culture and history.  He also knows the level of dryness between wines.  An impressive man.VENUE -- The window area can be cold.  Clean and organized.  Warm -- modern decor with wood accents and slats.  Table placement is tight.

52.description: This restaurant opened in the South Loop two months ago and it is fantastic!  It is beautifully decorated and the food is awesome.  The staff is very welcoming and knowledgable about the menu items.  I will return often and highly recommend this restaurant which is in a great location with great views.  Come to the South Loop for an amazing dining experience!

50.description: Fairly new restaurant in the area. I've tried it a few times now and have had a bit of all the different items on the menu.. Their sushi and fish are good. My favorite rolls are Mellow Yellow (ginger and mango combined with salmon really gets me lol) and Ocean Maki (love rolls wrapped in cucumber). Tuna tataki app is delicious! The Korean kalbi beef is not as good as it could be.The tempura udon is good and you really get your money's worth as it is a pretty big portion. The Shoyu ramen is pretty good too, although not sure if it beats out some of its other Chicagoland ramen competitors.Depends what you order really! I'll always come back because their location is convenient and the sushi is fresh!

4.description: Good sushi place with fire cracker special roll being my favorite. Fast friendly service.

6.description: Excellent!  I've both eaten here (on the patio) and received delivery several times.  I haven't tried anything super complicated, but their rolls and service are good, and the delivery came much sooner than I was told on the phone.  Certainly recommend.

22.description: It was our first time here and surprisingly, food was awesome and priced right. We were afraid that it will be overpriced due to its location. Wifey's tonkatsu ramen soup was very tasty and pork belly melting in your mouth. I have the pleasure of having the Dragon maki and was very good with side of spicy mayo. Host was very polite and our waitress was always asking us if we need anything. Definitely a place to check out if you are close by.

15.description: Let me start by saying that the quality of the fish used at Niu B is excellent. Since that is by far the most important quality when it comes to sushi, my experience started out on the right foot. When I was seated, I was immediately served water with cucumber which was a wonderful surprise. If you've never had the pleasure of eating sushi and cleansing your palate with cucumber infused water, you're missing out! I started with the Miso Soup and it was very good. I ordered the Lychee Martini in hopes of trying something a little different. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was a very light and refreshing cocktail. Something I'd happily order again. For my meal I ordered the Maki Roll, Mellow Yellow Roll, and two pieces of Salmon Sashimi. Everything was wonderful! The Mellow Yellow Roll is so unique and beautiful. The presentation of both rolls was very impressive. I've noticed several complaints regarding the prices of the sushi. Sushi is quite similar to steak in that pricing dictates quality. So if you can't tell the difference between a $10 Applebees Steak and a $40 Ruth's Chris steak, by all means, go to Applebees. Yes, Niu B is a bit higher on the sushi price scale, but it was worth the price. My next trip to Chicago will lead me right back here to try out the other rolls that Niu B has to offer. If I could give this restaurant a 4.5, I would!

57.description: Crappy sushi. So disappointing. This place is right on. Michigan Ave and must cater to tourists who won't return

20.description: This place is conveniently close and has mixed service of friendly and polite. The sushi is a bit pricier than average I would say but not expensive compared to others. I tried the cherry blossom which was this adorable ball of spicy tuna topped with slices of avocado. It was quite delicious but not superb and of course, small. My friend ordered ramen, which she enjoyed, she tried a pork one the first time. The second time she ate a mushroom one. I tried the green tea creme brulee which had a good texture, but lacked the strong green tea flavor I love. I still liked it. However, it is creme brulee, so it tasted like that. Overall this place is decent. Its pricey for a college student, so its not a rave rave.

36.description: My friends and I have now been here twice for dinner. Have nothing but positive things to say about Niu B! Service has been friendly and prompt. Sushi has been priced well and tasted great! Fresh, well rolled and great flavors. Have tried standard maki rolls as well as specialty and enjoyed them all. Quality and quantity were very good too!
