14.description: The prettiest food presentation in the Chicagoland mid-priced Asian Fusion world.  Competitively priced and portion.  A notch up to the common menu.  Decent taste.For 2:  share a Ramen + 1 maki will suffice.WINE LIST -- decent selection that is below $10 per glass.CHERRY BLOSSOM ($12) -- one big half a scoop of spicy tuna.  Impressive avocado wrapping.SPICY MISO RAMEN ($12) -- 2 big rounds of perfectly grilled pork, 1 half egg, bamboo shoots, 2 slices of rice cakes, and my favorite wood ear.  Medium spice.  The artistically pleasing bowl is inconveniently functional.THE FLAMER ($15) -- skip it.  The baked shrimp tempura batter is hard.  Nice and colorful.SALTED CARAMEL CAKE ($8) -- the perfect ending to a meal.  Light, fluff and crunch.  Unique.  Presentation looks like a painting with red flying birds.  Impressive.SERVICE -- Tak is informative, smart with good recommendations.  If you are curious and bored, seek out Tak's knowledge of Chinese culture and history.  He also knows the level of dryness between wines.  An impressive man.VENUE -- The window area can be cold.  Clean and organized.  Warm -- modern decor with wood accents and slats.  Table placement is tight.

58.description: OK, it isn't really anything that great, but I find myself coming here often enough that I need to give it at least three stars.  Everything is good and it is much better than a lot of similar spots, the quick sandwich/diner type place.  Everything I've had is good, well prepared, and fresh.  The sweet potato fries have a good flavor to them, their turkey chili is quite good, and for sandwiches you can't really go wrong with any of their chicken sandwiches or the turkey burger.  Yeah, it isn't high end food, it isn't anything all that interesting either, but for a quick bite it is a great choice.I will say though, for what it is it does seem to be a tad on the expensive side, only by about 10% or so though.

56.description: Been getting them for years.  Everything great especially SRO Burger, SRO Chicken, and the gyro.  Their delivery is a little expensive, but so are a lot of places downtown.

29.description: Basic lunch spot. Has great gyros and turkey burger though and everyone that works at SRO is very friendly. In the summer I enjoy sitting on their patio and grabbing a quick bite. Price is reasonable for downtown and if you're looking for lunch (or a lunchy dinner) in printers row SRO is a great choice

42.description: We placed a order online for delivery to our office. delivery was fast.The food was great. A lot of people got the cajun chicken sandwich which i would get again. The sandwich bread is so soft you just gobble it up so fast.The size of the sandwich was tad small but tasty.We would certainly order here again

23.description: I have been going to SRO for years.  I have used them for catering events and they couldn't be nicer and professional.  My favorite is the veggie burger and sweet potato fries.  I also enjoy the falafel and hummus plate.  Yes it would be great if they were open on Sunday, but I try to get there as often as I can.  Thanks Dino and Tom for the great neighborhood atmosphere.

47.description: Meh, nothing special. I had the Italian beef which was just deli sliced roast beef on a bun. I think I will take a pass next time.

8.description: I had no idea, after all these years. This review is solely for your bean burger, which is the best I've ever had.  Period.

31.description: Went here during my Lunch Break from work and I was STARVING!! I saw the special of the day was the Cod Sandwich. I asked the young lady working the register how she liked it, she stated she herself was not very keen on seafood, but that it was quite popular among the customers, and they only have it on Friday's, so I thought to myself, "why not?" After getting the sandwich, I thought to myself "Why did I do this?" I couldn't even finish the sandwich, it was so soaked in what was supposed to have been Tartar Sauce, yet the blandest thing I think I've ever had. This "tartar sauce" was so water and flavorless, the cod also had no flavor and the sandwich, which was to be a Battered Cod was so soggy. My French Fries were fried very hard and also, no flavor, even the extra $1 I spent on the side of Cheese Sauce couldn't save them. It was a waste of a very hard earned $8.48.  I left feeling very dissatisfied and disappointed.  don't think I'll ever grace the doors of Standing Room Only again.

34.description: Great food.  Love their chicken salads and mozzarella sticks.  They have the best French fries!

16.description: I've been to SRO a few times now and have found it to be decent. Nothing horrible but definitely not the best food I've eaten either.The first visit I had a hog dog and fries. The second time I tried the burger... I wasn't blown away either time. I thought the food was a little too greasy and slightly overpriced for what they are offering. I guess the prices are typical for the location though.Sadly, the atmosphere appears to be better than the food. I don't think I'll be returning to SRO anytime soon.

13.description: Standing Room Only is a good option if you're looking for a quick bite to eat or burger takeout. It's more than one step up from fast food, in my opinion-- although don't expect anything that's mind-blowing. Great service-- they are very kind and patient people.

11.description: When I first arrived, the cashier didn't greet me. Ordered a turkey burger the other day w/ fries.  At first, I wasn't sure if it was a turkey burger it was brown and looked like a regular one...anyways, it was just OK.  Their fries were the crinkled kind, no luscious steak fries here. I had the special that comes with fries and a drink for a little over $10.  I thought to myself I should've just gone to the place down the street.  Walls are adorned with sports memorabilia and signed autographs of various players.  This is a laid-back place where you can grab a quick bite with edible food and subpar customer service.

39.description: Came at 8:55pm. (close at 9:00)Ordered Burger and small fries. $8Taste is average.  nothing special. will come again and try more as its so close to my apartment.

37.description: There is a good reason why SRO has been in existence for over 25 years. The Rookie Chicken Sandwich and/or Turkey Burger and fries. Try it and you will see. The folks that work there are awesome, fast, and if you come here enough they will learn your name. Great place.

0.description: Decent spot with a fun atmoslhere.  Fast casual (think Flaco Taco, you order then they cook it and bring it to you) dinner spot with a Chicago sports theme.  Lots of fun Chicago sports photos, jerseys, and other odds and ends.  Also has fun jazz music in the background.  I got the gyro with fries and it wasn't bad.  Meat wasn't that hot, but fries were scalding and lightly crunchy.  Plenty of meat in the gyro and the lamb was thick cut, not the typical thinly sliced stuff.  Staff is friendly enough and service timely.  It is a little hidden, but next door to well known spot Sofi, so not hard if you know the area well.Prices are reasonable and worth what you pay.

38.description: The SRO chicken sandwich would be pretty good if the chicken didn't taste boiled.  Decent food, but too expensive for decent.

51.description: This is your typical burger joint. Nothing fancy or anything. The portions aren't too big and aren't too small.  It's a nice chill place and the food comes out very quick. But for the price i pay i prefer getting shake Shack or In-n-out.   However, i do like how my cheese was melted here. It does dripped a little, because it's very warm. so be careful not to get it all over you. The Zucchini fries were ok, but i like the carls jr. ones more.

27.description: This place is just okay. I'm a sucker for good advertising. The sign said "city's best turkey burger" which I thought was obscure enough a thing to brag about and perhaps true as a result. Not the case. The turkey patty was dry and flavorless. The bun was delicious and so were the cheese fries. Nice outside seating. But other than that...pass! Wouldn't spend the money again.

32.description: I am a fan of the SRO chicken sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries. It has a great sauce on it. Great pick up food when we don't feel like cooking.

54.description: Turkey burger and sweet potato fries for under $10. Enough said.This place gets pretty busy around the noon hour, but it's a great, fairly fast lunchtime spot if you're in the south loop. Lots of options, and you can usually grab a seat if you want to stick around and eat (so no, not really standing room only).

48.description: I've lived in this hood for years... I've only been to SRO like 3 times. Yea the grilled chicken and the burgers are ok... but... it is a little rich here for what you get... If you are going to spend 10+ bucks on food, go get a real burger from the Hack.. Or go get some Thai food next door. I want to like this place more. There is nothing here to make me an addict. Further, there are no specials to catch me while I'm walking down the street. I like the inside with all the sports stuff but why wouldn't I just go to Bar Louie to catch the games, sports center, etc. Meh is right...

44.description: SRO is in heavy rotation on my list of lunchtime places; co-workers and I eat there once a week at least, and sometimes more. It's a bit of a walk from the office for us, but we've never had a problem getting in & out of there in a timely fashion during the lunchtime rush. My friends come for the burgers, I come for the less traditional (but no less tasty) black bean burger and portabella mushroom sandwich. The sweet potato fries are also a guilty pleasure.

24.description: Nice walk down Printers Row, this place has a nice outdoor seating, very cool Chicago sports memorabilia stuff.  First time here, got the Chicken fingers and fries. Not bad, but nothing too outstanding. Prices overall are normal for the area maybe even a bit cheaper. Stop in for the atmosphere, but I'll definitely return and start go down the menu, to be continued...

7.description: Best Gyro outside of Greek town!

49.description: Overpriced, and its never open.Chicken sandwich+fries+soda=11 dollars---and it didn't come with fries. On my visit, the place was empty, and the tables weren't clean. Will not be back.

40.description: Braved winter storm to satisfy hot dog craving. Not worth that trip (maybe not so bad on average day) but their hot dog is better than most in the loop. They have the jumbo which I like. Most other places have the little skinny hot dogs. They say "oh, just get two" well I don't want two, I want one big one (what can I say, don't hate, I like it meaty!). The best I have had in the loop is from Cellars Market in the basement of the Board of Trade building. But they close at 2:30 (I eat lunch late) and for the past few years the taste of their dog seems to have changed for the meh. Cellars hot dog is a big one though! LOL.

53.description: Sitting contently on Dearborn awaiting your presence is SRO, Standing Room Only. It's polite, cozy and makes for good conversation. Its broad, awesome menu isn't flashy or gigantic, rather it relies on consistent, affordable food specifically crafted to satisfy you without invoking any strong reactions one way or the other.SRO is good food, don't get me wrong. Their grilled chicken sandwiches are decent, the sweet potato fries passable and their burgers non-offensive and very middle of the road. The prices are in line with what you'll find in the south Loop and the sports-oriented decor isn't distracting. Like this review, it's alright. Not ROTD material, just good enough to get the message across. SRO. Food for people, by people.

30.description: Standing room only is a solid diner.  Their burgers are great and the prices are on point.  Also their salads are incredible, the Ceasars salad comes with actual anchovies. Wonderful place to order or stop in.

46.description: This place has the most delicious grilled chicken burgers I've had in a long time - if you're scoping this place, their SRO burger will give you the best first impression.I was kind of surprised by how big their menu was, they've got a huge variety and plenty of healthy/vegetarian options available too. Management and staff are awesome and orders are fairly fast and less than 10 minutes. They've got a great decor and plenty of seating area too.*to all the reviews complaining about price - quality food doesn't come cheap.

1.description: So I've been going to this place for years and am finally able to write a review. Do Go...Go Again and Again and Again. Love the turkey burger. They will add anything you want on in (for a price) or take it the way they make it. It's still awesome! Small dining area but I guess that's why they call it Standing Room Only. A must on the burger list. You can now order online and pick-up your order, however they are a bit slow in that area and you may or may not get a confirmation email with your estimated pick-up time. I did not receive a confirmation time, however when I arrived, the order was ready.Burger Heaven

55.description: I know proximity has a lot to do with this, however I have eaten here an absurd amount of time the past 3 yrs I've lived next door and it still sounds good. That says something.I love the salmon burger and you cannot miss out on the sweet potato fries. Really, I am a critic of those and they make some humdingers!When they have the patio open its the perfect place for a yum and affordable outdoor meal before heading across the street to Kasey's for a beer.

9.description: Best Chicken Caesar salad in South Loop. Heads above Panera and so much faster.  And they serve it with yummy garlic bread.

26.description: Tried it about a few years ago.Not a bad place, If you want something fast.Or take a break from the Lit Fest.

25.description: I call this place "mini Portilllos" which, in my book, is a huge compliment.  Over the years I have tried everything on the menu.  The food is high quality and very consistent.  I would rather go here and pay a little extra, knowing that it's high quality, than some place down the street that's cheaper.  The SRO chicken sandwich is my favorite in the city.  Good size chicken breast, always cooked to perfection, with bacon, cheddar and garlic mayo. Served on a grilled and buttered Turano bun.  Try it!  Some other great choices include the chili, cheese fries and gyro platter.  The italian beef, turkey and italian sandwiches are average.  Surprisingly, the vegetarian options, like the trio platter (hummus, babaganoush, pita, falafel, cucumber and tomato), are solid.  The ambiance is quintessential Chicago hot dog joint with nice flatscreens airing local sports.  Lots of cool sports memorabilia on the walls to look at while you eat.  Whether you're from Chicago or just visiting, go to SRO's and order practically anything on the menu - you won't be disappointed.

12.description: This place is in my building so its very convenient for me to grab some fast food when I don't feel like venturing out or ordering delivery.  I've had their burgers, hotdog and fitness plate so far.  The food is decent but not mind blowing.  It's a good spot for a simple meal, but if I didn't live in the area I wouldn't make a special trip to eat here.

59.description: went here a week ago and had an ok time. Had a burger and some cheese fries. Burger was average and the cheese fries were pretty good. Although they dont have the best turkey burger its definetely cheaper than epic burger a few blocks away.

21.description: I've been to SRO a few times now and have found it to be decent. Nothing horrible but definitely not the best food I've eaten either.The first visit I had a hog dog and fries. The second time I tried the burger... I wasn't blown away either time. I thought the food was a little too greasy and slightly overpriced for what they are offering. I guess the prices are typical for the location though.Sadly, the atmosphere appears to be better than the food. I don't think I'll be returning to SRO anytime soon.

17.description: The friendly staff can't entirely save the slightly overpriced menu items and mediocre food.  My order of a black bean burger and sweet potato fries came to almost $12.  If you're in the area and are in the mood for quick American fare, give it a shot, but let it be known that you'd most likely be better served by just walking down the street to Hackney's.

10.description: Volunteers at the Printers' Row Lit Fest all received a $10 voucher to redeem for food at SRO.  I wouldn't have known this place even existed otherwise.  I'm so glad the Lit Fest introduced me to them!  Their food and service were both amazing.  I ordered the turkey burger, and it was delicious.  Great size, didn't take long to make, and just an all-around good burger.  I will definitely be coming back here as a paying customer soon.  Kudos to SRO for supporting such a great event.

5.description: Boss burger was delicious! Wish the patty was a little thicker, but still delicious. Would definitely grab another one.

3.description: the turkey chili is so good. Also try the turkey burger with all the trimmings. Nice area to eat at tlunch time in the summer time.

35.description: Is there anything better than an SRO burger?  It's odd, there is nothing out of the ordinary about them, but yet I crave  them every once in awhile!!There is also some great sports memorabilia hanging on the walls... White Sox!

19.description: This is a pretty decent American fare restaurant, and the hot dogs and burgers are alright. I have to admit I did not see what the big deal was about this place when I went. It was lunchtime and it was super packed, so I was excited to try their food because a place this packed has to have some delicious food.  To my surprise it was just average. Then as I looked around the place and saw all of the sports memorabilia I thought maybe they flocked there because there's always a game showing on their televisions. I would go back to give them a second try if I was in the area. But I would go out of my way to travel to them.

28.description: This is a pretty decent American fare restaurant, and the hot dogs and burgers are alright. I have to admit I did not see what the big deal was about this place when I went. It was lunchtime and it was super packed, so I was excited to try their food because a place this packed has to have some delicious food.  To my surprise it was just average. Then as I looked around the place and saw all of the sports memorabilia I thought maybe they flocked there because there's always a game showing on their televisions. I would go back to give them a second try if I was in the area. But I would go out of my way to travel to them.

45.description: It's kinda pricey for a burger joint but the food is very good.

33.description: service is just ok. Nothing special but also not bad.Fried zucchini is bland.Cod sandwich is AMAZING. Great fish, great batter, awesome bread.Fries are crinkle cut and very tasty.Turkey burger is all that, juicy and totally worth a try.Chili cheese fries are EXCELLENT. Very good chili!I'd go here for lunch again!

43.description: Deceptively awesome food, as it's somewhat easy to pass by as you're walking up Dearborn. Their turkey burger, as they claim, really is the best in the city. That and the fitness plate make up my staples, and they never disappoint. The outdoor seating in the summer is also great.

2.description: Brought the family here for lunch. Great chicken burger, good salmon burger, and good grilled cheese and chicken tenders. Crinkle fries were excellent and BBQ sauce was great!I really enjoyed the vast collection of sports memorabilia on the walls!

18.description: I call this place "mini Portilllos" which, in my book, is a huge compliment.  Over the years I have tried everything on the menu.  The food is high quality and very consistent.  I would rather go here and pay a little extra, knowing that it's high quality, than some place down the street that's cheaper.  The SRO chicken sandwich is my favorite in the city.  Good size chicken breast, always cooked to perfection, with bacon, cheddar and garlic mayo. Served on a grilled and buttered Turano bun.  Try it!  Some other great choices include the chili, cheese fries and gyro platter.  The italian beef, turkey and italian sandwiches are average.  Surprisingly, the vegetarian options, like the trio platter (hummus, babaganoush, pita, falafel, cucumber and tomato), are solid.  The ambiance is quintessential Chicago hot dog joint with nice flatscreens airing local sports.  Lots of cool sports memorabilia on the walls to look at while you eat.  Whether you're from Chicago or just visiting, go to SRO's and order practically anything on the menu - you won't be disappointed.

41.description: Very disappointed. I had the Tri Platter that included babaganouj, hummus, falafel, tomato and cucumbet and pita. It was disgusting. I couldn't even eat it. Well for one, it was all very greasy. Second, it was not fresh at all. Third, it was extremely dry. I was drinking water as I was eating it but I could tell it was not fresh at all and I've had heartburn for the past hour and chest tightness from it. Extremely disappointed and will not eat that again.

52.description: Mystified by bad reviews. However I keep hearing "you can get better at Hackney's" and I realize that there is some good and anti-good at war here. Thought Hackneys was by far the dullest meal I've ever had in Chicago. Seriously if that's your idea of a good burger, please find some kind of farm-to-table place at once for *good* beef.If you share this not-good opinion of Hackneys you might feel as I do about SRO:This is a freaking amazing grilled chicken, good enough to crave at times from far away,  and a FINE-ass falafel. Best ever? Not so much, but a solid four out of five.I swear, this grilled chicken is one of the best "this can't be THAT bad for me" options downtown and quick. I'm comparing apples to apples: chicken sandwiches under ten bucks that arrive in a plastic basket. Better? Where?I can't speak to the dogs, because frankly vienna beef is a vienna beef is a vienna beef and the chicago dog eludes me.

50.description: Fast food joint that caters to its neighborhood with lots of healthy options, like hummus, rice, tuna, salmon, veggies....as well as more common fast food, like burgers and fries.  Food is easy to carry from counter to table in round stainless steel dishes that look like dog bowls.  Coke products in the self-serve soda fountain, no Pepsi, but interesting bottled sodas like Mexican Jarritos.  The decor is sports-mad, with sporting stuff on all the walls, a faux chunk of ivy-covered Wrigley wall in one corner, all the TVs tuned to games.  Very nice jazz on the overhead speakers, a surprisingly good playlist for what seems to be a non-jazz focused place.  Friendly helpful service from the one guy behind the counter.  SRO is a keeper.

4.description: I have been here many times, we used to live across the street in Printers Row and recently visited a friend in the area. The food is pretty good. It hits the spot when you are craving something you shouldn't be eating. Good Turkey burger although my friend didn't think it was great. Maybe I was influenced with all the signs saying it was voted best turkey burger and is now famous. Couldn't tell you who voted it as the best though. Gyro was pretty tasty, that's one of my favorite foods so hard to not make me happy with one! Also like their charred chicken salad, Greek salad and steak salad.  While I never order them....big fan of the mozzarella sticks I steal off other people plates!

6.description: We live a minute walk from this place so it's very convenient whenever you feel like getting something quick.  My daughter LOVES the chicken fingers and fries.  Her cousin was in town this past week and I think they went there 3 times for lunch and paid for themselves as it's only $6.  The BBQ chicken sandwich and SRO sandwich are great but I usually only get it if it's on special which is $10 for sandwich fries and a drink.  If it's not on special, the sandwich is about $8 or $9 w/ nothing else.  I can do turkey burgers and had it once and it was good, not great in my opinion.

22.description: I've been here a few times, started off with the burger, turkey burger and then tried the gyros.  I've been sticking with the last because they put a ton of feta on it.  It's all good, they've got a patio, they're not trying to win a michelin star, they want to watch the game.

15.description: Yikes. SRO...Serving Raunchy Only. Their burger is wicker nasty. Yeah it is build your own but I seriously doubt my creation was the problem. There is nothing worth going back for. Maybe this place is called Standing Room Only because people are in there complaining about their nasty food. Do yourself a favor and walk a little further and go to Hackney's. Yet they have their problems too but at least their burger kicks burger butt! Sweet deco though. Thumbs up for that!

57.description: Very mediocre food.  My husband got a turkey burger and I got a beef burger.  The best thing about them was the bun.  Both burgers were bland and, I suspect, heated up from frozen.  The French fries were also likely from frozen.  The food is just okay - nothing special. I agree with another reviewer - go to Hackney's down the street instead.  It is a little more expensive, but fries are included.

20.description: Yikes. SRO...Serving Raunchy Only. Their burger is wicker nasty. Yeah it is build your own but I seriously doubt my creation was the problem. There is nothing worth going back for. Maybe this place is called Standing Room Only because people are in there complaining about their nasty food. Do yourself a favor and walk a little further and go to Hackney's. Yet they have their problems too but at least their burger kicks burger butt! Sweet deco though. Thumbs up for that!

36.description: I Love the food here!! Especially, the SRO chicken sandwich and the onion rings. I think it's way over priced for a burger joint and think the sandwiches and burgers should come with fries. Only certain things come with fries but the burgers do not. They are also closed on Sundays and I have come here during the week when they say they are open but they have been closed. I will continue to come back for the yummy food but definitely think they should have some kind of burger/fries/soda combo deal.

14.description: Really good cheese fries!! Super convenient location, fast service and the staff is very friendly.

58.description: This review starts on a melancholy note, but thanks to Warehouse Liquors, has a very happy ending.I went to Chicago last week and missed the luggage check-in cutoff time.  I typically never check luggage, but this was a special trip and I had packed three very, very special bottles of wine.  In addition to being somewhat pricey, they also all are difficult to find and have some meaning to me.  I gave them to some random, extremely lucky guy in Orange County.  Sigh.  Hope he enjoyed them.So I arrive in Chicago, morose and wine-less.  Enter Yelp and the reviews for Warehouse Liquors, conveniently a block away from our hotel.  I wasn't expecting much, maybe some overpriced Cakebread or something of that ilk.But holy wine bottles, was this place AMAZING.  Well-informed staff, lots of tasty chocolate and other munchies, great beer selection... And the wine!  Row upon row of bottles from all over the world, including the really hard-to-find French burgundy I had tried to bring with me! And the Naia Verdejo that is the most perfect summer afternoon wine ever.  And Calera Pinot Noir!  And TONS of shirazes and zins and other 750-ml containers of yumminess.Thank you, Warehouse, for saving the day and allowing me to drink so well at our BYOB dinner.  Cheers!

56.description: Don't let the name "Warehouse" fool you, this boutique wine shop, which also carries a small but impressive selection of liquors, including some harder to find stuff, is anything but. It's small but packed with a great selection of wines, champagnes and interesting beers. The staff is really helpful (they always offer to help me find something, and to chill my wine) and there is something for almost every budget. While there is no rock-bottom bargain bin, there is a variety of good bottles in the $9-$15 range, as well and many more quality bottles priced accordingly. There is a small snack selection, as well as sodas and the usual.

29.description: Love this liquor store! Very clean and neat, but mostly because of the great beer selection (and wine selection, although I'm much more of a beer drinker). I did a search for liquor stores in the area, closest to Grant Park. There are not many in the area, but this is by far the best one. There just so happened to be a free wine tasting the day we went (every Friday from 5-8, I believe); lucky us! We didn't want to pay a ridiculous amount for Budweiser beer at Lollapalooza, so we came here. The guys working the front cash registers are awesome, funny and friendly. They also carry some snacks. We actually returned to this store again the same day and again the next day. I will definitely bookmark this place for the next time I'm in the loop and need a beer or liquor fix.

42.description: Warehouse Liquors is cool liquor store in the South Loop .It has a nice selection of spirits(especially whiskeys), wines and beers. If you are not sure what you need, they have a very knowledgeable staff that can assist and educate you at the same time.I happen to walk in when they were having a wine tasting. I had a nice time and walked out with a few bottles for myself.   Great Place!

23.description: Gene and all his crew at Warehouse Liquors is awesome! They know their spirits. They especially know their whiskey. If you are just a beginner or even an expert at whiskey...Gene can be a great mentor. Warehouse Liquors is my favorite place for becoming educated about all things whiskey. They also have an awesome selection of the finest whiskies available.... Go there today. Buy great whisky.

47.description: What a gem! We were able to find a great bottle of wine at a really good price. Their scotch selection is also very, very good. Worth the stop!

8.description: I wouldn't even give this place a single star but I had to mark something to write a review. Save your time and never go to this store. I have never been treated so rudely in my life. Walked in there to ask about a rare beer release with a friend that lives close by and goes there regularly and after waiting a few minutes for anyone to come out of the back when a guy walks out and cut us off as we were asking and said they don't have it and the short rude old asshole walked away. We said ok thanks and were walking out when he turned around and said even if I did have it you would not be able to get it because this is a local store for regular customers , it's like a family you know not for people who just come around to buy this beer. We don't serve to people like you that just walk in here and aren't regulars. Wow if that is a type of family I sure don't ever want to be in it and we were actually with someone that shops there regularly... So I guess none of us will be going back.. You shouldn't either. #badchicagoian

31.description: I really love Warehouse Liquors.  They are expensive, but they're a high end store.  You don't go there to buy Bud Light.  They have a really fantastic selection of really great beer (which is the only thing I've ever gone there for).  It's right around the corner from my office, so I often stop there on the way home when I need a little pick me up.

34.description: Great collection of everything! And super helpful staff  gave us some to taste to help with making a choice on some some bourbon.

16.description: Thanks to Yelp, I found this place, since we decided to chill in the hotel room last Saturday night and also needed tailgate supplies for the Chicago Fire game this past Sunday. As a result, I needed hard cider, so the typical convenience store wasn't going to work for me. This store was within walking distance of the Palmer House Hilton, and we found it without any problems thanks to Google's maps app.I was impressed with their beer selection. I don't drink beer, but I can appreciate the variety the store carried, which reminded of me a mini Spec's (Texas liquor store chain). Since I was after hard cider, to give you an idea, the typical Woodchuck amber or granny smith wasn't carried; instead, Woodchuck's aged hard cider was available. A staff member asked if I need help, and I told him I wanted something really sweet. He recommended I drink J.K. Scrumpy's Hard Cider, which was $8 for 22oz. It was delicious and exactly what I wanted. Due to the service (wonderful, lengthy discussion about ciders) and result of a scrumptious beverage, I give five stars.The same staff member also helped a friend with a recommendation. I found it funny that the domestic cheap beers, e.g. Coors Light, was a TINY section. If you're looking for a special kind of beer, this is the place to be!

13.description: So much stuff!!! I came here with some fellow law school victims right after our finals so I didn't have as much time to peruse as I would have liked (the desire to drink was high that day) but it did take me about 30 mins to look at just about 1/10th of their wine selection (a lot of it with useful little notecards about the taste & some pairings). They also have all kinds of cool beer and liquours. Just go.

11.description: The Staff continues to impress. This business of booze has been forced to raise its game across the board.  At the retail level, these guys are setting the bar in Chicago with an informed & passionate staff. TIL the difference between RM and NM champaign.  WTF?  How has no salesperson ever mention this to me?  Bourbon selection is still curated by hand. Scotch selection is insane.

39.description: Warehouse Liquors is located in the Loop, on Wabash, kind of in the center of the Columbia College "campus".  The atmosphere inside is quite clean and aesthetically pleasing.  It isn't a large store, but it still manages to have a large selection of beer, wine and spirits.I really enjoyed their whiskey/scotch/bourbon selection which, considering the size of the establishment, is impressive.  You'll find a few bottles that would be hard to track down elsewhere.  The prices are reasonable, but not great.  That reflects the nature of being located downtown, though, and to have a place where you can find a good selection that goes above and beyond the run of the mill corner liquor store is great.Unfortunately the positive qualities end there.This past summer, right after Bluesfest in Grant Park, we wandered into Warehouse Liquors on our way home.  There were about five people in our group.  I had been wanting to purchase a bottle of Lagavulin 16 for a while and figured we could pop in and grab one.  We're all in our twenties and we had been out in the sun all day so we weren't dressed to impress.  I picked the bottle up off the shelf (Warehouse Liquors doesn't have these bottles behind the counter) to show my friend what we would be buying.  Seconds later the long-haired guy behind the counter barked at me not to pick up the bottles.  I was stunned but quickly put it back in its right place.  We weren't yelling or messing around, but the death stare I got from this guy was unbelievable.  I understand if that's their store policy, but work on your bedside manner a little if you want to work in customer service.This annoyed my boyfriend and we quickly made the decision to take our business elsewhere.  One of our friends was parched, though, and desperately needed to buy a bottle of water so we begrudgingly got in line.  As soon as the customer in front of us completed his purchase we heard one of the clerks look at us and mutter to the other "Oh God, kill me now."  We were appalled but we just handed over our money and left.  I'd never come across a cashier that pretentious in my life.Instead we went to Printer's Row Wine Shop which is only three (well, really, two and a half) short blocks away at 719 S Dearborn!  We found exactly what we were looking for and the gentleman working there was friendly and helpful.  I would recommend them hand over fist as a much more appealing alternative.  Their selection of whiskey is not quite as vast, but their wine and craft beer selection is wonderful!  They also have all the basics covered in terms of spirits.I still have no idea what we might have done to deserve the poor treatment we got at Warehouse Liquors.  Maybe the clerks mistook us for Columbia College students and thought we were going to be a pain in the butt.  Maybe they were having a bad day.  That said, I suspect that maybe this was just how they chose to cope with being in their thirties and still working retail.  I don't know what that feels like, so I can't say.

37.description: ive gone in a few times and had the guys working there be a bit standoffish, and that's fine, i understand. it is, after all, a liquor store. what makes up for that?gene makes up for that. gene is great. i work at that one college that's right across the street from here, and i work in an office that likes to throw parties every now and again. that's where gene comes in. i call gene up, tell him what we want, and he makes sure we get it. no bullshit, no nonsense. the last time i worked with him, he actually said, "i work for you, tell me what you want and we'll make it happen". pretty much the best thing you want to hear from your contact at the liquor store when you're planning an event that will be attended by the college president and other higher-ups. their selection is pretty extensive, in both the beers and the wines (i'm not sure about their other boozies, i don't drink too much of that stuff).i will add a star if they have southern tier pumking ale when i go in there next week...

0.description: Warehouse Liquors is a solid liquor store that may or may not be right for you. Luckily for me, this is exactly what I was looking for so I stopped by multiple times on my trip.Personally, I like Warehouse Liquors quite a bit. I'm a craft beer nerd from cali so I wanted to nab a few awesome Chicago brews to bring back home, and this place has quite the selection! They have a number of options from local breweries (revolution, pipeworks, mraz, and off color, etc.) and some out-of-state breweries I still find back home (sixpoint, surly, etc.). Prices are close-ish to that other store in the area. The whiskey selection is also very solid here too and the snack options are ok. The location is also supper convenient if you are in one of the nearby hotels. There are a few drawbacks. The whiskey prices seems to be a bit high here. Moreover, if you are here for regular/generic beers, you will probably be a bit disappointed. Some other yelpers seemed to highlight poor customer service as a concern. I was fortunate enough to not have this problem. The whiskey guy helped me out and even suggested some whiskey bars I should hit during my trip. The craft beer guy (Armando) was apparently late to work for the first time ever. Someone caused a scene at the train station and made a number of people in Chicago late for work so I had to look up some of the beers on my smartphone. Also, service here for me was a bit spotty. Still, I was satisfied with my experience here and look forward to stopping by on my next trip.

38.description: Great selection of whiskey. Decent selection of beer. Prices are a little high as one might expect for a downtown store. Staff is knowledgeable but surly, as other reviewers indicated. I'm visiting Chicago and I just took a cab and got there 10 minutes before closing. The tall longhair guy working there quickly tried to shoehorn me into a bottle of scotch just to get me out of the store. The guy doing the floors just stared angrily at me as if I had ruined both his and tall longhair guy's night by coming 10 minutes before closing. I asked if they had Linkwood and they did -- $50 for a Gordon & MacPhail bottled 15 year old. Not bad, but other prices were not as friendly. I also bought a bottle of Hopslam beer on the recommendation of another long hair guy after I asked him for Racer 5. He didn't seem surly, though I got the feeling that if he was actually overtly friendly and helpful, he might have a hard time keeping his job. When I came to the register to pay, I mentioned something about this being an expensive bottle as I had the cab waiting outside, tall longhair guy rudely said, "then we both have similar goals in common," referring to his desire to go home and trying to make me feel bad for coming 10 minutes before closing. The cab driver told me that Binny's is a bigger store. Next time I come to Chi-town and need a bottle of good booze, I'll try them. Or maybe I'll go to Warehouse at the last minute again and really give tall longhair unprofessional clerk something to complain about! BTW, if I was the owner, I'd replace tall longhair guy with someone who is passionate about booze and doesn't drive customers away with rude behavior -- and maybe angry guy doing the floors as well. One doesn't have to sell too many more $50+ bottles a day to make a noticeable bump in profit for a small store like this. If my clerk was driving customers to shop elsewhere and post negative reviews on yelp, he'd be out on his ass in an instant. So...Location, convenience and selection are the only reasons to shop here. If you have the time and the means of transportation, try another store. Here's your yelp, warehouse liquors.

51.description: Yes yes yes yes yes.This was my liquor store when I lived in the loop. A spot so great that I felt CLASSY to have branded a liquor store as my own.Husband and I would spend afternoons browsing. Reading the labels of all the exotic liquors and beers. Decidedly avoiding the wines (due to wine intimidation, NOT to lack of a rockin selection).But here's the magic: the guys here are so effing brilliant. They'll tell me, "that's not going to taste like you want it to. You want this one." And they're always right.They introduced me to Licor 43, now an all-time fave.They have a good selection of snacks, too. As in things I actually want to eat. When I was homesick from TX and frustrated at the sad selection at Jewel, I used to buy salsas here.I still go back whenever I'm in the area, grab a lambic, and the place is still stellar.

27.description: Hands down the best liquor store in the city.  There isn't a place witha better whiskey selection.  They have a great selection of all spirits, wine and beer.  Not to mention a great selection of mixers and snacks.  (I was surprised to find my favorite Ginger Beer and Sprecker pop!)I found the staff to be very helpful and knowledgeable.  I always walk out with a new scotch or beer and I have not been disappointed!   The prices are competitive with the neighborhood.  They also have free wine tastings on Friday nights.The store is very tasteful and clean.  I love Warehouse Liquors!!!!

32.description: This place just keeps me coming back.  I've been here around 1,000 times and the selection is always awesome.  Somewhat like a kid in a candy shop, I walk around the store saying "I want that, I want that, I want that" until I end up having two boxes worth of beer, wine, and liquor.The beer selection is great!  If they don't have it no one will.  The wine selection is ridiculously long.  In all the times I've been there, I don't think I've even scratched the surface of what they have to offer.  Plus, they have my favorite vodka in the entire universe Rain - Cucumber Lime.  I don't think I've seen this anywhere else.The staff is always really helpful.  John is the beer guy that helped me and he was extremely nice.  I just told him the type of beer I liked and he found me four others that I have since tried and extremely enjoyed.I would never go anywhere else!

54.description: Stopped in at the recommendation of a friend for a bottle of wine and ended up spending nearly an hour there.  Incredible selection.

48.description: Quite possibly the best liquor store I've ever been in.  A serious selection of liquor, beer, & wine many of which I am not familiar.  The staff was awesome as well - say three words to describe what you like and you'll walk away a happy person.  On Thursday nights they have tastings; lucky for us we stumbled-upon this and sampled some absinthe, some sort of 120 proof whiskey, along with some Ommegang brewing selections.  There is also a nice selection of cheeses and snacks.  So when you're in a tight again and need a quick bottle or package for a party, dinner, or just that lonely night at home...stop by.  As much as I hate chains...this would be a great place to replicate nationwide...

44.description: I love wine.Even if you don't read the rest of this review-- visit this store.  You will have a great experience there and you will love the bottle of wine that you leave with.P.S. They are dog-friendly.I happened upon Warehouse Liquors late one night this summer (by late, I mean 10pm-ish)-- all of my usual go-to wine shops were shut.  I had never been inside before, but decided to give them a try before resorting to Jewel.  First of all, they were open (yay) and second of all, I took one glance around the place and my eyes lit up.  I felt like a kid in a candy shop.  The selection of wines is, for lack of a better word, amazing.  It's an incredible array of boutique wines, peppered with some of the bigger names.  Grower champagne? Absolutely.  Expensive? Absolutely not.  Gene (we'll get back to him later) clearly spends a great deal of time handpicking excellent wines, all at exceptional values.  He and his staff pride themselves on recommending killer wines with very small price tags.  Seriously-- one of my new favorites is a Cab from South Africa that retails there for $10.99.  Yes, I said Cab from South Africa.  I would pay double for it.  It's really good.The staff loves wine.  But they don't love wine in a pushy, overbearing kind of way.  They are available to shop with you, or they are perfectly fine standing back and letting you do your own thing.  They love wine in a "we want you to love the bottle of wine that you leave with" kind of way.  Ask any of them for a recommendation.  I do every time.  I can't help it.  They're always spot-on.  Besides that, they are so incredibly laid back and cool.  I mean, you almost want to pull up a chair, hang out, and share a bottle right there in the store.Lastly, what finally prompted me to join Yelp...I stopped by earlier today to pick up a bottle for this afternoon.  I tied the dogs outside, ran in, grabbed something I'd never tried before, couldn't resist scanning the rest of their selection... Gene walked by asked if I was finding everything ok, I said yes, and he kept about his business.  Immediately, I remembered that every time I ask for a recommendation from them, it's awesome, so I stopped him.  He asked a few questions about what kinds of things I like or don't like and offered to give me the 10-cent tour of the place.  He told me to bring the dogs in (also awesome), and we took off down the rows of bottles.  I don't think I've ever had so much fun shopping for wine (I am an 8-yr veteran of the wine industry).  The thing is, he wasn't really trying to sell me on anything.  He was excited about his collection, and he wanted to find something I would love, which he did.  To top it off, seeing that I had two rambunctious puppies to deal with on my walk home, he offered to have someone carry my wine home for me (I wound up with several bottles (AGAIN, he did not push a single thing on me.  He even suggested that I stick with one or two; that I should try them out to see if our tastes in wine coincide before I spend more, but I needed to stock up anyways).So I've just gotten into the first bottle: it's amazing.  I even called the store to tell him it was amazing.  He said I made his day.Anyhow, shop there.  It doesn't look like much from the outside (I was honestly expecting one of those convenience stores that sells booze).  I've been going there religiously for months.  Every friend that I have sent in there has freaked out about how great the wine/wine staff is.  Other points of interests:  largest selection on sake I've seen at ANY liquor store in Chicago.  Most, if not all, whites, sakes, sparkling, and beers are available cold.  It looks like they stock the coolers with one or two of everything (I've been meaning to ask), so it's ready to go when you get there.  Last time I was there, Gene pointed to glowing wall of copper-colored liquids and mentioned a new-found zeal for bourbon and single malts.  They have snacks--cheese, crackers, chips and dip, whatever and maybe a hundred different types chocolate bars.

24.description: excellent neighborhood liquor store.  They have a nice selection of wines and the staff is knowledgeable.  I was looking for a Grey Goose Pear Flavor and called around to a few places and no one in the Loop area had it , save for Warehouse liquors.  They also carry nicer liquers that Jewel doesnt have like St. Germaine.

7.description: Pretty cool liquor store, they taste the whiskey before they order and will get single barrels that they request.  Very reasonable prices on liquor, good selection, kind of messy but cool.  I can't admit what I bought, because I want it to be there again when I go back (nothing succeeds like excess)......quality beer selection, pretty diverse for the size of the store.  A lot of 22ozers.  Seem like nice people at the counter, my only wish is that it was a block away from where I live or worked.

49.description: Love Warehouse Liquors!  Nice selection of wine - all prices, all regions, with descriptive, real reviews to help you navigate.  The Friday free wine tastings are fun - very laid back, lots of different varieties to try and discounts if you buy...but no pressure to purchase at all.  The location is just within walking distance so it's easy to pick up a bottle of wine,  cheese & crackers, crisp cider or fruity lambic - yum!

40.description: Great selection of wines and beers, perfectly reasonable prices, and friendly staff. We really like that they're dog friendly (it's fun to stop by there during their Friday wine tastings while we're taking the pups out for walk). Didn't think it was all that much to look at from the outside, but the inside has a nice, old wood floor, converted-warehouse-y feel (thus the name?). Very warm. This is not the closest wine shop to us; we walk a little further to get there. Hopefully a meaningful testament, given the weather outside right now!

53.description: What can I say, I love liquor! No but really.... this is one of the places I'll miss since I switched jobs. i'd always pop in after work and grab some "party supplies" and leave with a recommended bottle that everyone ends up raving about. Not to mention they have a wide variety of cheeses and meats. My dog loves this section of the store, yes - my dog. I somehow never get yelled at for bringing in my crazy-eyes chiapoo.

30.description: This is the place for great service and great prices, especially on Whiskey. I guess the owner makes some great massive purchases because he beats Binny's most of the time and has stuff they do not. Try the Monkey shoulder next time you need a inexpensive and tasty whiskey. Best thing is they deliver to the loop and do it fast.

46.description: there are a few things i miss since my office moved from the fine arts building- the park, the proximity of the el, and warehouse liquors.  i agree with everyone else, the selection and staff are fantastic.  i love that they don't push you to spend a whole paycheck in there.  a lot of times i'd go in and say 'i want something amazing for $15 or less' and they didn't look at me like i was crazy, or give me the evil eye, but hooked me up with a bottle of fabulousness instead.this is a great place to go if you have no clue of what you want.

1.description: Went shopping for single malt whisky at this store. The store is clean and the staff is friendly. What struck me was the wide selection of single malt whisky they had. Bottles were arraigned neatly and they have nice hand written notes describing flavors and tit bits about the scotch.However they are significantly over priced compared to Binnys. I wanted to pick up a bottle of Macallan 12 and Aberlour A-Bundah. They were priced at $65 and $97 respectively. The same bottles were $52 and $79 at Binnys. A price difference of $31 plus the extra taxes you pay. I wouldn't advice buying here unless you are rushed for time and live in the neighborhood.Even a whole foods sells the Macallan for $50:-(

55.description: First off, I'm grateful that this little neighborhood gem is alive and well. As sad as it was to lose the Dexter building and the old Thai Spoon building in the fire in '06, the damage apparently didn't reach Warehouse Liquors next door. Any time I need to find a very specific bottle of wine or a fancy ale or stout, I take comfort in knowing I can call this place, and often they have what I'm searching for. For such a small shop, they sure do stock it well. They even carry food items to compliment the imbibing. Also, I feel better knowing my booze money is supporting a small, neighborhood shop run by folks who know their stuff.

9.description: The name "Warehouse Liquors" was a little misleading to me, because this place is run more like a finely curated booze cellar than a warehouse, but that was just my initial reaction.Extremely knowledgeable and friendly staff with a superb selection of Belgian and domestic craft beers and spirits.  They have one of the biggest selections of local Chicago beers too from breweries like Pipeworks, Spiteful, Arcade, etc...If you are a whisk(e)y geek, you should really check this place out. They have their own hand picked single barrel program and regularly have some of the rarer stuff in stock longer than the bigger stores.  They have a nice little section of fine meats and artisan cheeses to go along with your purchases too.Highly recommended... these guys are doing good things, check them out!

26.description: Thanks to Yelp, I found this place, since we decided to chill in the hotel room last Saturday night and also needed tailgate supplies for the Chicago Fire game this past Sunday. As a result, I needed hard cider, so the typical convenience store wasn't going to work for me. This store was within walking distance of the Palmer House Hilton, and we found it without any problems thanks to Google's maps app.I was impressed with their beer selection. I don't drink beer, but I can appreciate the variety the store carried, which reminded of me a mini Spec's (Texas liquor store chain). Since I was after hard cider, to give you an idea, the typical Woodchuck amber or granny smith wasn't carried; instead, Woodchuck's aged hard cider was available. A staff member asked if I need help, and I told him I wanted something really sweet. He recommended I drink J.K. Scrumpy's Hard Cider, which was $8 for 22oz. It was delicious and exactly what I wanted. Due to the service (wonderful, lengthy discussion about ciders) and result of a scrumptious beverage, I give five stars.The same staff member also helped a friend with a recommendation. I found it funny that the domestic cheap beers, e.g. Coors Light, was a TINY section. If you're looking for a special kind of beer, this is the place to be!

25.description: Based on the name, the outside of the building, and its being next to Harold's Chicken Shack, you might get second thoughts about stopping by.  But this place is VERY nice with lots of selection! Be prepared to load up on Chimay and some other beers that you've never heard of but look damn interesting.

12.description: I no longer patronize this establishment. As others have noted -- service is very hit or miss, and can be pretentious bordering on utterly obnoxious. Sometimes it's good to know where you stand with folks, and there's no "loyalty" from wine shop guys. Liquor stores know that desperate imbibers are going to shop there regardless, so they don't have to provide particularly GOOD service to anybody. If you want the booze, 8 out of 10 people are going to spend the money no matter how poorly you're treated. Well, I'm one of the 2 exceptions. At the end of the day at this establishment, my business meant nothing to them. So I took my business elsewhere, and gladly. Fortunately we have options in the South Loop. I still prefer to support a small, locally owned business, so I'm now firmly #TeamPrintersRowWineShop. Come on by. Flavio and Marcus are waiting for you!

59.description: One word to describe this place..AWESOME!We stumbled upon Warehouse liquors when we moved to the area and were so excited a place like this existed near us!They have an AMAZING selection of beer, liquor and wine. The beer selection is wonderful, so many imports that you can't find anywhere and the staff is EXTREMELY knowledgeable about anything you ask them. You can really tell that every person that works there knows what they're talking about and they have a passion for it.A new Sam's liquor opened about the same distance from us as Warehouse is but my boyfriend and I refuse to even enter that place, we are die hard customers of Warehouse Liquors.I encourage others to support the smaller/local businesses versus the large chain stores. You're just not going to get the great service as ou would at the local place.

21.description: They have an excellent array of wine, beer and spirits for such a small space.  Don't be shy when you go in - ask for recommendations from their knowledgeable staff on what to buy.  But you can also trust this place as a source for your thirsty Thursdays - Busch, PBR, etc. are all available as well as a good variety of hot sauce and chips for snacking on with your beverages.  One of the best liquor stores in the Loop!

17.description: I was amazed at the cleanliness of this establishment, and the variety of wine and other alcohol that they carried!  I wish I knew his name, there was a very knowledgeable and friendly younger man who helped us (and I would give him 5 stars), but then there was this crabby lady at the front register that really turned us off to this place.  She sat up front petting her dog the entire forty minutes we were there not acknowledging any guests. We tried to make friendly conversation with her as she rang us out and asked her "How does the alcohol tasting work"  (after we noticed a sign about it)? Meaning like, when is it, where is it, what are the alcohols we are trying.?? The lady responds, "You just show up."  We kind of look at eachother like ooooooookay.  Then she says, "well it's free if that's what you were getting at."  I thought that was so rude of her to say, like insinuating that we were some free loaders.  In Summary:Helpful Man with vast knowledge on wine: 5 StarsCute doggie by the front door: 5 StarsAmbiance and Alcohol Selection: 5 StarsCrabby cashier Lady: 0 Stars

10.description: Other than the fact that they no longer carry beer from Firestone Walker, this is my favorite craft beer destination in the city. These guys know their beer!

5.description: I had a refrigerator and it was hot and there were local beers to conquer.I went in and saw a cornucopia of delights.They had two types of local sour beer.I would eventually get both.One of the guys who worked here advised me.Which sour beer is best,he said this one is more vinegary .I said that's the one I want.While you're at it , what's a kick ass local IPA.He recommended Working for the Weekend.Looks like they have a decent whisky selection.selection. Didn't pay any attention to the wine.

3.description: Don't waste your time.  Way more hype and lip service, or lack of, than real service.  The clerk acted like he just got back from Colorado.  They have all of the obscure beers you could never imagine and none of the basics.

35.description: A GREAT selection for a neighborhood liquor store.  I can get my Scotch, Bourbon, beer, soda (they have multiple flavors of Sprecher!) and wine all in one place just a couple blocks away.  Some of the items they have are even hard to find at other places, a big overall selection considering the size of the shop.  It is more expensive than Binny's, but with it being so close and the staff so great it isn't generally an issue, still stops it from getting that 5th star though (I go here so often now that 5th star is back).  While the pricing on a lot of things is generally higher, they do have some great deals, just talk to the staff and they'll point them out.  I ended up with a nice bottle of Bourbon for under $20!I just want to re-iterate, the staff here is AMAZING!  Very helpful, no matter what you're looking for, they really know their stuff and are extremely nice and helpful.

19.description: I called to see if Warehouse Liquors to see if they had pappy van winkle in stock.  I was told by the gentleman on the phone that they did in fact have it.  When I asked if it would still be there if I came in today, he said I wouldn't be able to buy it.  I guess "the owner" only sells it to his loyal customers. I understand holding things for loyal customers, but how are you supposed to get new customers if you don't allow for them to buy what they are looking for?Not sure why the owner doesn't want cash in hand today, but I know that Warehouse Liquors is missing out on business.

28.description: Despite not being able to find what I was looking for, this place is fantastic. They have a slew of high end harder to find spirits. The Ardbeg section alone is worth it. I've been on the hunt for Pappy Van Winkle and Ardbeg Supernova but those are nearly ghosts. I had a long chat with the guy at the counter about various boozes and he gave me recommendations for other places that might carry the things I'd covet. At the end I still had a very excellent obscure ginger beer so all was not lost. 4.5 stars

45.description: Perhaps there has been staff turnover? My experience was not the same as the other reviewers. Their selection is excellent, however, the staff was uncaring and inattentive, I was the only customer in the store and no one asked if I needed assistance -- which would not have been so annoying...except the employees stood behind the register chatting and continued to chat while they rang up my order, and could not be bothered to say thank you or to tell me the total of my purchase.

33.description: Your better off going to Jewel up the street - and shopping in there liquor dept.  The prices are extremely high - and all times I went the staff was very rude and not helpful in the least bit.  I am surprised they have been open as long as they have - maybe the college kids go there... or tourists from the Hilton.

43.description: Thought I would check these guys out as I live in the area but never stopped in.  Usually do the shopping at the Binny's off Roosevelt or the Jewel on Roosevelt.  I am a beer guy so I was hoping to see a good variety of imports and American micro's to choose from.  I was not expecting anything approaching Binny's but something in between the two places.  Frankly the selection was pretty disappointing.  They had some solid scotch's and wines but if you are going to have to come here and than go to another store to get the rest of your order why come here at all?  So if you need something and are in a pinch this will do.  Otherwise just go to Jewel for a better overall selection and Binny's for about the best selection in the Midwest.

2.description: Called them to ask some questions about products, the worker was rude and short before he hung up on me after I thanked him for his time.

18.description: They have an excellent array of wine, beer and spirits for such a small space.  Don't be shy when you go in - ask for recommendations from their knowledgeable staff on what to buy.  But you can also trust this place as a source for your thirsty Thursdays - Busch, PBR, etc. are all available as well as a good variety of hot sauce and chips for snacking on with your beverages.  One of the best liquor stores in the Loop!

41.description: Some nutbar below says their beer selection isn't so hot. That's ridiculous. They have an enormous selection of great Belgians and US craft brews, even some flanders red ales that you can't get anywhere else nearby, and a FANTASTIC selection (and great prices!) of bourbons and other whiskies. Their special single barrel batch of buffalo trace is a really good deal, too, and very nice. the staff are probably the friendliest and most helpful that I've ever found at any liquor store anywhere.Definitely the best liquor store I've found in Chicago, period.

52.description: These are my GUYS!!!!True there's a Binny's and Sam's in the area but I wouldn't go anywhere else!!  Typical Warehouse Experience:Me: I need a good wineWH:  What kind? Me: I have no clue!!!!WH: Well, what are you having for dinner?Me:  (mentions dinner plans) WH:  Try this wine, it should go well with what you're eating. The guys are helpful, honest, and friendly.  I've learned a lot about wine by talking with the guys.

50.description: One stop shopping for all things picnic and dinner party! Fabulous, extensive selection of wines and some great snacks and munchies to boot. There are craft beers on hand, and if you forget something to drink them out of, many styles of glasses to buy. The prices were pretty much right where you'd expect them to be for a wine shop in the south part of the Loop and near a college, and it's not the sort of place you stop in when you're running low on Night Train, so save your dosh for something special. You will be able to find it there.

4.description: Warehouse Liquors is a nice place. Great variety of beverages at good prices and carries stuff I haven't seen anywhere else.That said, the employee who rang up my purchase (I believe the owner) scoffed at me when I asked for a paper bag to put around one of the 3 bottles that I purchased and had to carry about 2 miles that were clanging around in the plastic bag he gave me. He said "well I put the green sleeves on there" but the green sleeves don't cover the necks of the bottles, the most fragile part. The noise and my concern of breaking bottles were gone once I got the paper bag.Regardless of whether or not he was right about the sleeves being sufficient, he argued over giving me ONE paper bag, after complaining to a friend for 10 minutes about how no one bought anything in the store anymore. If that's the case, why are you arguing with a PAYING customer? If you're looking to try a new drink at a place that carries local stuff, and are near by check it out. Just hope for better service. With the multitude of liquor stores in this city to choose from I probably won't be making the trip again.

6.description: I have been trying to limit my 5-star reviews, but I cannot help but give Warehouse Liquors the big 5. I go to Warehouse to explore new whiskey and scotches because their selection is unparalleled.  Not only do they have a vast variety of whiskey, wine, beer, tequila (everything really), the prices are very competitive.  Finally, the customer service at Warehouse is phenomenal.  I was offered samples of what I interested in and what they recommended (did I mention that they are extremely knowledgeable).  Overall, go here.  You will not walk out dissatisfied.

22.description: Beautiful store with great service. The staff is extremely knowledgable and they have a cornucopia of wine and craft beer (bells, three floyd's!) A little pricey, but that's what you pay for selection.

15.description: Very good to superb selection. That said, prices are 30%+ higher then local competitors and mail order.

57.description: Liquid Heaven!THE UP-SIDE:  Upon walking into Warehouse Liquors, the first thing I noticed was the nice selection of chocolate, cookies and snacks up front.  Looking at them got me in a good mood, and ready to browse the wine selection.  ...and what a wine selection it was!Hundreds of bottles of wine divide the length of this cavernous store into two long aisles.  Running the length of the walls on either side is a good selection of beer, soda and liquor.  However, this place is all about the wine.THE DOWN-SIDE:  No real downside to speak of here.  THE SUM-IT-UP:  If you're in the neighborhood and you're looking for a clean, pleasant and very thorough wine shopping experience, head to Warehouse Liquors.  You will not be disappointed!

20.description: I am shocked on all the positive reviews.  I live in the neighborhood and don't get this place unless you enjoy very self righteous aging hipsters that don't greet you when you walk in and feel put out when you ask for their advice.  BTW this happened when I was the only customer in the store. This is independent of the fact that the prices are aggressively high. Printers row liquors is down the street and a much better experience.  The guys that work at warehouse liquors give a whole meaning to pretentious. Maybe if I grow an ironic mustache I would get better service next time

36.description: My precious gem that I found on our last trip out to Chicago.  Every alcohol you can desire is in here.  From sake to wine, to gin, to Alize, to vodka.  They will gladly supply you with all of your alcohol(ic)  needs.  The staff is friendly.  They have all kind of snacks for drunk munchies, chips and salsa, pretzel bits, candies...  I'm sooo IN LOVE with this place lol..  Anything linked to alcohol, they have.  Mixers?  Check!Munchies?  Check!Hard Liquor? Check!Wine? Check!Sake? Check!Beer? Check!they got you covered booboo... just go.

14.description: Love this liquor store! Very clean and neat, but mostly because of the great beer selection (and wine selection, although I'm much more of a beer drinker). I did a search for liquor stores in the area, closest to Grant Park. There are not many in the area, but this is by far the best one. There just so happened to be a free wine tasting the day we went (every Friday from 5-8, I believe); lucky us! We didn't want to pay a ridiculous amount for Budweiser beer at Lollapalooza, so we came here. The guys working the front cash registers are awesome, funny and friendly. They also carry some snacks. We actually returned to this store again the same day and again the next day. I will definitely bookmark this place for the next time I'm in the loop and need a beer or liquor fix.

58.description: Wonderful atmosphere, wait staff was so friendly and knowledgeable. Huge menu, everything was so delicious. Definitely plan on going back - it was a great treat.

56.description: Service was exemplary thanks to manager David and server Renee. Food was top notch. Highly recommended. Would definitely eat here again. No question.

29.description: Lovely neighborhood place that is perfect for date night ... if you're already dating. It's romantic and intimate, but not dazzlingly obvious in a way you'd be looking for when you're wowing a new love interest.Service is exceptional and very genuinely friendly. The food is really good and they cook their handmade pasta perfectly al dente. The bar is not comprehensively stocked, but they had my second choice of drink.The small patio seating is nice and the clientele ranges from families to retired couples. Prices on the high side ($16-$20 for pasta), but not outrageous for the quality. Portions good, but you won't have much for leftovers. I'll be back, but if prices were a few dollars less I'd come more often.

42.description: Amazing food, friendly service and a pleasant atmosphere. If they had a larger staff and better turn-around, then they'd definitely be a 5 star. That said, if you're not in a hurry, you will feel very content at the end of your meal. Still, without a reservation we were done within 70 minutes on the 4th of July. It was kinda like Italy meets comfort food. Enjoy!

23.description: Found Sofi while searching for Italian food the night before the Chicago marathon.  What an amazing find!  The food and staff are as authentic as anything I experienced in Italy.  I'm not a huge red meat eater but the spaghetti bolognese was outrageous.  The pappardelle with lamb stew was also amazing.  Portions were perfect size and like true Italians, we were questioned as to why we couldn't eat more (when our plate held the last morsel of food we couldn't finish).   The wine was equally as delicious and paired perfectly with dinner. We will definitely visit again when we're back in Chicago!

47.description: What a gem! Great service, atmosphere & food. Took a short walk from the Palmer House Hotel on a rainy Saturday night at 7:30pm and was able to be seated immediately.  Shared a Cariofi Fonduta ($12) artichoke appetizer, then Cavatelli ($16) and a Risotto Aragosta Porcini ($24).  The risotto was the bomb with lots of tender lobster chunks.  The other two dishes were good but I'd have liked a stronger truffle flavor, since that was why we picked them.  For dessert: a scrumptious creme brulee ($8).  As noted in another review, the portions were appropriately sized so you can enjoy several courses and not be stuffed. Two glasses of Moscato ($10@) and Chardonnay ($9@) brought the total bill to $108 without tip-- pricey but this was the best meal of our 4-day stay in Chicago.

8.description: Sofi was a beautiful dining experience. Tastefully decorated and very intimate. They could use some soft background music bc at times it was too quiet but none the less, this would be a great date spot or a place to take clients for a nice meal. I ordered the Garganelli pasta special with peas and prosciutto in a cream sauce. Added the summer truffles bc...why not!!?! So good!!!  The bread and olive oil was a delirious start to the meal and kudos to the bartender for a delicious dirty martini with blue cheese olives. I'll be back!

31.description: Pros--the service was good and enjoyed the port and tiramisu.Cons-the food in general. The carbanera fettuccine  tasted "eggy," "fatty" from the bacon and too salty (to quote my son). I felt the sea bass was sliced too thin and overcooked. The cappuccino tasted like an instant coffee with steamed milk.I thought it should have been better for the price.

34.description: Our first time there, on a short-notice whim when we needed a night to de-stress, and we really hit the jackpot.All the staff were friendly and welcoming. Just after the hostess seated us, the manager came over and offered a better table right next to the first one, which I appreciated.My Martini was nice. Not stand-and-applaud nice, but good. I'm a Martini snob and hard to please with my gin, so "good" is actually real praise. Gin selection was pretty standard so I chose Hendrix, the olives were crisp with no fillings, a cut above what I expect from most restaurants or bars. I didn't think to ask for it stirred so they shook it. Next time...Bread and oil clued us in that we'd made a good choice. The bread was fresh and firm but delicate, not fancied up with herbs and spices, likewise the oil. No nonsense, just quality.Our waiter took excellent care of us. There was a misunderstanding (or was it) about the glass of white my date ordered, so he comped us the first one he'd brought before bringing the one she did order. I have a hunch, no real basis for this, that the "mistake" was really more like, "nah, have one of these." The first one was the one we finished.We each had salad. Generous portions but not overly huge trying to make a point like at some places, just good bowls of veggies. Perfectly fresh, with just the right amount of dressing. Spot on.The menu is long and varied, thoughtful Italian classic. We'd both had stressful days after a run of stressful weeks and I just couldn't make up my mind. All I knew was that I wanted a good glass of flavorful red wine along with a meal to go with it, so I asked for our waiter's recommendation on the wine. He nodded and said "I'll bring you something nice." What to go with it, I asked? "Meat." Uh well yeah okay, but... Without hesitation he suggested the t-bone. Fine, I'll have that! I don't eat a lot of red meat these days but if that's the recommendation...And, oh my goodness.What a steak. Big. Excellent quality, well marbled just the slightest hair toward fatty, tender, seasoned brilliantly. I ordered it rare and it came out just right. The side of white beans were seasoned to complement the steak in a rare and wonderful way. This was not some fancied-up dish trying to get into a trendy magazine, it was a classic Italian meal meant to please a hungry appetite, and oh did it.My date said her pasta was just a hair toward hard but otherwise fine. I can't say much else about it because I didn't try any, had my face too deeply buried in my meat. She tried a few bites, and nodded along with me.Dessert: apple pie with vanilla ice cream, as good as everything else, not an afterthought like desserts can sometimes seem to be. Even the berries next to it were carefully selected.I had a shot of espresso that made me grin. Like with gin, I'm hard to please with my coffee and this was terrific, just excellent, deep foamy crema, flavorful but not at all bitter. Herself took a snapshot of me rolling my eyes when I tasted it.We had a good time. I'm eager to go back.

16.description: I came to this restaurant on a weekend trip to Chicago with some friends. When you first walk in you get to see some beautiful decor even in a rather small restaurant. The menu is well sized and offers you plenty of options to close from. During the time that I was visiting they had a specials menu and I ordered a rack of lamb off of that menu. The rack of lamb was cooked very well and had a beautiful char on it. The sauce for the rack of lamb is what helped put the entire dish together. It was warm, fragrant, creamy, and balanced out the other components of the dish. It was a little pricey but was still an excellent meal.The service was great and everything was delivered within good time and together. This is definitely a place for people to check out if they get the chance.

13.description: The best Italian food! Great vibes and even better wine!

11.description: Ate here during restaurant week. We picked this restaurant because of the variety of choices on their restaurant week menu. All three courses on the $33 menu were full sized. Everything was prepared perfectly and delicious. Pastas and desserts are made in house and it shows. Our server was able to answer my numerous questions about the menu choices and did not even get annoyed with me (I had a LOT of questions! ). The place is small, but comfortable. I looked at the regular menu too and the choices are many and prices are reasonable. Recommend the eggplant parmigiana-type appetizer...very particular about this dish and it was excellent!!

39.description: Lovely atmosphere and nice staff. Unfortunately the food left a lot to be desired. At the recommendation of the waiter I chose the zuppa Livornese. It was a terrible disappointment.The soup itself was flavorless and uninspired. There was one prawn and one scallop (a 20#), a handful of mussels, a few small clams, and a single portion of baby octopus.
