I'm not sure why the soup was so bland other than it was woefully underseasoned.  It was an abyssmal disappointment. Maybe another selection would have been a better choice. I would try Sofi again at some point to give them a second choice.Chris

37.description: Host was very nice. Outside patio was nice initially, but then I kept getting dripped on by some unknown water source. It was not raining. I think the building above had some condensation from something. Waiter was super slow. Quail and octopus were not very good. Server removed food from final bill, so that was appreciated. Won't be back. Disappointed.

0.description: This is our go-to place before going to the Joffrey Ballet. I've been very impressed each visit, and usually find something from the "specials of the day" menu. This time it was a Linguini with large (whole) Scampi in an Imperial sauce -- a white wine with cream and saffron concoction that had great shrimp flavor and a touch of garlic. Really wonderful. My wife and daughter shared the classic Bolognese dish, another favorite. The soup and salad choices were also great, and we were pleased with the wine recommendation. Can't think of a better treat than Sofi plus Joffrey.

38.description: Some of the loveliest pasta I've had outside Rome.  Get the cacio e pepe with spaghetti (even better than in Italy -- is that possible?) and don't miss the bolognese.  I don't like meat, but that bolognese is out of this world.Perfect amount of gelato in the affogato (in the US restaurants tend to put way too much).  Warm, intelligent, friendly service and excellent cocktails, too.  A really lovely evening in a darling neighborhood spot.

51.description: I went to Sofi during a business trip, out of the 4.5 stars in Yelp reviews, and I was there without any specific expectations.The menu options were considerably large and all seemed very appealing. It was a hard choice, bur I ended up ordering a chef special: linguine with half a lobster and imperial sauce. Dish presentation was good and amount was just what I wished for. The pasta was perfectly cooked al dente, and the sauce was great, creamy with just the right amount of spiciness. The lobster was also quite good, but it didn't feel it was fresh because the meat was somewhat stuck to the shell. However, that was a really minor issue and didn't stop me from greatly enjoying the dish.I took the ricotta cheesecake for dessert. Ii was happy it wasn't one of those excessively sweet cheesecakes. It came lightly warmed, which helped me appreciate the slight saltiness of the cheese mixed with sweetness that makes it a cake. Just my type!The ambience is old style wooden tables and dimmed light, which makes it perfect for a romantic night out. Also, not excessively pricey considering the quality.Overall, I highly recommend Sofi.

27.description: Very good Italian food. Pasta was cooked to perfection and had exquisite flavor. Waiter was very attentive and was a font of information not only regarding the menu, but of things we needed to check out in Chicago that were off the beaten touristy path. This is not one of those Italian places where you will be presented with so much food that your grandchildren will inherit some. It's definitely quality over quantity here. Our meal was impeccable from start to dessert. On par with the finest Italian restaurants that you'll find in the enclaves of the big northeastern cities that set the bar in the U.S. for this style of dining.Next time I'm in the Windy City, I'm sure to visit again.

32.description: The pasta is very good, I've been their twice.  I live 50 feet away, so it should be my local.  However, it's a bit overpriced and the last trip did it for me.  I ordered a not inexpensive bottle of wine, and the waiter brought it over, showed it to me, and then said I should REALLY get this other bottle (in his other hand), it tasted better.......and it's $20 more.   And then just stared at me.I respectfully asked for the bottle I ordered, and never saw that waiter again until the check came.  Hi attitude definitely changed.  I don't need people upselling me when I'm trying to have a relaxing dinner.

54.description: Last minute. Didn't need a reservation on a Saturday. Great food, price and service. Highly recommend.

48.description: This is a great spot for authentic Italian food.  We came in and was seated immediately.  The entire staff was very friendly and attentive.  Food arrived quick and was over the top delicious.  Strongly recommend this place if your visiting Chicago and looking for great Italian food at an amazing price.

44.description: I'm always on the lookout for places that offer a decent Cacio e Pepe dish and wanted to cross this place off the list.  We took my brother here for dinner during his last visit a month ago.  I was 40 weeks pregnant and a few days past my due date.  Made reservations and were seated promptly.  It was pretty busy, crowded, and loud.  It took a while for the server to greet us and take our drink orders.  He was pretty no nonsense, skip the small talk kinda guy.  I ordered the Cavatelli Cacio e Pepe while Hubby had a lobster spaghetti dish, and brother tried the Orecchiette with broccoli rapa and sweet and spicy sausage.  The entire meal was so disappointing!  The pasta was overcooked, the lobster meat didn't taste fresh, and the cacio e pepe was the most disappointing of all.  There was barely any flavor or sauce (very little at the bottom of the dish) and too much pasta that wasn't tossed in what sauce was there.  I was thrown off by the pasta since cacio e pepe is usually made with a thin spaghetti.  I felt so bad that we took my brother here.Not sure how this place has an average 4.5 star Yelp rating.

24.description: Great food and great service. I got the gnocchi bava & it was pretty good. The wine recommendation was good and the seafood dishes thst my sisters got was pretty good as well. I would definitely go back next time I  go to Chicago.

7.description: I came here for dinner on a Saturday evening (~8pm).  The restaurant wasn't too packed so we were seated immediately (note: I did make reservations as well).Atmosphere: nice and cozy place, good for dates (maybe dessert only?-at least desserts looked tasty).Food - NOT impressed at all!  AppetizersTegamino Polpettine ($10) - veal meatballs in a zesty tomato sauce.  The meatballs tasted ok, but nothing amazing.  I have tried better from potlucks that I have attended.Trofie Genovese ($16)- fresh pasta with pesto and diced potatoes.  The entree was very flavorless so if you like bland food go for it.  It tasted likecooked pasta mixed with watered down pesto sauce..not impressed nor will i pay $16 for pasta like this again.. :/Aragosta Porcini Risotti ($24) - lobster chucks and mushrooms in light fish broth.  I would stay away from ordering this unless you really like the smell of raw fish or something very stinky!! I felt like I was going to gag from the smell and after trying it....ek...I couldn't taste the lobster because something in this entree really smelled horrible!! I am pretty sure that 99% of the people I know will NOT enjoy this.. so this is just a warning...definitely not worth $24!!Ravioli Vitello Pasticciati ($18) - cream sauce and bolognese ragout (this is like meat sauce).  I would say this was the better tasting items of the night...how can you go wrong with meat sauce and ravioli?  It wasn't anything to die for though.  The price was a little overpriced here as well.Customer service - it was ok, we did end up waiting awhile to order and then waiting awhile to get our checks.  The waiter was friendly though.Parking - street parking right across the street (pay at meter), or better idea is the red line (Harrison stop)I don't think I'll be back here... unless maybe it was for dessert or the lobster bisque that I have yet to try..

49.description: I really enjoy the food here, it's just a bit pricey. I've had pasta dishes both times and been really pleased, especially with the tagliatelle bolognese.  Delicious.

40.description: The restaurant looks  nice but I've had much better Italian food! I would not recommend this place to anyone and I will not be coming back. I thought because it was highly rated that it would be good but me and my friend were disappointed. And I told my waiter that my food my food wasn't good and he laughed and said he wasn't the chef.

53.description: I got the mediteranian seafood risotto - rise and clams cooked seperately coming thru as rise putting with clams.... Probably not core to their repertoire. It is a nice place - risotto not.

30.description: Very disappointed. The atmosphere is great and the story behind the owner and the staff lead you to believe the food is authentic and fresh and delicious.  But it is blah. Salads were boring. Lobster ravioli did not taste like anything. Nothing ordered at the table was exceptionally memorable.  Oh and the Parmesan cheese was clumpy powder that I would swear was some kind of processed Kraft product.  Couldn't bring myself to order dessert. Very pricy and extremely slow service.

46.description: Authentic Italian! Wine is great, the food is better. Our waiter Roberto made the experience even better. Thumbs up. Next time I come back to Chicago its a definite must go.

1.description: This place is one of the greatest Italian restaurants I have ever been to. I took my girlfriend there on Valentine's Day for dinner. We were impressed and overjoyed at our dining experience. The bread and oil was perfect. We got the Lobster Bisque (was different than most Lobster Bisques, but tasty nonetheless) for an appetizer. For an entree I got the Rigatoni Contadina, which was absolutely phenomenal. My girlfriend got the Tortolini Ricotta, which was also quite tasty. We shared each other's dishes because we could not decide which was better. For dinner we split a canoli and some gelati. Both were perfect. Also, another classy sidenote that captures the class and ambiance of this place, my girlfriend along with every other female that attended that evening, received a fresh rose upon exiting the venue.This place is now my favorite Italian go to. Check it out, seriously!

55.description: The best thing about this restaurant is its atmosphere; a lot of Italian places end up feeling kind of dark and stuffy, even the nice ones, but this one has a lot of natural light and is generally really pleasant; I would definitely come for an early date -- it looks upscale and the food is going to work for almost anyone (can't vouch for vegans, gluton, etc). I came with a large group, (~10 people), and got to try a lot of the appetizers, entrees, and desserts -- without overwhelming the details my short story food wise was that it was solid but not special. For the entrees especially I really enjoyed the first couple of bites for almost everything but then got bored after that.

9.description: I went for the 1st time on 1/30/16 with my sister, her husband and my date.  The owner or manager of the restaurant made the evening GREAT.  We arrived on time for our 7pm reservation.  Due to the restaurant being super packed, the owner/manager offered us a free glass of champagne while he put a great table together for us.  I enjoyed the tuna for an appetizer, & short ribs of beef in pasta.  They were out of my dessert so they offered me a free shot.  Sometimes things happen to amazing restaurants, but its how you treat your customers that will make them come back.  We will definitely come back and refer Sofi's to all our friends.  GREAT JOB SOFI's!!  Food is as AMAZING as the service!!!!

26.description: We went to this restaurant as a group and the service, as well as the food, was disappointing.  As one member of our group noted:  "It tasted like it had come out of a Chef Boyardee can."The food came out at different times (10-15 min. apart) for different parts of our table (group of about 15) and one order was completely wrong so she ended up eating when all the rest of us were done.  Very disappointing experience.

25.description: Great food on a quiet and cute street in Printer's Row - definitely recommend! The only thing I'd change is the glaring street light right over our table on the patio... Other than that, it was a great experience!

12.description: Best al dente spaghetti in their seafood dish. Loved it so much I ordered a second portion but they must have gotten busy because the second time around the noodles were soft. Grateful they did it right the first time.

59.description: Our pasta came out very undercooked on 2/3 dishes... The sauce was very good though. Asked for a dessert for a birthday and it never came : ( waitress was very nice- unimpressed by management! Thumbs down wouldn't go back

21.description: Our server was very polite. Food was excellent. Souffle was divine (more like chocolate lava cake). I will def. come back.

17.description: Very good Italian food. Pasta was cooked to perfection and had exquisite flavor. Waiter was very attentive and was a font of information not only regarding the menu, but of things we needed to check out in Chicago that were off the beaten touristy path. This is not one of those Italian places where you will be presented with so much food that your grandchildren will inherit some. It's definitely quality over quantity here. Our meal was impeccable from start to dessert. On par with the finest Italian restaurants that you'll find in the enclaves of the big northeastern cities that set the bar in the U.S. for this style of dining.Next time I'm in the Windy City, I'm sure to visit again.

10.description: Food is amazing.  We ordered 3 appetizers including seafood, veal meatballs and Italian sausage.  Gnocchi dinner was best Gnocchi ever in both taste and texture.  Good ambiance and staff is very attentive and helpful.  Owner was personable and promptly greeted us upon arrival and talked with us before we left.  Highly recommend for anyone wanting great italian food in Chicago.

5.description: Lived in the neighborhood for 2 years and our first time at Sofi.  Got here about 90 minutes for closing.  Roberto from Naples was our waiter.  He was really good.  He knew the menu and the wine to go with our selections.  We chose the 2006 Barolo and it was perfect.  Roberto aerated the wine for us and I never had to touch the bottle the evening.The orecchiette was prepared perfectly.Looking forward to the gnocchi, paccheri focaccia, ravioli and many many more.I am really happy Sofi is in the South Loop.  I feel like it's all mine.

3.description: Incredible Valentine's Day dinner experience. I've travelled all around Italy (Florence, Rome, Venice, Bologna) & this place is AUTHENTIC. Our waiter was Italian & very friendly. I got the bolognese which was fabulous & like I said, very authentic. My boyfriend got the penne filante & loved it. Portions were typical Italian, hearty but not the healing piles of pasta we're used to in American restaurants. But nonetheless, it was just the right amount of food. For dessert we shared the vanilla ice cream with berries & it was wonderful. We made reservations, so on a weekend I would definitely recommend doing that because the place itself is kind of small. Dress is casual, more so than we were expecting. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone seeking an actual authentic Italian dining experience in Chicago.

35.description: Very nice place with great fresh food. Quiet, small but a real gem. Staff was very friendly.

19.description: Went for the first time last night. Thought it was not going to be child friendly, but they easily accommodated a stroller. The service, wine and food was excellent. I love spaghetti carbonara and it was fabulous.

28.description: I came to this restaurant on a weekend trip to Chicago with some friends. When you first walk in you get to see some beautiful decor even in a rather small restaurant. The menu is well sized and offers you plenty of options to close from. During the time that I was visiting they had a specials menu and I ordered a rack of lamb off of that menu. The rack of lamb was cooked very well and had a beautiful char on it. The sauce for the rack of lamb is what helped put the entire dish together. It was warm, fragrant, creamy, and balanced out the other components of the dish. It was a little pricey but was still an excellent meal.The service was great and everything was delivered within good time and together. This is definitely a place for people to check out if they get the chance.

45.description: I had the linguine jumbo prawns with imperial sauce last night and it was to die for. Staff was very friendly too, highly recommend coming here.

33.description: One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago...never have had a bad mean here and this is real Italian food served by actual Italians. The space is lovely, making for a charming experience. My only complaint is one of the servers who has waited on me a number of times feels the need to complain about how tired he is from working so much, as he hands me a $180 check - it makes me want to tell him how hard I will have to work to earn enough for the bill. Beyond that, the place is excellent and recommend it to everybody.

43.description: We started with the veal meatballs -the sauce was very tasty, but not too rich.  My husband ordered the Tagliatana - Beef Tenderloin.  The portion size was a good-sized meal for him and he was very happy with his choice.  I had the Paccheri Focaccia with double smoked bacon/sage/garlic/ and creamy touch of tomatoes.  It was a nice sized portion.  I chose the lemon sorbet for dessert- the flavor was quite strong, but it was a good way to end a wonderful meal.

2.description: This is a fantastic neighborhood joint with delicious and authentic Italian cuisine. Every single thing I've had on the menu is delicious and you can't help but eat everything in front of your face. I would eat here all the time if I wasn't fearful of what my waistline would look like.My boyfriend and I always seem to end up here on holidays, having a great time enjoying dinner at the bar last NYE, and having gone there for Valentine's Day just last night. Of course, they were pretty packed on both occasions, and the space is pretty small, but they do a great job accommodating everyone, and last night as we left the hostess handed all the ladies a rose. A cute touch which made me smile. Recommend to anyone looking for a date night out or just a dinner with friends, prices are very reasonable for the food and ambience you will experience!

18.description: My dinner was awesome. Staff was great. This is right by the Hotel Blake - you can walk there. The doorman from the hotel, Showtime, recommended I check this place out. I had the duck ragut pappardelle (great flavor); fingerling potatoes (loved the rosemary, garlic and bacon!) and the chocolate soufflé (like a molten lava cake). All that with a glass of wine really warmed me up on a freezing cold night and I slept so well. Dinner for one was about $60. Great spot for a good Italian dinner.

41.description: Sofi was a beautiful dining experience. Tastefully decorated and very intimate. They could use some soft background music bc at times it was too quiet but none the less, this would be a great date spot or a place to take clients for a nice meal. I ordered the Garganelli pasta special with peas and prosciutto in a cream sauce. Added the summer truffles bc...why not!!?! So good!!!  The bread and olive oil was a delirious start to the meal and kudos to the bartender for a delicious dirty martini with blue cheese olives. I'll be back!

52.description: On our last night of our mini-vakay to Chicago, we wanted a good Italian restaurant. Not one of those that piles huge portions of overcooked pasta on your plate, but something *good*. Sooo glad we made reservations Sofi! The first 15 minutes of our dining experience were marred by the group of six drunk and very loud people sitting right next to us. If I'd been the maitre'd, I would have seated a couple like us in a different section of the small restaurant to begin with, but they did offer to move us a couple times. The group was just finishing their dessert so we opted to stay put. After they left, the rest of the night was perfection. I found the service to be excellent but not overly attentive. The fried artichoke & mozarella appetizer was good, but the lobster linguini with Imperial sauce was to die for. Perfectly al dente pasta, half a Maine lobster and enough sauce to make each mouthful a heavenly experience.We were stuffed by the time our wonderful waiter thrust dessert menus in our hands, so we only ordered the hazelnut gelato to share. But the waiter surprised us with a complimentary order of creme brulee, saying "Happy anniversary!" (It was really our honeymoon, but I can see his confusion because we're firmly middle-aged. LOL) My husband happily gobbled the gelato all by himself while I dug into a surprisingly big creme brulee. It was way too much food but you can bet I scraped out every single bit. They were lucky I didn't lick each and every plate!

50.description: I want to love this restaurant. It's in my neighborhood, and I enjoy a nice Italian meal. I've been here twice now, and each time I've felt like the food was good but nothing special and the service was curt and unfriendly. The first time we went, I ordered the Ravioli Aragosta (lobster ravioli), which was good but not great. We went again last night because I wanted to give the place another try. I ordered something different-- the Tagliatelle Bolognese, which again was good but didn't blow me away. My fiancé felt the same about his order of the Penne Filanti. What disappoints me most about this restaurant, though, is the service. Each time we've gone, we've had a different waiter, and both acted in the same rushed, curt manner. Meanwhile, however, we noticed that other patrons were treated in a more friendly manner. It seems that most of the clientele here are older. My fiancé and I are in our late 20's, and we can't help but feel like there's some sort of age discrimination going on with us being ignored while meanwhile the waiters joke around and chat with the older patrons. I understand that these people may be regulars, but the staff should recognize that other patrons (such as ourselves) have the potential to become regulars too--if we receive good service.All in all, it's not a bad restaurant, but between the just ok food, unfriendly service, and fairly high prices for pasta, I don't think we'll be returning anytime soon, despite the fact that it's nearby.

4.description: I ordered spaghetti vongole and carbonara. They both were delicious, although it wasn't filling. Highly recommended. The service was excellent and very welcoming.

6.description: I'm always on the lookout for places that offer a decent Cacio e Pepe dish and wanted to cross this place off the list.  We took my brother here for dinner during his last visit a month ago.  I was 40 weeks pregnant and a few days past my due date.  Made reservations and were seated promptly.  It was pretty busy, crowded, and loud.  It took a while for the server to greet us and take our drink orders.  He was pretty no nonsense, skip the small talk kinda guy.  I ordered the Cavatelli Cacio e Pepe while Hubby had a lobster spaghetti dish, and brother tried the Orecchiette with broccoli rapa and sweet and spicy sausage.  The entire meal was so disappointing!  The pasta was overcooked, the lobster meat didn't taste fresh, and the cacio e pepe was the most disappointing of all.  There was barely any flavor or sauce (very little at the bottom of the dish) and too much pasta that wasn't tossed in what sauce was there.  I was thrown off by the pasta since cacio e pepe is usually made with a thin spaghetti.  I felt so bad that we took my brother here.Not sure how this place has an average 4.5 star Yelp rating.

22.description: This place is an amazing find for any resident or non resident in the Chicago area.  I came to Chicago to run the marathon and of course, I had to carbo load the night before.  I found Sofi on yelp and surprisingly was able to get a reservation for 7 PM.  Upon walking up you'll notice both indoor and outdoor seating are available.   You'll also notice that the manager is speaking Italian, this to me told me I made the right call.  The restaurant has an extensive wine list and true Italian cuisines.  My girlfriend has a gluten allergy and they were able to accommodate her with gluten free penne on any dish of her choosing.  I got the Paccheri Focaccia w/double smoked bacon/sage/garlic/ and creamy touch of tomatoes.  The pasta is whole made and some of the best I've ever had.  After a great meal I awoke the next day feeling fully loaded and ready to run.  Thats Amore!

15.description: I have been wanting to try this place for a while. Space wise its kind of cramp but I wasn't bothered in our small corner. Our server was so sweet, patient, and gave great recommendations. I wish I could remember his name but he had great locks! My only regret is that I was sick so I couldn't taste how good it was, it was good, but imagine if I was not sick! Though the spicy pasta was not spicy at all.... but it was still great.Only thing is that it was Pricey, and my pasta bowl was so small.. but high quality. Also my friend got the tropical salad and she couldn't stop staying how great it was.

57.description: Had a really nice relaxing meal.  Wait staff were friendly. Meal portions were a good size and not overly done. Food was very good, filling and tasty!

20.description: Fantastic staff and a menu with lots of choices but not overwhelming. Beautiful space with a warm ambiance. I was impressed with Sofi and I think the olive oil used for dipping was the best I have ever tasted

36.description: Perfect night for al fresco dining. Terrific roasted beet salad in endive.  My fresh pappardelle with duck ragu was outstanding! Cavateli was light and delicious. Fabulous grilled veges. Professional staff. Reasonable prices.

14.description: Great food on a quiet and cute street in Printer's Row - definitely recommend! The only thing I'd change is the glaring street light right over our table on the patio... Other than that, it was a great experience!

58.description: Amarit is okay.  The food is okay, the prices are okay, the staff are okay.  Definitely a place where you can get food quickly.  Online ordering is very nice.  I have used a coupon once with them and they weren't sure how to approach that, even though I got the coupon off of their website seconds before ordering.  If you are in the South Loop, I'd give it a try.

56.description: Delicious and very fresh tasting.  The ambiance of the restaurant might be in the 3 star range, but this is top of the list for my thai take out.

29.description: Stopped in for lunch, the service was very nice & fast. I had my lunch within 5 minutes. I had the Mongolian beef it was well above average. I would definitely come back and I would definitely recommend it.

42.description: I ordered carry out one afternoon for lunch.  It was my first time in and I didn't expect the interior to be as cute as it was.  It made me want to end my work day early have have a cocktail.  The Mongolian beef was pretty good, the pad Thai was not.  I will definitely try some other things on the menu in the future.

23.description: Sitting here now sipping on an ice cold Singhs awaiting my 2nd roll. Just finished a full Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll that was absolutely amazing.....edible art at a minimum.  Before getting my roll the sushi chef gave me some gratas shashimi...which was wonderful. My 2nd roll was a Spicy Rainbow which was delicious. This place is highly recommended.

47.description: The Crab Rangoon Appetizer and Mongolian Beef Entree are my favorite dishes. I highly suggest trying this restaurant out if you have not done so already.

8.description: My gf and I have found the best keep Asian secret  at this place...food is always consistently fresh and staff are great! Really chill place to hang late night or if ever you want to grab a smooth drink and good food with the lady friend during a snowy night. Thank me later ;-)

31.description: I really enjoyed everything we had at Amarit. I had crab meat fried rice, which was delicious. The portion was large-I wasn't able to finish it all. My husband also enjoyed his pineapple fried rice. It came in a pineapple, which was a nice touch. Good meal, especially for the price. We will definitely be back.

34.description: Rated for this 'class', genre of restaurant.  Dinner 4 ppl -- Down from 5 star lunch due to disappointingly Odd service: waitress immediately wanted appetizer order, before beverages (!?); needed water at times; would have ordered another wine...  Food arrived timely and hot tho.  Loved the sushi rolls 1) w/ tomago, tofu, etc 2) 'crunchy gommae'.. And massuman(?) and 2 noodle dishes were good.

16.description: Not a fan, pad Thai was very plain, springs rolls had no substance, will not order again.

13.description: Went there several times since we discovered this place. It is a more quiet restaurant which we love. They are good for families and they accommodate us with the stroller! Last time we ordered the FIRE DRAGON roll, it is a must have! Delicious and so beautifully presented!Will go back for more sushi! And their soups are great and portions are large.

11.description: Sitting here now sipping on an ice cold Singhs awaiting my 2nd roll. Just finished a full Crunchy Spicy Tuna roll that was absolutely amazing.....edible art at a minimum.  Before getting my roll the sushi chef gave me some gratas shashimi...which was wonderful. My 2nd roll was a Spicy Rainbow which was delicious. This place is highly recommended.

39.description: Fast and they use very fresh ingredients.  Love the Crab Rangoon and Duck in Spicy Basil sauce is a must try!

37.description: We orderd the chicken pad thai, chicken pad see ew, beef fried rice, amarit beef steak, chicken panang curry. I really love the panang curry and pad see ew. We ordered sushi too just forgot the names, but I was yummy too!

0.description: It's been a while since I have been here but its still simple and good!Can't tell you how much I have missed good maki (Sushi). Had Salmon and a Tuna avocado maki. The fish was excellent, melted in my mouth. I want to know where they get it! Also the avocado was perfectly ripe. Not a brown spot in site and nice and soft but still cut perfectly. The ginger was on pointed and pickled nicely.Also had their jasmine rice and chicken soup in a clear broth. Very light and what I was looking for. They make their soups to order so you have to wait a few minutes for it to cone out. The only negative on the food is the soup had a touch too much salt but probably good for most people.Service was also on point, not obtrusive, and there when you needed something.Bonus on checkin they offer a 15% discount. Not sure how long that will last so get it while its good.

38.description: Amarit is a pretty good Thai restaurant that gives a discount to Yelpers who check in .I had a dish I've never had before which kind of reminded me of  Thai Chili.At Thai places I often order  Chicken with Basil and Chili and that's what I thought  I ordered.Well there was one difference , the meat was ground.I liked it ! My wife had Pad Thai which we both liked and fortunately the place had Tad Man Pla , the fish cakes , which I've always liked.They had a mid western touch , being made from walleye.You can order beer and wine.The service is efficient and friendly.The atmosphere is calm !Generally I like that.I've yet to figure out why people want a restaurant to be a party scene.Although I admit there was little kid grooving to the music and we and other patrons did bop along with him.

51.description: Amarit Thai Restaurant was not special, but it wasn't too bad- it was pretty average Thai food.  The service was fast and friendly, and the prices were very reasonable.  We had fish cakes (not amazing) and potstickers (very good) for starters.  I ordered the Ram Chicken for an entree.  The chicken is served on a bed of steamed broccoli, covered in a very good peanut sauce, with a bowl of rice on the side.  The peanut sauce was great, but I enjoyed the broccoli more than the chicken, which didn't taste very fresh.

27.description: I DO NOT understand HOW this place gets over 1 star. We ordered takeout of the fried calamari, 2 Mongolian Beef and the Shrimp Wonton soup. (~$39)  There is no reason why food SO DISGUSTING should ever be sold to the public, unless they are SUPER CHEAP!!!  The "shrimp" is just a soft rice-like mixture dyed pink ....and I have no idea how on earth they were able to make the "wonton" runny, but they did. It turned into a nauseating, gelatinous blob in the mouth. At the bottom of the container of tasteless hot water, we found 2 shrimp. The calamari tasted as if it'd been sitting in water for decades and was so bland that not even the over-processed sauce could save it. The chalky "mongolian beef" dish tasted like some over-salted buffet style garbage you'd get at Panda Express, and came w/a mini-me portion of white rice. Truthfully, you'd probably be better off spending your money at PandaEx than this place. What a rip off! Never EVER again!!

32.description: Here for appetizers and drinks. Huge portions of perfectly prepared rolled sushi. Try the saketini-it was really, really good!

54.description: Ordered twice from Amarit and they've become my go-to Thai place.I had their Pad Thai and Fried Spicy Basil Leaves with Meat so far: will have Pad Thai again (it tastes like what you expect a Pad Thai to taste=safe choice).But I think I will be cautious of their meat dishes in the future since the beef in Fried Spicy Basil Leaves dish was super tough.

48.description: For a restaurant who labeled as "Thai Resto" it baffled me that I enjoy their maki more than their phad tai. So there.

44.description: It took quite a while for Amarit to win me over. The first thing I ever got there was pad thai and I was not a fan. Now that they have remodeled and revamped the menu, things are really looking up. I love love love the chicken/beef noodle soup. I've tried both and really enjoyed them (w/ extra bean sprouts) and also the veggie variety is good too. The spicy chicken curry is great, but the bean sprouts are super long and hard to eat. Great flavor though! I'm also a fan of the pineapple fried rice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. It's not the best thai in the world, but it's definitely the best in South Loop.

24.description: Pad See Ew. Awesome. Green Curry. Kang Karee Kai. Awesome. Bulls, bears, and dynamite roll. Amazing. I live a few blocks away and have ate here 3 times in the past 3 weeks.

7.description: Decided to try something a little further from my office for lunch the other day and thai-inspired sushi sounded like a good option. I ordered a sashimi combo that came with some chef's choice cuts and my choice of a special roll. Overall, the fish was fresh and the roll was okay, but I just wish it had yielded more food for the pricetag. I may try some of their other rolls and dishes and re-assess the situation at a later date, but for now, it's just A-OK.

49.description: This food is flavorless at best and taste funny at worst. I think probably the worst Thai I've ever had. Tom kha gai was blah.

40.description: We ordered delivery..took much longer than the time told, ill blame the rain that night... Food...it was OKWe loved the chicken noodle soup and the grilled chicken satay! I will probably order soup here if we dine again We also had the curry panga nue. The peanut sauce was a bit much for me. None the less we would go back to try other dishes

53.description: 5 stars for service. 5 stars for food. 10 stars for the alcoholic beverages. Great food for reasonable price. Clearly this place is popular, since we were there, we saw 8 other tables fill up...The food was really yummy and the cocktails...O,M,G -- sooo good and only for $7 and it came in decent sizes. I would totally come back to this place again!

30.description: I am giving it four stars and I will tell you my reasons why - 1) They have singapore sling on the drink menu - long story short but my 90-something granny has dementia and is always ordering singapore slings at restaurants which usually have no idea what she is talking about. No worries granny, Amarit has you covered xo ;)2) Prices were very reasonable for where it is located3) Food was not great, but it was not bad either and it came out quick4) Crab ragoons were pretty decent5) Atmosphere was a nice medium, not too posh, not a dump6) They have cashews in their pineapple fried rice!7) We were able to be seated quickly8) Service was fair in that kind of reserved asian style9) 15% off with Yelp checkin - this is the only fault of the experience, I do not believe we received our 15% off when we checked out despite showing to host at beginning of meal. An oversight I am sure. Calling now to see if they will honor.

46.description: I've eaten at Amarit many times, but never reviewed it. Previously I would have given it 3 stars. But they recently remodeled the space and added a sushi bar.  The new space looks great, and the same great Thai menu is still there. While I love sushi, my problem is that the space smelled like a fish market when I walked in. It was very off putting.

1.description: I stopped by here for a quick and early dinner after work because I was desperately craving noodles (when am I not?). The restaurant was fairly empty since it was only 5:00, so the service was extremely quick and efficient! The menu had a lot of variety, which sometimes worries me at any Asian restaurant, but the pad see eiw that I got was good! This is not blow-your-mind food, but if you're in the neighborhood and want some Thai food, I would recommend stopping in.

55.description: Just ordered Sesame Chicken & Pad Khee Moa. Delivery was quick. But the food was Meh. Received very few veggies in the noodle dish & the chicken was bland. Boring meal.

9.description: I am giving it four stars and I will tell you my reasons why - 1) They have singapore sling on the drink menu - long story short but my 90-something granny has dementia and is always ordering singapore slings at restaurants which usually have no idea what she is talking about. No worries granny, Amarit has you covered xo ;)2) Prices were very reasonable for where it is located3) Food was not great, but it was not bad either and it came out quick4) Crab ragoons were pretty decent5) Atmosphere was a nice medium, not too posh, not a dump6) They have cashews in their pineapple fried rice!7) We were able to be seated quickly8) Service was fair in that kind of reserved asian style9) 15% off with Yelp checkin - this is the only fault of the experience, I do not believe we received our 15% off when we checked out despite showing to host at beginning of meal. An oversight I am sure. Calling now to see if they will honor.

26.description: One of my favorite places to order from for lunch. They have great sushi -- I'm obsessed with their Cubs Roll -- and fast delivery!

25.description: Living in the neighborhood I've been looking for a good Asian food restaurant, particularly Thai food. Amarit Thai is the best I have found and I intend on going back... Again and again and again!! It'll be difficult not to go a million times a week! We went last night for dinner and can't stop talking about it. They are incredibly well priced, and the portions are fantastic. My husband got the Panang Nu curry with chicken. It had really great flavor, it was perfectly spicy, and it was the perfect portion size for him. I had the pineapple fried rice and wow! So good! It comes served in a hollowed out pineapple, it's a generous portion (I took home leftovers which were JUST as delicious the second time around!) and has plenty of chicken, cashews, pineapple, and veggies. The BEST part about our dining experience was dessert. We had the mango and sticky rice. That dish is heaven on a plate. It's seasonal, so I'll take as much as I can get for as long as they have it. I would eat it every night if I could!! Love love love. Will for sure be back.

12.description: good food, good service :)

59.description: Okay, so the beef curry didn't taste all that bad. But what kind of curry has no vegetables? Am i crazy to be minorly (yes, minorly is not a real word) outraged?

21.description: Really good consistent Chinese food. I have ordered from here 6 times and every time been so happy. The Pad See Eiw, wonton soup, spicy tuna rolll & chicken curry are all so good!

17.description: BEST PAD THAI YOU'LL EVER HAVE THE PLEASURE OF TASTING!I started eating here when the restaurant was located at the corner of Delaware and State.  Now I live in the north suburbs and will literally go out of my way to drive there for carry out.  I have this phone number saved in my contacts.  I dream about Amarit Pad Thai.

10.description: food is very mediocre, does not feel very authentic, and very bland. the mushroom is from a can, pad thai is quite sticky..and the portion is a bit small

5.description: I really like this place because the service is excellent. They are so friendly and nice. I've been there once for dining in and then to pick up an order. Dining in I had the pineapple fried rice. It was actually served in a pineapple. Ha ha... I got a kick out of that one. The quantity was huge. I think I made about 2 meals out of that.Server was super friendly and came to check on us and kept filling the water glasses.Next time I went there to pick up. I had the roasted duck. The order was ready when I got there and a very friendly guy at the counter handed me the order. Again everything was great.This remains to be one of my fav. Thai spots in the area.

3.description: I would consider myself extremely well-versed in ordering Pad Thai. Not only is it my favorite dish, I have ordered it from 100+ unique Thai restaurants in the Chicagoland area through my years. Quality can range from OK to amazing as it's a pretty easy dish to make right. Another fact I would like to point out, I don't really leave negative reviews on Yelp. I don't usually have negative experiences because I use Yelp to sift through the junk. Things didn't work out as planned this time...I ordered the Pad Thai and an order of crab rangoons for lunch on delivery. This Pad Thai was literally the WORST I have ever had. Flavorless, lack of presentation, and terrible consistency are ways you can start describing the abomination of food they call Pad Thai. I ordered spicy, and it was not remotely spicy. It was like the noodles were made of blandly-seasoned cardboard with 2 small pieces of chicken mixed in. I made it a bit better by dousing it with various hot sauces, but ultimately it was inedible. I can confidently say I have never thrown out anything I just ordered until now. This experience was a waste of time and money, and I hope this can help someone in the future. The crab rangoons were pretty good.UPDATE: The delivery was quick and the service was friendly.

35.description: Ordered delivery, and when my order came, it was incomplete.  When I called the driver, he tried to tell me my food was in the bag.  No kidding???  I opened the bag and unless there's a false bottom or it's the Tardis, my food is not in here.  When I called the restaurant, wanting a refund because paying 30 bucks for a bowl of Tom Kha and a side of peanut sauce is ridiculous, the woman was unhelpful and combative.  I have never had such a ridiculous reaction to calling in with a problem....  How are you going to treat a customer so poorly after YOUR mistake???   I also I tried a bite of the Tom Kha before giving it back so I could get my money back, and it was watery and thin.  Same with the peanut sauce.  Gross.

19.description: Amarit is a pretty good Thai restaurant that gives a discount to Yelpers who check in .I had a dish I've never had before which kind of reminded me of  Thai Chili.At Thai places I often order  Chicken with Basil and Chili and that's what I thought  I ordered.Well there was one difference , the meat was ground.I liked it ! My wife had Pad Thai which we both liked and fortunately the place had Tad Man Pla , the fish cakes , which I've always liked.They had a mid western touch , being made from walleye.You can order beer and wine.The service is efficient and friendly.The atmosphere is calm !Generally I like that.I've yet to figure out why people want a restaurant to be a party scene.Although I admit there was little kid grooving to the music and we and other patrons did bop along with him.

28.description: Fine if you want something quick and easy, a little underwhelming but it was okay.

45.description: There's nothing bad I could ever say about the service here at Amarit. Bo & Pong are amazing! I work a block away from here & have been coming here for 3yrs. They always greet me with a smile, Wan thank you for such amazing service.

33.description: I love this place. It is one of my top three go to restaurants for carryout when I don't feel like cooking. I'm surprised the portions are so generous as the quality of the food is great and the price is quite low considering the location of the restaurant. They are super quick too; my normal wait time is 10 minutes and the most I've ever been quoted is 20 minutes.The mongolian beef is delicious and my go to.

43.description: Great place for classic Thai dishes and sushi. If you like red meat and spicy, crying tiger is the dish for you. My go to place for refreshing dishes and beer, especially when I'm longing for summer. Bring on the heat!

2.description: Clearly, this restaurant is a target for non-Thai customers. As I am Thai, eating at this Thai restaurant, I can immediately assure that. I came here on Christmas Day for dinner with family only because it's open and closest to our hotel, we ordered pad Thai, tom yum chicken, and crab meat fried rice. All of them were way below to our Thai standards. - Pad Thai was extremely sweet.- Tom yum was not made from scratch. It's so cheap that they just threw chicken, onion, mushroom, and tom yum flavored knorr soup ( I know this because I sometimes used it when I cook at home)- the crab meat fried rice was the only decent here but a little too salty. Overall, the service was friendly. Just extremely disappointed with the food. Again, this is coming from a Thai person. If you want authentic Thai food, this isn't a place for you.

18.description: Best thai in the loop    Their noodle dishes are clutch        Plus, there's great service

41.description: We live in the neighborhood, so this became our go-to out of convenience. After exploring the menu we have discovered that we have no need to go anywhere else.   Let me tell you, their tom yum soup became the standard, a high standard, for me and Thai food. And not just in the US but while we were just in freaking Thailand for three weeks I would often compare the tom yum to our good ol' neighborhood take out in Chicago. Of course the Thai food in Thailand was better at times but many times I felt it was equally delicious. Also, everyone told us we would be ruined with American Thai food after our trip to Thailand but as of last night I am here to tell you that amarit is pretty damn delicious still. Side story: awhile ago they accidentally delivered an extra dish of pad thai. We felt bad (what if someone else is missing their order now?) but not bad enough because we inhaled it. They created a pad thai monster! My hubby was obsessed with pad thai while we traveled and still is. Long story short: the best and most authentic thai food  around IMO. Never change, amarit.

52.description: I've ordered from this place couple of times, mostly because it is really close to my office, but today was last time.I had sweet & sour shrimp for $9.89 with tax, and it was mostly sweet, 4 (no more no less) shrimp with tail on, not impressive at all! Couple of weeks ago I ordered another dish with shrimp, and the same amount was served. It's ridiculous!

50.description: I love a good thai place and this place has a great atmosphere, very awesome and welcoming staff. A good place to feel comfortable eating along or with friends. Saw several groups in there and the delivery guy was constantly on the run. I would say the place is a great local neighborhood spot and though the portions were huge and the food was good, it wasn't the best Thai I've ever had. Maybe I'm just used to a bit sweeter pineapple chicken curry. It's certainly worth trying if you live close.

4.description: We are from out of town & we enjoyed this place so much! The staff was so nice & patient. You could tell the food was really fresh! It was clean & cozy inside.

6.description: I'm unfortunately not a fan and will not likely order from here again. Placed an order for pick-up on a lazy, rainy Saturday evening. The Chicken Pad Thai was extremely bland and the thai noodles were very soggy. Arguably the worst pad thai I've ever had. It was super disappointing especially after all the rave reviews. Oddly, their Thai Iced Teas were amazing though. I wouldn't hesitate to order it again, but our entree was so abysmal that it's hard for me to imagine another item on their menu being any good.Another positive is their staff is super friendly and pleasant. BUT (like most of us) I'm in the business of devouring good food and did not find any here. :(

22.description: Best thai in the loop    Their noodle dishes are clutch        Plus, there's great service

15.description: Always great food for a great price! The sushi is artistic. I recommend the fire dragon. I generally stick with the curry chicken or Kung Pao chicken.Decent assortment of beers, wines and cocktails.

57.description: I was very surprised at how great the food was here!  I've been searching for good Pad See Ew since I moved here from NYC.  Glad that I found the place!  The staff was all very friendly to us.

20.description: The kung pao chicken was terrible. No flavor and super watery sauce. Disappointed I wasted money on this.

36.description: Got carryout here and honestly wasn't impressed. Got the veggie Tom Yum and Singapore noodles. Tom Yum was pretty bland. $8 for a portion for 2 people which I didn't think was worth it. The noodles seemed like they were made out of spaghetti which was a first for me and also was way creamier than I've ever had--it was also like it had a coconut milk base. Nothing was spicy either which was disappointing given I was eating Thai. Don't think I'll be back.

14.description: We orderd the chicken pad thai, chicken pad see ew, beef fried rice, amarit beef steak, chicken panang curry. I really love the panang curry and pad see ew. We ordered sushi too just forgot the names, but I was yummy too!

3.description: Located within Target, clean location, but poor service. Baristas clearly DGAF. They need to train/ retrain the baristas to make some drinks on the menu. The last time I went here I paid $5 for a venti Soy Chai and received nothing but steamed soy milk. Thanks, but I can steam milk at home for a lot less.

1.description: Terrible service. They took my order and then after I paid they notified me they did not have it. Then they didn't want to make a new drink for me, more concerned with a conversation they were having amongst each other. Eventually they made a different drink.I left and by the time I got to my destination I realized they didn't put the appropriate amount of espresso for a venti drink and it tasted like chocolate milk. All around poor service compared to most other Starbucks.I should have just asked for a refund. Lesson learned, I won't be going to this Starbucks anymore.

2.description: I come here often as I like to drink my coffee while shopping at Target. All the experiences I've had were alright. The reason I say that it is alright at this location is because if it gets busy, it can be a long wait but that never really bothered me. However, today, was different. There were a young lady taking the orders and a lady older than the younger lady taking my order making the drinks. The barista who took my order never said hi or welcomed me at all when it was my turn to order. She looked at me in silence. Like, should I order or should I wait for you to ask me what I wanted to order because the last time I checked I was at an establishment where there was supposed to be some kind of worker to customer communication where the worker is supposed to communicate to the customer? I just thought it was very rude. Not one smile, not one "Welcome to Starbucks", not one "Hi, can I take your order?". Look, young child, if you hate your job that much, don't work. You make my favorite coffee company look bad.

0.description: Awesome service, the crew here are the bomb!! Most consistent Starbucks I have been to

58.description: This location is very close to the museum and Grant park.  We stopped in for a snack and enjoyed their food.  I haven't been disappointed by a TJs yet!

56.description: I'm here at least twice a week. Friendly staff, always clean, and the prices are very reasonable compared to Jewel and some of the other grocers in the area.

29.description: I loooove Trader Joe's! The best coconut almond milk, Greek yogurt, chili lime chicken I've ever had. They have an array of food items but be warned..not everything here is organic and they dont have a wide assortment of vegan items either. I've never had a bad shopping experience here and the staff is always friendly and extra helpful. Oh and there is 3 buck chuck and cookie butter. 3 buck chuck is a wine for 3 dollars or so that is really great usually a white. Good samples too. Be there Friday for my coconut almond milk.

42.description: This TJ's is a lot more open than the one I'm used to at the River North location. Like the other Trader Joes, they have a great selection of interesting things you won't find at Jewel. In particular, they have a great selection of frozen meals ranging from Tamales to Pad Thai, and their generic offerings are very cheap and taste great.The produce is fresh, and the excellent variety of beer is very reasonably priced. I do wish the meat wasn't quite so expensive, but this truly a minor gripe in an otherwise awesome market.

23.description: This place is probably one of the reasons why I miss living by S. Loop.I love everything about TJ. Not to mention a great bargain for wine in the middle of the city. Lots of unique wine choices, leaning heavily toward the bargain/low end. Helpful staff, the lines move fast.

47.description: Gluten free Joe Joes! Has parking, easy in and out, friendly staff.

8.description: In terms of grocery stores, Trader Joe's is the bomb, and this location is no exception to the norm. It's all private label (mostly), healthy (mostly), and affordable!  TJ's is my grocer of choice. They also have flowers and ice cream... fyi guys, just in case you get in trouble with the old lady. A few of my favorite things include (but are not limited to) chocolate covered espresso beans, kale, apple and strawberry fruit bars, chicken breasts, and mango sorbet. Their cookie butter is flame (Google it).

31.description: I like the trader joes on diversey better, but they still have my tj favorites! There is a big wine section which is great. The workers are always really nice and helpful, with the exception of a bagger that smushed my peaches because she was trying to fit everything into one bag.

34.description: I love Trader Joe's! They have great prices, a great selection, and great employees.  I'm able to get in, get out, and on with my day. I love the turkey Bolognese sauce. It's a great value and it tastes great. Their butter cookies are to die for. I know that most people refer to Trader Joe's as the "poor man's whole foods"-But it's so much more.

16.description: The fact that I have to visit at least once a week for therapeutic reasons should really say it all. As a long-time Trader Joe's junkie, finding out there was located a few blocks from me was like discovering the fountain of youth. The store has a great layout and the aisles are so wide so you never feel like you have to scrape the walls to get around other carts, and it allows you to really browse without being in the way of those people running on a very tight grocery schedule. They offer both organic and regular products at prices that are really hard to compete with, as well as having signature trader joe's products (cookie butter, seasonal joe joe's, SEASONAL EVERYTHING, etc.) that keep you coming back for more. I'm also on a very tight student budget so the fact that I can afford fresh produce and have managed to stay away from ramen for as long as I have is amazing. The cashiers are also all so lovely and will most likely love it if you spark up a conversation with them. Definitely won me over and will win you over too.

13.description: I hate Trader Joe's.1. It prioritizes presentation over both quality and quantity, so attracts dumbasses2. 2 buck chuck - I gag at the smell of this wine3. "fresh" meat from poland / czech republic... seriously? they ship this shit unfrozen all the way to here and expect people to like the taste of it?4. everything tastes cheap and salty5. food is packaged in weird portions and cutsEvery time I plan a meal and shop at this store I regret not having gone to a nice restaurant to tip the hard working local waitstaff. When I buy food here, I know the premium I pay is a tip to the corporate pigs that sell the same shit in different packaging at ALDI on the south side.

11.description: The prices here are pretty low for some items. For some other items they cost too much. That is for the organic items. If you're rich then you can buy those.They have a free samples counter, which is kind of fun. I wish they had more free samples people just sitting in one of the 4-5 aisles. It would be okay that they would cramp the aisles.Sometimes it feels weird in here when it is quiet and only playing annoying music. I don't like catchy music playing at the grocery store. I want to buy groceries and not dance.The free samples counter is nice. They always have some seasonal drink available and you have sample cups, but you don't know how many you're supposed to take. I usually just fill my small plastic cup once then through the cup away, but sometimes I feel daring and fill it up 2 or 3 times. I had a friend who was thrown out of a McDonalds for filling his water cup with Hi-C Fruit Punch.

39.description: Very nice! parking lot and deals!! love it

37.description: Compared to jewel and other huge grocery stores, Trader Joes takes the cake! This store may be smaller but the variety is unbelievable and I've never had a problem with anything I've bought there. The employees are trained well and can help you find anything you need. Nothing like buying food that looks great and then feeling great after eating it!!! Next shopping trip here I come :)

0.description: I love Trader Joe's. I almost had a heart attack over the 19 cent banana's, organic banana only 32 cents. I swear if i was 80 years old and i saw those prices they would have to call an ambulance.There frozen food is great. Organic Quinoa is amazing. I love there juices. They have grass fed meats. There chicken salad is pretty good, but generally they do not have good prepared food.

38.description: This is hands down my favorite grocery store! I love this place! I find so many good things here and I feel good about buying stuff from here. Everything from produce to wine is exceptional. The workers are all so friendly and you can tell they really enjoy working for this company. I've even had an employee rave about the company as she was ringing me up. Only thing is I wish they had a little bit of a bigger selection. Maybe a section that had prepared foods you can pick up. Will shop here till I DIE! :D

51.description: Well, I already told you I love Trader Joe's, and this one might be even better than the one I fell in love with in the first place.It's larger than the Ontario location and  is laid out a little differently, so it took me a minute to get my bearings, but it also gave me an excuse to spend time browsing.Other pluses are the parking lot, and the very helpful employees! I couldn't find vegan mayonnaise (it's just called low-fat mayonnaise, you have to read the label on the shelf to learn that it is dairy- and egg-free), and no fewer than three people either helped me find it, or checked back to make sure I found it. And the cashier made suggestions for other products I might like.

27.description: Trader Joe's is fantastic obviously, this one's just ok.  I'm a huge fan of the location, but relative to other TJ's it's nothing special (visit any Trader Joe in Calif. and you'll know instantly what I'm talking about).  The bread selection here is poor, they are OOS on fairly basic items more than I would expect (like jalapenos and other basic fruit/vegetable items), and the prices are definitely high on some items ($4 for a half-gallon of TJ's milk, in that awful Tetra-Pak packaging?  Come on).  I do think it's a very well-run store however, the lines are generally very short and move quickly (despite crowds), the beer selection is good, and the space is clean.  Most of my gripes are probably endemic to TJ's in the area more than anything.

32.description: Convenient, good deals, what's not to love??I'm addicted to ice cream mochi. One evening when the cravings kicked in, I hit up the Bridgeport/Pilsen Mariano's. It was $5.50 for the exact same pack that TJs sells for $3.50! I'm also not complaining about their large, cheap wine selection. Staff is friendly and it's easily accessible in the South Loop. It's a wonder I don't go every day.

54.description: This was the biggest Trader Joe's I've ever seen. I'm used to the typical Trader Joe's we see in the suburbs. Out here, the Trader Joe's are cramped and crowded. (Though, they have their advantages over other grocers.)Our first reaction when we entered was "wow". The aisles are wide; there was plenty of room; the wine section was enormous. And, it seemed more well stocked than others. This may be due to its location in the south loop where the population is pretty dense.I'd like to see one out in the suburbs that is modeled after this one.

48.description: This is a smaller Trader Joe's than most, but they have all the basics and at pretty decent prices.  I do recommend for those of you that are concerned with potentially harmful substances (GMO, carrageenan, artificial flavoring, preservatives, non-organicetc.) to CHECK THE LABELS before purchasing.  A lot of people have the misconception that as long as they buy from Trader Joe's it will not have any harmful substances, and this is not the case.  Their produce is not all organic, however, they do have easy-to-read labels marking what produce items are organic.I do love a lot of the Trader Joe's brands, as they are quality items at affordable prices.  I do recommend this store as an alternative to Jewel-Osco across the street (those of you who are budget conscious:  Trader Joe's does not offer as many coupons as Jewel, however, many of their products are a lot cheaper in comparison).I will continue to be a regular customer here!

44.description: Thrilled to have a Trader Joes on the near South Side, just thrilled. First of all, free parking, including an underground garage! Secondly, the selection is excellent and acceptably priced. This store seems bigger than other locations around town, and their wine and spirits section is rather large as well. Trader Joe's focuses more on dry and frozen goods so their produce section is relatively small, but it isn't a deal breaker. Finally, the service I received was extraordinary. One of the staff helped me to my car on a cold day, chatting pleasantly with me the entire time. I can't praise it enough. I really don't know why someone would even consider the competitor across the street.

24.description: My go-to Trader Joe's as it is the closest to where I stay. Conveniently located half a block from the Roosevelt train station.There is also a small parking lot at and below level located on Wabash.

7.description: My go-to Trader Joe's as it is the closest to where I stay. Conveniently located half a block from the Roosevelt train station.There is also a small parking lot at and below level located on Wabash.

49.description: This place makes me happy and makes me feel like I'm doing something good for my body because I'm more likely to pick up healthier options here then any other store. The staff is always nice on my last visit I purchased apple blossoms which r good not healthy but good but anyway the cashier told me she tried them that they are great and that ice cream goes really well with that. I love this place even tho I have to travel far and get up early to come here to beat the lines. I have never had to stand in line more than 2 minutes to checkout.

40.description: Love this place. They have really great produce. The prices are pretty good as well. The customer service is nice. I just wish they had more parking spaces available! The parking spaces are a little small too but overall it's a great place to shop.

53.description: As a weekly shopper of this location I continually experience great customer service, fresh fruit and veggie selection and consistent pricing (which is huge if you live in a big city where prices often fluctuate). Chicken and beef selection is always up to par and they have majority of the items you are looking for.  Also a zillion times cleaner than Jewel's or Dominick's which is a big plus since I tend to be a clean freak. I like to think the fact they aren't a massive box store allows them to focus more on the details...like the customer and cleanliness. Plus, if you are unsure about a product or a 'first time user' of something, the clerks are always willing to chat with you about it as you check out - super helpful. I tend to walk since I live near by  but I did notice they have a parking garage in addition to their parking on the first floor so don't worry if you pull up and don't see a spot. Also located near Roosevelt train and bus stops.

30.description: So, I'm making small talk about Fourth of July plans with the checkout guy, when he looks at my baby carrots. He pauses. "These seem a little dry. Do you want me to get you another bag?" Are you freaking kidding me? You happened to notice? I hadn't, when I picked them out, but by gum they were, and I would. He made a couple little rings on the bell, and off went another Hawaiian shirt to retrieve them, over by the regular cantaloupes and the Tuscan cantaloupes, where had I asked another Hawaiian shirt whether she had tried the Tuscans. Much sweeter, she likes them better. Well, mahalo, muchacha.   No one has steered me wrong here yet, though they did discontinue my favorite one-pound bar of dark chocolate--that with Valencia peanuts. Checkout guy had an answer for this too: turns out that there was a disease-ridden Valencia peanut crop a couple years ago, prices for any remaining good crops went through the roof, and the PR will be irreversible for a while. So, I'm going to have to resort to getting the one-pound unsullied dark chocolate bar & add salty peanuts to my mouth as I eat. But let me return from my sweet digression and say that I love almost all the products I purchase here, and the service always includes a friendly "aloha," whether you're coming or going. And that bell serves another purpose: whenever the lines grow long, the bell is rung and more checkout guys & dolls appear.So my question is: do these folks get paid so much more than the mopes at Jewel that they transform into extraordinarily helpful & courteous people? Or is that Trader Joe, Ming, Jose, Giotto, Pilgrim Joe, or whomever he is, is just that good at recruiting talent? (If so, he should go over to the last place I worked!) Or maybe it's because different divisions of Aldi (yes, that Aldi) were owned by two German brothers, and one just happened to be cooler? Perhaps he had the better taste, in music, films, fashion, food, fine wine and perhaps even fine women? (In all fairness, they should have some products named Josephine, Josefina, or Giosetta?) Even better, a pretty, poor girl named 3 buck Charley.

46.description: My go-to spot for groceries. They have exactly what I need and even some of what I don't. The store is clean and the employees are super friendly and helpful. Prices are decent too and the location is super convenient. A+!

1.description: Definitely a Trader Joe's fan!There are many options when it comes to grocery shopping and the prices are not bad.  This location is bigger than the ontario street location in River North area.Customer service - is good! The employees here are usually helpful and friendly.Location - this location has a parking lot (can't say no to free parking!) and it is located just minutes from the CTA (Red line & bus stops)!

55.description: I love the helpful, amiable staff that will lead you right to the item you've been walking past looking for, for the last ten minutes, that is right where it usually is--and won't roll their eyes at you. I love that I can get organic produce here for, sometimes, one-third to half the price of what Whole Foods charges. I love that when I asked whether the eggnog was nutmeg-y, and the team member took me over to the sample station, opened the carton, and poured us all a drink. I love finding new favorite things because I was given a sample of it. I love TJ's policy that if anything you buy from them sucks, they'll refund your money--no explanations needed.Can you tell that I love this store??

9.description: I love TJ'sI hate that they are always busy.Mad house on Wabash definitely at this one.Alas, it is pretty large.  TONs of selection of fresh stuff...I just have to rent out the store to go back.  Such anxiety even getting into the parking lot.  AHHHH!  Someone give me a XANAX!

26.description: The prices here are pretty low for some items. For some other items they cost too much. That is for the organic items. If you're rich then you can buy those.They have a free samples counter, which is kind of fun. I wish they had more free samples people just sitting in one of the 4-5 aisles. It would be okay that they would cramp the aisles.Sometimes it feels weird in here when it is quiet and only playing annoying music. I don't like catchy music playing at the grocery store. I want to buy groceries and not dance.The free samples counter is nice. They always have some seasonal drink available and you have sample cups, but you don't know how many you're supposed to take. I usually just fill my small plastic cup once then through the cup away, but sometimes I feel daring and fill it up 2 or 3 times. I had a friend who was thrown out of a McDonalds for filling his water cup with Hi-C Fruit Punch.

25.description: There's good and bad to Trader Joe's. The good is that a lot of their products are less expensive than other brands and tend to be healthier and fresher than the average inexpensive brand. The downside is that a lot of their products aren't really healthier or more natural or more green--but they're marketed as such. The products, not the produce, are usually the good finds. Really inexpensive and high quality coconut water, soy yogurt, fruit juice, and tortilla chips, for example, compared to average brands. If you're a lazy vegetarian there are a lot of nice frozen vegetarian meals. The produce is often unnecessarily wasteful with packaging and not always so fresh looking. So, again, it's a give and take with some nice products, but definitely overall a limited selection. Come to the store, for sure, but you won't find everything you need on a shoestring budget. Chinatown grocery stores and mexican grocery stores supplement really well for bulk rice, beans, good produce, and other essentials.

12.description: Great store. It's busy at all times but the shelves are always stocked and the front of store staff are efficient. One tip- avoid the parking lot at all costs. If I have to drive here I'll pay to park in the street

59.description: I feel bad for anyone driving here.  The parking lot is literally 1 car in 1 car out, not wide enough for 2 cars.  ALWAYS causing traffic on the corner, and parking lot itself is super cramped and that just seems unpleasant.TJ food is hit or miss.  I get the whole "organic" trend thing going on right now, but half the stuff in the store can be bought at a regular supermarket so what makes it so special here?  I R confused.  TJ Hummus?  MISS.  Tasted like lemon and bleach (or lemon bleach?).  The baked breads were so miss that they got rid of them all together, always stale and hard as a rock when I went there after 5 p.m.The big HIT is the staff, and wonderful atmosphere.  Love just walking around catching everyone trying to make themselves feel healthy by buying food packaged to look healthy.I am super happy that they opened up here, an obvious win for the company and the neighborhood.  I like going there for little stuff when I'm out b/c it's so close to home and I can literally be in and out and back home in under 5 minutes.

21.description: Employees at this TJs are so helpful. I am always impressed with the service at this location! The alcohol selection is plentiful and makes it a great one stop shop. I'm not even tempted to go over to the jewel across the street.

17.description: This is the closest grocery store to me so I love stopping in from time to time to pick up items. I really love some of "different" food items i can find here that i cant get at jewel. The thing that gives this place the 5th star is the people working here. They are really great and super nice. Its a great place to do your shopping.

10.description: This is TJ, so of course I have nothing but love for it. The staff are always so helpful and friendly. The products are delicious and intuitively organized, so you can find just about whatever you need very easily. All of the fruit and produce I've ever bought here has been fresh and well priced. It's great having this so close when I need my TJ-brand fixes (corn salsa, caramelized onion cheddar cheese, truffle brownies, etc.).There is a small parking lot, but I'd recommend taking public transportation, if you can (which should be easy enough, given the proximity to the Roosevelt stop for the red, green, and orange lines, plus the 146, 12, and 18 bus stop at State and Roosevelt); I do every time I shop here, and it saves me the hassle of having to get into/out of the lot.

5.description: I love that, even when traveling, I can find a familiar market to get the kinds of food I love to eat!

3.description: Whoever is responsible for hiring at this location should be praised. Every single employee is so cheerful and friendly. I have never had an unpleasant experience shopping at this location. I always leave happy! The ONLY downside is the parking lot.

35.description: This is a nice, big store. There's lots of parking in higher lot and garage, and there are bathrooms downstairs in the garage atrium. It feels less cluttered to me than the Lincoln Park store, and I'd bet it's bigger in square footage and it also has nice open high ceilings. Other than that, it's an average trader joes, going from produce on one side to dried goods, frozen foods, and eventually alcohol on the other side. The prices are the usual. There's a Jewel across the street, and my friend paired a tj's visit so one to Jewel for produce, which seems like the right way to go, since tj's produce selection isn't awesome, and Jewel is overpriced for some things, but has good and decently priced produce. The bongo room is across the street, so one can do brunch then pick up some groceries.

19.description: We were loyal customers of this store for 4 years. But tonight (8:28pm) we suffered very bad customer service there. While we check out, I had my 10 months old boy pushed the customer in training cart. Then a store guy wear colored shirt came over and helped cashier put our grocery into bags. He shouted to us: do you need bags for Watermelon? I said YES. And then he asked: and Milk? I said YES. (OS: Of course I need bags to carry all my grocery home. Or he wants my 10 months old boy help me to carry them?  What kind of questions he asked?!!!) And then I told him, I don't need the peach box, can he put those peaches into a bag? he put them into a plastic bag without hand holds and told me Here you go. I told him, how can I carry the peaches, he said just put into your bag with watermelon. I show a unbelievable face and he said those bags can carry 16 pounds.... oh...then okay!!!May I know what kind of customer service of this??? I really doubt that. Trying to save bags???  Then how about just tell us to bring your own bags to do grocery??? I have never face this kind of situation before for these 4 years. I can't believe your store have this kind of staff. and I don't think it's a good transaction for me to show my 10 months old boy (a first time, training customer).

28.description: Trader Joe's here is like Trader Joe's anywhere else. The selection is excellent, quality is great as well. The only thing that ever really changes between stores is the staff and the staff at this location are amazingly friendly and bubbly. Even my mom was tickled pink when she was addressed as "mademoiselle" - haha!

45.description: Sloop's TJ is similar to other TJ stores I've experienced. Most of my experiences have been positive with regard to customer service and having inventory (which if you're familiar can be an issue at times). The only recent experience that left a bad taste in mouth was regarding a wouldbe purchase of the coveted "two buck chuck". In an attempt to purchase a few bottles, I was carted. After camly explaining to the cashier that I simply rushed out and left it at home but clearly I looked of age. In short, I left with my 2BC only to return 15 minutes later with my ID in hand (but at another register).So, here is the kicker, I asked him, "what's the carting policy"? He said, "well it depends on the cashier, if you seem suspicious or they feel something is odd, typically you will be asked for your ID". Hearing that left a bad taste in my mouth. So, knowing this, I have since tried on a few occasions to act "suspicious" to no avail. That said, perhaps it was a consciencious rookie cashier who didn't realize underage kids who want alcohol will likely not come to TJ to do so. #justsaying #Kudos to 2BC lovers and all of you none suspicious types

33.description: Trader joes desserts never disappoint us. I would highly recommend tiramisu, green tea mochi n macarons. Yummy!

43.description: As much as I like the selection and prices vs. Whole Foods...good luck trying to park! This lot gives me so much anxiety...teeny tiny and SOOO crowded.

2.description: I love trader joes and this location is pretty amazing. They have really friendly and helpful staff. They have Petey amazing stuff on the shelf and there are always samples. One downer is that this place is get busy. It's right on the crossroads of Roosevelt and Michigan. Plus there's a train stop right behind it, do you see a lot of people. If you drive, it might be hard to find a parking spot. Lines can be very long at times also.
