18.description: The more I visit Trader Joes, the more I love it. I'm so happy that Trader Joes is located in the South Loop. I just can't get enough of it. I had been researching where I could find some green tea matcha powder to replicate the green tea matcha latte from Starbucks. I had done an extensive search online (Amazon) and everything cost at least $17 or more. I decided to come to Trader Joes to see if they carried any green tea matcha powder. I was not expecting much since it seemed so expensive online, but Trader Joes came through again for me! They had green tea matcha latte powder for only $3.99!!!  How wonderful!! Prior to this trip I was on the hunt for chia seeds. When I asked a sales associate if they had it available, I was directed straight to it!This store has a lot of hidden gem products that are healthy and delicious. I especially love that they are constantly coming out with new products and restocking the products that continue to sell well. I was able to find a new product in the Indian section. It was the Vegetable Biyani with vegetable dumplings. I havent tried it yet so I can't attest to its taste, but at $2.49 each, its definitely worth taking a chance on.They don't just sell food here but they also sell facial and body products like tea tree oil (in the form of liquid and facial pads) and body butter at affordable prices. Awesome!

41.description: i LOVELOVELOVE TRADER JOESS!IM SO GLAD TO HAVE FOUND OUT ABOUT ITi come from a bum middle of nowhere place called dunlapand then i moved up here to chicago for schooli discovered whole foods a while backand although i LOVE it. i hate the pricestrader joes is a lot kinder to my college walletits only two blocks furtherand definitely worth itits a lot smallerbut the prices are so reasonable and the people who work there are awesomethere is this most deeleeeshus green drinkits like a smoothie texture.. almost. like the naked juices. but MUCH CHEAPERAND THEY GIVE MORE!its calle green plant juicebut it has like green fruits + spirulina+ mango+ strawberries + etcits amazingGO GET IT GO GO GO!

52.description: Love this place! The staff is super friendly, the store is big, and the selection is good. The only downside is the small parking lot.

50.description: "Never an angry face"Greeted with a smile and checked out with a smile. I always learn something when I come here and people are super friendly. I come to trader joe's enough, but Anita made me want to post. She is like I appreciate YOUR business and want you to keep on shopping because it's a win-win! The guy in the veggie department schooled me on basil and how keeping it at room temperature keeps it from browning so fast.The only thing that sucks here is PARKING. Avoid it if you can or put on your patience pants.

4.description: I love Trader Joe's!  Although this location is smaller than some of their others, it still has everything I need.  Employees are professional and friendly, and prices are great.  Highly recommend.

6.description: My favorite Trader Joe's in Chicago. I never have difficulty finding parking in the lot but they do have a lower level if you can't find any!The best part about this store is that the organic produce is priced similarly (or even cheaper!) than conventional, so why not?They always have great employees at the cash register, those guys are so hip, reminds me of home!

22.description: The employees drive us to return to this store. Customer service is amazing; they always acknowledge my daughter in here and her need to "shop with the cart!" Love the food here too!

15.description: So, I'm making small talk about Fourth of July plans with the checkout guy, when he looks at my baby carrots. He pauses. "These seem a little dry. Do you want me to get you another bag?" Are you freaking kidding me? You happened to notice? I hadn't, when I picked them out, but by gum they were, and I would. He made a couple little rings on the bell, and off went another Hawaiian shirt to retrieve them, over by the regular cantaloupes and the Tuscan cantaloupes, where had I asked another Hawaiian shirt whether she had tried the Tuscans. Much sweeter, she likes them better. Well, mahalo, muchacha.   No one has steered me wrong here yet, though they did discontinue my favorite one-pound bar of dark chocolate--that with Valencia peanuts. Checkout guy had an answer for this too: turns out that there was a disease-ridden Valencia peanut crop a couple years ago, prices for any remaining good crops went through the roof, and the PR will be irreversible for a while. So, I'm going to have to resort to getting the one-pound unsullied dark chocolate bar & add salty peanuts to my mouth as I eat. But let me return from my sweet digression and say that I love almost all the products I purchase here, and the service always includes a friendly "aloha," whether you're coming or going. And that bell serves another purpose: whenever the lines grow long, the bell is rung and more checkout guys & dolls appear.So my question is: do these folks get paid so much more than the mopes at Jewel that they transform into extraordinarily helpful & courteous people? Or is that Trader Joe, Ming, Jose, Giotto, Pilgrim Joe, or whomever he is, is just that good at recruiting talent? (If so, he should go over to the last place I worked!) Or maybe it's because different divisions of Aldi (yes, that Aldi) were owned by two German brothers, and one just happened to be cooler? Perhaps he had the better taste, in music, films, fashion, food, fine wine and perhaps even fine women? (In all fairness, they should have some products named Josephine, Josefina, or Giosetta?) Even better, a pretty, poor girl named 3 buck Charley.

57.description: I like Trader Joe's because they have low prices on items that are good for you. The prices in general are pretty moderate but since I try to eat more locally sourced, organic, healthy items, etc. I know I can always come here and get at least one item that fits into one of those categories and not have to pawn one of my kidneys doing so. It's not very big but it suits me fine.

20.description: I love TJ'sI hate that they are always busy.Mad house on Wabash definitely at this one.Alas, it is pretty large.  TONs of selection of fresh stuff...I just have to rent out the store to go back.  Such anxiety even getting into the parking lot.  AHHHH!  Someone give me a XANAX!

36.description: The more I visit Trader Joes, the more I love it. I'm so happy that Trader Joes is located in the South Loop. I just can't get enough of it. I had been researching where I could find some green tea matcha powder to replicate the green tea matcha latte from Starbucks. I had done an extensive search online (Amazon) and everything cost at least $17 or more. I decided to come to Trader Joes to see if they carried any green tea matcha powder. I was not expecting much since it seemed so expensive online, but Trader Joes came through again for me! They had green tea matcha latte powder for only $3.99!!!  How wonderful!! Prior to this trip I was on the hunt for chia seeds. When I asked a sales associate if they had it available, I was directed straight to it!This store has a lot of hidden gem products that are healthy and delicious. I especially love that they are constantly coming out with new products and restocking the products that continue to sell well. I was able to find a new product in the Indian section. It was the Vegetable Biyani with vegetable dumplings. I havent tried it yet so I can't attest to its taste, but at $2.49 each, its definitely worth taking a chance on.They don't just sell food here but they also sell facial and body products like tea tree oil (in the form of liquid and facial pads) and body butter at affordable prices. Awesome!

14.description: This is the most pathetic Trader Joe's I've ever been to. Ever. It's like they've never heard of vegan.

28.description: Allie is an amazing artist. The atmosphere is great. I brought a couple friends and we all joked around with the artists. I've gotten two tattoos from Allie and I will go to him for all future ones.

1.description: This was a normal Tuesday and i did my regular Tuesday things. I worked my 9 hours at work and told myself the entire day that i will be going to IKEA once i got off work. The minute i clocked out i thought to myself "Well why not get a Tattoo?", and off i went to get a Tattoo. I stopped at this place because it was the first thing that came up on yelp and i did not want to think about it any longer. When i got here, the guys were super friendly and welcoming. I walked in there not even knowing where i wanted my Tattoo or what I wanted it to say. All i knew is that i wanted a Tattoo and i am going to get one today. Didn't take me too long to decide what i was getting. Well, i am lying it took me like an hour to come up with something simple, meaningful and good placement.Thanks Guys!

39.description: This has to be the most hip, clean, and innovative tattoo shop I've ever seen. Besides being able to accommodate you with any tattoo style you wish for from their talented artists, they also have a really fresh retail space full of cool Nixon watches and bags, Von Zipper sunglasses, and apparel from upcoming labels. Jason HoodRich tattooed a perfect little anchor on me and it was exactly what I wanted. He helped me get the sizing and the colors just right before he began and made me feel real comfortable the entire time. Not only did he do a flawless job (the lines are seriously PERFECT), but he was cracking me up with his jokes the entire time. Even though HoodRich specializes in a traditional style, he can do mostly anything you propose to him.Check Code of Conduct out, and see Jason HoodRich. You won't be sorry! Email him directly at HoodRich@TheCodeOfConduc….

9.description: Approximately 75% of my upper body is covered in tattoos. I follow a large number of tattoo blogs, have looked through most of the big-name Chicago-based artists' portfolios, gotten work from half a dozen people, and most of my friends have one or more tattoos and similar obsessions with wearable art. And when anyone asks me for advice on where to get a new piece, I only have one answer: "Code of Conduct." So far, my girlfriend, her friend, one of my best friends, my boss, and another colleague have all taken this advice with incredible results.The shop:The atmosphere is clean and bright without being clinical somehow. Workstations are arranged around a large common area so everyone can watch and learn from each other. There's a lot of hovering and "that's awesome how did you do it?" among the artists, which I enjoy. The walls are decorated with sketches, oil paintings, photographs, and other forms of art, all of which is created or curated by the staff. With no piercers on their payroll, unlike other tattoo shops Code of Conduct is exclusively about the art (and a touch of fashion thrown in), with less of a focus on walk-in business and more focus on custom work than some may be used to at other "tattoo and piercing factories."The staff:So far I only wear work by one of the artists at Code of Conduct - more on him shortly - but in the many many hours I've spent in the shop, I have seen incredible work spring from under the hands of every member of the staff. Each definitely has his own style and strengths but they all share knowledge, advice, techniques, and a strong drive to constantly better their craft. Plus, they're friendly, hilarious, and very laid-back. Because they take their work very seriously (like any artist should), if you're looking to walk in with a google image of someone else's tattoo that you think is really cool and want the same thing, this probably isn't the place for you. If you want an incredible, unique, custom piece of art that requires you to give some effort and forethought, research portfolios and make an appointment.My guy:I first explored Allie Sider's digital portfolio back in 2009 and was immediately jealous of the people who got to wear his ink. Even from a distance, his attention to minutiae and skill with black-and-grey were mind-boggling, and I can personally guarantee you that it only gets more impressive up close. I'm a visual artist and lighting designer by trade, so you can imagine how floored I was to find a tattoo artist that actually thought about light sources and shadows! Allie manages to work in some of the finest, tiniest details I've ever seen, his lines are always super clean, and his shading techniques vary from intricate pencil-thin crosshatching to sublimely smooth watercolor, depending on the piece. He has a very light hand and gets it done without chewing your skin up, so his work heals much faster than others' (I'm talking like a week, week and a half at most!). Plus he's a great guy that I can actually have a conversation with for hours on end - and all my friends who wear his work agree. In the five years I've been visiting him, Allie has done my entire upper back, a small piece on my left arm, and we're halfway done with a full shoulder-to-wrist sleeve on my right arm. For black-and-grey (he does do color sometimes, it's just "not his thing"), as far as I'm concerned there's none better. I'll keep coming back to Allie at Code of Conduct until I run out of skin.

29.description: Really fantastic experience! First, it was definitely my type of place. There was someone's Bianchi Pista in the hallway, Shepard Fairey posters, and super chill music. Everyone from Mike at the front desk to Allie who tattooed me were nice, easy going, and welcoming. No pretentions, just good, honest people, doing work they love.  Price was actually less than what I expected for the detail of my tattoo!I would highly recommend Code of Conduct!

23.description: My friends and I had a great experience here. I love how they don't allow you to be impulsive.  We came in for a consultation, paid a deposit and came back a week later. Also, there are no cookie-cutter books of pictures of tattoos.  You come in with your idea and they bring it to life.  Jake did our tattoos.  He is personable and a great artist.

5.description: TATTOO ARTIST WITH VISION!I was visiting Chicago from California and I came across some of BJStorms work on Instagram. After a few text I came in and the first drawing wasn't what I was really looking for, but BJ, without blinking an eye, redrew the tat for me no problem and the new one was badass as fuck! The shop is very clean and isn't one of those. Tattoo shops with tons and tons of reproduced flash art tattoos. The owner clearly has a vision and eye for talent/art. Everything from the lobby to the bathroom was curated with a good eye. Every artist I saw that had a unique style that was different than the next.

31.description: I had seen the shop a few times while I was going to Columbia and they even had ads on in some of the buildings. I went in one day to take a look around because I am always looking for new artists. The staff was extremely cool from the beginning and the fact that it isn't any normal tattoo shop really peaked my interest. Anywhere I can go and play x-box and buy a new watch AND get  tattooed is a winner in my book!! I spoke to Jason about a piece I wanted done and his very first drawing was perfect. A week later I had my newest favorite tattoo. I really cannot say enough about this place.

25.description: Walked-in on a Saturday afternoon to get my first tattoo. Totally spontaneous. Jake was available and did a great job. Didn't have to wait long, he spent a lot of time getting the size and placement right, and talked me through everything since I was a tattoo virgin and a self-proclaimed pansy when it comes to pain. My tattoo is small, on my side/rib area and hardly hurt at all. Jake was friendly, calm, and very professional. I'd definitely recommend him or go back to him in the future. Thanks!

12.description: I have never gone to a tattoo shop that was opened for business and no one was available until I went to this place.  The tattoo artists (I guess) were sitting around acting nonchalant, one even said he was off work.  I was recommended to go here but I was turned away. It was only 3 or 4 in the afternoon.  Don't they close at 10pm?Guess they didn't want my money or business.  But here's the good news, there are plenty other tattoo artists in Chicago and the suburbs who won't mind taking my money and the bad news is I'm not able to give a review on their artwork.

37.description: I am willing to bet money that by next year, this will be one of the most popular tattoo shops in Chicago.  Not only is it conveniently located downtown in the south loop, but the shop itself is intriguing and the artists are stellar.  I have gotten work done by Jeff and Johnny, both of whom are fantastic.  With all the publicity this place is getting, make appointments soon before it becomes impossible!  I will be back again.

21.description: I have never gone to a tattoo shop that was opened for business and no one was available until I went to this place.  The tattoo artists (I guess) were sitting around acting nonchalant, one even said he was off work.  I was recommended to go here but I was turned away. It was only 3 or 4 in the afternoon.  Don't they close at 10pm?Guess they didn't want my money or business.  But here's the good news, there are plenty other tattoo artists in Chicago and the suburbs who won't mind taking my money and the bad news is I'm not able to give a review on their artwork.

16.description: Hands down some of the best tattoo artwork I've seen out there. These are not just tattoos folks, these are works of art. I love the atmosphere at code of conduct too, it's relaxed and I know that each artist is going to take the time to make each tattoo perfect. You don't feel like the artists are rushing on to get as many tattoos as they can get done. You can't rush a masterpiece, and when I'm sitting in the chair I know I'm going to be taken care of. I have recommended Allie Sider to countless friends, so I also know I'm not just speaking for myself. If you are looking for something beautiful to put on your body, something technical and skilled, than this is the place to go.

17.description: I love Code of Conduct! I made an appointment based on a friend's recommendation and got a script tattoo. The artists  were super helpful and supportive during the design stage until I settled on the final look. Since this was my first tattoo I really appreciated that it was absolutely painless which surprised me, it was done by Jake who did an amazing job. I keep getting compliments on the color and the beautiful clean lines.

10.description: I've gotten several tattoos from Code of Conduct, all from BJ. The shop is very clean and the atmosphere is casual. They have a movie playing always and it's usually something I like. The artists all come around and comment on eachother's work, always positive stuff. Everyone is very friendly there. They don't have piercers, so that kinda classes the place up. I feel like there's an expected atmosphere in most tattoo shops, sort-of pretentious and cooler-than-you; Code of Conduct is NOT like that.I am really happy with the pieces I've gotten from BJ. He is really great with color. We talk a lot about the design beforehand and he is good at explaining why something won't work or what will work better. He was able to work with the terribly blurry picture of my dead dog (I didn't have a better one that I liked) and the outcome was amazing. It embodies her personality perfectly. His shading is on point. Additionally, I am always able to get ahold of him to make appointments, send pictures, ask questions regarding healing, etc.

11.description: I am late to the game when it come to tattooing.  I suppose I was just too busy for the last several decades!  Over the past several years I have made up for lost time and accumulated several pieces.  I work as a scientist and my pieces tend to be replicas of highly detailed technical drawings. I scouted around quite a bit before finding Allie at Code of Conduct, noticing from his website that he does a lot of very accurate nature drawings.  I could not be happier with the work that he has done: absolutely brilliant.  He makes the time to plan out the pieces, contouring them to my arms etc, making sure he appreciates the details of the pieces. The most recent is a big reproduction of the Flammarion image (Google the image if your are interested): it is very complex.  Allie did a fantastic job.The level of accuracy and beauty of all finished pieces is remarkable, literally remarkable since they have been a big hit on the science mean-streets.  (For example, one of the fly tattoos has the level of detail that allows fellow experts to identify it to genus: extra science nerd points for that.)  Code of Conduct is a great shop with a cool but friendly vibe, and Allie is an extraordinarily talented artist and a very affable fellow.  Easy to get hold of, there when you need him.  I can't say enough about the experience....

26.description: I had an awesome experience at Code of Conduct the other night.  A friend and I called them and they were able to give me pricing info over the phone (60 dollar minimum, no matter how small the tattoo).  They told us to just drop in now, and Ben would be my artist.  We got there a little while later and Justin at the front desk was really nice and explained it all out for me.  The place looked extremely clean (bathroom too!) and everything was out in the open so I could see where the tools were coming from.  He introduced us to Ben and he mocked up a couple designs for me since i was going pretty basic (an eighth note).  Ben was very accommodating and also kept making jokes to make me more comfortable since it was my first one.  After the few times i asked for re-placement, we got started and i was very happy with the result.  Something I found comforting was he let me test the pain by doing a small line that was part of my design already - i know that it's probably unusual, but it definitely helped me gauge if i could handle it (and it was totally fine).  I would highly recommend Code of Conduct and I give high props to Ben for making me feel so at ease and making it fun (love the sound effects!!)The only reason I don't give 5 stars is I found 60 bucks a little high for something so small, but I suppose with all the equipment that is used and sterilized, it evens a bit.

27.description: I love this place! I love the people! I wish I could be here all the time.The artists here are very chill, very conversational, very open-minded, and very REAL! There was none of that typical "tattoo snobbery" running around in the room. These guys are here to do what they love, and make some money, and NOT to make some money then say 'go screw yourself". I had recently visited Deluxe tattoo to get a consultation on a piece I had been wanting. The man there said it was impossible and would look stupid on the body. O RLY? Well Johnny McDevitt did it just yesterday. And let me tell you, it looks amazing. so many people are giving me compliments (while the sucker is still covered in goo-goo-overnight-bandage-blood. They are either all correct that it is awesome, or they are vampires. Highly unlikely. Also, I was quoted at a lot of other shops in price ranges going into the 500+...never in my life for something this size. Its about 7 x 5 inches. Only 6 colors used. No way. Johnny asked for 400, I said I didn't want to go beyond 350, and he agreed. I knew I'd be paying the above average price for myself, considering I normally go to small - town shops in Southern ILL, so for a Chicago tatt THIS nice...It was perfectly reasonable. No stiffler's here. Sadly, Johnny McDevitt is transferring to Insight Studios tattoo. I will most definitely be contacting him in the future. I believe he is the nicest tattoo artist I have ever met. He is open for a joke, ready to converse (or not if you need a moment to breath, haha). He was so patient . This was my 4th tattoo, but I had  not had one on the front of my body before where I could WATCH, so I was pretty anxious. It was like he was just so happy to be there doing something different, he didn't even care if I was letting out the few occasional "ow, ow, ow's". It took maybe 3 weeks to solidify a time and a day, but it was very much worth it , and we BOTH were to blame for the complications and issues outside of the world of tattoos, so there was nothing but forgiveness :)  I will be posting a picture very soon. I am so happy with this piece. And I am very happy I found Johnny. If you are looking for someone to do your first tattoo; if you're a bit of a pansy; if you have room for improvement and some space for him to share his ideas...Johnny is the guy for you. Remember, he will be going to insight, but I think all of the guys at CoC are worth a try. Allie seemed like a really professional, hilariously funny guy.   I also love the clothing they sell there. It's not cheap , but it is not pricey. Very cool designs. And you can buy some of their artwork from time to time. The best deals are the huge , like 24 by 32 posters of their Rebel work. Very cool.

35.description: I had an appointment with Jason Hoodrich after work on a weeknight, and though I was a bit early, there were no other customers in the shop at the time and it took Jason about an hour AFTER my appointment time before he actually brought me back to get my tattoo.  I assume part of the delay was due to the arrival of his friend, who showed up  as I was waiting and then sat in a chair three feet away through my appointment, talking with Jason.  The extra person might not have been so bad if I didn't feel like Jason thought of me more as a nuisance than as a client.  He didn't make much effort to speak to me directly other than a few questions about the placement of the tattoo and where to sit.  I felt like I was intruding on their guy time.  While I didn't expect him to ask for my whole life story, I was hoping to have him take a remote interest in me as a person, as a potential continuing client.  Instead, he was too busy making unflattering jokes about some women he and his friend knew.  My tattoo turned out nicely, but I walked out more frustrated with how I had been treated by my tattooer than I was elated about a new tattoo.  While Code of Conduct is just about everything you'd want in a tattoo shop: hip, clean, reputable, experienced tattooers, etc., I won't be going back to get tattooed by Jason H. again.  Part of getting a tattoo is the experience, and I've had plenty of other tattoos to know that being tattooed isn't supposed to be impersonal and stale--to either the client or the tattooer.

8.description: My experience here was perfect, I got a couple tattoos and the shop was super friendly, super clean, played great music and movies. I am super happy with the end result of my tattoos, I would recommend Code to any of my friends and I will be returning for more work in the future. Code has now become my go to shop!!Word to the wise, it is a custom tattoo shop so I had to book, I actually prefer this, they take their art very seriously.

0.description: Ralph did my arm piece back in March.  It was absolutely beautiful.  I was a walk in, but it only took him 30 minutes to design the perfect tattoo from the photos I showed him.  They had Tron playing on the flat screen, and Ralph kept me distracted with conversation while he did the work.  The piece itself only took an hour and a half.  I have a couple other small tattoos, so this was a big step up for me, but Ralph made me feel relaxed and comfortable the whole time.  Very chill guy.  To this day, I get a compliment on my tattoo at least 3-4 times a week.  I love it more than I could possibly say, and I can't speak more highly of Ralph himself.  I will get all my tattoos here from now on.

38.description: Went in with my cousin a week or so ago.  Had appointments with Allie.  He was great.  I got some script on my wrist from a letter my dad had written me.  Allie worked it up perfectly.  It looks great.  We both really liked Allie, and the place itself is way cool.  The place (and Allie) have a good vibe.  Code of Conduct is a classy joint.

20.description: Well.. It's been a busy couple of years almost three .. Wow! Time flies ... I have been with my two gurlz and have been very happy to deal with professional tattoo artists. That I have the pleasure to wear their art ever day...Thought id pop by the old shop in my neighborhood.. Funny how some things never change. Denial is a funny thing . At the suggestion of Allie to update my review .. I thought well maybe I will . I also would suggest to him to read my review .. 15 mins late .. Ha! Try 45 and no my appt. was earlier. I was so pissed that day .. I will never forget it. What I found funny he seemed to think I was there to book an appt. Ha! That will never happen . I was actually there to thank him for being such an asshole that it put me on a mission to find a new tattoo artist and through her I found another and they are the perfect fit for me and my style . I loved hearing out of Allies mouth .. I told you before I don't need your money . This will be a funny conversation at my next tattoo appt sept 17 ;) .  What tattoo artist doesn't like a loyal repeat customer? Well.. I've had one re-do my wrists and the other re-do my Karl Lagerfeld portrait . He now looks like he should have . So I don't own any of Allies work anymore .. And trust I get stopped on the street all the time and asked wow! Who does your work ... Where do you go .. Trust the answer is not the code of conduct . I was just pleased to see it looked like a slow day .. And the visual of me looked like I have been busy somewhere else.. Why yes I have = ) ..

19.description: My friends and I had a great experience here. I love how they don't allow you to be impulsive.  We came in for a consultation, paid a deposit and came back a week later. Also, there are no cookie-cutter books of pictures of tattoos.  You come in with your idea and they bring it to life.  Jake did our tattoos.  He is personable and a great artist.

33.description: I followed my usual artist here and literally couldn't have been happier with my experience. The place is super clean and pretty swank for a tattoo shop. Flat screen tvs and a comfy waiting area. I even got a confirmation call for my appointment the day before. How many tattoo shops do that? The other artists hanging out were really cool and made me feel right at home. And they  have a never ending supply of Vitamin Water. Y'know, in case you're into that kinda thing. Can't wait to head back.

2.description: Me and my friend were in the mood for tattoos while on a mini vacation, we yelped Code of Conduct was top of the list with good reviews and great artwork. The establishment is very chill with great relaxing music and everyone is very nice. Our tattoo artist jake did an amazing job on our wrist tattoos. I highly recommend this place

34.description: Excellent shop. Laid back, chill atmosphere and clean clean clean. Everyone is friendly, extremely talented, and the aesthetic of the place is awesome.The book collection is funny, it looks like a bunch of college books that someone choose not to sell back, mashed up with some great lit. I didn't take a long look at the clothes on offer, but the art on the walls is amazing, honestly if had more money, I'd have bought a couple.Allie Sider is an obvious talent, and a great addition to Chicago's already awesome line-up of artists. I look forward to being in there, and under the needle(s) again soon.

32.description: I really wanted to love this place since I live right down the street.  Unfortunately that's not what happened.  I walked in and the guy at the front desk was so nice and welcoming.  He said that they could get me in for an appointment later that day so I agreed.  I did arrive a little early (I realize that I don't get extra points for arriving early) and he said that my artist, Jason was running late.  He offered to let me use their i pad  or watch TV which I thought was really nice.  I decided to just wait, thinking that he was only running a little late.  Jason arrived almost an hour late and when he finally came over to speak to me he barely said he was sorry and then quoted me way too much for what I wanted.  I told him what I wanted to pay and he had NO response.  So then I told him that I was going to come back.  He handed me my print out and walked away.  I was dumbfounded!  I couldn't believe that I waited for an hour and then he was going to over charge me by a lot.  This was not my first tattoo and I know what it should have cost.  It's too bad because the place is really nice and very clean.  Too bad the guy at the front desk is not a tattoo artist because I would definitely have had him do it for me.  Oh well.  If you do go there, don't go to Jason.

18.description: Jamie was great! I came in with a design for a foot tattoo (as a walk in), and he told me honestly that it wouldn't look good as small as I wanted it or in the place that I wanted it. For about 45 minutes, he worked with me on reworking the design and placement, and I'm happy with the end result!

13.description: Allie is who I have always seen. I found his portfolio online when he worked at Tatu. I have now followed him to Code. All of the guys who work there are awesome. Jake has done a tattoo for me for Friday the 13th it is everything I imagined. BJ has tattooed my elbow. It is also perfect. Allie has done the rest! He has done everything from color to a portrait. They are all still so vibrant years after I have gotten them. His style is very gentle and subtle but still can very much so "stand the test of time". He will do absolutely anything to make the tattoo everything you want. He will draw up anything you want again and again. No matter how small and particular. He is so patient and kind with everyone and it really makes you feel like a friend and not another client. Code is a great atmosphere for a tattoo. Everyone is kind and fun to talk too. There is usually always a movie to watch or music.  You have to make an appointment usually. These guys are booked up anywhere from a week to a couple months so call in advance! It is very much worth the small wait to get your tattoo done right.

4.description: Everything about Code of Conduct is aces. The space is modern and clean, the artists are cool and funny, and the work is top notch. I came here because it's down the street from my place, but now I can't see myself going anywhere else regardless of where I live.I'll be back soon.

24.description: I live out of town, but was born and raised in Chicago and coming home for Thanksgiving. I had my heart set on a new tattoo while home and decided to give Code of Conduct a try. I called a week and a half before I was going to be there to describe exactly what I wanted and to find out the best way to get it done. I asked if they would rather be come in earlier in the week for a consult and at that time set up and appointment, or if I could just make an appointment right then. The guy I spoke to said that my tattoo sounded easy enough and they would do me as a walk in. I really wanted to have an appointment, but he said that because it was the week of the holiday and because any of the artists could handle my tattoo it would be better to do it as a walk in. When I got there soon after they opened for the day I was told no artists were yet in, but if I come back in an hour they could tattoo me right then. I was fine with that. I came back and then had to wait another 30 minutes only to be told that the only artist available at that time did not feel comfortable doing my tattoo! He suggested another artists would be better suited for it, but he wasn't going to be around that week except maybe Thursday. I was pissed because I had called and was told to come as a walk in. If not all the artists were capable of doing my tattoo then they should have let me make an appointment like I wanted to do. Needless to say I did not get my tattoo done.Now the reason I'm still giving 2 stars is 1) the shop was super clean and I would have no issues getting a tattoo done there, 2) the guy working at the front desk was super friendly and helpful. He took my info down in case the other artist did come in and could do my tattoo, and 3) I do appreciate the fact that the artist was upfront about not feeling comfortable doing my tattoo. He could have done it anyways and put something jacked on my body. I think this shows the shop really is in it for the art and not for the money. At the same time, they did drop the ball by telling me they could do it as a walk in when they obviously couldn't.

6.description: Awesome shop, upscale environment. They do great work, super professional. They didn't mind a small entourage that came along for the ride and made everyone very comfortable. There's some amazing talent at work here!

22.description: This just became my favorite tattoo shop in the city surpassing Deluxe which I still hold dear to me.  Great artwork. Some of the best geometric work I have had in the last 10 years.  You pay for what you get. You will pay top notch dollar but It is worth it. You will leave with a great tattoo. That is a guarantee!!! This place is one of the coolest places in the city, a friend referred me here. The place is awesome, artist rock, and are very accommodating. Just very expensive. You have to to remember that  this is forever. If you want a beautiful piece of artwork than your going to have to pay for it.

15.description: I was absolutely terrified and they were the nicest, most professional people i can imagine.  i would refer absolutely everyone i know.

40.description: I hopped in here this past weekend after spying their site for the past month.  Not only is the shop extremely chill, the people are extremely accommodating. They couldn't have been more welcoming.  I can't wait to come back when I have more time.

7.description: Love love love my tat that Rafael Corona did. Great atmosphere & great price. I will be back soon !!

36.description: I live in Aurora, but drove right by all the shops in town to make sure that my first tattoo was done by Johnny at Code of Conduct.  This shop is utlra hip (loved the random assortment of books on the built in shelves), but carries a laid back vibe.  Johnny is talented and professional, and the other artists were friendly and fun to be around while they worked on their own clients.  I couldn't have asked for a better experience.  Get your appointment while you can.  I have a feeling they are going to hard to come by soon.

30.description: I got a tattoo here by Jimmy and he was super nice and patient with me as I decided what I wanted to get done! The guys at the front even offered us some of the thai food they had ordered in. The price was super reasonable and everyone made us feel really comfortable! I had a great experience.

3.description: Great place to go get a tattoo! BJ made the entire process smooth and now I have a beautiful wrist tattoo! As a first timer Code of Conduct made this such an easy and smooth process! Thanks guys!

14.description: I've gotten 4 tattoos from CoC, my wife has gotten 3 and my brother has gotten 1, all from the same artist (Ralph Corona) and every one was perfect. The artists are cool, the place is inviting, and the work is beyond compare. I would, and have, recommend CoC to anybody. Just don't be a dick and you'll be fine.

3.description: Cool little neighborhood grocer.  It's in a small space and filled with shelves stocked to the brim!  It's a great place to go when Chicago is being blasted by a polar vortex  and you can't make it to the grocery store.  Not much in the way of produce, but hey, you really shouldn't be expecting produce from a place like this.  Same prices like you'd find at a 7-11.  Not cheap, but you are paying for the convenience, not quality.

1.description: Everything is surge priced and the staff don't really know what's going on. I walked in and asked "where are your sodas" and not even thinking he said they had none... when they are directly across from him in the fridge. Also baby whiles were $4.99 and I just went to jewel to get the exact brand for $1.80. Haha so I got two, they also never really have anything either.. and milk isn't very fresh (usually sell date is within three days) .. but if you don't feel like walking the next block to 711 or the next four blocks after to Jewel then this is okay..

2.description: Not cheap, but has a lot of random stuff. No booze, either, but 7-11 is right down the street. The man working there can be pretty sour sometimes. They sell pipes, too. Good candy and Gatorade selection.

0.description: It's your average urban grocery store - bodega. The prices are a little high, the products look a bit stale and dusty, but when you need something in a pinch, this place is slightly better than 7-11. But that's not really saying much.

12.description: I highly recommend Village Eyecare for an eye exam and for choosing new frames.  Dr. Sarai, the optometrist, gave me a thorough exam and spotted some possible problems and advised me to see my opthalmologist.  He had his office send my report to my opthalmologist.  Sherice, the  optician, helped me select some great frames that look good on me.  The office has a professional feeling and is clean and well laid out.  The staff is professional and seem to be happy.  If you are looking for an interior decorator ask about Monica who designed their space.

3.description: Sherise is so helpful & nice. She has such a pleasant spirit. She always keep a smile on her face. She made it so much easier to pick out the perfect frames she even changed my mind about the original frames I wanted. I must also add kudos to my doctor she was wonderful & explained everything in detail... Great place to recommend..

1.description: I purchased my glasses in May of 2015. Unfortunately I broke the frames 10 days ago. Immediately I contacted Village EyeCare since I purchased them there. I was told that new frames would be ordered immediately. After a week went by I contacted Village EyeCare to see if the frames came in. I was told they were not in and they would check to see how long it would take. I did not hear from them for two days and called back. Again I was told they would check and call me back. Then after still not receiving a call back I called again. Not trusting them I waited on the line while they called the manufacture. After waiting the representative from Village EyeCare came back on and said the frames were discontinued. Terrible service and poor communication. BUYER BEWARE!!

2.description: I had my eye exam performed by Elizabeth Urbaniak. I went in for both a contacts fitting and regular eye exam. She was very helpful and thorough. I never someone explain so clearly my vision problems or give me suggestions on contacts and contact care. I was very pleased with the rest of the staff as well. It was very easy to get an appointment online, and the paperwork process went very smoothly. They were also really helpful in suggesting glasses and finding out the best way to make most of my insurance benefits. I have VSP.I would give it five stars, but the reason I'm giving four is because of the prices of contacts and glasses. I picked out a set of Ray Bans and a year supply of contacts and the total (with insurance applied) was over $500. I didn't realize it would be so much, so instead I asked for my prescription and will be looking around for more affordable options.

9.description: Fantastic service!  I was looking to purchase a second pair of glasses and Renita Darrough helped me step outside of my comfort zone.  Colors are my friend!  Reds, blues, greens, purples.... I settled on royal blue!  Love my new glasses.

10.description: Extremely professional and knowledgeable folks, and Dr. Urbaniak was fantastic.  First eye exam I've had in quite some time and needed to go in for new contacts.  It was a very smooth process and I'll definitely make this my new optometrist.  Highly recommend!

4.description: I went there to buy glasses and they had a good selection and helpful staff. I did feel a bit swayed into my decision as I didn't have any friends or family there to help but had to rely on the staff there for how the glasses looked. Even with my pretty good insurance the glasses came out a bit expensive. They do have a less expensive selection. I was also told glasses would be 30% off for u of c students before insurance when I was there a few days earlier but when I purchased them they said the student discount was only if I didn't have insurance ( which would have been nice to know up front). But for u of c students who don't have insurance, this is good place to check out. Hopefully I'll be happy with my glasses that should come in soon.

6.description: I love this office. Dr. Urabniak is knowledgeable and patient, and the office staff is superb. I had two choices of prescriptions for contacts and got trials pairs in both prescriptions to try out. For glasses I chose to replace the lenses but not the frames and the office was happy to accommodate. My whole family have been coming to this office for years, before new ownership, and we love it!

15.description: Everyone at Village Eyecare - Hyde Park was both welcoming and professional. Clearly they were more focused on my needs. I am completely satisfied with their work and how they treated me. Also, the cost of services was very reasonable.

0.description: Everyone in this office was so unbelievable kind, knowledgeable, and helpful, and Dr. Elizabeth Urbaniak is GREAT. She thoroughly explained all of my options, the pros and cons for each, and she gave me the space to decide for myself. I didn't feel pushed in any one direction. I felt very comfortable asking her questions and sharing my concerns, and she addressed each of them.Honestly, she is one of the best optometrists I've ever seen, and I will be coming back to her for as long as I live here. Highly recommend!

5.description: Enjoyed my first visit to the Hyde Park location. Staff was friendly, equipment modern and good selection of frames. Definitely would recommend.

13.description: I stopped by Village yesterday for an exam and to select new glasses and contacts.  The entire staff is excellent!  Sherice was very patient and helpful and Dr. Sarai was very knowledgeable and considerate. This is the most technically advanced 'facility' I've experienced and the counseling and explanations gave me great confidence I was in good hands.  Thanks all.

11.description: I had a great visit at Village Eyecare.  The equipment is very modern and the staff are upbeat and helpful.  I am really happy with my service.  Street parking was easy and service was fast.

8.description: Great selection of frames along with professional and personable doctors. I definitely would recommend them for your eye care and glassware needs.

14.description: I had the most comprehensive eye exam ever since the new ownership. My service was outstanding and I love my new glasses. The staff is friendly and efficient too! On street parking is ample

7.description: Best eye care shop I have ever been to. The salespeople were warm, knowledgeable, and very helpful. My sale associate spent over one and a half hours assisting unstylish me pick a set of glasses that would look good. She answered all my questions regarding the nature of eye glasses and I left the store feeling quite confident in my decision to visit them first (I had originally attended to shop around).Unfortunately the store was a little bit pricey, so as a graduate student on a limited budget I purchased the frames separately on Amazon and will come back to receive the lenses and have things fitted and adjusted. Regardless I highly recommend Chicago locals come here and get assistance.Pros:- Environment/ambiance- Salespeople- SelectionCons:- A little expensive

58.description: I work in the loop and when craving a Chicago style pizza, I won't hesitate to rally up my co-workers to pitch in the pot for a thin crust pizza with sausage, onions, light bell pepper, extra sauce and cooked well done!  This has become a monthly craving around the office and when we get a hankering for good pizza, Pat's is definitely on the top of our pick list.

56.description: The pizza at Pat's Pizzeria is pretty good. Many of the other things on their menu are worth trying as well, such as their pasta dishes and sandwiches.

29.description: By far the best thin crust in the city of Chicago. Their pizza is so thin, greasy, and cheesy. It is heaven. I only wish I lived within their delivery area.

42.description: Best customer service I've seen for a small pizza shop. Their wings are some of the best I've had in the city and their pizza is top notch. Highly recommended!!!!

23.description: Best thin crust pizza in Chicago - no frills just good food. We ordered pizzas for a party and were able to taste a variety of toppings which were all fresh. We liked it so much that it has become our new go to pizza delivery place.

47.description: This is a small place you'd probably just walk past without giving it a second look, but let me tell you, have the pizza here and you won't miss this place again. I'm from out of town so I'm not sure how popular this place is among the locals but you've got a fan in Minnesota that will be back. Not only for the pizza but for the customer service the owner is such a nice guy and makes every customer feel welcomed.

8.description: Ordered a medium thin crust, as others have mentioned it's definitely not on the cheaper side of pizza (as compared to other chain stores). Sauce was good, on the sweeter side, and contrasted nicely against the saltiness of the pepperoni and mushroom we ordered. When craving some higher quality pie, would definitely order again.

31.description: Tried it for the first time today. This is how thin crust should be done. Paper thin crust. Good flavor all around. Ordered a medium sausage and jalapeño, extra sauce well done. It was perfect and ready for pickup in 20 min.

34.description: Went to the Bears game for Monday Night Football and stayed at the Hilton on Michigan Ave. Thank god for this place because it made me forget about the disaster that happened at Solider Field! Awesome thin crust pizza! Order it "well done" and it'll come crispy but not dry or burnt! Well done Pat's!

16.description: Good place to get some quick pizza near the South Loop. Was dinner time and heard they had great thin crust pizza so I called and spoke to a guy who was relatively patient with me despite all the questions I asked about costs.Went ahead and ordered a Large (16 inch) 2 topping thin crust pizza with pepperoni and sausage and paid about $23 to go pick it up. It was ready in 20 min.Pro: The pizza tasted great, the thin crust was the type that wasn't cracker thin but soft and thin. Great combo for me. Healthy amounts of toppings, no shortchanging there. Good stuff for a hungry dinner/late night situationCon: A little bit pricey though in my opinion, $23 for large 2 topping, and the 1 topping wasn't that much cheaper like $20-$21 if I remember correctly, and it doesnt stop there, the Medium or one size down at 14 was only a few dollars cheaper at like $19-$20. Anyway, good tasting pizza if you are a high roller in the south loop willing to dish out some money for a good tasting pizza.

13.description: Pizza is alright.   Thin crust is the go to here.   Toppings are not thick really.   Not exactly a cheap pie.   Deliveries will take over an hour easily.   I've never had mozzarella  sticks be delivered warm .  Honestly, go to your regular thin crust spot.   I wanna try to like the place because it's close, but it's just the worst service I've dealt with in terms of pizza.   Place needs to figure it out.

11.description: Beware that this is not the same Pat's Pizza as up North. I looked at the online Menu that redirected to the northside location assuming they were owned by the same people. Ended up ordering a meat lover's pizza, which they knew how to make, but cost me like $35, for a medium. The sausage was so greasy that the pizza fell apart and it just tasted awful. This was a regular crust pizza. It kinda sickens me to live in Chicago and have knock off pizza places like this. Maybe I just ordered the worst thing on the menu, but never returning here again.

39.description: IMO, this is the best thin crust cheese pizza in the city.  Their sauce is on the sweet side, but that's probably what makes it so delicious.  For whatever reason, their + toppings pizzas are just OK (still better than average); but, if you're in a purist's mood for cheese only?  Pat's every time.

37.description: I have yet to find another non-chain pizza place in the loop for lunch.  Small 8" thin crust pepperoni pizza is good!  The only problem is the 8" isn't on the menu.  There's nothing special about the pizza but it is good.

0.description: So happy to find a great neighborhood pizza delivery spot!! We ordered 4 thin crust (well done and easy cheese) pizzas on valentines day and they delivered our pizzas exactly at the time we asked! The pizzas were still hot and crispy. Pizzas we had:GiardineraJalapeno, Garlic, Green pepper onionSpinach, Onion, Garlic (THIS WAS THE GROUP FAVORITE)Super fresh and great service. Highly recommend it!

38.description: Pat's was alright, I don't have too much to say.  The giardinera and sausage combination was good don't get me wrong but man it was expensive for thin crust.  If i'm paying that much for pizza, it better be chicago style deep dish!!!  The quality and quantity did not justify the pricing but if you're not worried about the budget, it's a decent place to get some thin crust pizza. It's the kind of place i'd go back for with a coupon.  Service was nice and fast! : )

51.description: This is our Sunday night staple.  By far the best thin crust pizza in the city.  Jalapeño and bacon is our favorite. Just ask for well done if you like the cheese brown and the crust crunchy. We get it delivered and it always arrives hot and in a timely manner.

27.description: Horrible customer service. I placed an order for pick up and when I got there the woman who was behind the desk was so Unbelievably rude. She clearly couldn't handle answering the phone, helping customers who walk in and packing up to go orders.  She couldn't be bothered to take care of me when I first got there just brushed me to the side and said its not ready yet. I waited for 20 minutes for her to tell me they didn't put in my order and if I was sure I called the right pats pizza. I must look like an idiot to her. Then a cook put my pizza on the counter so I guess they "found it". She didn't apologize or acknowledge anything. The pizza was just ok. But thanks to that woman I'll never order there again. Why do people work In Customer service if they are miserable and mean? I don't understand.

32.description: The staff is absolutely wonderful! I stopped in on the way home from work one night and was not disappointed. I highly recommend this place!

54.description: I've been eating pats for a number of years as I work about a mile away and have never been disappointed. Several of my coworkers regularly order from here as well. With all the excellent choices for the best food around Chicago in the area my staff and I always find ourselves going back to Pats. From pizza,  to pasta, burgers, chicken strips, mozz sticks, and an amazing grilled chicken sandwich it's hard to go wrong with Pats. The staff has gotten to know me over the years and is always very helpful and friendly. I couldn't think of a bad thing to say about this place and I've ordered from here at least twice a week for the last several years. Give them a shot, you will not be disappointed!

48.description: Great thin crust pizza. Everything looks very clean. It is a take out place but quality is good

44.description: Ace has a coupon for Tuesday special that has no date on it for expectation.  Called to place order and would not accept.  Maryann needs to take some management/customer service classes and print date on them if they are going to tell you no.  One star but you can take that away too

24.description: I order pizza from Pat's often both pick up and delivery. The price of an individual pizza comes with a can of soda. I didn't realize I was missing soda until I received my order. Then I remembered that the woman that took my order didn't offer soda. When I called to see why I wasn't offered pizza the same young lady said soda comes with pick up orders only. Please note that there is a $2.50 delivery fee. So I said to the young lady...I paid a delivery fee for a delivery that was a 2 minute walk and I couldn't get a soda? She said I'm just telling you what the manager said. Rude! The manager then confirmed and also said they don't give fries for sandwich deliveries. When I said that's horrible customer service the manager said its up to the customer to ask for these items. Sooo...If you decide to order at Pat's be sure to ask for soda or fries...otherwise you'll feel cheated for OKAY food.

7.description: I don't give 1 star reviews often.I wanted to ordered pizza delivery last night which is a rare occurrence for me. I didn't realize finding a "regular" pizza that wasn't deep dish or thin crust would have been so difficult, so I searched Yelp for places in the South Loop and just called around asking who had what I wanted until Pat's said yes. I knew I wanted a regular Papa John's-type pizza that wasn't Papa John's, but in hindsight this was my mistake and I should have just ordered from there and been totally satisfied. Instead I got a super thick pizza from Pat's... the sauce was about 3 times the necessary amount and there were gobs of cheese everywhere. It looked like a heart attack waiting to happen. The pepperoni was visibly on top of the pie, but the sausage was imbedded somewhere within, among the sauce and cheese ridiculousness. If that's your thing, great, but it's not mine and I was highly disappointed... especially for $28! Seriously, I almost choked when the lady over the phone gave me the cost for ONE pizza delivery which should have been my sign to hang up (again my fault) but I figured it must be good given the solid star ratings... Nope, not worth it a dollar in my mind. But hey, this is my review and my opinion. Take it with a grain of salt.

49.description: Worst pizza I've ever had in Chicago! 50 bucks for two large pizzas and the box probably had more flavor than the pizza did. Never again!

40.description: Excited for our order to get here!! The thin crust pizza and fried raviolis are AMAZING!!

53.description: Husband and I are new to area, walked in here to find out what the hype was about. Definitely worth the 20 minute wait!  Nice staff. We got a thin crust and it had delicious buttery crust! Also got the loaded salad which I wasn't a huge fan of but the pizza would of off set anything it was that good.This will be our new Friday night pizza

30.description: I don't give 1 star reviews often.I wanted to ordered pizza delivery last night which is a rare occurrence for me. I didn't realize finding a "regular" pizza that wasn't deep dish or thin crust would have been so difficult, so I searched Yelp for places in the South Loop and just called around asking who had what I wanted until Pat's said yes. I knew I wanted a regular Papa John's-type pizza that wasn't Papa John's, but in hindsight this was my mistake and I should have just ordered from there and been totally satisfied. Instead I got a super thick pizza from Pat's... the sauce was about 3 times the necessary amount and there were gobs of cheese everywhere. It looked like a heart attack waiting to happen. The pepperoni was visibly on top of the pie, but the sausage was imbedded somewhere within, among the sauce and cheese ridiculousness. If that's your thing, great, but it's not mine and I was highly disappointed... especially for $28! Seriously, I almost choked when the lady over the phone gave me the cost for ONE pizza delivery which should have been my sign to hang up (again my fault) but I figured it must be good given the solid star ratings... Nope, not worth it a dollar in my mind. But hey, this is my review and my opinion. Take it with a grain of salt.

46.description: During our little outing in downtown chicago, we were still on a pizza craving even though we had pizza the day before.  Wherever we were, there was a pizza place in walking distance so we just wanted to grab a small bite to eat.  We found this place that made pizzas but it wasn't too big.  We ordered the Pat's special, which came with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and onions for $7.50.  It took about 15 minutes to cook which I thought was pretty long considering how small the pizza was.  The pizza was decent but it wasn't anything to spectacular.  Good find to eat if you want to hold your stomach for a delicious meal forthcoming.NOTE:-Free drink included-no bathrooms-small place (walk up to counter and order)

1.description: I have been looking for a good thin crust pizza place since I moved into printers row and I found it.  It is better than the place my family always eat at in the burbs and any other thin crust i have tried in the city.  It is nice, crisp, the sauce is amazing, and PINEAPPLE is a topping!Staff is always very friendly and I like that they have such a variety of soda to choose from.  I mean a ton of options.  For those who complained there is no where to sit and eat, its a pick up or delivery place what do you expect?  There is a counter with a few high level chairs however if you need a place to eat. It is a little pricey but that is because it 100% worth it.  I found my new go to pizza place and could not recommend this place enough.

55.description: I've lived in Printer's Row for about a year now and finally decided to give Pat's a try, after reading all of the great reviews in here.  What can I say, I was not all that impressed.  I got the Pat's Special and the pizza was nothing out of the ordinary.  The crust in the middle was not crispy, the flavor was just average.  Honestly to me it was pretty darn close to stuff you can get at Papa John's or Dominoes.  I'm a little upset that I spent $22 on a pizza at Pat's when I could've gone to Lou Malnati's on State and paid a little less for much better quality & flavor; Lou's thin crust sausage pizza is amazing!  Sorry Pat's, your prices are too high for the quality that I experienced.

9.description: I love the sandwich menu, great value for money, quality is there too. Im also a fan of the pizza

26.description: Good place to get some quick pizza near the South Loop. Was dinner time and heard they had great thin crust pizza so I called and spoke to a guy who was relatively patient with me despite all the questions I asked about costs.Went ahead and ordered a Large (16 inch) 2 topping thin crust pizza with pepperoni and sausage and paid about $23 to go pick it up. It was ready in 20 min.Pro: The pizza tasted great, the thin crust was the type that wasn't cracker thin but soft and thin. Great combo for me. Healthy amounts of toppings, no shortchanging there. Good stuff for a hungry dinner/late night situationCon: A little bit pricey though in my opinion, $23 for large 2 topping, and the 1 topping wasn't that much cheaper like $20-$21 if I remember correctly, and it doesnt stop there, the Medium or one size down at 14 was only a few dollars cheaper at like $19-$20. Anyway, good tasting pizza if you are a high roller in the south loop willing to dish out some money for a good tasting pizza.

25.description: great pizza and fast delivery

12.description: Part of a taste test when my family came into town, we put Pat's up against County Inn from Elmhurst (others were Due's and Pequod's for deep dish).To make it a true taste test, we just got pepperoni and onion to match the County Inn pizza. The crust on this one was incredible, cracker thin, crispy and delicious. Hands down a favorite among our group of 7, including one who has been biased towards County Inn his whole life.The toppings were good but may be able to be spiced up a bit.Always a great option if you're looking for something quick, or for some great thin crust pizza.

59.description: Very good, fast delivery, pizza was really hot. I'll be calling again.

21.description: I'm a Pat's fan!  In my opinion, it's the best thin-crust pizza in Chicago.  The crust is nice and crispy and the sauce is perfectly tomatoey and a little sweet.  They deliver to our house in River West.  Our usual order is a large pizza with sausage and pepperoni.  Soooo good!

17.description: Visiting Chicago for training... this is the best meal I've had yet! Delivered super fast, and so hot it burned my tongue, the way it should be. I would have given 5 stars but the kid who took my order wasn't exactly friendly, and there were no plates or napkins with the delivery even though I'm in a hotel. Might be my fault for not requesting them. Would order from here again in a heartbeat!

10.description: I love Pat's. Being in the neighborhood and walk past here every day after work, I have to fight myself from getting a pizza daily. This is the staple of a walk up counter pizza joint. They do not have slices, but no worries, they are usually quick. I typically don't even call ahead, but just stop in and order. 25 mins later, my large pizza is ready to take home (have been in here during lunch and it's even quicker with their individual pies). There is very minimal seating; more or less counter space to grab their special on your lunch break. The owner is extremely friendly and accommodating. I've only had their thin crust pepperoni and sausage, but I'm afraid to try anything else, because I enjoy it so much. The crush is thin and crispy with a great balance of savory sauce, toppings, and cheese. Most importantly, the flavors just work together. I have no complaints or critiques. Pat's is a no frills spot cranking out pizzas for all to enjoy.

5.description: Best thin crust Pizza in Chicago.  No debate.  My boss ordered from here about 6 years ago, and I never looked back.  The Pat's (sausage, onion, green pepper) is my fave.  Not really a dine-in place, just some counter space.  Probably great for a quick lunch. I always order delivery, always tip big because I never want this place to go away.

3.description: I love this place. Best pizza in the city. But when they charge me $26 for a medium pizza and take close to two hours to deliver, I may have to reconsider my options.

35.description: Whoever the woman is answering their phone over there is very rude and disrespectful. It was if taking my order and answering a question was a huge problem for her. I have been ordering from Pats for 3+ years, the pizza is very good, but based on how I was treated on the phone I probably won't be going back.  Horrible.

19.description: Whoever the woman is answering their phone over there is very rude and disrespectful. It was if taking my order and answering a question was a huge problem for her. I have been ordering from Pats for 3+ years, the pizza is very good, but based on how I was treated on the phone I probably won't be going back.  Horrible.

28.description: I have ordered the thin crust from here a couple of weeks ago, I fell in love with it but today I ordered the same pizza and it was like having an eraser! Dry, cold and tasteless. Don't know if I will order again.

45.description: Probably one of the best thin crust pizzas ever. A small hole in the wall place but well worth it.

33.description: What a great surprise! This Pat's is not related to the one I used to know on the North Side so I wasn't sure what to expect. Our options for delivery in the South Loop are pretty limited so we were excited to find a place that would come to us on a cold, snowy winter's night. They told us 45 minutes and it was 45 minutes. They have coupons online, and there was no problem redeeming it. The delivery fee must be baked into the price, which was also nice. But the main thing, of course, was the pizza itself, which was excellent- super thin crust, crisp and a great taste. Definitely not greasy. We had to warm it up a bit and I could have used more mushrooms, but overall, this was a very favorable experience. We will definitely be ordering from Pat's again. I noticed that they also have sandwiches and pasta, too!

43.description: Part of a taste test when my family came into town, we put Pat's up against County Inn from Elmhurst (others were Due's and Pequod's for deep dish).To make it a true taste test, we just got pepperoni and onion to match the County Inn pizza. The crust on this one was incredible, cracker thin, crispy and delicious. Hands down a favorite among our group of 7, including one who has been biased towards County Inn his whole life.The toppings were good but may be able to be spiced up a bit.Always a great option if you're looking for something quick, or for some great thin crust pizza.

2.description: During our little outing in downtown chicago, we were still on a pizza craving even though we had pizza the day before.  Wherever we were, there was a pizza place in walking distance so we just wanted to grab a small bite to eat.  We found this place that made pizzas but it wasn't too big.  We ordered the Pat's special, which came with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and onions for $7.50.  It took about 15 minutes to cook which I thought was pretty long considering how small the pizza was.  The pizza was decent but it wasn't anything to spectacular.  Good find to eat if you want to hold your stomach for a delicious meal forthcoming.NOTE:-Free drink included-no bathrooms-small place (walk up to counter and order)

18.description: Best thin crust pizza in the south loop area. My favorite is pepperoni with extra cheese well baked.

41.description: Fantastic pizza place, the best in the South Loop.  I get delivery only (always fast) and always order thin-crust.  Pepperoni & Mushroom, and Sausage & Spinach are both fantastic combinations.  The sauce is what makes the pizza.

52.description: I've been ordering from Pat's for 18 years and today I'm sad to say, I'm done with Pat's.  I've had so many bad experiences with orders being correct, wrong credit card #'s etc. and today the pizza was awful.  The usual crisp thin crust was almost deep dish style.  it was terrible.  I called Pat's and the manager Danny blew me off and said sorry.  Well, here's sorry.  I'm done.  I wash't looking for anything other than how can I help you, but that won't in the cards.So long Pat's, I can no longer recommend you with such passé attitudes and bad service.

50.description: My boss ordered delivery from here for lunch today, and here are my thoughts.- thin crust: crispy- sauce: I think there was sauce- cheese: there was definitely cheese- sausage: there was sausage on the pizzaAll the elements of pizza were there, but it just wasn't very flavorful. Overall, very "meh." Unfortunately, the boss said it was significantly cheaper than Giordano's so I think we will be ordering from here from now on. I'll have to request the stuffed or think crust next time and see if that's any better.

4.description: We were happily surprised that this is our favorite pizza place here in Chicago! It's just good and has been consistently delicious every time we order.   I'd order this before Malnatis(also good...), Gino's(yuck), pequods (yuck)... And all of the others around downtown.  They also have fresh salads, yummy pasta, and have been friendly when we order and pick up. Thanks Pats!

6.description: I got a coupon mailer in the mail (If you are advertising a restaurant, the mailers apparently work. I never thought much about this until I used this coupon - but - print advertising worked for my uncle's dentistry in the 90s so I guess my 'revelation' is moot - I am not sure where I am going here). All of the coupons came out to saving three dollars. Except the one weird one where if you buy 15 large pizzas, you get a case of soda. I wonder if they meant a 12-pack of cans - I'll never know - I don't plan on buying fifteen large pizzas. I get the feeling they are nice enough that they might give you that free pack if you buy only fourteen or thirteen large pizzas.Well, I ordered over the phone. It came in about 20 minutes or so. I forget. it was very hot when it got here. The delivery person was nice.  After tax and delivery fee and tip it was kind of expensive, part of that was getting three toppings. I don't get toppings pricings.Okay, my review:The pizza was as good as this picture looks to you:yelp.com/biz_photos/pats…

22.description: Falling out of love....Used to think the pat's pizza was the best after my office ordered it for lunch and have been getting for years.  But tonight their thin crust was a little too thin, it was kind of soggy.  Wonder if they changed their recipe?  Also, kind of expensive.  Almost $23+ tip/deliver for a medium pats (sausage, pepper, mushroom, onion).   I think they are using frozen crust now....wonder what is going on?

15.description: We order pizza pan with pineapple , ham and cheese ,we just love it . The pizza was delicious

57.description: Basically the best pizza in Chicago!!!! Pat's pizza has a special recipe that no one knows because their pizza is sooo good!  No idea what they do differently than other places, but whatever they are doing it's amazing! I always ask for my pizza to be extra sauce and extra crispy! The sauce is delicious!!!! If your in the south loop area looking for a pizza place ... Please try it out!!! They r good for thin crust! If your looking for a deep dish just head over to Lou's on State.

20.description: Solid quality pizza. Perfect blend of saucy and cheesy!  We came here on a rainy night and did not leave disappointed!

36.description: I got a coupon mailer in the mail (If you are advertising a restaurant, the mailers apparently work. I never thought much about this until I used this coupon - but - print advertising worked for my uncle's dentistry in the 90s so I guess my 'revelation' is moot - I am not sure where I am going here). All of the coupons came out to saving three dollars. Except the one weird one where if you buy 15 large pizzas, you get a case of soda. I wonder if they meant a 12-pack of cans - I'll never know - I don't plan on buying fifteen large pizzas. I get the feeling they are nice enough that they might give you that free pack if you buy only fourteen or thirteen large pizzas.Well, I ordered over the phone. It came in about 20 minutes or so. I forget. it was very hot when it got here. The delivery person was nice.  After tax and delivery fee and tip it was kind of expensive, part of that was getting three toppings. I don't get toppings pricings.Okay, my review:The pizza was as good as this picture looks to you:yelp.com/biz_photos/pats…

14.description: I came here for dinner one night and ordered the Pat's special with cheese fries.  Preparation took a while (25-30 mins) but the owner was very friendly and chatted with me during the wait.  When I received the food, I was very impressed with the quantity.  The pie had pretty good size for the price and came with a free soda, assorted crackers, and probably half a dozen packs of grated cheeses and other seasonings.  The order of cheese fries was also huge and filled an entire takeout box.  Both tasted pretty good and I'd recommend a visit if you're hungry and craving pizza and/or fries.

58.description: I have been here twice. The first time I bought the yelp coupon which was a $75 gift certificate for $50. On that visit I got my eyebrows waxed, pedicure and 30minute massage. The eye brow wax was quick and easy the pedicure was great I love the comfy chairs and style of raised seating over the sinks-very cute. The massage is AMAZING. It prompted me to go back one week later for another one. My only complaint was the nail people don't do any type of nail art. I don't like anything crazy but I like some polka dots. I was able to show the lady what I wanted but if you want anything more exciting you won't get it here. Anyway I really recommend this place especially the massage.

56.description: Good Place, Ambiance is good. Freindly Staff.Facial consultant was good, looked at my skin and suggested a good facial , for 1 hour good hour clean up,applying all good products, well massaged & loved it.During and after facial I felt a looooooot of difference, feels like HEAVEN.

29.description: I got my nails done and eyebrows waxed. Everything was pretty slow (spent about 2 hours there) and my eyebrows were done in a very mediocre way. I don't think I will go back.

42.description: I have received waxing in multiple places. I travel far if I have to, and I never try to skimp on waxing as I like to make sure I am receiving a safe, hygienic and skillful service! Finally, I've found the right place. Amy is absolutely trustworthy and she is highly knowledgable on what she does. Waxing is done very quickly and painlessly! I love visiting Anjou, it is always a nice stress reliever. I look forward to my next visit! (..which I hope will be tomorrow if I can book an appointment in the morning. My nails are looking freaky from this horrendous weather, aahhhh)

23.description: I have been here a couple of times. For pedicures it's pretty good. Comfortable seats, but they're not massaging seats, however it's quiet and with the movies on, it's very relaxing. Although a pedicure is very quick and the massage component maybe lasts 60 seconds. For manicures I've had no chip here twice. First time with OPI products was OK, and the second time with CND Shellac. The second time the shellac started lifting within 3 days. I came back and they dutifully re-did them all. But annoyingly they never apologized and were really annoyed at me for having to re-do work. Well it's not like I wanted to sit there for another hour to have a job I'd already paid for done again. I won't go back in a hurry. And this place is not exactly cheap. For mani and pedi with tip it's $95.

47.description: The yelp $75 for $50 deal was great. I got a manicure, pedicure, and waxing service. All staff were very nice and professional, clean environment. They also have a great waxing deal for regular maintenance. Enjoyed all services and will definitely go back!

8.description: I visited this location on 1/31 for a pedicure and a no chip. The spa was very cute and clean and the staff was very professional. However my no chip started chipping and lifting yesterday (2/3). No chips are supposed to last more than 3 days.

31.description: Lovely!  Stopped in with my coworker during lunch.  My new favorite spot to get a lunch time mani.  Very cute, very clean.  The staff was nothing but friendly.  They played calming (but good) music so you could sit back and relax.  While my nails were drying they surprised us with a neck and shoulder massage (all for $15).  My nails look fabulous.  The attention to detail was wonderful.  I cant wait to go back and get a pedicure!

34.description: I had my first experience with massage with Spa Anjou. The overall experience was great! My friend and I went in at 7 for a pedicure and half hour massage each. In total it required 1.5 hour.  Even though they close at 8, they still welcomed us. The service was great and I loved the massage.
