The only reason that I did not give a five star was because I felt like the pedicure was expensive, $40. I have received bother manicure and pedicure for $40 at other locations. Plus, the owner has a cute dog, maybe if you go by close time, you can play with the dog too! :D

16.description: I didnt get the name of the girl who did my nails but she was a young girl with cute freckles on her face. She was very impersonal with no words, which I didnt really mind but when I asked for wifi password or to take off my cuticles more thoroughly she just answered "ok" and didnt really follow through. I paid $45 for regular mani and pedi and extra $10 for taking off my previous gel polish. After drying my nails I took a good look at my nails and I couldnt believe i just spent 2 hrs sitting there to get such a nasty mani..my cuticles were still intact! but before I could say anything she was out the door. Its the shottiest mani job I've ever paid for and it was not worth spending my $60 or time here. Never coming back.

13.description: This is such a cute place and so close to my apartment I was hoping the Brazilian waxing would be better. She was so friendly but I think that the entire top layer of my skin was waxed off. One of the most painful experiences ever. I went 2 times to see if the first time was a fluke, but it wasn't. I will not return for a wax, but will for other services!

11.description: Great place with a very relaxing environment but I felt for a $45 mani/pedi it was very very basic but no perks at all.Also now three days later and I have three chipped nails. And all of the nails look like I got the manicure two weeks ago

39.description: Accommodating and friendly. I got a walk-in mani + spa pedi. The spa pedi was thorough and really relaxing. The front desk woman helped me to choose a color and she did a nice job, I'm very happy with the color. The nail technicians were perfectionists. No little spots of polish on my skin to wash off tomorrow. Zero. Perfect.The chairs are comfortable and cute leather armchairs. Not recliners or robo-massage chairs. The ambiance is nice. Not uber-girly, if that makes sense. There's a wooden moose head on the wall. Sort of hipster-girly, like a chic lodge or something. Everything was very clean. They play movies on mute with subtitles on. I saw the last 20 mins of "Some Like It Hot" and the first 30 of "How to Lose Friends and Alienate People," which I thought were good picks. Nice to be at a salon where you feel like they have really good taste. I thought the price was fine for the level of service. My total was $60 before tip.

37.description: Got a no-chip manicure and pedicure that was already chipping a few days after !!! Would not recommend this place.  Colors are limited and staff can be very rude!!! Especially Kima/Nima, avoid her if you can. She was so unpleasant.

0.description: Most of the reviews here are for manicures, but what brought me into Spa Anjou was a Brazilian wax. I had to cancel my appointment at the spa I usually go to get waxed the day before, so the next morning I booked an appointment at Spa Anjou to get a wax just an hour after I called, so availability seems to be great! I have gotten Brazilian waxes many places around the city as I would just go to mostly anywhere that offered a good groupon, so I have had my share of terrible experiences to really great ones, but I would actually say my wax today at Spa Anjou was the best I have ever had. Amy took her time and was very meticulous to completely get everything but did it in a way that was still fast and a lot less painful than most places I have been. She also has a very sweet personality and conversation was very nice the whole time which made the experience much more comfortable.I paid $55 as a first-timer here, but if you get waxed regularly you MUST go here as a regular because if you come back within 40 days, the wax is only $35!!! I booked my next appointment right after for that reason. I'm extremely happy I came into Spa Anjou today.

38.description: Very friendly and courteous.  Nicely decorated and relaxing environment.  The prices were good @ $45 for a mani/pedi and it includes a quick shoulder massage.  Would return.

51.description: Solid ($12) eyebrow waxing here. Not the best but solid.  Nice small, spa so I'd love to go back and try more services.

27.description: Amy is excellent.  She is my go-to when I'm back in Chicago.

32.description: I had an amazing time at this spa today! Everyone is super friendly and the space is comfortable and clean! I had a facial with Amy who took her time with me and provided me with both a relaxing and enjoyable facial as well as a very thorough treatment. She really cared about providing a great service! I will be back in a month.

54.description: I loved this place. I got a yelp coupon and used it with a special. So it was a lot for my dollar. They were very thorough and took their time. People even walked in the door and because they were taking their time, they told them that it would be a while and they couldn't take them. Awesome. Highly recommend it!

48.description: I just moved to the South Loop and was looking for my new go-to neighborhood nail salon. I bought the Yelp deal ($75 of services for $50) and figured I'd try this place out. First, I didn't realize that the Yelp deal has to be used all at once (it's not like a gift card where they keep a balance - if you don't get $75 worth of services, that's too bad). So that was annoying, but the girl at the front was really helpful and suggested a reflexology foot massage ($15) to add to the mani/pedi to hit the $75 total. The atmosphere is really clean and appealing and the music is soothing. I love the leather chairs for the spa pedicure - so much nicer than the big, bulky massage chairs (though, those have their moments too). I also noticed that a couple of people had brought their own wine - so apparently it's a byob nail place, which is great. The lowdown:Spa pedicure - Fantastic. She did a good job on my toes and getting my feet to feel closer to normal. At the end of the pedicure, they put some kind of chocolate mud mask on your feet and lower legs. Awesome. Reflexology foot massage - Save your money! It was terrible. It didn't hurt or anything, but at the end of a long day, if I'm getting a foot massage, I want my feet massaged. Paying $15 for 10 minutes of someone to very gently rubbing my feet to the point that I can barely feel it is not worth it. I've have better leg/foot massages from people just giving me a regular spa pedicure. Manicure - Looks good so far. I'm not sure how long it will hold up, but one day in it still looks great. Polish Color Selection: Good, not great. I didn't have any problems finding a color that I wanted, so I have no complaints. They have a good range of colors, just not every single color that has come out in the last two years (which can be overwhelming if you're not sure what kind of color you want to go with). Time - It took about an hour and a half, which I appreciated. It made the whole thing very relaxing (probably because I didn't have somewhere I had to be) and I didn't feel like they were rushing me back out the door.

44.description: The decor is modern but still inviting. They also have the softest chairs for when you get a mani. There are a couple of TVs around the store, as wells as magazines on the coffee table to keep you entertained. Prices are reasonable - $40 for no-chip/gel mani that lasts. I am pretty pleased with the results. The girl who did my nails wasn't chatty and got right to business. There were so many steps that I don't even remember, but that must be a good thing right? Clip, file, wipe, file more, cut cuticles, lotion...etc. rinse and repeat. Very detail-oriented and careful. In fact, my nails are still holding up 2 weeks later. Although there are tiny chips, it's in good shape considering how often I wash my hands. (see the 0 weeks and 2 weeks picture below)

24.description: Very nice, relaxing environment to get a manicure (the only service I've received here.) My no chip mani was great- the technician was very thorough, attentive and careful. My nails look great and aren't chipping or peeling anywhere, which is the first time I've had a no chip last this long (over a week good as new!) I'll definitely be coming back. (I didn't give 5 stars because my go-to nail salon goes above and beyond when I get a mani/pedi by offering a free neck and shoulder massage while my nails are drying, hot tea/ water with refills, and more personalized service. I didn't experience this here, but was very satisfied overall.)

7.description: Best no-chip I've ever had. Hands down.Went back again and can confirm it was not a fluke. Got an awesome no-chip + pedi. Bottom line, Nima is awesome and does a beautiful job.

49.description: I love this place. It is rare to get ambiance, relaxation, customer service and quality service all in one place for fair and moderate prices at one location. Usually you have to give  up  at least one of these attributes.  Normally I do not consider smaller businesses as a "Spa". But Spa Anjou has changed my mind and re-educated me on the definition of the "Spa experience" . Call me snobbish if you want to, but this place is magnificent, and the staff cannot be more warm and nice upon your entry.  The young lady that works at the desk could not be nicer when telling that that were all booked up for when I wanted  have my No Chip manicure.   That is finesse as I was given an appt 30 minutes later.  It is relaxing, clean, inviting, and the best no chip removal and application that I have experienced. I will be back this week!

40.description: Very clean and sanitary.  Cute touches here and there and fun movies playing.  Technicians are friendly and do a good job.  Spa Anjou is a little too pricey for me visit frequently though.  Color selection is somewhat limited.

53.description: Got the yelp deal here after a long fourth of july weekend. I felt grimy, unshowered, and had time to kill before my flight out of Chicago, and visiting this place was a great idea. It was a very relaxing atmosphere, had many chairs available to accommodate a same-day appointment, and the people were very nice. I had a good massage and pedicure. The paint job wasn't bad, but it's only been a few days so I'm not sure how long it'll last. I'd go again if there were another deal!

30.description: Came here for a gel / no chip manicure last week. Pros: the spa is nice; receptionist very friendly; dog mascot adorableCons: my gel manicure started chipping the VERY NEXT DAY! I went back to get that nail fixed, which they were nice enough to do, but then the next day, ANOTHER nail came off!! For $40, I would expect a manicure that lasts more than 24 hours. :( I don't think I'll be returning.

46.description: I came here for a wax and pedicure and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere was very relaxing and calm, I'd love to know what Pandora station they had on because it was good relaxing mix. The two estheticians were very detail oriented and professional, prices are reasonable. I left feeling more relaxed that I have in a while. I definitely will be back. Thank you!

1.description: I visited this nail salon first for a brow wax. Amy did a great job! The following day, a pedicure and gel nails. They did a good job but the service is very basic. The staff is friendly and the establishment is very clean but it's a bit over priced. Usually anywhere else I've visited through out the U.S, 65-75 dollars with tip gives me a gel set and pedicure. This includes (hot towels for your legs, callus removal and lotion). Gel nails included detail cortical removal and nail shaping once the gel is applied.This is a nice place but the service doesn't match the price.

55.description: Had a wax appointment with Amy. She is very thorough and meticulous. Also she is an absolute sweetheart. As a bonus I got in the same day I called. Definitely going back.

9.description: Attention to detail on my pedi - and the music adds. Relaxing touch - thank you

26.description: I used to frequent this salon and was generally happy with the results, and I like that they play movies on mute, so it can be more of a relaxing experience. I'm taking a break, though. I most often get no-chip manicures and during the last visit, the nail technician buffed my nails down to nearly skin level. I already have weak nails (that's why I get no-chip) and my fingers were in pain for days. I haven't been back since.

25.description: i went for a no-chip manicure & pedicure.  It was expensive ($90), but I've paid that before so the price wasn't a big issue for me.  PROS:This place is CLEAN. Most nail salons are dirty.  This place isn't. And it's relaxing.  The woman who did my nails was a perfectionist, which is good.CONS:I had the no-chip manicure on Saturday and by Tuesday night, it was chipping.  NOT GOOD.  This was my first time going to this place; however, I've had no-chips at other nail salons and they didn't start chipping until after 2 weeks.  So, I won't be going back.  $40 is too much to pay for something that chips after 3 days.  That's ridiculous.

12.description: Spa Anjou is my go-to place for a pedicure. The atmosphere inside is very relaxing, quiet, and warm. They play good music and have comfy spa chairs. I always get a nice leg massage as part of the pedicure. There are lots of OPI and Esse colors to choose from. Be sure to make an appointment - they don't take walk ins!

59.description: Love Spa Anjou! My mother, sister, and I have been getting almost weekly nail services there for about 8 months. It is not a quicky nail place. Each technician takes their time to make it an enjoyable and peaceful experience. Spa Anjou is friendly, bright, and clean.

21.description: More like an upgraded nail salon than a spa. But this place is nice. Clean, tasteful décor and movies on silent with subtitles if you forgot your book. No massage chairs for pedicures but they have clean supplies and did a great job on spa mani-pedi. The woman was so patient while I figured out color combo I wanted to get (pre-wedding jitters). I could have used more massaging of the feet and arms, but maybe I'm spoiled by the west coast/Cali. I also got a facial and they did all sorts of nice things to my skin. Again, more neck and scalp massage would have been nice, but that was not specified in description so I can't be mad.  I was worried that I was breaking out a bit after but by the next day I was hydrated and glowing for my wedding!

17.description: Didn't want to give me service that I was requesting for even though I got there 1hour and 10 minutes before they were closing.

10.description: This place seems great for mani/pedis. Unfortunately, I had the first layer of skin removed in three rather significant chunks from my upper lip due to a lip wax (photo with patch dimensions posted).I've visited three times for similar services and never had this problem before. I think the aesthetician just left the wax on too long and ended up ripping skin off, too.I called and explained what happened when I notice after getting home, they had me come back in to see what happened. She thought it was because I use acne creams, (no retinoids though) and apologized several times, mentioning that she should have asked before my appointment services began. I've been using acne creams for almost a decade though and have Never had this happen before! These ladies are super sweet, but I think she just left the wax on Way too long, or the temperature was too cold? They did give me my money back, apologized for the incident, and thanked me for coming back in, but I probably won't be coming back.

5.description: I went to this place this week since it is in my moms building and was convenient. I needed a mani. I hadn't been to this place in a year and thought I'd give it a try. There are about 4 mani/pedi places within a 2 block radius. Bad move.Come to find out there is a reason this place is always empty - one of the manicurists was so rude!! I was waiting in the waiting area and had a couple of bags - the woman called across the room and flagged me over (I think her name was Kelly)  no help getting there from her. Then on my way there I dropped a polish since my hands were full. She scoffed and reminded me to pick it up once I sat down. No offer of tea or water - she did not introduce herself or even smile. Then, she asked if I wanted my nails short or long - I told her before I decided I wanted to see the colors. She curtly stated "I asked you if you wanted them short or long." At that point I said, "that's it, I want another nail tech or I'm leaving." At this point she finally looked at me and said "fine, whatever." Someone else did my nails - unremarkable.When I left I complained to the receptionist. As I walked by the place when I left the woman was looking at me and laughing. Wow.Also, when I paid cash. I gave $25 for a 20$ bill. I expected to be brought back 5 singles. The manicurist kept all. I'm a good tipper - I did find that a bit presumptuous.Never going here again - just walk up the block to pure rain like usual. Good luck with bad service Spa Anjou - you'll need it.

3.description: When I walked in and saw a dog I should have seen that as a sign.  I could smell the dog too, gross.  I'm animal friendly but this is a spa like environment, I was so excited about my mani and pedi but now I'm just so disappointed.I won't be back.  There wasn't an Introduction of my technician, I have no idea what her name was.  She spoke in her language throughout my whole pedicure to the technician next to her.  In America this is considered an insult.  The girl to who she spoke kept looking at me.  This made me feel very uncomfortable.  She massaged my first leg for about 1 minute and I got a 30 second foot rub on the other, I guess she got bored.  I work hard and want to feel pampered.  I'm in the service industry too, I recommend this place put forth some better etiquette, however I doubt my technician even cares.  I felt rushed.  Onto my manicure.  I requested bond aid for my nails and she said they didn't have it.  So I spotted it on the nail table and I pointed it out.  She then got very nervous.   I wasn't given a hand massage either.  She didn't  even offer.  I called her out on it and she offered, but by this point I just wanted to get away from this girl and her bad energy.  What the heck?  I will never come back here.  What a shame because I live across the street.  I will visit Pure Rain down the street from now on, they are a little further down but they are very professional and friendly.  They also offer nail specials, I always add extra gratuity when they do so.  My mani and pedi took "what's her name," only one hour and I felt like it should have been priced at $25.  I paid $45 and a 10% tip added onto that.  WOOF!

35.description: Received a gift certificate and had a really nice facial with Amy. At $85 for a deep pore cleanse, peel and resurfacing, plus an arm massage, it felt like a great deal. Relaxing atmosphere that is different than most nail salons. I will definitely be back often.

19.description: My first visit to this nail salon. Very clean place with a tasteful decor , nice music and professional atmosphere. They did really good job with our manicures and waxing. We'll be coming back .

28.description: Spa Anjou has a relaxing atmosphere and the receptionist is super friendly.  I went to this salon several times because it was just a few steps from my apartment and I enjoyed the quite, calming atmosphere. I've only had no chip manicures and one time I received a complimentary pedicure because they were running about an 45 minutes behind on my appointment. The manicures I received were always disappointing, most of the time they didn't trim my cuticles and extra skin around the nail beds and my NO CHIP always chipped within a few days. Sometimes, I would go back to have them fix a nail or two but I felt like they were annoyed with me and I don't have the time to go in between appointments. If you want a manicure that last don't go here.

45.description: Overall, 4 stars. Great addition to the neighborhood. I have had mani/pedi, waxing and massage . I cut one star because the massage and waxing room could be more private and the manis/pedis require an upgrade and more $ for a massage. The receptionist is wonderful, very welcoming.

33.description: One of the best manicures I have ever had! They have a large high-end nail polish selection, and they use a nice scrub and lotion to leave your hands feeling extra soft. I highly recommend this place to anyone!

43.description: Got a mani/pedi and eyebrows waxed, wax room was clean and well lit. She did an ok job, left one brow shorter. I wasnt thrilled, but I dont have a lot of hair..I probably wont get waxed here again.  Place looks cute, nice decore, clean, but unfortunately it was 15 degrees outside,everytime someone opened the door the temperature dropped inside. I was really cold  I asked them to turn up the heat,they disregarded my request,  I asked if they had any tea, I would think they'd be attentive, or considerate, since I was a first timer and it was cold inside. They weren't!  Overall pedicure was good, manicure was thorough. They didnt help me put my boots on or spray me with fast drying spray. Like I said, if you're not going to be attentive with your customers,why should they come back!

2.description: Very professional, sanitary and friendly. They all take pride in their work and schedule mainly by appointments, which I love. Their establishment is so clean and neat with very relaxing music playing over the loud speaker. They charge a little more than what I'm accustomed to paying, but it's worth the extra money. Their no chip mani lasts for weeks and they actually give you a real foot and hand massage. Many nail salons don't do that anymore and if they do it lasts for five seconds.  I'm hard to please and I've been going to the same nail salon for ten years, but after coming to Spa Anjou I'm never going back to my old stomping grounds. I recommend Maria and Duku. But, I hear they're all really good here.

18.description: Very nice, relaxing environment to get a manicure (the only service I've received here.) My no chip mani was great- the technician was very thorough, attentive and careful. My nails look great and aren't chipping or peeling anywhere, which is the first time I've had a no chip last this long (over a week good as new!) I'll definitely be coming back. (I didn't give 5 stars because my go-to nail salon goes above and beyond when I get a mani/pedi by offering a free neck and shoulder massage while my nails are drying, hot tea/ water with refills, and more personalized service. I didn't experience this here, but was very satisfied overall.)

41.description: LOVE THIS SALON!!!!Pretty pricey but the owner is an eyebrow wizard. My brows have never looked better.Very nice decor and very clean.

52.description: The deep cleansing facials are great. Prices are standard, and it's a great way to treat yourself :)

50.description: I was looking for a place to get a Brazilian wax and decided to try this place, because it's right near my office. It was my first time ever getting waxed and I was super nervous. The woman who took care of me (middle aged Asian lady; I'm horrible with names) was super professional, talked to me the whole time, and made me feel comfortable. She tweezes off any stray hairs, too. I've gone back several times, and will be going back again soon!

4.description: I alway feel so relaxed when I'm here.  I love being pampered. The ladies here always seem so attentive. Which is a plus.

6.description: I had a wonderful experience here. I must say my manicure looks great and the my manicurist was fantastic. I truly felt like I was at the spa and felt relaxed. They have low key music playing and its so quiet, no loud talking or anything. I can't wait to return to this place.

22.description: Love, love, love this place. Very friendly, professional staff and they are always playing something new to watch. They have great colors to select from and if you ever need some advice they will direct you in the right direction. There is parking (pay to park) available right in front and I have never ran into an issue of not finding a spot. I have received the mani/pedi, both regular and no chip mani. They have specials from time to time and I have gotten those as well, they are worth it. The chairs to sit in are comfortable, I do wish they had a massage capability. Sometimes while your nails are drying the technician will massage your back and neck for about 2 minutes. Oh and this place is BYOB. love. it.

15.description: My no chip manicure chipped on 4 of my nails the very next day. I came back to get it fixed and instead of taking the no chip polish off my whole nail she just polished over the spots and you could clearly see it. What needed to be done was the polish needed to be taken off the whole nail and re-done. 3 hours later the polish came off the spot she re-polished! I wasn't doing any cleaning or anything that would cause the polish to come off. I get no chip manicures all the time and never have I had it chip the next day what's the point of paying $45 versus a $15 regular manicure. Many other nail places that do a great job and are cheaper. Also, they have very few no chip color options. The place is cute and staff is nice but don't think I would come back.

57.description: This review is for the massage service at Spa Anjou.Got the yelp coupon and used it for the massage. The pillow where you put your face during the massage (face down) has a plastic warp which is awfully uncomfortable. The massage therapist didn't really know how to massage, just rubbing you and killing the time. I definitely won't be going for the massage there again.

20.description: This place seems great for mani/pedis. Unfortunately, I had the first layer of skin removed in three rather significant chunks from my upper lip due to a lip wax (photo with patch dimensions posted).I've visited three times for similar services and never had this problem before. I think the aesthetician just left the wax on too long and ended up ripping skin off, too.I called and explained what happened when I notice after getting home, they had me come back in to see what happened. She thought it was because I use acne creams, (no retinoids though) and apologized several times, mentioning that she should have asked before my appointment services began. I've been using acne creams for almost a decade though and have Never had this happen before! These ladies are super sweet, but I think she just left the wax on Way too long, or the temperature was too cold? They did give me my money back, apologized for the incident, and thanked me for coming back in, but I probably won't be coming back.

36.description: This humble nail place has great prices and a slightly old hollywood vibe.  A standard manicure is only $15, but the work is great.  They have a great selection of colors including the newest rollouts from Essie and OPI.   I love that you can see the sanitizing machines too!  No tools will be dropped on the floor and re-picked up here.There is a bit of a language barrier with the manicurists and my nails were cut too short for my liking, but I'd go back again.  Nice little salon in Printer's Row hood.

14.description: This humble nail place has great prices and a slightly old hollywood vibe.  A standard manicure is only $15, but the work is great.  They have a great selection of colors including the newest rollouts from Essie and OPI.   I love that you can see the sanitizing machines too!  No tools will be dropped on the floor and re-picked up here.There is a bit of a language barrier with the manicurists and my nails were cut too short for my liking, but I'd go back again.  Nice little salon in Printer's Row hood.

0.description: Awesome customer service, super trendy and cute clothing pieces. Ask for Megan and Jillian when you go in!

1.description: The masterminds behind this cafe seemingly assume their customers are either desperate or dumb. The prices are outrageous and the product quality is low, even by hotel cafe standards. Your choices here are basically $4 for a single serve Chobani yogurt cup, which is like 1,000% mark up; or $6 for a breakfast sandwich, which seems like a fair deal until you actually try eating it. They have a variety of fruits and breakfast bars, but I'd basically have to cash out my 401k* to buy a complete meal here.In the upside, the employees were friendly. That's about the most positive thing I can say about this joint. With the wealth of much better places to grab a quick snack, just outside the hotel, you'd be insane to go here. I'd actually go to one of the thousands of McDonald's nearby before eating breakfast here. *okay, it's not that bad, but seriously, $4 dollars for a yogurt cup!? WTF.

2.description: Staying at the Hilton--a fine hotel--for a conference. Went to Herb 'n Kitchen for breakfast. Good news: open early (5:30?), coffee was fine. Bad news: bagel sandwich. It was like something you would get on an airplane; something that had sat around for a long time. Bagel was plain, stale, and tasteless. Tons of cheese that had little flavor other than fat + salt. Fried egg was completely overwhelmed by the other ingredients. Go to Peet's for breakfast if you stay at the Hilton. It is only a block away.

0.description: Spent five days here for a conference, and had almost every meal from this spot, sadly. They have options for breakfast/lunch/dinner. You can find deep dish pizza, breakfast sandwiches/burritos, soup, pre-made salads, and Starbucks coffee.The pre-made salads were actually pretty good; veggie burrito was on the salty side; and of course everything is your standard hotel-food quality and way more expensive than it should be.I didn't get any pictures, but the set up is nice, there's candy you can buy by the bulk, a limited Starbucks menu, and a gelato set up (I did not care for the gelato - it was waaaaaayyyy too sweet). I hope you never have to eat here as many times as I did.

29.description: Went here with a large group for a Friday night dinner.  As it is new and I'm sure has some kinks to work out, there was plenty to like here but also enough to be disappointed in that at this point, it is a 3-star restaurant.First the pros:1) Portion sizes & value-    Our group of 9 ordered 4 appetizers and 3 "BBQ platters" that were supposed to serve 3-4 each.  It was a TON of food - enough for everyone to take home leftovers.  Well done2) The space is very cool, ambiance is good with plenty of TVs and a good draft beer list.  The bar area seems like it'd be a good place to watch a game.3) Some of the food was quite good.  The hush puppy & mac and cheese were good, candied bacon was excellent.  Among the BBQ, the pulled pork was a solid 7/10, the sausage was very good as well. Now the cons:1)  And here's the big one:  the brisket was pretty terrible.  Its tough to judge a BBQ place based on one visit, but the majority of the brisket we got was dry bordering on inedible.  With that, and them being out of ribs, it left the overall actual barbeque experience a bit lacking.2) The sauces were very meh.  They had 4 different sauces, but I can't say that I truly enjoyed any of them.3) The service was friendly, but only ok.  I'll give the benefit of the doubt here as it is new and we had a large group.Overall, a decent experience, and given its location less than a block from my apartment, I'll certainly be there to try it again.  However, I'm a bit worried its just going to be a "decent place to get a beer and a sandwich" instead of a good BBQ place that I am hoping for.

42.description: I had a great experience at Belly Up.  The decor was great, clean, and I can't wait for the weather to be warm to open up that front!  The ambience was busy, but noise level was good for easy conversation.  Our server, Dani, was knowledgeable, personable, honest, and working her butt off!The food was very good.  We ordered the Cajun Spinach and Artichoke dip. The Cajun added some great flavor.  We then ordered the Platter and selected Pulled Pork, Ribs, and the smoked half chicken.  All were done perfectly.  The platter says it serves 3-4 people - we were a group of 4 and it was not enough for us.  We ordered an additional half rack of ribs and a pulled pork sandwich. Enjoyed the homemade sauces.  I mixed the Belly Up Original with the vinegar-based spicy one, and it was delicious!As with any opening, there are kinks to be worked out.  I would have really liked to try the brisket and Mac&Cheese (my personal BBQ staples), but they had run out.  Bar service was a little slow at times and our side of baked beans was missing - delivered later, but it took a while.  The food and the service were good and I will definitely be back to try that brisket!

23.description: I've already been twice since Belly Up has opened and everything I've tried is delicious. Highly recommend the spring rolls! The cocktails are delicious, too!

47.description: Four days in- kinks, but the food is stellar.  You're in luck if you love BBQ.  Belly up has got it!  Start with the Candied Bacon and BBQ Spring rolls.  Then grabs a pint and dig in.  Where to begin- the 12 hour smoked pork was amazing.  You can tell they do things the right way.  The smoke, the pork- Homer Simpson would  give this three mmmmmss! The links are rich and delicious, KC beans are spot on and do the steamed kale.  Yup, you read correct.  They are just getting started, so cut them some slack.  A South Loop staple for years to come.

8.description: Great addition to the South Loop neighborhood. The Burnt-end Chili and Windy City sandwich were awesome, along with the sauce selection. The servers and staff were friendly & efficient. Marcos  kept my Ice glass filled, and the water filled Bullleit Bourbon bottles were a cute touch. I will definitely be returning.

31.description: Made our first visit last night and we were not disappointed. The decor of the place was very comfortable with plenty of big screen tvs. We don't usually order apps so we got down to business right away. The ribs were very good, meaty and tender with a nice flavor even with out one of the 4 sauces. The sauces added a nice touch and each one was distinctly different. My wife had a pulled pork sandwich which was generously piled on a freshroll, fries and cole slaw came with the sandwich. My ribs came with cole slaw, a roll, and a side of macaroni and cheese. The mac and cheese was really good with a creamy cheese sauce and a bread crumb topping. The beers were cold and the food came hot I'll definitely be back. Our waitress Laura was also very attentive.

34.description: I do not usually write reviews for restaurants but everything about this restaurants was so not good I just had to write about it. This was our experience:Candied bacon - most of them were flimsy (undercooked)Hush puppies - too dry to eatPulled Pork - no flavor (menu says 12 hours smoked but it seemed someone forgot to include the wood in that process)Brisket - again, no smoke seemed to be used in the 12 hour cooking process; more important, though , is someone does not know how to slice brisket. Anyone who has ever cooked a brisket knows to cut against the grain. This brisket was so stringy it was hard to eat.Sides - well, after being so disappointed with everything else, I didn't even bother with the sidesWaitress - could not really explain the differences in the sauces. All she kept trying to make me understand is that they are all made from the same base - whatever that meansSauces - just did not care for themSorry for the harshness, but I paid damn near $60 for two of us and hardly ate anything and no leftovers made it into the house.

16.description: Our group of 3 had dinner on January 30th at 6:30 PM. The experience started off great. Nice décor, good space, seated within 10 minutes of my reservation. We had drinks at the bar while waiting for the table and the bar service was great.Once at the table, our server was very friendly and attentive.  I came in knowing exactly what I wanted (brisket) but I asked her opinion of what was good. I was relieved when she recommended the brisket and said it was her favorite. Great, that's decided.We ordered the house wings as a shared appetizer. I ordered the brisket with a side of smoked mac & cheese. My friends both ordered the pulled pork with mac & cheese and cheesy corn as their respective sides.  After 5 minutes of mouthwatering anticipation, our server comes back to inform us that they are out of brisket. They are also out of mac & cheese.  I laugh thinking the server was just trying to be funny because we had just had a long conversation where she was recommending the brisket and it was only 6:30PM on a Saturday. I was sad to find out she was not joking. I changed my order to the ribs with a side of cheesy corn and ordered a beer.  She comes back and tells me they are out of the beer I ordered. Later during dinner my friend ordered a different beer that they were also out of.This was opening week so some learning curve was expected, but they were out of brisket, mac & cheese, and 2 of the beers that were on the menu so early in the evening. That is just poor planning.Now to the food that was served. The house wings were amazing. Apparently they are prepared in a pressure cooker so the skin has a nice snap to it and the meat is juicy.  I definitely recommend the wings. I tried some of my friends' pulled pork and thought it was good and they both really liked theirs. The sauces were above average, albeit a little runny. The ribs were pretty decent too but nothing special. The cheesy corn was not for me, nor was the coleslaw.As mentioned, I thought the service was good. I was a little disappointed that the manager didn't offer an apology or explanation for why they were out of so much on a Saturday prior to dinner rush. You'd think when 4 of the things that are listed on the menu are not available that you'd be offered a complimentary drink, dessert, or at least an explanation. The final issue was when it came to the bill.  We asked our server to split up the bill evenly 3 ways and gave her our 3 credit cards. The credit cards were run for 50%, 25%, and 25%. That is not an even split. It was busy so we just paid it as is and worked out the difference among ourselves with cash.I will return to try the brisket. I do believe things will improve and they will get into their groove.  I do hope the management reads the above review for the constructive criticism it is and I look forward to seeing the improvements.

13.description: Belly Up just opened on Monday Jan 25 and I went on Sunday Jan 30th.  The middle of a Sunday afternoon.  The crowd was steady.  3/4 of the tables were full.  Great atmosphere.  Plenty of TV's to watch the Ohio State basketball game.And like Louis, Caroline was our waitress.  She was so helpful and very friendly.  She recommended some appetizers....the candied bacon and the BBQ spring rolls...thanks to another yelper.  They were amazing.  I agree, the candied bacon could easily be served with ice cream.  I hope she is there the next time I go in there.We had the brisket and the pulled pork.  They were prepared perfectly.  The paused are made in house and they were all quite good.This is a great addition to the South Loop.

11.description: Finally a good, casual BBQ place in the South Loop! The service was great, (thanks Marco) the beer selection was better than expected and their selection of sauces were oh so tasty. All at a fair price. Definitely coming back.

39.description: Had dinner there last night and had the candied bacon, hush puppies, and full sized brisket. And I just couldn't stop and ate some of my sisters pulled pork. I had the Old Fashioned cocktail to wash it all down. All of it was absolutely amazing and I'll be back as soon as possible. Also, I had a chance to speak with the owner, hostess, and my server for a while. All amazing people!!!

37.description: Just went for an early dinner at Belly Up after hearing good things from some friends. It was delicious! We started with the "south loop spring rolls," which were amazing, and then both had the "Windy City" special (a sandwich with brisket AND pulled pork) which was also phenomenal. All four barbeque sauces were really tasty, too, with both the waffle fries and the spring roll appetizer. Cole slaw and mac and cheese were good but nothing extraordinary.Service was great - prompt, attentive, but not overwhelming. My water glass was always full. Overall, a great experience!

0.description: Our server, Danni was super sweet and chatty in a good way. And I loved her pink pen! Ha - seriously, she let me keep it!I ordered the half order of pulled chicken with mac and cheese. It also came with a small dinner roll and a smidgen of coleslaw (I hate all coleslaw so I have no comment about whether it was good or not). It was plenty of food and I tried to save some of the mac and cheese to go but it was too good to stop eating. I'd pause and before I knew it, my fork was going back in! There was so much meat too, even in that half order, it offered a full leftover meal for me the next day, which tasted just as good. I'm actually not a huge barbecue girl so that's saying something. I tried my friends' wings and yumm... no sauce necessary. Try them naked first before making a decision to smother them. Danni explained that they are made in a pressure cooker so the outside is super crispy and the meat on the inside is super juicy. All true! I was surprised at how much flavor burst out of it. I'm also not an extra crispy wing person so yeah... the naked, crispy outside didn't look as enticing to me as it may have been to others but shoot... take one bite and see for yourself! I'd order it next time. Or wait... the pulled chicken again. Hmmm, decisions, decisions...

38.description: Welcome to the South Loop Belly Up!  My wife and I checked out Belly Up last night and had a fantastic experience.  The space is amazing!  This is especially true if you recall what used to be there... I think it was a uniform shop?Anyhow...  I had the brisket and my wife had the South Loop Spring Rolls starter as her meal.  The portions were massive and everything was very tasty.  We ate at the bar which was a great experience too.  Their BBQ sauce selection is outstanding too.  They have a coding system on the bottles that tells you what goes with what...  I too wish I could give 4.5 stars but will round down and go with 4 for now...  We will go back and I will reassess.

27.description: The chicken wings are delectable! Kale seasoned to the bone! Ribs fantastic! And Marcos was a shining star! We enjoyed our visit greatly, come to Belly Up to get your belly full!

32.description: Just had dinner at the Belly Up Smokehouse with my husband and everything was delicious.  The service was amazing.  The Cajon Artichoke Dip was my favorite.. the beef brisket was tender and enjoyed trying all 4 different barbaque sauces. Welcome to the south loop!!!

48.description: Thrilled that this place finally opened!  I came here on the second day it was open, and we tried the macaroni and cheese and pulled pork and chicken sandwiches.  We liked the pulled chicken better than the pork, but everything was good.  The service was also very kind and prompt.  Recommend!

44.description: Great new place.  We had the pulled pork and fried chicken, which was amazing.  They make their own sauces in-house.  Lots of variety on the menu.Very comfortable and welcoming design.  Extremely high quality, yet casual.  Beautiful bar.  Lots of televisions.  Caroline was our very helpful and friendly server.  They will be adding Southern style Saturday and Sunday brunch in the coming months and outdoor seating when it warms up.   This is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.

24.description: Second time here. Great addition to the neighborhood. Awesome service and even better food. Had the belly up burger and it was cooked to perfection. The cole slaw is good too! Marcos was our server and was awesome. He immediately told us his favorites and was very attentive. So glad this is finally open!

7.description: Just went for an early dinner at Belly Up after hearing good things from some friends. It was delicious! We started with the "south loop spring rolls," which were amazing, and then both had the "Windy City" special (a sandwich with brisket AND pulled pork) which was also phenomenal. All four barbeque sauces were really tasty, too, with both the waffle fries and the spring roll appetizer. Cole slaw and mac and cheese were good but nothing extraordinary.Service was great - prompt, attentive, but not overwhelming. My water glass was always full. Overall, a great experience!

40.description: Belly Up just opened on Monday Jan 25 and I went on Sunday Jan 30th.  The middle of a Sunday afternoon.  The crowd was steady.  3/4 of the tables were full.  Great atmosphere.  Plenty of TV's to watch the Ohio State basketball game.And like Louis, Caroline was our waitress.  She was so helpful and very friendly.  She recommended some appetizers....the candied bacon and the BBQ spring rolls...thanks to another yelper.  They were amazing.  I agree, the candied bacon could easily be served with ice cream.  I hope she is there the next time I go in there.We had the brisket and the pulled pork.  They were prepared perfectly.  The paused are made in house and they were all quite good.This is a great addition to the South Loop.

30.description: My partner and I tried Belly Up Smokehouse this past weekend. We both concluded that the meat was great! but the rest of the food was pretty bland and boring. We had the hush puppies to start with the bacon jam. The puppies were very dry and had no flavor at all. The jam was pretty good, sweet with lots of bacon chucks. But let's be honest... what bacon flavored doesn't taste good?!We both then got the Windy City sandwich (1/2 pulled pork & 1/2 brisket). The meat was fantastic and the portion size was great! My partner got the waffle fries which had no seasoning at all and I got the Mac N' Cheese which tasted pretty much like Velveeta.Service was great! Raquel tended to all our needs and checked in periodically with us to make sure we had everything we wanted. Awesome service Raquel! Overall, the restaurant was OK - Just didn't feel there was much that really stood out and definitely think they need to work on giving some more flavor to their sides and appetizers.

46.description: For its intent/objective, it's a solid 4.5 stars, but I'll round up for the candied bacon, which...wait for it, I think is better than Honky Tonk BBQ, which is the only place I've ever had candied bacon that really knows how to do it well.  It's completely different, but oh so good. The bar service was a bit slow, but maybe give them a pass due to the number of days being open.  The brisket was awesome, tender, juicy and just amazing.  Now that I review all the items I had on the menu, those two were 5 stars, everything else was 4 stars.  The draft beer options were only mediocre.  So, in summary, I guess all it takes is amazing candied bacon to get 5 stars on Yelp!  Ha.  I'll be back for more BBB!

1.description: We just finished our first dinner from Belly Up. I truly think the reason this place is called "belly Up" is because thats the exact position you would be in trying to finish your plate. We ordered the Smoked Brisket at $22. On the menu, it says is was smoked for 12 hours. The smoke rings on the meat tell a different story. There was not any flavor on the brisket its self prior to adding sauce, and you need a lot of sauce at that. Coslaw comes with the meal. Its appearance left so much to be desired we didn't even try it. There is also not ANY hot barbecue sauce. Its all sweet or mustard based.Onto the side of Mac and cheese... it was penne pasta, with processed cheese. For any mac and cheese lover, this is a complete let down. We ordered the Chili as an appetizer. It looked great, and I wish I could say it also tasted that way! There was more OIL than meat or beans in the chili. I've had a lot of different chilis, and have a broad palate for them. This is by far some of the worst chili I've ever had. The $1.50 chili from trader joes would've been a much better choice than this $8 grease pie. For $28, I am just happy we did not order MORE. As barbecue connoisseurs who spent the majority of our lives on southern barbecue, we cannot believe this place is in business. DO NOT EAT HERE. Oh and they were out of the smoked chicken. I am not too disappointed about that any more though.

9.description: Ugh.  Atmosphere, decor and staff were fine, but this experience was like eating leftovers of some much better meal mom and dad enjoyed when they went out without you.We went on a Sunday evening around 7:30.  A couple of the appetizers looked pretty good on the menu, such as the dirty french fries.  But Belly Up were out of all those, along with the burnt-end baked beans and the candied bacon.  They were substituting pickles for one of the other appetizers.  So, we skipped the appetizers.On to the main course.  We ordered pulled pork, beef brisket, a half chicken and ribs.  Sides were mac and cheese (not good) baked beans (good) and cole slaw (good).  The meat was uniformly lukewarm (quickly room temp) and had clearly either been recently warmed over or just kept warm for hours.  That worked OK for the ribs but the other meats were kind of nasty.  Sauces were fine, but nothing special.I got the feeling the chef had gone home and just pointed the staff at a few plates under the warming lamps, telling them, "If anybody comes in tonight just feed them this (junk) and tell them we are out of everything else."

26.description: Great service, not so great food.  I like tender flavorful BBQ, the ribs were tough, the pulled chicken was flavorless.  I went the first week so hopefully it will get better.

25.description: Our server, Marcos, provided great service. I got the pulled pork sandwich, very good. My wife got Belly Up burger. She loved it.

12.description: Friday night after work in a relaxing atmosphere,  friendly staff, excellent drinks and SPECTACULAR FOOD!!!!! Thanks Danni for your recommendation and great personal service. We will be BACK SOONER THAN LATER! :-)

21.description: Great addition to the South Loop. Our waiter Marco was very attentive. We really enjoyed the South Loop Spring Rolls. I had a rack of ribs and my wife had the pulled chicken sandwich. Both were pretty good but we've had better at places like Smoque. I'm a BBQ purist, so I would have preferred it unsauced. Also, they could be better served by having a wider selection of bourbons. For my tastes, there's not much better than good smoked meat and an interesting whiskey. If they found some barrel selections it would go  a long way. All that being said, we look forward to going back to Belly Up.

17.description: Just had dinner at the Belly Up Smokehouse with my husband and everything was delicious.  The service was amazing.  The Cajon Artichoke Dip was my favorite.. the beef brisket was tender and enjoyed trying all 4 different barbaque sauces. Welcome to the south loop!!!

10.description: I recently moved from Texas to Chicago so I know bbq.  The brisket and pulled pork were good, Texas good.  It had a nice crust and smoke ring.The beans were just ok and the mac&cheese was soupy and flavorless.Real bbq doesn't need sauce, but i tried them and thought they were pretty good.The service was fine, the food took forever to get to the table (45 minutes). This is absurd wait for bbq that requires zero prep.  It was the first weekend they were open so a little extra wait is understandable, but this was excessive.Additionally, there are burgers on the menu. WTF.I'd go back just for the smoked meats, but everything else needs improvement. 3 stars.

5.description: Thrilled that this place finally opened!  I came here on the second day it was open, and we tried the macaroni and cheese and pulled pork and chicken sandwiches.  We liked the pulled chicken better than the pork, but everything was good.  The service was also very kind and prompt.  Recommend!

3.description: Welcome to the South Loop Belly Up!  My wife and I checked out Belly Up last night and had a fantastic experience.  The space is amazing!  This is especially true if you recall what used to be there... I think it was a uniform shop?Anyhow...  I had the brisket and my wife had the South Loop Spring Rolls starter as her meal.  The portions were massive and everything was very tasty.  We ate at the bar which was a great experience too.  Their BBQ sauce selection is outstanding too.  They have a coding system on the bottles that tells you what goes with what...  I too wish I could give 4.5 stars but will round down and go with 4 for now...  We will go back and I will reassess.

35.description: Once I got over my crushing disappointment that they were out of ribs by the time we arrived, we enjoyed a great dinner at this new South Loop spot last night. We started with some apps...Candied Bacon (yum), Hush Puppies with Bacon Jam (double yum), and the South Loop Spring Rolls (meh...almost too creamy inside...would have liked something with crunch....maybe bacon?!?!).  For my meal, I got the Pulled Pork Sandwich with Corn Bread as my side. Let me just say...for a girl that spent a big chunk of her life in North Carolina, getting pulled pork in the North is a bit of a gamble, but Belly Up passed muster! The meat was moist and tender...perfect for a sandwich. My only disappointment was the sauce options. The vinegar sauce wasn't done in true NC style, and none of the others had a spicy enough kick for me. Service was fabulous (thanks, Caroline, for the attentive service and good recommendations!), and one of the owners (George) took the time to introduce himself and chat with us for a bit as we were getting ready to leave. All in all, a fun evening...glad to have a new dining option in the South Loop. I'll be back....save me a slab of Baby Back Ribs, George!!

19.description: The chicken wings are delectable! Kale seasoned to the bone! Ribs fantastic! And Marcos was a shining star! We enjoyed our visit greatly, come to Belly Up to get your belly full!

28.description: Had lunch today, tried the special Brisket and pulled pork sandwich. It was very good and plenty of food. I'll be back. Raquel was friendly and helpful, great service was provided by everyone. Thanks

45.description: This was their opening weekend so the bumps aren't unusual. That said I'm definitely going back once they've had a chance to work out the nuances. We ordered candied bacon for our app, it was everything you'd imagine. Would be great on a dessert as a sundae topping or inside cheesecake. They ran out of brisket, the reason I wanted to try the place, glad they were busy and good call to err on the side of underprepping. We ended up splitting the platter, ribs and pulled pork. The pulled pork was amazing! Super tender, great smokey flavor good portion size. The ribs were baby back which isn't my favorite, too many bones and not enough meat for my taste. The sauces were great especially the original, great combo of spice and heat. The skillet cornbread was also amazing, the Mac and cheese was disappointing, gloopy with an overwhelming heaviness nothing unique. Please add greens to the sides menu! They would be a great alternative to the somewhat traditional sides offered. We sat at the bar and Nicole our bartender was amazing! Super busy but attentive and helpful with drink and dinner decisions. I'll try it again in a month or so and hope to say nice things about the brisket!

33.description: As displaced Texans, we had to try out the new barbecue restaurant in town. We were pleasantly surprised! We loved the loaded fries (they put a lot more brisket on them than we expected), and my husband loved the South Loop Spring Rolls (which he picked as his meal). I had a half brisket portion, which was tender and delicious. The half brisket portion was huge and much more than I had expected. It's definitely not the best brisket I've ever had, but it was still good. The only thing I didn't like was the cheesy corn-the cheese tasted powdery to me. My favorite sauce was the Windy City sauce, and I liked it so much, they let me take some home with me! We will definitely be back.

43.description: As per my earlier review, the food was amazing. I will definitely mgo back and try individual servings. The management really went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied with our experience and we were happy we stopped in.

2.description: I do not usually write reviews for restaurants but everything about this restaurants was so not good I just had to write about it. This was our experience:Candied bacon - most of them were flimsy (undercooked)Hush puppies - too dry to eatPulled Pork - no flavor (menu says 12 hours smoked but it seemed someone forgot to include the wood in that process)Brisket - again, no smoke seemed to be used in the 12 hour cooking process; more important, though , is someone does not know how to slice brisket. Anyone who has ever cooked a brisket knows to cut against the grain. This brisket was so stringy it was hard to eat.Sides - well, after being so disappointed with everything else, I didn't even bother with the sidesWaitress - could not really explain the differences in the sauces. All she kept trying to make me understand is that they are all made from the same base - whatever that meansSauces - just did not care for themSorry for the harshness, but I paid damn near $60 for two of us and hardly ate anything and no leftovers made it into the house.

18.description: This is a welcome addition to the South Loop. The Candied Bacon is amazing!! The meats are all solid, but the Fried Chicken and Brisket are FANTASTIC! Nice selection of craft cocktails and a solid beer list. Management and staff are friendly and attentive. I am already looking forward to my next visit!!!

41.description: Our group of 3 had dinner on January 30th at 6:30 PM. The experience started off great. Nice décor, good space, seated within 10 minutes of my reservation. We had drinks at the bar while waiting for the table and the bar service was great.Once at the table, our server was very friendly and attentive.  I came in knowing exactly what I wanted (brisket) but I asked her opinion of what was good. I was relieved when she recommended the brisket and said it was her favorite. Great, that's decided.We ordered the house wings as a shared appetizer. I ordered the brisket with a side of smoked mac & cheese. My friends both ordered the pulled pork with mac & cheese and cheesy corn as their respective sides.  After 5 minutes of mouthwatering anticipation, our server comes back to inform us that they are out of brisket. They are also out of mac & cheese.  I laugh thinking the server was just trying to be funny because we had just had a long conversation where she was recommending the brisket and it was only 6:30PM on a Saturday. I was sad to find out she was not joking. I changed my order to the ribs with a side of cheesy corn and ordered a beer.  She comes back and tells me they are out of the beer I ordered. Later during dinner my friend ordered a different beer that they were also out of.This was opening week so some learning curve was expected, but they were out of brisket, mac & cheese, and 2 of the beers that were on the menu so early in the evening. That is just poor planning.Now to the food that was served. The house wings were amazing. Apparently they are prepared in a pressure cooker so the skin has a nice snap to it and the meat is juicy.  I definitely recommend the wings. I tried some of my friends' pulled pork and thought it was good and they both really liked theirs. The sauces were above average, albeit a little runny. The ribs were pretty decent too but nothing special. The cheesy corn was not for me, nor was the coleslaw.As mentioned, I thought the service was good. I was a little disappointed that the manager didn't offer an apology or explanation for why they were out of so much on a Saturday prior to dinner rush. You'd think when 4 of the things that are listed on the menu are not available that you'd be offered a complimentary drink, dessert, or at least an explanation. The final issue was when it came to the bill.  We asked our server to split up the bill evenly 3 ways and gave her our 3 credit cards. The credit cards were run for 50%, 25%, and 25%. That is not an even split. It was busy so we just paid it as is and worked out the difference among ourselves with cash.I will return to try the brisket. I do believe things will improve and they will get into their groove.  I do hope the management reads the above review for the constructive criticism it is and I look forward to seeing the improvements.

4.description: This was their opening weekend so the bumps aren't unusual. That said I'm definitely going back once they've had a chance to work out the nuances. We ordered candied bacon for our app, it was everything you'd imagine. Would be great on a dessert as a sundae topping or inside cheesecake. They ran out of brisket, the reason I wanted to try the place, glad they were busy and good call to err on the side of underprepping. We ended up splitting the platter, ribs and pulled pork. The pulled pork was amazing! Super tender, great smokey flavor good portion size. The ribs were baby back which isn't my favorite, too many bones and not enough meat for my taste. The sauces were great especially the original, great combo of spice and heat. The skillet cornbread was also amazing, the Mac and cheese was disappointing, gloopy with an overwhelming heaviness nothing unique. Please add greens to the sides menu! They would be a great alternative to the somewhat traditional sides offered. We sat at the bar and Nicole our bartender was amazing! Super busy but attentive and helpful with drink and dinner decisions. I'll try it again in a month or so and hope to say nice things about the brisket!

6.description: My wife and I live in the South Loop and have been waiting to try this place since it opened. I wish we waited an eternity. We ordered the South Loop Spring Rolls for an appetizer. The came to the table quick, but they weren't hot. I'd say warm at best, which makes me think they were fried earlier and kept under a hot lamp for an extended time. Then we split the brisket. I asked for the more meaty (less fatty) portions. This also came out quickly, but was room temperature. They clearly pulled it out of the refrigerator and didn't warm it up long enough. Fast-forward to 4:30am and I began vomiting. It is now 11:30am and still vomiting (from both ends of you know what I mean). My wife is also sick to her stomach, but it didn't hit her quite as hard as me. Needless to say, this was my first and last time eating at Belly Up.

22.description: good atmosphere and good service, the bbq is great. I loved all their appetizers, the candied bacon was delicious, loaded fries were full of flavor, and the southwest rolls were too good. pulled pork sandwich has alot of flavor. definitely gonna be my go to bbq for the summer

15.description: Service was good,  food was dissapointing. The Brisket had a good flavor but was dry and tough. The black bean and corn soup was watery and just spicy, not a whole lot of flavor coming through. Kale was way overcooked and served in a bowl of liquid like soup. Definitely couldn't recommend this place. I let the waitress know about the brisket but she didn't even offer to take it off the bill. It's okay I'll take it home and feed it to the dogs, it'll give their jaws a workout.

20.description: Outstanding service by Marcos! Rubbed wings, ribs, southwest salad, baked beans, and waffle fries were all fabulous. Pulled pork was a bit dry, but sauce it up and it slides down well.

36.description: Wonderful service. Hot links are fantastic and I usually don't even use words like that regularly. Our server Raquel was great. It's a refreshing new setup for the south loop

14.description: Yesterday we stopped by for lunch. Or server Caroline was extremely helpful explaining their very interesting drink menu and making wonderful suggestions. Their strawberry concoction was outstanding. The brisket sandwich was moist and delicious and the wings were the best ever. I will be going back tomorrow.

58.description: COCKROACHES! Comping our bill after roaches fell from the ceiling onto our table seemed to be a bit too much to ask. We stopped in with the intention of spending two hours of drinking and dining, and after that incident found it hard to stomach even the appetizer. Never going back, I advise you don't visit this place and let it shut down either naturally or when the health department decides to drop in.

56.description: This place was nice and quiet.  The waitress was nice.  I order the Tom Kha Soup.  Normally, the broth looks like chicken noodle soup.  However, this broth was more white and had a heavy coconut flavor.  Delicious, just not what I was expecting.  (I think they call it something like "seafood special soup."My Spicy Basil noddles were delicious as well.  The edamame was hot, but the pods were hard to get open.  No biggie, though.Service was great, not exceptional.  Overall, I enjoyed this little spot.

29.description: The first time I visited Tamarind I ordered crab rangoon and potstickers for takeout.  The server game me the wrong order at first; when I realized, I went back to the restaurant and exchanged it for my actual order which they fortunately hadn't given away yet.  It was an honest mistake so I didn't make much of it.  Also, both the crab Rangoon and potstickers tasted pretty good.I visited Tamarind again with friends a few weeks later, I ordered the pork yellow curry and a fruit smoothie.  The pork yellow curry came quickly and was a bit too spicy for me but otherwise tasted fine.  After over 20 minutes of waiting for the smoothie, the waitress came over and told me that they had given it to the wrong person and that I would need to wait another 15 minutes if I still wanted the smoothie.  I decided to wait it out, which put the total waiting time for a smoothie at nearly 40 minutes...  When the smoothie arrived, it was extremely watery and had very little flavor; it was probably the worst smoothie I had in all my time in Chicago.  If I had rated Tamarind after just the first visit, I may have given them 4 stars but another service mishap on my second visit combined with a low quality smoothie loses a star for them.

42.description: Cute, neighborhood Asian restaurant. We usually stop in at least once every time we come to Chicago. Quick and inexpensive. Consistently good.

23.description: I love seaweed salad and this one is the best I've ever had. And the chicken coconut soup is nourishing and delicious. If you get it with the rice noodles the portion is large - it's a full meal by itself.

47.description: Was very torn based on mixed reviews of this place. I'm pleased I decided to try it. I agree on the "Americanized Asian" comments, but went with the idea that's what I'd be getting-- so no disappointment there. I had the Empress Chicken, and it was very good. Very freshly prepared, so temperature was great. Vegetables were good quality. I asked for it to be spicy, but should have said extra spicy. Portions were generous and the price was fair.

8.description: Your average Thai restaurant. The server was efficient and kind. We were served cucumber + lemon water when we first entered which was a step up from your normal tap water. I chose the Thai red curry and my coworker got the chicken lettuce wraps. The food was average, nothing extraordinary but filled the Asian food craving we were having. The portions were huge as you can tell so I wasn't even close to finishing my meal at the end. Would recommend for anyone looking for some Thai cuisine in the loop.

31.description: Was craving for some Taiwanese greasy spicy beef noodle soup. Only 2 places popped up in the South Loop area on yelp and Tamarind was one of them, the other was Ed's Pot-sticker House. I one at Ed's is actually okay but still not authentic. So gave Tamarind a shot and it is definitely not the place for spicy beef noodle soup. Basically they took some beef, noodles and broth and threw in some black pepper. Its just very lazy and had no soul. It was a very very sad bowl. I ate the whole bowl anyway. The beef was actually satisfyingly tender. I also ordered a super bland fried calamari appetizer which came with a sweet and sour sauce that just sucked. It was just sweet and had no sour, and it was deceivingly bright orange. If there was only like a bottle of sriracha nearby to correct the overly bland calamari. Sadly there was no condiments on the table not even a simple bottle of salt shaker or some black pepper. Even some soy sauce could have given some life to this sad sad sad calamari dish. So to summarize Tamarind, it is a Pan-Asian restaurant done lazily. Could learn a bit from Joy Yee's.

34.description: The waitress was honest and nice. Service was fast! Water refills were timely.The food was decent---sushi was fresh and well seasoned---although it was a tiny bit pricey. The sushi was better than the other dishes. The Thai curry was quite good but a bit spicier than other places. The mushu pork was a 2.5 or 3; sushi and curry was a 3.5. However good service leads me to give the place a 3.5/5.

16.description: On a recent business trip to HIMSS '15, I was craving a little bit of Asian cuisine to mix into the overwhelmingly heavy diet of pizza, ribs, and other American favorites. After some brief research regarding some of this type of cuisine close to the hotel, we decided on Tamarind. Our experience at this restaurant was very good.Food: We started with an order of potstickers, I had the Red Snapper Nirvana Maki (sushi roll), and my colleague had the Empress Chicken. For me, the potstickers were a bit of a 'miss', but they still delivered some of the traditional flavors I am used to. I prefer the outside to be crispier, and for the inside of the potsticker to have a little more flavor. They seemed to lack finesse and seasoning.My sushi roll, on the other hand, was dynamite! It tasted soooo incredibly fresh. The snapper on top of the roll had ZERO fishy aftertaste -- something that I sometimes get, even from some of the better known sushi places in my area. Everything was so, so fresh. I don't know how else to describe it. It was one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had in my life (6 / 5 stars - bonus point)My colleagues Empress chicken was also spot-on. It was like if General Tso, Orange Chicken, and Sesame Chicken all had a threesome, and the fundamental DNA of all three dishes made it into the baby that was produced. It was not super unique, as it had all of the traditional features of the aforementioned dishes; but it did pack a unique flavor profile that was extremely pleasant. Additionally, the chicken was cooked marvelously. Nice and crispy on the outside, yet juicy and tender on the inside. Bravo.Food: 5 / 5Service: The service was pleasant, but very rushed. I suspect it was a result of the conference being in town, but either way it was kind of a bummer to receive some more individualized service. As I have mentioned in previous posts, I am into receiving a quality experience where I dine. Although great food is nice, and equally great experience is just as valuable to me. Tamarind provided a mediocre experience in terms of service.Service: 3 / 5Atmosphere: Other reviewers have complained about dirtiness in the restaurant. I did not experience as such. However, Tamarind is in an old building, in downtown Chicago. Cockroaches would not surprise me if they were infested in the building; but I did not see any, and would assume that the restaurant is doing all it can to protect its space from a building that is likely in need of some serious renovation. Unfortunately, I just don't think that is feasible given the location of the building.Despite that, I really like the furnishings and interior of the restaurant. I never felt as if it was unclean, and thought that it really set a nice mood for enjoying a great meal.Atmosphere: 4 / 5Price: My sushi roll was $11, and my colleagues food was $9. The potstickers were $5. Although the potstickers were not worth the $5 we paid (more like $3), the other meals far outweighed their value. I felt like I really got my money's worth for a high quality product.Price: 4 / 5Final Thoughts: I grew-up in NY with the benefit of having a lot of good Asian eateries at my disposal. I feel as if Tamarind is one of the more delicious places I have dined at. Although I may not necessarily return to Tamarind to dine-in. I would certainly get some takeout from here if I were ever in the area again.

13.description: Tamarind is a nice experience  for a date or a group lunch or dinner. The menu options are aplenty with your regular Thai favourites as well as Japanese fusion dishes. Drinks are not bad either. It's justified pricing of the menu as well. Do communicate to the waitresses what you want, and they can serve well.

11.description: Good service? Check.Fast? Check.Affordable? Check.Good food? Miss.To start, the menu itself at Tamarind is confusing. Any restaurant classified as "Asian" that also has sweet potato fries on the menu should be a red flag. It's definitely an eatery with an identity crisis, trying to cover too many types of food options. Classic quantity vs. quality situation. But we settled on crab rangoon as an appetizer, and 3 sushi rolls to split: the spicy tuna, tropical seafood maki, and california roll. Even though all of the food was served ridiculously fast, none of it was very good. If I were in the area again, I'd go to a different restaurant.

39.description: Chose this place because of location and great outside seating area. We were the only ones outside and pretty much the only table in the place (Monday lunch hour) and the service was not good...very slow. The sushi was just okay - they definitely were cheap with how much tuna they put into my spicy tuna! Some rolls had a tiny bit of tuna and mostly cucumber, which I did not appreciate. We ordered smoothies as well, which were too small for $5 and again, were made too slow. However, the udon noodles were a large portion and were really good. If you want sushi, skip this and walk a couple blocks to Kai. It is the BEST in the area, by far.

37.description: Pretty mediocre.  Rice doesnt come with dishes  it would be nice to know that in advance. No sauce for eggrolls. I guess you have to ask for that. Duck soup is good but bland, needs flavoring. General tao chicken is not dark meat, they just use the stock fried chicken probably for every dish.

0.description: Tamarind is my favorite restaurant! The atmosphere is great for a date night or a meal out with the family. Service is quite quick, too. Plenty of variety on the menu. The sushi is amazing. The Crab Rangoon is even better!5 out of 5 stars on food.But never order delivery. They're completely rude. I recently had a guy, who didn't bring my receipt to sign and tip him, so he demanded a tip in person and asked "where the cash" was. When I told him I paid credit card and wanted to add it from there, he shoved the food at me, shook his head, mumbled under his breath and stormed out. NOT worth the $4 delivery fee.

38.description: Our sushi was fine but the crab rangoons were to die for. And I loved the cucumber water. Great spot for a quick meal.

51.description: This place is pretty interesting -- the decor is great, the service is prompt, there's tons of choices on the menu, and the presentation and color of the food is excellent.The bad part is that it's a bit pricey (although not terrible for the loop) and not extremely authentic -- however with that said, if you're looking for a milder introduction to more unique Asian cuisine -- this place is perfect. It would be similar to taking something like PF Changs but introducing a couple more traditional ingredients and dishes to the mix -- being careful not to be too spicy or put in an excessive amount of oils and herbs.The flavors are really the only thing that I can really criticize as the portion size was pretty good, the textures were all on point, food temperature was good (although if you're sitting outside, remember Chicago is windy so your food will cool down quickly), and they use fresh ingredients instead of sauces to add flavor when possible. So the food is still enjoyable even if you were looking for more authentic flavors (which, in this case -- you should probably hop over to Chinatown quickly as most Asian food in the loop is a bit more mild).In summary, I'll be back -- I know tons of friends who would love a restaurant like this, which is a in a convenient spot near many Chicago landmarks and offers a wide variety of options for everyone.

27.description: Great service!  The menu is extremely huge. They have everything. The portions are huge for a very reasonable price.

32.description: the decor and vibe was nice! There's a huge variety of types of food you can get. We got a caterpillar roll, honey walnut shrimp, pad Thai, and kimchi. The food was alright-- the food quality was pretty good but the flavors were average. The service was great--the waitress was super attentive.

54.description: I want to be able to give this restaurant more stars, but the food was ok, just not great. I ordered the spicy scallop, shrimp tempura, and Taiwan shining noodles. The sushi was average; nothing exceptional. I asked the employee over the phone if the noodles were going to be tossed in any sauce, and they explained yes and that it would not be dry. Unfortunately, when i received my food, the noodles had absolutely no flavor. Very disappointing. The food looked amazing, but jut didnt live up to my expectations.

48.description: The pad thai noodle is very dried, Tum yum soup does not taste right, ordered chicken satay received beef ( we do not eat beef), and it's very dried as well, thai ice tea was full of sugar syrup..........paid extra 20 bucks for delivery(incl tip) what a waste of my money ;-(

44.description: This place looks good so I thought I'd give it a try. Went in around 1 and it wasn't very busy so I figured it wouldn't take too long. I was seated immediately and then sat there for 15 mins with out a single person approaching me to take my order. I scanned the room attempting to make eye contact with a server to notice me but nope every server completely ignored my gaze as if I was invisible. This place is a joke they ignore there customers and don't give a fuck.
