24.description: We got take out here the other night because it was so close to the hotel.  The service was excellent, staff friendly and courteous.  The food is were this place kind of suffers.  Although it is does not tout itself as a Thai place, we decided to try the Pad Thai and two spring rolls.  The rolls very good but the pad thai was a huge disappointment.  The noodles were bland, lacked any flavor.  The vegs were flavorless and the whole dish didn't have the peanut pad thai background flavor that you expect.Overall, we didn't care for the dish we had, but the ambiance of the restaurant appeared nice, and the limited interaction we had with the staff was friendly.  May have to try the other dishes such as the Sushi to see if that is there strong point.

7.description: No stars!!!! A customer should get the same quality food no matter what time of day the order. I placed an order for pickup through grub hub for the chicken wings, seafood ceviche, and double pan fried noodles with chicken. The food was terrible.   First we didn't even get silverware to eat. Second the ceviche was disgusting. It tasted old, rubbery and as if it was sitting for a week. I bit into the chicken wings and they were still uncooked, lots of red blood at the bones, gross.  Lastly the double pan fried noodles were awful. The sauce was salty, and jelly like. The noodles were inedible. To top it off when we complained to grub hub they won't give us a refund. Why would I want a credit to go back and eat your aweful food?  Needless to say if they don't refund me today I'm writing the better business bureau and contacting the health department. Gross, don't rush people's food if it was late don't accept the darn order.

49.description: Lunch, 3 ppl:  OK, only.  Very Bland summer roll with tasteless dipping sauce.  Wrong!! lettuce type with average (Chinese) flavored minced chicken. Mushy and small sushi rolls w standard jar-pink pickled ginger. Steak stirfry lunch was average, and served w rather dry rice. No need to return with better choice nearby.

40.description: I was advised to eat at Tamarind from the concierge service at the hotel.  She was right-this place was great.It starts with something as simple as the water which is flavored with cucumber and lemon.  The server, Wow (from Thailand), arrived at my table within two minutes and was very polite, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.My appetizer was a piece of salmon sashimi along with ikura (salmon eggs) and wasabi tobiko (fish eggs).  All three were fresh and flavorful.My main entree was the three kind mushrooms.  I thought it was only going to arrive that way and was pleasantly surprised when other vegetables were in the dish as well (red pepper, carrots, broccoli, snow pea pods, fresh ginger). The mushrooms were white, shiitake, and wood ear.  This entree had best flavor and was cooked to perfection.I finished my meal with some lychee ice cream. It was refreshing and settling to my pallet.Tamarind is definitely a place that I'll come back to in the future.

53.description: Absolutely love their sushi. Warm, fast and affordable. Great service - presence is so graceful and peaceful. Oh, and don't forget to get a glass of plum wine. You won't even know it's alcohol until your second glass...I'm so serious.

30.description: We moved over a mile north and were very happy to see that they will deliver to us. The Chinese food is the best bang for the buck around, and the appetizers are great. They have great options for my Vegan fiancee too. The sushi, soups, and Curry are all good, only complaint I had was the Pad Thai lacked flavor.

46.description: I was in Chicago on a business trip and Thai/Asian sounded good so I came to Tamarind because the reviews were decent and it was close to my hotel. It was a Monday and the place was moderately busy. I was seated and ordered a Syrah wine for $8.00, it was sub par to say the least. Ordered chicken satay as an appetizer, what came was 4 deep fried (oozing with grease) chicken "fingers"! I tasted one and returned it, was horrible. The server just looked at me when I told her I expected grilled chicken. The peanut sauce was flavorless and probably came from a jar. Ugh, Next up was my entree of lemongrass beef, what arrived looked decent but was void of any hint of flavor let alone lemongrass.  The meat was hit or miss on tenderness but the veggies were good. I sent the white rice back because I don't eat it but the server offered no alternative. All in all a very marginal meal, lacking in flavor and disappointing since many reviews ranted about the food. I'm not sure if this place survives off the hotel trade. If it does that explains why it's still open. My recommendation is skip this place and try one of the others in the area.

1.description: Well this used to be a favorite place to dine after an afternoon of music in the Fine Arts building but unfortunately Tamarind has lost it's flavor and luster.So I pulled out my iPhone to check a Yelp review and saw that all the recent reviews for the last three years before were similar to to our experience. Too late for us so that was a lesson learned. Use Yelp BEFORE going into a restaurant!

55.description: On a recent business trip to HIMSS '15, I was craving a little bit of Asian cuisine to mix into the overwhelmingly heavy diet of pizza, ribs, and other American favorites. After some brief research regarding some of this type of cuisine close to the hotel, we decided on Tamarind. Our experience at this restaurant was very good.Food: We started with an order of potstickers, I had the Red Snapper Nirvana Maki (sushi roll), and my colleague had the Empress Chicken. For me, the potstickers were a bit of a 'miss', but they still delivered some of the traditional flavors I am used to. I prefer the outside to be crispier, and for the inside of the potsticker to have a little more flavor. They seemed to lack finesse and seasoning.My sushi roll, on the other hand, was dynamite! It tasted soooo incredibly fresh. The snapper on top of the roll had ZERO fishy aftertaste -- something that I sometimes get, even from some of the better known sushi places in my area. Everything was so, so fresh. I don't know how else to describe it. It was one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had in my life (6 / 5 stars - bonus point)My colleagues Empress chicken was also spot-on. It was like if General Tso, Orange Chicken, and Sesame Chicken all had a threesome, and the fundamental DNA of all three dishes made it into the baby that was produced. It was not super unique, as it had all of the traditional features of the aforementioned dishes; but it did pack a unique flavor profile that was extremely pleasant. Additionally, the chicken was cooked marvelously. Nice and crispy on the outside, yet juicy and tender on the inside. Bravo.Food: 5 / 5Service: The service was pleasant, but very rushed. I suspect it was a result of the conference being in town, but either way it was kind of a bummer to receive some more individualized service. As I have mentioned in previous posts, I am into receiving a quality experience where I dine. Although great food is nice, and equally great experience is just as valuable to me. Tamarind provided a mediocre experience in terms of service.Service: 3 / 5Atmosphere: Other reviewers have complained about dirtiness in the restaurant. I did not experience as such. However, Tamarind is in an old building, in downtown Chicago. Cockroaches would not surprise me if they were infested in the building; but I did not see any, and would assume that the restaurant is doing all it can to protect its space from a building that is likely in need of some serious renovation. Unfortunately, I just don't think that is feasible given the location of the building.Despite that, I really like the furnishings and interior of the restaurant. I never felt as if it was unclean, and thought that it really set a nice mood for enjoying a great meal.Atmosphere: 4 / 5Price: My sushi roll was $11, and my colleagues food was $9. The potstickers were $5. Although the potstickers were not worth the $5 we paid (more like $3), the other meals far outweighed their value. I felt like I really got my money's worth for a high quality product.Price: 4 / 5Final Thoughts: I grew-up in NY with the benefit of having a lot of good Asian eateries at my disposal. I feel as if Tamarind is one of the more delicious places I have dined at. Although I may not necessarily return to Tamarind to dine-in. I would certainly get some takeout from here if I were ever in the area again.

9.description: This place is pretty interesting -- the decor is great, the service is prompt, there's tons of choices on the menu, and the presentation and color of the food is excellent.The bad part is that it's a bit pricey (although not terrible for the loop) and not extremely authentic -- however with that said, if you're looking for a milder introduction to more unique Asian cuisine -- this place is perfect. It would be similar to taking something like PF Changs but introducing a couple more traditional ingredients and dishes to the mix -- being careful not to be too spicy or put in an excessive amount of oils and herbs.The flavors are really the only thing that I can really criticize as the portion size was pretty good, the textures were all on point, food temperature was good (although if you're sitting outside, remember Chicago is windy so your food will cool down quickly), and they use fresh ingredients instead of sauces to add flavor when possible. So the food is still enjoyable even if you were looking for more authentic flavors (which, in this case -- you should probably hop over to Chinatown quickly as most Asian food in the loop is a bit more mild).In summary, I'll be back -- I know tons of friends who would love a restaurant like this, which is a in a convenient spot near many Chicago landmarks and offers a wide variety of options for everyone.

26.description: Disgusting. Ordered the Yaki Udon, Hot & Sour Soup, Pad See Eiu, Egg Rolls and Mongolian Beef and ALL were terrible. I will never order from here again.

25.description: Inexpensive but excellent food. The coconut-lemon soup was the best soup I've ever had. Staff are extremely friendly and attentive.

12.description: Warm staff, quick service. We came here for a quick bite and ordered calamari and crab rangoon which was from nominal. The service was great and I each server was very sweet.

59.description: Although Tamarind seems to have an identity crisis by offering several types of Asian cuisine, I do enjoy the Taiwanese beef noodle soup, spicy dynamite mussels, spicy chicken wings, and fresh sushi.  The sushi is less expensive than nearby sushi restaurants.  Thai curry dishes were ok and there is a good Thai restaurant directly across the street where I'd rather eat Thai dishes.  I personally feel that their menu is too extensive and they should stick to two types of Asian cuisine (Chinese/sushi) and perfect it.  Service is consistently good and normally easy to obtain a table.

21.description: I ordered crab Rangoon, shrimp tempura sushi and red curry. Everything was bland. The red curry was more like a paste.

17.description: I love seaweed salad and this one is the best I've ever had. And the chicken coconut soup is nourishing and delicious. If you get it with the rice noodles the portion is large - it's a full meal by itself.

10.description: As a local I started eating at Tamarind when it opened.  It was one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants but no more. Every time I go it just gets worse. Tonight was the final visit. Crab rangoons were a doughy mess, and served with a sauce that tasted like apple pie filling. Empress chicken was bland with too-large pieces of chicken surrounded by mushy breading that I didn't want more than a few bites of. Previous visit I had pad see ew which someone in the kitchen thought should contain bean sprouts. I like sprouts, but not in pad see ew. And there seemed to be other ingredients missing, as if whoever prepared it didn't have a clue.If the Hilton concierge suggests this place to you then she has sized you up as someone who doesn't want to travel more than 1/2 block for a meal, a rube who doesn't have any concept of what good Asian food is, or both. If you want good Asian food go to Chinatown or Little Saigon. Yes it's going to take a little more effort, but if you're not willing to walk more than a few hundred feet and can accept the most mediocre of Asian food then Tamarind is the place for you.

5.description: I had this yesterday for my birthday and I must say, I love it. The menu list was overwhelming however( that's why there's a missing star) but overall it was really nice. I had Yaki Udon which is basically Yakisoba but the noodles are fat and it was pretty good. I also had Mochi ice cream as a desert and it was Soooooooooooooooo good. They didn't have Mango but I had the other 2 and they were well delicious.I will definetely go back there when I'm in the South Loop.

3.description: Meh, I won't try this place again. It wasn't bad per-say, but it wasn't good either. 1) It looks nice from the window and the doorway, which kind of raises your expectations very high.2) The waitstaff was polite and appropriately friendly. They didn't try to give me the check as some Asian restaurants seem to do to African American women who are on a date. She placed it in the middle of the table - fair enough I guess.  3) The calamari was served at room temperature in a to go box, why? It was oily and gummy like it was two days old. Also why not serve it in a bowl, if the patrons are dining in? 4) The food arrived - large American sized portions! Sadly, it just wasn't good enough to take in a to go container so we just left it on the table and money wasted. 5) The food was meh well just okay, but considering the wide variety of options in this neighborhood for Asian food being just okay is a waste of time.

35.description: Cheap and really good! Perfect place to go with friends and enjoy a good sushi here in Chicago

19.description: More 2.5/5 stars but I'm okay with rounding up for this place. Some others have said this as well, but while the service, ambiance, and timeliness are excellent, the food is just okay or less than average. My friend and I split a shrimp basil fried rice, szechwan style chicken, and a godzilla roll. The szechwan was okay, not as good as other szechwan dishes I've had before. The fried rice alternated between being salty and then really bland depending on the bite. The godzilla roll was as the other food, just okay, again have had better and the wasabi mayo tasted kind of funky. Probably won't be back, but maybe just not for me.

28.description: More 2.5/5 stars but I'm okay with rounding up for this place. Some others have said this as well, but while the service, ambiance, and timeliness are excellent, the food is just okay or less than average. My friend and I split a shrimp basil fried rice, szechwan style chicken, and a godzilla roll. The szechwan was okay, not as good as other szechwan dishes I've had before. The fried rice alternated between being salty and then really bland depending on the bite. The godzilla roll was as the other food, just okay, again have had better and the wasabi mayo tasted kind of funky. Probably won't be back, but maybe just not for me.

45.description: Love. The orange peel chicken (Orange chicken) is amazing. I usually get, but the lo mein is great as well. The portions are HUGE. Always go home with left overs. Also, I would highly recommend the crab ragoons (they are more on the sweeter side, but great!). I usually walk there, not sure about parking. Great take out place !!

33.description: I've had Tamarind twice before and my thoughts were the same the second time around. It has the advantage of being in the loop but personally I think their prices don't compliment the quality of the food. I've been to places that are still less expensive and taste phenomenal. All the dishes I've had from Tamarind can only be described as "eh". I do give them a plus for fast delivery, especially since I've ordered during my lunch break and they've delivered in 20 min. But it really is like a last option place for me and I think I only take it into consideration because it's the only place near me in the loop that carries pho but even the pho can only be described as okay. It's not totally awful but it's not a favorite either.

43.description: Found this place on Yelp. Super friendly service. Beautiful & tasty  food and great prices. Cute little outdoor patio too

2.description: In town for a conference and came here for lunch with two other folks, and it was ok (just ok).  One person in our party said, "there's so much on the menu that, if they focused on one thing, it would be much better."  There are lots of different cuisines represented (Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese, Thai).I had a Plum Saketini and it was heavy on the lime, which I wasn't expecting (it didn't have a plum wine taste to me).  One member of the party ordered Gyoza and shared them with us, and this was a very good dumpling.  My entree was Chicken Pad Thai and it didn't have a lot of flavor.  It didn't have a "spicy" indicator on the menu, so I asked for it to be spicy ..... didn't happen.  Another member of our party ordered the Pad See Ew, which was indicated to be "spicy" and it was not, so we asked for some hot sauce, which helped a bit.Overall, it was ok, but I wouldn't come back.

18.description: I write this review coming from a biased point of view, since I am from LA (asian food central of the US!). My coworker wanted chinese food and I wasn't going to settle for chinese take-out, so I took to yelp and found Tamarind. It's a cute shop and there were a good number of parties having dinner when we got there. My coworker ordered their eggrolls and the combination fried rice. I got the spicy beef soup with noodle. The soup came out in this pretty cute bowl that I believe has a flame under it, but the first sip screamed MSG to me. It was just a simple beef broth with scraps of beef and some bok choy and cilantro; it didn't blow me away. My coworker loved the eggrolls and the fried rice, but honestly, it looked like it was from takeout. We did notice that the sushi bar was empty and the chefs were just sitting there with no business. This place does its job, but just purely rating the food, I have to say it's a 2. It's a good casual atmosphere, but I'd pass on coming back here. The total for everything was about $32 including tax and tip. It is reasonably priced, so if you lived close by and just wanted some type of asian food, this works.

41.description: The food here is Average. The coconut chicken soup is great though! I got it when I was sick and it's a fav. Despite that I've been here dozens of times and of all of those times the service is at every level rude and disrespectful. I got take out because I can't sit in anymore and deal with their servers. Then the guy at the door was very nice and made me smile. Which is why this place gets Three stars instead of Two and I'm even writing this review.. instead of just labeling it as terrible like everyone else.

52.description: Really great food, good price and fast service. Our server forgot to ask us what we wanted to drink but we are all human. Water is fine. ;-)

50.description: Working in Chi town this week, I ordered delivery from this lovely restaurant. I was fairly hungry, and they had a 20 minimum, no big deal, I didn't want to leave hotel. Ordered beef noodle soup, spinach app and Thai tea. They called me within 5 minutes to apologize that they were out of spinach and I happily switched to the eggplant instead.  When I took the bag from the friendly delivery guy I knew I was in trouble, felt like it weighed 10lbs! There was easily enough for 3 to share, barely made a dent! Soup was great, delivered with a side bag stuffed with bean sprouts, jalapeño slices, lime and a side of a tamarind sirracha blend. I'll have the eggplant for lunch tomorrow :)

4.description: Said they have gluten free, got mildly poisoned, probably pan not washed or same utensils or some additive in tofu. Not sure. They literally served me pad thai with absolutely no sauce on it. They did bring me some tamari, but if you are going to serve someone plain rice noodles with plain unseasoned chicken, please warn them. Friend got some egg rolls that looked like they forgot to fry them? He didn't eat them. Waitress kindly took them off the bill, so two stars.  She was nice.

6.description: I was advised to eat at Tamarind from the concierge service at the hotel.  She was right-this place was great.It starts with something as simple as the water which is flavored with cucumber and lemon.  The server, Wow (from Thailand), arrived at my table within two minutes and was very polite, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.My appetizer was a piece of salmon sashimi along with ikura (salmon eggs) and wasabi tobiko (fish eggs).  All three were fresh and flavorful.My main entree was the three kind mushrooms.  I thought it was only going to arrive that way and was pleasantly surprised when other vegetables were in the dish as well (red pepper, carrots, broccoli, snow pea pods, fresh ginger). The mushrooms were white, shiitake, and wood ear.  This entree had best flavor and was cooked to perfection.I finished my meal with some lychee ice cream. It was refreshing and settling to my pallet.Tamarind is definitely a place that I'll come back to in the future.

22.description: This place is ok. I've never reviewed it before because it was just that - ok. Tonight however left an impression and it was not a good one. Service here is usually good and the staff was polite but not tonight. We were eating with small children so when the hostess escorted us to a table in the middle of the restaurant I saw one in the corner and asked to be seated there. If you don't know eating with small children can go from zero to a hundred real quick so I prefer to not be on center stage when it goes down. The hostess threw up her hands in frustration, grunted and escorted us to the other table. I know we should've left but I was like maybe she's having a bad night and we don't have to see her anymore. The waitress comes over after about 10 minutes. There appears to be a bit of a language barrier as she keeps asking us to repeat ourselves. No worries it happens. I was patient as she brought out one plate, bowl and glass at a time. Luckily another waitress saw she was struggling and pitched in to help. We ate. Waitress never asked if we needed anything and only came over when called for a to go box. When she brings the bill I see the 20 and 25% gratuity calculations are highlighted in orange at the bottom. This waitress clearly thinks she's done a stellar job and didn't bother to waste time highlighting the 10 and 15% gratuities. I give her cash and ask for change. She brings the change back, points to the highlighted gratuities and says, "This amount does not include the surcharge." Really? Now I know tipping can sometimes throw people off if it's something they're not use to. But who trained her and taught her this? I included a 15% tip and had to resist every urge not to underline it. As someone who has made a living off tips in the past I'm an over tipper, always leaving 30 - 40% sometimes 50 if the service is excellent, especially when I'm dining with little people. So ends my mediocre love affair with Tamarind. Time to find another.

15.description: We got take out here the other night because it was so close to the hotel.  The service was excellent, staff friendly and courteous.  The food is were this place kind of suffers.  Although it is does not tout itself as a Thai place, we decided to try the Pad Thai and two spring rolls.  The rolls very good but the pad thai was a huge disappointment.  The noodles were bland, lacked any flavor.  The vegs were flavorless and the whole dish didn't have the peanut pad thai background flavor that you expect.Overall, we didn't care for the dish we had, but the ambiance of the restaurant appeared nice, and the limited interaction we had with the staff was friendly.  May have to try the other dishes such as the Sushi to see if that is there strong point.

57.description: Whoever posted that picture of the Spicy Beef Noodle soup deserves my gratitude from the bottom of my belly.That thing was solidly satisfying: the ample amount of braised beef, so tender and delicious, feels like melting in my mouth; the mildly spicy soup concoction was perfect for someone like me who's coming in from the cold Chicago wind-chilly afternoon; and the firm 'n' flat noodles filled my hungry stomach to the brim.

20.description: Someone lied, because this place is pretty bland. I have the orange glaze chicken, which did not taste like orange and was flavorless. Not too much of a glaze consistency either. My boyfriend had the basil fried rice, which tasted better than the chicken but was still not fantastic.  I've tried better hole in the wall spots.

36.description: Want some terrible service and less than mediocre food? Then this is the place to go! The plates were dirty, as well as the table. We waited 10 minutes before a server approached our table, had to actually get up and grab one. Myself, as well as many of the other guests, were attending a show at the Auditorium theater. It turns out showing up an hour before a show is not enough time at Tamarind, we ordered a couple of sushi rolls, a noodle dish, and some edamame...not too much food. It took about 15 minutes for the edamame to appear, then another 15 for the noodle dish. After waiting and waiting for our sushi to appear we finally said something, and they said that "everyone is ordering sushi tonight." The fact that the restaurant wasn't even near capacity and it was taking this long was ridiculous. We had 10 minutes to catch a show, the table behind us walked out without their food because they didn't have enough time either. In fact, there was a line of people at the register not waiting for their server to bring them a bill, because they too needed to leave. We got our one sushi roll, paid, yet was still waiting about 50 minutes for the second roll to come out, we instead decided it wasn't worth being late for, we left, unfortunately paying for a roll that we never even received. STAY FAR AWAY. There's plenty of other great spots around.

14.description: Found my Asian spot when I travel to Chicago. Had the curry shrimp fried rice and red fish curry. Both were very flavourful and very yummy. I asked for both to be spicy which was just the right amount of spice and not over the top. I called in the order and it was ready in 15 mins for pickup (on a Wednesday night).

28.description: Took me long enough but I finally came to terms with the facts:(1)My head is fatter than anything on God's green earth. (2)Fabio's stylist armed with the Mjolnir of shears couldn't do anything to make my hair look cool/sexy/awesome/hip/not-lame.Thus, blind to price, I chose Yehia since it's right across the street from my swinging pad. Here's the scoop: Showed up at 10:45 for my appointment, and I was greeted by a cavalcade of oddities. Reading material? Spin, N'digo, and the Lake Forest Academy Viewbook 2009. Given those choices, I obviously went with the Viewbook which is why I now know more about the competence of the girls' field hockey team at LFA than anyone (parents included) would ever care to know. Hat's off to you, ladies.My stylist? Quite mum this one was. Gave him my usual, stunning opening line about not knowing what to say when a stylist asks me how I want my hair done. Imagine...Stylist: How do you want it done?Me (bumbling): Well my first instinct is always to say, "shorter," but--ha!--you can't really cut it longer, can you?crickets...crickets...cricketsSo I guess it's time to retire that tired bit, but I'm not happy about this development. After bumbling through what to do with my absurd mop, we embarked on a twenty minute experiment in silence, awkward moments where our eyes met in the mirror and I quickly pretended to investigate the ceiling, and hair cutting. You know what struck me as terribly odd? My stylist kept borrowing tools from a comrade. Shouldn't he have his own tools? Has he not earned his stripes yet? What gives, man? Besides these oddities, Yehia did hit the mark at times: My hair doesn't look atrocious, the price was reasonable (20 bucks), and the place is right at my doorstep. I'll probably go back but it won't be with gushing enthusiasm.

1.description: The only plus to this place is that they're fast. You won't wait all day just to get in the chair or leave out. I went to Mohammed for a couple of years. He's nice and does a great job with styling layers but cuts too much hair off length wise. My hair grows fast but never progressed past nape length the entire couple of years I went to him. Had to stop going to him. If you want your hair to stay short-medium length, then he may work for you. Otherwise, I'd choose another stylist.

39.description: i've gotten my hair done here before and they did a great job for under forty bucks. i havent been back due to my schedule but i plan to pretty soon

9.description: I walked in to ask about their services and everyone seamed like they were high, the boy at the desk didn't even want to take off his ear phones when i approached him.I asked how much a QUICK trim and style would be, that's all. and he sat there and kind of laughed and said "i don't know" how do you not know how much your services are?!i then asked if they had a student discount and he laughed, finally someone else came up and i asked him "how much for a quick cut and style" no wash (i was in a rush between work & school)he said $40 which i am not able to afford as a college studenthonestly i think this place is a front, they were all sitting around acting really weird

29.description: The second time I visited, my hair was box-dyed brown.  I asked to go blond.  I chose a relatively ashy medium shade.  They foiled me, covered the rest of the hair, and then I sat.  In total, i sat FOR FOUR HOURS.  They plied me with Starbucks, funny stories, and reassuring looks, but at no point did my stylist or anyone else suggest I was in for such a long adventure.When I left the salon, my hair was a very very pretty, very very light blond.  I received wild compliments over the next couple of days.  I was very happy, and forgave the marathon.  UNTIL THE ENDS OF MY HAIR STARTED TO FALL OFF LIKE ASHES AT A BONFIRE!It's supposed to be an Aveda salon--healthier for your hair?  I had to cut some of the ends myself so I could go to my business meeting without little bits of hair all over my shoulders.  As a result, I now have stupid-looking pseudo-bangs and the back layer is still fried.My roots have grown out to the point that I need a touch-up and am at a loss as to where to go.  I'm thinking I'll have to get a bob to get rid of all the brittle/dead ends, which bums me out b/c I'd like to keep the pony-tail option through summer's end.I'm pretty bummed b/c the location, people, atmosphere, and price are right.  I just can't have my hair falling out :(

23.description: If you have CURLY hair, go to Emad.  Emad understands curly hair and knows how to cut it.He is the only stylist cutting my hair from now on.  My hair feels light and sexy after I leave Yehia.

5.description: I have been going to this location for 14 years! I may take breaks and try other things but I always come back. My stylist is Misch who is amazing and always makes you feel beautiful, if he is not available then ask for Ahmed he is so nice and very talented as well. Misch recently did color after Ahmed talked me into and and I haven't stopped getting compliments! I have never had a problem. I even get all my waxing done here. My waxing person is Val she is AMAZING! I get Brazilians, brows and lips and you cannot beat the price and precision. If you are looking for an all in one stop shop this is your place. I love everything about it!

31.description: 0 stars!My experience was awful.  It wasn't just that my hair looked awful; but the fact that everyone kept saying how straight, beautiful and lively it would look....WTF?I went to the Oak Park location.  The staff was very friendly; however, I could immediately tell that they knew NOTHING about AA hair.  Yes, the blowdryer was hot but my hair is natural and that is definitely not enough to straighten my hair.  My hair was still moist at the scalp and neckline when some really old man attempted to curl it with the old school stove curlers.  He parted a couple of big pieces and turned my hair under really tight after I told him I wanted it straight (he probably didn't understand me considering he didn't speak english).  The edges and roots were soooooo nappy and the style looked like a JCPenny doo.  This was a complete joke and wasn't worth the $45 (no tip for flat ironing my hair wet)!  Whoever said bone-straight, silky etc.  has never been to Detroit and had a real satin press and ceramic curl!Maybe it was just the location IDK, but I left pissed, $45 lighter, damp scalp, and had to go home and do my hair.Oh BTW, parking sucks!

25.description: I have been going to Yehia's for about 2 years. I have used a few of their services. I have had my hair relaxed by Mohammed who just rocks!! My hands and feet done by Burt (she is awesome!!) and my hair washed by Marcus, Mish and others. I love this place and will go back for more!!

12.description: It is hard to find a good stylist that does a good job on your hair AND knows what they are talking about. I have natural hair and when I go to the hood to get my hair done it looks great but they can't tell me how to take care of it. When I get someone downtown that can give me great ways of keeping my hair healthy, they unfortunately can't get my hair the way I want it (my roots straight as well). Emad was able to do both, provide advice on how to manage and treat my hair AND does a great job. This is the recipe to make an excellent stylist!

37.description: I've had the best and the worst here. The best: have Jessica do your eyebrows and any waxing needs! My natural brows look like I am the love child of Bert and Ernie and Jessica makes them look fantastic--and only for $12! So, definitely get her! As far as other stuff goes, I got my hair done here for my headshots and they curled it into Shirley Temple curls! Depending on the hairstylist, there can be language barriers (I told my guy I wanted it straight and nice big, soft curls at the bottom. He said he totally understood but made me look like a Texas beauty queen). I also got an overpriced manicure there and it was mediocre. Anyway, moral of the story: Jessica is the best person EVER for waxing (she also does a bunch of skin care stuff--fantastic)! Go to Yehia for her, but steer clear for other stuff.

21.description: I've got curly hair that is typically difficult to manage and style.  When I want to change it up a bit- I like to have it straightened but with lots of volume.  Although I wasn't formally welcomed to the salon, I was walked over to the shampoo spot where a young lady shampooed, conditioned and massaged my hair.  I must say, it was the best shampoo I've ever had:-). Later they applied a softener and gloss that stayed in for a good 15-20 minutes. Finally, Emad worked on my hair got it just right!  My hair stayed frizz free and with lots of volume for a couple of days.Definitely going back!!!

16.description: I've got curly hair that is typically difficult to manage and style.  When I want to change it up a bit- I like to have it straightened but with lots of volume.  Although I wasn't formally welcomed to the salon, I was walked over to the shampoo spot where a young lady shampooed, conditioned and massaged my hair.  I must say, it was the best shampoo I've ever had:-). Later they applied a softener and gloss that stayed in for a good 15-20 minutes. Finally, Emad worked on my hair got it just right!  My hair stayed frizz free and with lots of volume for a couple of days.Definitely going back!!!

17.description: If you have natural hair please avoid..Or you will regret it!!  Worst experience ever!

10.description: Mish has done my hair many times.  I  have very short natural hair that I wear blow-dried.  He takes good care of my hair and is excellent with cutting and styling.  I would recommend him for long or short hair and for either natural or chemically treated hair.

11.description: Mish did an awesome job although I have to say I found the price a bit high in comparison to other salons who have provided the same service. I'm natural and very very curly so my hair won't stay straight very long so paying nearly $100 seemed ridiculous to me. However, the service was quick, the salon was clean, and the music was jamming. I may go back one day but not too soon.

26.description: This is what I get for being spontaneous and stubborn, and insisting on getting a haircut even when my usual, beloved Daniella's wasn't open.  I'd walked by this place a few times, and because I never looked closely and only saw a bunch of Aveda ads, thought it was an Aveda salon.My hair was getting way too long, so I just wanted it shortened to shoulder-length, with some layers. A reasonable request, I thought, and not too complicated. Who could mess this up?Yehia can. Apparently, "shoulder length with layers" to my stylist meant "a short bob with shoulder length pieces."  WHAT?  He chopped away so fast that I didn't even realize how short he was cutting, and by then it was too late to salvage my hair.  My head has split personality disorder now - half of it wants to be a bob/pixie cut, and half of it is a terrible shoulder-length trim. It kind of looks like a longer, punk-rock mullet. I didn't even know what to say at the end. "You fucked up my hair"? "This looks terrible, I'm not paying"?  Instead, I just got out of there as fast as I could.  When I came home, my husband called me "Poof Head."Thank god it's hat season.

27.description: Yehia is my eyebrow waxing go-to in a pinch. There are better salons out there, but when I can't get into anywhere else or happen to be in the area, it's where I go. Not the best, but it'll do.Shaping is $15, cleanup is $12. Just make sure when you go, they know which you need and they don't try to convince you otherwise.

35.description: If there was a zero star rating, i would give it to this salon.l rang in to make an appointment to have a shampoo wash. l made sure the receptionist understood that l wanted a stylist who knew how to take care of black hair and she recommended a stylist named Mohammed. And so, appointment made, i got in my car,paid $10 to park in a lot closeby, got in the salon,the receptionist asked me to sit and wait,  l waited for about 5 to 10mins and decided to ask a random stylist who and where Mohammeds station was, he heard me ask and turned around, he then signed to me to come to him(l thought that was rude,although he was working on a client, l still thought he could have been courteous),he asked me what l wanted to do and l told him a shampoo wash, and he just carried on with his client and said he does not style black hair, speaking under his breath and not even looking at me like l wasn't there, and he then just pointed to another stylists and said ask her if she'll take you on. What an ........... At this point l was boiling.l walked over to the other stylist knowing there will be a very small chance that she could fit me in, asked her and she said no she could not .And so i stormed out of there.That was my first time and definitely my last time.Could not believe l had wasted my precious time driving all the way there, paid for parking and then to be spoken to so unprofessionally by this uncouth stylist, was to say the least, deplorable.What you need is professional etiquette.Spend a day in Van cleef on Huron and clean your act.

8.description: Just got my hair done here last Saturday. I made an appointment to get my hair dyed and styled, before I went back home for spring break. Unfortunately, I am completely disappointed with my results! When I called to make my appointment I made  sure the receptionist new that I was coming in to get my hair ombré to a grayish blue color! She set me up with a guy named Mish , and when I arrived and showed him the picture, he told me he would have to reschedule me! I couldn't be rescheduled b/c I needed my hair done that day! I had a flight the next mourning!  Long story short, he took me in , and I got a completely different hair color than I expected. I was near tears when I left the salon. I hated the color or colors!!!! My hair is pink orange purple and just Ughhhh!! I now have Multi  colored hair b/c he failed to evenly distribute the dye throughout my hair! I honestly can't express how upset I am, and I paid 130$ for the worst dye job of my life! DO NOT GO HERE TO GET YOUR HAIR DYED!!!!!

0.description: I am a Yehia's fan. I've been going to the one in the suburbs since I was in high school. I was very skeptical about Emad doing my hair since he was using the ceramics, but it turned out Emad did a great job doing my hair. My hair stayed flat and straighten. I have thick hair as you can see in my profile picture and a lot of hair. Hair tip: Remember ladies, It's all about the blow drying technique. If your hair isn't blow dried properly expect a hair fail. Your hair will puff up in 5 minutes.

38.description: Don't like the place. It's too creepy.

20.description: My experience with the stylist Marketia has been professional, courtesy, and a great stylist My hair has never looked so good.  My biggest concern, or should I say gripe is the shampoo assistant Brandy. I had an appointment last week that included getting my hair colored. I informed Brandy twice that I wanted a dark brown color and she said okay.  I sat and waited about ten minutes until she got everything together.  Brandy then proceeded to put a white product on my hair that I was not familiar with, so I asked her what is was, she stated that she didn't know. I then informed her that the product smells like a chemical and asked what chemical was she putting in my hair? She stated that she was not putting a chemical in my hair, I told her I could smell the sulfur and peroxide and she was indeed putting a chemical in my hair.  Brandy responded by saying she didn't know anything and was just doing what she was told. Really!?  I was shocked and very concerned that one of two things was going on (1) Brandy knew what the product was and just refused to answer my questions or (2) she didn't know what the product was and was doing as she was instructed.  Either way that's bad customer service, if you ask me.  This establishment or any other consumer establishment is based on relationships, honesty and integrity. If those characteristics are lacking then your business will suffer. So, after the chemical was put in (developer) she put in the color. I asked her was the color dark brown and she said yes. I informed her that it appeared to be black and she stated it was a very dark brown.  To make a long story short, I asked her three times about the color of my hair and when she was blow-drying it, told her she colored my hair black and she repeatedly denied that she colored it black. Brandy colored my hair black even though I did not want my hair black, then she insulted my intelligence by lying about the chemical and color.  I do not want to be bothered with someone like that.  I remained calm, professional and courteous, and even tipped her $5.00, but I don't plan on having her in my head ever again.   Hopefully, the shop as more than one assistant! Just because I don't possess a cosmetologist license doesn't make me a fool.  In fact, I have too much education, too many degrees to let someone make me loose my temper because they are incapable of telling the truth!

19.description: Yehia is my eyebrow waxing go-to in a pinch. There are better salons out there, but when I can't get into anywhere else or happen to be in the area, it's where I go. Not the best, but it'll do.Shaping is $15, cleanup is $12. Just make sure when you go, they know which you need and they don't try to convince you otherwise.

33.description: I had a bad initial experience with the service there. Its not that they are not friendly, its that I had a photoshoot and made a special appointment and the hairdresser went on a trip and he didn't call to cancel with me until I called him. So luckily enough, I found another hairdresser the same day.Next, I returned because I know they can blow my hair dry afterwards. I asked the hairdresser to return my hair to its dark color and brought photos. He just brought out a mix and got to work. It didn't return to my color so he had to explain AFTER THE WORK was done that he was apparently acting in my best interest. What made it worse, I don't think he had a good eye for what brown would best suit my skin color- it looked like a wig. A girl even asked me, "Is that yours???"  Anyway, I returned upset and at no charge I was handed around the room for color, dry and then, the owner himself took the liberty of layering my hair! Do you know how long my hair takes to grow??? My holiday, my friends said my hair was wrecked. Weak from color, a cut that didn't suit my curly hair and i just had to wear it back everywhere. I'm still trying to moisturize what's left. But come on!!! The cut was aweful but one feels so bad because they are so darn nice while they are wrecking your life. You just go home and cry but while saying goodbye, you think they deserve a tip. Here is a tip: Go for friends and not for your hair!If anyone knows a hairdressing place that with a customer service strategy that listens, educates and asks permission about what they plan to do- and who actually knows black, mixed, latin hair- I would be happy to hear from them. Yehia's is a friendly place but they will smile and promise you donuts while coloring your hair an unmatching color and cutting the rest off giving you no notice at all.  Their new motto should be: Go for friends, not for hair.

2.description: I went to Yehia last week and Ahmed did an amazing job with my hair. I needed a lot since my sew in had to be taken out. He took it out and made suggestions and washed and trimmed my hair. I appreciated that he showed me how much he was cutting. Great service at a fair price.  This was my first time there but I'll definitely be back!

34.description: yehia is a business that i've been able to count on for the past 16yrs. i've been to a number of locations over the years. this is my fave. being black and having natural hair isn't a crime here...if you want to wear it straight they won't try to pressure you into chemically altering it. i dont wear my hair straight ALL the time, but i know that when i do i can count on it to be gorgeous if i go here. i like the stylist ayemen...i highly recommend him and the shop in general. i've never had to wait when i go in and have never been displeased. check em out it won't break your pocket book either. my only criticism is they are SERIOUS about the blow dry...a little too serious...they can some times make it so straight that if you like to go back and forth from curly to straight...that may be hard b/c the "straightness" often stays after you wash...

32.description: If you want bone straight hair this is your place.  They charge $45-55 for blow dry, press and curl.  They get you in and out really fast.  I will warn you though they use A LOT of heat on your hair to achieve the silky bone straight hair you desire.  If you go too often your hair will become very dry and brittle over time and you may need to chop it all off and start growing it all over again.  Oh and if you get your hair colored here and you have very dark hair... and you want lighter hair. They will use a bleach to get the results you want but I don't think it's too healthy. Overall, my recommendation is if you have an event or you can't get an appointment with your regular stylist then go here.  But I wouldn't make this a regular place...your hair will not stay healthy here.

18.description: It's the best place in town for a blowdry. I have very difficult curly hair and Emad works his magic every time I go there! If you want an amazing blow dry that last for few days ask for Emad.

13.description: From beginning to end, this was a wonderful experience. I was greeted when I walked in the door and the guy asked who was my normal stylist. I told him it was my first time there. Right away, he told me to sit in the seat to get my hair washed. The woman was very respectfully the whole time asking me was the water too hot or cold. She even apologized to the fullest when a "splash" of water hit my eyes. Next, I was put under the steamer. I chatted with hair washer and asked what she would recommend I get since our hair was the same length. She suggested a few styles and I chose one. She offered me some water and I politely declined. I was handed off to a guy who blow dryed my hair. Didn't take long but it hurt a little if the heat was on too long. He offered me water as well. I still declined. Finally, my stylist comes over and introduces himself as Mish. He wanted to know where I usually get my hair done. I told him I wanted to try some new and convenient to get to. He finished blow drying my hair. He asked whether I wanted a lot of volume or not. When I say I felt like a princess afterwards that's an understatement. My hair was so bouncy and shiny. I thanked him for his service and gave him a tip. I will definitely go to Yehias again. I love the fast and efficient service provided. Thank you.

4.description: By the look of the place, it's nothing special.  Not a high quality spa. It's not classy or polished. My rating is purely based on their work.  They do a great job with hair.  I have had a mani, pedi, hair and eyebrows done here.  They are very nice and I've been going here for probably 10 years now.  I drive an hour just to get my hair done.  Love it and have recommended a million people!!!!

24.description: If I could, I would give this place 0 stars. The walls were dirty and there were old plastic carts (the ones used when hair is colored) haphazardly left with old dried out dye against the wall at the back of the shop.  The colorist barely spoke to me, started the highlights an inch away from my roots and because he didn't check whether or not my hair had previously been colored, managed to turn it orange.The stylist interpreted a "trim" as "please chop 4 inches off half my hair and leave the underneath hair long". This made my hair look like 2 different styles on one head, an ear length bob and then a longer style underneath.  By the time I realized what was going on it was too late as the damage had already been done. When the hair was being dried I felt like crying, the highlights were awful and so thick that I looked like a zebra, and the cut was akin to a mullet. While I was there another woman getting her hair dyed started yelling that her head was burning.Needless to say I ran away from this place and will never go there again.

6.description: I live a few blocks away. Emad cut my hair like an artist. I was extremely happy. Have received nothing but compliments. My only criticism is the shop is dirty. It needs a good cleaning. The staff is very friendly. I am going to try a mani pedi next time.

22.description: I always go to Albert!!! He is my stylist and he is fabulous, enough said!!!!! He does all types of hair and has great conversation. He will not let you leave the shop until your hair is up to the level of perfection he holds himself too! I also go here to get my Brazilians done by Valerie and she is amazing, her expertise and technique is amazing! I have been going here for the past 3 years...never disappointed!!!

15.description: I absolutely love how Elliott styles my hair! He is also a phenomenal colorist.

40.description: This is the "new" Yehia - i.e. a sexist excuse to make men stop going to the old Yehia, which still maintains a predominantly female clientele.  The barbers are nice... but freakishly religious.  Two Orthodox "Passion of the Christ" loving Christians work here.  I guess that's tolerable for a nice $15 haircut and shave in the loop.

7.description: When I first walked into Yehia my hair had become damaged as a result of me wearing weave.  I only had a limited time to get everything taken care of, because I had work later.  Not only did they take down my extensions, but they were able to style me as well, all before I needed to leave for work.  Their deep conditioner and other products make it a fantastic experience.  Now I'm a regular customer and I go to Emad because in my opinion he's the best. Emad is very attentive of his clients and is meticulous in his work.  If you're thinking to go make sure you request him, you won't be disappointed!

36.description: I will never patronize this place again. They use ENTIRELY too much heat and actually severely damaged my natural hair. They are not well-versed in dealing with all the different types of textures of African-American hair. My hair is fine and doesn't need that much heat and I told the stylist this repeatedly. Still, my hair was literally fried. It smelled like smoke and was so damaged that I got double my refund back. Yehia himself had to take care of it. I really do not recommend this place for any African-American woman.

30.description: My experience here was awful.  I wanted to get my hair colored black and just a wash and blow cut after that.  I walked in and once I checked in and put on a robe, I was lost.  No one came up to me so I just went over to my sister who was getting her hair pressed while I waited for someone to come up to me.  Finally someone approached me and asked what I wanted done.  I told him I wanted my hair colored black and he was like, "Really?  Don't you think that's too dark?"  I'm black woman with medium dark complexion.  How would it be too dark??  Well, he ended up talking me out of it and just dying it a dark brown color.  So another guy came up to me and colored my hair and toward the end got color on my blouse!!  A big glob fell on the collar of my blouse and yes, they were concerned and he tried to get it out but it was to no avail.  I could tell he wasn't that comfortable dying hair.  The only competent person was the person who washed my hair.  Once I got out of the chair the first guy came back and and finished styling my hair.  He was saying how dark it was and how good it looked.  Of course it looks dark!  It's still wet!!  So he's drying my hair and putting the dryer so close to my scalp he was practically burning me.  When he was going over my hair with the flat iron, he was curling his hand under and spritzing hair spray.  I asked him not to curl it under because I didn't want to look like a 12 year old girl.  And I asked for no hair spray because I wasn't going to be washing my hair the next day.  I have African-American hair and I only wash it about once a week.  So he did it several more times after I asked him not to, so pretty much the damage was done.  I looked like I had a bowl cut.  And he takes me to the mirror to show me how dark it is, but it still looks brown to me, the same color it was when I walked in.  So pretty much I paid for color where there was no difference and to look like a little girl.  And my sister has natural hair and all they did to straighten it was to blow it dry with a hair dryer.  You need more than that...at least a pressing comb.  And come to find out, Yehia was the one styling my hair.  He never made any introduction and there was no communication while he was doing my hair.  If you're the owner or the manager of a place, at at least be personable and make your clients feel welcome.  I'll definitely never go back and I advise everyone out there not to go either.

3.description: I am due for a hair cut and unfortunately it's too expensive for me to fly from Toronto just to get a hair cut :-).  I decided to give this salon a chance based on reviews and I was happy with the results.  They applied a deep conditioner that made my hair smooth and soft.  Mish was the stylist who cut my hair and he did a great job! He could have done a quick trim but took the time to let me know that more of my ends needed to be trimmed so my curls look better.  The overall experience was nice and would recommend this salon to anyone.  From what I observed they are capable of working with all types of hair which means they are talented.  I'm in Chicago often and I will be back soon! This place is worth a try if you're looking for a quality salon with friendly staff and affordable prices!

14.description: I visited Yehia almost a week ago. My hair still looks GREAT! Mish did an excellent job. His assistant's were kind, friendly, understanding, and they listen to your concerns and questions regarding your hair. 5 stars goes to his team of assistants as well. Great customer service. He clipped my ends perfectly. Not too much & not too little - still have the length I desired plus my hair looks healthy. It's JUST RIGHT! I love Mish. My next hair appointment will be with him that's for certain. I must add I watch other clients leave from their stylists' chair very pleased & happy. I believe besides just Mish there is salon full of qualified individuals that know how to make their clients leave feeling replenished and recharged.

29.description: I'm giving this two stars simply because Yelp separates the theater from the bar, so I figure I will in my review as well.  And the bar is simply, meh.  Then again, if you're at Showplace for a movie, it's location can't be beat.The food is OK but a bit overpriced, the drinks are OK, and the service is OK to spotty.  I would never come here if it weren't attached to the theater.  It's not bad, it just has nothing going for it other than its relative location.

42.description: I have no other theater experience with drinks and food to compare to this one so I have to say I was pleasantly surprised after reading all the other not-so-positive reviews.1) bacon popcorn - to each his own; i didn't care for it and thought it tasted weird but my mom liked it. I think it prob isn't wise to mix with alcohol though ...2) the Sex & the City martinis were great - could have been a bit stronger. Since they were so easy to down, we switched to a bottle of Prosecco for the movie.3) the mini angus burgers were mediocre but nevertheless tasty and great little bites to have for the theatre4) the meat/cheese platter - we did the 4/4 and the cheese portions were a bit small and the prosciutto a bit dry but still really good. I loved that they don't skip the accompaniments (as some places do) and the artisan walnut toast, quince paste, grapes, dates, hazelnuts and dried apricot were nice touches.5) RED VELVET CAKE - seriously the unexpected winner here. I wish I hadn't eaten so much b/c I wanted another piece! Really excellent moist cake and delightful cream cheese frosting - i want to come back just for a slice!Overall, I will say that the whole VIP Premium movie experience is not something you do every day but it was a nice afternoon spent w/my mom to see SATC2. It was fun having cocktails in the lounge on the couches and looking out the window (though there isn't much to look at) and we had plenty of help getting our food to our seats - there isn't much room on those side tables though so don't order too much!They gave us an ice bucket for the Prosecco so that was great as well.Servers are a bit frazzled though - I was surprised to learn they opened the week before Christmas since it really seemed more like they had only been open a month or so ...Overall, I would definitely come back!

23.description: I'm a huge fan of this place.  Great drinks and a large drink menu complete with movie themed cocktails, wines, and champagne by the glass.  They have a selection of small plates, the food is okay, if a little over priced.  They get packed on Friday and Saturday nights as early as 6pm, but the service is efficient and friendly.  If you want to order food and get a table you should go at least an hour before your movie starts, if not more.

8.description: Took my girl here the other night... big mistake.The decor is tacky, nothing special. Felt like a child decorated the bar for adults.Food was terrible and service was not worth my overpriced badly made drinks.

31.description: Anytime I can:A. See a movie, and get free parkingB. See a movie, get free parking, and reserve my seat ahead of timeC. See a movie, get free parking, reserve my seat ahead of time, AND enjoy adult beverages??Yeah, that makes me happy. I wish Icon and Lobby Lounge had been here when we lived in the South Loop, but now is as good a time as any. I've been here twice in the last few months and have enjoyed all the surroundings; it's nice to just walk out to/up to a bar right before or after the show. It gets crowded in the Lounge for periods but eventually thins out. Service is good, decent drinks, decent food..overall enjoyable.

34.description: While I do enjoy being able to kick back a glass of wine before a show...the Lobby Lounge just doesn't do it for me. 1. The crowd is. Um. Just, um. Sort of a weird mix of older frat boys, groups of giggly girls from the 'burbs, mom and dad on date night, and the occasional thug. It's strange. Luckily, it's at least all 21+...they card you at the entrance. 2. Having said that...it's packed on the weekends. So, apparently the niche is a good one, and people want to get sauced before taking in a flick. The key here is, there is NOWHERE else to go even close walking distance to this place. IN the winter, that means...it fills up quickly. 3. The decor is "oh-so-Jerry-Kleiner." And while that probably kicked ass in 1995, I'm not feeling it so much in 2011. It's red and black and trendy all over and I'm sure the suburbanites think its super hip to the tilt. I think it gauche and played out. OOooo, black and white photos of movie stars!? How creative! No. 4. Service is increasingly spotty. And, if you are attending a VIP showing of a movie, the entrances are up here through the Lobby Lounge. Great, except VIP means move your own damn drinks into the theater. I don't find this to be a very smooth transition. Super awkward for the price one is paying to be "VIP" and have the luxury of buying one's own drinks and moving them when the movie starts, and then trekking back to the bar to order more if that is desired. What is VIP about that!? Methinks not much. No service included in a steeeeeeep price? Um, fail. Especially when the regular tickets afford very nice cushy seats. I prefer Diet Coke with my movies anyhow. So there's the skinny...it's fine, and in a pinch it's OK for a drink, but I wouldn't make it a destination, nor do I think it's anything super-duper-special. It's fine. They serve booze and people go there before/after the movies because our winters are hellish, and people drown their sorrows before having to walk out and face the cold. Or large Hollywood movies. I can't decide what's been worse lately!

16.description: Excellent lounge. The food is not so great. My friends and I ordered food and 75% of our meals were deep fried. The drinks are really good though. They are small, expensive, but pack a punch. Just beware. You can dump a lot of cash there. 4 of us dumped $200 in an hour.

13.description: Worked here as a line cook two years ago. For the most part, when I started, the crew was made up of professional cooks with a pro chef at the helm. As the pro cooks dropped away it became the policy of Lobby Lounge to use and promote candy counter workers in the kitchen. Since I left the chef and sous chef have left and have not been replaced. I went back to see a movie and sample what the food has become and it is just awful. I would strongly recommend that you have a nice dinner prior to going to the movie and just have a drink with your film.

11.description: Menu is now a chuckfull of carbohydrates -- panini, pizza, sliders, fried chips and dip.Chicken Alfredo Pizza ($12) -- sprinkles of chicken, flavor in the middle but not in the outer crust, thin crust was perfectly crunchy.  One pizza for One person.Coffee -- super generic for a bottomless $3.View from Window -- NONE.  You get an empty lot of dirt.  In the future, there will be a garden.Reserved Seating Cards -- They are on every single table even though NO ONE was around.  Maybe an attempt in pretentiousness.Drinks -- cute with the average price of $12.  At least good liquor (Grey Goose, Smirnoff) is used, not cheapo well vodka.You can get better value for your $ if you dine somewhere else in the South Loop before going to the movies.  BUT, if you are hungry for a meal, besides buttered popcorn...then this would be the IT place.Unlike the hyperimaginative review from UrbanDaddy....I totally missed the celebrity pictures.  The pix are part of decor, not the centerpiece...just like in Kleiner's Carnivale.

39.description: [ Visited in September, 2010 ]It was a Wednesday night when our six-o'clock showing of a film ended at the Showplace ICON. My partner and I had not eaten dinner and as the hour approached eight, we decided to hop up to Lobby Lounge with two friends in tow.Lobby Lounge, at least in 2010, has one of the most pleasant views of the city. One can entertain themselves with a view of LaSalle Street station, the Sears -- whoops, strike that...I meant Willis -- Tower, and the various buildings in the South Loop. One must wonder how long this view will exist, so you should get there now before the empty lots are filled with obstruction.We were seated immediately in the sparsely-filled seating area and quickly delivered menus. Much to my own dismay, Lobby Lounge does not serve full portions of food. The tapas-sized portions offer meat, meat, cheese, and more meat to omnivores. Vegans and strict vegetarians: sorry, you're out of luck as everything seems to have cheese in it.Between the pair of couples, we tried two orders of panini (the kitchen brought the "Italian" panini instead of the one I ordered, so they comp'ed us), Royale burgers, a pizza, and a cheese and meat pairing.  Add a glass of prosecco and wine, and our faux-dinner came out to nearly $65, pre-tip.Service was relatively quick and friendly, but the both panini sandwiches were overcooked with too much butter. The pizza was decent, and Royale burgers were good, if too small. All in all, the best thing about Lobby Lounge is the view. Want to impress a date who hasn't been in Chicago for long? Take her to Lobby Lounge *after* dinner elsewhere. She'll appreciate the view, and might even join you for a movie afterwards.

37.description: We were about to see Harry Potter, needed some sustenance before the movie started.My friend and I got the special pizza, which was a chipotle chicken, corn, and avacado crema pizza.  Yes crema.  I don't know what that is but it's probably spanish.The pizza was ok.  I liked the flavors but the actual pizza was kind of flimsy and ...shall I risk saying the word that 90% of english speakers can't stand?? yes.  I have to do it...  moist.  Like it had been sitting in a steamer. meh.We also got the bacon popcorn, which was good.  I liked the flavor of the popcorn-- BUT, the bacon itself was more like beef jerky.  I suggest using actual pieces of bacon, not clumbs of dehydrated meat.Another unfortunate occurance was after eating the bacon popcorn, my hands had a VERY strong beef jerky smell.  It was making me nauseated during the movie, so I had to get up to wash my hands and therefore MISSED part of fhe movie (I am trying to make this seem like an epic tragedy but I'm joking, I read the books anyway).Generally though, the place was nice, service was good, and food was average ( or just a smidge below at worst).

0.description: Big fan of the Lobby Lounge. Never mind the bad reviews here... you can't please many Yelpers. Some of them just live to hate. Love the sliders. It's a nice change of pace from the regular popcorn, which isn't great. They have good paninis as well. The service is solid and usually very quick. It's a fun spot.

38.description: If i'm not seeing a Disney movie or something rated G i'm probably trying to avoid most kids (I swear I love the little suckers). Wish granted? Kind of.It's pretty cool to have a bar inside the movie theater. What better way to kill time before a show than drinking? It sure beats fighting kids for broken arcade games.Too bad the food isn't that great. The sandwich I got was a piece of saran wrap short of a pre-packaged sandwich from 7-11. If you can't do food well then just stick to popcorn and maybe offer some gourmet toppings or something. I like what you're doing but I want you to do it better.  Deal?

27.description: Menu is now a chuckfull of carbohydrates -- panini, pizza, sliders, fried chips and dip.Chicken Alfredo Pizza ($12) -- sprinkles of chicken, flavor in the middle but not in the outer crust, thin crust was perfectly crunchy.  One pizza for One person.Coffee -- super generic for a bottomless $3.View from Window -- NONE.  You get an empty lot of dirt.  In the future, there will be a garden.Reserved Seating Cards -- They are on every single table even though NO ONE was around.  Maybe an attempt in pretentiousness.Drinks -- cute with the average price of $12.  At least good liquor (Grey Goose, Smirnoff) is used, not cheapo well vodka.You can get better value for your $ if you dine somewhere else in the South Loop before going to the movies.  BUT, if you are hungry for a meal, besides buttered popcorn...then this would be the IT place.Unlike the hyperimaginative review from UrbanDaddy....I totally missed the celebrity pictures.  The pix are part of decor, not the centerpiece...just like in Kleiner's Carnivale.

32.description: I went to the Lobby Lounge with two friends before seeing The Kings Speech on a cold Wed. in January 2011. At first we were elated with the window seat and our perky waitress but things went downhill quickly. We ordered a round of drinks, my two friends ordering simple Bourbon and Waters each with a separate specialty Bourbon. Their drinks came and in the first sip was apparent the drink were incorrectly made...now that is a drink that is pretty difficult to screw up. We sat waiting for our waitress so that we could resolve the drink issue and move on to our conversation, and she never materialized. My two friends decided to take matters into their own hands and walked to the bar, which is a large rectangle in the center of the restaurant, and waited for 4 minutes to be asked if they needed help. Finally the bartendress asked if they needed help and upon replying yes, she promptly turned away from them with no comment and went back to the cash register. Now, being a Wed. night in January it wasn't a busy night so the business at the cash register being more important than the needs of a customer was difficult to understand. She eventually returned to them, and when told that the drinks were not right, she stated she had to research the drinks in the cash register/computer and argued that the waitress had selected "soda" instead of water. She eventually did replace the drinks. This episode took over 8 minutes and in the time it took, which was significant to our pre movie dinner, our food arrived. One friend ordered the appetizer sliders which she raved about and she is a hamburger aficionado. My other friend and I split a prosciutto pizza which unfortunately had cooled down quite a bit during the drink wait. The flavor was good though. We then were brought the bill as they are quite conscientious about making sure you make your movie which is good. However, when the bill was brought the waitress said the computer was to blame for the drink mix up. When we looked at the bill it took all our control not to laugh or make snide comments. The bill looked like a kindergartener had played hangman on it and scratched out all the numbers in two sections Our waitress' explanation about the messed up receipt really made no sense. One of my friends took a picture with her cell phone and if I get am going to post it . All in all it was a pretty "meh" experience. We did like the movie theater and the concept is great. They need to work on the service at the Lobby Lounge and hopefully that will improve. There are not a lot of movie theaters in Chicago and very few restaurants around this one, so being the only place to eat, they could really increase their business by having a good customer service training for their staff.

44.description: So, the good first: very cool, hip decor. Awesome views of the city. Great if you just need a place to grab a beer while you wait for your peeps and feel very sex in the city while you sip your cosmo.  Seats are super comfy.The bad: Service was SLOW - not good when you're trying to make a movie. Food is only so-so. The portobello panini was very good, but the margherita pizza was totally bland, the touted "homemade" chips completely flavorless and stale, and my friend said the sliders were tasteless. We ordered our food before the movie started but it didn't arrive before showtime - so the waiter gives you a pager to let you know when its ready, nice right? Well, this of course, means you have to get up and bother everybody to get out of the theatre and then you have to navigate back in the dark (not *their* fault, just saying that if you can, get your food before the movie starts). And there aren't any trays - so don't order more than two things or you'll have a heck of a time getting back trying to carry the lovely, but heavy, porcelain plates in the dark while stepping over legs and looking for your seat.On the whole, far less pleasant than you'd think. By all means, take your cocktails in with you - that's very nice - but trying to deal with "real" food and "real" dishes in a darkened theatre is more trouble than its worth. Especially for such mediocre food. There's a reason popcorn comes in tubs folks!

24.description: What are people taking about ?This over price place Is so bad  the seating is tight,the food i would not feed to my Rats.maybe it's just great for people who don't want the leave downtown.

7.description: No pre-movie location needed when a lounge is included at the venue. Great idea on paper but in practice it was a failure.The the Florentine pizza had a great thin crust  with fresh ingredients and a unique tomato sauce. The bruschetta was compiled with warm toasty bread and a blend of garlic, fresh tomatoes, parmesan, all atop balsamic vinegar. All great except for the appetizer and pizza came out at the same time. Eh, I think as a server you can account for some lag time between the two. This is where things got off on the foot and the last time we saw our server for the next hour.Empty plates sat for a good half hour no one was to be found for a fresh drink. Tried asking bussers, and they replied "I'm not a server", and other wait staff were clueless. No help in that regard. We ended up flagging our server down for the check  and that concluded the shitty service giving us just a few minutes to get to the show. We debated walking out on the check to give you an idea of frustration from this Houdini act (which I have never done).I enjoyed the food and the drinks were reasonably priced. Disappointing when the service has to ruin it. I am sure its hit or miss on a Sunday evening but this was a clear miss.

40.description: Located on the second level of the new Showplace Icon theater in Roosevelt Collection, the Lobby Lounge is one of Jerry Kleiner's newest additions to the South Loop.You must be 21+ to even enter the Lobby Lounge.  It is attached to the 2 VIP theaters where for an additional charge, you have bigger and quite comfy chairs, a shared table, and cup holders that holds all of their stemware (the only exception: champagne flutes)The lounge itself has seating at the bar, plush banquettes, and intimate table seating that are perfect for small groups.  The decor is lots of red and the view of the skyline is beautiful.As for the food, the options are somewhat limited but still quite tasty when considering you are at a movie theater.  They have meat and cheese platters, paninis, pizzas, fillet sliders, and a few other small bites.  My favorite bite is the bacon popcorn.  It is the perfect portion size and tastes like heaven.  I have brought the popcorn downstairs to a non-VIP show and had no problems so you should be able to order food and bring it with -without the additional ticket charge!Overall: Not a destination in and of itself but a must-go when already planning to see a movie.

30.description: I go here WAYYYYY too often before movies and after. But on Oscar Night, I stayed and watched the Ocsars. Loved it. Great service, good drinks, and fantastic finger food. I would recommend people go here instead of Tantrum down the street.

1.description: Came in last night, Friday, for a quick dinner before seeing Sicario. One thing I thought that stood out was the immediate attention the hostesses were when my Boyfriend and I arrived. They were very nice and welcoming, no doubt it was genuine. This was the moment that began to set the experience and expectations pretty high. Unfortunately it all fell pretty flat very quickly!The lounge wasn't packed at all and the lounge seemed like there was way more than enough staff to attend to the guests... That said, it was hard to believe the service after getting our drinks would be so terrible! We had one waiter who took our drink order and then completely disappeared?! A different waitress came, after some time, to take our food order, with no explanation. Considering their menu, we waited quite some time for sandwiches & chips, and even quesadillas... None of this made any sense. Serving sizes are pretty small, though I can't deny the sandwiches were quite tasty. The chips (side dish to the entrees), their claim to fame, weren't anything special. They were warm and aside from that I can't see the appeal. Once we got our food, that was pretty much the last time we had any interaction with our waitress. My boyfriends drink was empty, my water was empty, no refills at all. We ended up splitting his water, WHO DOES THAT???! I could've used a little more sauce but our waitress, yet again, nowhere to be found!I noticed the staff gathering and chatting in the corner for a good chunk of the night, while our glasses were clearly empty. Shouldn't they be checking on their tables? I guess this is how this lounge works! Beware of what you're getting into, you're better off sitting at the bar or better yet going to Chop right next door!! We left the lounge and grabbed drinks at Chop, what a relief to salvage what was left of our dinner!The only good thing I took from that lounge was the spectacular skyline view! Aside from that, I feel like this lounge is trying to be something they are clearly not! It's clear they are trying to appeal as an upscale lounge... Unfortunately the lack of quality service does not reflect what they are trying to be. It is very sad that the service falls very short, it's such a shame considering it's amazing location and atmosphere! I can honestly see this lounge losing its appeal with CHOP downstairs and new coming restaurant on it's way to opening. It's a shame if they continue running the way they did last night!
