Wouldn't recommend when there are other places around the corner!

9.description: I dined here recently for the first time and loved it! We arrived during prime time and were told that the wait would be about thirty minutes but it was actually only about five minutes so we were stoked!  We ordered Florentine pizza w/ a couple of glasses of Chardonnay...My only complaint would be that the pizza was a little floppy and thus a little messy, it would have been better a little more crispier....other than everything was delicious, iur server was great, bartenders were fast and we made our movie on time! Can't wait to be back!

26.description: They are so hospitable here!  I never had a bad experience.  Yummy treats and drinks, also.  Give them a try!

25.description: The décor is quite lovely and contemporary with lovely accents of black among the red and gold. The view of the Chicago skyline was stunning... however, the bartender was a bit abrupt. It felt as though she was rushing us to order drinks when we hadn't been to the local before. Aside, from that bit. Lovely experience. :)

12.description: I'm a huge fan of this place.  Great drinks and a large drink menu complete with movie themed cocktails, wines, and champagne by the glass.  They have a selection of small plates, the food is okay, if a little over priced.  They get packed on Friday and Saturday nights as early as 6pm, but the service is efficient and friendly.  If you want to order food and get a table you should go at least an hour before your movie starts, if not more.

21.description: No pre-movie location needed when a lounge is included at the venue. Great idea on paper but in practice it was a failure.The the Florentine pizza had a great thin crust  with fresh ingredients and a unique tomato sauce. The bruschetta was compiled with warm toasty bread and a blend of garlic, fresh tomatoes, parmesan, all atop balsamic vinegar. All great except for the appetizer and pizza came out at the same time. Eh, I think as a server you can account for some lag time between the two. This is where things got off on the foot and the last time we saw our server for the next hour.Empty plates sat for a good half hour no one was to be found for a fresh drink. Tried asking bussers, and they replied "I'm not a server", and other wait staff were clueless. No help in that regard. We ended up flagging our server down for the check  and that concluded the shitty service giving us just a few minutes to get to the show. We debated walking out on the check to give you an idea of frustration from this Houdini act (which I have never done).I enjoyed the food and the drinks were reasonably priced. Disappointing when the service has to ruin it. I am sure its hit or miss on a Sunday evening but this was a clear miss.

17.description: This lounge is a very trendy and hip place to have a drink before your movie with your group. The hang up is becaue of the bar, no one under 21 allowed, which is understandable but any minors in your group will have to wait downstairs. There was quick seating the night we went. The bar food options look great! You wouldnt go out of your way to come hang out here, but do visit before or after your movie at ICON.

10.description: I had the best experience dining here after a movie this past Wednesday. I visit this theater frequently and usually have decent service, but this past Wednesday was exceptional. I recently became Vegan and there were no options on the menu other than a pickle/olive appetizer and chips and salsa. Not great. I mentioned I was Vegan to the bartender, Quinton, and he said he could have a Vegan pizza made. He explained what was in the pizza crust, and the veggie toppings he could add, minus the cheese. It was fantastic! Kudos to Quinton and his service. They should really think about formally adding this pizza to the menu! It's a healthier alternative that I'm sure people would enjoy. I came back today and a different bartender had no clue how to make it...informing all of the wait staff about this option until it is added. ;-)

5.description: The lobby lounge, theater is a great place to relax, have a drink before the movie starts. The bacon popcorn is to die for. The involvement is very safe , pleasant. People are very warm, friendly a must to do in Chicago.

3.description: I came up for a drink and grab a drink before meeting my girls to see a movie on a Wednesday evening. The bartender was extremely busy working alone serving drinks. I ordered a wine, not as easy and typical as a beer, but it took her a long time. She was very nice so I did feel bad, but for advertising the lobby lounge as a place to go before seeing a movie- they should hire more staff. I wanted to order a pizza but it would have taken 15-20 minutes so I went with an appetizer that took 10 minutes. I was starving- but I definately would not come here for dinner but only to meet with people for a drink if you have enough time to lounge. I don't know how it gets later through out the evening but instead of buying a 11 dollar glass of wine or an expensive cocktial- save the money and just get popcorn, nachos, or whatever when you go see a movie.

35.description: Eh. It was very chill and pricey. We didn't go watch a movie. We just wanted a place to hang out and grab drinks. The drinks were good. Weren't the best but they were just okay good. The atmosphere was kind of nice and plenty of TVs there if your eyes decide to wander around.My friends really enjoyed the Pumpkin Ice cream and caramel cake. I think it was called Caramel Pumpkin Bliss...? I could be wrong. The bacon popcorn was really interesting. All in all, it was okay.

19.description: So, they were having "technical difficulties" with our movie and we were unable to watch it but we got two comp tickets for the movie of our choice...an hour later. We were hungry and the ticket seller suggested we wait in the upstairs lounge. Well, this was no ordinary lounge, people. It's fawesome. The appetizer menu is a brief but sophisticated variety of upscale appetizers such as cheese and meat plates which boast assortments of Pecorino Romano, Gorgonzola Dolce, Dry Aged Prosciutto; an Antipasto plate that includes marinated olives, quince jam, toasted hazelnuts, dried fruits, and toasted currant bread. Obviously, this is no run-of-the-mill hot dog and nachos menu. For dinner, my date had the NY Strip Sliders, which were served elegantly on a rectangular sushi type plate. They were tasty but small; definitely more snack than dinner. I had the Basil Chicken Sandwich on Press Grilled Focaccia that came with homemade potato chips, which were crispy and heavenly. Atmosphere is everything: the seating is plush, the colors vivid, and the decor so posh, it doesn't feel like a movie theater lounge. It is a seriously cool and even trendy place with a stunning view. See my skyline picture attached.  It was an unexpected surprise. Turns out Jerry Kleiner, the famous Chicago restaurateur is behind the boutique-y concept. No wonder this place rocks!

28.description: If you find yourself watching a movie at the Showplace Icon (which you should, because the theater is shiny and big and there is free parking), then you should probably stop into the Lobby Lounge first.The decor is Jerry Kleiner, and I love a man who loves Damask wallpaper/prints. If I was uber wealthy, I would have a house with Damask wallpaper everywhere (seriously, that stuff is $$$). Pretty surroundings? Check.The service at the bar was great. We ordered a few drinks and bacon popcorn. Everyone sitting at the bar asked about my Double Agent shot (St. Germain + Effen cucumber) and then proceeded to order some for themselves. I was in a happy place... and then the bacon popcorn came out...Looking around at the bar, you'll see most patrons with little white bowls of snacks - maybe bacon popcorn, maybe marinated olives, maybe chips with caramelized onion dip. However, we were brought out this HUGE square take-out container of bacon popcorn and told "Sometimes I like to put it in here, because the small bowls just don't hold enough popcorn". Did I really only just pay $5 for a gallon on popcorn tossed with juicy pieces of bacon? (Nobody is skimping on anything in that kitchen). The guy must have honed in on my bacon popcorn eating skills because he gets mega bonus points for that move. My only suggestion? Maybe add a St. Germain cocktail to the menu. The Double Agent shot was nice, but I would have rather enjoyed a larger cocktail-sized drink of elderflower and whatnot. Bacon popcorn guy: I love you!

45.description: So, they were having "technical difficulties" with our movie and we were unable to watch it but we got two comp tickets for the movie of our choice...an hour later. We were hungry and the ticket seller suggested we wait in the upstairs lounge. Well, this was no ordinary lounge, people. It's fawesome. The appetizer menu is a brief but sophisticated variety of upscale appetizers such as cheese and meat plates which boast assortments of Pecorino Romano, Gorgonzola Dolce, Dry Aged Prosciutto; an Antipasto plate that includes marinated olives, quince jam, toasted hazelnuts, dried fruits, and toasted currant bread. Obviously, this is no run-of-the-mill hot dog and nachos menu. For dinner, my date had the NY Strip Sliders, which were served elegantly on a rectangular sushi type plate. They were tasty but small; definitely more snack than dinner. I had the Basil Chicken Sandwich on Press Grilled Focaccia that came with homemade potato chips, which were crispy and heavenly. Atmosphere is everything: the seating is plush, the colors vivid, and the decor so posh, it doesn't feel like a movie theater lounge. It is a seriously cool and even trendy place with a stunning view. See my skyline picture attached.  It was an unexpected surprise. Turns out Jerry Kleiner, the famous Chicago restaurateur is behind the boutique-y concept. No wonder this place rocks!

33.description: Mom's birthday lunch at the Lobby Lounge?  Why not!It's kinda fancy that the restaurant is completely separated from the theater level.  Nothing like feeling '"exclusive" or whatever.  Seating is pretty ample (tables throughout the restaurant, seating at the bar), so I don't picture this place ever getting overly crowded.  The awesome hostess sat us by the window, which was probably the best thing ever as my dad became enamored with the view of the train tracks.  Food here is surprisingly delicious and semi-upscale.  Instead of your mainstream burgers and pizza, they have things like sirloin sliders and prosciutto pizza w/ pears.  I decided to go with the chicken panini (chicken, pesto, artichokes, red peppers and cheese) on this AMAZING olive oil bread.  It was fabulous (albeit a little pricey at $10).  The sandwiches come with their homemade chips - which was probably one of the highlights of the meal.  Definitely order the chips and sour cream and caramelized onion dip - it's addicting!   The staff here are very friendly and accommodating!  They gave us a list of all the movie times AND informed us that they could wrap up any/all of our food if we wanted to eat it in the theater.  Enjoyable experience if you're looking for something different before heading to your movie.  Oh, and shoutout to that amazing hostess I mentioned earlier.  Why?  She carded my sister and me!  Wonderful!

43.description: The first few times I went, I really enjoyed the food, drinks, and atmosphere.  However, the service has gotten terrible. I have waited for servers, barely gotten food before our movie, and have had my order goofed up where I missed the start of the movie and got cold food. Now the last two times we went there, we learned that they only open at 3:00 on weekdays so we were unable to eat lunch. Then we tried going at 1:00 on a Saturday (they open at noon on weekends) yet they were closed to clean up after a special event. There was no sign saying they were closed or anything.  Now I just called to confirm whether or not they are actually open, and the rude response was "we open at noon on Sundays." Well as I have, learned your actual hours of business are not consistent. After such a string of crappy service and food, I will not be going there again.

2.description: Convenience. convenience, convenience. The bacon popcorn was BEYOND salty.  (This from a lady who salts everything). My tongue shriveled back into my mouth from the pound of salt they put in it. I also had cosmos which were dark red and super sweet. (Way too much cranberry and lime juice). But who are we kidding, no one is coming here for perfect cocktails. This place serves  adequately priced drinks and food you'd expect from a joint in a theatre.  Way dated decor...all black and red.

18.description: The management is consistently top notch. I've always walked away feeling satisfied even when servers have been spotty.

41.description: Let me start by saying that the ambiance and concept of the Lobby Lounge is amazing. Wonderful setting for drinks and light fare after work or late evening, with or without a movie. It will be even better after all of the S&TC girlz nights have been completed. Although, I went for one of these and it was a blast. I had a cocktail while waiting for me girlz to show up and then we went to the theater. They announce your show in the lounge so you won't have to miss it and since seats are assigned, no need to rush!! GREAT IDEA. The place however leaves little to be desired by seasoned lounge professionals such as myself. We've been doing the Chicago Scene for a long time and just don't get impressed when we see contemporary furniture, flat screen TVs and fancy drinks. The drinks were slightly over priced. In the Lounge they offered specialty Sex & The City cocktails made with Moet Champagne for a decent price of $12. They offered Prosecco for $6. Outside of our theater where they had set up a makeshift bar for our noted 'convenience' the same specialty drinks were being made in a plastic cup with Prosecco (NOT Moet) for $1 more. Guess they think we're really dumb. I guess so because we bought them, against my better judgment. After the show, we went into the Lobby Lounge for food and drinks, we were seated after a short wait and the food was OK. Pizza's were bland and the mini burgers were basic. The fried potato chips were great from what I was told. The most unappealing event of the evening is the catastrophe in order to bring a very small 6inch cake in for a friend. As this was our first time dining here, we were not aware there was a $20 cutting fee. I asked them to store my cake during the film. Afterward, I pleaded to give me my cake and they would not allow us to have our cake because there's a cutting fee and they have their own cake. Warning... do not bring a cake there. I completely understand a cutting fee for a large cake but the little cake I brought in was so tiny that we could cut if ourselves with a butter knife. Not even a big deal. This pretentious attitude turned us ALL off. We'd rather go to a restaurant that costs much more and be treated much better. The "manager" Mario even came out to watch over us so that we did not eat our cake in his restaurant. Pathetic. New venues tend to rise and fall in this city and it's usually because they are not run with the customer in mind. They want to get as many people in and bamboozle them with overpriced crap that when people finally realize they've been fooled they stop going and the place usually falls off rapidly. Note to Mario: take care of your customers and they will take care of you! Allow them the opportunity to have their little cake and inform them of your policy as well as the awesome cake you have to offer and guarantee that they will return the next time they need cake and overpriced drinks! I can say that not anyone in our party of 10 people are itching to run back to the Lobby Lounge anytime soon after that experience.

4.description: Piss poor service worse than a shitty dive. First it took awhile for anyone to acknowledge me while they had a group discussion about some shit and a manager type asked if I was being helped after looking at me a couple times. Nope.. I'm just sitting at the bar for kicks. That's all. I finally got my drink order in and the bartender asked if I'd like any water also.. I said yes please. I had to hold back not saying out loud to her: so is my water ever going to come that you asked if I wanted? It never came. Never. Why bother asking me if you're not going to give me any ya dummy? Waste of my fucking breath. Check please, I'm done. Fucking atrocious. NEXT.

6.description: Great service from bartender Arianna!! Super happy super fast and quick funny conversation while I had to wait an hour and fifteen minutes for my movie to start because it my first time option was sold out . But so happy they have this spot in the theater adults only and convenient for people like me who get there to early and have to wait around. ... but now I can wait at the bar yahoo  win win!!!

22.description: Excellent lounge. The food is not so great. My friends and I ordered food and 75% of our meals were deep fried. The drinks are really good though. They are small, expensive, but pack a punch. Just beware. You can dump a lot of cash there. 4 of us dumped $200 in an hour.

15.description: Mom's birthday lunch at the Lobby Lounge?  Why not!It's kinda fancy that the restaurant is completely separated from the theater level.  Nothing like feeling '"exclusive" or whatever.  Seating is pretty ample (tables throughout the restaurant, seating at the bar), so I don't picture this place ever getting overly crowded.  The awesome hostess sat us by the window, which was probably the best thing ever as my dad became enamored with the view of the train tracks.  Food here is surprisingly delicious and semi-upscale.  Instead of your mainstream burgers and pizza, they have things like sirloin sliders and prosciutto pizza w/ pears.  I decided to go with the chicken panini (chicken, pesto, artichokes, red peppers and cheese) on this AMAZING olive oil bread.  It was fabulous (albeit a little pricey at $10).  The sandwiches come with their homemade chips - which was probably one of the highlights of the meal.  Definitely order the chips and sour cream and caramelized onion dip - it's addicting!   The staff here are very friendly and accommodating!  They gave us a list of all the movie times AND informed us that they could wrap up any/all of our food if we wanted to eat it in the theater.  Enjoyable experience if you're looking for something different before heading to your movie.  Oh, and shoutout to that amazing hostess I mentioned earlier.  Why?  She carded my sister and me!  Wonderful!

20.description: oh god where do I begin. Im only giving 1 star because it is the minimum number of stars we can give.First of all, the servers are clueless and somewhat rude.It took long for me to get my order and it wasnt even busy. The bartender (Adriana believe) seemed very angry and not welcoming. The food is extremely overpriced for what you get! Ordered some chips w buffalo chicken. The chips were stale and the chicken was cold.  When i complained to the manger who looked like Screech from Saved by the Bell. She seemed very nonchalant about the issue and walked to the back room.The bathroom line was sooooo long. I waited at least 15 minutes. Definitely not returning here. This is only the restaurant, the theater itself isnt much better.

36.description: My date and I stopped into Lobby lounge for some pre-movie noms and cocktails. We split a Pizza Marguerite.  It was nice, but I would have loved for it to be heavier on the basil. I had a cocktail that was actually super strong and I was a bit buzzed by the time we left.  Things are a bit on the pricier side of things so we really just snacked. The menu is more set up for snacking anyway and the meat and cheese trays looked nice, for future reference. I also came to a CMYE event here a while back and can say that the cookie skillet thing is pretty friggin amazing. Last but not least, our waiter was a dear and took pretty good care of us.

14.description: While I do enjoy being able to kick back a glass of wine before a show...the Lobby Lounge just doesn't do it for me. 1. The crowd is. Um. Just, um. Sort of a weird mix of older frat boys, groups of giggly girls from the 'burbs, mom and dad on date night, and the occasional thug. It's strange. Luckily, it's at least all 21+...they card you at the entrance. 2. Having said that...it's packed on the weekends. So, apparently the niche is a good one, and people want to get sauced before taking in a flick. The key here is, there is NOWHERE else to go even close walking distance to this place. IN the winter, that means...it fills up quickly. 3. The decor is "oh-so-Jerry-Kleiner." And while that probably kicked ass in 1995, I'm not feeling it so much in 2011. It's red and black and trendy all over and I'm sure the suburbanites think its super hip to the tilt. I think it gauche and played out. OOooo, black and white photos of movie stars!? How creative! No. 4. Service is increasingly spotty. And, if you are attending a VIP showing of a movie, the entrances are up here through the Lobby Lounge. Great, except VIP means move your own damn drinks into the theater. I don't find this to be a very smooth transition. Super awkward for the price one is paying to be "VIP" and have the luxury of buying one's own drinks and moving them when the movie starts, and then trekking back to the bar to order more if that is desired. What is VIP about that!? Methinks not much. No service included in a steeeeeeep price? Um, fail. Especially when the regular tickets afford very nice cushy seats. I prefer Diet Coke with my movies anyhow. So there's the skinny...it's fine, and in a pinch it's OK for a drink, but I wouldn't make it a destination, nor do I think it's anything super-duper-special. It's fine. They serve booze and people go there before/after the movies because our winters are hellish, and people drown their sorrows before having to walk out and face the cold. Or large Hollywood movies. I can't decide what's been worse lately!

58.description: Met one of Sweetie's oldest friends here for brunch while we were in town.  Parking is crazy, of course, but you can find it in lots or on the street nearby for reasonable rates.  We came at 1pm on Sunday and there was no wait, though they were pretty full.The place is very nice and bright inside, and there is some outdoor seating.  Service was great, start to finish. Prices are good for what you get.Sweetie had an egg white omelet and enjoyed it.  Her friend had a jalapeno chorizo scramble; I tried it and it was excellent.  I had one of the specials, short rib hash.  The meat was incredible- tender, savory, perfectly done.  The veggies and potatoes were very good, and everything meshed well.  Toast on the side was good, and there is a little tray with butter and other toppings for bread.I would come back in a heartbeat.

56.description: Meli is the place to go if you want good food and horrible service. We've been going here every weekend for brunch since they opened. Over the last few months the service has gotten so horrible that I actually dread brunch. The staff is completely inattentive to their tables and make what could be an efficient easy breakfast into a drawn out affair. Want a refill on your coffee, fat chance. Want to get your check from your server, have fun waiting 20 minutes to even find your waitress to request it. Finally got your check and want to pay, that will be another 15 minutes until you can get your waitress to run your card. It doesn't matter if Meli is full or you are the only one there, the service is ALWAYS terrible. We will be finding another place for our weekend brunches until they get their act together.

29.description: Love this place sooo much. Bfast anytime with lots of veggies and fantastic fruit-veggie juices/smoothies or alcohol, depending on the day. With convenient hours starting at 5am!!

42.description: Food is good and the venue has a modern and open ambience.  The hostess does not smile, mind you.  But our table attendant was efficient and soft spoken.

23.description: Another divine brunch this morning with a friend here.  I ordered the salsa stacker today, which was delicious.  It had an English muffin topped with tofu, zucchini, red peppers, salsa, and avocados.  The serving was plentiful and filling, and it was decently priced.  I highly recommend this restaurant, especially for brunch.

47.description: The food was fantastic, however I have only been there for breakfast and brunch. I highly recommend any of the Benedict options. My favorite is Hash Benedict followed by the Cafe Benedict. The reason I am giving the place 3 stars is because the service is a hit or miss. Slow refills is the common problem I encounter.

8.description: Another divine brunch this morning with a friend here.  I ordered the salsa stacker today, which was delicious.  It had an English muffin topped with tofu, zucchini, red peppers, salsa, and avocados.  The serving was plentiful and filling, and it was decently priced.  I highly recommend this restaurant, especially for brunch.

31.description: This is a cute little place that was next to my hotel.  I didn't know they were connected until after I walked out and down the block and saw I could have easily gone through the lobby.  For a brunch time Saturday, they were relatively busy but I easily found seating at the bar.  The staff were attentive while busy preparing others drink orders - which looked quite tasty!!  They checked in without constantly asking me if I needed anything.  I was entertained as they made different kinds of cocktails and smoothies - the things people request!!I ordered the breakfast quesadilla and it was AMAZING!!!  The plate was as big as my head and there was no way I could have finished it - a full quesadilla with a side of chopped red potatoes.  However, I did make many attempts.  Everything was seasonly perfectly which made it hard to stop eating - it was just that good.  I would highly recommend this spot to folks looking for a lively, open, airy spot for themselves or for a few of your friends.

34.description: Amazing food, coffee, jam, juice. Terrible service. It was was almost entertaining. Waitress asked us for a pen, forgot numerous items, etc.

16.description: I believe this is the third Meli location that I have been to, and it's been very consistent. This location is a bit trendier and more contemporary since it is downtown. The food is delish. I got the Meli salad and it was better than I thought it would be. It was slightly deceptive because the presentation gave me the impression that I might not be full, but that was not the case at all. Service was a little slow, but eventually we got the check.

13.description: We went there on a Sunday morning! We didn't have to wait much, for 5 mins which was great.The restaurant is so classy, fancy. Loved the decoration, the atmosphere. People were high-class. The food was great especially the omelette. The crepe was not as expected, we ordered the chocolate infused crepe with strawberry, it wasn't that good I would give it 5/10. I had a way better ones in a cheaper places.Pricing wise, I can tell you that it's a bit over priced. It's on the high end of pricing. You should expect to pay 20 - 25 $ per person for breakfast . The coffee was normal, not superb. The mimosa was great thought to be fair. Overall, it was a good pleasant experience, I would definitely come back.

11.description: Not only is this place gorgeous, the food is amazing too!  I had the banana bread french toast and my wife had the jalapeno bowl.  I could barely put my drink down before she had finished half of her dish.  Banana bread french toast was amazing, and the drinks were too. Definitely coming back!

39.description: This place is amazing! Ari, is amazing and we ate here 6 times, lunch, breakfast, and late dinner, all with excellent service, consistently spot on food, and bar drinks including said pressed juices at a discounted price compared to hipster shitholes. Relatively stuck up clown free, and the eastern european waitresses make the place a fresh of unpretentious deliciousness, boo to the hipster American clowns who gave this place bad reviews for service, go eat at Ihop you suburb creatures!

37.description: The first impression I had when visiting was: Wow, this place is gorgeous.  The interior design was very modern and welcoming for a morning brunch.  The first time I visited I ordered the café benedict which both looked and tasted good.  The second time I ordered a do-sant sandwich and a kiwi juice, both of which were delicious.  Both times the service was fine, no complaints there.  Meli Café is a little pricey compared to most other brunch places but overall I still recommend it to those willing to pay a little extra for a quality brunch.

0.description: Great brunch menu! I ordered Cafe Eggs Benedict and it was delicious. It does have pork belly in it so you have to OK with pork. Pork had good flavor and hollandaise sauce was the perfect consistency and flavor. It came with red potatoes, which were well seasoned and tasteful. They MAKE THEIR OWN KETCHUP! Which I thought was pretty cool and delicious. My friends ordered the Brioche French Toast and Farmers Bowl, which both looked and tasted amazing as well. Overall, great place to eat if you're looking for a nicer brunch. It was a little pricey ($13-15/meal) and the alcoholic beverages seemed extravagant when it came to the pricing as well for a small glass; nonetheless, you wouldn't just go here for the alcohol, but their food!

38.description: Just saw this place around the corner and looked good so decided to try. Everything was ok, the eggs, potato's. The sausage was really good. But the pancakes are a no go. So if you go, just don't order pancakes!

51.description: My fiancee and I went to Meli Cafe a few weeks ago, looking to watch the NBA finals and have a burger and drink at the bar. The staff were friendly and invited us to come in, but despite having almost no customers it took a long time to find someone to change the channel, and take our order. We each ordered a burger, me the turkey burger with jalapeno coleslaw and my fiancee a beef burger with fries. The burgers were fine but a bit messy, the only problem being that the tomatoes in mine were decidedly mealy which I think should have been evident to an experienced cook. My slaw had no discernible jalapeno, and my fiancee's fries were soggy and oily and we couldn't bring ourselves to do more than try a few before abandoning them. Also challenging was that the plates were narrow ovals each covered with a much larger swath of wax paper. Because they weren't sized or fit together, food or ketchup on the paper would start to drift off the plate and start dribbling on the counter.On the way in, the dessert case had several options that looked good, and we ordered carrot cake and coffee. The carrot cake really was delicious, but they only brought one fork even though we ordered just one dessert between the two of us and specifically mentioned that we were looking to share it. It took a while for the dessert to arrive although it wasn't clear why, given the lack of crowd and the fact that it was coming from the case at the end of the bar. We waited to start eating the dessert until the coffee arrived, but when the bar attendant returned several minutes after bringing the carrot cake, she didn't have any coffee. When we asked her about it, she apologized and mentioned that she simply forgotten the order. She then poured it from the station that was right next to where she was standing when we ordered it the first time.Other things we noticed when we compared notes afterward were that the dessert menu didn't mention many of the items in the dessert case in front, and the chalkboard specials menu had a few misspellings. To be clear, the hostess and staff at the bar were extremely friendly and polite, but the experience accumulated a lot of disappointments that could have been helped by better management and better attention to detail. Given our experience, we were honestly surprised at the many positive reviews it has on Yelp (but at not the spotty service) but perhaps Meli is stronger with brunch, or sometimes its kitchen isn't on its A game.

27.description: A little gem in Printer's Row, where brunch options are still sparse.  Although the space is small, there are rarely the sort of lines that you'll encounter on a weekend morning at the original Greektown location.  Unfortunately, unlike the Greektown location, the "homemade" jams don't appear homemade and seem to be limited to strawberry and strawberry.  The chicken and waffles is generally a treat worth the calorie splurge...  perfectly seasoned and sometimes-crispy fried chicken pieces (boneless tenders, not actual legs or wings) with bacon maple syrup and herbed waffles.  Solid strawberry french toast for those who prefer dessert for breakfast.  Eggs are well-done whether the request is for sunny side up, over easy or over medium.The service isn't overly friendly, but it's not unfriendly and it's very accommodating.  You'd prefer your french toast stuffed?  No problem.  You'd prefer feta to mozzarella?  Done.  You want your cappuccino with 2%?  We'll mix whole and skim for you.

32.description: A tip to ALL hostesses, please before you seat someone make sure there's someone servicing the table.  There were at least 5+ waitresses walking around. I was alone waited 10min even after 2 parties came in after me was seated, waited on & given coffee. I watched now I'm irritated. But at least I got a glass if water from the busser. I flagged him down to get the manager. I got the attention of the manager. Finally the waitress NOT MINE waits on me. I ordered they got that wrong. In my head "since I don't have a waitress I guess no one will bring me a bill". Or " maybe i should flag down the bussers they're always attentive & around" LOL I'm trying to make light of the situation & not destroy my bksft experience. At the end still never knew who my waitress was. YES my meal was comp but the SERVICE IS JUST AS IMPORTANT AS THE MEAL....

54.description: Absolutely excellent!Get the Athenian steak, it's great!Love the place. Great service and an amazing ambiance!

48.description: Went with a group of friends for brunch and really enjoyed the place and food was very good. Came highly recommended and met the expectations. Had the avocado toast. Was good but maybe a little less chili flakes next time. Will be coming back for brunch again to try some of the other items.

44.description: This place has the best breakfast menu- my husband described their scrambled eggs as "little buttery clouds of heaven". Everything I tried was delicious. We were in town for four days and this was the meal of the day- one day we strayed..wish we went back to Meli cafe!

24.description: Cute spot in Printers Row. Popped in on a Saturday around the lunch hour, and it was surprisingly crowded. My Dad and I sat at the bar and enjoyed a cup of coffee. Ambience was nice and even though it was crowded, we were able to chat without yelling. The hostess and Bartender were very nice!

7.description: The Eggs Benedict were fantastic.Ample seating, nice atmosphere. It's close to where I live definitely coming back!

49.description: I'm giving them a 3 for extremely slow service and no smiles.  Food is great.  I had one of their egg breakfasts with bacon, toast and potstoes.  So delish and well seasoned.  I highly recommend this restaurant despite poor service.  They would get 5 stars from me if their service improved greatly.

40.description: Delicious food! Good service. Will return, fo' sho'Falafel and beer. Who could ask for more?

53.description: Meli was an amazing brunch experience. I came on a weekday and we were seated almost immediately. The flavors are very unique and I would definitely come back.I ordered the Banana Bread French Toast. It was fantastic, heavy as you would expect, but I did wish that there was a little more nuttiness as well as crisp on the edges. But I would highly recommend this dish as one to share, very unique.The Pork Belly Benedict was also great. Flavors were better than the banana bread in my opinion. Egg was cooked perfectly.Our service was good and the food what we expected.

30.description: Meli isn't amazing but it's reliable and nice. Pleasant lunch or breakfast place. I've had some hilarious staff interactions, and some weird service experiences, but overall Meli gets the job done.

46.description: I go here in a pinch or if it's on my way. The servers always seem a bit inconvenienced, or ready to finish shift, or anxious to close up. And one or two don't know the menu and get orders wrong. They seem to work hard to shoo customers out around 9-10. So kinda mixed bag. The food's good, but ultimately this place could be so much better but seems to be mismanaged and staffed in a really strange way.

1.description: Came here on Valentine's Day so a bit of a wait was given but we were seated after around like 30 minutes, which we didn't mind at all. The seating is quite tight and the tables are a bit small, so don't expect a great deal of privacy. My boyfriend and I ordered the Artichoke Benedict off the Daily Specials menu and the Yuppie Breakfast bowl. Both of the dishes were just okay, nothing surprisingly delicious and would make me want to come back. The Artichoke was tender and the potatoes were tasty but you can't really go wrong with roasted potatoes. The Yuppie Breakfast Bowl had kale, mushrooms, and chicken sausage slices, but still lacked seasoning. Our server was very inattentive and not very friendly. Not once did we see a smile. You would think that on such a busy holiday, they would want to get customers in and out as quickly as possible, but we had to flag her down for everything in order to get what we wanted.

55.description: I came here for breakfast before heading to work, and I had a delicious meal. I got the salmon crepes which were delicious. The portions were huge! I had another meal for the next day's breakfast as well. I love the decor.

9.description: Eh, this place was ok. We came for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 9 and had no problem getting a table. We sat at the bar. The food was pretty good--- i got the avocado toast and the husband got the breakfast tacos. Portions were HUGE. Almost laughable really.... But it wasn't cheap so I guess it's nice that you get a lot of food. Tab for us was about 40 between two coffees and food. My main issue with this place was the service. Zero smiles, zero small talk, very little interaction with the woman behind the bar besides "are you ready to order" and "can we get the check".  I would give her a pass if she was slammed but the place wasn't very crowded. The other servers seemed to have the same attitude, a little robotic. The place felt a little sterile to be honest. So if you're in the neighborhood--- decent food but don't expect much in the way of service. Id probably wait at wildberry.

26.description: Eh, this place was ok. We came for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 9 and had no problem getting a table. We sat at the bar. The food was pretty good--- i got the avocado toast and the husband got the breakfast tacos. Portions were HUGE. Almost laughable really.... But it wasn't cheap so I guess it's nice that you get a lot of food. Tab for us was about 40 between two coffees and food. My main issue with this place was the service. Zero smiles, zero small talk, very little interaction with the woman behind the bar besides "are you ready to order" and "can we get the check".  I would give her a pass if she was slammed but the place wasn't very crowded. The other servers seemed to have the same attitude, a little robotic. The place felt a little sterile to be honest. So if you're in the neighborhood--- decent food but don't expect much in the way of service. Id probably wait at wildberry.

25.description: Love the place, love the food, ambiance, love the vegan and vegetarian options! The only thing that you should really focus on improving is SERVICE!!! We've been there 4 times now, and we always get waitresses with no service attitude, that you literally need to interrupt their chatting to call their attention.

12.description: I've been here several times and have really enjoyed this place.  Huge portions at fair prices with a ton of variety!  What more could you want?  (I suppose the service could be a bit better, but I haven't had any huge issues other than inattentive servers).  In any event, try the caprese wrap!

59.description: I had one of the worst service experiences of my life last week. We had a party of six with my very hungry 3-year-old nephew and were told the wait would be 20 minutes. It ended up being about 55, only after checking in three times and told it would only be another 5 minutes, and when I finally asked at the 55 minute mark, I saw that our name had been crossed off the waiting list. The hostess seemed to have no idea that she had done anything wrong, so the manager scrambled to find us a table. When we were finally seated, we ordered drinks and food. Drinks for four people came, but two of our party never received theirs. When the food came, we asked about the drinks for the other two people, and our waitress got defensive and said they were very busy at the bar and said there was nothing we could do about it. Only once we were halfway through our lunch did their drinks finally come. My mother's food was cold but didn't say anything to the waitress because of the waitress's poor attitude. Other than that, the food itself was pretty good, but we were all in horrible moods by then that it did little to save the meal. It's a shame, because the Meli Cafe in Greektown is one of my favorite breakfast places in Chicago, and I've never experienced this kind of horrible service at that location. Please bring the same quality of service to the Dearborn location!

21.description: Food - Food was awesome, I got the jalapeño bowl which was chorizo with eggs, jalapenos, onions, pepper jack cheese. The food was full of flavor and spicy. Toast had a sweet taste which made the food more enjoyable.Service - Our waitress was unhappy from the moment we saw her. She was short and cocked a bit of an attitude. It seems the general feel from anyone working here is unhappy, and it really kills the vibe and atmosphere.Timeliness - Whether our waitress forgot to place the order for waffles, or they were just that slow, one of my friends received her waffles as I finished my Jalapeño bowl. It took about 30 minutes for them to get the waffles out and there was no genuine apology or any kind of compensation.Atmosphere - Really the typical modern feel, not anything spectacularOverall - I really liked the food but I will not be coming back here again and will discourage people in the future. The service was bad enough for me to not even want to bother. There are so many brunch places in the South Loop area and they have all been very friendly and nice even if the food was sub-par. I would stick to those.Service - 0/2Food - 2/2Atmosphere - 0/1

17.description: Meli was an amazing brunch experience. I came on a weekday and we were seated almost immediately. The flavors are very unique and I would definitely come back.I ordered the Banana Bread French Toast. It was fantastic, heavy as you would expect, but I did wish that there was a little more nuttiness as well as crisp on the edges. But I would highly recommend this dish as one to share, very unique.The Pork Belly Benedict was also great. Flavors were better than the banana bread in my opinion. Egg was cooked perfectly.Our service was good and the food what we expected.

10.description: Love this place... for the most part. They serve breakfast almost at anytime. Their fresh juices are also great!! This place is the ultimate Hangover cure. Be sure to try their Bloody Mary bar. 8 different bloody Mary's. My favorite is the cucumber one.Only negative thing is the music is so weird. Like a mix mash of odd sounds & very hard house music at time. Not at all what I want to hear when eating breakfast. Come for the food & drinks but bring ear muffs if u can.

5.description: Had a great time with my 9yr old daughter. Only giving it 4 stars because we were seated near the entrance and every time the door was open a very cold breeze would rudely enter. Chicago weather on this particular Saturday was 5°F not including wind chill.

3.description: Came here when a bunch of my college friends were in town and while the food was good the poor service knocks this place down to 2 stars.It took about 15 minutes after we were seated for our waitress to come over to take our drink orders. It took another 15-20 minutes for us to get our drinks and when the Bloody Mary's came to the table the busser had no idea which Bloody Mary was which, so my friends and I had to spend time investigating the contents of each drink to determine which belong to whom. The same thing happened when our food was delivered to our table. We had three orders of French Toast and two looked damn near identical. When we asked which was which the busser gave us the "how the hell should I know look" and said she didn't know. You would think that someone delivering food to a table of 9  would know what dish was what so that the correct person could get the food they had ordered.In terms of the food, 90% of us enjoyed what we had ordered. I probably won't come here again because of the service. I didn't like having to spend 11,000 seconds trying to figure out which dish was which because the people working here couldn't help us figure it out.Food we had*Chicken and Waffles - the chicken was juicy and crispy. *Breakfast Tacos - must try. So good and filling.*Elvis French Toast - hated it. I am not a fan of peanut butter unless there's jelly so I don't know why I got this. My own fault.*Cookie French Toast - this was a special menu item and it was delicious. *Cornbread French Toast - this was a special menu item and my friend said it was good, but there was a little too much corn for her liking.

35.description: Environment, layout, interior design was pretty nice. Waitress wasn't very nice. The french toast didn't have any taste of egg on it. If you like that, then I guess that woudn't be a deterrent for you. Prices for food ranged mostly from $10-$14.. which is alright given the area. It wasn't a terrible experience, but I wouldn't go back. If you're in the loop, Wildberry is better.

19.description: I've eaten at Meli Cafe a few times. It's usually packed on Sundays, but the service is still good. It's breakfast food / brunch mostly and yes it's a little higher than the average brunch place, but it does taste a bit better. The portion sizes are definitely American sized. Two people can share an omelette and potatoes and leave very full. They also offer a wider variety of choices and their overall presentation of your food or drink will add to the experience. Mimosas - yum!

28.description: I believe this is the third Meli location that I have been to, and it's been very consistent. This location is a bit trendier and more contemporary since it is downtown. The food is delish. I got the Meli salad and it was better than I thought it would be. It was slightly deceptive because the presentation gave me the impression that I might not be full, but that was not the case at all. Service was a little slow, but eventually we got the check.

45.description: The service was....weird. I can't tell if my waitress was angry or confused. I paid 12 bucks for a french toast that tasted like cardboard and then 5 dollars for a side of two eggs. I went with a party of 6 and the payment process was super weird. They gave us each a check for our plate but then said they could only take 4 cards. It was all just very weird and uncomfortable. I could have paid 8 bucks for a better tasting breakfast anywhere else!

33.description: This is a great casual spot for brunch, lunch, or even dinner. The menu is extensive, the ambiance is cute (think "upscale trendy diner", LOL), and the food is fabulous. I am a sucker for breakfast food and am a huge fan of the cinnamon apple crepes. The lunch items look great, too, especially the fries. Service is efficient and friendly, though maybe a tad disorganized (multiple servers were assigned to our table, causing some confusion for everyone). Prices are higher than the average diner but you get what you pay for in terms of quality and generous portion size. I highly recommend.

43.description: It's nothing great but you get tons of food for the price. The wraps and smoothie was good. Our waiter wasn't to friendly and barely saw her. I would pass on this restaurant and go somewhere cheaper. But if you want smoothies this is place to go.

2.description: Wahhhhh, how have I not reviewed this place yet? I guess it's easy to forget since I have reviewed their original location over in Greektown, but this location is my go-to spot now since it's much closer to home. For visitors to Printer's Row, it might be hard to find parking, but at least it's close to the 22 and Harrison Red Line.Much like the other location, it's all about the brunch specials here (never been here for lunch or dinner, though I should try it). Now I know it's kind of common knowledge that you should avoid specials on menus since that's how some places get rid of surplus ingredients. Here though, the specials change daily and really tend to stand out. And even if none of the specials stand out to you, you can't go wrong with one of their cheesy breakfast bowls.While the tables are a bit on the small side, you can't beat the decor or the large windows. It's weird that they've converted a former fancy hotel restaurant into a brunch spot, but it really works well. It seems like a super fancy place, but it's really just a great casual location of my still reigning champ of breakfast foods.

18.description: Met one of Sweetie's oldest friends here for brunch while we were in town.  Parking is crazy, of course, but you can find it in lots or on the street nearby for reasonable rates.  We came at 1pm on Sunday and there was no wait, though they were pretty full.The place is very nice and bright inside, and there is some outdoor seating.  Service was great, start to finish. Prices are good for what you get.Sweetie had an egg white omelet and enjoyed it.  Her friend had a jalapeno chorizo scramble; I tried it and it was excellent.  I had one of the specials, short rib hash.  The meat was incredible- tender, savory, perfectly done.  The veggies and potatoes were very good, and everything meshed well.  Toast on the side was good, and there is a little tray with butter and other toppings for bread.I would come back in a heartbeat.

41.description: The food here was fairly good, but the service was so unacceptable the food was ruined: Asked for warmed skim milk with coffee, which came cold five minutes after the coffee which was barely warm to start with. Served scrambled eggs were cold. Informing the waitress, she offered to microwave the dish. My sister sat with barely touched cold coffee and cold eggs, which was of no interest to the staff. I guess there's always more tourists. Maybe the second time in my longish life that I tipped 10%

52.description: Delicious food. TERRIBLE service. Their juices and smoothies are terrific and their crepes and french toast were great! But the waitress was horrible! She left before taking our whole parties drink orders and rolled her eyes and corrected me when I misspoke and said "berry crepe" instead of "mixed berry crepe." She was rude in all interactions and overall made the dining experience unpleasant.Would recommend the food if you didn't have to deal with the people.

50.description: Tried this place for the first time yesterday as I just moved to the South Loop/Printer's Row area. Huge menu with lots of options for everyone, including vegetarians (went with my sister and she does not eat meat). I have the chorizo jalapeno breakfast bowl which was delicious. A little pricey at $15 but turned out to be a huge serving. Mimosa was good but expensive as well at $10. Food was brought out quickly but ended up waiting for the waitress for 10-15 min to get a check and then another 10 minutes for them to pick it up which is the reason I knocked it down a star. It wasn't busy at all (noon on a weekday) so no excuse for slow service.

4.description: yummy yummy yummy chicken and waffles! This is the first place I've been that actually seasons and puts BACON into the waffles. YES, I SAID BACON! WHOA! The chicken is always fried to perfection. Living in miami, there are really no good chicken and waffles places. I remember looking forward to my trips to chicago for this little piece of food heaven.

6.description: I really enjoyed breakfast here.  I ordered the breakfast tacos - Warm corn tortillas, eggs, chicken chorizo, cilantro, pepper jack, pico de gallo, chipotle aioli. Served with baby reds.  Loved everything about this meal.  The flavors worked really well together, portions were good and would order this again and again.  My mimosa was really good too.  My son got chocolate chip pancakes and he liked them.  He really didn't like his fresh squeezed apple juice though.  His still-developing palate is used to Mott's.  This was very thick and unfiltered juice.  I drank it on his behalf.  It was ok.  Can't wait to come back!

22.description: Meli cafe is trash. I live around the corner so I've given it a few chances. The first time was disappointing, second time disappointing, third time -disaster. Their food is mediocre at best but way over priced. The last time I even bothered to give this tourist trap establishment my money, it was because my parents were in town and all other breakfast restaurants had hour and a half long waits while Meli only had a 30 minute wait. So we go and we get on the list and we see other families of three get on the list behind it. Of course 3 other families get seated before us of the same number. At this point I'm getting heated so I go in and ask about our position on the list and the hostess looks flustered and says "you should be next" as if she noticed the mistake. So we get seated in the next few minutes and we're put next the loudest table of couples you could imagine. Ordered coffee, never got coffee. Ordered eggs Benedict, the dish was poorly seasoned. It took forever to get our check but when we did, we were out of there.The only thing that Meli does right is when you order you a specific way, your food will come that way. Like my dad is on a strict diet so when he asked for an omelet cooked with no oil and no roasted red peppers. He got that. Cool, if you actually read this whole review, I suggest you not go here and go anywhere else like Le Pain Quotidien (upscale good food) or even Toast (lower scale better price for the quality) is better than this trash.

15.description: Food - Food was awesome, I got the jalapeño bowl which was chorizo with eggs, jalapenos, onions, pepper jack cheese. The food was full of flavor and spicy. Toast had a sweet taste which made the food more enjoyable.Service - Our waitress was unhappy from the moment we saw her. She was short and cocked a bit of an attitude. It seems the general feel from anyone working here is unhappy, and it really kills the vibe and atmosphere.Timeliness - Whether our waitress forgot to place the order for waffles, or they were just that slow, one of my friends received her waffles as I finished my Jalapeño bowl. It took about 30 minutes for them to get the waffles out and there was no genuine apology or any kind of compensation.Atmosphere - Really the typical modern feel, not anything spectacularOverall - I really liked the food but I will not be coming back here again and will discourage people in the future. The service was bad enough for me to not even want to bother. There are so many brunch places in the South Loop area and they have all been very friendly and nice even if the food was sub-par. I would stick to those.Service - 0/2Food - 2/2Atmosphere - 0/1

57.description: Best Pork Belly around!

20.description: The food was delicious! Try the cornbread French toast for sure! The only disappointing factor were the mimosas. We tried four different types and it took way too much time. The mimosas barely beat the food out. One had a fly in it and two tasted terrible. The waitress comped the two mimosas because we didn't drink them. Best advice go for the food, but they really need to work on bartending speed and quality of the drinks.

36.description: Excellent service, great customer service, the food was delicious. I loved the staff, I got to meet all of them and they where from different countries and so nice to talk to! The general manager was had so much expertise and so friendly. I found out the jam was made by the chef, that was delicious! And the house coffee was good!

14.description: A little gem in Printer's Row, where brunch options are still sparse.  Although the space is small, there are rarely the sort of lines that you'll encounter on a weekend morning at the original Greektown location.  Unfortunately, unlike the Greektown location, the "homemade" jams don't appear homemade and seem to be limited to strawberry and strawberry.  The chicken and waffles is generally a treat worth the calorie splurge...  perfectly seasoned and sometimes-crispy fried chicken pieces (boneless tenders, not actual legs or wings) with bacon maple syrup and herbed waffles.  Solid strawberry french toast for those who prefer dessert for breakfast.  Eggs are well-done whether the request is for sunny side up, over easy or over medium.The service isn't overly friendly, but it's not unfriendly and it's very accommodating.  You'd prefer your french toast stuffed?  No problem.  You'd prefer feta to mozzarella?  Done.  You want your cappuccino with 2%?  We'll mix whole and skim for you.

1.description: I wish "Jonathon" from the previous review was still there. I've never encountered him, but he sounds great. The two people that have been there both times I've gone in were extremely unhelpful and shady. The woman at the register tried to tell me it was illegal to put a T-mobile SIM card into a Verizon iPhone 6. I had to argue with her to get her to sell me one. She finally agreed, but warned me that I would need to get an unlock code from Verizon to access the Internet on the phone. That wasn't true.Then she tried to get me to switch to a more expensive plan. I told her I was actually considering adding two lines and taking advantage of the promo that gives you 2.5 GB per line when you have 4 lines. She lied and told me that promo was over. The whole time she was serving me, she would periodically lean over and converse in Spanish with her associate who was "helping" another customer. These two people were absolutely fluent in English. I can only imagine how many ways they were screwing that poor lady over. I love T-Mobile, but this specific location provides some truly awful service. Steer clear unless Jonathon comes out of retirement!

2.description: Cant agree more with Ryan in the previous review . The lady at the register was rude and not helpful at all. "Jonathon" please come back!

0.description: I love this store! Jonathon was amazingly helpful and fantastic. I went to this store to switchover from Verizon. By the way if you haven't done this already you are just wasting your money, my cell service is actually better and my data speeds are just as good, and I pay tremendously less money. Jonathon was very helpful and answered all of my questions and did an excellent job. I wasn't badgered into buying anything that I didn't want.  This was overall the best experience I've ever had with a cell phone provider. While I was in there getting my plan I also noticed that they take excellent care of their customers if they came in with any problems. Definitely THE go to T-Mobile store in the south loop. Go in and ask for Jonathan, he'll take excellent care of you.

58.description: Worst chorizo and egg (and 1/3 lettuce apparently) breakfast burrito ever! Soggy, bland mess, yuck! Horrible obnoxious music and kinda confusing menu.  Horchata and chips were good.

56.description: If you're downtown looking for lunch and possibly thinking about going to Chipotle, punch yourself in the face and walk over to Spanglish instead. They have an extensive, easy to customize menu, friendly service, and delicious food. The restaurant itself is casual, clean (including the bathrooms), and quick for either takeout or a sit down meal.

29.description: I have eaten here about 5 times including breakfast and I have never been more confident in giving a restaurant 5 stars. The food here is amazing. The ingredients are fresh and the service is fast! I recommend stopping in if you are in the area. I especially enjoyed the black beans. They are by far the best I have ever had. 5 stars, no doubt!!

42.description: The food is good and cheap. It's not as good as moms cooking but it comes close. I liked it and I will sure be back!!

23.description: I finally got a chance to try this place out and the second I walked in (being someone who lives closer to Flacos Tacos nearby) I instantly loved the decor and vibe here much more so and I thought the food in general was better too, but still not quite the level of cheap Mexican food I was craving being the CA native that I am!!Their chips are fine, and their charred fire roasted salsa in the bottle was ten times better than their tomatillo style salsa, so go with that one if you come here. Their al pastor gordita was the winner though between that and the breaded steak torta that we got. But the fact that we got both of those things and chips and salsa for under $10 was pretty awesome both for our bellies and our wallets. They do make things pretty fresh here as far as I could tell and there is a TV here with HD in case you want to catch that sports game while dining which we did for NFL playoff fun times. Really nice service, and if I am in the area again and looking for a fast bite, I would come back since I did think this place had more flavor overall than some of the other cheaper mexican spots in the area.

47.description: I should have just gone to Chipotle. I got a Chicken burrito. It had lettuce (which tasted old), beans, a little bit of cheese, and tomatoes. The worst part was that the burrito was made unevenly. I didn't even realize that there was cheese until I got to the very end of the burrito. The only plus side was the salsa. Both the green and the red one were delicious, but even the yummy salsas couldn't save the burrito. Also, considering that the burrito cost almost ~$8, I was expecting a lot more.

8.description: Talked to the manager on the hours situation and they said they can close when they like, disappointing.However their food is good (when they are open), I can't find many places they serve black beans versus pinto. Their portions are large and I think authentic. I have recently moved and will most likely not venture over here any more. If you are in the area are would like some good Mexican food, this is an OK place to try.

31.description: I had high expectations for Spanglish, which, sadly, went unfulfilled.  The person taking orders at the counter was kind of a jerk, which got me off the wrong foot.  The rest of the service, however, was quite pleasant. I ordered chicken and al pastor tacos.  The al pastor was fair, but the chicken was very dry.  The tortilla chips seemed well past their freshness date, and the salsa, while adequate, was so cold it was almost frozen.The decor is modern a la Chipotle...  which I found to be a bit cold and uninviting.  Next time I'm in the neighborhood, I'll pass on Spanglish and try somewhere else.

34.description: I had the tamales dinner and it was alright. It was on the dry side, but the cashier was really nice and gave great service! I had tacos the other day and it was really good. I was surprised by how authentic the tacos tasted, since this is supposed to be an Americanized fast food joint.I am a student at the UC and I'm thankful that I could fix my Mexican food cravings just by going downstairs. The horchata is really good too!!!

16.description: I had the tamales dinner and it was alright. It was on the dry side, but the cashier was really nice and gave great service! I had tacos the other day and it was really good. I was surprised by how authentic the tacos tasted, since this is supposed to be an Americanized fast food joint.I am a student at the UC and I'm thankful that I could fix my Mexican food cravings just by going downstairs. The horchata is really good too!!!

13.description: They are fortunate that I am giving them 2-stars and not 1. I was the only person in the restaurant. The person who worked there kept on coughing never covering his mouth. He was brief and unwelcoming. The food was average. I was walking by and decided to try it. I regret the experience. There are much better lunch options nearby.

11.description: Just ok. Ventured out to try somewhere new on my lunch break, and honestly I most likely won't return. The service was fast and the restaurant was clean however the food wasn't all that good.  I ordered the chicken quesadillas and it had no flavor whatsoever.  I had to drown my food in the green sauce just so i could get some type of flavor. The side of rice was good, the flavor of the beans were good they were just extremely soupy, something i definitely can go without.

39.description: I pass by this restaurant every day and thought I'd try it. I ordered the cheese enchilada meal with the mole sauce. I barely waited 5 minutes and my order was ready. The food was hot and delicious. Loved the spicy green tomatillo sauce!Great job, Spanglish! I'll definitely be back!

37.description: I love this place and I am pretty picky about Mexican food. I visit often bc it is near my house and always get the same thing - Steak Torta dinner. My mom usually tries the tacos. If you dine in you get free chips & salsa. Pricing is good. My only complaint is that they seem to pick and choose when they will close shop. I know that they close @ 10 on weekdays, so I went a little after 9pm one day and they were already closed. Happened again tonight (they are supposed to close @ 1 on Fridays and Saturdays) and they were already closed by 10:15pm, so I went to Epic Burger instead. Another time, I arrived with a friend @ 9:30ish on a Friday, and we were told they were only doing take-out orders. There were still a good 3-4 tables of dine-in customers eating, I just thought it was strange. Very disappointing because I was telling my friend how flavorful their food was the whole walk over. This place is great, but they need to be consistent. I'd rather make the drive west to El Gordo, which is my favorite and is open till 12am CONSISTENTLY, than to waste my time walking over for Spanglish to be closed early.

0.description: Got the pork tamale dinner... Delicious! Great value and nice atmosphere- they had an action movie on TV!

38.description: They're supposed to be open until 1 AM according to the door on Saturday night and midnight according to Yelp. They are not and it's 11:30.

51.description: Had the steak taco, chorizo gordita and pork tamale.  All were amazingly good!  Free chips and salsa (chips aren't anything special,  but who can complain about free?!).  Horchata was also very good.

27.description: I went here today after work on a Sunday. I've been to this place a few times before and have had very similar experiences to today.  The decor is very sleek and modern. Throwback corona tables made a nice touch to the wood and metal theme. The flatware, plates and baskets for the food were pretty basic and the food presentation were just standard no frills kinda thing. This time I had guacamole, it was delicious and fresh and I absolutely loved it!! I had the chicken tamale, which was on the dry side but the other tamale, green chile and cheese was a bit better. Overall I like this place and the prices are super reasonable.

32.description: The food here isnt cooked just assembled.  Seems like everything was microwaved to luke warm. Stale chips, stale shells. Wack wack wack. Horrible music.

54.description: I found myself south of the loop and very limited options for a moderate dinner out but I wish we would have hit up a chain instead of Spanglish. The only thing holding this from a one-star rating is that the space was interesting, concrete floors, tables, and wall art were all neat and not standard. Everything else, can be altered.The music was LOUD. So loud that the people at the cash register cannot hear your order when you are standing less than a foot from them. We had to repeat ourselves several times and my bf's was still wrong. Other people (including to go orders) seemed to have similar problems. There were also notable f-bombs in the music. A few songs were clean but the rest were the explicit versions. For that reason I would not take any little guys here.The food was also, very unimpressive.The chips were stale and store bought with extra salt added. Bf got the torta (with the wrong meat) and it was just a ground beef taco on bread. Maybe that's not the standard torta. I got chicken enchiladas with tomatillo (green) sauce. Everything was under seasoned. The tomatillo sauce was spicy, but lacked other flavors. The rice had no flavor, the black beans had minimal flavor. It also seemed expensive for what it was, it was over $20 for both of us to get our food and a mexican coke. They do have free, serve yourself water though so maybe that's how it gets a $ rating instead of $$. I don't know. Maybe it was a bad night but I'm not going to risk going back and it being the norm.

48.description: The food was great and not too pricey at all! The cheese in the quesadillas was amazing. Great black beans too! You got a good amount for what you pay, too. The best part was the service. The workers were all very friendly, and we got a free drink because my boyfriend was wearing a US jersey! Would definitely come back again.

44.description: I get tacos and quesadillas from here frequently. It's basic cheap Mexican and always been served fresh for take-out lunch. I love their sauces and it's pretty straightforward, simple Mexi fare. If the place were closer to home I'd be enjoying it more often.

24.description: After checking in at the Blake Hotel Chicago, the concierge recommended that we try this restaurant. The name sounded like it would be tex-mex restaurant. When we arrived outside, it was a small, modern looking restaurant. This led me to think that this really might be a tex-mex restaurant after all. We were greeted by a very friendly man working behind the counter. I think he might have been the owner. We ordered the dinner options. The portions were pretty big, I had the enchilada dinner, and at the end of my meal, I still had one whole enchilada left. Two people actually split a dinner. The taste was surprisingly authentic. The only thing that disappointed me was that they were out of horchata. My sister and I had become instantly excited when we saw the horchata machine at the cashier. Then again, we went pretty late. Overall, this is a nice almost-authentic spot for a quick bite.

7.description: The food is ok, but pretty standard. No one is welcoming or ever smiles and overall all just unpleasant AND it fucking cold because they don't turn the heat on. You deserve better. Skip it!

49.description: The food is always good, the service is okay, nothing over the top. I just wish their portion size was a little better and the chips they provide were more of them. For the prices downtown they should step it up a little more.

40.description: Excellent quick place to go for lunch! I had the fish taco dinner and it was more than enough food. Hot fresh tortillas, great chunks of fish, and black beans and rice mix. It was less than $10 for that dinner meal and a tall glass of horchata. I'll definitely stop here again on a lunch break! I just like to find places where I can avoid chains in the loop and this was a terrific option.

53.description: Love the atmosphere, the food comes out quickly and the tacos are very tasty. A great lunch spot.

30.description: I found this place while I was at a conference at the University Center. The ordering counter was nice and I was able to get my order in quickly even though it was lunchtime. They aren't very clear about what to do when you're waiting for your meal to come up. I sat on a stool and the guy found me. Unfortunately, I did not like the food there at all. The chips were cold and kind of stale. My burrito bowl was barely warm. The chicken seemed like it was reheated and not hot off the grill. It was all edible, but very disappointing considering their fun atmosphere.

46.description: Let me start by saying that from the outside of the restaurant it looks pretty nice. Once you walk in it almost looks bare. The tables and chairs look like they were left over from something else and instead of having matching tables and chairs everything was just thrown together. The guy working the register was plain rude. My co - worker and I went there for lunch today and as we were standing in line looking at the menu we almost felt being bossed around. So rude. The way he spoke to us seemed like he didn't need our business. After getting our order,  which was very quick, we just wanted to stay and finish.  Food was just ok. Nothing special. Nothing to make me come back again.  Just plain alright. I had the steak torta and my friend had the chicken burrito. Chips and salsa came with our meal. They too were alright.

1.description: **BEWARE** ***BEWARE** **BEWARE**I've dined here before and once you get past the sub-par customer service the food is enjoyable.  My friend and I had lunch here on Dec 4th at around 1pm.  On this day, two young men came in off the street who weren't patrons under the guise of passing out flyers in lieu of donations.  Since guys passing out flyers in the city is common i'm used to saying no thank you and they tend to go on their way.  On this day the men wouldn't leave and proceeded to stand very closely to the table my friend and I were at. After a tense 30 seconds  or so we felt threatened and noticed that nobody was going to step in so I yelled towards the counter to get the staff's attention.  The two men then ran away and it wasn't until after they left that someone pointed out that they'd ran out with a phone.  It was mine :-(   We asked the staff if they could call the police and they refused to do so citing that it would cost them $150 or so for the police to come out and they didn't want to be liable for any damages.  An employee eventually offered us his personal cell phone to use.  We wanted some sort of response from the restaurant but got nothing,  Instead one of the employees spoke candidly about how frequently non-customers come in and squat in the back of the restaurant.  He told us that they try to keep the side door locked because it happens so frequently.  We were also informed of their lack of cameras and video surveillance.  All in all it was very unsettling to know that as a customer, if i'm in danger or in need of help Spanglish will not step in.  I didn't even receive an apology.  Please be aware of all of your belongings and keep an eye on the door if you choose to dine here.  I however have had my last meal here.  **DINER BEWARE**

55.description: Excellent service. I ordered a chorizo burrito and it came soaked in grease. I brought it up and got it exchanged immediately without issue and ended up eating a steak burrito. The taste is fine, but I actually would prefer a chipotle burrito for the same price point. It's 7.68 here after tax.

9.description: I finally got a chance to try this place out and the second I walked in (being someone who lives closer to Flacos Tacos nearby) I instantly loved the decor and vibe here much more so and I thought the food in general was better too, but still not quite the level of cheap Mexican food I was craving being the CA native that I am!!Their chips are fine, and their charred fire roasted salsa in the bottle was ten times better than their tomatillo style salsa, so go with that one if you come here. Their al pastor gordita was the winner though between that and the breaded steak torta that we got. But the fact that we got both of those things and chips and salsa for under $10 was pretty awesome both for our bellies and our wallets. They do make things pretty fresh here as far as I could tell and there is a TV here with HD in case you want to catch that sports game while dining which we did for NFL playoff fun times. Really nice service, and if I am in the area again and looking for a fast bite, I would come back since I did think this place had more flavor overall than some of the other cheaper mexican spots in the area.

26.description: Stumbled upon Spanglish as I hopped off the bus and what a pleasant surprise. Being from Arizona it's hard to find decent taco shops. Excellent prices and good food.

25.description: Surprisingly good. I have had 3-4 different burritos here, and they have all been good. I love the chipotle, or smoky salsa they include. They are fast, and relatively cheap too. About $8 for a decent sized burrito, not cheap, but okay for being downtown. The decor is kind of sterile, but that doesn't bother me.

12.description: Moving to Chicago from the U.S./Mexico border, it's been hard to satisfy my hunger for legit Mexican food in the South Loop. Welp yelpers ... Look no further... This place is legit and reasonably priced. I tend to judge all Mexican places by their beans and rice, and this place nailed both. I had the ground beef gordita plate and it was awesome. The gordita itself was handmade, crispy yet soft on the inside, and fresh. The picadillo meat is well seasoned and not overly salty. Finally, the tomatillo green salsa is flavorful with just the right amount of kick. This meal reminded me of dinners at my Nana's house back home.

59.description: This place was great! Went here last night for a quick dinner with a friend. The place was pretty empty (i imagine it's packed at lunch), but the service was friendly and fast. I had the fish taco dinner (less than $8!) for 3 delicious tacos with corn tortillas, pico de gallo, and fresh fish. It came with rice and refried beans, both of which were OK. the tacos were great! My friend had one of the breakfast items for dinner, which looked good. All in all, a great, affordable spot for a meal!

21.description: I've tried this place a few times and have just given up on it. There's always something off with the flavors of the food. It's a small place and seems to have been taken over by college students. I went for dinner and felt like I was in a university cafeteria filled with prospective freshmen. Sadly, I won't be going back.

17.description: I've tried this place a few times and have just given up on it. There's always something off with the flavors of the food. It's a small place and seems to have been taken over by college students. I went for dinner and felt like I was in a university cafeteria filled with prospective freshmen. Sadly, I won't be going back.
