10.description: Mediocre Mexican food at best. Not to mention the customer service leaves a lot to be desired. I went in and there was a person at the register taking an order over the phone. He hung up, continued writing the order then walked to the back all without a simple hello or nod to acknowledge my presence. He left for about 4 minutes, returned and just stared at me waiting for me to give my order... I was still waiting on a hello. I ordered a chicken taco and he gives me the total. I hand him my cash and when he gives me my change I say "thank you". He still doesn't respond or whisper a peep. My taco was dry and lacked flavor. Even after I dressed it up with the salsa they provided. I only stopped by because I was at the 7-11 getting a slurpee. I will NOT be returning

5.description: This is a go-to lunch spot for the folks in our office - but try to show up early, 'cause there's usually a line shortly after 12:30.The pork and chicken tamales are my favorite, and the $7.95 Tamale Dinner- featuring three flavorful tamales, rice and a smattering of beans- makes for a perfect lunch portion. Wash it down with a Mexican Coke, and you're out of there for a $10 bill.Tacos ($2.50) are also popular with our crowd, including the smoky grilled fish tacos, the tender al pastor and the spicy chorizo - the hand-pressed corn tortillas are rustic and great vehicles for the proteins, whether you drench them in mole or the spicy green tomatillo sauces.And don't forget about the breakfast offerings; scrambled eggs with tomatoes, onions and peppers are only $5.50, and you can upgrade to a chorizo scramble for only $1 more. All their breakfast tortas are $5, and feature simple eggs and bacon, green peppers and eggs, and a chorizo and egg scramble.

3.description: This local Mexican restaurant in range of the downtown campus scene is a decent place for a cheap lunch.  The fish taco plate I had was amicable enough; for less than $8.00 you get three small, appetizer size tacos with a soft corn shell plus chips, spanish rice and refried beans made to order.The refried beans were the highlight of the show...dark and full of flavor.The good:--FAST service when you can get them on an off time.--CHEAP faire compared to other restaurants in the area.  You get a full meal for tapas prices.The bad:--NO drink fountain.  You have to buy your own drinks a la carte out of their fridge.--NO fresh salsa with your chips.  You have to deal with squeeze bottles of red and green sauce.The ugly:--The decor...San Franscican smart pretensionism applied very badly here.  I have to imagine that not a few performance artists from Columbia college stoked up on molly have wandered in here over the months, thinking they could order a wheat grass smoothie, only to be told that this is actually a burrito joint.

35.description: This was very disappointing. Really a takeout joint and not a very good one. Enchiladas with pork had a lot of calories but little taste. Barely warmed. Gummy and smothered in sour cream.  The only virtue is that it is priced as a takeout joint as well. No beer but you can't bring your own either.

19.description: Had the chicken burrito / more like a Lettuce burrito  ! Came with a Free side of Fruit Fly , that was special.

28.description: Went here on a vacation to Chicago 2 years ago. It was within walking distance from our hotel so we figured why not? I'd describe the place like a more authentic chipotle for people considering it. Service was great, the food is cheap, and everything we tried was great.  Will have to stop by again next time we're in the city.

45.description: After walking by this place a hundred times and subconsciously writing it off as a shallow college spot, I'm glad I actually opened the door and walked in.  This is a legit, Mexican place that could compete in Pilsen.  I liked the fresh bright atmosphere when you walk in.  Food is simple but flavorful.  Great flavors and reasonably priced.  They serve breakfast all day (but no coffee).

33.description: Came into Chicago for one day and was looking for a quick bite. The reviews didn't look amazing but still wanted to give it a shot and I'm so glad I did! Had the chips and guacamole, plus the tostada suiza with no meat, and enjoyed every bite. Was pretty surprised to see they put rice on the tostadas, since I had never had one that way, and there might have been a bit too much crema, but with some of the guacamole on top and the green salsa, they were absolutely delicious. Highly recommend that and will make sure to go back on my future trips to Chicago. Plus it helped that they are super quick and pretty cheap!

43.description: Good tex mex and really good value for the price.  Often seems understaffed and on this particular Saturday evening at 6:30 pm, one poor employee is taking orders, ringing the register, bringing out meals and bussing all tables.  She is obviously doing her best but seems really stressed.

2.description: I've lived in Printer's Row for a little over 5 months and have pretty much eaten just about everywhere between Congress Parkway and Polk. However, I had never eaten at Spanglish because I read too many bad reviews about the service from Yelp but at the end of the day, you can't always believe what you read so I decided to give this place a chance. Growing up in LA, I've always loved Mexican food and have a taste for it at least once or twice a week so I decided to walk over just now and finally give it a try. I walked in, looked at the menu real quick and knew what I wanted. Unfortunately, the guy behind the counter, looked up at me, right in my eyes about 3 different times as I stood there waiting for him to say something to me WHILE HE TEXTED THE ENTIRE TIME. Seriously, the guy was texting a novel so I finally said "I guess you're too busy right now" and I just walked out. If you're running a business, the very first thing about all is at least make an attempt to have good CUSTOMER SERVICE. Now I will never even bother to know what your food tastes like as now, I could care less. So for this review, I can't tell you anything about the food but if you've read this far, it shouldn't matter. Btw, after I walked out I walked over to WingStop and the cashier was very helpful and now I'm home with my wings. The experience was much more pleasant.

18.description: Let me start by saying that from the outside of the restaurant it looks pretty nice. Once you walk in it almost looks bare. The tables and chairs look like they were left over from something else and instead of having matching tables and chairs everything was just thrown together. The guy working the register was plain rude. My co - worker and I went there for lunch today and as we were standing in line looking at the menu we almost felt being bossed around. So rude. The way he spoke to us seemed like he didn't need our business. After getting our order,  which was very quick, we just wanted to stay and finish.  Food was just ok. Nothing special. Nothing to make me come back again.  Just plain alright. I had the steak torta and my friend had the chicken burrito. Chips and salsa came with our meal. They too were alright.

41.description: Stopped by while working at the library. Had a great set of enchiladas. Staff was friendly and directed us to a table w chips and salsa waiting for us. High quality chips and 2 salsas; verde and smoky red. The enchiladas were delicious.Will definitely revisit if I'm in the area. You should too.

52.description: Ordered Suizo Dinner and Fish Taco Dinner.Summary: Get the fish tacos your first time, not going to be disappointed.Just roll in and order what you want, pay, then they bring your food to the table.They serve some very crunchy tortilla chips and a couple salsa (in squirt bottles) before the meal. The salsas are great for squirting over the tacos or any other dish (if you're into spice)..Suizo is Spanish for "Swiss". As in Swiss cheese melted on top of the burrito. I loved it, huge cheese fan. sans cheese would be good too.The burrito is a bit fresh and light for those used to chipotle and company. They lack rice, tons of beans, etc. Mostly made of meat, lettuce, sour cream, refried black beans, and a bit more.

50.description: Decided to give this place a chance when I happened to walk past it for the nth time. I've heard mixed reviews from friends who have visited but wanted to give Spanglish a fair shot.Right off the bat, the music was pretty loud. I don't know if they keep it at that volume every day obviously but when I did stop by it was blaring so much so that it was hard to hear the lady that was ringing me up. The decor was nice and inviting. You order and pay first and then they bring you your food wherever you're sitting. The chips that I got were actually really good despite some reviewers stating that they go some stale ones. I got a chorizo burrito and once I got over how much smaller it was than what I'm used to getting (sadly: Chipotle), I was won over by how tasty and fresh it was. Not amazing but also not horrible. I want to say that I'd had better.I took out a Horchata to-go but it ended up being way too sweet for my liking. I might stop by again because I've heard good things about their fish tacos (wasn't in a fish-taco-mood that day). A-OK at the very best.

4.description: I had their chorizo and chicken quesadilla last week. This is easily one of the worst mexican places I have been to within the loop. The flour tortilla didn't taste fresh and didn't have the proper texture when you take your first bite. I also didn't think the meat and seasoning was even that great. In fact, the ratio of cheese to meat was off. It was far more cheese than meat. I definitely would not come back here again and I suggest others avoid it when there are plenty of other great mexican restaurants in Chicago.

6.description: I came once before and the owner was actually very mean to me, but my enchilada was decent. I still rather go to Pilsen for my Mexican food. Anyways, I had a steak taco dinner there and it was good. Their salsa is alright also.. I don't see why they do not have fresh salsa but, they don't.Also while I was eating I looked down and there was a bug crawling on the table, then on the floors. They weren't roaches but still... they were bugs...SO the food was decent but they need to be cleaner and nicer.

22.description: Everything was fine until the worker kicked me out 21 minutes before the place closed and said I can't eat in there even though people were still walking in and he was taking more orders on the way out. Screw that kind of service I'm gonna go to chipotle 2 blocks from here from now on. They actually serve beer there too unlike this americanized Mexican joint. NOT HAPPY

15.description: After checking in at the Blake Hotel Chicago, the concierge recommended that we try this restaurant. The name sounded like it would be tex-mex restaurant. When we arrived outside, it was a small, modern looking restaurant. This led me to think that this really might be a tex-mex restaurant after all. We were greeted by a very friendly man working behind the counter. I think he might have been the owner. We ordered the dinner options. The portions were pretty big, I had the enchilada dinner, and at the end of my meal, I still had one whole enchilada left. Two people actually split a dinner. The taste was surprisingly authentic. The only thing that disappointed me was that they were out of horchata. My sister and I had become instantly excited when we saw the horchata machine at the cashier. Then again, we went pretty late. Overall, this is a nice almost-authentic spot for a quick bite.

57.description: Fast cheap and reasonably authentic in the South Loop...works for me.

20.description: Stopped in here on a Friday night. Wanted a quick bite to eat and to not have much miss and fuss with a traditional sit down. Ordered the chicken quesadilla meal (3 quesadillas, beans and rice). Much to my surprise after taking the order, here come chips and salsa. The verde sauce has a bite! Just what I wanted! And the quesadillas were very tasty. If you are looking for a proper Mexican meal at a sit down, this isn't it. But if you want some tasty Mexican food that is 100 times what normal Mexican fast style food is, stop by. I'll be back!

36.description: Loved this place! The food was yummy and the inside reminded me of a Fonda in Mexico. Def going back!

14.description: The menu says there's avocado in the vegetarian filling. There's not. I came in while a family that took up all but 2 tables in the restaurant was ordering. There was one girl on the floor; ringing, running orders to the kitchen, and serving. I waited half an hour to order a burrito to go. Not thrilled with my experience.

58.description: First of all, I came in with high expectations because the waitress was nice and they had free popcorn ( my favorite), but everything changed very quickly when we ordered our second pitcher of beer.  The pitchers were smaller than average and the glasses that came with it were about 8 oz each. WTF? $14 a pitcher I excepted better. When we ordered our 2nd pitcher...it wasn't even full to the top. There was about an inch of head at the top. We brought it to the two waitress's attention and they just laughed about it. They said the manager poured it and they were too scared to do anything about it...it seemed. We also heard one of their regulars shouting out to the bartender (manager) as he was going out for a smoke... that yeah maybe it was a lot of head in the pitcher, but I don"t care I'm not Jewish! WTF!!!! We were so disgusted and we left and never to return again!

56.description: This is a dive bar folks.  Sheesh!  Walked in to see a game.  Friendly staff, good selection of brew and the wings weren't bad!  Manager came in to ask how we were doing.  Nice touch.  If you enjoy friendly, non snob dive bars, head on in.

29.description: DO NOT COME TO THIS PLACE. Dishonest, unprofessional and stinks like wet mop- A dump.They even charge you automatic gratuity. I've been serving for over 10 years, I think I know how to tip. I just feel like I should not have been obligated to give an amount she didn't deserve.

42.description: When I first came to college in Chicago I must have come here twice a day sometimes.  They are the only place in Chicago that use charcoal.  It's like having a backyard webber grill barbecue burger anytime.  I wish they would toss all the promo liquor company decorations.  Stop here for the first drink of the night, and have a burger and maybe come back at 3am for another.

23.description: ehh coming from SF to eating this.. not impressed bbuuutt its a dive bar soo .. yeah. benefit of the doubt.wings were good. beer was good .pizza was poopoo. not gross but very mediocre... like very... like definitely was probably froZen 25 minutes ago.

47.description: omg, i used to walk past this place all the time and one day at work decided to stop by for lunch. Jim, the bartender was super cool and informative and the cooks were fun too! There was a pretty server that was really nice and ready to give us all of our desires. I ate fallafel sandwich with hummus and tried my friends pizza too and my mouth is watering at the memory! Delicious! i give it 4 stars for deliciousness, loving people, nice location, and big smiles! Went back a few times and had their cider and also one of their deficits chocolate mint martinis. #mustdo! #yum

8.description: DO NOT COME TO THIS PLACE. Dishonest, unprofessional and stinks like wet mop- A dump.They even charge you automatic gratuity. I've been serving for over 10 years, I think I know how to tip. I just feel like I should not have been obligated to give an amount she didn't deserve.

31.description: Stopped in for a beer on the walk fr downtown to Soldier Field - friendly local pub with good pub food and good variety of beers

34.description: My boyfriend and I stopped in on our way down to Chinatown for date night and I'm so glad we did! There are so many bars in this city that claim to be "dive bars" but are really just overpriced hipster hangouts. This is a dive bar. I'm happy it's a dive bar. The prices are right for a dive, the atmosphere is right for a dive, and the people are right for a dive.Our waitress was great - she was friendly and attentive when we needed it and hung back when we didn't. We got free popcorn which is always a huge plus in my book. Beer was cheap and came by the pitcher. I can't speak to the food, but it'd probably be pretty standard bar food.I wish Chicago had more bars that were like this one!

16.description: We stopped in after Draft Town and got everything we were looking for - a great sports bar environment, cheap booze and lots of TVs. We didn't order food, but the service was quick and we were sat at a good table by the window right away.

13.description: They are dicks to their customers. We walked in and first thing they said was "we don't have a table for 4." Ok, so we stood at the bar and ordered a beer. When a table opened we sat down and were told we couldn't sit there because we ordered our beer from the bar. WTF? So we ordered beers from her and two-fisted so we could stay there. Oh, and they charge 2 bucks for a glass of water.

11.description: When you order a turkey burger and the place you order it from (South Loop Club) INSISTS it's a turkey burger .....even after you tell them that you've "cooked your fair share of turkey burgers enough to know that this is clearly not what they sold you".AWESOME.Thanks for nothing, and thanks for not reimbursing me, despite the GM being 'right there'. You failed to make things proper, and in turn, you failed to keep me as a customer when I come to town or when I have friends in town visiting, looking for a bite.

39.description: Walked in and sat down.  Asked waitress for a glass of water.  Waited 10 min and still no water, asked waitress again and asked for a drink at the same time, waited 10 more min.  After 20 min and still no glass of water we decided to pass on ordering food and walked out.  Stay far away from this place!

37.description: When you order a turkey burger and the place you order it from (South Loop Club) INSISTS it's a turkey burger .....even after you tell them that you've "cooked your fair share of turkey burgers enough to know that this is clearly not what they sold you".AWESOME.Thanks for nothing, and thanks for not reimbursing me, despite the GM being 'right there'. You failed to make things proper, and in turn, you failed to keep me as a customer when I come to town or when I have friends in town visiting, looking for a bite.

0.description: I wanted fried garbage and a beer, mission accomplished. I ordered the curly fries and the $5.50 PBR tall boy. It was everything. Aside from that, this is a great dive bar. The owner even has his work desk on top of tables next to the bar. The best.

38.description: This place had decent food. They have obviously not had the best crowd of people and it is very dated. I waited in the take out line for some food. Decently priced, food wasn't great but was just what I was looking for.

51.description: I don't know how anyone likes this place, but maybe that's just me?  The service is fine, but the general selection for beers is actually pretty limited and the selection for food is really limited too.Maybe it's just that a bunch of underage kids probably try to come in here and drink - that even though I don't see it happening, that's all I can imagine would be their business. In humor I went here dressed in a full tuxedo and the nearest school is a music school, so everyone in our group got carded bigtime. However, can I really pass for a high school student? I jest.I guess if this is your area this might not be a terrible establishment but I can't say I was wowed by anything here. They really don't have many drink choices.

27.description: I've been here a few times. It's a good late-night greasy food place. Maybe a little overpriced,  it you can literally find anything you're craving at 2:00 AM here. There's a pretty extensive bar, too, but you enter through a separate door. I used to live nearby, so it made for a nice place to go if I had no weekend plans and needed an impromptu night out with friends.

32.description: The positive- the place saves food late into the night (morning). The rest- The food is mediocre- e.g. gyros are not authentic, curly fries are OK. But the management is awful. We walked in the open side door and the manager (?) yelled at us and insisted we walk through the front door. What the hells the difference? They treat customers like they are a burden.

54.description: I love a good dive bar, but this one crossed the line from dingy to downright disappointing.  Very unfriendly front door staff, spotty service, and blah bar food.  There are lots of other bars in the area (we were staying at a hotel right near there), so I would recommend that you check out one of the many other choices.

48.description: If you're looking for a very casual and chill night and a place where you can eat a decent burger or wings, this is your place! I appreciate watching games on tv here because they have several tv's and plenty of seating. I've never felt crowded at this place and the customer service is excellent. The vibe is very real and down-to-earth. I appreciate a place like this in the city because there aren't many like this.

44.description: I'll give this place one star for decent wings.  Otherwise, please avoid this place.  They've been violating federal credit card laws for years with a $15 credit card minimum (currently, it's set at $10).  Their bathrooms smell horrendous, and are never clean.  They do not provide tasters of their draft beer.  They are rude, servers, management and all.  Instead, check out Hackney's, Jimmy Green's, Gino's or Blackie's, which are all within a block or two.

24.description: This place sucks. We made the mistake of ordering a $300 bottle of Dom. It was corked. Dimitri, the night manager, refused to do anything. He was an ass. Will never come back here.

7.description: The South Loop Cub is becoming a thing for me. What can I say? I like their mojo. If your scene is d-bags and hos beating the beat up, this ain't your spot. If you want a five-star meal, find yourself a restaurant. But if you're looking for a good time at an actual bar, this is your joint. The SLC has a pretty extensive selection of beers on tap (Green Line, sadly, not among them) and their burgers are actually delicious. I've also sampled their pizza and found it to be really tasty. I've never tried the free popcorn, but it's there if you want it.

49.description: Great for a late night bite, and some shots!  Nothing fancy here.Love stopping in here on the way back to the Hilton.

40.description: Kind of a dive...The burgers are decent... Their veggie burgers make you feel important. ;)The drinks are so bad that I just said to myself,"Oh f---k it if I want one ounce shots of booze mixed into a drink it's not going to be paired with 8 oz of another liquid!" When the waitress asked our table,"Would you like another drink?" Everyone said no at the same time! Ha ha This is one of the bars where everyone is sober, but their bills are just as high as every bar/pub around. Never buy drinks there unless it's beer or wine.

53.description: South Loop Club to Pay $100,000 to Settle EEOC Sex Harassment and Retaliation Caseeeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/r…

30.description: Food was decent, good drink specials, good service. Would be a regular spot for me if i lived in the area.

46.description: The food here was really great, my server Ashlee was so sweet. I loved my drink, the Jonny Pucker. I will be back, but hopefully it will be a little bit warmer.

1.description: Horrific. Absolutely horrific. Don't even THINK about visiting SLC.I've walked past SLC for years without ever having an inclination to stop in. Yesterday one of my coworkers decided that she wanted to have a gathering there so a dozen of us decided to walk over there.We got there about 5:15 and there was only one big party there. There was a huge group of men there about 20 deep. We sat right next to them even though the other side of the restaurant was empty. There were about 15 of us in my group.There was one waitress there. She was an older lady and she appeared to work solo until after 7pm or so. There was a bartender and another guy who was probably the restaurant manager. We waited at least 15 minutes before the waitress even came to the table to take our order. She didn't write anyone's order down so we figured she'd screw it up. Even then she didn't take the order of everyone at the table. She came back several times in between running to the cash register and tending to the other patrons. After the order was taken it took eons for our drinks and food to arrive. Two of my friends ordered cheese fries that never even arrived. When asked about the fries, the waitress said she thought the fries had already come out!! Seriously??? Even then she never saw to it that the fries were served. The pizza I ordered took over an hour to come out. When I inquired with the waitress about why it was taking so long she gave me a deer in the head lights look. I don't believe she'd even submitted the order to the kitchen.The waitress mixed up everyone's order and had a terrible time keeping our individual tickets straight. I had to ask four different times for my check and it the waitress must have questioned me about it at least 3 separate times. Finally, a second waitress came over to figure out what was happening and to assist. Even then the check was still wrong. I was charged for two drinks when I only ordered one. Whatever. It was easier just to get the $7 overcharge from my friend and avoid another debacle. The service was SLOOOOOW. The food was terrible too which made the experience worse. The pizza I waited ages for was gross as were the chicken wings I nippled on. The wings and curly fries had no flavor whatsoever. The only thing that was halfway decent was the complimentary popcorn. The cocktail I had (called the Eager Beaver) was decent but it tasted more like fruit juice than alcohol. After the check was settled the older waitress came to me and apologized for the  dreadful service. She stated she was new and struggled with having to take care of the entire restaurant. She stated that she was an "idiot" but that she wasn't "that dumb." She was embarrassed by the situation and simply wished to apologize. I appreciated her effort and thoughtfulness. Honestly, I think if she'd stated up front that it would have made a world of difference. I don't blame her. I blame the restaurant's management. Why would you leave a new employee to handle the Friday night after work happy hour rush?? The bathroom was also dreadful. One of the stalls was locked because it appeared to be leaking. The open stall also had a leak from the bottom of the toilet. Little did we know that it also had a leak at the top!! When you flushed the toilet water shot out at you!!! My friend got her shoes wet as a result. Luckily, she warned me so I knew to open the stall door before I flushed and be ready to run. I should call the health department on the restaurant because that has to be some violation. Who wants nasty sewer water sprayed all over them while they're eating? It's negligent and irresponsible of the restaurants mgmt that a plumber hasn't been called to fix the leak. For a dive bar the restaurant was actually cozy. The decor and seating was spacious and comfortable. Judging by the outside I expected alot worse but it really was a nice atmosphere. It's too bad that the terrible service cancels all the positive things out.At any rate, SLC was a one and done experience for me. I'll never step foot in the place again.

55.description: WORST SERVICE EVER AND WE DIDN'T GET PASS THE BOUNCER. Even though South Loop Club is ADA accessible, my party of 10 was turned away because apparently there was no room for a scooter. Yes, it was a Saturday; however, the bar was no where near capacity. I'm an event planner and I know space capacity.  South Loop Club is not ADA friendly!!!! Maybe they should build some steps so at least they have a decent excuse!!

9.description: Came in on Monday evening and was pleasantly surprised by how nice the service was despite the other negative Yelp reviews. Granted, there were only a few other people in the bar but it was still a nice and friendly atmosphere with a large picture window view of the street outside. Drinks were well priced for downtown and they had a large selection of different beers on tap. Recommend it for a quick drink.

26.description: After over a year of my boyfriend raving about the burgers at this place we finally made it in! He used to come here all the time in college. This place is a total dive with very unique seating, which I loved; right up my alley. It was a Sunday afternoon and there weren't a lot of people in the bar, but the servers were very friendly, attentive and quick! We started with the jalepeno poppers - they have cheddar cheese which the bf loves. I'll take any kind of cheese in mine, but these were delish. I got the wings, with sauce on the side. The sauce, was I believe, just from a bottle - but despite that, it was really good sauce! The bf got his beloved cheese burger, which I tried and it was great! As were the curly fries. It's so close to me, I'm not sure why it took me so long to get here...but I'm already thinking about when I can come back next!

25.description: I'm not going to say it's the least appealing bar in which I've ever been...I'm mean, it's not like there are glory hikes in the bathroom, not that I'd use their bathrooms. Good news is that you can carry out from the package store...no pun intended given my glory hole comment.

12.description: Nice selection of draft beers for $6. Tried Liney Pumpkin beer, tasted good. Ate half rack of ribs, very good. Fresh and fell off the bone good. Enjoyed the BBQ sauce, tasted fresh and home made. This place really surprised me. It's a dive bar and I like dive bars. I would try a burger next time.

59.description: I ate here once with a friend back in January of the year.  I had the bbq beef sandwich and beer.  :D It was ok not to bad but I don't know if will come back to be honest.

21.description: The South Loop Cub is becoming a thing for me. What can I say? I like their mojo. If your scene is d-bags and hos beating the beat up, this ain't your spot. If you want a five-star meal, find yourself a restaurant. But if you're looking for a good time at an actual bar, this is your joint. The SLC has a pretty extensive selection of beers on tap (Green Line, sadly, not among them) and their burgers are actually delicious. I've also sampled their pizza and found it to be really tasty. I've never tried the free popcorn, but it's there if you want it.

17.description: Manager (bald guy) was very rude!! They did last call, we bought beer for the whole group....and then five min later said we had to go, after I paid for the beer!! I asked to get two min to finish my beer but the manager snatched the beer out off my hand and said he would call the cops if I didn't go. Not the 4am bar you should go to!! No stars if I could!!

10.description: Yuck what a terrible place.  I don't enjoy it at all. I went there ten minutes before they closed and they wouldn't take my order.  Nice.

5.description: Never make an assumption that you can upcharge me on a drink, then proceed to act as if it's no big deal.I don't care if it's an upcharge of 10 cents or 10 grand.Didn't your mother tell you it's the thought that counts?

3.description: I came here with my friend during a late night food run. She was very satisfied with her burger and fries. I enjoyed my beer and appreciated their broad range of beer and drink options. I can definitely see myself coming back for late night food next time I'm in the area.

35.description: Food took 45 min to arrive. Im actually sitting here writing while I wait. Service is slow but yet the prices are kind of pricey. Let us determine how much the waiters get as a gratuity... never again

19.description: No policy!!!  Please hiring educated people.  Thanks you. You are in the third best city in USA

28.description: There are just too many old-school Chicago spots still doing it right to rate this any higher. The fries were disappointing, it took forever for my takeout - although they had a ton of outdated reading material on the windowsill - and the guys just seemed downtrodden, tired, and apathetic. I'm not saying they needed to be ecstatic to see me, I'm just saying other joints have a little bit more passion and pride in the fact that they're still serving up greasy, Chi-city grub, even if they cuss you out when you take too long to order. Anyway, the dogs are okay, but I'd even suggest heading around the corner to Devil Dawg's for some spunk if you're craving dogs - and that's saying a lot.

45.description: definitely perfect for late nights! price range is reasonable and the food is good. I got the jonny pucker, ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and ended with a banana banshee (extremely delicious)!to add, my waitress Ashlee was A+ and made the experience amazing.

33.description: This place needs to be on 'Bar Rescue'....

43.description: I'm gonna give this place two stars for the food being good And decently priced. I came for the US Ghana game and the waitress told us to pick anywhere to sit. Then a couple who came in 15 minutes after us were helped before us. Another waitress came up to us and mumbled she'll be right with you. 30 minutes later after the manager brought us orders of beer and food we didn't even order the waitress comes up and asked if we've been helped. We said no. Another 15 minutes go by and she finally takes are order. Then we want our check and the manager comes up and instead of asking how were doing he says she'll be right with you. 10 more minutes come by and she comes and we ask for the check. She comes back another 10 minutes later and said oh did I not give you your check? Horrible service and even worse the fact that the manager or owner was here and didn't talk to anyone or see how anyone was doing is ridiculous. I don't know how they have an average of 3 stars.

2.description: A dive bar that delivers on all fronts!I'm an atheist, but if I believed in purgatory this is what it would look like...and frankly I wouldn't mind staying.Great popcorn and service.

18.description: There isn't an option for no stars so I had to go with the lowest.  We went here after Lolla was evacuated and just looking for a place to cool down, rest, regroup and have a cold drink.  When we got there, there was a line about 5 people deep and we were told by the others waiting in line that they were at max capacity as well as understaffed so they wouldn't let anybody in until someone left.  We looked in the windows and there were about 5 open tables and 2 people at the bar and maybe about 15-20 patrons in total.  What?!?  In the 45 mins we were waiting in line and getting rained on, they let 6 people in because they were regulars.   Mind you, I am 8 months pregnant and they wouldn't let me in!  Shame on you, South Loop Club, for being understaffed on one of the busiest weekends of summer in Chicago and for not even letting a pregnant woman in!  Bad business if you ask me.

41.description: Don't go here. Don't work here. These people are screwing everyone over.... Customers and employees included. Customers: no tasters, no comp for bad food or drinks, charge 10% for splitting checks , automatic gratuity added for bills over $20, they take an imprint of your credit card!!!!!!!, gross bathrooms, cocktails are premixed and watered down (purposefully), if a drink is not drank they save it and reserve it! Do I need to mention overpriced and terrible food?Employees: everyone is underpaid, they have to pay their own credit card processing fees, all work 10+ hour shifts, upon being hired they have to pay for their own uniforms, they have to pay to use the POS system, get fined for throwing away anything that can possibly be reused (gross menus, old coasters, etc), all the cheap silverware is counted every night, the cooks are the bar backs and clean all within the same shift-- the cooks go from the kitchen to cleaning the bathroom and back with no gloves and leave the same chef coat on while scrubbing!! They literally can only give you an extra napkin or a soda refill if you buy a meal!!Last but not least, SLC paid out $136k in July 2013 to settle a sexual harassment lawsuit! (eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/r….) I'll end on that.

52.description: I'm a fan of their food when the late night hunger strikes. (I live nearby)Fried chicken wings with curly fries - They are awesome. Crispy, most and tender. They come with curly fries that are pretty good. I always had mine freshly fried so they're always warm and crispy, just like the wings.Grill chicken salad - It's a salad so nothing much to talk about. It's worth to note that the salad is always fresh and green. The grilled chicken is usually moist and grilled just right.Gyro taco - I never had this before in my life. I don't have another place to compare this dish too but all I remembered was it was really good. Ample meat + fresh vegetables.The staff is always friendly.

50.description: this is one of my late night food spots open late burgers are great and if you are with friends try the Greek pizza

4.description: After over a year of my boyfriend raving about the burgers at this place we finally made it in! He used to come here all the time in college. This place is a total dive with very unique seating, which I loved; right up my alley. It was a Sunday afternoon and there weren't a lot of people in the bar, but the servers were very friendly, attentive and quick! We started with the jalepeno poppers - they have cheddar cheese which the bf loves. I'll take any kind of cheese in mine, but these were delish. I got the wings, with sauce on the side. The sauce, was I believe, just from a bottle - but despite that, it was really good sauce! The bf got his beloved cheese burger, which I tried and it was great! As were the curly fries. It's so close to me, I'm not sure why it took me so long to get here...but I'm already thinking about when I can come back next!

6.description: Stopped in here on Friday, had a few Stellas, i used to come in here many years ago, it was a great neighborhood place lots of character, now it looks even better this would be the place to go after work to meet the group or to meet new people, i didnt eat there, but i will go back and try there food, Jody the bartender was very nice to talk to, she makes you feel like a regular, they have several beers on tap, and there is a lot of room for larger groups, i liked the placed it gave you the feel of a Chicago bar in a neighborhood where everyone knows you, i will defenetly go back

22.description: Charcoal grill, fantastic burgers for the price.  You don't need a shiny brioche bun to get a great burger.  Awesome beer selection. I'm an out of towner and they were very hospitable.  Hidden Jem

15.description: Don't go here. Don't work here. These people are screwing everyone over.... Customers and employees included. Customers: no tasters, no comp for bad food or drinks, charge 10% for splitting checks , automatic gratuity added for bills over $20, they take an imprint of your credit card!!!!!!!, gross bathrooms, cocktails are premixed and watered down (purposefully), if a drink is not drank they save it and reserve it! Do I need to mention overpriced and terrible food?Employees: everyone is underpaid, they have to pay their own credit card processing fees, all work 10+ hour shifts, upon being hired they have to pay for their own uniforms, they have to pay to use the POS system, get fined for throwing away anything that can possibly be reused (gross menus, old coasters, etc), all the cheap silverware is counted every night, the cooks are the bar backs and clean all within the same shift-- the cooks go from the kitchen to cleaning the bathroom and back with no gloves and leave the same chef coat on while scrubbing!! They literally can only give you an extra napkin or a soda refill if you buy a meal!!Last but not least, SLC paid out $136k in July 2013 to settle a sexual harassment lawsuit! (eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/r….) I'll end on that.

57.description: Good neighborhood spot with good specials. This is NOT haute cuisine, but a good local bar.

20.description: We stopped in after Draft Town and got everything we were looking for - a great sports bar environment, cheap booze and lots of TVs. We didn't order food, but the service was quick and we were sat at a good table by the window right away.

36.description: I went in with a couple of people to grab some food to go but also get a beer while we waited.  The waitress/server behind the bar had a major attitude, she was no help at all and she made it seem like we were bothering her. She tried to make us go to the take out window but we told her we wanted beers as well and she rolled her eyes said she needed to see everyone's ID even the people who were not drinking beers. Then when the food came my friend took out a french fry and ate it but she said no eating at the bar.  I will never come back!

14.description: There are just too many old-school Chicago spots still doing it right to rate this any higher. The fries were disappointing, it took forever for my takeout - although they had a ton of outdated reading material on the windowsill - and the guys just seemed downtrodden, tired, and apathetic. I'm not saying they needed to be ecstatic to see me, I'm just saying other joints have a little bit more passion and pride in the fact that they're still serving up greasy, Chi-city grub, even if they cuss you out when you take too long to order. Anyway, the dogs are okay, but I'd even suggest heading around the corner to Devil Dawg's for some spunk if you're craving dogs - and that's saying a lot.

58.description: Always enjoy going to Kaseys when I'm in town, which is sadly only a couple of times a year now.  They have a good beer selection and a nice mellow crowd.  Used to frequent the place when I lived near by...I toast a bud light and a rumpleminze to Brendan, Andrew and the rest of the crew gone by.

56.description: If you are in the South Chicago Downtown area and it just happens to be a day when the Bears or the Bulls are playing, and you enjoy a great pub/local bar to watch some sports, then you need to head to Casey's.  It is old time with a great history.  It is Chicago in so many ways.  And great service too.

29.description: Nice staff. Mixed customers. Given free Guinness glasses. Lots of draft selections from a variety of breweries. Old bar, mellow feel.

42.description: Great neighborhood bar with an extraordinary local beer selection.  Went here with a friend to order some flights and was given great recommendations from the bartender.  Super laid back neighborhood spot that I would definitely recommend trying if you are in the south loop area during the day looking for a quick beer or two.

23.description: Great place to stop in for a beer. We got a flight for $10, great selection, great service.

47.description: This little hole in the wall place is super impressive - so many unique and local beers on draft. I was pumped to see Deschutes Fresh Squeezed IPA, one of my new favorites! You can create your own flight and you can bet that's what I did. When I'm back in the area I will definitely return. They don't have food besides snacky stuff so if you want something to eat you can order from the place next door - their food is really good - burgers, sandwiches and salads. They deliver for a small fee but the food's hot and tasty. Also: extra points for allowing dogs. :) I love these cute places in Printer's Row.

8.description: Fond memories. Love this place! Used to go way back when and the vibe is still great. Classic bar.

31.description: Good beer selection, nice variety of Chicago local favorite drinks and a nice neighborhood vibe.

34.description: Nice place.  Good atmosphere.  However the bartender was not pleasant.  Very short. Didn't care if we were there or not.  I would go again.  Maybe she was just having a bad night.

16.description: This place is great!  Good beer selection, low key hang, dog friendly.

13.description: This is Chicago's version of Cheers! Great bartenders (Shelly!), good beer selection and a nice neighborhood vibe. OH and they allow dogs. Inside. It's amazing.

11.description: Solid neighborhood bar kinda joint. I don't believe they have any food, but you can order from the surrounding businesses and have them deliver (or bring something in with you). Very laid back with a good beer selection - they open the front windows/doors when the weather is nice to let in some fresh air. And dog friendly!

39.description: My boyfriend and I came here recently to watch the Sunday football game. It's a super cute local bar with a homey atmosphere. Great 4-page beer list with tons on draft, and they even had hot dogs and tamales on hand for those who were watching the game. Definitely will be coming back here and would recommend to anyone for a low-key, neighborly place to have a drink. As previous reviewers mentioned, they don't really have a kitchen here (they do offer pizza), but you can bring in food - which is even better with all the great food places nearby! They also don't accept credit or debit cards unless the order is above $15 - so grab cash if you're only planning on a beer or two.

37.description: Chose Kasey's due to the beer selection listed on-line and it did not disappoint.  Great variety of beers on draft although no pumpkin beers this time of year was a little disappointing, but found 1 in a can to start off with and it was good to go.  Shared a couple beer flights (5 for $10) and sampled some winners and losers.  Finished the night with an Allagash White.Service was incredibly friendly and efficient.  Only 1 server working the tables and bar on a Monday night and she did a great job.Add bonus was the food.  They serve the restaurant down the blocks menu.  They add a $2.50 fee, but well worth it.  Had the guc a chips, fish taco and buddy got a burger.  Fish tacos were huge and the chips were some of the best ever.  Burger got a thumbs up too.  Next time I'm Chicago, I'm going back.

0.description: Last night two of my co-workers and I decided that Friday the 13th was a swell day to get a drink after work LOL we work across millennium park but the bars around us didn't appeal, or should I say the prices hahaha. We spent all day reading yelp reviews and we came across Kaseys Tavern and Halligans The reason we chose Kaseys; the blueberry beer was very appealing and so were the reviews!We came in at around 7:00 pm  there was only one table available in the back by the bathrooms but didn't bum us out as much. The blueberry beer was GREAT! Even though they don't have a full kitchen menu, we swear that was the best frozen pizza we had ever ate!Definitely want to make out that our Server STEPHANIE was awesome!!! it was crowded and busy yet she was so attentive! A table open up in the front and she set our next round of beers over there and told us "hey ladies save u a seat up front, some folks just left" how awesome is she! Definitely recommend and are coming back again!

38.description: The married people bar.On the weekends it's full of couples and geez are some of the female patrons more than a little territorial. "Is this seat taken" means can I sit at this bar since the only chair available is right here it doesn't mean a single woman wants to join your conversation. *shakes head*The staff at this bar are top notch. You can order from nearby restaurants and eat it in there, which is great.

51.description: A small neighborhood bar that has a premier extensive craft beer list. This place must have more storage than actual seating place. A nice small neighborhood bar in a sea of extensive gentrification. That is good to see.

27.description: What a fun place.  The staff are extremely friendly and pour a nice drink.  This is a sports bar but more low key than others.  One of the best things about this place is that they allow deliveries from all of the local restaurants - eg you go to dinner at Lou Malnati's Pizza Restaurant and there is a 50 minute wait (as was the case with us).  So we opted to go somewhere else.  It was much to our surprise when the bar tender told us we could order delivery!!! Perfect!!

32.description: A stand out among the bleakness of bars in the Printer's Row area. As a little girl, I've always dreamed about having a neighborhood bar that wasn't Applebee's (HAHAHA ok I'm done).

54.description: Kasey's was a decent enough place to stop in between the auto show and dinner a few weeks back.  When I planned a valentine's day of fun for me and the mister, I mis-calculated the amount of time we would want to spend at the auto show, and we were left with a few hours to kill before dinner.  Neither of us had been to the Printer's Row area before, but were happy to see a casual bar such as Kasey's to grab a few drinks before heading up the street to Sofi for dinner.I was impressed by the beer selection at Kasey's!  I was surprised by the fact that they did not serve their own food, but impressed with the fact that Hackney's will deliver to them, not bad!I had a few Crabbie's ginger beers, while my other half tried a few different somethings.  The bartender was nice and not pushy, and was also ready to go with suggestions when we were undecided on what to order.The atmosphere was a bit dark, but its a cool neighborhood place, you can tell there are a lot of regulars.

48.description: We were looking for a place to grab a few drinks & kill time before dinner after arriving in Chicago that morning. We stumbled upon Kasey's tavern while wandering the streets and still trying get our bearings. It looked cool, so we gave it a try. It's a great little place with lots of beers on tap and a great selection of bottled beer as well. My boyfriend tried a few different beers on tap and liked them all. After asking for a suggestion for a "girly beer" the bartender presented me with heaven in glass. When she opened a bottle of "Wild Blue" beer and proceeded to pour it over ice, I was a bit skeptical, but she told me to trust her. The purple drink hardly tasted like beer and more like a blueberry cocktail, but nonetheless delicious and went down way too easy for a drink with 8% alcohol. I loved it so much I immediately looked to make sure I could buy it at home. If we find ourselves in Chicago again, we'll definitely be back. In the meantime, I'll settle for Wild Blue at home!

44.description: This was a pit stop before we met up with our other group for a bachelor party dinner. We was only going to stop for one drink and watch a little bit of the USA vs Ghana World Cup Game but we ended up staying for over an hour taking shots and ordering beers. It was a great time and the crowd was so hyped considering about 70 percent of the crowd had no clue what goes on during a soccer game but hey it gave us all a reason to chant U-S-A, U-S-A, U-S-A! Space and seating is very limited but the patrons were nice and it can get crowded. If you don't crowds this definitely isn't the place but if you love beer then this is the place. The beer selection is pretty awesome and if you need water just order a $3 Miller Lite during happy hour. The bartenders are pretty cool there too. I have a motto: treat your servers well and they'll treat you well. They charged my phone when my battery died and when we ordered shots of Jameson the pours were definitely not stingy. This place makes me miss Chicago and would definitely recommend this bar to anyone.

24.description: Bar staff is very friendly and they have a great selection of beers on draft. I will defiantly return to this bar.

7.description: The married people bar.On the weekends it's full of couples and geez are some of the female patrons more than a little territorial. "Is this seat taken" means can I sit at this bar since the only chair available is right here it doesn't mean a single woman wants to join your conversation. *shakes head*The staff at this bar are top notch. You can order from nearby restaurants and eat it in there, which is great.

49.description: Beer, beer, beer. No food. But beer.

40.description: Great bar in the south loop! The bartenders were super friendly and the drinks were good and didn't cost an arm and a leg, what more do you need?

53.description: My boyfriend and I were in town for a long weekend from Denver, our first time visiting Chicago. Our first night in, we decided to look on Yelp for a nearby bar to get a few beers at. We ended up at Kasey's Tavern, just a few blocks from our hotel. Our bartender for the night was Shelby, who provided us with amazing service, to say the very least. Because of Shelby, we were in every night while we were in town. Don't get me wrong, we visited other bars and did the touristy thing as well, but each night when we were done seeing the sights and such, we made sure we stopped by Kasey's Tavern. I would recommend this bar to anyone. And recommend that Shelby needs a raise! Thanks for giving us a great experience.

30.description: They have flights and great descriptions for the beer. It's my favorite place to try something new.

46.description: The beer menu is four pages, there are 9 TVs playing the World Cup game, need I say more? Great place but eat before you come because there is no food. None!The tables are tough to out together and the waitress shooed us away from our table saying it was reserved.

1.description: This place is very cool! They are a neighborhood Chicago bar that offers a large beer selection. They have a small outdoor seating area, about 12 people can comfortably sit outside. They offer monthly beer specials, I noticed their website wasn't updated with the current beer special, so I did call the day I was visiting. The location is perfect! It's not on a busy street or near a train so you can really enjoy the outdoor sitting area.The only con is that they don't offer food. You can bring your own food, which is cool because there area ton of restaurants in the wreath at you can walk to or have delivered.If you are looking for an authentic Chicago bar where actual locals hang, I would definitely stop here!Im giving 4 stars and not 5 stars because they don't offer food, the outdoor section is very small & the website wasn't updated.

55.description: Pros: Great beers on draftNice winesLively place but not too crowded on weekendsFun waitstaffCons: Right on the edge of being too far for pregaming events at Soldier Field

9.description: It's like drinking at your friends house. With many many more varieties of beer on tap. Such a comfortable atmosphere, with laid back clients. Full bar, but beers are their forte. Prices are incredibly reasonable and bartenders are efficient and no nonsense.No food, but they'll let you bring it in.

26.description: Probably the best after work pub in the area. Great service even w/ bigger crowds.

25.description: My erstwhile favorite neighborhood bar (I live practically across the street) until I saw they charged me $3 per drink for "rocks"...otherwise known as ice...otherwise known as frozen water. That's just some NY $hit right there. I'll be going to First Draft around the corner on Clark St for my drinking in the neighborhood needs.

12.description: This bar has a wide variety of draft and bottle beers. The atmosphere is very chill, which made it a good place to unwind after a long day. The service was slow since the bar was busy and there was only one bartender working.

59.description: Cool local bar. A little off the beaten path. Has a great variety of beer, good service and tasty food brought in from a local restaurant!

21.description: Solid neighborhood bar kinda joint. I don't believe they have any food, but you can order from the surrounding businesses and have them deliver (or bring something in with you). Very laid back with a good beer selection - they open the front windows/doors when the weather is nice to let in some fresh air. And dog friendly!

17.description: My son and I are from Boston and were looking for a good place to watch the Pats game yesterday.  We felt really comfortable, even though we were obviously not watching the same game as most of the bar.  Great, friendly atmosphere with dogs running around in football jerseys and free hot dogs and hamburgers. I had a very tasty bloody mary, although I made a note to myself to come back here again next time I was in town and taste one of the 30+ microbrews they had on tap (all at very reasonable prices).  Thanks, Kasey's, for representing the awesome city of Chicago so well.

10.description: Our concierge recommended this neighborhood gem. Fun place for drinks. Knowledgeable bartenders.

5.description: Been a few years and I still come here. The place is a bit small, so come early to snag a table. It seems the beer list has grown, and is in my opinion second best to Hopleaf. I haven't been everywhere, so take that with a grain of salt, but it's a really solid list. I'd actually come here over Hopleaf. While the Hop is bigger, maybe three times as big, it's cramped. They set it up to accommodate as many people as the fire code will allow, and it just doesn't work. Anyways, Kasey's makes good use of their space, with a small outdoor patio. The service has always been good, and the prices are reasonable given the area (printers row). This is my pregame bar of choice.

3.description: I typically do not give one stars out to establishments but I have no choice but to do so for Kasey's, and not because of the drinks but because of the service. My friends and I decided to check out this bar about a month ago based off the great reviews on yelp. When we first arrived we were slightly confused because there is the bar and then there are tables. Since there was a group of four of us we chose the tables. What made this process confusing was that we waited for several minutes but no one came to serve us, so we were not sure if we had to go up to the bar or wait an eternity to come serve us. That was more so awkward than a huge deal, we just went up to the bar and ordered. We loved the beer and the environment and were overall having a great time. Towards the end of our time there, we noticed that the table behind us was getting service but not us, but at this point we did not care. I asked the man (his name is Craig with a "C" as he later bluntly told me) for our check. When he arrived with the check, he had added my boyfriend and my bill with our friends' bill. When we asked about this, as we had all ordered separately he stated that it was easier for the bar to do so. This was perplexing to me especially because there were no signs around stating this was the policy. I asked Craig for a pen so I could circle who had what. Craig hastily stated that he could just be informed of how we wanted to split the bill. However, when I began to tell him he rolled his eyes and then requested we split the items. After a few minutes of attempting to remember and almost calculating whose was whose, Craig returned and ripped the check out of my friend's hand and stated that this was not "rocket science" and stormed off. When Craig returned, I asked to speak to the manager due to the unbelievable amount of disrespect he had now shown us and I was told that he was the manager that night! I asked him why he had been rude to us this entire time and he stated that he had not because he had only started serving us (giving away his awful service once again). Needless to say he continued to argue with me until I finally requested to speak with his boss. In the end he continued to make errors on the separation of the check and did not even give my friend his card back originally. Also Craig was taking shots behind the bar, which is absolutely unprofessional especially if you are the manager. Although I have not called his boss, I am writing about my experience here. It is truly a shame because the place was great but who wants to be treated like that?!

35.description: Kasey's is a great place to watch a Blackhawks game. Doesn't have to be a grandpa bar if you bring 20 year old friends!

19.description: Kasey's is definitely a cool little neighborhood local tavern with a friendly vibe, chill, but not too dead. Old-school place that's been there in Printers Row forever. Also love most of the staff. Great moscow mules. Great place to meet friends, just chill out and pull up tunes on the juke box. Also, dogs are welcome, which makes it fun!

28.description: Great chilling neighborhood bar just like Yelpers said. Got a beer on draft per bartender recommendation. Was more bitter than I like. She wanted to replace it but by then, I didn't want more beer; just wanted water. I wasn't feeling too good (not anyone's fault). She was very nice though and didn't charge me and wanted to get me something I would like. So I give it a very good rating which for me is a 4 star. Would go again definitely. ps. They have lots of big TV screens, but they are hung up so high, I found my neck to be strained. A minor discomfort.

45.description: Man I miss this place. This is one of the most laid-back yet fun bars - and with a great selection of GOOD beer no less. Count on obnoxious Bears/White Sox fans at times, but overall, a pretty cool vibe and some fun bartenders. There's really no better place for football Sunday than here!

33.description: It's like drinking at your friends house. With many many more varieties of beer on tap. Such a comfortable atmosphere, with laid back clients. Full bar, but beers are their forte. Prices are incredibly reasonable and bartenders are efficient and no nonsense.No food, but they'll let you bring it in.

43.description: I am a regular...  I avoid this place on days with sporting events because I don't really like sports or sports fans or crowds, but go several times a week because the beer selection is excellent and variable, and the staff is really nice.  I can read at the bar or play a card game, and it is not considered strange...

2.description: I wish Yelp had a 3.5. Kasey's is a nice neighborhood joint with great beer selection, featuring many seasonal varieties. However, there is no waitstaff whatsoever. You must go to the bar for all drink orders. They have 1x bartender in the whole place on a Saturday night. When we went to order a drink we were told by another guy behind the bar that the bar ltender would be back soon and we would had to wait a few minutes. Why couldn't the guy behind the bar get us a drink or ring us up? Decent place, just awkward on the whole process of getting a drink lol

18.description: Lots of TV sets, boring ass sports shows ....lots of different kinds of beer. Some people like that. I'm getting old or something because it just confuses me anymore. Usually wind up asking for beers by type ... like "yo, IPA please my friend" and just go with whatever they bring. Let's see what else....art students, friendly and OK to talk to. Free popcorn. Oh yeah, I went out front to smoke (large 6'5" (almost 2 meter) dude in black t-shirt) and some people tried to show me their ID. So... yeah that happens once in a while :)

41.description: I wish I could give 0 stars for this place. In from out of town walked a few miles from where we were to go based on reviews HORRIBLE customer service, dead bar, I would definitely skip and head to first draft where we ended up and it much better!

52.description: I was looking for a place to watch March Madness in the South Loop since the person I was meeting was coming from the north side and I was coming from the south side. We decided to meet at Kaseys. Parking was super easy to find on a Saturday afternoon. It is street parking so you get to shell out money to the parking meter company. Kaseys is also not that far from the red line.Kaseys has a great beer selection and a decent setup for watching sports. There is not a ton of seating but I was able to find a table. They don't have food at the actual bar but you can order in takeout.

50.description: Lots of TV sets, boring ass sports shows ....lots of different kinds of beer. Some people like that. I'm getting old or something because it just confuses me anymore. Usually wind up asking for beers by type ... like "yo, IPA please my friend" and just go with whatever they bring. Let's see what else....art students, friendly and OK to talk to. Free popcorn. Oh yeah, I went out front to smoke (large 6'5" (almost 2 meter) dude in black t-shirt) and some people tried to show me their ID. So... yeah that happens once in a while :)

4.description: One of my absolute favorite places to go for a drink close to home!! The perfect down to earth neighborhood bar vibe and down the street from a taco place (you can bring outside food and eat it here). Kasey's boasts a 4 page long beer list and Tank 7 on draft.. They'll always have my business

6.description: The bartender Shelby is awesome!!!! She managed to handle the whole bar by herself and was on top of it with service! We enjoyed our visit to Chicago and are so glad we stopped in here, twice!!!!! Thanks!

22.description: Came in from out of town. Awesome atmosphere great staff! Really fun place to watch some hockey. Will be back for sure!

15.description: Great neighborhood bar. Atmosphere is pleasant. Diverse beer menu. Something for everyone. Bartenders are pretty attentive, even when you sit at the back tables. They have chili and hot dogs during home Bears games, which, how can you say no to that?! They also have an outside area which is perfect during a sunny summer day with an ice cold beer.

57.description: Still a great place to grab a beer and chat with your friends. The few times i've been here it's never been too loud or too crowded. As usual, inexpensive drinks and good times. Sometimes you meet a bartender with a great accent that flirts with you ALL night...texts you for three days...and then find out he has a girlfriend. What a loser. When then doesn't happen Kasey's is awesome!

20.description: Kasey's is definitely a cool little neighborhood local tavern with a friendly vibe, chill, but not too dead. Old-school place that's been there in Printers Row forever. Also love most of the staff. Great moscow mules. Great place to meet friends, just chill out and pull up tunes on the juke box. Also, dogs are welcome, which makes it fun!

36.description: Absolutely love Kasey's! Very comfortable and casual place for drinks in the city. Always a good mix of people and the bartenders are extremely friendly and attentive! All around a great place to hang out.

14.description: Great chilling neighborhood bar just like Yelpers said. Got a beer on draft per bartender recommendation. Was more bitter than I like. She wanted to replace it but by then, I didn't want more beer; just wanted water. I wasn't feeling too good (not anyone's fault). She was very nice though and didn't charge me and wanted to get me something I would like. So I give it a very good rating which for me is a 4 star. Would go again definitely. ps. They have lots of big TV screens, but they are hung up so high, I found my neck to be strained. A minor discomfort.

29.description: I have been going to B.Bella since it opened. I have known Rihad and George for almost 10 years. Jasmin does my hair and I love her work! Although, George and Rihad's work is fantastic as well. The ambieance is very relaxing and comfortable. If your hair is natural this is the place to go in my opinion because they know how to deal with all hair types. If you have a sew-in they know how to deal with those too. LOVE IT!!! Keep up the good work guys.

42.description: I usually go to Tiffany (with the purple hair ) She has an attitude out this world. I went in there to get my hair permanently colored to red 2 weeks ago and yesterday all of the red came out interesting....I went back to show her and she got an attitude * your not getting a refund regardless chitter chat" i just wanted to know if there was anything you could do she wasn't listening whatsoever to my problem so Rihad explained everything in a calm manner and now he is possibly going to fix it. Im officially changing hair dresses. anyone who takes Tiffany be careful she do not have patience.

23.description: Bad Experience!  I came in for a bikini wax purchased through Lifebooker Loot for the price of 29.25.  Marta did the service.  She was not friendly and handled my area in a very rough manner.  She pulled on the wax as if she was pulling weeds off the ground!  I've had many waxes for 10 + years and this one was one of the most painful ones.  She kept reapplying wax to the same area which led me to believe she was not pulling the right way to begin with.  Once it was finally over, I was ready to run out of there, but when I got to the counter and told them about the lifebooker deal, they called the manager because no one had heard about this deal being on the internet.  The manager who didn't as much as look up at me proceeded to get on the phone and yell at someone for not having the right dollar amount on the website.  After about 15 minutes of waiting by the counter he said I can go ahead and pay that amount and walked away.  They were all very rude.  Needless to say, I will not be coming back.

47.description: I really wanted to get my hair cut one day and I called them up and they got me in that same day.  I forget the name of the stylist who cut my hair, but she did a great job.  She cut it exactly how I wanted it and then styled it really nicely for me because I was going out to a party that night.  She threw in an eyebrow thread for free.  It was a great experience.  I definitely recommend this place.

8.description: Got a mani/pedi using a living social coupon.  Overall, I was satisfied with the quality of the work.  However, like everyone else has already said, there are barely any colors to choose from so I had to settle for a color that I'm not too crazy about.  Another thing that bothered me was that it took FOREVER. I came with my sister and since there was only one manicurist, it took about 2.5-3 hrs for her to do both of us.  To give the place some credit though, everyone was very friendly and they did a good job if keeping everything clean.

31.description: I used a groupon for a Vitamin C Facial the other day at B Bella. The overall experience was pretty positive. It was easy to  get an appointment. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The facial itself was really good! I forgot the name of the woman who did the facial, but she was very professional. It has been a couple of days and my skin looks and feels great! I think there are some small changes that the salon as a whole could make to improve their salon. It was really loud in the salon. Even inside the facial room I could hear people talking loudly and lots of hair dryers going. The door to the room was a thin sliding door. The lighting in the salon was really abrasive fluorescent type lighting. The walls in the facial room had black marks on them. The towels used during the facial smelled like bleach. I think if the salon put a little bit more effort into creating a calming environment, they might have more success. Right now it feels like the place used to be a Fantastic Sam's that they are now trying to make into a pseudo-upscale salon. I'll still give 4 stars though because the quality of the actual service was pretty good. .

34.description: I used the Groupon I bought for a spa mani/pedi and was very disappointed.  Here are the lowlights:1. My service started 25 minutes late2. The "spa" pedi water was cold, and she let me sit there for another 15 minutes before starting the service3. The polish selection is very limited.  About 20 polishes (half fluorescent) to choose from and when I picked them up, they were all greasy4. The tech kept telling me she was a nail tech for "the stars" and how she has a patented nail system.  Wtf?  If this is patented, I'm a gorilla5. The pedi was subpar at best.  Weak.6. I sat for another 10 minutes waiting for my mani to start7. Mani was below average8. The dryer she put my hands in was covered in hair.  My palms were covered when I took my hands out9. This place is dirty.  I showered when I got home10. The magazines are from 2009-2010 and are filthyOn a side note, I had come here once before for a quick eyebrow wax.  I left with uneven arches and an itchy brow.  I really wanted to like this place because it's so close to my home.  I will not be back.

16.description: This salon is great. The best part about the salon is Marta, the person who does the waxing. The only reason I started going to this salon was because I was a customer of Marta's at another salon.Ladies, if you're looking for a place to get an excellent wax job, you've found the right place. Marta will definitely take care of you!! She is awesome! I won't go anywhere else to get my waxing done. She's super friendly, and is a pro!

13.description: This is my very first Yelp review.  I decided I needed to review this salon, not because I want to disparage this business, but I want customers to know what they are getting into before they go.  First, this is NOT a SPA and I DID NOT RECEIVE A SPA MANI/PEDI. The salon was overbooked, which meant that I was there for HOURS, and I didn't receive any quality service.  There were no hot towels, no luxury.  My manicure took 10 minutes. Also, please know, this is a hair salon, with four nail stations (two manicure stations, two pedicure stations), and a tiny waxing room (which is right off the main hallway, so when Marta opens the door, whoever is walking by can get a glimpse at what you're waxing.  The salon has about 20 Opi nail colors, many of the good fall/winter colors, but few spring colors yet.  The owners were nice - offered me tea, and water, but in a styrofoam cup (who uses styrofoam anymore?).  My bikini wax was good.  If you don't mind going in and out, and having standard nail service, go here.  But if you are looking for luxury, go elsewhere.  Even for a standard salon, I've experienced better.

11.description: I bought the Groupon deal that they had for Brazilian waxes and it was a great experience. It was such a good experience, I decided to stay with the salon. They now give me a deal where I can pay for three Brazilian waxes for $99. Normally their Brazilian waxes are $65, but because I bought three they gave me a huge discount. I've been all around the city searching for a good Brazilian waxer and this is by far the best experience I've ever had. I've been to quite a few salons that were not good at waxing. I've had experiences where they had to re-do the wax because they completely messed it up. All of the other places I've been to were extremely painful so for a while I assumed all Brazilian waxes were a horrible experience. I then met Marta a few months ago at Bella Salon and she completely changed my perception on Brazilian waxing. It takes less her than 15 minutes to do it. Marta is not much of a talker, but I don't mind that at all. She's quick, it's painless, and I get a great deal. Nothing beats that in my book.

39.description: Finally found a good Brazilian waxing place in the city - SO RELIEVED!Good ol' Groupon led me here, and I am deeply indebted. Everybody is SO NICE here, and Marta, as previous reviewers can attest, is awesome at what she does.  I really like that she doesn't use gloves while she's doing the wax (I've had girls who have pulled out big leather gloves before, and it made me feel like I was filming an extra scene from "Hostel"). She's really friendly and efficient - if you want the details, message me.The Groupon deal was a total steal - $35 for the Brazilian (plus the tip based on the original price of $55). She also gave me a coupon to come back again for $44, which is still an awesome price for Chicago.This place is right in the South Loop at State & Balbo, near Columbia College. Super convenient for people working in the Loop - it was a 10-minute walk from my office and I definitely plan on coming back.

37.description: I went  to this salon in January [ a week before i went on vacation to Costa Rica ] with intentions to get my roots re-highlighted - so I would look super good for vacation! The lady who did my hair only put  a few highlights in, and she didn't get anywhere close to my roots, so it still looked like i hadn't gotten my hair done in weeks!! It gets worse, She than asked me if i wanted a hair cut, and since I've been trying so hard to grow my hair out, i told her i just wanted a tiny trim, and some bangs!  She cut about 2 inches off my hair, and she didn't even give me bangs, she just cut the hair by my bangs into layers!! My hair was so choppy and ugly!!  I also couldnt even put it up into a pony tail because the ugly layers she gave me would fall out! I will never go back!

0.description: I  have been natural for the past 6 years. This was my first time here.My stylist was Roni.  Very kind & pleasant.  I had a cut & color.  My hair is gorgeous. Very soft & silky.  So happy I went.  Also love that they use Aveda products. Please note you are in and out.  Very professional.

38.description: This is my very first Yelp review.  I decided I needed to review this salon, not because I want to disparage this business, but I want customers to know what they are getting into before they go.  First, this is NOT a SPA and I DID NOT RECEIVE A SPA MANI/PEDI. The salon was overbooked, which meant that I was there for HOURS, and I didn't receive any quality service.  There were no hot towels, no luxury.  My manicure took 10 minutes. Also, please know, this is a hair salon, with four nail stations (two manicure stations, two pedicure stations), and a tiny waxing room (which is right off the main hallway, so when Marta opens the door, whoever is walking by can get a glimpse at what you're waxing.  The salon has about 20 Opi nail colors, many of the good fall/winter colors, but few spring colors yet.  The owners were nice - offered me tea, and water, but in a styrofoam cup (who uses styrofoam anymore?).  My bikini wax was good.  If you don't mind going in and out, and having standard nail service, go here.  But if you are looking for luxury, go elsewhere.  Even for a standard salon, I've experienced better.

51.description: I decided to check out B Bella for a manicure and pedicure on my birthday and went back for a massage the day after. This company is all about customer service. They aim to please. The manicure had a peeling issue a couple of days after I got it. The owner had me come in the next day and fixed it free of charge. Since the last time I was in for the massage, they have been working on remodeling a room for massages. It was previously small and loud, less than ideal. I can't wait to see what they have done with it. The massage was awesome and deserves an atmosphere to match it.
