27.description: I had a TERRIBLE experience at B Bella Salon and don't even know where to start.  I had gotten a Gel-ish nail polish from another salon a couple weeks earlier and was meeting a friend in the area so I came here to get the Gel-ish taken off and have a fresh one put on.  Wish I would have come to YELP first...   B Bella does a No Chip manicure and said it wouldn't be a problem to change out the polishes when I called.  I am typically a regular manicure kind of person and didn't know all the ins-and-outs of the Gel-ish as far as removal goes.  I had asked when I got it done originally and the woman said that you soak it for 5-10 minutes in a high strength Acetone and the stuff just comes right off... Well the woman at B Bella starts off by asking if I want my manicure "pulled off or drilled off?"... Uhhh... neither - Both sound painful?!  When I explain what I was told by the other technician, Nelly at B Bella huffs off to the back of the store and begrudgingly gets stuff to soak the Gel-ish off.  I sat forever in 10 make shift things that I can only describe as tinfoil-finger-nobs not understanding how loosely wrapped cotton and foil was going to provide any of the necessary elements to get the polish off.  Tons of Acetone evaporation combined with no friction and no pressure left me with nails that only looked slightly worse than when I had come in 40 minutes earlier.Nelly then takes one of the coarsest grade nail files I've ever encountered and starts going over the TOP of my nails.  At this point in time, I'm fighting a bit of a panic but rationalize that obviously this stuff needs to be filed off since sitting for 40 minutes did nothing.  I also rationalize that a person who has been doing nails for as long as she said she has been wouldn't do anything that would eff up my nails.  This MUST be some sort of magic nail file... NOPE!!!  I have nails that are as thin and razor sharp as a new born baby's with all these thin spots across the top that a week later are still unbelievably sensitive whenever I pick something up or brush against anything.I was heading out of town on vacation two days after coming into B Bella and basically decided that the best course of action was to cover up my nails and continue on with the No-Chip because I had at least seen the comparable Gel-ish in action and knew that it looked good.... I deserve to be slapped up-side the head for having that thought after witnessing what I had already been through at this salon.  The No-Chip was a mess (color me shocked on that one) so I finally tucked my tail between my legs, paid, and ran away from B Bella after 2.5 hours of stupidity on my part and walked IMMEDIATELY to the salon where I got my Gel-ish done (Salon Vision) to have them take everything off.  The nice woman at Salon Vision gently took the stuff off in 10 minutes using the same amount of time and same process she told me the Gel-ish would be.  She then looked at my nails and told me she would buff out as many of the deep scratches as possible but because my nails were so thin, she could only do so much... I know this was a long rant but sometimes you read these reviews and people give 1 star after complaining that 1 thing was wrong and I always think that they may be blowing things out of proportion if only 1 thing was bad.  1) painful nails 2) thin nails 3) scratched nails 4) terrible quality 5) 2.5 hours long 6) stupid me.

32.description: This is the first yelp review I've ever posted and it's well deserved.  I bought the groupon for my girlfriend thinking it would be a nice gesture.  Unfortunately, it backfired horribly.  It was the worst nail / salon experience she has ever had.  DO NOT GO HERE.  Her appointment for a mani-pedi took 3 hours!Here are the highlights:* Her nail was cut so badly that it bled for an hour and would not stop.  The employee that was doing her mani/pedi tried to wait for her finger to stop bleeding but after an hour she painted OVER THE BLOOD.  She said it was a very painful.* Because it was taking so long, her parking meter ticket was running out.  She had put 2 hours in the meter and, because her nails were wet from the pedicure, another employee offered to add time to her meter for her.  She asked the employee to add $5 for another hour & 1/2 because they hadn't even started her manicure yet.  The employee returned explaining that she only put $1 in the meter because she was SURE she would be done in that amount of time.  Since my girlfriend was getting her nails done, she couldn't get up and take care of it herself - so instead she had to worry about getting a ticket.  By the time she finally got to her car, it had been w/o a meter ticket for 40 minutes.* As if this wasn't enough, the employee insulted my girlfriends hair.  She had just gotten it cut last weekend and the employee pointed out that she thought it didn't look good and she needed to get it cut.  My girlfriend noted that she wasn't happy with it either and and the employee actually said that's why she asks all her clients if they're happy before they leave.  Clearly, she didn't ask if my girlfriend was happy with this experience.Long story short (as my mom likes to say) - this was a terrible experience and this place does not deserve your money or time.

54.description: A much needed addition to the South Loop. Went to Nina several times for eyebrow threading. She is always pleasant and the owners are very friendly. It is very nice to have a salon open on Mondays!!Price for eyebrows is normal for the city!

48.description: This is my third salon with Rihad, with each move his prices have gotften better and his products have gotten better. Thanks to him, I no longer wear chemicals in my hair, my hair is longer and stronger than ever, and if I went for weekly appointments like I should, I am willing to bet I would never have a bad hair day. Seriously its that good.

44.description: It's past my bedtime so I'll get straight to the point. Yesterday between errands I spied B. Bella and despite the mixed reviews from my fellow yelpers, I decided to chance it. If only life had a rewind button. Normally I'd venture further north to Sonya's where I'm never disappointed for eyebrow threading, but B. Bella's convenient location lured me in like a siren's song. Now, I will say that the salon is nicely decorated with a favorable ambience and the staff was very friendly. The lady that threaded my brows, a pretty and amiable brunette, named Ruby created a signature Cruella Deville-ish look for me while I was only seeking a "clean up". She also threaded parts of my eyelid void of hair follicles resulting in a puffy scar on the crease of my left eyelid that irritates me at this very moment. Perhaps the mutilation of my lid explains the closed eyeball massage that I've never experienced in my 4 years as an eyebrow threading customer. Needless to say, I will not be returning.

24.description: Bought a Groupon Now! deal for a blowdry and straightening.  Called them immediately and was able to secure an appointment within 1 hour.  The salon is clean and relatively modern, although some of the decor looked a little tacky (ugly fake flowers in vases on the walls).  But -- this is not about the decor, right?  It's all about the service, and the service I got!  First, this was probably one of the best hair washing jobs I've gotten so far: the lady (didn't get her name, alas) took almost 30 minutes to thoroughly wash my hair, massage the head, and untangle my very messy curly locks.  It felt amazing!  Then I was transfered into the hands of Kylee, who proceded with the blow-drying and flat-ironing portion.  It took a little longer than I was planning, but she did a very nice job.  So... why 4 stars?  Because it states "Yay, I'm a fan!"  -- and that's exactly how I'm feeling about the place.  5 stars takes an absolutely stellare everything, including the ambience.Final verdict: definitely recommend.

7.description: I don't know, you can get somewhat decent hair style or service in general occasionally..but not too often. Also it seems like their marketing department or manager or who ever is in charge don't take their coupons and deals too seriously because they usually refuse(?!) to accept any of those...strange...very...

49.description: I cam here to have my eyebrows threaded, something I've never done before, and I told the stylists explicitly that I DID NOT want them thinned out or reshaped just cleaned up.I walked out with thinner, reshaped eyebrows and I'm really pissed about it.To be fair, I guess I didn't spell it out for her.  Maybe she thought trimming them down was cleaning them up?  I don't know.  But I like my eyebrows to look really natural and now they look really "perfect" and that is NOT what I was going for.I'm just going to stick to home tweezing from now on.

40.description: B. Bella is one place who I believe they have hair stylist that will cater to their customers in there every need. *Ruby*- is one of them.I love her work in what she has done and what she keeps doing till this day. She  knows what she is doing and very educated about  hair. Always looking for the best interest for the customer to leave the salon looking FABOULOUS. I highly recommend her.!!!! :)The salon is sooo pretty and feels "homie' to get all the accomidations you can expect. The decor is great also. :)If you are looking for a great duo/color/cut- RUN!! to B. Bella You will leave looking like a doll. Michey

53.description: Since I wrote my previous review, the owner contacted me to try change my mind. I went back in for a new mani+pedi and eyebrow waxing.My nails lasted longer before I chipped them - I'm really hard on my nails - and I didn't have any of the peeling problems that I did before. Deborah was most definitely friendly and capable, and I enjoyed my time with her. I'm pleased with the job she did as well.The only negative I have now about B Bella is their limited nail polish color selection. I generally avoid the traditional reds and pinks, and they don't have a lot of blues, greens, or purples to pick from. But I was able to pick a very nice emerald that I'm very fond of now.I'd never had an eyebrow waxing before, and I'm quite pleased with the results. I was really worried I'd have this huge dramatic change to tiny pencil eyebrows, but the technician listened to me and shaped without making huge alterations. I'm sure she'd be just as happy and capable to make pencil-thin eyebrows if that's what you want.The bottom line is that B Bella is a great addition to the neighborhood, they really care about their customers' satisfaction, and will go the distance to make sure you're happy with the care you receive.

30.description: This salon is great. The best part about the salon is Marta, the person who does the waxing. The only reason I started going to this salon was because I was a customer of Marta's at another salon.Ladies, if you're looking for a place to get an excellent wax job, you've found the right place. Marta will definitely take care of you!! She is awesome! I won't go anywhere else to get my waxing done. She's super friendly, and is a pro!

46.description: I called and made an appointment with this highly recommended Yasmin lady for last night to get my eyebrows done. The appointment was for 5:40pm. I got there 5 minutes early and at 5:50pm I look over at Yasmin still finsihing up her last client and it didn't seem like she was going to be finished any time soon. I ask how much longer she'll be and she says 30 more minutes. Um...Why didn't she say that in the first place! I had an appointment! I wasn't just a walk-in! She didn't even apologize or anything. She was soo incredibly rude. I will not go back to that salon every again.

1.description: I didn't even have to go her a crappy hair cut in order to find out what this salon is all about!  I tried calling tonight to schedule an appointment.  The front desk dude, who claimed to also be the manager, is a world class jerk.  I had one simple question.  Do you have any availability after work hours next week.  1.  He didn't understand what the term "work hours" means.  2.  He refused to answer the question.  3.  He hung up on me! Thank you, for not wasting any of my time or money.  You lost a potential customer and some revenue.  You must so much business that you don't even NEED a new client!  So Yelp people out there don't bother!  They are not in need of new clients!  Keep looking!

9.description: I don't like to write 1-star reviews. I believe that for the most part businesses are doing their best to survive in a tough economic climate and will bend over backwards, but not necessarily so with B. Bella.I like in the neighborhood and had passed the salon many times, but had no real reason to come in as I already have a great salon for my hair. I got saw an e-mail from Living Social for a spa manicure/pedicure deal - I believe it was $25 for the service which is normally $70. I figured it can't hurt right?Of course I waited longer than I should have (the deal expires in early Feb) but booked a service for December. They let me know they would not accept the coupon any time around the holidays (this was not stated on the terms and conditions of the Living Social, but again I figured that was fine). The day of my appointment came near and feeling sick, I called the day before to cancel my appointment. The women on the phone said not a problem and I told her I'd call back to reschedule. The next day I get an anxious receptionist on the phone (I'm assuming someone different) saying I'm late for my appointment. Again I let them know I was sick, had called the day before and would reschedule.In the new year I realized I needed to book my appt. before it got too close to the use by date. I was walking by the salon as it was closing and saw two people inside. They kindly let me know I explained I wanted to book an appointment. The receptionist logged into their computer and we made the appointment. She asked if I wanted a card and I kindly said "no" because I'd just logged it into my calendar. I called today to ask if I could by chance come in for a later appointment (this is again the day before my service) and they don't even have me in the system!I can understand if there is one mess up. Two with no course of apology is just embarrassing. I spoke with who I believe was the owner and told him I probably won't use my Living Social coupon after all because this has been such a hassle and that in the future they should try to keep a more organized system at the reception desk. Needless to say there are enough other nail spots in the South Loop that I can take my business to.

26.description: Still a great place! Thanks, Vicky!

25.description: I used a groupon now to get my hair washed and styled. The whole experience was positive. As a black women it is hard to find a salon that I would trust even washing my hair and this place is great. For 28 bucks I got a great wash, deep condition, and style. It was easy to get an appointment and George knows his stuff. It is not a fancy spa, but the people are nice, it's cheap, and George knows black hair which is all I need in a hair salon.

12.description: Finally found a good Brazilian waxing place in the city - SO RELIEVED!Good ol' Groupon led me here, and I am deeply indebted. Everybody is SO NICE here, and Marta, as previous reviewers can attest, is awesome at what she does.  I really like that she doesn't use gloves while she's doing the wax (I've had girls who have pulled out big leather gloves before, and it made me feel like I was filming an extra scene from "Hostel"). She's really friendly and efficient - if you want the details, message me.The Groupon deal was a total steal - $35 for the Brazilian (plus the tip based on the original price of $55). She also gave me a coupon to come back again for $44, which is still an awesome price for Chicago.This place is right in the South Loop at State & Balbo, near Columbia College. Super convenient for people working in the Loop - it was a 10-minute walk from my office and I definitely plan on coming back.

21.description: So they had a Groupon for hair extensions - $199.  What they didn't include is that you have to buy your own hair - another $250ish.  I got them done less than a month ago (told they'd last 3-4 months) and am now wearing a bandana for the 4th day in a row because some of them are falling out.  I was supposed to go in today to get them fixed but, despite what we planned, the woman who does them "thought she was working today, but isn't."  Alas, another day of hiding my head...  Perhaps it's my fault - you get what you pay for, right?!  I'm now rapidly calling various salons to just find anyone to take this mess off my head!  Ugh!

17.description: I cam here to have my eyebrows threaded, something I've never done before, and I told the stylists explicitly that I DID NOT want them thinned out or reshaped just cleaned up.I walked out with thinner, reshaped eyebrows and I'm really pissed about it.To be fair, I guess I didn't spell it out for her.  Maybe she thought trimming them down was cleaning them up?  I don't know.  But I like my eyebrows to look really natural and now they look really "perfect" and that is NOT what I was going for.I'm just going to stick to home tweezing from now on.

10.description: Let me first start off by saying how much I loathe eyebrow threading. The pain is unbearable for me. I've always wondered why some call it painless while I liken it to child birth.So I called at 9am looking for an early appt. the informed me they do both threading and waxing for eyebrowns. I opted for an eyebrow wax. My appt was for Ruby. I ran late but they saw me right away. She started with a painless wax and surprised me by following up with a painless quick shaping with the thread. My overall experience was  painless and my eyebrows were perfect! Ruby did an incredible job and I believe I found my new eyebrow person! Yay!!!!

5.description: I am ANGRY with this salon and their management. I scheduled a last minute no-chip manicure. The woman buffed my thumbnail and the skin around the nail. She was being so harsh and within a mere 5 seconds of rough burning, my thumb was pulsing in pain. I tried pulling away but before I could even process the pain, the skin was burned and scratched. It doesn't take more than one or two seconds to quickly burn someone and if I had the time to recognize how bad it was, I would not have allowed her to continue. About a minute after she did this, she sprayed something on my hands that intensified the pain. I immediately began blowing cold air on my thumb. She asked what was burning and I told her. She just said, "oh" and continued to work. Later she sprayed more fluid on my hand and brushed a coat of polish on my nails. My thumb was burning so badly and she just kept working!! Finally, at the end, she put antiseptic on and ensured me it would feel better and heal. I wasn't expecting the antiseptic to make my thumb even more irritated. I asked her to stop coating my hands with anything else because the pain was getting to be too much. She then said that if she didn't finish my nail would be sticky. I really didn't care about my nails and I just wanted to leave and stop the appointment because everything she did made it burn worse. I'm sure the antiseptic prevented infection and cleaned the injury but I was not prepared for multiple coats of top coat and polish on top of the antiseptic. It was horrible.When I asked her to please stop, she finally got the point. The management was sitting next to me the whole time and witnessed everything. No one asked me what went wrong. When the gentleman checked me out, I knew he saw what happened, he didn't ask me for anything but to pay $45 and fill out my email and customer info. I told him i won't provide them with my information because I will not return. He didn't ask me for any detail. I left without tipping. I have never done that before but they had made me feel so crappy that I just couldn't justify a tip. I even called when I left because I wanted to talk to the manager without having the nail tech nearby; I hate confrontation. The manager wouldn't take my call!?!?!??Oh, and the white portion of the French is completely uneven. GRRRRRR.

3.description: I am writing this at the request of my girlfriend who is completely pissed off right now. A picture says a thousands words, but since she isn't fond of me posting what they did to her, basically picture this:You have a kid.Your kids asks you, "mommy, can I cut your hair?"You tell her "sure honey, cut my hair" because you love her, and seriously, how bad can it be?The kid starts chopping.That is the equivalent of what "B Bella" did to her bangs.Here is a recreation of her hair:|_--^_|   --- Her bangs.|  o o ||    ,    ||  __  |Best of all, apparently they had the balls to charge her for this "service" AND gave her change in singles, expecting a tip.To say the least, one star is generous.

35.description: My friend and I bought 2 Groupons for the Spa Mani-Pedi package for $35; this package is advertised here on Yelp! for $45.Pros: staff was not at all pretentious, complimentary coffee/tea/water, good parking, fair price for service rendered.Cons:  loud, cramped, sorta dirty, our tech (the only one working) was in pajamas, massage chairs for pedicures were terrible, kids were running around, people were using the salon as a lounge area...Let me say that our technician (I believe her name is Janiece? She only works weekends) was very friendly and treated us like old friends.  BUT, we wanted to get our services done together, and she was the only one working.  Our appointment was at 5:30, and we weren't completely finished until 9PM!  That's crazy!  The tech took a few people in between our mani/pedis, which I found to be very unprofessional.  As far as the package itself...honestly, I've had better mani/pedis done in the suburban nail joints closer to my house.  The tech kept going on and on about how her nail services are her "own innovations."  I didn't experience anything new or innovative in my mani/pedi.  We sat in cheap massage chairs, waiting for her to be finished with the other clients she took.  Our foot baths were cold by the time she arrived to service us.  She informed us that our extended foot baths were the spa portion of our package.  If that place is a spa, it's the worst spa experience I've ever had.  it was so loud and crowded in there, as the hair salon was not a separate space from the 2 pedicure chairs they had...which were right outside the bathroom.  That's really the spa experience I want: to watch people enter and exit the bathroom while struggling to hear what my friend is saying over the din of a crowded hair salon.She used your typical pedicure tools to trim/file our toe nails, and she gave us a "complimentary callous treatment."  WHAT?!  That's standard for a pedicure, in my opinion!  That's why you pay a technician to give you a pedicure; filing down the rough skin on my feet shouldn't be an extra service.  Her nail polish selection was bare minimal; she didn't have any black polish, which is what I wanted for my half-moon manicure.  The manicure portion was standard; not bad, but not stellar. Since the salon was so busy, cleanliness was not a strong point for this place.  I'm not 100% certain the tech disinfected the foot bath of the pedi chairs.  Icky.  The floors were pretty dirty, and everything appeared either aging or dingy.  The pics on their website are misleading at best.Overall, I won't be making the trip downtown to B Bella Salon for anything ever again.  I can get a comparably-priced mani/pedi at ANY suburban nail place, and it will be quicker and better than the experience my friend and I had.

19.description: Sadly, I never experienced this spa despite trying to use my groupon for a mani-pedi.  My first attempt at an appointment was rebuffed with "we don't honor it on weekends" although this was not mentioned in the fine print.  My groupon expired and I called the spa to see if I could still use it.  The receptionist said the manager would call me and took my name and number.  He never returned my call.I then visited the spa in person to plead my case to the manager.   He was very nice but said "no" with some weird excuse about the barcode.  It is my understanding that the merchants get the money from groupon whether the client uses the groupon or not.  I contacted groupon and sure enough, I was right.   As per groupon's contract, the merchants are supposed to honor the voucher for face value (what the buyer paid for it) even if it has expired.B. Bella Salon potentially lost a good customer as I'll never use them nor recommend them, even though they're in my neighborhood.  They need a lesson in good customer service.

28.description: I love this place! I initially went in February for a mani/pedi deal I had found on Groupon. The tech's name was Janice and she was amazing! The pedi was awesome and the mani was decent, but feet were her specialty and she was great at pampering them! While waiting on my service that day, I was watching the stylists work on ethnic hair... thick, natural ethnic hair and was impressed with how straight they got it. Today I went in because I came across a Groupon Now deal... $28 for a wash, blow dry, and flat iron... ummmm, yes PLEASE!! Booking was a breeze... originally booked for 3:30 b/c I was making some runs, but I finished early and changed appt to 2:30 with no problem. The lady who washed my hair (didn't catch her name) was AMAZING... my scalp feels crazy clean and fresh! My stylist was Yasmin and she was fabulous! She was fast and got my hair amazingly straight with minimal product... just how I like it! I was in and out in about an hour and 15 minutes. She used Marcels on my hair to straighten and curl it, and I was still allowed to use the Groupon. Nice and accommodating staff! Thoroughly impressed and will return to Yasmin in the future!!

45.description: as you can see...i am not a big fan of this hair salon.  I was a walk in because i live nearby the neighborhood.  The salon it self is real clean and trendy looking...nothing bad to say about that.  I had Yasmin as stylist and she was fine...she didn't really ask me much what i want from my hairstyle and just cut as she see please.  I don't really mind but a week after my haircut, my hair is still not  flowing correctly.  The most annoying thing about my experience in this hair salon is that Yasmin was constantly interrupted by her friend trying to talk to her.   The friend doesn't have much manners and clearly doesn't understand that she is servicing others ...can't she wait?  Yasmin just kept on being dragged away into the conversation! I don't know why she can't tell her friend to wait...that she has a client  to take care of first.  I really find that Unprofessional!I was nice and waited patiently but sometimes i wish i could just speak up.

33.description: I used to go to B'bella when Sara worked there as I love the way she did my hair but then she left and I did go back once and another girl (Tiffany I think) did my hair but I didn't like it so I won't go back as it's not the same. I wish I could find out where Sara went..sorry B'bella I won't be back!

43.description: two months ago i happened by the salon, thought it looked cute, and went for an impulse trim. George (the owner) was trying to force his salon door closed for the day (it was caught on a nail) and when i stopped, he gestured me inside even though he was "closing for the day" he told me he was the owner is his broken English and that my haircut would be $20. so cheap??? why?????? (i usually pay 50 to 70) i thought, fine, quick trim. He consulted with me, washed my hair himself (one star for the scalp massage) and i thought, this will be great! OH MY SWEET BABY JESUS. HE BUTCHERED THE SHIT OUT OF MY HAIR. HE CUT IT IN FIVE MINUTES AND WAS ACTUALLY LOOKING AT HIS FRIEND HE WAS CHATTING WITH WHILE CUTTING. i am in the business and i was watching his inconsistent angles, the poor way he held his scissors, and the fact that my cut was THREE INCHES SHORTER ON THE LEFT THAN THE RIGHT. i had this confirmed for me by Maggie at Hairitics salon when she beautifully cut the bullshit damage out of my hair. it took her ten minutes to figure out how to save it, as random chunks were out everywhere. George, if you read this, you should be deeply ashamed of yourself for being more interested in making a quick buck than of helping people look and feel better WHICH IS THE BUSINESS YOU ARE IN, YOU INCOMPETENT LITTLE MAN. PLEASE NEVER CUT HAIR AGAIN. LEAVE IT TO YOUR OTHER (SEEMINGLY BETTER STYLISTS)

2.description: Great salon for all hair types-Ruby is my colorist and she is excellent! Very few hair stylists can do it all well-Ruby is fantastic at color, excellent at hair cuts, great at color and great at styling. She spends time with you to get to know what you like- and she listens! She gives good ideas when you are looking for a change.......Ruby is top notch. I like this little salon---everyone is friendly and it's comfortable.....always a  relaxing experience.

18.description: This is my third salon with Rihad, with each move his prices have gotften better and his products have gotten better. Thanks to him, I no longer wear chemicals in my hair, my hair is longer and stronger than ever, and if I went for weekly appointments like I should, I am willing to bet I would never have a bad hair day. Seriously its that good.

41.description: Riadh has been my hairdresser for 5 years. I have had many opportunities to go elsewhere, but I've stayed because my hair has never been healthier.  He knows which products I need to use and helps me know what to do for in-between care.  Also he has a great sense of humor. Chris (hair washer) is hilarious too and gives me good hair advice too. Love the fact that this is a salon catering to everyone's hair type and men and women. I'm African-American and my good friend is Asian-American. We both go to BBella for great hair.  Highly recommend to everyone.

52.description: I followed the stylist Yasmin over to B. Bella Salon from 'Day's Salon & Spa,' mainly because she does an AMAZING eyebrow threading. I've gone through quite a few eyebrow stylists, and by far, I'm the most happiest with her work. I look like a NEW me after my threading.I recently went to the salon for a trim. Yasmin gave me a CUT! I was initially mortified, but after being honest with myself (going almost 2 months + without any trim) I had lots of split ends and my hair started to thin. I must say the trim...errr...cut, was cute and suited my face. I didn't get a blow dry, but I could imagine that it would have looked mighty nice.In the future I may consider getting my hair done at this salon. Oh and on a special note, it really does seem like they care about hair at this salon. Yasmin really wanted me to have healthy hair, thus the chop. At other salons, when I refuse, they just let me leave out with my stringy hair. Thicker healthier hair always trumps long thin hair (that's what I keep telling myself :o) ).

50.description: quick & affordable eyebrow threading.

4.description: awesome place!!!!!! threading done in STYLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Fast and jazzy environment!

6.description: Been wanting to try this salon for sometime as it is right down the street from where I live. I went  this past weekend for a color (wanted all 1 color to cover up the highlights i've had for the past year) and I needed a trim (trying to grow my hair out). I had been going to a different salon in the gold coast for a couple of years and was getting ok-service there from a junior stylist for the same price as I got a B Bella from someone who clearly knows what they are doing and has been doing it for many years. George cut, colored and styled my hair and it looks great.  I am going back next week for an up-do for a wedding instead of trying to do my own hair.The salon itself is clean and bright. I was 15 mins early and there is a nice waiting area. Someone attended to me right away to check me in and offered me water while I waited.  My appointment started on time and I did not feel as if I was being ignored. Overall, great experience and this will now become my new salon!

22.description: My husband bought a Groupon deal for me. I called on Mon and got a appointment for the time I wanted on Tuesday.  I arrived a few minutes early & waited till Lily finished with her client. She took my coat and I followed her to the back where the pedicure stations were. There are 2. She asked how I liked the water, hot or cold? I said hot, and it was. But, it felt great. She need a great job, spent more time on my toes than any one else had ever done. I had some polish with me, cuz I read the reviews prior to going & someone said their selections were limited. We then went to the front where Lily has a station. My nails look great. I am going to go back. The price is right and I really thought Lily was great. On the way out, I was handed some info on hair cuts and color. Also offered a discount. I am not sure I will take them up on this, but, we review them again if I do.

15.description: I love to try new places, but this place was dirty and sketchy. My nail technician was very sweet, but the overall ambience is lacking.

20.description: Let me first start off by saying how much I loathe eyebrow threading. The pain is unbearable for me. I've always wondered why some call it painless while I liken it to child birth.So I called at 9am looking for an early appt. the informed me they do both threading and waxing for eyebrowns. I opted for an eyebrow wax. My appt was for Ruby. I ran late but they saw me right away. She started with a painless wax and surprised me by following up with a painless quick shaping with the thread. My overall experience was  painless and my eyebrows were perfect! Ruby did an incredible job and I believe I found my new eyebrow person! Yay!!!!

36.description: I love B Bella Salon I feel like the money is worth the quality of service you are receiving.  I've been getting my hair done by Riadh for many many years and I will continue getting my hair done with Riadh for many more years to come.  Chris is the best hair washer/blow dryer I have ever experienced in my life and I dont think anybody can get any better than him.  I will keep coming here no matter what and if they leave no matter where they go I will follow right behind them :)

14.description: I haven't had a cut this good in a good while...my stylist Ruby was very knowledgable, her attention to detail was impeccable and I was impressed with her techniques and how she did an assessment of my hair with ease. I felt very comfortable and will certainly be returning for my next cut!

58.description: Great, great burgers.  Love them!

56.description: The food is very good taste, but service is not friendly, I think they would earn more with a more friendly and kind attention.

29.description: I'm puzzled by the less than stellar reviews for this place. I pride myself on my knowledge of fine burgers, and the burger here literally blew my socks off. LITERALLY literally. The Epic Burger is nothing short of amazing for a fast food chain burger.Perhaps whether you'll love Epic Burger comes down to whether you like Wendy's. (For my part, Wendy's is my favorite national burger chain.) Like Wendy's, Epic's patties are loosely packed and come with a distinct salty flavor. The cooked patties are then surrounded by the sweet, sweet love of an excellent bun. Epic is basically Wendy's turned to 11, and, in terms of regional, upper-scale chains, neither In N Out nor Shake Shack can come close.The fresh fries on the side was likewise great, and the shake made from actual strawberry ice cream really stood out.Summary: Epic Burger lives up to its name.

42.description: The staff was very friendly.  It was a casual place to eat.  The burger was delicicious as long as you held it in your hand!  I did until I finished it.  Other than that it was really greasy.   Fries were  really good!

23.description: Food was good, not a place i would go on a normal basis, food expensive,  they charge you for everything.

47.description: There are better burgers but this one still is satisfying. Also of note, the fresh cut skin on frenchfries. Both are good ol comfort food favorites. Friendly nice staff is always a plus.

8.description: Amazing food and even better service. Came here with some friends from law school and ordered burgers, fries, and milkshakes. They took great care of us!

31.description: I'm just going to go with three stars here. Nothing seriously wrong, but nothing all that great either. You might normally be happy about getting your food super fast, but to me that just means the food was sitting around already. The burger was pretty good, certainly not disappointing. The fries were pretty pedestrian. The shake, well, they said it is real ice cream, but I doubt that very much. Like others have said, it is good, but don't go out of your way to go there.

34.description: Epic Burger? More like Epic Bummer. From customer service all the way to quality of the meal, this experience is extremely subpar. Tastes like Smash Burger, what is that you might ask; Smash Burger is yet another overrated burger chain, much like Epic Burger. Cookies at EB are bomb as fuck though.

16.description: Amazing! I had turkey burger with avocado and special sauce. It was sooooo good. I also had French Fries and although they look really oily, were absolutely perfect!Great service! Very positive experience for my very first time at Epic

13.description: Cooling my heels on a frosty downtown Chicago day, I bumped into Epic Burger, started in 2008 and now with eight Chicagoland locations.  A straightforward, simplified menu, namely, a burger, a chicken sammie, turkey burger, portobello burger, fries, salad, snakes and fountain drinks, period.The emphasis is on quality ingredients, humanely raised, hormone free, and their beef supplier is Creekstone Farms of Kansas, which I personally believe now deserves the crown of the best burger supplier in America, bar none.You can add a choice of three different Wisconsin cheeses to your patty, nitrate free bacon, and condiments of your choice.  Fresh cut thick fries with sea salt are available solo or in a combo.Buns are baked fresh daily, the establishment uses real butter, cage free eggs, and the burger produce tastes like you grew it yourself.The patties are amply-sized, have a nice little char crust and are obviously (note pic) hand-formed.This is a real winner, as evidenced not only by my smile and warm belly, but by the company's acceptance leading to its growth.  Great burger, great fries, great value.Try one.  Or a double. Daily.

11.description: After reading the other reviews I have come to the conclusion that my taste buds are off or I did not eat at Epic Burger. I checked my receipt, yep, I ate there. So it must be my taste buds. I ordered the Junior Beef Burger Combo with cheddar cheese and all the fixings. The only thing I could taste was the ketchup I put on it, the lettuce and the pickle. The meat was FLAVORLESS! Also, there was special sauce?!? Couldn't tell. Plus, the cheese was sooooo melted it just looked like glue and tasted like nothing. Needless to say, I won't be back. A star for the fries and the fountain drink.

39.description: The food is great, but every time I've been here the employees have had bad attitudes. I've never felt so much condescension from a guy who's job is flipping burgers. Also, don't pay the $1.29 for avocado. It would be more appropriately advertised as a green sliver of overweight lettuce.

37.description: Great juicy ethical burgers. The epic sauce is also super delicious.

0.description: Lots of seating for a quick lunch. Kind of pricey but expected because of the non-go, organic, good stuff here. I went with an Epic Classic burger with bacon---no onions, no tomatoes. It was delicious. Epic sauce reminds me of the sauce from Cane's chicken. The wheat bun tasted fresh and the fries were fresh cut. I loved loved loved the fries. The ketchup at the tables are also GMO free! All natural ketchup! #winningGood for groups. Good for a solo lunch.

38.description: Very bland, flavorless meat. I think the cooks are afraid of seasoning. Salt and pepper go a long way in flavoring meat and vegetables. They do not do that at this place.

51.description: The burgers can be made of hamburger meat or Turkey! Selection of regular white or wheat bread, & toppings to choose from seriously made my burger. Surprised to see there was Bleu cheese & avocado. The fries weren't so good but the burger was

27.description: I personally didn't like these burgers. While it was cheap and there were plenty of good toppings, I didn't like the flattened, grilled meat patty.

32.description: Orgasmic food! Especially when you know you're eating quality ingredients. Great atmosphere, awesome service, and If I lived here I would become their regular customer. Yummy and well worth the money.

54.description: I'm not gonna lie, this place is a little expensive! Its basically a build a burger restaurant. You have choicrs like beef, turkey, mushroom, and more as your base and then you choose your cheese and other toppings. Though from the price, the workers were very patient and helpful with me. When they served me my burger, I could tell why its more expensive since the burger was soo good! If you're in the Loop area of Chicago, I'd recommend this place.

48.description: Had a delicious bacon, cheddar and egg burger. Dare I say, it was Epic (see what I did there).  Fries were very good . . better than I expected.  All very fresh. Courteous staff too!

44.description: Epic Burger rocks! Charlene's smile and upbeat charm made it all the more pleasurable ! Thank you for the mighty tasty Bacon Cheddar burger.

24.description: Ordered the Classic Burger and additional Jr. Burger for my wife. Both orders were way overcooked. Multiple areas there the burger meat was simply hard as a rock. Fries weren't too bad. Comparable to Five Guys standards is the best way to put it.Were done with the meal, saw some other people recommending the Peanut Butter Milkshake. Order one and proceeded to wait over 15 minutes before someone even began preparing it. I understand that this isn't "fast food" but this is just a lack on employees caring to fulfill orders in a resonable amount of time.Finally, the smell walking in the door and dust balls everywhere high on the walls. When was the last time the place was cleaned? Sure shows that it's been far too long.

7.description: I only eat turkey burgers. This burger was unlike any other; juicy, sweet, not greasy, not overwhelming in any way. Grilled onions, cheddar, lettuce, tomato and pickles on a wheat bun. The service was amazing and the atmosphere is chill.

49.description: The burger is nothing extraordinary but it feeds you which is the most important thing. I would never go out of my way to go here though, if I'm in the area I'll consider stopping by. Keep in mind, it's 6+ for only a burger. $10+ for a meal. Parking is fairly easy, their is meter parking for $4 an hour just south of Harrison street. They have a very large seating area with outdoor seating. the restrooms are fairly clean and you have to get a key from the cashier for it. They offer free wifi, but it's never worked for any of us (but not a big deal, here for your info). What can really kill your experience is the cashier that serviced us. There was no greeting, no smiling, no nothing. I felt like I was at the DMV. It was just give me your order and keep moving along. And she worked super slow, there were about 7-8 customers behind us and she was taking her sweet time punching in the order. I'm not kidding, the guy before us ordered one burger meal but the time to place his order took 3 minutes... Eventually another cashier came and opened up another register.The waiters were awesome though. They bring the food to your table. So the depressed cashier punched in our order wrong and my sister didn't get her fries. When we told that to the awesome waiter, he quickly ran to the back and got her fries and didn't ask us to pay for it.

40.description: I love here:) the burger very very juice, and casual relaxing environment, staff have good service, nothing can judge them except the price is a little high... Hehe... Btw, must order is Milk Shake

53.description: Glad I grabbed burger and fries here. The ingredients are top quality and I loved the texture of the burger patty (smashed and meaty). Wish I'd gotten the double but I was already back at the hotel before I tasted this goodness

30.description: I was very pleased to come to Epic Burger. It is not a "out of this world" burger, but it is well prepared and tasty. Fries are good too. I would come again here

46.description: Amazing! I had turkey burger with avocado and special sauce. It was sooooo good. I also had French Fries and although they look really oily, were absolutely perfect!Great service! Very positive experience for my very first time at Epic

1.description: I have to say, burgers with grass fed ingredients always peak my interest! They also had fried egg and avocado, so you know I was telling my friends to come with me to try this! I had friends who took photos of this place while we were on a conference so it was definitely on my bookmark list while visiting Chicago! I was overall satisfied with my meal! The burger was delicious and I felt I had ordered just the right amount when I ordered the junior epic burger. I ordered my epic sauce on the side instead of on the burger so I could dip these addictive fries in it. And all the flavors meshed together so well! I also greatly appreciated and got really excited for the wheat roll all over the photos. Very delicious and I almost ordered a second burger! As much as I enjoyed the meal, I have to lower my stars and rating for service. When initially ordering my food, I was baffled as to why my burger was missing so many ingredients I had asked to put on (and theoretically paid for), including a full order of fries. I asked for avocado and fried egg and they were missing from my food. They had forgotten tomatoes in my friend's burger as well. I also ultimately noticed they didn't give me a receipt and were unable to pull it up to check if I had already paid for it or if I was paying extra for fries I clearly ordered. They also didn't include my epic sauce on the side when asked. When approaching the cashier who took my order, he walked off and deferred it to someone else, which to me seemed very off putting. Luckily my friends and I were able to ultimately get all the components of my meal which were missing, but I had lost my appetite initially due to the sub-par customer service. I ended up getting everything I wanted but after the employees not exactly having the best tone about it. I ended up eating maybe 15-20 minutes after my friends did due to the amount of missing items plus feeling less excited about my meal due to how the employees made me feel. I'll come back for the food, but hoping service improves and that I get what I order.

55.description: Great food, great staff!  I'm visiting from New York and was told to try these burgers. I'm glad I listened! The burgers are exactly as advertised, just wish I had gone the whole wheat bun route instead of white bread. Vanilla shake was delicious and thick. The fries tasted great although as anywhere you go, sometimes they're oily/greasy.  The manager walked around and spoke with us, we told him about the fries and he brought us a brand new batch of fries on the house. If I ever come back to Chicago I will definitely come back and I will be back before I go back to NYC. I would compare them to Five Guys Burgers just healthier (I mean burgers fries aren't the healthiest option, you know?).

9.description: I'm puzzled by the less than stellar reviews for this place. I pride myself on my knowledge of fine burgers, and the burger here literally blew my socks off. LITERALLY literally. The Epic Burger is nothing short of amazing for a fast food chain burger.Perhaps whether you'll love Epic Burger comes down to whether you like Wendy's. (For my part, Wendy's is my favorite national burger chain.) Like Wendy's, Epic's patties are loosely packed and come with a distinct salty flavor. The cooked patties are then surrounded by the sweet, sweet love of an excellent bun. Epic is basically Wendy's turned to 11, and, in terms of regional, upper-scale chains, neither In N Out nor Shake Shack can come close.The fresh fries on the side was likewise great, and the shake made from actual strawberry ice cream really stood out.Summary: Epic Burger lives up to its name.

26.description: Nice environment, one of the good place to grab a lunch. Food was okay, feels like need more times on menu. Overall Good!

25.description: I was stuck in a conference next door and stepped out into the rain looking for anything other than the flavorless wraps that were being served up.What a find! $13 for a burger and malt is reasonable when you factor in cleanliness, friendly employees, fast service and really good food.The burger was perfectly cooked and piping hot, and the made it exactly as I requested it. I would definitely return!

12.description: This burger spot is across the street from my house & is perfect when I don't want to cook. I definitely recommend, it's a good cross between fast food and a sit down restaurant. Still Fast service but so much healthier & plenty of options for meat, cheese, sauces & toppings. Charlene helped us last time; she sang Happy Bday to my friend & was so patient while we picked out our burger options from the menu. An Epic experience! My only wish is that they had a rewards program.

59.description: I have never eaten not heard of an Epic Burger. This place was delicious. I would totally eat there again.

21.description: Amazingly delicious burger after the marathon!  Add an egg on top for even more epic-ness!!

17.description: Best burger in the south loop foods great service is better all the employes are super nice and the burgers are so big n juicy it melts in your mouth not to mention the fresh cut deep fried French fries that are made to order every time that

10.description: Very delicious option for burger craving patrons!  Try their double patty with fresh egg, and their legendary epic sauce.  I also like the root beer, and lemonade options they have for drinks.  The fries are very good as well!  One of my fav places to grab a burger!

5.description: Went here and got a hamburger with bacon and a fried egg. Not too bad.  Fries were good, good quality, friendly staff, and great wait time.  Even on a busy Wednesday night only took about 10 minutes.  Everything is fresh, which is another plus.

3.description: Food was delicious! Service on the other hand was absolutely terrible! This was my first time here, the girl upfront was of no help. There was no eye contact or effort on her side. When I was unsure, instead of a suggestion she just rolled her eyes. We were eating in, clearly stated that it was for here. When our food was brought out, it was in a to go bag. Management really needs to get their staff in order. Next time, I'll just have someone pick up the food.

35.description: Just finishing a delicious and easy lunch here. Think: Chipotle does burgers and you will have a good idea what to expect. Friendly, fast, clean and really well executed food. Thanks!

19.description: I'm not gonna lie, this place is a little expensive! Its basically a build a burger restaurant. You have choicrs like beef, turkey, mushroom, and more as your base and then you choose your cheese and other toppings. Though from the price, the workers were very patient and helpful with me. When they served me my burger, I could tell why its more expensive since the burger was soo good! If you're in the Loop area of Chicago, I'd recommend this place.

28.description: We eat alot of burgers. My wife is a pseudo vegetarian.  However, she eats hamburgers and hot dogs. I know it's weird but I gave up years ago. Now, on to the review.  We have been patrons of Epic Burger for several years now. We split our time between the Lincoln Park and State Street locations. In my experience Epic has always been on point. They have the thin and flat patties I enjoy. The flavor from their burger is mouth watering and keeps me coming back for more. The buns are buttered, soft and perfect. The fries are always delicious and their milkshakes are brilliant.

45.description: Excellent food!   Charlene is a true at to the company.  She greeted us with a smile, suggested the  BBQ bacon cheddar burger and had great enthusiasm!  I wish I could get that type of service everywhere!   I highly recommend Epic Burger

33.description: Being next door to where I stayed this summer, Epic Burger was a tempting option. However, the burgers are not very large and can get pretty pricey if you add toppings (it can be over $10 for a 3-4 topping burger).  Flavor-wise, it's probably better than the majority of burgers I've had but I don't eat burgers regularly so that's not really saying much.

43.description: Epic burgers are good quality.  The service is quick.  Epic Burger is a cute little burger joint to grab a casual, quick bite.The strawberry shake was delightfully creamy and rich.  Mmmmm.

2.description: Pretty good...but not quite "Epic"Tasty, all-natural, simple menu...great fries!  Sort of a cross between Smashburger and Five Guys, but with fewer options and not quite as much flavor.  Definitely worth trying, but don't get your hopes up too high.

18.description: I came here along with my two sisters when my oldest sister was in education at Roosevelt. I completely loved the burger from the first bite and had to take a break to process everything. Completely recommend for anyone in the area.

41.description: The service here is amazing! Everyone was very nice and helpful. Caleb cracked jokes and made us feel very welcome when we expected to just eat a turkey burger and go home lol! My wife and I had some delicious turkey burgers and shared a skinny PB shake. All of it was delicious.

52.description: The Epic Burger at this location is impressive--both the burgers and the fries. Food is wonderful, the service is friendly. I don't think I've ever had a better burger!

50.description: With the motto of "A More Mindful Burger," I envisioned some meat substitute being erroneously called a burger.  I also imagined my fatness being sad while I attempted to smash some science experiment passed my taste buds.  What I actually received was so much better!  This place definitely earned the manta of "Epic Burger."I was fresh off covering the first day of the NFL Draft in Chicago, IL, and after being around so much testosterone, tapas will not due!  You need something filling and you need something All American in nature, since I just finished covering American football.  I was strolling down many unfamiliar streets and came across a place that had two words of mystery and wonder on their moniker, Epic and Burger.  Well, what is more American than a hamburger combo?  Now it is not lost on me that the hamburger is probably a German invention named after Hamburg, Germany, it truly is not, but I am sure the way we tweaked the item makes it quite American!I walked closer to the door and terms like "humanely raised" and "caged free" made me feel as though I let America down with meat substitutes for this omnivore with tendencies that leans towards carnivore!  Ready about freshly baked bread is never a bad thing, but for some reason, when you start tinkering with meat, I just get nervous about the product!  They were advertising nitrate free this, cheese from Wisconsin that, organic milk whatever.  Wait, isn't milk organic anyway?  I digress!   I decided to walk pass the doors and at least smell the place.When you walk in, you are certain that there is actual meat in the place. You cannot step far into this place without noticing several good write-ups from various media outlets about this place.  I was not drinking the Kool-Aid, so I was definitely going to be unbiased in my tasting.   I was not sure what to get, so a quick look at the menu let me know two things, with the first being, this place is pricey.  The second thing being that they keep a small menu, which means that you have the potential to get tasty food and not filler items to make up for lack of taste.  I was uncertain what I should try, so I went with the manager's suggestion and got a cheeseburger fully dressed, with egg, and the same with a turkey burger but with cheese and an avocado slice.Can have a grain fed, all natural beef burger make a difference in taste and texture?  I am happy to report that it does.  The meat does not have quite the rubbery feel you get from eating burgers that has plenty of fillers inside.  The taste is almost sweeter to the palette as well.  You definitely feel the difference in the freshly baked bread as well.  They use real butter on the bread, so that was a great treat, but I think the real star of the night for me was the sauce.  I enjoyed the fact that my beef and turkey were not only juicy, but also spiced well, but something about that sauce sat right with me.  I appreciated that the fries were texturally very sound and season quite well also, but if I had the sauce for my burger to dip my fries into, I would like them much better.  I must admit that they options they have for your burger, such as Wisconsin cheese, avocado slices and caged free eggs, blend really well with your main dish.  They keep the add-ons low because they know they have a quality product that does not need the taste of inferiority masked.  All in all, this expensive meal was worth doing at least once.  I opted to get a fountain drink because I want to have an excuse to come back and try one of those organic milk shakes along with a chicken sandwich that time!  If you look at the menu, they even have vegetarian options which include a mushroom burger and freshly made real fruit smoothies.  You can even get your burger without a bun if need be.  They have all types of customizations for your preferences and enjoyment.Make sure you ask about cross contamination from peanuts, if nut allergies are in your DNA, because they do use fresh ingredients all around, and not only with the meat and buns. They have multiple discounts which includes students and law enforcement, so they definitely have an added bonus for doing so. You know I am a fan of loyalty card programs, and this place definitely does have that.  They also are a BYOB establishment, but there are some beers that they don't allow on premises, so contact them, or their website for those exceptions.  There is also an email list, so I am sure that will provide you with even further discounts.I normally would allow for a burger chain to only get 3 out of 5 stars, but I feel confident giving them an extra star for all of the healthy options that you are presented.  You can actually check their napkins for further explanation of the many healthy options you have. Dinner at Epic Burger is fat man approved, but definitely not frugal meter approved!  The sauce though - the end!tinyurl.com/qe6tfme

4.description: I stopped by epic burger with my son for an early dinner while on a daddy-son weekend. The burgers are pretty big and were tasty, although a little greasy. The service was also slow and they got my order wrong. My little guy enjoyed it, so I was happy...P.S. the bill for the 2 of us was 35 dollars for burgers and fries. That's steep for what we received, not in a rush to return

Dinner at Epic Burger is fat man approved, but definitely not frugal meter approved!  The sauce though - the end!tinyurl.com/qe6tfme

22.description: OMG the turkey burger are by far the best I've had compared to some of these other places who sell frozen patties.. I only eat turkey I will definitely be returning to this place soon oh I had my burger delivered from postmates

15.description: The burger is nothing extraordinary but it feeds you which is the most important thing. I would never go out of my way to go here though, if I'm in the area I'll consider stopping by. Keep in mind, it's 6+ for only a burger. $10+ for a meal. Parking is fairly easy, their is meter parking for $4 an hour just south of Harrison street. They have a very large seating area with outdoor seating. the restrooms are fairly clean and you have to get a key from the cashier for it. They offer free wifi, but it's never worked for any of us (but not a big deal, here for your info). What can really kill your experience is the cashier that serviced us. There was no greeting, no smiling, no nothing. I felt like I was at the DMV. It was just give me your order and keep moving along. And she worked super slow, there were about 7-8 customers behind us and she was taking her sweet time punching in the order. I'm not kidding, the guy before us ordered one burger meal but the time to place his order took 3 minutes... Eventually another cashier came and opened up another register.The waiters were awesome though. They bring the food to your table. So the depressed cashier punched in our order wrong and my sister didn't get her fries. When we told that to the awesome waiter, he quickly ran to the back and got her fries and didn't ask us to pay for it.

57.description: Good food, good staff, not much more to say. Its a burger joint.

20.description: I'm a frequent visitor of this location, and I'm always pleased. This place makes a really good burger, and uses very fresh ingredients. Although this is more of a fast food style place, the quality of food and staff far beats full blown burger restaurants in the area. They also make a mean milkshake which you should definitely grab on your way out.

36.description: Fantastic angus burger and portobello burger with lots of options. The shakes were amazing too.  We will definitely go back and recommend others.

14.description: This place was delicious and super easy to find an autoimmune protocol, paleo diet friendly meal here- plus the meat is antibiotic free! Also very fast service.

12.description: I don't know what to say about this salon.  I've always had bad experiences at salons as a whole.  This experience was very different.  I walked in there and no one speaks. It's so quiet with the exception of the blow dryers and water running.  People look at you and still no speaking.  It was creepy! LOL  They even make you get your own drape from the open closet/coatrack.  That was odd.  I had my hair washed and blown dry and flat ironed.  Let's say I left there looking uglier than when I went in.  My hair was a frizzy mess. Luckily I had my cap with me.

3.description: Where is the 0 star option? As a black woman with short hair it's very hard to find a good stylist. I was on the hunt for a good colorist and I was referred to Josef from a lady i met at the mall. And after seeing her hair I was excited to go here. I didn't know it at the time but it turns out to be the same salon my mom had been going to for more than a decade. So I figured that I was in good hands. I wanted them to die my hair from dark brown to blonde, which is a difficult process so I wanted it done professionally. I was shown a hair swatch of what my color would look like and I gave them the ok to proceed with the color. And now I'm walking around looking like a pumpkin by the head. My hair is the color of apricots. And to top it off the color is uneven. The roots are a orangey blonde and the ends are a really light orangey brown. And to top the top off Magid, who supposedly is good with short hair, had the worst technique in styling my short hair. Short edges + blow dryer + small barrel brush= electrocution hair style. When I informed Magid of my dissatisfaction I was told that I should just leave. The nerve of a business man to behave in an ill trained and ill mannered way. I would never go back. Magid has piss poor skills and horrible customer service.

1.description: I really didn't want to write a review but I am so upset about my hair cut. I even gave Magid a second chance after his first cut where I had to go back because he cut my hair so uneven that i couldn't take it. It was a bob where the front was longer then the back but apparently so was the left side from the right. When I drove all the way back downtown to fix it he laughed at me and said it wasn't that bad but proceeded to take over 2 inches off the left side to even it out. I still liked how he had straightened my hair and really enjoyed the lady who washes your hair so I tried again. I admit I wasn't very specific but I did say I wanted my hair shorter but still long enough in the back and I wanted to keep it angled. He said "I got it" very confidently so I trusted he knew what I wanted. But then his first cut took maybe over 5 inches off the back right side so there wasn't much I could do then to stop him. After he was done cutting I made sure the sides were even which they weren't and had him cut more on the left. He explained this was a different cut where he cut on an angel not straight like a bob. I was still worried when it was all done that it was not even and was shocked how short it looked. Then he tells me "don't focus on if u hair is even by an inch or so. You're young That's what 70 year old women do. " I laughed because I was shocked but how disrespectful!! What kind of stylist says don't worry if your hair is even!!! So my hair is way to short! It's cut unevenly all over. He didn't even ask where I wanted my part. And the worst part is it's too short and uneven in the back that all my new growth and neckline hairs are exposed.  It seems he does what he wants when styling hair. I should have never gone back after he didn't apologize to me the first time!!!!

2.description: Magid was my stylist.  I literally had some time to kill and I'm pretty laid back when it comes to hair cuts.  I needed a trim and was just passing by the salon.  The trim itself was average and I can't complain.  He got all the split ends in 15 minutes.  It was $35 so I bit steep for 15 minutes of work.  I guess fast can be good too.  Perhaps he's just that good but he also didn't seem very enthusiastic.  It was like he was restless and bored.  As I was paying he pulled out his cigarettes to get ready for his smoking break.  The place kind of smelled like smoke when I walked in but it was probably just te stylist.  I say this with respect, that I felt like I could of had the same or better experience at Hair Cuttery or Hair Clips.  Sorry to say.  The salon ambience and style looked meek as well.  Overall a sub par experience.  I doubt I'll ever return.  Now to look for a place to have some coloring done for the summer!

9.description: Just got my hair cut by Joseph and it is my favorite haircut I've ever had.  He gave me a very modern, youthful, bouncy 'do.  I feel like a million bucks.  Bonus:-- The staff is incredibly friendly and laid back.  I don't know how to describe it-- they just all seem like really cool, really nice people.-- The shampoo is amazing.  The first time I was there, there was a shampoo person, and this time Joseph did the shampoo himself.  They definitely take their time (in a good way). Both times I could've fallen asleep with my head in the sink.-- Joseph was thorough in asking me what I wanted to do with my hair before he started cutting (do I use a blow-dryer at home? what products do I use?).  I especially appreciate his taking the time to make sure it's a style that I will be able to do myself every morning before work.-- After we figured out what I wanted he gave me a really great haircut.  It's modern, it complements my round face, and it looks and feels great.  -- Took less than an hour.This is the second time I have been in-- the first was just for a trim, but a fabulous experience as well.  Highly recommend it!

10.description: Magid's is the best. I moved from Tennessee to the Chicago area two years ago and I've tried a few different stylists, but haven't been able to find THE ONE.  I was a little skeptical at first but I called anyway and got a same day appointment with Magid.  I was in need of touch-up, but he was able to shampoo, blow dry, and flat iron my hair to perfection! My hair looked exactly as I wanted it to with alot of body.  I was in and out of there in 1 hour and 15 minutes.  His prices are very reasonable and lower than what I expected. Looks like I found a new hair stylist!!

4.description: I've been getting my hair done by Magid and then by Joseph since 2002. I will never go to another place as they really know how to take care of my hair. Joe is not only one of the best hair stylists in the city, he knows my hair. Not sure about those having different experiences or leaving one star is ridiculous. As long as I've been coming here, I can say without a doubt that this is the best place for black hair care in Chicago. I get a million compliments every single time I get my hair done. Don't listen to anyone with a negative review. I am talking about 12 year's worth of experiences with these guys.

6.description: I'm a fan of Madgids for sure!! I am transitioning from relaxed to natural hair.  After I took my sew in out, my hair was pretty weak and damaged.  I was worried that he wouldn't know what to do with it, especially because it was already short and I wanted to wear it straightened.  Well guess what, homeboy did know what to do!  He cut me down pretty short and then got my hair the straightest its ever been!  I've been back once since and had a great experience.

15.description: Soooo I cheated on my hairdresser. I needed my hair done for Thanksgiving (a girl can't go meeting her boyfriend's family for the first time looking all disheveled), and my usual stylist was booked solid, so I  was on the hunt for a back-up. I was a little nervous in my search, as i have very thick, natural african-american hair, and am often times charged double what I'm quoted on the phone once i get in the chair. I called and spoke to Magid directly and described what I wanted done over the phone, and had an appointment for the next day. I got in early, and was immediately washed and blowdried by the two assistants. They were a little too chatty for my taste, but they both did a good job. Then I was off to Magid, who blowdried and styled me again to a silky shine, and trimmed up my ends. My hair looked fabulous, He charged what he said he would and my boyfriend loved it, so everybody wins! In the event that I can't get in to see my regular stylist, I'll definitely go see Magid again!

0.description: I had to update the update....BECAUSE...OMG! And add a star. This is one of those reviews, where you're not sure you want to divulge the information because you snottily don't want someone to have the same goodies as you (but I'm working through that selfishness people).JEROME CAN DO HAIR YALL!!!!! YAAASSSSSSSS! YAAASSSSSSS!Let me tell you, I woke up this morning a BRAND NEW WOMAN! Full thick hair, bounce, shine, style...that hair did everything but put my celebrity crush in bed next to me...and if I got my ass to CA, it could possibly do that too!I was super elated when I found an amazing eyebrow stylist...but now I have the "it" factor in the hair category, an amazing artist (hair is a true art). I'm not just looking for pretty hair. I want healthy, strong, and gorgeous hair. I can check that off the list. 2015...watch out!!!! So, run your happy asses to Magid's Hair Studio and ask for Jerome! ----------------------Okay there are so many conflicting views on here about this Salon. So as a long time client that has used three different stylists, let me give you my honest feedback: After 7 years, this salon is far from perfect and at times I've strayed away to visit other stylist to see if I could find better. The reason that I've comeback time and time again is because as a natural head, I needed long lasting results and for the most part I got that here. Magid aka "Magic": He's the owner and he was the very first stylist I went to prior to his current location. I believe that he's good at his craft for basic blow outs. Joseph (the brother): I love his personality, but more so, he is really talented with a flat iron. He listens to his clients and he cares about what they want. The case majority of photos on my yelp are blowouts from him! I ended up being Joseph's client for the last 5+ years. Jerome: On a recommendation from Joseph, I wanted more creativity with my natural hair. My hair had finally reached a really great length and constant blowouts for me were not a way of necessarily retaining the length. I really love Jerome's capability and understanding with natural hair. I feel so confident about having more control of my hair shed, my product knowledge, and making sure that at the end of the day I have the healthiest head of hair possible. He's now my main stylist and I'm really happy. The Cons: - I personally don't think this is the type of salon you come to for custom color or for any other style aside from a simple blow out. - if you want the latest cut, I don't think it's going to be here either. They really just specialize in natural hair. It's the bulk of their business. While individual stylists do varying degrees of stuff, recognize the overall capabilities of the salon. - I don't get perms/relaxers or any color from here. Wait actually once I did get color, but it was minimal and I honestly can't recall, but I was satisfied with the results. Honestly, I'd only go to a place that I KNEW specialized in it or did a significant amount of color in a week. - the one barber they have on staff is RUDE and HONORARY. He doesn't know how to respect women or keep a professional demeanor around clients. I literally took a star off, because I choose off days to avoid this man! This is a family owned business. The brothers are really great and they're kind. Advice: use sound judgement when deciding to get chemicals put in your head from a salon that has more business doing the opposite. You can expect to be in and out on time. The location is good and there's plenty of paid parking. Hair is a really finicky thing. Ask all the right questions before you agree to getting anything done.

5.description: I'm from LA just on vacation and I was looking to get some highlights done for new years. Magids took me in right away! :)I usually like to talk and ask many questions and I felt welcomed. I enjoyed listening to Magids' story about how his father taught him the craft of hair styling and is still  working well in his 70's. A family of talented hair dressers! The service was very fast and the highlights were the right tonality, being a filmmaker myself I can be very picky when it comes to color. I am very happy to have met a new stylist and a friend. Thank you.Happy New year Magids and Joseph!

13.description: This is the best hair salon I've ever been to. I was in and out within 1.5 hours and Magid was friendly and professional. This was my first trip to a salon after removing my dreads and Magid was up for the challenge. I left the salon with the blunt bob with heavy bangs I'd asked for--my hair looked EXACTLY like I hoped it would and he didn't pressure me to relax my hair (in fact, he told me I never should--a good stylist should be able to get my texture straight with a blow-out and flat iron only). Magid and the other stylist on staff (his brother, I think?) work wonders with a blow dryer and flat iron--my hair has never been straighter. Every woman who left the shop while I was there looked spectacular. I highly recommend this salon.

11.description: I enjoyed this visit...it was quick and my hair looked amazing. This is my second time going to Joseph. He is kind and a Good stylist. I have natural hair and its a new adventure so I appreciated the fact that he told me what to expect over the next few months.

8.description: It's been so long since I've been on yelp, that I forgot to come back and send an update to this review.  I haven't been going to him since April 2010.Magid is ridiculous.  Since he got his new shop, he became extremely arrogant.  He cut my hair completely uneven during a lunchtime appointment, and when I got back to the office, I noticed it, and so did my colleagues.  So I called to go back in for a fix later that evening, and when I got there, he never admitted to the fact that the cut was a butchered mess, and offered to fix it by cutting it another inch to even it out.  Heck NO!!  So, as I was a client for about a year, I expected some sort of consolation, like a discounted or free next visit.  Instead, he offered me back the $10 for the "cut," and I just balled it up and left it on his desk.  Everyone in the salon saw the exchange, and even his stylists saw that the cut was fudged up and just shook their heads.  I haven't been back since.  He's ridic.I've since then found a much better downtown lunchtime salon, and my hair has never been healthier.

14.description: Joseph did a great job and gave me a great hair cut! Cost me about $60 for both. Great service but the threading lady was HORRIBLE!!!!!

7.description: *sighs* You don't know what you got until it's gone.....Joseph how I miss you so much! I have yet to find a replacement since I moved to NYC. I would fly back home every weekend if I could just to get my hair done by your masterful hands.

58.description: What an abomination.We went here after a movie at the Roosevelt Collection. Here's what we ordered:appetizer: bruschetta. The bread was stale and too greasy. I thought that was forgivable since they're a steakhouse, not an Italian restaurant.entree: flat iron steak (me), lamb rack (hubby). Oh my, they were both NOT good. Especially considering this place is supposed to specialize in steaks. It appears they use the same sauce for both of these dishes. For a bill of $80, this "steakhouse" is soooo not worth it, even if the ambience, location, and service was ok.

56.description: I cannot believe how disappointed I am to be writing this review. After living here for almost three years, my wife and I were SO excited to finally have a restaurant within our complex. We decided to meet my sister at Chop for supper last night, a Friday evening. Since I'm usually more time-sensitive, I chose to head on down to Chop to secure our table. We had a reservation for 3 at 5PM. I arrived and the first thing I thought was "Where's the rest of the restaurant?". This place is tiny TINY. I'm guessing they have tables for maybe 50 diners, at most. In addition, many of the tables and chairs backed up into each other, and I can't imagine it's very comfortable in there if it ever gets crowded.Anyway, I was shown to my booth, and a few minutes later, my sister arrived. We decided to wait for my wife before ordering, and had water. If you're looking for a quiet place, this is NOT your kinda joint. The music was excruciatingly loud, and despite sitting directly across from each other, we couldn't hear each other without yelling and cupping our hands behind our ears. We asked our server (Tommy) if he could do something about that, and he accommodated us by turning the volume down a bit. It was somewhat better, so thanks. Right after that, I had to use the rest room, and the music was EVEN LOUDER in there than it was in the restaurant.
