I had to almost run out of there because I couldn't stand the sound level.My wife arrived not long after that and my sister and I asked for refills of our water. Almost simultaneously we both noticed an "off" smell to the water. Now, understand, we live in the same building, and I have to believe we share the same water supply as Chop, but the water was so bad, I couldn't drink mine, and my sister had to add the juice of an entire lemon. Had I not been very thirsty, I would have sent the water back, but I sipped it to quench my thirst. Yuk.My wife order a cocktail to start her night, and when it arrived, she was very pleased. The "Garlands for the Dead" was delicious. OK, good start.I ordered a blue cheese burger for my entre', my wife ordered Oysters Rockefeller and a Caesar Salad and my sister, after consulting with Tommy to ensure she understood the "doneness" of Chop's steaks, asked for a filet mignon, cooked medium. After not too long, our food arrived. The first thing my sister noticed was her steak was overcooked. Um, Tommy? He gets it, and returns the steak. So now my sister has to sit there with no food while my wife and I either eat our food, our we wait for her and our food gets cold. Very VERY bad sign.My sis tells us to go ahead, and I have to say my burger was good, although the size of the small cooked patty was dwarfed by the average-sized bun.  Now, things went from bad to worse. My wife's Oysters looked great, but they smelled "off" (here's that term again). We both have lived for extended periods of time on the Gulf of Mexico, so we've had oysters many times, and we know that they do have a particular odor to them. These, however, stunk like no oysters either of us had ever smelled. Rather than make a scene, my wife (who is very sensitive to smells) ate a couple and said they actually tasted pretty good, but on her third oyster, she put something very UN-oyster like in her mouth and almost immediately got sick to her stomach, spit it out and raced to the bathroom to be throw up. My sister followed her to the bathroom to check up on her. I called Tommy over and told him what had happened. We both immediately smelled the oysters again, and that's when it hit me - they smelled like feces. Yep, that's what I said. He took them away and went to tell the Chef. My sister came back after a couple minutes to report that my wife was still sick to her stomach and was trying everything possible to get the taste, smell and texture out of her mouth. Tommy came back and told us the Chef said "that's how oysters smell". Really?At that point, my sister and I decided we had no interest in eating anything that came from a kitchen that would serve something that smelled that horrendously, and that it would be best if we just left, paying for my wife's drink and leaving something for Tommy, as it wasn't his fault. We pushed our food aside and waited for my wife's return.My wife came back from the bathroom visibly and understandably upset, and she couldn't even stand to be in the restaurant. She left to go outside, and my sister and I spoke with the manager, Ashley. While apologetic, at this stage there wasn't much she could do.We were worried that my wife would end up in the ER, but luckily, after our experience ruined a rare night out for us, she's OK today.So, we won't be going back to Chop,EVER, and strongly recommend you take your hard-earned money elsewhere. VERY loud music, crowded dinging room, odd smelling water, improperly cooked filet, and worst of all, putrid smelling and sickening oysters.

29.description: We walked in here really wanting this to be a good/great experience because there's nothing like it in the South Loop.  Regrettably it fell short in so many areas.  The space is piercing loud; when a table or chair is moved its like nails on a chalkboard.  The lighting is usually bright against the mural.  Chairs were falling backwards because their tops are too heavy (this happened to us, too).There are a few staff that genuinely care about what's going on here, yet a few that don't have that genuine servitude attitude that matters.  For example, a nearby guest accidently spilt an entire glass of water on the table; the hostess stopped by, handed them a napkin and walked away.  The look on the guests face was priceless.  In fact, everyone around watched this episode and were equally disheartened.  Moments later the Manager and staff jumped on the matter - which we were all glad to see. The food ... was mostly a disappointment.  First the good: the ribeye ($39) was outstanding;.  The steak poutine was also a winner, though pricey.  The bad: the Nicoise Salad was should be taken off the menu; the double pork chop ($29) was way to dry to enjoy (I was starving & in no mood to fuss, so I ate it).  The side vegetables were flat.  Perhaps the menu is too ambitious for the small kitchen.  Its difficult to tell.Our server was friendly, however lacked product knowledge.  The cocktails were good.In short, Chop fell way short of simple expectations.

42.description: Some things on the menu are good - prime rib sliders, French onion soup, crab cake. But what is NOT good are the overpriced entrees - steaks, lamb etc - definitely the worst I've had. But what really gets me is after spending about $125 on dinner for two - they don't offer free refills on soda that they serve in skinny bar glasses. It is not likely that I will return for a good sit down dinner - maybe just appetizers and drinks at the bar in a pinch.

23.description: It's in a great location next to the movie theatre. Beyond that it's nothing special. I've eaten there 3 times and each time the service was painfully slow. Drinks are slow to arrive and the food is just ok. Over priced. I won't be going back.

47.description: My wife and I ate here Saturday night.  Had I read the reviews here, we might have skipped this restaurant, which would have been too bad.  As it was, it more than met my (modest) expectations of a nice place to go before a move in the adjacent Ikon roosevelt theater.  I admit that the euphoria of being out without the children for a change allowed us to overlook problems that I might have focused on were I in a less generous mood.This restaurant has the significant virtue of being the only restaurant in the complex that houses our go-to cinaplex.  There is nothing else but fast food and a diner within walking distance.  If owners' can't make a success of this, they probably shouldn't be in the restaurant business.The complex in which Chop resides is basically a small shopping mall with some rental housing, and Chop is what one would expect for one of the "nicer" restaurants in city or suburban mall.  It is small, but opens up onto an outdoor seating area which is very pleasant on a nice fall night.  The bar takes center stage, visually, and there's a large beer selection.  The menu has no particular focus.  In a nod to the restaurant's name, there are several kinds of steaks on the menu.  There are also a variety of fancied-up hamburgers/turkey burgers/vegy burgers that are not inexpensive, but still decidedly less than steak house prices.  (Also decidedly smaller, which is fine.)  Appetizers include mac 'n cheese, oysters rockefeller as well as "East and West Coast" oysters (six for $10, 12 for $16)..The waitress meant well, but was desperately in need of training.  We were surprised that she was unable to name any of the beers on the menu without squinting (along with us) at the list behind the bar across the room.  When my wife said she'd like a dark beer, the waitress asked if that meant something "like an IPA."  (Even if you know nothing about beer, you might know what the "P" stands for -- hint: it's a word that means the opposite of dark.)When I asked what the East and West coast lobsters were, the waitress looked bewildered, and then volunteered that she believed they were oysters rockeffeller.  I explained that while oysters rockefeller were on the menu, I was asking about the raw oysters.  She went to ask someone but didn't seem to retain the variety's name long enough to make it back to our table, because the word she came up with was incomprehensible. She looked so uncomfortable trying to say it, that we decided to let the question go unanswered rather than embarrass her further.Throwing caution to the winds, we ordered oysters anyway, and I'm glad we did.  They were on the small side, but very fresh, and the mignionette sauce and horseradishy cocktail sauce were both very good.We weren't in the mood for steak -- I might try one next time.  My burger, though not the medium rare I had ordered (more like medium well), was nevertheless tasty, as was my wife's turkey burger.  Fries were excellent as was the martini I ordered.In short, this is an ok restaurant for what it is -- a fun place to go before or after a movie. I don't expect that anyone will be going out of there way to visit this as a dining destination anytime soon, nor should they. That said, some effort to train staff about the food and drink offerings is definitely warranted.  Given that it is relatively new, I'm willing to overlook this and other issues that would definitely disqualify this for even three stars in a more established place.

8.description: Stopped here to eat before seeing a movie next door and in retrospect I should have just filled up at the concession stand. Where to start? We sat at the bar and ordered 2 shots of fireball - a couple of minutes later we were told that they were out of fireball so we changed our order to Jameson - and were told that they were currently out of that as well...oh and the wine we ordered was out as well (can't make this up). My wife and in ordered shrimp cocktail and Scottish salmon for lunch. Once the food arrived the cocktail sauce (using the word sauce lightly) was not sauce but frozen chunks of cocktail sauce. The salmon was warm at best and not cooked all the through. Needless to say we won't be back any time soon...or any time later.

31.description: Stopped here to eat before seeing a movie next door and in retrospect I should have just filled up at the concession stand. Where to start? We sat at the bar and ordered 2 shots of fireball - a couple of minutes later we were told that they were out of fireball so we changed our order to Jameson - and were told that they were currently out of that as well...oh and the wine we ordered was out as well (can't make this up). My wife and in ordered shrimp cocktail and Scottish salmon for lunch. Once the food arrived the cocktail sauce (using the word sauce lightly) was not sauce but frozen chunks of cocktail sauce. The salmon was warm at best and not cooked all the through. Needless to say we won't be back any time soon...or any time later.

34.description: I'm on a carb restricted diet currently,  and am limited as to where i can eat.  I checked out the menu here before coming and it looked pretty good as fat as selections.  They carried burgers,  steak,  salads,  etc.  I decided on their turkey burger with grilled veggies instead of fries,  and it was very good.  The burger patty was delicious and the grilled chopped veggies were also good. I also had a taste of the asparagus and fries that others ordered.  Everything was good.  I will definitely be coming back here in the future.  It's very conveniently located in Roosevelt Commons and we were able to eat here before going to Icon for a movie. The prices were reasonable... $10-$13 each fir lunch.

16.description: This is for service only since I waited 10 minutes to get a menu after being told multiple times "I'll be right there".  People were cancelling their orders and walking out as they were trying to make it to the nearby movie theater.  Total failure by the management team on a Saturday afternoon to staff with only a bartender for the whole place.

13.description: We walked in here really wanting this to be a good/great experience because there's nothing like it in the South Loop.  Regrettably it fell short in so many areas.  The space is piercing loud; when a table or chair is moved its like nails on a chalkboard.  The lighting is usually bright against the mural.  Chairs were falling backwards because their tops are too heavy (this happened to us, too).There are a few staff that genuinely care about what's going on here, yet a few that don't have that genuine servitude attitude that matters.  For example, a nearby guest accidently spilt an entire glass of water on the table; the hostess stopped by, handed them a napkin and walked away.  The look on the guests face was priceless.  In fact, everyone around watched this episode and were equally disheartened.  Moments later the Manager and staff jumped on the matter - which we were all glad to see. The food ... was mostly a disappointment.  First the good: the ribeye ($39) was outstanding;.  The steak poutine was also a winner, though pricey.  The bad: the Nicoise Salad was should be taken off the menu; the double pork chop ($29) was way to dry to enjoy (I was starving & in no mood to fuss, so I ate it).  The side vegetables were flat.  Perhaps the menu is too ambitious for the small kitchen.  Its difficult to tell.Our server was friendly, however lacked product knowledge.  The cocktails were good.In short, Chop fell way short of simple expectations.

11.description: I had a pretty disappointing experience eating here. I stopped by Chop with a friend after catching a movie on a Friday night. She ordered the French Onion Soup and I ordered a Salad Nicoise with seared tuna. The soup was so salty that my friend could barely finish half of it. And my salad had no dressing. Just dry greens with some tiny pieces of seared tuna. When I asked the waiter if the dressing came separately he told me quite confidently "this salad doesn't come with sauce". I asked if they had any dressing I could add and he offered caeser or ranch. When I hailed a second waiter he told me they could bring me some balsamic vinaigrette. When he finally brought that out it was just pure vinegar and I had to wait again to have him bring me olive oil. He also brought out the soft boiled egg that was supposed to accompany the salad - 10 minutes after they had initially delivered my food and it was cold. When my friend asked if the soup came with a baguette our waiter said "what's a baguette?"We were not given a discount or even an apology for the mixup and delay with our food. Our waiter didn't seem to have received much training or have any knowledge of the menu. I would not return and eat here again which is a shame because I love coming to the nearby movie theater

39.description: Food was awesome. But the it is pricey considering the decor - very casual. Service was excellent. Don't recommend the veggie side. But the twice baked delicious and the dipping sauce really good. Ribeye and KC Strip both excellent. Also noisy. Music over speakers too loud. Food - 5Noise and decor given price knock it down to a 4.

37.description: The lighting and atmosphere is more Wing Stop then CHOP. The server we had was distracted, and didn't know the difference between a beer menu and tequila menu. And after all that, I took way too long to get our food. The two couples around us were experiencing the same half-rate service. You can't be in the restaurant business in this town  and offer such shoddy service and mediocre food. Too bad.

0.description: Food was awesome. But the it is pricey considering the decor - very casual. Service was excellent. Don't recommend the veggie side. But the twice baked delicious and the dipping sauce really good. Ribeye and KC Strip both excellent. Also noisy. Music over speakers too loud. Food - 5Noise and decor given price knock it down to a 4.

38.description: My friends and I stopped in a couple of weeks ago for a bite before a movie.  While the burgers were pretty good, the service was lackluster. Our gal seemed a bit overwhelmed and was somewhat non-existent.  I cut her some slack and thought, perhaps a bit more experience and time will help the service problems.  What is my bigger issue, is they overcharged us all.  It's not a large sum of money, but it's the point now.  One of my friends has called multiple times, I called and then we also stopped in person once.  On one of the calls, they told my friend it was a "computer glitch" and that it happened to many people.  Most surprising, is that each time we've contacted the restaurant, we were told a manager was not on duty.  Now, how is a restaurant supposed to function without a manager ever on duty?  I'll tell you - it won't.  I waited a bit to do my review to give them a chance to make it right.  To date, they have still not made the adjustment on our credit cards - even after the last stop in person where we were assured by the "chef" - you heard me, as he was the most senior person working that day, that he would make sure it was taken care of for us.  A bit of advice, pull it together Chop or you will be out of business in less than 6 months.  I'd rather skip a meal at your joint and just get a larger popcorn at the movie.

51.description: Food was excellent. Thumbs up on the sliders and the calamari. Nice bar staff (where we sat). Some improvements would help - no clean shared plates offered in between servings. Bar tvs oddly placed. Wine list is weak. Parking 90 minute rule is NONSENSE - even the staff has to pay for parking! WTF?!But overall, better than expected, especially considering some of the reviews. Would have gone 3.5 stars but didn't know how, and went 4 cause the staff was great.

27.description: Poor service, high prices and mediocre food, was happy to see a good place open in the mall, but sadly won't be returning.

32.description: Despite many negative reviews on this place, we decided to give it a try after watching a movie at Roosevelt Collection. Since the reviews were either loving it or hating it, I decided maybe the negative reviews were on a bad day. Well, we picked another bad day.First of all, the seating is horrible. There are approximately 6 booths that hold 3 adults in a C shape. They add chairs onto the tables to get 4 or 5 at these booths. This blocks the aisles and makes the place even more congested. It seems almost as if this was designed to be a bar, but they decided to add a dining room in the bar.On the other side of the "dining room" there are tables for 2 that are so close to each other, you might as well be dining with the table next to you. I am not into eating when the couple next to you can hear your conversation and vice versa. We had to wait for one of the booths, even though the dining room was not even half full. The other half of the room is the bar. There are no booths there, just high tables for 2 and the bar itself, which you can sit on the stools. It looks like a decent place to drink, but we were there to eat. Onto the meal....Service overall was good, even though there are many negative reviews. Our server tried, and so did the hostess. It's not their fault. Look what they're dealing with. This is a management and kitchen problem.Okay, so our waitress asked if we would like cocktails. We both ordered the Summer Harvest which tasted like syrup. It was supposedly " good bourbon, seasonal syrup, ginger beer, and lemon. All we tasted was syrup. For $10 a pop, it should have had some effect on my brain cells.Next were the oysters Rockerfeller. They came out lukewarm. Taste was decent, but the temperature was way off.....negative stars. I didn't complain. I just don't like to send food back.The entrees came. Cowboy ribeye, medium rare. Was decent. I'm not sure if it's prime meat. It was chargrilled with nice marks on it and a hint of smokiness. However, it didn't deserve the pricetag of $38. My wife ordered the Buffalo Crossing Burger medium. I tried it because she said it wasn't that good and had come out of the kitchen cold. What it tasted like was a formerly good burger, and you know how you hate it when people press on a burger to squeeze the juice out of it while they're cooking it? That's what it tasted like...dried out meat. Sorry. I still didn't complain.Finally, I had the Scottish salmon. I ordered it med rare to medium. I told the server I hate well done salmon. Well, I got it and was really disappointed in the size of the portion. It's $22 and I got about a 5 oz. portion.  Lunch portions are usually bigger than this. I cut into it and because of it's shape, it was cooked well done on the thinner side and about medium well on the thicker side. I can't complain at this point because everything sucks. The risotto I ordered as a side literally tasted like white rice with cream poured over it. Tasteless. If you're going to put this on the menu and you have no idea how to make it, don't bother.  Get a box of Rice a Roni and charge $5 for it. It would be more palatable. I also got a side of creamed spinach. It was good and hot in a crock with melted cheese, but it was exactly what was on top of the Oysters Rockerfeller that I already ordered, so in essence, it seemed like a continuation of what I already had.We didn't do dessert. Why bother at this point?I received the bill. It was $129 before tip. I tipped 15% because again, I don't think it was the server's fault. However, I noticed the server had misunderstood me and ordered my salmon well done as it was reflected on the check. I did notice there was a lot of confusion at the kitchen window where the food comes out. I have been a server in my past life and know the look of "hey cook, where's my.....?" It is usually followed by bewildered looks of all the 3 cooks in plain view trying to figure out where it is or where it went, or who's going to cook this on the fly because the main entree is already on the table. This is a true and honest opinion of this place. We eat out at least 3 times a week. I am a bit picky because at this price point, I deserve to be. This place will not last unless these problems are fixed pronto. There are too many good places to eat in this town, and I would not waste my time returning. I would have really liked to write a good review, because we are always looking for good places in our neighborhood.

54.description: For such a small space, the music is excruciatingly loud! Weird for a "steakhouse". Cramped and awkwardly shaped booth seating as well. Anyway, our drinks at first were completely and totally awful. We sent them back. Can't remember the name but it's the first on their cocktail list. Maybe it was just the bartender because my girlfriend had it before and raved about it. We ended up getting amaretto sours and a half poured glass of moscato instead. The pours were so inconsistent because here first glass seemed like half a pour, but the next glass was over poured. Weird, again. Food was great, actually. However, they were out of the ribeye steak at 6 pm on a Saturday evening. That was a huge and major turnoff. How does a place that specializes in steaks run out of the most popular cut an hour after opening on a SATURDAY? Very disappointing. I, truthfully, have no complaints besides getting a better bartender and managing your inventory better. Amanda was great and a darling. We ordered pretty much everything she suggested and were pleased with it all. She checked on us accordingly without overcrowding and seemed to truly enjoy interacting with everyone. There was also a slick gentleman walking around whom I assume to be the manager checking on people as well. I appreciate that. It's a thing that most restaurants aren't doing anymore. While my first encounter was mediocre, I believe that Chop has the potential to be great. I'd just advise you to call ahead and make sure they have what you would like to eat. Haha.

48.description: Horrible experience. Soups came out after the entrees and the bisque was cold and watery. Waitress was inexperienced and stretched too thin, which led to complete lack of attention throughout the meal.One burger came out without half the toppings that were listed in the menu for the item. Another burger was over cooked. The third burger was supposed to have bacon jam, but tasted more like burnt bacon bits.When brought to the attention of the management they attempted to fix by comping most of the meal, but would have rather just had a good experience to start. Not sure we will ever try this spot again, but hope they get their act together quick. It'd be nice to have a good option in Roosevelt Collection to dine when shopping or seeing a movie.

44.description: Went here before a movie, and was incredibly disappointed.  I can say that I will NEVER be back. The server we had asked the most bazar questions.  I ordered a glass of wine and she asked if I wanted one glass or two..??? Now onto ordering the dinner.  I asked for the french onion soup to start and then asked if the veggie burger was made in house.  She said, yes.  Ok, I will go with that then.  She then asked if I wanted the veggie or the turkey burger. Really?  Then proceeded to ask me how I would like my veggie burger cooked.  Again, what? It's a VEGGIE BURGER! Nothing was moving quickly here.  We were then delivered our entrees along with my soup, all at the same time.  WRONG!!!!!!!  Who orders soup and gets it delivered with their entree?  Furthermore, their veggie burgers are disgusting and NOT made in house, just a note for all you vegans out there.  It's called Boca style, I'm sorry I don't pay $14 for a Boca burger.  Service = negative stars, Food = negative stars.   And the worst part of the entire experience last night....they charged my card twice!  Fortunately, I have American Express and it pops up on my screen anytime my card is charged.  This morning at 8:00am I received a pop up on my phone with another charge from CHOP.  I called them today once they opened, they said they have been having issues with their credit card machine and everyone is being charged twice.  The best advise they could give me was to call back on Monday if the charge was still appearing on my statement.  Really???? I don't have time for this, pretty sure no one does either.  My advise, don't go, not worthy food, service and you might run the risk of flighting two charges at the end of the month.

24.description: We came in after a movie and were seated at the counter across from the bar. After being seated no one came by to greet us or take our drink orders we waited for over 5 minutes and no server came by, we even asked a server walking by if we had to order at the bar or something but he just kept walking....we were really looking forward to trying the food but ended  up leaving because due to the lack of service. The restaurant was not very busy so I'm not really sure why we were ignored.

7.description: Oh where to start... Made a booking through open table, when I arrived I said I had a booking and they didn't even take my name down. We were seated close to the door and the unfortunate design of the place makes you shiver at every new customer come in. We ordered a flank steak medium rare, French onion soup and pepper steak. French onion soup never came. One steak arrived before the other forcing me to start eating. The side dish came on a separate plate leaving the poor steak all alone on a white cold plate (F&B people! Don't you know the plate has to be warm???). Finally the second entree came. My steak was bloody raw as soon as I had the second bite. My server was at the back of the restaurant chatting so I stood up and took the bloody steak to the bar. Someone came to to assist and said ok I'll bring it back to the kitchen. No apology or sorry. Went back to my table. My server came and asked if there was something wrong with the steak. You bet there is. No sorry no apology. Finally the steak returned. The meat is flavorful. We asked for the dessert menu and it came with a stain of grease on it just to complete the picture. Nice. Never again. No manager around or anyone that knows F&B.

49.description: I only went here because this was the only restaurant close enough to the movie theater to grab something just in time before the movie time. Never again, for the following reasons. Food: I got the lobster bisque and the crab salad. I usually don't send food back, but the lobster bisque I just had to. It tasted like melted down cream cheese & sour cream mixed with lobster flavoring. There were no chunks of lobster in it like I would expect in a normal lobster bisque, let alone from a steakhouse. Crab salad looked like something I put together with scraps of romaine lettuce leaves and canned crab when I had nothing to eat at home for the total cost of less than $5. Food looked and tasted like it was put together not by professional cooks but by kids working part time jobs who have no idea what they're doing. If you must absolutely eat here for movie time purposes, get the burgers. Service: service was very slow although the place wasn't even half full. It took forever to get our foods. When I sent back the lobster bisque, the waitress seemed disgruntled. I will not be back.

40.description: We've tried this place a few times because it's close to home, but we probably won't give it another chance. Service is always unbearably slow and the food is only mediocre. Last week, we were there for an early dinner and even though there were only two other tables eating besides us, it still took almost an hour for two burgers to come out. Just not worth it. Ordering for carry out has proven to be a better experience - didn't have to wait for more than 15 minutes for the food to come out. Even still, just not worth it. Save yourself the time and money and get a mediocre burger elsewhere.

53.description: I was scared after reading some of the prior reviews, but came here today, and we had a good time. Service was very pleasant... The guy was new, so he wasn't very experienced, but he made up for it in charm. The crab cake appetizer is a must! Huge portions of crab, and very tasty! We also had the oysters Rockefeller, which was delicious! The atmosphere is a little different, agreed, so we sat outside and loved it :-).

30.description: Came in on the Wednesday before thanksgiving so they were completely dead. We decided to just sit at the bar bc I knew the bartender. She offered us their special for the day of 50% off wine bottles and we jumped right on it. The wine was very good and they had a huge selection. We ordered surf and turf and jumbo crab cakes. Wow! Pretty upset it has taken me so long to get here. I loved it! The filet was amazing! One of the best I have ever had and the presentation was beautiful! My jumbo crab cakes were homemade. It was overall a great dinner. I will definitely be back! One down side, the wait for our dinner with us being the only ones there was a little longer than I expected.

46.description: After viewing BLACK MASS at the show I need some brunch and a bloody.  The scotch egg and fingerlings were excellent.  I haven't met a bloody I did not like and they kept up the streak.  A nice little bloody bar with jerky and all the basic assortments to add to your drink.  In addition you can have your glass rimmed with truffle salt to make it more savory.  Kyle was the friendly bartender who was kept busy by the theater crowd.  I must have had a good day to hit them because I had no faults with service and food.  I will return after the next show to try the dinner menu which seemed quite reasonable.

1.description: Meh. Just meh. Totally should have read the reviews before taking the plunge,  but it was one of those things where I thought "how could it be bad? It's a steak house next to where the movie is".Wrong. The server was real nice tho. Wish I'd gotten his name. He was totally on board with putting the Hawks game on. And was totally personable. The food was meh. Quality of food was at like, bar food prices, but food pricing was like Mastros pricing. Not quite on the same page. The blackened shrimp was totally not blackened. The wasabi aoli was bland. The chicken roulette was dry & the risotto was gummy. None of it was BAD, it was just...... not great. The Bruschetta was tasty tho.  We won't be back.

55.description: We had oysters to start both east and west coast style and I would say it was ok. I had the locomotive hamburger and again it was just ok. The bread pudding desert I could done without it. The drinks were ok again. Overall, the service, appetizers, drinks and desert was ok. Would I come back and five it a 2nd try? Probably not.

9.description: I only went here because this was the only restaurant close enough to the movie theater to grab something just in time before the movie time. Never again, for the following reasons. Food: I got the lobster bisque and the crab salad. I usually don't send food back, but the lobster bisque I just had to. It tasted like melted down cream cheese & sour cream mixed with lobster flavoring. There were no chunks of lobster in it like I would expect in a normal lobster bisque, let alone from a steakhouse. Crab salad looked like something I put together with scraps of romaine lettuce leaves and canned crab when I had nothing to eat at home for the total cost of less than $5. Food looked and tasted like it was put together not by professional cooks but by kids working part time jobs who have no idea what they're doing. If you must absolutely eat here for movie time purposes, get the burgers. Service: service was very slow although the place wasn't even half full. It took forever to get our foods. When I sent back the lobster bisque, the waitress seemed disgruntled. I will not be back.

26.description: I was excited to have a new steak place in the SoLo, but this place is over priced for just okay food.  The prices are set as right at the same level as Gibson's and Chicago Cut, but the food is far from the quality.  I think people have already read the previous reviews that echo a similar statement because the place was dead.  My friend and I made a reservation for a pre-movie dinner at 6:30pm on a Thursday night.  I'm not even sure they had a computer host system set up to see that we made one.  I ordered the jumbo lump crab cakes and French onion soup.  Prior to my order I asked what the soup of the day was and I was told Broccoli Cheddar.  Really? At a place where you order steak and seafood a la carte, I expected something made by the chef and not something I could get pre-packaged at Panera.  The jumbo lump crab cakes were pretty delicious with a nice balsamic glaze.  The french onion soup was tasty as well, but if you're a vegetarian, stay away from it because I missed the part that states there is "filet" in the soup. Also, the "filet" tasted much more like diced mystery meat than a tasty chunk of steak.When it was time to order dessert the waiter told us they were out of everything except for the bread pudding.  Instead they had some pies we could order.  Again, did they run out and just run next door to whole foods to buy some pies?Overall, a disappointing experience for a place that I had high hopes for.

25.description: We were excited for this place to open as it was the first restaurant in the Roosevelt collection. Our waitress was training and very nice but everything else was terrible. They told us it was half priced bottles of wine so we ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir. Since it was half price we went for a pricier bottle than we normally would. The bottle that they served us was not the bottle we ordered and in fact not even on the menu at all. I did not enjoy it at all so we sent it back and got cocktails instead since they were reasonably priced. Our food came out while we were waiting for our drinks and my husbands steak was literally raw on the inside (I like rare steak and even I wouldn't eat that) he sent it back to the kitchen where they put it back on the grill. I ordered the crab salad and all I can say was it was gross. I am not a picky eater and I couldn't bring myself to eat anything in it. At this point I was tired of sending stuff back (I'm a waitress myself and hate being an annoying customer) so I just ate the side of veggies that came with the steak. When our drinks finally came mine was fine but my husbands martini tasted like eggnog - like they had just made a holiday drink and didn't clean the shaker. We asked for our check and when it came the wine was still on it - we asked if she could take it off and she did. Still with steakhouse prices minus the ambience and quality of food we ended up paying over $100 (we still tipped our waitress well as nothing was her fault) for me to eat a side of veggies for dinner. Probably will never try again.

12.description: Finally, there's food at the Roosevelt Collection. My husband and I went there for dinner and we're blown away by the food, drinks and decor! We ordered 3 appetizers: flank steak sliders, calamari streaks and the crab cakes. Everything was delicious and very fresh! I would have to say the crab cakes were my favorite, but the sliders were a close second!I forgot what my drink was called but it had whiskey and ginger beer. It was so tasty and refreshing on this hot day. We'll be back to try more!

59.description: I will just say that I hope these issues are because it's new and not what their service should actually be like. The service is slow, the drinks took forever to come out, and the tap is still down since it opened and it's been open for over a month now. They had a short cocktail list and were out of half of them because they didn't have ingredients. Drinks are ok, at best. I ordered a medium rare ribeye and the first time it came out REALLY rare. Also they smother their steaks in some horrible gravy and don't let you know until it arrives. I sent it back and then got a steak that was medium well, pushing towards well done. At least the asparagus and potato pancake were good. For this place to be as small as it is, you would think they could get their logistics together. Hopefully they will get better with time.

21.description: This place seems like it has a lot of potential but needs more work. The restaurant was very understaffed when we went there for lunch today. There was only one chef working there, as a result the food was served to one or two people at a time. Since we had a decently sized group there was around a twenty minute time difference between when the first person received their entree and the last. The food itself was decent but given the poor service and the all the other options in the area, we will not likely return for a long time.

17.description: Service and food were bad not worth trying. Very disappointed. We need a good place around the icon theater.

10.description: We came here like most people because we stopped after movies/shopping. I am HIGHLY disappointed by this "steakhouse." The whole environment is quite confusing to me with casual decor, loud pop music, and extremely expensive food prices. I figured the quality of food had to be decent given the prices but I was sadly mistaken. The food was so incredibly bland and mediocre. The caesar salad was something you could've bought in a premixed grocery isle and the fries were so cold and hard I couldn't believe they served them. We also ordered crab cakes (which were ok and tasted best out of everything we had) and also chicken pasta (which was slimy and gross). Will not be returning.

5.description: Convenient location if taking in a movie, but SKIP IT!Service was horrible. Waited 35 mins for appetizer which was flavorless and cold. Almost an hour before our overpriced tiny burger showed up. Not cooked to the requested temp either. The place is small, service is bad and food is overpriced and flavorless. Pay the VIP prices in the Icon Theater for food - better taste and more timely.Bad experience.

3.description: Just weird. It's a small space in a spot that could get a lot of people between the shoppers and the movie goers.We came in after we realized Mego, the Mexican place, wasn't open yet. We sat down quickly and then reviewed the menu. Pretty standard menu but "steakhouse" seems a bit aggressive of a name for this place.Our waitress seemed a bit odd. She walked up and said, "hi" and just stood there. Do we order? Who are you? Weird.We got the Caesar salad, mussels and side of asparagus. Took about 35 minutes to come out. Asparagus was cold, mussels were good for the most part - got a couple icky tasting ones I spit out.Will probably save our meal for somewhere else next time we are around here - it's the only option for food in the Roosevelt collection right now. Or just eat popcorn.

35.description: I had a pretty disappointing experience eating here. I stopped by Chop with a friend after catching a movie on a Friday night. She ordered the French Onion Soup and I ordered a Salad Nicoise with seared tuna. The soup was so salty that my friend could barely finish half of it. And my salad had no dressing. Just dry greens with some tiny pieces of seared tuna. When I asked the waiter if the dressing came separately he told me quite confidently "this salad doesn't come with sauce". I asked if they had any dressing I could add and he offered caeser or ranch. When I hailed a second waiter he told me they could bring me some balsamic vinaigrette. When he finally brought that out it was just pure vinegar and I had to wait again to have him bring me olive oil. He also brought out the soft boiled egg that was supposed to accompany the salad - 10 minutes after they had initially delivered my food and it was cold. When my friend asked if the soup came with a baguette our waiter said "what's a baguette?"We were not given a discount or even an apology for the mixup and delay with our food. Our waiter didn't seem to have received much training or have any knowledge of the menu. I would not return and eat here again which is a shame because I love coming to the nearby movie theater

19.description: Had a dinner & a movie date night with the hubby. Its very convenient that this is right next to the theater. But if you come here expecting to make a movie, make sure you allow at least 2 hours for dinner because they are extremely slow. When we arrived we were seated right away. & even though we picked a table far away enough from the door, everytime someone entered/exited a freezing gust of wind hit us. They should really invest in some weather shield doors for the restaurant. The restaurant itself is BBQ style vs steakhouse. I think I was expecting something more upscale but its casual. We started off with Lobster bisque & crab legs. It took 40 minutes to get our appetizers. The lobster bisque sucked.The crab legs were decent. The steaks have a bbq flavor to them, like some type of sauce added during cooking, (they even give you A1 sauce for your steak lmao)  I've never been a fan of A1 sauces or that type of favor and didnt enjoy that on my steak. I ordered a chive butter addition to the steak that was literally tiny chopped up butter pieces with chives sprinkled on it. (Usually if you order some type of butter to your steak it comes whipped/mixed together in a more uniform state.) I will say on a postive note that my steak & my husbands were cooked perfectly, and it was a very nice cut of meat.We ordered a twice baked potato as a side... It was basically a baked potato cut in half, with the insides sliced a bunch of times and a glop of cheddar cheese. Totally sucked and was completely different than the usual perception of a twice baked potato (which is usually filled with mashed potatoes) For dessert we order the raspberry cheesecake. I am not sure why any restaurant would put such an ugly looking dessert on the menu but for some reason Chop does. The cheese cake is 2 layers, the base is a cream color, and the 2 half which is the top layer is the ugliest pink color I have ever seen. (think 70's bathroom tile/shower/toilet) It tasted fine but was so un-eye appealing that it made it hard to eat. I really do not think we would be back.

28.description: With Chicago Firehouse lighting itself on fire over the last year, I was looking to try something close by that offered up a prime cut Bone-in filet. I agree that there are better cuts of beef in the city, but if you are looking for something local to the South Loop and are willing to belly up to the bar, Chop is not awful. The Monday free side special is pretty cool - allows you to grab a steak, lobster Mac-n-cheese and a glass of wine for under $100. Atmosphere reminds me of an aloft hotel, but who cares if all you care about is catching a game, eating a steak and drinking some drank.

45.description: A drinks place. Eat only in desperation.  Excellent price and portion WHEN edible.  A better venue when it is Porkchop.COCKTAILS ($10-$12) -- just right ice cubes.  ALL FRUITS RIPE taste like fruit punch.FRENCH ONION ($9) -- bitter grilled baguette and overcooked Gruyere.STEAK POUTINE ($13) -- steak was crazily chopped to pieces.  Is there a steak in there?  Hard fries.  Chewy chompy lump of cheese.  I have no idea what the gravy supposed to taste like, it's brown.VENUE -- spacious, a bit disorganized with stuff around, open late.

33.description: Went here last night before a show.  Pros:Half price bottle of wine on WednesdayHostessAmbiance/setupIn the Middle:FoodService is a little slow (but the hostess was clearly trying to help out)Cons:No communication from the waitress on specials, especially the fact that wine was half price (we caught this on out own after ordering)Way over priced

43.description: We were on the run, so we had to grab something quick.... We both had burgers and fries... One was beef and one was bison... The fries were really good... Have to come back again..:)

2.description: Hi Jen.  I can assure you that this is not a fake review and that I have never worked at a restaurant in my life.  When we dined at your establishment on the evening of Saturday 1/30/16, there were two female servers working and everything we ordered was listed on the menu presented to us in your restaurant.  All of those same food items are also currently posted in the menu section of your website as of today, 2/12/16: chopchicago.com/menu.  I don't leave reviews on Yelp very frequently; only when I feel strongly about an exceptional experience or a very negative one.  A quick look at my Yelp account will reflect that and will also show that you won't recognize me as part of Chop's past kitchen staff.  This is the first negative review I've ever left for a business.  I took the time to write a review of your business void of any falsities or exaggerations that honestly reflects my opinion and experience at your establishment, just as I have done in the past with my positive reviews of other businesses, in the hope that others might read said reviews and consider them when deciding whether or not that business deserves their patronage.  I only wish that I would have exercised due diligence and read the other reviews about Chop on Yelp before going to your restaurant so that we could have avoided the poor and disappointing experience we had there.  If you, your attorneys, or anyone that is considering dining at Chop would like to discuss this review or my experience at Chop with me further, feel free to contact me directly at my email address: mikerinkenberger@ymail.c…

18.description: Extreme disappointment. Looking forward to when this place shuts down and something new and improved can take it's place.. Live above the restaurant in a shopping plaza and is the only food in the immediate area, which in turn took away 3-4 different food trucks that we had circulating through. Not only did we have cold food on 2 occasions, but the service. was. so. freaking. slow. There were 2 parties around us that left due to the fact. Not sure why we have been back, 2 too many times if you ask me.

41.description: Not worth the money at all.My fried pork chop was so salty that I couldn't finish it. My spouse's filet mignon was even saltier. The service was mediocre at best. Our server brought out the entree without utensils, and we were forced to reach over the meat to get to the baked potato (which tasted like it came from the frozen section of the grocery store) because of the awkwardly large plates. We won't return for sure.

52.description: I've been back. Again ate at the bar. Lobster bisque and the crab cakes with a glass of wine. Perfect for a quick bite before your movie.

50.description: The good: The two stars are for the food, I will give them that. I ordered the Locomotive Burger and my boyfriend ordered the Crab Cake Burger. I really wanted to dislike the burger, but it was very tasty. My boyfriend's burger was basically just a regular burger with a mini crab cake on it, for $18 no thank you. I would have taken a picture of all of this but I was so hungry that I needed to start eating immediately. Now on to the bad, they use a Wordpress website, so you can't really make an online reservation, so I had to call. My boyfriend and I arrived at approx. 6:14. We were seated in these very awkward booths and noticed how congested the place was. There was a large group in the banquet area who had a bunch of their friends standing around their table, very awkward and uncomfortable for us to say the least. Anyway, around 6:18 we ordered our food-- we were trying to be in and out of this place. When my boyfriend asked if there were any substitutes for fries our server told us no and that "once someone ordered mixed veggies"-- yet another turnoff. We saw about three tables, who arrived after us, receive their food. 6:49 rolled around and FINALLY our food came. If this place was very large, I would understand the backup in the kitchen, but nope we waited almost 30 minutes for our food. Bottomline: We will not be coming back, there is no excuse for the amount of time that it took to get our food.

4.description: A drinks place. Eat only in desperation.  Excellent price and portion WHEN edible.  A better venue when it is Porkchop.COCKTAILS ($10-$12) -- just right ice cubes.  ALL FRUITS RIPE taste like fruit punch.FRENCH ONION ($9) -- bitter grilled baguette and overcooked Gruyere.STEAK POUTINE ($13) -- steak was crazily chopped to pieces.  Is there a steak in there?  Hard fries.  Chewy chompy lump of cheese.  I have no idea what the gravy supposed to taste like, it's brown.VENUE -- spacious, a bit disorganized with stuff around, open late.

6.description: I was excited to have a new steak place in the SoLo, but this place is over priced for just okay food.  The prices are set as right at the same level as Gibson's and Chicago Cut, but the food is far from the quality.  I think people have already read the previous reviews that echo a similar statement because the place was dead.  My friend and I made a reservation for a pre-movie dinner at 6:30pm on a Thursday night.  I'm not even sure they had a computer host system set up to see that we made one.  I ordered the jumbo lump crab cakes and French onion soup.  Prior to my order I asked what the soup of the day was and I was told Broccoli Cheddar.  Really? At a place where you order steak and seafood a la carte, I expected something made by the chef and not something I could get pre-packaged at Panera.  The jumbo lump crab cakes were pretty delicious with a nice balsamic glaze.  The french onion soup was tasty as well, but if you're a vegetarian, stay away from it because I missed the part that states there is "filet" in the soup. Also, the "filet" tasted much more like diced mystery meat than a tasty chunk of steak.When it was time to order dessert the waiter told us they were out of everything except for the bread pudding.  Instead they had some pies we could order.  Again, did they run out and just run next door to whole foods to buy some pies?Overall, a disappointing experience for a place that I had high hopes for.

22.description: Very very disappointing.  My boyfriend and I ordered drinks at the bar (draft beer and glass of wine) and an appetizer (steak poutine).  For $13.00, the poutine had no steak in it whatsoever, had very little gravy and the cheese curds appeared to be microwaved in one large clump.   May return for a burger but would not come back otherwise.

15.description: After viewing BLACK MASS at the show I need some brunch and a bloody.  The scotch egg and fingerlings were excellent.  I haven't met a bloody I did not like and they kept up the streak.  A nice little bloody bar with jerky and all the basic assortments to add to your drink.  In addition you can have your glass rimmed with truffle salt to make it more savory.  Kyle was the friendly bartender who was kept busy by the theater crowd.  I must have had a good day to hit them because I had no faults with service and food.  I will return after the next show to try the dinner menu which seemed quite reasonable.

57.description: Yay! FINALLY a place to eat in Roosevelt Collection.  Went in before a movie with my boyfriend and all i can say is WOW---it was definitely worth the wait.  We started out with the jumbo lump crab cakes---no filler, great presentation, and delicious.  After that we moved on to the steak poutine...it's poutine + steak...need i say more!? Entrees (Lamb Shank with Risotto/Filet Mignon)---very impressive, huge portions, seasoned just right, well done.  Compliments not only to the chef, but our server Lina went above and beyond. We will be back!

20.description: We went here for lunch before a movie because it was next door.  The service was poor at the table and the bar.  Out of eight of us there was only one decent meal and the was the crab cake sliders and the French fries.  The steak sliders, philly, and burgers didn't have much taste and not tender.  They're going to have to up their game to stay in business in Chicago.

36.description: This is absolutely the worst burgers we've had in really long time, followed by horribly slow service. I would NEVER come back. I rarely write reviews, and I go out a lot. But this was horrible. It took almost a half an hour to get our order (and it was empty, no reason for it to take so long!) and when mine arrived and it needed to be sent back, after another 30 minutes I still didn't have my food. The waitress was nice, but there was no communication between her and the kitchen and we ended up leaving to catch a movie after being there over an hour and I still hadn't eaten. After being in hospitality for years, the best way this would have been handled would be by pushing the re-order to the front of the line (and not watching piles of other burgers be brought out) and by not charging for the food. Also, there just seemed a huge lack of management to oversee the process & training. Side note- the layout is horrible. Hire a designer for flow next time. The front door is so discreet it's hard to see, and the lack of hostess stand laughable. Hopefully a new restaurant will take the place of this one soon as the location is prime.

14.description: Despite many negative reviews on this place, we decided to give it a try after watching a movie at Roosevelt Collection. Since the reviews were either loving it or hating it, I decided maybe the negative reviews were on a bad day. Well, we picked another bad day.First of all, the seating is horrible. There are approximately 6 booths that hold 3 adults in a C shape. They add chairs onto the tables to get 4 or 5 at these booths. This blocks the aisles and makes the place even more congested. It seems almost as if this was designed to be a bar, but they decided to add a dining room in the bar.On the other side of the "dining room" there are tables for 2 that are so close to each other, you might as well be dining with the table next to you. I am not into eating when the couple next to you can hear your conversation and vice versa. We had to wait for one of the booths, even though the dining room was not even half full. The other half of the room is the bar. There are no booths there, just high tables for 2 and the bar itself, which you can sit on the stools. It looks like a decent place to drink, but we were there to eat. Onto the meal....Service overall was good, even though there are many negative reviews. Our server tried, and so did the hostess. It's not their fault. Look what they're dealing with. This is a management and kitchen problem.Okay, so our waitress asked if we would like cocktails. We both ordered the Summer Harvest which tasted like syrup. It was supposedly " good bourbon, seasonal syrup, ginger beer, and lemon. All we tasted was syrup. For $10 a pop, it should have had some effect on my brain cells.Next were the oysters Rockerfeller. They came out lukewarm. Taste was decent, but the temperature was way off.....negative stars. I didn't complain. I just don't like to send food back.The entrees came. Cowboy ribeye, medium rare. Was decent. I'm not sure if it's prime meat. It was chargrilled with nice marks on it and a hint of smokiness. However, it didn't deserve the pricetag of $38. My wife ordered the Buffalo Crossing Burger medium. I tried it because she said it wasn't that good and had come out of the kitchen cold. What it tasted like was a formerly good burger, and you know how you hate it when people press on a burger to squeeze the juice out of it while they're cooking it? That's what it tasted like...dried out meat. Sorry. I still didn't complain.Finally, I had the Scottish salmon. I ordered it med rare to medium. I told the server I hate well done salmon. Well, I got it and was really disappointed in the size of the portion. It's $22 and I got about a 5 oz. portion.  Lunch portions are usually bigger than this. I cut into it and because of it's shape, it was cooked well done on the thinner side and about medium well on the thicker side. I can't complain at this point because everything sucks. The risotto I ordered as a side literally tasted like white rice with cream poured over it. Tasteless. If you're going to put this on the menu and you have no idea how to make it, don't bother.  Get a box of Rice a Roni and charge $5 for it. It would be more palatable. I also got a side of creamed spinach. It was good and hot in a crock with melted cheese, but it was exactly what was on top of the Oysters Rockerfeller that I already ordered, so in essence, it seemed like a continuation of what I already had.We didn't do dessert. Why bother at this point?I received the bill. It was $129 before tip. I tipped 15% because again, I don't think it was the server's fault. However, I noticed the server had misunderstood me and ordered my salmon well done as it was reflected on the check. I did notice there was a lot of confusion at the kitchen window where the food comes out. I have been a server in my past life and know the look of "hey cook, where's my.....?" It is usually followed by bewildered looks of all the 3 cooks in plain view trying to figure out where it is or where it went, or who's going to cook this on the fly because the main entree is already on the table. This is a true and honest opinion of this place. We eat out at least 3 times a week. I am a bit picky because at this price point, I deserve to be. This place will not last unless these problems are fixed pronto. There are too many good places to eat in this town, and I would not waste my time returning. I would have really liked to write a good review, because we are always looking for good places in our neighborhood.

58.description: 1st time in chicago and went here to try deep dish for the 1st time!The long wait time was dreadful, so come early, before you are hungry! (my dad was grumbling when he had to wait an hr or so to be seated for pizza and I felt so bad for the huge family with a pregnant mother who were waiting and eventually left because the wait line was too long) It's best to order your pizza when you book your seats so when you get seated at a table, the pizza will be almost ready. Besides that, the food was amazing, we got medium size with half classic deep dish and half of the 'lou'. Both were good, but the 'lou' was a lot better for my parents who like to eat a more variety of veggies than meat. Really didn't regret going there, the pizza was awesome and filling, we even took some back to our hotel to finish!

56.description: I came here with a party of four, and this place was packed! It felt a bit disorganized at times, but it all ended up working out. I liked that we could order some stuff ahead of time and grab drinks while waiting. It took some time to be seated, but they were able to accommodate us.For food, we had The Lou for our pizza with mushrooms and olives added and the Chicken Louie. Although they said a large pizza would only feed four, we were super stuffed after going back for seconds and even had leftovers. The pizza was fluffy and cheesy with quality ingredients. The Chicken Louie pasta dish was also good but not necessarily that different from standard chicken Alfredo except that it was covered in cheese. I don't know how this compares to the other pizzerias, but our party was very satisfied with our food.

29.description: Chicago deep dish pizza... Always a must when you come into town... but never a stunner. Let's be honest with each other and set out all the facts beforehand -- I'm a NY pizza lover, so Chicago pizza does not tickle my fancy. The pizza itself is massive. Unless you have a huge appetite or really love heavy pizza, two slices will be your max --  the waitress may try to tell you otherwise, but either you'll be full by then or sick of eating the same ol' thing. We ordered the sausage pizza -- which was heavily loaded with cheese. A fork and knife in hand, I attacked the pizza. Thank goodness for that, because the crust is not crispy.Overall, impressive? Prob not. But would I do it again, most likely because no trip to Chicago is complete without a slice of deep dish pizza.

42.description: The pizza was excellent. We had the "Lou" one, very cheesy - delicious. The salad was nice and I liked the house dressing. Our server was very friendly and nice but we felt very rushed - couldn't enjoy our food.

23.description: Good food, big portions, great service. Centrally located. Definitely a place to go when you visit Chicago

47.description: I've never really been a huge fan of deep dish pizza. I always though there's too much crust and not enough filling for something called deep dish. I knew I had to give it another shot though because this is one of the things that Chicago is known for. Tip: give everything a second chance! I think this was one of my favorite meals in Chicago (and there are a lot of good food)! We got 2 mediums to share amongst the 3 of us - The Malnati Chicago Classic and the "Lou." Both were delicious! There wasn't too much crust because I hate it when it's too bready and there was the perfect amount of grease so that it wasn't super dry, but it wasn't super greasy either. It's a good thing they have someone to cut it for you at the table because it would have been a mess if we did it. There's a generous portion of cheese that stretches like they do in movies when you grab a slice. The toppings were delicious as well. Overall, it was delicious! I wish I can get a slice (or a whole pizza) right now as I write this. I am definitely a fan!

8.description: You can't visit Chi-town and not have deep dish pizza! It would be a sin for 11th circle of hell! But with a pizza joint on every block it's hard to choose! Thanks to all my fellow yelpers for lending a hand on leading us to Lou's! The set up and decor faintly reminded me of Bucca Di Beppo back in LA! Which is awesome because I'm a huge Bucca fan! The service was friendly and everyone was all smiles! Our server even lended us a helping hand on which train would take us back to our hotel. Our food actually came out on time and in the proper order! I know that probably sounds strange but we've rarely gone to restaurants where the hot apps come out before the main entrees. Our salad was the first to come out and oh my goodness! We were loving every bit of it! It had the perfect balance of acidity and salty! Our Calamari came out soon after and that didn't last very long either! It was crunchy and well seasoned and the squid just melted! Not chewy at all! It was a dream! And then! The moment we were all waiting for! Our deep dish heaven! The pizza itself was on a whole new level of bomb. I hate pizza crust mainly cause well it's gross. But I could eat this crust all day! The freshness of the roma tomatoes really added a lightness to the pizza which made it such an enjoyable meal! All in all, Lou's is doing great things and I'm  super happy they were our first Chicago Deep Dish experience.

31.description: This was GREAT pizza! Deep Dish, Chicago, Buttered Crust pizza! These folks have an efficient process for getting you in and out. Don't be discouraged if it is busy and their is a wait. They put your name on the list, give you a wait time and encourage you to pre-order at the counter before being seated, so that your food is practically ready when you sit down. GENIUS! The staff was great! very friendly and accommodating!

34.description: best deep dish in Chicago !!! just wooow

16.description: I was in town with a friend for my birthday and was very excited for Chicago Deep Dish Pizza! We came across Lou Malnati's on our walk and decided to have lunch.  We shared a pizza (half The Lou & half The Classic) and it was very cheesy and delicious.  I could not get enough of the slighty crispy, flaky Buttercrust...YUMMY!!! The stuffed spinach bread was good, too, and very filling, so glad we shared the pizza.  Hopefully, I'll be able to visit this amazing city again and come back to Lou's!

13.description: You know, there might be something to this deep-dish phenomenon after all. New York-style pizza is really my favorite, but at Lou Malnati's I discovered I can love deep-dish too. The key is in the expectations: it's really more like lasagna than pizza, so once you understand that, you can sit back and be amazed.The overall experience is definitely that of a chain restaurant: there are huge groups of tourists (we were behind a girls' volleyball team) and there's a whole procedure to ordering and getting a table (done in that order, which makes sense because there's usually a long wait for both.) Our server was polite but harried; he looked completely slammed even in the middle of a weekday afternoon. We began with their house salad, in which they use crispy, fried bits of pepperoni as croutons -- talk about a stroke of genius! -- but it was nothing special, and the dressing was way too sweet. We didn't finish it despite the inflated price tag.Despite these quibbles, however, there's nothing on this earth quite like their incredibly rich "pizza" casserole, with a buttery pastry crust, thick sauce, crispy pepperoni and an avalanche of melty cheese. It really was amazing, and the next time in Chicago I will make time for a repeat visit. Meanwhile, I need to stop writing Yelp reviews when I'm hungry!

11.description: Ok, so I visited Chicago twice and discussed this with multiple people who are from Chicago.   Lou's is hands down my choice out of the Uno's vs LM vs Giordanos battle.  Perfect cheese/sauce balance and the meet pie has just the right amount of juicy and not overly greasy meat.  Ugh... just writing this review makes me want more.

39.description: Services was a little slow at first but food was really good. If you are wanting good pizza/ real Chicago deep dish come here. But don't come too hungry, deep dishes take at least 30min to make so get a few appetizers to hold you over :)

37.description: After everyone recommending this pizzeria, we expected a really good pie.  We came to Chicago really open and enthusiastic for a good deep dish pizza.  Instead, we got a very bland offering with a hard crust.  The only saving grace was the tomato sauce and the garlic bread with marinara.  Very underwhelming experience.  I wonder if it was just this location or the crust is just that bland.

0.description: Tried their deep dish pizza. First time there and waited about 10 mins at 3 pm, don't forget to order your pizza while waiting, saved us some time!My pizza was good except I only had one topping so the deep dish pizza didn't taste "deep dish" enough, how was I suppose to know since nobody told me that! Anyway I am willing to try it again and definitely will have more toppings in my deep dish pizza next time!

38.description: Okay well everyone's pretty much already shared how great this place is, and it's a Chicago staple. I was in town for a conference and this was one of the place that the Yelpers led me to, and boy they did not fail.When you dine in during the typical dinner hours, more likely than not it's gonna be packed with tons of people waiting in the lobby. They have a great system where you can preorder the deepdish pizzas you want, of which they'll half bake while you're waiting and then complete once you sit. This definitely saves on time as it usually takes a while.We ordered the app sampler and fried calamari to start with, nothing special just a ton of fried stuff. For the pizza, we ordered the Chicago classic which comes with tons of cheese, buttery crust, and sausages. Holy wow it is sooooooooo good. So good. The sausage was stellar, the cheese was so cheese. Agh. It was definitely filling too, I could only do like 2 slices.It was so good that I had it twice in 1 week. That good. Agh.

51.description: Food was good as usual, but the service was so bad. The waiter didn't care about our table at all. I ordered coffee, he only gave me black coffee at first time without cream and coffee spoon. So, I asked for it. He brought me cream at second time but still no coffee spoon. So, I asked for it again. At third time, he brought me SOUP spoon, still no coffee spoon!!! I saw the other table a waitress served coffee with cream and coffee spoon on the side. Also, when he took empty dishes, he didn't hold steady. So, it was falling down and food was on my hand. I said I need napkins. He said ok. However, he was going to another table and ignored me, I had to ask napkins again!!! My table waiter didn't feel sorry at all. This was my worst experience ever!!!

27.description: You know, there might be something to this deep-dish phenomenon after all. New York-style pizza is really my favorite, but at Lou Malnati's I discovered I can love deep-dish too. The key is in the expectations: it's really more like lasagna than pizza, so once you understand that, you can sit back and be amazed.The overall experience is definitely that of a chain restaurant: there are huge groups of tourists (we were behind a girls' volleyball team) and there's a whole procedure to ordering and getting a table (done in that order, which makes sense because there's usually a long wait for both.) Our server was polite but harried; he looked completely slammed even in the middle of a weekday afternoon. We began with their house salad, in which they use crispy, fried bits of pepperoni as croutons -- talk about a stroke of genius! -- but it was nothing special, and the dressing was way too sweet. We didn't finish it despite the inflated price tag.Despite these quibbles, however, there's nothing on this earth quite like their incredibly rich "pizza" casserole, with a buttery pastry crust, thick sauce, crispy pepperoni and an avalanche of melty cheese. It really was amazing, and the next time in Chicago I will make time for a repeat visit. Meanwhile, I need to stop writing Yelp reviews when I'm hungry!

32.description: There are tons of places to get a decent Chicago style deep dish pizza. I practically tried about 5 difference places during my short trip. Lou Malnati's, well you are franchised as hell and all over the place, but you are still a winner. Lou Malnati's won me for best buttery crust.I ended up stopping by this location during a trip around the Loop and walking around the snowy park. It was the lunch hour and this place was relatively packed. Lou Malnati's at this location took over 2 side by side restaurant spaces, so even while busy, there was ample space with minimal wait.-=-Lunch Deep Dish-=- Best way to eat deep dish is to not stuff yourself crazy, like most portions end up being. The lunch portion deep dish, perfecto. The sauce is sweet, but not over overly bearing. The best part though was the crust. It was flaky with a buttery crunch. It didn't quite excel in the cheesiness category, but you really can't have it all. A+, I will crave this again.

54.description: Ok, so I visited Chicago twice and discussed this with multiple people who are from Chicago.   Lou's is hands down my choice out of the Uno's vs LM vs Giordanos battle.  Perfect cheese/sauce balance and the meet pie has just the right amount of juicy and not overly greasy meat.  Ugh... just writing this review makes me want more.

48.description: I was nervous coming to this pizza place when I visited Chicago this weekend because of the popularity. You know how this get when they are too popular. But, this place is legit delicious and amazing! We got here around 9:45pm on Friday night and there were a few tables left, all of a sudden it was packed! Service was great! Very attentive and people always walking around to help/assist you with whatever you need. Bathrooms were clean. But really Chicago, no toilet seat covers? What's that all about. Now the best part...the food! We ordered a Medium Classic Lou Manati and added pepperoni. And a side of cheese curds. Absolutely mind blown on both of these items. Those cheese curds didn't last long on the plate as they kept getting dipped in that fantastic marinara sauce then down the hatch. The pizza was a deep dish with a buttery crust that was amazing! The extra pepperoni added the additional fantasticness, but the sausage was amazing enough just saying. I usually eat pizza with ranch, but I guess it's a slap in the face in Chicago, so I didn't go there. Absolutely amazing place!

44.description: Never been to Chicago but wanted to try Chicago pizza, we chose this place because it was close to our hotel, and we were not disappointed!  Absolute delicious! We had a spinach and cheese stuffed bread appetizer and shared a small Chicago deep dish pizza. It was soo good!!!

24.description: Place is great for deep dish and the chicken wings are really good!! Next time I am there I hope I go with some friends so I can get a regular pizza versus a personal size pizza because I think I would like it a lot better. Would also like to try there salads. Place was very clean and the servers were very nice.

7.description: I was nervous coming to this pizza place when I visited Chicago this weekend because of the popularity. You know how this get when they are too popular. But, this place is legit delicious and amazing! We got here around 9:45pm on Friday night and there were a few tables left, all of a sudden it was packed! Service was great! Very attentive and people always walking around to help/assist you with whatever you need. Bathrooms were clean. But really Chicago, no toilet seat covers? What's that all about. Now the best part...the food! We ordered a Medium Classic Lou Manati and added pepperoni. And a side of cheese curds. Absolutely mind blown on both of these items. Those cheese curds didn't last long on the plate as they kept getting dipped in that fantastic marinara sauce then down the hatch. The pizza was a deep dish with a buttery crust that was amazing! The extra pepperoni added the additional fantasticness, but the sausage was amazing enough just saying. I usually eat pizza with ranch, but I guess it's a slap in the face in Chicago, so I didn't go there. Absolutely amazing place!

49.description: Recommended by the hotel and we were not disappointed by the food... The wait was long but it's because the pizza is amazing.  Wish we were here longer to eat here again!

40.description: This may be a tourist spot, but I do not think it is a tourist trap.  When in Chicago, you must eat deep dish and highly recommend you have it here.  I went to this place with 3 other people and although we had to wait about 30-45mins for a table, it was worth it...plus, you get to order while you wait here...your food gets timed and is cooked so that once you've been seated, it's not long before it's ready.  Honestly, I think any kind of topping/pizza you get here will be good.  Their sauce is delicious, they can do dairy-free pizza with no cheese, the crust is great.  I recommend, if you want something to go with your pizza, get their house chopped salad...I don't recall its exact name but it has a bacon vinaigrette on it...it was awesome.  Service was also awesome.  If/when I go back to Chicago, I'll definitely be going here again!

53.description: Fresh Salad, 60mins waiting turns to 15mins, pre-order pizza when we were waiting. Will come in next Chicago visit.

30.description: I'm probably going to get crucified by LMP fans but this review was for the pizza ordered to-go and eaten in the hotel room as well as the frozen pizza I bought and flew back home to SoCal. Maybe we didn't cook it right, maybe..First of all, the ladies over the counter were rude and unfriendly. I was willing to overlook that if the pizza was mind blowingly good. Sad to say, it wasn't. The crust was thin and crisp, yes. There was lots of gooey mozzarella cheese topped with loads of sausage and tomatoes but somehow, it's missing a "wow" factor. I thought it was just me but everyone I ate it with echo my sentiments. It could've been over hyped is what it is which made our expectations soaring high. It's too bad though.To be fair, I probably should have dined in but I'm partly relieved I didn't because there are just too many good places to eat in Chicago and if I had the same outcome as when I ate it at the hotel and at home, I'd be bummed out to miss out on a better restaurant in this city.Perhaps when I'm in town again I'll give it another shot. Until then, 3 stars is all I could muster.

46.description: The wings were really good but I was a bit disappointed in the pizza. Other people bad time me really good things but I thought it was just so-so. I had a sausage and mushroom pizza and I didn't really like the the taste of the sauce. However other people seemed to really like it and recommended the pepperoni but it was already to late. I would def eat there again the service was good and the staff was very friendly.

1.description: This was our first chicago deep dish pizza, and we thought we just didn't like deep dish pizza after having it here until we went to Pizzaros in the loop. Where we LOVED deep dish pizza. Heres what we didn't like: We ordered the classic with the sausage. The sausage seemed really rubbery. The sauce was watered down, and I had to ask for more sauce. There just wasn't a whole lot of flavor to it... I caked it in the parmesan, basil and red pepper sauce they put on the table and it was ok. Aurelios, not far from here, has great pizza as well as Pizzaro in the loop.

55.description: Haven't had authentic Chicago pizza since the year 2000.  Went to the "Taste of Chicago" back then.  Although I have been in Chicago countless times since 2000, pizza was the furthest from my mind when it comes to dining.  It was my co-workers first time in Chicago and besides visiting a couple of bars downtown, he wanted authentic Chicago deep dish pizza.  Yelped best Chicago pizza and found this place.  It's down the street from the Oprah Harpo studio.  Restaurant has seating on the second floor.  Decided on a smooth Chianti that didn't disappoint.
