It came with very thin shoestring-like fries, which I could have done with out being that some were cold and they were way too thin for my liking. My friend did enjoy them. For cocktails, I had the Chicagoan and it was made perfectly! If you like classic cocktails like Old Fashioned and Manhattans, get the Chicagoan. My friend had the Snappy Mule and margarita. She definitely preferred the margarita.  The service was superb. The whole staff was extremely friendly and welcoming. We sat at the bar and talked at length with our bartender, Kiera. We also got a chance to meet one of the owners who provided some background to the restaurant. I definitely would go back for a nice cozy night of cocktails with friends.

12.description: Wish I had a 4.5 for this one. Great tapas options and enjoyed the environment. A little noisy but we had a table of 6. Would never have ordered the cauliflower but really enjoyed at small plate. Main course was the bone in ribeye. Loved the huge bone and presentation. Great marbling and really good flavor. Unfortunately, I feel it should have been served a little sooner because it wasn't really warm/hot anymore by the time we were eating it (they had pre sliced it).

59.description: Went to Sociale for the first time this week.  New restaurants need time to mature, but the food was good.  Attentive service, nice space.  A cocktail (top-shelf vodka) is $12, more expensive than almost anywhere else in the South Loop ($10 tops at a few places, but as low as $7.50 in some local restaurants).I will be back.

21.description: Found sociale on Yelp while staying at the Blackstone nearby. It had great reviews so we decided to check it out. The reviews were spot on, great service, good ambiance, and excellent food. The scallops and skirt state are a must. Highly recommend a visit.Some millennial feedback for the owner...your restaurant is amazing but your logo is dated and somewhat cheesy. Chicago is filled with talented graphic artist and designers. See what they can come up with.

17.description: A fancy, stylish new place in the South LoopSociale is the new happening, hip place just south of the loop. It has cold and hot tapas, contemporary appetizer options for sharing with friends and good wine selection.Its a good place for going out with a group of friends. Lively music and nice ambience. Would totally frequent this place.

10.description: Such a cute place! They had a great draft IPA. I went there with two friends and we ordered: - smoked salmon flat bread - it was above average, but not exceptional - clams - the best clams I've ever had. I am definitely going back there for the clams - scallops - a little pricey ($12 for 2) but so delicious! They were well cooked and the pistachio butter was great with them. I will order that again next time I am there - beats salad - it was a pretty average beats salad - octopus - wasn't too impressed by it, but I am not a huge octopus fan to begin with - chicken with potatoes - that was good. My friend got it last time she was there and recommended to get it again - I don't remember what the desert was called, but there were 7 sweet balls with chocolate dip in the middle. The waitress recommended a different one, but we didn't listen. We will listen next time lol

5.description: This place is a gem we are lucky to have found. My husband and I were looking for a spot we can grab a few small plates and glasses of wine when we came across Sociale. Made reservations here on Yelp for 7:30p on a Saturday night. When we arrived, there were a few empty tables. We were shown to our lovely 2 top by the window(love a table with a view). A few moments after we were sat, we were greeted by our incredibly friendly server, Stacy. She helped us navigate the wine offerings until we selected two glasses we'd enjoy and then made some recommendations on food. We tried the scallops, brandade, grilled minouri, salmon flatbread, and finished with the crema catalan for dessert. Everything was delicious and the wine was a terrific value. We cannot wait to go back. Thank you, Stacy, for making our evening out so lovely.

3.description: Came here on a sunday afternoon for a drink and a bite. The service at the bar was lacking. She would dissapeared for long lengths at a time. Ordered their savory Bread Pudding. HOLY @#@# that was good! Amazing!!! Manchego bacon and prociutto inside bechmel cream sauce on top. Topped with arugula and pickled red onion. where the bartender lacked attention the kitchen did not! The price was what i would have expected and the flavor was so good. ive never had a savory bread pudding (doubt i can find one here in Orlando) and highly recommend it to anyone in the area.

35.description: This place is awesome.  Food, Service, atmosphere was great!  We had the grilled Octopus, Sea Scallops, and shared plate...Rib Eye it as amazing!!

19.description: Sociale is the much anticipated Mediterranean restaurant that finally opened their doors this week in the South Loop! I had the pleasure of dining their during the opening night and was blown away by the food and, most important to me, the service!While we obviously weren't able to try everything our first go around, of the dishes we did try here are some highlights: Grilled octopus with grapefruit vinaigrette; seared steak with chimichurri sauce (we got two...); Bikini sandwich. We'll be back to try the ribeye and whole fish which looked amazing.Also, the restaurant ran into some issues with their liquor license, but in the meantime are BYOB which is fine by me. The owner was there on opening night and was also making martinis for folks out of the Tito's he brought - cool lad!Welcome to the neighborhood.

28.description: As South Loop residents, we enjoy frequenting the local restaurants for the convenience and support. We recently tried Sociale on a Saturday night with our 3 year old and the food was amazing as was the staff. Staff was very accommodating to our child, which is important to us living in an urban area. We experienced many items on this visit, pork belly pintxos, pickled beet salad, feta burrata, brie with bacon jam flat bread, special of the night potato leek soup, and roasted chicken. All were amazing! The pickled beet salad was a little too pickled for my liking, but was still good. My only interest would be to see a website in the future. We appreciate viewing menus for specials and new items, and Sociale is lacking this feature.

45.description: YAY! I'm so glad there is a tapas restaurant in printers row!! This is a great spot to enjoy a few small plates and delicious cocktails.  My favorite small plate was most definitely the skirt steak, followed by the pork belly and salmon flatbread.  On my second visit, I got to sit right next to the kitchen and man those guys are working hard, makes me appreciate the food even more.   Servers have always been knowledgeable of the menu and quick enough.  I do think the plates are a bit overpriced and the beer list is severely lacking. But if you are into small plates and wine/cocktail drinking, I recommend checking it out. Welcome to the neighborhood Sociale!!

33.description: I am not sure what a professional food critic would write but my guess is they would write a very very very complimentary review. Consider this amateurs' review to be as complimentary as a Vettells' really positive review. Go! Enjoy! It's all good. Service needs just a slight uptick to get this place to five stars and I am sure it will get there.. Food, ambiance, drinks, staff courtesy and professionalism, and value spot on. Actually food is superb by any measure.

43.description: We went last night for the first time. The good is pretty good. We ordered the cauliflower, veggie flatbread, bikini sandwich, and Chilean bass (daily special). It was sufficient for the two of us. The bikini sandwich was so highly reviewed, but nothing extraordinary. The bass and cauliflower were the definite winners. Veggie flatbread was good, but the fall/winter option that evening wasn't my favorite. Boyfriend ordered a tempranillo and I got the Polk. His portion was smaller. My cocktail was tasty, the ginger beer was a great complement. Overall, it was good but overpriced.

2.description: Such a great addition to the south loop! I walk by this spot every day on my way to and from work and I've stopped in to cafe press (next door) a few times. Great spot for a date. Lots of small plates to share. Get the meatballs. Get the bacon wrapped pork belly. Definitely and I mean definitely get the bacon, Brie and egg flat bread. For $10 you'll be happy you did. Plan on picking up something to go next time I'm on my way home.Give a cocktail a go. I tried the Polk and loved it. Very refreshing.

18.description: Been waiting for this place to open... And I'm happy that my friend's 4year old wanted to go down Clark street....The service was great.... And the food was amazing.... Loved everything we order... And I'm glad the 4year old ask for steak.... So we got the Skirt Steak, Flat bread with Brie and bacon onion jam, Pork belly Pintxos, Roasted Califlower, Tortilla, A Cheese Platter, Bougatsa, and on the house we got the Dark chocolate Panna Cotta, because the little one shared her gummy letters with the staff... Over all the three of us loved the food... Our food was approved by a 4year old... :)

41.description: Most unique tastes in South Loop. Been to French Laundry, Trotter and Jules Verne. Food as good but better service. The chef is rocking it.

52.description: Been here twice, I'll be back for more.  Great cocktails.  Not the biggest fan of their take on chorizo, but that's probably my lack of a developed palette speaking.  Superb wait staff (I can't believe I have to comment on wait staff these days, but some places really don't have it down.  Sociale does.)  Love the small plates style, they have a nice variety.  Just look at the pictures, they do look that good! If you want a great place to go on a date, consider this restaurant a winner.

50.description: This place is beautiful with great food to match. The night I went with a friend we sat at the bar and the service was attentive and helpful. The server made great recommendations (lamb meatball, feta burrata with accompanying  wine pairings) all which were excellent and surpassed my expectations! I will definitely be back

4.description: My husband and I came here yesterday evening and sat at the bar.  We had heard great things about this new addition to our neighborhood and were very glad to try it. We indulged in several of their cocktails, which their cocktail menu has many creative options.  I first tried the Lisbon, and it was delicious.  It had a mix of bourbon, carpano antica, port, and bitters with grapes for garnishes.  The combination was smooth and subtly sweet.  I then opted for the Chicagoan, which contained rye, vermouth, grand marnier, and bitters with cherries for garnishes.  It was a delightful rendition of the Manhattan.  My husband chose the Snappy Mule.  Served in a copper cup, it combined vodka, snap liqueur, ginger beer, and a pleasant addition of mint.  He was very satisfied with his selection.We also tried their smoked salmon flatbread, which was divine.  They have a fire oven for their flatbreads and other dishes, which always adds extra flavor to your dish.  The salmon flatbread contained not only fresh smoked salmon but also a wonderful cream spread with chives and cucumbers.  The restaurant has a warm ambiance with both bar and table seating.  The staff was welcoming and friendly, prompt and attentive.  As other reviewers have mentioned, it can become pricey pretty quickly though with multiple tapas and cocktails.  Overall, I'd recommend this restaurant, and I look forward to coming back.

6.description: Went on a Friday night. I was early so it wasn't too crowded. The area around it sure is growing faster - new condominiums and restaurants, which is interesting.Our waiter was very nice. He had a beard. This restaurant is attached to Press Cafe. The cafe and the restaurant are under the same ownership by a group of people. I met a co-owner, I think his name was Jeff. Well maybe it was Mark. I don't remember... but I know what he looked like. He was friendly. On the ceiling above the bar, there's this white dome with a glowy green ring sticking out. Is that one of those Nest detector things? It was kind of funny, such an alien device poking out in this room which was mostly a dark wood aesthetic.The kitchen is open and you can see part of it if you get the right seats. We got the right seats and could see the chefs sometimes. I could stare straight into a furnace. The furnace started smoking once and one owner was kinda panicky-ly staring at the smoking. No one was panicking though, so that must have been normal.As you might expect, it being a sorta-high-end Tapas place, it's a little expensive.  If you skip alcohol, dessert and coffee, though, you could likely get away with $30 or less per person.I like the orange-creme-something-something dessert. Their octopus is very good too, not rubbery, nice other things on the dish. Their salads were good (we had the beet salad, and then a cheese? crouton salad? the foccacia crouton was good, though I think they could stand to have more arugula rather than cranberries/golden raisins.Their cappucinos are good. No almond milk when I went, though. Coconut milk was good enough.

22.description: Awesome upscale place with great food and drinks; so needed in the south loop!

15.description: Found sociale on Yelp while staying at the Blackstone nearby. It had great reviews so we decided to check it out. The reviews were spot on, great service, good ambiance, and excellent food. The scallops and skirt state are a must. Highly recommend a visit.Some millennial feedback for the owner...your restaurant is amazing but your logo is dated and somewhat cheesy. Chicago is filled with talented graphic artist and designers. See what they can come up with.

57.description: I wanted to update my review, because we gave this place a 2nd try, and the food was MUCH improved. I'm still only rating it a 3 overall, because they have to be consistent to deserve a 4 in my book, but if they maintain this quality on my next few visits, they will definitely become 4-star worthy. On this visit, we had the Brandade, Bikini Sandwich, Crispy Olives, Chistorras, Lamb Meatballs, and the Chorizo Flatbread. All of this was excellent, though I have to say, my favorite thing was Smoked Paprika Crema served with the Crispy Olives. YUM!! I could have eaten that with a spoon. (Also, if you are an olive lover like I am, it's worth mentioning that the olives they serve with their cocktails and martinis are wonderful! Excellent quality!!) The outstanding service continued on this visit...this time courtesy of Paul and Katie at the bar. Okay, Sociale....I'll be back. Here's hoping you keep it up!

20.description: A fancy, stylish new place in the South LoopSociale is the new happening, hip place just south of the loop. It has cold and hot tapas, contemporary appetizer options for sharing with friends and good wine selection.Its a good place for going out with a group of friends. Lively music and nice ambience. Would totally frequent this place.

36.description: Really liked Sociale located in the South Loop / Printers Row neighborhood. We were there with a group for a Birthday party and shared many of the small plates on the menu. My favorites were the Chicken Thighs, Scallops, Grilled Octopus, and the House Made Burrata. Good wine selections and the service was excellent! I will definitely be back!

14.description: Checked out this new addition to South Loop with some friends for dinner.  While the waitstaff seemed a bit green, they were super nice and friendly.  We ordered a number of their small plates and a flat bread order to share among the three of us which enabled us to share a variety of selections off of their menu.  Everything we ordered was pretty good especially the pork belly pintxos and their grilled manouri cheese which were all cooked very nicely and were tasty to the palette.  I also really liked the grilled octopus, but could have done without the fennel.  I'm interested in trying some of their other selections next time.

3.description: We walked out in biting cold/rain today in the hopes of grabbing some good ol ABP breakfast. Only to find that it was closed on the weekends. This review is only to alert folks to not go with the hours posted here. This location is housed within East-West university building, and I'm assuming it only opens when classes are in session during the week. Nothing against ABP - just would have loved updated hours for this location.

1.description: Pretty sad looking blt, especially when they forget to even put the tomatoes on it : (

2.description: This is a great addition to the South Loop area: A Cafe where local students can get a (as low as I've seen) breakfast/lunch at reasonable prices. Au Bon Pain has some healthy options, too. Hopefully it will increase foot traffic around here later in the day.Also everything is half-off past 5 PM, so that is great. Less than $1 for really good bagels!  (Tip: You can walk 5 minutes from here and buy six bagels from Trader Joe's for $3).

5.description: Since all we needed was something basic to hold us over this was fine. A bit overpriced as expected, but it filled us up. The sandwich menu is extensive and there is also a large, made-to-order salad menu. If you get a small soup and sandwich there is a small discount. The seating seems to be in the dorm of a small college so during school time it is probably more crowded.

0.description: I went on a Saturday and they seem to close earlier on Saturdays and don't have all their options available. I had the broccoli cheddar soup and a chicken Caesar wrap. I was starving and asked for extra chicken. The taste was pretty good and fresh overall. However the girl making the wrap hooked it up for me. She added like a pound of chicken breast it seemed like. I wasn't hungry for the next 7-8 hours. When I go back to landmark I'll definitely check out au bon pain again- though that's for another day. Overall 4/5

4.description: So glad this place is finally open!  Such a great addition to the South Loop area.  I can finally grab a quick & healthy breakfast on my way to work.  The customer service is fantastic as well, this location is so welcoming!

28.description: Was referred from a friend to this shop.  After reading many reviews, I wasnt really sure what to expect.  My first visit was ok.  Although they staff was more interested in unloading boxes and chit chatting with other guests and workers, they finally got around to me after about a 10 minute wait in a pretty empty store.  That said, the gentleman who helped me, walked me through all the different types of pens they had and what would be best for what I was looking for.  I got my pen and my juice and I was on my way. I have been into the printers row store on numerous occasions and honestly I have never really felt welcomed when I walk into the store. First and foremost, the store is run by obvious stoners that are completely pre-occupied with how many smoke rings they can blow with their vaporizers.  And when you walk in to purchase something, its as if you are taking them away from their fun.  Ask them a question about something you are unsure about and they look at you like you are a moron.  Very uncomfortable experience overall.  I had gone back a half dozen times, each time hoping for a better experience and unfortunately it has only gotten worse.I refuse to give them another penny and have found several other shops, while a bit less convenient to get to, that offer a much better overall experience.To Smoque i say Meh... there is better places to get stuff out there.

1.description: Friendly guy working behind the counter!  I forgot my ecig at home while in Chicago for vacation. They helped me out getting set up with everything I need to make it through the week!  Prices were reasonable.  Thank you!

9.description: My new favorite vape shop . My brother took me yesterday and I only had intended to only buy some juice and walked out with a whole new and better kit than I had . Ross was great and unlike most vape shops I've been to he was actually happy to help us . He also took the time to set up my brand new e-cigarette . The juice selection was awesome and they had flavors that were omg great , i will be back there soon

29.description: Love love love this store. I go all the time, they're super nice and tell me how to figure out my ecig because I don't know anything. They've really taught me a lot. I've never had a negative experience, and the flavor options are amazing. Great place...

23.description: I always have a good experience coming here to get my usual favorite flavor juices. Recently I decided to upgrade my vape equipment and Ross walked me through the different units, did demonstrations, and got me all set up while answering my questions. Great service and I'm very happy with the new unit! Will definitely be back and would recommend Smoque to anyone.

5.description: Mike was very nice. Wasn't judgemental when I told him my "life story."  Pretty chill vibe with the regular crowd hanging out. Would recommend.

31.description: Excellence in everything. Sure, you can beat their prices in outlying areas, but you can't beat the service and knowledge. Convenience in the city might cost a little more, but I'm good again. My aerotank bottom, apparently aero controller, snapped off. I had it pressed back on but couldn't vape at all. My coil died in the process, as well. Stopped in for help, again, and like always I leave happy. Bought more coils but they'll get used.

25.description: It's a little like walking into someone's clubhouse.  The liquid I tried was good. The customer experience was a little juvenile but decently friendly.  There are better shops close by. Just my opinion.

12.description: The people were nice but the product was not entirely to my liking which is not their fault because I picked out the flavors, I would try again when I'm back in Chicago though.

37.description: Glad to have them in the SoLo! The staff & owner are friendly and knowledgable about their products.

21.description: I really don't know what's up with the negative reviews here - it seems like the things that other people didn't like were the exact things that make me want to come to this place over and over again! First off all, when you walk into the place, it's less like a 'store' and more like you've just been invited to hang out at a friends house. I walked in and was immediately invited to have a seat on the couch and try the flavor selection, which by the way was amazing! They make their own liquids, and they have a nice selection to choose from. The strawberry cheesecake was my favorite followed by sweetyhearts as a close second. They allowed me to sit there as long as I wanted; there was never any pressure to buy or to hurry and finish trying the flavors. They would come over periodically to see if I had any questions and to see how I liked the product and offer suggestions. Ross was the main person helping me that day, and I must say that his customer service skills are impeccable. He was attentive from the time I walked in until I walked out (and I probably was there a good hour and a half). He helped me choose flavors and helped me select a new device (which took some time considering I'm a newbie to the vaping community and had lots of questions). He even assembled it for me once I purchased it. I will definitely be a repeat customer of Smoque, and would even just go back to chill and vape sometime.

16.description: Summary: Great customer service + decent prices.I visited here upon recommendation from my friend.1. Great experience when purchasing my first vaporizerBeing a noob and all, the staff were very patient with my questions. I was invited to check out all the flavors at the little flavor lounge area. I took me a while to pick my favorite flavor (cheesecake) and we provided to talk about the vaporizer itself. They were not pushy at all about trying to selling you the most expensive devices. They took time to figure out what I wanted and my budget. (Bigger battery vs smaller one, size of tanks, etc)2. Follow up visits were great/ Staff is coolI dropped by a few times after the initial visit to ask more questions/ buy more e-juice. They were always very friendly and helpful. Sasha is cool and very approachable. Stephanie is kind and also cool. The staff in general is pretty laid back and chill. I like the vibe the shop and staff exhibits.3. Great pricesI did simple price matches online and their prices are actually cheaper than a lot of online websites. It's unbelievable. I don't mind paying a little more just to support local businesses but their prices are already lower than online websites. You also can't beat the face to face customer service Smoque Vapours provide.4. Chill environmentThe decor is cool and you will usually see people just hanging out in the shop trying out flavors or simply just chatting.Support the local businesses!

17.description: Was here about 2 weeks ago and this shop is a cool laid back spot. Im completely new to vaping but Ross hooked me up. One of the coolest dudes you'll ever meet. Very knowledgeable and helpful. Comfortable and relaxing atmosphere and of course I gotta mention the throwback N64 lol. Will most definitely be back to try out new flavors.

10.description: I was relatively new to vaping with oils so I tried many places. I found that they have the best flavors, the best customer service and the most inviting atmosphere. They walk you through everything. You can try all the products before you buy it.  And can I say again how good their customer service is!  This will be the only place I go.

11.description: Ross gives the best advice to anyone that wants to learn about vapes. He know about new and older mods and can recommend the best device for the inevisual needs of a person.

26.description: Bought an ecig from them and have repeatedly gone back for different flavors. I highly reccommend this place. They are knowledgeable and friendly even to a beginner!

27.description: Love this shop. I'm glad that there is a place that is excited about their own products and isn't just hyping some bad juice and cheap mods. The e juice here is phenomenal and the amount of time that the staff takes to stop and explain every last detail to everyone that walks in is impressive. Vaping has become a hobby for me and I'm glad the staff can reciprocate that. Joining the forum of actual physical social interaction can be intimidating, but I found the staff here very accommodating to any concerns I had.  My all day vape last month was Peach Pineapple from their Drip LIne, couldn't get enough of it.

35.description: This is a great store for a starter or a veteran on the vape movement. I went in there to get a starter kit and some E Juice and walked out below $60 with a decent set up and 2 flavors. They have a wide variety of flavors that you can sample in shop before you buy. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE - I was having issues with mine (twice) and they helped me out both times no questions asked. they have made a customer for life (as long as I love in this city)I highly recommend.

8.description: I'm a newbie to vaping so coming to Smoque I went in blindly. One of the employees, Ross, sat with me for an hour just to make sure I got exactly what I was looking for. Not to mention their amazing flavored they make themselves. I am definitely going to be a regular!

0.description: I accompanied a friend in this store and asked a few questions about the product and a few things that were on the news.The sales assistants in this place are top friggin notch! They give honest answers and advised customers on their products based on what was needed not what was the coolest gadget.Besides the sales associates, I liked the fact that they sell products that help people to stop smoking gradually. I'm not a smoker, but my friends are very happy with their new e-cigarettes.

20.description: I've been to many different vape shops (with lots of bad experiences) and I definitely got the most help here. I was looking for a new set up and had many questions, Mike helped me out and got me the perfect set up. Id recommend this spot to anyone needing info and quality products.

19.description: Excellence in everything. Sure, you can beat their prices in outlying areas, but you can't beat the service and knowledge. Convenience in the city might cost a little more, but I'm good again. My aerotank bottom, apparently aero controller, snapped off. I had it pressed back on but couldn't vape at all. My coil died in the process, as well. Stopped in for help, again, and like always I leave happy. Bought more coils but they'll get used.

33.description: I went here since I work nearby and I had been ordering all my stuff online and was getting kinda fed up with waiting and not finding the same quality I was used to from the place in my old city. I dropped in one day to get something random, I can't even remember what I needed. Maybe coils?I got the stuff I needed in a pinch and went back home with a business card and a small chat with the person working. A couple weeks later I broke my battery and my back up is an old piece of junk. So I went in and picked up a battery, but then thought I should try some juice since I had the time and wanted to try another flavor. So I picked up a couple bottles of this and that and went home. Well, when I got home, the bottles I was given were wrong. I called the store immediately. After talking to them, they said I could bring it back so about a few days later when I was back in the neighborhood I stopped in. They exchanged it and gave me a little sample bottle. Awesome! Definitely wasn't expected but it was a great gesture. They'll have repeat business from me and the juice that I got that I originally wanted (haha) was fantastic and rich. Some of the best stuff I've had.

2.description: I have been using e-cigarettes for about 2 years now - typically the ones that look like actual cigarettes with the rechargeable batteries and replaceable cartridges.  I decided that I wanted to trade up and get something better.  I googled places and found Smoque Vapours at 537 S Dearborn.  I went down there after work to check it out and found a very casual, inviting atmosphere.I was helped by Xalia, who walked me through everything, helped me make a decision, and let me try out some of their flavors.  She was extremely nice and helpful!  After I made my purchase, she worked with me to get everything right.  She explained how my new product would work and how I would need to maintain it.  She even assisted me over the phone the following day when I forgot something she had originally told me.  I am satisfied with all aspects of the service I received there, especially the friendly and knowledgable help I got from Xalia.  She answered all of my questions and made me feel extremely welcome despite not having much experience with these kinds of products.  I look forward to visiting them in the future!

34.description: Love this place, always great help... I'm new to the vaping and they're always there to explain everything... At first thought the prices of liquid were a bit high, then ordered liquid online at multiple sites and nothing compares... Plus it's downtown, have to expect prices to be a bit higher! Won't go anywhere else again!

32.description: I walked in without knowing anything about E-Cigs and the person, Mike, working there took the time to explain and demonstrate everything carefully and thoroughly with me.  I bought a kit with a bottle of juice and I felt it wad reasonable.  It is everything I had hoped for.  Outstanding service and product, I'm glad I found them.

18.description: This place is awesome, friendly service and great atmosphere. Couldn't ask for a better shop to hang at.

13.description: Super chill place that I would 100% just go to to hang out, great people working there (who spontaneously dance I guess) and buying there, has an N64 hangout spot (KILLER INSTINCT? SOLD) and the employee Ross is super helpful, knowledgeable, and nice.Not to mention he's incredibly attractive.WINK WINK

4.description: Great flavor of e juice, Ross was fabulous the first time. This second time was a much less rewarding experience the girl seemed to have no knowledge of the juices or flavor profile and basically walked away with a have at it yourself attitude.  The cherry on top was mike the manager who had a atank attitude and basically told me u could leave without anything when I asked him to correct ms. Checkout girls error.  I will have to drive up north as proximity does not erase poor service

24.description: Past reviewers stated that they felt unwelcomed, it's like walking into a clubhouse full of stoners.  They are spot on.  This shop operates like a hangout rather than a business.  Employees tries to ignore you as long as possible and when they finally do get you they have a serious attitude.  I am taking my business elsewhere.

6.description: Sales person was nice, but pushy. It was hard to find something simple. They talk in jargon and up sell you to something more complicated. Fine for the 26 year old hipsters who work there but not for everyone. The whole place has an attitude about it that rubbed me the wrong way.

22.description: Super chill place that I would 100% just go to to hang out, great people working there (who spontaneously dance I guess) and buying there, has an N64 hangout spot (KILLER INSTINCT? SOLD) and the employee Ross is super helpful, knowledgeable, and nice.Not to mention he's incredibly attractive.WINK WINK

15.description: My boyfriend left his vape pen in an Uber while in town. We found this shop and we were really impressed with the service and selection. Ross was great!

7.description: 5 stars for the knowledgeable staff, the abundance of flavor testers, and being extemely dog friendly!

36.description: Stopped in here the other day to pick up a vape set up and some ejuices.  Had a lovely time chatting and trying a bunch of the flavors.  Everybody was really nice and helpful, I'll definitely be coming back :)

30.description: Summary: Great customer service + decent prices.I visited here upon recommendation from my friend.1. Great experience when purchasing my first vaporizerBeing a noob and all, the staff were very patient with my questions. I was invited to check out all the flavors at the little flavor lounge area. I took me a while to pick my favorite flavor (cheesecake) and we provided to talk about the vaporizer itself. They were not pushy at all about trying to selling you the most expensive devices. They took time to figure out what I wanted and my budget. (Bigger battery vs smaller one, size of tanks, etc)2. Follow up visits were great/ Staff is coolI dropped by a few times after the initial visit to ask more questions/ buy more e-juice. They were always very friendly and helpful. Sasha is cool and very approachable. Stephanie is kind and also cool. The staff in general is pretty laid back and chill. I like the vibe the shop and staff exhibits.3. Great pricesI did simple price matches online and their prices are actually cheaper than a lot of online websites. It's unbelievable. I don't mind paying a little more just to support local businesses but their prices are already lower than online websites. You also can't beat the face to face customer service Smoque Vapours provide.4. Chill environmentThe decor is cool and you will usually see people just hanging out in the shop trying out flavors or simply just chatting.Support the local businesses!

3.description: Extremely friendly staff, very helpful. Good selection, and finally found what I was looking for. Thanks guys!

14.description: Not too shabby, friendly helpful staff I even brought  friends in to get them started on vaping instead of cigarettes. Good to see a neighborhood Vape shop this helpful and convenient.

3.description: The decor is.....interesting. A lot of love for the United States of America. It's a good thing this restaurant is loud and proud of the red, white, and blue because you will need a lot to look at while you wait for your food.Don't go to this place in a hurry and don't order breakfast. At least not the biscuits and gravy. Tasted a bit odd and I think it may have upset my stomach. The eggs were average. My friend's poor sausage link looked like a microwave attacked it. Breakfast is perhaps one of the easiest meals to cook unfortunately their cook doesn't know how to cook it.I do give this place three stars because the price is insanely cheap, especially for downtown Chicago. Just remember if you go, relax and take your time because your food will take forever. If this place lasts a year I will be surprised.

1.description: It was good, though I was a bit misled as the prices on their menu online was not what I was charged, it was a few dollars more, in addition there were some items that were listed online that werent actually on the menu, so that def needs to be updated, i was a bit annoyed at that, aside from that though, the food was good, i got a 4 piece chicken meal with mac n cheese and stuffing, the mac was really good

2.description: Note: It's a 3.5 star rating rounded up.WOW!! Did I just step into someone's presidential campaign headquarters? Their grand opening was the same day Trump announced he's running for president. Coincidence? You decide! ;) Red, white, and blue patriotic theme splashed all over this joint, you'd feel like a Benedict Arnold being a hater. All jokes aside, I think this place has a lot of potential. They had just opened so I understand there are many kinks to work out, and they just need to find a groove. My review may seem a little bit harsh now, but I do plan on updating it as they figure out a system over time.After asking my friend about this place several times, we finally found the opportunity to stop by for lunch. We both ordered the steak and eggs since we love breakfast food. He got there before me so he ordered his food before I got there. The steak and eggs are supposed to come with hashbrowns, grits, and a biscuit so my friend ordered a side of gravy. He was never asked how we wanted his eggs so he got scrambled by default and didn't receive his biscuit. When I got my food, I didn't receive any grits or biscuit. They did ask me how I wanted my eggs cooked, but I received eggs over hard when I ordered over medium. Both of our steaks were well done so it was a little dry and tough to eat. We also ordered some party wings with chipotle ranch sauce. I would recommend asking for the sauce on the side because they were drenched in it. They were supposed to come with fries, but they forgot. It did take a long time to get the food after ordering, and it wasn't a packed house. Like I said before, they just need to figure it out. The menu they had is more extensive than what's listed on their website so come in and check it out. They had dinner items and daily specials. I definitely want to come back on a Tuesday for the short rib and sometime during the weekend for the ribs!

9.description: Waited 35 minutes for my food before leaving. It smelled good, I would have loved to try it.

10.description: I had a really good experience here - good food, friendly staff and great price. What more do you want from a casual place in the south loop?I had the short rib special, which was delicious. Lots of super tender short rib, potatoes and vegetable and an incredibly rich gravy. My wife had the wings, which were crisp, spicy and juicy. You can tell a lot about a soul food place from their mac and cheese. Wingers' mac and cheese is great. I plan on coming back next time I'm in the area. A friend of mine had breakfast and said it was good.For what its worth, this place opened in June, so most of these reviews are from the first few weeks of business. Give it a try.

4.description: Came in to Chicago from California to a Bears game and this place was highly recommended by #Showtime at The Blake Hotel. The only reason im giving it a 3 is because it took them 45 minutes to get us our food and one person in our party didnt get her food with the rest of us. The food is beyond AMAZING great flavors but the service is just unacceptable. Never got drink refills either. And did I mention we were the only customers in there at 9am on sunday.

6.description: Great food. Some of the best I have had in awhile. But the wait is absolutely brutal for the food they're serving. I walk in and there is no one in front of me and my order alone takes 20 minutes. To their credit they do warn you on the door about the wait time and that they make their orders fresh, but still. That and the menu has several typos and is hardly ever correct. I hate to think what the wait time is when there is a line or more than 1 order.

12.description: We celebrated a bday here and had a blast. The staff are super friendly, it's a real family feel and they went out if their way to celebrate with balloons, pie, and singing.  The menu focuses on soul food, wings and burgers.

5.description: The food here is freshly prepared - be prepared to wait at least 20-25 minutes before receiving your order. Management appears to be aware of the issue and has at least 4 signs in the restaurant asking for their customers patience. With that said, I ordered smothered chicken, red beans and rice, and Mac and cheese. The food was great and generous but I waited 25 minutes to receive on a Friday night  in which there was only one other patron. The decor inside is  a U.S.A. theme - it may come across as obnoxious but a worker explained that they are all about patriotism which is understandable I guess. I actually give this place a 3.5 - the food took a while and the owner was rude to one of his staff members and as a result me when I asked if he could break my 10 dollar bill for change. He slammed the cash on the table as he presented. If not for that incident, I would give this place a 4 easily.

11.description: So fun!! Go here!!Atmosphere is a blast, food quality is what you'd expect and it's right in the middle of down town Chicago. I think it's worth is for some rockin wings, Chi-style.

8.description: This place is absolutely terrible. The decor is obnoxious. The food is mediocre. The staff very slow and is obviously not trained properly and seem to be just hanging around not working.Anyone that gives this place a positive review must be working for the restaurant.Questions:Who designed the interior of this place, Betsy Ross?How does the wait staff not know the menu? How do you not have blue cheese or ranch dressing when you serve buffalo wings?Why do you have to wait so long for fast food?Who wants to eat cold fries with no salt?What sit down restaurant checks your id when you hand them your credit card?Why do you have to walk all the way to back of the restaurant to give your signature on a portable ipad?This place needs some serious work. Amateur hour. I would not recommend it.

0.description: Stumbled upon this place for breakfast and it was so good came back the next day.  Reasonably priced diner with a whole lot of style.  Hash browns were delicious, eggs done the way we ordered them and served with friendly fun.

7.description: May be the most inefficient operation in restaurant history. Instead of waiting 30 plus minutes like the rest of folks in line, I asked (and received) the six leftover wings that were sitting (likely for hours) on a hot plate. I have to admit those wings hit the spot at 1am

28.description: Underwhelmed. Person at door seemed uninterested in me as guest. Waitress took order dropped  and off food. had to wait 30mins b4 she came bck. Food was lukewarm and mediocre. Won't go back.  The Cantonese Duck wraps were cold and soggy.  The Potstickers were cold too and mediocre.I put my debit card down so I could atleast get a check, seeing as how my waitress never returned. Some random person walked by after 10 mins and I had her cash me out. We were one of three tables in the enitre restaurant, so I have no idea why the service sucked so bad.  We were staying at the adjoining hotel, it was cold (-8 degrees) and we were hungry and desparate for food, so I chanced it at Mei's and was sorry I did.  I won't go back!

1.description: Came here after finding out Yolk had a 45 minute wait. We had limited time, and eggs are eggs, so we came across Mei's after walking down the street searching for alternatives. Waited 20 minutes before anyone came over to even give us some water. Ordered a breakfast sandwich, and yogurt with fruit, which we were charged differently than on the menu, but we didn't have time to argue the $1 difference. But the principle of it! You'll get a decent selection of breakfast/brunch items but this is more of a restaurant that serves brunch and not a brunch place.

9.description: Showed up half an hour before noon on a Saturday to discover the kitchen was closed.  The buffet, we were told, was still open.  Wound up paying $13 a plate for soggy waffles, runny and flavorless eggs, and the cheapest, greasiest, most inedible sausage in all of Chicago.  Even if your meal is free with your hotel room, it isn't worth your time (or the arterial plaque you'll acquire) to eat here.Also, shame on yelp for hiding so many negative reviews  under a "not recomended" tab. When a restaurant is so bad it inspires dozens of people to create accounts just to complain about it, you do a great disservice to the community by burying that data.

29.description: my boyfriend & i tried mei's kitchen because it was connected to the lobby of our hotel. we ordered seafood dumplings and spring rolls to go, which we thought would be pretty hard to mess up. however, the appetizers were pricey and super disappointing. the dumplings were soggy with air pockets in them, and the spring rolls were mediocre at best. the sauces that accompanied both weren't complimentary taste-wise, either. definitely not worth the price or the wait. don't do it!

23.description: We were staying at the Grant Park Best Western so we ate there for breakfast and dinner. The buffet for breakfast was good and the service was excellent. Sam did a great job as a waiter.Dinner wasn't quite as nice. The burger was really good but the ribeye was just "so-so". The service at dinner was good but not like breakfast.Andy the waiter we had for dinner was really condescending and almost a little rude.

5.description: This place was terrible. I still have no idea who our waiter was supposed to be. The girl who waited on us actually said that she wasn't our server but she would take our order because she had nothing else to do. Food was ok, nothing special. We had to get our own coffee refills. And then they forgot to give our credit card back and we had to return later to get it from them.

31.description: What is the deal with service? I walked in. Nobody there to greet us. Waited for a minute, and the owner/waiter/counterdude/? handed us a couple of menus. I said, "can we sit outside?"  He says, "sure". We go outside, sit down, and when is he ever coming back? He had handed us a menu of lunch specials which was pretty much turkey sandwich, burgers, some pizzas, and then some Chinese food on the bottom. Kinda weird, huh? What kind of place IS this?The menu says, this is lunch menu but you can order from the FULL menu as well. So when he comes back, I ask for the full menu. It looked more Asian, as the name of the restaurant would suggest.It had potstickers, bbq pork buns, wonton noodle soups, etc, as light fare. Alot of the menu items showed the pork ingredient as BERKSHIRE PORK in capitals. What is Berkshire Pork? (Ok, I just googled it.......it's a high quality pork from a rare breed from Britain)So I ordered the wonton noodle soup. My wife ordered the roast duck over rice plate.After 15 minutes, the orders came out. My wonton noodle soup (with 5 Berkshire pork wontons) was delicious. However, I don't know Berkshire pork when I taste it. It was good, though. It had a hearty serving of egg noodles, and the wontons were homemade, as well as the rich chicken broth. I hate those broths made from instant Chinese soup aka MSG broth powder from a can. This was the perfect antithesis. Ahhhh....quite the change from most Chinese restaurants of late.My wife's duck was awesome....perhaps the best I've had in many years since my Dad, who was a Chinese chef used to make that in the BBQ oven in the back of the restaurant kitchen. Most notably, the skin was really crispy, and the meat moist. It tasted like it was just made. On the side was some steamed baby bok choy and some dipping sauce which tasted like hoisin thinned out with a little rice vinegar. I was really impressed, because based on the service, I thought we had made a bad decision. Oh yeah, 10 mins after we started eating, this dude who I hadn't seen yet shows up at the table and says "Is everything ok?". He had startled me, but may have been a waiter who showed up late for a shift or something. He ended up bringing us the check.............so yes, there is more than one employee there.I have to give them 4 stars for the food, 1 for service. Yes, I'd go back, but  at least wait to be seated..........

25.description: I joined yelp just to warn others about how bad this place is.The girlfriend and I were stuck in the rain and looking for someplace to eat. Knowing how bad this place would have been, we should have stayed in the rain.The placed looked empty from the outside and we thought it was closed at first. We met a server who seated us and acted like we were bothering her. 10 minutes go buy which is more than enough time to look at the half page menu they had then she comes back to take our food order. What about drinks? Again, seemed like we were bothering her by ordering something other than the half glass of water they poured for us. Another 20 minutes go by and we finally get our food which was terrible. I chose the roasted duck which they cut in such a way where every bite was a struggle to find meat and pick out residual bones. The girlfriend got a ham and cheese sandwich that tasted like it was sitting under a heat lamp for 2 days. The prices were cheap enough but so was the food. Please stay away from this place.

12.description: I've been here a few times and the food and service has always been quite good. Alfredo, in particular, is a very gracious host and took our order as soon as we were ready. I've had the salmon, crab cakes, and two different types of pizza. All were very good. The bread pudding is awesome. I do understand the mixed reviews given that this place, at some point, was an Asian restaurant and is living with several remnants of its previous life - an ambiguous name, misleading Asian food advertising on the outside awning, etc. It's a shame bc they have a nice American bistro-ish menu selection, laid back ambiance, reasonable prices, and good food.  I hope their management is reading these reviews and 1) invests in some simple marketing to embrace the current theme and 2) makes sure the staff is on the ball so people aren't sitting around for service. Sounds like these two improvements would go a long way.

21.description: Terrible, terrible, terrible!  Was on my way to yoke and thought id try something different for lunch so I stopped in here.....bad decision!  Service sucked and there was only one other table besides mine.  The fries tasted like bad grease, the egg rolls had water dripping out and the steaksandwich was freazer burnt.  I will never go back....save yourself the money and go somewhere else

16.description: Much like most of the other reviewers we came to this place because the wait for yolk was too long. However, unlike the rest of the reviews we were completely satisfied with everything. The waitress was attentive and we waited about 10 min if that for our food. Our food was great as there was no complaints from anybody at our table.Our meal was about 10 bucks which is most definitely reasonable.I feel that this place got bad reviews because people were angry about not being to eat at yolk, which is unfair to this place.Next time I am in Chicago I will definitely be coming back to meis kitchen for breakfast.

17.description: Stopped in here since it was the closest place to the train station after the Bears game. We just had some beer and pot stickers, nothing to write home about since we were just waiting for the train and trying to stay warm.

10.description: We looked up the menu online and looked interested in the items listed.  Outside the awning says "authentic Asian cuisine." The logo has some sort of Asian language character on it. We went and sat down.We were the only ones in there. We sat down and looked at the menu and it was entirely different. No Asian cuisine whatsoever.  As we were leaving the waiter came and said very nicely "let me guess, you were looking for Chinese food. I had the same thing happen to me thirty minutes ago. I wish I had something to do with correcting the website. Its completely inexcusable. Come back if you want some good american bistro food."At least they were nice about it.  We didn't eat here.

11.description: Pathetic.Got Lemon Chicken. It literally had 2 cubes of chickens a piece of lettuce and a slice of lemon. The whole thing must have weighed less than 2 ounces. I paid ~ $14 for that. And did I mention the food was in a box and cold?If you go there to eat, you're stupid.

26.description: I ended up here because yolks line was too long for me and my stomach was touching my spine (super hungry) and I could eat my arm off. I ordered off the menu a basic breakfast of eggs, hash browns, toast, and bacon. The eggs were that fake egg stuff, bacon was deep fried in oil, hash browns reminded me of McDonald's hash browns and greasy. Orange juice was obviously from concentrate and needed more water to dilute the taste a bit. All I enjoyed was the toast.

27.description: The first night I got spring rolls and a salad to go. The gal at the counter was super nice. The inside of tje spring rolls were strangely mushy but still were good.The next day we ate in. the food was great but our waitor had to come back a few times and ask again which beverages we had ordered which seemed a little ameteur and unprofessional but he was nice and thw food was jiat fine. How much can you really expect from a hotel restaurant.

35.description: Sometimes when a restaurant is not what you're expecting, and not quite up to par, it's really disappointing.  You feel like you've wasted your time and money and wish you'd just gone to McDonald's, instead. Other times, the experience is hilarious enough to make up for it--if you're with good friends in a good mood, that is.  Luckily, that was the case for us a couple of weeks ago. My brother is a music student at Columbia College and all of his recitals and concerts take place about 20 feet from this place.  This time there were 10 of us, mostly my parents' friends, and we were in a celebratory mood after the brother's triumph: the senior recital.  It was a Thursday evening and my dad attempted to make a reservation--they INSISTED he didn't need one.  Which was true...we were basically the only ones there. We told all our friends we'd been there millions of times but...wait?  Had we?  How has this been an Asian place?  Had we just not noticed?The menu was eclectic, mostly Asian food (featuring especially BERKSHIRE PORK, which they seem to be obsessed with) but also burgers and pizza. Our waiter was awfully sweet, and good lord did he try hard, but his English was just not very good.  Most of the hilarity of the evening came from trying to communicate with him what it was we wanted, and the manager had to intervene/translate several times.  The server knew every item on the menu, and everyone got the item they ordered--but he really couldn't understand details like how people wanted their burgers cooked, if they wanted cheese (and what kind), and the names of wines (nothing complicated...just Merlot and Pinot...)I had the veggie pizza and I think it was the big winner of the evening (it really was very good--had unexpected pizza toppings like corn, peas, and broccoli.  Sort of random, but tasty).  The burgers were hit or miss (extremely well done or very rare) and I think the Asian stuff was as well. Service was a bit slow, which always seems to happen when there's no one else in the restaurant and I can never understand why.  Also, my dad ordered lemonade and ginger ale, and the manager said they didn't serve lemonade....then halfway through our meal I saw some waiters carrying a giant jug of it through the restaurant.  It looked like it was for a special event or something, not regular restaurant service.  But still...they clearly had it on hand.Finally, the bill felt slightly high, but it honestly wasn't bad...I think there were just a lot of us, and many of us ordered drinks, and the food was slightly disappointing so it felt slightly more overpriced.  Add in Cook County taxes and you've got yourself a pricey total.  But meal by meal, I actually thought it was very reasonable. In conclusion: my pizza was great, and we came away with some new stories and family catchphrases...but we probably won't be back.

8.description: I love the cheese pizza here. Hear me out..we actually go here instead of Giordanos because we like the pizza just as much and don't have to wait an hour for it to come out.  The food is decent quality at the very least and actually quite enjoyable.I think the only thing I'd improve is to change the black awning outside to accurately reflect what the place really is inside.  We live close by and its our hidden gem for sure. Don't judge a book by its cover.

0.description: We came here on Christmas day craving some good Chinese food and wow did we find some.We started with the crab rangoon which was delicious anf made with real crab. For dinner he had the roasted duck and pork combo plate served with baby bok choy and rice. I had the noodle bowl in a beef broth with roasted pork..bok choy...mushrooms etc. Serious deliciousness.We ordered a bottle of sake and he brought it out  in 4 increments as to keep it warm for us.Service was spectacular as well. A definite recommend

20.description: I have passed by this place for years without stopping.   I must say that the Seafood Fried Rice here is the BEST [hands down] rice I have ever eaten.   The flavor profile is right on. Its so delicious that I came back just one day after to have it again, and waited over 30 minutes for lunch to start just to order it.   Sally, the waitress from Africa, is a sweetheart.

19.description: An onsite review. Empty bar/restaurant. Staff nowhere to be found. Already two parties walked out in frustration without paying. The staff here should consider a career change. So much potential...  Wasted. Avoid at all costs.Postscript: The bill was messed up, too.  (Yes, I waited around long enough to pay.)

33.description: Lettuce wraps were good, but a bit salty, and $12 was a bit much for just three wraps. Same can be said for the dumplings, though they were three for $4.Waited almost ten minutes after we finished eating for the bill and finally got up and found our waitress to ask for it. Waited another few minutes before we finally got it.

2.description: We came here because, like many people probably, Yolk was too long of a line. I don't necessarily regret going here, but I'll definitely just do the wait at Yolk next time. Pros: no wait (which could also be considered a con)Biscuits and gravy were good, but you can't really mess that up. The waffles were pretty good. But it comes pre-syrupedCons: there were not that many people in the restaurant but it took forever to get our food. The omelette didn't have its ingredients mixed in...they just threw it in the middle of a flat egg thing. The steak biscuit was absolutely horrible. I went with like 6 people, that's why I had such a wide variety of food.

34.description: An onsite review. Empty bar/restaurant. Staff nowhere to be found. Already two parties walked out in frustration without paying. The staff here should consider a career change. So much potential...  Wasted. Avoid at all costs.Postscript: The bill was messed up, too.  (Yes, I waited around long enough to pay.)

32.description: My fiance and I went here this morning because the line at Yolk was so long.  I would NEVER go back.  First, we walked in and no one sat us.  We waited a few minutes, had a waitress walk past us mumbling something a few times, then finally what seemed like the owner maybe sat us but only gave us one menu and one place setting.After 5 minutes of no server, I saw the maybe-owner and asked for a server.  He tried to tell us that he didn't even sit us there and that was why we had no server.  Excuse me?  He seriously argued in the middle of the restaurant that he didn't seat us there.  Finally we get a server, I thought he was nice in the beginning.  To make a long story short, we asked for coffee and water and since we only had one coffee cup on the table- he took one off the un-bussed table next to ours and gave it to us; brought only one water glass and left the pitcher w/out filling the water; took 10 minutes before he came back to take our order and I had to remind him for another water glass; never came to refill our coffee; wouldn't bring me another set of silverware until my food would come.  That's the little of it all.After he told me he wouldn't bring another silverware set until our food (nevermind I wanted a napkin!), we got up and left, paid for our coffee and said we wouldn't be needing the food we ordered.  My fiance who is the nicest guy ever told this owner how horrible the service was and he just nodded his head saying he didn't think it was bad at all! Don't go there!  Don't even try it.  The service was horrible and I bet the food would be too.

18.description: I really wish I could like this place especially since it is so convenient BUT I just can't.I came here for breakfast awhile back and I was so disgusted that I swear I will never return.  The food looked okay and presentable... but nothing special... but the service was something indescribable.The wait was about 15 minutes even though there were only a few people in front of me and they were surprisingly not busy for the time.  Once we were seated, we went to the buffet to check out the buffet menu and their literally was nothing left... they said they would be refilling it but the point of a buffet is to get it right away so we decided to just order.We watched who seemed to be the owner run around and take food to tables, and it is very embarrassing, but the owner was sweating an uncontrollable amount.  So much that I was so grossed out I asked our waitress to please be sure to bring us our food and not have him serve it because I wouldn't eat it.  I explained why- he was literally dripping and I am not even joking- dripping sweat in the food.  To say the least when we finally got our food 50 MINUTES LATER I had no appetite left and was turned off by the place I will never return.

13.description: Good service. Recommend grilled salmon!

4.description: If you're looking for a quick breakfast/brunch - this is not the spot.  The 1 star is for the staff, the one gentleman who greeted me tried to do his best - explain the options, follow-up on the details of the order, but that was about it.  I ordered the Florentine Benedict which came out over cooked - and no server to follow-up with was to be found.  It was pretty cheap food, so I thought I wasn't expecting 5-star quality, but this could have been significantly better.I never saw my server again.  Another person dropped off the bill, but never returned to pick it up.  I took the bill to the counter to pay causing the wait staff to get into an argument about who can run tickets.I was just looking for a low-key, good quality brunch on my first day in Chicago.  Sadly, this was not the place.

24.description: We walked here from the Shedd Aquarium becaue i was starving and it was the first place we saw.I wish we would have walked a block down to any other restaurant.Despite having lots of chucks of undisolved bouillon cubes in the food, it was still incredibly flavorless.What they lacked in taste was certainly not made up for in ambiance. complete snooze-fest.

6.description: Same as many folks, we were planning on going to the Yolk and didn't want the wait! Should have waited. The hash browns were the deep fried pre-made triangles.The old grease made them inedible. Eggs were overcooked and under cooked. Really should have kept walking.

22.description: DON"T GO!!! Went to Mei's when line at Yolk was too long...took an hour to get food and when it arrived,  (I ordered an omelette) canned mushrooms, frozen spinach and frozen hash browns in the shape of a triangle...something you'd get at burger king!  Unbelievable!  The manager seemed uninterested as did the entire wait staff.  The table was dirty and their were sticky fingerprints everywhere.  This place could be great (location) , but fails in every aspect.

15.description: I just left Mei's Kitchen restaurant after being seated and ignored for 10 minutes.I kid you not, there were more employees than customers, and no one came to my table.A waiter walked by me three times and didnt even look at me, acknowledge me or anything. I am a 45 year old male professional. I was on my iPad while I was waiting. Skip this place.... Plus it's menu is bizarre... From potstickers, chicken tenders, pizza and burgers. Why did I go in in the first place!??

7.description: We stopped in here due to the insane wait time at Yolk next door. The food was ok, at best. We were so hungry though so, it didn't really matter.

36.description: I was seeking breakfast after having done the Race for the Cure 5K.  Of course, Bongo Room and Yolk were packed.  I wasnt too keen on waiting an hour for an overpriced, overcrowded restaurant.  Thankfully I stumbled on Fornetto and Mei's Kitchen.Admittedly, the place is a little confusing.  It appears to be a hotel restaurant but I dont think it is.  The have a huge dining room.  When you walk in there is a coffee bar, the dining room is to the left and all the way to the left there is a bar and a cute lounglike seating area.  The breakfast menu is pretty average.  They had a breakfast buffet for $9.95 which included coffee, 5 kinds of juice, a selection of cold cereals including granola, assorted bread and pastries, bacon, sausage, waffles, eggs, hash browns and fresh fruit.  I think the breakfast buffet was the most expensive thing on the menu.You can dine outside on Michigan Avenue or inside the large airy dining room.  Again, it's not extraordinary gourmet foodie type stuff but if you are looking for no frills breakfast in the South Loop this place is a great option.

30.description: My wife and I ended up here after trying to get a table at both the Bongo Room and Yolk. 45 minute waits at each. No thanks. Mei's Kitchen was empty, and we got seated right away. I guess I'm not surprised by the number of sour reviews of this place. I'm sure that a good number of people, disappointed that they couldn't get in to Yolk, end up walking through Mei's Kitchen door.But, for folks who are just looking for food rather than an experience, this place would suit just fine. I don't know if the breakfast service is *that* odd: You order at the counter, sit down, and they bring it out to you. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time. My french toast and bacon were to my liking, and my wife enjoyed her chocolate banana crepes. The end result is that we ate a good breakfast for a quite a bit less than we would have at the first couple places we had attempted. We'll be coming back again.

3.description: Breakfast was a satisfying and an easy option this winter morning since we stayed in Best Western in the same building. I don't think I'd come here if I had choice.

14.description: If you cant get in Yolk, this is 5steps away from it without the wait. You'd have to wait and holler hard for someone to take your order and give you water. Once they do, theyre on the roll with the bomb dot com coffee since they serve the italian coffee! Im not picky with food, its nothing extravagant, but its breakfast and i love breakfast!

58.description: Stayed at the Hilton so went down one night when it was too hot to venture far. Ordered the fish and chips, tasty but not worth the price. Service was fast but probably wouldn't go back if I had a choice.

56.description: Nice little pub inside of the hotel. I think you can enter from the street but I was so blarney wasted I can't remember how I got out, let alone in. So they hosted a work event here, basically 100's of people in the construction industry gettin fershnickered. but they handled the volume very well, were patient and didn't seem frazzled. They even had an Irish dude working at the bar. I drunkenly ate off of strangers plates - Chicken wings - these were okPretzels - standardGood little place, worth a visit. They even had a bunch of dudes come thru with the bagpipes. Word.

29.description: The "Irish Pub"  looks like half diner half failed attempt for a pub feel.  We ordered a salad that tastes horrible besides the bacon and egg on it.  5je chicken wings were good.  The service was a joke.  The bartender obviously does not give a shit about his job.

42.description: Good food, but we had to wait an hour on a Monday night for food to arrive. Wait time is ridiculous. Noisy atmosphere. Shepherd's pie was good.

23.description: Came in here for lunch on a Sunday because the first couple places we tried had long lines. Didn't really know anything about the place but it didn't have a line so we were sold.The lunch menu seemed pretty normal with your usual sandwiches, salads, burgers, etc. We also got to choose our seating so that was a plus.Our waitress was friendly, attentive & prompt & didn't seem to mind us sitting around & chatting for a bit after we'd paid the bill either.

47.description: If I could give less than one star I would. So to start off they have an Irish bar tender with zero personality. Asked for three Irish car bombs, was told "NO" we're not that kind of bar!! I guess apparently they don't sell booze!  never heard those words in all my years! The bartender did serve us beer as we were flabbergasted for almost an hour. Never will return to this bar again!!!!

8.description: Putting it politely the service was poor and our drinks followed suit. How can draft beer very in taste? The food however was good.

31.description: Although nothing is more generic than an Irish pub in a hotel, the food is pretty decent. The wings were crispy and spicy and the wild boar sloppy Joe was tasty and filling and the French fries (steak style) were excellent. Music was nice; The Strokes and Muse come to mind.  Its actually a 2 stars joint, but for not sucking as a hotel pub it gets an extra star.

34.description: I can think of about 20 Irish pubs off the top of my head that are better than Kitty's, but if you've got someone from out of town staying at a hotel off Michigan Ave it's not a bad option. The food is decent, they pour a good Guinness and there's usually some sort of live Irish music so your mom and dad will probably get a kick out of that. Mine always do. My biggest issue has always been the under staffing here. It's taken forever the couple times I've been before, but last night our poor waitress was incredibly swamped. We waited for a good half hour till our drink order was taken and almost that for it to arrive. Our girl was hustling so it definitely wasn't her fault, but another employee or two on the floor probably would have stepped up the overall star experience.

16.description: In town for a conference and this bar is located in Hilton so stopped in for a desert and wine. Great waiter Jay , helped me on desert choice and I decided on the salted caramel crunch cake and glass of Riesling. It was good for bar desert and waiter was great so I'm happy. I agree with some of the other reviewers it is pricey.

13.description: Corned Beef Sliders and Shepard's Pie are a MUST.So yummy. We were staying at the Hilton and didn't want to go out since it was raining and foggy. Didn't expect much from this pub, but we were so happy with our meal! The Shepard's pie was perfect for the weather. It just warmed me up inside, Kids liked their mac n cheese and fish n chips.

11.description: Can here cuz I was staying the Hilton above...... Butt was super surprised by the service and the atmosphere.... Really nice would recommend to all

39.description: Weak drinks, terrible bartender, overpriced.  The lady who "helped" us at the bar couldn't bartend her way out of a paper bag

37.description: Kind of pricey because it is attached to the Hilton. The waiters were slow.  There was nobody there and we still waited for a good 5 minutes before anyone eve said hi.  That is not a long time, but when you are one of 4 other patrons, it seems service should be snappier. The potato flat bread was great.  They have Murphy's on the menus but when asked for, we were told they no longer carry it.  What is up with not updating your menu?  Went with a Smithwicks, but still!

0.description: For a hotel dining establishment, I was very pleasantly surprised by Kitty O'Shea's.  We were a bigger group, in town for a conference (7, and expecting 2 more), and they were very accommodating.  Our server was very friendly, answered the questions we had, and didn't bat an eye when we needed our alcoholic beverages on separate tabs.We started with the cheese plate (three cheese options with raspberry jam, and crostini), and the curry fries (with a cheese sauce, and a curry sauce), and an order of the Award Winning Mac and Cheese.  This was so odd, it was compelling and good.  We passed it around the table and all shared.  It had cauliflower and golden raisins, was topped with a puff pastry and a miso butterscotch sauce.  It is worth the try!I had the Shepard's Pie and it was excellent - highly recommended.  Some of the folks in my party had the Fish and Chips and there were also pleased.In addition, Kitty O'Shea's has a nice selection of Irish Whiskeys.

38.description: Good selection of beer and the shepherds pie was okay. Seriously lacking in table seating.

51.description: Wandered over here on Friday night after a day at Lollapalooza and had a decent time. It's a hotel bar, so you'll be hanging out with tourists, but since all of them had a Lolla story, it was fun to share in them. The place is clean and decorated and they had a dude playing some traditional irish songs making for a pleasant atmosphere. The bartender was awesome, though I may be more than a little biased toward an Irish bartender. But the Guinness should come in a Guinness glass. This is the Hilton, after all! The waitstaff get uniforms, and so should the drinks!So yeah, I'll always choose Fado for a Guinness, but it's nice to mix it up every once in a while. And when you're in Grant Park, this place is super convenient.

27.description: You had me at Killian's on tap.Dad and I came here for lunch on SoxFest Saturday and we shared a good experience.  He had a Smithwick's pint and I, a Killian's.  Pretty decent menu (prices were what you'd expect for a restaurant on Michigan Avenue, which is to say, 'a lot').My old man enjoyed his pulled pork sandwich that came with salt & vinegar chips.  I ordered their 'world famous' mac & cheese, which when it arrived was an unexpected (unpleasant?) surprise.  They start with spiral tube noodles in a creamy, white cheese sauce and then top it with breadcrumbs.  Then it gets weird.  A substantial drizzling of salted caramel accompanied a sweet, sugary mixture that reminded me of the toppings on a streusel muffin.  The idea of combining sweet with savory is ambitious, but I don't think it worked in this case.  Cheesy mac should be left well enough alone--don't get creative and ruin a good thing!  On the upside, it came with lumps of pulled pork, so it was like getting a side order of meat with my mac.We only stopped in for a quick bite, but the service was friendly and expedient, so I would return.

32.description: Great pub. Lotsa great beers and they pour a decent whiskey. Had wings as appetizer order with blue cheese and u will not be disappointed. Had a salad greens, could not eat it.  Wasn't good. Had Kale Geeze that tasted like bad weeds. Won't order that again. But love the bar.

54.description: I'm being generous with the stars because we didn't order any food.We got back to the hotel late and were not ready to turn in, so we came here to Kitty O'Shea's. It was a pleasant surprise as it was relatively quiet and so we were quickly seated and served.  We ordered Bailey's and decaf and they were hot and flavorful though not overly steeped with Bailey's. I had two and didn't feel particularly inebriated so I think they went pretty easy on the Bailey's.  You wouldn't have thought that from the price which was typical hotel bar pricing.  We enjoyed our visit enough that we considered returning, but there was just nothing all that special about Kitty O'Shea's that we wouldn't go, as another reviewer noted, to a Starbuck's down the street instead.Okay for a hotel bar, but nothing much beyond that.

48.description: Not much to write about this place.  We happened to be staying at the hotel and after walking around the city we stopped into Kitty's for a beer.  Service was ok, nice decor we did not try the food so cannot comment on that.

44.description: This is an Irish pub located on the ground floor of the Chicago Hilton Towers.  Pretty basic menu with your standard salads, burgers, soup, American food, but it's overall pretty good for a hotel bar/restaurant!  I had just come from a reception, so ordered only the basic salad which was unexpectedly tasty with a fried egg on top.

24.description: Kitty O'sheas is located in the Chicago Hilton. Had lunch here upon arrival for a conference. Wasn't very busy so service was quick. I had the grilled chicken sandwich and it was very good. My daughter had the Mac and cheese which comes in a mini cast iron skillet and was very good. My friend had the fish and chips and said it was also very good. A little pricy but in a hotel after all.

7.description: Easy, no fuss place that offers Pub classics as well as modern healthy alternatives.Inside it looks like Irish Pub, outside like a modern cafe. Food is delicious! I ordered Pub Garden Salad and loved every little bite of it!Will be back for sure

49.description: We got to the Hilton and wanted something convenient before crashing. The wait staff was very friendly and was more than welcoming with our two young kids. The portions of food were huge and we pretty good. Overall it was a good place. Nothing fancy.

40.description: This is definitely a hotel bar. However the drinks are pretty bad. My summer lemonade came with a gummy orange. It felt like I was I ordered a kiddy drink! It cost $12 and had very little alcohol. The meal wasn't worth the cost either. My chicken sandwich looked like a half a breast and I never revived the honey mustard for which I asked.
