My friends got the soup with Irish soda bread, both were not good and they are less than half. Overall, if you're in need of some calories and a place to drink light drinks- this is the place. Otherwise, walk outside the hotel and experience another restaurant. I won't be returning here by choice. I considered one star, but since I didn't get food positioning I will give it two.

53.description: This place is just OK. I live in the neighborhood and wanted to try a new place for some good beer. It is a little over-priced, nothing fancy, nothing that any other pubs in the neighborhood can't offer. They don't have a whole lot of collection for beers on tap. I had chicken wings which was pretty decent. Service was pretty good as well and hence the three stars.

30.description: I'd remembered that Kitty O'Shea's served the best Chicken Pot Pie on the planet, so I insisted that my convention colleagues join me here for dinner.  It's the crazy crowded hotel bar, but they were willing to accommodate. Unfortunately, they've taken the pot pie off the menu, and we just had a passable dinner in a busy hotel bar.  Darn!  The Shepherd's Pie was only fair. The cheesy potato top was okay, but there was more gravy than meat underneath, and the meat wasn't very well seasoned (no lamb involved either, but it still had looked like the best thing on the menu.)  Mussels were equally boring, although I did appreciate that they had opened them in the kitchen so I didn't have to stare longingly at any closed shells.  My colleagues were okay with their salad and fish & chips, but they weren't anything special.

46.description: Fantastic Sheppard pie, week day last call is 1pm depending on the crowd. I was here on a tuesday night and it was a full house at midnight

1.description: Not a bad little bar for being inside of the hotel. Definitely had a pub type of atmosphere. It is a bit small, and if you're here on a convention, getting a beer or drink can be a bit tough. Still a good overall establishment.

55.description: Stayed at the Hilton and came here for a later dinner but not absurdly late by any means. The whole "seat yourself" thing at 9pm is annoying when you're coming to eat and drink, not just drink. We found a spot to sit with relative ease, but it took nearly 10 minutes for someone to come acknowledge our presence. It was busy, and I understand that, but maybe just maybe they should have a hostess. The food was ok; the boyfriend had the burger; I had the chicken, brie, and arugula sandwich. It tasted good but was a bit bland (would have been better had I asked for them to add the onion jam that accompanies the burger). The burger was decent but also a bland, aside from the tasty jam. The fries were ok, as were the chips; they would have been better had they actually been warmer. Overall, this place was convenient and the food was ok. I'd recommend it to someone who wants to pick something up if they're staying in the Hilton, want something sit-down-y and relaxing, and don't want to move beyond the confines of the hotel. Otherwise, I'd totally pass on it and recommend people do the same.

9.description: You had me at Killian's on tap.Dad and I came here for lunch on SoxFest Saturday and we shared a good experience.  He had a Smithwick's pint and I, a Killian's.  Pretty decent menu (prices were what you'd expect for a restaurant on Michigan Avenue, which is to say, 'a lot').My old man enjoyed his pulled pork sandwich that came with salt & vinegar chips.  I ordered their 'world famous' mac & cheese, which when it arrived was an unexpected (unpleasant?) surprise.  They start with spiral tube noodles in a creamy, white cheese sauce and then top it with breadcrumbs.  Then it gets weird.  A substantial drizzling of salted caramel accompanied a sweet, sugary mixture that reminded me of the toppings on a streusel muffin.  The idea of combining sweet with savory is ambitious, but I don't think it worked in this case.  Cheesy mac should be left well enough alone--don't get creative and ruin a good thing!  On the upside, it came with lumps of pulled pork, so it was like getting a side order of meat with my mac.We only stopped in for a quick bite, but the service was friendly and expedient, so I would return.

26.description: This was an irish bar in the lobby of the Hilton Chicago which was across the street from Grant Park.  We just had beer in here.  They were friendly and the employees had authentic irish accents.

25.description: Located inside the Hilton.  Service was great but don't waste your money on drinks (unless they are bottled or on tap).  Their mixed drinks are very weak and very expensive.  We spent $44 on 2 drinks and 2 shots.  We only went there for drinks so I can't comment on their food.

12.description: I can think of about 20 Irish pubs off the top of my head that are better than Kitty's, but if you've got someone from out of town staying at a hotel off Michigan Ave it's not a bad option. The food is decent, they pour a good Guinness and there's usually some sort of live Irish music so your mom and dad will probably get a kick out of that. Mine always do. My biggest issue has always been the under staffing here. It's taken forever the couple times I've been before, but last night our poor waitress was incredibly swamped. We waited for a good half hour till our drink order was taken and almost that for it to arrive. Our girl was hustling so it definitely wasn't her fault, but another employee or two on the floor probably would have stepped up the overall star experience.

59.description: Huge disappointment. I got the Shepard's Pie...terrible.  After eating maybe 1/4 of it...I got rid of it and ordered a side of French Fries.  Even these were terrible. There will be no further dining here! Only one thing to do here - drink!

21.description: Outdoors were awesome! The weather was great! They do close the patio at 11:00pm but that was plenty of time for me to enjoy the outdoors. Joe was our server and he was such a pleasure.

17.description: I was staying at the hotel so I ordered a salad to go. While I was waiting I ordered a ginger beer. The bartender brought me a nonalcoholic soda instead of a beer. She turned it into a moscow mule which was better but when I got the bill it  was 12 bucks for her mistake. Secondly the drink was very watered down. The salad was not fresh and they gave me two knives instead of a fork so I had to go back and get it for a sub par salad. Poor food and poor customer service. Dont waste your time.

10.description: Ate here during the Blackhawks convention.  It was obviously crazy crowded by the staff handled it well and remained attentive. I enjoyed a delicious bacon, Irish cheddar burger and a green line.  The burger was amazing! And obviously the green line was terrific as always. The fries were perfectly seasoned and not too soggy. I would definitely go back here if I was in the area.  The fact that they can handle that many hungry and thirty Blackhawks fans running around in such a small area is impressive on its own.

5.description: My friends and I met up here for a beer. They have a broad range of beer and other drink options. I appreciated all the different seating arrangements available. Note that it can be very loud and hard to have a conversation. The atmosphere was vibrant, and I can imagine it would be entertaining when flying solo.

3.description: Straight up, Kitty O'Shea's is a hotel bar. It's located inside the Hilton on South Michigan Avenue. I ended up over here because my friend was staying at the Hilton for the Blackhawks Convention, which is, apparently, a huge deal. I mean, he got to hug the Stanley Cup for goodness sakes. Being around the touristy area farther up the road, I hadn't found a decent bar. Even my own hotel's bar, at the Wyndham Riverfront, wasn't all that lively. It must have been all the hockey people, you know my brethren, that did it. Kitty O'Shea's was a happenin' place with hockey fans, Blackhawks players, announcers, etc roaming about. It was the bar I needed and deserved. My friend had been there for a bit and had a spot saved for me upon my arrival. The beer selection was an appropriate mix of local and commercial beers, including Guinness and Magners. If you own an Irish pub and don't have those two drinks, in particular, available, you may want to contemplate the "Irish pub" thought. I, having not found a local beer that suited my taste by that point, went with the Bottom Up Wit from Revolution Brewery, which was the current seasonal selection available. I did not regret my choice and ended up having one more before I left. There was a great folk Irish duo playing throughout the night. They were excellent and pumped the atmosphere way up. They played "Blackbird" by The Beatles, but then seemingly changed the lyrics to "Blackhawks fly" to the delight of the die hard hockey fans in the room. The bartenders were as attentive as they could be with such a large crowd, and the menu looked pretty yummy. I kept debating the Corned Beef and Cabbage, but had already eaten. For a hotel bar, this was a pretty excellent one. If you find yourself wandering about South Michigan Avenue looking for a pint, I'd stop in here.

35.description: It opens until late, food is good but the service and price is bit poor.I saw the menu at the entrance and decided what to have but once I sat at the table, waier told me there isn't such thing. Where's my Shepherd's pie gone!??One of the guy who took my order was blunt, seems like he wanted me to go away soon, but other guy offered me water when I did not have anvthing to drink, so I think not all of them are unfriendly. That saved me somehow.It's in Hilton hotel, so we expect hotel standard but I feel Hilton is not doing very well in that aspect....

19.description: We had the Fish and chips and the pulled pork. The fish was all white meat and good. The pulled pork was good, I didn't care for the slaw they put on it, I've had better. Our server was great. Overall nice place.

28.description: Burgers were tasty and service was friendly.  Stayed at the Hilton and ate lunch there.

45.description: In an almost empty restaurant on Wednesday evening I order the short rib stew with some bread. I was in the navy and chow was better than this. The bread old to the point it would fall apart when you pick it up. Yes I know about Irish bread. This was just awful. The "stew" a clump of mashed potatoes with not much (but good) short rib around it and not very hot I might add. Had visited this place for beers only a few days ago and at seven-eight a pint you can do way better.

33.description: In town for a conference and this bar is located in Hilton so stopped in for a desert and wine. Great waiter Jay , helped me on desert choice and I decided on the salted caramel crunch cake and glass of Riesling. It was good for bar desert and waiter was great so I'm happy. I agree with some of the other reviewers it is pricey.

43.description: Corned Beef Sliders and Shepard's Pie are a MUST.So yummy. We were staying at the Hilton and didn't want to go out since it was raining and foggy. Didn't expect much from this pub, but we were so happy with our meal! The Shepard's pie was perfect for the weather. It just warmed me up inside, Kids liked their mac n cheese and fish n chips.

2.description: had the goat cheese and pig /fig apps...delicious. Great waitstaff. of course enjoyed a Guiness Draught!

18.description: Do you want a side of tots? Well you have to pay for the loaded ones. Plus you will wait half an hour for your drink.

41.description: This probably would have been 3 stars if not for the prices. We came on a friday during the blackhawks convention which we did not know about (try social media so your customers know whats up) and it was absolutely packed. Idk how but we scored a table outside right away and luckily it was nice outside. The food was cooked well but was nothing special. I got the bourbon salmon which need more glaze (the glaze was delicious) but for what you get on the plate it isn't worth the $18. My gf got the shepards pie which was pretty decent but tasted a little bland and not homemade. We got buttered cabbage (good but needed a little pepper and salt maybe), and the mac and cheese which was decent. Their home brew is ok after a glass but my initial thoughts on it were fairly negative. The service was good, a little attitude-y at first but i can imagine she was under a lot of pressure, that place had to of been filled to capacity and then she was much nicer later. The biggest disappointment was the prices which was cool with us since we had a giltcity voucher and it only cost us $29 (SCORE!) However i would not return without a voucher or something.But what do i know, go check it out and yelp it!

52.description: 10 minutes, at least 10 passes by servers, and no recognition I was even there...and there was no sizable crowd. Between that and the smell of a frat-house basement, I made the decision to leave.

50.description: Nice place the Servers are great  and friendly . Food is good to . avg pricing . they also have outside dining.

4.description: Some out-of-town friends were in town recently for the Mexico / Cuba soccer match at Soldier Field. Since they stayed at the Hilton and are partial to the sauce, I assumed there was a 100% chance that I'd have to devote one night to drinking in a hotel bar. And I was right.While I went into the evening dreading the assorted nonsense that hotel bars can present, it actually was a lot of fun. I went with the fish and chips (yep, I have not one original bone in my body) and was pleasantly surprised by the dish I was presented. Perfect amount of batter, fried golden brown, and very reasonably priced for the area. Fries are sort of hard to mangle but these ones were really delicious. Great meal.And Killian's on tap always sends my heart fluttering over the moon and my poor liver throwing its hands in the air and finding something to hide under.

6.description: Came in here for lunch on a Sunday because the first couple places we tried had long lines. Didn't really know anything about the place but it didn't have a line so we were sold.The lunch menu seemed pretty normal with your usual sandwiches, salads, burgers, etc. We also got to choose our seating so that was a plus.Our waitress was friendly, attentive & prompt & didn't seem to mind us sitting around & chatting for a bit after we'd paid the bill either.

22.description: Located inside the Chicago Hilton, this Irish restaurant has the appeal of a pub, but falls a bit short in what I would expect a restaurant especially inside of a Hilton to be. We waited at least 20 minutes to have our order taken, mind this was our first night at the hotel and we were already tired and hungry.. The table next to us was quite close and I felt I was intruding their meal. It was odd to see them eating and having what seemed to be a good time, while we quietly and patiently had to wait for someone to notice us. We ordered some typical traditional Irish foods, and waited once more. There was a live performance with a fiddler and a singer, and that was pleasant I guess but was definitely quite loud. I think a better design would be to have the musician in the pub/bar area, with distinct tables for families and larger groups. Food was ok, and felt I had to eat all of it because I was hungry. Maybe we came on the wrong night, but I would expect a restaurant that KNOWS it will be busy to take care of each of their customers properly. They're not only dining at the restaurant but most likely staying at the hotel too.. Don't wanna lose hotel guests by a negative experience at a resultant, do you?

15.description: Good Irish fare decently priced. I especially dug the wings. And I'm a hardcore wing bigot. OMGGGGG!

57.description: Every year I am here for a Christmas party.  For such a large, lively crowd of mostly men, service is exceptional, the bar is flowing with great drinks and the food is very good!  Great atmosphere! Directly across the street from Grant Park if afterwards you wanted to stroll outside.The owner made his way through the crowd and made sure everything was going well.  Trays of mini corned beef or pulled pork sandwiches and  several varieties of  chicken wings were well prepared.  Tasty and filling!I had no complaints and would venture into Kitty O'Shea's at some point outside of the Holiday season.Excellent Irish Pub!

20.description: Not too shabby for a pub in a hotel.  Bartenders and servers are excellent. Draught selection isn't great but they up for it with some really good onion rings.

36.description: Went here for a work date.  Had the pretzel appetizer and chicken sammich on a pretzel bun. Not mind blowing but it filled me up. Work date had the fish and chips which looked pretty good and he seemed to be content. I hear this is a decent place to stop before a bears game. Overall, not terrible, but meh.

14.description: Kitty Oshea's is in the Hilton Hotel.  I ate/drank there 5 times during a recent stay.  Service is exceptional (5 stars), Ambiance is typical pub (3 stars), Food is as expected, bar food (3 stars), value is high (5 stars) because they offer big portions at reasonable prices.  They could charge a lot more being in a high dollar hotel in Chicago.  I would eat there again.

58.description: I love Pauly's. The food is great, the staff is generally nice, and the food is reasonably priced. The soup and chili are excellent also. There are lots of choices on the full menu as well. The buffalo chicken pizza is amazing!!!

56.description: What a disappointment this place has become since "Pauly" took over.  There truly isn't a recipe that they haven't ruined.  It would seem that, in an aggressive effort to reduce cost, they have sacrificed quality.  Was this reflected in Pauly's new prices?  Absolutely not.  As the food got worse, they actually raised prices.  Within a month of the Pauly take over, the price of a large pizza jumped by ~$3.The food is very below average and the value is terrible.  Please go elsewhere. Chicago has so many better restaurants.  Pauly doesn't deserve your business.

29.description: I'm not sure where some folks are getting their information, but this is not New York pizza. it doesn't say anything like that on their website nor does that seem to be advertised anywhere inside. I'm from NY, and I can tell you right now that this is NOT NYC pizza. If you're looking for NYC pizza, check out Cafe Luigi in Lincoln Park.With that little rant out of the way, my wife and I stumbled upon this place walking home, and thought we'd give this place a shot. We were a little desperate, and I really should have waited for something better. I looked at the menu and saw that slices were basically $4 and up. Are you kidding me? Thin crust pizza slices? One topping?Decided to order a sausage to go, and was happy to see that they at least put the slice in a air-filled bag so the cheese doesn't stick to the bag. Thoughtful at least!So how did it taste? Well the sauce was nicely seasoned and had a good tomato flavor, but the crust and dough was hard like cardboard. It's a shame this place couldn't manage a better dough for this sauce and cheese. It would do wonders for the taste.If you're in a bind, this place will work in a pinch. Got more time and open to something appealing for your taste buds? Please stick to what works in Chicago - deep dish. I can count the number of places that do a decent thin crust (not NYC style, but a Chicago thin crust) and this is not one of them.

42.description: I ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza. I got food poisoning. Need I say more?

23.description: We were headed to a jazz show in the area and needed to eat a quick meal. This spot is in a strip and could be overlooked. There were lots of pizza options. Seems almost like NY pizza instead of Chicago style. Large thin slices but they were tasty and filling.

47.description: The crust tastes like old school frozen pizza. Cardboard style.

8.description: The Popeye and Garbage pizza are my favorite slices of pizza here! I haven't tried the other kinds of pizza, though, because I don't know if their simplicity is worth the $4/slice.The fountain drink machine is self-serve and it's rather expensive (and not worth it) for 1 person to drink while eating there so I would order 1 cup and share it with 1 other person. The staff is friendly. Restroom is available for customers - it's nothing fancy, just a toilet and a sink and maybe a hand dryer or paper towels.It's a great snack place.

31.description: This is one of the most under-rated pizza joints in Chicago. If you want fresh toppings and amazing cheese consistency, you've come to the right place. The dine-in seating is a bit old school and parking can be difficult in that area so I suggest grabbing your pie to go or getting delivery. This is quality pizza at standard, non-Papa John's prices though.

34.description: Ordered through GrubHub, fast delivery and got exactly what I asked for. I ordered a stuffed pep pizza, it was good. Tomato sauce was a bit sweet, but offered different taste than others. Also ordered the buffalo chicken salad, when I opened it I was disappointed that it wasnt a warm salad. But it was still ok. Overall if you like a sausy pizza, this would be for you.

16.description: This place had been recommended by a friend. I was really looking forward to trying a new place.  The person taking the order seemed distracted and I had to repeat myself several times.   The pizza was 35 minutes later than the hour to hour and a half they told me it would take.  When it arrived it was slightly warm, runny and the cheese had slid to one side.   Ordered three pizzas, two dish and one regular.  The regular had the wrong ingredient and tasted like the cardboard box it sat in. Very disappointed. Will not order again.

13.description: I read some of the reviews before trying this place and they're all over the place. I recalled one saying it was on par with the best of NYC slices or something like that. I found that odd after trying this place out. I'm sorry, and taste is definitely subjective, however I found this pizza to be worst than that of the worst I've had in NYC, and I've had more NYC pizza then I care to admit to. Something about the cheese, it's waxy, and has a strange consistency to it. The crust was crisp, you can't fold it, NYC pizza you fold that sh*t. The crust would have been great as a typical Chicago style party cut pizza if it only had some flavor and good toppings. Friendly enough staff though, I'd come back if I were in the area, needed food quick, but I'd get something else. If you think this is NYC pizza, I have to ask if you've been there, or are you going by what someone told you? Because this is NOT NYC pizza

11.description: Ordered a pepperoni pizza for delivery while visiting. It was a pretty typical greasy pizza. What we were expecting and it was good for that.

39.description: Absolutley Delish!!!! Omg i love the BBQ chicken pizza mostly every slice is $4 thats decent cuz the piece is big and tasty... right by 7-11 so i can buy a drink to go with it LOL.... You should def try it

37.description: This pizza is amazing! Large slices that are really two slices and they aren't shady on the meat or servings. Inexpensive and pretty quick.

0.description: I had the vegetarian pizza, ate in the restaurant, and it was good, cheese good texture and the pizza had a good flavor. It is inexpensive.The staff is very friendly and helpful. I'm 79, have mobility problems, and staff members helped me to get around.

38.description: Absolutely the best thin crust pizza around! Sold by the slice each piece is hot and delicious. Takes about 5 minutes to get your pizza out of the oven. Much better than other places that serve slices out of a heated display.

51.description: Ordered a veg pizza and honest to God this pizza would taste good if it was overlay-ed with a Tombstone pizza.  I never had pizza this bad for 17 bucks...seriously, I would stay away and grab a slice from 7.11 or something...eww.

27.description: The guy at the counter, Paul, was really cool!!! He brought 5 different flavors of Italian ice to our table for us to taste apropos of nothing. There wasn't any pressure to buy anything either. He just brought us Italian ice to be a great host. Our table was not the only one he brought desert to.  What a great place. We all felt like the customer mattered here!!  The ONLY reason it isn't a 5 star is because there is no bathroom.   Other than that it was a pleasure to eat at.

32.description: One of my favorite places for a slice, on the level of the best NYC by-the-slice joints. Crispy thin pizza, piping hot, nice amount of cornmeal on the crust for texture. Two slices for one at a good price. I love this place! Haven't tried the deep dish, cuz I love the thin so much.

54.description: this rating is for the pizza and service only.. the service is very slow even when it wasn't busy.. the cashier doesn't greet or smile... few times i came here they just took my order and walk away to talk to their friends... oh and it took like 10 - 15 mins for my reheated slice of pizza to be ready with no one else waiting for their food!I've tried their sausage pizza and pepperoni pizza.. altho it was a decent price for a big slice of pizza that they cut in twos.. it tasted cheap... oh did i mention they just reheat the pizza the few times i came here? the quality was just not there... i think i give up on this place.. since the service and pizza isn't that great..

48.description: So so pizza, normal fast food ambiance. Relatively cheap - a plus. Probably more of a two and a half stars.

44.description: I go at least 2/week, I haven't tried the pizza because the salads are THAT GOOD!

24.description: I loved this place in high school and I love this place now. The pizza is amazing and they have some delicious & unique flavors like the Malibu (Parmesan cheese & grilled chicken) which is my personal fav. The staff is friendly I just don't enjoy sitting in the actual restaurant. The atmosphere is a bit unwelcoming. It feels as though you're not allowed to linger once you're done with your food. Simple solution: take your pizza to go and enjoy it in the comfort of your home!

7.description: A friend and I went in to grab a quick slice to warm up after a documentary screening in the South Loop.It was my first time here, so I opted for a simple cheese (as did she). I always figure when trying out new pizza places that if the joint can't do their simple cheese slices right, I probably shouldn't expect much better from their other 'gourmet' pizzas.While the slice was cheap ($3.50ish including tax), unfortunately this was the most bland pizza I've had. No sweet acidity of the sauce, nor was there the salty richness of the cheese. This slice had me thinking that my taste buds had become dull. But my friend agreed. And no pizza has ever made either of us girls feel that way.I probably won't be returning, especially with better options so close by.

49.description: Good pizza, I guess. My husband liked it a great deal more than I did, but I don't prefer pizza, usually...Generous portions for a good price.  Yeah I'd have some again. I know he would.

40.description: I found the pizza here to be cheap-tasting, and the service to be slow.  It feels like a trap for tourists and college students who are on State Street and don't know where to go.   Based on some of the positive reviews here I guess that's not entirely the case, but color me surprised.  In the South Loop strongly prefer Lou Malnati's, Flo and Santos, or Pat's Pizza (about equally between the three).

53.description: 1 slice = a giant slice cut into 2 slices. So when you order 1 you get 2. Not bad... Like the other reviewers they are right that it does take an unusually long time to heat up a slice. I have a theory that they are frozen or something and that's why it takes so long.. I mean really there is no NYC style display of the pies so them must be frozen and it takes a while to defrost and cook. Think about it... How long does it take to cook a frozen Tony's.... 8-10... SLice of Pauly's is about 8-10...  But their stuff is better than Tony's for sure... Get the Malibu slice... Pretty tasty..

30.description: I will be honest and say that I do live in the neighborhood so this is my local pizza joint. Love this place. Open late and great for after having a few drinks to grab a slice of pizza.  Really good waffle fries as well as their pizza.  You can never go wrong with any of their slices. #yummy.

46.description: Wanted to try something new and Pauly's did not disappoint. Their BBQ chicken pizza was the best I have ever had and the meat pizza was loaded with a bunch of different meats! I will definitely be coming back to Pauly's!!

1.description: I really like Pauly's, but their pizza's just don't cut it, there's some kind of burnt flavor that just sits in your mouth for a few hours. The calzones are much better, but still don't feed my crave for pizza. It's almost like they try to skimp out on butter/oil/sauces and you essentially get a piece of toast with cheese.Service is about the only thing I like about Pauly's, the online ordering, the staff are friendly, and the food is fast. I think several places in the South Loop should take note.I feel like I'm in some kind of space ship at Pauly's. Its very metallic in there...maybe close off the back a bit, but Pauly's feels cold and the tables don't help the situation much better.

55.description: Pretty dirty.  That's gross.  Baskin Robbins napkins?  What's up with that? Too cheap for your own napkins?  Pizza that tastes reheated.  Tummy ache immediately afterwards.  Done and done.

9.description: I waited to post this review so that I could try Pauly's a few times before making an assessment. I probably frequent this place about once a week now for several reasons. First, it's just good traditional by-the-slice pizza. Not reinventing the pie here. Pauly's appeals to the masses. I've taken friends who are visiting here from different parts of the country and they all enjoyed it. You can walk in, order a slice for $3-$4, wait 10 minutes, and go on your way. One "slice" is actually a monstrous two pieces (see picture for scale to plate). Don't go in expecting a standard New York style flimsy pizza. This is just thick enough that you can eat one handed without all the toppings fall on to the floor. Being that Toppers is a few doors down, this is a much better substitute for the value and taste, and they're open late on the weekends. This is a convenient and quick stop after the bars or late night munchies. You really can't go wrong here, no surprises. The team consistently puts out delicious fresh slices. Check them out if you're in the neighborhood.

26.description: The cheese pizza is delicious. They have really late hours. The staff is courteous. They have a lot of delicious food options. I will definitely be back to try the pepperoni pizza and the other food options.

25.description: Thin crust pizza was so delicious we came back a second time to confirm the goodness! The salads are nice and huge and we always end up with plenty of leftovers for another meal! Parking is cool, we just walk from across the street. The staff is always nice and the service is quick. I can't express the goodness of the thin crust pizza!!!! I WILL BE A REGULAR!

12.description: Came here because we didn't want to wait at the crazy line at Lou Malnatis. Wasn't let down. The pizza was delicious, affordable, and prompt. Would definitely come back again.

59.description: This is crappy reheated pizza. The crust is terrible, the cheese bland, and the sauce isn't noticeable. Oh and the employees are real charmers along with the napkins that say baskin robbins. At almost $5 per slice I can pick up red baron in the frozen food section for less and get a much better pizza. Surely there can't be that many drunk/high people at 11pm to keep this place in business?

21.description: Fantastic pizza, great service and quick! Just rolled into Chicago and was told to try them out. Great advice!

17.description: Pizza needs a recipe change. Sometimes I'll get a nice fat slice and sometimes I'll get a little sliver. Needs a thicker layer of cheese and a less slapped-together tomato sauce. If this place had slightly lower prices it would be an even more popular joint than it already is

10.description: I'm not sure where some folks are getting their information, but this is not New York pizza. it doesn't say anything like that on their website nor does that seem to be advertised anywhere inside. I'm from NY, and I can tell you right now that this is NOT NYC pizza. If you're looking for NYC pizza, check out Cafe Luigi in Lincoln Park.With that little rant out of the way, my wife and I stumbled upon this place walking home, and thought we'd give this place a shot. We were a little desperate, and I really should have waited for something better. I looked at the menu and saw that slices were basically $4 and up. Are you kidding me? Thin crust pizza slices? One topping?Decided to order a sausage to go, and was happy to see that they at least put the slice in a air-filled bag so the cheese doesn't stick to the bag. Thoughtful at least!So how did it taste? Well the sauce was nicely seasoned and had a good tomato flavor, but the crust and dough was hard like cardboard. It's a shame this place couldn't manage a better dough for this sauce and cheese. It would do wonders for the taste.If you're in a bind, this place will work in a pinch. Got more time and open to something appealing for your taste buds? Please stick to what works in Chicago - deep dish. I can count the number of places that do a decent thin crust (not NYC style, but a Chicago thin crust) and this is not one of them.

5.description: It's really hard to mess up a basic pizza but Pauly's have done it! I would happily choose any off-brand frozen pizza over this. Crust, sauce, and cheese were almost totally flavorless. My husband, who is a grateful person and never complains abut food, was really pissed off that our late night pizza run resulted in cardboard. I was too. Then I made the mistake of putting the leftover slices in the fridge and the next morning they were even worse. Inedible, really. Also, the hot wings weren't spicy or flavorful or even sauced well. I never say no to hot wings but I guess there's a first time for everything.

3.description: Ordered the Garbage pizza and the breadsticks tonight. The pizza was ok. It was definitely NOT New York style, which is how they advertise the pizza. This just the typical Chicago style cracker like thin crust. The breadsticks were nothing to write home about. If you have had the New York brand breadsticks from the frozen section of the grocery store, that is exactly what these were. For $4 for 4 breadsticks I expected something better.

35.description: For an entire city known for it's pizza, this is the best in town. LIFE IS A SLICE!!!

19.description: I loved this place in high school and I love this place now. The pizza is amazing and they have some delicious & unique flavors like the Malibu (Parmesan cheese & grilled chicken) which is my personal fav. The staff is friendly I just don't enjoy sitting in the actual restaurant. The atmosphere is a bit unwelcoming. It feels as though you're not allowed to linger once you're done with your food. Simple solution: take your pizza to go and enjoy it in the comfort of your home!

28.description: This little pizza place has a good atmosphere and good pizza. Their thin crust is nice and crunchy, and the ingredients they use on it is quite good as well. It's nothing incredibly special, but if you spot this place when you're out and about, it would be worth your time to check it out.

45.description: I used to like running in here for a quick lunch sometimes. It's also popular with my students - whenever I've gotten pizza for them I get it here. However, that won't be happening any more. I tried to place a pizza order yesterday, to be delivered today. I was told not to bother - they'd only need an hour's warning. So I get up today and try to place the order. They're closed, and don't open until eleven. I need the pizza at noon. Now I'm calling around pretty frantically trying to find anywhere else where I can schedule a delivery. Go here for lunch, but don't expect any kind of customer service. (Why am I writing this review? They don't have any other way to register a complaint.)

33.description: There's a variety of options regarding what you can get on your pizza which I really liked. Also, the fact that you can get slices versus a whole pizza is a huge plus. The slices are large, but lacking in sauce for my taste. All and all good thin crust pizza, but it's nothing to write home about. Also, the employees were really nice which makes me give this place a 1/2 star. So my rating is 3.5...BAM

43.description: Best pizza hole-in-the-wall...EVA!

2.description: Walked by this place and decided to give it a try. Wish that we did not and walked next door to Jimmy Johns instead like we originally planned. We ordered a slice of the cheese pizza and the loaded pizza. We decided to try the chicken tenders, garlic knots, italian beef sandwich, and waffle fries. I can't recall the last time I ate so much junk fried food. We were all hurting, but it was paid for and we were starving. The pictures look nothing like the end result. The place is small, and operated with one person at the register that also did the cleaning around.I can see this place as a hangout spot for kids to chat. Not a fan of the food. Sorry..

18.description: I ordered from here on a Saturday night wanting to try something different.  I had the garbage pizza which was really great.  Fresh ingredients, flavorful sauce and good thin crust. The delivery was really quick. I would definitely order from here again.

41.description: My favorite thin crust pizza place in the south loop! Used to go often when I was a student at Columbia!

52.description: Do not go to this place or order from this place. They have no idea how to run a business or service customers. I've excused them in the past but again today, I placed an order at 7 that didn't get delivered. I called them and they apologized and said they were sending it out right away. I called them again at 10, and they hadn't even started making the pizza.

50.description: Awful, awful, awful. I wish I could give 0 stars!  This was the second time I ordered from here and they did not do any better the second time. First, the delivery estimate is 50-60 min. Fine. But 75 min later when I finally called, I was told that the drive had an "incident" and should be there soon. I asked if my food was going to be hot and he just hung up on me. Then, when he finally graced us with his presence, he asked for cash when we paid on line with a credit card!  Then to add insult to injury, the pizza had almost no cheese on it. I will never order from here again. Beware!

4.description: Went in for a snack about 7 one night.  Got an order of the garlic knots.  Good quality and quality.  A little too much butter (they were served with a large amount of butter on the bottom of the plate), but was otherwise very good.  Good service too.

6.description: Had a Big Meaty Calzone and it was magnificent. The abundance of protein with hearty zesty pizza sauce really electrified my taste buds... So good I'll definitely be back....oooh the staff was really attentive for a pizza joint!

22.description: The Popeye and Garbage pizza are my favorite slices of pizza here! I haven't tried the other kinds of pizza, though, because I don't know if their simplicity is worth the $4/slice.The fountain drink machine is self-serve and it's rather expensive (and not worth it) for 1 person to drink while eating there so I would order 1 cup and share it with 1 other person. The staff is friendly. Restroom is available for customers - it's nothing fancy, just a toilet and a sink and maybe a hand dryer or paper towels.It's a great snack place.

15.description: Terrible pizza (thick dough + tomato topping with very little cheese) in the name of deep dish. Not recommended! Will not return!

57.description: So, so, so awful. Let me preface this by saying, I'm no snob when it comes to pizza. I'm a near-universal fan, from Lou Malnati's, to Piece, to Papa John's. The 2 slices I had from Pauly's, however, both tasted terrible, and to make matters worse, my stomach and I were having a very hostile disagreement within 30 minutes of eating. If you're in  the area and need to grab something quick, just go to Jimmy John's a few doors down and save yourself the misery.

20.description: A friend and I went in to grab a quick slice to warm up after a documentary screening in the South Loop.It was my first time here, so I opted for a simple cheese (as did she). I always figure when trying out new pizza places that if the joint can't do their simple cheese slices right, I probably shouldn't expect much better from their other 'gourmet' pizzas.While the slice was cheap ($3.50ish including tax), unfortunately this was the most bland pizza I've had. No sweet acidity of the sauce, nor was there the salty richness of the cheese. This slice had me thinking that my taste buds had become dull. But my friend agreed. And no pizza has ever made either of us girls feel that way.I probably won't be returning, especially with better options so close by.

36.description: Thin crust, pie cut. Decent pizza for delivery in the loop.

14.description: This is the one place my roommate and I can always count on for a big amount of food for a low price. We always order cheese fries and cheese pizza and our total is under $7.The only time we had a bad experience (which is why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of 5) was when we came in at 11:15 (they were supposed to be open til 12 that night) and the manager on duty said they were closed. The cook was listening and said to him that he would make us a cheese pizza, and the manager straight up said no and was very rude. So we said we would just go next door then to toppers, which was when he all of the sudden acted super nice and said he would make us pizza. We ended up leaving anyways because the situation pissed us off.  All in all, it's good food for a good price and most of the people who work there are very nice. The cook ALWAYS is, and most of the time brings our food to the table instead of calling our names. The fries have always been hot and fresh, and the pizza is as well.

58.description: Best music venue ever.Perfect sound. Gorgeous to look at.  Truly as good as it gets.I've even sat in those way up nose bleed scary seats in the ceiling.. but I could still see and hear perfectly.

56.description: absolutely gorgeous. bf and i bought a groupon to see a ballet there and we loved it! we felt elegant just walking into the expansive lobby...and when we actually entered the auditorium, it took our breath away. guilded ceilings, comfy velvety chairs, champagne and ballet. pretty high brow, eh? honestly, though, it's a lovely space and we were certainly impressed. a fun chicago place for an evening out.

29.description: Being a big fan of old theaters I really enjoy going to the Auditorium. Theaters today just don't have that same charm and feeling of class that these old theaters have. The Auditorium is huge though I must say. I highly advise getting good seats or you will be really far from the action. The gallery here is scary. People walk and it shakes. Fortunately for the Pet Shop Boys concert I had great seats. The sound quality hear was also great. The seats however can use some TLC but overall this is one of the nicest theaters in the city.

42.description: My parents were coming into town and I wanted to treat them to something different then their usual, cue theater tickets to Sister Act at the Auditorium Theatre. Getting to the the Auditorium Theatre was easy since multiple forms of Public Transit have stops around there. We ended up taking the brown line to Harold Washington Library stop and walking the 2 short blocks to the theatre. I know the red line will also drop you within a few blocks of the theatre as well. As for parking I'm not certain how it is in the area as I didn't look into it, but I do believe there are a few parking garages dedicated to the universities around there that are open evenings/weekends; DePaul, Roosevelt and Robert Morris among them.  Seeing as I had never been to this theater before I wasn't sure what to expect for the stage/building, but based on the pictures online I was sure it was going to at least be beautiful. I wasn't wrong; the stage and theater in general have been beautifully restored and preserved so much so that they still look straight out of 1889. Everything from the floors and chairs to the stage and walls all seem original. The one thing that I very much appreciated about this theatre was its size. The building is huge, so at no point while waiting in line to get in or waiting in line at the bar did I feel cramped. There is enough space for everyone to move around comfortably, even on a night with a packed house. While I did have a great experience, I would say one thing would have made it better would be better bathroom signage. Its funny that something so minuscule could be an issue, however after I saw many many people make the same mistake I did, I realized that it was an issue. In this theatre the Men's and Women's restrooms are located in different areas, however the signs at the top of the stairs down to each restroom did not completely reflect which restroom area you are entering. My Mom and I accidentally went down to the men's restroom and luckily caught ourselves before entering. And, while waiting in line for the Women's restroom during intermission I noticed that many men were making the same mistake. It was such an issue that many people were commenting on it while we were waiting in line. If you are ever looking to try something different I would encourage you to take a trip to the Auditorium Theatre to see ballet or a show of some sort. You will not be disappointed.

23.description: This is really a review of Alvin Ailey's performances.  They are based in New York but do more gigs here than any other place outside of maybe NY and SF.  DO NOT MISS.   The venue is outstanding and there are many good seats off the floor.   The crowd and ambiance terrific, and the performance we saw could was superb.  Put this on your must do Chicago list.   You won't be disappointed.

47.description: pros: a beautiful venue no doubt! the acoustics are great - as it should fundamentally be for a theater. my old soul loves the idea of sitting for a concert. no body moshing for this cat. heels haven't massacred my lil piggies being that i sat down for a 3-hour concert. i've never encountered a theater with such great service. the ushers were very nice and helpful. every worker went out of there way to make sure we were taken care of. i half expected one of them would ask "would you like grey poupon with that?" also we were in the theater pretty fast - no cray cray lines tracing 3 city blocks before we got in - impressive for the number of peeps swarming in here.cons: thing that was a downer was my back was hurting like an old lady being seated a sharp 90-degrees with the hard back of the chair digging into my shoulder blade. next time i'd bring a cushion for the arse too. and for some reason the air was so dry i had to peel out my contacts mid concert while my eyes were hurting and i forget my binoculars. also just don't by the wine. it's $8 for 4 oz of shitty wine in a plastic cup. i could by a whole bottle of shitty wine for $8. and $4 for a bottle of water. i mean it is almost standard in Chicago you need to get your drank on pre-concert unless you wanna spend your entire paycheck at the concert - it just makes me feel like a stupid consumer if i succumb to these outrageous markups.

8.description: Saw Anthony Bourdain here.  Did the VIP which they could have reminded us when we checked in that we had to get the pass from will call.  Had to go out and come back in to get the passes.  The VIP could have been better organized.  A line formed but then people came and redid the line which meant people who queued up early ended up at the back of the line.  Not really fair.

31.description: Nice place for the Russian Masters show. Would not recommend the seats in the Box on the second floor though. The angle was too narrow to get the whole stage and you would hate to miss 1/3 of the show...

34.description: Beautiful theatre!  It's like taking a walk into the past.  Plenty of restrooms, and I really like that you can preorder your refreshments for intermission.  We saw the Joffrey Ballet perform Othello here (amazing!).   All the staff working the event were very upbeat and courteous.  Given its age, the theatre is in great need of refurbishment.  The stuffing was coming out of the seats in front of us, and the floor in the lobby is so uneven that after awhile you feel like you are performing a sobriety test for a police officer (unsuccessfully).  The operators of the theatre are well aware of the need and are raising funds.  Hopefully, they will reach their goal and restore this theatre to its true glam gal status.

16.description: I have seen a number of different performances here but am here most often to see the Joffrey Ballet.  My favorite seats are in the Mezzanine, though there aren't many truly bad seats in the theater.  The sound quality is fine.Snacks and drinks are available for purchase in the lobby.  Speaking of the lobby my one complaint about the theater is that the lobby is always cold.  I don't know if they just don't try to heat it or it's the way the wind blows in through the doors but I feel like I am always running in and hoping for some relief from the cold and there isn't any to be found.

13.description: I had the privilege of seeing a Friday evening performance of the Joffrey Ballet's The Nutcracker here earlier this month. The last time I'd been to see the Nutcracker was at the Milwaukee Ballet when I was seven, so  I clearly didn't appreciate all of the nuances - though I will say, my seven-year-old self was probably more kickin' (style-wise) than adult me, as it was a cold evening and fashion needed to take a backseat to function on this latest venture to the ballet. It was fun milling around the lobby, before the performance and during intermission, to see the kids (and some adults, too) decked out in their fancy holiday duds. The children's choir was adorable, and took my back to my time singing in a choir during my elementary school years. With the tree and festive decorations, not to mention the pre-show glass of prosecco that I enjoyed, this venue and the performance itself put me in a decidedly festive frame of mind.The theatre itself is an architectural masterwork. There is a restoration project underway to bring features such as the mosaics and plush seats back to their former  glory. With its elegant, ornate interior, the theatre is the perfect backdrop for the Nutcracker. The staging and scenery, not to mention the dancing itself, was world-class. The acoustics were excellent, and our seats in the orchestra view afforded an unobstructed view of the musicians. I made a break for the women's room during the intermission. I was daunted at first, as the older theaters don't always have the best reputation when it comes to restroom space, but didn't have any difficulty with the line. This time of year can be stressful with parties, shopping, and other attendant obligations. It is good to be able to be transported, if only for a few  hours, to the childlike state of wonder portrayed in The Nutcracker, as a reminder of what makes the holidays truly significant.

11.description: I started writing this last night, so it's mostly true. We really didn't JUST get home from spending an evening at the Auditorium. After sleeping in all morning, I decided my review would not be authentic if I started over. So, this is how my 250th yelp must begin. As soon as we walked in the grand entry, my mind traveled back in time and my heart started racing with excitement. I closed my eyes, took a deep breath and inhaled the long history of this amazing theater. I had total recall of all the live performances I've ever attended over the years in the theater district, small Northside venues, comedy clubs, concerts and at this Auditorium.It made me appreciate and remember all the people I once knew who had similar interests for the performing arts. Those of whom gave me the opportunity to be a part of a live audience. Then, 6 years ago today (3/29), I met a man who told me exactly what I did not want to hear.As "they" say, opposites attract but similarities will keep us together (ok, I improvised). He has always been steadfast about not going to baseball games and has a disinterest for the performing arts.So you can imagine my surprise when he told me he purchased tickets to see Amy Schumer and had been hiding them from me for a couple months. Thank you Amy! Without my boyfriend watching your uncensored televised stand up performance one fateful night on Comedy Central, I wouldn't be giddy about where I was, who I was with or who I saw on stage!It is not the same as watching "it" on TV or the big screen. Things get beeped, edited, cut to commmercial... I don't get to enjoy the comradery like we do when I'm at a live sporting event, concert or comedy club. Who could watch Les Miserables at an AMC once you've seen it twice on stage?! I hope they made their goal last night to fund preserving this beautiful and breathtaking landmark.A personal reminder to myself for future events: 4th floor, aisle 2, N301 and N302. Aisle on one side, a large pillar on otherside so no one sits on either side of us. Unobstructed view of stage unless you're unlucky to have a giant sitting in front of you.There's even space between the seat and the pillar to store coats, purse, whatever. The theater is immaculate so I didn't think twice or hesitate to store anything between there. In case you're wondering, he bought the tickets in Dec through ticketmaster for $37.50 each. He makes me proud!

39.description: 1 star because the jackasses who run the place and create policies which they tell to security need to wake up to 2012. I don't care if you don't want me to take photos,  I'm going to do it. Calling me out and letting me know you have a photo contest but photos are in the lobby? F you, stinky security guard. I took my photos anyway, which were designed to show just how awesome your place is. Now? Disappointed.  None of the photos I created which had been designed to show how awesome this place is, will now be displayed. Yet a ton of similar photos are also shown below.Yes, "how dare I" actually take pictures, like everyone else. Sheesh.The concert was great, music and all. I saw Nutcracker, and I was very pleased with the performance. However, my review is for the theatre - either walk around with a photographer's rights thing, or be prepared to be hassled by staff for daring to do what your camera is capable of doing. It was openly hostile and unacceptable. I will never be patronizing this theatre again.

37.description: The theater is absolutely gorgeous!  I love that they allow drinks and snacks inside the auditorium.  Such a welcome change!BUT the entire orchestra level is a problem, since the seats aren't staggered in any way and the change in height between the rows is minimal.  Almost certainly, no matter how tall you are or the person in front of you is, you will have a highly obstructed view.  I couldn't see anything in the center of the stage!Would give it five stars, except for this major issue. :(

0.description: This place is like theatre heaven. So beautiful and regal.. Historical (125 yeas old) it's actually floating on pilar beams! I love this theatre. Mostly here for Joffrey (this is their official theatre) but also enjoy other dance companies here as well. The staff are the best people you could ever imagine - gracious and accommodating.

38.description: I saw a performance of The Joffrey Ballet's American Legends here and was fortunate enough to sit in one of the lower level boxes.Although there were portions of the show that were obscured from sitting so far over on the side, I really loved the experience.The Auditorium Theatre felt old but well-maintained and beautiful. I hope to return for more performances.

51.description: I couldn't say enough about the beauty of this truly spectacular theater.  Every time the lights came up from the show, I was just stunned at the breathtaking interior!  We had seats in the balcony and I was amazed at how great we could see and how comfortable and roomy the seats were for being in such an old theater.   We saw 'Fiddler on the Roof' and I think I liked the theater as much as the show.  Only downside, when you are in the restrooms people can see you inside.   Otherwise, A++

27.description: The work is ongoing on this older theater. A nice venue but not all seats are equal. Last time I was here was to see Deepak Chopra and the deal seats we had were so high up in the rafters that I am pretty sure I was sitting in the heat/air duct. I would definitely not recommend those seats.I have seen several events here and for the most part it is not bad. Not much going on around the theater at night in regards to unique drinks/eats unless you are open to a hotel (disclaimer - most nearby State street options I consider standard convenience fare) If you head west towards Union Station around CME there are some options but  I noticed that at least on a school night they close up rather early (10pm-ish).

32.description: Well this is a really beautiful venue that has great sound.  I enjoy going to this theater to just see the architecture.  I will state that I sat in the cheap seats this time and man when you are way up there you cannot see to well and those are some old chairs.  Have to be very old as no current human is that darn short.  The seats did make the evening a little less enjoyable as I could not get comfortable in the small seats and I'm only 6'1.

54.description: For Starters, this is one heck of a gloriously,beautiful theater.Oh, the Libra in me came out in full force tonight,we Libra's do so love beautiful things and places, and tonightwas no disappointment..I have been to many shows and concerts and don't think Iever made it to the Auditorium before tonight.This place is phenominal, elegant and extremely ornate,I saw the Blues Brothers Tribute tonight and had a great seat,a beautiful plush velvet chair, pretty comfy..:)5 rows from the stage, leftcenter orchestra, could it get any better?Well, yeah, things can always be better..But anyway, the theaters interior, so stunning, lotsa gold schemedinteriors here, beautiful wall murals,And this theater is beyond huge, lotsa balconies, so glad I did'nt have my seat up there!A huge stage where the "fake"Blues Brothers performed, they may be fake but they were pretty cool imitations.Okay, I did buy a Blues Brother T-Shirt in the lobby, kindda priceybut I am a blues brothers junkie..:)A bar was in the lobby too but I avoided the all forever dreaded glass of $12.00 champagne.. Korbel at home..Hello..:)So, I met this one nice usher and I specifically asked him ifI could take pictures inside the theater and he said no flashwas permitted so I took some pictures of Jake and ElwoodImposters with no flash and then after the show this reallymean man comes up to me and says that I should have beenlocked up for taking any pictures of the B.B. imposters...Hey, I've never been to the Big House...I would yelp the jail... but hopefully my friends would comeand bail me out before I had to yelp the jail..:(So, good overall experience tonight at the Auditorium, beautiful interior,a great seat for me, pretty good Blues Brothers imposters, a nice usher and one crabby old man!But still, so glad my next Broadway show is at my very favoritetheater, West Side Story here I come..:)

48.description: We had a great time at the Auditorium Theatre during our first visit to Chicago. An event celebrating the day which  which would have been Ella Fitzgerald's 95th birthday  was presented by the Chicago Jazz Philharmonic Orchestra accompanied by four wonderful female vocalists. I've never heard jazz created by so many musicians (I believe 56 of them) and recommend anybody with a chance to see them perform to do so. All the singers were wonderful in their own way but I was especially smitten by Bobbi Wilsyn and her rendition of  "A Tisket, A Tasket" with a petulant, racy and  unexpectedly, seductive take. As some have remarked the theater shows its age a bit but who doesn't? I thought it was beautiful.

44.description: It's a beautiful venue. Partner and I saw Michael Feinstein recently and will be attending the Joffrey for the season. I don't think there's a bad seat in the house (though binoculars might be helpful from some.)

24.description: I've been here a few times and always love looking at the architecture. The staff is great, and I've always enjoyed the shows that run here.

7.description: I purchased tickets for the Joffrey Ballet Nutcracker for a Saturday evening show.  These tickets were not the lowest priced seats so I had high hopes that we would have a lovely evening at the theatre.  Our tickets were in section, FBLCLS, Row C, seats 708-710.  We basically had a partial view of the stage.  It was miserable!  I was so upset that I sat there for the first half in dismay that I wasn't warned by ticket master that there was an obstruction, or a partial view when purchasing the tickets.  After the show was over, I decided to see if there was office staff or anyone that could assist me with this issue.  I ended up talking with a manager that told me "Well if you would have come down and told us, we could have given you different seats."    I guess call me crazy that when I buy 3 tickets for $224, I expect to see the stage.  I was told this was the first time anyone has ever complained about this section and there isn't anything they can do now that the show is over.  They have offered me tickets to other performances but I live in Indiana and cannot make it to the city for these dates nor are they shows of interest to me.  The theatre is beautiful yes but be careful where your seats are because they certainly will sell them to you at the highest price they can.  It was not a good experience and I won't be going back.

49.description: What a beautiful building!

40.description: Ah I love it here, I have been to several shows here and the building always amazes me. I have sat on the floor level and in the boxes, both provided a great viewing experience. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The only thing I didn't like was that you have to go up and down many stairs to get to the restroom, which was difficult for my mother in law.

53.description: History and architecture are a definite five here - the lighting, walls and ceilings are all gorgeous.  So if I was coming on a tour of old theatres, we'd be done, it's a five.But it's a working theatre and I came here for over 20 years and then I just said, I'm done.  I've brought student groups here, I've seen all the mega Andrew Lloyd Webber musicals here, Paul Simon and then the last group I saw here was The Indigo Girls up in the balcony.  I just thought, nope, the sightlines, the incredibly lousy seats and the nightmarish trip to the basement (or wait for a 3 seater with the rest of the balcony) for the bathroom all add up to bad experiences for me.Sorry, supposedly Grand Dame of Chicago theatres, you are just too darn uncomfortable for me to enjoy.  But you are good looking.

30.description: detroit has a theater almost exactly the same as this call the fox.if only the fox in my hometown of detroit could take a couple notes from this theater. first, the staff. they are nice, polite and quick. exact opposite of the fox. also the place is actually kept up. the lights are all functioning. the bathrooms are clean. the carpet isn't stained.i really enjoyed my evening here seeing the pet shop boys. i found the acoustics nice. i found the seating exceptional. there really isn't a bad set in the house. thanks chicago, i will return if another band decides to skip detroit.love, juston

46.description: We saw Andrew Bird here...great show, great sound! Staff very friendly...would come back to see a show in without a doubt!

1.description: Wonderful place! The atmosphere is pleasant and the building looks beautiful. It can get very messy during the rush. The staff can get a bit unpleasant if you need help. Bathroom can be quite the mess mid show. The performances is always great.

55.description: I only gave it 5 stars because I think the Theatre itself is beautiful I would have gave  it 4 because all of the drinks and food is completely over priced.

9.description: Worst front of house (ticket takers and front entrance) I've ever encountered.  They act as if they are driving cattle, not welcoming patrons.  The place is a zoo.  If I spent $600 to take my family to a wonderful restaurant, we'd be welcomed, assisted and treated with courtesy.  AVOID THIS THEATER AT ALL COSTS.

26.description: This place is breathtakingly beautiful. I was there today to see Alvin Ailey and it is spectacular. The floor mosaics, the gilded walls, the acoustics. It's just fab.

25.description: I have seen a number of different performances here but am here most often to see the Joffrey Ballet.  My favorite seats are in the Mezzanine, though there aren't many truly bad seats in the theater.  The sound quality is fine.Snacks and drinks are available for purchase in the lobby.  Speaking of the lobby my one complaint about the theater is that the lobby is always cold.  I don't know if they just don't try to heat it or it's the way the wind blows in through the doors but I feel like I am always running in and hoping for some relief from the cold and there isn't any to be found.

12.description: I am reviewing the physical theater, and in particular the upper balcony seats, NOT the wonderful production of The Nutcracker which we saw yesterday afternoon, the last production.  The only thing close to "heavenly" for these seats was the distance from the stage.  These are by far the most uncomfortable seats in any theater I have ever had.  I am 5'7" and could not sit with my legs straight in front of me.  I and the people around me were all normal-to-small sized - and still we sat thigh to thigh.  For some people, the view of the stage was completely blocked by the huge posts and they ended up sitting on the steps in the aisle next to us.  There was nothing on their tickets to indicate that the view was blocked.  Also, most of the seats no longer have numbers on them,(paper stuck to the floor at the ends of rows showing seat numbers were inadequate information) so many people sat in wrong seats and had to move around, and there were not enough ushers to help, so there was lots of shuffling around after the production began.  Finally, if one was naive enough to buy the tickets from one of the rip-off websites that pop up on google,  one could have paid $85. for these seats instead of the $35 charged by Ticketmaster. I have sat in other seats in the theater which are better, so I am warning against the upper balcony seats, in particular.   The Auditorium needs to remodel this section completely.

59.description: I went here to see Fuerza Bruta, look up.  even though I am a sit down and watch girl I did enjoy this performance.  It is hard to label but I will try.  Fuerza Bruta is a Dali painting come to life, yes, basically it is surrealism that is alive.  I don't want to give too much away just be prepared.  Don't wear your Sunday best and be ready to get hit with a type of cascarones invention.

21.description: The theatre is beautiful! There is no doubt about it. It's a piece of history in downtown! The only problem is the seats are just as historical as the theatre. They are very cramped, old and uncomfortable. I am a taller person, so it's might not be the case for most people, but my legs were so cramped and uncomfortable.

17.description: Literally, the BEST venue to watch dance.The architecture is just stunning, and if your performance isn't going so well you can just admire all the subtle details to the paintings inside.This theater hosts the most dance in Chicago, from international companies, to local. Mostly classical, which is great, and some local mixed rep is housed here.Cheap rush tickets for students, and they usually have other cool events like a Chicago sing along on halloween.

10.description: This was a beautiful place. It's a fairly large venue for an event. It can accommodate close to 4000. We had gone there for AR Rahman concert and it was good. The sound and light quality was really good and it was a packed house. It's very accessible through the Blue line as well.

5.description: Attended the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater concert here in 14' and '15. The initial time that I saw the dance troop, I sat on the floor, 3 rows from the stage. My view was great and the performance was inspirational. The last time I went, I sat in the front balcony with hopes of an even better view and less crowding. The seats in the balcony were not filled but the view lacked luster. Overall - Great theater and performances. Tip: If you're a student, try and wait until after the first of the performance prior to purchasing tickets. You can get $150 tickets for $12.50!!!

3.description: This review is based on the theatre itself, not on any shows I've seen here. This place is setup nicely. The lobby is clean and typically well organized. Though during the show I attended last night, there seem to have been a lot of venders in the hallway. Though a bit obtrusive, I understand they have to make a living. The theatre itself is nice, the seats are comfortable and so well placed that you can see the stage from just about anywhere. The design and lighting is amazing, beautifully designed. The only issue is that the seats are a bit low so if you somebody tall sits in front of you, you can forget seeing a portion of the stage. (That's what happened to me last night). Overall, nice theatre though.

35.description: As a graduate of Roosevelt University, I am embarrassed to say I never got seized the chance to attend an event at my school Auditorium until couple years after graduation. Finally went over for an evening or Symphony Orchestra put together by the graduating class of the Music School in what has become the annual VIVID Events. Blown away by the regal architecture and cool lighting. I was trully impressed and proud to be a part of this institiution, one thing I took away that night is that I have not attained the level of sophistication required to enjoy the orchestra.

19.description: The Auditorium Theatre is one of the most gorgeous places I've ever been. Everything about it was just majestic. I really wanted to get a few pics inside--not of the play but just of the architecture-- but of course I was denied.  sad.My mom and I went and saw Sister Act a few weeks ago. I've been to a few musicals in my day and I would say that this one was one of the best that I've seen so far. It was fun, the actors were talented and the music was extremely good. We had excellent seats due to my awesome seat picking abilities and we were in the 2nd row--score! We could see everything and had a great time.I didn't feel like the stage was small as another reviewer mentioned but it wasn't the biggest stage I've ever seen either. Let's just say there was enough room for them to work their magic. I wish I could go see this play again--that's how much I loved it!

28.description: Oh, Adler & Sullivan...this place is the most beautiful. Every chance you get to be in this space, please go. We're so lucky to have this vestige of Adler & Sullivan's amazing works!

45.description: They have the most wonderful dance line ups here! All super amazing companies, with a huge variety!This spring season I saw three dance companies that I had been dying to see! All of them were extremely different (Batsheva, American Ballet Theater, and Alvin Ailey). The Auditorium is also home to the wonderful Joffrey Ballet. After reviewing the calendar, I got the season pass and called ticketing, and got Nicole on the phone. If you are thinking about getting tickets to see a show, I would HIGHLY recommend calling in and talking to someone, that's what they're there for. I got help picking seats, and also what day I should go see a show, based what I wanted to see. Nicole gave me all of the little backstage information that I otherwise would have missed out on, and then she let me know about a few other events that were happening prior to the actual performances, which I also would not have gotten wind of. It was a great experience, and over about 25 minutes we planned out my three tickets, and which days were the best for each dance company. I couldn't have been happier with my selection. The venue itself is magical. It's a Louis Sullivan building, so a true piece of Chicago history. It's also on the National Register of Historic Places. All of that might not mean very much, but once you go inside and actually take a look around, you'll understand why. The theater itself is grand, I won't explain everything. There are plenty of pictures you can look at.One thing I would recommend, and I do this to every theater I go, is - if you have a chance - go to the very front, by the stage, and take a look back at all of the seats. It's a whole different way to see a theater, and it gives you a great impression of what the performers see. And you get a great 360 of the space :)

33.description: Beautiful theater in a pretty good location.  Decent sound.  Tiny, uncomfortable seats, though, and I was not happy with the seating policy for the performance we went to.  We clearly had tickets for specific seats and, well, so did other people.  When we sat down, we were told we could basically sit where ever in our assigned area - that seating was open.  Ok, well, since people were in our seats, we sat in an open row.  There were 7 of us so we needed that.  Except then other people came and demanded their seats.  Some of went to sit in our original row and then other people came to claim their seats, rinse and repeat, until an usher finally got everyone settled.  By that point, it was the middle of the performance - and it was two guys on a stage talking so all the moving around was really disruptive and distracting to what they were talking about.  If it's open seating, tell people that on their tickets.  Also, with the number of empty seats in the lower level, this shouldn't have been a problem.  Not sure if this is how all performances are here but if it is, I am not likely to return any time soon.

43.description: Beautiful Adler/Sullivan-designed historical masterpiece here, folks.  Ornate and golden, and apparently "acoustically perfect."  I'm not sure about PERFECT, but I had no complaints after a night of theater here.  This is one of the most beautiful theaters I've been in, and is a big "must see" for anyone who like architecture, performing arts and/or live music.

2.description: Beautiful venue inside.  Lines were moving quick comfortable seats...concessions etc.  Came here to see the Nutcracker.  Close location to lsd and highway and transit.  Try and look at the art on the ceiling and decipher it yourself.

18.description: Great theater with hardly a bad seat in the house.  Compared to the Chicago theater there is more leg room between seats.  The venue is beautiful and the staff is helpful getting you in and to your seat quickly.  Even the cheap seats are pretty decent in this theater, especially with only one balcony.  They bring in some great performances to this venue, so keep an eye out for what show is in town.

41.description: The Auditorium Theatre is one of the most gorgeous places I've ever been. Everything about it was just majestic. I really wanted to get a few pics inside--not of the play but just of the architecture-- but of course I was denied.  sad.My mom and I went and saw Sister Act a few weeks ago. I've been to a few musicals in my day and I would say that this one was one of the best that I've seen so far. It was fun, the actors were talented and the music was extremely good. We had excellent seats due to my awesome seat picking abilities and we were in the 2nd row--score! We could see everything and had a great time.I didn't feel like the stage was small as another reviewer mentioned but it wasn't the biggest stage I've ever seen either. Let's just say there was enough room for them to work their magic. I wish I could go see this play again--that's how much I loved it!

52.description: When Adler and Sullivan designed this theatre they truly went all out!  This is a Chicago treasure. Anyone who is an architecture or theatre enthusiast should put this theatre at the top of their list of must sees.  Can you believe this theatre sat vacant for several years and was on the brink of being torn down?! What a loss that would have been. From the stenciling, murals, mosaic tiling, exposed carbon filament lighting, to the plush seating on the lower floors anyone can appreciate this theatre as being a masterpiece.As to be expected, the drinks are overpriced and the seats on the upper balconies aren't ideal.  But anyone who is a regular theatre goer should know this innately.  Also it's not an incredibly intimate theatre space as there are over 4000 seats.While you're there make sure you get a chance to really admire this gem. Acoustically it's perfect and unless you're on the extreme sides you'll have a great view or as good of view one can have from the 4th or 5th balcony.Anyone who gives this establishment less than 4 stars is not appreciating the historic value and understanding that this theatre was originally built to house the Grand Opera and not your rock shows or one man shows.My recommendation when seeing a show here is to splurge a bit on the seats and get something on the main floor or one of the first two balconies.  You'll enjoy your show way more. Any other seat you might feel a little bit uncomfortable but at least you'll be surrounded by it's splendor. :)

50.description: The Auditorium Theater is showing it's age, but it still is a beautiful gem in the crown of gilded age architecture in Chicago. It needs renovation and restoration but if they could start with all the upholstered surfaces, carpeting and painting they'd go a long way to making it sparkle. That being said, I absolutely love the charm of this place. From the unbelievable acoustics (the stage performers can be heard whispering without microphones due to the design) to one of my favorite (but unfortunately named) architectural tricks: the vomitoria. The vomitoria isn't a place where people can express their displeasure with the stage production, but rather a small, enclosed tunnel through which patrons enter the main floor. Basically, a vomitoria forces people through a claustrophobic space for a few seconds so that they can be surprised by the soaring experience of walking into a huge room.
