4.description: They hire uncouth, mouthy, neanderthals for their crowd control and ushering.  So you spend 150 bucks a ticket to be barked at like a floor sweeper in a warehouse!  The seats are so tightly crammed together its obvious they are money grabbers without the slightest concern for patrons.  I am a thin male, 6ft tall, 165lbs and was barely able to shift an inch in the seat!  Legroom?  Hahahaha!  Having seen so much theatre from Poland to France, the theater comfort and beauty in Europe is superior in every way.  This place was abysmal and an outrage.  Why do Americans put up with this?!

6.description: Lets just say JOE saved the day! my friend bought tickets for the A.R Rahman concert as a gift via stubhub  and sent me an email. I couldnt print tickets bcos i didnt have her password and showed with a print out after giving it to someone at the will call was told they couldnt honor the printout even though seat numbers were assigned. We were disappointed about the $200 going down the drain, then Mr.Joe printed duplicate tickets and got us in. The ushers were super efficient in finding our seats as well. would like to go back for another concert.

22.description: I started writing this last night, so it's mostly true. We really didn't JUST get home from spending an evening at the Auditorium. After sleeping in all morning, I decided my review would not be authentic if I started over. So, this is how my 250th yelp must begin. As soon as we walked in the grand entry, my mind traveled back in time and my heart started racing with excitement. I closed my eyes, took a deep breath and inhaled the long history of this amazing theater. I had total recall of all the live performances I've ever attended over the years in the theater district, small Northside venues, comedy clubs, concerts and at this Auditorium.It made me appreciate and remember all the people I once knew who had similar interests for the performing arts. Those of whom gave me the opportunity to be a part of a live audience. Then, 6 years ago today (3/29), I met a man who told me exactly what I did not want to hear.As "they" say, opposites attract but similarities will keep us together (ok, I improvised). He has always been steadfast about not going to baseball games and has a disinterest for the performing arts.So you can imagine my surprise when he told me he purchased tickets to see Amy Schumer and had been hiding them from me for a couple months. Thank you Amy! Without my boyfriend watching your uncensored televised stand up performance one fateful night on Comedy Central, I wouldn't be giddy about where I was, who I was with or who I saw on stage!It is not the same as watching "it" on TV or the big screen. Things get beeped, edited, cut to commmercial... I don't get to enjoy the comradery like we do when I'm at a live sporting event, concert or comedy club. Who could watch Les Miserables at an AMC once you've seen it twice on stage?! I hope they made their goal last night to fund preserving this beautiful and breathtaking landmark.A personal reminder to myself for future events: 4th floor, aisle 2, N301 and N302. Aisle on one side, a large pillar on otherside so no one sits on either side of us. Unobstructed view of stage unless you're unlucky to have a giant sitting in front of you.There's even space between the seat and the pillar to store coats, purse, whatever. The theater is immaculate so I didn't think twice or hesitate to store anything between there. In case you're wondering, he bought the tickets in Dec through ticketmaster for $37.50 each. He makes me proud!

15.description: This theatre was beautiful! This was my first ballet and I wanted to love the Nutcracker but I just couldn't get into it. I couldn't follow the story but I'd be willing to see another show. Maybe ballet isn't my thing. I appreciate the art of it but not sure if I'm interested.

57.description: Since I saw one of the gayest stage productions ever here, it makes sense to quote Bette Davis: What a dump!WTH, Yelp? I came here expecting a revelation in grand old buildings. Before I set foot inside, people favorably compared the Chicago Theatre to the Auditorium Theatre. No. Chicago Theatre is a classy broad. Auditorium Theatre is a reform school girl. Perhaps if one sits in the first few rows, he might have a different opinion. I did not have that experience. I sat waaay atop the twisted spoke that is their loge section. Since this isn't a proper theatre, I shall call it the lage (lege? lige?). If you have the misfortune of sitting this high up, be prepared to get your Suzanne Sommers on. It's a work out to troll up the approx. 15000 flights of gigantor cement steps. And, the kicker is since this is such an old building, the construction is old and you'll feel it the higher you go. What am I talking about? Rather than being built around a central frame, the theatre was built around an external one. This means the inside is sinking. The stairs are uneven and you'll walk at a slant. As I climbed the stairs, I felt like I was drunk and failing a field sobriety test. The overwhelming sensation of vertigo  almost knocked me on my butt a few times. And, speaking of my perky bottom...The.seats.are.filthy. They were orange, ratty and visibly soiled. They are also quite itchy. I felt as though I had bed bugs crawling all over me here (silly me, they wouldn't step foot in this place) and I couldn't wait to rush home to burn my clothes and take a Silkwood shower. I was extremely uncomfortable for the entire show and frequently looked at my watch to see when I could leave. I sat far up in my seat so as not to expose any skin to the fabric, but the hair on my ass itched almost all evening. Blame the Auditorium for that mental image. The only connection to 1889 I felt was the knowledge that it must have been the last time it was cleaned. Far be it from me to needlessly trash a place. I am a nice guy. Beyonce can see my halo (halo. Halo. HALO. HALO!!! *werewolf howl*). But, I have to call it as I saw it. And, what I saw was a hot mess.

20.description: What an enchanting theatre!  I saw Sigur Ros here and realised that given proper acoustics, contemporary talent can far surpass any classical concert.  I'd seen SR before but this venue just made the experience surreal.  Every layer of their music came through clear and sharp.

36.description: What an incredible, fabulous venue! My husband took me here to see Alvin Ailey; it was spectacular!

14.description: This is a pretty nice venue. We were lucky enough to score box seats for a Sigur Ros concert here. The view from our suite was great, but the sound was off. We attended their concert at UIC theater awhile back. The seats were far from the stage, but the sound was fantastic. The bar prices were pretty decent, and I appreciated being able to take drinks back to our seating area. I would go again for the right band, but with the expectation that the sound will not be the best.

28.description: I felt welcome the first time I went to this barber shop.  Jeff is my barber, he's typically easy to get an appointment with whenever I need it.  The prices are great, especially for the loop.  I notice that lots of college students frequent the shop too.  It's the type of shop where people learn your name and story pretty quickly, which is cool considering life downtown can be pretty disconnected.

1.description: I wish we could give half stars because this would be 4.5 star rating for sure!As an avid Yelper, I always research the reviews to see what people think about the said business. Because I moved to a different part of town (Streeterville from Gold Coast) I needed to change barbers. The one I already had was spectacular but it was easy to just walk there and back home and now he is a little ways away. No further than Headrest actually, but I did have to try this shop as a last minute emergency since my previous barber had to cancel.At any rate, after reading the reviews I decided to try out Headrest. And I am very glad that I did.Location: this location is awesome! Right on South Michigan so it makes for prime people watching and great views!. The huge floor to ceiling windows in the new location is awesome for just these reasons alone. Natural light never hurt anyone anyway right?!Price: Spectacular. Even though they are about to raise the price 5 dollars for a standard cut, it is worth it. I was pleasantly surprised to receive a 20% off coupon for checking in on yelp, however. I saved a good 5 dollars off. Also they take cards! which is awesome!Interior Decor: blast from the past! Very vintage very antique. I felt as if I transported back 4 decades when I stepped inside. My father would really love it here.Service: all of the barbers are funny as ever. I was laughing the entire time during my cut. I have to admit though, It felt awesome to get a sort of celebrity treatment when I told them I was an Elite yelper. But even before this they were awesome.Cut: I received a cut from Raynie. I do believe he is either the manager or owner, at any rate...the guy is highly skilled. And should be a professional comedian. He is very personable. I mean, he literally hugged me instead of a handshake when we first met. You don't get that. He is like that crazy uncle we all have. But in a good way. I had not had a haircut in a solid month. So my head was in real bad shape. Raynie conducted reconstructive surgery on my hair (as he called it). I looked like a completely different person on the way out. It was awesome.I had to dock half a point though because in the middle of the cut he stopped to help one of the other barbers fix their broken chair. It wouldn't have been an issue except the other barber was just standing there not doing anything to help Raynie so if it was a one person job they should have just let the other barber fix it by himself and not take 10 minutes out of my cut to fix his chair. My time is valuable you see.

9.description: Jeff did a fantastic job cutting Jeans hair for a special event. He was quick and through and paid special attention to the line. The music was good and the atmosphere was welcoming!

29.description: Good place, friendly service and they had college football on.. Wish I would have gotten the straight razor shave.. Oh well next time...

23.description: Just got a haircut  at their 55 E. Monroe St. shop this weekend and it was awesome! I drove all the way from Indiana to try them out. Jamon gave me straight lines and a pattern design at the nape of my neck. It was super affordable and they are hilarious. Jimmy Butler, Jamon wanted to let you know he is ready for you + your ugly fade. He'll fix that right up

5.description: I've been floating between haircutters for the past two years and the hunt is finally over.  Walked in and Manny cut my hair.....he's excellent at his craft.  Honestly, he was better than my old haircutter (Halo) and less expensive to boot.  A lot of urban men's salons charge crazy hight prices compared to what I was used to growing up ($55+ compared to the good old $12-15 haircuts of my childhood)....but this place was easily worth $20-$30 (depending on what they're doing to your mane). Won't be going anywhere else.  The shop itself is barebones, but I don't think getting my haircut in a modern, hardwood floored men's salon with a free coke and handwax were worth an extra $30 I'd pay atvother places......this place has skilled barbers at reasonable prices and a convenient location on the Magnificent Mile near South Loop.   Go. Ask for Manny.  You won't be disappointed.

25.description: I love this place. It is in the Congress Hotel and has the comfortable feel of an old time  neighborhood barber but with young, fun barbers. I always use Lawrence, but Rainey and Jeff are a good choice too. $25  bucks is more than I used to pay but not outrageous for having a regular barber who knows me. Love the banter and fun atmosphere.

12.description: Great service! Barbers are very personable. If you are new to the city I would definitely recommend.

21.description: Finding a good black barber north of Roosevelt and South of Irving Park is a challenge.  These dudes have been around for years and are as solid as they come.  They're cool, laid back and about their business.  They'll chat at you some, but their gettin the work done.  Unlike some barbers where you show up, they're clowning, talking on the phone when they should be cutting your hair etc..., not here.  Professional and talented.  Highly recommended.

16.description: Just had one of the best experiences ever. You can tell how much pride they have by the quality of the cut. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town. No need for an appointment if you don't mind the wait; it's an entertaining atmosphere. Worth every penny! -"Delly" from Cleveland

17.description: Finding a good black barber north of Roosevelt and South of Irving Park is a challenge.  These dudes have been around for years and are as solid as they come.  They're cool, laid back and about their business.  They'll chat at you some, but their gettin the work done.  Unlike some barbers where you show up, they're clowning, talking on the phone when they should be cutting your hair etc..., not here.  Professional and talented.  Highly recommended.

10.description: Great shop my son and I get out hair cut there weekly. Staff is friendly and professional,  and all the barbers can really cut any type of hair. I'd recommend this shop to all my friends.

11.description: Stayed at the Congress Hotel for a weekend getaway. The lone bright spot was this Barbershop. Came in from Cleveland for a little R&R. Got my cut from Jeff. He did me right. He took time with my cut and even gave me some services for free just because I was knew. The atmosphere was just like home. Good music, good conversation. I appreciate him and his staff for making me feel at home with the cut. I've now found my Chi-town barber. Worth every penny!

26.description: Professional service in a friendly environment convenient to the loop.  What more can you ask for?  They even take appointments.  Check them out.  You won't be disappointed.

27.description: I used to cut my own hair, but now I will go to this place.  Old school, friendly, best cut I've had in a long time, and they offer a straight blade neck shave.  Waited 5 minutes on a Saturday.It is cash only, but for $5 more (including tip) do NOT waste time or money at Hair Cuttery.  Headrest is great.

0.description: I first stumbled upon Headrest Barbershop when I was on a quest for a barbershop that was located downtown. Being that I'm new to the city I didn't know what to expect from a barbershop located downtown (i.e. overpriced, unskilled, etc.) but the majority of the Yelp reviews that I read were positive. From the very moment I walked into the door everyone, from the barbers to the clients, were extremely personable and friendly. The atmosphere will give you the impression of having been a customer for years even though it's your first time visiting. The barbershop itself is small with roughly four waiting chairs and only three barber chairs. I've had the fortunate luck of working with Raynie for the last couple of months that I've been going to Headrest. It is very hard to to find three equally skilled barbers that have great chemistry. Raynie is great because I've observed him countless times try to squeeze in a walk-in client or come into the shop earlier to fit someone into his schedule. In the past I've found it difficult to find a barbershop that was both aware and respectful of the clientele that they're serving. But the barbers at Headrest Barbershop are great at tailoring the conversation to whomever is present, whether it's a little kid getting their first haircut or a tourist visiting the city for the first time. The conversations are always lively and entertaining. I would highly recommend trying out Headrest Barbershop because you will never want to go to another place. If you do try out Headrest ask any of the barbers about stepping and the importance of knowing how to step.

20.description: Great old school barbershop inside the Congress Hotel, ask for Manny.  Only $5 for a beard trim for great for gentleman like myself who need a bi-monthly beard trim from a skilled professional.

19.description: Very professional barbershop, the barber Manny  done my hair cut just like the way I like it, so fresh! Also, it is old school barber shop, and has great offers & reasonable price.

2.description: Always festive, hilarious, urban and most importantly...great cuts!  Located at south end of Congress Plaza Hotel...use street entrance to shop on Michigan Ave (not hotel lobby entrance).

18.description: Walked in without an appointment at lunch and got a great fade done byJeff, cheers pal

13.description: Great old school barbershop inside the Congress Hotel, ask for Manny.  Only $5 for a beard trim for great for gentleman like myself who need a bi-monthly beard trim from a skilled professional.

4.description: One of the best barber shop in Chicago. In side of the congress plaza hotel go check out Raynie he will have you shape. He gave me my hair line back.

24.description: As an African American male, a barbershop is one of the first places I look for when I relocated to new city. My boss and a couple friends told me about this place, so my roommate and I decided to give them a try and was thoroughly impressed with the end results. After experimenting with a couple of other barbers, I have to say that Headrest was the best. Special shoutout to my man Cool le Barber. You definitely have a loyal customer.

6.description: An amazing barbershop! I love the atmosphere. I was really nervous to get my hair cut but the barber was kind and put me at ease. Ask for Raynie he is hilarious and very skilled!  I will definitely be back!  I'm in love with my haircut he gave me exactly what I asked for!

22.description: Having just walked out of a master artists studio, I am still in awe over of the professionalism and expertise Lawrence showed as he magically took years off my life. Every time I'm in chicago I will be sure to stop by his shop and get taken care of.

15.description: Headrest Barbershop is a great place to go for a solid experience. I have been there three times and always had Jeff cut my hair. The guys are friendly and skillful. If you have time, don't pass up the opportunity to get a beard trim or shave; these guys aren't afraid to use the straight razor to get that sharp look you should expect from a barber.

7.description: Very poor organizational skills for a small shop, I made an appointment few days prior to actual appointment through Whittl and I had a very tight schedule that day.When I got there on time, someone told me I have to walk 3 blocks as the guy who is suppose to do you hair went to our other place, I got frustrated and asked one of the available guys to do it instead, 5 of them refused for unreasonable reasons with no interest in solving the problem their colleague has caused.I cancelled and will never go back!

8.description: I moved to Chicago from Louisiana and was clueless on where I was going to get my haircuts.  From a google search, I found Headrest, and it's been great since.  Jeff is my barber, and it's always easy to get an appointment.  Plus, the atmosphere is very professional, and it takes no time to get a superb haircut to continue with your day.  I highly recommend Headrest for anyone looking to get a great cut, and I look forward to having Headrest as my barber spot for years to come.

30.description: Headrest is a two-seat barbershop whose barbers will keep a grin on your face throughout your entire cut.  High school students are regulars here, and both barbers -- especially Randy Jackson -- have established solid rapport with them.  They keep a chess board at the ready for when business is a little slow or a kid is in need of a game.My haircut was terrific.  Short like I like it and attentive to detail.  I'm glad I found this place -- hopefully others will also have a great experience.  And for $20, it was a little cheaper than other places in the Loop.  (Plus, they have a $15 student special on Tuesdays.)

3.description: My boyfriend got a great haircut. The shop was busy because it was NYE but the staff did everything to make sure we were taken care of while we waited. They had had a NYE celebration and offered us food and drink. Everyone was super friendly. If we ever move to Chicago he says this will definitely be the barber shop he will go to!

14.description: Hideous customer service experience---after making a 1:00 pm appointment, I had to wait for the next available barber (beyond the 1:00pm time). As I began to explain what I wanted done, the barber immediately started combing through my hair and was clearly not listening to the requests. After a constant badgering of unprofessional questions, I was rendered a haircut that was easily one of my top 5 all time experiences. I will not return and nor will any of my friends attend this shop---who happen to live in the Magnificent Mile area. Perhaps, if the barber kept his mouth shut and brain focused on the task then he would have been paid.

58.description: Blackie's went out of their way to correct an incident I had with them. A business that corrects their mistakes is one that will last. I really appreciate their gesture and am excited to come in and try some of these new menu items and daily specials.

56.description: Sweet patio! Lots of people walking around and dog watching. Good food. The Rueben and Salmon sandwich have never failed us. Good drinks, staff is really nice. Kinda quiet and laid back but it works.

29.description: Great spot for lunch. Since it's located a couple blocks from my office, I come here at least a couple times a month and am never disappointed when leaving. Food is excellent and prices are rather affordable.Plus, you can't go wrong with supporting a local, family-owned small business.

42.description: Casual Americana Pub Style Fare at it's finest!Came into Blackie's South Loop on the recommendation of a local. **Tip of the Cap** The menu gives you a little history about this family owned establishment. Generous on the portions, this is the dream for every hungry person on the prowl for some good old American comfort food. I could remember places like this always putting a smile on my face when I was a young boy. Glad to see Chicago is still holding it down. CHI TOWN FAVORITE!Talk about hitting the spot, this place is your dream come true. Low key with no wait for seating, we quickly ordered about half the menu without a second thought.In food measurement units - I think we ordered a boat load. The apps here are the perfect bite if your looking for a tapas style lunch (small plates). Great for sharing and trying a bunch of things while sipping on a cold brew. Our stomachs were growling since we had all skipped breakfast and clearly we went in hot and heavy. Take no prisoners!!! Round 1Slow cooked jumbo chicken wings, crispy and delicious.Smother everything in blue cheese is what I always say!Guinness braised,  Hormone free pulled pork with creamy Italian style polenta. A taste of the transitional and the new world. I could eat this everyday for a month.Big plate of Blackie's style poutine, which are like disco fair style hand cut fries. They had me at cheese & truffle oil, but the fried egg on top made my day. It's a foodie fact, everything is better with a sunny side fried egg on top. Break into the center and watch the liquid gold drizzle over the crispy french fries. My eyes teared up in pure joy after the first bite.We washed down our first round with a seasonal local brew.Clearly a local favorite from the recommendation, but did I mention all the apps were cheap, nothing was over $7. Round 2They make it very difficult to pick a sandwich with all the tasty menu options, but I went with what seamed like the most obvious choice - The Blackie's burger, which was fully loaded with melty cheese, smoked bacon, caramelized onions, mushrooms and organic greens. I personally love organic produce, which is always hard to find when your eating out and on a budget. All this was stacked on top of a hot juicy fresh Black Angus patty. The golden brioche bun was the perfect delivery system to grip my hands around. I could not have dreamed up a more yummy hamburger.WARNING: You will need another drink to wash it down, and it is very easy to get carried away when pitchers of beer are only $5. CHEAP COLD BEER ! ! !This good ol' American spot is a local Chicago gem. If you are passing through The South Loop area or looking for a new place to try, then stop by Blackie's. You will not be disappointed. The menu selections are all mouthwatering and the bang for your buck is through the roof.

23.description: Not impressed.Ordered dinner from Blackie's last night for take out. We ordered the linguine and the tortellini. When we went to pick it up we were given a brown paper bag and we didn't check it until we got home... At which point we realized they gave us 2 Caesar salads. We called back and they said they realized they gave us the wrong order when the other people came to get their salads... Well thanks a lot for the call... It would have been nice to know before we got all the way home. So we kept the salads and went back to pick up our pasta and were shocked to see that these $12 pasta dishes were TINY... Like the boxes it came in we thought were for bread. What a joke!!! The food was actually pretty good but absolutely ridiculously priced for the portion we got. Get real Blackie's... You're a bar, not a gourmet restaurant.... Either lower your prices or up your portions because it's absurd. No apology received, ridiculous pricing, average food. Safe to say I won't go back.

47.description: I had the salmon burger and fries here. I was excited for the entree, but unfortunately it took around 45 minutes for the food just to come out. On top of this, I'm pretty sure the burger was missing some dressing or something, it tasted very bland - not good at all. Overall, I haven't tried the beer, but when it comes to food I probably wouldn't return.

8.description: We went here Thursday night for light meal , we order grilled cheese , was fabulous .And Sunday we take a brunch , the food again is nice , delicious , service great , price wonderful .

31.description: Right across the street from my apartment, I'm surprised it took me so long to finally hit. It's a pretty neat little bar, but the service could be better. Awfully slow when you're in a group with 5+ people, even more if you're each on separate checks. And a little too pricey to have to deal with that type of slow service. But, the food and drinks are all good. Everyone in the group seemed to thoroughly enjoy the food, and it's not like we were even really in a rush to get out. It's the perfect spot if you want to sit for hours and talk over food/drinks, but not if you have other, time-dependent plans for the evening. We loved that they had a jukebox and a half-way decent selection of music, and even then, the music level isn't too loud for conversation.

34.description: Blackie's was fine. It is a neighborhood bar that's been around for a long time. Since it is right by my daughter's apartment, we met there.It's got that neighborhood bar feel. I have to agree with some of the comments made here about service. It was 6ish on a Saturday evening, and they were not crowded at all. There were, perhaps, four tables with people at them and one person sitting at the bar. Getting the server's attention should have been easy, but no.The food was actually pretty good. I had their fully loaded burger - it came out well done when I'd ordered medium. But, the meat was well seasoned and juicy, so the fact that it was overcooked was not so noticeable. It comes with pickles, sauteed onions, mixed green lettuce and tomato. I skipped the cheese. The fries were fresh, hand cut and were very good.I've wanted to try Blackies for a while, and it was a fair experience. With all of the new options popping up in the gentrifying South Loop, they may have to start to work on their service to survive.Oh, make sure you stop into their restrooms. While they are small/cramped, they have interesting posters on the walls and ceilings. I understand that they have similar posters in the ladies restroom too, but they cater to the sexes.

16.description: This is easily one of the best places for food and drink in the South Loop, and one of the best patios in the city.  "What's so special about it," you ask.  "It looks like just a normal sidewalk seating area."  Let me tell you:  It's the service.  You'll get excellent service out here, no matter how long you're chillin' with your chums.  Sounds so simple, but so few places can deliver like Blackie's.  Plus, the patio is so inviting, other patrons are liable to join your little sidewalk chat.  It's like they moved the fundamentals of a neighborhood pub outside!  If you're drinking, the prices definitely entice you to prolong your afternoon chill-session.  Highly recommended, for brunch, lunch, dinner, and chill-sessions!

13.description: Ha, this place knows how to survive a storm and reinvent itself! kudos to the owner of this place. *raises glass*First, they have better drink specials a bottle of wine for only $12 makes this a fine place for a quick date. Shot specials for a dollar seriously are you kidding me? Second, the menu was updated. The food is significantly better! Blackies now has the best calamari - ever! In the past they didn't season it now it's beautifully seasoned and ugh - (insert curse word here) good! The other food items are made fresh, so you can taste the difference asap. When I took a fork full of fresh spinach I had that moment - the yes moment! :) (Meg Ryan voice - restaurant scene) yes, yes, gawd yesssssss! Ha ha Third, the menu has been updated. It looks good, hip and people are coming in this means a better environment. Last but not least the new waitresses are fab! Great service will do wonders... (Insert curse word here) wonders for the entire atmosphere of an establishment! Someone who can confidently make recommendations, is polite, and socially aware of when to stop by the table and when to stay away- Perfecto! I rarely give out five stars, but here's my prediction... In less than six months this place will be packed daily! You are on the right path Blackies... as you can see, I'm  a fan of the revamp... previously not so much, but now yes!Areas of improvement: Never run out of broccoli, ever! Advertise that the menu makes adjustments for food allergies. Have dessert that includes fresh fruit. There's nothing like fresh fruit desserts to encourage people to have dessert.You will find me by the window a bottle of wine, appetizer, and dinner. Go ahead and say hi.... I don't bite unless you are on my fork! Grrrrrr ;) ha ha

11.description: I haven't been here for food, and not sure I would necessarily eat here, but for a bar option in the Printers Row area of the South Loop, Blackies isn't too bad afterall!I had been hesitant to try this place because it doesn't look the most inviting from the outside, despite the fact that it has actually been in business a long long time according to their signage. Inside, however, they actually have pretty nice looking wooden tables and a full bar and a friendly bar tender, which is really all you need for a little neighborhood spot. They have different drink specials every day too, like $12 house bottles of wine on Wednesdays I think? And then $1 watermelon shots and other bottled beer specials too. We were here late in the night and there was a large group of people who clearly had been there for quite some time, counting down all together as a happy group for their group shots which I loved. And on game days, this bar is also usually pretty packed as people eat/drink on their way to the game and there is a decent after work crowd here too. Plus in nice weather time, their patio is set up which is dog friendly, which is also something you have to love about the printers row area of the southloop.

39.description: I'm very disappointed that Blackie's did away with the $8 burger special. My girlfriend and I stopped in a few months ago, both hoping to get the burger, fries, and draft beer for $8 anytime before 8 PM -- like we had several times since we moved to the neighborhood last year.Instead, we learned that the special is gone, and the half-pound burger is now $9.95. The beer is $4, so the meal that used to cost us about $21 (that's including tax and tip!) now costs $36.I agree that the changes to the menu and the dining area are an improvement, but a 75% price hike for the burger special is too much to take. Blackie's previously filled a niche for us -- a solid meal at an amazing price. We would often decide to make the short trip to Blackie's when we didn't want to cook.Now that it's just like every other restaurant out there, we find ourselves trying other places far more often. We'll still stop in from time to time, but the days of this being our go-to place for a quick, cheap dinner are gone.

37.description: My husband and I decided to get lunch in Chicago.  This is our first trip to Blackie's. The bartender greeted us as soon as we walked in.  A very friendly waitress was at our table within a couple of minutes. I got the Reuben, which is one of my favorite sandwiches.  It's delicious. The best Reuben I can ever remember eating. To top it off, now my favorite Frank Sinatra song "That's Life" is playing. This is a good place.

0.description: Coat Hooks: YesAlso: I recommend the watermelon shots.

38.description: Just moved down the block and decided to try Blackie's.  Ordered dinner to go Sunday and loved it!  I had the salmon and shrimp!  I went back Wednesday with a friend.  Calamari was amazing as was the spinach dip.  Also had the flatbread, that too hit the spot!  Service while dinning in was good but not amazing.  Regardless the food was great so I will be returning.

51.description: I've been to Blackie's a couple of times now. First, the food:  it's simple American fare, and so far everything I've had has been fresh, well prepared, and delicious.  The price is very reasonable and the portions are substantial. The service was also decent, with attentive staff and a nice demeanor. Decor?  Well there I give it a C. It is definitely clean but it does suffer a bit from the cheap 1990-vintage decor, maybe slightly influenced by Miami Vice.So!  Four stars, basically minus one for the physical space.

27.description: Simple bar food with a simple atmosphere.  We live just around the corner from Blackie's and know that it will always be a place we can turn to for a quick beer and a basic bite.Nothing about Blackie's necessarily stands out, but that's not to say anything about it is terrible either.  The wait staff is always friendly and welcoming and provide us with what we need quickly.If I would suggest anything, however, go on a Sunday for their brunch.  Worth any wait.

32.description: We moved to printers row about a year ago, and Blackies has been our spot for breakfast most every weekend. Never disappointed....not once. I have a weird thing about coffee refills...seems like you have to beg for them in most places these days.  Not at Blackies. The staff is great, the food is great...walking in on Sunday morning feels like going home.  We just bought a place in the Fulton River District, and will miss Printers Row....but Blackies will remain our spot (via the pink line!)

54.description: Three stars for now until I have their food. Good overall bar for a beer or two. Nothing fancy. Large outdoor sidewalk seating. A few televisions... The place needs some freshening up. Long bar area for about 12 people.. Some high tables and a pool table.

48.description: My husband and I recently "tried" to eat here.  We entered into a very dark bar and waited for someone to help us.  No one approached us or looked at us.  It was the most bizarre experience I've ever had in a bar or restaurant.  Most places like it when people want to sit down and order food and drink and then pay.  We ended up walking up to Hackney's and were greeted right away.  Sad this neighborhood joint didn't work out since we live close by :(

44.description: Stopped here for lunch.A nice day so we sat outside and enjoyed the weather.Had one of their burgers and it was good. Not the best I ever had but still enjoyable. If you're in the neighborhood , not a bad spot to stop for a sandwich and a drink.Cheers to all

24.description: Grabbed breakfast here today - it was pretty solid. Great old fashioned breakfast, solid french toast & pancakes. Quick service and available seating.

7.description: So I used to come to blackies ever since I moved to the hood back in the day, years ago. The food was always good enough and the drinks were always cheap enough. They got a new chef in the last couple years and the food was still good. But...Awhile back I was planning a dinner event for big group and I wanted to have it in the side dining room space at Blackies; I liked the spot and wanted to keep in the hood. So reached out and called. The guy wasn't in, I said I lived in the hood and they said just stop by later to talk to the guy. I did. Wife and I stopped in. When we sat down and ordered a drink and asked to speak to the guy. Never comes out. We were hungry so decided to get some dinner while waiting, we ask again, after dinner we ask again. Dude never came out. Lastly we were told there was a call off in the kitchen and he was too busy to speak with us - after we have been sitting there for a long long time. Look.. There were 6 other patrons in the whole place. Perhaps 2 of them were eating. Not even a courtesy handshake and a card if too busy? Really? I felt pretty disrespected when I'm trying to bring a large dinner function in. Best part was, on Polk you can see into the kitchen, when we left we saw homeboy standing there.. Really? I can see you man ha ha.. Needless to say, our big dinner wasn't held here and I can't come back in good conscious after that. I'd especially caution anybody trying to plan an event here. In fairness, I'm sure the food is still decent and the drinks are still cheap.

49.description: Definitely a neighborhood bar with simple american fare. I have been here twice and have been impressed with their dinner specials and the bartenders. The service is pretty top notch.However, there are a few male servers who seem to have an attitude at times and once, I saw a pair of them fighting...in front of guests. That's a big no-no in my book...keep it behind closed doors.All in all, I'd say its a cute corner bar. I wish they had a dart board, then I'd be there all the time :)

40.description: I've always thought Blackies was a good neighborhood bar, but they just introduced an AWESOME new menu and the food is delicious!  They usually have some good drink specials too, making this a great place to stop in.  I live a block away and will definitely be stopping in more often now.

53.description: I had to renew my yelp account in order to write a review for Blackies South Loop. Amazing staff and management, the food is high quality and most definitely delicious. I live near Blackies and frequently stop in whether it be for some drinks or drinks and food. Best burgers around! If you're in printers row, you need to stop in and enjoy! I know I do!

30.description: I haven't been here for food, and not sure I would necessarily eat here, but for a bar option in the Printers Row area of the South Loop, Blackies isn't too bad afterall!I had been hesitant to try this place because it doesn't look the most inviting from the outside, despite the fact that it has actually been in business a long long time according to their signage. Inside, however, they actually have pretty nice looking wooden tables and a full bar and a friendly bar tender, which is really all you need for a little neighborhood spot. They have different drink specials every day too, like $12 house bottles of wine on Wednesdays I think? And then $1 watermelon shots and other bottled beer specials too. We were here late in the night and there was a large group of people who clearly had been there for quite some time, counting down all together as a happy group for their group shots which I loved. And on game days, this bar is also usually pretty packed as people eat/drink on their way to the game and there is a decent after work crowd here too. Plus in nice weather time, their patio is set up which is dog friendly, which is also something you have to love about the printers row area of the southloop.

46.description: Had salmon burger for lunch, and the whole meal, including fries, was really tasty. Loved the draft IPA from Colorado! A little-known feature are several private rooms, including a speakeasy downstairs. These would be great for events!

1.description: I am not sure why it has taken me this long to write a review for Blackie's, but better late than never. I started going to Blackie's last summer when I moved closer to the Loop/South Loop area and I love everything about it!Food: Great bar food and I always find myself wanting to try something new here because there are so many options. Prices are very reasonable as well.Drinks: I haven't gone to Blackie's without having a drink, but I think I fell in love with this place on my first visit when I tried their WATERMELON SHOTS! They were strong, tasty, and only $1! On my birthday, I visited Blackie's and just had a few standard drinks, until I looked at the drink menu. I was able to order a Frozen Mango Margarita! I am the pickiest person when it comes to Margaritas, and used to only drink them at Ceasar's in Lakeview, but this drink was excellent and large. Overall, Blackie's is my preference for drinks because of the quality and reasonable prices.Service: The service is great and everyone is really friendly. There aren't any servers or bartenders who give off the impression that they don't want to be there or that their customers are burdensome. Great hospitality!Atmosphere: It is usually quiet when I visit, but I enjoy that. It isn't the typical douchey River North atmosphere that many desire and I probably appreciate that the most. When I have cocktails and food, I prefer a relaxed atmosphere and I definitely had this at Blackie's.

55.description: Never waited longer for a waitress (in this case) in all my life. I've gotten faster service at Jamaican joints in Brooklyn...but at least they have good food. Under or improperly staffed.

9.description: I absolutely love Blackies and can't even count how many times I have been here! Love love love this place! First off the food is great! They have changed their menu and it's even better!! By far.. My favorite for an appetizer is the pork/polenta! You have to try it! I also really enjoy the baby arugula salad! As for entrees.. Honestly everything is very good! My favorite is the burgers!As for ambience it is casual/ bar/ restaurant. It's in a perfect location! In the summer you can enjoy eating outside and bring your dog! This is truly a Chicago Gem! There is something about this place that I just absolutely love!

26.description: Love this place. Love the atmosphere. Would definitely come back. You can't beat a $6 pitcher. Even if it's not your favorite beer. $20 minimum bar tab was an annoyance. Would've been a problem if I wasn't able to drink more than most. Would definitely come back

25.description: We dined here on a Friday night as we moved into the neighborhood that day and needed a place close by that was within walking distance. Who wants to unpack pans to cook after moving? The food was good, but it wasn't 'I have to let the world on yelp know how awesome it was' good. The Calamari was very tasty but the burgers were average. Nothing that really stood out. I had the tacos and there wasn't much special about them either. The pork belly taco came out as a cube. Hard to eat. But not lacking in flavor. The presentation could use some thought and reworking. The beer prices are good though. We'll be back for beers, but we'll either cook before we go or have a bite elsewhere. Closer to a 3.5 than a 3. Just not good enough to bump to a 4.

12.description: I'd been here once or twice for lunch with a colleague. However, this time, my husband and I met friends here for dinner before going to the Jazz Showcase, which is just a block or two away.The food was terrific! I had the burger with everything on it--delicious, with a side salad that I chose instead of fries--and my husband had the Mason Dixon burger (with slaw, pulled pork) with chips (instead of fries). Our friends had the massive Reuben (which looked fabulous--and huge) and the tacos. Everything was delicious and very reasonably-priced. I think we may venture over here even when we are not at work!

59.description: I am a semi-regular, but hadn't been because of the cold weather, and a bit far to go for me at lunch time.  So went today, and a whole new menu!  And not one I was really excited about.  I too loved some of the old stand-bys.  It was one place you could get a real BLT Club sammie and good fries.  I had the onion soup which was really good, and not too salty.  The the Margarita flatbread which WAS TOO SALTY, but good mozz and good tomatoes.  But the salty marinara sauce (from a jar??) was disappointing.  Then I saw a chef making pasta from scratch and thought they couldn't possibly use jar sauce, could they??  If not, please remember you can always add salt, but can't take it away.  And for some who are on low sodium diets, this is not your place, at least what I ordered.  And I know BLTs and fries are not low sodium, but once every two months, not so bad.  Anyway, this place has changed, for the better?? not sure.  Glad Paul is still there, will miss Ora though she was a dear.  Will be back.  Chef, easy on the salt shaker ok?  thanks.

21.description: Old School Chicago bar!Really liked the place, going back to see the Hawks play!Enjoyed their French Burger, delicious!

17.description: Casual Americana Pub Style Fare at it's finest!Came into Blackie's South Loop on the recommendation of a local. **Tip of the Cap** The menu gives you a little history about this family owned establishment. Generous on the portions, this is the dream for every hungry person on the prowl for some good old American comfort food. I could remember places like this always putting a smile on my face when I was a young boy. Glad to see Chicago is still holding it down. CHI TOWN FAVORITE!Talk about hitting the spot, this place is your dream come true. Low key with no wait for seating, we quickly ordered about half the menu without a second thought.In food measurement units - I think we ordered a boat load. The apps here are the perfect bite if your looking for a tapas style lunch (small plates). Great for sharing and trying a bunch of things while sipping on a cold brew. Our stomachs were growling since we had all skipped breakfast and clearly we went in hot and heavy. Take no prisoners!!! Round 1Slow cooked jumbo chicken wings, crispy and delicious.Smother everything in blue cheese is what I always say!Guinness braised,  Hormone free pulled pork with creamy Italian style polenta. A taste of the transitional and the new world. I could eat this everyday for a month.Big plate of Blackie's style poutine, which are like disco fair style hand cut fries. They had me at cheese & truffle oil, but the fried egg on top made my day. It's a foodie fact, everything is better with a sunny side fried egg on top. Break into the center and watch the liquid gold drizzle over the crispy french fries. My eyes teared up in pure joy after the first bite.We washed down our first round with a seasonal local brew.Clearly a local favorite from the recommendation, but did I mention all the apps were cheap, nothing was over $7. Round 2They make it very difficult to pick a sandwich with all the tasty menu options, but I went with what seamed like the most obvious choice - The Blackie's burger, which was fully loaded with melty cheese, smoked bacon, caramelized onions, mushrooms and organic greens. I personally love organic produce, which is always hard to find when your eating out and on a budget. All this was stacked on top of a hot juicy fresh Black Angus patty. The golden brioche bun was the perfect delivery system to grip my hands around. I could not have dreamed up a more yummy hamburger.WARNING: You will need another drink to wash it down, and it is very easy to get carried away when pitchers of beer are only $5. CHEAP COLD BEER ! ! !This good ol' American spot is a local Chicago gem. If you are passing through The South Loop area or looking for a new place to try, then stop by Blackie's. You will not be disappointed. The menu selections are all mouthwatering and the bang for your buck is through the roof.

10.description: The fact that the owner decided to tell me "goodluck in your life, you don't seem like a happy person" just because I thought their food was not great goes to show the professionalism. I'm sorry I did not like your food but I think you have no right to comment on my life because of it. Have a great day.If I could give you negative stars I would, it seems like the most terrible thing about this place is the nasty/witty comments the owner makes to people who leave less than perfect reviews. Take the criticism and improve upon it. Don't bash your customers on yelp and twitter.

5.description: I like going here for cheap pitchers of beer and decent fries.  The bar is weirdly dark but the patio is nice and I like that they let dogs on the patio, that's pretty great.Blackies kind of seems like a place that's trying to do fancy, gastropub food, but should really just stick to the basics. I have tried the pork sliders, the French burger, the poutine a la blackies, and the truffle mac n cheese (been here a few times, lol). -the poutine: truffle fries are good but these are just outrageously soggy and the egg doesn't do much other than conflict with the truffle flavor.  I love, love truffle flavor and the idea is good and the flavors are decent, just not well-executed.-the truffle mac n cheese - on a truffle vein...this is so bland!!!  It's not cheesy or creamy, it's just very plain and faint tasting.  -pork sliders - SO GOOD.  I got a few of these to share and subsequently refused to share.  They were just delicious, rich with flavor, and juicy.  Not too complicated, just right.-French burger - the patty itself was good, and nicely cooked, but despite the myriad of ingredients, the burger itself was unremarkable in terms of taste.In terms of atmosphere: the patio is lovely and I don't necessarily mind the inside, but why is it so dark?  It makes blackies seem...dirty, and I feel like that's (hopefully) not the case. Also, the decor inside is so fun and you can hardly see it!Service: to be honest, the service is never great here.  The servers and bar staff are very cold and often take a while with checks or checking on you.  I don't mind that much but it's not a great impression!  I also don't understand the rudeness of the comments that the owner makes on people's reviews.  If I hadn't seen those, I'd probably keep going to blackies - its location is nice and the beer is cheap.  However, the response from the owner to a lot of these people leaves a pretty sour taste in my mouth, despite the good taste of the food and I don't know if I want to support a business owner that does that...having worked in the restaurant industry for most of my life, he doesn't seem like someone I'd want to work for.  PS I'm sure I will also get a rude response for this commentary?  I try to keep my reviews pretty unbiased.  I like Blackies but it's definitely got room to improve!  Further, to address things you may say/ seem to say a lot, Jeff T, I can assure you that 1. I have never worked at your establishment and 2. I am definitely not too "high brow"

3.description: Solid spot on Printer's Row.  The prices were surprisingly inexpensive, the food was good if not amazing, and the service was excellent.  Definitely recommend.

35.description: As a Columbia student, I spend most of my time down in the South Loop. I had passed by the place HUNDREDS of times, but only experienced it once, three years ago. I'm incredibly loyal to my favorite restaurants, and usually frequent Hackney's down the street. It was planning my best friend's 21st birthday celebration that brought me back to this fine establishment-- and I was thoroughly impressed. I contacted the owners approximately a month in advance via email, and was pleased to find how kind, helpful and speedy her responses were. Susan was incredibly willing to and eager to accommodate all of my requests for the dinner (a reservation for 15), and very flexible with splitting the tab 15-ways. The atmosphere is excellent, the menu is OUTSTANDING (try the salmon sandwich), and the bar is sexy as all hell. The place was hopping the night of our reservation because of the Blackhawks game, and it really brought a lot of brilliant energy into the room. Our waiter was ridiculously helpful and patient (our party was there for a looong time), and I was able to meet the owner, Jeffrey. Bar Louie is known as the "college bar" on campus-- however, I strongly recommend that you stay far away from that overcrowded joint. Support this local gem! Blackie's is one of my new favorites, and will be my first choice for my holiday staff party in a few weeks. Thanks Jeff and Susan!

19.description: Old School Chicago bar!Really liked the place, going back to see the Hawks play!Enjoyed their French Burger, delicious!

28.description: I absolutely love Blackies and can't even count how many times I have been here! Love love love this place! First off the food is great! They have changed their menu and it's even better!! By far.. My favorite for an appetizer is the pork/polenta! You have to try it! I also really enjoy the baby arugula salad! As for entrees.. Honestly everything is very good! My favorite is the burgers!As for ambience it is casual/ bar/ restaurant. It's in a perfect location! In the summer you can enjoy eating outside and bring your dog! This is truly a Chicago Gem! There is something about this place that I just absolutely love!

45.description: So disappointed. The food is terrible now; inedible to a certain degree. Once happy staff are miserable or nowhere to be seen. And the staff that replaced them don't know how to do their jobs. (Saw a customer, who was drinking at the bar, seat customers, answer the phone, go into the kitchen, behind the bar, in the office...?)I also love the lack of respect from the owner for his regulars and their opinions. Go ahead and hire a fancy chef that can't cook a medium well burger but would rather post his food porn on Facebook...gross. Looking forward to my nasty reply.

33.description: This place is awesome!! Great food, great service, and great atmosphere ! I love coming here when I am downtown!!

43.description: Blackie's is a bar. An old bar. No more than a bar. An "old-fashioned bar. A traditional bar, with traditional drinks and traditional bar style, stick to your ribs food. While the menu has been updated to include several more chic food items, there's always the cheeseburger and waffle fries that has been a staple for decades. It's been in Printer's Row for what seems like forever; long before I was born. My mom's Bachelorette Party with the stereotypically annoying stripper was at none other than Blackie's, in the mid 1980's. Blackie's is so chock full of nostalgia and fun memories for my family. My mom lived in the neighborhood after college and Blackie's was one of my parents' favorite haunts when they were dating and wanted a bar away from Rush Street. Funny thing is, I like Blackie's now as much as my parents liked Blackie's in the 1980's. The salmon burger was pretty fantastic, as were the waffle fries. Really fresh, crunchy yet savory and flavorful. The portion of both is so ample, there was more than enough to gorge and have enough to take home for later or the next day. Bread is fresh and tasty, fish is moist and delicious, fries are just plain wonderful. Blackie's is one of the few places that remains fabulous and consistent and open for business. I hope they're around for the next several decades. The way they do A Bar, I think they will be!!

2.description: this didnt need to impress me just satisfy me - and it BARELY did that.first of all - a bloody marry is NOT bloody mix and absolute vodka - you MUST at least give me a pickle - some olivers but do yourselves a favor and get some salami - cheese - its cheap and people will be impressed... NOT disappointed.the wings had NO sauce - they were decent but get yourselves some hot sauce.  the classic burger was cooked decent - but the muschrooms were hard and the tomatoe slices way too thick.just get your bar food in order and you'll have a bunch of better reviews.

18.description: Good burger. Horribly unfriendly service. He was a Mexican waiter I don't know if it was because he didn't speak much English or something, but I've had friendlier service at steak n' shake at 2am. The guy never checked in on us, the bus boy had to get us our 2nd round of drinks, not even sure if that's legal. I just didn't get it, how someone could be that unprofessional. Then we had to flag down another lady to have him bring us the bill, even though he was in eyesight drinking a coke behind the bar. I could understand if it was busy, but this guy just seemed lazy or didn't care at all. I won't return.

41.description: Ha, this place knows how to survive a storm and reinvent itself! kudos to the owner of this place. *raises glass*First, they have better drink specials a bottle of wine for only $12 makes this a fine place for a quick date. Shot specials for a dollar seriously are you kidding me? Second, the menu was updated. The food is significantly better! Blackies now has the best calamari - ever! In the past they didn't season it now it's beautifully seasoned and ugh - (insert curse word here) good! The other food items are made fresh, so you can taste the difference asap. When I took a fork full of fresh spinach I had that moment - the yes moment! :) (Meg Ryan voice - restaurant scene) yes, yes, gawd yesssssss! Ha ha Third, the menu has been updated. It looks good, hip and people are coming in this means a better environment. Last but not least the new waitresses are fab! Great service will do wonders... (Insert curse word here) wonders for the entire atmosphere of an establishment! Someone who can confidently make recommendations, is polite, and socially aware of when to stop by the table and when to stay away- Perfecto! I rarely give out five stars, but here's my prediction... In less than six months this place will be packed daily! You are on the right path Blackies... as you can see, I'm  a fan of the revamp... previously not so much, but now yes!Areas of improvement: Never run out of broccoli, ever! Advertise that the menu makes adjustments for food allergies. Have dessert that includes fresh fruit. There's nothing like fresh fruit desserts to encourage people to have dessert.You will find me by the window a bottle of wine, appetizer, and dinner. Go ahead and say hi.... I don't bite unless you are on my fork! Grrrrrr ;) ha ha

52.description: Breakfast/Brunch is my thing. We've been coming here for over 10 years and they never disappoint. Our 4 year old lives the Mickey Mouse pancakes.

50.description: Blackie's is a really nice neighborhood sports bar.  The staff are always the same and friendly, the food is alright, but the beer and atmosphere is why I go!  The customers who go here are also very laid back and just want to hang out with their friends.  This is the type of place you can sit at the bar and not worry about anything.

4.description: Blackie's was fine. It is a neighborhood bar that's been around for a long time. Since it is right by my daughter's apartment, we met there.It's got that neighborhood bar feel. I have to agree with some of the comments made here about service. It was 6ish on a Saturday evening, and they were not crowded at all. There were, perhaps, four tables with people at them and one person sitting at the bar. Getting the server's attention should have been easy, but no.The food was actually pretty good. I had their fully loaded burger - it came out well done when I'd ordered medium. But, the meat was well seasoned and juicy, so the fact that it was overcooked was not so noticeable. It comes with pickles, sauteed onions, mixed green lettuce and tomato. I skipped the cheese. The fries were fresh, hand cut and were very good.I've wanted to try Blackies for a while, and it was a fair experience. With all of the new options popping up in the gentrifying South Loop, they may have to start to work on their service to survive.Oh, make sure you stop into their restrooms. While they are small/cramped, they have interesting posters on the walls and ceilings. I understand that they have similar posters in the ladies restroom too, but they cater to the sexes.

6.description: Food was okay, beer menu was poor, and service was terrible! Probably twenty minute wait for our server to pick up the tab after he gave it to us. Also forgot the diet coke I asked for.

22.description: This is easily one of the best places for food and drink in the South Loop, and one of the best patios in the city.  "What's so special about it," you ask.  "It looks like just a normal sidewalk seating area."  Let me tell you:  It's the service.  You'll get excellent service out here, no matter how long you're chillin' with your chums.  Sounds so simple, but so few places can deliver like Blackie's.  Plus, the patio is so inviting, other patrons are liable to join your little sidewalk chat.  It's like they moved the fundamentals of a neighborhood pub outside!  If you're drinking, the prices definitely entice you to prolong your afternoon chill-session.  Highly recommended, for brunch, lunch, dinner, and chill-sessions!

15.description: Blackie's is a bar. An old bar. No more than a bar. An "old-fashioned bar. A traditional bar, with traditional drinks and traditional bar style, stick to your ribs food. While the menu has been updated to include several more chic food items, there's always the cheeseburger and waffle fries that has been a staple for decades. It's been in Printer's Row for what seems like forever; long before I was born. My mom's Bachelorette Party with the stereotypically annoying stripper was at none other than Blackie's, in the mid 1980's. Blackie's is so chock full of nostalgia and fun memories for my family. My mom lived in the neighborhood after college and Blackie's was one of my parents' favorite haunts when they were dating and wanted a bar away from Rush Street. Funny thing is, I like Blackie's now as much as my parents liked Blackie's in the 1980's. The salmon burger was pretty fantastic, as were the waffle fries. Really fresh, crunchy yet savory and flavorful. The portion of both is so ample, there was more than enough to gorge and have enough to take home for later or the next day. Bread is fresh and tasty, fish is moist and delicious, fries are just plain wonderful. Blackie's is one of the few places that remains fabulous and consistent and open for business. I hope they're around for the next several decades. The way they do A Bar, I think they will be!!

57.description: Man I used to LOVE this place.I live less than a block from here and I used to go there 2-4 times a week for a burger, salad, or just drinks. But after the menu change I can't bring myself to go there anymore. The burgers were amazing, easily the best food and deal in the South Loop. But after the menu change the burgers became very mediocre and overpriced. A lot of the menu items don't make sense in my opinion too... Duck tacos? really? I had a HORRIBLE encounter with the owner on Twitter and it was the most unprofessional conversation I have ever been a part of. I couldn't believe someone would seriously handle their business like that. Be prepared to pay $15 for a burger that tastes like it should cost $7.

20.description: Finally!!! Blackie's finally changed the menu back to some of their old delicious staples!  Everything was just as good as it used to be!  Grilled cheese, side Caesar salad and the apple pie = perfect meal.  Oh and the chili is outstanding if you love chunky thick chili!!  Good to have you back Blackie's, we missed you!

36.description: Great burger. I liked the J. Lohr red wine. Good service. Beer list isn't bad either. They have quite a few craft beers. I'd come back.

14.description: Burger is awesome Great outdoor spot as well Lots of options Great spot I'll be back 5 stars

1.description: I have just moved to Chicago and I thought I'd give this Ulta a try bc I have been doing my hair at Ulta for the past 2 years, in other states.Boy! What a disappointment! I booked a time today at 2:30 and when I arrived at 2:28 the stylist was working on a guy and told me to walk around the store because he would page me as soon as he was done with the client. After walking around the store for 20 minutes I went to see what was taking the stylist so long to page me and I saw him working on a woman. I decided to take a seat and waited for another 15 minutes (35 minutes had gone by from my scheduled appointment) when I went up to him and said that I would be leaving because he was very late. He told me he would be done in 5-10 minutes. I took a seat and 5 minutes went by and I realized that it would actually take him longer, so I got up and left. This stylist should have apologized for being extremely late as soon as I arrived and given me the opportunity to reschedule instead of making me wait for over half an hour without saying anything.Bottom line: the reviews complaining about the staff are true: they lack people skills, which is essential when working with the public.Go somewhere else and if a place has bad reviews, be ware!!! I should have known better... I am on the train going elsewhere! Thank God for Yelp!!

9.description: Staff was helpful, store was clean and had a good selection of products for guys.There was a great sale (buy 2 get 1 free) going on for a few brands such as American Crew and Redken. I guess we hadn't paid attention to the signage because it wasn't a brand mix and match.  The staff was really great in helping us both in explaining the sale and trying to locate a product that was out of stock.  Ultra in the Roosevelt Collection gets our four stars for friendly, helpful staff and a clean professional store.  Would have gotten five had we been greeted or offered assistance in the aisle.

23.description: Not coming here ever again! Made an appt to get my makeup done for Halloween after having to give the person on the phone all my information twice because her computer shut down on her. Went there tonight to find out they had no record of my appt! That's why I usually get my makeup done with Mac!  Never coming back to this place!

5.description: COUPON CLUBThis place rocks with the coupons. In fact, I won't even buy anything here unless I have the coupon. I came shopping in here today and ended up not getting what I needed. While I was in the back of the store getting my stuff, my partner in crime was checking out at the front of the store. So when I walked up to use my coupon, I found out my wife had just used two coupons. The girl at the front counter almost stopped her but my wife said she was using her husband's coupon. So there I stood with product in my hand. Great! So I put my items back because I'm not buying stuff here without my coupon. On a side note this store is huge and not very crowded.  The Roosevelt Collection Shops were quickly becoming my favorite place to shop but that may change soon. I just found out that starting January 2014 they will be charging for parking.  They do realize that there's an Ulta on Halsted with a free parking lot (shared with Mariano's). I hate to tell this location but I'm gonna have to shop there. Why spend money on parking when I can use it on products in the store!If you haven't joined the club, then I recommend you do. You get monthly coupons and there great coupons. Anywhere from $3.50 to $5 off when making a $10 purchase. That's a great deal.

25.description: Poor, poor, poor service. Last week I read about the poor service. However, I decided to try this location because I reside in the area.Yikes. Staff would walk past and not acknowledge you. I had to locate staff for assistance. I continued shopping. Then I informed staff who was stocking the area that I was ready to purchase. She continued stocking. I had to go back to her and request a cashier. She said that she was not a cashier. No problem. However, would it have been reasonable for her to inform me that she would locate a cashier? Is that a unreasonable expectation? Then the general manager finally decided to go the the cashier area where there were three customers including my self ready to purchase. I informed him that I was dissatisfied with the service. Instead of him apologizing this man said, oh, the service is good. Can you imagine that response from a general manager. After he attempted to ring my purchases he was unable to utilize the coupons. After this experience, I told him to cancel my purchase. I was fed up. I left.I went to another ulta location on 40 s. halted. Cashier Edith was pleasant and competent such that she rang my purchases without a problem. Be careful shopping at the Roosevelt location.

12.description: Spent about 45 minutes at ulta and the only time an employee spoke to me was when I walked in. I wanted to purchase new foundation and an entire daily makeup routine, however, not one person asked if I needed assistance. Also, no employee was approachable. All were grouped by the registers gossiping/chatting about their personal lives. I typically have a good/decent experience here and a great Experience at ulta locations overall. However, I feel this should be noted.

21.description: This store is smaller and does not carry the same items as the other stores. They stated it does not have the full spa either. I have been in the store a few times since it opened the people are nice but not too educated about the products! This can be a big deal with the type of items they sale. Lighting is good and items they carry are good for anyone who needs make up skin care etc.

16.description: After going to hair cutters for years & not getting what I wanted, I decided to try the salon at Ulta. My stylist Alta, was very helpful & styled my hair beautifully. I got a blow out & additional styling with a straightening iron. My hair looked so nice for my graduation, & it lasted me the entire weekend.

17.description: I've been to this location about 10 times and not once have I been approached by a sales associate to ask me if I needed help. I continue to keep going because it is the closest to me. The cashiers on the other hand, are always super nice and well presented!

10.description: I usually come here to get my eyebrows waxed at the Benefit brow bar. If you are looking for somewhere professional & affordable-this is it. Ask for Scott if you can, he does an amazing job. My brows have never looked better! He is very friendly, and even touched me up so I didn't have to walk out with red blotchy skin! He also filled in my brows for me which was greatly appreciated.

11.description: Thank goodness for Ulta Roosevelt Collection.  Scott worked his wonders on my brows.  He is fabulous, courteous and professional in pleasing his customers and new clientele. He will explain the process and what works best to frame your face shape.  Location is great with free parking.  Will be coming back every 3 weeks.  A happy well satisfied client.  Prices here moderate, but well worth the price when you see the final result.

26.description: Came in the first Saturday they were open.  It was quiet inside.  There was what seemed to be an employee training class going on which blocked some of the aisles.  Annoying.  I was greeted by the girl when I walked in and then never was talked to again - which in all the other Ultas it's been the opposite for me.  The girl who was working the register wasn't especially friendly and gave me one tiny bag for the stuff I bought.  (which this is the third time that's happened to me at Ulta! Do they have rules for not using anything larger that a small bag??)In any event, I love that it's down the street from me now! I just hope they are training that staff that was in my way of the nail polish (I think it was, couldn't see!) to be more friendly and approachable.

27.description: I've been a fan of Ulta for a while. Once I saw that this Ulta was opened, I immediately went. After a quick glance through most of the aisles, I was pleased with how stocked up and tidy they were. Their salon bar was pretty neat, too. This is definitely an Ulta to check out before more people know that it's open and everything gets rummaged through.It was kind of empty, but I like that because I can head straight in and find what I'm looking for. The sales associates were very nice and asked if I needed help finding anything. They had a mark down on Ulta brand make-up so I grabbed the mascara that I had been eyeing for a while. (I can always trust Ulta for deals on make-up!) Their grand opening sale is right around the corner and I will be back for that!

0.description: It's good. The customer service here is pretty alright.. I do love being welcomed when I enter an establishment, (and this place is good for this).  Also, I hate being bothered every 5 minutes WITH--"CAN I HELP YOU?... WHAT CAN I HELP YOU WITH? ..WHAT BRINGS YOU IN TODAY???" Just STOP already.  IF I need something, I'll approach you and ask for assistance.   My biggest complaint is with the ever so popular makeup brand, NYX.   They do not seem to get enough product in on a consistent basis.  The lip liners are rarely stocked in full and it's very frustrating heading in here once a month and they don't have the 2 or 3 NYX items I want.    Other than this, it is a good ULTA.

20.description: This was seriously the worst place to go if you have any type of question! I was looking for a new facial cleansing treatment. I waited for a little while I browsed the facial cleaning section. I asked an employee if he could help me.. He said he would after he finished with someone else. I politely replied "take your time". After waiting 15 mins I just started googling reviews for all of the products that I narrowed down to. This whole process was maybe 30 mins after I talked to the employee. When I just picked one myself I walked up to the counter.. Where the guy that I talked to was chatting with another worker leaning on the counter and no other customers were in line or around! This makes me so mad! Do your freaking job or at least pretend you're busy if you're going to avoid working.. Next time I'll just go to sephora!

19.description: Came in the first Saturday they were open.  It was quiet inside.  There was what seemed to be an employee training class going on which blocked some of the aisles.  Annoying.  I was greeted by the girl when I walked in and then never was talked to again - which in all the other Ultas it's been the opposite for me.  The girl who was working the register wasn't especially friendly and gave me one tiny bag for the stuff I bought.  (which this is the third time that's happened to me at Ulta! Do they have rules for not using anything larger that a small bag??)In any event, I love that it's down the street from me now! I just hope they are training that staff that was in my way of the nail polish (I think it was, couldn't see!) to be more friendly and approachable.

2.description: Great location with convenient parking. The biggest downfall is staff. Came in on a Sunday after wasn't crowded at all. No one greeted us, asked if we needed assistance, or even had eye contact. This is a huge pet peeve for me since I worked in retail for 6 years. I knew that I wanted to purchase some smashbox matte lipstick, but I chose to wait. I love the ulta off clyborne and will visit that one for my purchases. also, my cousin stood at the philosophy area for 30 mins bc she had no idea of what products she needed. Not once did anyone ask if she needed assistance.

18.description: This store is smaller and does not carry the same items as the other stores. They stated it does not have the full spa either. I have been in the store a few times since it opened the people are nice but not too educated about the products! This can be a big deal with the type of items they sale. Lighting is good and items they carry are good for anyone who needs make up skin care etc.

13.description: Amazing service here. Was helping a friend buy some wrinkle cream and Scott was very helpful and friendly. There is free parking in the garage which makes it very easy and convenient. Overall great experience and the store is very clean and well stocked on products.  I would recommend coming here!

4.description: Store is nice and usually has a decent stock but there's an older man who works at the cosmetic counter by Benefit who is extremely rude. I approached him saying there was a mascara Benefit used to make that has been discontinued that I loved, he looked at me like I had seven heads and wasn't worth his time. I then said is there anything here like that? His response was that it was no longer made and blew me off, I clearly already knew this had he been listening to me. I then asked if they had anything similar to that around, he again didn't give me the time of day and said yeah so and so brand makes something close. He didn't even walk me over to the mascara! How rude! I had never heard of the brand so didn't know where to look. Very very rude and should not be working the floor with that attitude. The store wasn't even the least bit busy, at all. They will not get my business again.

24.description: I'm so excited that there is an Ulta so close to me now. I finally stopped up there and thought the customer service was excellent. I got there shortly before close yet everyone was still very helpful. The bronzer I bought came with a free eye makeup remover. There weren't any of the right size on the shelves but they searched for them for me, or agreed to give me the slightly larger size in the event they couldn't find any. They also threw in a free sample size hairspray which I just so happened desperately needed! Based on my selections, they also pointed out some great deals to me. I'm also glad that the make-up is organized by brand and not by type, as it is at some locations. Definitely my new go-to location!

6.description: Ulta Roosevelt Collection is a great location. Staff is friendly and helpful but the shining star is Scott. Scott works the Benefit counter and does the best brows in the city! He is patient and really tries to understand and achieve the look you are going for.Brows are really important as they frame your face ladies, don't neglect them they can do a lot. Go see Scott!

22.description: COUPON CLUBThis place rocks with the coupons. In fact, I won't even buy anything here unless I have the coupon. I came shopping in here today and ended up not getting what I needed.
