While I was in the back of the store getting my stuff, my partner in crime was checking out at the front of the store. So when I walked up to use my coupon, I found out my wife had just used two coupons. The girl at the front counter almost stopped her but my wife said she was using her husband's coupon. So there I stood with product in my hand. Great! So I put my items back because I'm not buying stuff here without my coupon. On a side note this store is huge and not very crowded.  The Roosevelt Collection Shops were quickly becoming my favorite place to shop but that may change soon. I just found out that starting January 2014 they will be charging for parking.  They do realize that there's an Ulta on Halsted with a free parking lot (shared with Mariano's). I hate to tell this location but I'm gonna have to shop there. Why spend money on parking when I can use it on products in the store!If you haven't joined the club, then I recommend you do. You get monthly coupons and there great coupons. Anywhere from $3.50 to $5 off when making a $10 purchase. That's a great deal.

15.description: This Ulta location is convenient because it's right by the movie theater and several other stores I frequent.  Alas, I will occasionally browse but rarely buy anything here.  I will literally test things here when I'm in the area and need to kill time then go to an Ulta that acts like they care about my business to purchase. I like the chain overall and this location has a decent selection.  The customer service, however, is seriously challenged.  I'm a fairly low maintenance shopper and even I am thoroughly taken aback by just how difficult it is to even get a greeting in this place let alone any actual help! If you see me walk into the store, look me in the eye, and walk away without so much as a "Hello, Welcome to Ulta" I am hard pressed to spend my money with you.

7.description: I love the convenient location, the free parking, and the size of the store. This location is much cleaner than the State street store.  However, I don't like that every time I visit this store there are no sales associates available to help the customers on the sales floor. During my last visit, there was one sales person who was helping another customer.  I hung around for a few minutes hoping he'd have time to help me, but no such luck. It's a beautiful store, but the customer service is routinely lacking.

8.description: It's a beautiful store and very nice location. But the customer service is awful!!! I'd been waiting for assistance's help about 15 min. Okay, I understand everyone was busy with other customers, but there are was one guy who were talking on the phone and was ignoring me, I waited for a little bit, hoping that he will ask me " if I need some help " but he didn't!!! So I told him "excuse me" twice and finally I got his attention. He looked at me rolling his eyes and told  me "what's up?!!" What's up???!!! Seriously?! Alright I didn't say anything I just ask him politely could hi help me to find a primer, so hi did, he just pointed a finger to the corner where I will probably find it! Thank you so much! You were really helpful! So I wanted to give the only star, but cashier girl were supper nice)

3.description: So, I went to Ulta yesterday after reviewing one of the stylists portfolios on styleseat. I was in desperate need of a trim because it had been a while and my ends were looking scraggly. I contacted the stylist, Ahz, and he confirmed that a walk-in would be permissible. I waited an hour and 30 minutes, but I wasn't tripping because I needed my hair to slay for the night. So, first red flag: he curled the young lady sitting in the chair and she left looking like she had a helmet on her head. No judgement zone. Maybe it was a bad day. Now it's my turn. I sit in the chair, take off my glasses and he starts cutting. He starts at the back and gets to the front. 2nd red flag: it was taking him an incredibly long time to trim some ends. Then, He cuts my front and I'm thinking to myself like 'damn, I know my hair wasn't damaged in the front.' Mr. Edward scissor hands chopped off 3 inches!!! I came in as 'long hair don't care' and left with a barely shoulder length helmet. The shape is awful!! Now, I didn't ask him to shape my hair, I asked him to trim the ends. This man is obsessed with helmets and now I look like I play for the Steelers. I slept on it to make sure I wasn't overreacting. I'm still pissed, but more sad today. I'm accepting donations toward the Grow Alysha's Hair Back fund

14.description: I stopped in looking for blush and Scott and Tya were ROCKSTARS helping me get everything I needed and more. Scott took extra time to show me how to apply everything. I left looking, feeling fabulous and excited about trying my new tricks. The store is gorgeous, this location always has a few more brands than the other Ultas. I LOVE this place :-)

3.description: I've tried a few things here and all have been good. I've had the chocolate chip muffin which is moist and pretty big, I could only eat half and saved the other half for later. A chocolate chip cookie which was soft and moist. Also tried the almond croissant which was flakey and had a little filling inside. It wasn't overly sweet and I enjoyed it. I think these items are a bit overpriced in comparison to Corner Bakery, Starbuck's and Panera. A breakfast pastry was over 3 bucks. You can get breakfast pastries for under 3 at the other places. As far as lunch I have tried the chicken panini. It's good but I'm not sure why there are raisins in it, it's not listed in the description. Also you just get a sandwich, no chips or an apple or even carrot sticks. So you pay 8 bucks for just a sandwich.Servers are pleasant and you get your food pretty quickly. It's clean and bright inside and not crowded. If you are trying to work though, not sure if it would be ideal. Music is kind of loud and they play all different kinds.

1.description: SO SO happy that this cafe has opened up! Seriously though, where else can you get a coffee and they offer to throw a shot of bourbon or rum in it for you? That's my kind of working cafe if you ask me!Shots of alcohol aside, their muffins and pastries here are very filling and made fresh and they will even heat them up for you too which I love. Their coffees are pretty good and strong and they try and use quality beans here too which I appreciate. It isn't the biggest cafe in the world, but they do have a few tables and pretty good internet the few times I've come here to do work and it is clear that nearby students from Columbia and such have office hours here with their professors sometimes, work parties and study dates and the like. There are not enough cafes in this part of the south loop, so all in all, I am thrilled that this cafe can be a part of my normal printers row life. Good coffee, they bring in food from the Sociale restaurant next door too, and free wifi. Big fan.

0.description: I was very excited for Cafe Press to open, and I have yet to be let down. I've now been back a handful of times, and have had their pour over and french press made coffee, as well as their Vietnamese iced tea and a flavored cappuccino.All of their letterpress blend coffees are excellent, with a very good, yet distinct flavor. The coffee is not at all bitter, and has somewhat of a smokey smell to it. Their espresso drinks are also very good, and adding a flavor shot creates a good taste yet it isn't overpowering or sugary like most other coffee shop versions. The atmosphere is also very nice. It is pretty quiet, and has always been clean. Enough foot traffic to keep it somewhat busy but it is still a place that I wouldn't mind coming to get some work done.I'll be back every week. It's great to finally have a decent coffee shop in the neighborhood.

2.description: Really good-tasting coffee! Super cool decor, including bricks (which are now a section of the wall) that they discovered from the old Chicago brick streets while rebuilding. Pretty small space, but not cramped. The one downside: seems overpriced. A small latte cost me around $5. I've never paid that much for a latte in my life. Was it good? Yes. Was it ridiculously good enough to cost $5? Not too sure.

5.description: I am a coffee lover, particularly espresso in the form of an Americano.  In fact, I drink iced Americanos nearly every day from one place or another.  The Americano at Cafe Press is strong and bold.  However, Cafe Press is incredibly overpriced.  A small iced Americano with soy milk here costs $5.80.  It is certainly the most expensive small iced Americano I have ever purchased, and they charged much extra for soy milk.  The coffee is good, but frankly not good enough for that price.  On other days, I've also tried their scones, which are delicious, but also overpriced when compared to competing coffee shops in the area.  The coffee shop has a vintage ambience with old print throughout the store.  The service is friendly but often slow, sometimes taking around 7-8 minutes for espresso in the morning, even when there was no line.

6.description: To be honest, I came in with little expectations and left very satisfied.I dropped in for a quick lunch and had their short rib sandwich, my roommate had the lamb meatball panini - both great options when you want something quick and under $8.Portion was a little small, but for those who live in South Loop - our food options are limited. Good spot to drop in for paninis, good coffee, and descent pastries.Glad you opened up so close to my complex.

7.description: Exactly what the neighborhood needed! The coffee is excellent, has almost a hint of blueberry. They rotate out the blends for variety. They offer Nitro Iced Coffee which is mind blowing! It is coffee served off a tap like Guinness with nitrogen & is served chilled without the need for excessive ice cubes to dilute the coffee & flavor, truly amazing!! The food selection is gourmet but reasonably priced. Excited for a close, good cafe. Great place to get work done, read, relax, or watch the city flow by.

8.description: Latte and blueberry/lemon scone were delicious. Looking forward to going back for a panini, chips and another pastry. Very nice inside & staff is friendly. Nice addition to South Loop.

9.description: Great coffee, delicious breakfast paninis and scones in a friendly and beautiful space!  We've been there three times already and are fans.  I only wish they would serve their biscuits by themselves with some jam in addition to having biscuit breakfast sandwiches.  Perfect addition to the neighborhood.

10.description: Solid spot.  The smoked salmon press was a solid 4 stars.  The only complaint is they picked the wrong tables, which don't accommodate a computer mouse well.  Welcome to the neighborhood!

4.description: Great new coffee spot in an area dying for something other than the usual cookie-cutter chain from the city that rains a lot. Excellent expresso, a small selection but high quality pastries, friendly barista who seems to give a shit, and late hours are why I give Cafepress a solid five stars. Parking is limited tho - that is the only down side... so maybe 4.75 stars...

28.description: New staff is inconsistent with drink making and it feels more like a Starbucks than a legit coffee shop. LOVED the old staff, those guys knew their coffee and were really helpful with any home brewing issues. I miss the integrity that place had before new management swooped in. Will be following the original guys to their new shop in Pilsen.

1.description: I only got an iced coffee here, so it's hard to evaluate a place based on one cup. But I'll take a shot at it anyway.They use some good beans here. The iced coffee was rich, very cold and more earthy than fruity. Diner-style coffee, this is not! A shot of simple syrup was all it took to bring everything into nice balance as I went back around to the running store.Best of all, the prices were incredibly reasonable; I think I spent a little more than $2.50. This is a great deal for great coffee.

9.description: I came here before my movie started.Service- very friendly. And not busy during the day. Price- Costed $10 for latte and cake.Taste- I really didn't like their cake. The latte tastes just ok. Also, I was expected them to pour latte art..they didn't.Wifi- yes, the plaza has freewifi.

29.description: Great coffee spot!  One size drinks, great outdoor seating options and a playground next door.  I imagine it is a zoo during prime movie-going hours, but we stopped in at 9:00 on a Tuesday and it was empty.  The guy working was really nice, and let me try the coffee-soda before I bought a bottle.

23.description: Super friend staff.  We came here before our movie and I got "dinner" and hot chocolate, both of which I was able to bring into the movie without attempting to hind anything.  They have a very interesting selection of food items, I was recommended the vegan burrito wrap.  The wrap was perfect for the evening and tasted pretty good for a pre packaged item.  The only downside was the ample sodium.  They seem to have other items that were vegan too.  Its a small cafe and I'm not sure its good place for studying, but it is perfect to grab something and go.

5.description: My cup of joe was cold the first time and it was easily replaced with piping hot coffee. Excellent customer service! forgot the gal with blue hairs name she was very nice to warm up the chicken sandwich my kids ordered. Better food option than in the IKON theatre.

31.description: They haz birrrr herrrr!!! Not that swill crap... Good shtuff. IPA's... can's, bottles... no MillerBudCoors. And the overall quality seems much better than the best Star bbbbb  ucks.Very tasty sandwiches. Nothing ordinary. Everything top shelf.The outdoor seating is very refreshing and the backdrop of the Willis Tower is pretty impressive.The service is exquisite for a coffee shop from Bridgeport... just saying'...At the far end of the outdoor seating, there is a monster fireplace.

25.description: This place is close and open late, and gets 4.5 stars. I really wanted it to be good, but it just isn't. Mind you I got regular coffee, black. Maybe if you get some sort of sweet drink it's fine, but the coffee itself is mediocre. Bummer. It's a nice little patio though and the pastries look good I guess.

12.description: I am definitely a fan of Bridgeport Coffeehouse, especially the original one in Bridgeport. This spot is small and is located near the icon theatre. The nice thing about this place is the outdoor patio where you can go and hangout. However, I don't think I would go here to get my coffee unless I am actually there for a movie, H&M or Ulta. I like the vibe in Bridgeport more.

21.description: I can confidently say this place is back. The baristas are much better and seasoned, drinks are consistent and good, and they introduced a great rewards program. I'm here every day, once again, and I'm happy to see their progress.The turnover has been minimal, if anything, and they're all really friendly. It's got that vibe back, even if there were a few changes and bumps along the way.Don't miss their alcohol selection at night (or whenever - I don't judge) and their awesome patio now that the weather is getting nicer.

16.description: I have always like the Hyde Park Bridgeport, whose coffee is always perfect and whose lattes are, too. But today I had a latte that was absolutely scalding hot. Very sad!

17.description: This place rocks.  The cafe menu is super straight-forward and drinks come in one size.  Maybe it's just me, but sometimes I hate deciding whether I want a tall or grande (or a small or medium), and I don't have to worry about it here!I love their lattes here, on the stronger side, but I like it that way.  It's definitely more of a to-go kinda place since there is limited seating inside, but there is no shortage of outside seating considering it's in the Roosevelt Collection plaza.  It's also really relaxing on a nice spring/summer day.FYI, they also serve wine here!  Espresso and wine... I don't know about you, but those are two of my favorite things.

10.description: Extremely nice staff!  That they had beer and wine, wifi, and outdoor seating is what brought me to their shop.  It was a great find!  Their sandwiches are good too if you need to grab a bite as well.  I highly recommend this place, and will definitely be going back.

11.description: If your around the area and need a place to relax and have a nice snack. Stop in here. A variety of coffees and pastries. Service was friendly. The place was clean. I will stop in again for a snack between shopping.

26.description: This place is a pretty good spot. The baristas are super kind. The coffee is good and holy hell the sweets are delish! I don't live too far from here and I enjoy coming here, especially when the day is nice because you have a great view of the city from the outdoor seating. I'll be back for that warm warm good good!

27.description: Listen.... Homegirl Miranda I think her name is, is a BEAST. She made me the best iced latte I have ever had in my whole life. I felt loved. There was cinnamon involved and my whole chemical composition changed as I drank her creation. I didn't even want to finish it because I didn't want the moment of  enjoying it to end. I'm serious.      If you like coffee and mall type environments then please go here. All the pretty aesthetic around the shop makes the initial hit of that mean caffeine even harder/better/stronger. It's a good experience even if you aren't lucky enough to have Miranda serve you. Also the answer to the pastry question at Bridgeport is ALWAYS yes. Dieters; just take one or two bites and give the rest away. It's the little things that make life better after all, and pastries from here are one of those little things.

35.description: When I first came onto Yelp, Bridgeport Coffee was consistently on the front page under the Best of Yelp heading. After all this time of wondering what the hubbub was and never having had occasion to find out, I can now say I'm finally in the know. I think I can sum up this Bridgeport Coffee as follows: South Side coffee with a North Side taste and North Side price tag in a North Side type location. Translation?Great coffee in the same vein as the king of coffee - Intelligentsia. These guys sell all the usual variations of coffee drinks as well as tea drinks and apparently alcohol. I ordered some fancily brewed such-and-such, which turned out to be one great cup of coffee. It had better be for three bucks. It's somewhere in the vicinity of Intelligentsia. It will take more investigation to determine exactly where it stands.Price wise, you're looking at $2.10, $2.30 and $2.50 for the respective sizes of coffee. Of course, if you want fancy pants stuff you'll post photos of to Instagram you'll be looking at about double the price. Hipsters, if you want to hang out all day on your laptop (why?), then don't ride your bike to this place because the interior is spartan and there are only maybe three seats in the place.However, hipsters and Young Yelper, do take note Bridgeport Coffee has an outdoor alcove with probably 16-20 tables. This area will be very nice for those who hang out and drink coffee (and booze?) in the spring time, with the surrounding buildings giving it a sort of secluded, serene feel - at least for now. I still think this whole mall is locationally challenged, but there can be no doubt Bridgeport Coffee is knocking it out of the park.

8.description: Great customer service: friendly, clean, fast. Coffee well-made. We had a mocha and a caramel macchiato, & we loved it.

0.description: Lovely location, friendly staff, and best of all, great coffee! My boyfriend and I ordered the cappuccino, latte, and bought one of the shredded steak sandwiches. The space itself is small, so it can get pretty packed but the decor is welcoming, clean, and fun! The coffees were both very delicious and paired well with our sandwich!I will be sure to be back! ALSO! To validate your parking, be sure to ask one of the staff members to help you.

20.description: Caramel mocha is a killer! Small cozy place, tastes a lot better than Starbucks in my opinion

19.description: Listen.... Homegirl Miranda I think her name is, is a BEAST. She made me the best iced latte I have ever had in my whole life. I felt loved. There was cinnamon involved and my whole chemical composition changed as I drank her creation. I didn't even want to finish it because I didn't want the moment of  enjoying it to end. I'm serious.      If you like coffee and mall type environments then please go here. All the pretty aesthetic around the shop makes the initial hit of that mean caffeine even harder/better/stronger. It's a good experience even if you aren't lucky enough to have Miranda serve you. Also the answer to the pastry question at Bridgeport is ALWAYS yes. Dieters; just take one or two bites and give the rest away. It's the little things that make life better after all, and pastries from here are one of those little things.

33.description: Been in love with Bridgeport since the first time I had a latte in their "Bridgeport" store.  Was extremely excited about the Roosevelt location opening and must say that it is just as amazing as their original location!  I've already hooked a couple ppl on it and dare to say they make the BEST coffee in Chicago (and yes I have had, and frequent, Intelligentsia)!   A must visit for coffee enthusiasts!

2.description: I will preface my review with revealing my personal fears about visiting satellite locations other than the original. I have been going to Bridgeport Coffee in Bridgeport ever since I moved to Chicago. Thankfully, this location did not disappoint. The staff are definitely pleasant, the drinks are excellent and they are super generous with toppings on drinks. I haven't ordered anything to eat from here other than a chocolate pastry, so am not sure if they serve sandwiches as in the original location. My profile picture is my cup of hot chocolate from here. Yum. Excellent place to rest after traversing the local area shopping.

34.description: Quality A for Awesome!  Finally they opened their South Loop location in the Roosevelt Collection space.  I live a few blocks away so I was ecstatic to find out they were ready and rumbling their beans...which are soooo flavorful by the way!  I am uber impressed.  It is up there with Intelligentsia and Bow Truss definitely!  I can't wait to go back now...I have a cappuccino machine at home and feel extremely guilty going out for one...but eeeerrrr it's sooooo goood! The space is uber small, I think just one window bar for seating...but most of the seating is outside, which is out of question in Chicago winter.  They have alcohol too!  And besides the usual pastries they have (some) sammiches and salads, like quinoa and other greeneries.  They said they are hoping to get more food so people can hang out there for dinner as well (and not just for bfast coffee).  Well done Bridgeport team!  Lovely shop, great service and freakishly awesome beans!

32.description: Taste just as good as the one in Bridgeport. This is more of a grab and go place rather than sitting down. They have about 5 single chairs, and 2 tables with 4 chairs in the back. This location doesn't seem to be busy at all. The settings are very modern. They do have some good desserts though, like red velvet cheese cake. It's a nice place to grab coffee and shop around. Staff here are very nice.

18.description: Location is a little tricky, but coffee and service was great!

13.description: Great coffee (I got an iced coffee). More of a good review for the service, though. The woman who helped me at the register was exceptionally kind and dealt with a difficult customer who'd come right before me in an admirable way.

4.description: European Cafe as they have booze available - only one in town!  Pray that Bridgeport Coffee is open when you are in the area -- as its the only decent place in the hood before a movie.ROOIBOS CHAI LATTE -- house blend that is naturally sweetened by honey.  Unique - one and only in town.  And, the one and only coffee house to offer 2 kinds of Chai (one is the standardized Masala Chai).  Flavor needs to be stronger for an edge above milk.DESSERTS -- an impressive selection.  My kind of desserts.CRESCENT -- perfect for a light, petite dessert.  COFFEE -- standardized drinks list.  Availability of Bridgeport Coffee by the pound that is synonymous with Bridgeport landmarks.  Yay!  Go Bridgeport.ALCOHOLIC DRINKS -- cider, lite beer, beer, and chilled white wine.  Woo hoo!  Impress.VENUE -- small but maximized space.  Clean.  Organized.  Nicely and comfortably decorated.STAFF -- very pleasant and informative.  You can chat with them forever about Le Menu.

24.description: My girlfriend and I enjoyed our experience at Bridgeport Coffee.  I liked being able to have a glass of wine while she enjoyed a coffee. I also liked the outdoor seating.  I'm certain to stop by again while shopping at RC.

6.description: Pass. Great dessert/non-existing service. I asked (half an hour before closing) for a plate and a cup. "We've already washed the dishes". "Can I have a fork?" She grabs the fork with her by the points and hands it to me. That's after I already tipped 20%. Blank stare.

22.description: I came here before my movie started.Service- very friendly. And not busy during the day. Price- Costed $10 for latte and cake.Taste- I really didn't like their cake. The latte tastes just ok. Also, I was expected them to pour latte art..they didn't.Wifi- yes, the plaza has freewifi.

15.description: My latte was awful! I ordered a vanilla latte, they initially forgot the vanilla flavoring and the latte tasted scorched. I went back, and instead of making a new latte, they just opened the drink up and pumped in the vanilla flavoring. Never going back here. Back to Starbucks for me!

7.description: This place is in the center of the plaza on Roosevelt. It's more modern than it's other coffee shop located in Bridgeport. It's still cute and intimate but strays away from it's brand image. Maybe it is because it is amongst other modern stores and their are regulations. However, I go to the Bridgeport coffee shop mainly for it's environment, not coffee. That's why I think this place is simply alright.

36.description: It's really hard to pull off consistency of quality in product when you have multiple locations.  But Mike Pilkington has done it again!  Fantastic location with a beautiful outdoor patio.  Store design is very clean and flows well into the plaza and the elevators to the parking garage.  This a grab and go location not a sit and chill location.  Wonderful new pastries and sandwiches to take into the movie theater.  Best of all the espresso was fantastic!  Got a vanilla latte and it was very smooth and delicious!  Congrats on another location!

30.description: This place rocks.  The cafe menu is super straight-forward and drinks come in one size.  Maybe it's just me, but sometimes I hate deciding whether I want a tall or grande (or a small or medium), and I don't have to worry about it here!I love their lattes here, on the stronger side, but I like it that way.  It's definitely more of a to-go kinda place since there is limited seating inside, but there is no shortage of outside seating considering it's in the Roosevelt Collection plaza.  It's also really relaxing on a nice spring/summer day.FYI, they also serve wine here!  Espresso and wine... I don't know about you, but those are two of my favorite things.

3.description: Bridgeport Coffee located in the Roosevelt Collection Shops is the lone, tiny coffee shop among the stores located in the court. It has three small, two seater tables in the rear and a row of seating in front of the cashier counter. They have an assortment of coffees, soft drinks and sweets if you're craving a caffeine or sugar fix as you shop. If you don't feel like paying the high movie theater concession prices for bottled drinks, this will be the only place in the court where you can purchase and sneak something in. :)

14.description: we ordered cappuccino from this location prior to a movie and it was very bitter. We also ordered their mini cheesecake and it was too sweet.

1.description: Evenita is a true professional. I received one of her cards and decided to take advantage of her new client special for a full set of lashes. The location is very convenient I arrived a bit early to my appointment so I had some time to do a little bit of shopping at Target and H&M. When walking into her suite there is a nice modern reception area. Evenita offered me some tea/coffee/water before starting. She asked me what type of music I wanted to listen to while she completed my lashes I opted for smooth jazz and it put me right to sleep! When she was done she gave my a brush to maintain my lashes. I love my lashes as they look very natural. I will definitely come back to Renway for my fill in a few weeks.

2.description: Love Evenita and her work. She's definitely a lady boss and very personable. My lashes always look amazing. She's big on making her clients comfortable and relaxed throughout the whole process. Would highly recommend and can't wait to come back for my fill!

0.description: It was my first time getting eyelash extensions and I'm so happy that I did! Evanita makes you feel very comfortable.  It takes about an hour and a half to get a full set done. Plus her prices are very reasonable.

58.description: This place is great. We came here on a Monday night after softball, starving none the less, and when we walked in the hostess told us the kitchen was closed but then the Manager overheard and came over to tell us that he'd keep it open to let us order which we thought was extremely nice. Our waitress was so nice and very attentive. The facilities were clean and I loved the TV's in each booth. We will definitely be going back and recommending to our friends!

56.description: This place is ok. I think I ordered the wrong menu item. Not a fan of their italian beef sandwich. It was dry and lacked flavor. They do have a ton of TVs so the place is great for watching games. They have a good drink list as well so not a bad place to meet up with friends.

29.description: Ordered delivery. Food was lukewarm upon arrival. Spent $50 for a salad and two entrees. Way over-priced for the quality. The salad was skimpy and lackluster. Calamari was overly sauced and soggy. Steak sandwich was tough. Delivery was made in a reasonable time frame. That's the only reason for the third star. Also I think I'm giving three stars because we were really really hungry and hunger was satisfied, but taste and overall quality was meh. From what I hear they have a decent beer selection. Maybe dining at the restaurant would provide a more positive experience like hot food would be nice. Again: over-priced!

42.description: It's just alright. Nothing to make me want to go back, actually. Ordered chicken tenders and they got the sauces wrong, then took the corrected ones away before I was done while I was talking to my companion. Steak quesadillas weren't anything memorable.

23.description: This place has great lunch deals at $6.95 which includes a sandwich and waffle fries. The menu also offers good daily specials and happy hour specials. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and also seats inside next to their huge open windows that makes you feel like you're outdoors. We were very comfortable sitting inside by the open windows.  Its a great place to catch a game because they have a ton of TVs here.  Service was great and they even allowed us to have separate checks when we needed to pay.   Its easy to get here because its close to the Harrison stop.  We'll be back!!!

47.description: Something's going on here...and it's good. Pros, and they are big pros: The menu has changed a few times and only for the better. The staples are the same but the fresh-ingredient items seem to have been upgraded, such as the mini tacos (order the steak). Delicious before, even better now. In the summer it's a great place to people- watch from the bright windows. Cons: the "fresh" herbs outside seem like ashtrays for passers-by at night. Also I avoid the place during football or basketball season because I'm not into sports. I can usually hear who's winning from my condo window. But hey, if that's your thing, it's great!

8.description: Here for the Jumbo Bloody Mary!  The place was nice service very attentive.  The jumbo bloody was fabulous.  Our food was pretty good.  As a sports bar it was very good mostly NASCAR which isn't our thing, but a nice walk to Soldiers Field.  Good meet upPlace before the Bears Game, close to subway line

31.description: I love a great neighborhood place, where the food is great and the service always wonderful. Jeff (the owner) is always there, so you know it's running smooth. He will do anything he can to accommodate you. They have some of the best burgers around and the nachos are enough for a circus and loaded with goodness. You can watch any game here, including UCF and Boxing specials. Try it and like anytime you get service, tip the people that work hard at least 20%. Otherwise, don't go to places where employees work for tips.

34.description: Great food, great drinks fun trivia nights. What more can you ask for. I come here often with a group of friends and we usually sit at the bar. Service is good, food is really good (for bar food) and they have a lot of drinks on tap. I would recommend this place to watch a good game or for a fun brunch.

16.description: Yep . . .it's a sports bar.  But all in all, it's a pretty good one with bartenders that are quick with a quip, plenty of TV's to watch your favorite games and a menu full of bar favorites that will surely satisfy anyone in your group.I also liked that the bartenders will put on whatever game you want as long as your "neighbors" don't seem to mind and for my Lions lovin' friend, this was a huge plus!They have a pretty extensive beer list but pour a decent drink as well.As for the food- my burger was good and the fries hot and tender (hard to make fries bad!).  And the regulars are a friendly crowd happy to welcome you into their fold as they scream at their favorite teams!If you drive, I usually have no problem finding street parking around here unless there is a Bears game going on.All in all- a pretty good sports bar . . .but look for it.  As it's unassuming front on a busy street could have you going right on by.

13.description: I've dined at Jimmy Green's for lunch twice in the past 3 weeks and I must say that I pleasantly surprised with my experience both times! The food was great and the service was pretty good. My reason for 4 stars is that I had to ask for my water to be refilled both times that I was there. It seemed like honest mistakes because other aspects of the service were wonderful.I had $6.95 lunch specials on both occasions. To be honest, I expected the food to be mediocre at best for a price like that, but they proved me wrong.....lol. On my first visit I had a beef burger with tator tots. My burger was prepared exactly as I ordered it and their sandwiches are served on brioche buns......which I love! Brioche and I have a love hate relationship.....I love to eat it, but I hate the calories. The tator tots were perfect. They were hot and just crispy enough, without being overcooked......again, perfect!On my 2nd visit, I had the lunch Cajun tilapia sandwich, which was soooo good. The seasoning definitely had a little kick to it, hence the word "Cajun", but it's not too bad. The sandwich had a large portion of tilapia and it was yummy!!I like the decor and the televisions. I didn't miss a second of the World Cup and it wasn't too crowded either time that I went. They have typical sports bar type seating with booths, tables, and high tops inside and they have a few outdoor tables as well. I will definitely visit Jimmy Green's again and recommend them if you're looking for some good bar food.

11.description: Stopped in here for lunch before the gym cause I thought it was a salad bar.. Ended up being just a bar with normal bar food.. My burger was below average and my onion rings came out raw with batter still inside so had to send then back.. I feel like some other stuff on the menu would be good and the inside actually looks pretty cool... Bet It's a fun place to watch any game.. Need to stop by again maybe they were just having an off day.  My friend said the tacos were okay..

39.description: Jimmy Green's is a sure bet for great food and drinks. My husband and I were there yesterday for brunch. He had a fabulous giant Bloody Mary. We started our meal with some loaded waffle fries (which I had been craving for quite some time) and this appetizer portion was very generous and well served. I ordered the grilled cheese with tomato sauce and my husband ordered the steak sandwich. Both were delicious! Quite a nice way to get the day going :)

37.description: Went on a Friday night, around 11ish. It wasn't very busy, but wasn't dead either. I sat at the bar for 25 minutes and flagged down multiple bartenders and servers before I got service. They seem to have 3 barbacks carrying boxes per every server. After I finally ordered I waited another 15 minutes for my beer, but it never showed, so left. The place looked new and clean, but had stupid club music playing. It looks like an okay place to catch a game, or maybe grab food, but I would never go again on a weekend. Just go down the street to one of the other bars. Wabash Tap is 5X busier, and cranks out drinks like it's nothing.

0.description: Visiting from New York, and wanted to find a sports bar that had good food. Was so surprised , when I found Jimmy Greens.The shaved beef sandwich was out of this world. Service was phenomenal. And they had the mets game on the whole time.As a bonus , it was Trivia night and added a little extra fun to the experience .

38.description: My friends and I come here weekly to play trivia at 8 on Wednesdays. The beer list is impressive, but they often run out of the seasonal drinks. They have La Fin Du Monde, though (a personal favorite), so I'm pretty much always happy. The food isn't anything to write home about, but the specials are decent--$6 for a bowl of act and cheese (which is sometimes dry, and other times cheesy) and $4 for the Jimmy Green Lager on Wednesdays, which is hard to beat downtown. There are always a bunch of TVs with any number of games on, so if we weren't going for trivia, this would be a decent place to catch the Blackhawks, Cubs, Sox, or Bulls (I presume they show Bears games, too, but I've only ever been here on Wednesday nights, so I can't be sure).

51.description: For a sports bar, this place is a pretty nice option. They have multiple TVs in different areas of this bar, and their menu is pretty big with lots of daily specials. I wouldn't say their food is the best in the world, and I wouldn't say their beer selection is huge either, but for a sports bar in the printers row area of the south loop, this place is a fun spot to meet up for drinks. We come here for trivia on Wednesdays which is always a good time, but this place actually gets a fair amount of weeknight business so people make reservations for tables here on trivia night in particular, so just a word to the wise if you are venturing here on a Wednesday ever! The servers are also pretty on top of things with fast service, and you will always get IDed here too. But their Wednesday $6 mac and cheese special isn't too bad and their nachos which I have yet to order are one of the largest things I have ever seen!! So clearly you can come here with an appetite and not spend too much, and they even have their own jimmy green lager which is decent for a cheaper lager.

27.description: Solid drink selection. Small food portions. Good place to kill time while waiting for Malnati's. The teriyaki calamari is 90% batter.

32.description: If you're looking for a great place to watch sports or just hang out with some friends or even make new ones like I did, Jimmy Green's is the place. I had never been and the owner, Jeff, intro'd himself and made this out of town visitor feel like he found his "local". Come on in and be a local.

54.description: The atmosphere is great for watching a football game and the bar is awesome with great beers on tap.  The food is pretty good and the service was pretty bad.  Our server was extremely friendly, but running around like a chicken with her head cut off.  She had too many tables spread outside and throughout the entire restaurant, I think she was loosing it.  (Actually, I know she was loosing it because she reminded us several times that "this day cannot get any worse" and this day was her "fourth day working a double" as if that makes up for the 2 hours of my life I spent waiting for my cheeseburger.)  I do feel bad for her though as we were dining there 2 hours before a One Direction concert and the place was creepin with 12 year old girls dressed like baby strippers.  Oh yes, one more strange thing about this place...they I.D. you at the door...like if you're 10 or 40.  Like I said, there were baby stripper tweenagers in there so it's not like you had to be 21...I just don't get it?

48.description: I stopped by for a weekday lunch and wow! Was I glad I stopped at Jimmy's! The food was excellent. We both ordered burgers, cooked to perfection. I love to try new beers as often as I can and Jimmy's has a great list of brews available. Our server Jackie was so friendly and on top of her game. I will definitely be back!

44.description: Despite how crowded this place was for a Saturday night the staff took great care of us! They were fast, friendly and provided us with great customer service!

24.description: They have really good bar food. Drinks are yum. Servers are okay. Hostess kept carding me back to back which was highly irritating. It was as if she didn't believe my ID was real. Televisions all around so you never miss a play! Right off the red line so convenient!

7.description: Great spot for Sunday Ticket jam session. Def go for the 22oz Jumbo Bloody Mary with a Chicago hotdog on top.  The Italian beef was tasty with tots.

49.description: We had a great time watching college football all night while having some great beers and food.  The waitress, Emma, was a super great sport and did a great job on her 3rd day.  One girl spent half the night changing tv channels for us.  She even found the Memphis - Old Miss game.  They have TVs everywhere.  It's pretty loud but that's a sports bar.

40.description: Love this place. Laid back atmosphere and "JoNel" was awesome and fun to talk to. They have tons of craft beers and my steak sandwich was pretty bomb. I'd def go like 3 times a week if I lived here. That'd be trouble.

53.description: Good food, nice beer list, and EXCELLENT customer service! We went there as part of a Meetup group to watch the Bears game. It was a last-minute venue change because the owner at The Scout changed his mind about separate checks and cancelled our table reservation (at 11 pm Saturday night before a noon Sunday game). The organizer had to scramble around to find another place for 20 hungry, thirsty Bears fans. The owner was very accommodating, the wait staff was friendly and didn't complain about separate checks, and everyone had a great time (except for the final score of the Bears game, but that was out of their control, LOL!)I'm also a co-organizer of a Blackhawks Meetup group, and I always have trouble finding venues because bar owners don't seem to understand how Meetup groups work. Meetup groups sit together and cheer together, but that doesn't mean we're all "together." Most of the time, I've never met half the people who show up to watch a game. The last thing I want to do is put total strangers on my bill. This guy gets it! I was so impressed, I asked the owner for a business card and I will be scheduling a Blackhawks meetup there very soon. We will not be having any events at The Scout until they wise up and change their policy.

30.description: I like this place: solid food, good variety of food, pretty good bloody Mary's complete with a mini Chicago style hot dog, probably the best looking female servers/bartenders in the area (not that there is much competition but they do have some nice looking women, solid selection of games to watch football, and like the bar area a lot. Prices are, consistent with the area, too high to go there all the time...we need a real neighborhood bar.

46.description: Reserved a booth table (with the tv)  on Saturday night expecting that the blackhawks game would take precedence over college football and we were very wrong.  After asking three separate workers if the game would be switched, we spoke to the manager who informed us that more people were there to watch football even though they are an "official" blackhawks bar. Our drinks and food ended up being comped (even though that was not our intention) so we stayed to finish our burgers. They were very tasty. The smokehouse burger paired well with the waffle fries. We really wanted to order the nachos but went with sandwiches instead. I would recommend this place to anyone who appreciates a variety of food and beer but would suggest avoiding college football Saturdays if you're planing on watching a different game.

1.description: After seeing an interesting menu and nice pictures of food on Yelp, I was excited to go to Jimmy Green's... expecting a unique bar experience and above average food. Unfortunately, I ran into slow service, wrong orders, and unspired food.Given the relatively high prices of food, I was expecting to see decently large portions and above average ingredients. Instead, the food was plated well but small for what you normally expect for a bar and not good enough quality to justify a smaller size. The best part of the meal was the drinks, revolution tea and south loop lager -- which is what I probably should've stuck with having instead of trying the food.I went here for brunch on Sunday and the best item I had was the breakfast burrito, with a slightly crispy tortilla and a good mix of asiago and white cheddar cheeses with the ham.The Tavern Style Fish N Chips was probably the most disappointing. The cod flavor was barely noticable, the batter was more hard than fluffy, and the fish was slightly tough and a bit dry. The parmeasean on the waffle fries was so light I could barely percieve it.The Italian Beef did not have much meat or flavor on it and was very dry (the sauce being almost necessary). The onion rings that accompanied it (only a handful even with an upcharge to get it as a side) did not have any sweetness to them.The grilled steak sandwich was pretty tough, almost like beef jerky, with a very light flavor despite grilled onions, cheese, and mushrooms being added to the sandwich. The cream of brocolli soup that came with it had a very thick consistency and lacked the pleasant texture of creaminess or earthy flavor of brocolli I would expect.The Walk of Shame was an okay burger, not as flavorful or as juicy as other similar burgers I've had in Chicago. Once again, a bit overcooked on the meat but the tater tots were decently crispy.Overall, I like the menu and the concept of this restaurant -- but the service and food execution could be improved to provide a better experience.

55.description: Jimmy Green's is a solid choice when dining in the Loop. The food is always good. The drinks are standard and average, except for the massive Bloody Mary which comes with a Chicago hot dog set on top of it. Amazing.

9.description: i've been here before and thought it was decent but last night was awful! the food was just so so...don't get the pizza..... we sat at the bar and the service from the bartender was horrific. we had to ask for everything.  she didn't check on us once. we continually had to flag her down, for another drink, the pepper, etc. too many other good places. don't bother here.

26.description: This is a great place to watch a game, have a drink and grab a yummy bite to eat.  Upscale bar food with a menu that continues to improve with seasonal additions and specials.  Burgers are hand made, seasoned, and cooked to order.  How nice to actually get a burger that is overcooked, dried out, and tasteless for a change!  I have had great service the times I have been in so far and will return again I am sure.

25.description: Great bartender.  Chicken wings were good and had some fast finishing heat.  Steak sub was okay ... It was a little fatty.   Good prices.

12.description: This place has great lunch deals at $6.95 which includes a sandwich and waffle fries. The menu also offers good daily specials and happy hour specials. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and also seats inside next to their huge open windows that makes you feel like you're outdoors. We were very comfortable sitting inside by the open windows.  Its a great place to catch a game because they have a ton of TVs here.  Service was great and they even allowed us to have separate checks when we needed to pay.   Its easy to get here because its close to the Harrison stop.  We'll be back!!!

59.description: Service was super slow and they never brought my water.  The wings were really good and the bleu cheese dressing was really chunky.  Overall, just really average though.

21.description: Let's see....Our server needed some "support" in many ways...A small group of us came to have some beverages and a bite while watching the hockey game....2 beers and a water was confusing and some how got "messed up" by the bar.Another server jumped in and took over while our original one giggled and laughed her way through a table of all men.

17.description: It looks like they raised the prices on the nachos, they used to be a good deal but are now overpriced. One thing that annoys me about this place is their condiment rationing. When you order a burger, you have to ask for mustard. And for the fries, they give you a little cup with about two tablespoons of ketchup for your fries. Today I ordered a brunch omelette with toast that came with one small frozen butter single serving container and no jelly. I don't know why they are Grinches with the condiments, but it's gotten really annoying to me.

10.description: LOVE IT HERE! Especially $4.95 burger day (Tuesday).  It's my go to for fight night.  Tons of options, healthy and not so healthy.  Lots of big TVs.  Comfortable space. Good service.  Great value for food in a sports bar.

5.description: Let's see....Our server needed some "support" in many ways...A small group of us came to have some beverages and a bite while watching the hockey game....2 beers and a water was confusing and some how got "messed up" by the bar.Another server jumped in and took over while our original one giggled and laughed her way through a table of all men.

3.description: This place is GARBAGE. the staff is horrible; I saw a server walk out of the bathroom without washing her hands! the last time I was there my server was evidently drinking on the job and totally incapacitated to take my order properly. moreover, the management seems atrocious, always drinking in the corner of the bar. DO NOT COME HERE. their food is garbage, the people who work here are not good servers, and this place is GARBAGE. DO NOT WASTER YOUR MONEY HERE. go down the street to South Loop Club and you'll get more drinks, food, and better company for your buck.

35.description: Stopped in here for lunch before the gym cause I thought it was a salad bar.. Ended up being just a bar with normal bar food.. My burger was below average and my onion rings came out raw with batter still inside so had to send then back.. I feel like some other stuff on the menu would be good and the inside actually looks pretty cool... Bet It's a fun place to watch any game.. Need to stop by again maybe they were just having an off day.  My friend said the tacos were okay..

19.description: Love Jimmy greens!! Food is always good, bartenders and waitstaff are always friendly and there are always seats at the bar! Great wings, beer list, and italian beef is quite tasty as well. It is more like a french dip but it is still good. The appetizer platter is huge and definitely worth the money.

28.description: It was a standard place to eat and grab some food. They don't mess around with their bloody Mary's though. I would recommend them and would come back to get another. Be careful if you're anything but a Blackhawks fan (after all, you are in Chicago).

45.description: I have been here twice now, once for brunch with my 3 year old and twice for dinner.  All three times, service was ridiculous.  For brunch, my daughter and I sat for 19 minutes before a server came...and I was one of three tables in the entire place.  The hostess was too busy eating and checking Twitter, the bar tender busy telling another patron how hungover they were and another server...well, doing nothing.  I ordered the special from their brunch menu...it was out of stock.  I really wanted this place to be good because I live in the neighborhood.  Three bad experiences I think is enough of a sample size to not go back.

33.description: Ordered the salmon sandwich and parmesan waffle fries for delivery last night. Within 40 minutes my delivery showed up. NICE! I was at work so of course as soon as I sat down to eat I got called to do something "right now". After about 20 minutes I was digging in to my dinner. First the fries, tasty, the waffling holds the parmesan seasoning perfectly. My only complaint is they were soft, not crisp, but that was my fault by letting them set for 20 minutes. The salmon sandwich was also outstanding, I love the pretzel roll it comes on but again, soggy due to work getting in the way. I read a review stating the restaurant has a good selection of craft beer so next time I'm heading to the bar. As far as delivery again, not by myself  I'll need to get a few others to join me, the extra $5.00 for delivery and the tip make it a little too spendy, but my growling stomach convinced my brain to go for it. Definitely recommend.

43.description: Yep . . .it's a sports bar.  But all in all, it's a pretty good one with bartenders that are quick with a quip, plenty of TV's to watch your favorite games and a menu full of bar favorites that will surely satisfy anyone in your group.I also liked that the bartenders will put on whatever game you want as long as your "neighbors" don't seem to mind and for my Lions lovin' friend, this was a huge plus!They have a pretty extensive beer list but pour a decent drink as well.As for the food- my burger was good and the fries hot and tender (hard to make fries bad!).  And the regulars are a friendly crowd happy to welcome you into their fold as they scream at their favorite teams!If you drive, I usually have no problem finding street parking around here unless there is a Bears game going on.All in all- a pretty good sports bar . . .but look for it.  As it's unassuming front on a busy street could have you going right on by.

2.description: I've been here quite a few times over the past three years visiting Chicago. The bar typically has good, sensibly priced beer. The reason for 3 stars (wish I could do 2 1/2) instead of 4 is because of the menu selection and owner.

18.description: My friends and I come here weekly to play trivia at 8 on Wednesdays. The beer list is impressive, but they often run out of the seasonal drinks. They have La Fin Du Monde, though (a personal favorite), so I'm pretty much always happy. The food isn't anything to write home about, but the specials are decent--$6 for a bowl of act and cheese (which is sometimes dry, and other times cheesy) and $4 for the Jimmy Green Lager on Wednesdays, which is hard to beat downtown. There are always a bunch of TVs with any number of games on, so if we weren't going for trivia, this would be a decent place to catch the Blackhawks, Cubs, Sox, or Bulls (I presume they show Bears games, too, but I've only ever been here on Wednesday nights, so I can't be sure).

41.description: I always enjoy coming to Jimmy Greens for sporting events. Lots of TVs, quick service, good food, and they always have food and drink specials, which I love! Definitely my go-to local hang out in the South Loop. Get the Gringo burger, one of my favs if you like spicy!

52.description: Great food. Amazing beer selection. Fantastic service. This bar has it all.  Our server Joanna was attentive, but not intrusive, and really friendly. This will be my home bar seeing as I live less than a block away and they have everything I need and want (Direct TV NFL Ticket)

50.description: Accidental find while on a business trip.  Highly, highly, HIGHLY recommend!  Wish I could remember our server's name so I could thank her personally.  She was perfect! (I think it was around lunch time on 09/06... we sat in a back booth :)  ).  I'm not a nachos fan, but my friend is, and I'll be danged if those weren't the FRESHEST, tastiest nachos I've ever had!  And the Bloody Mary's... what can I say?  Didn't need to order the nachos, as the drink, and all it's accoutrements, was a meal in itself!  Gotta love Chicago  :-)

4.description: If u enjoy female servers with Irish accents and so many tvs u can hardly think this place is for you.But if u want amazing nachos, go to scout(Where they don't charge for each iced tea refill)

6.description: This is one of my go-to spots in the south loop, especially when I'm trying to catch a hawks game. They have tons of tvs, great food specials, some games, and really great mixed drinks. You have to try the pineapple upside down shot - it's heaven. It's usually a pretty lively atmosphere, but it can get a little loud, so maybe not the best place for an intimate night out, but definitely a great place to root for your favorite chicago team.

22.description: Here for the Jumbo Bloody Mary!  The place was nice service very attentive.  The jumbo bloody was fabulous.  Our food was pretty good.  As a sports bar it was very good mostly NASCAR which isn't our thing, but a nice walk to Soldiers Field.  Good meet upPlace before the Bears Game, close to subway line

15.description: Love coming here to watch UFC fights and drink beer. I'll have to come here to actually try the food but that day will come.

57.description: Awesome place. Watched the UFC fight here. Great hosts, good beer and wonderful food.

20.description: After seeing an interesting menu and nice pictures of food on Yelp, I was excited to go to Jimmy Green's... expecting a unique bar experience and above average food. Unfortunately, I ran into slow service, wrong orders, and unspired food.Given the relatively high prices of food, I was expecting to see decently large portions and above average ingredients. Instead, the food was plated well but small for what you normally expect for a bar and not good enough quality to justify a smaller size. The best part of the meal was the drinks, revolution tea and south loop lager -- which is what I probably should've stuck with having instead of trying the food.I went here for brunch on Sunday and the best item I had was the breakfast burrito, with a slightly crispy tortilla and a good mix of asiago and white cheddar cheeses with the ham.The Tavern Style Fish N Chips was probably the most disappointing. The cod flavor was barely noticable, the batter was more hard than fluffy, and the fish was slightly tough and a bit dry. The parmeasean on the waffle fries was so light I could barely percieve it.The Italian Beef did not have much meat or flavor on it and was very dry (the sauce being almost necessary). The onion rings that accompanied it (only a handful even with an upcharge to get it as a side) did not have any sweetness to them.The grilled steak sandwich was pretty tough, almost like beef jerky, with a very light flavor despite grilled onions, cheese, and mushrooms being added to the sandwich. The cream of brocolli soup that came with it had a very thick consistency and lacked the pleasant texture of creaminess or earthy flavor of brocolli I would expect.The Walk of Shame was an okay burger, not as flavorful or as juicy as other similar burgers I've had in Chicago. Once again, a bit overcooked on the meat but the tater tots were decently crispy.Overall, I like the menu and the concept of this restaurant -- but the service and food execution could be improved to provide a better experience.

36.description: I went here last year during the World Cup. I went out on a long lunch to watch a game with a couple of coworkers. I got a simple hot dog and chili. My coworkers got burgers. The things I got were good, not greasy or anything. The atmosphere was great. A lot of people were on their lunch break for the World Cup too. It wasn't too packed; the perfect amount of people were there. The waitress was kind and sweet too. I think this is a great place to watch sports games. There's a sense of comradery when your national soccer team is going against other countries.

14.description: Visiting from out of town. Expected an enthusiastic Friday night crowd. Was disappointed. Pretty dead. The cocktail waitress was really nice and attentive. But they threw up the chairs 35 minutes before closing which made us feel like we weren't welcome at 1:15 am which was 45 minutes before they close. Overall underwhelmed.

58.description: I've been here before and had a fairly good experience, but I unsuccessfully tried to get my eyebrows done here twice this past week, which prompted me to write this review. Earlier in the week, I walked in at 6:30 and was turned away because there were two people waiting. Now, I'm no threading novice, so I know that eyebrows/upper lip combined take under 10 minutes each, but I leave anyway. Today, I called ahead and was told on the phone that coming at 6:30 was fine. I came in and was told it'd be a 45 minute wait. When I asked if they didn't take appointments because I'd called in earlier, I simply got a blank stare. Not sure what was up this week, but I am pretty displeased.

56.description: Helllllllo painless threading!Literally, painless!I also appreciated the fact that the woman gave me the mirror to inspect my eyebrow after she was done with the first one.  Good for no surprises, right?  She also did a mini-massage while putting moisturizer on.  Nice added bonus.$15 for upper lip and eyebrow.  Love the shape of my eyebrows...and love the pain-free threading!  Woot!

29.description: I love these ladies, they are the best!! I've been coming here for about two years to get my eyebrows done and they always do a great job.  Both ladies, Asha and Ashi (hope I spelled their names right) are very meticulous.  Highly recommend if you have sensitive skin.

42.description: Threading Plus has never let me down! My eyebrows always look amazing after leaving! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!& with a $10.00 price tag, what more could you ask for?

23.description: Love stopping in for my monthly threading! Both ladies are friendly, quick and precise.

47.description: I had never done threading before, but Asha has converted me. This location is really convenient, and they are very accommodating to walk - ins - I dont think that I've ever made an appointment. It does still hurt but the eyebrow massage after takes out a lot of the sting. The price is great, its what I was used to paying in Cleveland and I dont think there is a cheaper place or comparable quality in the area. In fact, a lot of the more expensive places I tried did not do as good of a job.

8.description: This place gave me the best eyebrows in my lifetime. I have never been to anywhere that gave me such perfect eyebrows. And I'm extremely picky. But I think only one person there is good. Have her help you with your eyebrows. I forgot her name I will update her name next time I come back

31.description: For threading, this is the BEST place in the South Loop.  The women do a fantastic job, the prices are incredibly reasonable, and the salon itself is clean and nice.  I highly recommend it.And if you drive there like me (and it's worth the drive), street parking is really easy to find.

34.description: I adore the owner! Very small, quiet, and FAST service. Best quality I have ever had for the lowest price in the south loop. I always receive compliments on my eye brows and this is the only place I will get my brows threaded.

16.description: Always a great eyebrow! They are experts and give a perfect shape. they are fast and efficient. I love coming here and do not go anywhere else. They are part of my money team!!

13.description: I've been coming here for a few years now for eyebrow threading and upper lip wax. Asha is about as sweet as they come and she takes a lot of pride in doing a great job. She has a colleague who also does a fantastic job (she snaps the thread a lot) but she always shapes my eyebrows beautifully. One time, however, she did break skin in a couple places around my eyebrow. She tends to thread a bit aggressively.

11.description: The place is great and relaxing. I have been coming here for years and have always had a great experience and service. However, I went in the other day and came out with the thinnest eyebrows in existence. I wanted to cry. It may be my fault because I did not specify but she should have asked. I figured since I'm a regular, she'll know that I like them shaped but not thin. In the past, I never had to tell them. Well I came out with pointy-clown brows. I'm not being mean. I am just so sad. Now, it will take another year to grow out my brows. I already have awful brows naturally. I ran to Sephora to get the brow wiz. I cannot even look in the mirror and feel comfortable without brow makeup for these brows. They are nice and clean but they are so thin and pointy! Moral: do not assume... Try to be as specific as possible. I will now cry and find somewhere else to go. Giving them 2 stars makes me so unbelievably sad... Update: after filling in my brows, they are not too bad. I'm still sad but they look nice with make-up.

39.description: I love this place. my brows come out great every time.

37.description: This place is so unbelievably close to where I live, I couldn't resist.I used to live in India as a kid and my mom discovered threading when we lived there and never looked back. So, naturally I had to give it a try.I've been in there twice and the first woman did a much better job threading my eyebrows than the second. I guess it all depends who's working that day. Both were very soft spoken and very swift. They will massage lotion into your eye area and temples as well, free of charge.$10 well spent.

0.description: While I always (and only) went to a middle eastern woman in the suburbs, I had to find a place in the city closer to me.  I am extremely picky and don't let anyone touch my eyebrows, so this was a huge step.  I took a leap of faith and had a woman named Ashi do them for me.  She was extremely quick, only used thread (no tweezers), and had my eyebrows looking perfect- sharp as ever and did not thin them out.  So glad I discovered this place!

38.description: Threading Plus is close by and they service waxing,  threading, facials, etc... I decided to try it out because the place had good reviews on Yelp. Since I've heard threading is better than waxing, I decided to go with threading this time around. I arrived when they opened on Saturday at 11am. Two other people were already waiting patiently inside. The two ladies working were very nice, soft spoken, and knew what they were doing. Once I was seated, I told her I just needed my eyebrows threading and away she went-- threading the brows. The woman took her time and trimmed my brows with scissors. Overall I had a good experience and my eyebrows look great (not too thin and not too thick). They are reasonably priced - $10 for a thread job. I will be back!

51.description: I tried Threading Plus out yesterday as my regular place in Rogers Park is closed for renovations. I live in South Loop but I'm very picky about my eyebrows and don't like to try new places. Since they were starting to look out of control I looked on Yelp and found Threading Plus which is a mile from me with excellent reviews.Since I read in the reviews about wait times I called to find out how busy there were hoping there weren't since they'd just opened at 11. A woman told me there wasn't a long wait so I rushed over. There was one person in the chair before me which was great. The woman took her time and trimmed by brows with scissors which I loved ( not many places do that). Overall I had a good experience and my eyebrows look great ( not as good as my normal place but close). They are reasonably priced as well. I will come here again.

27.description: I have been threading my eyebrows since the past 15 years and I am very particular about it. Heard about this place from a friend and since it was close to home decided to give it a try.Loved the clean minimalistic decor and the fact that they accept walk ins. I had my brows done so well and to my liking that I have been going to them for the past 1.5 years. Asha, Ashi and Farzana are all super sweet women and extremely pleasant to talk to. I have never had to wait for more than 15 minutes. All the three ladies are fast, efficient and take pleasure in making sure you leave looking good.Highly recommended !!

32.description: Horrible service. The owner was less than polite and ripped my skin at two different spots. It still burns after almost half a day of getting it done. Felt like she was in a big hurry. Not enough time to even clean after threading. There were still a few strands left which I had to come home and use tweezers to remove. I usually go to Devon street where the ladies are polite with warm smiles. More than anything I never walked out of Devon st place with bloody spots around my brows. And I have been going there for 4 months now. This place is just disappointing.

54.description: Love this place. It's a little more pricy than the burbs but well worth the couple bucks considering what an amazing job Asha does. She is very patient and accommodating. The first time I went to her I asked her to keep my brows thick and she was so sweet she didn't have the heart to tell me I don't have "thick" brows so instead she did her best to keep them thick, showed me a mirror and when I wasn't pleased she explained what she would recommend and then proceeded. I honestly have never been so pleased with a threading experience in a professional salon. My eye brows looked perfect!

48.description: This is the best place in the South Loop for eyebrows. Customer service is always great and they also do a great job. There's also parking in the rear. I've been coming here for 2 years and I have never been disappointed. I won't go anywhere else.

44.description: Best place to have your eyebrows threaded!

24.description: Love this place. They listen to exactly what you want and never take too much off! I've never waited more than 10 minutes to get my brows done. Very professional and far and away the best place in the city for the price.

7.description: After reading all the positive reviews, I went in one day for threading for my eyebrows. I was shocked that the lady I was with did not ask me how I want my eyebrows after she asked me to just lay down and about to get started. I like mine curvy not too thin, but they usually assume you want yours done archy/pointy and thin. I explained to the lady I wanted a curvy shape but I don't think she knows what that means...and I showed her with my fingers drawing on my palm (she even asked for help from another coworker for translation). After she was done, she gave me the mirror, but the shape wasn't exactly what I was looking for but was acceptable. She missed a lot of hair here and there that were pretty obvious and I had to tell her. But one thing that anger me was that she started cutting my eyebrows after she was done WITHOUT asking me! A big no-no because for my brows, cutting it makes it grow back thicker (which makes some of my eyebrow hair pointing in odd directions uncontrollably).It was definitely disappointing. I usually go to a salon in Lakeview but that's really far from my house right now but might reconsider, at least I'm confident that they know what I want. Thank god I have a thick eyebrows or else it would have been a bigger risk of having my eyebrows done not the way I wanted it.

49.description: Super gentle and a perfect eyebrow threading! I just moved here from Los Angeles and I was wondering where I was going to go for threading in Chicago. I yelped this place and was truly satisfied! Its also a great price for the service.

40.description: This place is amazing!! especially if you want your eyebrows threaded or waxed! i recommend Asha (the owner) for the job if you are doing the first time ever! She listens to you patiently and does a great job! almost painless! They accept credit cards which is nice. The waxing service is one of the best and they are very reasonably priced! I love how they do it quick and yet efficient!

53.description: Threading Plus is fantastic! Asha took care of my eyebrows with such careful precision. She did a wonderful job shaping my eyebrows. I can't wait to tell my friends!

30.description: I live up the street so I decided to give the place a try.  I was able to get an appointment for eyebrow threading immediately and was back home in about 20 minutes.  The service was very fast and very thorough.  My threader gave me exactly what I asked for and also understood how to work with my natural eyebrow shape and curly hairs. The establishment is clean and quiet and the staff is very courteous. This will definitely be my regular eyebrow threading place.  I'm so impressed I'm going to try out their waxing services next.

46.description: Best threading ever!  The owner is the only person who keeps my eyebrows from sprouting up to 2 weeks after a visit!  The shape is perfect too and she accepts credit cards.  Try to come during the week, I heard the weekend is busy!

1.description: Not sold on this place. There was no wait as I was the only person there but my eyebrows were just ok. I've had better. I only went here because my regular place closed down. Price is good for the South Loop at $10 though.

55.description: The only reason that I didn't give this five stars is because the wait was a very long.  I had to wait about 45 minutes, there were two people ahead of me.  One person was in the chair getting their eyebrows done and the next person got a full body threading/waxing so I guess this explains the wait.This is the most even my eyebrows have been since I started threading.  She was very precise and when I asked her to do something and she didn't agree, she explained to me the reason why.  I will definitely return but will more than likely try to make an appointment or come when they are opening or closing.I stumbled on this place via Yelp, I use to get mine done on Taylor Street but the young lady left and I wasn't satisfied with the other operators in the salon, you know how when you find someone that can do them how you like them, its hard to go to some place else.  I'm glad I came on here and found this salon, I will definitely return in two weeks.

9.description: Love this place, & my eye brow game slays.

26.description: Went here for the first time and loved it! I prefer eyebrow threading to waxing, and they did a great job. Called ahead and got right in, but you can just walk in too. Clean facility and very reasonable prices, will definitely be back!

25.description: The ladies at Threading Plus have been keeping my eyebrows neat for ages now.  Its quick, easy, and I've always been pleased with the results.  I usually do a walk in when my eyebrows need it and rarely wait more then 10 minutes. Totally worth it!

12.description: I just left Threading Plus after my second experience with them - the first time, I gave four stars and called them "Friendly, efficient, worth the price." My eyebrows had needed cleaning up the first time, and they did a fine job, leaving hair to grow in, as had I specifically said that I was trying to fill in formerly too-thin brows. When I came back today, I again told the woman threading me that I wanted to just clean them up, not touch the shape or the thickness. I was very, very clear. Unfortunately, my eyebrows are now way too thin for my liking, and have been shaped (arched) in a way that does not follow their natural shape or conform to my face. Dealing with eyebrows is mostly about listening to the customer - I have no issue with the quality of the hair removal (thread, pull, etc. fine). But I have been threaded enough times to know how to be very clear about what I want, and what not to touch. I felt she took liberties and did not listen. Worse still, when she finished, and I saw and I told her that this was not what I wanted, and that I was not pleased, and reiterated what I had said, she told me that one eyebrow was naturally thinner than the other and so she had tried to even them out, accompanying her defense with a shrug. No, no, no. Terrible customer retention plan. I will not be back - there are other places that I am willing to try rather than risk this again (before a wedding, no less).

59.description: I have my usual spot that I always go to for threading.  They didn't open on time and I didn't have time to wait until someone got there.  I Yelped to see where another place that was close and I came upon this gem of a place.It is hidden so it took me a bit to find it (it is connected to an Indian restaurant), but it was definitely worth it.  I walked right in, the owner introduced herself and went to work on my eyebrows.I have been threading for quite a few years and I am not lying, this was the BEST my eyebrows have looked ever!  She got a perfect shape and she listened when I told her that I liked my brows a little more on the thicker side.  She took her time and it was definitely worth it!Plus- it is only $10 ($5 cheaper than my usual place!) I would definitely recommend it if you like threading. Ask for the owner, she is amazing!

21.description: You tend to appreciate a  good threading experience when you have had a rough experience like I did. All of the women at the Salon Asha, Ashi and Farzana are very gentle and take their time getting the job done instead of rushing. I was so happy to have Farzana do my eyebrows today and I highly recommend them to my friends and fellow yelpers.

17.description: You tend to appreciate a  good threading experience when you have had a rough experience like I did. All of the women at the Salon Asha, Ashi and Farzana are very gentle and take their time getting the job done instead of rushing. I was so happy to have Farzana do my eyebrows today and I highly recommend them to my friends and fellow yelpers.

10.description: Having just moved to Chicago, I have been on the lookout for an eyebrow threading place and I think I may have found the one.I am really picky about my eyebrows, but these ladies really knew what they were doing. They listened to my instructions, and my eyebrows turned out great. The place is slightly expensive at $10 for eyebrows, but it is worth the quality service.
