I went in on a Saturday around 4 pm without an appointment and there was absolutely no wait. Overall, a very quick and seamless eyebrow experience. The only thing I didn't like was the location - it was a bit seedy and hard to find. If anyone else has that problem, the entrance is actually on 9th St between Plymouth and State.

5.description: This is my second time and I returned because I really liked my eyebrows on my first visit, however, this will be my last. This time I am still pleased with my eyebrows, but I noticed that prior to threading the woman's eyebrows in front of me Asha(i) used hand sanitizer as well as after me. I realized after that she didn't use it before me. In addition to threading someone else's eyebrows where many people bleed, she was also handling payment so I am now really uncomfortable with my experience. The woman before me was white and the woman after me was of Indian decent (they spoke to each other in their language). I hope it was not a racial thing and that she just forgot, but either way I will not return. Furthermore, there was a lingering urine odor which I'm assuming is due to the out of order restroom tucked away in the corner. Nonetheless it was a turn off. Did I mention I will not be returning. I'll stick to my place in the suburbs!

3.description: Absolutely RUDE! I have gone to this place a few times because it's convenient and they've done an OK job, but after my last visit, I have no plans of ever returning. They are never particularly friendly when you walk in so I don't expect a greeting, but the older lady who did my brows this day really had her foot up her butt. She was extremely rough while threading, so I yelled out in pain once she jerked my face three too many times. When it came time to pay, she tossed the pen at me to sign. I stared at her as if she had lost her mind. I then left my purse on the counter and walked out to get my OWN PEN from my car which was parked directly out front. This lady then chased me down as if I was going to leave without paying. Lady, I LEFT MY FREAKING PURSE AND WALLET INSIDE AND OUT IN THE OPEN! Obviously I was coming back inside. I got my pen, returned to sign the receipt and tossed it at her. Learn how to treat your customers. There is no reason to be rough when threading and there's NEVER  a reason to toss a pen at a customer. If you're having a crappy day then maybe you need to go home.

35.description: This place is very professional when it comes to work, I get my wax, eyebrows done here, been very happy and now a lot of my family goes there too. Ask for FARZANA when you go, she works several day and is very good at what she does, you will defiantly love how you look after she does your eyebrows.

19.description: I used to go to Threading Plus every other month or so to get my eyebrows threaded. (I've since moved, so I can't go anymore.)- $10 for eyebrow threading, which is cheaper than waxing elsewhere- the owner and staff are fast- never a long wait, even if you walk in

28.description: I really wanted to like this place. It had decent decor, and the woman working there was very friendly. The girl getting her brows done before me looked GREAT - I took this as a good sign.This was the first time I had my brows threaded, rather than waxed. I thought it was quite a bit more painful, but this wasn't what really bothered me. What really sucked was when I the woman was done and I looked in the mirror - my eyebrows were DRAMATICALLY thinner than they have ever been. The woman took a lot off the top of them, which I've always read you're not supposed to do. I'm giving them three stars because my brows have grown in pretty nicely, but I won't be returning any time soon.

45.description: Moving to Chicago was a scary ordeal for me. I was warned: scary people on buses and especially scary scary cold weather. Although this scared me a lot nothing scared me more than the thought of having to find a new place to get my facial hairs threaded. For the first three years I searched to no avail, settling for some small place on Devon Ave. run by two ladies who chattered a lot of nonsense and didn't clean the place well. I thought that was it until one day near my work I discovered Threading Plus Beauty Salon. Sure they are a small space located next to a Nepalese restaurant but theres no harm in exploring and I decided to give them a try. The place was small, yet clean with courteous people. Asha took care of me promptly and treated me well with a small conversation and caring about exactly how I wanted my brows to look, not what she recommended or thought. It was all about me but she did throw in her two cents which made me think twice about what I wanted and it turned out great. I had a few concerns she promptly took care of and now this is my little place to go to when I get all "bushy" up there.

33.description: Don't take your eyebrows anywhere else!For $10 you'll be in and out within a few minutes with perfectly sculpted brows.  I've gone elsewhere a few times (out of town or for a special) and always regretted it.You can make appointments but I normally just walk in and I've never had to wait more than 20 minutes.  At most they have two chairs running, so if you're in a hurry, you may want to call ahead.  There are two comfy couches to sit on if you have to wait.The women who work here are kind and friendly and both do an impeccable, quick job.  They'll offer you a nice little temple massage with lotion or aloe vera gel at the end, too.  I've only ever had the eyebrow threading done, so I can't speak to their other services, but I've only heard good things.Credit cards accepted, but they prefer cash for tip.

43.description: Threading Plus totally deserves an increase in clientele and I'm happy to say that this place has gotten a bit busier. Service is still absolutely great, and the outcome is lovely as always. It can be busy on the weekends, so expect to wait a bit.  Always worth it, though!

2.description: What can I say ...linsey R. Thank you I really like my eyebrows. The shop has a very warm atmosphere soon as I walked in the door. She was not in a rush so when I was giving the mirror I was like WOW.. very nice. I will be back.. :-)

18.description: Pro-rated price for threading depending on amount of work or flat rate.  The only one in town!Great free form henna design on my ankle.  No photos.  No design to copy.  Asha's joy in her work product is shown in the one-of-a-kind design.

41.description: Terrible!  I had tons of hairs still on my brows once I got home and looked in a magnifying mirror!  I saw a few in the regular mirror when she showed me and had her correct, but she didn't most of then and I had to tweeze out what I saw in the magnifying mirror at home.Also, my brows are weirdly shaped now so I have to let them "grow out" to start over.  AVOID this place.  Bummed since it's in my neighborhood and threading is hard to find.

52.description: Found a nyc threading replacement in Threading Plus.  The ladies are extremely nice and fix your brows exactly as you like.  The hours are great, open till 7pm and on Saturdays.  Will become a regular for sure.

50.description: Love, love, love this place. Clean, professional, and perfect brows. Wouldn't go anywhere else to get my brows done!

4.description: The place was okay.  As mentioned by another reviewer, it was sort of annoying that she kept on snapping the thread.  My eyebrows came out nicely but I did mention I wanted it thick but she took out more than I wanted.  All in all, it was a good first experience having just landed in Chicago.  Not bad.

6.description: Asha used to be my go-to eyebrow threading queen. I had a terrible experience with someone else a few years ago that caused me to flee however, so I honestly stopped coming here. The problem I found is that it's a hit or miss experience depending on the person, which doesn't work for me. I don't want to have to always call ahead and ask for Asha's availability. What I do like about Threading Plus is that they are open on Sundays and conveniently located to me. There's a small parking lot in the back, which I always find a spot in so I can run in and out. Basically, I only come here when I'm in a pinch.

22.description: These people are truly unprofessional and I will make sure everyone i know stop going to them.Due to the carelessness of one of the ladies she accidentally wiped my nose ring which was real diamond and gold from india onto the floor and we could not find it after looking for a very long time.  I called the owner ASHA several times she never returned my call and finally when i got a hold of her she didn't even know about this incident. I told her i felt bad as i know it was an honest mistake but after losing a $200 dollar nose ring she still made me pay for my eyebrow service-- that was super cheap and more than trying to get her money she should of tried to keep my business as i was so disappointed i will never go back. She is so CHEAP, when i told her she should try to keep my business and show a-little remorse for what happened she asked me do you know how much money it cost me to have a shop in downtown!!!! Damn stupid lady if its that expensive go back to india! I told her if and when she loses some gold and diamond she will understand my feelings. What goes around comes around she will get it back one day. UNPROFESSIONAL..... STAY AWAY!! The employees are nice but when they have an OWNER that is so cheap you can't expect much from the employees.

15.description: I've been going to threading plus for the last 5 years now and Asha and Farzana have been excellent. I always have a wonderful shape and they keep my look very natural. The best place for theading in the South Loop!

57.description: Friendly and very competent staff, no need for appointments and it is a very fair price. I was very impressed because I have a very sensitive skin and I am used to have pink rashes for a couple of days, but this time no reaction at all! I will definitely come back!

20.description: Still my favorite.  I will walk miles to get there which I did yesterday.  They are the best! They do a beautiful job!

36.description: Pro-rated price for threading depending on amount of work or flat rate.  The only one in town!Great free form henna design on my ankle.  No photos.  No design to copy.  Asha's joy in her work product is shown in the one-of-a-kind design.

14.description: This is one of the best place in south loop to go for eyebrows threading n their price is lowest in the area. Parlor is clean n have nice ambience. Ladies who do my threading are good nature wise n they know their work.

12.description: Just had the nilla zilla and it was amazing! So delicious!!

7.description: Cuffins are the world's best dessert -- no joke. Cookie muffin? Yes please! I love Zayna's unique flavors and creativity. Definitely getting them catered at my next event!!

3.description: Recently visited Chicago and came across this magical baked good known as a "cuffin" = cookie + muffin = cuffin!  How does Zayna do it?!  Tastes just like a cookie, looks just like a muffin, yet this delectable item remains moist throughout!  As a tourist, I knew I wouldn't have time to order cuffins but thanks to a great tip from a previous review, I found the cuffins at Plum Market and lo and behold, there they were (waiting for me)!  I only tried the chocolate chip cuffin, but it was divine and I adored the fudgy center.  Hope to try more cuffin flavors in the future; you should consider selling them in the DC area!

1.description: Zayna's cuffins were amazing! We had a wedding reception here in Chicago and these little bundles of edible joy were gone in seconds! Everyone raved about how delicious they were. Zayna was also wonderful to work with and was very accommodating.

2.description: seriously, Zayna is a genius!!! this is by far my go-to dessert that I like to purchase for my friends. Peanut Butter Nutella is my FAV... any time I'm near Old Town, I always stop in Plum Market to buy a box. YUM, YUM, YUM!!

9.description: My sister and I picked up two dozen cuffins for a family member's birthday party in Michigan.  We picked them up from Zayna Bakes the night before, drove them to Michigan the next day and served them at the party that night.  Not only were they just as delicious and fresh as they were the night before, but they traveled really well - no slips or spills and they looked just beautiful!  On top of that, they all tasted amazing - we sampled the Nutella Bella, the Nilla Zilla (my fav!), the Pretty Woman and the PB&J.

10.description: I ordered a dozen cuffins from Zayna back in November for a friend's birthday party and they turned out amazing!  No one had really seen a cuffin before so I had to kind of explain it ... but once they tried them, they shut up, haha!  My fave is the oatmeal raisin one that was in the box, it had like a bailiey's and cinnamon frosting drizzle.  So good!  I got the normal size ones, but next time I think I'll try the minis.  And the best part is that I live in Old Town and she had no problem delivering them to me, so convenient.

13.description: i still cant decide which one is my favorite. every thing i had was amazing i want to live in your kitchen.   ;)

16.description: Zayna's cuffins are amazing! Its a muffin and cookie combined - a very unique twist that is so yummy. Her cuffins come in a variety of flavors. I've tried several of them and the one with bacon is my favorite!! If you ever need baked goods for an event or just want to order a box for yourself, call Z! She is very passionate about baking and it really shows with her creativity :)

17.description: Want to try something new? Unique? Delicious? Then try the new Zayna's Bakes Cuffins! She bakes best Cuffins in Chicago, hands down. Got a sweet tooth? Go for the Oreo Montage. Want something fruity? Don't pass up the Strawberry Cheesecake it's to die for. With Zayna's wide variety of Cuffins your taste buds will never be bored and that's a promise.

15.description: I was eating a cuffin at a dinner party.  I had half left when I left the room for a moment.  When I retuned, it was missing. Someone had eaten it. That's how good these are.

0.description: Zayna is one of the sweetest and most passionate people I know and by golly gee is she passionate about baking!Zayna's great personality is only overshadowed by one thing, cuffins. Her amazing baking skills and endless variety of homemade cuffins have made her legend. She spends hour apon hours of time coming up with great and unique flavor combinations! I've had almost every flavor she makes though I'd have to say my favorites are the Baklava, PB&J and of course anything with Nutella!

5.description: Can not even begin to start talking about Zayna's cuffins.  My mouth is already watering.  Cuffins are a magical work of baking art if there is such a thing.  Just try picking out your favorite kind - I dare you! Not an easy feat.   Not only is Zayna amazing at whipping up the most creative flavors and types of cuffins, but she has the ability to take just about any ingredient and make it into a cake, cookie, muffin, or of course cuffin! Do your self a favor and call zayna bakes immediately...you won't be sorry.

11.description: Zayna knows how to put a crazy delicious twist on some classic desserts, creating her own original masterpieces. You have to try the cuffins for yourself, you will not be disappointed and will be left wanting more!!

8.description: Zayna's cuffins are delicious. My favorite was the Gaga Cuffin which came in a nice variety box. I'm excited to see her expand her product line.

4.description: I understand Zayna's cuffins are being sold at the new Plum Market in Old Town!Is that true?!Can't wait to get my hands on some whenever I'm in Old Town!

14.description: Loved the red velvet and baclava cuffins.

6.description: If there is one indulgence I cannot resist it is the cuffin!  These treats are better than any cookie you can imagine and I have had a lot of cookies in my day working for a baking manufacturer.  I would say that the minis are a perfect portion control size but to be honest there's no point in trying to portion as they're too good to have just one!  I highly recommend anything Zayna bakes as she has so many great treats that are perfect to order for yourself or send to a friend!

58.description: I don't really eat fast food burgers so I don't really get the hype around 5 guys.  I enjoyed the free unlimited toppings.  Also the fries are tasty.

56.description: FINALLY after years of living in the city I tried Five Guys.  The hype did not disappoint.  My burger was great - juicy, slightly greasy with the perfect ratio of bun to cheese to meat.  The other yelpers are right, the fries are plentiful (don't let the small looking cup fool you, they pile them high in the bag).  I got the bacon cheeseburger, but would probably go without bacon next time...it didn't add much to the experience.I love that you can order and pay online too!  Plus the staff was upbeat and friendly.  Definitely a place to stop for a quick bite or if you're craving a burger.  The prices is similar to what you'd find at a diner.

29.description: Let me start by saying I got food poisoning here yesterday (12/21), which is the main point of this review.  While I typically enjoy Five Guys fast food, unbelievably unhealthy burgers, I can't eat at this location anymore.I came in when they opened at 11am and got a burger and fries.  I tipped the loose coins from the change from my order in the inexplicable tip jar and got a very sarcastic "thank you" from the three girls goofing around behind the counter.  I remember thanking, "why am I tipping you in the first place, this is a fast food restaurant and you're not waiters", and then thinking "great, now I have to get food from three people who think they are entitled to 20% for cooking food".  It's an $8 fast food burger and you don't even bring it to my table or fill my drink... what are you doing for a tip again?Needless to say about three hours after eating the food I got incredibly sick and threw up for several hours.  It was my only meal since 6pm the previous night and my only meal up until that point.  After several hours of vomiting I felt better, so it clearly wasn't the flu.Considering some kind of police or legal action, but I imagine it's difficult to prove someone intentionally served bad food or undercooked food, or whatever set it off.  I'd be very surprised it if wasn't on purpose, though.I will NEVER visit this or any other Five Guys again, and I'm done tipping people who flat out don't deserve tips.

42.description: Most Islamic-friendly fast-food place in the City.  For example, you have a rushed day and you plan to Meet your friend here for lunch, but she shows up on Princess time , an hour late.  Thankfully, there is a hallway in the back , so if you get stuck here and it's asr time, u can pray there in peace.  Then order your food, while u experience GENUINE, and REAL Customer Service, thanking you for your patronage with free small fries to share with your friend.  Food is hot and delicious right off the grill, never too greasy, but greasy enough.  Special requests are handled with finesse.  You are never treated like a second class citizen, or international exchange student, because you order a veggie burger or grilled cheese in a Burger Joint.  You can occupy a table for hours and hours, study, and get your b'ness situated while you sip your weird concoctions of raspberry-infused Coca-Cola, and remember the way you were treated badly at the Falafel place around the way, and Alhamdulillah, you won't be going there any time soon, cuz this is the new place you like to hang with your sis.

23.description: Walked-in 10 minutes before they closed, but the staff was full of energy and the service was great. We ordered hamburgers, cheeseburgers and a large fries. All toppings are free, and the burgers are a good size. They were pretty generous with the fries. They cut up the hot dogs from the middle, which looked interesting. I'll be getting that next time I'm there. Service was a bit slow, but they were busy as well, considering they were trying to live up to the "five guys" only behind the counter. I'd definitely go again.

47.description: Very great service. Everyone there is very friendly, quick and courteous. The food is good never had a bad five guys burger good flavor and lots of topping options. Can't beat the coke machine Cherry Vanilla Coke is my favorite l. Parking isn't easy though there is a empty lot next to them but don't think it's there's still parked there the three times I went I always take it to go.

8.description: picked up burgers for my kids, surprised to see that they have only 2 kinds,hamburgers and veggie burgers. I like the help your self, free roasted peanuts which is kinda cool to munch on while your burger is being cooked.

31.description: Split a small order of fries for up to three people. Your stomach will thank you.

34.description: I first visited the Five Guys 2 years ago at their Orland Park location.  This was when the hype was just starting to circulate.  I wasn't that impressed and haven't thought of returning until today.So many people love Five Guys, so I thought that I may have missed something my first time around.  I ordered a little cheeseburger and little fries which came out to $7.76.  I decided to omit the drink since that would have brought the tab to over $10.I was really disappointed.  It took a really long time to get my food even though there were only a few people eating.  I was able to eat 3 trays of peanuts while I waited for my burger.  Given the long wait, I just don't understand why the meat on my burger was cold.  How does that even happen?  The burger just wasn't good.  I felt ripped off.  The fries were warm but nothing great.  I prefer fast food thin cut fries, however, so maybe I'm just biased.Overall, the highlight of my trip was the peanuts and that's sad.  For $7, I would rather get 4 McDoubles and make an 8 patty Super Cheeseburger with large fries, and a drink at McDonalds.  I'm giving it 2 stars because of the peanuts.  Let me reiterate the burger wasn't bad; it was just bad for the price and for being cold.

16.description: Tasty burgers & home-cut fries, but way overpriced.

13.description: Not real sure what some people are expecting when coming to this place? McDonald's fries are better? That's sad to the point of laughable! Chemical laden crap vs cut and cooked fresh.  Sorry but no comparison.  My experience at 5 guys was excellent as expected and this location is awesome.  The employees make it even better. They were singing and smiling and enjoying their time at work. Keep up the good work and kudos to the workers! Great job

11.description: You know what you are getting when you come here. A great burger and fries and they definitely deliver

39.description: I am not sure what all the fuss is about here. The burger wasn't that great. I don't get the two patties. The BBQ lacked flavor. The bun was blah. The fries were just average (and way salty). The service was good but we were there for the food.

37.description: Love it. I'm the guy who always orders the double bacon cheese burger with ketchup and jalapenos.  Love the soda machines here too.  Awesome idea and investment.

0.description: Very friendly employees and very good food, if you don't mind about a five-ten minute wait to get it. But it's always fresh and you can taste a difference. This is one of the few places that also does bacon right on a burger. Wendy's 4/$4 may be a good deal, but they can't get everything right. Five Guys may cost more, but it's so worth it. They dump a bunch of fries in the bag with a beautifully cooked burger and a smile on the side. Their ketchup containers are huge so you don't have to keep refilling. Sometimes they skimp on the napkins, but just ask for a few more and they'll give you more than enough. BUT keep in mind, you may end up coming often like I used to, it's just damn good food. Plenty of seats all the time except occasionally when groups of students come in, but you'll find a seat, just maybe not the one you wanted. I've had no problems parking in the lot across the street (Trader Joe's) but I keep it quick. Little burger = 1 patty, regular = 2 patties. Remember this or you may not be able to finish. Side note: I once got an extra free patty because they accidentally threw an extra one on or something. So, they can hook you up once in awhile. And they will shoot the breeze with you if you look bored. And pay attention for your number, pick a seat and wait by the pickup, it just makes everyone's experience quicker and more organized.

38.description: My burger was great. Staff was super friendly. Had a bad experience at the restaurant next door, so it was nice to find something worth going back to.

51.description: Definitely one of the best Five Guys I've been to. It's consistently good, great staff, fries are cooked well and it's always very clean.

27.description: I'll admit this place had some really good food, the cheeseburger and hot dog were both really good, the hot dog is sliced open, which is different, but what won me over was the cajun fries, they were so good, couldnt get enough of them, plus you get all the free peanuts you want in the store, the one downside tho is that I had some major gas afterwards and into the next day, idk if wanna go through that again, but i might endure it cuz theyre so good

32.description: People focus too much on the burgers from Five Guys that the hot dogs go under-appreciated. Next time you go, get the Cheese Dog, and try it with the jalapenos; you'll be pleasantly surprised (love how they slice the dog in half).Don't really care for the whole bag full of fries, I doubt that anyone actually eats all of them anyways. They are on the pricier side, but at least they make good food. I also realized that there are exactly five guys that work at this location between all the positions, and it may just be me, but there is kind of a lengthy wait time that they could improve on compared to other locations but you can always just order ahead (online.).

54.description: Standard five guys, free peanuts, great and plentiful cajun/normal fries (no sweet potato fries here), great burgers and pretty good hot dogs. Drinks are self-served from a Coca-cola freestyle machine so you can have that raspberry sprite zero if your heart so desires.Their burgers aren't pretty to look at and should probably be eaten immediately, but what greasy fast food sin't like that?Pretty friendly crew too which is a plus.

48.description: Amazing service!! Great atmosphere!! The most friendly place I've been to in a while and the burgers are DELICIOUS!! Highly recommend the little cheese all the way.

44.description: Don't know why it took me forever to eat at Five Guys, but when a buddy of mine took me a few months ago for my first time at this S. Loop location, I was SO impressed.  The bacon cheeseburger was AMAZING.  I didn't order any fries because I was going to share with the friend I came with.  But when the guys dishing out the orders found out it was my first time and I didn't have any fries with my burger, they just gave me a regular order of fries (with the customary extra scoop of fries in the bag) for FREE.  For a chain restaurant, that was a super nice touch.  Thanks Five Guys!  I'll be back.

24.description: picked up burgers for my kids, surprised to see that they have only 2 kinds,hamburgers and veggie burgers. I like the help your self, free roasted peanuts which is kinda cool to munch on while your burger is being cooked.

7.description: With a flat top grill much longer than necessary (not being properly used either), two double sided deep fryers and six employees on deck, a staff large enough to accommodate 75 people given the menu. You would assume this establishment runs fluently and efficiently, and at times it would appear so, but that is not that case. Destroying your food is exactly what they are doing, literally slamming out your burgers. Not sure if they know this but once you smash those burgers like they owe you money, you lose most of the flavor and moisture of the burger.  While waiting for my pick up order I heard one of the employees ( short skinny hispanic girl) say to the grill cook," flip and smash those burgers!" this is usually a technique done out of desperation to catch up on orders if you are running far behind schedule...it was Dead! and unfortunately so were everyone's burgers. They were so flat, it resembled roadkill. I wasn't sure if he was making burgers, or ground beef for chili the way that flat top looked, and it was only six patties at most. If you can't handle six patties on an enormous flat top grill such as the one in this kitchen you need to find a different job, cooking is seriously not for you.If it wasn't for all the toppings they offer and stockpile on to a soggy bun, there would be NO flavor. The burger itself would be unpalatable. This wasn't the first time I saw them smashing burgers, I've been there several times and each time I see them smashing burgers I pray that mine weren't treated as poorly. Pretty sure its just their forte now, Laziness.

49.description: LOVE LOVE. Great Burger and Awesome Service.

40.description: Five Guys is my burger splurge joint because have you seen how giant their burgers are? I also love that they have so many ingredients that just come with your burger--mushrooms! jalepenos! and they're fresh and not canned!--so you can get it loaded. I'm not even going to talk about the cajun fries because you already know.This location loses a star because my burger had like a single jalepeno slice on it.

53.description: I had the BEST experience at this Five Guys location. We had visited a couple other locations in the past, so my expectations going in weren't that high.  This location totally redeemed Five Guys' reputation. The staff was very friendly and made sure my order was perfect. Excellent customer service!

30.description: The food is always god and the workers are super friendly. Fries are so delicious!!!!! Sometimes it can be a bit of a wait for the food, but I'd say it's worth it.

46.description: Great burgers, and great fries. The cajun fries are a must. Also, they don't charge for extra toppings, which is definitely a plus in my book. I also love this place because you can see the employees cooking, which means it is probably a lot cleaner than other burger places in the area.

1.description: Wonderful crew! Always courteous and friendly. Five Guys' burgers are always made to order, so expect a wait. But, it's well worth it! The fries are also yummy. Such a treat eating here!

55.description: I have been to Five Guys all over the country (including the Chicago Clybourn one) and have never been disappointed.  In fact, we love their burgers. However, we have been to this franchise on Wabash at least 4 times and the burgers her are far below anything we've had at other Five Guys.  The first time we went to this one, we thought it was subpar just because they had been opened for less than a month and needed to work out the kinks. Subsequent visits showed no improvement though.  Every time we ask for mayonaise, they put so much on there it's oozing out of the bun and you can scrape off at least half a teaspoon of it and still have more than enough.  The meat is also pretty bland and tasteless. Worst of all though, they never seem hot enough.  As another reviewer said, the cheese isn't even melted. As for the "abundant"  order of fries you get Five Guys is famous for, this one doesn't give you nearly as much as the others.  With the overflow in the bag, there's usually plenty for 3-4 people.  Here, the portion we got barely fed the two of us .... the cup and maybe 7 fries in the bag.  Never been to a Five Guys we didn't like, so this is a first.

9.description: I went here for lunch and this place is like a fast food joint for burgers, hotdogs and fries. I try their hotdogs with fries. I must say I didn't like the hotdog and fries I got but I ate it. I wouldn't go back to this place unless a friend wants to go who never try it and by then I would have yet need to try the burgers people rave about. The waitstaff was friendly and attentive to my needs but the wait time was a little longer than I expected since I only had an hour lunch.

26.description: The burgers here are a big step up from McDonald's and the like for a modest step up in price. Well worth it. The best part, though, are the cajun fries. I get mine with extra cajun on the belief that there's no such thing as too much cajun seasoning.

25.description: Didn't have a good experience.they forgot to put the bacon and also the taste was very pretty ordinary.The management seemed least bothered.I have had better burgers which were grass fed beef,very delicious,had very awesome toppings and cost the same.

12.description: Good food, good service. They,ace was well kept and clean which is nice for a downtown location.

59.description: This place is OK. Yes, the burger is $5, it's greasy and you get a mountain of fries. I felt it was a lot of hype and not a lot of substance. I guess the market is the college kid that wants a greasy burger for $5.00 -  for that ok, they fit the bill.

21.description: I wasn't expecting much because many people overhyped Five Guys.But I must confess, I really enjoyed their burgers and fries.  I order single patty with lettuce, tomatoes and mustard, and they've always been delicious to me.I still don't understand the hype but their food is very good.  Not to mention, the fry cup was always overflowing with fries :dI used to eat there often since my school was really close by.  The staff was always friendly too.

17.description: I visited Five Guys for the first time here. It's very delicious! I like the taste of beef there!

10.description: Satisfying, relatively fast, but not that cheap... everything is a la carte, no combos.

5.description: Hands down the best location! And the employees are super friendly, makes you feel like part of the family.

3.description: People who don't "get" what's so great about this place have just been missing out on great burgers their whole life!I'm from the DMV area where this place originated, so I've been a fan of Five Guys forever. Now I'd weigh 300 lbs if I ate here all the time, but I do appreciate having a great burger joint in my neighborhood. The last time I was here, James, the night manager was fantastic and hooked me up. I mean, I've always had great service with these folks, but he was particularly friendly and welcoming to all of the guests. Oh, and they also have that fancy coke fountain machine where you can mix and match a ton of combinations... pretty cool with that's your thing! LOL.Fun fact: DMV = DC, Maryland, Virginia ;-)

35.description: Good, reasonably fast burger at a solid price. Normally I would prefer Cajun fries, but their normal fries have enough flavor for me. If I had reviewed Five Guys 2 years ago, they might have gotten 5 stars, but over the last 2 years I've experienced some other burger places in the same category that are simply better tasting.

19.description: Hell yes, very good. Awesome burgers.

28.description: Very decent and good sized burgers.  The fries are also delicious and I'm usually really picky about fries.  You can basically get all the toppings you want for free (excluding bacon).  I'm knocking off a couple stars because 1) parking in the area sucks, 2) the fries arrived EXTREMELY HOT, like burn the roof of your mouth hot, and 3) prices are a bit expensive for a fast food burger place... like ~$7 per burger.

45.description: Five guys is my favorite fast food burger place and the location in the south loop is my favorite branch.  Definitely has the friendliest staff in Chicago

33.description: Amazing fries, staff making food was super friendly. I don't eat meat so I can't speak for the burgers but the rest of my party loved theirs, and the hot dog. Veggie sandwich is good as long as you don't forget to add extras.

43.description: I thought it was fast, but then it was very slow....and although I was there at 9pm, it wasn't too busy.  But the worst part is that my cheese wasn't melted....so what the heck took so long?I really like their cajun fries, they're pretty great, but no size larger then a small is needed, they're pretty generous with them.

2.description: The first thing I like about this place: the free, in-the-shell peanuts. Not only does it attract peanut lovers like me, but it keeps all the families with whiny, peanut-allergy-having kids. away. (Just kidding, kiddos: If they were serving dust mites over a bed of pollen plants, I'd run for the desert hills myself.)Do too many cooks spoil the broth? Perhaps. The place is good for a fast food place: the burgers are cooked to order and the fact that their patties are never frozen is likely responsible for their good flavor and chew. The fries were "meh" on my crispy outside/fluffy inside scale. Service was very friendly both times that I've been. Prices are reasonable too, at least for the burgers. A smaller size of fries at half the price would improve the offerings.If there weren't a bevy of good burgers at non-chain, locally-owned burger palaces and joints in the city, the place would probably rate a four (maybe a five in the 'burbs or beyond).Final verdict: Three guys out of five. The other two can hang around and have a beer or two; just don't hover over the grill and fryer guys with your "helpful" suggestions; and don't even think about touching those tongs to press the meat down on the grill (and squeeze out the juices)). If you do, then as the burger Nazi might say, "No snoop(ing) for you!"

18.description: I'll admit this place had some really good food, the cheeseburger and hot dog were both really good, the hot dog is sliced open, which is different, but what won me over was the cajun fries, they were so good, couldnt get enough of them, plus you get all the free peanuts you want in the store, the one downside tho is that I had some major gas afterwards and into the next day, idk if wanna go through that again, but i might endure it cuz theyre so good

41.description: I made it to the South Loop location today, and I am inspired to post because 1) the fries can now be ordered in a smaller size [not unique to South Loop but anyway]; 2) the staff is SO nice and SO friendly. That's really it. I love a good burger, and the fries are great, but with so much competition around for burgers, I wanna recognize when service is exceptional. I felt like I was living a Hunter Hayes song, "I wanna make you feel wanted". They want you in their store and aren't afraid to show it!

52.description: This place is across the street from my work and after a long day (or weekend) I end my shift with a nice juicy little burger. As I've said in other reviews about Five Guys, I enjoy the fact that the menu is simple and that my burger is made to order. The toppings are also always fresh. You can order and pay online if you are really in a hurry or are tired of interacting with the human race (hey, it happens to the best of us). The little cup for fries? You're getting a whole bag man. Sidle up to any table here and strap on a feed bag. It's going to be a good day.

50.description: Meh....This was my first experience at a Five Guys, and honestly I think it's a little hyped up. The environment is pretty cool and I appreciate their free peanuts, and their creative approach to the Cajun Fries. However, I thought the cheese burger was a little too greasy. Honestly it's probably a PHENOMENAL option for a late night snack after a few drinks, but alas, I not so well prepared when I visited.

4.description: Performed above expectations.  I hadn't been to a Five Guys establishment prior to this, but I'd be hard pressed to imagine people that were more enthusiastic than those running this particular joint. Burger was fresh made and delicious. Legit that all the toppings are included so you're able to step up your burger game without stepping more out of pocket. Value + Delicious = Awesome.

6.description: Their food was not worth all the hype for me. I have friends who love their food. I tried their burger and fries. I was not impressed. The burger was huge and it was good but I don't think it's worth the trip or the price. Their fries are separately priced and I regretted getting them. I would rather have mc Donalds fries...then again who can beat mcdonals fries.. still their fries were probably one of the worst I had. :-/ Would I go back? Maybe if I'm really craving burger and it's nearby.

22.description: Even during the lunch rush, the staff was super friendly. The cashier was just the sweetest. Love their burgers, and nothing beats their fries.

15.description: I've never written a Yelp review before but felt compelled to after my experience at this Five Guys location.  I have always enjoyed this franchise and want to note that this review is about the customer service vs. the food.  The burgers are quick and fries are good.I just moved in to a new apartment and was excited to see a 5 guys across the street.  I ordered online this evening and walked over about 10 mins later and arrived 5 minutes or so after my order was supposed to be ready.There were only 2 other people in the store (1 already eating) - I was not greeted by a single person upon entering (so okay whatever) and headed to the area marked "Pick Up" - There was an employee standing about 1 ft in front of me who did not even acknowledge my presence, so i stood and waited.  The other person's name was called and they went and got their food.  So now i'm the ONLY person waiting on an order and still no one has acknowledged me.  Finally, I SEE my name on a ready to go order - so I said politely "sorry, you didn't call my name but I see my order over there just want you to know i'm here"  I kid you not, the ENTIRE line of employees (about 4 or 5) started arguing with me, saying "Yes we did WE CALLED YOUR NAME!" and i was so taken a back, I go "I've been standing here and I don't think you did", and the female employee tells me "Yes we did, but YOU did not do this right.  You are supposed to go to the "Order Here" section before "Pick Up" to tell us you are here.  You did not do that, so we did not know... so you need to walk over there"  Perhaps that was my mistake?  But either way, if I'm the only person in the store a simple "how can we help you?" could've helped me understand I wasn't following their strict order process.  I was fuming, but walked over there where another employee gave me my receipt and said "don't worry ma'am you'll get to eat your burger" while literally laughing at me.  Even though no one acknowledged me when I walked in, I certainly received several "Have a nice day!" condescending shouts as I left.I realize that if the worst part of my day is when the employees at Five Guys make me feel like an idiot, then overall things are good haha, but i just had to write this.  It was cathartic and as a manager I would be appalled if my staff treated a customer like that ever.  Probably for the best that I will not be going back, those fries are delicious and their rudeness will save me some calories :)  Either way SHAME ON YOU SUNDAY STAFF!!!

57.description: I was underwhelmed by the burger here. Perhaps it's because I only got onions and mushrooms on it, but personally I think if a burger is good, you don't need a lot of extra stuff on it. And the well done thing? Not MCOT at all. I like my meat medium rare and seasoned well. This was neither and I was disappointed after hearing people hype it up so much. The 2 stars are for the fries (Cajun) and the soda fountain. I mean, how cool is the soda fountain? I wish I had one at my house.

20.description: This is a solid 5 guys location.  I always online order, and then pick-up.  Never had any problems and the food is great, I get junior bacon hamburger all the way with jalapeno peppers.  Not a fan of the cajun fries, but their regular ones are good.

36.description: I was a Five Guys virgin until yesterday.  While it was not the burger orgasm I was expecting, it was damn good.  Get lots of napkins; it was one of the juiciest burgers I'd ever had.  Fries are great too.  Everything was made to order.  Don't think I'd want to go here if it's too busy-you might wait awhile-but if you're hungry and the line isn't too long, go ahead and get your burger freak on.

14.description: I wasn't expecting much because many people overhyped Five Guys.But I must confess, I really enjoyed their burgers and fries.  I order single patty with lettuce, tomatoes and mustard, and they've always been delicious to me.I still don't understand the hype but their food is very good.  Not to mention, the fry cup was always overflowing with fries :dI used to eat there often since my school was really close by.  The staff was always friendly too.

3.description: I think this is positively the best place in the city.  To give you an idea of how great it is; I live on the North side and drive or take public transportation to the South side to see Dr. Aleks Orkiszewska ( Dr. Aleks ). She used to be a mere 3 blocks from my home. However, I find her skills vastly superior to any other family practice doctor I have seen in the past fifteen years, and that says a lot. So, I was not going to lose her due to her relocation. She is affiliated with Thorek Hospital, which I have also had good experiences with as well ( for testing, etc).  Additionally, Ken the Office Manager and " Go-To-Guy" is the nicest person and the perfect front desk persona extraordinaire. From paperwork to  assisting Dr. Aleks he is definitely a modern renaissance man.Please see my individual review (on Yelp) of Dr. Aleks. I really do think the world of her.Recently, she has also added aesthetic cosmetic procedures to her practice. And with her feather-light touch, (trust me on this one ) She is definitely THE Doctor you want wielding a needle near your face. I definitely do not have this type of thing done frequently, but I have had it done in the past, so, I do have something to compare it to RE: Pain factor.  Now, when she said "Little Pinch" that's exactly what I felt. In the past when others have said that, Well, I thought I would faint and maim them after reviving. So, not only is she a first- class doctor, but also she is a super cool person. Now that combination, I believe, is a rare commodity. She will be "my doctor" for as long as I remain in Chicago.

1.description: I typically only write reviews if I have wonderful things to say, but ugh, I've had such an experience with this practice that I thought I should share in order to prevent anyone else having to go through the headache I've had with this office.  The doctor's that work there themselves, are fine and nice, you're not getting amazing service, but you're also not getting 2 minutes with the doctor.  That being said, the rest of the practice is not great.I called and made an appointment the week before it was scheduled, however when I arrived, they were packing up saying that I did not have an appointment, fine no big deal, except they were pretty rude about the whole ordeal.Following week I go in for the rescheduled appointment, which I get every year, however this one was the most complicated and fairly painful appointment I've had.  Doctor was fine, asked her to refill my prescription (the only reason I went in the first place) she says fine, I'm on my merry way.Based on my prior experience with this place and them not being super organized, I called the week my prescription was due for the refill I requested just to be sure it was called in. As suspected, it was not called in but was told the doctor would call it in. No big deal, happy to just have my prescription and the whole ordeal over with.But that's naturally not what happened. Got a call back saying the doctor did not remember agreeing to prescribe me and that she was not comfortable prescribing me my prescription despite the fact that all the test results came back fine, they've prescribed it to me before and she agreed to do it during my visit.   I called back a few times  to try and understand why this was, considering it was not brought up in my appointment and finally she agrees to give me 1 refill under the condition I go back to the doctor. Not happy at this point, but whatever, I'll do it.  Go to pickup my prescription, and of course, the doctor called me in the wrong one.They are clearly quite unorganized and honestly, fairly rude. Anytime I had to call their office on the phone (which was quite a few times), they were not very helpful and seemed irritated that I was bothering them.  Needless to say, I will not be back.

2.description: One year on and I've needed Dr Aleks help on a few more occasions, including for the aftermath of being hit by a taxi on a crosswalk! After quite a few visits to her clinic I have to say that she is by far the best family doctor I've ever had. She is really focused on the patient and always wants to provide the best possible care. When I've needed referrals for specialist help, she's got me in to see the right people in double quick time. Her support team is also outstanding and always in good humor. Thank you Vanessa and Marnie!

5.description: When I had Blue Cross Blue Shield Dr. Alecks was the very best! She has the bedside manner of a doctor that you wouldn't even be able to dream up. She was always extra patient with me and made sure that even the smallest of my concerns were all addressed and taken care of. She was always on top of everything and kept me up-to-date on all my results and meds. She's super open-minded, caring and considerate. Imagine how heart-broken I was when I found out that my new insurance did not include Dr. Alecks in their network xP Have not been able to find a doctor that met Dr. Alecks' standards yet. Hopefully my next insurance will let me switch back!

6.description: Dr. Aleks is awesome. She's incredibly personable and down-to-earth. She's very easy to talk to, and she's also very knowledgable and thorough. The office is extremely clean, friendly, efficient, and prompt. You will be in great hands here!

0.description: Dr. Aleks is  great!!  I easily communicate with her by email, if necessary.  She is so caring and thorough, I cannot say enough.  Love her and will recommend her anytime I get the chance!!!!!

4.description: I can't say enough great things about Dr. Aleks and her staff! Being new to Chicago I was nervous to get a new primary and start my "adult" life. They made everything so easy for me, with their flexibility and fast communication via e-mail, I feel like they are all truly working to make me as healthy as I can be! My commute is near an hour on public transportation to come to this office, and I do so happily. Look no further, this is the place for you and your family.

29.description: I made an appointment yesterday for a Groupon I purchased for 3 massages.  My massage therapist was Samuel and he was very professional and knowledgeable.  I've always gotten massages from women so I was a little concerned at first, but he was very professional and didn't make me uncomfortable at all.  The massage was amazing, better than a lot of spa places.  Other places might just go through the motions and seem like they're just waiting for the hour to be up, but the massage I received here was very relaxing and he targeted the muscles that were tense.  He also gave me some tips to help my tense muscles afterwards!The only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is the same reason many others have said.  I could definitely hear the shouting and music from the classes going on, but I think they've got a CD player in the massage room now in an attempt to drown out the noise.  The room was really chilly too...I'm assuming they have the AC on pretty high because of all the people working out.

42.description: Apparently there is a massage discount which I cannot afford to prepay.  Will need to save up.

23.description: Bought a Groupon for three massages.  Went on vacation to Chicago and got to use two while I was there.  Everything went well from the time I called to schedule the appointments till the time I finished my second massage.  Terry did both of my massages and did a great job.  I had stiffness in my neck, shoulder and back and he found it and worked it out.  He explained what he found and what he was working on during the massages and after.  He also gave me recommendations of what to do as far as maintenance.  The staff was great and friendly.  Will do it again.  Also, the office is above a Trader Joe's.

47.description: If you're looking for a serious chiropractor, avoid this place! I went in for an appointment, and they tried to sell me classes, a membership, pilates, and yoga balls. I even heard my MD trying to sell protein shakes to the patient in line before me. This is such a gimmick. They're worse than a salon: "You have a problem, and only our products can fix it!" When I told them I was a member of another gym, they said: "Your gym wouldn't have you do the exercises correctly, you need to come here." UM- I am not a cash cow. They were especially excited when they saw that my insurance covered things. They tried to sign me up for everything to get money out of my insurance. Apparenly, I need a massage once a week. Although that would be nice, all I wanted was an adjustment- not a two hour solicitation. They were pressuring and sales-y. Very annoying.

8.description: I made an appointment yesterday for a Groupon I purchased for 3 massages.  My massage therapist was Samuel and he was very professional and knowledgeable.  I've always gotten massages from women so I was a little concerned at first, but he was very professional and didn't make me uncomfortable at all.  The massage was amazing, better than a lot of spa places.  Other places might just go through the motions and seem like they're just waiting for the hour to be up, but the massage I received here was very relaxing and he targeted the muscles that were tense.  He also gave me some tips to help my tense muscles afterwards!The only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is the same reason many others have said.  I could definitely hear the shouting and music from the classes going on, but I think they've got a CD player in the massage room now in an attempt to drown out the noise.  The room was really chilly too...I'm assuming they have the AC on pretty high because of all the people working out.

31.description: Staff is friendly and instructors are knowledgeable. The classes are amazing! I love Ripped on a Budget, Kettle-bell class, Zumba and Pilates. Kathy Trainor is one of the best trainers in the city. I lost over 30lbs working out with her. You will see results working out with Kathy.

34.description: I love Interchange.  The studio is great and staff are friendly. Kathy is a wonderful Pilates instructor.  The variety of pilates equipment allows Kathy to give you a WORKOUT.  She is an excellent instructor and makes everything look easy in her demos.  If it looks easy for Kathy, trust me you will struggle - that's how good she is.

16.description: I love this place. Kathy is an incredible pilates instructor, and Molly gives amazing massages. I might be a bit biased since it's walking distance from my house and that Trader Joes is coming in downstairs. Couple of issues...I have tried to register for the spin class for ONE Sunday out of the next six.They are all booked up. There are only five bikes which is a real downside. Because the place is so small (workout room), it can be tough to get into any group exercise class that you want. I have found that it hasn't been too conducive with my schedule as of late. My only issues - NEED a bigger group fitness space and more equipment. Other than that, have been pleased.

13.description: I attended the Capoeira class today and it was AWESOME! The instructor was great, he took his time showing us the moves, explaining the steps and what part of the body we were working while moving. The staff and other class goers were all very warm and friendly. I did have some trouble finding the location at first it gets lost being next to Trader Joe's and all the traffic but it was so worth the confusion. The facilities were great and almost spa like. I would definitely recommend this place to friends & family.

11.description: Bottom Line - I am a fan of Interchange Medical Wellness.  Let me count the ways.  :-)VISUALLY - I am a visual person, so it was important for me to visit the center before booking an appointment.  Upon walking in, I was immediately impressed.  The space has been nicely appointed with a minimalist eye and immediately lends itself to a calming atmosphere.THE FRONT DESK -  I love the people at the front desk.   No matter who I get at the front desk, I am always greeted with a warm reception and they are always eager to be of assistance.  That is my first impression and it never fails me. CHIROPRACTIC CARE - I have been seeing Dr. Patricia Zemaitis for chiropractic care over the past several months.  I initially went in for migraines.  I appreciate that she is well-read and does a great job of balancing traditional chiropractic care and new-age chiropractic care.  Her approach is whollistic and she a sincere overall concern for your well-being.  MASSAGES - I have seen both Bill Underwood and Renee and they are both great!  :-)  When booking an appointment, you may have to book a few weeks in advance - these two are always in high demand.  Bill offers a great deep tissue massage.  If you need deep tissue, you must see Bill.  Renee is equally as great and she offers a combination massage and facial.  I had this package with Renee and the facial was perfection.  My skin was amazing for days to come.  TIMING OF MASSAGES - If you are coming for a "SPA DAY" or Utilizing a coupon from "GROUPON", please, please, please ask them to book your massage around a time that will maximize your relaxtion.  If seeking relaxation, I would not recommend coming in during the busiest time of the day for a massage.  I typically come in for deep-tissue and muscle relaxation with Bill and Renee and noise levels have never been a concern - but I can not speak for everyone.PILATES - I had never taken pilates before, so having one on one sessions with Steve and Kathy was a great introduction.  With patience, I watched my body grow in strength. As opposed to pilates classes in the gym, this instruction is led with a mix of the equipment and the mat work.   If you've never utilized the equipment, you should at least try it once - it'll give you a glimpse of what your body should be able to do on the mat.  Steve is into traditional STOTT Pilates and prides himself on teaching you about the process.  If you are looking to learn and grow, Steve is a great option.  Kathy is also great.  I saw her when I first started attending pilates.  She has a balanced tone and really listens to you as you move through the session.   They both offer Single or Group Instruction.AMENITIES - They provide water.  There are also showers, towels, and a flat panel television in the women's bathroom.  (Can't speak on the view inside the men's bathroom).  The bathrooms are clean and pleasant.  (So Important!)OTHER CLASSES - I have not attended their group exercise classes.  I am considering joining the "Walk to Run" club with Bill Underwood that will meet on Saturday Mornings at 7:30am.  Currently, he has a running club that meets on Friday evenings.Interchange Medical Wellness does an excellent job of balancing the many aspects that can affect the "Wellness" of their clients.   While they are not a spa, they do offer spa-like benefits without the spa-like pricing.  And as a bonus, you'll find that everyone in there is a semi fitness nut and has some information about something fitness related.  Ask a question and you'll be surprised at the wealth of knowledge you might get from anyone in there.   :-)

39.description: I love this place. Kathy is an incredible pilates instructor, and Molly gives amazing massages. I might be a bit biased since it's walking distance from my house and that Trader Joes is coming in downstairs. Couple of issues...I have tried to register for the spin class for ONE Sunday out of the next six.They are all booked up. There are only five bikes which is a real downside. Because the place is so small (workout room), it can be tough to get into any group exercise class that you want. I have found that it hasn't been too conducive with my schedule as of late. My only issues - NEED a bigger group fitness space and more equipment. Other than that, have been pleased.

37.description: I just had a massage and I was very disappointed.  I agree with Robyn T.  Whomever set this place up did not think it through very well.  The space is very esthetically pleasing, however, the group exercise classes, the exercise room, and an private office are all bundled very close to each other along side the massage rooms.  Because it's a loft space, sound carries throughout the space and even echoes more than a traditional office space.  Two gentlemen were having a conversation and it was if they were yelling right into my ears.  Very unpleasant.Perhaps because I came with a Groupon or perhaps because I recoiled so often from pain, but my therapist, Tia, was very abrupt and curt once the session ended.  I couldn't help but to react as my ulnar nerve (think funny bone) was being dug into more than once and on both arms.  She failed to ask if the pressure was comfortable and seemed to think mind-numbing pressure in the joints and over bone should have been theraputic.  Never was offered any water-before or after my massage- which is a standard to flush out toxins after a massage and I was started 15 minutes late....but Tia sure made a point to finish precisely at the top of the hour!  (15 minutes is still 25% of my massage, and, afterall, I did arrive 20 minutes early!)I'd say for an awesome massage, leave it to a spa.  Go to Aniko Salon just 1/2 block away.  I'm a massage junkie so I know good from bad, professional from rude, and a dedicated professional from someone who just wants to get the job done.  I will try it at least once more since I do have the Groupon and see if my next therapist can change my opinion of the spa side of this operation.....to be continued!

0.description: My husband and I just got acupuncture for the first time here. The building is very clean, the decor is is simple and welcoming. There were two girls at the front desk, one was brunette and she said she was new. She was very nice. The other was blonde, her name was Kristina I believe, she was mildly annoying because she kept talking o  the other girl like she was dumb. I think the new girl was kind of annoyed with her too but i don't know. The doctor who did my acupuncture was named Patricia and she was amazing. she asked me about where I had pain and a little about my life. She explained the procedure and made me feel very comfortable with everything. When she put the needles in I hardly felt anything. She turned the lights off and put some relaxing music on and let me relax for twenty minutes. I can def say that I felt relaxed when I left. My pain had lessened, but not extremely. I think I will go back again to see if it helps after a few sessions. Hell, I may go back just for the twenty minute nap I can't get at home with my kids. My husband had Dr. Amanda and he said he enjoyed his experience as well.I would recommend this place to anyone. The staff is professional and friendly. I enjoyed myself.

38.description: I'm sure this place is fabulous for its exercises classes, but I wouldn't be running there for any spa services. That is assuming you want to relax, and ahem, if you're going to the spa, wouldn't you be there specifically to relax?This place is in a great location (biased because I live nearby), but it is at the corner of Roosevelt and Wabash near the Red, Orange & Green lines so pretty great transportation-wise. You'll have to be buzzed in when you arrive and if you're taking the elevator you'll need to go to 2R. The space itself is a beautiful, modern loft space...and go figure when you're entering a wellness center wouldn't you want to be watching "Two and a Half Men" on the plasma? Sets the tone for relaxation right?While my massage was fine (basic room, no frills which is totally OK) I could not relax because there was a Zumba class going on the entire time. The massage was about 40 minutes (I'd booked for an hour) and though my masseuse was pleasant enough she said "you'll get used to the noise". Really? Not so much. Upon check out the receptionist could not have been less friendly. She didn't ask how my service was. She thought it was strange that I asked when a more quite time to come back would be. She said they don't have any change (for a $5 - not even a $20!) I had a Groupon for 3 1-hour massages here and I won't be back. I won't recommend it and sadly I won't try any of their other services either based on my not so warm interactions with the receptionist.I understand you can get overwhelmed with service from a Groupon, but this is one place that is sorely under prepared for the flow of clients that they'll be receiving from the website and if they want to have more happy customers they'll have to make some changes.

51.description: I was walking by and noticed this new business in the neighborhood.  I attempted to go up, but realized that I needed to be buzzed in....I hit the buzzer, in hopes that I wouldn't look like a weirdo saying "Hi, I just want to come see what you are all about" - well, I definitely wasn't treated like a weirdo :)  -  When I saw the words "Medical Wellness Spa," I didn't know what to expect.... turns out, they have EVERYTHING.  Chiropractic work, massage, acupuncture, pilates, strength training, and cardio equipment!  And, let's back track a bit here to the pilates equipment:  These reformer machines are none like I've ever seen - not the typical reformers you see at some of the local fitness clubs around here - and they even did a little demonstration for me.  I wish I could give you more details about the equipment, but I have no idea what the springy-doodads are called... I just know it'll work wonders on my legs, thighs, butt, arms, and back!The space is amazing, and it looks so pristine (not what you would expect when you are told "Excuse the construction dust" - um...what dust?!?!!)I'll definitely be back - well, I better be, because I bought a group exercise package (YES - They have group exercise too!)Welcome to the neighborhood, Interchange!

27.description: Got the Groupon for massage and really, really enjoyed it. I went to Renee two times and Mary once--they were both phenomenal. They provided excellent service, helped calm tension and worked out kinks in my muscles, and provided sage guidance on stretches and things I can do to prevent tension. This is a busy place with classes and such, so it is more a place for those who are looking for physical therapy massage and not the fancy spa type of massage. If you're in pain, this place will more than do the trick. It's close to the Roosevelt Red Line stop, not too far from the Lakeshore bike path, and there is a fair amount of metered street parking, so it's quite conveniently located too.

32.description: This place is a lovely space, great location, with a friendly staff.  So why the 3 star review?  I have a love/hate relationship with their Zumba classes.The Zumba classes are fun, a great workout, and taught be great instructors.  But the space is too damn small for the number of people they put in it.  You need a lot of room to do Zumba, and this is a small awkward space that they fill with people.  I understand they have a great class with a high demand, but jamming the room with people makes it less fun, less of a workout, and less appealing.

48.description: If you're looking for something a little different from your regular gym, I would highly recommend Interchange.  I've been going there for about a month, taking personal training with Kathy.  I used to take pilates group classes from her at a different gym, and she's great.  She'll definitely kick your butt!The studio is really nice, clean and modern--it just opened a few months ago and I can attest to the bathroom/locker room being much cleaner than my other gym...  And since it's a bit on the smaller side, you don't get the overwhelming feeling like you might at a bigger gym.  It's a little calmer and low-key than the typical gym--in a good way.  There's a good variety of classes offered both in the mornings and evenings, and the location is great (especially if you don't live in the South Loop and need to take the el - it's right across from the Roosevelt stop).

44.description: So far I've done Pilates here and attended a Pretty City event. Both times were great, the staff here is truly welcoming and friendly. I will be coming back for more classes in November. Easy street parking.

24.description: I visited Dr. Amanda for acupuncture. I purchased a You Swoop for 5 sessions, and was very pleased after my first one. Dr. Amanda was very personable and thorough in explaining acupuncture (my first time), the course of regimen and expected benefits. I look forward to continuing my sessions and possibly using the chiropractic care services in the future.

7.description: Dr. "Patty" aka "Z" Zemaitis and this place are a God-sent! I cannot praise her and this Center enough. They literally have changed my life! After going to five different doctors and specialists who could not figure out what was wrong with me, I was referred to Dr. Patty, who took the time to listen, re-run tests, and administer new tests I was not even aware of and figured it out! After almost three months of constant health issues, she had the solution and I am finally feeling better. Even though she is listed under "chiropractic" on the website she does SO much more and is well-versed in so many different, natural, and holistic treatments from acupuncture to herbal treatments. I love that she will work with you and try to stay away from meds as much as is possible. I had never done acupuncture before, but I am now a HUGE believer having seen how my health situation has changed from Day 1 of being on this treatment path. She is HILARIOUS and always accessible via email if things come up between appointments. She is also a great educator and explains ever thing so clearly. She has basically given me my very own "user's manual" to my body and a lot of things I have just "lived with" now make sense and I know how to counteract them. I not only feel better but I feel empowered in the sense that I know what to do to avoid/fix issues. The massage therapists are AWESOME, too! So far I have had the pleasure to meet Gabi and Anne/Anna(?). Gabi is incredible. She is like a wave of power all over your body. I was so relaxed during our sessions that I fell asleep on the table, snoring, hahaha. I love her. Anne/Anna is more of a precision knot laser/ninja. While I wanted to cry and beg for mercy as she working on those knots in my shoulders, I feel great!The thing that totally blew me away was the fact that Dr. Z takes insurance which has made all my weekly appointment SO cheap. I have to pinch myself every time I see my monthly invoice because it is SO little compared to any doctor's visit I have ever had. So, if you have been dealing with health issues that no one can diagnose or has taken the time to figure out, or if you are tired of dealing with health issues you have just gotten used to "live with," or if you know that your body is "off" somehow or want to just simply know how your body functions, you must give Dr. "Z" and the guys at Interchange a try!

49.description: I wish I lived in the city or close by to take advantage of this place more often. All the doctors and trainers here are so nice, personable, and professional! They seem to do it all!! Where can you go where you can get a massage, chiropractic visit and group exercise all under one roof? Up until this place opened up, probably no where. Consider it a one-stop-shop.I had an appointment with Dr. Patty Zemaitis for a chiropractic visit. She is extremely knowledgeable. If you're a newbie to chiropractic and/or acupuncture, don't worry, because she will explain it all to you. She's especially knowledgeable in Women's Health, as she said that has always been an interest of hers when she worked as an Office Manager of Chiropractic office before she became a Dr. She definitely made me feel better and helped the headache that I had, go away. I will definitely be back to see her and all the staff at Interchange!Oh! And you don't need an appointment, just walk right in!!! Crazy!!! but in a good way!

40.description: Looking for a way to get a great workout that you'll come back for?  This is the place.  The classes are small.  The instructors know you by name and actually notice whether you come or not.  They know your strengths and weaknesses and are very encouraging in helping you progress.  You will never get bored!  The instructors I have had (Nancy and Kathy) change up the routines every time.  So you always get a full-body workout and use some muscles you might not have known you had!I also highly recommend getting a massage with Steve, he was amazing!  He gets deep into your muscles and provides some good stretching as well.

30.description: This place is the complete package.  I was treated weekly (starting around week 24) with chiropractic & accupuncture by Dr. Amanda during my  pregnancy .  I also saw Mary (a.k.a. "miracle Mary") and Bill for weekly massage.  Mary has a delicate, natural touch.  Bill does deep tissue and is a freakin rock star.  I have an autoimmune disease and without the help of the wonderful team at Interchange  I'm not sure that I would have loved pregnancy as much as I did.  THANK-YOU Interchange for representing your name...WELLNESS.

46.description: I've recently started taking pilates classes with a girlfriend at Interchange. The classes break down to about $30 per hour, and I honestly think it's worth it. Far less than a personal training session, and my body feels just as beat when I'm done. The moves look so simple. When Kathy Trainor (seriously her name!) shows the moves, I'm thinking "Jeeze lady, I'm here to work out, not just stretch", but when I need to replicate what she's done, I feel the burn. My girlfriend is much more advanced than I am, but we can do all the same moves so the session flows nicely. She will often do a more advanced move, or go a bit deeper, etc. I'm a total beginner and just really out of shape! (well, not if you consider round a shape...then I'm quite in shape) Kathy's voice is really calm and soothing, and she is very knowledgeable about what moves we're doing, how to avoid getting hurt, and what modifications I can do to still be working the same muscle groups without being able to extend to the full range of motion. The entire gym is first rate. Everyone I've met there is very pleasant and it's not a crazy bustling gym like most others. It's a nice change of pace once a week for my pilates class. I've been twice but I'm sure I'll become an addict and keep buying those 10 week packages!

1.description: I don't understand why they still use the name Interchange Medical Wellness Center since all the signage on the windows indicate a different name. IMWC was a fantastic facility before the new proprietors took over two years ago. You can feel the lack of enthusiasm from the staff, although there has been a complete turnover the last I heard. This is one place where attitudes trickle down from the top. No thanks, I'll take a pass.

9.description: Interchange takes a really comprehensive approach to wellness and does it in a way that isn't pushy with their services. I went in for mid-back issues and was pleased with the therapy and chiropractic services and absolutely impressed with the massage therapy provided by a practitioner named Rene (book in advance, the word is out about her!).They remembered me each time I came in and I never felt like "just' a customer. They also do due diligence on taking notes about your condition and each time you come in to see someone new you see them reading your file and then addressing the specific issues during the treatment. A really nice change of pace from places that just ask a few basic questions and provide standard treatments.Oh - they also were super helpful in working with my insurance to get the treatments covered.

26.description: I think Dr. Patricia Zemaitis might be saving my life.  I've been having problems with my weight, digestion, sleep, etc.  My primary care physician (I have tried two), endocrinologist, allergist, ENT, nutritionist, and personal trainer have had absolutely no answers.  I bought a groupon for food allergy testing (something my allergist says doesn't exist).  After one meeting, Dr. Zemaitis had a diagnosis and a plan.  She was more knowledgeable about thyroid testing than my endocrinologist, more knowledgable about reviewing all my bloodwork than my physician(s), and more helpful than anyone else I have ever met.  For the first time since I started seeing doctors over a year ago, I have a plan to get better.  I cannot recommend her highly enough, or thank them enough.

25.description: Yes, I also bought the Groupon for 3 one hour-long massages for $97.It was pretty bad.  I wouldn't have said anything but I saw that somebody else complained about Tia as well so I guess it wasn't just me.  Unfriendly, rude and a bit intimidating to be quite honest.  She seemed annoyed when I asked her to do it softer and continued to cause excruciating pain with her hands of steel, regardless of my requests to do it softer.  She was abrupt and curt and kept sitting on the side of the massage table as if to take a rest.  I'm pretty sure she kept checking her cell phone for the time as well or maybe she was even texting during the massage.  I did not feel welcome and I did not feel as if my business was appreciated.  I decided to go back but ask this time for somebody different.The next two times I went to Terry.  Now, I feel a bit bad talking poorly about Terry because I really liked him as a person....not so much as a masseuse.  He has really rough hands and a very strange technique.  I'm not sure when my collarbone and pelvic bone started qualifying as back muscles but that's where he focused most of his attention.  That and my arms....which he let hang off the side of the table for so long they started going numb.  My collarbones were literally sore to the touch the next day because he was pushing on them so hard.  He also didn't massage me evenly on both sides and at the end he practically ripped my ears off after squeezing my skull as hard as he could.  Overall, the massage did not feel good and did not do a lot of good for me afterwards physically.As far as the atmosphere, the facility is brand new and looks really nice but there are aeorbics, zoomba and kettlebell classes held in the room right next to the rooms where massages are held i.e. it's very hard to relax when you can hear jock jams blasting through the wall.
