Conclusion: I will never go back to Interchange Medical Wellness Center for a massage because of the attitude and overall poor quality of the massages.  I do not recommend it in the least.

12.description: I feel better than I have in a very long time and I owe much of that to Sergio, Dr. Amanda, and Bill's remarkable hands.  In 1985 I broke my hip.  I was 8 years old.  Luckily my doctors were able to repair the break and after 6 months in a body cast and multiple surgeries I was up and walking again by 1986.  Needless to say my back has been a mess ever since.I have been in and out of chiropractic care for at least the last ten years.  Some with massage, some without.  Thanks to groupon, I made it into Interchange.My first two massages were with Renee.  She was good, but wasn't really getting at the deep tissue spots that needed work.  I asked the receptionist who the strongest massage therapist was and that I wanted to book with them.  She told me his name is Bill and he books out a month in advance.  I was willing to wait, and it was the best thing I ever did.Bill has what I call "magic hands" that somehow know exactly where the flare ups are in the muscle.  By far he has the strongest hands of any massage therapist that has ever worked on me, and I've had well over 50 therapists in the last 20 years. I made an appointment with the chiropractor, Dr. Amanda.  She is awesome.  In all the years of chiropractic care I've had, Dr. Amanda is one of very few who actually took into account what I was saying.  She took the time to really get to the heart of, and understand the problem (my hip) rather than just throwing me on a table pushing on my back here and there and determining that the current issue was caused by something else, somewhere else.  After a full exam and listening to Bill's assessment of the issues with my hip, leg, and back, Dr. Amanda prescribed a regiment of physical therapy with Sergio and massage therapy with Bill.    She LISTENS to her patients.  Pretty amazing stuff this day in age.  I started working on the flexibility issues with Sergio who is a total professional.  He seems to know just where the exact point is when there's no more stretch to give.  He is balanced in his techniques and varies the routines that we do regularly.  The best part about working with Sergio is that in addition to his strong knowledge base of the body, he knows his movies and pop culture.  No matter how much a particular stretch hurts (it's the good hurt, nothing that's easy does any good) he can distract you enough so that you can push through to the next level.  Bill's massages are the deepest deep tissue massages I have ever had.  He somehow hits trigger points that other therapists either glossed over or didn't know were there.  It's like he has sonar and can just see the knots with his eyes.  The strength in his hands in unmatched.  I know that he wants to be a therapist for a professional sports team and work on athletes, but selfishly I hope it never happens because what about me?  Seriously I can't say enough about how awesome this guy is at what he does.  I want to be clear; I have not had a relaxation massage from Bill.  He has only performed therapeutic massage focusing specifically on problem areas.  If relaxation is what you're looking for, you don't need the powerhouse that are Bill's hands.In the last 2 months since I started going to Interchange on a regular basis I have noticed decreased pain throughout my back, neck, and shoulders.  I am stronger in my core and can tell the difference in the way that my body moves as I walk.  Much of the pain I was having were a direct result of the tightness of muscles nowhere near the location of the pain.  For as crazy as that may sound, I believe the body is a whole system, not just individual parts.  I feel better than I have in a very long time and I owe much of that to Sergio, Dr. Amanda, and Bill's remarkable hands.

21.description: I've been going to Interchange for about eight months now and love it!  I purchased a Groupon, or something of the sort to try the group fitness classes.  I tried "Hit It" with Leslie and have been coming back every since!  It's a high intensity kickboxing workout that can be modified to your level with great music and great people.  I'm exhausted afterward, but always leave feeling like I've had a productive workout putting me one step closer to my fitness goals.  The space is contemporary and always clean.  The locker rooms and amenities are great.  The fitness room is on the smaller side, which means smaller classes, which makes makes it more personal for me.  The lady usually at the front desk is friendly and remembers my name when I come to check in.  Their online scheduling is super convenient.  They are a little pricey, but definitely manageable if you can get one of their specials or groupons and such.

17.description: I've had a few massages in my relatively short life and this was one of the best. Dieandra (sp?) was excellent! She listened to what I wanted to concentrate on during the session and really tailored the experience to what my body needed (and it needed a lot!) and the massage did not feel like a generic routine for her. I definitely plan on coming back to see her in the future!

10.description: I'm sure this place is fabulous for its exercises classes, but I wouldn't be running there for any spa services. That is assuming you want to relax, and ahem, if you're going to the spa, wouldn't you be there specifically to relax?This place is in a great location (biased because I live nearby), but it is at the corner of Roosevelt and Wabash near the Red, Orange & Green lines so pretty great transportation-wise. You'll have to be buzzed in when you arrive and if you're taking the elevator you'll need to go to 2R. The space itself is a beautiful, modern loft space...and go figure when you're entering a wellness center wouldn't you want to be watching "Two and a Half Men" on the plasma? Sets the tone for relaxation right?While my massage was fine (basic room, no frills which is totally OK) I could not relax because there was a Zumba class going on the entire time. The massage was about 40 minutes (I'd booked for an hour) and though my masseuse was pleasant enough she said "you'll get used to the noise". Really? Not so much. Upon check out the receptionist could not have been less friendly. She didn't ask how my service was. She thought it was strange that I asked when a more quite time to come back would be. She said they don't have any change (for a $5 - not even a $20!) I had a Groupon for 3 1-hour massages here and I won't be back. I won't recommend it and sadly I won't try any of their other services either based on my not so warm interactions with the receptionist.I understand you can get overwhelmed with service from a Groupon, but this is one place that is sorely under prepared for the flow of clients that they'll be receiving from the website and if they want to have more happy customers they'll have to make some changes.

5.description: This place is a lovely space, great location, with a friendly staff.  So why the 3 star review?  I have a love/hate relationship with their Zumba classes.The Zumba classes are fun, a great workout, and taught be great instructors.  But the space is too damn small for the number of people they put in it.  You need a lot of room to do Zumba, and this is a small awkward space that they fill with people.  I understand they have a great class with a high demand, but jamming the room with people makes it less fun, less of a workout, and less appealing.

3.description: This used to a great place for group fitness classes and personal training. But then they got rid of the classes and exercise equipment, and tuned this place into a chiropractor/acupuncture office only. What a shame!

35.description: Revising my original review -  I still wouldn't under any circumstance come here for a massage after 3-4pm due to the noise from the classes (very irritating when you are trying to relax) but if you can schedule a lunch-time massage, I HIGHLY recommend Letitia - she is fantastic!

19.description: love kettlebell at this place with Kathy, also love the power HIT class on Sat AMif you want your butt kicked come to these classeshowever they must have gotten quite popular over the past couple of weeks, there seems to be a waiting list for these classes every timeand if u want spin class, forget it, sign up like 2 weeks ahead of time otherwise you get wait listed.thats probably the only downside..oh and parking...seriously 4 bucks to park on the street for an hour?!  wish they had a lot we could uselove the workouts here for sure!

28.description: I found out about Interchange after purchasing a Swoop - one that I almost didn't use.  What a loss that would have been!!!  I've been going to the group exercise (Ripped on a Budget) and Spin classes for about 6 months now and I have definitely noticed an improvement in the way my body looks and feels.  My first Spin class was intense!!!!  I thought I was going to pass out but I LOVED it.  I'd never taken spin before, but I was hooked!!!  Kathy is AMAZING!!!! and she's nice.  Not just superficially nice, but genuinely nice.  She's a great instructor and she makes the classes hard - but fun.  You definitely get your money's worth from a GREAT workout. The classes are also very challenging and no routine is the same.  I'm always surprised by some of the things she comes up with. This is really good for me because I bore easily.  Working out at Interchange w/Kathy is something I really enjoy and look forward to.  There aren't many things you can say that about that start at 6a.

45.description: Another GREAT reason to love October's Pretty in Pink promotions!  I live and work north of this area so wouldn't normally be over there, but I saw a terrific deal and wanted to try out a new place. The offer was $31 for a REAL facial and $31 for an HOUR massage. Unheard of, I know. The outside of the building is nothing special, located just off of the Rooselvelt Red Line stop,  so I was wary seeing it, but the inside is so pretty! It's got a very relaxing vibe and is a very clean, pretty lofty space.Renee, the resident esthetician, is wonderfully warm and friendly. She recommended some affordable products for my skin type and talked me through everything she was doing during the facial. Next up was Eddie.....   best. massage. ever. Not even kidding. I got manhandled and I liked it! My back has been warm and tingly for the past 36 hours, in a good way. This man knows what he is doing! I can't imagine going to anyone else again.If I had to change anything it would be a dimmer light in the massage room so as to totally zone out and maybe some soundproofing as the boxing class is directly next door and all the grunts and yells were a little distracting. BUT, no matter. The services were professional, the space is classy and I will definitely be back to this South Loop med spa for future visits.

33.description: Bottom Line - I am a fan of Interchange Medical Wellness.  Let me count the ways.  :-)VISUALLY - I am a visual person, so it was important for me to visit the center before booking an appointment.  Upon walking in, I was immediately impressed.  The space has been nicely appointed with a minimalist eye and immediately lends itself to a calming atmosphere.THE FRONT DESK -  I love the people at the front desk.   No matter who I get at the front desk, I am always greeted with a warm reception and they are always eager to be of assistance.  That is my first impression and it never fails me. CHIROPRACTIC CARE - I have been seeing Dr. Patricia Zemaitis for chiropractic care over the past several months.  I initially went in for migraines.  I appreciate that she is well-read and does a great job of balancing traditional chiropractic care and new-age chiropractic care.  Her approach is whollistic and she a sincere overall concern for your well-being.  MASSAGES - I have seen both Bill Underwood and Renee and they are both great!  :-)  When booking an appointment, you may have to book a few weeks in advance - these two are always in high demand.  Bill offers a great deep tissue massage.  If you need deep tissue, you must see Bill.  Renee is equally as great and she offers a combination massage and facial.  I had this package with Renee and the facial was perfection.  My skin was amazing for days to come.  TIMING OF MASSAGES - If you are coming for a "SPA DAY" or Utilizing a coupon from "GROUPON", please, please, please ask them to book your massage around a time that will maximize your relaxtion.  If seeking relaxation, I would not recommend coming in during the busiest time of the day for a massage.  I typically come in for deep-tissue and muscle relaxation with Bill and Renee and noise levels have never been a concern - but I can not speak for everyone.PILATES - I had never taken pilates before, so having one on one sessions with Steve and Kathy was a great introduction.  With patience, I watched my body grow in strength. As opposed to pilates classes in the gym, this instruction is led with a mix of the equipment and the mat work.   If you've never utilized the equipment, you should at least try it once - it'll give you a glimpse of what your body should be able to do on the mat.  Steve is into traditional STOTT Pilates and prides himself on teaching you about the process.  If you are looking to learn and grow, Steve is a great option.  Kathy is also great.  I saw her when I first started attending pilates.  She has a balanced tone and really listens to you as you move through the session.   They both offer Single or Group Instruction.AMENITIES - They provide water.  There are also showers, towels, and a flat panel television in the women's bathroom.  (Can't speak on the view inside the men's bathroom).  The bathrooms are clean and pleasant.  (So Important!)OTHER CLASSES - I have not attended their group exercise classes.  I am considering joining the "Walk to Run" club with Bill Underwood that will meet on Saturday Mornings at 7:30am.  Currently, he has a running club that meets on Friday evenings.Interchange Medical Wellness does an excellent job of balancing the many aspects that can affect the "Wellness" of their clients.   While they are not a spa, they do offer spa-like benefits without the spa-like pricing.  And as a bonus, you'll find that everyone in there is a semi fitness nut and has some information about something fitness related.  Ask a question and you'll be surprised at the wealth of knowledge you might get from anyone in there.   :-)

43.description: What a great environment to work out in!  The classes are challenging enough for experienced athletes, and the instructors make them accessible for new exercisers, too.  Kathy is amazing!  The kettlebell classes will whip you right into shape.  The space is clean, light, and full of energy, and is really conducive to a holistic sense of wellness - not the typical gym, just looking for volume of members!

2.description: Shake that booty! Or, if you've come to the fitness classes here, you may not be able to shake anything because you've been working out so much.  I really like their fitness classes.  Is it the biggest space?  Not at all.  Is it the most high tech place?  Not a chance.  Is all of the equipment the best?  Hmm, not really.  Is there a good shower room?  Yep, not at all.  I go home to shower. BUT, I like this place!  They work you and they work you hard.  I started here on a discount deal and haven't left yet.  Plus, every once in awhile they offer a great deal internally which I've definitely taken advantage of.  To wrap this up, my booty is looking fine!

18.description: Bought a Groupon for three massages.  Went on vacation to Chicago and got to use two while I was there.  Everything went well from the time I called to schedule the appointments till the time I finished my second massage.  Terry did both of my massages and did a great job.  I had stiffness in my neck, shoulder and back and he found it and worked it out.  He explained what he found and what he was working on during the massages and after.  He also gave me recommendations of what to do as far as maintenance.  The staff was great and friendly.  Will do it again.  Also, the office is above a Trader Joe's.

41.description: this morning i went for spin class - oh man that class is worth every penny!  The instructor was really nice, good workout songs, very courteous fellow students, and the instructor came prepared with a program and kept us working the whole hour!  Yes, the full hour, not 45min and 15min stretching and such...that is great value for my money!  love it and will attend next session -even if it means waking up early on a sunday morning to go attend the 8:30am class!!!

50.description: Run, don't walk, to this place.  Kathy T. is the personal trainer/fitness director and one of the owners and she is awesome.  Lots of great group classes really reasonably priced.  Personal training.  Pilates studio and mat classes.  Cardio equipment.  It just opened. You can just walk in and take classes and not worry about a monthly membership or initiation fee. Second floor above where Sam's used to be on the corner of Wabash and Roosevelt.  The opening night party was packed!

4.description: I made an appointment for a massage but when I arrived at the front desk I was told the masseur had to cancel.  I understand that things may come up but they didn't even seem to care about the inconvenience I went through to get to the location by train.  They never tried to offer another person to take care of me, nor did they try to reschedule for another time.  I have been to this location 3 other times and things went fine.  I was surprised that they never even asked to reschedule or give me a discount on the next massage for my inconvenience, but either way, I will not be returning to this location.  If you are looking for a spa this is not the location.  You change in the same room you get the massage in.  For some people that is an issue.....not really for me, but I thought I would let you all know anyway so you can make a better decision if that's not what you are looking for.

6.description: Oh lordie....so I shouldve known there was going to be problems when I tried to make an appointment online and it didnt work.  That site is a disaster...just call, but then thats a bit of a disaster too.  I was placed on hold for 10mins, hung up and called back.  It then took about 20 mins on the phone to make the apptmt.  I guess they were experiencing problems with their software....which was annoying.  I could tell that the woman on the phone was frustrated...So I finally got the apptmt made...YAYYAYAYAAYA!Parking...its street parking....BOO but there is some free spots right out front just be careful of the tow zones between 7-9AM and 4-6PM.  Other than that metered spaces that is pretty easy.Space...well its kind of a 'gym' type atmosphere gone spa-ish....The room for the facial was pretty standard...no heating pad but everything else was there.  There was relaxing music playing, etc.  However, you can hear people working out outside of the room so its not 100% ambiance, but its also not that badFacial...it was good.  I had a gift certificate from a previous spa event that I had went to for $75.  I received the vitamin c facial.  I got there at 330.  Filled out paperwork til 335 went back to room, changed, etc and Renee talked to me about my face...not sure of the time now.  We did the facial and was ready to get dressed at 425.  Its supposed to be a 50 min treatment, which I am pretty sure it was not.  Now, I didnt pay anything bc the gc covered the cost so I cant complain.  However, if I had paid for the treatment, I would be disappointed in the less than 50 mins for $75.  Renee was helpful and not pushy.  Her technique was pretty standard...nothing special.  She gave suggestions for my face post and didnt push product, which is nice.I liked the facial...didnt love it enough to go back.

22.description: I have heard great things about this place. I was not disappointed. I took a group exercise class and it was great! The facility is clean and very modern. Andre the instructor was an excellent instructor. I will definitely be taking class here!  I have also taken Ripped on a Budget and Kettle Ball classes with Kathy.  The class are great, I had a wonderful workout. Kathy is amazing!

15.description: Interchange has been disappointing me lately. They have been canceling a lot of classes lately, especially the Zumba classes. They even cancelled all of their Sunday group exercise sessions. I hope they get their act together soon. It is only a matter of time before their regulars move to another gym, I am definitely looking for another place when I am done with my pre paid group exercise classes. Very disappointing Interchange!!!

20.description: I've been coming to IMWC for over a year for massage, pilates and most recently accupuncture and facials. They accept insurance too! I can't say enough good things about everyone I've dealt with here.  I love that you can book appointments online, it makes scheduling so much easier!

36.description: I've been going to Interchange for about 6 months now for chiropractic, massage and individual pilates sessions and feel great improvement in my posture and physique. Amanda, the chiro, is really down to earth and makes practical suggestions and Steve, the Pilates instructor has been really flexible with my ever-changing schedule. I have to say that as a former college athlete, I didn't think much of Pilates until I tried it. I have had such great success, especially with Pilates Reformer. The toning and stretching of the muscles just doesn't happen in other kinds of exercise methods. I feel great.

14.description: I've recently started taking pilates classes with a girlfriend at Interchange. The classes break down to about $30 per hour, and I honestly think it's worth it. Far less than a personal training session, and my body feels just as beat when I'm done. The moves look so simple. When Kathy Trainor (seriously her name!) shows the moves, I'm thinking "Jeeze lady, I'm here to work out, not just stretch", but when I need to replicate what she's done, I feel the burn. My girlfriend is much more advanced than I am, but we can do all the same moves so the session flows nicely. She will often do a more advanced move, or go a bit deeper, etc. I'm a total beginner and just really out of shape! (well, not if you consider round a shape...then I'm quite in shape) Kathy's voice is really calm and soothing, and she is very knowledgeable about what moves we're doing, how to avoid getting hurt, and what modifications I can do to still be working the same muscle groups without being able to extend to the full range of motion. The entire gym is first rate. Everyone I've met there is very pleasant and it's not a crazy bustling gym like most others. It's a nice change of pace once a week for my pilates class. I've been twice but I'm sure I'll become an addict and keep buying those 10 week packages!

12.description: Love, love, love.  H&M down the street from me.  At the moment, this one is super easy to shop in because only the South Loop dwellers are shopping here, but I think once the Roosevelt Collection word gets out, it's all over.  The employees in here that I've talked to are very excited to be in more of a locals area.  That way they can develop a relationship with their repeat customers, instead of dumb tourists all the time who they'll never lay eyes on again.The only downside is the wait.  At the H&Ms on Michigan and State the lines for the dressing rooms and checkout are horrendous.  Here the dressing rooms are great and no wait.  But I suppose because of the lack of traffic, the wait to checkout still blows because they have one person at a time on the register.  Though there are a ton of people running around on the floor - but I don't know if all their staff is register trained....All-in-all though, H&M use to be a place I went if I had a weekday off or I left work early due to the crowds.  Here it actually makes browsing possible!

7.description: My review is based upon the service, or should I say, lack thereof.Gather 'round...Stopped in this location for the first time today.  It's Monday, 11:15 am.  Store is empty, except for one other customer, the security guard and handful of employees.I proceed upstairs to the children's section to pick up some shirts for my tween boys.  I walked around and then headed downstairs to the checkout.When I got downstairs there were three associates, one of which was the manager,  all crowded around one register trying to figure out how to help a foreigner navigate his mobile apps presumably for something related to H&M.Mind you, the store is empty and there are THREE staff members at the counter.  The manager neglected to even acknowledge the waiting customers.  The appropriate response would've been to move over to one of the other registers and help the waiting customers while the staff continued with the first customer.  It doesn't take THREE people to help one customer.  I've worked in retail, I promise you it doesn't.  So, after waiting nearly 7 minutes in an EMPTY store for him and his staff to remember his customer service training I said, "pardon me, is there another register?"He dismissively side-eyed me and said, "oh, yeah, just a minute."  On top of all the other minutes I've already waited? 0_oWhoa.  In a perfect world a trap door would've opened and he would've headed straight to Customer Serviceland for 100 hours of intensive training.  My transaction would've taken a mere minute; ring 2 shirts, swipe my card, drop the shirts in a bag and head out the door.  Name tags rock.  His said, "John."So I dropped the shirts I intended to buy and headed to the door.  Fortunately, Roosevelt is full of other retail establishments that value their customers.However, the highlight of the experience was the kind, older gentlemen, security guard who saw my dissatisfaction as I left and apologized.John you out to know better.  You should care about servicing  customers in a timely manner.  Brick 'n Mortar stores are losing revenue to their online counterparts.  Customers won't waste their time and energy in a store when they aren't shown even the basic of courtesy and service. If he can't manage the check-out line properly with two associates and an empty store, how will you manage it on a busy weekend?I'll never know.  I won't be back.

19.description: I don't care much for H & M but just left the theater and saw this new store opened. I docked one star because as new as it is, there are dust bunnies in the fitting room. Less chaotic than the H & M on State St.

1.description: Slowest checkout ever! 2 registers open before Christmas? Come on H&M. Also incredibly unorganized. Please hire more staff to pick up the slack.

2.description: This location is very consistent in having only one cashier working with a 20+ minute wait to checkout. You must really want something badly to shop this location- Michigan Ave and State Street stores have way better management clearly.

9.description: Horrible customer service. Reached a store. Manager told me he wouldn't look for an item for 45 minutes. I called back and was told to call tomorrow with the tags for the #s. Girl answering today says numbers from my online ordered sweater will not work in store. Hold on. Now new girl picks up phone. She says she'll know by description, something I tried yesterday. Ok start again. No they don't carrythis line in her store, as revealed by material tag on inside of sweater.  Reccomends calling another store on Roosevelt. Ok, can I have the number please.  No we don't have store numbers. Here's customer service. After several prompts reach another person who says no more phone calls to stores, also no sweater, and no this huge sweater (size S) does not come in XS. Ok send this huge sweater and other too small sweaterback through mail and be charged again for shipping!  No fun.

6.description: It's a nice H&M store by the Icon Threater. I enjoy being able to browse around the store after a movie night. I haven't purchased anything yet but I hope to shop around there again.

18.description: Get it while its hot

10.description: Clothes geared towards high school and  college kids. Low quality, chic. Understaffed, but it's easy to find what you're looking for.

13.description: I am new to the area but not to H&M. Their stock is great, especially their kids section.. however their staff is pretty rude! A bunch of young kids (not really surprised, this is retail) with a terrible attitude. Like they'd rather be anywhere else. Do us a favor then, kids, get a job somewhere else so someone who would be happy to work can have yours! I complained to management about the cashier here. So rude.

16.description: I usually avoid the downtown Chicago H&M locations because of how much foot traffic and messy the clothing is in the store. This store didn't have that problem. It was very clean and organized.

17.description: Great H&M!  I prefer this location over State St and Michigan Ave.  It has more selection and is less crowded, so you can actually shop leisurely and not worry about waiting for a dressing room (even on the weekend).  Sheena was so helpful and nice and helped find exactly what I was looking for. In addition, there are other stores within this complex, a theater and free parking underground.

15.description: The staff on the floor just talk to each other rather than the guests. Only one cashier per floor 10 days before Christmas?! Get your head out of your ass. I don't have 20 minutes to stand in line to check out.

0.description: More quiet and clean than the State St and Michigan Ave locations although I'm not sure how long that will last. The employees here seem to have a more pleasant and upbeat demeanor than the other locations.Roosevelt Collection has free parking - for a limited time so get there while you can!

5.description: Horrible customer service I went to get a full refund on an item with the receipt and was told I had to get a store credit.  Now mind you the item wasn't over 30 days and before purchasing the item, I asked  the saleswoman what was the return policy. ..it's sad when the manager of this environment is telling me that there's nothing she can do and that I should read the back of the receipt...really I know forever 21 will tell or ask you. About their policy.  Really nice people skills.  So now I'm stuck with a freakin  $33 store credit.  I told everyone I know about this store stay away.They get no rating no stars

11.description: Less crowded and quieter than their other stores in Chicago.  Selection comparable to their loop location.  Parking very easy to find.  Staff though lazy and completely uninterested in doing their jobs.  No motivation to help in any way.  Robot employees would be more helpful and friendly

8.description: This store never has enough registers open.  I'm here waiting in a line of 10 people while there is one register open, and the registers upstairs are closed as well.  Not worth your time.

3.description: Lackluster staff with poor customer service. They just seem so miserable. Parking is free but you must purchase an item for validation. The store is clean and well stocked

14.description: Empty! Free Parking! Won't last long though....

4.description: They seriously need more employees.  Every time I come here it takes at least fifteen to twenty minutes to check out. The line is around the corner, and there is only two registers opened.

0.description: Tiara is amazing. I won't see anyone else for my brows! She's personable and does a great job!

3.description: This place has pretty good chinese food. We could have gone to Chinatown for the more authentic stuff, but it was too far to get to so we ended up at Chop Sticks. The restaurant is located right next to the CTA Orange/Green line Roosevelt stop. Super convenient! They have lunch specials and dinner specials at reasonable prices. The portions were also very good. We ordered the Szechuan chicken, Hunan chicken, and mongolian beef dinner special. The food tasted good and it was not overly greasy or salty. Service was fast. They quoted us a 15-20 minute wait and when we arrived to pick up our food it was ready for us. The place accepts credit cards with a $10 minimum and also delivers.Their carry out menu says you can order online but you really can't because their website doesnt work. Also their carry out menu has coupons but you can't use it if you order any specials (like the lunch or dinner special).Definitely my next go to place for Chinese food when I'm craving it and too lazy to go to Chinatown.PS. This place does NOT use MSG. Thats awesome!

1.description: I honestly did not know it was even possible to make Chinese food THIS flavorless. It tastes like what you'd expect to get at a Chinese restaurant in some far off, podunk town. It tastes like nothing and somehow smells akin to a tub of Crisco. I spent around $30 on delivery and the only edible item was the egg roll (which, btw, had something hard in it which I'm HOPING was a chicken bone). The only reason I gave it two stars vs. one is because at least the food seems like it came from a clean place, and they use all white meat / non-fatty chicken.  Note: It appears that Chop Sticks is this place operating under a new name: yelp.com/biz/yang-restau…

2.description: Soy sauce.  Grease.  Almost 24/7.  Open on Holidays.  SPECIALS and COMBO is the best value for $$.MONGOLIAN BEEF -- a good amount of decently chopped white onions, a few green onions and slimy (as it should be, w/o too much coating, a sign of true chinese cooking ;-) ).Lunch Egg Roll was happily accepted and shared with a homeless person while still warm.VENUE -- cluttered.  Some order in the self service station.  Clean sauce spouts.  Table cleanup is observed.SERVICE -- counter service.  One man show.

5.description: The beef noodle soup here is excellent.  For some reason, it's hard to find good Chinese food outside of Chinatown.  This place is the exception.  It's also really  convenient (next to the Roosevelt EL stop).

0.description: This is what was formerly Yang's Chinese. I reviewed them but as they're closed I figured I could review their new incarnation.A lot hasn't changed. I've been ordering from this place since 2006 - 2007. The food is usually good for a simple take-out faux-Chinese place in America. Most of the time they deliver the food still hot and usually they follow special instructions (NOT SPICY! NOT SPICY!). I've had a few times when they didn't, and a couple of times when the food that arrived had a really extra-vinegar-flavor to it that I didn't appreciate - different cooks?Overall, though, quite good. I never hesitate to order up some Grub from them when I'm starving and need a bit of fried rice and heart-clogging chicken.

4.description: I basically hate ALL Chicago Chinese food. I'm a veg and my boyfriend is a manhattanite - thus making us Chinese food snobs. This place is the best. We got Szechuan tofu and veggies, sesame chicken, and assorted egg rolls. Everything was delicious and it took about 7 mins to be ready. Sold! LOVE this place!

1.description: I'm rounding up to 4 stars because I want this place to do well in the South Loop. But a more accurate scoring of my review would be 3.5 stars.I called ahead on a Sunday to find out how late the store would be open.  I was told 9pm.  I was expecting a large assortment of donuts (to last until 9pm) but the options were slim. They had sold out of a lot of donuts by 1pm. I was disappointed.  Thankfully there were some things that looked interesting so I didnt walk away empty handed.  Out of the slim pickings, I ordered the last strawberry bismark (donut stuffed with strawberry jam) and a blueberry fritter. Surprisingly both were very good.  The strawberry jam in the strawberry bismark was not overly sweet and had a good amount inside the donut.  The donut itself was still fluffy.  The blueberry fritter tasted good and was not overly greasy.  However, I could barely find any blueberries in it. At $2.55 a piece, I found the prices to be quite reasonable.The inside of the store looked very quaint.  There was limited seating with some chairs and even a sofa.Hopefully the next time I visit here there will be a larger assortment of donuts to choose from.

9.description: 5/5  for the doughnuts -  delicious, fresh, hard to resist. Coffee is intelligentsia, but it isn't brewed the best but still 4/5. Either way if you're hankering for a soft and satisfying donut hit this place up! The strawberry jelly one is my favorite amongst the other amazing coconut and pistachio donut. Go to stans today! It's everything you'd ever hope it would be!

23.description: After visiting their Wicker Park location several times, I was anxiously awaiting the opening of Stan's Donuts in the South Loop!  It's a relatively small shop, and the pricing is a bit high and confusing (for example, if you order an assortment, you have to choose a certain number of donuts from each category).  However, the donuts and coffee are both excellent, the service is friendly, and I'm very happy to have this place in the neighborhood!

12.description: I like Stan's Donuts quite a bit, but my first experience at the new South Loop location was a disappointment.  They put two donuts in a bag next to each other, not bothering to separate them with one of those liner sheets.  The result was that two different flavored donuts got a bit mixed together on the walk home.  Worse yet, the blueberry donut was either put in the bag upside down (which I suspect) or ended up that way after my walk home (though I was very careful about not disturbing the bag and held it upright the entire time).  The result was that I opened the bag to find the blueberry donut upside down with all the frosting stuck to the bottom of the bag instead of on top of the donut where it belonged.  For a gourmet donut shop where your average donut is around $3, they need to train the employees better on such basic things.

21.description: They have a nice assortment of donuts that are fresh and not over bearing with ingredients.  Just the right proportion of frosting/glaze/sprinkles etc. to dough.  They also have amazing gelato shakes.  I was thinking of giving it 4 stars because the price point was kind of high, but decided it was worth it given what designer donuts are going for these days.

16.description: 1 star because the long line only for ordering 1 star because the line for paying the doughnut1 star because of poor costumer service. No clue about it.1 star because the doughnut itself... It was hard and overly sweet1 star because of the price ... Almost $4 for one doughnut.I am sorry... But I did not like this place nor the doughnut.

17.description: Meh. My expectations weren't even that high, and I was still let down. They were out of donuts and the very nice employee said their shipment would be there in 10 minutes (YUM, shipment, sounds fresh) we waited. The pistachio donut tastes so sweet and artificially flavored. It leaves a thick reside in your mouth and a disgusting aftertaste. The old fashioned are painfully sweet. I ate HALF and I'm nauseous. I'll stick to REAL bakeries with fresh donuts and old fashioned recipes like Reuter's Bakery in Chicago! Now those are donuts.

10.description: Stan's Donuts has opened right by another CTA stop, making it easier for me to take in treats to the office :)Donuts are the same as in other locations, old favorites like the old fashioned glazed in their multitude of flavors, and all kinds of Stan's specialty donuts too - Nutella Banana Pocket or Blueberry Danish anyone? This location is smaller than others in the city, but it's cozy and lovely! Step in and gather your munchies from the case in direct line of sight from the entrance, get a drink - they were handing out raspberry white hot chocolate samples when I went in!! - clamber onto one of the tables there and indulge in sinfully delicious fresh donuts! The staff here is great! Ask for recommendations if you're uncertain. They also carry gluten free donuts, if that's how you roll!

5.description: This place would have gotten a five star from me and they didn't because of variety. I went at 7 pm in the evening and they only had about 4 types of donuts. The staff is friendly and very helpful.  The donuts are delicious. I had them warm up the apple fritter for me and I was in heaven. They also serve coffee.

11.description: This is my third visit since this location has opened. The blueberry Bismarck is the absolute best and must try, strawberry is also tasty and currently snacking on the cinnamon sugar. Just a pit pricey for my tastes. The chai tea is sweeter than I usually like, but I am rooting for them to find their footing because the service is great and they are a welcome addition to the south loop

22.description: Stan's Donuts has opened right by another CTA stop, making it easier for me to take in treats to the office :)Donuts are the same as in other locations, old favorites like the old fashioned glazed in their multitude of flavors, and all kinds of Stan's specialty donuts too - Nutella Banana Pocket or Blueberry Danish anyone? This location is smaller than others in the city, but it's cozy and lovely! Step in and gather your munchies from the case in direct line of sight from the entrance, get a drink - they were handing out raspberry white hot chocolate samples when I went in!! - clamber onto one of the tables there and indulge in sinfully delicious fresh donuts! The staff here is great! Ask for recommendations if you're uncertain. They also carry gluten free donuts, if that's how you roll!

0.description: Yummmmm! The temptation to try some of the exotic flavors was resisted in order to truly be order to compare this place's donuts to others.  So,  I ordered the classics apple fritter and strawberry jelly.  The apple fritter was full of delicious apple flavor like biting into apple pie  (I asked then to warm it up for me. )  The jelly filled donut is just that. A donut  STUFFED with jelly! But not that cheap florescent yellow, red, etc goo that other parlors sell, and that (who are we kidding) just taste like diabetes.  Stan's jelly donut is delicious  jelly  (seeds and all) that is not overly sweet.  The coffee is also really good.  My only issue is the costs,  over $14 for 2 coffees and 2 donuts just feels excessive. Overall,  so glad they brought this stand to the Midwest. ... welcome to the South Loop Stan.... so glad you're here!

20.description: I LOVE doughnuts and really wanted to love this place but it was an epic disappointment. The doughnuts were burnt and hard. The workers also did not seem to know what they were doing. I ordered two doughnuts and the woman got both of them wrong. The lady at the cash register also did not know how to work it. I'm adding an extra star for the variety, but I'll stick to my Firecakes for now.

19.description: I LOVE doughnuts and really wanted to love this place but it was an epic disappointment. The doughnuts were burnt and hard. The workers also did not seem to know what they were doing. I ordered two doughnuts and the woman got both of them wrong. The lady at the cash register also did not know how to work it. I'm adding an extra star for the variety, but I'll stick to my Firecakes for now.

2.description: Stan's is my favorite donut place in the city so I'm beyond thrilled to have it in my neighborhood. In the first week of opening, I went at least three or four times.The buttermilk bar is the best donut they have. You must try it. (But not all of you okay? Because it makes me sad when they run out.)Love that they have Stumptown cold brew on tap. I'll definitely take advantage of that in warmer months!

18.description: i was in the area looking for a washroom which starbucks across the street didnt have. so i came into stans donuts and coffee, which only permits washroom use for customers. i went ahead and bought a nutellla bananna pocket and a coffee.the donut itself has a light cream graze on top with crunchy vanilla chip grains and it is smothered with chocolate. the breading itself taste like a crosant. and inside the crosant there is a banana fudge cream.one of these will definitely fill your appepite and sugar fix. i will certainly buy another in the near future. oh yeah, their mens washroom was clean and they have a cool hand dryer called the "air blade"

13.description: Eh....while I like a couple of their donunts, the buttermilk bar and pistachio glazed, the rest are really not worth the price.  Guess part of the issue is the chocolate.  It's got a very strange taste to it that, in my opinion, ruins the donut.  All in all, as a treat, maybe I'd go back, but this would not be my 'go to' place for donuts.

4.description: Finally it opened in the Roosevelt Train station and my husband brought home 1/2 a dozen assorted donuts. I almost never eat donuts but coudlnt help eating 1/2 pistachio and nutella donuts. I really enjoyed both, quality is good but i wish they were made of butter instead of hydrogenated fats.Will be getting some donuts again for sure!

6.description: I was in Chicago for a weekend with my girlfriends, and while at brunch, kept watching people walking down the street with pink donut boxes.  After breakfast, I needed to see for myself.  First of all, the place was packed and smelled heavenly.  We chose a plain glazed (for control), one toffee, and a lemon curd.  After a wander through town, we went back to our hotel and shared all three.   They were fantastic!  My favorite was the lemon curd, with a yummy, tart filling.  My only regret is not buying 3 more for my flight home.  A must!

15.description: I wondered in here this past Sunday and it was really poppin! I heard a lot of great things about Stan's so I thought I give it a try. I bought two donuts one for me and my mother, one peanut butter pocket and a blueberry fritter. I had the peanut butter pocket and it was pretty good. I would say that the peanut butter filling was a bit dry... However I love the rich chocolate flavor that accompanies it! My mom enjoyed her blueberry fritter though! I will go back and try another flavor...

7.description: Doughnut lover beware of the sugar shock you will go into after a doughnut here!Here are all the doughnuts I have tried:Peanut butter pocket - AMAZING!! Leaves your mouth shut with a huge amount of peanut butter that craves a cold glass of milk.  The chocolate glaze on top is perfect pairingBoston Cream - Dark chocolate leaves you with a bitter aftertaste that I loved and the custard was made perfectly.  The doughnut was light and fluffyDreamsicle - Awful...there was WAY too much sugar glaze and the orange filling was grainy with sugar. I would have preferred a orange custard filling rather than one that tasted like sugary orange fanta frosting.Lemon Pistachio Old Fashion - unique and good.  The cake doughnut was done very well and the pistachio was a great flavor.  I didn't taste any lemon but overall I would order this again.Toffee cake - WAY too much glaze to get the toffee to stick and it felt lost.  The toffee wasn't that great and I truly felt like the glaze over powered the doughnut.Captain Crunch Bismark - Very underwhelming.  Pretty much a sugar glazed doughnut with cream filling and a few captain crunch cereals on top.  Would be better if they had crumbled the captain crunch and coated the top or even had some in the middle.Buttermilk Bar - once again WAY too much glaze!  The cake doughnut should be the shining star and it's lost in a overly sugary glaze.Blueberry Fritter - the Blueberry was a great variation on a apple fritter but AGAIN way too much glaze.  Beignet pair- Delicious! Great if eaten when warm.  Light and airy with the perfect amount of powdered sugar.  Definitely not Cafe Du Monde but a great option.Overall, very underwhelmed with the fact that they have a plethora of doughnuts to select from I was only satisfied with a few.  I am a doughnut NUT and this was sad to see so many doughnuts done so poorly.  I think Stan's does a great job with their pocket doughnuts because there is no sugar glazed involved but the rest...buyer beware that these doughnut will leave your stomach feeling sick and a sugar high that you will crash and burn from with regret later.  Your tastebuds will only taste SUGAR.  The doughnut and other complimenting flavors do not come through on many of these selections.I also have to warn those that go to this location and are in a hurry or ordering many doughnuts to watch their receipts! I was charged for a doughnut I never received!!  When I brought it to their attention on my visit back they only said "Well enjoy your doughnuts today"  Also doughnuts were poorly arranged in the boxes...placing a chocolate glazed doughnut under a wrapper leaves you with a doughnut with no glaze!?!Pricing of these doughnuts is pretty similar to what else is out there.With all the competition out there I will not be making an effort to go back....

8.description: $3.30 is kinda pricy for one of their specialty donuts but it was pretty tasty. They also serve Intelligentsia coffee which is a huge plus!

3.description: My friend will kill me if he see's me giving Stan's a 3, but I have to be honest. It's not one of my favorite donut spots. I don't know if the donuts I keep choosing happen to be stale, but they don't taste fresh like other donut spots I go to.

14.description: After visiting their Wicker Park location several times, I was anxiously awaiting the opening of Stan's Donuts in the South Loop!  It's a relatively small shop, and the pricing is a bit high and confusing (for example, if you order an assortment, you have to choose a certain number of donuts from each category).  However, the donuts and coffee are both excellent, the service is friendly, and I'm very happy to have this place in the neighborhood!

3.description: I don't join clubs - ever - but I joined theirs after getting my initial 1 hour service by TJ. The front desk people were pleasant and engaging. I was in severe pain walking in to the place and left almost pain free. Kudos to TJ who listened to where I said my pain was and working to eliminate it! Thank you. I cannot wait to go back.

1.description: I booked a last minute massage and enjoyed it. I was happy that they had a cancellation, it was a birthday treat to myself. It is conveniently located in the south loop and parking is free with validation. Everyone was really friendly, great location, and the cleanliness  is awesome. This was my first time, not sure if I would do the membership because its a bit pricey.

2.description: great experience , one of my best massages all time

0.description: Scheduled an appointment for 60 min massage for my birthday! Upon arriving front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating. They offer tea or water while you're checking in. Reception area very bright, clean and organized!Now on to the massage....OMG my therapist was Jen and she was SUPERB! Very attentive to my needs or requests before and during the massage. I have had numerous massages in the past; however, this has got to be one of the best that I've had. The massage room was a very comfortable temperature and the lights were dimmed perfectly! When she finished I felt extremely relaxed. It was hard for me to get off the table. The South Loop location is new and very convenient! I can't wait to schedule my next service here!

28.description: I bought my Living Social deal for the Brazilian wax and I was a little leary about trying a new place for this....essentially just for the price. Once you have a good place, you like to stick to it! Nonetheless I got the deal and had my brazilian done today. Carla was great and made me feel at ease. It always comes with its pain but Carla was great at helping me through it. She has a great technique. My regular girl does it in 15 minutes - wham bam and you're done - and she's close to me in the suburbs. I probably won't switch to LaFace for my regular waxes, but I would definitely stop in if I need it and I'm downtown. And I would recommend it to those who are close downtown too.

1.description: Not too clear on the name of the place, but overall, very good. I visited Carla for a Brazilian and she did a good job, very quick. I got the chocolatini and i think the wax helps with the pain- a little! but really, brazilians are painful in general. I liked that she was quick and the salon was clean, she didnt double dip and didnt use the same wax papers over. She's also good with timing and regions, didnt go over the same area twice, used her hands to help with skin pain. Overall, professional and good quality. I'll be back Carla, thanks!

9.description: I visited LaFace Cafe for a Brazilian waxing as I had purchased a voucher through livingsocial.  It was a little hard getting through to them as I always got their voicemail and it would take them 2-3 days to get back to me. However once the appointment was made, everything was fine.As mentioned in previous reviews, the studio is located in a nondescript building.  The lady did a great job and was very thorough.  She was very friendly and chatty, which made the whole process a little less daunting.

23.description: First time getting my legs waxed and they did a fantastic job. Great consultation and they did not try to push products. I have extra dry skin and she gave me simple straight-forward solutions - I just have to do my part and follow them.A great plus was it was a convenient location - only a few minutes away from home - a clean setting and incredibly friendly staff.I'll definitely go back.

5.description: I went to LaFace after purchasing a YouSwoop for a Brazilian. It is located in a nondescript building which I initially walked past. Echoing a fellow yelper's review: "The room was bare and bright. No soft light or ambiance music. She had me undress while she was still in the room and asked me to lay on the table. I would have preferred to cover up with something to at least portray the image of modesty, but unfortunately, there was nothing."Overall, it was ok, but I think I'd rather be in a more private, zen-like, dim atmosphere.

25.description: I had wax services performed here and the aesthetician who performed my service was truly professional. I was comfortable and relaxed and I mention it was my first time there and I will definitely be back.  Now if only I could remember her name.  I will have to provide an update later with that info!Update:  It was Carla!

12.description: I unfortunately was one of the unlucky girls that had an awful Brazilian experience. I pretty much received two Brazilian waxes in one sitting. I know that sounds crazy, but it really did happened. I liked the salon and the people who worked there, they were extremely nice and very accommodating. The girl that was giving me a Brazilian wax was still in beauty school. She was super sweet and it seemed like she knew what she was doing. As she was waxing, she had a worried look on her face. At the end of the wax she decided ask for help from the owner. The owner had to re-do my entire Brazilian wax and I can't even tell you how much pain I was in. The girl kept apologizing to me so I tried to look strong in front of the both of them as the owner waxed me for a second time. This was probably one of the worst Brazilian wax experiences I've ever had in my life. At first I didn't want to write this review because I really like the owner and her staff, but I think people should hear this story.

21.description: I visited LaFace Cafe for a Brazilian waxing as I had purchased a voucher through livingsocial.  It was a little hard getting through to them as I always got their voicemail and it would take them 2-3 days to get back to me. However once the appointment was made, everything was fine.As mentioned in previous reviews, the studio is located in a nondescript building.  The lady did a great job and was very thorough.  She was very friendly and chatty, which made the whole process a little less daunting.

16.description: I purchased the Groupon for this salon.I was a little hesitant at first, due to the negative review, and because of it's location.  However, my mind was put at ease as soon as I walked in. The owner is really nice, and does a thorough job.  Compared to the other waxing salons (Michigan Ave, Roscoe Village, Wicker Park) it is not much different.  Atmosphere: Clean, Zen-like, calm lighting and music, coffee/tea available, intimate.I plan to go back.  Written by a white girl.

17.description: This is a little late, as I went right after the Groupon deal. I have been to very nice spas in several cities, and have paid up to $120 for a brazilian wax. So, when I saw the deal, I jumped on it hoping to have a good experience. I must say I did:) What I wanted was something that was as painless as possible, quick, clean, and thorough - which it was! Written by a Bi-racial girl :)

10.description: Carla is great at what she does; an expert waxer and comforting companion who can coach even the most nervous (me!) first timer through a Brazilian wax. Her friendly attitude and clear directions and explanations through the process made it less painful than I feared. Would definitely come back!

11.description: This  was absolutely the  best spa experience ever! I had the pleasure of having the owner perform  my services and they do it all,, Waxing, eyelashes, facials (omg the 14kt gold facial is phenomenal) !!! my makeup that was applied was flawless !!! The price was reasonable no problem parking downtown. The service was also provided with light snacks and the ambiance was soooo relaxing !!! I have found my new home to care for all ,y personal needs!!! Thanks for your professionalism and exceptional work ethic in providing my services I received So many compliments!!! Oh btw the skin problems and sagging of my skin went away with the 14kt gold facial!!! Kudos

26.description: I purchased the Groupon for this salon.I was a little hesitant at first, due to the negative review, and because of it's location.  However, my mind was put at ease as soon as I walked in. The owner is really nice, and does a thorough job.  Compared to the other waxing salons (Michigan Ave, Roscoe Village, Wicker Park) it is not much different.  Atmosphere: Clean, Zen-like, calm lighting and music, coffee/tea available, intimate.I plan to go back.  Written by a white girl.

27.description: They do a great job here. Waxing is about as painless as you can get, it's downtown, but in an area where you can actually park, and they are really friendly. I will definitely go back.

0.description: Update:Trust the professional with many years of experience. I take back my rating and give Carla at 220 Beauty Bar 5 stars. She is very accommodating and patient. Carla has a warm and inviting personality. She decorates her space to be welcoming and to soothe her customers. I thank you for being a friendly person and wish others will continue to be loyal customers. The dim-lit room with nothing to cover yourself with was a huge turn off. Also, I agree with the non-descriptive building being hard to locate. The ground floor was going through a lot of construction and I couldn't even get in until one of the workers opened the door for me.Carla provided good distracting small talk but the service itself was nearly painless. She also let me get waxed even though I was there a little earlier than my appointment.After "inspecting" myself, I thought that I was hair-free. But with all the loose hairs on my skin/clothes it was hard to tell (and I couldn't touch or brush off the hair because my skin felt raw) if I had any areas with hair still on me.When I was in the shower, I did notice she missed some areas. I wasn't informed of coming back a week later for a clean-up service.Carla's really nice and seemed to know what she was doing. I did enjoy the chocolate wax. She did a nice job and always asked "Are you doing OK" and told me to breathe before she pulled the strip. I used a LivingSocial voucher but it was a bit of a hassle to schedule through Schedulicity.

20.description: I visit LaFace Cafe for a Brazilian waxing after buying a livingsocial voucher. I was a bit nervous as I was a waxing virgin, but the livingsocial deal was too good to pass up and hey, you only live once. This place was a bit difficult to find- I finally tracked down the address using my GPS. LaFace Cafe was situated on the second floor of a nondescript building. I had to scroll through a phone list at the door to find first where they were located and then I attempted to navigate through literally a maze to find the place. Once I found the magic door, I was greeted by a sweet young woman. She had me fill out paperwork and offered me some tea while I completed the forms. The entire Cafe was smaller than my one bedroom apartment. Then I was shown to the waxing room...What a disappointment! The room was bare and bright. No soft light or ambiance music. She had me undress and asked me to lay on the table. I would have preferred to cover up with something to at least portray the image of modesty, but unfortunately, there was nothing.My aesthetician was nice and chatted with me the entire time. It made the entire situation more comfortable. She also explained the process to me, which I appreciated. She seemed pretty knowledgeable not just about Brazilians, but about the products sold at the store as well. The payment part of the whole ordeal was actually the most awkward part of the process. I only had a $20 (stupid to not bring tip money, I know) and she didn't have any change. My aesthetician then told me that there was a bodega downstairs where we could go get change. So she locked up the studio and we made small talk for about 10 minutes while we waited in line behind several families for change.Overall, not bad. I'm not sure if I would return.

19.description: Originally, I went here with a YouSwoop Voucher.  I enjoyed the Chocolate Wax sooooooo much that I prepaid for my next 6 waxes on the spot. Ms Missy was very professional.  She engaged in small talk to distract you from what's going on (a plus and must have for me).  The room was clean,  she did NOT DOUBLE DIP(which I really enjoy).  Last but not least, she was very thorough. Not a hair in sight.   During the process she would ask are you okay and explain step by step the next process.  This is by far one of best waxes I had in a long time.  Did I forget to mention, as painless as a wax can be.  Trust me ladies, I been waxing for 7 years, and the Chocolate Wax is the best.  It did not irritate my skin, and I did NOT develop ingrown hairs or bumps afterward.  Oh, and she cleans the area with aloe when she's done too. p.s. I had to reschedule my appointment several times due to last minute meetings. She completely understood.  One day, she had a cancellation, and I ran over on lunch.  I was in and out in no time.  Thanks.

2.description: I get Brazilian waxes every 4-6 weeks so I know what to expect.  My Brazilian waxing experience with Carla was just OK.  The waxing room is literally located right next to the waiting area.  As others have stated, I did not like the fact that she did not provide a towel of some sort to cover up when you lay on the table waiting for her.  I ended up taking off my sweater to cover up because I didn't feel comfortable being exposed while the door swings opens before the waxing process began.Carla is friendly and personable and I like the chocolate wax she uses.  She doesn't double-dip and the entire process is done in about 10-15 minutes flat.  However, she left behind multiple long hairs that could have easily been waxed off.  I'm used to having every possible hair waxed off (except for the tiny ones that are too short to be waxed).  I almost want to get my own wax to wax the rest off myself because it feels incomplete.I'm happy I had a LivingSocial coupon because her quality of service isn't worth the full price.  I'll give her two stars for the convenient location and her friendly personality, but I'd go elsewhere for a quality Brazilian wax.

18.description: I had wax services performed here and the aesthetician who performed my service was truly professional. I was comfortable and relaxed and I mention it was my first time there and I will definitely be back.  Now if only I could remember her name.  I will have to provide an update later with that info!Update:  It was Carla!

13.description: Carla is fantastic, sweet, comforting, amazing, lovely! I had purchased a Youswoop a few months back and decided I should go in now to try them out. I agree, when you first show up, the building is very non-descriptive, but I'm used to that (my favorite yoga studio is in a professional type building as well). I had booked online and it mentions the suite number. I made sure to call as well and left a message letting them know I would be using my youswoop.I arrived early and no one was there. A few moments later Carla arrived. She automatically apologized and asked if she was late, no, I was over 20 minutes early. When you go in, it is very zenlike. There are chakra images in the room, calming setting. Carla is very professional. During my eyebrow wax she talked with me, reminded me the breathe, and mentioned how my skin was reacting. After my eyebrow wax I did the brazillian. I have had bikini waxes before but never the full brazillian. She was FANTASTIC! She made sure I was breathing here as well, distracted me, made me laugh and feel VERY comfortable during the process. She goes above and beyond and does whatever she can to ensure a positive experience. I will be going back for sure! Thank you Carla, you will be seeing me again!

4.description: Carla is a hair removal pro! She is quick, painless, and highly skilled. She also has some of the best deals in the city! As far as the negative complaints about the room, Carla has such a fun personality, keeps you distracted, and makes you feel comfortable during a service that is going to be awkward anywhere. When a service is done efficiently within minutes, it's really hard to complain about a room. At high end spas/salons, you're not paying for the service, but for higher operation costs & expenses. Consider skill when you have hot wax dripping in sensitive areas.

24.description: This is a little late, as I went right after the Groupon deal. I have been to very nice spas in several cities, and have paid up to $120 for a brazilian wax. So, when I saw the deal, I jumped on it hoping to have a good experience. I must say I did:) What I wanted was something that was as painless as possible, quick, clean, and thorough - which it was! Written by a Bi-racial girl :)

6.description: I visit LaFace Cafe for a Brazilian waxing after buying a livingsocial voucher. I was a bit nervous as I was a waxing virgin, but the livingsocial deal was too good to pass up and hey, you only live once. This place was a bit difficult to find- I finally tracked down the address using my GPS. LaFace Cafe was situated on the second floor of a nondescript building. I had to scroll through a phone list at the door to find first where they were located and then I attempted to navigate through literally a maze to find the place. Once I found the magic door, I was greeted by a sweet young woman. She had me fill out paperwork and offered me some tea while I completed the forms. The entire Cafe was smaller than my one bedroom apartment. Then I was shown to the waxing room...What a disappointment! The room was bare and bright. No soft light or ambiance music. She had me undress and asked me to lay on the table. I would have preferred to cover up with something to at least portray the image of modesty, but unfortunately, there was nothing.My aesthetician was nice and chatted with me the entire time. It made the entire situation more comfortable. She also explained the process to me, which I appreciated. She seemed pretty knowledgeable not just about Brazilians, but about the products sold at the store as well. The payment part of the whole ordeal was actually the most awkward part of the process. I only had a $20 (stupid to not bring tip money, I know) and she didn't have any change. My aesthetician then told me that there was a bodega downstairs where we could go get change. So she locked up the studio and we made small talk for about 10 minutes while we waited in line behind several families for change.Overall, not bad. I'm not sure if I would return.

22.description: I really wanted to like this place, because it's a small business and the are trying hard.  I went here for a brazillian wax with a living social deal.  I'm a waxing  veteran, so I knew what to expect.  Firstly, the building is unlabeled (other than the address) and locked, so you have to scroll through the keypad to find someone to buzz you in. When I finally found the place in the building, I walked in and was shocked to see how tiny it was.  It's one room with a curtain, and then one other small room that has 2 waxing tables in it.  I kind of wish they would give you something to put over yourself at first.  I know they are going to see it all, but you are right in front of a door and when they open it, everyone in the other room can see you.  Awkward.  A towel or something would have been nice, even if it was just for when they opened the door.  At least when I was there, I was the only person other than the 2 staff.  The girl I had was very nice and explained everything to me.  That's one good thing.  The problem was that she waxed in a direction perpendicular to the hair.  So of course, a lot of it didn't come out at first.  She went over the same spot with the wax multiple times.  I feel like she kept making excuses for why it wasn't working.  When I got home, I noticed blood on my skin there.  I've never had that happen before.  I was really red and irritated all night.  Usually, after a couple hours I feel fine.  However, a day later and it's still flaming red and tender.  Bottom line:  I wouldn't go back.UPDATE: someone did contact me to offer me a free service, which I appreciated.  However, I've now developed some sort of infection there.  I've had waxes dozens of times and this have never happened before.  I won't be returning for the free service.

15.description: I purchased 2 Brazilian waxes at youswoop. I loved it. I had an appointment with Missy and I was pleasantly surprised (I'd had my share of terrible experiences). I will definitely go back. The building the studio is located in is under a reconstruction, so the outside doesn't look very appealing.

7.description: I bought a Lifebooker for this place for an eyebrow Sculpt. Carla did it! I happened to go on Valentines Day for which I received a glass of champagne and a goody bag with yummy candy. Carla and her daughter has also decorated the space all valentines day ish! Nice touch! She did an excellent job on my brows and I will definitely be coming back.

8.description: I just received my first ever brazilian wax from Carla. I have never had a brazilian or bikini wax before so I looked like a 70's pornstar lol. Carla took great care of me and made me feel comfortable and at ease, my pain was minimal, all of my hair was neatly removed, and she gives great instructions on caring for your waxed areas.  The atmosphere is calm and relaxing which helped because I was a nervous wreck!

3.description: 1. I have only paid full price for a Brazilian once in my life... and that was my first wax 2 years ago. I had a good experience so I've been waxing (albeit not regularly) ever since.2. In my mind, the cost of a Brazilian has been rightsized to Groupon/YouSwoop/Living Social/Yelp rates. This means that I only go when I find a deal and read enough positive reviews about the location.3. Before today, I only had 2 locations where I would comfortably and confidently go back to again and again (provided there was a deal).4. Ms. Carla was simply amazing so I now have a 3rd location to frequent for my waxes!!So I clearly had a deal to go to Carla at LaFace and it was well worth it. When I booked she said that it would only take 20 mins (I was taking a break from work for the appointment so I was concerned). I made a face and rolled my eyes thinking that yeah right... she'll be torturing me for much longer, but no lie I was in and out within 20 mins. I was so shocked and pleasantly surprised. The studio is very small/intimate/whatever you want to call it, but the waxing room has plenty of space and light. Carla uses a chocolate wax (never heard of it), so it smells really good and helps keep your mind off of the treatment too! The process was really quick. She tells you to take deep breathes throughout and makes sure you are as comfortable as you can be. This might be TMI, but she also has the best technique I've experienced for getting your backside without you having to awkwardly and uncomfortably stay in doggy-style position. Score!My last Brazilian was amateur night (I just realized I never wrote a review!), while Carla was professional, quick and as painless as a Brazilian can be. I'm a fan!
